product_name: Gucci Envy Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Just gorgeous. Green, floral, powdery, woody. I have both EDP and EDT. I left a review on the EDT and it goes into the nuances of both. Simply stated, this was master perfumery at its best.

product_name: Gucci Envy Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Envy is really beautiful, and the name is perfect, because this fragrance is very green, and you will be envious of all who managed to retain a bottle in good condition; I understand they are rather hard to find now. But I don't feel envious, only glad that my friend Sarah sent me a sample of this to test. On skin it is giving me a distinct promise of spring (so I know it's a liar, but it's a sweet consoling little lie). The pineapple note popped immediately, and then I got the hyacinth and lily-of-the-valley. I trust the other notes will pop up as the fragrance develops; I can already smell the sandalwood, and I can tell that it is very good indeed.

I think Oil Perfumery or one of the other good dupe houses should do an impression of Envy, since it's discontinued now and obviously has many ardent fans. If any dupe-chemists are reading my reviews, get busy, then prepare yourself for an onslaught of gratitude (and perhaps envy from those who didn't think of it first).

product_name: Gucci Envy Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Divain 689 is a decent copy of Envy. Fir everyone lamenting the loss of this gem

product_name: Gucci Envy Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Gucci should have never, ever, ever, never, ever stopped making this fragrance. Never. It's one of their best. I held onto my bottle for as long as possible once I discovered this was discontinued.😢🤧

product_name: Gucci Envy Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: When I bought this many years ago, I loved it. I love green fragrances. However, there is something in it that makes me feel nauseous. (Vent Vert has the same affect on me) Hence why I still have a half bottle left of the bottle I bought when it first launched. I dug it out today because whilst wearing my latest green acquisition Frederic Malle's Synthetic Jungle (which I love) I t suddenly hit me that it reminded me of Gucci Envy. I tried on the Gucci and now it is overpowering everything, and I can not smell the Synthetic Jungle as a result. But I would say that if you loved Gucci Envy, try synthetic Jungle, It is lighter fresher, cleaner somehow (Yes it I know it is not an EDP, so hard to compare) I did notice that the Gucci Envy and the Vent Vert both have musk in them, which Synthetic Jungle does not, maybe that is what makes me feel nauseous.

product_name: Gucci Envy Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I just received this today, an eBay bargain. It is absolutely divine, to me it smells like a richer version of the edt, I’ve only had it on a short time so cannot judge longevity but sillage is impressive so far. So sad that Envy is discontinued, the edt was my signature scent about 15 years ago and I’ve never managed to find anything else quite like it, although my collection has grown significantly during the attempt!!

product_name: Gucci Envy Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
23. september 2015

I have been sorting out my bottles and a gorgeous black bottle of EDP just fell on the floor and an upper corner of it was broken, so devastating. I didn´t spill much of it, but at least while cleaning the bottle i finally had the chance to try this perfume which i owned for a while but never managed to test yet.

This is simply beautiful one, a very strong LOTV, jasmine and hyacint combo in a very good way. The LOTV is not like in DIorissimo or MiuMiu, but the very natural smelling, just like the real flower in the springtime. All the flowers are gorgeous and natural smelling, jasmine as well. I agree with others, who say it has kind of "metallic" vibe, but it does not distract me at all. In general the notes here are so well blended, that it is hard to pick more, than those i have mentioned before (well, the bergamot is sooo gorgeous here as well, i yet have to look for another so good smelling bergamot in a composigtion)
Gorgeous smell, i understand all the praises and totally agree!

P.S. I haven´t compared it to the EDT yet

product_name: Gucci Envy Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I had Envy and it't was gorgeous. Unfortunaly I didn't found it again.

product_name: Gucci Envy Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I like Envy Me and I wanted to try Envy. Before I found the EDT, I found this. I actually don't like it at all. I have since found the EDT and I LOVE it! I'm not sure why I don't like the EDP, there must be something in it that really doesn't suit...

product_name: Gucci Envy Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I saved up a pretty penny to get myself this when I started working as I fell in love with the scent. Its green, slightly metallic and floral at the same time. Unfortunately, my mum liked it too and I had to surrender my bottle to her. Till today, I still can't find anything that smells like it. Now, the only available version of this scent is the EDT which is also becoming hard to find. :(

Intense personality in a bottle...

This fragrance is a personality! it resembles someone's essence! it's like the scent of Agent 006 "Alec Trevelyan", cheeky, masculine, & strong villain. It's musky with olibanum, cumin, and a touch of vanilla to softens the dark side just a little to trick you in order to fall in his web.

This is elegance animalic, def not for everyone. Beautiful in an excellence way.

First Impression.
Living next to a Gucci boutique, I’ve had the chance to try nearly every Alchemist’s Garden release since the line debuted in 2019. So when I heard they were launching two musk fragrances, I was excited. This black musk leans darker and more masculine of the two, though I wouldn’t call it musk-dominant.

With nitro musks banned and polycyclics heavily restricted, what we get here is a couple of macro musks "dirtied" up with caraway. Personally, I think they’d have been better off leaning on materials like ambrette, civetone, muscone or hyrax — all of which can still be harvested responsibly and legally — to give the composition more character of a true black musk.

As it stands, this fragrance isn’t really musk-centered. Instead, it’s more of a caraway and incense affair, softened by a touch of vanilla and lifted by a faint mineral edge that fades in the drydown. If you’re into smoky incense and cumin-like spice, you may find this appealing. For me, it isn’t bad by any means, but it doesn’t feel purchase-worthy. I’ll keep testing and update accordingly.
-----------------------------------------
Scent 60/100
-----------------------------------------
"delivering a long-lasting sillage of supreme strength" is what interests me
Smells like the cheapest bar soap on the supermarket shelf. A shame.
While I can smell the creminess, there's like a lid on top of it which smells kind of medicinal/green. After I let it dry down for 30-40 minutes or so is when I could enjoy the creamy floral notes

It is very, very nice. I think it is very close what I am looking for. I want sweet, but quite fresh, suitable for work, not too mature but not teenager with a celebrity perfume on either. I think it is sweet, better than the newest Gucci gourgeous gardenia intense which is VERY spicy (however my husband prefer that one and that one has enormous sillage as he could smell it from the second floor when I was wearing it down stairs in the kitchen ;D )
This one is much milder and vanish (for my nose, I have learned that just because I can't sense it myself it doesn't mean it is gone) pretty fast, within 2 hours.

I smell vanilla and subtle florals. Suitable for summer, definitely, however I would wear it in winter too because it is also cozy, just very mild.
if only this were more long lasting on my skin, then it would have been my favorite flora

Oh my, this is delightful. Very powdery and soapy, with a hint of that coconut creaminess that somehow reminds me of an Elseve shampoo? Let me describe it better: an expensive floral lotion? Think of it as an evolved version of Flora Gorgeous Gardenia, that one smells too much like plain fabric softener it gets to a point. It's very pleasant and office safe, a perfect choice for everyday, even for the hottest places. The thing is, I can still get whiffs of it and it's been TWO days since I sprayed it. Two days, considering I showered and it should be impossible to still smell it. Interesting to mention that I smell it when I move around, and that's when I really pick at the berries, juicy berries. It somehow reminds me of the Rituals of Yozakura's body mist, so consider that one as an option to layer with this fragrance. My mum adores Magnolia it as much as I do, you'll sure get tons of compliments with it.
Very surprising creamy coconut magnolia. I didn’t pick up the coconut at first but after spraying next to 4711 Magnolia (pure floral), this one was a lot more tropical and fruity. I like it
Soap. In the opening it's a very pleasant magnolia soap, but its drydown is mature woman soap and I think headache-inducing. Meh...
It smells like soap, I don't smell any sweetness there, a sharp scent of flowers and cleanliness. Not a trace of coconut. But it smells good to me, even though it's not my cup of coffee, I like it.

There is definitely a red berry element in it, but never smelled dewberry before, so not sure about that. The coconut is there too, but this isn't a tropical fragrance at all. I am not a fond of musk, and luckily, in this one it nicely blends in and does not come to foreground too much even after hours of wear. On clothing it lasts days. Feminine, sweet, floral, neither too elengant nor too simple, suitable both for day and night wear. It is not groundbreakingly exciting, but a nice general fragrance.

I first smelled Gucci’s Gorgeous Magnolia perfume in my dorm room after a roommate's friend sprayed it. From the first smell, I instantly fell in love with it and knew I needed to purchase it. The scent comes off floral, creamy, and powdery with a hint of musk underneath. It is incredibly sweet and feminine. I definitely tend to enjoy it for a night out in the spring and summer months.

Due to this, I find that the perfume lacks a super substantial or complex scent that other perfumes tend to have. However, I personally tend to enjoy airy, feminine scents, so this aspect attracted me rather than turned me off. This perfume tends to last far longer on clothing compared to skin (rarely lasts). I find myself reapplying a lot, which is a little frustrating for the price point. However, this is common for light floral perfumes.

Overall this has become my most repurchased and second favorite perfume that I wear.

Bought this for my mum and she liked it! I personally am not a fan of floral perfumes so I have mixed opinions, but I did like this one.

Didn't get any hint of coconut but a mix of florals at first. I realized lily of the valley doesn't fare well with my skin and that was a bit off-putting.

But on my mom the scent bloomed, she is blessed with a skin that amplifies any kind of perfumes and I am not even kidding! She smells divine, like fairy queen in the woods. Overall, a 7 out of 10 from me. I like the airy, powdery quality to it btw.
My favorite gucci perfume from the series. Fruity-floral scent but on the sweeter scent rather than the floral. Definitely dries down to a floral scent but the coconut and berry is very apparent.
you cannot convince me this smells any different than the other Fucci floras.

so beautiful, so unique, it's very ethereal and IMO, fairy like. if I had to choose one perfume to wear for the rest of my life, this would be it :) nothing on the market is similar to this. really stunning!
A soapy, dewy, fruity nectar. A tad powdery but not in a vintage way at all. It’s seamlessly elegant and a little flirty.

I expected a (Southern) Magnolia scent, but I see it's Magnolia alba in here (so "white champaca", totally different). It smells like a slightly spicy, creamy white floral blend and a lot of fruit/berry. This perfume is overall sweet and a little powdery. It was interesting for the first second because it was very clean and had a weird fresh clarity to it. Then it turns and there's a quality to this (and a lot of current day formulations) that performs "off" to me; it's too candied and hazy on my skin. Pass. Try if you like hazy, sweet soft florals.

Such a creamy, fluffy beauty. It's so juicy and fresh; I absolutely adore this fragrance. It's definitely my favourite from the line. This scent is lovely; however, it is really weak! There isn't much projection on this fragrance after about an hour, but it's still nice as a skin scent. I like to layer it with Signature by Montblanc :)
Out of the entire flora line, this one takes the cake. It’s beautiful and timeless. Cant get over the bottle design too, so freakin cute! Gucci does magnolia so well

Agree with the review below mine. crowd pleaser!! Good floral, although it doesn't last much, even in clothes. Got complimented on 3 different occasions when I wore this perfume! I think is a safe buy, I also have the pink one, the Gardenia from the Flora line, this one is much better imo.

I sampled a variety of this line not expecting much, and I was surprised by how much I liked this one. It's fresh and clean, but not in an overly sterile or soapy way. Its definitely a crowd pleaser, very mass appealing and I could see myself safely gifting this to nearly any woman. I think I could see myself wearing this to work, as it has a very office safe quality to it. That being said if you already have a 'office safe, mass appealing floral' perfume, you probably don't need this in your collection.

my favorite out of the flora line.. or from Gucci in general. The smell is so beautiful and nostalgic, yet it DOESNT LAST. That’s been my issue with Gucci, especially within the flora line. I’d kill for an extrait version of this truly.

I love magnolia but this doesn’t quite make the cut for me
There’s so many better magnolia fragrances than this
love me a creamy sweet ylang ylang magnolia ! like a grown up sweet girl, but any flowers smell kind of grown up to me

I'M GONNA SUE GUCCI. This fragrance is gorgeous, juicy, delicious, and fresh. I'm gonna sue Gucci for advertising Gorgeous Gardenia in this series more Gorgeous Magnolia. Like seriously this one contains every pros of the other gorgeous floras series. It's delicious and gourmand like gorgeous orchid. Fresh like gorgeous jasmine and for sure sweet and delightful like gorgeous gardenia. It's good for both daily and occasional usage and it's crazy cus every single time I wear this someone compliments me and asks my perfume. You see it's a rich(or at least richer than others in this collection) and yet a minimalist fragrance and that's why it's delightful for everyone and suitable for everywhere. It starts with a juicy red berries scent and with a touch of delicate coconut that makes it feel like your eating Raspberry tart. It continues with red berries fading into background so can coconut can shine and as a matter of fact the soft floral scent is there from strat to the end.

I can’t believe no one is comparing it to Flowerbomb! As of now, it is not in the ‘reminds me of’ section. I’m equally as surprised to see it compared to GIAW, RL Romance, Reb-l-Fleur, Viva la Juicy, etc.
This is like a softer, summery take on Flowerbomb. I agree that it isn’t strong (which for me is great for warmer weather with that scent profile), and doesn’t last long. But boy is she beautiful!

this is soooo gorgeous. its delicate and soft and I cannot stop smelling myself.
i'm on the hunt for a wedding fragrance and this might be it.
does anyone know a cheaper dupe for this? i miss it a lot and i do not have the money for it 💔
A fruity version of the Flora Orchid. Smells quite generic to me unfortunately but the drydown's stunning!
the berry in this stands out to me the most and i love it yummy
Literally the Dove shea butter & vanilla body wash
I have perfumes from Zara that last longer...Save your money
So. Effing. Pretty. Everytime I spray it on me it makes me smile. It's such a beautiful blend of flowers without it being too cloying.
This perfume smells amazing – it’s a lovely sweet scent that isn’t too overpowering. I also love how long-lasting it is; you can still smell it hours later. Perfect for everyday wear.

⋆｡ﾟ☁︎｡⋆｡ ﾟ☾ ﾟ｡⋆

Not purely a magnolia, but its smoooooooooooooth.

On one hand, qualiity wise, I think its the best naturalistic floral composition in here. Probably most interesting out of the 4, and has a creamy texture similar to Bal d'Afrique or Guidance. It smells pleasant, creamy, like petals, like Dove soap. I can easily see people being very emotional over this scent as it it both intimate, creamy, dreamy and smells like pink magnolia petals on a clear water surface. Most beautiful in a serene way.

⋆｡ﾟ☁︎｡⋆｡ ﾟ☾ ﾟ｡⋆

On the other hand, I can barely smell it and am also partially anosmic to it, so I tend to forget its there. However, since it does blend very, very beautifully with skin and provides an amazing smell texture. For this reason, I hearthily reccomend it for intimate encounters.

Quite a cuddly one.

⋆｡ﾟ☁︎｡⋆｡ ﾟ☾ ﾟ｡⋆

I have tested it in a perfume store, This fragrance is a balanced sweety coconut, dewberry in the top notes, dewberry here come like chocolate scent exactly, in the middle notes dewberry gradually transforming to similar scent of blueberries plus fresh Orange with pure white flowers and Ylang-Ylang, at the dry down, the scent will be exactly like middle notes in addition of balanced amount of Musk, Patchouli and Woods come from the background. This perfume is very pure balanced feminine easy to use and love.

If you didn't smell this perfume before, I advise that you can blind buy if you interest balanced Calm coconut fragrances, I think if you interest perfumes like; "Yara from Lattafa", "Qaed Al Fursan Unlimited Lattafa" or "Alien Goddess Mugler" you will like this perfume with exist of simple differences between perfumes notes.

This fragrance suitable to wear it during the day or at night, in all seasons, It lasts 4 - 6 hours on the leather and one day on the clothes.


لقد جربته في متجر للعطور، هذا العطر متوازن برائحة جوز الهند الحلوة والتوت في النوتات العليا، والتوت هنا يشبه رائحة الشوكولاتة تمامًا، في النفحات الوسطى يتحول التوت تدريجيًا إلى رائحة مشابهة للتوت الأزرق بالإضافة إلى البرتقال المنعش مع الزهور البيضاء النقية واليلانغ يلانغ. في القاعدة، ستكون الرائحة تمامًا مثل النفحات الوسطى بالإضافة إلى كمية متوازنة من المسك والباتشولي والأخشاب والتي تأتي من الخلفية. هذا العطر أنثوي نقي ومتوازن سهل الاستخدام وسهل أن تحبه.

إذا لم تشمِ هذا العطر من قبل، أنصحك بإمكانك شراؤه شراءً أعمى، إذا كنتِ تستمتعين بعطور جوز الهند المتوازنة والهادئة. أعتقد أنه إذا كنتِ شغوفة بعطور مثل "يارا من لطافة" أو "قائد الفرسان أنليميتد من لطافة" أو "إلين غوديس من موغلر"، فسوف يعجبك هذا العطر مع وجود الاختلافات البسيطة في النوتات العطرية.

هذا العطر مناسب للارتداء نهارًا أو ليلًا، في جميع الفصول، يدوم 4 - 6 ساعات على الجلد ويوم واحد على الملابس.
love it smells like bubble bath

wow okay. i love when a scent just absolutely catapults me back into a memory of years gone by. at first sniff i was instantly transported to the duty free perfume department at changi airport in singapore, 2007 or 2008 when the dior poison line was having a moment (midnight poison launch i believe). vividly reminded of smelling various dior poison iterations while standing in a cloud of the old formula of hypnotic poison. i'm sure this wasn't gucci's intention at all with this fragrance but i'm glad to have gotten a sample. as someone who can't wear hypnotic poison anymore because of how cloying it is, this is definitely a possible alternative. not really my style anymore but wow. wow gucci wow
beautiful sugary, creamy floral that barely lasts an hour. it's unfortunate, i really wanted to wear this but the longevity is almost non-existant.
This smells exactly like Elnett hairspray in the gold bottle.

strong creamy floral scent. like you're entering a public washroom right after the janitor cleaned it, with floral disinfectant still hanging in the air, but in a good way. Sort of grandma like? a powdery, slightly dated trail that lingers in the space once you’re gone. I wear it often.

"Constantly shitting between dreams and reality..."

I hope this is a typo because that sounds awfully unpleasant.

Lives up to the name; gorgeous feminine addicting floral scent. I don't get that much coconut personally, but its blended pretty nicely and makes for a sophisticated and versatile scent. A guy could pull it off, but it definitely leans feminine. Type of perfume that just intoxicates you, in a good way

Seasons: Spring + Summmer
Wearability : Very versatile; office, date, hangout. Just make sure not to overspray
This is a pleasant fruity floral scent. It's very well-blended and none of the individual notes stand out to me. Nice and inoffensive but ultimately forgettable.
OOOOOO as soon as I smelled this in sephora I KNEW I HAVE to get this. it's such a beautiful floral scent
love how it smells but doesn't last over an hour on me :((
This was sharp and screechy to my nose. I expected a lot more creaminess from the coconut but it was nowhere to be found.

Do not buy this the scent Trail barely lasts for a half hour. I cannot believe these perfume manufacturers are shilling out this stuff as perfume.. garbage. The initial scent is very pretty. but the lasting power is zilch /none. Completely disappointed as this is quite an expensive perfume.
why wont she stay on my skin? the scent disappears after about an hour for me. such a shame because i really love this scent.
I have a sample of this and wow! It’s sugary sweet like sweet tarts! I love it! It is so pretty!
I love her so much. It’s so sugary sweet and delectable, and it clings to me forever.

Pretty floral that smells vanillic from the magnolia. Sweet with a lovely die down. Not particularly special or unique. The purple colour of the bottle does not at all match this smell, it presents in my mind as more of a cream colour. I prefer others from the same line, particularly Gardenia.

It smells more gourmand but muted to be gentler for warmer seasons. It sits close to the skin in my opinion. I personally I feel it is best for spring or summer. It's lighter and has those soft floral notes which dry down to almost a pleasant vanilla. A very beautiful, soft warm leaning scent.

This is the only one from this Gucci line that I have tested and I have to say I love it! I have the travel spray and I find it just so easy to wear and enjoy. It is lighthearted and happy, a mood-booster. Delightful! It's not a true gourmand for me but there is a richness to the flowers in this that is addicting, possibly from the coconut addition. I am a white floral lover so I am already the perfect audience for this. I don't love the bottle design so had not gravitated to this line, but the magnolia flanker called to my southern spirit, and I am so glad that I gave it a whirl. There are a lot of negative reviews on this, and I get that we're all different, but it's hard for me to understand what is not to like here! My husband rarely comments on my fragrances but he made a point of telling me I smelled lovely, which made me happy. Downside is it doesn't last very long so reapplication is necessary - but I truly don't mind because I get to enjoy those addictive top notes more often! Easy to love, this one!
Now I think this is the best one in the series. Creamy floral and not overwhelming. Playful and sophisticated.

This was a miss for me. Magnolia is noticeably heavier and muskier than Gardenia or Jasmine, and far too sweet for my taste. The dewberry note is definitely there, but not in a fresh or juicy way. It's drowned in sugar and musk, and the result is too syrupy and cloying.

There’s a hint of coconut too, which adds to the thickness rather than lightening it up. The overall effect is dense, sticky, and oddly muddled. I’m not someone who’s prone to headaches, but if I were, this would bring it on. Longevity and projection are weak like the rest of the Flora line, it performs more like a body spray than a perfume. And frankly, even the bottle doesn’t feel like it’s trying to be a serious fragrance.

I don’t mind magnolia as a note in general, I actually enjoy it when it’s fresh and clean (like in Issey Miyake's blend). But this version feels too heavy, almost dirty. Just not for me.

Oooh. Oh. Yes. This is a beautiful, creamy, floral coconut. Perfect for Spring and Summer though it has an inherent warmth to it that makes it suitable for year-round wear. It’s a glorious, feminine, deep, rich scent. Longevity on me is moderate but that’s why God made travel sizes. Not your average floral, no, this one is a special delight.
this is a really lovely fragrance. It doesn't stay very long. Not really worth the money.. I Blind bought it and was completely surprised how beautiful it is, but it just does not last, unfortunately

First word that came to my mind as I tested this was 'pleasant'. Also there's something really nostalgic about this, I've smelled somrthing like this in my childhood but I can't remember what it is. It's a pretty good perfume but not for me. Kinda has a nice aunt vibe to it, maybe one of my aunts has worn something similar and that's what I'm remembering...?

I absolutely fell in love with this one, and it was completely unexpected, I never imagined I'd love it so much!

It's a luminous fragrance, built around what I perceive as coconut milk, ylang-ylang, and magnolia. It's smooth, creamy, sunny, and floral. There's also a hint of fruit in the background, most likely dewberry and orange. It's a "happy scent", yet also sensual and feminine.

Very pretty for the holidays, but not only; I can see it being suitable all year round too. My favorite of the range so far!
It's a nice, fresh, creamy baby powder scent, powdery and musky. I adore it but it might not be my go to scent.

This is being my go to this spring. Yes, it does smell like dusty berries in the opening but in the best way possible, I personally don't get any coconut. As the fragrance develops the patchouli comes out giving it an earthy vibe. I think it smells like the color of the bottle, it gives hippie chic, love it. Longevity is pretty average like most gucci fragrances like 5-6 hours tops and it projects an arms lenght for the first hour.

one of the only florals i can stand - i think the berry/coconut helps with that in the opening, and then the woodiness towards the end. after about an hour or so it becomes very subtle - pretty much sits right on the skin, no projection unless maybe there’s a breeze to help it out.
This one is well for older people I would assume, I can't really picture anyone wear and suit with this scent if they are younger

Creamy Floral Woods with a Berry Accent...

I've tested this a few times now. It's an enjoyable wear, for sure. Opens with a burst of dewberry & coconut, but already the woods are pressing through. The coconut I get here isn't a toasted coconut, but more of a creamy coconut frosting. As it transitions to the heart, it gets creamy florals, with a hint of wax from the magnolia, all mixing with the blonde woods which gives me a banana Laffy Taffy dusted in powder with a berry top note. The berry top note stays for quite awhile, but eventually fades. There's definitely an illusion of tonka bean in the base, which has a stronger presence than patchouli to my nose.

Contrast to Reb'l Fleur Rihanna:
These are different, but there may be some similarites with coconut, patchouli & berries, but Reb'l Fleur is much fruitier with a more forward patchouli, while Flora Gorgeous Magnolia is much creamier & smoother. Both have good performance, but slightly better for Reb'l Fleur.

Overall: enjoyable creamy, sweet floral-woody scent with good performance. I look forward to testing this in summer to see if I can get more of a bloom from the magnolia. It's a love for me. Enjoy!
Got this in a gift sample set, this was the first one that stood out to me scent notes wise. Unfortunately for me, all this projected was a baby powder that smelt like flowers. Headache inducing :/

Okay, let me just say it- now that I finally managed to buy it, this perfume is everything. Out of all the colors this perfume is available in, the purple one is hands-down my favorite. It’s one of those perfumes that immediately makes you feel like your best self the second it hits your skin. It’s powerful in this elegant dreamy way, and honestly? It’s kind of addictive.

The scent is this perfect mix of sweet, floral, and warm. It opens with this juicy freshness of the coconut and berry in there, and then it melts into this gorgeous magnolia note that is creamy and rich without being too heavy. There's something about it that feels romantic and soft, but still confident and grown. It's not just “pretty”, it's literally captivating.

What I love most is how balanced it is. It's floral, yes, but not your typical powdery floral which I personally hate. There's depth and warmth to it, almost like vanilla or musk in the base, which makes it feel cozy and sensual at the same time. It's the kind of scent that wraps around you like a beautiful aura... and then you don't just smell good, you smell expensive and unforgettable.

The lasting power is amazing too! Personally I can still smell it on my clothes and wrists hours later, and it wears so beautifully throughout the day. Every time I wear it I catch myself randomly sniffing my wrist like a weirdo because I just can't get enough.

If I had to describe it in a feeling, it's like walking into a sunlit garden wearing a silk dress, feeling confident, magnetic, and soft all at once. It's a whole vibe.

11/10. My holy grail. Please never stop making this Gucci!
weird cardboard/gluestick opening. it dries down woody but unfortunately becomes extremely weak by this point. not worth it sadly

Beautiful scent! I think the strongest note for me is juicy and tart berries, with a hint of patchouli that I think will appeal to even those who hate it. It adds an earthiness to this otherwise effervescent scent, keeping it from being too girlish. Strong enough that my sister could smell me an aisle over!

This is not the family of perfumes I lean towards, but it is pleasant in the same way the smell you get after a fresh wash, cut and blow dry at a high end salon is pleasant.

There was a tester going around at work and all my colleagues had spritzed it on, and high end salon is the vibe I got from it.

Apologies… not a review… just a chuckle 🤭
Read the 3rd paragraph under the big “ symbol near top of page 😂
Ooops!

I like it! I can detect the creamy coconut and the soft florals. It's feminine and easy to wear. Office-friendly. Not too mature despite the white florals and musk. The dusty, powderiness keeps it from being a love, though. I prefer "juicy" scents (fruity, aquatic, shampooey) over "dry" scents (powdery, musky).
It's a nice soft powdery scent I am content with keeping for indoor use, but I wouldn't recommend it elsewhere as it's quite weak and too subtle.

white floral with a bit of fruit/coconut and a bit of patchouli that makes it smell like old lady a little bit. i think the other releases in this collection are better 😞 i understand how it may smell like dirty berries like the person before me mentioned
Berries, but dirty. Not altogether unpleasant. I suspect I would like it more if I tried it out on a summer evening. Sample from the Christmas 2024 Sephora perfume sampler.
I enjoyed this scent very much, I just wished for the price point that it stayed longer.
My favorite Flora. The magnolia is gorgeous.

I’ve had this perfume for almost over a year and it’s so beautiful. I smell creamy from the coconut and fresh from magnolia in the perfume. Also, since the bottle isn’t clear glass and it’s in a bottle that won’t get sunlight, the longevity for me has gotten stronger for me.
It's my favourite, when I tried it in the store I went crazy, like it was the most delicious smell I've ever smelled.

Wow. I was surprised by this. Forget the notes, right at first, it smells like if kayali rock sugar candy and sol de janeiro 59 had a baby, and that baby had a baby with Cloud. It’s fruity and floral. That lasts for about 5 minutes, then it’s coconut and florals. if this is what wonderstruck smelled like i’m sad that i never got to smell it!

I tested this one in Sephora Medina (SA) and at first whiff I was reminded of a coconut mist I used to like a lot maybe ten years ago or so and that's Waikiki Beach coconut!
I was expecting a floral fragrance featuring the Magnolia as prominent note hence the name, but unfortunately it smells nothing floral but rather coconut all the way. The sillage and longevity are huge but if you can get your hands on the old formulation of Waikiki, that will save you lots of money.

surprised by how much I like this. the fruity notes last about 10 seconds and then it's mostly coconut with a touch of white flower. I am 50/50 on most coconut forward perfumes but I enjoy the note here. feels very beachy without being sunscreeny, spring and summer fragrance for sure.
This smells like sweet tarts and I love it

Oh wow, this is so damn pretty!!! It’s giving spa day at home. It’s like taking a scented milk bath strewn with flower petals while washing your hair with berry scented shampoo. Then when you’re done you moisturize your clean skin with coconut oil. Fresh, clean, lactonic, berries & flowers.

Tested:
Tried this sample, is sweet, floral, sophisticated, mass appealing. The fruity note does help.
Now, the coconut note is beautiful! Made me said wow Holly S!
After that, it was so sultry sweet that it was bothering me, and i wanted to wipe it. The dry down is sweet and powdery with huge longevity. Wouldn't buy it.
i love this scent! my sister said its a tad grandma-y, which it admittedly is but i think thats the patchouli, the dry down is sweet and powdery and it lasts all day! definitely worth a sniff
Too floral-y for me Almost burn my fricking nose
my favorite from the line. the berry note is delicious

very comforting scent. i can’t decipher the notes very well, i would say i can smell some kind of woody vanilla (maybe it’s the blonde woods) that mixed with the fruits make a beautiful comforting everyday scent. i wouldn’t buy a full bottle but it’s very nice!
VERY VERY syrupy and coconutty, overwhelms the floral notes. Unfortunately longevity was great despite the scent not being for me. Had a headache throughout the day.
Something about this smells to syrupy for me, not into it

I usually don't post reviews, but I had to for this one..
At first and on paper, I loved this perfume.. I don't really get the coconut, but overall, it's (very) sweet, fruity (berries) and has a huge powdery vibe (which I love), so I bought it.

As soon as I got home and tried it on my skin, it started smelling incredibly mature. Now, don't get me wrong, I usually like perfumes that are labeled as "mature", but the powderiness started smelling a little like a "house that has been closed for too long". Unbelievably headache inducing.

After not even not 30minutes, I started picking up on the patchouli. I did see that this perfume had patchouli in the notes, but since no one mentioned it and since I didn't pick it up on paper either, I went ahead and bought it anyways (my bad for not testing in on skin first).

It all comes down to personal taste, but if you're sensitive to patchouli like me, pleeease try it on your skin before buying it.
Creamy but slightly sinister floral scent. Like walking into a poison garden in a good way. In the heat, it's wild and inviting. Falls a little flat in cold weather.

I was super excited to get a sample of it but I ended up not loving it :( agreeing with the mall perfume smell…it’s very strong! Reminds me of when I was a kid and my aunt would make my cousins put on lotion and they used her bath and body works scents. I freakin love coconut but this fragrance isn’t for me
All I smell is the floral, gave me a headache, I gave it away.

The opening is very “mall perfume counter,” but I mean that in a nice way. The dewberry is so juicy and mixes well with the magnolia … at least at first. Then it turned. So, here’s the thing … magnolia flowers are beautiful, but they don’t always smell nice. (IYKYK.) “Rotten” is the word that comes to mind, and that’s certainly the case here. Once that initial mingling with the dewberry settles down, the overly floral-creamy (like a facial cream, somehow), almost rotten magnolia comes forward. I didn’t recognize the coconut, but now that I see it in the pyramid, yes … I think it’s adding to the funk.

A scrubber for me but seemed to be pretty good for lasting.

I love this perfume, but I’m still learning how to work with it. Some days, it smells like the most delicious, slightly sour berry; on other days, it reminds me of a specific nail polish remover with a magnolia scent that we have in our country. Here are my observations so far:

-This perfume doesn’t layer well with other perfumes or scented products.
-The most compliments I’ve received while wearing this fragrance were when I applied it right after a shower, without any other scents.
-Interestingly, it seems to work especially well after I work out—it pairs surprisingly well with my sweat! I think this might actually be my favorite workout perfume.
-Avoid over spraying or applying it to your hair.
-This fragrance seems to thrive in heat and moisture, which really brings out its magic.

I used to like and want this fragrance, but the other day when I smelled it, it felt so mature and aged. It reminded me of something an older woman would wear, and that really disappointed me. I’ll revisit it, though. I typically love white florals, and who can deny coconut?

The perfume that sparked my recent love of scents (Especially female ones a man could pull off).

This smells like creamy blackberries in a way that fits amazingly into British Autumn.

Despite nothing about this scent being warming, it feels quite cosy and inviting in a way that just feels right for me.

It's very well blended, and smells both fresh and sticky somehow.

It does have a little bit of the "fruity shampoo" smell I don't typically enjoy, but in this scent the lactonic undertones make it feel more like a shower lotion or creame; I don't know why, but I like that much more.

About 6 months later into my fragrance journey, I can see the roots of my passion for powder and musk in this scent and think it will remain one of the few fruity scents I will pick over my growing menagerie of powdery smells (anais anais is on its way!).

I regret only buying 30ml at the time in a coy attempt to not comitt to a hobby that might not last, but I will certainly repurchase this in a larger bottle (or get a larger one in a great sale if that comes first).


Easily the best Gucci Gorgeous scent.

I am familiar with the scent of blooming magnolia, it is gorgeous, but flowers on the trees don't last long.
That it is difficult to distill magnolia, I am fully aware that I'll get a smidgen of it in perfume. That is the case with this. There is the jasmine as well.

The opening of fresh white florals is very pleasing without any chemical/alcohol blast. Fresh with some depth. I enjoy this clean composition.
Refreshing to the dry down. I get a bit of coconut.

I am happy with this, it delivers what it claims. So I am wearing this in December and thoroughly enjoying it. In Spring and Summer it will really bloom.

The opening reminded me of Katy Perry’s Meow (the pink cat bottle). Gorgeous Magnolia is nothing spectacular, but it is nice. Sillage and longevity are slightly better that the Gardenia one, so that’s a bonus. On the bottle it says that it has patchouli as a base note, which is nowhere to be found on my skin.
Overall, I think this is a decent fragrance but, again, nothing extraordinary - pleasant, sweet, feminine, good for everyday use.

nothing too crazy, nice simple white floral thats sweet and grounded. not that excited by it but i feel everyone needs a nice and easy white floral and this does the job very well! unoffensive and pleasant with enough complexity i’m not bored by it

Got a sample of this as part of my sephora birthday gift... notes like clary sage and sambac jasmine had me excited but frankly this scent hardly even qualifies as 'floral' in my opinion. It's incredibly sweet and sugary, to the point that it's almost headache-inducing. The coconut just completely overwhelms and smothers everything else :( Seems a little overpriced considering you can get a sweet coconut scent with similar longevity/projection out of something from say.... b&bw.

I feel like I'm being so mean but honestly I'm kind of shocked at how... one-dimensional this is compared to the other Gorgeous Flora scents I've tried so far. I can see why people like this, don't get me wrong, but I am just not one of those people, sadly.

I get creaminess, which must be from magnolia and coconut. I don’t detect coconut though. At the same time, there’s a bit of freshness or plant, greenness to it.

From this line, I like orchid and gardenia best. Magnolia is just not preferred scent profile.

Absolutely adore this fragrance. I tried just about every perfume in the shop and this is the one I went home with. I wear it more than anything else and get compliments on it constantly. It’s not a complex scent, but the simplicity is part of what I love about it.


I love coconut scents but they’re often too sugary or immature for me, and they rarely last long. This one lasts all day! Bright, sweet but not overpowering, perfectly balanced.


The coconut lasts throughout and is probably the strongest element here, and I’d say it’s more fruity than floral. I do definitely notice the magnolia, which is a difficult scent to capture, but I think the jasmine is actually a little stronger — moreso than the Gucci jasmine, which has an overpowering aldehyde scent for me. The musk is subtle and creamy.

It’s not in the scent pyramid but I also notice a hint of vanilla. I don’t get the patchouli or blonde woods, nothing herbal or woodt in this one, but there’s just a touch of spice that strengthens in the dry down. Surprised this one isn’t higher rated. I’d call this a safe blind buy.
looove this scent. i like the white florals buy they tend to get overwhelming. the berry in this really balances it out

I don’t normally like coconut scents, but this has to be one of the best scents in the Gucci flora line. I could still smell it on my clothes 24 hours after spraying it! Lasted longer on clothes than my skin. I’m not sure how to describe it besides it smells how I believe the color purple would smell. Even though it has that coconut, it’s not too tropical and is a really good balance of sweet and floral.

My favorite of the Gucci Sephora sampler we all got for our birthdays in November. Undoubtedly sweet but not sugary/juvenile like Gardenia, and more complex than the linear Jasmine, the dewberry (never tasted this, but can smell it) and jasmine in Magnolia combine to aromatically match the color of the bottle. I usually don’t care for coconut but here it adds a lactonic feel to balance what might otherwise be sharp white florals. I don’t know if I would reach for a full bottle, but of the three I’ve tried, this Gucci Flora Gorgeous at least gives me something to think about.
Smells exactly like Dolce Garden
i've just emptied my bottle and i agree with those sayin that it's not something new and complex but it is such a crowd pleaser, i've never encountered a person who didn't like it

Gucci Flora Gorgeous Magnolia is a pleasant floral. Not complex, but easy to like and good.
It smells like flower nectar, white flowers, a little bit of blackberry, a little bit of coconut water. The blackberry note doesn't generate a pure, individual blackberry scent, it's there just to give some depth to the flower nectar scent.
The coconut note is not something I'm a fan of, but in this perfume, it's not bothering.

Just got a sample of this as my Sephora bday gift and I must say that as a floral hater I actually love this scent!
I struggle to describe florals but this is creamy and slightly baby powdery. Maybe it's the coconut that's making it so smooth and pleasant. I get a fresh opening that's insignificant and then it dries and becomes this pretty girly everyday scent! If there's one floral scent that belongs in my collection it's this one! Fresh, creamy, smooth, feminine and baby powdery are the words I'd use to describe this scent.
Sillage is moderate and longevity is just over 4 ish hours. I spray it lightly as I only have a small sample and I'm rationing it to make it last but I definitely want to grab the full size eventually and give myself a proper spritz to test how it wears.

This was my favourite out of this line, until Orchid came out. This is really lovely. It gives me a hippy girl vibe for some reason. I can imagine a girl who drives around in a van, going to all the alternative dance raves and festivals wearing this. She's a very friendly and warm hearted girl, who is quick to make friends wherever the goes. Braids in her hair and strappy sandles on her feet. A mix of trinkets hanging from her rear vision mirror and an "eat the rich" bumper sticker. Really cool and feminine without being too girly. The coconut offers something you might not expect. It definitely gives some body to the fragrance.

8 out of 10. All year round. Day or night. Very versatile.

If a young girl asked me to buy her first perfume in her life, I would tell her to buy this perfume. It is an incredibly delicate fragrance. Very light and serene. It's not for me, who likes very strong spicy and sweet scents.

I just have a teeny tiny little sample of this but wow just wow it's so elegantly floral but that berry smell sticks its so beautiful it smells like you're walking through a field of flowers while picking blackberries at the same time, it has that sweet flare to it from the berry but that sweetness aspect it brings is so light it's barely there. This scent is heavenly! I applied a little on my wrists and now I can't stop smelling them every two seconds

I must be the only one not smelling coconut in this.... it just comes across as a weaker take on the Gorgeous Gardenia, which I think does the sweet aspect better. I think this entire line is very spring/summer (Jasmine being the most), but if there's one that errs towards fall/winter, I'd say it's this one.

Edit: Whoever is voting Taylor Swift Wonderstruck is right on.. EXCEPT this one smells more expensive and is better blended. A high-end version. So if you're a young Taylor Swift fan that missed out on Wonderstruck, this is a really good bet!

Absolutely favorite scent ever! Always get compliments when i wear this!

It smells like coconut and flowers! Amazing for a signature scent, and appropriate for any occasion! ^o^
It is a nice perfume. It smells like a nice body wash or shampoo (in a good way). Not much to say.
eh kinda smells like everything else

Been testing Gucci Flora Gorgeous Magnolia for a few weeks from a 5ml sample and I find myself gravitating towards it more and more. I love the sharp berry opening and that sweet coconut sugar scent that follows. I rarely get fragrance compliments and this one got a, "Someone smells good!"

From the range, Gorgeous Gardenia is my favorite scent and it's the lasting brown sugar that I find so clean, delicious. and lovely; I am getting the same vibe from that consistent milky coconut sugar in Gorgeous Magnolia.

Update: Ended up going for full bottle.

beautiful opening. like drinking a fruity cocktail under a blossoming magnolia tree while the petals fall over you. unfortunately it's incredibly weak and too intimate. didn't even last an hour on my skin.
The opening is truely gorgeous. Worth it for that moment. Overall, flowery and not unique.

This is on my wishlist. Besides the Jasmine one this is my top pick from the Gucci Floras. It is sweet, like candied flowers on my skin with excellent longevity and medium projection. If I ever made flower candies this is what they would smell like :D Lovely!

On my skin a fruity flowery coconut , sweet. I love it, I wish it would be stronger or last longer. But is one of my favourites. I use coconut body mist, flor layering and it does make it feel more coconuty and longer lasting. I didnt overspray it because it is quite expensive for the lasting saddly. But I love it

this scent is so sweet, creamy and powdery! definitely purple smelling, and the silage is very good imo. i layered it on a crème vanille perfume from amazon and that really boosted the silage. it just smells so creamy and sweet and good. fresh, dry, berries.

i can't believe i'm saying this but this smells exactly like a laundry detergent in the opening. then berries and coconut comes but in the drydown it turns into a soapy floral musky laundry scent. not my cup of tea.

Blind buy 🙈 after so many months of good behavior 😩
I really don't want to buy more perfumes.
First sniff, I don't have anything like this in my collection, love it 😍, fresh, sweet, floral, feminine and young or rather ageless? 🤔
Anyway after 1h, I know this scent, I've smelt it before and it's definitely in my collection, which one though?

Absolutely in love with this scent!! I wear it for any daytime outing, sometimes in the evening as well if it’s warm out. It smells unique and even though it is floral it has a sweetness to it that makes you feel flirty and not like you’re a bouquet of flowers at a funeral. Comfortable strength, not enough to offend but enough for people to ask you what you’re wearing and compliment you. A one-of-a-kind fragrance!

This is beautiful on initial spray and thought I was in love with it. I bought a travel spray (I'm learning) to give it a good try and have found that after about an hour or so, it begins its descent into a bit of a too-musky fabric softener. At that point I'm kind of over it but, unfortunately, it has quite decent longevity. It'll be a pass for me.

I enjoy this perfume the most out of the gucci flora collection, I feel this is the most unique and expensive smelling. I enjoy the dewberry note very much and it’s quite pleasant. I used to have Gucci Flora’s Gardenia and I felt myself getting very tired of it easily and sometimes even headaches, I still enjoy it but I don’t feel that way with magnolia and find it very reliable.

I realllyyy love this. Out of the entire Flora collection, this is the only one I don't find to be a Bath & Body Works fragrance..everything else smells pretty cheap in my opinion. The sillage is quite poor, but the longevity is great. I'm enjoying this very much during the summer-fall season!
i wanted to love this so bad but once the top notes faded away, it smelled like laundry detergent. the opening is very fruity and sweet. it reminds me a lot of candy!

I purchased a travel-sized version and it consistently reminded me of a beloved fragrance. After much thought, I realized its scent profile closely resembles Khaltaat Al Arabia Royal Blends by Lattafa (2020). The similarity is striking. It raises the question: are original designers taking cues from clone makers? To clarify, I absolutely adore this scent profile. Gucci's rendition is subtly softer and more floral, while Khaltaat boasts greater sillage. I have yet to assess its longevity. Considering the cost, I am inclined to stick with Khaltaat.

the best of this collection, this fragrance strikes the PERFECT balance between sweet and floral. it’s like if a bouquet of flowers was a starburst flavor, in a good way. as someone who doesn’t normally care for sweet or gourmands (this is not a gourmand, just for context) this has a juiciness i can absolutely get behind

This is by far my favorite release of 2023 and definitely in my top scents of all time. This scent is so bright and summery, elegant but youthful. The patchouli and dewberry work together so well, bringing out the best in each other and the star of the show, magnolia. The blend isn't as complicated as you'd expect a luxury fragrance to be, but I think the 'less is more' approach was executed perfectly with this scent. It carries a select variety of high quality notes that complement each other exceedingly well. The bottle itself is also so wonderful, the atomizer disperses so well and allows the fragrance to set beautifully on the skin, and the materials from which it is constructed look and feel so classy and luxurious. I will definitely carry this scent in my collection for years to come.

On my skin, this scent began somewhat sweet and mildly fruity. The dewberry note was prominent upon the initial spray. As time went on, it turned into a powdery floral with patchouli. If you like floral/patchouli profiles and prefer scents that stay close to the skin (as opposed to projecting throughout an entire room), this one is for you.

Tested Gucci Flora Gorgeous Magnolia in Macys briefly and it smelled like sweet berries. Darker berries not raspberry but also not bitter. Not tart or watery, but a nice, sweet fruity floral with purple berries. The magnolia made this creamy. Tested again a year later now in Sephora and I will say my initial thoughts were spot on. I will add that it smelled like a nostalgic hair conditioner, and then it hit me that it smells exactly like the Aussie moisturizing creamy conditioner for curly hair, also in a purple bottle. Well at least similar to how it smelled a decade ago, I can't attest to how it smells now. Gorgeous magnolia also lasted longer and projected more this time around into moderate zone.

It’s a musky, sweet floral. Starts clean and creamy, but turns more musky every hour. It’s my favourite from the line, and it reminds me of La Nuit Danse by Chabaud. It’s like a musky crowdpleaser version. Perfomance is average, and for the price it’s alright.

If you want a similar scent in beast-mode, check out La Nuit Danse. The notes are different, but somehow they have a similar floral, creamy, musky sweetness.

Opening is mesmerizing. Coconut and berries smell too perfect. But it turns into a basic jasmine perfume in 20 minutes. Since I don't like jasmine, I wished for it was a magnolia perfume but unfortunately it is not. In the end of the day, perfume is still there but the smell is unbelievably sweet. Almost like a sugar note. Maybe it is about my skin but I feel so disappointed and I would not buy it

Sweet and the coconut adds a bit of creaminess, but overall it’s quite sharp and musky on me. The jasmine is wayyyy too strong and I sadly don’t get any dewberry. The patchouli isn’t too strong and the blonde woods only comes through after a few hours. Has minimal sillage and projects for about 3 hours before remaining as a skin scent for another 3 hours.

Well, this isn't bad, but I'm not shaken up by it like many people seem to be. My socks are still on...so to speak :/

It's really *nice*, just like her sisters Gardenia and Jasmine. They're well-behaved, church girls if I were to personify anything (and I have the horrid and dramatic tendency to do so in my reviews).

This opens with pear to my nose, it's not a berry scent to me. Well, maybe slightly. Or, maybe dewberries smell like cocktail pear? Either way, it's pear in my mind.

It's a clean, musky white floral, but it's indistinct. I could tell the Gardenia fragrance was gardenia, and the Jasmine was jasmine, bur with this, it's more vague. Absolutely likable, polite and pleasantly floral, but rather nebulous and not at all a punchy floral.

It's softest in the drydown, and has the character and texture of coconut, whilst not necessarily smelling *of* coconut. It's slightly powdery and actually tricks me into smelling violet. Is that a synesthetic impression owing to the purple bottle? Hmmm...I honestly cannot tell.

It's nice, but I'll forget all about this in a month.
@FrkFors - Same thing happened to me a couple of times! Most recently with Good Girl Supreme. So frustrating!

I absolutely love this and want a full bottle but it’s just not long lasting enough for the price! I know it’s a a bit shampoo bubblegummy and juvenile but it’s just so yummy and delicious to me and makes me happy! Plus the coconut is soooo perfect I love a coconutty creamy floral! One of my absolute faves just wish it lasted longer :(

This reminds me a lot of the Narciso cubes, particularly the white one, but sweeter. I don't get the coconut at all
Sweet, powdery floral

Also reminds me of Huda Easy Bake but not as tropical, and Lush's Sex Bomb - the actual bath bomb though cause the spray smells different
@DJ Potato - Unfortunately I have the same experiences as you with the sample vials vs. the versions of perfumes for sale. And no one wants to believe me.

I have a sample of this and the first time I smelt it, I was ready to buy the full bottle. I exercised restraint though, saying that if I gravitate towards the sample over multiple days, this is worth a buy. Well, I finished the sample and can’t stop craving it. I am a person who hates creamy smells. I’m also not a big fan of coconut type tropical scents as I don’t go to the beach (despite living next to it). This fragrance though, it’s like they took the best part of the coconut flesh and blended it with an expensive floral scented shampoo. Like an upgraded herbal essences experience. I wanted to dismiss it for being shampoo-like but this is elevated shampoo. I want to smell like this. I just ordered the full 150ml bottle. I hope I don’t regret it.

Aug 22 - EDIT

This perfume turned into a longevity and sillage powerhouse after sitting for two weeks. The scent is beautiful. Highly recommend!
Berry + White florals, incredible. Total blind buy for sure.

A lot of people are saying this smells like soap when this doesn't....there is a huge difference between soap like for example a soapy vintage rose smell and then there is freshly washed hair with drug store shampoo smell(think tocca guiletta)and this is indeed that smell. It definitely smells like luxury shampoo and conditioner though but if you don't like that smell and you think it smells cheap then this may not be for you. I happen to love smelling like hair products and men really happen love that smell too ❤️ huge love for me especially because there is coconut in it. Discounters have it now, I paid $90 for the 3.3 ounce and I don't regret it at all!
Kind of good. Smells like Katy Perry meow. Fruity shampoo scent. Just buy the Katy Perry one and save your money.
It smells too good but too light, and dries off to smell like a soap bubbles.
Lovely! It's got that bubbly feel on the dry down, like shampoo. The magnolia and coconut give it that creaminess that softens the berry note quite nicely. But she's light! Too bad, it had potential.
Just very boring. Easy, inoffensive but unremarkable boring floral... Nothing special, wouldn't bother buying

Wore this today from a tester but I'm not too enthusiastic. I had read loads of good things about it but I'm a tad bit dissapointed. Smells like a basic, sweet perfume, not the floral bouquet I was expecting. Patchouli is nowhere to be found. Bad performing sillage and longevity. Not terrible and the smell is quite cute, just not what I was expecting for the price and hype at all. Will not be purchasing this.

This is really an okay time. 😂 Is it the most original fragrance ever? No, but do you want to smell good? This will give you that experience. The dewberry gives this a nice kind of sweet fruity cross between grape or plum flavored smarties candy giving it a sweet/tart flavor. The texture is a little bit fizzy, and slightly powdery. The coconut gives a nice smooth creamy feeling along with some light florals. It’s all wrapped up in that kind of designer type of fragrance DNA. If I squint I could see how this could give shampoo vibes but a delicious smelling shampoo. A lot of people are complaining about the longevity of this but I had the opposite experience. Two sprays lasted 8 hours.

This is a really beautiful fragrance done well. Its not as sexy as Flora Jasmine who is the expensive bombshell mistress or a very sexy date that was too high maintainence. Flora Magnolia is the most beautiful girl in the room, well mannered, charismatic sophisticated and sweet. She lingers in your imagination as a crush or she becomes your girlfriend or wife she is the perfect signature fragrance.

I had free samples that lasted really long and had a strong floral smell, I liked them so I got the full bottle gifted. BIG MISTAKE and it seems most people had the same experience:

The actual perfume doesn’t last AT ALL. I have tried other pulse points, with unscented lotion and vaseline, it doesn’t make a difference. On top of that, it also doesn’t smell either. Can’t discern any of the notes, at best it smells kind of fresh or like shampoo (as others have described when I asked them). When sprayed on clothing, it does get a bit better, it lasts more and you can actual distinguish the coconut and floral notes.

In conclusion: These Gucci lines all have the same issue, as I have tried the pink & green ones too, do yourself a favor and DON’T get these unless gifted or you want to smell like overpriced mart shampoo.

Honestly im disappointed with this 😑 and not because it doesn’t smell nice because it does, it smells gorgeous but because it lasts for all of 5 minutes and it’s gucci!!! The longevity is pathetic and for the price you’d expect it to last at least 8hours 👎🏽👎🏽👎🏽 it’s my first gucci perfume and my last. I’ve paid less for for cheaper brands that preform so much better and they’re toilette 🤷🏼♀️
This smells so freaking good. I just bought a bottle of it

Creamy sweet sexiness. The dewberry grabs your nose, the coconut holds it. It ultra femme, it makes me feel bold yet with a womanly touch. My man can't get enough and I often wear after a bath & for bed. My office lingers with the scent and it's unique enough to get people asking "what's that beautiful smell?" It's me, lol.

Smells like the most beautiful, expensive shampoo. Longevity is great and it’s so beautiful, you can really smell the dewberry and floral notes. It’s interesting because this isn’t a unique scent and yet it is different from the other floral perfumes I’ve tried. It’s so clean and slightly soapy yet has a hint of sweetness from the berry. Fresh, perfect for warm weather.

I've been looking for a creamy and sweet summer scent and I think this might be it! it smells like a sugary (but not too sweet) coconut whipped cream on me, yet it feels drinkable somehow, kind of like a thick cocktail. It gets even sweeter when it warms up, too! I don't like florals but this is perfect for me, get this if you want a cozy coconut scent!

This scent is beautiful! My friends and I got free samples from a Gucci ad. My friend who is a white floral lover reached out to say how amazing it was. I immediately tried on my sample and liked it too!

It’s white floral without being overwhelmingly so. I get a fruity berry opening with creamy elements. It feels fitting for spring/cooler summer/beginning of fall. If it’s too hot, the berry drowns out the other notes. It smells youthful in the opening.

I can’t help but detect a slight lavender almost lavender jasmine dryer sheet facet to this. I think it’s from the clary sage. If I had to change one thing, I’d dial down or remove that note.

There’s a bit of a vintage vibe in the drydown from the patchouli (which my friend claims to hate patchouli but did not recognize in this scent). She did say to spray it on skin because the scent when smelling the bottle itself feels “grandma”. Personally, I think it’s the best of the Flora line.

Out of all the women’s fragrances I smelled today, this was my number 1. A tastefully sweet, floral fragrance with what I initially thought it was a lactonic backbone, but after looking at the notes I realized it was the coconut giving it that creamy/milky tone. I kept coming back to the bottle in the store because I found it so addictive. Had to purchase a bottle for my wife.

This is a beautiful gem.

My favorite of the 3 in this line .

I get juicy Dewberry, creamy coconut milk, and that magnolia is so velvety. I don't know how magnolias smell in nature but this is so refreshing especially for the heat. I live in the tropics. It blends so wonderfully with other fragrances in my collection. I feel like it smells very clean as well. Like, freshly laundered clothing. The patchouli is not bothersome at all. I tend to avoid fragrances with patchouli in them.

I personally love this. It's one of my feel good fragrances

Not very floral at all. Just smells like a generic berry coconut sugar scent with a soft musk base and a little lemony pop. While it doesn't smell quite as cheap as the VS scents this reminds me of, it seems very overpriced. Nothing from the Flora line seems to match the names or concept. I'll probably just pass this over to my sister who loves sugar perfumes.

My boyfriends daughter (18) just got this fragrance as a gift from her boyfriend and it’s stunning! A truly lovely scent with dewberry, magnolia and a fun touch of coconut. Perfect for a summer evening!
EDIT:
I actually had to walk into a store this weekend just to spray this on a test strip so I could smell it walking around Stockholm in the sunshine…
EDIT:
I just bought my own bottle of this one and I’m so happy about it!

I'm lucky enough that the coconut and magnolia do come through on my skin! Right now, I'm alternating between Gucci Flora's gorgeous gardenia and magnolia. This fragrance is creamy and it makes the magnolia more youthful. its somehow clean and warm at the same time. it is sweet and cosy cause of that coconut and musk, yet totally fruity-floral because of the magnolia and other goodness. Delicate & creamy, perfect daytime perfume: Flora Gorgeous Magnolia is My favorite from this line

SOTD Flora Gorgeous Magnolia Gucci SOTD 4/5

First spray is straightforward lovely white floral. One point off for longevity, everything else is perfect from this scent. Simple, elegant, and linear. Smells like sweet white florals. This is my favorite out of the three and I wouldn’t mind owning full size bottles of any of them. Lovely vintage purple bottle. Lasts on clothes much longer than on skin. I don’t get any coconut. Spouse says that it is sweeter than my other perfumes. To him it smells like the floral part of vanilla.

Wore this to Disney, running errands, and at home. Used up a 10ml travel size. Would purchase another travel or full size. Received a free 2ml sample from Macy’s.

I smell the magnolia and a hint of patchouli on first spray. On dry down, I detect a hint of patchouli, musk and vanilla. I loved this on a strip. I even loved it when I spritzed it on in the store to test with my body chemistry. It won out over the the Flora Gorgeous Gardenia and the Flora Gorgeous Jasmine. So I purchased it. I am so disappointed. It is too close the skin and quite faint. It has absolutely no sillage. I have to find something to layer this with. I hate that I have to work this hard to get wear out of it. It sucks because it is such a lovely and feminine scent. Ugh.

I had this one for like a month and at first I was disappointed I bought it bcs I didn’t liked it but I realized it was bcs I was spraying WAY too much. Now I only do 3 splashes and omggg, this is DELICOUS, smells like a bouquet of flowers, it is sweet and pretty and I love itttttt. A lot of people say it doesn’t las long but It last more than 5 hours on my skin!

It reminds me a lot of M by Mariah Carey minus the smokiness. They seem to only share one note in common which is patchouli. But it’s the same concept, gourmand and florals notes and patchouli in the background. The top notes smelled of raspeberry valentine candy hearts and sweet coconut ice cream. The patchouli is muffled but still needed to create a good dry down that will give this sweet perfume an edge and not make it smell more ordinary than it already is.
On paper, smells like piña colada.
I smell nutmeg

I'm surprised how much I dislike this. I like magnolia in other fragrances but there's something about this that makes me want to scrub it off. Heavy white florals and way too much patchouli. I don't get any of the coconut that's listed! Bummer. It's really strong and really "perfumey" to my nose. I sprayed it about 5 hours ago and it's still extremely noticeable. So, longevity and sillage is there - for once I wish it weren't!

This is by far my least favorite of the three. Gorgeous Gardenia is probably the best, followed by Gorgeous Jasmine. I will be giving my sample of Magnolia away.

This smells juicy, creamy and a bit soapy all at the same time, so it feels really balanced.

Side note..... I kept smelling maple syrup at work all day, which I ended up realizing was the perfume. So now I also smell aunt Jemima every time I wear it lmao

I think would be hard for people to not to like this. It's very pretty and "polite" because it doesn't project heavily, but has creates a fluffy cloud-like aura around the wearer that lasts all day at the office. It's not terribly unique, but the blend is done in a way that while sweet and coconutty, it's not too childish; while woody, it's still feminine; while floral, it's not to overpowering. It leaves a creamy and watery mouthfeel if that makes sense? There is a decidedly sugary sweetness that doesn't seem to fit the listed notes. It feels like the more refined older sis to Cheirosa '59. I would never pay full retail for this perfume, but if I were to run out of other easy-reach fragrances in my collection, I can imagine seeking out a (1 oz) bottle of this on a discount website.

On my "like" scale of 1<5, it's a 3.

i like this line and the pink is my favorite. with this, the initial spray is a nice, coconut floral scent. but it becomes a skin scent super quickly and then disappears shortly after. i can't detect a scent bubble despite spraying a decent amount and I like to smell my fragrances. disappointed by the performance.

A Fresh, feminine, bright, elegant, warm, softly sweet, creamy, slightly woodsy, subtly warm spicy floral. What a beautiful fragrance! I really like all 3 of these… Jasmine was 3rd, Gardenia 2nd, and Magnolia my favorite! I really don’t pick up on too much coconut, just a soft touch. I’m also surprised that the magnolia isn’t more prominent, but it’s still there and still a very lovely fragrance. There really is a whole beautiful journey with this fragrance. It’s a more bright and fresh floral with a soft sweetness and creaminess at first. As the fragrance evolves it becomes a more musky and woodsy floral. Then, it continues as a musky and woodsy floral that has a prominent patchouli scent.

I feel that I should mention that I don’t have a lot of floral fragrances that I love, but this is a really good one. Also, I can be hesitant about fragrances with patchouli, but can also really enjoy them if done well like this one. For reference, a few of my favorite florals (most containing patchouli) include: Coach Love (2012 version), Coach Poppy Blossom, Coach Poppy Wild Flower, Nest Sunkissed Hibiscus, Chloe Love Story, Flowerbomb, FB Ruby Orchid, FB Nectar, and FB Tiger Lily.

I get excellent performance with Gucci Flora Gorgeous Magnolia. The longevity is great, it lasts the entire day and I can still smell it the next morning. The projection is really nice too, it can be smelled from a few feet away.

A beautiful warm floral. I really enjoy this scent. It reminds me of late spring/early summer when the flowers have begun to bloom and some of the petals are dying off and decaying back into the warm earth. I think I want a bottle of this.

I got a 2 ml and like it for sure, would I buy a bigger size? ehh maybe not. possibly a 10 ml. It’s not super unique, and a little juvenile. I just turned 30, so I’m not sure about rocking these fruity bath and body kinda scents like that but I think it would be a great every day for a 25 or under.

This fragrance is absolutely lovely. It’s my favourite out of all 3 flankers. I love the subtle sweetness, smooth, creaminess of this fragrance.

However, the dry down is a patchouly explosion, I was very very surprised about how this perfume evolved. I can see what people mean, when they say, it smells like Rihanna rebel fleur, I would say that they’re relating to the patchouly drydown of this fragrance, which is somewhat the opening of rebel fleur.

After experiencing the dry down I would say it’s not a safe blind buy, for those who are patchouly sensitive. I’m gonna keep trying and see how it goes.
softer and warmer than the other two in the collection. Magnolia is definitely a lot more powdery than people say it is, especially before dry down.

Playful and not too mature scent! Once I sprayed a bit of it at the store I kept coming back to put more on myself and ended up buying it instantly. The coconut and patchouli made me fall in love instantly… the blond woods note isn’t too strong, too. I adore it! Mama, I found my signature scent ! Perfect as a scent to accompany for a fresh start.

Opening is very floral but the dry down is a creamy coconut and lactonic skin scent that barely lasts 30 minutes. Kinda smells like a generic shampoo/conditioner or lotion. Safe blind buy (if it lasts longer on your skin type) that I don't hate but I don't love either. Meh.

The coconut took over everything else almost immediately after I put it on. There’s a hint of the tart dewberry but I had a hard time smelling it over the coconut. After a couple of hours it turned soapy similar to ELDO’s Ghost In The Shell but without the coconut. I like it, but I prefer Gorgeous Jasmine more. I would also encourage those who can take or leave coconut in scent to test this on their skin before buying it.

I actually love this one, it goes very well with the coconut scented conditioner I use. It's very creamy and bright, but not super floral imo. It leans into the coconut smell pretty heavily, the patchouli brings a nice balance but I think it could've had some more actual magnolia fragrance to it. Otherwise, it's a versatile and generally inoffensive scent that manages to have decent longevity without being cloying.
the patchouli and musk makes it so difficult to smell anything else.. not a nice blend.
Zara wonder rose designer version!

I don’t understand how some people rated this as weak, I did one spray at Ulta took a shower the next day, and I could still smell it

Smell- very mature, old lady like. Would not want my girl wearing this

(Tested a 2 ML sample)
This is more coconut-floral than anything. It smells so much like Rihanna's Reb'l Fleur, but smells more blended and smooth.
Love it . Smells like dolce garden, summertime fragrance beachy to my nose . Smells al little like sunscreen to my nose.I smell coconut,magnolia. Milky sweet fresh

Opens to a creamy, coconutty white floral. Warm and sweet and almost tropical. It smells like a good cheap perfume you find for a bargain. It’s fun, but I wish there was more magnolia and less coconut.

Probably my least favorite of the flora flankers… not that it’s BAD or anything, just not what I was expecting. This is a lot sweeter than I anticipated, not enough to be sickly, but it’s more fruity to my nose than it is floral. I smell more magnolia in gorgeous jasmine than I do here, which is a little funny considering the namesake. I don’t know, I don’t care for this one as much as gorgeous gardenia or gorgeous jasmine. Just not really for me.
A more creamy smell than I was expecting
What a beautiful fragrance very perfumy because of the patchouli but it’s got a freshness from the sage and coconut with added florals what a lovely fragrance 😍
The opening is lovely! Mid and drydown is just OK, imo.

From a man's perspective, I found this to be my favorite out of the other scents at Ulta when looking for a scent for my girlfriend.
Its very attractive and feminine and smells like a high quality woman, not 'i dont need a man' high quality more so great mother and wife and person overall type high quality.

And sure it doesnt last super long or fill a room, but the subtle projection is what makes the scent, it makes it more inviting and makes it more noticeable that it is you that smells so good when i smell you or your clothes up close, which i prefer to constantly smelling in the air, personally.

I usually don't go for florals but this was a gift after smelling it in an airport and saying it was beautiful. Definitely doesn't last very long, and isn't very strong either. I really like it but I'm saddened by the lack of staying power... I declared it as my work perfume as I am in a shared office and this will hardly offend anyone. A nice, pretty perfume. Creamy, coco-musky, fades to nothingness in an hour. Might be a good idea to pair with a good body butter or mist spray... Anyway it's very nice okay I just wish it lasted longer!!! >:[

The Gucci Flora collection reminds me of my childhood - maybe the Jasmine & Magnolia notes together are similar to something my mom wore. This one in particular reeled me in - this is going to be the next perfume I buy. It's a safe, everyday scent that I need.

The coconut touch was kinda lame, generally a warmer tone than the other two in the collection. Prolly a bit unremarkable for 100s of bucks. It lost the mysterious, melancholic bit that was in the bottle design and magnolia.


4/10

This is a nice safe spring and summer fragrance. Definitely not anything revolutionary and the lasting power is disappointing imo. I bought a full bottle and enjoy it but will probably not repurchase.

After spending some time with this fragrance the lasting effects are better than I initially thought. I just go nose blind when I wear this consistently.
It didn’t wow me but also I don’t dislike it, it’s creamy pretty safe scent for both men and women but nothing groundbreaking in my humble opinion.

Creamy musk...

Beautiful creamy sandalwood that merges with musk to form a creamy musky blend with some vetiver, cedar. & ambrox. Later this mix kind of forms soapy effect alongside the musk.

It's an interesting take on musk. Beautiful.

This is a strong entry into the white musk space. In fact, Gucci’s first real attempt at a straight-up musk, after their underwhelming Black Musk. If you enjoy classics type musks like Blanc Kogane, Kiehl’s Original Musk, or Jovan Musk, this will feel familiar and approachable. What stands out is the lack of intrusive florals (jasmine, lily of the valley, etc.), which lets the musk stay clean and uninterrupted at the center.

That said, I’m not sure most people will justify the full Alchemist premium for the scent alone, or just want the bottle. Personally, I am a musk lover, so I admit some bias - but so far, I’m genuinely enjoying it.

-----------------------------------------
Scent 80/100
-----------------------------------------

It’s nice but it’s a little too masculine for me. Also it’s too heavy on the ambroxan for my personal taste but still it is a nice musk fragrance that I can see being a hit and I’m sure it will definitely get compliments! It smells better in the air than right up on skin. On my skin after it dries down I get mostly ambroxan and musk which does nothing for me, I enjoyed the opening way more. Also for me it smells better on clothes, somehow it’s creamier smelling on my shirt but on skin not so much. I wish it smelled more like that on my skin.
