It’s definitely a scent you will go nose blind to but others will notice it though. Easy reach and work safe type of scent.

I thought it might have some resemblance to Musk K by Ella K but it doesn’t. I prefer that one as I don’t get much of any ambroxan in it plus it has iris. Musk K is also much more fem. This is unisex enough but leans more to the masc side to my nose.

Edit: tried it again one more time the next day and yeah it’s just very heavy on the ambroxan, an ambroxan bomb honestly, ugh. If that note when amped up doesn’t bother you then try it out but for me I would have preferred it not have that or not so much of it at least. It drowns out the parts of the fragrance I do enjoy.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Green fresh and fougere with aromatic herbs and ginger and a nice peppery woody base with a slight hint of citrus and amber. In my opinion it’s pretty mass anppealing and a great masculine scent for summer and spring. Performance is average but a great fragrance nonetheless.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: @Kellykiller wrong love edition… you are talking about the 2024 love edition.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: smells exactly like gucci guilty elixir but with a fresh citrus opening for the first 30 minutes. if you like gucci guilty elixir then just get this and save some money lol

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Gave me a headache right away. Cheap smelling but I dislike the male line. The ambroxan in the base is way to strong.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Similar to the OG but with an herbal/vegetal twist in the opening. Nice change up, though may not be unique enough to warrant owning this and another from the Guilty line. Overall, very pleasant fragrance, especially in the dry down.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme is an aromatic, citrus, floral and woody fragrance.

Its opening is citrus and aromatic, where it is possible to perceive the freshness of some citrus fruits accompanied by fresh spicy notes such as pink pepper and rosemary, as well as floral notes such as lavender. As the minutes pass, a note of geranium is also noticeable, which gives it a slight metallic smell, until reaching the drying phase with some woods, particularly patchouli, although there is also something that gives it an earthy sensation, which I want to assume is due to vetiver. The smell in general retains part of the DNA of several fragrances from the Guilty Pour Homme line, being quite close to Guilty Black, where herbal elements predominate that bring it closer to an Aromatic Fougere.

This version of Gucci Guilty Pour Homme is fresh and aromatic, providing a very pleasant clean sensation, which makes it ideal for use during the day, in outdoor activities, office work, at school or even in closed spaces, since Its projection is discreet.

In terms of longevity, it lasts between 6 and 7 hours, and its sillage, as I mentioned, is discreet.

Guilty Love is an easy-to-wear and very nice fragrance, but since it is a limited edition I would only recommend it to those who like the DNA of the Guilty Pour Homme line, especially if they know Guilty Black

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme

Such a bright juicy zesty lovely opening from the ginger kumquat orange and spiciness from pink pepper.

Some of you may feel it's kinda generic amongst the freshie but it still smells really lovely, a little tard sweet yes but juicy sweet. The lovely opening goes off rather quickly and opens up to lavender and rosemary and drydown to more earthy and herbal.

Folks who is into designers and freshie will like this. Overall fresh juicy lovely soapy laundry vibe. This probably performs better in cooler conditions as it's performance is just about average settling becoming a skin scent rather quickly.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
First 10min I get orange & ginger on top of a touch of Guilty Black in the background. The dry down of GGLove begin to turn synthetic & cologne-y.
I find Black to be more fresh & rounded w/ a cooling effect. Sexy ass Lavender & very clean patchouli dominate.

Black all day baby 💯 👑

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I really like the opening. If I had known this smelled like it did, I would have bought this over Gucci Guilty Black. The only difference I'm noticing is the opening. I love it, bright, spicy, citrusy. But it dries down so similar to Gucci Guilty Black that I'm having trouble convincing myself to buy a bottle especially at the current discontinued prices. Maybe if I can get a deal on a bottle, otherwise I'll just have to enjoy my decant until it's gone.

Opens like Coach for Men then goes to Gucci Guilty Black..

Edit: Finally got a full bottle, granted it's three years old. I really have to over spray this frag to get it to last but I'm ok with that. After so many high heat summer days with most of my colognes seeming to be suffocating, this is a welcomed change. I can wear it to smell nice and raise my confidence and not worry about being sick of it 8 hours later when it's gone stale because this just tapers off instead of transforming into a nasty hangover. I love how fresh it remains while still having character that's not based on musk.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Fresh and zesty ginger. Sophisticated, yet also quite sensual. Perfect for spring and summer. Lasted about three hours on my skin and seemed to project relatively well. A truly enjoyable scent.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Fresh Fresh beautiful summery / spring fragrance. Wish it was eau de Parfume it would have lasted longer on me and my cloths it reminds me of ADG Profondo. 8/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Lovely fresh smell, crisp and clean, doesn't seem to last long enough though. Several sprays before going out, and it's gone by the end of the night.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I bought this for my husband at Christmas. In store, on the dabber, I really smelled the spicy ginger opening. On my husband's skin it smells much different. I really like it on him. It has a slightly sweet and aquatic smell yet still masculine. The notes do not point to this at all so maybe it is his skin chemistry changing this quite a bit. It is great for those times where you don't want a pungent, in-your-face men's cologne. He really likes it, too!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
This along with most of the Gucci Guilty line is made to be one thing: people pleasing and easy to wear scent. It excels at that, which is why it receives most of the hate that it does.

Is it generic and “boring”? Sure.
Is it meant for the people who throw shade at it for being those things? Nope.

This is something you grab when you wanna smell nice and get compliments. Whether you have 4 bottles or 400, it’ll still work the same.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: The fragrance itself is very one noted. When I spray it on myself it only smells of lime, which is strange as the only citrus in it is mandarin orange. It lasted no more than 30 minutes on my skin and didn’t project at all. It smells okay, but is not worth the price.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Not a BAD scent profile by any means - just super forgettable and boring. Smells like any other fragrance you've probably smelled in your life.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Generic, generic, generic, and guess what...generic. This was made to please people and to sell.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
@rosetinteddream I blind bought this one when first got into frags and I still love it. I don’t think GGLE smells cheap, the ingredients are definitely of high quality. Wish I bought my bottle from you instead of nordstrom’s 😂

Glad you found something you like better though!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
When I first got into perfumes, I blind bought this and Gucci Guilty Black. I will say that these two were definite blind buy mistakes. I can’t help but find these as cheap smelling, and very juvenile. I don’t mean to sound so harsh, but after smelling some better quality scents...I just don’t even see the appeal in these besides the packaging and marketing. I sold both my bottles together for $40 cause even though I paid more, I don’t find them to be worth it.

🥀

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: This fragrance describes " LOVE" as bright,+fresh from floral ,citrus and spices aromatic, This smell of love bring happiness to life for sure, (unless you are negative person.) In my opinion the bright side of this smell can be medicate for stress or mental health problems too. It will not make you calm but Happy and love the moment in your life. ❤

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I’ve been binging on all the Guilty fragrances lately, and this one stands out as the lightest and most airy, and it’s more citrusy and crisp, less sweet. It feels like the Dior Homme Cologne of the Gucci Guilty line, where it differs quite significantly from the OG edt version and presents itself as a super casual, light, clean, totally inoffensive fresh citrus fragrance that you really can’t go wrong with in summer.

This excels in hot weather and gives a very refreshing and energizing vibe. The opening is gorgeous, it’s fairly bitter and a bit tart, which is what makes it work so well in hot weather… it stays fresh and never too sweet or cloying. The opening has moments where reminds me of Mr. Burberry EDT, just a sort of bright, tart, and crisp citrus with some bright green/floral elements mixed in. They both have patchouli, vetiver and lavender in common.

The green elements mix with the opening citrus and pepper and add a crisp kick to it, mixed with the warm, underlying floral notes and some very light resinous/woody vibes, but for the most part this feels like a purely citrus/green/floral concoction. Like I mentioned before, the opening has a note that really reminds me of Mr. Burberry EDT, and the heart and drydown reminds me of Dior Homme Cologne and Dior Homme Sport. This does almost feel like it could be a CK One inspired unisex scent at times especially with the floral notes in the drydown, but it’s never feminine and leans more masculine the whole time. Great scent, very refreshing, but as usual with the Gucci Guilty line, performance is not the best, be prepared to spray this one frequently. It’s not abysmal as far as performance but it doesn’t hold up as well as I’d hoped. My third favorite in the Gucci Guilty line behind the EDP and Eau, and a very solid and welcome addition to the line.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
My sister works in the beauty industry and recently acquired a load of free perfume. This is one of the bottles that was offloaded to me. Been test driving it for a few days, and it is truly sub-par. You gotta love how the PR departments of these Sephora-shelf houses try to drum up interest and fantasy for their dime a dozen flankers. Kumquat??? Gimme a break, Coty. That’s not what I smell at all. This edition of Gucci Guilty opens with a top note of “middle class suburban man after his post-gym shower.” I can picture this man vividly (I hooked up with tons of them in high school): Eastern European parents, middle management at a bank or something, 30-ish, minimally decorated condo… and just as I get a sense of this man, he is gone without a trace! Two hours of wear, MAX.

This makes me feel like I’m 18 again. Would not recommend!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Delightful. Bright citrus notes at the top initially reminded me of a CkOne Summer release. And as pleasant as some of those are, they are typically linear and a bit boring. This one has much more depth than I anticipated. The juicy opening gives way to a subtle, drier freshness (evidently rosemary and lavender, though I don't pick up much of the former). The vetiver lays nicely against the patchouli, which, like in all other Guilty releases is very smooth. I don't get as much of a clean laundry vibe as others have described. But maybe... the outdoor terrace of a juice bar that is located directly adjacent to a laundromat. Yeah, I think that's the vibe I get from this. Very nice. Easy choice for spring or summer.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Mmm, the opening is so great, but the dry down is hideous! Smells like straight-up body odor to me because of the strong patchouli and vetiver combination.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: After a while with this fragrance I decided I like it! It's perfect for out of the shower, work, or laundry day. It's super fresh with a little spice. Pretty basic but I think the kumquat gives it a little bit of an edge.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
A surprising fragrance: not your typical fresh citrus-intensive summer scent. A light mandarin is noticeable but soon transforms into a soapy delight. It smells very clean. I don't think is generic at all because is pretty distinct. Longevity is fine in the tune of 6-8 hours but after the first 1-2 hours it is more close to the skin.

The bottle is very nice too. Overall a masculine soapy fresh scent that is perfect for the office or everyday. 10/10.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I have to admit, I really enjoy this fragrance. "Generic" is not the right word for this. It is a safe, fresh, and great smelling scent. I enjoy it right through the opening to the deep dry-down. I own and also like Gucci Guilty Pour Homme and the Intense version, but this one adds a different level to the fragrance.

Definitely get that strong fresh aromatics from the kumquat and the mandarin in the opening and then plays down to a really nice dry-down with that nice earthy/herbal blend.

I got complimented right when I walked into the office, really refreshing and inoffensive.

Longevity: 5-6 hours (Average)
Projection: 1.5-2 hours (Average)
Scent: 9/10 (Love)

Would recommend if you like the aspects of the original Gucci Guilty Line.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Smells great. Clean. Should do well in a variety of situations based on first sniff. Have to do a comparison but reminds me of the original. The problem I have currently is the performance. Seems to die down after 1 to 2 hrs.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I love what Gucci has been doing recently with releases like Gucci Guilty Absolute, Cologne, Oud etc.. but this one is pretty disappointing. I don't blame Alberto Morillas or Alessandro Michele but the higher ups who decided they need to make more revenue.

This is just so generic and forgettable.

4/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Clean fresh fragrance that's perfect for spring and summer.

Great for outdoors and or just casually lounging around the house drinking a cold one.

It's fresh,it's soapy. It has a clean clothes right out the laundry vibe.

You will not offend 1 person with this cologne.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I am not that big a fan of the "Gucci Guilty" line of fragrances but while I was at the store I saw the green bottle of this new flanker & decided to give it a sniff! This is just my first impression off of a paper strip.. Right away I could tell that this new "Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme" was very connected to the original Gucci Guilty fragrances! The most recent flankers for men "Gucci Guilty Absolu, Gucci Guilty Cologne" strayed quite far from the original Gucci Guilty DNA & are quite daring fragrances! This Gucci Guilty Love Edition takes it back to the original Gucci Guilty DNA & smells a whole lot like Gucci Guilty Black to my nose! Very fresh, very green, very soapy, very Gucci Guilty! I do have to say this may be the most pleasant Gucci Guilty fragrance I have smelled as it maintains that pleasing Guilty DNA while coming off a lot less synthetic & a lot smoother.. There is a really nice citrusy kumquat note in there along with a nice clean patchouli.. It's really pleasant! If you like the scent of Gucci Guilty or Gucci Guilty Black but want something a bit less synthetic smelling, this might be for you!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I first stumbled upon this fragrance while browsing in my local Sephora. My first sniff on the test strip I was instantly hooked! To my nose it smells quite unique for a designer fragrance. I initially got like a pine smell but very natural pine not synthetic which I guess is from the rosemary. It somewhat resembles the dna of former Gucci guilty releases but not to the point of imitation.

I noticed a lot of people on here said the longevity is weak at least on my skin I got a good 6 hours before it faded to a subtle skin scent. FYI that was with only 2 sprays on my forearm. Once I try it again I’ll make sure to not have another fragrance on so I can spray my usual amount on my neck and wrists. Can’t wait until after this weekend’s cold front when the weather is much warmer that way I’m sure it will prove to be it’s best performance in the Florida heat.

All in all, so far this new Gucci guilty release seems like it will be a welcome addition to my collection.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Just smelled this in store. This will be a hit in 2020 summer. I will ne picking this one up

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I think this is totally cool

Smells soapy

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
The advertisements looks so promising with the launderette. I usually love soapy scents.

Guilty Love seems to me as an aquatic. Smells like a cheap alternative to Versace Pour Homme.

Disappointed!
Not bad. Just an unnecessary shrug.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Smells good ignore the negative hate your gonna see.Def something good for warm weather and differnt from the usual strong citrus summer scents you get usually.A clean scent that will not offend anyone.Just nice to have a lil something that dont burn your nose like most citrus heavy scents.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I was walking around Ulta looking for something new for my husband, and this one was my favorite among the new ones I tested. It stuck out to me because it is very fresh & clean and not headache inducing or sickly sweet. I think it would be great (i.e. non-offensive) in hot weather, good for if you're looking to add variety to your Light Blue, etc. summer rotation. I didn't catch any one note in particular, to me it smells like a man that has good hygiene. I quite like it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I think it's really nice ,it is different enough and just smells great. It's a great smelling scent ,that's the point right? Sorry to all the frag nerds that want to smell like a piece of wood that was shoved up a donkey's ass and then dosed with gasoline and dipped in garlic butter , I just want to smell good for different moods and occasions and this is a damn good smelling scent. I think it veers off a bit from guilty black into something that is a little better, and it actually performs pretty well if you give an extra couple sprays.

It just smells super clean, but different from other standard clean scents.

Its worth trying if you're a fan of the guilty line

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Decent balance between sweet and fresh, but feels very generic. Reminds me of other scents without having much of a character of its own. Doesn't come off as very well rounded to my nose. A bit cloying. There are much better sweet and fresh fragrances out there.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I like this new flanker. It has the DNA of other Gucci fragrances but it’s unique in its own way.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Smells good to me

Very good longevity on teststrip, on my skin not...gone in an hour

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: a bit soapy for my liking, and weak it does not last very long on me. but its not that bad

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Really enjoying all the moves that the Gucci Guilty line has been making lately. Gucci Guilty Love Edition smells even better than it's predecessors. Gucci Guilty Love Edition probably isn't going to appeal to newer noses, and may fall short within the niche/premium/indy group. Despite its niche-like quality and smell for for being a designer fragrance.

But wow, Love Edition would make for a lovely casual or office spring or summer fragrance. Definitely going to cop myself a bottle once it hits discounters.

Performance/Longevity are above average. Most people will achieve an easy 6-8 hours with 4-6 sprays.

8.5/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Smelling this now.

Pretty unique for a designer, a bit mature. Verging detergent with an initial sharpness. I don’t hate it. Not amazed.

Edit for dry down.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I want to make note that I believe the advertising campaign actually hints at the general feel of this scent overall which is of fresh clean laundry, almost detergent-like but not unpleasant. As such, it presents itself far better on fabrics than skin, where I notice it can have a harsher edge when smelled close. I’d also like to add now that I’ve had it a couple weeks, my girl actually enjoys it and wears it herself occasionally as well. She enjoys lighter fragrances and this fits that in the fact that its very airy and fizzy but pleasant. Not going to be a standout in your outfit, but a light playful accessory if you’re into this style.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: gucci black meets cacharel eden. for about 25 minutes, then it's gone, baby, gone. 6/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: despite having different notes the love edition smells almost the same as gucci guilty black. i'd say its 90% the same scent

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Not a bad fragrance per say. The kumquat/rosemary combination is quite appealing. But there's better options out there.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Smells fresh and lightly sweet with the original dna but with a twist of the kumquat. Had a green undertone.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Tested this one at the mall today
with some friends, safe to say
neither of us was impressed, not
even the sales lady, she said it
smelled like a lot of other releases,
and she was right, very boring fresh
spicy citrus combo, starts off very
artificial too, the drydown was better
but by then it was very weak.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Man, Gucci can hit it out of the park (Gucci Guilty Absolue (M/F), Memoire) or fall flat on it's face (Guilty Cologne Homme) and here they fail once again. Love Edition smells like cheap Motel 6 soap. I was in the GUCCI boutique recently and sprayed this in the air to test and a customer making a purchase turned to me and said "Awful, isn't it"?
'nuff said.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Initial impressions, I feel fairly middle of the road about this- I don’t think it deserves the low rating of 3.1 that it currently has, but I definitely wouldn’t be giving this a “love” either. In the grand scheme of mall designer fragrances, you could definitely do worse than this (Original Gucci Guilty, Im looking at you), but is in not way groundbreaking. Solidly mainstream, inoffensive, and unobtrusive, but doesn’t always mean bad. Very light and aromatic, you get more from letting it waft to you than sniffing yourself like a mad person. Average, or slightly above.

Edit: After giving this a try for the evening, it’s a take on the very familar orange vetiver men’s fragrance with a slight floral feel from something that adds a softness but just the slightest heft, however it definitely remains very airy and almost fizzy at times. There is a dose of nostalgia also because it does remind me in the dry down to some familar 90s men’s fragrance that I can’t place. There was a chill in the air tonight which Im sure quashed it’s performance, but still fairly fleeting. Only at the very end to I get that ambrox bite in the dry down, it keeps the rest real light but still noticeable until the rest of the notes drop off.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Cool! Another flanker that smells just like all the other mall scents!

The color of bottle is sure to draw people in. This is a typical sour-fruity aromatic. Very typical smelling. Next.....

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Just added the new Gucci love edition to the Guilty collection. Gucci brought it back home to the original while refining the edges and adding some new character. I was never a fan of the original guilty, but since Gucci’s new direction I’ve been becoming a bigger and bigger fan. Gucci Guilty love edition is very reminiscent of the original but it’s been modernized with unique and quality notes that makes it standout from its predecessor. If you are a fan of any of the original Guilty pour hommes then I would recommend trying out this release.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I just sampled the new Gucci Guilty Love Pour Homme! I have it on a blotter, and my forearm. Very nice! I definitely get vetiver and ginger. The ginger kind of smells like that designer generic smell. There is a very relaxing floral quality to this. All in all, I like it! But I am on the fence to purchase it! I'm walking around the mall to see if I like it enough to purchase. It is a limited edition.

Edit: On the blotter, the citrus notes have a cold feeling to them when I smell it. But that's all I get. On skin, the fragrance actually transforms into a relatively spicy green scent which a touch of floral. It is refreshing, and certainly ideal for anyone looking for a great scent to add to their collection! The bottle alone is beautiful! (My favorite color also). There is a slight, *slight* sweetness which may be from the benzoin. It has faucets that are similar to the "Cologne" with the rosemary and patchouli. Also similar to the way the patchouli is used in Absolute. The dry down right now is definitely patchouli and benzoin.

For a first impression, this gets an easy 8.5/10.

Edit #2: So I sprayed this probably 7-8 hours ago, and while it is a skin scent now, I still detect it on my arm. Wow! It is not radiating, but still, I'm shocked to see it there still ever the slightest!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Very pleasant smell, but gone in 60 min

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: People are gonna say this is generic, but in my opinion it’s quite an awesome people pleaser. It’s in a similar category as Acqua di Gio Absolu, but it seems to have a pear note and also more gourmand elements. Can’t remember exactly what “mall” designer fragrance it resembles the most, but whatever it is it smells better than that. My girlfriend said it is amazing and she’d love to fall asleep to the smell. The bottle is also awesome and there is a Love feminine counterpart too so if you have a girlfriend you can get her that and get yourself this one

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Uma versão profunda e densa do Guilty, com foco na Íris atalcada, em um tom mais escuro e opulento. Abre com Pimenta e Noz-moscada, evolui para um coração floral de lírio e Rosa, ancorado em uma base intensa de Benjoim, Baunilha e Patchouli.

Pontos Positivos
Elegância Atalcada: A nota de Lírio é de altíssima qualidade, proporcionando um toque atalcado, chique e cosmético, digno de nicho.
Performance Excepcional: Como um "Elixir de Parfum", possui longevidade e projeção superiores à média designer, durando facilmente mais de 10 horas.
Profundidade e Calor: É uma fragrância rica e resinosa, perfeita para o clima frio e ocasiões noturnas formais, transmitindo sofisticação.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Another gucci with practically no scent. I tried it at the store and was really let down. Hardly any smell from it at all.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I absolutely love this fragrance. Such a strong scent but not offensive. The amount of compliments I’ve got for this fragrance is insane. It is a little pricey, but I think maybe it’s just about worth it.
It sticks to you for ages aswell, particularly to your clothes. If it gets on my hoodie, it’ll still be present after being washed and dried.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: My thing about men’s fragrance is that I never feel like they stand out enough, THIS ONE DOES. I often say I like things that “stink” and I’ve found that usually means I like those aggressive and slightly offensive scents that give 70s/80s grandma/grandpa vibes. Dated I guess lol, gotta be the orris. Out of the bottle this is so loud and assertive, but the dry down is a nice masculine and super herbal vanilla vibe. I was just really surprised by this and I didn’t think I’d ever NEED a Gucci scent but too many people have told me I smelled good today and it’s went to my head I fear. Also I love the bottle so bad.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Ok so i am thinking...
Old money style is very trending with many followers... Apart this i say this:
Gucci Envy, Gucci rush, Gucci pour homme , Gucci pour homme ii, Gucci by Gucci. All of these old money MANLY masterpieces are gone.Now i let you think of your own what gucci have to offer now.Have a good day.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Orris + Nutmeg & Cinnamon
◆◆ In Plain English ◆◆
It's a Rootbeer/ Dr. Pepper note, but in the most Handsome, Dreamiest & Sexiest way. Semi-Sweet, Masculine (Not Sickenly Sweet) done perfectly.
●Ending is creamy, sweet woods● (Amber, Patchouli, Vanilla). Still spiced from the Cinnamon+ Nutmeg combo.

Smells good, Yes GREAT!! But NO, Not worth the price [Retail- over $200/ 2oz.] *Jomashop $109
w/ Code GOOGLE5*
(Aim your sprayer) Too expensive for Missed Sprays.

🎇 Happy Holidays 🎆

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Another screechy, synthetic, nuclear bisch bowel movement 🔥

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: There's just something too strong about this fragrance, almost sour. Absolu flanker did this scent profile better and smoother. Love edition also does this scent better but in the opposite way

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I blind bough this based on reviews… don’t know what I expected but… this is not it.

The smell that I get is something like mixing Bvlgari Black (rubber note) and Joop Homme…. Sounds ridiculous but - not really a fan 😅

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
oh you gotta love it

this has been a good driver for me during the August - October stretch in Boston right before it gets cold enough to wear my cold weather fragrances, the first spray gives you a mystical opening that people either passionately love on your body or deeply hate with a passion. they either believe your scent is wildly feminine (who cares?) or teeter-tottering on masculine.

its creamy, its powdery, its beautiful, its easy on the nose, it checks every single box on the checklist and its absolutely worth smelling if you get the chance. this has singlehandedly chanegd my mind on all gucci fragrances, and encouraged me to grab Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Homme. whatever they're doing over at gucci, they have to keep doing it, because they'll keep getting money out of me, thats a promise.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Cringe, this fragrance is goated whether or not you are a "perfume afficionado".

10/10

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Guilt is not something that us, perfume afficionados, should deal with in this hobby. We shouldn't feel any form of guilt for liking or not liking a certain fragrance that maybe is highly acclaimed in the community, by friends, family, etc. Tastes differ, and so do preferences. And in regard of Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme, one of my father's favorite fragrances, I hardly feel as impressed by the scent. But I do see why it garnered so much attention.

The opening is properly intoxicating, with an immediate blast of orange blossom floral prowess, with a clear bitter facet and a potent white floral/jasmine sweetness. Warm, spicy, even slightly cinnamon-like nutmeg and pimento aid in keeping that white floral potency in check. But to no avail; the orange blossom eventually wins the round.

At the heart, things turn interesting, but not exactly in a good way. Under the load of orange blossom, a prominent powdery orris appears with a creamy/buttery accent as well. Hints of violet are also detectable. The osmanthus does seem to add some sweet fruitiness to the blend, but it's still unable to dethrone the main protagonist. However, it's at this point that I get a pretty strong hair fixative spray vibe which mildly burns the back of my neck as I breathe in. It's got that sharpness and chemical attributes which instantly reminded me of hair fixative. And while it's not enough to ruin or overpower the whole scent altogether, it's not trying to hide either.

As we reach the base, that hair fixative vibe does diminish, but the orange blossom is still very much present. Some patchouli brings a generous dosage of muskiness, but also sort of a medicinal nudge and a sweet undertone attributed to patchouli. The vanilla and benzoin do not seem as strong, bringing just a mild ambery warmth and powderiness. All things considered, I'm not the biggest fan of the scent structure, but it does gain a few extra points for being more unique on the designer scene than most other modern day entries. The overall blending and quality are nothing extraordinary, derived primarily from that hair fixative vibe that I get, which to my nose, doesn't hint at excellent quality, but rather at intoxicating attention-garnering composition. But then again, maybe my nose is betraying me by being too sensible (skill issue).

Speaking of attention-garnering, you'll be getting plenty of that with Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme, just there's a 50/50 chance that you'll get positive reactions. On my skin, this fume lasted for well over 24 hours. On my second wear, it even surpassed 34 hours. And I see that great longevity is largely the case for most people with Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme. So no worries there - this has plenty of fixatives to offer that performance, which might also be responsible for that chemical hair fixative vibe that I get. In terms of projection, I got a very solid 3+ feet for the first hour, with a very noticeable sillage. It would slowly mellow down to 2 feet across 2-3 hours, and eventually it would settle on less than one foot of projection by hour 6-7, still noticeable if you got close enough, e.g. sitting next to me.

While Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme is definitely guilty of having a load of fixatives for increased performance and intruding people's noses, it's not guilty of being Swiss Army Knife-level versatile. And that's primarily because of that performance. The scent itself is also, as mentioned, a bit more polarizing/intoxicating than your average designer (mostly due to that sharp fixative facet), so it limits the number of sprays. As a leisure wear, for clubbing or for more formal events, this would fit just fine. For office or school, or any context where you don't want (need) to stick out, keep the sprays on the lower side.

Verdict, your honor? Guilty of intoxication through the usage of fixatives. That's largely the only thing I find Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme guilty of. Do I find it guilty of being an irresistible scent? No. Do I find it guilty of being a high-quality creation? No. Do I find it guilty of huge success? Well... yes, it appears so. Amongst designers, Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme does manage to stand out, and I believe its slightly more polarizing (but not challenging) nature, paired with the performance are what drive the sales of this juice (and, well, the brand name too, as always). Do I believe it is a good value fragrance? Not really, but it could've been worse. Do I recommend it? Not really. So, therefore, I sentence Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme to a lifetime in my "decent at best" category. But what say you, people of the jury?

Presentation: 5/10
Scent: 6.5/10
Longevity: 10/10
Projection: 8/10
Versatility: 7.5/10
Value for Money: 4/10
Overall: 6.8/10

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Nah this lasted all day through sweat and a full day at work i mean im impressed. Masculine white florals does the same thing as Reflection Man by Amouage but added vanilla and honestly much better projection maybe more ambroxan than reflection too. Reflection feels like the muted reserved version of this.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
The opening is powerful and masculine — it really grabs your attention and feels like it’s going to be something special. Unfortunately, that excitement doesn’t last long. Very quickly it slides into a drydown that’s overwhelmingly heavy, dominated by an almost suffocating synthetic amber (or something similar). A friend of mine even said it reminded him of burnt tyre, and honestly, I can see why.

Such a pity they wasted such a promising start. The unbalanced middle and base notes completely ruin what could have been a great release. I was this close to buying it after testing it on my skin, but the drydown made me give up instantly.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Picture a non-metallic Pegasus.
I get an almondy orris-heliotrope-nutmeg overdose both here and in the new one (the darker bottle, that's essentially just a more juiced up this).

Reflections third cousin. They're related, but don't take that and run with it too much.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: hard to find

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Bad smell synthetic and nothing to get compliment with...

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: This is excellent, ticks all the boxes

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Smells like reflection man by amouage undeniably. Maybe added vanilla but yeah this stuff will get you compliments i’m not a huge fan on this whole orange blossom DNA but i think it’s mass appealing and uniquely masculine with the florals. I’ll give it very high rating for this also being a recent designer release that actually lasts. The elixirs have been mostly a joke but this has quality performance and nuance for a designer release. Bottle is hideous tho and feel that’s 85% of the reason this isn’t being hyped up by everybody.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Elixir done right

This elixir flanker has gone to a different direction and smells very different from its predecessors just like what Dior did to Sauvage Elixir. Gucci Guilty Elixir is dense, woody, resinous and masculine floral. Think of Amouage Reflection Man with added resins and vanilla. A very complex and unique fragrance. This is what an elixir should be. This is trespassing into niche territory so be sure to sample first.

Projection - Strong
Longevity - 10 hours

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
10/10 for performance alone! The cherry on top is that it also smells amazing from the initial spray.

Absolutely a beast mode frag so 4 sprays is the very max you want to go! honestly, maybe even just 2.

Sprayed myself in the car at noon and the next morning this was still radiating in the car heavily.

Must own for anyone that loves extremely loud room fillers.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: The price tag was one of the reasons I was holding back on it, as it was difficult to find at discounters. When I eventually picked it up, I was breath taken, I love the powderiness in this, it's a monster in performance. Im 3/4 of the way finished with the bottle, and it hasn't been a year since i've gotten it. I will not lie tho, I was surprised, I did not expect it to be as good as it is, because the other gucci colognes are very meh, but this is perfection.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Gucci is a funny brand. Loads of really basic generic stuff and every now and then a genuine niche-standard top-quality number. Guilty absolute. Intense oud. Guilty elixir de parfum. These gems get panned at times for their association with the blander stuff - but it’s crazy unfair as few designers offer up such ground breaking and unique scents.

Guilty elixir is pure quality from start to finish. It’s different, it’s complex, it’s a stand out in the sea of forgettable designer releases. It’s also not as expensive as you might think - honestly 2 sprays of this is more than enough for anybody! For me therefore the 60ml bottle is essentially a 120ml as I’ll use 4 sprays minimum of most other frags. It’s worth every penny and if this was a PdM or Amouage it would be held up as a modern classic. Fair play Gucci - you’ve done it again and this takes it place alongside Absolute in my collection.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: @akos515 I agree this comes off as something I wore in the early 2000s (Gaultier 2). Not bad but not something I would wear or pay the price for.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: In the opening I take a few whiffs and I tell myself this smells like a more wearable version of Ganymede, I search this site and what do you know Bisch who made Ganymede, made this lol. It’s getting a bit ridiculous now that I smelled several of his fragrances which all either smell very similar to Bois Imperial or Ganymede. After about a couple of hours it does morph and then it’s more of a wearable version, less metallic Pegasus, I think just like the reviewer below that it is much better that Pegasus. Pegasus comes off an old woman/aunt scent to me with a Bengay/ Icy Hot undertone. Definitely closer to those two instead of Reflection in my opinion. It is kinda sweet too which is just not my jam but this would be great if you’re in your 20s. I think once you’ve hit your 30s it’s time to level up to something extremely better than this. 7/10 which I not a bad score here I’m just very tough on scoring but it is very solid I do think Gucci could made a tad better but lessening the sweetness.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Smells like Pegasus to me but better, more refined and smoother.
Not fan of guilty line at all. This is really good doe.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
This is Le male, not Reflection Man!
I hate it, smells pretty close to the mentioned Le male, which I hate even more. Cant say much about it...
If you want the clean florals of Reflection just buy the original or Shiyaaka. If you want that sharp Le male scent, go for that instead. This is totally a waste to have. Very outdated scentprofile, would not recommend.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I recently purchased this one. I’ve smelled it when it came out back in the day and I didn’t like it at all.. I don’t know if my nose changed or my taste or what exactly changed but now I love it. To me this is so fresh and clean and there is something green in it. I don’t know why but I don’t get the extremely strong vanilla at all. I think that hast to do with the fact that I’ve had Covid like 4 times and since than something changed. (For example I used to think SWY intensely by Armani is way too sweet and now I can’t smell it that much).
So anyways I get do get the sweetness that comes after 5 min but it’s more like honeyed orange blossom if that makes sense. Also I didn’t know what it reminded me of but than I got it.. there is something extremely linden blossom or linden tea or like lindeny about it. I know there is no linden in it and I know it’s not exactly linden blossom but it kinda reminds me of linden blossom a lot. But yeah hey my nose is pretty weird the last 1-2 years so who knows maybe I’m the only one getting that linden blossom in it.
Performance is really good and price wise I got mine for 79€ on discounter which is pretty good !
It definitely is not for everyone. Not a safe blind buy!
Not many at all. I’d say it’s kinda unisex leaning more feminine. At least to my nose. But I do love it exactly for that. I’m kind of a lover of powdery slightly feminine fragrances.

One more thing is I usually don’t like neroli at all I can stand a bit of orange blossom but in general I don’t like it at all.. but in this one I love it!

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I blind bought it, since there was nowhere to test in my area and after getting it I was quite disappointed given the hype it's getting.

For me it smells like 70% vanilla, 20% orange blossom and 10% powder.
The smell is quite soft, powdery and sweet. To be fair it leans more feminine, I don't see masculine man wearing this and I did not get anything masculine in the notes as well. If I smell it on the street I would guess it's a woman passing by.

Not sure why all reviewers are hyping it so much, it is actually quite boring scent. I would not call it generic, since I did not smell anything exactly the same, but I would call it basic, linear scent. It does not change much from the opening, you just get a bit more vanilla in the mid and synthetic woods in the drydown.

It also has nothing in common with the actual Gucci Guilty line, this is entirely new fragrance that should be it's own line.

As a positive I would say the performance is very strong in terms of longevity and projection. If you like the smell it would be positive, but after a few hours it started to be quite annoying for me even though I sprayed it on my hand and it remains after wash.

For me this is hard pass - not worth the price and hype. Test it before buying.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: This does not smell like Reflection at all??? This is way better in my opinion. Has this really addictive saffron/oud note (not real oud but a clean "western" oud accord, pretty subtle and airy) that I love. This reminds me of a slightly more masculine version of Liquide by LLI (also by Quentin Bisch I believe). Definitely getting a full bottle of this one!

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I love it, but it’s polarizing for sure. The opening has this talcum-like pungent wall that is impossible to ignore. It sticks to the inside of your nose and colors everything you smell for the next hour, or so. This is actually the magic of what happens later. This stuff clings to clothes, for days. I had my flannel hanging on a hook near my bedroom door, and with my window open, I would get these wafts as a breeze would come in, and it was so intoxicating each time. All different scents and smells throughout the house, melded with the sillage from my hanging shirt was exciting. Dinner that was cooking, cookies and a cake in the oven, freshly mowed grass, whatever else was going on and combined with this fragrance was.. magical. Is it nice to smell from someone 3ft away? Sure. But this is the one that gets you like a tractor beam from across the room.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
i've loved this one since the first time i smelled it! it's so gorgeous, sexy, alluring, i can never stop smelling it on myself. but a little goes a long way for sure. as lovely as it is, too much for sure makes my head hurt. it's bright and spicy and warm and just so good, it really makes an impression

i love the orange blossom and the powderiness of this, out of all of the variations of gucci guilty i smelled (including the women's elixir- it's too generically floral-) this was the only one that felt unique and special to me.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I like it, wife hates it -says it smells of Germoline!!

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
This is quite an interesting one..

I got a decant of this with an order last year in the middle of winter, knew nothing about it, tried it on strip first and thought it must be a summer fragrance, just because it has this bright, floral quality it. Somehow a bit got onto my hand and I was amazed at how ridiculously strong it projected off of it. I went outside at night, it was freezing cold and I could detect it very distinctly just from that little bit on my hand. I ended up giving the sample away, because at the time I was only interested in very dark, woody stuff, but it certainly left an impression on me.

I ended up testing it, among other stuff, on skin and it still blows my mind how much stronger it is than everything else. It's loud, but not screechy, bright, but not abrasive, sweet, but not overly so, floral, but not too feminine. Some of it got on my shirt, when I sprayed in store over a week ago and it still projects off of it. It takes several showers to get it off my skin completely.

Sweet, buttery, slightly bubblegummy iris/orris with orange blossom and vanilla - that's what it mainly smells like to me. It smells like a memory of summer in the middle of winter.

In my opinion a must try for anyone who is into fragrances. I'll probably not buy a bottle, because it's just too strong for my personal liking, but it's definitely something I want to smell again in the future.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: mevsim geçişlerinde rahatlıkla kullanılcak bi parfüm hava soğudu gece 15-20 derece sık baba sık sık kışın da sık ilkbaharda da sonbaharda da hatta yazın bile sıktım ben bunu np yani...... reflection ve pegasusla benzerler

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: layer this with vibrato or tygar !! compliments everywhere you go

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
after a whole bottle(60ml which lasted me 3 months)this does NOT smell like Amouage Reflection man
however;sadly it smells just like JPG LeMale (with a lil more vanilla)
DO NOT FALL FOR THE HYPE! i love white floral men scents and tbh this just dont worth the price or the hype

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I loved this one sice the first time I smelled a year ago. I just bought it a week ago, and it is great. But I remembered it a little more stronger and spicier. Has it been reformulated or maybe I got amosmic?

Anyway, great fragrance. My one to go for special events

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Really strong and long lasting fragrance, not that similar to Amouage's Reflection Man, but there are some similarities. Less woody, more strong powdery vanilla, like in PDM Herod or EP Divine Vanille. Some orange notes at the start, but i feel like the nutmeg and vanilla is more prominent. The scent doesn't seem to evolve that much.

Its good (gf loves this one) and reasonably priced at discounters (got my 60ml for 80€).

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: This scent is truly amazing. I would choose it over any version of Sauvage. Even though they don’t smell very similar, considering that almost the whole world seems to be obsessed with Sauvage, this fragrance can definitely be used as an alternative because it never makes you miss it. An outstanding fragrance overall.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
This is one weird little green bottle.
Why weird? Because I disliked this fragrance since day 1, in 2024.

Now I am on my 4th bottle, surprisingly priced dropped on it somehow.
It is completely different than 90% of "designer" frags, lasts long too and has a healthy sillage.

What I dislike? Well... is hard to explain, is the hospital disinfectant note, the bitter notes?! The fact that in airports it gave me an "unwashed" feeling lol like feeling dirty... probably that's where "guilty" comes from.

Overall impressive release and yes, I will repurchase.

Gracias Coochie!

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I’ve grown to like this … I hated it at first BUT… ima performance whore and this is the best projector and performer I’ve seen in 10 years …. So for this reason alone it made it into my collection - It’s strange funky floral and I was able to find the beauty in the funk somehow. But ima performance whore so that’s only reason I like this . It’s not a safe blind buy, it’s not very masculine but it’s not so feminine either. This is very niche smelling and challenging. Test at Sephora first ! I love Quentin Bisch so I can appreciate all of his work somehow .

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: maybe my nose is messed up but all i get is a very small amount of vanilla and a lot of a smoky plastic smell. my friends can all smell the notes listed in fragrantica with the vanilla and such and say I smell amazing when i wear it but im just nose blind.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Had to try it multiple times for months to pull the trigger on it and i did! Such a beautiful scent

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: It’s a banger. I also really like Gucci guilty love edition. And the elixir is the beast mode version. I would not wear this on the regular but love to wear it if going to a gig or outside party or something because it’s strong a projects and last forever. It’s an orange blossom bomb basically. Love edition is the daily driver version

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Perhaps it's just me, but my initial reaction was that Guilty Elixir reminded me a good bit of Prada Luna Rossa Black. To my nose, Guilty Elixir has very similar notes of that rubbery powder that a get from Luna Rossa Black. I think I need a little more time with this one before I decide whether I or not I need a full bottle. To be continued.....

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Gucci Guilty Elixir pour Homme is an orange blossom, osmanthus, warm, soft spicy, powdery vanilla based scent. When you first spray it on the skin it’s more sharp and slightly bitter, but within half an hour it warms up and rounds op beautifully on the skin. The nutmeg, pimento seeds and the patchouli create a equally balanced counterpart for the florals, the benzoin, the orris and the vanilla.

I love the way it’s performing, this is truly a long lasting, strong projector orange blossom forward scent! I think ambrofix took care of that, but also makes the juice smell a bit unnatural, if you get what I am saying…

I have bought this perfume because my husband loves it as well, so we’re using it together. When I wear Gucci Guilty Elixir pour Homme, I like to layer it with one of my more natural, realistic orange blossom scents, but those don’t last. So if you have any photorealistic orange blossom scents that perform poorly but smell heavenly and you want to prolong their wear, layer them with this. You’ll get the best of both worlds, trust me!!

I am wearing it today layered with Sana Jardin’s Venus of Verbena and dare I say, I smell intoxicating! I have worn it in the past mixed with Miller Harris’ Le Jasmin or Guerlain’s Nettare di Sole and it cuts down on the amount of ambrofix I detect and adds more of a real scent of orange blossoms flowers. I don’t mix it with other fragrances because I find it too masculine on its own, it’s really unisex IMO, I mix it with other perfumes because I like it to smell less ambrofix heavy…

Also, be aware that this scent comes in a 60 ml bottle only and it’s quite pricey. It’s strong and has beautiful radiance in the air, thanks to ambrofix probably, but it’s on the pricey side of designers end!

I can’t comment necessarily on similarities to Amouage’s Reflection Man because I have only tested that one once, about four months ago, but if it’s indeed very similar to Reflection Man, it makes me feel it’s better value for money, since Amouage perfumes are super expensive.

I have Pegasus though and I can tell that these two share the same vanilla base, but Gucci Guilty Elixir is an orange blossom vanilla forward perfume, while Pegasus is an almond vanilla forward perfume. It is not the same thing, because florals/spices don’t smell like almonds/nuts. So no, not really similar!

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
OMG cant believe i got this obsessed with this master piece Very elegant simple scent with the perfect sillage and longevity U looking for a syrupy vanilla this is perfect for you
i cant stop sniffing my wrist its like crack every time i imagining myself:
sitting on a fresh clean after rain very green grass that is mixed with insects smells and nutmegs that are on the ground in a big garden after a heavy rain during the fall grey clouds covered the area and there is this cold brew wind hitting you while you are surrounded by alot of orange trees that had just bloomed and u smell the orange blossom mixed in the wind
while u carry a wet patchouli and and a home made very sweet vanilla in one hand and reading an old book a fantasy book with that smell of old pages ALL OF THIS MIXED AND HIT U ALL AT ONE IN THE AIR'S ENVIRONMENT very WELL MADEEEE DONT UNDERSTAND THE HATEEE

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Smells like an oilier version of love edition. They both seem like takes on Reflection man by amouage masculine white florals but to me it either comes off like a grandma making tortillas or fabric softener. Not something personally wanna smell like but i do think it smells good. This one has great projection

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Finally pulled the trigger on this one as a birthday present to myself. I must’ve requested 10 separate test strips of this over the last 6 months. I can recall each time being pretty amazed at how many *days* later I could still clearly smell the fragrance on the test strip. Anyway, finally caught a really good deal and now I’ve been wearing it for 2 days. It’s a smidge dirtier on the skin, but the overall orange blossom / vanilla dna carries over beautifully. I can understand some people saying it’s feminine. If you compare to Sauvage or Aventus, of course it’s feminine. Here’s the thing though… as far as what you can get at your local Sephora or Ulta… this is the most niche-like experience you’re going to get. It’s unique, it’s a bit weird, but above all it smells really really GOOD.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: It's giving Minuit et Demi by Fragrance de Bois to me.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Gucci elixir is syrupy Reflection man. I don't get anything from bad comments saying about this fragrance. Well known white flower,orange blossom scent. A designer mass appealing doing its job wonderfully. It last 12h on my skin and I'm using it all year long. When body gets wormer the fragrance project like mofo!
From a designer frag point of view this fragrance is 9 /10 for me.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: The pimeno seeds and ambrofix is a horrible combination damn this smells dirty

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Nose Note #456

I could guess this is Quentin Bisch, it fits his "weird" line of fragrances, at least to me they are weird and niche - Ganymede, Encelade, Experimentum Crucis and this one fits in the line. This is 100% niche fragrance, nothing like the usual Gucci about it (actually, if you consider the clothing style this might actually work, but doesn't feel like a usual Gucci fragrance which are usually mass appealing).
Yes, this is "medicinal, metallic" gunpowder-like and very sweet. I badly want to try Amouage Reflection Man, but I pray that it's nothing like this... This is typical beastmode Quentin Bisch. Out of all things it reminds me a lot of Rosendo Mateu Nº 5 Floral, Amber, Sensual Musk - it has this same play-doh plastic smell.

UPD. Now that I've bought Milestone Mouj Affection I do get the slight resemblence to Amouage Reflection Man. It's a weird scent to me.

3/10, a big no-no

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Blind buy review: Smells like a milf drunk driving a 7 series bimmy through a corn field, while listening to Lana del Rey AND chief keef. This is perfectly unisex and not leaning masculine. Ignore the "leading masculine" votes, my opinion is true.
Longevity and sillage: ETERNAL.
Smell: First, medicine, metallic, candy, granny like. Later it gets more creamy and floral. Somewhere between HORRIBLE and MASTERPIECE.
Do NOT blind buy. Do NOT believe strangers on the internet, besides me.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Vanilla and leather. I have since watched some reviews and there apparently is no leather in this, but it smells like leather to me. Still relatively alright. I don't mind this. Powdery, for sure, which I'm a big fan of, but the leather makes it a bit different than your usual powdery numbers. Still, I wouldn't mind getting this as a present, but would I buy it? Not sure.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Similar to JPG Le Male.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Great, classic and timeless scent. Reminds me of ''Grease'' era.
Very powdery and potent! Amazing performance.
Just not a scent for me. Quickly becomes sickening after a while.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Very Dry and powdery . Warm .Certainly not a Freshie .From start to finish remains constant / linear . Longevity and projection is good .
..... You will be noticed .

Gucci elixir de Parfum ... must be the Italian version of Le Male elixir and ... both in common have Quentin Bisch their creatior .

In my opinion - not a safe blind buy especially considering the price .

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: When I tested this on a strip I immediately thought of good and plenty’s licorice candy. Anyone?

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I've tried to like this, but the strong Osmanthus note makes it smell like Olive Oil, and now I can't unsmell it. To my nose, it's the oiliest smelling fragrance I've ever tried. I sprayed it on in-store and immediately had to wash it off when I got home. Not my cup of Tea at all.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I had high expectations for this release. I gave it multiple chances, but I just don't like it.

It's a more complex scent then the rest of the guilty line, but Its very messy to me.

Incredibly cloying and gives me a headache. Smell's like medicine.

I could see why some may like this, but this is not for me.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Gucci Guilty Elixir is so good in my opinion that it becomes a problem lol. From the first spray, you get that a blast that just grabs attention and that almost has a floral root beer float feel. It’s seductive very intoxicating in a good way like you know you smell good, and the people around you know it too.This turns heads every time I wear it. Women lean in near me. Guys also ask what I’m wearing.This works so well with my skin chemistery. This elixir is just pure attraction in a bottle.If you're looking for something LOUD that speaks sensual heat, and sex appeal, Gucci Guilty Elixir's got it.
Top 5 in my collection 11/10. PS: This stuff has nuclear firepower if you dont like strong perfumery this is not for you. Also test it on your skin on paper is a whole other story

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Opens sweet and creamy, has a medicinal scent that resembles "Calpol."
It's kind of boozy, yet fresh. White floral notes are apparent from the off.
Lots of vanilla and Tonka, also smells nutty.
Powdery notes develop, iris. It's reminiscent of spicy, animalic orange blossom. Very floral.
Aromas turn green but it's still creamy and nutty. Overall smells deep and rich.
Vanilla is constant and it only gets sweeter. There's a note which smells like almond before it develops a modern musk accord.

Performance is nuclear! This will fill a room and lasts on skin 12hrs+. (It's too loud TBH.)

Good for evening wear year round and would work well on a date, however someone commented that it smelt like an "old ladies perfume" so try before you buy.

I think it's very pleasant and the quality is good.
To me it's closer to Le Male than any of the previous Guilty offerings and I feel this is actually what Le Male Elixir should have smelt like.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Finally got around to getting my nose on this yesterday at Doha Hamad airport while killing time on a layover.

Yikes, the "Play-Doh" mentions are real. Certain vanilla fragrances really do go that literal Play-Doh route in their dry downs. Prada Luna Rossa Black also suffers from the same thing.

This is very effeminate, which is fine, but as with Tom Ford Noir Extreme (another sweet sugar bomb), this definitely strikes me as a firmly unisex fragrance to my nose.

This is more for the "manicured/shaped eyebrows, off the rack skinny fit suit" type of guy, in my opinion. I'm actually a bit stumped here. Do most men genuinely want to smell like this? This is very close to something akin to "wasted chick at a nightclub wearing a vanilla gourmand". To the point where I swear I have actually smelled this same fragrance DNA on women passing by on Saturday nights out. I wish Gucci would bring back something more in line with their older, marketed-for-men offerings, e.g., Envy, Pour Homme 1, Pour Homme 2, etc. I'm not some jaded Gen X'er btw, I'm young Gen Y, but yeah this is just so god damn sweet and crass to my nose...

Not going to give this a rating. Much like Quentin Bisch himself, I find this extremely overrated, yet at the same time, I also don't think the composition of the fragrance itself is terrible or anything.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: surprised no one has compared this to Alexandria II by Xerjoff - similar pencil shavings & play dough powder but with more floral! Close resemblance!

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I’ve tested it twice now and still forgot the scent again — so nothing groundbreaking after all. It’s not a completely standard fragrance, but nothing extraordinary either. Something on the borderline between gourmand and a somewhat lighter oud. But the vision is imprecise…

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Good smell tbh im not seeing it as a male perfume its more unisex to me
8/10 beautiful one

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
To me it smells like a le male flanker. A very good one though!
Perfect for me

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Very similar to Jean Paul Gaultier Le Male eau de toilette except Gucci Guilty elixir for men is heavier and sweeter(feminine) in vanilla.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
This smells so beautiful. I have 2 favourite fragrances and this is one of them. A few words to try and describe Gucci Guilty Elixir - yummy, sparkly, magical, unique, sweet, sexy, playful…
The first time I tried it in store, the tester was pretty much empty and I spritzed on the tiniest touch possible, while testing other fragrances on my other arm. Surprisingly this was the fragrance that kept coming to my nose, despite how little I was able to spritz on. And what a magical smell and feeling it was…
Making this a signature scent - I LOVE it!
Really awesome performance too, the way the smell just wafts around and actually comes to my nose while I’m wearing it is so nice. And it lasts so long.
This is really such a special one.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I just purchased this, so I'm rating it off of first impression. I love the scent. It is very sweet, but is fairly original. I can not say that anything else smells just like it. There is similar, but it is unique. I will have to return on its performance. It seems like it should last, we shall see.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: امتلك العطر منذ عامين تقريبا وحتى لو استعمل الا جزء قليل منه، العطر فيه شيء مزعج بالنسبة لي لا اعرف ما هو، يبدو لي وكأنه مشروع لم يكتمل ويحتاج الى تعديل، اتمنى ان يصدر له فلانكر جديد يعالج هذا الامر، تشبيهه بعطر امواج ريفلكش غير صحيح، اداء العطر قوي وثباته عالي جدا على الملابس

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Guilty Elixir is sweet, spicy, and even has a bit of a Play-Doh vibe—in the best way possible.

This one is really strong. The orange blossom hits immediately with a sweet, creamy feel, and there’s some spice in the background. Some people say it smells a bit like Play-Doh, and honestly, I get that, but in a comforting, pleasant way.

It’s creamy, playful, and sweet, with just enough freshness to keep it interesting. It’s like someone told Gucci to make Amouage Reflection but more mass appealing, and they nailed it. The vanilla here smooths everything out, making it easier to wear for more people. Honestly, I prefer it over Reflection Man.

Performance is nuclear. One spray lasts for days on clothes and projects strongly off the skin. This isn’t a scent that stays close—it makes its presence known.

It’s definitely an all-rounder. You can wear it year-round, but if it’s warm outside, don’t go beyond one spray. This stuff is potent.

I’d give it an 8 out of 10. Bold, sweet, and way easier to wear than some niche options. One of the best Guilty flankers out there.

In short, creamy, spicy orange blossom with a sweet vanilla twist. Think Reflection Man but more mass appealing. Nuclear performance. One spray is all you need. Eight out of ten.

RobTheScent - Honest takes. Big nose energy.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I get a softer, less minty Reflection Man.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Fresh minty toothpaste.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I tend to always find something enjoyable in Quentin Bisch’s perfumes, and some of them are quite outstanding. This, however, is pretty revolting. I regret having to say so, I usually keep quiet about scents I don’t like. The reason is probably that it is a bit like Reflection Man and Fleur du Mâle — both of which I enjoy — but it has something disturbingly synthetic and sickly sweet over it that actually made me scrub it of my wrist after 45 minutes.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Smells funky. I did not know all those notes combined could evoke such a chemical smell. I am overwhelmed at first by a potent medicinal smell; plants used as medicine. This eventually dries down to something tolerable, classy even. When you knock a fragrance for being too cookie-cutter, this is what you get in response. Enthusiasts will toast to you, but you may clear out a room otherwise.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Smells great but this is a unisex fragrance straight down the middle. Way too floral to be a Men only fragrance

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: An overbearing medicine concoction. Regret even wearing it. So glad it was just a sample. Looks cute: try me--but for me, never again. I live for unusual funky perfumes--like Bowmakers--this one aint that.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci

I See some compare this to ysl myself edp. they share a note but myself is musky blue / masuline, vs guilty elixir is like a desert topping. Pegasus for sure has the same vibe as this thought, actually i dont think the average person could tell them apart if you wore them interchangeably
