product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I have it and i love it! Bought right from the begining and using it since then! It's super strong, strong enough to cause an explosion if use to many sprays! The smell itself is nice, summery, flowery, very easy to like, but a little to synthetic! Recently I have smelled Zara Vanilla 01, and it is very close to this one! Performance is also great! My advice is to go gentle with the sprayer!One of the strogest perfumes from my collection, 5 spray is more than enough for the whole day! Compliment getter 1000%! From me it has a 9,5/10.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
a banger of a fragrance , i can litteraly smell it the next day on me but unfortunately its very intoxicating ,to the point its giving me headaches.
its very unique ,as i dont remember smelling something similar that reminds me of this one in particular but the opening for me is reminiscing of fahrenheit le parfum by the heavines and also the smell.
its sweet , floral ,a bit spicy and although its syntethic it doesnt bother me that much .
i dont think its a safe blind buy tho ,better smell it before buying. overall i think its an excellent fragrance and also one of my top picks for date nights , 8/10

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Super Synthetic. Hate at first sniff😖

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
First impression definitely in direction of Prada L'Homme but deeper sweetness and added leathery accord. I can see similarity with Le Male Le Parfum but this is much stronger.

Projection and sillage is really great. Beast mode practicly. Easy with the sprayer.

Not for everyone as it's powdery sweet.

Awesome.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
A sweet, pretty, floral albeit strange scent that always grabs attention. The orange blossom and pimento give this fragrance a sweet sharpness, while the vanilla and bonzoin make it well rounded and quite bouncy. For me, it is like someone took the classic Gucci Guilty, and turned up the saturation and volume on all the notes.

It performs well, but living in a hot country the only issue with this is that it falls apart in the heat, becoming quite sickly and headache inducing.

I have seen the comparison's with PDM Pegasus and Amouge Reflection and it is very much in the same race, albeit much lower down in the pecking order.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: aşşşırı tozlu pudralı bi koku midemi bulandırdı

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Reminds me of Fleur du Male

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
4 Compliments within 1 hour of wearing this. All the compliments at work and we have our separate isolated office.

Enough said on this one.

Last all day and really good sillage. Pleasant Orange Blossom.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Gucci Guilty Elixir was a fragrance i was very curious about, especially amongst recent designer releases, thanks to the largely positive feedback it received. The fragrance is compared to Amouage Reflection Man, which itself is often compared to the original Le Male so i aproach the scent with this mindset. To further add to the string of comparitions, just days ago i tested the most recent iteration of Gucci Guilty Love Edition and that one also pops up firmly in the “reminds me of” section.

Before i even smelt the fragrance, in my mind i was already preparing a very positive impression and my wallet for a new purchase in the future. In an unexpected manner, i have to say that Gucci Guilty Elixir is not IT for me. Infact, i prefer all the above mentioned fragrances and i’ll explain why.

By order of which i mentioned each of them:
1. Amouage Reflection Man is the classiest of them all, its smooth, its regal and its the embodiment of quality when it comes to this scent direction. What i appreciate about Reflection is a sort of vintage aura that the fragrance gives off to me. Very Chanel, almost aldehydic type vintage. Fresh and bright done with high class, an aristocrat's day time scent.
2. Le Male is the most popular of them all, a trendsetter and generation definer. Le Male pointed the way towards the future of men’s perfumery by popularising traditionally non masculine notes in a men's fragrance. Maybe it wasn’t the first, but one of the first to do it on such a mass market scale.
3. Gucci Guilty Love Edition 2025 is the most modern of them all. Its that young man that has a genuinely kind heart and inviting smile. Equipped with all the up-to-date ingredients and aromachemicals, its a modern fougere that’s bright, pleasant and a good vibes fragrance.

Guilty Elixir is sharper then all three of them, more agressive, more synthetic and surprisingly less detailed. To my nose, it lacks the refinement of Reflection Man and it lacks the casual pleasantness of both Le Male and Gucci Love Edition. Its mainly a white floral and green scent but the accords are "thorny" and the soapy aspects are scratchy. Picture sticking your nose directly into a bottle of very concentrated floral fabric softener. Only after a good while does the vanilla move forward but its too little, too late. In the first phases, the vanilla doesn’t manage to roundout the fougere elements as it did in Le Male, because they are too sharp to my nose.

I believe it beats the trio in terms of performance but that is no longer the most important benchmark for me. Its a pass and im glad i didn’t blind-bought it.

P.S. My God, its done by Quentin Bisch. This guy just cannot catch a break from me. If i knew who created the scent before i wrote my notes, i would have questioned myself if its subconscious negative bias against him.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
This is my first encounter with Gucci, at least on my own skin.
It's the kind of scent that makes you obsessed with smelling your wrist. I got a sample from my perfume shop and I couldn't help but buy a full bottle.
It has good persistence, not the best sillage but still good, and a smell that's unlike anything else that I've smelled. Still a designer smell though, so nothing super fancy. The price could be maybe 50% lower.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Another Bisch bomb. Unfortunately my own tastes still don’t line up with most of his work and the same is true here. I love Le Male, and I’m fond of Reflection Man, but this is very overpowering to my nose. It feels like every element is cranked up to the max, and it comes across as a very confusing soup of notes. Much too strong for me sadly but I can imagine it could smell nice in the sillage for a lot of people. 6.0/10

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I think the new batch code isn't performing like it used to 🫠

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Superb Vanilla perfume,
A great mixture of florals , it's a very elegant adult perfume,
Safe blind buy for the vanilla and floral lovers,
It's more men than women, yet ,it can be Unisex,
Performance is strong ,
Pricy but worth it indeed

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: This is for men but I think a woman can easily pull this off. It’s not strong in sharp spices but very rounded. I mostly get Orris, nutmeg, amber and I think I get a tiny hint of the pimento seed note. I have other fragrances with this note and something about it is so addictive! For the fall winter I will definitely be giving this a tests run.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: This is literally Reflection Man with a hint of masculine sweetness. This somewhat reminds me of barbershops. Sex in a bottle. Absolutely 10/10

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Reflection man with more vanilla

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I smell insecticides in the opening for some reason .. but take that out of the equation and it's a pleasant floral take on vanilla that's really refreshing and calming .. a bit on the nutty side too around the edges .. but it's definitely unique .. and in that sense i think it's good

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I used to own Amouage Reflection but ended up selling it due to its poor performance, which didn’t justify the price I paid. I came across this fragrance, and it offers much better performance at a far more reasonable cost.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: This has hint of Myself, hint of Armani Code parfum, hint of Tom ford eau d'ombre leather, hint of gucci love edition, hint of JPG Le male, never smelt Amouage reflecrion but seems it is similar to it also. So, I believe the vanilla note is this thing which link all this fragrances to Gucci Guilty elixir. I am not sure what to think about it, sometimes I am liking it, sometimes not and feel it is too redudant and ordinary.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Better than reflection man, I own both. Niche snobs gonna disagree.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: This is good but in my opinion very forgettable. It has a nice scent but the bottle is so hideous, it has nothing to do with the scent and its barf green. 5/10

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: smells just like grape cough syrup

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Surprisingly very nice. The best Gucci fragrance I've smelled (not a fan of most of them). It reminds me of a very familiar DNA, I've never smelled Pegasus or Reflection Man 45 so I mostly get pieces of Le Male here. It doesn't really remind me of MYSLF, maybe a tad in the dry down but this is way sweeter and more complex. It reminds me of a new car smell, it's very sweet with a lot of vanilla but it's still a very masculine smell. It has some nice spice and the white floral gives it a soothing, clean smell. The orris is not the star here, this is not a Dior Homme. It's just a background nuance.

Pleasantly surprised with this overall. I'd consider this about a 90% mass-appealing scent, some might find it cloying or a little strange but it's not gonna offend anyone. If you're a fan of any of the scents its compared to I'd reccomend trying it. This smells like how I'd imagine the inside of a millionaire's car would smell. It's STRONG too, projects like crazy.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: i was at sephora looking for feminine perfumes and found this, i thought it was in the wrong place but no? to me this is very white floral, clean and feminine which i really loved. however its expensive for what it is, but definitely one of the best white floral perfumes out there. i do agree it fits for a lot of occasions but it its also epitome of spring time scent, idk why theres so many votes for winter and fall its too light for these seasons.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: smelt this at Sephora twice now and both times thought it was amazing but its $220 in canada for a 60ML literally can get amouage reflection man for cheaper price per ML ridiculous pricing

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
This elixir turned my nose upside down since I didn't use to care about these heavy vanilla scents but man... This was my biggest shut the fuck up and let me talk when it came to fragrances, sprayed it on a tester strip in a Brasil duty free and I was blown away, the florals, the first medicinal smell when sprayed... Decided to try it on skin and clothes and sprayed generously, 4 on my neck and 3 on clothes. I enjoyed my flight smelling delicious, the t-shirt smelled heavily 48hours after when I decided to wear it just for staying home before laundry day. So longevity is really good.

I'm still not a fan of vanilla forward perfumes but at least I try them without a second thought.

I bought the bottle and use it happily when I'm on the mood. Good stuff.

Would buy again.

review_content:

Read my hateful review down, was cap. Sorry.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: الناس يشبهون هذا العطر بريفلكشن مان امواج وبارفمز دي مارلي بيجاسوس، والحقيقة العطر فعلاً مزيج بين الاثنين، تحسه في النص بينهم، ريفلكشن زهري حمضي اكثر، وبيجاسوس سويتي معدني اكثر، العطر فعلاً بعد ما يبرد يميل لامواج ريفلكشن بقوة، لكن اول ما تشمه ما يجي في بالك هذا الشيء، عطر جميل على سعره، اداءه فوق الممتاز، يميل لكونه معتدل ومتعدد الاستخدام، ما اعتقد انه صيفي كثر ما هو خريفي او شتوي اكثر، يستحق التجربة.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci

When i first walked into the local fragrance store, i smelled this fragrance and i really hated it. it was like freshly cut grass for me, but it slowly grew on me, and after a month of thinking about it, i bought the fragrance. i did and didn't regret it, because as the name says i indeed felt guilty after spending $200 for 60ml of pure goodness. :)

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:

To me this is the white version of Dior Sauvage Elixer. Not note wise but use wise. I put them in the same use category if that makes sense. One is white one is black. The performance is outstanding.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: This is IT. It smells amazing. Currently my number 1 ranked fragrance in my collection for good reason. Also very versatile and I would say unisex. I love this fragrance and so glad I bought it. Performance is great too.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Love it! First try it smells like fresh out of the box type of scent. Later, it smells so gorgeous! I just have to get it!

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Gucci Guilty Elixir is an extremely strong, syrupy and spicy barbershop fragrance. It is not blind by safe, nor would I recommend it for summer heat. With that said, 1 single spray is perfect to last all day if you enjoy this power house.

I am pleased with my blind buy, but the strength definitely took me off guard at first.

FWIW I ordered because I love orange blossom, but it mostly reminds me of JPG right off the bat, then obviously Pegasus, followed by reflection. it is far more spicy on my skin than it is orange blossom. I would say GGE most closely aligns with Pegasus and certainly performs better than my PdM batch (which is lighter and more floral).

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: 1st ever review on this platform.. I’ll start by saying the fragrance is just not for me. My initial thoughts.. “Worst fragrance I ever smelled” lol. Gave me rubbery, cardboard, & licorice vibes. The clerk at the counter even said.. “This one is an acquired taste. To me.. It’s really stinky” I will say the performance is amazing. Had to wash and scrub like 3x for it to become a faint smell. Not bash it if others enjoy this. Just an honest opinion based on my experience and skin chemistry

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Nice fragrance to impress someone you are out on a date with. I thought someone else at the venue was wearing Givenchy L'interdit Intense, until I noticed it was him. They smell uncannily similar in the air. Very sexy on the right man. I kept leaning in to smell him. 9/10 fragrance, adequately safe gift option if they like vanillic scents with a darker edge.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci

The only thing I don't like is the price to ml ratio, so I'm only using this on special occasions.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci

Me personally any fragrance below 100ml is a big no, lol, like wtf are we paying you less, the performance is not even close to the word “elixir”, expensive fragrance, i like it only in terms of smell. product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: White floral with a strong ambery base. Honestly what makes it really good is how it performs. I am not much into hunting compliments but I do notice with this one more frequent complements than usual. It may share something with Reflection Man and 45 too but Reflection seems more lighter and clean than Guilty Elixir. More of dynamic change in the notes in reflection too yet. I do find GGE to be an amazing fragrance! Vanaliic, White floral, resinous beauty!

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Just got this one. It's a potent one. I really love it after it dries down a bit. Niche type scent for sure. Heavy duty compliment puller. Women especially love this. The orange blossom, vanilla, benzoin and patchouli blend nicely and it's mostly what I smell when the top fades.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Just women loves this that's it

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Got a great deal on Jomashop and paid $110 for the 50ml, It reminds me of YSL Myself but myself is a bit more fresh up top and not vanillic sweet when it settles, it still is very orange blossomy but much fresher and woodier, While reflection man is orange blossomy with fresh SPICY vibe, and this here Gucci Guilty Elixir, is orange blossom heavy + vanillic heavy throughout, very linear and extremely strong. If Reflcetion Man and YSL myself were combined and added heavy vanilla to it it will make Gucci Guilty PH Elixir.
Id rate it: 7/10

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Unfortunately this parfum is my biggest disappointment.
It's a pure synthetic rubber smell with a big headache feeling...it's just not good at all :(

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Smelled this in Sephora on Tuesday and purchased from Joma t2 days later, I was that impressed. Very complex frag as others have said, does not mimic anything I currently have in my collection, enjoyed this sample a lot. Some people are saying they haven't purchased because of how much it costs, I just grabbed this from Joma for 122 for the 2 oz.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Upon spraying my sample, I was immediately reminded of Reflection Man. The opening of this is harsher, spicy, and not nearly as smooth. I could almost tell this was a Quentin Bisch creation. This even has the same sort of bubblegum sweetness I detect in Reflection. That being said, while I do enjoy this fragrance, I'm not sure who I'd recommend this to. It's far too expensive for what is essentially a dupe, and Reflection Man can be found for about the same price on discounters.

If you've never smelled Reflection Man, I highly recommend sampling it. It's superior in pretty much every way. Nevertheless, if this was much cheaper, I'd probably buy a bottle. This is a clean, sweet, and pillowy masculine floral fragrance. It's like an orange blossom fabric softener. Excellent performance and longevity; I can still smell this after showering.

Update: I detect a very synthetic, weird "chemical" note in here that is very disruptive. This only makes me want to own Reflection Man even more.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: This is quite nice, it reminds me of air refreshers that you can plug into the wall and make the room smell nice, however, I wont buy a bottle beacause 1. the expensive price point. its really good, dont get me wrong, but not sure if its worth the price tag and cant get it on discounters or anything and 2. the opening, is extremely harsh, in a good way but it kind of makes me sick to be honest. it is so increadibly strong that it just makes me want to get a bit sick, its really nice but sooo overpowering. This is not blind buy safe at all, need to try it before you buy.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Budget version reflection 45

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I really liked this and think it is great fragrance for men, although it could totally be unisex. I am surprised by the negative reviews but its not your typical masculine fragrance

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Got a sample of this. Smells like sultry goodness and play dough and I love it. Full bottle incoming.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: nice sweet fragrance , spicy sweet opening , nothing more to say 8/10

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Ultra sentetik ve overrated bir parfüm,çimen gibi kokmak istemeyen almaz diye düşünüyorum açılıştan bitişine kadar sentetiklik hissiyatını veriyor,onun yerine gucci intense oud alırdım.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: !!!!!!! Ambergriz In the comments just a few posts down from this one , REALLY doesn’t like this fragrance. And I could not disagree more with what he’s said about this here masterpiece. He either gotta bad batch , or a bad case of meth nose & should have it checked out by a Dr. preferably a head Dr, cuz it seems like he’s been doing too much semen retention and now needs his nose blown!

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Seems to be an extremely controversial one, reading the comments below. This is my favorite perfume though, there is just something so unique and addictive to it for my nose. From the first time i smelled it, it just captured my attention and i couldn't stop sniffing the strip. Absolute nuclear performance as well, two sprays will last you 36 hours or so. In that regard it's affordable as well, as you only need two sprays each time you wear it. I have had this for 6 months wearing it regularly, and i am about halfway the bottle now. 9/10 for me, but definitely try before you buy.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I smell lots of metal on this but it is my most complimented fragrance in a way I don't understand.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Ima big fan of Quentin Bisch so I try to buy or sample all of his work . Influencers been peddling this hard af. This got great reviews from the respectable reviewers with integrity who aren’t paid bots. #1 I was open minded and positive. #2 excited for anything Bisch and #3 I have the biggest sweet tooth when it comes to Parfum that I venture further into fem leaning unisex than most hetero cis American men will go (Arab men don’t genderize fragrances and will wear florals, Western heterosexual men won’t bc of cultural stigmas) BUT I will only go so far. And this BEYOND my limits , as there is nothing remotely unisex or potentially non feminine here. This smells like someone grandma from the 1920s. Maybe Bad Bunny in his skirt would wear this but I don’t see how any intact man with a hanging pair who is still producing semen would ever like this . (FYI : I often like quality fem parfums bc they are more interesting and creative that basic azz medicinal woods and barbershop axe fragrances ). Busch was trying to hard to be too edgy and too revolutionary, as this is rather revolting , putrid, jarring and obnoxious. Even if I had a bloody gash , I still wouldn’t wear this rubbish. What is this juice ? It seriously smells like someone’s 90 year old grandma who hasn’t showered in days and covers it up in cheap floral perfume she found 80 years ago at a garage sale. It also smells like burning plastic , I get a jergens cold cream accord . There’s also this cough syrup accord. Everything you would never want to smell like is present. I’m not too picky and can find beauty is almost anything but this has no redeemable qualities. What was the point of making this ? The ironic thing is , this is the best performing Parfum from any designer house I ever smelled released in the past 17 years. Of course it would be , it’s the most atrocious smell. While I only bought 3 Samples from Gucci , I realized that the best thing about this juice is that it can’t clear out any room you are in . So next time I go on a date and I’m not into the dumb fluzzy, I’m gonna start spraying this all over and start having a loose wrist. Or even better, when I want a seat on the train,or to have nobody sitting next to me, I’ll just douse myself in this and clear out the entire train court . So it seems there is in fact a purpose for this geriatric gash lubricant . I’m sure granny can really clear out all the cocoons , moths, and spiderwebs down there with this a-bomb!

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Honestly, this is interesting. Not because it is good but because it shows how quickly and easily you can massacre a masterpiece of a DNA. Take Reflection Man, add every single synthetic vanilla-benzoin sweetness you can find and you get this. Synthetic and overbearing and gives me headaches because of the sweetness and synthetic notes in there. Not good, do not believe any influencer that says you should perefer this over Reflection. Very bad, very dissapointing. Only recent good Gucci fragrance is the Guilty EDP (and maybe Absolute but it doesn't suits my tastes) and that's all, others are unworthy.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: idk why but this smells like my grandma. and that’s not what i want from a male fragrance. way too powdery for me.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I mean...this fragrance should have a higher mark. This has CHARACTER! Smells like a mixture of rubber and gasoline, but in the most masculine way possible. When it comes to performances - it's nuclear!

UPDATE:
After wearing it for a few days I actually don't find it that masculine no more! There is definitely that "old woman" touch to it.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I bought another bottle after selling my old one last year. I do regret selling it, hence I had to pickup another bottle. I did try reflection man, but it wasn’t hitting the same. Bought this on eBay, paid £54 for around 55 ml remaining. Great price anways, it is a ‘new’ batch from 2025. Don’t seem different from the og bottle I had. Smells amazing and compliment all the way. Never really got compliments from R Man. But this one is something I’ll definitely keep in my collection. I love this stuff

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Complimentary getter for sure

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: For me it’s a little bit to syntetic. It not a smooth vanilla. A little bit better in the dry down. But can be really heavy in the opening.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Easily one of the best releases of the last couple of years. I personally think you can wear this all year and in all situations.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: One of the best from Gucci, smooth, high quality vanilla, with floral nuances, extremely strong, niche level quality

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I revisited this about 3 times before buying, and couldn't get it out of my head. I think this is one of the scents that just phenomenally compliments my body chemistry. Easily one of my favorites. It's juicy, floral, and there's a slightly dirty element to it. Not dirty in the stinky element but think like aged suede in an older car that has a hint of vanilla soda or something sweet spilled on it. I can see the chemical element that others are commenting on and I feel like that is tied to the spiced element. It ages out as you wear. It's not really fresh at all and I actually dig it. The longevity is next level for me, and without having to douse myself like with other Gucci fragrances.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Sugar, vanilla, & orange blossom. A strange, unappealing fragrance.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Very green and lasts forever, but has a strong synthetic opening that’s a bit too much for me. When I take price into consideration, I’d rather get Reflection Man which smells classier to my nose anyway.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Masterpiece, worth every penny....

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I absolutely adore this. Soapy floral fragrance with outstanding performance.
Lots of Orange blossom at the top. Dries down to Vanilla with hints of Orange.
Picked up a tester bottle off eBay for £75, which was a great deal for such a Masterpiece.
Certainly not blind buy safe but I will always have a bottle of this in my collection. One of three I own that falls into the fragrance for life category.
For me personally, this is absolute perfection.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
First bottle in January 2025, batch number: 4313

Presentation: sucks. A flimsy, lame bottle, small and light weight. Cap marked just on top "Coochie".
Atomizer is good, nice mist.

Edit: after used my bottle, this is geriatric cream, Bengay style creams, hotel disinfectant.
Only covered in some nasty synthetic flowery smell - yeah, nobody will get your "you smell good" = - minus aura points.

Smell: a snake, but a plastic like snake which was raised by Jared Letto. Something from Blade Runner. Plasticky flowers, sweet but very clean. Aggressive smelling, like a poopy diaper in the face lol

Performance under an "elixir", more EdP. Lasts longer on clothes.

Anemic, plastiky, flowery green little poopy snake raised by Jared Letto on a his magical island.

6/10 and will probably never repurchase. Shame on you Coochie!

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Rayhaan imperia intense. Thank me later. 😁

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Ok, after live with them a while.
Smells better in very cold weather, like -5, -15.
They are less anoying, bit more sweet and not so soury.
Last forever, whole work day easy.
On hoodie, for +2-3 more days you feel them.
Its nice scient, but i think not for my taste.
Way to screeming and anoying, nobody says you smell nice.
Because you smell strongly synthetic.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: one of the best smells I smelled, too bad its so overpriced...

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
A great way to get a call from your Piece of Sh!t Human Resources department associate that hates their job and cant wait to reduce margins for the crappy company and to save their worthless job and on your poor choice of scent choice.


Epic run-on sentence award?

Accepted

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: This should be listed as unisex. It’s just as floral/feminine as YSL myslf, a great fragrance nonetheless.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Very good cologne..but a little pricey

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: anyone who is planning to buy this masterpiece should stay away, we are gatekeeping this one!

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Say whatever u want Quentin, This is a Masterpiece!!!!

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Bengay krem kokusunu anımsatan arada elimin gittiği mücevher gibi koku

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I noticed a soapy and powdery profile similar to Prada L'Homme. If I recall correctly, Prada L'Homme slightly leans into fresh side of soapy/ powdery, while Gucci Guilty Elixir slightly leans into sweeter side of soapy/ powdery.

In my opinion, this is clean enough for office (air-conditioned) as well. All seasons, except for high heat/ humid days where a citrus-fresh/ aquatic fragrance would be ideal

Overall, a decent floral fragrance for men. Nothing groundbreaking though. Hence the price cannot be jutified.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
In addition to the reminds me of section, I get a bit of Nishane Safran Colognise with some of the bright leather accords.

Really fantastic stuff. Super longevity and siliage.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: The opening is ruff harsh chemical garbo. Even smelling the atomizer is a little off-putting. After about 30 minutes you start to get the orange flower fresh powdery DNA known to most from Reflection Man. That opening is where I get the heavy synthetics which throws my nose off. Unlike other AkigalaBISCH creations that keep that energy until the dry down, this smooths out a lot. I've been wearing Space Juice Ganymede for the last week so this is nice and smooth for you, carbon-based life forms. I really dig this. You also get this nice vanilla that compliments the composition and syncs everything. If you can get this for about $120, its a great fragrance. Its not bischmode, but it was made to last and project like crazy. A few sprays go all day so that dinky little 60ml should last a country mile unless it's your signature. My viewpoint is skewed because Reflection Man EDP was that token "grown-up work scent". In contrast, I think this can be pulled off by younger guys as well as older men. Since the performance isn't a problem, this is an all-year, any situation scent. I think Bischypoo found a way to strike a happy medium between great performance and sacrificing your nose for the least amount of time. Sample worthy since you can find it at your local Macy's counter. Check discounters for deals. Do not pay $183 for this when it can be had for a generous discount.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I was surprised when I first sniffed this at a Notino store in Prague. It was love at first sight.

Since I heard it was similar to Reflection Man, I ordered a sample to compare. However, I prefer the Gucci fragrance - so I bought a bottle of it. Now I am comparing them side by side. Initially they are very similar, but as the fragrances settle on my skin there is a clear difference. Gucci goes in a sweeter direction and starts to smell like an icy, medicinal cherry-esque candy of some sort, while Amouage is more floral with woody and herbal hints. I would say that the Amouage fragrance is the cleaner of and brighter of the two, while the Gucci fragrance is heavier and sweeter. It is like a combination of Reflection Man and Guerlain l’Homme Ideal.

Performance is great. I sprayed like 1,5 sprays and could still smell it quite a lot 12 hours later.

I love wearing this. It is very versatile and I think many people enjoy smelling this in the air. 9,5/10.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Sadly it's a trend to hate on men's Gucci fragrances now days and that's the reason it's only 2K votes on this masterpiece and not 10K.

product_name: Guilty Elixir de Parfum pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
This juice wasn’t even on my radar. Honestly, I only bought it because I work with a younger girl who’s also into fragrances, and she just cannot stop raving about this one. Every single time I see her, she shoots me the question : “Have you tried it yet? Have you tried it yet?!” So, to preserve my sanity, I caved and blind-bought it.

The parcel arrived yesterday morning, and I’ve been wearing it non-stop since then. I’ll admit, based on the packaging and the look of the juice, I was expecting something…different. But hey, I’m not mad at it.
Is it a masterpiece? Hmm, the jury’s still out. Compared to the rest of my fragrance wardrobe, it hasn’t yet made me want to build it a shrine, but it’s definitely not bad.

I’ve decided to give it a proper test run—a full week straight—to see how we vibe. Who knows, maybe it’s one of those slow-burn relationships that gets even better with time. I’ll update you all once I have more insight. For now, it’s a solid “not disappointed, but not smitten…yet”

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: It smells like freshly cut grass. I LOVE it! The stores near me stopped selling it though

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Anyone tried Lanvin Oxygene (women)? This one reminds me of it, only the peppery spiciness toned down a little in this one. Oxygene a bit better for a heat wave in summer. I think Oxygene was an Alberto Morillas creation as well? This one’s a misty almost aquatic green scent. Cool crisp spices combined with the soft sweetness of white florals, very subtle creamy notes seeping through as it progresses. I like it. At first I thought of this as a very ordinary scent. Then it grew on me.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
This is the most beautiful mix of equal parts green and equal parts white floral scents. I think this flanker is the most different from all the others and the most unique. This was my first perfume I got with my own money and I wore it exclusively for two years, I cherish the little that I have left.

I am shocked they discontinued this. I like the OG bloom too for its powdery cleanness, but you could call that boring, while this one is special, unique and interesting without being too odd or unpleasant.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Do ppl not like these type of fresh floral, green gardeny scents anymore?
Cuz this and Florabotanica are my absolute favorite spring/summer fragrances.
And they’re both discontinued! WTH
They’re both so pretty and so fresh and I always get compliments when I wear them.

You know that feeling when you’ve just taken a shower and you want to prolong that freshness but still want to smell posh? That’s basically what these two fragrances do for me.

Acqua Di Fiori smells nothing like the original Bloom. It’s so complex in a niche way but still gives the feeling of simplicity. It’s simply fresh, green, white floral with some clean white musk enhanced by Iso E Super.
What you get is an after rain, wet garden filled with Galbanum, Cassis and freesias.
There’s a slight pencil sharpener note that comes and goes that I usually don’t like in other fragrances. But in this one it kinda enhances the experience for me!

I like the fact that it’s an EDT so I can freshen up every now and then when I’m out and about.

But the fact that it’s an EDT means it has a weak to moderate longevity.
Silage is great for the first hour or so.
But then it turns into a beautiful skin scent which I don’t mind at all.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I love bizarro aquatics and that’s how this reads to me. There’s a salty volume beneath the green florals that evokes sea spray over a garden.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: The best green perfume I've ever smelt/had. I can't find it anymore and I want it so much, can't find any other green fragrance that I like this much. 100/10

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: If you want a cheap run-around, Primark has those tiny 25ml bottles from the PS... series. This one is the muted green/blue bottle called Blackcurrant & Amber, to me it's a dupe of this. They also have a pink bottle for the OG Bloom, and there was a third one but I can't remember, I didn't like it. Primark also has a pretty decent dupe for Delina/Exclusif called PS.. Regent, it's actually really nice for the price! I stocked up with 5 bottles (20ml), it's a mix of Delina with a nice subtle rhubarb and that powderinnes of Exclusif, to me it's best of both as I find the Exclusif too powdery.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: smells nothing like the original. it's soooooo crisp and green. to me it just smells like foliage, plants. not really floral! I really like it.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I don't understand why this smells fresh to some people... maybe it's my body chemistry? but I feel like it's straight up musk but not in a pleasant way. it's very clogging and almost grandma-ish to my nose...only keeping it because the perfume has been discontinued :(

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I´ve been searching for a fresh perfume perfect for summer, but this is not it. For me it´s too herbal.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: this is so good in my opinion. but I can understand it may not please everyone. It is somehow so...different :)

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: A green and sharp scent with a strong vibe of freshly cut grass. It's dusty and slightly synthetic. Definitely not the best among green florals, in my opinion. It lacks naturalness and freshness

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Nice

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I kind of enjoy this one, even though I think the opening is a bit harsh on my nose, one of my most exuberant fragrance in collection, I have the feeling that it project well and so I actually don’t reach for it that much except for some events

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This was my first “adult” fragrance purchase! I was so excited and loved it ~. Very approachable, and barely-there enough that its waft isn’t distracting or unpleasant. I got compliments on it a lot, especially within the first 1hr or so of putting it on. My one gripe with the scent is that the silage was desperately intimate and truly barely-there after that first hour. If you want a fragrance that makes an entrance and then settles into something only you can smell (and blends well with that summer day funkiness lol), this one is for you! I ended up giving this to my mom during the pandemic :)

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Acqua di Fiori is my go-to on sunny spring or hot summer days, I love how refreshing the green notes are in it, like walking in a dewy garden. I haven't reached for this perfume in months, but today I decided to do a little experiment and try it in nearly freezing weather.

Well, I thought I made a big mistake first... the same green notes turned annoyingly sharp. But once the top notes started to fade (after about 30 minutes) it transformed into a comforting and uplifting scent that makes me wish it was spring again. Not a total mistake after all, but I will save this lovely scent for warmer months for sure.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Call me crazy, this smells like pencil shavings to me. A perfect pencil shavings.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This fragrance is basically a greener fresher Bloom. I prefer the original as I don'tlike overly floral green scents. And somehow this loses the sweetness that original has and its also not my cup of tea

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I've tried a couple of times to give this one a fair shake, because I got a full bottle as a blind buy on clearance. The initial fresh garden notes are beautiful: green, fresh, light and decadent at the same time. But it very quickly turns too musky on me, and the lovely green notes fade into the background. As a result it starts to smell fairly synthetic and soapy. Within an hour, it smells like a cabinet that people store all of the random lotion and potion and cream gift sets they receive at white elephant christmas parties, just an amalgam of generic musk with some floral notes. I want to love this and on the right person I bet it is beautiful and elegant, but on me it's a no.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I absolutely love the green garden that blooms on your skin, when you first spray this. I can enjoy this sent for a couple of hours but when the musk slowly starts taking over, I can't help but to try and drown out the smell with a body spray. This scent has the potential to capture nature beautifully, almost perfect but then that musk tugs at my nose, like an insect flying through that beautiful garden ,that won't go away.
I eventually sold my bottle.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: My base perfume for warmer months. If I don't know what to spray - this always comes to rescue. Cooling, yet welcoming and youthful. Not too green

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This is one of my only floral perfumes, I’m typically a sweet/fruity gal but this is such a lovely perfume. Green and almost aquatic. First tested this ours in a Sephora and it immediately reminded me of trips I’ve taken to Orlando. I think there is a note in here similar to a plant grown on Disney property, because smelling this reminds me so much of walking around outside the hotels. Even aside from the positive association with vacationing, this is a really great hot weather perfume. Performs well on my skin but isn’t overwhelming like I find a lot of other floral perfumes to be. Unique in my collection and I can’t think of any other perfume that smells like it.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Here we go again, another perfume ruined by galbanum for me, first time I smelled it is in Live in Love Oscar de la renta, which I own and sort of love if not galbanum. Here is even stronger and more masculine than in LIL, otherwise it would be fantastic frag. Galbanum is from now on on my No-No list. If you like unisex fragrances it’s really good one. I would love to get whiff here and there, it’s pleasant easy going scent, it’s just not enough feminine for me.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This flanker strays the farthest from its parent frag -- it is the blonde son in a family of mostly brunette daughters. Cassis lends a leafy, lush, vegetal quality. The florals I get are mostly tuberose and honeysuckle with noticeable hints of lily of the valley and freesia. However, the galbanum and cassis are clearly the stars here. This flanker can easily be enjoyed by those who typically do not enjoy the basic white florals and/or green frags (living proof ✋🏻). The citrus notes are just enough to make this frag slightly juicy and sparkling, not sweet or "fruity" like other popular white florals. I get just a hint of sandalwood, and the slight musky-woodiness of Iso E Super is undetectable until after at least the first hour of wear (if at all). This flanker is meant to be worn in the spring. 3rd place for me out of the entire Bloom line by Gucci. 🥉

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I nearly sold my bottle which I purchased heavily discounted. Couldn’t miss the chance! So glad I didn’t ❤️Opened it one gloomy afternoon needing something to go with my mood…Once I sprayed it and got intrigued (usually search the maker) and realised that it was made by Alberto Morillas who is responsible for the iconic CK One. You should get the drill by now;) It is a very beautiful take on the latter if somewhat more poetic by adding flowers…Here, lily of the valley and then tamed tuberose shine through…It brings some nostalgia and memories for me. Happy I kept it 💙
A few hours later I’m getting a sweetened sandalwood dry down…must be the musk & sandalwood combo 💗

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This is giving me strong Rosabotanica vibes. Not identical, but very much in the same green watery spectrum. Unfortunately neither work for me as on my skin they turn into week old vase water. Oh well, you can't win 'em all...

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: smells like a wet garden~ i can practically see a courtyard speckled by fresh spring rain. misted flowering plants. the faint earthiness in this is cloaked in musk. (reminds me of thunderstorm by demeter). the fresh notes are filligreed with drowned flowers, ready for sun. its a catharsis, fleeting relief from love’s chaos, reverbing through scent. i didn’t think i’d like this so much, it’s surprisingly clear for a floral musk- scent. im very excited to see how it does in the warmer months~

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: A huge vase filled with cold water and creamy smelling tuberoses. The top notes fade incredibly fast. Not that green to me.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Salaryman (below) wrote:
"Wasn’t sure if I wanted this fragrance but the more I imagine wearing it on a trip to the forest during a nice spring day while the grass and leaves are still a little wet the more I want a small bottle of it… It’s just perfect for that type of occasion."

This sold me.

A very lovely lady stranger was selling this 100ml bottle brand new (opened, unused) in box for $50 online. Came to read reviews here, saw the above.. BOOM. Sold. For $10 she said she would deliver it to me today. Take my money! I even got a hug from said Mrs when I admitted I use perfume as a distraction to get my mind out from drowning in grief. We just found out some news about my dad, so I'm preparing my perfume stockpile now. This is the perfect "happy & content" scent I needed and reading all your reviews will keep my mind occupied when required. So thank you to everyone who leaves reviews here. 🤍 Keep em coming!

Thank you Salaryman, if you ever read this.. Gucci Bloom Aqua di Fiori will absolutely be my new forest scent. I'll be going home to be with family and staying as long as I need to. Spring is coming and I'll be exploring the forest I adventured in daily all through my childhood and youth, into my teenage years. I'm 41 now, I hope those mountains welcome me as they always did. I'm looking forward to being amongst the trees and nature that were my family when things at home were rough.

Aqua di Fiori edt is stunning. I haven't tried the others, but this green floral woody musk is absolutely EXACTLY what this gal needed.

I am so grateful. 🙌🌲💕

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: they won't get away with discontinuing this.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
This is fantastic!!!
A wet photorealistic pleasant feminine green with light and airy mild florals as a supporting act. Not overwhelming and definitely modern interesting and niche smelling!
Shame that it’s discontinued. Why are the best ones all discontinued? Gucci rush 2 and now this! Its much better than the more recent (and more expensive) gucci releases.
Layers so well with the aqua allegoria line.
Could never get sick of this, am buying every bottle I find! This is what I imagine a field of daisies in the morning mist in heaven would smell like.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Wasn’t sure if I wanted this fragrance but the more I imagine wearing it on a trip to the forest during a nice spring day while the grass and leaves are still a little wet the more I want a small bottle of it… It’s just perfect for that type of occasion.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
i smelled this all the way back in 2021 and fell in love with it because of the strong freshly-cut grass accord. Today i got a bottle (the batch is from 2020) and i really cant pick up on that smell at all anymore :(. Still a great, interesting perfume and it will definitely see a lot of use in the spring and summer months :) On my skin it smells like someone blended the white florals but forgot to take their stems off, which i love
edit: my mom is getting the grass note lol

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This perfume smells of green florals, with the jasmine kicking in pretty strong - it is calming and pretty non offensive in my opinion. Though I find the scent pretty boring, as I can only smell the jasmine. I also wouldn't recommend getting the EDT version of this because it only lasts 2-3 hours on my skin.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
'After rain garden' is the best way to describe this fragrance in my opinion. It still has the identity of original Gucci Bloom but this one tell another story. It's not just a whole bunch of white floral anymore. This one is aquatic, fresh and green like flowers with rain drops on it.

The performance is great on me. Even I'm not a green fragrance lover but this one is good and still growing on me.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Not gonna lie, the scent is fresh and great. Gucci Bloom yellow one gave me a headache but this one not. Quite fresh actually. It’s like a fresh pick of jasmine. But longlasting power of this perfume is quite bad. Like gone after an hour. The pink bottle is very pretty.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Yes, it does remind me a lot of pleasures! It doesn't have that much depth however because it's missing the lilac note. Still cute, still pleasant and greener than pleasures. It would be even better if it had a little more peppery notes, it would bring something new to the table.
I liked it so much better on a paper. Unfortunately, when I wear anything with freesia it's all I can smell, it overpowers everything else. It must be my skin's ph. It's gonna be a pass for me.

This is what a put together plant mom with a secret love for Sci-Fi would wear.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Fresh white flowers fragrance, evokes the image of a garden in the morning, still with dew and all. I live in a tropical climate and it’s pretty decent in rainy/colder weather, but under the blazing hot sun it’s a little bit too much. It’s inoffensive for the office, and pretty enough for a fancier lunch. As pretty as it is, I don’t see myself reaching for this often. I’ll probably revise my statement if I ever find a good pair for this scent.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This smells like a salad. With tulips in it.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I can’t really pick out anything specific other than jasmine. It’s a pleasant, maybe watery white floral. I don’t mind it and ran through my sample as a dumb reach during early spring

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Very fresh summer fragrance. Very lovely and wearable perfume. Smells very green and floral. 4/5

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This smells *exactly* like playing in the sprinkler in your backyard in the summer. Exactly. To the point that if REPLICA wanted to make a perfume evocative of that, they should just take this and put it in their own bottles. Not necessarily something I’d wear but certainly not unpleasant or overbearing.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: To me this smells like flowers and number 2 pencils (and pencil sharpenings). Not something I'd want to smell like but definitely an interesting scent. I guess for me the woody base comes out into the top notes, it's a bit outdated but not in a bad way. To me it smells like autumn even if most votes are for spring/summer.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Tried it because of all the advertisements that were running when this came out, which intrigued me a lot as someone who loves flowers and fresh scents (as the ads promised). Also the same for Gucci Bloom, with slight alterations:

It's really disappointing, it smells predominantly dusty middle-aged woman (not spicy enough to be considered 'old woman', for whatever a compliment that is...) And that's the majority smell - the other smell was like a leafy, wet petal-something, I can't even tell what kind of petal because it smelled more like damp herb if I'm honest. You'd smell weird and not particularly 'floral', fresh or green with this on.

My boyfriend tried it and he didn't like it either, but said it's not hateable either - it's this annoying middle-ground of, he'd tolerate it and let the person feel fancy, then breathe easy after the encounter 😅 Thanks babe.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: It is a moderate climate meadow after the rain, with a distinct and beautiful lily-of-the Valley. This is not about flowers, it is all kind of greens - grass, galbanum, all kind of weeds and plants. Very green, a bit bitter, but there is also some screechy note, maybe that's how musk works in this combination with sandalwood. It is also totally unisex, would be very good on men.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: My favorite of the Gucci Bloom line. This is what I expected Kate Spade’s Truly Gracious to smell like.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Absolute must for spring and summer!
The top note smells like you’re enjoying a refreshing lemon tea in a botanical garden.
The dry down reveals a light, clean lemony musk. It smells like nice crisp morning dew.
This scent is so aquatic and uplifting- no choking heavy florals 🌿

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: this smells like green plants, but not unpleasantly.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I love this so much. A light white floral with heavy wet green notes. Like leaves and grass in a jungle after the rain. Gives a very botanic garden greenhouse vibe. Very deserving of the name "flower water" however has such little longevity. This is one of those you can spray infinitely and it's still very watery, which I love (although I wish it stuck around longer). Is it being discontinued? I can't find it on any retailer.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Very niche smelling. This is such a wearable scent- lovely top notes with something spicy in the mix. It's definitely become my signature after smelling many perfumes over the last year- there's not anything else like it. The white floral isn't too overwhelming and the herbaceous notes are beautifully blended. Sillage is good for the office. True love for me ❤️

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This is lovely! It really invokes a feeling of a freshly watered garden, water & dew droplets on flower petals

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I love the top notes, it opens up a pleasant floral layer of softness. I do not recommend you spray too much as it can be it can be overwhelming. Moderate spray on the right places would be nice for an evening date. I did chose to wear this to bed after a shower. I'd like to dream of a field with flowers unending. It's a good buy.
I recommend for anyone they loves flowers.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
This is gorgeous. Light, fresh summer garden rain feel. More original then most designer fragrances. This is niche interesting with designer price and wearability.
Layer this with Minérale Oud for interest.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I just bought a bottle of the Bloom Ambrosia and love it. I like the original Bloom as well even though I wish it was a bit stronger. This Aqua flanker is not for me and I kind of knew that going in smelling it because of the top note of galbanum, I'm not a big fan of it. Aqua uses galbanum w/ a very heavy hand and this smells very masculine to me because it is so green. If you love green florals and want something that mimics crushed plants and crushed flower stems this is a good one to sample. I agree w/ the reviewer below it has a very spa vibe but I hate spas, my sister is always trying to drag me to one but I can't stand that spa smell.

Edit: Later this evening. I personally find this scent very unisex, and it could be a white floral a man might like to wear if they enjoy white florals. Heck, I think it would be a major step up from the male fragrances I smelled today. No wonder I give my husband the unisex fragrances I sample that don't work out for me. What they are making for men now a days is truly horrid. I would rather smell this on a guy than all of the male fragrances I sampled in Sephora today. Which were Invictus, Guilty Pour Homme, Spicebomb flankers, And 1 Million. I thought Dior Savauge was bad.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I love this so much. Its an instant spa vibe with bits of the original dna. I like layering this with white tea and sage from bath and body works. Very all year round but i think it will be super nice in the summer.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I really love it, this is bitter, more herbal version of Gucci Bloom. Perfect for summer!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Instant waft of botanicals, like being in a garden but this dies very swiftly into a musty musk base that is just not very nice. Absolutely doesn't warrant the 'Acqua' in the title either, there's no watery notes or dampness here. Horrid little flanker sorry.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This smells like a hot summer night, deep into a lush garden, big palm leaves all around, ripe fruits about to fall from the trees.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I couldn't stop smelling my arm after I sprayed it. Such a unique perfume it is bright and floral with dark green depths. What you see is what you get, flower water. It smelled so green and fresh, it reminded me of a beautiful bouquet and Springtime. Sadly the magic ended about an hour later. This is amazing but it doesn't last. I'm considering ordering a sample size so I can try it out again because I liked it so much. I wouldn't blind buy this one.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
〰✴A green and delicate bouquet✴〰

The name of this perfume literally means 'flower water', and I think it suits the fragrance very well. As you can tell from the notes it is a predominantly a floral fragrance, but also very fresh and green. I've noticed that a lot of people find the green note annoying, as if it smells like grass and nothing else, but I don't perceive it that way. I can't understand the single notes very well, but I can clearly smell flowers and leaves. Very youthful, elegant and discreet. Overall I find it a pleasant scent, but I have to say that I’m not particularly impressed, definitely. I find it nice, but not incredible or unforgettable. It smells good and the bottle design is amazing, but it's not enough to convince me to buy it. Also, I have to mention sillage and longevity are pretty low for the brand and the price.

Setting & feelings: You are having a picnic with your close friends in a park near a pond, having a good time. While talking you absent-mindedly pick up some flowers and blades of grass, playing and rolling them between your fingers.

Overall: 6/10

N✴〰

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
a pleasant powdery green scent. i think it smells fresh in a different kind of way— not fresh like citrusy scents usually are (which is funny because lemon is supposedly one of the top notes!), but fresh like the morning dew or freshly cut grass… it doesn’t ACTUALLY smell like grass imo, just trying to get my point across ;) i think it would be an ideal spring scent if you’re not really into super sweet florals. however, i can definitely see how it wouldn’t be for everyone as at times it can be quite mature and grandma-ish (i don’t get how other people say it smells sexy.. lol)
the florals in this aren’t like fresh flowers but rather a preserved vintage bouquet if that makes sense. if i smelled this on someone i’d think their perfume is nice but i wouldn’t purchase it for myself

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: A very pretty soft green fragrance. It reminds me of a cold lush garden just after the rain, pure and innocent. Inoffensive, office friendly and a safe blind buy if you enjoy light green scents that are only ever so slightly floral. Although one note doesn’t dominate, I pick up on the lily the most. I do like this flanker I only wish it lasted longer.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I think I would really like this... if I could smell it! It's so w e a k...

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Smells like grass - I hate it

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Tried this on at the store, *smells* lovely, it is HEAVY on the tuberose; fresh, and lightly musky, I can smell the honeysuckle and the other notes are combined well enough to be there but not noticed, in general, the scent is angelic and fresh and elegant and young, cheerful I'd say. Yet, the lasting power is *ABSOLUTELY DREADFUL*. For the price, I cannot stand how quick it flew away. Lasted no more than 30 minutes on my skin (Keep in mind that this might just be my skin). I didn't think it was worth its price because of its performance, otherwise I would have bought it.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I'm torn with this one. There are days where I like the scent of cut off grass this gives me, and others where I feel it's too harsh for my nose. I will only wear this on very specific warm spring days.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I absolutely adore this fragrance.
I was seeing someone whose signature scent was acqua di fiori and although things turned sour my relationship with this perfume certainly did not !!!
It blends into the skin giving this balmy green summer scent and i can only really describe it as comforting - not offensive in the slightest.
Way too tame to be an evening scent but it performs so well during the day, and I find it does cling to clothes well.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Smells like grass...

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
This is beautiful. The florals are so uplifting. I wish the galbanum would be a tad stronger for a more greener facet but hey still I enjoy wearing this especially on rainy days.

A beautiful fragrance indeed.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: my favourite of the gucci bloom series - she's different! super fresh, almost clean, and definitely very green. wishing there was an edp for this one because edt's get absorbed by my skin, and i'd buy it in a heartbeat.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I tried it again today ... maybe the tester was not at the top ... but compared to the other times after the wonderful herbaceous opening similar to a splendid garden ... later it turned into something acidulous-fruity that I can not defining, but definitely not as pleasant and refreshing as I had tried the other times ...
I repeat ... maybe the tester had gone bad ... and besides, there is little or no tuberose. and none of the other flowers listed that I know are on my nose.
I have to retest it in another perfumery.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
It's been a while since I smelled this so it's not quite fresh in my memory.
I love green freshies and I thought this would be the perfect addition to my collection. I got the travel size roller ball before pulling the trigger on a full bottle, and found it really pleasant.

But this was not nearly as 'natural' as I was looking for, if that makes sense. It smells like a perfectly manicured garden, rather than a natural meadow.
If you're looking for a perfectly manicured garden without being too sweet, this is perfect.
But I found myself wishing for a little more zing of morning dew / agarwood / aldehyde or even cedar / vetiver, to give it some more damp soil or wild burdock vibe. (think Miu Miu L'eau Bleue)

I enjoyed smelling it on my wrist, but it didn't last terribly long and wasn't anything 'special' in comparison to my other green freshies. So I wound up giving it to a friend.

It's really gentle and unobtrusive. Neutral enough to not offend anyone. I feel like you could wear this pretty much anywhere; Lunch date, office, church, at home on a rainy day... even the gym, if that's your thing!

If I had more disposable income, I'd consider buying another bottle just to have, because it IS nice, just not nice 'enough' to justify the purchase if it doesn't "wow" me.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This is by far the best bloom! All the others smell identical. I dont even find bloom interesting in the first place, but I love this one

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
A few days ago I walked into Sephora and asked to test the original Bloom. I'd seen it everywhere and wanted to finally smell it for myself. It was nice enough, but very familiar and too linear for my taste. For whatever reason, the saleslady handed me a tester strip of Acqua di Fiori, too, and even with my mask on, I knew I was going to have to get it. I ordered a smaller bottle off eBay once I got home, and now that I've had the opportunity to smell it on myself, I wish I got the larger size! The best way to describe this scent would be "lush."

I've been looking for a green, floral fragrance that still manages to be fresh and bright, and Acqua di Fiori is all of that. It's not exactly aquatic, but there's a certain juicy tartness that permeates all of the greenery. While I do enjoy green fragrances that have notes of fresh-cut grass, this is not one of them. This smells like white flowers, stems and all, doused in dew and citrus. A very modern, lush green.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
The opening....I get a citrus/galbanum vibe....then in the middle phase and dry down....all lily of the valley/freesia....
Not what I was expecting, I guess.
Too much LOV and freesia .
A pleasant scent, but.....I prefer the original.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: It is green and fresh and drys down aquatic on me. TF Mandarino di Amalfi Acqua is similar but the TF is spicier and is more masculine, using traditional terms. Bloom finishes with the green white flower, it pretty. To my nose, they ar similar with the above differences.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I was on the hunt for a green fragrance that reminded me of fresh cut grass and rain. When I came across the Bloom range in Ulta and first smelled Aqua di Fiori I knew I had to have it, it was exactly what I'd been looking for.
This fragrance opens with a bright, super green punch - a lush field of grasses, clovers, and wild flowers after a fresh rain.
It begins to settle into a slightly sweet, fresh white floral dream, maintaining a zingy freshness - like a green Aqua di Gioia.
I can really smell the Lily of the Valley on my skin, beautiful!
It retracts into a skin scent on the dry down that smells like fresh linens on the lawn, relaxing under a shaded tree on a cool spring afternoon.
It only lasts a few hours on my skin, but I love it so much I don't mind respraying. Plus, I prefer this one for daytime and like to switch to another fragrance for nighttime, so it works out. It's very feminine but could be worn by anyone! It could work nicely in an office as it's not overpowering, yet it's also a great spring/summer date fragrance and can even be worn on a run to the grocery store.
I can't stop wearing this!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This is also my first Gucci and a blind buy which I strongly suggest you don’t do. It’s beautiful but on me it’s nothing but green green green, galbanum and a little sandalwood. I respect who likes these accords but it’s really not my taste, I thought I would get more florals, the jasmine and tuberose to be exact. Longevity and sillage are not good. After a few minutes you can feel it only close to the skin.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
This is comes out all galbanum on my skin! So different than Gocce di fiori from same line that truly adore for its all fresh blossoms and blooms with natural sweetness. None of the flowers show up for me in this one, maybe the slightest of honeysuckle if the semi bitter galbanum and cassis ever leave me!
This is good too though, reminiscent of the nicest chypres like Chanel n19 and Ralph Lauren Safari. It is like walking into a green meadow with knee high wild grass in morning fog. Just don’t expect an overly feminine fragrance as any of the other blooms.
I like the bottle and the greenery on it that sets it apart from all the pink, yellow and bordeaux of the other bloom bottles, consistent with the juice.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I've missed Chypres over the last 20 years or so,but now they're slowly creeping back! Yay!

I'm bored with sugary sweet scents all the time. This is fresh, green,clean and hypnotic .

I love that first opening,I feel like I'm in a cool forest of fresh green ferns. It's extremely addictive for me. I love it when I get a waft.

Bloom is beautiful,this is another level. I've have Eau Coriandre but this is a modern day version.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Very different from Bloom, honestly the connection between the two is simply that both are floral, although this one is leaning heavily on the green side. It's wearable, but I'm not a fan of Lily of the valley and IsoE in general, so it's a pass for me. It could work for people who want something green, but milder green than Vent Vert, Chanel No. 19, etc. Sillage is minimal after the first 10-15 minute blast. Interestingly, at the beginning it made me think of Mugler's Womanity (I have no idea why, as they don't share any common notes) - somehow like a watered down Womanity, with floral notes and a good amount of conformity.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
This is my first Gucci and I blind bought it for my birthday.
It opens with a fresh, natural, white bouquet. Very comfortable, the kind of scent you feel when you crush fresh, green leaves. Then, it starts to develop to a woody skin scent, with a hint of something citrusy, with the white bouquet showing up here and there.

Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori is a fragrance that makes me happy, very uplifting. This is not for that days you want to feel sexy (in a conventional way) but the special moments you want to sit and read a book with a mug of tea, looking at your blooming garden, without make up and having your hair on a messy bun.

The ad with the actresses bathing in that lovely lake surrounded with flowers is pretty accurate to my experience, but in no way GBAF is an aquatic fragrance. I'm testing on a very hot summer season here in South America (sorry my english btw).

Bad thing is, it doesn't last that long and sillage is more intimate (which can be a good thing for some, myself included).

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
This was a blind buy and I do not recommend anyone to blind buy it. I expected green fresh grass with white florals or fresh summer garden. Instead I got bitter smell of a freshly cut flower. Sharp and bitter. Also very weak longevity.
Definitely test before you buy, not for everyone.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
This is a really good modern chypre. I love it. It’s heavy, thick, weird, but not stuffy like some can feel... when I say heavy, maybe I should say deep/rich? Not sure. it’s a polarising scent, but if you love chypres that’s kind of part of the charm. We don’t want safe sweet perfumes! Something about your look should turn heads, it’s awesome when it’s the perfume.
This is very similar to Stella McCartney L.I.L.Y. (another modern chypre but now almost a decade old), and a bit of a distant nod to Chanel 19° (My #1!). They’re going for the same vibe as the classic green bombs (even Mitsouko a bit), and I think they did a great job with this one. This is actually my first Gucci perfume ever!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: GREEN! Honeysuckle, freesia and tuberose, my favourite flowers! I love this scent, it's vivacious, youthful, fresh and slightly warm. Office safe everyday scent. Some resemblence noted with EL Pleasures.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
awful
it smells like green herbs

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Very green smelling, but less "fresh green" and more heavy green. It smells like tearing apart a thick, waxy, healthy, leaf in the middle of summer. Or the smell of torn stems while clearing a brush. Strangely agricultural. Not unpleasant, but not my personal preference.

The white florals here aren't mainstage like they are in Nettari di Fiori, instead they play a supporting role to the dominant green notes.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I Really Love this fragrance a lot I think I love it even more than the original Gucci Bloom it’s so gorgeous I personally am a huge fan of white floral fragrances and Jasmine fragrances I love the green feel to it it’s perfect for spring or summer an absolutely gorgeous fragrance.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
It's the first ever fragrance that I actually love! This one is perfect for me and I can wear it all year long. Best suitable is for summer. The opening notes are delightful, very fresh, mint leaves accord for some reason is what I sense. Later it gets a bit sweet on my skin, as every perfume I tried so far, but it doesn't bother me, wanting more and more to smell it all day long. Too bad it last at best 3h on my skin. On hair has a slightly longer longevity.
Suitable for people that don't like sweet perfumes. I'm still exploring this perfume world, the starting point was 2 years ago after I realized that I cannot wear sweet perfumes during work hours, as it catches my attention too many times in not a good way.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Too stuffy, heavy,сold and white flowers
Сannot be used from the smell starts to spin the head ...

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: @pr-few-m It's galbanum, not aldehyde

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Fresh, green, mysterious. A very pleasant perfume! My love from the first breath. And how beautifully it unfolds! Great aroma, beautiful bottle and fine spray. Love very much!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
@gardeniapetunia
that note you couldn't like in this scent is called 'aldehyde'. i guess different people interpret the smell of that note differently and it's challenging to many. i see only 'perfume_infatuated' had mentioned that note so far.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
