I love the opening but there is a note, and I don't know what it is other than to say Green, that is very reminiscent of Chanel #19, a fragrance I had and swapped after much thought. This note shows up days later on clothing, definitely not right away but the same aroma I got from the #19. I don't like it so this Bloom flanker may get swapped to.
I don't care if this gets no balloons, but someone might appreciate knowing this if #19 isn't their cup of tea.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
This scent makes me think of conifer woods. It's green and strange.

I was on the fence about buying it. I enjoyed it but I couldn't decide if its something I want to smell like. It's definitely not for people who just want to smell pretty - this is a strange, unusual scent that will definitely draw attention.

I ended up getting it and I do use it sometimes, but it's been in my shelf for two years and I'm still not done with 50ml bottle. I think it's the sort of scent you need to really like to actually reach for. It's not a "perfect (insert season) scent" or something that just fits a certain occasion. It will always stand out.

In terms of longevity and sillage, it's decent. That's probably because it's such a weird scent that it's hard to not pick it up, even after a long time.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This is mostly white floral to me and I was hoping for something a bit more green, grassy, leafy. Acqua di Fiori may be a green scent for those who are not into green scents normally. I can't really smell the green notes in it for some reason, all seems to be dominated by flowers. Also it seems to be quite faint on me.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
This scent is amazing. I bought after I tried it one year ago. It's light yet it so lush and floral. I did not know that I had a soft spot for galbanum and honeysuckle. It starts out crisp and then it is drying down into this beautiful summer field of flowers. It's also quite aquatic which makes me think of walking through a garden during summer rain. It kind of captures the moment when rain amplifies every scent that is lingering in the atmosphere. It's very sensual yet very natural. I can not wait to wear it for warm summer days.

But....the longevity is bad. Have not tried to overspray or spray it on clothes yet so it might be a way to keep the scent. Maybe a body lotion might keep it at place as well. Because I do want to have this scent on me for way longer than 3 hours.
But honestly it is quite terrible that such a beautiful scent has weak longevity. Especially when I think of its price tag!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Very fresh, green and uplifting. It makes me feel as if I just spent some time in nature and had a chance to just take the time and recharge.

While I enjoy the sample that I got, I don't think I would buy a full size, simply because I feel like Green Tea by EA would give me the same feeling at a fraction of the price. Also, the dry-down really remind me of CK's Reveal's dry-down.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
This frag is SOOOO lovely in all its spicy greenness. It's incredibly sharp and herbal, smells like the experience of walking in a garden and crushing stems and leaves underfoot.

The big disappointment here is the longevity. It has completely disappeared off my skin within an hour of application, even when I spray it on my clothes and hair.

How I wish this came in a longer-lasting EDP!!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
How fitting. While I was applying this I was listening to the latest by Perfume Genius on KCRW. Indeed, whoever crafted this is a genius!
I just love how it is a warm floral which makes it more accessible throughout Spring and Summer. Kudos in adding the top notes of Cassis and Galbanum which lend an element of depth and sophistication that you don't normally find in a white floral.It is like standing in the middle of a lush garden in full bloom after the rain. You can appreciate the floral notes but there is the smell of earth and sun as well.
The sillage is great so you can spritz in the beginning of the day and take your sun-drenched garden with you all day long.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Okay, I am going to say this and then quickly duck out of harm's way, but... the opening of this smells like a German ecologically friendly dish soap...
please don't hurt me...

Let me save myself a bit though and say that it's not the fragrance's fault at all. It just so happens that this mix of notes seems to be popular in some German 'close to nature' household brands as well. Just that combo of Lemon, Lily of the Valley and Honeysuckle.
And it's just the first few minutes. The dry down I like a lot better. I never smelled galbanum leaf on it's own, but by method of exclusion, knowing that what I'm smelling is neither of the other notes, I have to say, well... seems I like galbanum leaf? And it goes amazing with the dried down citrus notes.

It's actually lovely. Clean, fresh and a lot of... errr... natural springtime greenery? It does remind me a lot of taking a springtime walk in Europe. Everything is budding, first tiny yellow and white blossoms on some of the trees, young grass reclaiming the thawed ground, a few first spring flowers here and there. Clean mild air, that carries the fragrance of new life and the promise that winter is finally gone.

I don't dare really judge the longevity. In hot humidity it lasts maybe an hour. I mean all of it is so gentle and fragile, you cannot really blame it for not standing a chance in hot and sweaty conditions. However, if I was currently living in Europe I would totally consider this for a no-brainer everyday springtime pick and it might last a lot better under those moderate climate conditions. Sillage is also very soft on me. It's probably a fragrance that you'll mostly be wearing for your own pleasure. In that sense it's very office/school safe.

Anyway, solid like from me.

Edit: I ended up getting a full bottle. The heat is just picking up in Mumbai and this is just such an incredible uplifting refreshing relief from the muggy hot air all around. I really don't mind spraying more often to up the longevity.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I got this one because I was looking for a green type of scent for summer. And because of the bottle, the bottle its beautil!
But thats what it is: green, point blank. No flowers on me just all the green notes. It doesn’t last either, maybe 3hrs max and poor sillage. I didn’t regret my purchase but wouldn’t repurchase either, specially for the price.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This is lovely! I’ve never smelled the original, now I really want to, but this is a unique, woody, musky floral, with just the right amount of freshness or brightness from the citrus.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I find this much nicer than the original "Bloom"! The original Bloom is a really straightforward, minimalistic, white floral smell. This flanker has many more green notes that are both lush and dry at the same time, I find it very well balanced with the citrus notes dancing on top. The white florals take a backseat. It smells very aromatic, with the other notes that round out the smell so that it's not sharp. Still, with all that is going on, it's not messy, but actually quite well blended to create a distinct fragrance. The dry down at first reminds me of Comme des Garcon's Lily, then it develops into a thinner "Gucci" musk that I reminds me of Gucci Envy. I was really surprised by this--there are so many Gucci fragrances that feel rushed or unfinished to me! 9/10

UPDATE: THE DRY DOWN SMELLS LIKE GUCCI ENVY!!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Flowers straight from the florist's refrigerator, or a lush garden on a dewy morning. This is a refreshing EDT that's green through and through, but tempered in a way that I feel I could wear all year long. It's very reminiscent of flower stems and water in a vase that has infused for a day. Dewy cassis buds and delicate honeysuckle bring a joyfulness to the vibrant green galbanum top notes. Lily-of-the-valley gives this a crisp floral feel.

I feel that this is a versatile scent, uplifting when worn on its own, or giving dimension and elevating a heavy floral perfume, or a liveliness to a woody fragrance when layered.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This smells like a cup of tea, innocent, green, fresh, aquatic, floral...

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I like the Nettare di FIori flanker. I wouldn't wear it but I like it. This one, however, I can't stand. It's too green and not in a good way. It also smells dated and I just don't know what I would ever wear this to. Maybe just a casual spring day. Good sillage.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I love this and have the Nettare di Fiori also but not the original. This does not seem like a flanker to me but a different perfume in its own right and I get no tuberose.
Many green perfumes are overwhelming to me and too.....something, like Chanel 19 is green but so strong.
This is not although I do wish it lasted longer. However, it's cheap enough (without being a cheapie) to spray all day especially if you get a tester.
It's lovely.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
To me, it’s a green floral. More green than floral. I was expecting a white floral bomb like the others and i am a bit disappointed. It’s not bad, but it is shy and forgettable. Longevity is poor and it doesn’t project.
Not my cup of tea.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I'm not really a fan of this one, it is too much like grass. It has that dirt earth smell going for it. Not for me, but if you like those type of scents I say go for it. I find the original to be more of my style. I grew up in missouri and when I smelt this that is what is smelt like when it was spring. I like the other two blooms and this one I can do without. I see where they were going with this one tho. It smells earthy and very vintage

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Deep green; walking in the woods, inhaling the scent of the earth and soil and the half composted leaves from last autumn. Springtime coming, leaving the winter behind.
I love this. Many perfumes I have, love or like, are for me versatile to have most seasons, all hours of the day or night. But this one, at least for me, is really really a springtime fragrance. By springtime then, I mean from the very time you can see that the days slowly become a little longer, it can still be pretty cold outside. And then I love to wear it until the summer comes, and even on cooler nights in summer.
(I love the original Bloom as well, but it’s different.
Nettare di Fiori I don’t like at all: too strong, too mainstream - first time I had ever thrown a sample in the garbage bucket...🙂 but that is me, maybe not you. The newest - red bottle, Ambrosia I think?? is lovely too, but too close to the original for it to make me think I need that one too. Softer.)
Romantic like Jane Austen books and films... ☘️🌸🌷🌱🐾

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: The original Gucci Bloom with WAY more green notes. You must like Galbanum to enjoy this version. It’s got the original Gucci Bloom DNA with crushed up stems and leaves and it’s quite woody with a pinch of powdery dry sweetness.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Love this scent. Reminds me of Commodity Rain, which sadly is now discontinued. Smells just like a rainy day in spring by a flower garden and is really nostalgic to me. Been trying to find a floral and aquatic fragrance just like Rain as I mentioned and even being a guy it is a really great scent to wear at home after a shower or a run to the store. Only if it was more to the aquatic side it would be the perfect fragrance for me, but I highly recommend it and is way better than the other flankers!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: If you find the original or the other flankers too much, give this a try...You might enjoy it. It is fresh, green, and quite refreshing and lacks the heavy naturalistic sweet tuberose /honeysuckle mixture in the original and Nettare Di Fiori. However, if you love Bloom/the other flankers, don't blind buy this. Acqua Di Fiori is very light and pales in comparison to the other lush, white floral powerhouses in the range. It is sharper and a little bitter in the opening and dries down to a fresh green dewy rose and slightly woody scent. Performance is as expected of an EDT.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This one doesn't lead with tuberose like the other ones do which is a very velvet rich smelling flower but most people don't like the waxy sharpness it has I think the original bloom is beautiful because of the tuberose being so dominant but bloom fiori leads with galbauam leaf which has a wett meadow & dewy green forest scent but minus the heavy woods. Men this could definitely go unisex because of the freshness it has and I think this one is the best one out of all of them. I have so many perfumes from 90's favs (CK escape) to current niche gourmands (BR540) to my current signature (Armani rose de arabie) and everything in between but NONE of them smell as FRESH as this I find myself reaching for it more than any other perfumes I have..hands down it's in my top 5 must have a back up list and yes I'll still be reaching for it in the winter becauseto me smelling fresh shouldn't just be a spring time thing smh. I would suggest buying a sample vial on ebay or smell it at a department store but if you like fresh forest smelling fragrances you should like this one.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: i've been wanting to have this since it first came out. i don't like other in the Bloom serie, because they are tuberose scents and i do not like tuberose. this one was love from the first sniff. i do not smell tuberose here, even if i do see it in the notes, and i am always very sensitive to tuberose - to a point than no scent with tuberose works for me. i have no idea how they managed to hide tuberose in this one, i quess here it just gives that full-bodied feeling, otherwise this green scent would be too flat. anyway, this is a modern green scent. simple and linear, strong and long lasting to me. it smells wet forest (no pine trees, just decicuous-tree forest,in a shadow, not in a sunlight; the smell of crushed leaves, green wildflowers and freshly cut grass. it corresponds just so well with nature at the place i live at. we do not have meny flowers, nor smells, just many greens, grass, wildflowers and forests, lots of forests. it is pretty much how it really smells here on a late summer evening, or early autumn day. it is a smell of a cut grass in a shadow, not a smell of a grass in a sun. it is a smell of crushed wildflowers, not those with many blossoms, but those with a few and small ones, and it is smell of more of a stilk than of an actual blossoms. why would i want to wear this you may wonder - it is very green and full of life, and not like any other perfume, and not any sensual or nothing to appear attractive. it is just like a smell of nature. very green. very pretty. just for myself. just wat i wanted.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
This is the Bloom flanker that most differs from the original. There are vague hints of Gucci Envy in the very opening. To begin with I get the sense of walking through lush, wet pine forests, past ponds covered in blooming water lilies, then the scenery dries out and the scent turns more aromatic. Afterwards, the dry down becomes more like the original Bloom, but sadly disappears too quickly. It really takes you on a journey and it's crazy to me how different this one becomes from beginning to end!
Overall, I appreciate this as a fragrance, but it's too aquatic and green for me to actually wear.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I tried the Blooms and enjoyed (and wanted) them all,lol. Acqua isn't a tuberosey scent like the others, they definitely feature that note quite prominently. The note is listed in with the white flowers but Acqua is green and astringent, it is crushed leaf and wild flowers. I chose this one to buy a biggie from the batch as a new modern signature scent, as it fits me now. It has the green of the 90s classic Gucci Envy, so if you enjoy that, this is going to be the Bloom for you. Do try first though, it is the least mainstream crowd-pleaser of the bunch. Guys, this has the green herbal feel on a par with Fleur du Male - if you love that, try this. It is easily the most 'unisex' if you heed the conventions of gender assignment to smell. Enjoy!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I spritzed this on a paper strip at the mall yesterday, and couldn’t stop sniffing it. I’m surprised at the negative reviews. To me, this was just delightful! I don’t care much for the other Gucci Blooms, but this!
A lovely balance of oh-so-fresh green, -in a natural, dewey-grass sort of way, with sweet flowers, but not in a cloying, headachey way many floral perfumes smell. I think of a happy, smiling, barefoot young woman in a white linen boho dress twirling around in a sprinkle of rain in a garden of mostly foliage with a few flowers here and there.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Lovely floral scent, but nothing too outstanding.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I liked this green, cassis-based flanker a lot more than the other "Bloom" flankers. It's a great summer scent, but it was pretty much a skin scent and lasted only two hours. I have no problem with the light sillage, but two hours? COME ON! No way I'm paying 80 euros for that.

7/10

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: The green/lemon notes are very prominent and strong so if you like "aqua" type scents this one will be very refreshing. If you like the original Gucci bloom, this isn't likely to appeal because it completely transforms/ruins the original vibe.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I like this perfume, it is fresh and grassy and a little bit zingy (just quietly zingy). It reminded me straight away of Estee Lauder's Pleasures, but more green and less floral. I was disappointed that it didn't last long on my skin, only 3 hours or so. I'm not sure if I'd buy it, I'll try it again to see.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This fragrance is great. It reminds me a lot of Clinique Happy, but with something a little different that I can't quite put my finger on. I got this one in a subscription installment and would definitely consider purchasing a full sized one in the future. It's fresh, clean and mood uplifting. Gucci nailed it again!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I really like this. First impression, this is different than anything else I own and tend to look for in a fragrance. On me, this starts strong, like a forest after the sun goes down and the air starts to cool around the wild blooms and the lake. I don't get how other people say that it smells synthethic, this smells so authentic to me, it really transports me to a forest where Snow White communicates with animals and battles the evil witch. The dry down its the best part, the greenery starts to mellow and surfaces a creamy floral aspect that gives it sweetness. This lasts too.
Good work Gucci.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I've only tested this one on paper by now, but I've fallen in love.
It is definitely similar to Pleasures, but I think this one is more authentic. It smells exactly like green, field plants with a bit of soil, like a meadow. I guess this is not as pleasant scent for some people, as it is for me. I love it because it is so authentic and it takes me back to childhood memories when we used to work in the field and roll around on the meadows (which I still do, whenever I can) and these are beautiful memories.
For me, this scent is real, it is not artificial, plastic, urban, unique or innovative. It is the smell of nature as I know it, it smells like life in the woods, which I long for right now, during the winter, living in the city and being indoors most of the time.
Maybe i don't come across this kind of perfumes a lot, it is definitely not as warm or strange as are the scents I like in this moment of my life, but if it's gonna behave on my skin as I hope it will, it is going to be mine, no doubts.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
this perfume is very similar to pleasure by stee lauder but the background in different (90% similar )! i don't know why they given this the same name like gucci bloom, it's not the same perfume at all.
very plesant, a litle bit green, perfect for spring/summer

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
First it smells like you just walked through a bunch of green leaves, trees and flowers, okay like you just got out of a forest after the rain. Literally. Then after that you'll see the wet woods and the ground more clearly.

It's interesting, different. I'm confused by it. It's beautiful but at the same time I just smell like I literally got out of a forest/ garden after the rain and the different types of leaves are all over me. Green, sensual but a bit dirty.

The thing I like most about this is that it smell natural. On the paper it smells green but on my skin it smells even greener ha ha. My friend told me I smelled like some type of herbal medicines lol.

The problem is none of my clothes seem to fit the smell. I own mostly either super bubbly clothes like pink hoodies n white denim shorts or really work-wear types. You gotta be wearing something like linen or anything a bit raw & natural for this scent to work well. Like you can't wear sloppy clothes and wear Decadence by Marc jacobs at the same time if that makes sense.

This perfume is really unique so I suggest you should go try it instead of blind-buying.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Mainly freesia and musk with some galbanum and a hint of cassis. Almost comes off like a floral with some fig leaf. A nondescript floral. Nothing extraordinary. Very mainstream.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I think this perfume is an actual gem
It has a different smell then the original but it is still in the same family
When i spray this it directly smells like a bouqet of flowers
It does not smell artificial so that is good
It starts of as very fresh then later it dries down in a fresh sweet floral perfume
On my skin it lasts about 6 hours
The silage is moderate
Rating 9/10

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Usually I love Gucci perfumes. Totally disappointed.
This was an assault on my nose. It was like when we used to clear land in the deep south when I was younger. Strong, blooming, green, irritating, hot vegetation and stinking wild flowers burning your nose and eyes. Pollen and allergies. Buzzing insects, hot sun beating down on you. Utterly preposterous. The bottle is nice.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Earthy-flowery-fresh and soft, close to skin, aromatic and yes, long lasting.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I much prefer the original Gucci Bloom for it's honeysuckle & tuberose duo. The honeysuckle is the dominant note in the original, so I would go instead for Jo Malone Honeysuckle & Davana.

But here, in Acqua di Fiori, even the jasmine is silenced and all I could sense is a slightly sweetened galbanum, complemented by the freshness of cassis.

So, for a non sweet and fresh scent from the recent Gucci's offerings I would much prefer Gucci Absolute Pour Femme.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This is a definite pleaser. Bitter jasmine and not much else, sweet and sophisticated and not a hint of the syrup candy-like sweetness. I find it very sensual in a natural kind of way. Jasmine does dominate in this perfume, but it's a very authentic scent. Sillage is moderate, and lasts up to 6-7h.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I received a sample of this "supposed" perfume. But what smell of that? They look like withered flowers in a vase full of putrid water. It does not seem to have flowers on but the liquid inside the stem. I am used to smeel other florals where flowers are flowers and not the sap inside them. I do not like it.
P.S. EDP, are we sure?

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I smell this as an aromatic green/herbal perfume, with white flowers, faint wood, and very faint sweet vanilla notes, on a thick musky-ozonic-aquatic background. Probably this perfume can resemble the smell of a garden after rain.

That musky-aldehydic background--which I'm not fond of, reminds me with that background found in (Burberry Brit Rhythm), but overall, this Gucci is the easier one between the two to my nose.

I find the original bloom to be the best among this line, until the date of this flanker release.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I thought that nothing could be worse than the original Bloom... but I was so wrong. I really don't understand the obsession with floral dominated fragrances. Sure, florals can be nice and even extremely sexy or elegant, but they cannot be the only notes in a fragrance. Acqua di Fiori smells like flower and grass juice. The worst thing abut this perfume is that the grass note is way too literal and it’s even stronger than the florals. It literally smells as if someone tried to juice grass and added a touch of floral. There's nothing attractive about this fragrance at all.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I must be anosmic to this or it is very weak. I purchased it by accident ,at Shoppers Beauty Boutique and I’m not happy. It was $138 plus tax, that is well over $150 .... I thought I smelled this , becuase of what people say .... I smelled a Bloom that was like fresh cut green grass and I loved it.... but it wasn’t this . This seems like a soft aquatic with a dominant galbanum that is almost dusty on my skin. I don’t smell any white florals like Tuberose or honeysuckle.... if anything some water lilies or osmanthus. There is no sweetness in this, it’s a cold perfume.
To me this is like a sad , melancholic pastel... it isn’t like spring, full of new life and vivacious greens. ...beautiful but lethargic, a flowerwall with no life energy. It’s a beauty that is too delicate, too fragile , too mellow.
Do I like it ? Yes. do I recommend it? Nope, not for the money it costs. If it was cheaper, yes. Oh, and the silage is minimal and the lasting power quite poor too.... by my skin eats fresh scents . Bummer. I liked it .
Edit: despite the very poor silage and lasting power I love it, it’s natural and reflreshing smelling. Gorgeous but NoT worth the money.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I haven’t tested Gucci Bloom I just wasn’t that bothered to. It was a impulse purchase to buy AdF blind but I’m glad I did :) it’s a luscious wet green fresh mossy garden kind of fragrance. It’s definitely different to my usual style of fragrance choice. The longevity is moderate but that’s to be expected as it’s only an edt. I’ve started pairing it with my sadly discontinued Jo Malone Honeysuckle and Jasmine cologne it smells beautiful really unique. If you want to step out of your comfort zone then give this flanker a try it’s definitely different.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Not a bad one, however save your money and buy Truth by Calvin Klein.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I liked Gucci bloom, but I found it similar to something else I owned. This flanker though, I love it. I can't explain exactly what it is, but from the first wear I loved it. It is a green scent, also normally not a category I'm really into, but it just works for me. The tuberose is still here but dialed down in the background making way for the green notes to shine. I will say that as much as I love this one, I won't repurchase. The performance is terrible. I have to spray myself like 20 times to get a good whiff of it and within an hour it's gone. Such a shame because I really do love this one. :(

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Reminds me of Clinique Happy Heart. Which reminds me of my mother.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Beautiful scent but too aquatic for my chemistry which goes a bit metallic smelling on me the first and third Blooms are the ined for me.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I blind bought this, after loving the Gucci Bloom so much. I thought it would be close, in a green way (for me) close to Chanel No 19 or Crystalline which I love. This unfortunately is not working. It's seems so synethic and allergic green, ouch. I can't even describe, except to say....what brings us together, then tears us apart. This is a big wreck on a very cold city night with Beetlejuice either there to entertain you or get you to say his name. Might try again, but it seems so fake and headache, oh can I say migraine. I guess I should not try to venture too far from what I already have. Try it, but I would not blind buy it. I usually am true to my favorites, and glad I have backups of them. Good luck....

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This perfume definitely isn't for everyone, what with its strong green notes, but I like it. Good for special occasions.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This perfume is very green in the top notes! It smells like stepping into a flower shop refrigerated section, green, cool and sparkling. It tries down to a more woody floral scent on me. It's lovely!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I love its initial spray. It's fresh,green and cool. Then I let it sits on my skin and it dries to be kinda creamy,earthy and warm. Although it has the same floral DNA like its darling sister,Bloom but somehow I personally like Acqua di Fiori more than Bloom. Honestly, when I smell AdF, it really reminds me of Annick Goutal's Gardenia Passion.Both shares the same floral beauties of Jasmine and Tuberose. And that's the only perfume that came to mind.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
This doesn't smell anything like Gucci Bloom. If I didn't know it was supposed to be a flanker of Gucci Bloom, I wouldn't be able to tell.

They took out the tuberose. I know they claim tuberose is still in here, but I can't find it.

Instead this smells like crushed green stems. Fresh, green. Slightly sweet. Aquatic.

After about an hour, this turns into a Versace Bright Crystal type of smell. If you have put your nose on that, you can expect hours two, three and maybe part of four to smell like that. But underneath that 'Bright Crystal' vibe, there is lurking the green freshness of the opening that you can activate by breathing down on it, or misting yourself.

During hour 4 or five, the scent becomes a faint, faint green trace on your skin. I only get about five hours out of this. Perhaps six on a lucky day.

I like this a lot better than Gucci Bloom, because I hate tuberose and this is much more appealing to me. But that's just a personal preference. This is also weaker and lasts shorter than Gucci Bloom.

This is a nice, slightly sweet aquatic and green perfume. Not what I would describe as a 'floral.' More predominantly green than predominantly floral.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
On my skin both the middle notes and the dry down have the Miss Dior Cherie L'eau vibe and I enjoy it so much: is fresh, green suitable for the warm summery weather, but with a woody touch. I am happy because I loved the discontinued Miss Dior l'eau given to me as present by my dad during an holiday 10 yrs ago.

UPDATE: the bottle is really gorgeous.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Literally smells like grass and dirt, if you like earthy scents check this out

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I just saw a newer version of this parfum it had brownish flowers on the label..it's really nice more womanly..liked it very much on my to buy list.. smells really nice that makes three version
Gucci bloom nettare di fiori that the name..
It's a new intense version ..yes

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: First spray a total thrill. Freshly cut grass, bottom of the garden broken stems, pine needles pinier, fresher than any other ever. unfortunately dries down to a generic slightly fruity sweetness. All sweetness should have been banned!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
The original Gucci Bloom was a bit of a disappointment for me. I was on the hunt for the perfect wedding day scent, and although very pretty, Gucci Bloom was just a reinterpretation of a tuberose scent that had already been done to death.

Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori, on the other hand, is surprisingly more unique than its predecessor. I'm not madly in love with this flanker, but I do enjoy it. I find it to be a very refreshing blend of jasmine, honeysuckle, cassis and white musk.

The tuberose note barely features in this fragrance's composition. Jasmine tends to lead as the reigning white floral in Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori, followed by sweet honeysuckle and the sharp greenness of cassis.

It's hard to place this flanker into any specific category. In my attempt to describe Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori, I would call it a watery and crisp green floral. It doesn't smell anything like the original Gucci Bloom.

This flanker would be great for Spring and Summer, especially for those that live in a warm, tropical climate. The only downside to this fragrance is its lacklustre longevity and projection. You might want to reconsider purchasing this fragrance in a smaller bottle so it's easier to have on the go for constant re-application.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This Gucci reminds me of another scent by Alberto Morillas, Bvlgari Omnia Crystaline EDT. It smells... zen. If I practiced yoga in a zen garden, that's what I would smell like. Clean, green, floral, a bit woody, sort of salty. I already own Omnia Cystaline, so I don't need one so similar, but it's a fragrance I'd wear to bed after a shower on a hot summer night!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I'm surprised by the reviews and statements on longevity & sillage in particular. A friend of mine has this and wore it on Saturday for a night on the town. And boy this is a lovely beast! First of all it filled her apartment and I could still detect it at 4 in the morning in the cab.

It has little do to with the original and I think that Gucci would've done this scent a favor if they'd launched it in a different way.
It has hints of a very fresh tuberose but the Cassis and Galbanum lend an interesting herbal touch ( a bit like the new Balmain Ivoire). Green but in an abstract way. And also a little creamy and just really well rounded, in a way like the cleanliness of Forever and ever Dior. I for one really really like it, it's a classy scent that never feels out of place or too bothersome. Works well year-round. Thumbs up!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: crushed dandelion stalks + something reminding Tommy Girl in the background (honeysuckle + musk?). Nice. Poor longevity.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I found myself underwhelmed by this. I expected galbanum and instead got honeysuckle. It is, by no means, a bad scent, but it is rather weak. Watery, if you would. As an EDT, this is to be expected. Eau de Toilettes don't always last less time than Eau de Parfum, but they do project less and this is most certainly the case here. Tuberose was in trend last year and Gucci Bloom definitely delivered one of the most chic there was, alongside Twilly & Gabrielle. It was bold, but also soft and elegant with white flowers blossoming around it.

Acqua di Fiori is closer to the ground, in the forest where all the greenery is... not in a romantic garden, adorned with gateways and white coloured flowers. Honeysuckle is definitely the most prominent, with its creamy sweetness enveloping your skin... and then that's it. The greenness is there, but not in a big way. LotV seems to be more present than galbanum, as the galbanum is very soft. Looking at the notes, one would think 'hmm, maybe a N°19 of the 2010s'. At least, that's what I thought, hoped and wished for. Perhaps that's why I was so underwhelmed. It's not the fault of the scent, nor Gucci but, instead, my own. I set a massive standard that couldn't be reached. Don't look at the notes and formulate ideas like I have, it does no good. Let your nose do the talking, then let your mind put it to words.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: A herbal scent of a bouquet of some synthetic nettles. Disappointing.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Ok. Nothing like Gucci Bloom. Reminds me of D and G light blue without burning my nose the way light blue does. Has a little more floral than light blue eau intense. For a fresh fragrance it lasts longer than most fresh fragrances. I get 6 hrs out of it in the heat, but I also tend to over spray. I think you might get like 4 hrs if you’re a normal sprayer. I love this for hot days in summer.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
high up on my wishlist. For me this is one of the best modern green scents out there. not sweet. fresh and dark green. a real novelty in the sea of sweet creations. i dont smell tuberose here whis is a good thing for me. to me it smells just like that green print on the bottle looks - dark green grass, forest on a summer day, some gentle flowers, and something just a sligtly mysteriuos, like a soft touch of a butterfly.
it has nothing in common with the original pink bloom bottle. i dont like that one at all. this is a scent of its own. i am looking forward to be lucky to get it some day.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Lovely swindle by Gucci...thanks Master Father Alberto for the dandelion flower water! :D
What do you smell? A joke...scent.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
The sample i got from the department store is just like scented water!!

What is this? A new trend?? To wear perfume but not let anyone know?? All my body creams smell much stronger than today's perfumes!!

And who wants to spend so much to vaguely smell of something???

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
This is very different from Gucci Bloom, but I like them both ! I chose this for its green scent, as I have lots of flower fragrances.

There is creamy green and flowers at the start. The bloom goes to the background in the dry down and its galbanum till its gone. Well made , but fbest for spring and summer. It is rightfully an eau de toilette. Well done!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
REFRESHING
______________________________________________________


I wanted to try ACQUA DI FIORI ever since it came out - and to day I had the opportunity to do it.

The first and last thing I smelled was the freshness - the Galbanum Leaf is very present. After some 30 minutes ACQUA DI FIORI turns from being fresh to somewhat woody (I felt that Sandalwood and Musk took over the fragrance), but after an Hour it returns to its starting point (the dry down was and is Galbanum).

Today was very hot outside and that might have influenced my perception (i hope not).

Longevity: - 3/10 (it's only an EDT)
Sillage: - 3/10

All in all: 8 out of 10 subjective points -> because it's very fresh and I don't get any tuberose (which I truly dislike).

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Green & tuberose scent, fresh, but definitely not my cup of tea. Ah, tuberose, why don't you like me?

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: It smells divine in rainy weather when notes of freshly cut grass sound very natural and in unison with humid rainy air, but dry weather makes it too overwhelming and monotonous, and considering its good longevity it can become really annoying.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Creamy greenery!

The first Spring forest plants mixed with luxurious body lotion to give feminine touch.
I get like Morning vibe from this fragrance, to energize you for the day.
Very interesting!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This is a very nice scent, but quite different from the original Gucci Bloom. While the original is dominated by soft tuberose and jasmine sambac, this version is greener and more herbal. Galbanum, cassis, honeysuckle, and then sandalwood and musk. It is very wearable, if slightly unremarkable, but I appreciate that they decided to emphasise the green aspect of Gucci Bloom for the first flanker, instead of going in the sweet-fruity direction. The silage is soft to moderate, depending on the outside temperature, and longevity about 4 hours (pretty much the same as the original). I might decide to purchase this flanker after I have emptied my bottle of the pillar.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Bloom Acqua di Fiori opens as a duet of vegetal galbanum leaf and ammoniac cassis in an unusually sappy, and herbal accord reminiscent of a long-since fertilised box hedge just taken to with a trimmer. Jasmine and honeysuckle quickly bloom from behind the tart foliage, shifting the composition almost entirely to a floral one. Transparent, tinged slightly green, and in the absence of any indoles, the florals here are those of opening buds. There’s a sweetness too, but nothing overbearing or matronly. Toward the gentle dry down of white musk and florals, sandalwood’s soft green creaminess becomes increasing apparent.

A genuinely worthy flanker, Bloom Acqua di Fiori manages to be effortless, youthful and endearing all at once. If the bottle is millennial pink, the scent itself is millennial green.

Feminine leaning though potentially unisex, longevity is moderate at 4-5 hours with soft sillage.

7/10

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I detect a distinct note of calone (or similar) in this as I did in the original Bloom. It produces a fresh, slightly salty effect that I appreciate more than really like. (Normally I detest calone but it is tolerable here.) So, for me Acqua di Fiori is a salty green fragrance with a hint of tuberose, and the original Bloom was salty floral with a strong note of tuberose. Both are well done and pleasant and I have considered laying down the credit card for both (with a preference for Acqua di Fiori), but ultimately both are too polite and lacking character for my taste. Longevity is under par. The opening of Acqua di Fiori offers 10 minutes of cool stemmy greenery. After those notes fade they are not replaced by anything as interesting. The galbanum is restrained. If galbamum is too much for you in traditional green fragrances such as Chanel No 19, RL Safari, or Jacomo Silences etc, you might be able to tolerate it here.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Yeah look, it's definitely different from most things being released today but I was definitely expecting something much more green. I'm a little disappointed, but the scent itself is SO lovely. The honeysuckle gives it some much needed character, it's light and watery. Very well blended.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I love how different it is. Alberto did it again, it's like being in a garden surrounded by flowers of the best quality. On the Bloom vibe but a bit greener. Love them both and it lasts hours on my skin

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Remember me one of those hundreds of fragranges born in the 90s following the success of CKone eternity and the others cool water acquatic ozonic scents: Lancaster sunwater mostly, rochas fleur d'eau and similar.

Nice for summer. Nothing new or wow. Longevity quite poor.
Galbanum? No way. Synthetic note of nimphea/lotus, melon etc.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Smells like all stems ..wish they go sweet or more flowers something missing I really wanted to like this but
sometimes parfums have to sit til your ready for them

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Beautiful openening of galbanum,but I don't detect tuberose.Only a generic musk in the end.

Longevity:2 hours
Sillage:very poor.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I found the original Bloom to be utter generic rubbish but hey what do I know about mainstream designer scents that are made for women? Not a lot. What I do know is that Gucci have raised their game massively in recent releases the two new Guilty Parfums being notable. I thought the bottle, branding and campaign behind bloom gave it a high profile and a feel of real quality which personally never translated into the fragrance itself, however I have to say I really enjoyed this flanker and so did my better half. She enthusiastically came over waving her wrist at me saying “Smell this...It’s Gucci bloom” I sniffed it and immediately replied...”That isn’t bloom...it’s nice.” She proceeded to show me the bottle and it was this flanker. I subsequently got a sample and confirmed that Acqua di Fiori opens up with a green, galbanum note of transparent incense which by its very nature is fleeting but quickly establishes a herbal, musky woods which is very fresh and green. Nothing sweet, overly floral or cliched in here just really good, light stuff perfect for spring/summer and unisex...I’d rock it. Maybe not enough to blow me away, it’s no Ninfeo Mio but it shares some similarities.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
The original was better, this has a very weird floral scent in it, that reminds me of flower garden.
Not all specific strong floral notes smell like you would want to wear them.
Too much tuberose, I think it's missing something, that could balance it out.
It makes me think of summer, but I guess I would never buy it for myself.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Hmmmm.... Sampled this one today at Belk & it is a strange one. I love Bloom, so I thought that this one would be beautiful as well. Oh well. Can't love them all.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I was shocked as I didn't like it at all. Not even close to the original Bloom. Of course they don't share similar notes, they aren't even in the same 'perfume group' if we could say, but this is too gross! (or too risky, to be more polite)

We all see that perfumes become weaker and weaker, the houses less creative and thousands of 'new' editions from masterpieces are coming on the market. Some people may like 'green' perfumes, it's something truly daring for Gucci I guess, we asked for something more unique but...I don't know. All I get is a grassy, earthy, green mess. It gives me the idea of being in a not so well cared freshly watered garden in a villa with a fountain in the middle and a gothic environment.

If you're lucky and your chemistry loves green type of perfumes, who knows? Maybe you'll be unique. For me is a pass...

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Loved the first one but this was so BITTER to me. As others have mentioned it smells a bit like your hand after pulling weeds, and that simply isn't a pleasant smell to my nose. Straight from the bottle I could smell the flowers but on skin it was sooooooo green. Too green for this gal. If you love green notes, give her a whirl.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: When you’re doing gardening and getting rid of all the weeds and then your fingers smell of all those different plants. Or when you’re cutting flowers to put them in a vase or make a bouquet - and the stems give off this fresh scent. This is exactly how Bloom Acqua di Fiori smells like. Lovely!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
This one gives me serious " Bright Crystal- vibes" just maybe a tiny bit more aromatic.
Verdict: NOTHING NEW

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Did anyone else as a child, ever rub fresh dandelion on their wrists to see it go yellow? Well this smells of that. Freshly picked dandelions. Green and a bit sweet. Like early summer mornings.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I love this fragrance! The original Bloom edp gave me such a headache but this is crisp Spring time freshness! Just like walking through a garden after light rainfall! Really enjoying it, it reminded me of a more green Loewe L Cool for her, my only gripe is that it lasts 2 hours tops...
I do have an atomiser so I can get around that but do I really want to pay that price for 2 hours of performance?

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Really excited to try this. Love the original and LOVE Galbanum... kudos Gucci, you're on the right track!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This is a decent fragrance! I would have liked more galbanum and less sweetness, but it does stand out among the designer offerings of today. Light and fresh without citrus.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: That was fast!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Very light honeysuckle scent with a sweet burst to start off with ,settles very nicely with musky sandalwood,this smells more woody than the original Gucci bloom ,the original is very strong tuberose and pungent honeysuckle throughout !
This scent would suit well in the summer time

product_name: Gucci Bloom Acqua di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Here come the famous Coty flankers

Very fresh, clean, watery citrus white floral fragrance with aquatic accents.
This is a smile-planter.
It smells just like a classic cologne for me

This smells high quality and very well blended.

When I saw the citron note listed in the opening I thought it would be a blast of very tart citrus, but it's not. The citron is light and this fragrance smells mostly of neroli, somewhat soapy. I believe the oakmoss makes it more unisex, giving it a bit of a more masculine feel.

It's really smooth, but very light wearing after the first hour. Hardly projects at all and is a skin scent almost instantly. Might last 4 hours tops. Leans slightly masculine, but can be worn by pretty much anyone, any age.

The scent profile isn't very unique, but this is very well done. A great inoffensive work/office fragrance. The stunning presentation is probably the deciding factor that leads me to buy a bottle.

Gucci 1921 is a citrus, aromatic and floral fragrance.

Its opening is citrus and herbal, very pleasant, the list indicates that it is citron, but to me it seemed more like bergamot accompanied by lemon verbena and neroli. In these first minutes it reminded me a little of Zegna's Acqua di Bergamotto or Italian Bergamot fragrances. Once it reaches its dry phase, it remains herbal and adds a musky and slightly woody accord, without further changes.

Gucci 1921 is a fragrance for daytime use due to its citrus and fresh notes, the aroma is pleasant, for casual use or office work.

Its longevity was approximately 6 to 7 hours with a low sillage, it only projects well for the first 20 minutes, but then it stays close to the skin.

I liked the scent of this fragrance, but it is a little expensive and has a low performance, plus there are other fragrances with which you can get that citrus and fresh feeling.

If you enjoy very simple blends of clean citrus fragrances and want a unisex one with a beautiful bottle to make you feel special, I can see you enjoying this one. Office, school, church, day-time friendly. Maybe on a first date on a lunch to not overpower your meal, but not for being remembered. It's a very clean, sweet orange flower scent. I bet it would layer and compliment most others in The Alchemist's Garden collection, but do we have the budget for that?

The bottle is to die for!! The bottle is so so beautiful as is most in this collection, but the scent is VERY generic. Most people would probably select a different fragrance from The Alchemist's Garden for that price and hardly anyone is going to want to buy some generic citrus scent to layer with for $384. I don't quite understand why such a generic scent would be selected as an anniversary release, either. Choose something else unless you want it for the bottle - try to get it on discount. It is absolutely not worth that price.
Daring, outgoing, authentic lemony goodness. More collectible than wearable. This whole LV-looking series from Gucci is killing it.
A strong, masculine citrus, heavy on the verbena and neroli. I wear this when I want to feel like a successful businessman. It’s my can-do scent. It’s, admittedly, a little generic.

Slightly different take on a classic but different enough from the likes of 4711 or TF NP. This isnt zingy or crisp like 4711 or smooth/ambery like NP but yea - that mossy quality gives it a different character which is unique in a way. This has the same lasting power as 4711 though which at sooo much more $, its not a compelling purchase for me even though it does smell nice.

I would mostly disagree that this is a niche copy of 4711 simply because of the citrus notes. This is a very nice green smelling citrus that has a faint but beautiful oakmoss note in the base. The oakmoss just gives a nice contrast while playing in the distant background. I’d honestly compare it’s styling rather then smell to bergamot 22. This is very smooth not juicy or sharp and has a soapy feel this is a great morning scent. IT’s performance is not great but it’s a nice wear and also great for layering. If you like bergamot 22 Nishane colonise or profumum Roma orangea you’ll likely enjoy this one. Not worth full retail due to performance but on scent alone it’s up there with the best.

This is a beautiful citrus floral that is in the same vein as 4711 but better. And it should be better for the price of $350 USD. It separates from the others with a brilliant citrus limone cedrato (giant lemon) which is so tart and fizzy it literally makes my mouth water, a high quality natural neroli, and finely crafted oakmoss accord. Natural neroli is expensive and takes literally 2000 pounds of flowers to create 2 pounds of oil.

Here's the deal, if you want the best (my opinion) version of the 4711/Neroli Portofino DNA and money is no object, I'd get a bottle of Chanel Les Exclusifs Eau De Cologne. Longevity sucks, but it is the Ferrari of this DNA. I rank 1921 just below Chanel EDC.

If you want to spend less but still get niche quality, get a bottle of Histories De Parfums 1.6 or Tom Ford Neroli Portofino Parfum on gray or secondary market. If you want the best performing version of this DNA, get Bond No 9 Eau De New York.

Overall an excellent fragrance if you can find it heavily discounted. However, at $350, there are lower cost niche options.This is not super unique but the quality is there, and would probably only appeal to someone that wants the beautiful bottle for shelf art. I'd pull the trigger for around $100-120 because I love tart effervescent citrus, green mossy vibe and high quality neroli.

Scent 9.5/10
Performance 2/10

P. S. The atomizers are fantastic, but get can jammed up and break. Italian quality control at it's finest 😂

Love this scent -- feels like a lovely modern take on 4711 however I will say for this price, the staying power is minimal. I know these are not notes meant to be beast mode to put on 10 sprays of this and not smell it 3 hours later was a little disappointing.

I love the way the dry citrus of the citron top note plays off the verbena from the heart in this fragrance. The effect is long lasting (for a hesperdic scent) citrus note that is reminiscent of the smell beneath a lemon tree on a hot day. As the citrus begins to settle, there is a delightful neroli note whose sweet, vaguely citrus floral scent gradually emerges from the lemony clouds of the opening and early mid notes. A nice oak moss accord marks the base. This is a great smelling, natural feeling, warm temperature unisex scent. Today is my second full wearing from the bottle I recently bought and my experience is at odds with folks who are getting very limited longevity. I am getting about 5 hours on a day that has gone from very hot and humid to pleasantly temperate this evening. I did not spray my clothes (I usually don't) but part of one spray caught my shirt and it remains noticeable 6+ hours after spraying. Projection is minimal, and is just a bit more than a skin scent from almost the first moments. So performance can be an issue with 1921.

This fragrance is definitely office safe. I find it very pleasant, but I admit that I bought it because I love the presentation as well as the fragrance. Like all of Gucci's Alchemist's Garden line, 1921 comes in an elegantly retro bottle with a great atomizer. Even the box and the little silken bag that accompany the bottle are lovely and luxurious.

So to sum up, 1921 is a delightful citrus-focused, lemony, scent with relatively poor performance but exceptional quality and presentation. If you love realistic, dry lemon notes, 1921 is worth sniffing. However, at the prices Gucci asks for the fragrances in this line, I suspect that, as others have noted, this scent is probably principally for die-hard Gucci fans like me.

UPDATE 8/10/21: The last time I wore this fragrance, in high heat with low humidity, the longevity was stretched out to about 8 hours with moderate, gradually fading to minimal, projection. I have decided performance is pretty good here, particularly for a citrus dominant scent. I am definitely happy I bought a bottle of 1921.

As someone said downstairs in this comment section, I feel like this piece is more for collectors or Gucci fans.
I am not.
I have tried it on and I would definitely not spend the niche money for something that in my view, is a simple neroli masculine scent.
I would love to spend the money on one of these bottles if the scent strikes me such as « voice of the snake » or even « eye of the tiger ». They are beautiful and collector!
However, the scent of 2021 don’t do the job enough for me. But Gucci fans, its for you! :)

I would say that if you are someone who is looking for something to wow your nose, this is not the fragrance for you. This is a traditional Eau Sauvage-esque fragrance of very high quality, and that's about it. I own it and love it, but is it worth $330 to someone who does not care about the fact that it was made to celebrate Gucci's 100th anniversary? Definitely not. This fragrance is the definition of something that is made for collectors. The packaging is absolutely top notch with incredible artistry and materials, the scent is high quality and has that dignified, understated, classic businessman vibe, and the fragrance has the best sprayer I have ever come across. If you are someone who believes that "all that matters is the juice," this fragrance is the exact opposite of what you are looking for. This is something I will rarely use because it is more of a collection piece than anything else. Should I throw a $10 million 1965 Ferrari convertible around a racetrack just because it is a slightly enjoyable car to drive in 2021? No. It is not groundbreaking in any way in 2021 and it is slow and boring by modern standards, so it just stays in my garage as a beautiful piece of rare art to show off. If you want a modern marvel that will grab attention and perform well for a good price, buy a 2021 Corvette and Dior Sauvage. If you want a collectible piece of art that has timeless style and class, buy a 1965 Ferrari convertible and Gucci 1921.

The last 3 reviews have summed up everything you need to know about the scent. Spot on descriptions and I have nothing else to say on the matter.

What I WILL add is a note for any tiny perfume goblins: There is a 3mL parfum splash bottle and if you can get your hands on it, DO IT. DO IT IT'S ADORABLE AND SO VERY TINY AND BRINGS ME SO MUCH JOY. LI'L ITTY BITTY TEENY TINY PERFUME BOTTLE. I LOVE IT SO MUCH. IT'S SO CUTE. ASDFGHJKL--

Definitely an '80s scent. Aldehydic, citrus, oakmoss opening to a dry down of smoky, wet earth, lily of the valley scent. I like it, it's okay, but it reminds me of other '80s scents. Smells like an earthier Balmain Ivoire. Update: It differentiates itself from Ivoire in the rosier dry down which is delicious.

I have a miniature bottle of Gucci 3, unopened and seemingly well-preserved. It is an old-fashioned inky-dark, earthy chypre - of its era and manages to be simultaneously dense yet muted.

Gucci 3 opens with a blast of soapy aldehydes and bergamot, bolstered by earthy green notes. There is some musk in there too. The bergamot is bitter yet realistic, and there is a smokiness to the opening. The dense, mossy base notes are present from the initial application, with murky oakmoss and dry vetiver in prominent roles. As Vilja Vee below put it, "scorched earth" describes it perfectly.

As it develops, G3 unexpectedly loses a lot of its earthy darkness quite quickly, and becomes more powdery and floral - iris/orris root and narcissus are most evident to my nose, and a subtle white floral accord in the background adds a feminine edge. The mossy earthiness of the opening becomes very suble, adding a hint of depth to the florals. It fades to a leathery-amber accord, while retaining the subtle earthiness. Restrained patchouli features in the drydown.

G3 is not long-lasting on my skin, unusually for a parfum concentration. It is subtle and quiet with intimate sillage and could be unisex by today's standards. Ultimately G3 is quite nice, but doesn't come close to other classics of the genre such as Givenchy III or Mitsouko. 3/5.

At first No 3 is bitter, cigar-like, earthy (minerals? clay? chalky?) After it settles, there is a pleasant floral lift present, like a slight fleck of soft pastel teal somewhere behind an in-your-face wall of mahogany-coloured fuzz. The overall sensation is like being submerged in a bathtub filled with a heated mixture of inky oakmoss, mud and flowers as a part of some decadent skin treatment.

Perfumes that showcase oakmoss (especially chypres) have made me feel puzzled, and this does the same. It completely lacks moisture, freshness and sweetness, ie. it doesn't share much of a palette with any of my modern nature-inspired scented shower gels and cleaning products, which I think explains its anachronistic queerness. It more than makes up for these 'lacks' with strong smells from some foreign depths.

Trying to wrap my head around how anyone could have intuitively experienced this as smelling 'good', I suddenly envision an older vision of nature that does not merely seek to replicate its pleasures, but to refine and make mystifying rhymes with all shades of its profoundness. A sort of abstract religious language that you were "supposed to get". That, or rambling conservative statements that seem dubious to relay in modern contexts.

For now, I wouldn't wear this for anything else than sitting on the sofa in my bathrobe, pondering its historical context and what this scent has meant for the people who have worn it decades ago. I can't deny that there is an addictive quality and a complex character to it, in all of its scorched earthy bitterness.

I have a newly acquired mini of Gucci No 3 parfum, and it is exactly the way I would expect a chypre from this era to smell. Big aldehyde blast of soapy musk, followed by oakmoss, orris and narcissus. After it settles, a light dusting of rose emerges. And boy, does this last! Put it on last night at about 8 PM, and 12 hours later I can still smell it on my wrist. Not a huge sillage, but I suppose if I'd been more liberal that might have been different. In reading about the EDT, I might have to hunt for a partial somewhere. I'd love to smell a more rose-forward version. Very nice!
This perfume is gorgeous and still can be sourced on ebay by those who have stored it away because of its classic smell and discobtinuance

Absolutely beautiful perfume not sure why they discontinue fragrances with a classic scent
You can still source this perfume on ebay if you look around for it

This was the first perfume my mom gave me. I really liked it at the time, and still have about 30ml left of it. Unfortunately it is in fact a very floral, elegant feminine scent, but it reminds me too much of laundry detergants, cheap classic shampoos and cheap neutral air fresheners. I personally only get a whole lot of lilac, a hint of amber and a bit of musk.

If anyone, who still owns a bottle of this gorgeous perfume, and has access to try from Estée Lauder’s Luxury Collection a scent called Radiant Mirage, can you please tell how similar these two perfumes actually are?!?
Because I have purchased recently a bottle of Radiant Mirage and every time I smell myself I am reminded instantly of Gucci Guilty Intense. I haven’t smelled Gucci Guilty Intense in a few years, since I have finished my bottle so I don’t have it fresh in my nostrils. And like anything good, it’s been discontinued for some unknown reasons…

But Radiant Mirage smells like I remember GGI to smell like! I am getting things totally wrong here? Please help me get some clarity if you can. Much appreciated!

I have tested it in perfume store, This intense version perfume more flory with a little amount of spicy plus clear base note from amber and Patchouli than "Gucci Guilty Original", in addtion, my nose was feeling the baby powdery note in clear way, but amber and Patchouli overwhelming, so I did't feel that I want this perfume, the feeling of femenine here not satisfied me. In my openion, this version is more better than "Gucci Guilty Original". This perfume isn't my type of perfumes which, but surley it lasts along.

If you didn't smell this perfume before, I advise you to not blind buy. This Fragrance didn't suitable for majority of people, needs someone interest this fragrance or someone don't prefer gourmand or sweety perfumes.


لقد جربته في متجر العطور، هذا العطر الإصدار المكثف وهو أكثر زهرية مع كمية قليلة من التوابل بالإضافة إلى قاعدة واضحة من العنبر والبتشولي من "جوتشي غيلتي"، بالإضافة إلى ذلك، شعر أنفي برائحة البودرية كبودرة الأطفال بطريقة واضحة، لكن العنبر والبتشولي طاغيان، لذلك لم أشعر بأنني أريد هذا العطر، لم يرضيني الشعور بالأنوثة هنا، برأيي هذه النسخة أفضل من النسخة الأصلية من "جوتشي غيلتي". هذا العطر ليس نوع العطور المفضل لدي، ولكن بالتأكيد يدوم طويلاً.

إذا لم تشم هذا العطر من قبل، أنصحك بعدم شرائه شراءً أعمى. هذا العطر غير مناسب لغالبية الناس، يحتاج إلى شخص مهتم بهذا العطر أو شخص لا يفضل العطور الشهية الغنية أو الحلوة.

The intense is a grown up version of the original Guilty. While its mother scent is more playful, floral and bubblegum violet, the Intense is deeper, with peppery amber balancing the sweet citrus and romantic florals. It also has twice the longevity and sillage, for which the original fragrance cant match. While the notes may seem overwhelming, it’s balanced so beautifully. It’s luxurious but doesn’t completely lose its playful side, and though it isn’t my favorite from Gucci, it’s a clear and well-earned runner up. It is my go-to for weekend getaways, late dinners/cocktail parties etc but I wouldn’t necessarily hesitate to wear it (one light spray) as a day scent.

This is such an iconic fragrance, it used to be my signature scent for ages. Unfortunately, now it has been discontinued and honestly, I don’t find new versions as good as it used to be.
For this version I got like 10ML left and I use it only for the occasion as I want it to last 🥹it’s not just about the fragrance, it is memories 🥹good memories

Gucci Guilty will always stay in my mind because it was the first perfume i got myself and the one which started my perfume collection. I remember the cool Jared Leto campaign and I was a teen and didn`t have the money to buy it. In my college lunch breaks I would go and spray it and feel like a million bucks. Then I finally got it and I wore it a lot with my leather jackets in autumn.
I also find this dark and intense, but also mysterious and really smooth. I pick up the amber, lilac, violet and pink pepper. Not good for warm days the amber dominates everything else and it starts to smell dirty. Easily unisex.
But it smells luxurious, soft, sexy and reminiscent of iris perfumes but not old lady like. For some reason this smells like marzipan, violet and lilac to me.amazing projection and longevity. Unfortunately its discontinued, not the same as the new intense version and this intense version was the best.

For me, I really find this dark and intense. I imagine this wearing in a cold night wearing my leather outfit or for formal events at night. It's not the daily perfume scent but it is good to use to break the monotony. First 15 minutes is intense and the dry down becomes somewhat dark, mysterious and I can relate the scent to an incense and maybe that is the combination of wood, soft spicy and patchouli notes. The patchouli is very subtle, I won't really able to recognize it but the juxtaposition of these notes is giving me the vibe of an incense burnt during the Holy Eucharist inside the church combined with the scent of a leather. It is not a disgusting scent, but rather a unique and sophisticated one. Sensuality may come from the concept of the darkness, leathery vibe but it lacks femininity and that might not be defined by other guys as "sexy". I love the bottle and I like the scent. The bottle is among my top 10 faves but this is not my top 10 favorite perfume. This for me does share the same vibe with Black Opium that is quite polarizing within the ultra feminine sexy department, alongside with Versace Crystal Noir. These scents are associated with sexiness when you imagine the girl wearing a sexy leather outfit with very dark smoky eyes. These does not offend either as I enjoy smelling and sniffing them on my skin. I am not getting the Barbie vibe but the Catwoman vibe in these perfumes....intensely dark (noir), could be naughty, feisty, fierce...hence, another category of "sexy".

A unique, complex, and rather glamorous fragrance. The opening has an interesting and well balanced mix of bright and sweet mandarin and spicy pink pepper. The beautiful purple florals soften things up and add a lovely feminine touch. The patchouli and amber add a warm and golden spicy warmth.

I bought this fragrance back in 2011 when it first launched when I was 23. I wanted something that was elegant, classy, and feminine with a touch of glamour that would make me feel put together and grown up. I only ended up wearing it for a short while though. Not because it’s a bad fragrance, but just because it wasn’t me. I was still trying to figure out what “me” was in fragrances back then. I still have my bottle to this day though and I do like to smell it from time to time. It is lovely, but still not me. Now at 36 I’ve discovered that I prefer beachy/coconut, vanilla, gourmand, and woody florals fragrances for myself.

I get excellent performance with Gucci Guilty Intense. It has great longevity… it lasts the entire day, and I can still smell it the next morning on myself. The projection is very good too, it radiates out a few feet from me. Also, a little goes a long way, so it makes this a better value for the price.

I had this since 2012 and never really LOVED it. It's nice, clean and the bottle is lovely.

Now, when I am reflecting on it again, I think it was grandiosely mis-marketed. There is nothing dark, sexy, mysterious or guilty about smelling like lilac and violet with a tiny bit of red pepper.

For me, this scent is about an English tea party in a French garden: lilac bushes, violet flower beds, wicker furniture, white dress, Earl Grey tea served in airy fine porcelain... and sweet treats.
The Alice in Wonderland Tea Party theme. Maybe, Guilty is about indulging into biscuits or mysterious while reading the famous book.
It's quite sweet I think and easy to wear. Modern and simple. Rather intimate than overwhelming. I'd say a safe buy for young fashionista.

One of my very first fragrances alongside Bvlgari Omnia Crystalline. What a great time it was when the designers were creating stunning, complex smelling scents with great performance for a decent price.

This is the fragrance that made me fall in love with lilac in fragrances. It was so addictive and sexy smelling.

I have always loved how the lilac smell in my parents garden but Gucci put it in a bottle with added sweetness, powderiness and some spice! Created a masterpiece and then discontinued it a couple of years later..

I would be forever devastated that I didn’t secure a second bottle so that I can enjoy, even sparingly, this divine smell for the rest of my life!

I found something similar from Tiziana Terenzi, Aphrodite, and it’s built in the same style but it’s obviously a different scent.

Please bring this (and Gucci by Gucci EDP) back, Gucci!
I recently purchased a sample of this and all I get from it is straight up hairspray. It just reeks. Bloody awful perfume.

This is a softly spicy, lilac heavy floral. When I first sniffed it, I exclaimed, 'mandarin orange', it is very noticeable in the opening.
There's nothing quite noteworthy about this one to me, it's nice, faintly sweet, feminine, but not worth a full bottle purchase for me.

It is something weird about this fragrance: all in all i find it ok but at the same time not. Would be nice without the pepper. I found out I don't like (pink) pepper at all. I had the Avon Summer .....something(with orange cap) and I didn't like it also. I'll use it and never repurchase it

I am nursing a bottle of this from 2012 or thereabouts. My first big perfume purchase for myself in my late 20s, with my glamorous dreams. It always worked beautifully as that evening scent that made a splash. I would wake up with heavenly floral amber smells the morning after a big evening. After a move back east years later, it worked wonderfully as a winter daytime scent, floral and intoxicating on cold days. These days it has a harsh opening, but the gorgeous purple floral drydown is worth the wait. What a gorgeous creature!

I go in phases with this -- my dumb reach, my most "perfumey" perfume -- though I don't question if I like it overall; I question if I want to wait about an hour for the odd, sour, slightly bitter orange and pink pepper edge to fade. Once that initial, synthetic blast dies down, the floral heart of this perfume is truly pretty -- a literal bunch of powdery purple florals. Leans rich and soapy, and has a slightly grape-y whiff sometimes. If you like perfumes that smell like makeup, give this a try. The violet/heliotrope combo gives Guilty a soft, powdery fullness at the heart that I associate with some of my favorite waxy/oily/synthethic make-up scents.

As a fragrance it's unchallenging, a little basic, and prim... which brings me to the name, which doesn't affect the juice at all, but it's really irksome to me when perfumes are given these naughty, faux-transgressive names like Guilty. I think all those "Ooh don't you wanna be a bad girl?" gimmicks are really childish. What are you guilty of? Smelling like flowers? Grow up lol.

Best for cool and chilly temps -- could easily be cloying in the heat!
Decent sillage and staying power. Compared to most modern perfumes, I find a few spritzes to be quite strong!

I gotta tell you something, in the year 2011 I wore this perfume like 4 days a week, not knowing it was a womans perfume, yes I knew it was kinda feminine smell too it, but back then I didnt care, I liked it I wore it. And know I find out it was for woman... :) But it was a lovely perfume. dont know how the formula is now, but back then it was great.

Well there must be some deep existential reason that I fall in love with fragrances that are discontinued. Yes, I’ll love this till it’s all gone!!
Gucci Guilty Intense is like a warm snuggly dance party on a frosty night that combines the rave music in one room with the lullaby and sleeping baby in another. Somehow this works and everyone is happy. It’s lovely.

Part of the scent profile is sensual and grown up, and part of it is like a calming cloud. Those purpley flowers are heavenly and heartwarming.
It’s not my job to know how it works, but I’m happy I get to enjoy the ride. 3 sprays of this and I’m set for the day.. I think it compliments all seasons but sticky summer.
Seems universally likeable.
The amber and patchouli base are quite warm, and I love it for that quality.

This one was my signature scent for a long time and I was heartbroken when it got discontinued, so I bought four backups.
I don't know what happend but I smell it differently now; like too much powder and very little lilac. The amber in the drydown though is still there and this is the only thing that makes me not to sell my bottles and move on. I still hope to adore it again the way I used to. And if I don't, I guess it is good since I can't buy it anymore. But I do feel a little sad honestly. Still, It is such a beautiful perfume.
My darling baby. Def lasts longer than Guilty EDP which was my gateway scent which got me on this journey 12 years ago. Lol.

This is one of the perfumes I've had in my collection the longest. It starts somewhat peppery and then becomes more powdery, with a hint of lilac (which I absolutely adore), resting on a base of amber and patchouli.

Beyond the notes, this perfume holds a lot of memories for me - I started wearing it in university and it takes me back to the simplicity of those days. I stopped wearing it after I graduated, or when I started working in offices and moved to Chloe/Coco Mademoiselle, but I still kept the bottle - hidden away and untouched, but still good after so many years. I pulled it out today and it put a smile on my face. Would I re-buy this if I can find it? I don't know - but I will keep the bottle I have for as long as I can, just because it makes me happy.

I really like this scent as well as regular Gucci Guilty but I'm a bit disappointed with longevity. It's a warm and sexy fragrance, when it dries down on my skin it reminds me a bit of YSL Black Opium. But I would definitely pick Black Opium over Gucci just because it's more affordable and lasts way longer.
