I only started getting into fragrances this year at 25, but before that, this was tied with Black Opium for being my 'signature scents' ages 22-24. I'd alternate between the two depending on my mood. This is so sexy, well-blended, and unique enough and I love how it makes me feel when I wear it. If I were trying to seduce an older man, I'd probably reach for this one instead of one of my many gourmand frags. Like Mark from Grey's Anatomy. I'd definitely wear this trying to bed Dr. Mark Sloan.

I like this far better in hot, humid weather. I’ve tried it over the past couple years at different times and never loved it. I found it screechy and not full bodied or interesting. Now, in summer, I’m finding I love it and notice the pink pepper (a note I love when it’s not powdery in its treatment) blending beautifully with the lilac & I almost find some gardenia, though I know it’s not a note. Soapy, spicy, warm, sweet and lovely in hot weather.

I am disappointed by this blind buy. I was expecting so much more from Gucci and for the price. IMO there is nothing intense about this fragrance. It sits close to the skin and then it disappears. It is not a horrible perfume but there is nothing memorable or fantastic about it for me. Maybe it is because it vanishes so quickly.

This is the first perfume I have ever returned, that is how much I am disappointed by it. Usually, I give fragrances a chance and if I don't want it, I give to family. I would not gift this to someone as it just doesn't last.

I am fine with fragrances that sits close to the skin, sometimes I don't want beast mode. Sometimes I want something delicate and lovely but unfortunately I just could not fall in love with this one. Its way too weak for me. So, for me, this is a "No."

-This smells cheap.
-Straight up linear, cough-syrup.
-Not for me. (-)

This is intense purple flowers with a smack of powder and I LOVE IT 💜 It’s the most fresh 🌬sweet 🍬fragrance I’ve smelled in a while. I mean, it’s really a breathe of sweet purple air. Goodness this is good. I have a decant and can’t WAIT to get my hands on a bottle. This makes me want to try Mancera purple flowers so badly now. If you love purple flower frags and powder YOU NEED THIS. Much more modern and youthful than Guerlain Insolence EDP. A love 💜

I got a sample of this at a Macy’s a couple of weeks ago. I wanted to see if they had testers of Obsessed by Calvin Klein because I’d heard that it contained lavender. They didn’t, but one of the salespeople claimed that this had lavender in it and encouraged me to try it. It doesn’t have lavender in it at all, but it is still a nice scent. It’s not very “Intense” smelling- the violet and lilac stand out, giving it a nice soothing feel. I am relieved to see that it’s not a Xerox of Gucci Guilty- it stands alone well as its own entity. This would be a great scent for a relaxing night event. I’d like to see this in a rollerball or purse spray.

When I was a teenager (not that long ago!), this bottle used to sit in my mother's collection and I HATED it. I thought it was too strong and overpowering and all in all, just unpleasant. After trying it again in my 20s, I now quite like it. It's powdery and strong so back then my untrained baby nose registered it as a more mature scent, but it's not. It's a sensual blend of purple florals, especially lilac, pink pepper and amber. I don't get much mandarin on my skin, but YMMV. Now these specific florals are something I personally very rarely reach for, but it's still a gorgeous scent. Definitely for cold weather though!
Pleasant fragrance, but too ordinary for me. Quite sweet, and I'm sure a lot of women like it, but it doesn't make me want to buy it.

I personally love this fragrance and I will explain why...From practical point of view, it's potent and lasts very long. It is not harsh, too aggressive on the people around you, yet it makes it's presence.
I think it is an original scent, reminds me what a real leather bag would smell like. Its powdery for sure and the amber is definitely there.
I do not like Gucci scents usually, but this one, the Intense version is a winner for me. Only in winter I search for it, but in summer It's too much, suffocating and smells differently on the skin. For me it's a cold weather fragrance. Comforting and sooo smooothhhhh!Super sexy yet sophisticated.

I know this scent. It has been on my wish list since I received a sample of Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum from a seller a while back. While not the Intense version, it is basically the same scent except they swapped the rose for heliotrope and the pink pepper is amped up giving it a peppier opening. As others have noted, it is also a little muskier than the edp. It also has much better silage and lasts a lot longer, which has been the reason I was hesitant to buy the edp in the first place. Since I love Gucci Guilty I am over the moon that I basically found almost the same scent (this is better!) that delivers much improved performance. It's beautiful and really a joy to wear.

I cannot possibly expand on Jae's very informative review below, except to add that contrary to maybe being too much for warmer weather because of the amber, it actually performed very well in hot weather. I wore it during the heat wave we just had in NY (couldn't help myself) and it wasn't too much. It stood up to the heat very well; never disappeared, but never overwhelmed. It wasn't room-filling or cloying. There is no excessive sweetness that might make it so. Jae's description of dewy is very apt. It's fresh, but at the same time calm. No screechy, sharp, or jarring notes to disrupt. Nor is it soapy or complicated with dozens of notes. What notes there are work harmoniously together. While not quite delicate, it certainly isn't a beast. Beast mode would be an 80s powerhouse, which this sure isn't. It's modern, in that it fits in with today's olfactory sensitivities, while at the same time being present enough where it is noticeable. It smelled so great to me from beginning to end on a hot summer day, I can only imagine how great it will smell in the cooler weather. I am very happy I listened to all the positive reviews, particularly Jae's, and blind bought a bottle. It is already a big love for me. I really, really enjoy wearing it.

Who would think of combining lilac, pepper, and amber? You'd think the second two would overwhelm the first, but that is far from true, because this is an inspired perfume. Dewey, almost syrupy lilac—along with the other purple florals heliotrope and violet—is put into sharp relief by the addition of spicy pepper and mellow amber. The patch is definitely there too, adding some leafy greenness to the florals and picking up that peppery note. The juicy mandarine orange is the perfect fruit here, because it's not a sharp as regular orange, lemon, bergamot, or other citruses. It neither clashes with the sharpness of the pepper, nor does it overwhelm the florals.

Guilty Intense is an altogether vivacious, lush fragrance. It's fun but not light, sensual but not sexy, fresh but not clean, juicy but not sweet. Because of the amber and pepper, it might be too heavy for warm weather, despite the cool, powdery florals. More feminine-leaning, but this will work on anybody. And in spite of lilac's soapy-powder quality, there's enough complexity and dynamism here to prevent GGI from ever smelling old-fashioned or frumpy. A lovely perfume.

I'm not familiar with the original Guilty, I got a sample of this Intense version from a friend and will review it on its own merits.
This is not a very intense scent and not that 'guilty' either, but I don't think that it's extremely light and innocent. It's a slightly sensual scent with medium intensity. The opening is pretty and interesting, I really get the lilac, a note that should be used more often and more creatively in perfumery, and also the warming, piquant pink pepper and musky amber. This is a good floral choice for rainy days. But the drydown is disappointing to me, it smells like a muddled mixture of florals, amber, patchouli, pepper and musk to me, not very distinct or well-blended. I don't know why this fragrance seems so musky to me, as it doesn't have musk as a listed note, but that's how it is.
I think I would have liked this more if the lilac was more enduring and the base better blended.

This one isn‘t as good as the others from this line. There is something in the opening that i don’t like. After, it gets floral powdery with the amber in the background. It smells mysterious but not sexy, actually, it smells a bit dated. It’s not bad, it’s feminine and interesting but not really my cup of tea.
Anyways, if you like powdery florals with a bit of washing powder smell, try it.
final note: 7/10
Lovely fragrance!I tried Gucci Guilty EDT befor and now this one. The are almost the same. For intense version I can say that the longevity is very poor.

I went to ulta ans was looking for a fragrance somewhere between night and day time and I think I found it. I smelled about 20 perfumes at ulta and when I smelled this I even said “oh” out loud. This is a perfume that smells like a strong confident woman would where which is why I got it! The first thing I notice is the Citrus. Floral and a deep sweet musk( no candy sweet here which I love ) on my skin this last 2 hours it sucks and I was disappointed. But on my clothes? Omg till the next day! I’ll take that! After 12 hours I still smell it on my shirt,
The citrus goes away and you are left with a deep sweet musk slightly floral.

Upon spraying, you can smell it from arms reach, after some hours only up close.

EDIT: I honesty might return it because it does not last on my skin at all, you can smell it on my clothes but it is very light. I think I would like to get something with more staying power.

It's a gorgeous, sexy, sultry, sweet scent for evening wear. There is lilac present but my skin is really amping up the amber and it's in charge here. A real shame because it's the lilac that really interests me.
Pink pepper adds a little spice but not much. There is a good dose of vanillary heliotrope. More violet might have made it less rich.
If there was such a thing as lilac wine then I suspect it would smell a bit like this.
It doesn't really develop that much. It gets a wee bit less sweet and more peppery. You start to pick out the patch in the background.
Good longevity and sillage.
PAMPERS. The initial blast is a stack of clean diapers. Powder bomb.
Wow, heavy on the lilac. Very deep, dark and sexy, but maybe too much lilac? It's slightly bitter, but I like that kind of twist.

This is the scent of a strong, confident, determined woman. She doesn't make excuses, she owns it.
It's bold and sexy, only for night wear. The lasting power and sillage is strong.
I definitely smell purple flowers, pink pepper, amber and patchouli. As it settles the warmth of the amber becomes more prominent, and the patchouli becomes less obvious, whilst providing depth.
If you are looking for a perfume that is sexy and mysterious but also sophisticated and not sweet, this is it.
It stands out from all these almost identical sweet patchouli perfumes that are swarming the market.

It really pains me (right in the ego) when I see a fragrance I feel so strongly (read: positively) about being billed as a forgettable basic-girl fragrance or simply "office safe."

I think that Gucci Guilty is far more special than this. Allow me to explain:

Guilty gives me really strong synesthetic associations, due in no small part to the actual presence of purple florals at its heart. I see an art deco stained glass window, moody indigo irises and pale milky greenery against a flamingly gold background. A soft subject matter, but sharp around the edges.

I also see neo-classical Madeleine Vionnet ensembles--all soft folds, flowers, and goddesses.

Guilty just smells divine to me. A bit heady and spicy, but with spring freshness fraying it around the edges. I get that sort of salty/sweet play-doh accord that I'm always seeking laced throughout, likely from the heliotrope. Adding to the play-doh effect is something I've seen other reviewers cite as well -- an unlisted nutty, almondy creaminess.

Can't. Stop. Smelling. This one has such a tactile quality to it.

An odd candidate, indeed, but one I'd put in the race for best make-up/cosmetic-smelling fragrance. The violet gives Guilty a soft, powdery richness at the heart that I associate with some of my favorite waxy/oily/synthethic make-up scents.

From top-to-bottom this is one gorgeous scent!

A note about the name and marketing: It's really irksome to me when perfumes are given these "exciting" faux-transgressive names like Guilty. I think all those "Don't you wanna be a bad girl?" gimmicks are really childish and probably are only persuasive in their own right to people who are still mad at their parents for not letting them dye their hair when they were in high school or something.

This one deserves a classier name that is...well...less guilty about its pleasures.

This is quite sexy, in a quiet sensual way. One of my favorite fragrances. I am never without a bottle in my collection.

I mostly get lilac, pepper and patchouli which work so well together. The amber and heliotrope come in during the dry down and turn this beauty to a spicy, warm, sensual fragrance. Very beautiful.

Lasts about 8-9 hours which is ok with me. Sillage is moderate and perfect for work/crowded places IMO, but then again, I'm the kind of person that goes to work in Jungle l'Elephant LOL. I easily pull this off all year round as well.
Smells nice. a well composed purple florals that gets along well with the patchouli and amber, but im still in the hunt for the perfect violet fragrance.

I think I may be anosmic to some notes in this perfume. All the reviews claim it to be strong. However, to me it smells very light and floral. It is more of a daytime, spring/summer perfume to me. It is very odd.

Many people say this is a night time perfume. I wear this during the day and the night. THIS IS A SEXY FRAGRANCE high notes of patchouli (Patchouli smells like raw sweaty sex to me) and dumb down with a sweet scent. Very grown smell. Onto my 2nd bottle. Love this Fragrance.
Put this on this morning and it was super powdery. It honestly felt like I rubbed myself down with a fresh diaper, lol... definitely not for me. Giving the rest of my mini away!

I just bought this EDP, because the EDT didnt last more than 4 hours on me.
This is very long lasting on clothes and skin...Amazing I love it, like the powder note combined with the violet or lilac.
Very weak sillage and doesn't last for long. yet good and feminine one!
Smells good but fades very quickly!

I also regret not buying the original. Intense I find cloying & hard to wear. Tested several times over 4 years.

Finally sent off to a new home where it will be appreciated, and I received a swap in return. Glad to see it gone, tho I had my doubts when I tested it that final time. The final base notes in the dry down make me feel nauseous.

I'm really sad I purchased the intense version, should've gotten the original. I love this smell, it's powdery, a bit lilachy, deep and delicious. But it really is heavy and I don't feel like this opens up or changes as you wear it, it just stays so concentrated. I only wear it for formal occasions.

Man this is good stuff. Especially I love the lilac note.

I wish I had it in my collection, but it´s on my list
Soft intimate secretive and seducing warm powdered lilacs. An impressive mainstream fragrance. To pair with pink lingerie.

I got hold of a miniature of this lovely. In the beginning its pretty much all about lilac, pink pepper and amber. For a fragrance called intense it is pretty weedy. A very pleasant fragrance though. Perfect for evening wear. Intoxicating is the right word for it regarding all the dense sweetness from the amber, heliotrope and citrus. There is a bit of patch in the background.
Good silage and longevity

Not more intense than the original. In fact, it might be weaker. I wasn't amused like I was with the original. Definitely not as powdery as the original. Less patchouli and amber too.

Sweet like pistachio, floral peeks through too, feels very grassy for some reason and for a quite some time. Just as the original it has some stages until the warm lilacs. Cannot pinpoint what note causes the grassy feel, could it be the pink pepper? It's weird because I have worn perfumes having a dominant pink pepper and they aren't grassy. Could it be the orange? whatever, it's grassy for some time.

Something vanillary that obviously comes from the heliotrope, but it doesn't settle. Leathery at times too, could be the violet? Either way violets don't settle either. I wish it had more prominent violets; in fact violets should be as prominent as pink pepper.

It's not totally bad, but it's not the best that Gucci could do. It's abstract and weird. Not intense, does not project more than the original but seems to last just as long. I got a full six hour wear, only it would stay really close to the skin.

When amber intensifies, the last stage of wear, it will smell kind of "dirty", it's "guilty" now. It's sensual just before it totally softens out. The patch is completely inoffensive, so don't worry that you can't wear it because of the patch, if you don't like it. It's not a patchouli centered perfume and that is fine, patch is barely traceable.

A yes from me, but if you have the Original don't bother with the Intense flanker.

Tried this when it first debuted a few years ago and had forgotten how much I loved this on my skin! My hubby recently returned from Europe and brought me a large bottle of Gucci Guilty Intense--first of all I was surprised that he had smelled many scents and chose this one! With my body chemistry, this more Intense version of the original is very creamy, soft & sexy and really long-lasting. The purple flowers are simply divine and drift softly around the heart of this scent. Never loud or harsh, but rather a strong soft, sexy and memorable fragrance. Very rich yet simply-blended--perfect for a romantic date or special evening out. I really prefer the Intense to the original EDT but think they could both be used--one for day and other for night. Very glad to keep this one in my collection.
I adore the smell of lilac, so this one, for me, is a sure thing. In addition to that, it is beautifully blended with an underlying subtle spiciness. Perfect for any occasion and any season.
This smells strikingly similar to the original except with more powdery notes. A cheaper smelling version of Gucci Guilty edt

I have a sample of this I wore today. Having tried the regular version I can say the intense version is so much better! I loved the kick of pepper and the lilacs and violets (My favorite).. the only disappointment I had was it has hardly any staying power after 45 minutes or so I could barely smell it at all. Maybe the spray lasts longer, I had the splash. I'll have to give it some thought about buying a full bottle.

Sweet sweet gourmands are my thing, but lately I've been craving sweet syrupy white florals, and I like this enough to have bought a 2.5 for a STEAL, after having a sample vial.

It's easy to wear, a feminine floral with a sweet airy feel. Def not intense, but my opinion may change with a full bottle that sprays, compared to a dab-on vial.

Reminds me of Lady Million, Elie Saab EDT/EDP, Roberto Cavalli EDP.... not dupes-- just the vibes and aura.

I can't wait to get my full bottle!

This is the kind of sexy I want to be. Come-hither, feminine, sensuous...all in a subtle, delicate fashion...but it makes quite the impact, even in it's subtlety (though it is subtle only in comparison to other popular dark fragrances in the market). It's the kind of scent that stays in your scent memory. Maybe it's the lovely lilac that's dressed in warm amber, and lightly powdered in spices. Heliotrope adds some sex appeal to the regular Guilty formula and violet adds a touch of mystique. Very womanly. A little mysterious, a little coy. Gently teasing. But ladylike and classy. I've run out of my mini for months now but I can still smell it when I think about it. The initial phase is especially heavenly and sensuous, and I get a little disappointed when it dials down into a thicker, slightly darker version of Gucci Guilty after 30mins, Still better than regular Guilty though. This scent is perfect for those who are not usually into dark or heavy scents (like Alien, Black Orchid, etc) but still want something 'sexy' for a night out. This is for the more demure, soft-spoken vixen. Also for lovers of lilac who want a more urban interpretation of lilac as opposed to the usual English garden variety. It makes a statement without screeching for attention. It's great for day-into-night wear as well, all year around, and versatile enough to be a signature. Sillage and longevity are both moderate, but good enough...just spray a little more if you want more oomph. Good stuff.

What a surprise! The bottle is massive, the perfume is called Guilty, this is intense version. I expected heavy scent similar to Dior Addict. Without trying edt version I ordered a sample of Intense version of Guilty. Unexpected happened. This is pleasant, light, delicate and soft scent of lilacs. Recently I have become fan of delicate perfumes so I really like this tender beauty. Very surprising scent. I think the name and the bottle are inapropriate to scent.
At first i liked it, than I ended up disliking it. Extremely synthetic. kinda nutty too.

I've got a free sample of this, and was about to pass it along (Gucci just strikes me as too mainstream). But then I've tried it... what a nice surprise! It doesn't smell mainstream to me - or floral. I get cozy, warm, sexy, comforting. This is not the girl who goes clubbing and hunting for a man. This is the more mentally mature woman who shares a glass of wine with her man in front of the fireplace.

This perfume never goes unnoticed. I get compliments every time i wear it. And i can tell, men are crazy about it. I would even say that this is the perfect scent to go on a date. Dangerously sexy. Who doesn't like Lilac anyway ? It smells so pretty.

I have the largest bottle of this, because I thought I really like it, but it's just "meh". It's rather too floral for me, perhaps. I do like some floral perfumes, but this one isn't a favorite. I'm wearing it today, and I seem to smell a lot of lilac? I know it's popular, and I sure wish I could like it more than I do.

The bottle is substantial, if a little tacky. It's always fingerprinted, and I'm having to wipe it to make it pretty again. This smells nearly identical to the original.
This is not my favorite. A bit too floral/musk perfumey for me. Not a bad scent, just not one I look to wear.

This is one of my favourites, it comes second to my signature. Light sweetness in a bottle with some nicely blended flowers in the background.

This is a floral scent, but it's not what you'd usually expect from a floral perfume. I've never been a fan of floral perfumes, mostly because a lot of them contain heavy white flowers or a rose note that dominates everything. No, this is definitely not your stereotypical flower powerhouse.

Guitly Intense isn't heavy or suffocating like most floral perfumes. It's rather fresh and 'sparkly' smelling, almost like a fruit champagne. I always get a whiff of honey whenever I put this on, even though it's not listed as a note. Delicious!
I don't find it especially sexy (I've owned sexier scents!), I just wear it because I like it. It's appropriate for daytime wear as well! Don't turn this beauty down simply because it is a popular clubbing perfume!

I receive compliments when wearing this, mostly from my friends whenever I hug them. Like I said earlier, this is no powerhouse with monster sillage. It's a bit light and I usually spray around 5 times so that other people can smell it on me as well. Longevity could be better, however the real problem with this scent is that it becomes a skin scent rather quickly. After about 4 to 5 hours it just becomes a skin scent that you can barely pick up anymore. It lasts longer on clothes so I just spray some on my scarf. I will definitely repurchase this when I run out!

One of the best examples of the modern school of perfumery, sweet, floral, fresh and pretty but not watered down, She's very girly twirly but smarter than you might think, she reads Foucault as well as Cosmo, all lilac and warm amber, she's complex, more interesting than you might give her credit for if you don't pay attention

Soft, sexy and utterly feminine...this scent goes with my body chemistry from the first spray! It's heady and rich enough for evening with a peppery spicy hit, but then settles into something creamy and delicious for either day or night. Truly I dislike over-blown floral fragrances. This is certainly not a flighty floral. But a much richer floral core compared to the GG EDT. Also the amber and patchouli are nicely done--I'm usually not a fan of patch--and really add to the creamy attractiveness of this scent. Okay, I love it but please if you like rich scents go for the Guilty Intense NOT the EDT. It's more expensive but worth it! My Fall/Winter go-to...

This is BEAUTIFUL. It smells opulent and sexy...and that's probably why so many people say it's a clubbing perfume...frankly, that's probably why it IS a clubbing perfume - because every girl who wears this knows she is going to be irresistibly seductive this evening.
P.S. There's absolutely nothing wrong with that. In fact, more power to the women who know how to live and how to love!

The original Guilty fades pretty quick on me, I don't know why. This one is much better in that way, but unfortunately this is NOT sexy, at least not on me. It's funny how many women thinks this is so sexy...my man said it smelled terrible - like insect spray or something like that. It gets better after awhile, but still...I will try both sometime, Guilty on one wrist and Intense on the other and see if the original is different in that regard.
I prefer Guilty Black.
I Love IT so much its strong its sexy rich and varmer than the original ,pink pepper lilac and patchouli very sensual composition

I rediscovered it, it is simply very pleasant, warm, addictive, too bad longevity isn't great..this is a beautiful, feminine, rounded scent, for fall, and winter...it is mostly floral, in a smooth velvety way.. Intense though it isn't really...
There is a masculine version by the way!! This is all woman!!

Hmm.. so this is "okay" .. this is what I think, is too generic almost, it doesn't scream gucci.. the notes looked like a beautiful combination however, meh, not a fan. I dont find it sexy or seductive, its just a perfume for a normal female on a normal day, doesn't scream look at me, or anything..

My sister in law wears the original version of this and it smells gorgeous on her. I would never consider even to test it, because it is such “her” perfume in my world. But i got a sample from a lovely swap and decided to test it anyway.
It opens with a lot of realistic lilacs. It would be lovely in a garden but is way too much for my taste in perfume. But it fades away in a couple of minutes.
Later this is a gorgeous musky floral scent, a bit too fruity and has too much patchouli for my liking.
I still think it is lovely just so not “me” for some reason.
Try if you like sweet musky floral fruitchouli scents.
Good longevity.

Clubbing perfume.

I like the packaging because I could dump it in my bag and not worry about breaking.

This perfume is extremely sweet smelling. It reminds me of the common perfumes that ladies in the club use, and would be masking sweat.

This is quite pricey, but it smells cheap. I was ok with it at first, until everyone else is using it.

There is also a cheaper perfume that smells exactly like this but I am not sure which.
(Topless dancers use this.)

When I spray this one on it puts me in the mindset of the club scene. I visualize myself with my girls at the bar or in vip wearing a bandage dress with 6 inch heels and smelling good with my Gucci guilty on. To me this is a very sexy scent. I get a warm, powdery, pink peppercorn scent out of this one. I will say that it is def a head turning, crowd pleasing type of scent and it smells fabulous. Be careful with how much you spray this one as well because it can be a beast! I think 3-4 sprays would be just right for a night out on the town with the girls or date night. This one may be too much for the office but it's def a fun fragrance for night wear.

ohh im soo lucky, just had a birthday and my hubby bought me this, is beautiful-its floral yet not at all old fashioned kind of flowers, more sweet-ish flowers with just a little bit of spicyness so its not heavy at all. Heavenly sexy sent that is sensual and creamy.If your blind buying as a gift i cant see how anyone would dislike it as its soo lovely- but just 1 thing- its not on me as long lasting as it may be on others-thats its only downfall-my partner said its totaly beautiful-really sexy perfume, i have never owned a very floral perfume b4 as i have sents like chanel coco , angel liquer and alien etc so strong sents are usually my thing, this does not project as much as those types of strong and heady perfumes but its totally beautiful and very summery and very easy to wear so an all round yummy sent u cant really go wrong with, but i do agree with those that say it should linger longer for the price ,could just be my skin sucking the life out of it :)
Bottle is stunning,well made,expensive,classy- feels good as you spritz this, i,m 42(shhhh lol) but it made me feel like im a sexy early 30,s and still have my mojo :)
I would deffo get this 4 myself when it runs out as it makes me feel sexy happy and warm- but in a soft sweet, way, rather than a showy kind of way if that makes any sense :) LOVE -LOVE- LOVE THIS FLORAL ORIENTAL !!

This is lovely and I didn't expect less of it. The original Guilty is somehow even better, but this one is also really good.
I like how it's deep, powdery and light at the same time.
Light lilac note, powdery violet, deep amber and spicy pepper. Amazingly brilliant composition!
I consider it seductive and elegant!
Great spicy scent. Not sweet at all on me. Lasts a long time too!

I had them all EDT, Diamond and intense. Right now I have intense just because when I put it on-I want to smell it. It is a long lasting and I think this perfume is the one! Not just sexy. Seductive! It is definitely for a romantic dinner. I wouldn't waste it for everybody to smell, I would save it for dinner with the one! Absolutely worth spraying on your hair if you wear it down. It is a very warm, flowery amber. After about 2 hours it is sweet and spicy. I'm sure that is how James Bond's Girl smell like. Seductive, feminine, empowering. The scent of a real lady! I'd say it is my signature scent for years. But only my man knows it.

فهذا العطر قريبب منهم
It's very different from gucci guilty. This one is all about spicy mandarin orange, I can smell nothing more in this.

Unfortunately, the longevity and sillage are very weak - I thought it was an issue with my skin, but now reading some comments I see it's a general problem of this product. It's really a shame, and the only reason I've never purchased it.

As for the scent, it's all creamy and soft sweetness, sexy and elegant, not at all intrusive, although it is intense in a gracious way (I think "suave" is the word haha). I'll keep praying for the gods of perfumery that Gucci reformulate Guilty Intense to something that lasts more than 30 minutes.

I must have smelled this perfume more than 20 times from people around me because as soon as I sprayed it on the test strip, oh how familiar this scent is! A very expensive, luxurious, and alluring kinda smell. Great for party, not very wearable as an everyday perfume.

Sprayed this on in a store. For being called "Intence", it really isn't. It's not a heavy perfume. It had a lot of amber on me, and ths increeeedible mix of soft, sweet notes - like soft cotton candy, a tiny bit of white berry chocolate, and warm freshness - hard to explain. It's a feminine, classic, but definitely not outdated smell. It does, in a way, remind me of today's candy smells, but this is done the correct way. Very long-lasting on clothes (it has been on my jacket arm for about 2 weeks since I sprayed this on my wrist, and I wear that jacket every day), but also lasts well on skin.

The way this smells on me is that it changes between giving me whiffs of flowers (lilac, for the most part) and pink pepper-amber-patchouli. Quite interesting! The latter 3 notes are the ones that remain on me for the longest time

You might not want to blind-buy it, but it's definitely worth smelling. The Gucci Guilty EDT and EDP didn't impress me - they are too sharp for my taste, while I like subtle fragrances.

I couldn't for the life of me get the Gucci Guilty eau de toilette to stick around on my skin for even a minute, but I loved it. Solution to my problem? This gorgeous eau de parfum intense! It is so sexy and now I can actually enjoy it. Something about that Gucci signature patchouli mixed with lilac and pink pepper that takes this scent to the top of the heap on the standard sexy level.

I've purchase My 2nd bottles of this.. It is a sweet but not overly sweet, fresh, warm scent that i adore.. I think it's suitable for a day wear or a formal evening.. I'm in love with this scent at the first spray :D and great staying power is a plus..

I really love this scent. The citrus in the opening is mild on my skin. The pink pepper, lilac is just simply Devine. Classy, sexy, feminine and warm. Not too sweet or powdery. Lovely and dreamy. I'm enchanted.

I'm continuously torn about Gucci Guilty Intense. On the one hand, I like it; it's a solid "spicy lilac" smell that's very unisex. On the other hand, I think it smells like a lot of other products on the market right now. That's not really GGI's fault--it may have even started the whole "PINK PEPPERCORN EV-UH-RAH-THANG!" trend that's going on now--but it's still a bit of a turn-off.

Guilty Intense starts off with a blast of pink peppercorn and citrus, firmly rooted in patchouli. After a few moments, the citrus fades away and the lilac becomes much more obvious. For about 6 hours, this perfume sits relatively close to my skin and smells like lilacs, pink peppercorns, and patchouli. The amber note provides a feeling of warmth, but is not particularly easy to single out.

While this fragrance is relatively linear, it does change a bit towards the end of its lifespan, taking on a slight powderiness that I think comes from the violets. However, I do not detect any heliotrope in this fragrance. For 90% of its lifespan, GGI is just the aforementioned lilac/peppercorn/patch combination on me.

This is not a bad fragrance by any means. It tends to be a crowd pleaser, it's easy to wear, and the level of projection is right up my alley. I do like it. But it's not a particularly unique smell, and I feel bored with it shortly after I apply it.

For reference, the main differences I notice between Gucci Guilty Intense and the original Guilty are that this fragrance is slightly more potent, and the pink peppercorn is more prominent in Intense. The original also seems more powdery than this one.

Love this perfume. It's definitely a going out, night type of scent. I only wear this when I'm going to a party/club. I feel like it fits that type of scene perfectly. I would not wear this during the day or just to run errands. I feel so sexy when I wear this and it definitely lasts! It's kind of intense you only need a few sprays and I usually pour perfume on me otherwise I feel like you can't smell it enough on me, but not with this one. I love the gold bottle too.
I have it and it makes me feel 'guilty' when everyone asked me 'what perfume are you wearing?' . It has a very charming scent and it good for special ocassion

My first encounter with this was in the perfume shop, on a testing strip. I ended up sniffing that strip the whole day. It just made me feel so happy. It was very crisp, sweet slightly spicy perfect for a sunny autumn day. I had no choice, I had to have it.
Now that I have it....I simply love it. It has a very crisp warmth to it, which I find very sexy. I do get a bit of spiciness which is fresh and not overpowering. It definitely is a fall/winter perfume.
It lasts on me quite good, 5-7 hours I would say.
I did try the EDT version but for me the EDP is more warm and crisp. If I had to describe it in one word it would be "crisp". It makes me feel very sharp and sexy whenever I wear it.
All in all a perfect fall perfume for every age group in my opinion.

nice but not last long
maybe depends on the body chemistry

Lilac...Oh how fresh, soft, girly, and innocent this little flower is...mix some pink pepper, amber and patchouli and you have a good girl gone bad! This is purple flower(mostly lilac) dominated and with the rest of the notes mixed makes this a cool sexy perfume. This is a sweet floral scent but not too sweet which keeps this from being childish. This is a fragrance for the once ugly duckings, plain janes, goodygood girls that fianlly grew up, decided a change and a makeover was needed, and now lusted after by everyone. Floral, a bit spicy, a bit warm, flirty, fun, young, and feminine.
This is much more ambery and warmer than the EDT version, and also this has a slight smokiness than I could not detect in the original. Overall, I'm liking this alot.

I was digging through a makeup bag, and found a sample of Gucci Guilty in one of the pockets. This is by no means my favorite kind of scent- I love patchouli, and this is the complete opposite. I smelled the clean soft note, and nothing else. I don't know if my chemistry is lacking cause of the lady flow, or if this one is just a bad apple.

I'll keep my review short and sweet;

I'm lost for words. It's just.. amazing! This is pure sexiness and class in a bottle. I adore wearing this. Absolutely gorgeous! Well done Gucci, this beats the eau de toilette version hands down.

Ambery floral goodness! This EdP may not totally fit into the sinful and kind of provocative concept suggested by the name and the ads, but there’s definitely something addictive and overly sensual about it which I couldn’t find in the - nonetheless pleasant - first version.

On me Guilty Intense feels vibrant and cozy since the opening, with the sparkling blend of red pepper and mandarin orange providing a juicy, kind of nectarous crispness: the spicy aspect is quite noticeable in this initial phase, more than in the previous Edt where the emphasis was instead put on the fruity tones of peach, although the peppery note manages to stay demure and gently tickling, adding a certain warmth to the briskness of citruses. The overall effect is sheer and smooth at the same time, like a bright summery sunset. Shortly after the floral heart appears: a seemingly undistinguishable bouquet of velvety flowers in which only lilac really stands out with its intensely sweet aroma, luscious and almost erotic in here, while delicate hints of heliotrope lead slowly to the ambery undertones from the base. From there on the composition seems to turn down the light and at the same time it acquires depth, getting a bit darker and more voluptuous without losing its radiant aura: the beautifully blended drydown, dominated by an honeyed mélange of amber and patchouli, melts so well with my skin to create the sensation of a luxurious body lotion applied after a bath.
I wouldn’t go so far describing this fragrance as having a “your skin but better” quality to it, because all in all this is a quite perfume-y scent if that makes any sense, but probably its self-proclaimed sexiness comes from that creamy aspect provided by the amber and lilac accord that, to me, recalls the scent of warm silky skin.

I feel like this is a fragrance I should have in my collection one day, being a lover of sweet/ambery florals: after testing many from this group I would say Guilty Intense falls into the category of those flororientals I would be able to wear on a daily basis thanks to its perfectly balanced sillage (not too subtle neither obtrusive in the least: just right) and the very good longevity (about 8 hours on my skin).
Having to choose only two words to describe this scent's personality I'd say it is equally polished and seductive: it doesn't try hard to be complex or at all costs unique, but in my book it is a must try for those looking for an easy to wear oriental that's both warm and luminous.
All in all, a beautiful and in my opinion underrated/overlooked fragrance (that's often the flankers destiny....).
A fragrance to drool for. Wear this you classy ladies. Gentlemen will love you for it.

Ironically, this perfume does make me feel guilty, but probably not for the reason you think.
A good friend of mine gifted me a mini gift set of gucci perfumes last year, and I didn't like anything, but tried oh so hard to convince myself I at least like this one. 9 months later after I have never worn it once despite "loving it", it's time to face the music. It's so hard to admit to yourself that you hate something someone you like so much has given you.
I rarely leave negative feedback for perfumes, because I truly believe just about anything can be loved my someone, so why bash? But I feel like my warning to other bubblegum haters should be carried out, JIC.
GGI just doesn't do it for me. It's confusing, I feel like if lilac just wasn't in here it would have been fine, because I like pink pepper, patchouli, and amber. However with that sweet watery flower though, it smells like peppery bubble gum to me. I hate bubble gum! It assaulted my nostrils all throughout work, and with my first held high I swore never again!
I could never stand the flavor, reminding me of that cloying fluoride paste from my dentist. I still remember how over joyed I was with my dentist got in other flavors (yay, spearmint!).
To those who like it, hope I didn't offend. If it's any consolidation it sure lasted a long time!

I adore this so much! I love lilacs and Gucci has created a rapsody dedicated to these gorgeous flowers! Stunning perfume, elegant and seductive. It's not a loud perfume that screams at you, trying to make itself noticed. It's soft and powdery, mysterious and delicate. Like a fine silk scarf wrapped around your neck.
Longevity is good: 8+ hours on me. Sillage is moderate.
You can wear it anytime: day, night, winter, summer.
Love this very sophisticated smelling but not old ladyish or boring it's defo a woman's scent I wear it on nights out it is an intense smell but not overpowering at all

I really really love this, I have been testing it for a few days and it smells great. I won't purchase though, because the sillage and lasting power on my skin is really poor. I can barely smell it after an hour. Bummer because the smell is so fab.

This is second Gucci that i have after Gucci edp. I had try the Guilty edt, but i think that is not enough for me so i blind buy this after i read nice review from fragrantica for this Guilty edp.
I find it sweet from the first spray. After a while, the sweetness is gone than lilac note blended well with pink pepper. I can smell warm patchouli and amber at the base. A simple, modern yet sophisticated. It is not overwhelming, I mean this is moderate sillage, long lasting enough, office safe, day and night fragrance, easy to wear in any occasion. Nice bottle too. I love this. So why don't you try this? :)
Pink pepper and lilac with a backdrop of Amber. I would not say intense, or really all that guilty. Not a sillage monster and you could wear this to work.
Beautiful! Longevity is amazing, it is still going strong after 6 hours. The strongest notes on me are the Amber, florals notes, and the pink pepper. I love it.

I wear on the night, perfect! So warm, sensuelle, and never get wrong with Gucci.
First i want to try the guilty first, and after my seller give me a little cheap price than guilty..

i gave it 8/10

who the heck said a dude could pull this off? I'm a dude and I tried this earlier today and I def smelt feminine!!! :(

however, it smells really good. If a tall, brunette, black coat wearing chick wore this, I would be falling for her right off the bat. mysterious, at the same time lovely scent

amazing perfume so beautiful for day and night and all day perfume i buy it for my wife she love it and i love when she wear it
try intense it's nice :)

I accidently sprayed this all over me at the mall the other day when I was headed out for an evening with friends. I didnt realize it was the women's intense version.

Yes, I am a man and I put 4 sprays of this on my body..


It is slightly floral, but mostly spicy and warm with notes of pink pepper, patchouli and amber.

To my surprise, heads were turning, compliments were flying, and everyone wanted to know which "spicy powdery fragrance I was wearing"

I never told anyone it was gucci guilty intense for a woman, but seriously..

A man could pull this fragrance off without anyone assuming it was "feminine" or "girly"

It is much better than the gucci guiltys for men

Ahh! This perfume is so sexy! It's like the little black dress of perfumes. When I smelled it in the bottle I wasn't a fan, but I tried it on and once it dried I loved it! My boyfriend liked it too. Perfect for special occasions and nights out.

Mixed bag for me..bought a gucci coffret of 5ml bottles, found flora to be super pretty and delicate but gucci guilty and gucci guilty intense both started off as straight harsh alcohol in the open before the scent developed on my skin..should love it according to the notes but GG seemed just mediocre with mild sillage and staying power..but like I said flora was quite delightful, go figure!

oh Gucci, its hit or miss with you saucy italians. this one is most definitely a HIT. guilty intense smells dark and gothic (pink pepper, amber) but still very alluring and sexy with its soft lilac drydown. its potent, possessing and seductive. wear this at night with something black and slinky and he will be yours the moment he catches your scent.

This perfume has such a glorious beginning, and such a yucky ending on my skin. It's a tragic movie.
It starts amazingly wonderfull, but after a while, transform into an old lady yucky cheap perfume. The regular Guilty on the other hand, smells amazing on me and I love it!
It's also rediculously expensive in my country. Really not worth it.
Isn't it fun finding a perfume you don't like? every time I find a perfume that I don't like I feel that I'm saving money lol!
Like this one. Sexy and can be sprayed liberally to make a bold statement

I had this perfume before and I think I still wanna buy it again. Every time I'm wearing this on a date or going out to the club , People keeps telling me you smell so good and asking me what perfume I use....Of course it's Gucci Guilty Intense for woman but I think this can't go wrong on men. For me I think this is a good Unisex perfume just like Gaultier 2. Only this one have a very sensual , sexiest , mysteries scene which will makes you seductive with the people you meet. I'm saving my bucks to go for this one again

Chance by Chanel is my signature scent, at home (my vanilla job) everyone can tell where I've been wearing this. My kids are always like. I'm also liking this Pink Sugar shit I bought at the sephora rack. It's a toilette, some light vanilla, citrus-y smell. Wears great too, throughout my whole day....but i fell in love with That Gucci guilty stuff....that lilac....oh god...so mysterious ans sexy...

Just bought this and wore it tonight. I'm a Dior girl through and through, so this is my first Gucci. I do like it, I think it's definitely different and sexy, and my boy went crazy over it. But it's not love yet. I wish it was a little sweeter, with more vanilla - more feminine. As it stands, it's almost a unisex scent. Sexy, but not as feminine sexy as I would like, if that makes sense. Still a great scent worth the hype. We'll see if it grows on me.

I just received my first sample of Gucci Guilty Intense --- OMG, I can't stop smelling myself. It's GORGEOUS!!!!!!!!! I have several new fragrances arriving this week, as I was always wearing Vera Wang Princess & G&B's Light Blue, but I'm ready to try something new as my signature scent. I'm thinking I've found my next signature scent in Gucci Guilty. I'm also receiving Viva La Juicy, La Vie est Belle by Lancome, & Flowerbomb in the mail in the next week --- so who knows, maybe I'll love one of those more, but it's going to be hard.

I can tell that it's going to be hard to figure out which one to invest in to become the ONE I wear daily. Gucci Guilthy Intense is soooooo awesome!!!! I love this perfume....now I can see why all the great reviews - it's sexy, which is exactly what I wanted. The only thing I'm unsure of is whether it has a strong enough smell, that was my problem with VW Princess. I only put a small amount of my Gucci on today since I'm not going anywhere, but I could smell it well, so I'm hoping others can too.

This was something very new for me to try I usually don't go for these smells but I have to admit I love this one!, the lilac and amber really stand out on me with the powdery almost musky type smell. It is a mysterious seductive perfume with plenty of depth in the dye down it just gets better and better sillage is excellent on me and so is longevity it lasts me all day or night. it Is a sophisticated sexy smell with a desire to want more in the dye down as it continues to evolve and wrap your senses in a sexy orgasmic mysterious heaven! You don't know whats coming next its wonderful!

Glamor in a bottle!!!

I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this perfume!!! Guilty Intense was a blind buy for me after reading all the great reviews all over the internet. I was initially put off by the price, but after smelling it I had no regrets.

The most prominent notes are pink pepper, lilac, amber and patchouli. If you like Black XS, Flower Bomb and Diesel Fuel for Life, YOU WILL LOVE Gucci Guilty Intense.

My skin type: oily / youthful
Office safe: no too strong
Potency: HEAVY (1 or 2 sprays is enough)
Projection: arm's length
Longetivity: 10 hrs+
Timing: Fall & Winter / Evenings
Packaging: 9/10; the front and back of the bottle is gold, the side pannels are clear so you can see how much perfume is left
Price: $69 for 75ml / 2.5 oz at Winners / TJMaxx

Will I Repurchase: YES

Disclaimer: my experience may be different from your experience based on my skin type, my chemistry, the season, and my personal tastes
I feel so relaxed and just myself when I wear Gucci Guilty intense. It smells floral powdery fresh. I just love it. I wear it everyday and never grow tired of it.

It's intense allright! But what it dries down to is actually very alluring and soft...floral. Its one of those things that I would spray on my clothes and then wait about 10 minutes to get dressed. The dry down to me, is worth waiting for. I just dont like the name. I dont want to be guilty.

Gucci Guilty and Guilty Intense are pretty nice fragrances, more sophisticated than let's say Premiere which is utterly generic, it's not even funny.
Guilty is young, sensual and invigorating but also elegant and even sophisticated. A wonderful lilac- based fragrance.
The problem with it is the lasting power -- it just doesn't last on me, even this so called 'Intense' version. 2 hours and i can't even smell it. I expected a bit more from Gucci.

This is a really warm, powdery fragance. I love it. It sets close to my skin. But I think that the name gucci guilty eau intense isn't completely right. The fragance is really nice but it is nothing very intense, it's merely subtle. The lasting power is ok! A nice fragrance and very suitable for different occasions.

I liked Gucci Guilty Intense, but would only wear it for specific situations. It is a very light sillage perfume with very little longevity. Due to it's lightness I would recommend this before a bedtime seduction. It would also be good for a dinner out when you don't want your fragrance to interfere with your food. I found:

Within the first five minutes:
- Lilac, which I find made me feel pretty more than sexy
- Pepper notes that were uplifting and balance the lilac
- I noticed the violet, but cannot detect the mandarin

The perfume evolves quickly:
- Lilac remains and amber note increases
- Pepper dies down quite a bit after a half hour

6/10 rating
*1/10 headache factor - this does not give me a headache.

filmoyster.wordpress.com
The smell of letting yourself be yourself. Love it.

The first half hour of this spray is a kind of bitter yet soapy smell that I didn't paticularly care for.
After the half hour, the bitter smell goes away, and this turns into a warm, spicy smell.
I can smell the pepper and what I think is lilac.
As soon as the patchouli starts to blossom, this fragrance becomes much prettier. My boyfriend, who didn't like the initial notes, told me that the smell kept getting better and better.
That is until it went away. I sprayed this on around 6 p.m, and it is now 9:30 p.m. I have to put my nose right up to my wrist and sniff hard to find it.
3 and 1/2 hours? Seriously?
If this fragrance had some longevity, it might have been tempting, but I have cheapo body lotion that lasts longer than this fragrance!

It does indeed smell like that kind of old-fashioned make up that's not around anymore. A pleasant, sweet and powdery smell. To be honest, I thought Guilty would be something different - the EDT did nothing for me, I could barely smell it and thought there was nothing guilty about it, but I like this one a lot better.

On my skin it's pepper, amber, violet and lilac. Patchouli keeps it earthy and grounded, which is nice. This could have easily soured down to a bitter pepper-patchouli combination but it's sweet and well-balanced, I must say. It's almost syrupy and the lasting power (especially on hair- try it out) is really great.
very atractive perfume , you can wear it ,you must wear it , you have to wear it :)

I was disappointed with this fragrance, it was all hyped you and i was so looking forward to buying it, it smelt lovely on the sample paper it still does smell lovely on my skin, the only problem is it really doesnt last long on me maybe an hour tops which is a shame as its nice but so weak! :(
Disappointed, everyone raved about it, i smelt it, and nothing hit me, just a normal pleasent fragrance, :(
Aroma picante, sedutor e ao mesmo tempo sofisticado,inspira sensualidade. Para momento romantismo =)

My HG fragrance for over a year now, and I have tried every fragrance under the moon. On me, it is a very sexy, follow me around store, fragrance that I adore myself. Cannot get enough of it and spray on pillows for heavenly sleep. Smell my wrists daily when I need "pick me up." The soft sexiness has never been mastered until Gucci came along with this unforgettable fragrance from office to bedroom. I will wear forever.

I tried a sample of this and love it. For whatever reason it makes me think of Le Feu d'Issey, which I wore in the late 90s. Maybe it's the pepper? The two have something in common that I love, not sure what.
So very sexy. This smell turns heads everytime!
I adore Guilty Gucci Intense. Lasts a really long time. It really goes with my skin.

Something about this one smells really artificial and fume-y to me - there must be a substantial amount of white musk in this, because I'm getting that telltale, airy headache-inducing cloud from something that's not listed in the notes. I'm also getting a bit of a peach accord that I have to admit goes really well with the lilac and fruity spice of the pink pepper. As for amber... what amber? Maybe somewhere in a supporting role, but the base is all about the tamed plastic patchouli holding it all together.

The problem I have with this one is the same problem I have with Midnight Poison. It's a pleasant fragrance, even if a little heavy on the musk cloud (why is that note not listed on here?). But in isolation, this scent does not impress me at all - sillage is barely there, with "poof and it's gone" longevity", and while it's a pretty scent, it's nowhere near the sex-bomb that's advertised. Heck, if used on pulse points I'd use this on a spring or summer day for work - to me this is that non-sexual and nondescript. Take away the gold flacon and the sexy advertising (I do have to admit the ad is stunning), and Guilty Intense's overall impression scent-wise is more in the vein of Love Chloe's powdery pastel florals and musk: something nice to feel feminine and put together everyday, but forgettable. But at least Chloe EDP and Love Chloe have an aura of class and posh cleanliness about them. They smell like money spent on expensive toiletries, or like the French soaps in a five-star hotel. Guilty Intense doesn't even have that class level going for it. Between the gold plastic flacon and the forgettable drugstore scent, this is not worth paying full designer retail. No-go for me.

I heard so many good things about the edt so I decided to try it, i did not like it one bit! A week later I bumped into this beauty and thought i'll give it a go and see if it's anything like the edt.. to my suprise I loved it and bought it instantly! It's a very erotic, sexy, sensual very feminine and it has an extravagant feel to it... LOVE IT!

at first it smelled like wet grass to me, so i got the burberry body and as soon as i stepped outside the shop, i smelled my hand again .......i brought the box, and paid for it in 30 seconds !!

for its price, it's kind of expensive but it's gucci right ?? :D

i wouldv really regret if i didn't buy this one....

the only think i don't like about it is that it's gone after 2 hours.... i wanted it to last longer

I don't know why at first I don't like it.
after sprayed, I fall in love.
very long lasting. It smell a little bit older than my age.

I don't know whether an intense version of this fragrance was entirely necessary. To be fair, the original Guilty was fairly short-lived, and while Guilty Intense is an improvement in terms of projection and longevity, it leaves much to be desired.

Gucci Guilty Intense is a pleasant fragrance, easy to wear and a sure crowd-pleaser. It shows a somewhat interesting contrast between peppery florals and earthy patchouli.

Since this fragrance has been 'amped up' to an EDP, what was considered pleasant in the original fragrance, now smells sharp and at times, a little screechy. The pink pepper accord is unfortunately overwhelmingly strong on my skin, smothering the feminine lilac and heliotrope blend.

I personally like to wear scents that make me stand out from the crowd and feel exceptional. Once again, (similar to my reaction to the original Guilty), this flanker comes across as bland and overrated. The high price tag leads you to expect so much more.

Gucci Guilty Intense is much warmer and more elegant than its predecessor, making it a good choice for Autumn and Winter. Fans of the original fragrance that had issues with its lasting strength, will most likely enjoy this intense EDP flanker.

Overall I find this composition stronger and more floral than the EDT, due to the intensified lilac note. Also the patchouli seems more dominant in the base, which is my favorite part since I love patchouli. While the EDP and EDT are definitely related, they have different personalities, and so I would choose one over the other based on mood or weather. I think the EDP smells more mature, has better longevity and more defined phases, but I love the sweetness and balance of notes in the EDT, especially in summer.
LOVE.

I SHOULDN`T like this, because of the patchouli, but I do.
It smells like "Yves Rocher Comme Une Evidence", which also has patchouli. And these two are the only patch perfumes I can stand.
The patchouli in those two scents smells very musky, maybe that`s why I can handle it?

It`s a very dark and erotic perfume in my opinion. I can smell flowers and citrus in the EDT, but not so much in this EDP, thankfully. It`s deeper, and more "guilty". :-P

Ambery, musky, warm, sexy, confident, womanly... Great sillage and longevity when sprayed on clothes.

Ok well, I purchased this one recently and have to hide it from my twenty year old daughter. It became her go-to scent when she has to party!!!! I cannot say that I've worn it one day yet, but I will before she wears it all...........hmmmmm just spayed it and its a wow-zer!!! It bangs!!!! some serious stuff here!!!

Tested this one yesterday, I would not say that this is an oriental-floral fragrance, but a floral-fruity to my nose. At first I smelled juicy pear, but I guess it was the mandarin, a bit weird. It is a bit spicy maybe from the pink pepper, but overall a nice floral-fruity fragrance which is a quite familiar to me. I don't want to say that this is ordinary or cheap but sometimes I do feel that.
like it ..
Always wanted this one. Now I got it and I feel like a million dollars - definitely not Guilty!!! It wears well on me during the day and does not require any 'touch ups".

This baby has attitude and bite!, very sexy scent, very clean and crisp yet the sweetness is all spiced up to a more mature alluring quality. It is all about the pink pepper in this, I think i have a weakness for pink pepper to be honest. This one is not for the shy and retiring but the only flaw is the lasting power :( surprising for the strength of this perfume (and the price!) It is a gorgeous smell that lasts maybe 2 hours. I would say this is for the summer months also as it is very fresh and I couldn't see it lasting more than an hour in colder months unfortunately.
It smells like Dr. Pepper.... mmmmm :)
Perfume so beautiful
I love that perfume and there are no words to describe how amazing it is.

The juice is concentrated and deeper than the original one ..

Both are too similar ,,but this version has more stages & levels till reaching the heart of the perfume..I smell more intensive Oranges & violets here.

Juicy, charming & flirty scent.

On my skin thee lasting power of the EDT was so good ,, and this EDP is sticking on my skin even if I washed it.

I think this EDP is to be used in winter, because of its heaviness.

I have 2 bottles now of Gucci Guilty EDT which is one of my top 10 perfumes, and diffidently I will purchase this one later when I finish both of my bottles.

I love it!I love it!I love it!I love it!I love it!
my signature parfum of all time!
the only parfum I'll ever wanted! Thank you Gucci!!!!!

I actually have both versions of Gucci Guilty fragrances. They smell amazing, BUT again- the lasting power is very very weak. It could have been my signature scent, if only this could have lasts longer than 1 hour.

Guilty is a favourite of mine, but it has weak lasting power. Therefore I think Intense would be a better choice. If I repurchase Guilty, it shall be the Intense version.

Scentwise, I don't detect much of a difference between the two versions.

It has better lasting power (the original cca 2 hours, this one about 6), sillage is weak on both, but to be honest, those fruits were a reason i liked Guilty, in Intense i don`t get them so much. Other than that, it smells identical to me, Intense`s drydown smells a bit cheap, like random Escada.
Those flacons are amazing though!
Spicy,soft,sweet,sensual. Yummy peppery amber dry down. Great stuff.
i have this perfume and i love it so much

I would say I got the sample one week ago and I was expecting a bit more out of this because of the branding of this perfume.....I didn't felt the guilt side of it but the perfume for sure has a very different appeal to it...it is mature but at the same time not overpowering. ...it has deeper violets and that's why it stays and didn't let you forget it. It surely special occasions perfume
very very sexy! Have it, Love it <3

The original, tedious 'guilty' overlaid with fake caramel instead of chemical cleanliness. Not absolutely dreadful, but pretty dreadful for the price. Bravo marketing dept. at Gucci! A triumph of appearance over substance.

Finally the edp! I own and love the edt but was tired of having to tote it around with me and reapply because it would disappears.

Alas, with the edp you get more of the peach and citrus and less flower on my skin. The spillage is poorer than the ept but the longevity is doubled. Which on me means 4 hours. I think I'll have to wear them together.

The edp you want all over your skin and the edt you want on your clothes or to use in warmer months.

The edp is still sparkling, fresh, honeyed with a great patchouli dry down.
I think this smells exactly the same as gucci gucci. So i now have both! just different bottles lol
I was right. I tried it and I prefer still EdT. its too heavy.

I had wanted to test this but hadn't seen it lately. Yesterday my husband surprised me with a bottle. He seems to find things that I look for and don't see but he finds them.

I like this I think it is classy and a bit stronger thank goodness. I have been waiting for the designers to return to the stronger perfumes because there are heaps out there for the people who like linear scents which is fine but others like me who like strong perfumes haven't had much choice from the mainstream of late.

This doesn't last very long on me. I have to respray every 2 hrs or so. I am not sure on a really cold day if it lasts longer or on a really hot day. The weather here is middle of the road so it is hard to tell at the moment.

If you like Estee Lauder Sensuous or Kate Moss Velvet Hour, Deseo by JLo, Britney's Believe, Provocative Women by Elizabeth Arden, Infiniment by Choppard etc you should try this but only if you can afford it because it is mega expensive and doesn't really last and is not as strong as it could be really.

It is strong but not offensive and polarising like Angel or Red Door etc you could wear this to the office because it has a smooth warm drydown slightly sweet. I don't get any headache from it and my husband could only smell it a little bit.

It is slightly spicey and warm so not sharp or prickly and no where near as strong as Bella D Opium by YSL. If you wear those sort of perfumes it is a great middle of the road one to choose as it has little elements of all of those perfumes. It could be worn on a hot day without being too cloying as long as you don't spray too much.

I think this one needs the body lotion with it to really smell it all day but appart from that it is very nice and worth a try if nothing else.

Is it just me or are perfume designers trying to ease the mass market back into stronger perfumes? That for me is a good thing as I am craving something strong but original with lasting power and is available. I know I should stick to niche perfumes if I am after that but sometimes you just want to know you can find something when you like it. I don't have a lot of time to go hunting for things and I have to say most places seem to carry the same old range of perfumes some of the niche ones on here I have to go to David Jones to smell them.

I have noticed quite a few popular designers are introducing "Intense" versions of their previous editions which don't last and are difficult to smell apart from others on the market.

I hope the strong perfumes make a comeback as there really are enough office safe perfumes to chose from.

By the sounds of the reviews here this one is one to try. As usual no where around me sells it and doesn't know when they will be getting it. Sighs.. oh well I am sure I can wait. :(
This is a bit stronger than the original, but all in all it's still the same. For me it's too sweet vanillary and I see this on young girls. Still the staying power is not good.
First reaction was, 'wow'! It has a great punch when you first put it on. Dries down softer and more oriental...but still oh so nice. Much nicer and more staying power than the original.
Got it as a gift and can't wait to wash it off...smells like something from a nursing home side drawer
much,much better than the first version.

I surprised myself by buying some of this stuff. Most of my fragrances are strong chypre or patchouli-based things. But let's face it, we don't need to blow the doors off every single day. This is a fruity-musk that for whatever reason I found a little more appealing than most out there. The patchouli is just a hint, barely there. The dominant note for me is peach.

I have to say the whole "Intense" thing is fairly insulting to the consumer. It feels kind of like "What ho, Biff, are you telling me now we have to put perfume in our perfume? This Occupy Wall Street thing is out of control boys." The composition is highly unoriginal, fruitiness, clean musks and patchouli. But, it smells good, I bought it.

So apparently due to my girlfriend complaining I haven't brought her anything for a long time, I decided I'll buy her a perfume because I wanted to get a cologne too hehehe.

So I came across this product on the male section side, not knowing this is actually a female version of the intense and I brought it!

To be honest this smell better than the male version and I actually thought this was made for males because my girlfriends perfume normally smell so sweet compared to this one. Even my girl thought it was for males and she liked it and told me to buy it -.-"

I have a question down below if someone could answer it.

Not really a fun of this poduct. I think That Gucci by Gucci was far better in terms of looks and luxury execution. This bottle is plasticky And Not That sophisticated. i think though that the intense version of the fragrance Is nice, voluptuous and feminine. A nice creation.
Quite powdery and sweet, it reminds me of cologne and smells a little old-fashioned on my skin, not interesting enough.

This is definitely intense! It last a long time in my skin and that is a miracle because most scent just fade on me with the exception of a few. This is very similar to the original although this version is more oriental more deep smells like violets and mandarin it's kind of refreshing. But I have to confess that it was not love at first sniff. I'm still getting used to this scent. This would be great for day time and for going out. I have only wore it two times and the first time I most have oversprayed, because my sister told me she didn't like the perfume I was wearing. I can see that if one sprays more than two times it can be overpowering and nauseating. I was wearing it today and my mom commented on how good I smelled. From now on I will only spray two times maximum. You have to be really careful where you buy this one a lot of fakes out there!
Starts of as a very heady floral but dries down to a beautiful smooth spicy oriental. More intense the the edt for sure. Lasting power is much better then original edt

I've been wearing the Guilty, and it is a pleasant oriental, but just not enough presence and definitely not long lasting. From reading the reviews here it sounds like Gucci may have 'fixed' it by intensifying some notes and sublimating others. Will definitely give it a try next time I'm in a department store. Gucci Accenti has been one of my favorite fragrances for a long time. Love Gucci, Armani and Dior.
it has quite a lasting power and a unique warm and at the same time intense aroma.i liked a lot more than the original one.

I ADORE it, I LOVE it, but....what about staying power??????? it i sreally reallu really bad....about an hour and thats't :( but it is so beatiful...Actually regular Guilty is more intense in longevility unfortunately.

Gucci Guilty never managed to catch my interest so I have not even made an effort to try to get a perfume sample. I don´t really know why. When I bought a hair care product a few days ago I got a perfume sample of Guilty Intense and I am totally hooked. Must purchase a full bottle of this wonderful fragrance. It´s so delicious.
this perfume smells delicious, the floral smell lasted all day , and I get compliments every time I wear it.

I have to admit I did enjoy this lovely scent. The only downside was that it only stayed on my skin for 15-20 minutes. I feltlike I purchased an expensive body spray. I couldn't believe it! I was so dissapointed! Isn't it supposed to be very strong or intense version of Guilty? Perhaps it was my chemistry. Regardless,I had to return it and bought something with more longevity.

The other day, I went to the salesperson and told her, that I was bored and would she be kind and give me some scent-samples. She gave me this.
It has a plain plastic stopper and I was afraid I was going to spill it all over me. Well, my fingers got wet and I managed to get some of it on my wrists. Ok, what was it like?

This is pure sex! That is what came first to my mind.
Hot , steamy and erotic. Lush and juicy at first, deepens to a very sexy, musky ending. Long lasting on my skin.
Well, of course I had to phone my friend about it. We had a great time figuring out different occasions to use Guilty intense.
She had a better word for Guilty intense, with a twinkle in her eye: Po*n-scent. She told me she was going to put some on when going to bed, next to her husband. See what happens..? Does he even notice ..?

Anyhow, I WILL purchase this when possible.

I love this as much as I love the original! The only thing I miss is the lilac from the original Guilty. There is much less of that note in the intense version. The staying power is MUCH better in this version as well. Although it has better staying power I would say that this scent can be used at anytime, day or night (IMO). It has soft, fresh and then warm notes upon drydown. This and the original are my signature scents.

A smell similar to it's homme brother, so similar it could be a twin

10 mins - 1.5 hours - Some projectio, little bit of sticky orange

1.5 hours -4 hours - little or occassional projection, nice scent on drydown, though same as many other

Not for me, sorry, forgettable
