Срахотна прилика със Still Jennifer Lopez, абсолйтно непредубедено и ярко впечатление. Всъщност парфюмът на Дженифър Лопез е създаден по-рано

Definitely not unisex, this fragrance screams feminine in all its glory!
A rose is a rose, and boys, this is a Queen rose - not a King.
Pure, enchanting sophistication, the hint of dusty Patchouli perfectly balanced on soft, juicy, pinky petals. No pepper, but a veil of musk to envelope in such suave, angelic embrace. It murmurs of that nonchalant sassiness typical of women who are confident about their place in the world and consequently have grown unafraid of their sexual appeal, a charm aquired with each experience.
I don't see a man pulling this off, or a girl. This is an emotionally mature, happy woman in my mind. Smiling to herself, she slowly walks downtown, content and carefree, unaware of others' attention. For she's an indomitable spirit, and time can't change that.
It's a rose, a Queen among Ladies, and she doesn't care.

I haven't tried this one, but I found the Dorall Collection dupe, Enshrine Black, selling for next to nothing so I grabbed it. I get no more than a tiny amount of something vetiver-ish, but the rest seems consisent with the reviews for Flora 1966. Both treemoss and oakmoss are listed as ingredients, if that matters.

I got this with Singapore airline flybuy points and wow! What a great buy. I live in Perth, the Great Perfume Desert. I am an avid collector of rare perfumes so this was such a happy find. It is a wonderful deep rose, with no hint of old lady or nasty baby powder. Just deep, bewitching and passionate. Neither is it sickly or fruity. My pet hate is fruitchouli perfumes that have cheap, sweet ingredients that are the mainstay of the mass perfume market. No, this perfume is quite different. She is an elegant, intriguing and restrained beauty that captivates with subtle magnetism due to the synergy between the patchouly, rose and musk which is grounded by the vetiver. Make no mistake, this is nothing like the other Flora perfumes by Gucci. I am not generally a fan of Gucci (for the reasons explained above) but rarely they produce magnificent perfumes (Gucci Eau de Parfum now sadly discontinued). Flora 1966 is one.

This morning i was spraying gucci flora1966 for 8 sprays till now after 3hrs. I think its to weak for EDP can be just EDC.

Smell is good for Unisex but weak.

This review is about the new version of Flora, I'm not familiar with the original one.
Gucci fragrances don't agree with me. Not in a clinical "I'm allergic" way, rather a personal disagreement. The G frags I've had were generic, relying on the brand name rather than quality or originality. Not badly made, just nothing special.
Flora is a good example of a cool floral perfume that resembles other cool florals. There's a similarity to a wildflower scented organic laundry detergent I sometimes use, and Flora does have a soapy note.
This is a modern scent, wearable and work safe, unlikely to offend anyone with its average sillage and lasting power. Wearable and work safe is fine, but I expect more from a prestige brand like Gucci.

I feel people are sleeping on the perfume.
It's the sophisticated version of Flora.

Rich. Musky. Patchouli. Floral. & Sweet scent.

Very unisex and iconic.

A timeless perfume that you'd buy several times over the course of life.

Update: May 2019 I'm on my second bottle :)

I rarely salute a perfume.
I rarely bow to one either.....
And I rarely rarely lift my hat ( if I were a male) for a fragrance.

I thought it was spicy , sour oud that caressed my neck.
Only to discover that it's a stubborn red rose spiced up by this bourbon pepper.

The vetiver compliments this fragrance as a classy and beautiful olfactory experience.
On my skin it has nothing to do with aldehydes or 'old woman' scent.
If you like Oud, though not listed , and/or a mysterious rose , please don't miss this.
I dont want to smell like everyone else. Everyone here wears La vie est belle....... men,women,AND kids.

I wanna smell like Flora, a fragrance that says ' Don't f*^% with me'!


It's def 1966, and its def Grace Kelly.

I'm in love and its on my wish list.
Very nice. I opt to layer this with Dolly Girl by Anna Sui to give it more complexity.

I bought this perfume as I liked its smell, unique, not sweet, and sophisticated.

To my surprise, no one can smell it on me!! Including me !!!

So, for the price tag, I would definitely not recommend buying it.
It is like a skin scent, too soft to be recognized and appreciated.



Edit :
Yesterday I bought Zara Fleur de patchouli. It is very similar to Gucci flora 1966! Almost identical.
I hope it’s more long lasting , but again , for the price tag I can’t complain ;)

If you want something similar to Gucci 1966 try Yves Rocher Quelques Notes d'Amor. To my nose they are quite similar and they share mostly same notes. Not to mention that YR is readily available and costs a fraction of the price of Gucci.

A very classy smell. It is at the same time soft, sofisticated and complex. Not overpowering at all and the roses are really very pleasant considering I am not a rose fan.
On me it fades away after 4-5 hours but I still love it...
The bottle and the beautiful bag are an excellent match with the fragrance.

Wow! This is really very good juice. I got this based on reviews and the fact I was born in 1966 - I know how silly that sounds, but I had to have it.

I am wearing it at the moment and it's very spicy, it's a sweet/sharp chypre with a dusty rose base and it smells wonderful. It is like finding a massive bunch of flowers, dewy and redolant with scent in a dusty library. Woody, spicy, floral, dusty, deep,and deliciously divine!

If I had to compare it, it is like a mixture of Grossmith's Amelia and Roja Dove's Reckless - a complete love child of the two and clearly made from very fine ingredients. This is - to my nose - really rather special.

(Review based off of a Decant)

This was a surprisingly difficult scent to locate (Thank you, swap boards!!), I've been wanting to test it out for SO long. I have yet to find a Gucci fragrance that does anything for me, so I was excited to give this one a go. I don't think it's worth the 200$ price tag to me, personally, but I digress.

Gucci 1966 is a really soft fragrance, very airy and elegant - No defining characteristics: No main sharp notes, no powder, no sugar & no synthetic chemical feel! It also has no relation to the "current" Gucci Flora & flankers, which contain all or most of the aforementioned accords all at once.

In the opening, I was met with a strong citrus feeling - pure bergamot, and a vodka-lime-martini-somethin'-or-other. It fades into a gentle peony/pepper combo, but only after a wierd liquorice note slightly reminiscent of Lolita Lempicka. The rose in this juice is non-existent, and so is the rest of the note pyramid! The drydown is mildly sweet, vaguely floral, and overall nondescript - Something along the lines of scented pre-packaged moist towelettes, on my skin! Wear time lasts about 1-2 hours for me.

I seem to be the only one here with this experience, so I'm going to go ahead & blame my skin chemistry!

this is so delightful. some of the the notes sounded heavy however the overall small is soft and beautifully intriguing. pepper and musk do not usually work on me however they do not dominate. the balance is perfect. 1966 says sophisticated lady. just lovely
Zara jasmin musc is my favourite,and very cheap price.Gucci and jasmin musc is same,both are they patchouli explosion:)

This is gorgeous. The bottle, the aroma, the packaging. It's completely gorgeous. It has roses & fresh spicy at the main accords refers to the above mention. But this scent smells like patchouli or maybe betel leaf at first 15 minutes. And it will settled and well-balanced until the end of the day, even get more sweet. The aroma of it's roses quite sexy. It's last all day. I think this 1966 quite good for evening. Almost forgot to say, this perfume a bit classic, everytime i wear it, feels like I'm in my late gramdmother's room, been chat sleep with her. I really missed her. BTW this perfume was very nice.

I was surprise by this 1966, though it would be just a fancy version of Floral. The SA was so kind to let me had some free spray.

I can tell you this is a real deal. With current perfume market, bombarding us customers with cheap, synthetic perfumes, 1966 is a Real Perfume with Real Aroma Oil.

At first, I though this was a white floral like tuberose or jasmine, but the alcohol fade away, it leave me a woody smell. It's the smell of Immortelle Flowers found as important ingredient in Amouage Interlude. The flowers give you that kind of oud, woody, dry grass smell.

Ok, this perfume is the very very mind version of Interlude, it's not a silage monster that kills everyone on your way. A perfume that fits such elegant, classy lady like the great beauty, Grace Kelly.

So people, don't be scared by the price tag, this one, you pay what you get.

I hope Gucci will keep on producing this treasure.

So I went crazy reading reviews by everyone today, so I had to go to the Gucci store and try this myself!

I've been using Flora since it came out and I love it! This one struck me as very woody and spicy, almost like a men's perfume. Then it becomes very floral and almost sweet, but musky.

It cost me $280 (in Vancouver including tax) but I feel like I will be able to wear this perfume to special occasions, even when I become older. It's definitely worth the investment!

Bottle and Package is very gorgeous.
But not distinctive scent even that high price.
I'd rather buy another 'niche' perfumes.

I was at the Gucci store on 5th Ave. today and I noticed this beautiful ad campaign at the store for this fragrance. The sexy black bottle, the beautiful flowers against a black silk background....I had to see what this fragrance was about. I tested on my hand and I walked out. I immediately noticed the floral aspect, but it was mixed with musky, patchouly notes. I waited to see how it would dry down.

I go into Henri Bendel and I was asked by several people what was that I was wearing because it smelled so wonderful. They described it as floral with a tad of sweetness to it, mixed with an earthy note.

I then went into Saks, thinking that they were carrying this scent, but they did not. Someone thought it was a Tom Ford scent, but I said no.

By that time, I had to go back to Gucci with the hopes that it was still open, to buy this fragrance. I was in luck! I bought it and I am so happy.

The packaging is so wonderful. I got the impression that Gucci was trying to "copy" Tom Ford with this scent and the packaging. Tom Ford does not have scents packaged in a black silk floral pouch (if Gucci has a blouse with this pattern....I will buy it)...but the box, the look and the combination of the notes, reminds me of something Tom Ford would have created.

I love the musk and patchouly notes that mix with the floral notes. Instead of a bright spring floral, the earthiness breaks it up and makes it so wonderful. In this HUMID weather in NYC, it really made me feel earthy and sexy. I felt like no knew of this treasure, but they wanted to know...I was asked by several people (men and women).

Enjoy and love this fragrance...be forewarned...people will seek you out.

I am excited over my purchase and I hope you will enjoy it as well.
I need this. Really.
Unfortunately, this one is a copy of Lancome Hypnose Senses. The best out of Flora collection nevertheless.

This is a beautiful EdP, like walking into a florist in the middle of heatwave, the drydown is a touch too ladylike for me but still intriguing. Happily, although rose is present as promised I don't get a huge walking rose bush (which I'd get sick of) it's certainly more complex, layer after layer, and rich, very rich. A floral for women and not for girls.

A bonus, the gorgeous packaging and with its own little Flora pouch, altogether will make it a wonderful present for someone.

Please Gucci, stay up market, and forget all those celeb-endorsed monstrosities formulated for 12 year olds

I had a chance to smell this in Italy the second it was created. "I was at the right place at the right time you could say"

One word.

Award Winner

Beautiful perfume! Chanel Cristalle with the rose, is what I smell here. It is like Chanel Cristalle and Versace Donna Versus had a child and named it Rose becaus she reminded them of her cousin Fredric Malle Portrait of a lady. Yes, for me this one is like a combination of those three iconic perfumes.Very unique. I do not gett any animalic notes her. Mainly rose,deep rose and chamomile on the patchouli-moss base. Yes,I smell mosse in here,like in Cristalle.
I love it! Very potent and long lasting perfume,perfectly blended.

A vintage bossy rose-patchouli dame with an animalic touch. She's absolutely gorgeous.
It's about time I got my curiosity for L'Arte over with. I'm relieved I only got a mini - not because there's anything wrong with the fragrance, but it would have been redundant for me to have this since I already have Fendi (1985), which I like for a dark, mean vintage rose. The rose is more forward in L'Arte, though, and has a sweetness to it.
There are quite a few fragrances like L'Arte from that period of 80's to early 90's, but if you're lusting after this one, be sure you're ready for a heady rose wearing all black, with high cheekbones and a beckoning glare.
Really a phenomenal dark rose I'd opt for during winter.

I have a full 3.4ml bottle of L'Arte di Gucci purchased in early 90's and sprayed only few times. I always found it very strong and unable to wear it. It has been in a time capsule in my closet and in perfect condition. I did not realize it is such a rarity and sought by many perfume connisours and expensove. I do not want to hold on to it - any suggestions what to do with it and its worth?

Wearing L'Arte today and boyfriend goes "Wow, you smell good". I agree. L'Arte is addictive and it doesn’t really remind me of anything else. Or it does, but it isn’t a fragrance. It reminds me of William Blake's “Songs of Innocence and Experience”. In L’Arte there is the same inherent duality. It's soul searching, yet takes no prisoners. Good and bad, young and old, guiltless and wise. It’s silky smooth, yet bold and has this incredibly textured feel to it. You can feel it and nearly taste it as well, when smelling it. It's almost edible. Elegant and poised, but warm at the same time. The rose in this gem is outrageously beautiful too and I hardly ever think so, since I find most roses to be a drag in perfumes. It’s a very dark, earthy rose. Not really gothic, but as the name suggests a piece of art from the asymmetri of the bottle to the nerve encapsulated in the scent itself. It's the juxtaposition of the chypre structure and the rose that casts a spell of some sort and L'Arte is indeed perfumed art in its purest form. L’Arte de Rose Absolu.

I have a bottle of the original - don't really know if it's been reformulated, but it wouldn't surprise me - Gorgeous, sumptuous scent that never fails to get people to follow me and ask me what I'm wearing. Use it only for very special occasions.

The Italian-style rose, the advancement of Gucci No.3, is the prototype of today's Niche rose fragrance. Outstanding descendants such as Frederic Une Rose, Portrait of a Lady... and so on, all have part of the gene of L'Arte di Gucci.
In fact, the fiasco of L'Arte di Gucci is not without a trace. Obviously, people at the time no longer valued fragrance, no longer appreciated the complex beauty of the old days, and instead pursued new fragrances that were simple and light.
L'Arte di Gucci smells to me, it's a bright, sweet and rich floral and fruity fragrance, more ripe and round than No.3.
I totally agree with a netizen comment.
In the morning, you can wear Gucci no.3, and at night, it must be L'Arte di Gucci moment.
Structural standard, the materials used are better than No.3 in 1985.
Peach aldehyde, then oakmoss around rose, geranium (peach aldehyde refers to Guerlain Nahema and Mitsouko, damascenone refers to Chanel Coco) and Tagetes on a civet base.
The leather barely smells.
In addition, the lack of details is what I think is the most regrettable thing about this perfume.
A plump, thick, honey-flavored patchouli chypre with powdered beeswax.
It is mellow and soft, and it really feels like mixed with natural rose oil, which is fragrant.
Luxurious, good-smelling, and a favorite fragrance for most noses.
Guerlain Parure in 1975, Estée Lauder knowing in 1988... From 1980 to 1990, the chypre rose can be found.
L'Arte di Gucci is a charming lady.
Serge lutens Rose de nuit is L'Arte di Gucci intensifying animal sensibilities.
EDT is not much different from EDP.
The white flowers of EDP are prominent, and the fragrance is better and diffused better, and the attributes are closer to the oriental floral fragrance.
I like EDT, the chypre features are obvious.

L'Arte di Gucci is a very hard to find chypre of Italian aesthetic. ⁠⁠It's a green rose-patchouli with a distinctive 90-ies feel. Being a nineties kid it provokes some specific memories of that era. ⁠⁠
⁠⁠
My mini lost some of its potency but the smell is preserved. A FB is crazy hard to find and too expensive. I’m happy with my mini. ⁠⁠It's funny how chypres made a come-back: this could be Chloe Nomades mom. ⁠⁠
⁠⁠
For me this is what I hoped Voleur des Roses to be, and it also reminds me of Donna Trussardi (the older version).⁠⁠
One of my favourite! Wonderful! What a pity that it is so hard to find!

If Explosive and Daddy Lutens' Rose de Nuit had a child, it would be this bxtch (forget the dates). Where Explosive's oakmoss turns sour on my skin, and Nuit smells like a cat has pissed on its rose, Gucci's L'Arte is balanced: rose comes to play, whipping its extraordinary large bloom out and on the table to impress all, followed by oakmoss oozing, and a VERY resinous labdanum creaming all over everything (think Teatro Alla Scala) . There is a bit of Aromatic Elixir's witch's brew in this cauldron, especially the chamomile-- but where as chamomile plays old on my skin usually, here it softens and seduces like the best chypres.

I kept saying she is a bad bxtch as a I sprayed and sprayed and my feline ran far, far away, under the bed... Her annoyance only matched by mine at the prices of this discontinued fragrance. Worth it.

Now after a full year of living with this sad widow..I can assure you she is a good actress, she alluded you to her sad marriage.. and the sudden death of her husband.. acting in mischievousness to fool you to belleive that SHE poisoned him...
she is a bad wicked bitch/witch.
Nobody could creat emotions in encounters like this bitch/witch/widow..harming the OTHER for her was a way of comunicating with the world, if a scorpion will be able to act nicely for longer than 30 seconds..she will be

fantastic, elegant, sophisticated. that's how i can describe this fragrance, very hard to find now. the notes are blended in a smooth, fine, intelligent way..the rose, the oakmoss, the leather...the rose inside this scent is one of the best ever. if u find grab it, your man will be so happy to smell on you. the packaging is great! profumo eccezionale, senza parole.

my vote:9

in one word: art
Notes corrected and updated 3/27/18 so “Main notes according to your votes” above may not be accurate.

Some years ago, I found this online. I had never heard of it, but I was in the throes of Gucci Eau De Parfum (2002) so I decided to give it a try. Smart move. This is a gorgeous scent. Rich, seductive, very feminine. I get a lot of rose, but not a Victorian rose. A much more modern, assertive and dark kind. I also get leather, amber, orris and a bit of fruit (not the fruit punch variety, thank goodness).

Since it has been sadly discontinued I wear it for special occasions. And it never fails to get me compliments, the best being "It smells so different, so unique" (yessssss!).

I remember this scent very well, this leathery honeyed rose, heavy, straight-forward, unforgiving but awesome....it really blew my mind back then....and I would pay quite some money to buy this if relaunched now. Gucci, are you reading this ? :-)

This is the non-drinkable equivalent of 1990s Sauternes to me - a dark-ish, rich, sweet but not at all sugary or even gourmet dessert wine from Bordeaux, with overripe yellow fruit notes. It's related to another vintage discontinued Gucci beauty, Gucci No 3, which is a little more aldehydic and bright. Wear No 3 during the day and then bring on Arte in the evening.
It's funny how the shameless 1980s lead to some horrible clothes and hair as well as to the most beautiful perfumes!

Rose, oakmoss, patchouli, and musk are the only notes I can specifically pick out. And a hint of something leathery.

All I have left of this one is a mini, but since I only wear chypre fragrances on the rare occasion, it should last me a while still.

To me, chypres have a "witchy woman" kind of vibe to them, and they're serious business in the fragrance universe. Nothing playful or frivolous here, I feel that you better know what you're doing when you wear something like L'Arte!

The bottle is gorgeous, simplistic elegance. In retrospect, I wish I'd held onto my empty full size bottle for a display piece.
I have a mini and I am craving a bottle of it . It is the most beautiful perfume bottle I have ever seen . Pure Art

NOW 2016 and found some very similar - at last....LA PANTHÈRE by CARTIER.

I have been looking for years to replace this perfume which I used to wear in the 90s.
My husband said of my new perfume "You smell like your old house when we 1st met!"
I hope that convinces others who lovvve L'Arte di Gucci to give La Panthere a try.

Having it and loving it, again. Beautiful floral chypre, classy notes and very lasting. It is Lady's perfume. Opulent floral, well blend, not sweet and hard to fond. In a style of Pamela Picasso for those who never tried it before.
Bought my first bottle in San Marino, small country in the middle of Italy, in 94; enjoyed every drop of it. Today got another one, thanks to one member's referral, it is as good as I remember it, very lasting EDT.

DESCRIPTION from the sticker on an EdT bottle :

" A floral rose note with spicy accords enriched by warm woody ,fruity and light animal musky base .

ROSE , TAGETE ,NEROLI , CAMOMILLE , BOURGEONS DE CASSIS .

ROSE , YLANG-YLANG, MIMOSA, PATCHOULI .

CISTE , SANTAL , CASTOREUM , MUSK KETONE ."

Very heavy, dense rose

It does have a classic feel, and could convey a sharp, medicinal, furniture-polish sort of elegance. But on me it's just elaborate and overwrought

There's something sullen and almost recalcitrant about it--just sits there, refuses to open or do anything. For hours. It won't even layer well with other fragrances

The bottle shape was weird to me, but then I noticed, the slant of the top is similar to shoulder slant.. and the slanted bottom is like slant of a skirt. Like diva attitude in black & gold.

I agree it has a beautiful ' musky, leather and woody base. ' It has a soft incensey darkness that goes so well with the vibrant realistic red rose. I love this one a lot.

L'Arte di Gucci opens with the most beautiful rose note that I've encountered. Pure, singing, rich and deep. Just beautiful!

After about 15 minutes the heart opens, bringing in a light LoV, warm narcissus, a touch of geranium, and soft, silky, breezy mimosa. The rose remains clear and true, but softens, leaving a wonderful scent trail. You know that saying about how little girls are made of everything nice? That's what L'Arte is made of. This scent is almost magical in its complexity and balance.

In the dry down vetiver and leather appear, warming the scent, and grounding the airier florals which continue to move slowly forward. And that rose note, it remains perfectly balanced with the whole.

I usually can't wear rose, but this is spectacular. On my skin it has the darkness of the rose absolu, with the spice and tang of the base, and the wonderfully light, almost fairy like supporting florals.

Have you ever wondered what Morgan le Fae wore? Titania? Something like L'Arte, I'm sure. Gucci may call this art, but I call it magic in a bottle! You *must* try this- its phenomenal!

It's been awhile since I tried this, but it reminds me of my beloved Rose Barbare, and I read somewhere that RB was based on it. I plan on buying a bottle soon and I'm scanning eBay. Absolutely beautiful.

Finally! I've been searching for the name and perfume like forever! My mom used to have this and the bodylotion in the black bottle. Divine bottle and scent. I wish we would have more of these today and not only all the sugar and cleanliness. More variety would be nice! :)

This to my nose smells very similar to my beloved ARMANI ARMANI.. Why have i not known about this one? Alas both are discontinued, rare n expensive... Why on earth do they discontinue the best? What is that?

A mean green rose that shines like rippled light on patent leather, it's tender and soft too, with the subtlest sexiest skank running underneath like gleaming threads of gold. On me, I feel there is something animalic softly growling (or loudly purring?) in the base, but just retrained enough that it feels like the kind of secret recognizable to only the initiated.

Everyone says this is a vulgar 80s power horse, but to me it's incredibly sleek, smooth and modern. Smoldering, opulent and dangerous and knowing exactly what she's doing and getting herself into, she's like that girl who has perfect delicate bone structure and looks good doing saying loving hating breaking EVERYTHING, roaring through the night.

This is the most magical dirty rose of all time! Period. :-) And it is a crime that it was discontinued!!! I love you, L'Arte! Please come back!

L'Arte, huh?... Well, what can I say? It matches its name perfectly. Art... The art of indifference and nerve! Because even negative aspects demand a certain artistry. And here, this snob Italian lands a blow! She takes no prisoners! Insolence and sass galore! Rose as a note in perfumery, is not something I am truly fond of. (When it comes to male fragrances especially, I find it almost impossible for rose to be harmoniously blended in the composition. Untill now, only Loris Azzaro's Acteur and Alain Delon's Iquitos have found a not just decent but stunning way to do the trick.) But here rose shines! And not in a usual and, more or less, expected romantic way. No! A dirty and marginally vulgar rose it is that drags you by the nose... It is the scent of a woman who, under her expensive suit ( a Gucci one doubtless), hides leather underwear and a stiletto. A stiletto that she shall not hesitate to use, if all else fails (most unlikely). She had the misfortune of being born in a fin de siecle. In an era when the loud and hyperbolic (nonetheless dazzling) enfants terribles of the '80s started walking the path to oblivion and the watery and optimistic voices of the '90s started to gather attention further still. But she didn't care about it. To tell the truth she NEVER cared about anything! And today, even after so many years have passed since her departure for the heaven of lost scents, she still remains a serious contestant for the title of the most "Fuck you!" and "In your face!" attitude of the last decades...

I thought initially that I was experiencing something rather 'witchy-woo' a-la Magie Noire but upon a closer inspection I realised that there is something different and haunting to this composition. This is a byzantine fragrance;where a lost place with the sunlight overcast, the chills are warmed with fur, a diadem displaced is found, wine from overturned goblets spills forth and paths veiled by bramble canes sing of old glories.
I am unabashed in my love of this fragrance, and I am at a loss as to why the house of Gucci sacrificed one of it's most ravishing beauties. The more of the old guard lost, the more inclined I am to say my prayer before the tidal wave of juvenile syrup crashes over civilization. I can only surmise that it's birth was between two epochs and wasn't deigned to survive.
Another good perfume that was discontinued, shame, so many good ones disappear and bad ones stay.WHO determines that to take off the market?

Personally I find all shypres very much alike due to their beloning to the class of elegant perfumes, being enjoyed by our mothers and eternally being in demand as natural ones - in the sense of ingredients and as genuine, classy and nostalgic perfumes.
I hear men love fruity fragrances - that's it, they've got the point)). One man suggested me to test it as his favourite and waited for me to share my impression. L'Arte is a night scent for Grand special occasions, I'm sure it is unique and unforgettable. The woman who is to wear it will feel herself like in the protective envelope and very proud of her mastering it. Delight!

I blindly bought a random 3.4oz bottle of this at an antique store in Adamstown, PA for $18.00 (it was marked for $19.00, but since I was paying cash they took a dollar off)! A few months later I dropped it on my bathroom floor and it shattered. I cried(for a while)! I was already hooked. I searched obsessively on-line for a replacement bottle and finally bought one for $90.00....which is a great deal. I will never understand why this fragrance was discontinued. I will always be on the lookout for another bottle of this amazing 90's time piece.

Absolutely the BEST rose I've ever smelled.....and I have smelled a lot in my life. This to me screams class, elegance, and sophistication....think Audrey Hepburn in Breakfast At Tiffany's and you're close. It can be quite strong so exercise caution. One little dab with do. It can be quite pricey, if you can find it but totally worth every pretty penny and more. Overall, a hands-down, knock-em-out-the-park perfume. Long Live the House of Gucci.

Revised- I should have revised this as soon as I acquired some which had been properly stored. It is as I had hoped- smooth true rose, rich dense animalic unique beautiful. I left my old review intact below.

OK, this is frustrating and I'm still trying to figure this one out. I've never smelled this back when it was in production, and after reading about it, I knew it was just my kind of perfume. I got my bottle today and I tried it on. I was first off told that it didn't smell good- as if it had broken down and the components were coming apart (my spouses description- not mine)! I know it should be rich dense with an aniimallic quality that some don't like, but I don't know if that is what I'm detecting. I love animallic and this strikes me as something wrong. It is what I can so far only describe as either an over ripe fruit note- similar to but not as dominant as the one I smell in my possibly too old bottle of Oleg Cassini Cassini. The thing is I know these were both in a similar vein when they were new and fresh so I don't know if the similar unpleasant note is just how they both smell when they deteriorate, or if it is how they both are supposed to smell, or if it's unrelated in origin. The note faded in proportion to the rest of the scent when I wiped some of it away with a bit of oil. I'll have to test it again. Incidentally, nothing I did reduced the presence of the over ripe cantaloupe note in proportion to the rest of the fragrance with regard to the Cassini- I could just not get around that note, it took over the blend. On the other hand, with L'Art,I can smell the beauty of the fragrance around the off note- I can tell that I could love it and I just wish I could totally erase that note, but that note may be integral to the blend. Oh well- I wish I'd discovered this sooner so I could have smelled it when it was fresh!

this is one of the best rose scents I met so far on my quest for the perfect rose.

don't be scared away by the honey, it is not another sweet marshmallow scent... it is not so smashing imho.

not sure about the loudness or strongness though - would be interesting to see how it behaves when sprayed and not just applied to wrist with a dipstick.

interesting enough to take up the challenge and check how expensive it is really.

P.S. : i made a comparison to this with Etat Libre Rossy de Palma, after 30 minutes, these are very very similar to me

I have the EDP and I own it already for a very long time but didn't wear it, as I remembered it to be very strong. I was 27 then.

Because of previous reviews and the high price of this perfume nowadays I thought I should try the EDP again.

It's still strong, but I can appreciate the scent a little bit more (maybe the price is talking to me :-)

I guess it's just not one of those scents I would die for, but I can assure you it's a very unique scent, a real 90-ies scent, and therefore it deserves a place in my collection.

Words fail me.
At last I have found a replacement for Opium.
L'Arte may even be "better", please forgive me my rude simplicity.
This day will be spent in happy silence and sniffing.

19. april 2011

HOLY GUCCI!!!!

This one is a true Art of perfumery for me! I really treasure my every bottle (the edt's and edp's) of this discontinued beauty. For me this is one-of the kind perfume that is not made anymore nowdays! I wish i could have twice as more as i have of it now so it would last me a lifetime. Prepare to be noticed when you wear it, not everyone likes it and understands it nowdays (it IS a heavy smell and really bold), but you gonna feel yourself like a million-dollar lady! Pure sofistication and class! But this is strictly a cold time fragrance for me, i would kill anyone near me wearing this one at summertime.
A LOT of roses and big jar of honey with some spices (coriander anyone?) and you will get an absolute ÜBERsexy, animalistic fragrance that is full of passion. It takes some nerve to wear it, but if you can handle it you won´t regret. EDP is a lasting monster, lasts for over 24h on my skin and even longer on clothes. The EDT is amazing as well, but just a bit lighter (sillage is a bit weaker, but still very strong), but the scent is the same. More chypre in EDT but still over-the top honey rose!
Use it with caution, do not overspray it or you might end up having a headache. 3-4 sprays are more than enough.
But in general this is a true masterpiece and one of my most favorite and outstanding fragrances! All later Gucci edition don´t even come close to this one! Truly THE BEST Gucci ever made for my personal taste. (Gucci nr 3 is amazing as well and is on the same level of quality)

I had the good fortune to test this discontinued beauty recently and it is very beautiful. The opening is strong and 80's-esque. But it moves into the heart of honey and roses after about 20 minutes and it is a wrist sniffer, for sure.

I spent some time in my favorite perfume store deciding what I wanted to get myself for Christmas with this one and Boucheron Initial. I could have gotten this one for about $20 less, but I decided to go with Initial. As I was driving home, I started kicking myself as this was developing so beautifully. I couldn't stop sniffing it.

But after about 2 hours as it moved into the base base notes, I was glad I went with the Initial. The dry down is unpleasant to me, plasticky and weird. I dodged the bullet with this one.

This starts off really sharp and heavy, but after the first few minutes this perfume gets better and better! I really like it now, lets see what it does in a couple of hours...

Oh and I totally agree with Mymlan, that's exactly what it smells like!!!

l'Arte de Gucci (edp) is, together with Poison edp and Rabannes La Nuit, one of the most apparently seductive fragrances I've ever smelt. It's like a bottle full of feromones.

This stunning beauty is a creation similar to Christian Louboutins red sole high heels. They were made to send a big fat signal to men:” I’m free and ready to be romantingly chased”. But also, l’Arte is so elegant and sophisticated that you instinctively will understand that the woman wearing it is in full control of herself. And that the chain of reactions that just started around her, was exactly what she wanted and expected.

So what does it smell like? Well, as Nuppu says below it is honey dipped roses. So bind your self a big boquet of very big velvety dark red roses. Take also some that are on the verge to be owerblown. Add a lot of dark honey. Then add some animalistic notes, a pinch of moss and there it is.

I had it in 1993 (?)...I was dating with young diplomat,who gave me it as a present. I loved it for a bottle shape, for a box, for a mistery, but it is so sophysticated smell, so I used it for only special occasions, which is back then were almost every evening.
Since that I have hundreds of perfumes, although, when I saw it recently in a small boutique, I asked to sniff again.
oh, my God! It brought me back: honey -rose,moss.Femme-fetale woman should wear this.I didn't know that back then,however, I started to dream about this perfume day and night. I would trade most of my collection things just to have this one!

This has to be the most addictive concoction I have ever laid nose on! And discontinued! The lovely reviews of Mals86 and Chat Lunatique capture this perfume's spirit wonderfully.

Rose is a rather difficult note for me, as it is usually either too powdery, or too acrid, or dangerously close to the smell of burnt plastic. But this! This is none of those, oh no, this is a thick, velvety, fleshy, moist, scorching red rose, dripped with desire. A rose that slowly starts darkening and wilting, from the edges to the core, under the song of forbidden whispers, touched by the spell of the loss.

As a side note, although perhaps similar in structure to Paloma Picasso, Soir de Lune and Knowing, I do not find those perfumes good alternatives to L'Arte: on me Paloma Picasso screams with strong vetiver and musk, in Knowing - the prominent sandalwood eats up the beautiful rose, and Soir de Lune just seems to lack in depth compared to this one.

Wearing this for the first time today, and I adore it. A little black glass vial, scored at the vintage boutique over the weekend (I made quite a haul there!), and I feel like this is a scent to wear with a little black dress, pearls, high heels and nothing else - except maybe a small whip.

There is a sharp sweetness to it, and a heavy, rich floral spiciness behind that somehow. And below that there's something really earthy I don't recognize but I do love. It's deep and strong but I don't mind - I just want to sink into the fragrance. I put the tiniest dab on each wrist, and I now am floating in a cloud of confident sensuality.

Well this is for a real chypre lover!!!Very loud,strong,heavy classic chypre.Reminds me of Pilomma Picassso and very much of Soir de Lune by Sisley.I am not a chypre fan and i will pass it,although is a great perfume for mature women

I love Dark Rose fragrances - the ones that focus on deeper/spicier/more interesting facets of rose - so I had to test L'arte.

I bought a tiny edp splash bottle, and immediately loved it. The top notes (aldehydes, berry, green notes and a very hissy cassis bud) are immediately glamorous and almost overwhelming, although much less so when dabbed rather than sprayed. The heart of the fragrances is rose. Don't be fooled by the long list of floral notes; most of them are there to round out and soften the rose and geranium. This rose lolls luxuriously, seductively, on a mossy bed. The drydown is sensuous and deep, and the best olfactory description of "bittersweet" I've ever smelled. It smells like the beginning of autumn, following the best summer of your life... or time for Cinderella to leave the ball.

It is simply gorgeous, and quite sensual. I prefer to decant it into a roll-on bottle (I went straight out and bought two large bottles of the edp; it's nearly impossible to find now), since it can be a bit harsh in the first ten minutes when sprayed, containing a plasticky note that I don't care for, and which I don't smell at all when I dab.

I'm sure that the recent restrictions on oakmoss were what killed L'arte di Gucci; it is crammed full of moss. Well, that and the fact that the current fashion in perfumery is for sweet and fruity scents, the polar opposite of the sophisticated L'arte. Shame.

Chat Luna below is right, it is "intemperate" and slinky, and rather reminiscent of Ungaro Diva, which I also like and which might be easier to find at this point in time. But L'arte has a smolder, a smoky-eyed stare, that one rarely sees outside film noir. An amazing scent.

My Holy Grail...was lucky to snatch both edt and edp when the prices were not that sky-high... Actually it is almost 1:1 with Sisley's Soir de Lune, but less peppery and spicey. It's dark and warm, elegant and definitely not for young girls. A woman needs to have some background to be able to wear it...and then it will become like a second soul and skin;)

I wore it, when I was in 9th grade. I had a black mini. I loved it. It's very solid and warm. Very sexy chypre.
EDP at first has a bit sharp (aldehyde) green notes with fruity notes that you won't find such in recent perfumes, then comes flowery base entangled with musky, leather and woody base. It has similar feel to honey through it too... It has old-fashioned feel to it- it's indeed like Soir de Lune and sister of Piguet's Bandit. I thought it was oriental perfume at time. Shame they discontinued it.

Yes, L'Arte de Gucci is strong, opulent and even loud. I don't know why, but on me this smell rich, honeydipped rose with something else what I cannot identify. But lot's of honeylike sweetnes.

This is a scent that Alexis from 80- Dynasty tv-series woud wear, luxuriant, bold and very femme fatale.

I had a brief experience with this years ago and at that time, I remembered it was priced on the higher price range which of course is nothing compared to those super expensive perfumes that had emerged nowadays.

For the scent, I recalled it is rather strong, oppulent and loud with a tinge of metal nuance.

Would need to revisit as I still have a sample vial somewhere in my collection of minatures and vials....

product_name: Gucci No 1 Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I remember using this when I was 10-12 years old (late 80s/early 90s). I think I smelled it on my mom and expressed liking it so she gave me a bottle and kept giving me another whenever I ran out. I don't really remember how it smelled like and I'm really intrigued about it now because my mom and I have vastly different tastes in perfumes.
Edit: nevermind, i think it was gucci no.3 😆

product_name: Gucci No 1 Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is a true classic for a reason! Gucci No. 1 has been my go-to scent for years. It's floral and elegant with a touch of powderiness that makes it feel sophisticated. The longevity is amazing - I can still smell it on my clothes the next day!

product_name: Gucci No 1 Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Guy Robert is one of my favorite perfumers. He weaves his compositions into a tapestry that illuminates each element and has them singing a chorus of dramatic movements throughout each discrete work's development. It's not to say that this has anything to do with some wondrous alchemy on the part of Robert, but each vintage I own seems somehow immaculate, spared from the ravages of time, still sonorous after decades. It is quite a coincidence, though, and makes me wonder (and oh how I love to wonder!).

In Gucci No 1 EDP, Robert's penchant for arresting grandiosity is in full effect: an announcement of aldehydes ringing in the glamour of full-bodied florals, most notably rose, hyacinth, heliotrope, and lilac to my nose, with strong suggestions of carnation and ylang-ylang. It's intoxicating, with the blooms bursting and effulgent, reminding me of walking through an arboretum at the peak of spring with all manner of blooms emanating their seductive aromas. Yet it still manages to feel baroque and tender, especially as the dry down softens the edges, as if the flowers all retreat to a welcoming moss-lined cedar chest to reflect and rest. It is sensational.

product_name: Gucci No 1 Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I had bad luck with this scent. I bought a sealed box, but when I opened it, most of the juice had evaporated, so there was less than 1/3 left. The seller agreed to return half of my money. Anyway I decided to make the most of what I got and have been wearing it a few times now. This is fabulous, high perfumery, kind of old school. Very velvety and creamy, smells like you've been using the most expensive, luxurious soap and body lotion. I can't tell the notes apart, but the scent is woody and a little bit animalic but not in a bad way. It simply smells like a wealthy, well-maintained woman, driving in her leather-upholstered car, wearing Gucci sunglasses. The scent lingers around you without re-applying for good 8-10 hours. It's a pity my bottle wasn't full, but if I ever run into Gucci no 1 again I'm going to snatch it.

product_name: Gucci No 1 Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: When I was a child and thought about what perfume smelled like, Gucci No. 1 is what I imagined in my mind. As a child of the 80s, it’s no surprise that a big powdery floral with aldehydes and oakmoss in the base, would be what I had olfactory dreams of. When I first spray this it simply smells like “80s perfume,” but I immediately recognized the aldehydes, then the hyacinth, and I could already detect the oak moss. My 9 year old told me that I smelled good at this point. As it dries down, I smell a simple, but fragrant bouquet of early spring flowers, the oak moss and aldehydes are still there but tempered by the woodiness that’s peaking through. Maybe this perfume is dated, but it’s very lovely, and it’s exactly what I miss in todays perfumes. Definitely worth a try, if you can find a sample, it’s worth it!

product_name: Gucci No 1 Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I believe iI wore this in the 1970s, based on the picture. When I look at those many notes (and especially what some of them are), I wonder how it was that I wore this. I don't consider myself a big lover of florals. These days I am more of a gourmand girl. I would sure like to smell it again, though, just fior nostalgia's sake.

product_name: Gucci No 1 Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I have an old bottle of Gucci no. 1, with a content that has become resinous and difficult to spray, but the juice is still fantastic! It is like that one week of late spring/early summer when you can stick your whole head in a blooming jasmine bush, or a white lilac tree, and become totally emersed in a drunken, heavy and sweet smell, with still fresh and green stems, before the bloom is over, decay kicks in and the smell goes bad. Gucci no. 1 is right on that border between perfectly folded out and over ripe flowers. It stays on the good side though, even though my bottle is ancient by now. What a treat! Thankfully it is quite close to Jill Sander no. 4, which is still available.

product_name: Gucci No 1 Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Smells like Fidji, Shiseido Zen and L'air du temps rolled into one a real classic.

product_name: Gucci No 1 Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Really smooth, fresh but warm and creamy floral. Not dated. I don't think I would have been able to guess at the year it came out at all. Just a gorgeous floral for anyone who enjoys that sort of thing. Fortunately, I definitely do! I think it probably stood out for its time because it doesn't have any rough edges. Now we have so many florals that stay smooth from start to finish that this one would probably just blend in. Still gorgeous.

product_name: Gucci No 1 Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Gucci No. 1 Where have you been all my life? You are so rich and elegant. You are exactly the way I want to smell, like dense flowers and woods, mysterious and alluring, a damp forest on a spring morning. And you last all day. You are certainly No. 1 for me now, in my top 5 of all time that includes Jacomo Silences, Vagabound Prince Enchanted Forest, Guerlain's Chamade & Samsara, Morabito OR Black, EL Pure White Linen and Givenchy III. I will never let you go!

p.s. have yet to try Gucci No.3...it is next on my wish list!

product_name: Gucci No 1 Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I would LOVE to smell this fragrance, but I can't find it anywhere......I do have EAU DE GUCCI CONCENTRATED though....a wonderful fragrance that's timeless and elegant. Maybe we can exchange a small tester? Please send me a PM. Thank you.

product_name: Gucci No 1 Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Stunning!! I love green, I love ambers and I love carnation, this fragrance has all three!! I received this vintage perfume from a friend. I never smelled it before and as soon as I got it I sprayed some on. I didn't know what the notes were in the fragrantica pyramid but the very first thing I smelled was aldehydes a little bit of hyacinth. Soon it started to change into a very warm fragrance. This is mostly a spicy honeyed carnation with thick gooey Amber. I get the oak moss in the middle notes along with the Ylang Ylang. It smells like there may be some civet in here but it just adds to the class and sophistication of this perfume. It lasts so long at least over 12 hours. Sillage is an arm's length and after 30 minutes sits closer to the skin but still very noticeable. This is such a beauty and I feel very lucky to have this in my collection.

product_name: Gucci No 1 Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I am a huge fan of late Guy Robert.
Delicate lovely vintage floral.

product_name: Gucci No 1 Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
....When the snow falls you´re found in St. Mortiz, with the others of the jet set. And you drink your Napoleon brandy, but you never get your lips wet, no you don´t.
From the old song, these lyrics remind me of Gucci No 1.

I was surprized by this and you may be too. Sweet woody, smoky but rich. Just a really winning fragrance. This is an uptown girl with a downtown boy, type of fragrance. Classic and conventional, but with a few little edges.

product_name: Gucci No 1 Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Gucci No. 1 was pleasantly surprising for me. As someone who usually leans towards darker, heavy perfumes which are not blatantly floral, this bouquet bloomed into pure magic on my skin.

This is soft, sweet, and delicate without feeling juvenile; this is 100% class in my opinion. The composition is one of the most well-blended I've ever smelt. Without question, this is one refined lady.

product_name: Gucci No 1 Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Delicate but strong; feminine but balllsy; 1980s shoulder pads but classic; discontinued but found in an antique shop.

product_name: Gucci No 1 Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Maybe I am too subjective in here, because I have worn this svent for almost three decades and at that time I did not know nearly as many fragrances as I do today. Whatever the reason, I love this fragrance. I do not usually like carnation that much, which is to me the most preeminent note in this fragrance, but here, although very obvious and as noticeable as in other famous carnation fragrances or even more, it is used in a very good balance from my viewpoint with the other notes. Its scent goes and comes, and, at the breaks, lets you smell fully the round full sweet side of this fragrance, to me achieved mostly from jasmine and amber. It also smells a lot of cedarwood, whose scent mixes up very tightly with carnation. Also, this fragrance is really strong and powerful, everyone in a room wil notice it, and has excellent silage and staying power. Well, it was created at a time when eau de parfum really meant what it is supposed to mean. Guy Robert really created masterpieces. I have owned for decades all his three to me main fragrances, Madame Rochas, Caleche and Gucci nº 1. It is a pity it has been discontinued, although some five years ago I still found a bottle in a London Chemist.

product_name: Gucci No 1 Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This is a truly wonderful, classis scent. It is almost heartbreaking to know that Gucci has decided to stop make this one - when it's such a pearl.

My boyfriend always refers to soap when I wear it, classic, old French soap. I didn't like that at first but now I've come to understand that it's more a compliment then a degradation as I first took it. Now I come to think of the classic parfumeries in Paris, late 1700 and the French court every time that I smell it.

If you have a bottle, cherish it because this will be a curiosity to have in your collection in near future.

product_name: Gucci No 1 Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: They don't make them like this ANY more! This is what Gucci really is for people who remember the name and the brand. Very woody and slightly (sickly) floral. But at the same time warm and gives off a floral, almost herbal type vibe. This stuff is brilliant. Truly... They do NOT make them like this any more! (Which is a shame... A real shame). If you find this or have a bottle. Please, SAVOUR it. Make it last while you can. This is how real ladies used to smell like. Not like today's designer fragrance disasters.

product_name: Gucci No 1 Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This is perfume artistry, so elevated compared to Gucci by Gucci or Gucci Rush. It is easy to just think "oh that's pretty" but then the complexity of the ingredients keeps bringing more. I'll have to wear it more to have a review that does this justice.

Addendum:

I have a LOT of scents, so it has been a while since I wrote this. I wore it again today, and the first application as I said before was "pretty". It seemed very floral and kind of Joy/Fidji/Anais Anais-ish. The scent would be kind of on my periphery and then dissipate when I tried to get a good sniff. Then, after lunch I reapplied my vintage edp, spraying a bit more, not a lot. Same bottle, mind you. It was like putting on a different scent! All of a sudden the herbal/green/woodiness flowed forth and enveloped me in majesty! Now a few hours later, I have some of each the floral and the woody quality. Oh yeah, this is a real masterpiece, alright.

product_name: Gucci No 1 Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I don't typically review women's scents, but this is an epic masterpiece. With the passing of Guy Robert just two days ago on May 28th, I wanted to say that this is a bottle of amazing quality - a masterpiece and timeless beauty. While classified as a "Floral Aldehyde" - it is stunningly deep, rich and full of earthy and wood notes. Oakmoss, patchouli, amber, cedar, musk and a benzoin/vanilla base further enhanced by tonka bean. So deep and warm. The color of the Eau de Parfum in a 60ml spray I bought for my wife is bronze and all the notes are true to form. It is closer in color to Guy Robert's 1970 masterpiece he created for Hermes in Equipage (4 years earlier) than his bottling of Gucci Pour Homme Original just two years later...a chypre.

Now, while I am adventurous in scent and adore his 1976 creation - a masterpiece for men! - there is a part of me that believes this scent with it gorgeous base notes and integrated oriental tones and depth could possibly be worn by a confident, classic man! I have floral scents for men that are far less rich as this and could easily be worn by my wife. While I believe this is perfection in scent made for a confident and elegant woman of taste - understand that this plays off Carl Jung's archetypes of both Dynamic Feminine and a strong presence of Static Masculine in the base notes that could easily rise to the forefront. It smells as good today as it did nearly 40 years ago - and, perhaps in comparison to so many scents that are not nearly as well-composed...even better. Timeless. Just like a piece by Bach, or Chopin - does it ever sound "dated"? No, it is classic...as is this fragrance.

I see this as a centerpiece for a woman's collection - it is chic, amazingly elegant and gorgeously rich. Not for the faint of heart. Age appropriate is 30's to 60's, but it is how a woman carries herself and her aire of sophistication that will allow her to adorn this fragrance. This is a confident Woman's scent that is never going to be out of style - like Monsieur Robert's Pour Homme bottling...you must wear this proper or it will wear you.

10/10. Masterpiece.

product_name: Gucci No 1 Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I'm not sure about this one yet. I just got a vintage bottle of it--never before opened--and I was VERY eager to try it out on me. Gucci 1 is definitely designed for a woman. That said, I'm still trying to decide if it's for me. It has a very strong, decisive signature & I'm not sure which notes are the ones that define it. For me, it really is the aldehydes, cedar, geranium and carnations.

Gucci 1 has a way of making an imprint on that part of your mind where memories are stored. I can still smell it precisely even though it's a recent discovery for me; isn't that what is so amazing about classic vintage perfumes!! This is a main reason why we love fragrance isn't it?

This would go well with a mediterranean style palacial estate.

product_name: Gucci No 1 Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Exleftcoastgirl: yes this is correct!! You own this perfume. So do i, in a set of edp, a soap and EXTRAIT. :)
absolutely stunning.

If you are feminine, innocent and might cry if a Karen started an arguement in front of you, this might be your scent!
Clean, intimate, innocent. Too pricy for its longevity, 2 hours max on me.

Whoa, very pretty. I was wondering if the lily of the valley would be heady and it is not. To me, this is well blended. Sweet and juicy floral. There's something candy like to it, but its not cloying. I love this 9/10
Not worth the price but I love this scent

Not worth the price at all imho. Average fresh peony and soapy clean scent. Has a little bit of a sharp note almost smelling like magazine paper which I find a little annoying. Will most likely sell my bottle. Although I will say the bottles are absolutely stunning and I love the concept behind them. (Also the atomizer is amazing it sprays really good and even)

The scent feels like Tinker Bell gliding gracefully among blooming peonies
🧚⊹₊ ⋆

On paper, very lovely. I was completely blind to the top notes for some reason, and smelled the bottom and they were sooo good. Soapy and then a musk at the end that was so good. I ordered it after smelling it in a duty free.

I wonder if the blindness had been because I had been smelling other perfumes.. but the dry down was so beautiful on paper. I didn't spray myself because I wanted to smell how it developed on the paper in case I didn't like it, I didn't want to be trapped on a plane with it! It was so pleasant. Soapy and a light musk at the end. Then looking at the notes I thought I could imagine the opening, because I love white flowers.

Well, I just received it in the mail and.... I don't hate it as in, need to wash it off but.. I just sprayed it on and it's been.. 45 minutes and it already smells stale. The elements are there. And very pretty. But there is a sharp note that someone above described as "magazine paper" and I know exactly what they meant. To me, that sharp note, like an out of tune violin, smells to my nose like pleather.

I wanted to smell like a cloud. I wanted light and comforting. I feel so dumb for buying this blind! I can see it giving someone a headache.

All the lightness of the Lily of the Valley is dragged down by this dense pleather smell. It's fleeting, but enough to turn me off. I am so glad I didn't buy a full bottle. It doesn't do the rest of the line justice and I have no idea what happened. It smells the same way on paper. Sweet, then pleather, then stale perfume. I am so bummed. I wanted to love this so much. Edited my harsh review.....99% of the reviews I read were positive and the other 1% are reviews saying it's nice, or ok, but too expensive. If the fragrance delivered and smelled magical, as I was anticipating, then the price would be worth it. I guess I assumed because it was the higher end of perfumes, it would be good.

I might wear it to bed occasionally.

smells like you're drunk and happy.

lily of the valley is one of my favourite smells ever.
the bottle is beautiful.
it is way overpriced but i don't care because I smell amazing, but i have to do this one in small doses. I feel like it could be worn all seasons, honestly.
Dominantly rose and peony to my nose. I put this in the same category wirh Irrésistible Eau de Toilette Fraiche by Givenchy and Pivoine Suzhou by Giorgio Armani.
@Nihan_ Accurate. I’m a May born Gemini and I love this scent!! Musky lily of the valley so gorgeous 💗

Tears From The Moon, by Gucci, smells like roses and Lily-Of-The-Valley.

It is a very refreshing, floral, spring bouquet. The scent is very pleasant and very easy to like if you like refreshing rose fragrances.

This is quite unique, I don’t think I can compare it to many fragrances, few that come across my mind that are slightly similar but yet still different. HFC Dancing Queen but it’s stronger than Gucci and slightly sharper, Gucci is much softer yet still has that slight spice sweetness that I remember from HFC. And also Kingkydise Laurent Mazzone Parfums but I think this one has more musk and citruses so again I do prefer Gucci over this one as well.
Tears of the moon is very gorgeous, and absolutely ultra feminine fragrance and first fragrance from Gucci line I actually truly love and wear. I think the Lily of the Valley really adds that green quite note, softness and uniqueness to this fragrance that differs from other peony center fragrances. Also I would classify it as clean clean fragrances, it definitely has some slight spice and sweetness to it but just perfect amount not to be overwhelming. One down side is I don’t think it’s great performer, I get may be 4-6 hours before I have to reapply. All in all love it and definitely happy I bought it.

This one from this line stand out to me maybe because of it simpleness, has a very sweet light floral scent, but it kinda nostagic in a way that makes me think about that one time I went to a picnic to watch the night stars in the cold forest that I didn't have. Anyway in a more simple term I think it's simple, skin scent, blooming flowers, good for everyday wear, suitable for those that want a soft, leaning feminine sweet light floral scent. But would not buy full bottle because of the price
I feel absolutely no regret for the amount I paid for it. 🤗 Every time I wear it, I feel so fresh and clean. It's just amazing! 💖🌸

It smells amazing. Really dewy and the right mixture of fresh and flowery.
However it doesn’t last long and the price tag is just insane so I can’t justify buying it…

@Antoshka2 From the looks of your shelf of perfumes you own, you're not afraid of feminine leaning fragrances so why the archaic comment? All perfume is unisex and it is such a silly delusion to think otherwise. This is a beautiful floral bouquet that any man could rock if their fragile masculinity isn't at stake.
We all have the right to smell good, and I think any man that wears peony or any other floral focused perfume is still a man through and through, just one that may smell extra divine.

This fragrance is very pretty, it really is like all of those from "reminds me of" section together but lighter and more transparent. Carefree, sweet (just the right amount of sweetness), pleasant. Dries down to a slightly sweet jasmine with a hint of musk. Lasts about 30-45 minutes. I've never tested a $450 bottle of Eau Fraiche (not even a cologne in my opinion) before. I picture a young wealthy woman in a flowy floral dress on a sunny morning heading down to the terrace in her mansion to have breakfast. She only needs this Eau Fraiche to last about 30 minutes because after breakfast she will be wearing a different fragrance heading to the city to do all those important but unnecessary things she needs to do :-D

Notes listed are not complete. The base notes are missing, they are showing the beautiful top and heart notes. I smell incense and patchouli, just the faintest bit but it's there. So top notes are light clean and lovely. It's the dry down as usual, that doesn't work for me. Coco Mademoiselle base notes and it's mixed with the top notes but I still get the faintest ghost dry down it's the very very last notes of Coco Mademoiselle. This is wayyy lighter version so if you like that fragrance and it's just too strong for today's world or you work in healthcare but want that smell this is it. This is a wispy fresher ghost of that scent and suitable for healthcare. I don't like Miss Coco, don't like incense or patchouli but it's a crowd pleaser it seems.

Such a gorgeous floral perfume. It’s very well blended and I can’t pick out one flower over the other. It’s delicate, has the perfect amount of sweetness from the florals. There is just a touch of powderiness. It’s a very feminine perfume and I always feel pretty when I wear this. Longevity and sillage are moderate, but for how airy and light it is, it performs surprisingly well. Every time I’ve worn this perfume I get compliments, it really is so very pretty.

Ultra feminine, that peony is intoxicating. Most people associate peonies as fresh flowers, but if you've buried your nose into one you would understand what it means to get drunk off of a flower. This captures the peony blooming right in front of you beautifully. I disagree with people calling this clean because I am understanding that to categorize this as fresh. I wouldn't call this a fresh scent. This is very floral forward from opening to dry down. It'd not even like you're holding a bouquet, it's like you have flowers blooming in front of you, behind you, right next to you, and you're smelling it all at once.

It is not a unisex fragrance whatsoever. They’re just to do woke thing and not label them for men or women anymore but making life harder for their long-standing customers. Is is so politically incorrect to do a decent mens fragrance? Why is everyone labelling things that are clearly not nor ever intended to be unisex, as unisex? I’m so tired of blind buying ladies perfumes labelled as unisex.

I had high hopes for this white floral blend. Whenever I get my nose on these types of scents, I always hope for naturals, but instead get stuck with synthetic, cleaning products aromachemicals. One day, I'll find something that stands above the rest. As it is, thus falls into "the rest" pile. Meh. Even if slightly better quality than other chemical white floral concoctions.

It has Feathery light kind of creaminess you'll get to beautiful florals notes. It is one of the most exquisite, elegant dainty floral delicately blends. its like melting naturally sweet floral dessert on my skin. I feel like if one of the floral note got amplified, the beautiful blend will be ruined. It changes my mood every time i wear it. I think it will make the bride look more ethereal and radiant if she wears it.
The downside is it's price and longevity. I have to test them more.

Please make a more affordable, better longevity version of it.

Clean, fresh florals ~ when I say clean, imagine it's refreshing greens with a tiny hint of floral...maybe white floral? as someone who adores L'Ombre Dans Leau, I can resonate with this one. Im a sucker for anything PEONIES but I dont get much peony in this one? nonetheless, I LOVE IT, and im considering to buy a bigger bottle.
I feel Gucci always does bring out the best in their perfume line..(also Gucci pls bring back Gucci Parfum II and Gucci by Gucci EDP)

UPDATE:
this is my new signature scent. im bummed that it is sold out in my area and the waiting list for this perfume is now 2-pages long! i just love it so much i spray it on even before going to sleep. when i do spray it on my body, i'd take numerous sniffs on myself coz i love smelling it on me. people complimented me many times and i feel the perfume sings to me and calling my name hahaa..it's haunting as its name suggests! Oh GUCCI PLS DO NOT DISCONTINUE IT!

UPDATE Feb 2025 ~
im still loving it. it's a gem, a rare find, it's 2025 now and i havent found any perfume that smells like it. =)
also , i just discovered that Gucci Tears From The Moon won the 2023 Fragrance of the Year - Universal Luxury Category ... WOW!!!!!!!!!!!

I don't expect designer brands to stop making Peony fragrances, given that they sell exceptionally well. But I do hope that the perfumers try to present the note in a novel and refreshing setting.

Gucci Tears From The Moon and Creed Wind Flowers are two recent releases from established brands, both prominently featuring Peony.

The Creed plays it incredibly safe and does absolutely nothing out of the ordinary, delivering a floral, caramelized perfume laying on a gigantic base of coumarin. Typical pink floral. You've smelled it hundred times before; you know which scent I'm talking about.

The Gucci however, does start somewhat disappointing, but as it dries down I discover a wonderful take on Peony. The contrast of a floral note with lily-of-the-valley reminds me a lot of Dior Lucky, but not as much "zesty" and more delicate. What I LOVE about Tears From The Moon is that I smell next to no sweetness in it. Sure the peony itself does have a sweet accent, but it comes off in a totally natural and floral manner instead of a sucrose-type sweetness that I'm not really fond of.

As far as relation to the moon goes, I'd say this resembles a waltz under the moon: peaceful and elegant but still with some energy, rather than a quiet alone stroll or romantic dinner under the moon which are more melancholic and mellow respectively.
I really like this but if oversprayed it can give a slight dash of a hairspray vibe. Does resemble Bright Crystal but not the same sweetness. Mediocre lasting powder but better than BC.

This is an ethereal beautiful soft floral scent with very light citrus notes and a powdery feel. I agree with the previous reviews that it is not long lasting on my skin and does not have great silage beyond arms length; however I do find it to be potent for the first hour it is on. Definitely recommend a smell. Added this to my collection as I didn’t have any lily of the valley fragrances, and I also needed a new spring freshie.

the name does not match the smell. this is a rich, soapy, almost syrupy feminine floral. very “fresh out the shower” as someone said below. it’s a basic shampoo scent and may be too sweet for some, but I think it smells great and most men would love this on a woman.

I got this as a sample with my purchase of Winter's Spring at the Gucci counter at David Jones at the Queen's Plaza Mall in Brisbane, which I love! (I'm talking about the Gucci scent here, though I love this high-end mall too with it's Chanel and Dior boutique.)

I liked the opening of "Tears From the Moon" at first and I thought that it had a fairly pleasant smell, but that it really lacked any "oomph" to give it that extra boost. It's a very soapy, sweet and girly fragrance and smells like you just came out of the shower. I get a hint of citrus at the top, but it's more an almost sickly Glade rose air freshener smell. I guess that's the peony and the lily-of-the-valley mixing together. I don't think that it is a good combo at all and I usually love lily-of-the-valley.

As it develops, it gets closer and closer to the skin rapidly, until you smell pretty much nothing just under two hours later. I would NOT spend more than $500 AUD for a perfume that hardly lasts at all like this and smells cheap. I don't know what Gucci was thinking with this...

This feels like a departure from the rest of the collection. The majority of the scents are quite evocative, fitting, with names like A Gloaming Night and Love at Your Darkest. Tears from the Moon is almost too pretty to fit in with the rest of her melancholy siblings. It’s a beautiful floral that starts off bright and airy, with a little green from the lily of the valley, and dries down to soft spiciness from the Stephanotis. The peony is very subdued here. While I really like the scent and the overall aesthetics of the collection, the longevity leaves much to be desired.
A super light pretty sweet floral, almost candy-like.

Admittedly, I’m a sucker for any floral. But this has to be my absolute favorite. I wore Coach Floral on the daily for years, and this is her more sophisticated older sister.
It’s not at all an aged floral in my opinion, it’s very light and I’d say friendly for nearly all ages, while some florals can smell dated or age you. It’s a very fresh scent, you’re paying a lot to smell like you just took a shower and lit some candles, sprayed some rose water and walked through a garden of jasmine. It’s a very pretty scent, but quite light. There is no sweetness to it, it’s a dry floral scent. Fades nicely, and lasts many hours, but more of a skin scent than one you could smell projecting a mile away.
This smells very melon-y to me-- like a similar vibe I get from Lancome Idole -- dewy sweet fresh warm.

Light and unobtrusive. I got the sample and honestly couldn't identify any specific ingredients. It just smells like flowers. It's almost old fashioned, the way a lovely grandmother might smell. In a way of reminds me of Anais Anais.

I was at the botique when they first brought out the bottle so I got to smell this before the employees did 😂
Florals and fresh but super feminine to my nose. The sales woman at the botique liked it but I could tell she didn't know anything about perfume (she tried to tell me that niche fragrances should be linear) so take that with a grain of salt.

I got one spray on my hand and it lasted about 1.5 hours before it was gone. I'm getting close to giving up on this brand. Another 350 dollar disappointment from Gucci. This house is all style and no substance.

Just like a gentle morning kiss or an innocent evening peck, this fragrance arrives without any fanfare to simply envelop the space around one’s body with its close to skin notes while making its arrival a sensual happening.

The subtle peony notes take the center stage while the balance of the floral notes provide their supporting rolls in perfect harmony and create a symphony meant for one… intimate and reserved for the seldom few who get a chance for a closer encounter!

A journey to the days gone by and yet still ahead. A precious gift from another world… a tear from the moon!

I finally got this in the mail! its a lightly powdery delicate dry rose scent to me. When I say delicate, I mean very delicate which may bake it lean feminine however there is no sweetness to this. Im getting less Peony and more Rose as the notes say Peony but it a very natural floral oil and not an imitation of a floral note. This is not a strong fragrance at all more of a skin scent. I do like this a lot thought, however it may not be a crowd pleaser or compliment getter.. you will never bother anyone with this even if you spray 100 sprays. Its a white linen type of scent but maybe fit for a queens bed... it does remind me of royalty. A white satin pillow of a princess or queen :) Very fluffy and dry like a coconut husk type of dry but balanced out with the natural light floral oils in it. Really worth trying if you like light, delecate white T kind of frags.

I got a sample of this a few days ago and tried it out, the initial opening was very floral, the jasmine and peony really took over,

I first thought no way I can pull this off but after I let it settle for a few hours it was almost powdery with a very light musk note coming through, it did grow on me as the day went by and I really would consider buying a bottle,

It is however a little more on the feminine side so it all depends how it sits on your skin.

I would however highly recommend getting a sample to try if you can. It is very long lasting and the projection is great! It is for sure a complement getter!

I tried this at Gucci yesterday and from the scent pillow they had I got a delicate feminine cloud of powdery white linen in a light perfectly delicately blended way... "whoa, amazing" was my impression. I had to order it because they were out but I cant wait to get it. It could be a game changer which is why I forked over the 350 for it. To be contd.
I got decants if anyone is interested. Airy green floral with a nice musky dry down. Message me on insta with the same name as here.

Copied and pasted from review on new version (before this version was added to the database):

idressyou 08/20/10 14:53

This is for the original cologne concentree version. Initially, I get almost pure hyacinth, with a smidge of Spanish cedarwood, with the cedarwood becoming more prominent as the drydown continues. I have a jar of hyacinth tincture I made from purple hyacinths picked from my yard, and this is almost spot-on. I haven't tried the reformulation, but the original is very pretty and a must-try for hyacinth lovers.

The vintage one I have (comes in a dark plastic bottle) is pleasant, but reminds me very strongly of the smell of 80's, 90's hair salons. Whether it smells similar to hairspray or perming fluid I don't know, but it makes me think of bad teenage haircuts :(

(I have the rectangular pocket spray with the word concentree having an accent over the second 'e'). This is a beautiful perfume. After a few moments of initial spray on my inner elbow smell very similar to a Anais Anais by Cacharel's dry down (nod to @Kentington, whose review I only looked at after I began writing this review and noted the Anais Anais similarity). I believe I can detect all but a few of the notes. Thankfully for me the tuberose and hyacinth are neither loud nor cloying which would have steered me away. My takeaway: flowery, muted vanillic woods with a dollop of aldehydes that is the glue that holds it all together and keeps it sparkly. Very lovely and classy.

I had this, wore it, and loved it. It was marketed for women-- not unisex as labelled here.

Yes, it was a beautiful floral, but grounded so well that there were no high-pitched, fly-away notes. IMO, a "wearable" masterpiece.

For the guys who might be interested in this one...while "unisex" certainly applies to perfume in general, and you should wear what you want and not worry about what labels go on things (blah blah)...this is VERY floral. Reminds me a great deal of Anais Anais, but instead of an almost salty lily note, it's the powdery hyacinth from Chamade with a sweetish dry-down. If green-powdery florals are your thing, then this one is your perfume...but if your idea of "unisex" is a variation on the classic citrus colognes, then you're probably not gonna like it.
I always think that One by Calvin Klein is the first unisex fragance ... Is Eau de Gucci Concentree really unisex??? in the comparison charts Anais Anais is: a totaly femenine fragance

This perfume is beautiful- and it saddens me that it was so short lived, and that many have forgotten it, or confuse it with the far inferior 1993 reformulation. Maybe a fresh floral missed the zeitgeist by a decade, as we were heading into the 1980s powerhouses when this was launched. It is a wonderful lesson in how something can be floral, yet not cloying, pretty, without being soaked in vanilla, like so many current "pretty" scents.

I had this, on a denim printed packaging with the Gucci ribbons, and I loved it.
