Flora is about the ONLY strong floral that I can enjoy. It's just sweet enough to tone down the often-harsh white florals whilst drying down to a creamy sandalwood base. It's fresh and beautiful and sophisticated while still being youthful. A much better scent than any recent Gucci creation, in my opinion.

It is one of the few perfumes (Angel, Black Orchid, Le Male) that lasts all day on my dry skin. Sillage is amazing so it can be quite strong for those around you. When wearing Flora during the day I like to walk through the spritz or spray it on my skin before dressing. I have made myself sneeze with a couple of early liberal applications!

I have yet to smell Flora on anyone but myself so it could be a unique signature for a lucky woman. And the glass bottle is not bad to look at on your vanity either.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: i have a 50 mill bottle edt 90% full to swap i live in newzealand ;]

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This is light and pleasant and good for work. I like the streak of rose that emerges. And the faint (ever so faint) fruit keeps it bright and energetic. It does have what I call a "thin veil" aura about it, the same one that appears in Bvulgari, D&G, and Guerlain florals. It's not quite the same smothering a veil as in some of those lines, which is why I can wear this. I think No. 5 Premiere is more classy, and if I had to choose, would go with Premiere. But this is certainly a winner and manages to be both modern and old fashioned at the same time. I will like to find this lingering on my blouses.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: One of my favorite perfumes its amazing and I just LOVE IT!!!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: my top fevoret one

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Fell in love when i first smelled it, so girly and sweet :)

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
Floral and citrus. i do get some pepper which adds a little kick. while sweet it isnt the marshmellow type of sweet. for a floral i kind of like this one. a day time fragrance that could be worn to work. a spring or summer fragrance. every now and then i get a vanilla quality which is really nice. it is a bit tart smelling, which i think when paired with the pepper makes it a little more sophisicated. i tend to like more unisex fragrances, but i think i could wear this in spring. it kimda makes me think of eating a pastry outside in spring with a glass of oj for breakfast.

i asked my husband and he said peppery vanilla. i really like this.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Very fresh citrus in the opening, and sweet at the same time. However about an hour in when the citrus fades it turns into a rather generic floral. The opening is the most interesting part. It's inoffensive and light and good for the office. However it doesn't really stand out very well.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Overpowering floral scent which causes you a headache and nausea.....It's not of my favourite Gucci's perfumes....I would highly recommend to test to your skin before purchasing

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This is litteraly pure osmanthus juice (at least on my skin). When I was young, my parents sent my brother and I to a club for a month or so in summer (we live in argentina). It was kind of like a summer camp, except we went there every year (you were admitted until.you turned 14) and we got there at 9 am and left forlunch I guess. In the club there was a huge shrub that was always surrounded by bees so we weren't allowed to go near it, it was really close to the pool area so the 'counselors/teachers' were careful with the bees. One day I took a bunch of those sticky white flowers and found out that if you took the bottom of it, pulled and removed the bulb and sucked on the 'straw' (how we used to call it) you would taste a honey-like sweet substance. The smell of the shrub itself was sweet, this translated wonderfully in Flora, it's not sweet in an overtly chemical way, it's more like herbal/natural sweetness. It's not bad if you like to smell like osmanthus, but it's aswell quiye strong and my.colleagues find it quite nauseating, it lasts forever, and if overapplied can give you the barfs/headaches. If you've bought it and feel like there's something missing (in my case I like it but the osmanthus is just so weird/off putting) I found out you can use the herbal sweetener for perfumes that are extremely dry/sour (chanel 19/ chance eau fraiche/ paco rabanne metal cabotine, etc) to add a little something, this is only my experience since Flora translated into osmanthus and pink pepper, no sandalwood, no rose, nothing

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This one, for my preference, is far too sweet. I only get the slightest hint of floral before it is totally mitigated by sweet, sweet and more sweet. That's just my opinion, if you love sweet, this one is for you.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
Somehow expecting the scent will be soft in my own perception but when i apply it, i felt headache of it's smell. Its just not for me i guess. I still have a full bottle of it.
A friend of mine said this perfume is more when we have a special occassion in the evening.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
This is so over-powering when first applied. One hot mess until dry-down.

If you survive to dry-down, it develops into a well-executed floral. The mandarin orange seems to go overly sweet on my skin, almost to distraction. The base notes seem to get swallowed up as well.

Smells divine on paper and a work colleague.

Strongly recommend skin test before purchase.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I like this perfume, a great every day fragrance, for the office or on the run.
I live in a hot country and this works well it is a fresh scent, it is not overpowering and bugs aren't attracted to the sweetness.
I don't enjoy the smell of patchouli as it gives me a headache however the citrus works well with the patchouli in this case.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: NicoleO -- LOL! I'm 55 and liking Flora -- I'm feeling a bit silly, but I'm wearing it:)

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Too strong at first, but something soft cuts the edge and sends it into being a little piece of heaven on the skin...rests like a pillow--gentle, soft and flowery!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I must start by saying I am not a fan of florals. I usually going for orientals, and only tried this at a friend's suggestion. Surprisingly, there is nothing I don't like about this fragrance, and I have not stopped sniffing at my wrist since I put it on.
At first spray, I completely discounted it, but as soon as the base notes came through it was a whole new story. It's fresh and citrusy, slightly woody, and smells like spring. Flora is going straight to my Wanted list.
Now my only concern is that as Gucci is aiming this at a younger audience, and I've just hit 40, am I too old to start wearing this? Gee, I hope not!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Love this scent! I get a soft floral with a slight crispy vibe. It must be the pink pepper which works great with my chemistry. On my skin I also get a soft peony note but not overpowering.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Honestly, I never thought I would love this one...but hahahahahah I really love this one!!! I've always been the sweet and fruity type of person that always just wanted to smell sweet and edible...but this one???? I smelled it on my friend and I just have to stop her and ask what was she wearing!!!! I asked her 2 times that day and complimented on how she smelled over and over again... then I knew I need to own that perfume!!!! I was pretty shocked to know that she's wearing Gucci Flora..because I never thought I was the floral kind of girl... but this is a really lovely sweet floral scent! This is a really beautiful scent. I had the longest debate with myself whether if to get the EDT or EDP because I do want a long lasting one... but then I thought if I enjoyed how my friend smelled like so much and prolly EDP will be different as some people commented that the smell is sharper..then I think I just will not go wrong with the EDT. Anyways I don't regret it a bit since I love how it smells!!!! Seriously, your nose knows better than what you think you know about yourself!!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: One of my favorite floral scents. I don't get a lot of the citrus scent on my skin at all. It's mostly the peony and osmanthus I pick up on with a little bit of rose. I think the pink pepper and sandlewood in the dry down are really beautiful and set it apart from the standard fruity floral perfumes I'm used to smelling. It's a good balance of unique enough to stand out from the standard fruity florals but common enough (porbably thanks to the patchouli and rose) to not offend too many people when you're out in public.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This perfume is much too sweet for me -- on my skin it is sadly just a creamy scent.. no florals or fruit to be detected.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
رائع جدا ... حتى اشعر بجمال هذه الرائحة اقوم بتقليل نسبة العطر الى الكحول
100% like

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Gucci is my favorite brand perfumes. I love Flora because it make me happy and fresh. But it not long lasting because it EDT not EDP.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I recently got this perfume and i was sooo excited because when i smelt it in the sample it smelled amazing!
When i bought the actual perfume and sprayed it on me i was sooooo dissappointed, it didnt smell like the sample at all, i cant believe i spent so much money on this perfume.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I tried this perfume and fell in love with it after some minutes when the scent turned into something similar to Un Jardin Apres la Mousson by Hermès. Maybe it was the pepper in it. Definitely not a floral perfume like the others. Simply brilliant!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
Like some other reviewers, I do feel the smell is reminiscent of other scents around but I Do like it nonetheless. I like citrus notes and the pairing with roses is quite lovely.
Towards the middle, it turns warmer and I get a whiff of vanilla? A bit sweet, nicely done. Makes you feel cosy.
This is a classy, cosy, feminine scent. It doesn't need to scream out loud to announce it's worth.
Unfortunately, it lasts only maybe an hour. Sillage is weak. I don't understand the sales asst who told me the edt is rather strong!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I wanted to love this..but it didn't stay on my skin..and turned as a sour smell..but the ones who love it, enjoy it!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I thought Flora was good when I first smelled it, and I bought it and I was wrong.
It's too strong, too citrus-y for me, it's almost too noisy ! I think i'm going to give this to someone.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I found Flora by an accident, as a matter a fact I didn't even know of it's existence... but a few days ago, I was on a store, and the beautiful bottle caught my eye. Well.. I have to say it was love at the first sight.. I think Flora is beautiful!! Yes, it is a very soft fragrance, very subtle indeed.. but that's why I think is great.. is tender, feminine and delicate, close to my skin.. sometimes is good to have a scent like this. I have many fragrances for almost any occasion, this one is absolutely pretty, safe and confortable.. I love Flora..

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: My boyfriend loves this on me. Says its better then juicy c.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This starts off as a pure floral, with a bitter note that I can't recognize. That note smells like black coffee to me, but others don't smell it on me. I can't detect the individual flowers, its more of a medley of floral notes. As it dries down, this becomes sweeter and powdery. I don't like that weird note though. Otherwise I would find this very pretty.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I picked this one out to redeem for the voucher out of a Sephore gift sample pack, and it is a pleasant, "safe" scent, though somewhat boring. It will not be my daily go-to scent, as it does have this "plastic" predictability along the melon or cucumber lines (but clearly synthetically rendered). Makes me think of Barbie dolls for whatever reason. It lengthens the staying power of some Miller Harris natural fragrances (which I love) like Jarmin Vert, Fleurs de Sel, or Noix de Tubereuse, so can be agood layering scent.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
i really liked this fragrance . unfortunately something ( and i really think it's the patchouli) gives me headaches. it's even so bad that i can't sleep if i wear it to bed.

it's a lovely classy fragrance.
it's definitely not something everyone will like , because it's not really common.
it's a quite original and it smells like luxury and freedom. the bottle design is fabulous definitely my Favorite!!
the osmanthus and sandelwood give it a mysterious and oriental smell while the peony and the citrus make it a bit lighter.
i hate it that it gives me such head aches otherwise i would wear it everyday!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: i have a strange relationship with this one. I always liked it, but was not able to commit to be wearing it regularly. Not a signature scent kind of smell i guess, but very intriguing and sexy and unique

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I had this perfume for 3 years straight it was defo my signature perfume, the parfum one is better but more expensive so i stuck to this one, sweet floral goodness, love it, i got slightly bored of it for wearing it qll the time but i will defo go back to it soon, i wouldn't be bored forever its too nice, perfect for a night out in the summer, its lasting power is really good aswell

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
The very nice lookalike notes of Gucci Flora may make you think that it is a very well behaved, nice, interesting floral which smells somewhat like J'adore, by Christian Dior. However, do not be fooled; the notes may look very pleasing, but the fragrance itself is what you may sigh at and say "Oh dear".

This fragrance smells like a very light, soft floral. It's too soft to notice. I think the killer for this fragrance is the osmanthus. Osmanthus generally smells very nice, and it requires a very nice background of other notes to maintain that sort of a stature. Gucci Flora is completely lacking that va-va-voom temperament.

When you spray this on your skin, it smells very clean. Not sweetishly clean, but just clean. I enjoy catching small whiffs of it on others, but on my skin, it screeches like metal being rubbed on road. A very close friend of mine loves this stuff, and she thinks I'm making a niminy-piminy old fuss over something that smells very unique and complex. I'm sorry but that's the thing to which I heartily disagree.

Well, Flora really didn't do the trick for me. Try it if you may, but be careful; this squeaky clean floral is not as innocent as it seems to be.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
imho i think there is a rotten note in the back ground of this perfume ,you know the smell of rotten water that has been left in a plastic bottle for a year or the smell of rotten laundry that didn't dry properly in humid weather..now that we talked about the rotten part we can move on o the better part,i think its a young perfume made for younger girls,light floral i get the notion that it has flora bacteria that lives in the guts..
it smells like cheaper perfumes from the one dollar shop or imitations made in china..and i am really serious about the after rotten smell ,as soon as you smell it everything is nice fresh and sweet and floral but nothing crisp then immediately you get that rotten note that i cant stand even when it dries down it develops in to two distinct notes a rotten one and a weird rotten floral one ..
perfume ratting 2 out of 5
bottle rating 3 out of 5

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I was shaking my head in disbelief when I got a sample of this and tried it without a hope in the world to like it - I just don't go for pure florals, they don't shine on me , they are too discreet and I usually stand out of the crowd here in Germany (a tatar-mongolian blood is running deep there somewhere), plus my skin practically absorbs most floral perfumes. The sample was eau de toilette, and i sort of gave up on it before even trying. I thought - alright, i'll have my 5-minute fun smelling the wrist and then i'll say good-bye to yet another vanishing-all-to-quickly floral. Well, well.. 4 hours later I am trying to figure out where this amazing smell is coming from, then i brush my nose past my wrist accidentally, and it strikes me: FLORA! First of all, I don't believe that eau de toilette in a sample is the same as eau de toilette in regular sizes. Samples are marketing devices, so i bet my bottom dollar that the strength here is amplified. Ignoring this, I must say: this is one of the most well-blended florientals out there. It reminds me a little of ROSE ABSOLUE by Yves Rocher because it has this creamy leather base that gives the scent depth and staying power. Also, I find it quite amazing, that a scent, targeted at a spring/summer season works so well in winter! - this is so seldom found in fresh florals, if at all actually. The only thing I don't like is the name: flora hardly suggests character or gives your imagination a kick. Currently on a hunt for an eau de perfume, hoping it will also be issued in pure perfume at some point. A keeper.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Light, fresh, very citrus oriented. Perfect for spring/summer. Also the EDT lasts for so long, people have complimented me on this hours after I first sprayed. The citrus and florals have a musky sweet undertone but its by no means an overall sweet perfume. Very sophisticated and carefree.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
This perfume reminded me of my childhood memories of being in a 5 star hotel. The scent is classy, prim and proper, uncomfortable yet respectable. For some, this scent may mean nothing special, but if worn by a sophisticated woman, this would surely create an impression.

If too many girls would use this perfume, sure, it will smell ordinary. Besides, most can afford to buy this perfume making it ordinary.

A neatly tied hair, casual-formal clothes and a strong personality would give justice to its scent. A laid-back personality wont do.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
The best floral fragrance in my opinion that is not too dominated by crisp "white floral" notes like tuberose... for this it can suit younger ages and doesn't smell "mature." Not as fresh-smelling and green, however, as a scent like Beautiful by Estee Lauder.

Has a soft sweet/powdery drydown.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: The reviews have been saying this fragrance is light and crisp and floral, yet when I tried this on my skin, the specific combination of notes blended together conjured up a fluffy, airy vanilla! Nice, but I'm not in love.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
smells sooooo 90's !!!! I remeber when I was a child back then all the lady perfumes smelled like that !!! that floral hard to figure out the notes kindda perfume & once u read about it u discover its got over 17 notes in it !!!
wrong perfume in the wrong era....

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I just smelled it and I thought it smells vey rosy and peppery, with some light hints of woods and patchouli. No white florals or citrus. I actually really like it!!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
This perfume is really floral and feminine.
I like it. :)

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
i LOVE LOVE LOVE this perfume! It's so fresh and perfect and not overpowering. I feel beautiful wearing this.
Great sillage, i just need to spray 2~3 times and it's enough for people to notice the fragrance but not intrusively annoying. I put it in the morning, and can still smell it by the time the office hour is over. I wear a lot of perfume, but this is the only perfume that I won't mind to buy over and over again.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: i do not dislike this, but this is another generic, safe, floral.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I first sprayed a bit of this on in Sephora and thought little of it while I was doing some shopping. Then I kept smelling myself and couldn't stop. This was love. I made the mistake of spraying both this and fraiche on seperate arms and couldn't remember which was which, so I had to hunt it down again, but I know I love it:)
The main reason for my obsession? No headache. That is really hard for me to find. I can smell things on others and love them, but when I carry the scent all day I nearly cry. This scent didn't do that at all. Calming, even creamy blend of uniquely unoffensive notes. Love!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: flora by gucci gives such a sweet smell thru out my day that i kept taking deep breaths just to take in its lovely smell. it doesn't give me those nose-sting smell even at first spray. for me, it last quite a long time coz after i retire from a day's work, it still smell fresh on my skin, even if i just sprayed a little here and there on my clothes. very nice indeed!!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Very beautiful, youthful smelling floral. It's an extremely fresh scent, very spring-like.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: very nice perfume

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
Gucci Flora is the kind of a fragrance that I call "safe" . safe because its not too much and not 'not enough". Its perfectly balanced.

It smells of lovely flowers with citruses , a bit sweet and a bit sour. Very light, perfect for work and any occasion. Maybe not very sophisticated but definately has got that something . I love wearing it during a day it makes me feel so ...ligh and fresh.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I've had this scent for more than two years now, and it still serves as my favourite! The parfum, eau fraiche and garden collection don't compare to this original scent. This scent is so distinct and special, I intend to keep this as my signature scent!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
WOW! This turned out to be beautiful scent i shouldnt have judged it,i thought it would have been a strong,floral,mature scent and head-achy.
After testing it i realized it doesnt give me a head ache and it smells very classy and can be day or night,i imagine a woman with classic,polished style and an independent,strong yet loving and kind personality.
I couldnt stop smelling it when it was tested, i dont own it but maybe if i grow to become such a woman one day.. i definitely would :)

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: i like this perfume. it has a nice floral/vanilla/citrus scent. its defiantly something you could wear every day as its not overpowering.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: The BEST Perfume for me. Love it so much much much

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Very Elegant,classy. i love it so much very nice!!!!!!!!!!!!!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I've just sprayed this perfume on my skin n I have waited for about 15-20 minutes like that..okay,now I wanna give my sincere comment on gucci flora.

the first spray of it,i smelled zesty-citrusy like scents..then it quickly turned to be floral..i mean,totally floral scent..i don't know what kind of flower that the perfumer used in this perfume.then as it dries down,it turned to be woody-spicy-gingery-balmy n a little bit oriental like scent.


frankly,gucci flora had made me happy n curious to know everything about it.why did I say so is because I am able to tell how the scents are like from the first spray of it,on my skin.so,i quickly turned on the wifi n search for fragrantica.com.the question that came across in my mind was : what kinda compositions that gucci flora has?


luckily,all my guesses are almost correct..there's citrus fruit in it,rose,osmanthus n peony flower...sandalwood,pink pepper n patchouli..the pink pepper n patchouli reminds me of my favourite perfume n that is chance by chanel.it's really a mature scent for me.


Anyway,gucci flora to me is an aristrocrat-like fragrance.it also pictures a woman with elegance n timeless beauty like the princess of monaco,grace kelly..this perfume also has an expensive-smelling kinda fragrance..initially I thought it only suitable for rich n famous people..but I was wrong..it is humbly made as a universal fragrance..which means anyone can use it regardless of who you really are...gucci flora is also classy n sophisticated fragrance..


I used to dislike this perfume last time because it has strong scents n somewhat unpleasant n made me headache..but it's been a while i didn't wear this perfume...so i finally gave myself a second chance,like what i did to chance by chanel..maybe my olfactory senses has improved...and i'm liking it now...thank God.I prefer to wear this perfume in night time..
For those who like light n airy floral scents,i recommend you guys try this one..if u prefer gucci flora to stay longer on your skin,try the edp version.this edt is a lighter ones n the lasting power isn't as good as the edp.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I love citrus perfumes and this is definitely not my type of scent. I got it as a gift and used it a couple of times and I must say that it's anything but fresh. It is nauseatingly floral, makes me feel old and it has a kind of a disgusting undertone. When I got it I thougt that it's a neutral scent that would not offend anyone. Having used it for a short while, I hate it. Smelling it makes me sick and I'm glad that nobody I know uses it.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This is an okay perfume. I'm not a fan of citrus perfumes, I gotta say I'm more of a sweet perfume person but I don't mind using it. I'm definitely not going for a second bottle... really nothing special.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This is a very clean and light scent. It smells amazing but it is too weak for my tastes...if this had some more staying power and was a couple of notch's louder I would buy some in a heartbeat. I am actually surprised that this one is so weak being that it is Gucci...they usually have better lasting power with their fragrances. And for the money they charge for this I would have expected better. This could almost be like a body spray or splash.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Think this scent shouldn't offend anyone, it's pleasant, but quite plain. Expected better really, has no power, i barely smell it when wearing it. Def not worth the cost

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
1.not as simple as it seems
2.quiet longlasting on my skin
3.a pleasent freindly scent
4.looks adorable
5.a little different from other gucci frags

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
1.nothing special. an unmemorable scent.
2.no lasting power.
a disappointment for a GUCCI perfum.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I love this scent. It's gorgeous florals for men. (Very unisex.)

It's a shame that my bottle had very poor longevity and projection. This could have been in my everyday rotation if it was stronger.

Bought from Jomashop.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: it's the edp but way harsher on the nose. i liked this better at first but then promptly switched to the edp after wearing this one time. i would only get edp.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Gucci Guilty EDT is a well-known fragrance that leans into a classic aromatic profile. It opens with a fresh citrus note that’s clean and pleasant, followed by lavender and patchouli that give it a slightly old-school vibe.

It’s versatile and easy to wear, especially for casual or office settings. However, for me personally, it didn’t stand out enough to make a lasting impression. It’s safe and inoffensive, but lacks the uniqueness I look for in a signature scent.

Performance is moderate, with decent longevity and soft projection.
Overall, it’s a solid choice for someone new to fragrances or looking for something familiar — but I likely won’t repurchase, as I prefer scents with a bit more character.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Best gucci guilty, its a shame they discontinued it. Get it before it's goes up in price.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: First I am feeling like it is ok but later it is getting horrible. I am not sure what it is but something makes me dislike it. Not for me.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme is a citrusy, powdery and aromatic fragrance.

It is a fresher version of the original fragrance, although it retains much of the DNA of the Guilty Pour Homme line. In this fragrance, citrus and musk are accentuated, and orris is added, which gives it a powdery sensation and is a litlle more elegant than EDT.

Guilty Eau Pour Homme is the freshest of the entire line, and a good option to use during spring and summer, mainly in casual situations.

His longevity with me was good, more than 9 hours. and sillage better than others in the Guilty Pour Homme line.

It seems that was discontinued, but if you can find it a good price and you like the Guilty Pour Homme line is a good flanker.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I admit I'm old fashioned, I guess. Powdery scents on men make me think of my grandfather, who wore the old style barbershop powdery fougeres, and sweet makes me think of female-marketed perfume, so this one had me very puzzled. It starts nicely fresh with the citrus, but the dry down is full on, whole sugar cotton candy powder. It seems like it can't decide what it wants to be, a fruity powdery sweet female slanted scent or a fresh citrusy men's cooler. It doesnt' even strike me as really unisex, because it's too freshly citrus to be a modern 'feminine' scent and too super sweetly powdery to be male. I of course acknowledge that gender tags on fragrance are limiting, outdated and purely used for marketing, but still, being used to 'masculine' being bold, bracing woody and 'feminine' being candy sweet powdery fruitiness, this one has me puzzled.

There's nothing inherently wrong with it, but it sure doesn't settle much on me. Try before committing to a full bottle, but you wont' be disgusted. You might be confused like me though.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Bought this recently and I really like it. Great for everyday wear in the summer or right out of the shower. Brighter than most of the GG line and I really enjoy the citrus. Could be an office scent, but I like it as a casual attire fragrance. Not a trendsetter but definitely likable and a compliment attractor.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Very, very generic and has quite poor performance... the scent is pleasant enough but I only reach for this when I am fresh out of the shower and want to spray something on that won't be around long enough to compete with whatever fragrance I will actually be wearing for the day.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
This fragrance was a pleasant surprise. This one (Guilty Eau) and the Guilty EDP are easily the best of the line IMO. The entire Guilty line, to me, is well done but I certainly understand how the original, and some of its flankers like the Black or Intense, can be labeled as boring or generic. They’re very safe, kind of synthetic, but undeniably pleasant and appealing to the masses.

I was blown away by the EDP version for the risk it took, and it was such a bold and daring direction for the line, and I smell A LOT of the EDP formulation here in Eau. These two seem to be the ones that try to break from the mold and take a few risks, and it pays off in spades.

Eau is very fresh, but it’s not a generic “freshie”… it’s pretty rich and complex honestly, a beautiful mix of citrus/fruity flavors with some musk and spice to really add depth and solidify the fragrance. At first sniff it may seem deceptively light and airy, and it is compared to the others, but it’s still very rich and pretty deep for an EDT/Eau variety. It’s rounded out by this underlying woody/floral/musky warmth which can give it an almost powdery, barbershop-like vibe in certain stages, which I really like. It feels rejuvenating and refreshing, but fairly classy and relaxing at the same time.

Longevity is also surprisingly great on my skin, and I think it’s super easy to go nose blind to. At first I thought it was just okay as far as longevity, but I sprayed myself three times before bed and woke up 6-8 hours later and it still smelled amazing on skin, the drydown stage is really nice and relaxed. I always feel people REALLY exaggerate when it comes to longevity on this site anyway, it’s kind of ridiculous. I could wear this in any season, it’s really versatile, though it seems to do best in average temperature, not overly hot as it is very rich and fairly sweet.

Along with the EDP, hands down the best in the line by a long shot.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Simply smells like cheap lemon toilet cleaner with some the dry down better with a sweet lavender bergamot lemon mix still super boring to me. Dont blind buy

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: safe, mass-appealing. hard to hate this one. also hard to love it

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
This is the best scent for office!!
this frag is good for climate-controlled environment on which u wont get sweaty then only u will get good longevity with this one... i have tried spraying from 12noon and the base notes lasts on my skin til 1am for my bedtime shower, so i guess this one suits my body chemistry or because m not sweating at all.. so I suspect Gucci made this for men that does not sweat few gallons a day!! HAHA
for me this frag does not smells boring at all since am all about citrusy scents ever and patchouli as base probably gave it that unique character to this frag.
so am keeping this frag as my signature scent forever.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme and Guilty Black was what I wore mainly in my last years of college back when I had no interest in collecting fragrances. And to this day, these two fragrances are still some of the best in the designer market. Guilty Eau is much better than the original, as it isnt sweet and heavy. Instead it is airy, silky, and more elegant. There's definitely lavender in this as well, just like the original. In addition to all of this, I can't help but be reminded of Masculin Pluriel here. In a lot of ways these two share a similarity somewhere. I would go as far as to say this is practically MP without the leather and vetiver. Needless to say, Eau Pour Homme brings back great memories to me and it is one I hold dearly and close to the heart.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I smell Versace pour homme but a bit darker. It’s not bad.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Dont mind the hate. This is awesome.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
_i wanted to give gucci a chance

_too simple

_not bad but almost monotonous , so that it can touches on uselessness

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Really I discovered that fragrance but ıt was my favourite in short time. Better than classic guilty as quality. Especially that is suitable for daily using and every style wearing.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Jalen Ramsey’s signature scent. When I watched his GQ video series on the top 10 things he can’t live without, this was on there. I knew I had to try it. This is so good, quality stuff. My girlfriend really likes this too. This doesn’t get enough love on YouTube but it’s a top dog in the compliments category. Hidden gem.



Rating: 8.25/10
Compliments: 8.5/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Great opening, drydown is nice. But the perfomance sucks.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I have never paid attention to this 1 until today. It smells nice, clean, fresh, citrus on top but it has lousy performance. Such a shame.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Smells generic, save your money and buy something else

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
It smells quite good, but it's soft and doesn't last long enough. It was more like I didn't wear anything today. No reminders throughout the day of my scent at all. Smells a little bit like a few others I've tried, which is kinda odd. I resprayed when I got home and this is just not strong enough to warrant using. Not sure what do with this.

Smell - 3.5/5
Performance 1.5/5

Buy Again? Only if were really cheap.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
This cologne is so good it has that masculine musk dna of the Gucci signature smells expensive. Is quite underrated but is a lady killer for sure . This cologne is a must wear with not very casual clothes is not a cologne for jeans and joggers . With this cologne you should wear at least some kind of decent pants or top notch clothes to give the blend of masculinity and sexiness . Great compliment for girls that like masculine fragrances . Compliments are from the milf side tho.
Longetivity: 8/10
Uniqueness : 9/10
Performance :8/10
Price :7/10
Compliments :8/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: The scent of perfume is quite versatile, can be used for both day and night in the spring, autumn and winter. Can use when going out or dating his girlfriend for added romance

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Goodbye, Gucci Guilty Eau. It seems I've outgrown you! Once you were my favorite of the Gucci Guilty line, sharp, refined, versatile, long lasting, and perfect for a professional environment. Now you're not so sharp, just a hodgepodge of softer notes, vying for my attention. Maybe Club De Nuit Intense burned my nostrils away? Maybe experiencing other scents changed my tastes? Either way, it was fun for a while, but now I have to say goodbye to you. I wish you the best. Please don't hate me for my new love affair with Gucci Guilty Absolute. It's nothing personal...

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: It really surprises me that no one has mentioned how much this smells like Chanel Homme Sport Eau Extreme. It reminds me almost exactly of it but the Chanel has better longevity about 8 hours on the Chanel, 4-5 on this Gucci. It's quiet, unassuming, a little icy and a lot smooth. It's a nice fragrance. The one thing I notice about this Gucci when compared to the Chanel, is the Gucci has a slight fizz scent in it. I don't want to say root beer but more like a light root beer in vanila ice cream fizz. It's not bad at all but unless you see a huge price difference between it and the Chanel, you'd be better off going with the Chanel. In my area, Gucci still brings a fairly high price at $79 a bottle for this. I can get the same size bottle of the Chanel for roughly the same price.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
This is a great fragrance for summer day/night it smells so classy and fresh at the same time.Don`t judge by negative reviews on the original,yes they smell identical but this is more watery/airy,more easy to wear i think.

On my skin this lasts up to 10h maybe sometimes less but 6-7 h guaranteed with moderate projection! So if you find this on a good price grab it. 4/5 for me!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
If you will pick one from Gucci Guilty lineup, "eau" is the best in opinion. Exclude guilty absolute as it is totally different fragrance.

The additon of orris "iris" and snowberry takes the ordinary guilty DNA to another level. It is very pleasant, fresh, semi-sweet and unique enough. Light but with depth.

Beautiful.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Guilty Eau is a fresher version of the original Gucci Guilty. It has an opening like white, iced lemonade—with a clarity and refreshment factor that is simply out-of-this-world. This formula most notably replaces lavender and cedar with snowberry and orris root, which makes the fragrance a lot smoother and sweeter, with a sparkling tinge off the top like pure fallen snow.

It's literally what gives this fragrance its glow and makes it so enjoyable. And the aromatic effect that it adds is so divine. It's almost like walking through some snow-covered woods, and you can literally smell the snowy freshness from off top the bushes, with a crisp, icy tinge of the berries and petitgrain that brings the whole atmosphere full-circle.

The freshness factor alone makes Guilty Eau such a pleasure to wear. The fragrance is light and non-offensive. It does just as well in the winter as it does in the summer in my opinion—and could even be suitable for work given its versatile, and universally appealing qualities.

For all those people that wished for a "perfected" version of the original Guilty—Guilty Eau is very likely to be that wish come true.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Second best of the Guilty line, sweet, amazing smelling, can't go wrong with it. A must own.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
This was my first perfumes that i bought,
It has alot of memory,the scent of citrus so beauty,dried down with soft musky patchoulli scent,suitable for casual ocassions and for teenagers out there must try this! Highly recommend!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: For me this Eau version is definitely a heavy aromatic scent, with faint lemon (except during the extremely short-lived opening), and is mainly composed of huge loads of oris root, and a good amount of patchouli. It's one of those smells that are heavy on my lungs.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
This is a very pleasant fragrance!
You really can't go wrong with this one. I think you will get moderate to strong staying power with this and will definitely smell fresh and classy with this on.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: For me this is the best of Guilty line by far ! Fresh, inoffensive, clean, sweet with a floral soft touch. Longevity and projection to my skin are decent.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Wore this for a test today and it went over very well with the ladies at my office. However, I was less enthused, LOL! Which is to be expected, because I don't love woody scents all that much. However, this was overall a very good scent, with a strong "fresh" aroma that was quite pleasant.

It's just hard to get excited by being so fresh and clean, you know what I mean? I enjoyed the musk and patchouli base notes, of course, but then those are reliable for me, as always.

It was fine, I was told I still smelled quite fragrant at least 5 hours later.

And in fact, my co-worker loved it so much, I gave her the rest of my sample so she could entice her boyfriend to use it. So, for me, though enjoyable, it will be a one and done scent for me. Just not the style I go for.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: It takes a confident man to pull this one off. It's a clean, crisp floral scent and that's it. No powderiness or musk to my nose. If you've ever smelled a bouquet of blue flowers, you've smelled this. Most will like it (including myself), even though it's in no way remarkable. Longevity is 1 hour for me, after which it becomes an almost undetectable skin scent. This is not an evening fragrance in my opinion. I think it goes best with casual attire on breezy spring or summer days. I'd say this is a unisex fragrance, but certainly more masculine than feminine. It's also arguably the best in the Guilty line, despite that being a non-boastworthy achievement. Safe blind-buy for anyone that enjoys floral scents.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I LOVE THIS ONE!!!! i dont care am a lady but i love wearing this fragrance... the citrus smells sooooo good it blends well with musk and patchouli, i would say this the only citrus fragrance i would wear as a lady (i dont like flowery citrusy on women perfume), it did not smells too masculine to me LOL

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
It is nothing so special about this scent, a big name and another patchouli musky floral scent. It is grouped as a woody aromatic.
The smell is pleasant, but the projection and longevity is far beyond its price and expectation!
You need to test this on your skin few times before you decide to buy it or be a gucci maniac ;), otherwise, do not waste your money and there are tons of far better scents out there.
I would say gucci guilty man is suitable to wear in spring/summer mornings.
The combination of orange blossom, orris and snowberry makes this a nice light citrus white floral powdery scent, but what a disappointment when it fades away after an hour and becomes a skin scent!
In my opinion:
Scent: 8/10
Projection: 6.5/10
Longevity: 6/10
Price: not so cheap
Overall: 7/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Gucci as Armani, Ralph Lauren and Paco Rabanne were becaming factories, no more originals noses for doing icononics and amazing fragances ... Several flankers as Guilty and Pour Homme ... No more masterpieces like Envy, L Art or III ...

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: We just recently got this in our store. At first it does smell like Gucci Guilty but after it sits for 20 minutes it deff smells like a fresher version. It still has that slightly sweet tone to it but it smells nice. If you already have gucci guilty then i would not purchase it. But if you never have a gucci then check it out. Great work fragrance

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
To me, this scent is a perfect blend of Versace Pour Homme and Burberry Brit Rhythm, both of which are favorites in my collection. I never would've imagined something that was at the midway point between the two though, because they're such different scents! Brit Rhythm is leathery with deep fruity notes. Versace Pour Homme is aquatic with florals. Combining them? No way. But Gucci Guilty Eau does exactly that! This is an improvement on the original Gucci Guilty in every way.

Longevity for me is perfect and it just barely lasts noticeably through a 9 hour work day, which is perfect. Today I can even still smell it under my shirt over 16 hours later! Mind you, that's under my shirt. It won't last that long on skin.

Bottom line: Forget everyone's comments about synthetic this and generic that. It smells good, period!

Wear what you like, and like what you wear.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
OMG! Another Gucci Guilty fragrance that smells like every other Gucci Guilty fragrance. It's not a bad fragrance (pleasant, synthetic, people-pleaser) but come Gucci...an original thought, concept, idea and perhaps a somewhat original men's fragrance would be welcomed.

I give this one a 5/10 based purely on the scent alone. But it earns a barnacle encrusted anchor for being so dull, boring and a clone of a copy of a clone. What's Next? Charro schlocking, "Gucci Cuchi-Cuchi Guilty? It's no wonder why Gucci has fallen to being one of my least favorite designer houses. Ugh!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I've tried this many different times in dept. stores and also recently got a sample of this with a bunch of other samples, so I was able to really test it out better on my skin.

I don't think it's bad, it's a safe scent for sure. But just does nothing for me at all. Seems like there's a ton of other fragrances that are just like this or in the same vein. It just doesn't really stand out in any way to me. Also I'm a fan of sweeter scents so that may have some bearing on my opinion. This is a fresher citrus based scent that doesn't have much sweetness at all.

So this just falls into that gray area for me, where I don't love it nor hate it, it's just kinda there. Not something I would wear.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Boring, synthetic and thin citruses on top of some non-descript musk and bland woody sweetness.

I get a tiny hint of orange blossom and perhaps a smidge of patchouli if I really stretch my imagination.

Other than that, it's pure nothing. The same basic sweet, cheap and thin shit they've been bottling ever since the original.

Honestly, it drives me nuts. Balmain Homme is in a similar style, yet somehow manages to actually smell good and slightly creative. It is possible to do a fresh sweet scent that actually has some quality to it. Why must Gucci insist to fail every time?

Perhaps I am being unfair. I know the Gucci by Gucci line has been a big hit for Gucci, the Guilty possibly an even bigger hit. And credit where credit is due - Gucci by Gucci Pour Homme is decent.

I just know that Gucci can do so much better. They gave us Envy for men and Pour Homme I & II.

Why can't they show just a teeny tiny bit of creative and possible release something that's actually good? I'm not looking for a fragrance lovers fragrance at all, just a great scent. Paco Rabanne did it with 1 Million, Viktor & Rolf did it with Spicebomb.

Both of those are sweet and mainstream, but damn decent in their own rights.

Please Gucci, get your act together.

Longevity is fairly non-existant. 2 hours tops.

Rating: 1/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Smelled this at a sephora and it smells like a "lighter" less potent Dior Homme Eau (the blue liquid one). The comparison didn't hit me instantly because of its general lack of potency but it is 95% DHEau. Redundant purchase if you have any of the DH line or GG line.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I ran into this new Gucci Guilty flanker at Ulta.. At first I thought it was the same old Gucci Guilty because the bottles are almost identical but soon I realized that it was the new Gucci Guilty Eau, so I gave it a spray on a tester strip.. This is just my first impression of this new flanker.. Gucci Guilty Eau opens up very reminiscent of the original Gucci Guilty just a bit brighter & fresher! Fresh citrus top notes lead to a very fresh floral heart which than leads to a patchouli and musk base.. Gucci Guilty Eau smells a whole lot like the original Gucci Guilty except it is lighter, brighter, & fresher! There is no lavender here, instead there is amped up citrus & florals.. Lots of fresh florals like snowberry & orris compliment the prominent orange blossom heart.. The patchouli base is still there but it is a much lighter patchouli this time around.. I am not sure if this Eau flanker was really necessary being that Gucci Guilty Black already was basically just a fresher cleaner version of Guilty.. It does seem to perform very well, especially for an Eau flanker.. If you do not like the original Gucci Guilty or the Gucci Guilty Black flanker than I doubt you will like this one.. But if you do enjoy the other Gucci Guilty fragrances than you might really like this one! This is basically the Gucci Guilty for hot summer days! But when all is said and done, shame on you GUCCI! Shame on you for discontinuing all the great quality classic Gucci fragrance to release endless flankers of mediocre fragrances..

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Tried this at a perfumery today, first blast
smelled very good, so i thought id go back and apply a bit more.
The second time all i got was the same smell
as guilty intense and a twist between black, to me
this seem like a pointless release, its nothing
new just a boring ok smelling fragrance, but i guess
its all about the money these days, doesnt really matter
if its a new one as long as somebody buys it anyway.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: This is the best fragrance Of 2015. It reminds me of the classic YSL homme with a modern twist. Simple, elegant and fresh.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Another flanker of Guilty really Gucci? Gucci Guilty Eau? As if the original Gucci Guilty wasn't already fresh and inoffensive enough? Mind you Gucci Guilty Black is already a fresher version of the original Guilty, which I found quite odd since the name of the fragrance is "Guilty Black".. I really thought that since Frida Giannini was gone that Gucci would go back to creating unique, quality, fragrances that they were known for when Tom Ford was around.. Gucci how about before you decide to release endless mediocre flankers to very average smelling fragrances how about you bring back the classic quality fragrance that Gucci was known for.. Envy & Envy for Men, Rush & Rush for Men, Eau de Parfum & Pour Homme!

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
At the very beginning, the fragrance opens with a slightly coniferous nuance and a hint of balsamic warmth, I assume this comes from the vetiver.
The opening feels rich and dense, almost enveloping. As it unfolds, the composition becomes softer, revealing a pleasant delicate sweetness, lightness, and femininity.

Overall, the scent feels warm, elegant, and perfectly in harmony with its name. It also evokes an association with autumn and fallen leaves 🍂

Alberto Morillas is truly a master 👏🏻 creating such a soft and elegant fragrance from this rather complex pyramid is pure artistry!

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I have many perfumes and a hundred perfume sample decants and I rarely find something that feels "me". This one is earthy with notes that are classically male but somehow still feels feminine. Perfect, love it.

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I love this scent a lot. For me the opening and heart of the fragrance are very unisex, but the dry down was a bit feminine, mature and powdery. I'm relieved I dont like the dry down because I really can't afford to love this as much as I love the rest of it. I'm wearing it today in 90F heat. Inside, in the cold air-conditioning, it's sweet amber and smokey patchouli. When I wear it outside it lives up to its name. It reminds me of the very dry dead grass at the end of summer with the smell of the flowers that have dried in the heat. After an hour hitting golf balls at the range it's still lingering close to my skin. I personally like this more in the cold weather months.

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This one is one of my faves and go-tos. Kinda reminds me of Oud Wood from Tom Ford. Love it is much

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This is definitely a spicy, dark patchouli scent like others have mentioned. I dont normally enjoy scents like this so my review might be a little biased but I will say, it's not very overpowering on the dry down so it's better than most dark patchouli-woody scents ive tried.
Even if you're into this type of scent I don't really find it worth it because of its hefty price tag. I dont think its anything special either, its a smell ive gotten from many colognes on the market but its definitely on the softer side if that makes sense. That being said, It's definitely a unisex fragrance maybe even a bit more masculine-leaning.
I dont know, other than the bottle being super stunning this is very bleh.

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is just gorgeous and perfect for fall. It’s woody, spicy, and just the right amount of sweetness shines through. It smells completely different when I smell it directly on my skin (more woody, darker) than when I smell it in the air around me (aromatic, sweet woods). It’s just special. My young daughters always tell me I smell good when I wear this, too. It has pretty good longevity for how airy it is. The Alchemist’s Garden line has some true gems in it, and The Last Day of Summer is in my top 3 I’ve tried. Beautiful natural smelling perfume of such high quality.

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: It smells like a very woody, sweet scent. I think there has to be a floral note in there as well

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Most fall focused scents that try to capture the feelings and ambience of autumn end up reminding me of fall candles. Kilian Smoking Hot is good but I get that vibe from it as well. This one hits that mark without giving me that synthetic feeling. I was finally able to aquire a discounted bottle over a year after trying it at the boutique. It just hits that vibe perfectly for me without being cloying. The cedar nutmeg combo is really great here, and it lasts a long time without shouting across a room. My friends who I've let try it, really like it, and want a bottle. Unfortunately, it's been discontinued, so many won't get a chance to check this one out without paying a truckload of money on a blind buy. Highly recommend you try it if you get a chance.

P.S. Watch out for fakes. I bought a fake bottle of Midnight Stroll from a poor guy that had no idea he'd been wearing a counterfeit, which are unsanitary and dangeroust to put on skin. The scent should be rich, elegant (midnight should be strong) and not smell cheap. Pay close attention to the bottle and packaging, and try to feel the real bottle bag so you know the texture. The draw strings on the bag should not be frayed and coming apart. I posted pictures of the counterfeit in fragram

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Quite simply - stunning, aside from Hortus Sanitatis, the best in this line
Imo

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This is dark sweet patchouli, not to sweet. If you like dark patchouli this is for you.

Edit: Am i the only one with bad performance. There is no projection, after 1h i have to put my nose against the skin to smell anything. Yes it's original, batch is from 2021. I own also Gloaming Night by Gucci and that one preforms excellent, also 2021 batch.

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Never tried it but man for the money you could get a lot more from another house.

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Being summer the worst of the seasons for me (US Gulf coast), the name caught my attention, as the end of the summer is a big reason for celebration.
I remember sampling this many years ago in a Neiman Marcus and not being impressed, which is generally the problem with testing at Department Stores where the air is filled with perfume.
Fast forward a few years, I saw this being discontinued and ordered a decant, along with one of the Voice of the Snake. It was an immediate love for me.
I get mostly cypress with nutmeg on a woody base. Maybe a little patch and fortunately I don't detect any vetiver. The composition is smooth and well-rounded, leans masculine and seems to have decent longevity.
Also, although the atomizer is cheap, the bottle is a work of art.

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: jo malone sentenced to wander forever in gucci’s garden labyrinth

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Starts out as faux, "amberous" woods. Meh. Quickly recovers into a dank and realistic patchouli hybrid. Very nice, dark greenery toned out with nutmeg. Good stuff. Unisex. If worn by a woman, has a little but of an overtly maybe, grandma vibe. Just a but. If on a man, it's suit and tie or out of place.

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Stop, do not blind buy!
I'm glad I ordered a 1 ml sample from Fragrance decant Boutique... (very nice service) ...by the way.
I was looking for a great cypress fragrance. This was hyped as the best cypress fragrance by one YouTuber.
I don't get any distinct cypress note. I get a very sweet Vetiver and nutmeg mostly.
It's pleasant and will be mass appealing. But nothing special.

Rating: 6.25/10

God bless. John 3:16

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is a really nice one. I get tart, red berries and conifer, with slightly sweet nutmeg and patchouli. This is well-rounded, and everything is blended to perfection. Red berries aren't listed, but I get them, especially in the opening. I find this to be unisex, leaning masculine. Would be great for fall/winter.

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
It’s the last day of summer!
Pull it out and wear it today, if you have it!

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I would say this scent is quite nice for about 90 minutes to 2 hours. Then it is down to almost nothing on me. The opening is the best part. The freshness of the cypress and the sweetness of the nutmeg makes for a great partnership. It’s a happy casual uplifting scent I would say. And actually more suited to fall than summer. Safe. Unisex. I would not buy a bottle because of the short half life but that’s not the same for everyone so I would encourage a trial if you like the notes or if you admire Mr Morillas, as I do.

I got a sample through surrender to chance.

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Italian Cypress was the scent that got me into fragrance, and I was heartbroken that they discontinued it....

...until now.

The perfect follow up to TF's Italian Cypress, but with more warmth and depth on the back as it opens. Stuff lasts at least 8 hours on me. Its the center of my small collection, 'nuff said.

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: As a fan of woody fragrances im a fan of this one. Woody aromatic, with faint smoky patchouli and nutmeg in the background, all well blended. Not unique but nice all year round smell. Biggest draw back is the hefty price tag unfortunately.

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I'm wearing this right now after returning from the Gucci boutique. It's nice and performance is better than most of the others except for midnight stroll and voice of the snake. I wore this in 100° temperatures and it's still on my skin 7hrs later. This is like a more user friendly version of midnight stroll but without incense.
Woody and smokey. Does it remind me of the last day of summer? No, it reminds me more of Halloween or Fall 🎃.

Not worth anything close full retail of 350.......but I do like it.

Scent 8/10
Performance 7/10

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Nah hate unisex scents. Has no character. No wearer in mind by the perfumer. Unisex scents all have one thing in common... Profit over artistic creation. The Last Day smells nice but its neither masculine or feminine. It's genderless. Thus boring

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I assumed this would be heavily masculine leaning but i am pleasantly surprised. Definitely leans a smidge masculine, but definitely still fairly unisex.

There's a very heavy coniferous, piney note here but it's well tempered by sweet earthy vetiver and the spiciness of the nutmeg.

There's a woodyness from the cedar, the patchouli doesn't feel especially present to my nose. Maybe contributes a bit to the earthyness but i can't isolate it.

The cedar and nutmeg are stronger here than the note breakdown would have you believe. In fact if i had to rank notes in terms of prominence it would be cypress > cedar > nutmeg > vetiver > patchouli.

Not ideal for a hot summer day. Probably best worn in transitory seasons like spring and fall.

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
First impression: an interesting slightly fresh herbal woods with an earthy undertone from the present but tame patchouli. Definitely get a nice texture of vines but without the prickly edges, all smoothed out. The earthiness comes across similar to anise surprisingly, but only noticeable if you Bury your nose in. Nice, but not my style.

5.5/10 (subjective)

EDIT: this grew on me, now a 7.5/10. Very calming and zen but always intriguing at the same time. Feels "complete" bc all edges have been smoothed out.

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This is a good reminder to occasionally try things outside your comfort zone. I never would have tried this frag because the notes on paper don't particularly appeal to me (and patchouli usually makes me gag) but a friend I bought a full bottle of Memo from included a carded sample, and... it turned out to be my #1 favourite frag of all time, out of the hundreds I've tried and my ruthlessly curated collection of niche. It's hard to describe its beauty. The sweetness of the nutmeg lends an almost gourmand warmth to the cedar notes, and (like a few other people here) my nose gets a not-listed smooth sandalwood-- cozy but still very elegant, like Balmain pajamas or something. Perfectly unisex, and I'd wear it in any season except maybe the hottest days of summer. Also, if the retail price is making you shrivel, I got a reasonably* affordable tester from a discounter.
*Not according to my partner, most likely ;)

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This fragrance is very high quality. I wear it like aromatherapy after a shower in the evening. when I first tested at Gucci I was surprised at how masculine it was considering how feminine the bottle is. it starts spicy and warm. it dries down very soft and very woody, although it took a few weeks for the woody scent to macerate and mature. it reminds me of a chest of drawers or antique armoire lined with aged burgundy velvet.

regarding performance: this redefines the word "eternal". it is hands down the longest lasting fragrance I own. I can easily smell this on my skin 15-20+ hours after application. with a nice long spray and sumptuously fine mist, it also happens to be the best atomizer I've ever used, and must contribute to its longevity.

9/10 overall because of its linear dry down, and heavier use can get cloying into the second day 😅

update: this woody cedar blends well under many other scents with woody bases, and blue fragrances. believe it or not even Fahrenheit layers beautifully over this, making the dry wood wet and aromatic. of course it also goes well with other Alchemist Collection scents, esp Autumn Leaves

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is such a lovely scent! starts out a little too spicy for my taste, but it settles gorgeously into something very sweet, warm, fresh that lasts and lingers in such an infectious way.

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This scent from Gucci’s haute perfumery line, the Alchemist’s Garden, allows you to cling onto a summer feeling year-round. It’s a warming, cozy scent made up of cedarwoods, cypress, and nutmeg, with woody undertones of patchouli and vetiver. Bonus: The lacquered glass bottle is super chic too.

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Will be wearing today, it’s the last day of summer! Simply a masterpiece!

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Not as woody as your would expect it to be.

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Very fresh and green scent. Patchouli certainly is strong here. The whole scent become more somber and woody later on. I was holding the nozzle the wrong way and had it all sprayed into my hand. The scent in my had was very strong at first but very quickly disappeared even while a small spray on clothing lingered on. Nice spice dry down. Certainly the longevity is not up to par with the price. Neither is the silage. Rather disappointing.

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
A dusky perfume, nostalgic. Patchouli gives it an earthy raspiness - a lasting, lingering haze, otherwise it would be about sweet resinous cypress with clean nutmeg and nice rooty vetiver.

I do think of autumn on its way - the scent of damper cooler earth amidst the aroma of mature trees. An evocative scent which has a sort of golden elegance and mystery - like September sunset on old stone.

Hmm, waxing lyrical there, but this does conjure up a walk I used to take on my return from work some years ago, through a park filled with ancient trees, then through a neighbourhood of beautiful Arts and Craft era houses.

I like it, but it's definitely one for late summer and autumn, as intended - hence the name!

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Went into Harvey Nichols looking for a heavy oriental scent and ultimately got introduced to this one. As a person who's into classy, vintagy things - I fell in love with the design on the bottle and the overall design mood of this relatively new Gucci collection. This perfume is strong and classy, it's posh in a gentle way.

Note: I don't understand why they've named it "The Last Day of Summer" - it smells like a winter scent!

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Absolutely stunning fragrance. With a small online discount on Saks, I blind bought this a few months ago and it's been love at first sniff. I'll say I have a general bias towards dry, green woody fragrances, but man, the quality of this fragrance is just undeniable. It's almost difficult to dissect, which is what makes it such a quality composition.

Bitter cedar, cypress, and earthy vetiver are met with the warmth of nutmeg and patchouli. It does have a medicinal tinge initially, but that disappears rather quickly. The way the nutmeg is used here is, dare I say, ingenious. As it warms up on your skin, its spiciness suggests sunlight, or a forest drying in the late afternoon sun. Dense, but at the same time airy and fleeting. In tandem, vetiver provides a freshly upturned earth feeling (more dry peat than wet soil). Vetiver is one of those fragrances that I generally stay away from, as synthetic or low quality vetiver in most fragrances often smells sour and gives me headaches, but this is not that. This is the vetiver that I imagine people fall head-over-heels for.

All of the materials in this fragrance forwardly express their high quality. It even feels oily, which makes the very fine spray even more impressive. And while it sits pretty close to the skin, it stays with you until the next day. I wouldn't know if it was "worth" the retail price tag (that's always subjective), but I will say I don't have any regrets buying it and will gladly buy it again when I finish this bottle.

On an unrelated note, I've expressed some embarrassment to owning a Gucci fragrance as the brand in the last few years has developed a reputation for excessive branding and tackiness, but I recently read an i-D interview with Creative Director Alessandro Michele, and while I am still not a fan of the logos and merchandising, he did convince me of the direction he's taking Gucci in. A true visionary who pulls inspiration from every imaginable corner of the universe, I'm very excited to see what other fragrances await us in The Alchemist's Garden.

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I gets cypress, woods, and some incense. It’s a great fall fragrance, and I feel like I’ve smelled it before. It really is a standout. Great fragrance. If it sold at a designer price everyone would be talking about it.

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
this is beautiful beautiful sent, and i completely forgot that i have 30++ perfumes since i got this.

this is dry, soft, calming nutty woody with very good sillage and amazing projection.

perfect for rainy day.

last 7-9 hours on my skin.

instantly become my signature scent. 9/10

ps: the bottle is to die for!

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Very nice concept. Smells amazing off the tester strip but it's way too dry on the skin. The nutmeg note is nice in small doses but it gets a bit too photorealistic sometimes and makes me feel like I have a spoonful of grated nutmeg in my mouth.

Ratings for originality but I personally don't find it good enough for a full bottle.

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Bottle, name and notes sounds really amazing ... Anybody knows where I could get this ?

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Blind bought this... and all I can say is wow...Presentation is a heavy textured white box with gold foil printing with a Victorian/baroque style all around. The lid lifts off to reveal the fragrance laying in the box atop a handsome striped ivory satchel with matching bird motif. It has the feel of an ornate coffin upon opening. The bottles are stunning and feel very high quality. Quite heavy in the hand and the cap fits so tight it could easily support the weight of the bottle when pressed on. ‘The Last Day of Summer’ is in pristine white gloss lacquer with realistic looking reflective gold print that has a slightly raised texture imitating a hand painted gilded bottle. Two pops of green print fill the bow tie on the wreath surrounding the perfumes title. The top of the cap is adorned with the same bird and a band of gold, with the cap appearing to be an antique ’stopper’. I am not exaggerating when I say the atomizer on this bottle is the best I have ever seen or sprayed, similar to some Dior’s. A longer that usual sustained fine, fine mist comes out producing a voluminous dose, almost seemingly powered by aerosol. This aroma is a dank, earthen smell unlike any fragrances I can think to compare it, yet doesn’t feel ‘heavy’, cloying or oppressive. The nutmeg plays a big role here and provides just enough nutty sweetness to lift the patchouli and very rooty smelling Vetiver. The sillage it produces is just gorgeous: you get floating trails of musty green woods and a vibe that tricks me into thinking I’m smelling high grade sandalwood. While I can understand anyone wanting to smell like this, as it comes across very natural and earthy, it does read to me slightly more masculine, only very slightly...This is likely due to the very earthy use of Vetiver. It even seems to imitate a subtle leather accord... I can say I have nothing in my collection close to it, however, I do feel it is at home amongst other Alessandro-era Gucci fragrances that use daring raw earthy notes, namely Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Homme. If you hate Vetiver you may want to skip this one, it has a very rooty earthy feel. In my mind it conjures mosses and lichens growing on a fallen cedar tree on the forest floor with the first chill of autumn bringing a slight moisture to the air causing the smells of these natural growths to atomize up into the air and hover near the ground. Lovers of earthy smells must get your noses on this one, it produces a calming feeling, a slight sense of melancholy knowing the end of summer has arrived and that first rustle of leaves makes you take notice and know fall is approaching and with it darker days and colder nights to come, but with the seasons change new beautiful landscapes of colors and smells you forgot you had missed during the hot days of summer. An aptly named perfume and well executed vision-in-smell of what the last day of summer smells like.

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
oh my god this is so good

On first spray, a bright/sharp dash of freshly grated nutmeg - combined with the cypress & cedar it has a tough cough-syrupy edge.

The nutmeg here is so pure and true. When I cook I always use freshly grated nutmeg because the already-ground stuff does NOT compare in scent or flavor, and this is very fresh, you can smell that oily medicinal edge when the newly exposed surface of the inside of the nutmeg hits the air.

Then everything calms down a bit, the cough syrup/medicinal vibe disappears, and what's left is fresh spice on a bed of conifer forest and a soft gentle layer of vetiver underneath it all.

I feel like the vetiver is perfectly used here, sometimes if there's too much it projects forward on me and that's all i can smell, but here it is a wonderful supporting note.

I can't stop sniffing myself and everything is beautiful. Like sunshine through the trees in the mountains.

The name is poetic but this feels more like the first breath of fall than the last day of summer. Don't care, I love it.

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Slightly nutty Woods on a patchouli base with smooth vetiver rounding it out. I'll be honest here and say I'd probably give up half of my fumes for this Gucci Alchemist Garden collection because it's that good to me. These are just good, this whole line is how I want to smell.

product_name: The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
