After smelling 7 EdPs from the fancy bell jars, I ended up testing this one. Well, mostly because I like woodsy fragrance I admit. This one seemed to be mediocre at first, spicy woods and nothing ground breaking, I can't recall a particular cheaper version but the genre is heavily populated for sure.
However, as I'm wearing the sample, it's actually more pleasant than I first perceived. It has a restrained beauty. It's well balanced between woods and spices, and there's an interesting incense note that gives it some character.
Again, I'm not going to comment on the value, but I think it's worth a test.

product_name: Ode on Melancholy Perfume Oil Gucci
review_content: Deeply and intensely woody. Not a fresh or light scent, no forest air. Evokes the feeling / experience of oud because of this heaviness. I find it a bit heady and headache inducing. Lasts and lasts, has very intense sillage. People comment on this one, so use it carefully.

product_name: Ode on Melancholy Perfume Oil Gucci
review_content:
Tried this at Gucci today, very good smell. I didn't get a ton of cypriol it was more cedar, sandalwood with powdery facet but not overly so. Would be perfect as a layering tool, but also great on its own.
Really enjoyed it, but the retail price is outrageous 😬

product_name: Ode on Melancholy Perfume Oil Gucci
review_content: I have wanted this for ageees. Love the name love the old style enchanted bottle and just love the whole Alchemist Garden collection and the whole asthetic and vibe. It is just beautiful. Slightly spicy and earthy with a touch of sharpness on my skin. Not as intense as Nocturnal Whisper. Due to the high price this is reserved for wearing/dabbing on me when I'm in the mood to spoil myself. The perfume oils from this collection are designed for layering but I just love them too much on their own so no need to waste the precious oil in layering.

product_name: Ode on Melancholy Perfume Oil Gucci
review_content: I do not understand why this perfume would be named after a Keats poem yet feature none of the notes listed in the poem. First of all, what about the prominent image of the poem, the grape bursting on the palate? There's no grape in this perfume. What about the "globed peonies?" Not a single peony. What about the "salt-sand wave?" No salt or sand notes. The "droop-headed flowers?" We have yew-berries, nightshade, Wolf's-bane, and poisonous wine- all missing. And FFS, what about glutting thine sorrow on a morning rose?! We should at least be glutting our sorrows on a morning rose! Where's the dewey morning rose? This perfume is not appropriately named at all. It's like the boyfriend of an English major once heard the English major reading this poem but wasn't listening, but somehow the title stuck in his head and he just pulled it out of his ass and everyone thought it sounded great! Well, you should all apologize to Keats and to those of us who have read his poem and expected a lot more out of this perfume, at least a hint of a f'ing grape or a rose. If you're going to be a "Haute Couture" line, you need to do better than this, Gucci. This is simply woods and balsam. Not that don't enjoy woods. I'm a lover of woods. And if you're going to attempt to be literary in your titles you might have named it, "I Found Myself in a Dark Wood."

product_name: Ode on Melancholy Perfume Oil Gucci
review_content: I do not have a possibility of testing it, but what a beautiful name!

product_name: Ode on Melancholy Perfume Oil Gucci
review_content: I smelled the entire new Gucci exclusives line. This was the only one that peaked my interest. Too bad it comes in the form of an oil and I don't typically wear perfume oil.

product_name: Ode on Melancholy Perfume Oil Gucci
review_content: The only thing in this entire line that’s worth checking out. Please do, because it really is beautiful

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Wild irises grow along the coast here, and that’s the ‘feel’ I get here. More shimmery than their denser cultivated country cousins. The heart notes seem constantly blended, like stirring something in a pot, nothing heavy gets to settle. The geranium, lilac & rose stay perfectly even & full. No one mentions this note, it’s my favourite lilac perfume, by far the sexiest one, Pepper stays to play longer than expected, delightful. And the base, that patchouli is so smooth. Bvlgari Splendida Patchouli Tentation has this same P, a rich river carrying the higher notes along so beautifully. Amber keeping it all warmed through. I’ve been told I smell like a hug and a dirty sex bomb in the same day lol.

Edit- was wearing the Bvlg, after a few hours I layered this on top and ohmygoodness I’m a walking talking big fat sexy hug of scent. I want to wear my longest ankle skimming sweater over a black Tshirt dress and just swagger around.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I agree with the reviewer that describe this as having a sparkling quality . There’s something slightly fruity and a bit tangy when you first spray this fragrance . Then it becomes a bit more powdery but not too dense , it maintains that sparkling quality . To me it smells feminine a bit musky and slightly powdery . I get a lot of the patchouli but it blends well with the rest of the notes and it comes across as a clean patchouli . It’s also very elegant .it reminds me of Cartier La Panthere. I’m loving it .

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is a no for me. It smells the the 90's due to the violet and smelly geraniums. Glad I brought a sample and not a full bottle.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I loved the original version — it was my signature scent.
This one lasts longer, but I still prefer the old smell.
Such an elegant perfume, I can’t imagine my collection without it!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Not a fan smells like mature boring pefume with an annoying scent ingredient similar to theor old perfume

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum has become one of my favourites.
I think I should have given it a chance sooner!
I cant figure out why but something in it reminds me of Armani Si, this is definitely more powdery & soft.
Im almost certain I had tried it on a paper strip in a store but I didn't think much of it.a woman at my work was wearing it & I was instantly obsessed! Just goes to show its best to try it on skin

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is a really pretty scent, very soft and elegant. Something that really surprised me is that this perfume made me finally understand that while I adore lilac scents, I'd rather smell the scent of lilacs in the room than on my skin. I'll probably continue to use this one occasionally as an easy reach when I'm not sure what I want to wear but it needs to be something soft, elegant and unobtrusive.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: one of my all time faves <3 it was my first real big name perfume and i adore it. powdery, like a more mature baby powder scent.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I blind bought this fully expecting to be disappointed. I assumed it would be kind of trashy like "Rush". However, it is the most beautiful, purple floral powdery fragrance. It is not a blast of baby powder in your nose like "My Name" by Trussardi or "Omnia Amethyste" by Bvlgari. It is a perfectly moderate fragrance. Subtle, but noticeable. Not at all weak. Moderate sillage and above average longevity of 7 hours at its best. The initial spray is a bit aggressive but once it dries down, it is gorgeous. The mandarin orange and bergamot are more distant but certainly noticeable. They add a bit of juiciness to the florals. I find this quite versatile, from everyday use to serious events, this fragrance is a solid choice. While the current bottle design is not great, the gold colour is accurate.

P.S. Somebody asked me what laundry detergent I was using. In a way, it does remind me of a very nice laundry detergent. If you are into this category of scents, give "Guilty" a try!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: The essence of a wealty old lady , is that what we wanna smell like? Say no more

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: To me this is the same as the previous version, a soft spicy lilac amber perfume, absolutely addictive and one of my all time favourites!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This review is for those missing the original formula (in the little rounded edged square flacon).
I have not smelled this EDP version, (I really should try it) however, I bought the EDT as the notes are almost the same as the original version, with bergamot removed and raspberry added

I have the original and did a side by side. The EDT smells almost identical however the original is spicier, soapier, the notes a bit crisper and more distinct. It also projects considerably more and lasts longer on my skin. So if you have nostalgia for the OG you might just find what you are looking for in the EDT version.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is very pretty and sophisticated – a rich smelling floral. Perhaps just a bit too mature for my taste. I also get something slightly metallic from it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
It differs slightly from the eau de toilette which is airier and more floral with gorgeous lilac.
This feels fruitier, though the fruits are not obvious. The lilac seems in equal proportion to pink pepper and is not as evident. I feel also a salty facet which might be the amber base that rounds this scent up giving it a slightly soapy overtone.
I am not perceiving it as stronger than the edt and I do not feel violets here, nor geranium. Patchouli is also rather non-existent or styled beyond recognition. Maybe a little bit of rose comes of slightly soapy here.
It is very pretty, modern, stylish and floral in an not obvious way.
It is sensual, human skin-like and ever so slightly sweet.
But I think I prefer the airier eau de toilette and the lilac Love Edition.
It feels universal occasion-wise, possibly also season-wise. This makes the scent special.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Maybe my bottle was a dud but was bought from a reputable company. I wish I smelt what everyone else here is smelling but all I got was a metallic watery scent. I waited patiently for months for any transformation. There was none. Decluttered.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I've been wearing the original 2010 version of Gucci Guilty for 13 years, and it’s filled with wonderful memories, especially from my wedding day. I recently tried the 2019 version, and while it’s similar to the original, I found the Eau de Parfum lacks the same charm. The violet and lilac notes seem more pronounced, and the powdery scent is much stronger than I prefer. I still favor the Eau de Toilette, which offers a pleasant longevity and captures the essence of the original beautifully.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This perfume broke my heart - I’m a big fan of Lana del Rey and after seeing her being face of the campaign I immediately blind bought a full bottle, hoping it will give me beloved “Lana vibes”.
I don’t know what’s the cause of it, but after pleasant opening of lilac and bergamot, a strong gasoline (?!) smell sticks with me till the very end. Actually, I had to wash it off quite fast because of that, I didn’t even have a chance to fully wait for it to dry :( gasoline is one of the most hated smells by me, so I simply couldn’t stand it.
It’s super weird and don’t take my words as a red flag or something - I read a lot of reviews and didn’t find similar complaints. It just doesn’t work with my skin chemistry :(

But Lana is so beautiful in the advertisement, I’m proud of her and I hope that one day she will release her own perfume and it will become my perfect signature ;)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This perfume is more naturalistic than I expected. The opening is very stingy and quite zesty with citruses and herbs, which may be too overpowering. But otherwise is this a really pretty purple floral fragrance. It has very powerful aromatic scents in it, maybe like menthols and spicy woods like coniferous, whilst the undertones are more sugary and aquatic, which the scent eventually dies down to. This perfume might smell a bit chemical, but I still think it's a very clean and quite refreshing fragrance, and I really like it. I'd recommend this to women who like naturalistic green yet floral scents. It's unique!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: A little too overpowering for me, but I'm not a fan of strong flower scents so that makes sense.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
The opening is a pink pepper blast, rosy and citrusy, and tart, almost like raspberry. Guilty is a soft, slightly powdery floral fragrance that smells clean and elegant, in an understated way. It reminds me a lot of A Drop d’Issey – both have prominent lilac and smell clean in a floral scented hand lotion kind of way.

Guilty feels extremely versatile, seasonless, timeless, and ageless. I can’t think of a season or occasion it wouldn’t suit, and it would work just as well on both young and old women. It would be a great signature scent or a gift for a loved one. The longevity is at least 6-7 hours and sillage is moderate.

I love the ads with Lana Del Rey, but this isn’t at all what I imagine she’d wear. Lana Del Rey needs something more seductive and theatrical. Guilty is Elizabeth Grant sitting on a window sill at home, wearing a cashmere sweater, finishing up writing Norman Fucking Rockwell.

This is one of those perfumes I’d like on others. It’s pleasant, but not something I’d wear. I find it quite boring and I dislike the opening.

EDIT: My mother owns a sample of this and has been wearing it a lot recently. The more I smell it, the more I like it. It doesn't fit my current taste/style, but I could see myself wearing this when I'm older, after getting sick of the heavy woody incensy florals I'm currently loving. Maybe this will be a signature scent for 50-year-old me.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I have a good memory with original Gucci Guilty 2010. New EDT was not covered my nostalgic needs, so I tried this EDP and it was a right !!

That iconic opening of Guilty, top notes and geranium. Then purple flowers shows up very softly. Purple flowers with masculine touch of geranium and patchouli but it is keep forwarding to feminine.

Longevity was 12 hours +, Sillage was intimate at the first but it bloomed arm length.

Problem is I needed to over spray to feel purple flowers the notes I love. Nostalgia covered.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I love Gucci Guilty EdT so much, it is one of my favorite perfumes ever. However, I remember thinking once that even though it smells amazing, I don't know if I can justify paying so much for something that doesn't last that long, and I'm thinking it again now that my bottle is nearly empty. I still have a tester of the EdP, I put that one on one wrist and the EdT on the other, and compared them. The EdT feels somewhat fresher and dries down musky, and I sense more pink pepper. The EdP is similar but is more soft and powdery. Others have said this, but I'd like to reiterate that this perfume is great for every day and every season (a bit less so Summer). I find the guilty line is not as sexy as it is cool and a bit classy, which is what I like about it ('sexy' gets thrown around way too much when it comes to perfumes IMO). I tried this before when it came out in 2019, I loved it, but I used to think it smelled too powdery/mature, and that the EdT (which I already had) is better for me. Now that I've gotten older, I have changed my mind, and I can see myself pulling this off. I still have some doubts about the performance of this one, but I'm considering getting it in the future.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: A pleasant sweet, floral scent gently fades into powdery notes. It feels comforting and enveloping, smooth and calm. I don’t sense the revolutionary element mentioned in the advertising campaign. This is a contemporary, mature, feminine fragrance with a balanced projection.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: The name seems appropriate! 😍😜😎 You need to wear this a little while to truly appreciate it. This would be a nice signature fragrance...for an extremely hot person! Aurélien Guichard at his finest. ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Gucci Guilty EDP is an effortless choice for everyday wear in spring or summer. My only dislike is that it underperforms for me. It's a nice oriental floral, but I probably will not repurchase it because I need to respray every couple of hours. I will forever miss the original Gucci EDP.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I love lilac and that's the note that comes through the most for me. The sweetness of it reminds me a little bit of cola. My only dislike is that the powdery notes can be intense, a little goes a long way for this fragrance.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Clean, fresh and safe.

Fresh mildly citrus opening that already has violet mixing with it. As it dries down, the violet takes over giving a clean masculine vibe. Amber becomes slightly noticeable in the background giving some depth and warmth.

Could be unisex. Could wear year round for all occasions by varying the sprays. Longevity and projection are average. Not sure of the value…plenty that do this for less.

Overall, it’s OK. I don’t need to buy it…I have plenty that do this better for less.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: It smells clean and soapy — fresh but not overpowering. Even though I’m not usually into floral scents, I really love this one. It feels perfect for spring, light and uplifting.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This perfume is gorgeous! It's floral and sweet but not overpowering. I get a lot of compliments on it. The violet note is really prominent and adds a unique touch.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I really wanted to like it. I tested Guilty Intense and it lived up to its name (I didn't like it). I thought the EDP would be better for me, but I get a super heavy dose of patchouli. I sprayed it once on my wrists and I kept getting an unpleasant whiff of it. I will be selling my bottle.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Plastic. That’s it. Literally just plastic.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Very rarely do I come across a perfume that dries down so beautifully on my skin. Powdery, creamy, a little bit of a heady floral that is just perfect. The floral notes layer delicately amid the powdery opening. Great longevity and I enjoyed experiencing how this scent evolved throughout the day.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
to me, this scent is a luxurious lotion smell. its very creamy and powdery, not in an overwhelming way.
it feels very cozy and effortless, id say its appropriate for every age and works with most outfits. the floral notes are such a nice addition to the overall profile.
it doesn't last too long which is the only drawback for me. i find myself thinking i sprayed way too much just to reapply it 30 minutes later.
overall a very nice, basic perfume for everyday wear!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: If you want to smell clean, light, powdery, not very sweet then this is your girl. It’s a lilac/violet fragrance. If you like powder florals but don’t want something too heavy I recommend this fragrance. Is it totally original? Not at all but do you want to smell like lilac? This is for you.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Super floral which I’m not a fan of, but while it is sharp, it’s at least not stabbing-my-nose sharp. I don’t get any pink pepper, amber, or citrus—really just florals and patchouli. Has minimal sillage and lasts about 6 hours on me.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Thick? Lol this is super powdery and thin to my nose. It's really lovely, just a shame the patch in the dry down ruins it. Also nowhere near as beautiful and interesting as the discontinued original in the square bottle

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Soft and clean. Powdery, lipstick/makeup type scent. I really don't like those type of scents, but this one is ok somehow. It kind of reminds me of scented baby wipes. Would make a really good easy reach fragrance when you don't really have anything else in mind. Something you'd wear to the office or with a plain tshirt. The name Guilty is definitely a misnomer. I think it could work for any age, but I could see younger girls not liking it much because it isn't ultra sweet or even overly floral. It isn't a heavy scent at all though, so I wouldn't find this weird on a young person. I just have a sample, but I will definitely be using it up. Not sure if I'd buy a whole bottle because it's just not my type of scent, but I like it and it is continuing to grow on me. This one surprised me since it isn't my vibe.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I really love how the juice itself is thick and rich, unlike any other perfume I’ve owned, except La vie est belle before reformulation.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I'll admit, I think I must have tried too many samples while shopping, and my nose might have been confused when I thought I was in love with Guilty while shopping. Took it home, and the day after I found myself mildly disappointed. What I smelled while shopping was just a tad louder.

My bottle turned out to be surprisingly 'too clean' for my taste, and others' opinions were similar-- mostly that it just smells like an overpriced lotion.

I can say, however, that it's grown on me after about a year. I've come to appreciate it as a simpler scent for weekends when I want to relax.

If you're looking for something loud, complex or sultry, Guilty would probably be my last suggestion. An understated scent-- albeit probably not worthy of its given title. 'Guiltless' would be more fitting for this one.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Extremely luxurious, smells like high-end makeup powder. I imagine this is the perfect scent a female boss would wear. However, when it comes to luxury perfumes with female boss, I prefer YSL Libre.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: You guys have to get passed the first 90 seconds or so. It's that lipsticks smell, but it changes into soemthing so much better as I can't STAND lipsticks violet smells usually . But this changes quickly into such a fresh laundry mandarin scent. I find this unisex, or it a man was looking for a floral to love, he'd love this.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Not bad but too floral for me. The dry down is nice patchouli reminding me of Angel. Overall pretty weak and not very long lasting.
Update: Very powdery from the beginning to the end. Today it lasted on me all day but I was smelling nothing but powder (patchouli in the drydown) and it was annoying me a lot.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Beautiful!! I love how delicate this is and the dry down maintains that light and airy feeling. This is clean without the headache of some "clean" perfumes - like fresh air mixed with delicate flowers. Everyone from your aunty to your grandma to your next door neighbor will like how you smell. Very inoffensive, I don't see how anyone can dislike this. While saying this praise I would like to point out that it's definitely not unique and I don't see this lasting very long on most people. However, the dry down is intimate and soft and my friend could smell it on me when she got in my car and said I smelled good (I could hardly smell it anymore on myself after 3 hours so I was surprised).

I think this would smell the most beautiful in early winter or late spring/early summer.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: A great everyday scent. Crowd pleasing and inoffensive. Good for the office. A nice floral for any occasion or season but especially good for spring/summer.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Warm spicy lilac with hints of rose and bergamot. Full-bodied, sweet and pleasant.
If Drop d'Issey was darker and more mature.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I had a sample and used during a trip. It's very mature, but not dated. It's scent that for me is not groundbreaking, on the contrary, this makes it very wearable for doing errands or work. You have to like florals to enjoy, if they are not your cup if tea, it can be a bit annoying.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: If Gucci stop making this one I will have nothing to live for. I have 3 bottles of this one in 3 different sizes. I received lots of compliments and some like “ you smell like fresh clean clothes “ I believe it is because of the iris notes mixed with citrusy. I love this perfume and this is far better than Chanel Chance or Gabrielle

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I keep seeing sophisticated florals being called “rich auntie” scents. Especially with patchouli, rose, and/or the chypre accord. Gucci Guilty is that essence but in the most modern, sexy way. I do feel rich when I wear this (lies) but not snotty old money rich- more like 90s supermodel in the corner of a nightclub, private booth, slinky dress kinda rich. People want to be seen with her. She’s got legs for days and somehow just puts her hair in a stupid clip and looks like a million bucks. This scent is kinda classic but still a little edgy. It’s effortless, cool, but dressy. This feels like a signature scent you could wear through the decades. (It’s more suited to grownT women)

Spicy, floral, aromatic, musky; depending on the weather it reads a bit juicy or more powdery. Orange, violet, and patchouli might be singing loudest to me but it’s very well blended. Can see this working most seasons as it’s not a particularly warm frag. Just fabulous ugh!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: No siento ese polvo que tanto dice q hay en el, y es una pena, porque me encanta eso en un perfume. Es fácil de agradar, tiene su frutado, no es empalagoso...me gusta, pero no fue amor. Pésima fijación

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I really like it, but I think it smells a lot more powdery on the paper than clothes. On clothes it is more peppery and slightly fruity. I might buy it but I am not sure if this is what I am looking for... I was hoping for a love by chloe replica but it was not :(

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I love it. It's powdery, elegant with slightest tang of sweetness in the background, to some degree sort of cottony. It opens up with rich spicy aroma and then settles down with sophisticated florals that last all day long. In my opinion it is perfect for any season at all and any time of the day. It's strong but not overpowering and is definitely a statement perfume.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Going against the grain here, but this was an instant dislike. Pencil shavings, powder, dusty florals. Nope.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This reminds me of the old Bvlgari pour femme which I have in my collection. The powdery especially after dry down I guess. However, the Bvlgari has a more fresh citrus to it while Gucci more floral. It's not the type of perfume which makes me wow at first sniff. It's ordinary and okay. But due to the powdery note, it makes you feel slightly older than you are. The note does evolve over time on me which is a good sign. It grows on me when I use it a few times. But I still doubt if I would get a full size of it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: The floral for me is a strong lilac. It is a little too sharp, almost like a sweet-tart. Only a hint of patchouli, which is a good thing. I like fruity florals, but usually think they are too sweet and need more orange. In this case it's the opposite. It does have a mild powdery dry down that softens the tartness, but not enough. I'm not familiar enough with violet or geranium to know if they are contributing to what I don't like. It is strong too, not offensive, but you can't get away from it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I recently received this as a gift. Call me old fashioned, but I typically enjoy lilac and violet notes, so this fits into my collection easily. There is somewhat of a sharpness, maybe from the pink pepper or geranium, that is a bit unpleasant, but it fades away quickly. Sometimes patchouli can make or break a fragrance for me, but it's not too overpowering here. Maybe because of this, Guilty EdP doesn't seem to have much longevity - I normally only spray once or twice, and I don't really mind a scent dissipating after a few hours, but I figured I'd put it out there just in case it matters to others. Overall, I'm enjoying this scent!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: GF wears this a lot. I can confirm the longevity is very very good. Still projects within an arms length after 4-5 hours

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Oh my, my skin chemistry turned this to a baby diaper. Like brand new, unused, straight-from-the-package, baby diaper. I can't un-smell it.

Gifted the remainder to a friend

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: A good one for someone who wants a clean slightly powdery office friendly scent.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Quite stunning at first, but unfortunately, quickly declines into: oh, this hurts my nose, my head, just no. Generic mall like fragrance.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Incredibly boring and generic. Smells like a mixture of all modern feminine perfumes. As for who does this scent suit? This is definitely a fragrance for the more mature crowd, I mean ages 50+. The scent’s not horrible, but I just can’t see anyone under 40 pulling this off.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I bought it blindly, and I don’t care if it’s for ladies or whoever. I wore it before sleeping, and when I woke up I smelled something that I would like to drink or kiss

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: It's a shame that the violet completely dominates and turns this perfume into an old-fashioned and mature scent. Otherwise, the perfume is elegant, sparkling, clean, in my opinion the Italian version of Coco mademoiselle. I also have the body lotion and I am in love with it. Here fortunately, I don't smell violet and it's not easy to recognize individual ingredients, but as a whole the scent is feminine, sexy, rounded and divine with a touch of sparkling sharpness.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I love this so much.
I got it from my husband on christmas eve, and I absolutely Adore it🤎
It makes me feel ;
•Confident
•SEXY
•Feminine
•Elegant
•Desired

I've already ordered a new,big bottle of this.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Honestly, this confuses me. It has the same DNA as some 2010s perfumes, yet it came out in 2019. I feel it is very close to Lady Million.
I can't really tell out individual notes, but it's not spectacular or memorable. It made me a bit nauseous during warmer weather, so definitely cold weather.
The bottle is cute and small though, goes fine inside your purse.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
wow this smells so beautiful! The sales clerk sprayed Gucci Guilty on my left wrist and Olympea Solar on the other. Even though OS is rated as longer wearing on fragrantica, I think GG lasts more than OS. I was contemplating between GG and OS. OS has very little presence to me. I had to put my nose near to my wrist to smell it. GG on the other hand has more projection! I catches whiffs of it while I'm shopping. This is the first time I smell violet on a perfume. It reminds me of christmas. So so beautiful and uplifting fragrance! I associate the smell with my aunt who visits from UK every christmas. This fragrance reminds me of her. It does smells like a rich aunt.

Ignore the negative reviews guys. You have to test it first to see if it works on you. GG is certainly not crazy projecting like Libre or L'interdit but it's beautiful and wearable, so I don't mind.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Extremely strong in a bad, old-fashioned way
No, just NO

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Not a fan of the prominent geranium note here so do not blind buy.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Nice bottle, wrong name.
Boring, average, clean, feminine floral.
it's a classic mainstream frangrance; a violet, rose and lilac flower bouquet, with a tad of berry fruityness and a classic amber-patchouli base.
Not repulsive as other designer frags (think LVEB, Prada Paradoxe, Coach, Michael Kors, Daisy etc) indeed it's very wearable, not offensive, but as well not memorable.
OK for office wear (if you are able to locate a bottle, that is).
Very similiar to CK Beauty, RL Romance.
You can get better.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Gorgeous scent!!! I am personally tired of all of the sickly sweet caramel and overly fruity perfumes that we've had for the last, so many years! This is quite simply a beautiful soft floral, that makes you feel pretty! Soft, elegant, classy ~ wonderfully done, Gucci!!!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
The prettiest fragrance suitable for the prettiest ladies. It instantly resembles candied violets and parma violets i had as a kid and still enjoy now, probably why it's so appealing to me now. Not only this but its marketing and bottle screams simplicity yet sophistication, including the ad with Lana Del Rey, which makes me fixate on the screen its playing on whilst being in complete awe. The only down-side is that its longevity is poor and it's generally not very mass pleasing and receives minimal compliments :/

8/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Slightly sweet and verrryyyy floral. There's something lingering in the background that's almost like pancakes with maple syrup, but this fragrance on the whole is extremely light. I like it, but wouldn't buy at full price.

Nice choice for Springtime.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
GLAMOUR level 100! Gucci Guilty is one of glamorous perfume I have encountered, and I have encountered more than 200. It’s a powdery lilac and violet bomb with a punch of freshness, helping it not to be too much. It’s not sweet or syrupy at all, it is floral and powdery. It is a must for all violet and lilac lovers. I get all the middles notes listed above, but here the lilac and violet are the ABSOLUTE stars of show! Velvety and creamy, it is a rich perfume that will get you noticed and last really well; I can still smell it though my laundry basket. I had the impression to be in a cloud of powdery lilac for hours while wearing it and people asked me a lot while coming closer “it smells good in your direction; is that you?” Close to Violet Orchid, Lolita Lempicka, Parisienne and share the Moulin Rouge vibes of Le Classique EDP, I easily also imagine Betty Poop, Jessica Rabbit, Marilyn Monroe, Dita Von Teese; and yes, Lana Del Rey wearing that. The kind of perfume for people that want to make a statement, for sure.

Could be wear all year long by people who wants to be noticed in the crowd, however IMO Gucci Guilty is not perfume really casual or for work, nor for clubbing, its sophisticated, glam and if you are an over-sprayer; it could be really inviting and sultry ;)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: A very heady and divinely complicated GG edp Pour Femme INTENSE! So perfectly wicked for the sensual "bad girls" among us. YEEUUMMM!!!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: They reformulated, now smells like some laundry detergent. Very similar to amarni si passione. Just awful, I loved original guilty.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
UNIQUE SCENT. FOR THE STRONG INDEPENDANT WOMEN, AND OF COURSE RICH AND CLASSY ONES.
THIS SCENT DESCRIBES THOSE WOMEN.
I WORE IT I CAN SMELL A LOT OF OUD BUT IT FADES AFTER 5 MINUTES, I GOT COMPLIMENTS ON THE SCENT.IT LASTS ABOUT 5-6 HOURS.
IT WINS IN MY OPINION GUCCI NEVER PUTS ME DOWN.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Ok, not bad by any means, but not … compelling?

I LOVED Love, Chloe EDP and this is nowhere near as good as that beauty.

This is a pretty, powdery floral that’s very light, polite and unnoticeable. There’s a metallic streak that bothers me though. I love the bottle and am disappointed it’s not vastly better. At least it isn’t a super sweet gunky vanilla thing. Ok if I’m allowing myself to be snarky it is a bit like a bathroom air freshener. And there’s just something I can’t quite pinpoint that I don’t like about it. I think this needs a bit more green or a bit more sweet or a dash more of an unusual note. As it is, it’s just not compelling for me and a generic sort of air freshener. another recent blind buy mistake was Lilas Exquis by Jacques Fath. that one is a much better lilac floral than this Gucci. fairly similar overall but the JF seems better quality & dash more green.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Really wanted to like it. I imagined it as a good drugstore gem but this fragrance is almost giving me a headache with its really long lasting and strong flowery vinegar that never goes, never mellows. Such a shame as I absolutely adore the flanker design. It could work for someone who works at a medical setting. Work fragrance for someone who doesn’t want to exude any personality but smell clean and put together to others.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Getting to know this one. I'd been always intrigued by its smell so when I found it for a really good price went for it without even thinking. So far it remains a "yes but..." perfume: gorgeous vintage lilac BUT too much patchouli; baby gentle and understated BUT a tinge of something gagging. I will continue my investigation because it draws me in, time will tell if we are made for each other.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: If you want a unique floral scent, this is for you! It’s a strong, expensive scent, will last forever on skin and clothes.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: It has a very unique smell. Both sweet, warm, flowery and spicy. Smells expensive, and like a classic lady. It could be a great signature scent, because it smells so unique. I think this can be worned every day. Smells like roses and warm pebber.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Fresh violet lilac bright clean soft floral I love it like clean fresh beautiful expensive laundry great spring summer scent

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is a soft lilac and violet (very) feminine fragrance. Seems best suited for church or a Sunday stroll in the park. Some have said it smells like baby wipes. I definitely get that although it is a bit of an exaggeration. If you like soft feminine scents, this one is for you.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I loved Guilty, the citrusy floral but slightly spicy and patchouli notes could have been designed especially for me, a perfect everyday scent. But like most perfumes I’ve loved, it’s been reformulated 😢 This one is still recognisable as Guilty but much more powdery and sweet, maybe less spice. There’s something about this new version which slightly reminds me of Paco Rabanne XS for her, if anyone else remembers it?! That was a perfume I loved too so I’m not too disappointed.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
It starts off sweet and nice. But it then becomes very synthetic surrounded by powdery nothingness with a hint of green and pink pepper far, far away.

It does not work on my skin unfortunately.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I think this perfume would suit a classy, mature, sophisticated woman -but it really isn't for me lol. Not my style, not my vibe, but it's definitely a pleasant fragrance. I get almost no floral notes from it, besides a hint of rose and geranium. It's very amber-y, with the second strongest note (in my opinion) being mandarin orange. Then patchouli maybe? No pink pepper thankfully, which I hate. It smells expensive and I think it would make a great gift, even if it isn't something I would pick up for myself.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
How i want it. Thinking about day and night, reading all reviews and on feb 2022 after my birthday i received it 🎊🎊🎊🎊🎊 i was like « OMG » I’m happy try it couldn’t smell it !!!! Whyyyyyyyyyy!
After hours it’s beautiful long lasting powdery feminine classy vibes it bloom on cold weather
But it’s not for me !!!! No no no not for me on my mom it’s bloom on me i feel something wrong
This is life i enjoy having it and try it but i prefere when my mom wear it 💟

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Was very sweet at first, I thought it might be white florals and some fruit, like strawberry. On the dry-down, it's sweet, feminine, powdery lilac. Not a green or photorealistic lilac, but really pretty. It leans a bit mature, but the orange gives it some brightness.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This fragrance is pretty, but I don't think I would purchase it. The violet or lilac in it reminds me of either 1) a comforting, soft-scented laundry detergent/laundry sheets OR 2) baby products (baby wipes, baby oil, or baby lotion). It's a plush, soft scent, so I probably lean more toward detergent in the first few minutes and baby products at the drydown. None of those are bad - it's actually pleasant. I'm just not sure I would purchase it as a fragrance. I think I'd like it more as a plug-in for a room scent than perfume.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Guilty Pour Femme is synthetic, very mature, strong enough to make your throat itch. Settles into a powdery floral, still synthetic and a bit spicy. I got no fruits or amber, just a harsh cloud of flowers and patchouli. This is the opposite of a perfume I can't stop smelling my wrists for, and so many other things I don't want from any fragrance. I have a sample of the EdT waiting to be tested, but I'm honestly too scared to even try a little spritz at this point.

I was trying to figure out what the flowers reminded me of, but as others already said, it's definitely baby wipes. I'm sure it's good for someone who likes scents of this type, but for me? I got an immediate headache and looming nausea which both lasted for several hours, despite scrubbing my wrists clean, until my suffering finally ended when I fell asleep at night.

For the love of god, don't blind buy this if you have asthma and/or allergies, and please don't overspray if you wear this to public places.

1/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Wow they really butchered the classic and it is tragic

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Smells like an old aunt wearing too much makeup, too much golden jewelry and too much perfume.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Well, this is the perfume which dominates. Strong, mature, sexy.

Patchouli and violets dictate the aroma most. Geranium makes the scent milder but with bergamot and pepper, the result is spicy and fresh.

I agree that this perfume is clean, however I don't like it's syntetic mark. For me, this scent creates very luxury and confident image but it's not autentical...

Sillage and longevity moderate. At nights it will be fatale and chic.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This definitely gives off a rich woman vibes. Smells clean and elegant. Downside is this has a weak projection and scent is a bit too mature for my liking.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Rich b*tch in a bottle. Fresh, powdery, and powerful. Smells like a boss lady in her late 30’s or early 40’s. It lasts a long time, and projection is good. This is a great daytime scent.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: pretty, fresh and clean. Smells like a fresh clean shower. Definitely more feminine but since its such a clean scent it could work on anymore. The citrus isn't overpowering but very very gentle due to the powderyness and the floral notes sweeten it up slightly. Inoffensive. Definitely doesn't last long at all, id be shocked if I even got 30 minutes out of it tbh and it sits veryyy close to the skin. A good everyday intimate scent but definitely could be improved.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I got more of the floral and pink pepper notes. I didn't have to re-spray which was a good thing that it last throughout the day, I had to smell my clothes by the end of the day since it had faded a bit but I could still smell the perfume when the wind blew. Now that it is fall and temps have changed, this will be better to wear during cooler weather as it may be cloying in the heat.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
To me this fragrance is all lilac and little else. The sweetness balances out most of the green sharpness, but like most lilac fragrances it still retains something that I would describe as cold and slightly sharp. The other notes aren't prominent enough to change that and to me this remains a lilac soliflore first and foremost, so it's a note you have to get along with to love this fragrance. And I've found that I don't. I don't mind this on clothes or paper, but when it warms on the skin it initially turns a bit sour. This could be the mandarin orange, but it's not really distinguishable as an individual note, so it simply smells like sour lilac.

Overall I find that what this fragrance is truly guilty of is being lackluster. It's very simple and pretty generic. Somehow I've held on to my bottle, but I couldn't really tell you why honestly. Lilac is not a very youthful note to me, but at the same time a more mature wearer might want something a bit more elevated. This doesn't smell particularly refined, and the longevity isn't good either. So it's definitely not a fragrance I can recommend to someone, especially given that the price point is pretty high for a designer fragrance. I mean I guess it can be used for layering, but you could get a much higher quality fragrance for the same price from niche and independent houses.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Here is what this scent reminds me of: A boss lady in her late 30s, she’s effortlessly beautiful, successful and kind. She wears this to work everyday. I love love love it. This could be a great signature scent if the performance was better. Smells very elegant, feminine&expensive at the same time. I might even purchase despite the poor performance

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I really have to stop blind buying. The notes seemed beautiful to me but I can’t barely smell it? It’s very soft but oh so generic

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Got myself a set of Gucci samples, and Gucci Guilty is the first one I’m testing. I remember trying it years ago, but it didn’t exactly manage to catch my attention. Now? Oh, it’s lovely! I have no idea where these grandma/vintage comments are coming from. Are these days anything not strong on vanilla or gourmand notes people view as an old-smelling retro perfume? How boring 😜

Gucci Guilty opens a bit spicy, and that spiciness remains present in the dry-down as well. The florals here are simply divine! Had no idea I would enjoy lilac and violet combo this much. Yes, the perfume is kind of powdery, but it doesn’t bother me at all. General impression: clean, modern, quite elegant and unique.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is.. interesting. I'm not sure if it's the violet, but it smells overpoweringly of licorice to my nose. That's unfortunately not my thing, but if you like that, this might be a good fragrance to look into :)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Interesting. Quite perfumey, soapy, slightly powdery. I see this on a young woman dressed retro-chic style.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Vintage '50s makeup powder scent that manages to not smell formal or dated. A younger person could wear this with a casual outfit, which is a strong feat for a powder violet fragrance.

The patchouli, amber and bergamot in this make it a very modern and wearable scent. Very, very elegant and Guerlain-esque. I love it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Smells very similar to Armani si passione, nothing like the original guilty, very synthetic, kind of like washing detergent. Very close to the skin, weak scent. Was one of my favorite perfumes, very sad :(

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Note For Myself: Beautiful opening. Middle notes sit most on my skin being , lilac and violet .
Too powdery for my taste but, it is a beautiful affordable fragrance… I would suggest cooler to mildly warm weather for longevity.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Best soapy fragrance if you wanna smell clean feminine fresh out of the shower this is it but I've gotta say a little mature tbh so feel free to wear it it's beautiful 💗

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Lana Del Ray was the perfect ambassador for this. It's so unique like her but also perfect for the office. It's inoffensive, pretty but it also has the vibe "I'm only tame if I want to be" while at the same time subconsciously planting the idea "she has to have money" in the mind of whoever observes you as you pass by. It almost invokes a sense of mystery which is what I really like about it. The character is there.

The initial spray is consistent with the dry down with a well done Powdery lovely vibe intertwined with a violet rose. In the world where every woman seems to reach for Coco Mademoiselle this is quite unique while being very VERSATILE to wear in every environment you walk through from day to night. I recommend every woman to pair this with your favorite red lipstick.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I like Gucci Guilty pour femme, it is a pretty violet make up bag scent. It's slightly fruity but not overly so. Pretty powdery violet (it's not sharp like violet leaf can be) Floral lilac of spring comes through. I like the fact that it is more floral than fruity and the patchouli in this one isn't overdone. It's slightly spicy from the pink pepper but again that isn't overdone either. Guilty pour femme is a nice spring violet/lilac powdery make up bag scent. I may have to get a small bottle at some point for my collection. I like Pour Femme better than the Intense and the Absolute. The Intense gave me a headache and is to fruity and the Absolute is to fruity as well, you don't get enough florals w/ those and I'm a floral girl. This Pour Femme is up my ally and I may have to add it to my collection. Nicely done Gucci.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This one is interesting. Nice and calm smell of spring lilacs. Powdery and sweet, but subtle. Very attractive but low projection. Elegant and ladylike.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Smells just the same as the og edt in the square packaging but a lot softer, smoother & a lil' bit more floral... longevity quite good around 7 to 8 hours... i stick to my og edt cuz it's got more spiky & sassy & a lot more lasting & power... that's it... now i need the new intense 2022 version!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Mmm this is super unique for a designer fragrance. I expected it to be girly and floral but it's much cooler. I can really smell the violet. This would be my signature fragrance if it wasn't so weak/not long lasting on me. Also love the ad with Lana 😍

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
How refreshing and kind of edgy this felt, as different from all other women frags in the sweet pile as it gets. A bit spicy and very classy.
I like the fact that Gucci perfumes are not following the mainstream trends of every other house.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Violet just doesn't work on me. I'm trying to accept that. Something about this scent smells powdery in the worst possible way. *On me* the scent is one that reminds me of cheaply scented baby products. My nose picks up the warmth of the pink pepper and a bit of patchouli... and that's it! No citrus, no rose, no amber (so none of the notes that I love and really hoped to smell).

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Before trying, the notes of this of perfume sounded good but not too exciting. My first trial gave me again the same impression, good but not something very extraordinary. However this perfume has been somehow addicting for me. It is not too mature nor too girly. It is in the middle ground. It seems basic at first but gives me attractive woman vibes. It is hard to explain but this must be the definition of woman perfume. I'm imagining a succesful, confident and elegant woman in her late twenties or thirties wearing this. And also, I bought this as a rollerball to see If I will like this one and it has been a good discovery. So after it finishes, I will buy a full bottle.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I recently rediscovered this scent and i get it much sweeter than I remember. Its still a pretty floral and I don't get citrus notes from it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I remember reading about Lana’s Gucci Guilty campaign — she was originally considering her own line, but then got the offer from Gucci and went with that instead. I think this scent is absolutely beautiful and matches her vibe; no celebrity perfume could come close to this, so I’m glad she went this route. As a patchouli fanatic, I jumped on this as soon as I was aware of its existence. The top notes are quite common in perfumes these days, but the floral heart notes were very well-chosen for this blend. No jasmine or tuberose like everyone else seems to be doing. It seems fitting that Lana would be associated with a perfume containing violet, too, like it’s a nod to her poetry book. I love that. Rose and geranium are really lovely here, too. And the powdery nuances from the lilac note just works so beautifully, and I’m not usually a fan of powdery notes. This perfume is just so classy and gorgeous. I’m wearing it right now as I’m getting ready for a photo shoot and it just makes me feel like a sophisticated little fairy queen. I only have a travel rollerball currently (be warned, they don’t come 100% full… it’s closer to 75%), but I’ll be investing in a full bottle at some point. Great work with this one, Gucci.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I like floral as the main point and a little bit of everything else. This perfume meets all those requirements! This is my everyday scent that describes me the best. At sephora, other perfumes were a bit too much of something, but this one was just perfect. It didnt smell too sharp, but it's there and feminine and sexy and impressionable. Love it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This reminds me of the dry-down of Angel EDT (the older, comet version). They share pink pepper, bergamot, and patchouli.

Strong sour powderiness, borderline unisex. Longevity seems average at around 5-6 hours, though I would expect better from an EDP, especially at this price point. Projection is very good, it fills up a room.
Scent-wise, I think it's more interesting than the common offerings on the market at the moment. I think it's a bit too outgoing for an office or other professional settings, it could choke someone out in a closed space. It's more of an outdoors scent, maybe a date in the park or an open space event. Very chic, but I don't know if I can call it elegant. It has just that tiny bit of sass in it to make it quirky.

I would be very happy if someone gifted this to me, but considering I already have Angel EDT (the old, comet version), there's no need for me to buy it for myself. When I run out of Angel, though, I'll get it for sure as a replacement.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: To me this would make a perfect perfume for a bride. It's a delicate and romantic floral. I get well blended hints of lilac, violet and rose on a soft patchouli base. The dry down reminds me of a baby's skin scent.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Love this. Its classy and sensual without being to heavy and mature. Works for all seasons but I personally view it as more of a fall/winter scent. The amber and vanilla gives the perfume depth and warmth, and the florals makes it fresh and sweet. Really recommend this!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Well, this is a bit strange... I only get a soft, powdery, patchouli and leather creamy accord. No flowers. Nothing else. Very much like Santal33 but creamier still.
I like it very much, but I think I'd tire of it so haven't bought it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is the perfumiest perfume I have in my collection 🤣. Let me explain, this is a very aromatic, floral, heady scent. A tiny bit fresh and zingy because of the pink pepper, and bergamot opening. But other than that I really can't pull out any other notes from this scent. Altogether it's just what a department store, luxury perfume should smell like. Low key this reminds me of a more modern younger version of white diamonds. Which is what my mom used to wear back in the day when I was a child. So this has some scent memories attached, but it's still it's own scent. I actually like it, which is crazy because it isn't my type of scent profile at all. But it's great layered with other things in my collection. Gives me rich boss confident woman vibes. You literally smell like money with this one. High end, expensive, classy and good taste. This lasts forever so you're getting what you pay for. Definitely strong AF too. Can't really overspray with this one or it'll be too overpowering for yourself and the people around you. I think because its such an aromatic scent it could potentially be worn year round but as I am just wearing it this fall, I think of it as a fall perfume. But I will continue to wear it and see how I feel about it as time goes on.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Gucci guilty EDP is my favorite perfumes. it’s so soft and fresh. it reminded me about BLV Bvlgari for women

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: So good I love this perfume so much it’s so soft and pretty i recommend ❤️❤️😍

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is one of my favorite perfumes. I love the original edt version, but it doesn't last as long on me. This one lasts several hours, and the scent is identical to me. It is sweet, fruity and a little powdery. When it dries down it almost has a tobacco sweetness. Good for all year, but love it more in cooler weather.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: this was ok at first and there was something nostalgic in it within the first 20 minutes where i was like no i def smelled this before as a child. so even tho it’s not my usual taste i liked it for that. but then it turned sour on me and after that it vanished

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Impression from a paper strip: Powdery violet with a little spice. I'm really not a fan of this, it's almost as if this fragrance can't decide what it wants to be. The citrus, spice, florals, powdery flowers, and base notes just don't go together very well and it creates a "blob" that's just quite boring.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I received a sample of this at Sephora and i don’t like it. It doesn’t have anything special in my opinion. It’s a sweet and floral scent but without a twist. It’s that kind of perfume that my mother will wear.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Unfortunately, this didn't work for my body chemistry. It smelled too overtly synthetic, and ended up giving me a headache. The floral top notes are definitely there, but it's also a bit powdery, and I find that it turns a bit sour upon the dry down.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This is a very sophisticated, inoffensive yet sensual fragrance.
Reminds me of the impression Lancome Magnifique had on me. Oriental smell holding back on intensity, close to the skin, not too sweet.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is such a great scent. but I cant describe, what feelings I get when smelling it. It is such an original perfume with lots of flowers like lilac or violet. It is almost soapy fragrance with a bit of the spiciness. I have seen and read many reviews and some of them claimed that this perfume is a clubbing fragrance. Ant tbh I dont agree with this statement. Gucci guilty pour femme is light and romantic. Ideal as s gift I would say

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I love the scent and think it’s gorgeous, but it doesn’t last on me at all! I want to smell like this all day long, fresh, powdery, feminine, beautiful, but within an hour it fades away. Very disappointing! Looking for something that smells like this but LASTS

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I find this surprisingly addictive. It's predominantly lilac on me but the sweet femininity is tempered by noticeable pepper and patchouli. Lady-like but not linear. Strong florals and I usually don't get along but there's something about this that makes me feel confident and elegant.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
From first spray I cringed. It was very strong and I don't even remember what it was about it I did not like (I tested at Ulta). The dry down isn't terrible, but something about it I do not like and almost makes me feel sick. It's like a dark, powdery, overly sweet smell. It's syrupy. It smells very vaguely familiar, almost as if I have smelled it on someone else before, but it smelled better on them. Unfortunately, it does not play well with my nose and skin chemistry.

ETA: The more this fades, the better it smells. Too bad for most of its life on me, I don't like it :(

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Light and sparkling but also textured and sensual. Guilty opens fresh with a zesty citrusy burst like a combination of orange zest and patchouli. Starts to dry down to a cool floral and shifts to something a bit more sheer and watery. I get subtle hints of violet and and the texture starts to become powdery although I'd say it's a very light powder. I also get a sheer earthy aroma that smells a bit damp (though light and inoffensive) and there's something that smells woody about this as well which could be part of the amber I see listed as a base note. Overall it's a light fresh scent that expands to become a bit more powdery at heart and something I enjoyed getting wafts of as I wore it. Not mind-blowing or unique but also easy on the nose and inoffensive.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Let me start by saying that till now I haven't found a single Gucci perfume that I liked, and this is no exception. Smells to me like bug spray mixed with a bit of baby powder. It just has this Guilty dna that I am not a fan of. Performance is good but I don't like it. I don't feel "Guilty" that I didn't buy it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Having liked the unusual accords of the original Gucci Guilty, I was keen to compare it with this newer iteration, especially given the colourful retro-fabulous Lana Del Rey/Jared Leto ad campaign. However, this is a watered-down version, despite containing many of the original notes. Overall, this is less sweet and more green, but lacks depth.

After the alcoholic haze of the initial spray dies down, citrus and patchouli jump out at me. More tart bergamot than sweet orange, it has an earthy green, almost masculine quality. The geranium becomes more evident after half-an-hour or so, with a musky undertone. Violet and amber creep into the drydown but Guilty quickly fades to a powdery skin scent. Limited longevity and moderate sillage. Not a floral fragrance to me, could be unisex.

Fleetingly interesting, but ultimately disappointing. Passable, inoffensive day scent.
Guilty of insipidity. 2/5.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Very disappointed with this perfume.
I bought it after smelling a faux version on my Daughter, thinking how lovely it was.
The (expensive) reality is very different.
It's a nice smell initially, though probably a bit too musky for my liking, however, within an hour, it's faded to practically nothing on me!
All that's detectable is a very faint powdery smell - my family couldn't even tell I'd got any perfume on! It is like a very watered down EDT instead of the EDP it is supposed to be.
I was hoping this was going to be my new signature perfume for all occasions, instead, I have just wasted £50 😡

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I’ve just realized that I have been owning this fragrance for longer than a year now, thanks to one of the most generous Fragranticans, Scarbo, and never got to review it.
I am wearing this on a way too warm early spring day, around 15+ degrees Celsius, sun shining and an overall uplifting, optimistic day.
And Guilty EDP sings beautifully on my skin, not too intrusive but not too close, loud enough for me to catch wafts of it when I walk or move. The scent is very soft (as in tender and graceful), but absolutely present and it’s as clear as spring water. I get slightly sweet, dewy flowers and plants with a crystalline quality. Almost a glassy / sheer perfume, somehow innocent because of the lack of sweetness and “fluff”, yet in no way simple or immature.
I see this fit for any lady, from young to mature, because it’s so classy and feminine that it cannot really clash with anyone, as long as it’s worn with grace, imo.
Performance is fine on me. I have sprayed it 3 hours ago and I still very much smell it (not up close from the skin, because I have sprayed it on my neck, therefore I’m pretty sure it creates a bubble around me).

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I smelled it in winter in Russia in 2019, as my friend was wearing it while we were in the Ural forest there walking for about 3-4 hours. The minute I smelled it on her it was like that smell I was searching for since I was a teen in Russia in 1983- or even earlier... I can't remember to be honest what year it was. I wore many other perfumes which reminded me in a certain way about that dreamy like a fairytale perfume. I put it back then in 1980-s on my fur around my neck as my classmate's mom had it in a tiny little bottle made in France, this packaging was so similar in style to Channel as my mom always had Chanel 5 at that time, but this wasn't it for sure nor Gucci. I went through many vintage pictures and even bought Chantilly although the packaging was very different again, the experts were saying this was it; not it wasn't unfortunately... From my memory, it was in a way similar maybe to Chantilly, but way better smell than both of them Chantilly and Chanel 5 ... Mind you back in 1970-s or 80-s Chanel was a lot different than these days. I bought Ch5 again for my mom just a couple of years ago, and I swear it just has a horrible heavy and irritating side to it. So, I am waiting now to get Gucci Guilty once I have a chance to smell it and buy it in the store here in NZ. I am an old fashioned and I only trust to buy my perfumes in stores.
This perfume was made to evoke my memories when I was a teen. Some compositions are just calling you and you can't get enough of them. Thanks, Gucci, you made my dreams come true.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
So.. my task today was to compare this and the old intense edp. I really love reading scrupulose reviews so I will try for somebody who is breaking the head about new and old before sniffing. When I sprayed it I was a little dissappointed about the new version - it's less loud and more rounded, maybe more mass pleasing, I usually like perfumes with character or I would say perfumes with characteristic smell. At the first 30 minutes, I would disagree with those who compared it with chloe love (RIP ;(, chloe was a thicker, a little bit darker, more powdery and dry. Also I cannot see masculine or vintage vibe, but it's also not candy cotton girly sugar water like many of the new perfumes. I would say it's interesting and really represents more modern version of guilty (not that I have issues with old one :D) . This got more and more interesting while I analized it. Like I said, at start I missed the punch and loudness, what makes guilty guilty. It feels like you take the idea of guilty, but dilute it with something greener, brighter and lighter. When I think about associations - old one is oilier, translucent liquid in gold tone, new one is like translucent pale green glass, sun shines through it and you can see bright yellow.. so the feeling is like the new one is a little cleaner, tidier, not so sweet, which I like. And if we compare guccy guilty girls - for original girl/woman a lot of happens in her life, she enjoys it and she likes to be everywhere. She is clever, likes culture venues, she also likes to have a good party with a lot of drinks and dances till morning, she goes to dates, foodie etc... quite vivid. The new one also has everything happening in her life, but she is thinking more in advance and she cares for herself, she makes it happen the way it's good for her. So a little bit calmer, more in harmony, maybe little more minimalistic and eats healthier..

For both perfumes I see no age limit.

After some hours 2019 version is less sticky and more powdery than intense version, fades gracefully. But if you overspray you can catch detergant vibe.

In the end I can say, that after a day I fell in love with new EDP more and more. I like that it wraps you in a soft airy, but not sugary and sticky cloud. I thought that I would miss original guilty's DNA, but after a while compared with new one it feels overwhelming in some way.

Guccy Guilty 2019 edp Its a little greener, airier and sunnier, less sweet, but has the same idea underneatg. It's more modern but in a good way. Longetivity is somewhat the same for both. :))

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I came across this perfume at Sephora and remember falling in love with it immediately. After smelling several perfumes from the Gucci Bloom and Tom Ford ranges, I felt that Gucci Guilty pour femme stood out as feminine, light, powdery and elegant. In my opinion, this is the type of scent that does not perform like a typical perfume with monstrous sillage. Instead, it wears close to the body despite being long-lasting. At first spray, it is a sweet floral that quickly develops into a slightly spicy mildly fruity concoction. The dry down smells a little bit like baby powder, mild soapiness and of course, sweet florals. It is absolutely beautiful. This is a crowd pleasing scent that is appropriate for the workplace but also for date night. For this reason, I think Gucci Guilty Pour Femme could easily be adopted as a signature scent that is elegant and timeless. Needless to say, I purchased this fragrance immediately.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I have to be honest and say that I actually prefer this one over the original Gucci Guilty. Maybe it's because I love powdery floral scents. I love the manderin and red pepper opening followed by sweet violets and lilac. It's classy and has a vintage vibe which makes me feel nostalgic. My girlfiend loves this scent which is another pro. To be fair I did expect something more 'Guilty', but i like this nevertheless.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Smelled it today at Gucci counter, it reminded me about Chloe Love - a nice powdery scent was discontinued by Coty.
Gucci Guilty EDP is too generic, quite pricey and not worth money at all

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Lilac powdwery, wet/dry pressed compact face powder. Reminiscent of an old world. Some may even say it is old like perfume - something sitting on an old style dresser. I dont care, i like it. But dont expect a bomb.
Either way, it is nude like - And it has a kind of musky soft spicy nude allure, (keep thinking lilac too). Its not an overtly "sexy" perfume. Its more like - im nude so come in closer and smell the sweet spice of my skin.
Sadly, I find it performs well on a card and not so much on my skin - its like its kind of there but not ?
Perhaps it is one of those invisible under the radar penetrators, that softly projects..
You will be Guilty ! .. Innocent but GUILTY ! - only for the wicked fun this suggests and should get you into.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: With the exception of Delina Exclusif this is my favourite perfume that has come on the market in the last few years. I love the loud opening note that smells to me like bitter cherries, I think it is a mix of the pink pepper and germanium, whatever it is it’s lovely and so is the dry down

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This signora is an underrated beauty. GGPF has some of the original Guilty DNA, but this flat passport-like bottle takes you on a fresh journey through the collection. Along with shades of lilac and violet, I also detect some heliotrope and almond nuances (similar to the texture found in Alien), powdery softness and clean soapy musk. A little sweet mandarin offers sparkle to the warm base.

It's light, elegant and clean. If being addicted to this scent is wrong, then I'm Guilty!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I really love the Guilty EDP. I never really tried the earlier EDT so I can't compare, but this has a nice opening that is bright but not too citrusy. The main notes aren't necessarily clear on paper but this is not A Rose Perfume with some backup singers, it's a floral perfume that might have some rose in it, which I really appreciate. It's a really nice blend. I'm not sure I actually know what geranium alone smells like but I think I like it. It doesn't have a distinctive lilac like a soliflore but you can tell it's in there. The drydown is a really nice warm, sweetish patchouli that lingers a long time on my skin. It wears really well all fall/winter/spring so far, feels beautiful, and is a nice alternative to powerhouse white flowers or pure rose for when you still want a floral not fruity or tea or musk.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Blind buy fail. If anyone wants to buy or swap with me let me know. This is a creamy musky floral that is so light and inoffensive I can hardly tell I’m wearing anything. It’s not a bad scent, if you could actually smell it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I just have to admit that I’m just so into this fragrance. It’s so creamy, musky, light lilac floral with an elegance to it. It’s clean, fresh, and subtle which I like sometimes and over the top other times. It’s not overly floral but I love how rich but creamy this is. It’s warm and effortlessly sensual. I love it. Lilac can be intense but this isn’t at all. I have this and the Edt and they smell almost identical. I prefer the Edp because it lasts longer and is a little bit stronger but it still smells just like the Edt. It’s so good I can’t stop smelling it. It’s very office or anywhere friendly and it would make a great signature fragrance.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This starts off on me very fresh and sweet and then turns into something that smells like expensive soap. I'm not usually a fan of soapy perfumes but this is the right kind of soapy. I don't know what it is about this perfume but I just can't get enough of it. Wearing it I suddenly see myself in a whole different way. I feel confident, sophisticated, sexy even. I honestly have no idea why people are saying it's masculine. On me it feels feminine and then some. It isn't the strongest perfume but it's adequate in that respect. Usually I have to spray twice if I want it to last all day. Seems to cling to clothes for ages though. Sex in a bottle. I'm definitely buying it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I tried this on a whim at sephora and was taken by surprise at how elegant and lovely this is! Very classy, sophisticated, sexy, alluring stuff. Even my husband deemed it "Fantastic" which is high praise coming from him! It has a low sillage but extreme longevity - I can still smell it with my nose to my arm at 15 hours!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Elegant, creamy-powdery and classy. The nuances differ with temperature, as a reviewer below already has mentioned.
Winter test: sparkling, but elegant beginning (mandarin, bergamotte), distinct flowers and soapy woody (Patchouli)musky drydown. I think that part may seem a bit masculine to some; for me it seems just classic and mature (the good kind of being mature).
