Spring test: yummy sweet mandarin opening, mingled with lilac and sweet violets, bit candy like due to a more enveloping and warmer ambernote. Not so much Patchouli, stronger and longer lasting heartnotes.
Both experiences: an updated, even upgrated version of the original.
Personal taste: I like the less sweet experience in winter more, but the springtime sensation is also alluring.
My final vote: underrated.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is a really lovely scent, if you like makeup, powdery type smells you'll probably like this, this isnt the standard makeup scent but it gives me the same sort of vibe. Very soft violet, lilac rose powdery scent with a twist - it's got a slight warmth to it and at times it smells like sweets...I cant put my finger on which ones persay but like a gummy sweet, however it isnt juvenile, this is one classy mama and a great mix of modern and vintage, this is extremely feminine. The only negative about this scent is if I wear it too much it doesnt smell the same and I lose interest in it, it kind of becomes very nondescript, but then if I stop wearing it for a while and then wear it again it smells just as beautiful as it did with the first few wears, it's really wierd, I've never had a perfume that does this...either way its beautiful

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
The description 'dirty floral' makes most sense to me, because the florals are there, but somehow distorted. I love the scent of lilac so much, but this is more like a lilac bush trapped under a thick layer of dry bergamot and powdery violets.

My boyfriend said it's too sweet, but it's not to my nose.. quite the opposite, just very dark, maybe bittersweet? So the sample I got left me a little indecisive. I don't hate it and I understand why many people may love it, I guess this just isn't for me.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Gucci Guilty Love has just come out with a wonderful set of notes and a beautiful peach coloured bottle

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is truly a more intense vetsion of the EDT but with added powderiness and sweetness.Sillage and longevity both average somehow more suitable for daywear and cool temperature.It smells great and I do not think it got the attention it deserves.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: second review: in summer time this wears totally differently than now,when temperatures dropped below zero. now its very intense,bright and a bit overwhelming.though in summer time it was so juicy and sparkly on my skin,i was spraying a lot,now 2 small spritzes and thats more than enough. this temperature thing makes sense.totally.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I love the intense version of Gucci Guilty. However, this is a floral , warm, sexy and sophisticated smell. With this one after an hour the mandarin/orange note dominates everything else. It's not as long wearing, dark and powerful as the intense version obviously. Expected something more from this one. Would be great for Christmas or New Year's as it has a festive atmosphere due to the mandarin.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Wore a tester for the past week. On the one hand, this smells v. good - it is pleasant, rich, it smells expensive and it has presence without being obnoxious. This is what made me love it at first. On the other hand, it doesn't smell really original or specific to me now that I've worn it for a longer period. It is not quite generic but it does smells a bit like a perfume store, it smells like the idea of perfume. In the very best way possible, don't get me wrong, but still; Gucci Guilty doesn't seem to have a very strong identity to me. Nevertheless charming, and I find the advertising for this absolutely delicious. May still purchase a small bottle if I ever come across a good deal.

01/21 I still think it's not super interesting but I love it anyway! The lilac is delightful, warm and elegant. Sometimes you need a scent like that, and I think I wear this one well. Bought 30 ml today.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Well blended fragrance that evokes class and confidence. It’s the best from this line. Warm, powdery, versatile and expensive smelling.

Good for the workplace. Would be great for all seasons. Sillage is soft/moderate, longevity good.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I was gifted with the original Gucci Guilty EDT years ago and was madly in love with it eventhough it doesn't last long on my skin. I did try to repurchase it earlier this year however it doesn't sit with my skin like how it used to be. This, however, performs a million times better! It is the EDT but way waaaay better. Tested it on the counter this afternoon. 1 spray on my arm, and until now, 6hours and a bath later, I can still smell it (though it's now faint since I took a bath) the opening is the same to me however the dry down is much deeper (maybe even to deep so I think 1 to 2 sprays is enough) Sillage is soft for 1 spray but as long as I can smell it on myself, I'm good. I want to purchase the full bottle.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Its similar, but also different from original Guilty. I liked this perfume from the first time ive tried. Elegant, not cheaply sweet, sophisticated perfume. Especially nice, when put a little bit on the hair.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Violets so sweet (in a great way) that they smell like peach gummy rings! Chewy open, nothing like the EDT!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
One gorgeous floral with a sweet backdrop. The lilac is evident but also sweetness from the orange and amber. A little kick from the pepper and violet. The pepper gets a little stronger with time but otherwise there is not much development.
It's such a lovely sweet floral that I don't mind at all.
My only disappointment is the longevity is poor but the sillage is moderate in a warm room.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: @Ulusia you’re not alone..I’ve same opinions about that.I do like this fragrance at first sniff,thought that what a feminine & elegant scent is that..But I believe that positive words evokes positive feeling at least for me.But even that it still has a chance to buy;)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
One of these things is not like the other one.....

The edp in the ‘absolu like’ bottle, is not like the guilty edt in the rounded squared bottle.

This starts bright floral, white floral but .. bright, it’s a touch dirty like the other edt, but only slightly, this has stems in it with the flowers without being green. Plus a little like the smell if you nick the skin of an orange thrown in too.
This isn’t strong, I suppose i it catches your clothes it will last a bit longer. I had an hour now it’s a skin scent. This is like the dry version of guilty and without the Smokey dirty white floral feel.

This is not an amped up version of the edt, this is a different scent, with a different feel. Why Gucci? Stop messing around.
I should say that I do like the fragrance, and it’s the wee purple flowers that make the dryness. I’ve just washed my hands with some warm water and it’s made this pop out a bit more, I love the layer of smell under the dry layer. But I still want to point out to people that this is not the same as the edt the shop assistant said it was the edp version, pretty much the same scent, I don’t think so

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I love this! Like the original but better...Powdery soft spicy purple flowers...

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is soooo GOOD! Very elegant and expensive smelling! Also lasted on me a good 12 hours. Perfect timing for spring and the warmer months...

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Very much similar to the EDT..only I find this a slightly spicier..& dare I say slightly dirtier (in a good way lol)..i.e. this is like Guilty edt meets Chloe's Nomade..if that makes sense..it smells sophisticated & expensive.. a scent for a confidant classy (lady of business) who enjoys a nice boldness. It has a nice powdery touch & a scent you'll enjoy catching subtle wafts of. All in all really nice scent I enjoyed the original & this was no exception. Have to say if you liked the original EDT but longed for an EDP to deff. go for this one, I personally enjoy this more & would choose this over the edt. :)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This was a love for me. I was worried the floral notes in this, I am not a floral person. I found however this is a musky scent. Smelling it on paper does not do it justice. You must try it on your skin. I found it addictive.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Sniffing this fragrance was a milestone for me. For one, it reminded me of the first perfume I ever fell in love with - Bvlgari BLV, minus the sharp, throat-tickling ginger notes. Second, I've only just got back into collecting perfume and was so puzzled as to why some fragrances, especially florals, just make me nauseous and give me a headache. But after testing this and falling in love with it, (alongside a glorious shopping experience at the Gucci counter of a department store in Singapore), I came to understand that I can't deal with white florals, only purple ones. It's a real revelation for me! I adore this scent. It's not utterly feminine, there is a hint of something unisex there that makes it all the more lovely for me. It sprays out strong and loud but settles onto skin pretty nicely after a half hour. Longevity is not fantastic, I must admit, but it performs well in hot weather and I can use it in the day. My curiosity has been piqued and I will explore all the other fragrances in the Guilty line.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Soft, clean and powdery. Not exactly my cup of tea, but i can not say that i dislike it. It is discreet, feminine, comforting. It’s the best from this line.
I imagine an elegant and traditionally feminine woman wearing it. Most likely an introvert.
I think it is appropriate for all occasions, maybe even for a date. It has something to it that i can not describe. It isn’t sexy, but it somehow alluring. Could easily be someone’s signature.
It projects softly for the first minutes and then turns into a skin scent. Longevity is 3 hours and counting.
Final note: 7/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This should be right up my alley, but weirdly it’s not. In fact it’s so nondescript, I don’t even know how to begin describing it. Okay, so it starts as a powdery floral (lilac+violet), but only for the first half an hour; then it turns herbal and sweet-ambery, courtesy of orange, patchouli and amber. I feel that the scent is not given enough time to develop before this cloying sugared patchouli takes over. It reminds me of Ayurveda by Tesori d’Oriente - a scent that costs 5€... That’s exactly how much the newest Guilty is worth.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Man, if this didn't have violet it would be a winner for me! It's so frustrating when you figure out what notes you don't like and designers seem to use them all the time in fragrances you want to try, LOL!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I love the opening of this one! I smell berries, violets and powder. After about 10 minutes, sadly, this just turns bad on my skin, almost sour. I adore Love Chloe Intense (it's my signature), and I smell a faint similarity in the beginning, but they are definitely not the same. The original Guilty is much nicer on me.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Interestingly, the reviews are all over the place on that one...I don't find it boozy, nor masculine, I run if a scent is remotely unisex !! This is basically a well balanced creamy perfume, I don't find it exactly like the original, I much prefer this version,but they aren't very different, it has no sharp edges, and the lilac is smooth and pretty...it is also kind of fresh, like the florals aren't overwhelming , it smells modern and definitely feminine.
Now it isn't powdery like Chloe Love, although they share a certain vibe...happy to own it, it is my favorite of the Guilty !

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Stunning.
Creamy and powdery... Long lasting.

This is a hit with customers looking for an initially quite sweet and fresh fragrance with lasting power and a creamy drydown...

Want it to pop? Layer it with the men's Gucci guilty pour homme (original)

I do believe this is replacing the previous guilty range for women, as an updated, more current fragrance.

Delicious and I'm a massive fan.



While you're at it, layer the men's Gucci guilty absolute with Burberry her and you're in for an absolute treat....

This combo is my current fragrance ❤️

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This smells nice but I prefer the original edt more because of the powdery lilac note . I am not a fan of Rose so much and as its not strong it does give it a vintage feel . So the commercial suits it well . It's definitely likeable and the bottle is nice but I will pass for now .

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This doesn't mean that the "normal" Guilty will be discontinued, does it?

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I've noticed here comparison to Chloe Love Intense in "This perfume reminds me of". That alone was a good reason to check it out. All three Chloe Love are one of dearest in my collection. Especially Love Florale and Intense. Unfortunately there is nothing similar between them. That said I have to add,that similarities weren't of course the most important factor. I also wanted to have this new baby for its own reasons,like great bottle, Gucci house, cool advertisement etc. But it didn't happen. The smell itself, although quite nice at the beginning, later turns up on me into sharp lilac mixed with some soap notes. Don't get me wrong. I do love soap, clean feeling in perfumes. If I didn't I wouldn't be a fan of Chloe Love Florale in the first place. But here the soap is unbearable to me. Too much of everything. The only good thing I can say about this new Gucci release is its longevity. It stays literally all day long on me. Well...in that case...unfortunately.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Finally Lana Del Rey! Girl is looking HOT in the ad! Cant wait to try it, notes seem classy. Hope the longevity and sillage will be good.
I really hope Lana will have her own fragrance one day.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Am I the only one who is put off by negative words like guilty, envy, madness, egoist, etc. in the names of perfumes?
I prefer more positive ones, such as: Eau des Merveilles, Euphoria...

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
First, let's take a second to appreciate the gorgeousness of the bottle!!! the bottle even looks better in reality,, packing:10/10.

The scent: it's indeed comparable to Gucci guilty intense, but more powdery; comparing it with Gucci guilty Absolute
they have nothing to share at all!!

The first stage: lilac and pink pepper, in the dry down the scent becomes more powdery and musky, even though musk is not included in the notes, I guess I get this feeling from the patchouli; for amber I can't feel it at all, the bergamot I can get a hint of it when the scent dries down, but I guess what really gives the scent that crispy feeling is the mandarin orange that shows up very well and adds a very pleasant twist, preventing the scent from being so powdery which might irritate some people!

All in all, I would classify the scent as a powdery sweet with a crispy edge; I find it classy and modern, and suits women +25.
So glad to have it in my collection 8.5/10.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: OMG!!! I think I'm more excited about Lana Del Rey than the perfume, lol... but I can't wait to try it! I am desperately waiting for the day that she releases her very own perfume ;)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I’m personally glad they have bought back the edp of Guilty, I was never a fan of the original edt’s in either the women’s or the men’s... I found them a bit bland and ineffectual as wearable fragrances, both requiring heavy use and re-application throughout the day as they were so light.
This(and i’m assuming it is the original edp formula) has extra body and although still a delicate feminine breeze of a fragrance, will linger through the day in a much more respectable manner.
Well worth switching up to if you are still attached to the original edt.


Regarding the packaging change, I hope this means they may just discontinue the original edt. I don’t find the re-packaging confusing as it makes more sense to unify the range under one recognisable bottle especially as the original edt women’s is virtually alienated by the introduction of the Absolute range.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Ok, so I finally got to sample this today. First off, it's definitely an amplified version of the original Guilty, which isn't a bad thing.

The orange is very intense to me and stays even throughout the dry down. The patchouli, lilac and amber are stronger in this composition as well, giving it an almost boozy quality. The bergamot and geranium are barely noticeable to my nose and I get slight pink pepper nuances.

Overall, I think I like this one better than the original Guilty; it's much longer lasting on me vs the EDT. Good job on the EDP, Gucci!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Very masculine. Reminds me of a greener version of Guilty for men and the original Gucci Guilty for women combined.

Disappointed as I believed it to be a brand new product

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Got a sample of this parfum today..I must say it's very nice I will buy a full bottle..but it's reminds me of love Chloe but this is better way more softer and not as sharp very feminine great job Gucci..this is very nice

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is availabe at Lord & Taylor at the King of Prussia mall. It's a floral that quickly dries into a spicy-woody scent. Smells like old school aftershave, very piercing and masculine. Not for me.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I guess they are discontinuing the original edt .... My beloved edt . This is sad to me . I'm going to try it and hope it smells like the edt only longer lasting . Its on my wish list for 2019!

I do prefer the bottle of the edt.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
From what I've gathered, this is supposed to be an amplified version of the original. Notes are as follows:

Top: Mandora, Bergamot and Pink Pepper

Heart: Lilac, Rose, Violet and Geranium

Base: Patchouli and Amber

Source: Belk.com

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Can't wait to smell this new one.. The notes are different saw it was available..

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Even if I love Gucci Guilty Absolute for Men, this new women's edition in a men's range bottle is rather confusing - does it mean that Gucci Guilty for her from 2010 is gone? Aren't there too many Guilty pleasures - even for Gucci?

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I hope they release the notes soon .
the tonka bean is so strong in this, it's off-putting. smells like an incense

This hit me with a blast of sage that died quickly into a very faint lingering smell on my wrist. No lavender or tonka which was disappointing because I bought the sample for those notes. Very one-note, gross, and weak.
Lavender-scented water--Gucci is not joking. Evaporates and it is barely perceptible.

Blind-bought a small decant of this because I love lavender. I've been wearing it for 2 days and I'm very pleased that it lasts on me for about 2 hours, unlike the other reviewers who observed that it dissipates incredibly quickly. Unfortunately, other than a very brief whiff of lavender at the start, this smells to me like one-dimensional sage. I'm glad I just got a decant and didn't splurge on the full bottle.

Reminds me of being a baby, if that’s possible. In a good way. I feel comforted. But yes, the lasting power is abysmal. 5 minutes maybe. The most similar fragrance I’ve smelled is Lush Twilight, which also features lavender and tonka. Moonlight serenade is just a bit more airy and botanical
so beautiful, so timeless, so androgynously ethereal and angelic. the entire line is eden-like. wont last too long but a single spritz makes me smile for a week. im glad this exists.

The most beautiful Lavender scent i have ever smell but only for the first 10 Seconds. Literally 10 Sec. and its gone.
I know, the name said "Scented Water" but what's the point for having a full bottle (or even launch this perfume) if its can last only 10 second?

Scent : 10/10
Performance 0.1/10

Period.

This fragrance is a lovely fresh lavender. Wish the bottle reflected that. It would have been such a pretty 😍 addition to this collection. A very light, clean, green lavender lotion. Pleasant, fleeting, moderate projection, low longevity. Reminds me of Chanel Jersey, not nearly as potent though.

Tested on back of my hand.
Immediate blast of memories of my grandma that used different types of lavender eau de toilette through her life. Sometimes I was not keen on certain brands and sometimes I was uninterested, but it was her scent.
This is a lovely lavender, it’s green but also creamy.
It’s a lavender that I, as a non lover of that note, will probably wear from my tester for fun and memories sake, because it does not last more than an hour (at a push).
Would I splash out on a full bottle? Not for me, but if my grandma was still alive it would have been the perfect gift for her 90th birthday this past December. A little decadent treat that she could spray freely and admire the bottle on her dresser.
smells like my grandpa. I think this perfume is not suited for youngsters.

Gucci’s ‘Moonlight Serenade’ is so short-lived as it’s only a scented water, but in those moments it’s with you, it’s such a beautiful, realistic lavender soliflore.

This shy and fleeting fragrance is like Cinderella, as soon as she enters the ball, she’s the most authentic and beautiful thing you’ve ever experienced, but as the party warms-up and the clock strikes midnight, she’s suddenly gone, and doesn’t even leave behind her shoe.
This fades away after 5 minutes.... Nothing special, you could easily find the same scent like this in other fragrances, pretty bottles, though doesn't worth the price!
palm kerasa banget

Loved the original so I got a bottle at Marshall’s 15 years ago In my opinion it’s nothing like the original Rush. Love it for different reasons. Very similar to Rush Summer. No need to splurge on a stale bottle. Right now at TJ Maxx they have a dupe that is just a plain small clear bottle that just says Garden Charm with a green hue. I believe it's one of those "tru fragrance" scents. The ones they just have out with no box lol
reminds me of a cologne water that I would smell all the time as a kid it makes me kinda lightheaded

Worst flanker of all time.

Such a disservice to the OG.

Gucci Rush 2 is a light, floral fragrance with a clean and slightly woody undertone. It feels modern and subtle, suitable for everyday wear. While not overpowering, it may fade quickly on some skin types.
I had this in my late teens & I remember it being VERY fresh. I loved it. That’s what I gravitated toward when I was that age; anything fresh & fruity. Rush 2 was so perfect for hot summers.
Try eclát No.081 as a dupe for it.

Gucci... women really love this perfume...let us have her back! The scent memories with this perfume are now part of my DNA if that's even possible. Honor the magnificent perfumer Michel Almairac's creation so she lives again. Gucci Rush just isn't my love like "2". I search for the best deals I can find on the last inventory to be had. The price people are asking for her now is outrageous. I still manage to find a fantastic deal on occasion. I've worn her since the first release. I will hunt her down as long as I can. I never want to be without my Gucci Rush 2. When I smell it on myself, I think ...this is so me & I can't help but smile...❤️
This is my go-to spring scent! It's so fresh and floral, but not overpowering. I love the combination of freesia, rose, and lily-of-the-valley in the top notes. The musk adds a nice touch of warmth.

Omg I love this so much. Reminds me of being in my early 20's and hanging out in the VIP room at Club X in San Francisco! I really wish there was a way to still be able to get it and experience that nostalgia again.

30.September 2024

OMG, is this the best synthetic floral scent ever?? I mean, i did not like original Rush, even thoygh it was my best freind's sugnature and i quickly dismissed Rush2 as something not original or outstanding when it was released (maybe i just did not like the cheaply looking packaging?), but i recently acquired a bottle of it and i am testing it and im in love. It is nothing like original Rush, i do not smell any similarities, apart of same synthtic feel. I love tuberose, i love lily, they are here, but not your typical heady tuberose, this is mostly fresh lily, not cloying at all. Opening is fresh, flowery, syntheticly nice. It is still not the most original or outstanding, but it is really-really nice!! I say that sadly lasting power is not the best, almost 3hrs on my cold skin, and of what most magical part only ladts for about an hour. Yet it is refreshing, young, simple and seductive. I bet guys will love it! Now i need a backup! :)

I did not understand the popularity of this until I applied it on a hot day. Wow, it feels like a memory the author wanted to capture with this scent. Hot, sweaty body, under a shower, washed with a fruity-floral shower gel. Someone must have loved this memory. This is how the Rush 2 smells. Like morning after a clubbing night. It has a substantial projection and great longevity. Memorable scent.
For anyone that's looking for an alternative - VINE by Piper & Perro will do the trick!

This reminds me of that "Valérian et la Cité des mille planètes" scene (the only scene from the movie which I remember) where the two main characters are bickering on the beach over a cocktail and then later it turns out that the beach was just a simulation projected over walls of a sterile white room. Of palm trees planted in corridors of malls' luxury sections. Spreading a towel to suntan on Dubai's coast with oil rigs before you and unfinished skyscrapers behind.

I was once caught by a downpour in a middle of a walk through Singapore's National Orchid garden, waiting for the rain to end in one of its white-glass greenhouses -- Rush 2 makes me think of that. It's cooling, green, behaves well in humidity. For some reason it doesn't remind me of air refreshers as 2000s aquatics usually do. Is it the bitterness? Lack of citruses? Whatever it is, other aquatics don't really inspire me, but I would love to spend a season somewhere like Taipei or Sydney or any other warm seaside metropolis with pair of vintage Dior ski-mask sunglasses and a 75 ml bottle of Rush 2.

Rush 2 is reminiscent of OG Gucci Rush as it had inherited its predecessor's unashamed artificiality, that light sweetness of cheap plastic but it is very different in its mood. Rush (an eternal love of mine) is pointedly pessimistic, stuck in a melancholy it doesn't want to be taken out of. It sits alone on a tiled floor of a bathroom in one of those abandoned industrial buildings turned night clubs, gone a little mad, mumbling Baudelaire to itself as people step over its legs: l'Espoir, Vaincu, pleure...

Rush 2? For some reason the start of R2 clicks play on the Azealia Banks' "Count Contessa" in my head. R2 is more like: "The world is ending? Okay, fine, whatever. Bring out your swimsuit skin, we are switching the server's ambiance to Fiji."

I originally found this perfume in 2002 on a cruise ship. I was 20 at the time and I fell head over heels in love with it. I have since purchased half a dozen bottles even though it has long been discontinued. My last OG bottle has gone bad, sadly, but I am keeping it for sentimental reasons. I have since found a good quality fragrance oil dupe and have been wearing the heck out of it recently. Compliments galore. I get an instant mood lift when I wear it. Bright, cheery, fresh and watery. This is one of those perfumes where I cannot detect any of the notes individually but I just know that I'm in love with how it smells. I've never found another fragrance quite like it, so if anyone knows something that is remotely similar, please DM me! I will continue to use the fragrance oil dupe but would love to continue exploring other options.

I really really love this perfume.
It is light, girly, innocent, but sexy.
Maybe girls don’t realise it, but boys definitely like it on girls.
And very important for me, i don’t have headache from the scent.
What a pity that i can’t buy it anymore…
Smells lysol 🩷
i'm not sure if I can give a valid review of this because I think my sample was too old or some thing. All I smelt was alcohol😢 really sad because I was expecting to like this a lot .
@madalina.trifu - thanks, but the one u're referring to is compared to Rush, which is a different perfume
If you're looking for something similar, giving the fact that Rush was discontinued, try Sospiro Liberto. It's almost the same smell, with similar notes and long lasting sillage.

Usually when a perfume is discontinued I put on pink glasses and think it's the best one I've ever smelled. So, having said that, it is very nice scent, airy and green floral, but unfortunately plasticky. There is a certain plasticky note that turns the scent to "meh" for me.
Honestly, this scent in the early 2000's sent me absolutely loopy. I don't know what it was, but something about the top notes just absolutely intoxicated me.

Unique and daring green scent!
I don't know why, but this scent reminds me of water lilies...
OR.. cold grapefruit water...:)
Fresh, green and bitter!
I know why people love it - because it's finally smth without any sweetness!

One of my all-time favorites. It reminds me of new clothes, new shoes, new car smell. It’s fresh, bright, summery, slightly floral. It makes me feel like I’m rich, successful, powerful and well dressed. It gives you the feeling you have when you put on all the new stuff you just bought on a shopping spree.

Masterpiece modern green floral sexy but playful and also professional, genius work of art. Gucci frequently discontinues. Early 2000s were the best for gucci e.g envy, gucci II. The stuff they come out with these days is a let down. Niceish openings but gone in 5 mins.
Very sweet and floral without being heavy. Smells like apple tree flowers in morning dew.This is a long time favourite and I have always come back for it.

My rating is for the 2001 edition - the reformulation has destroyed that warm, sweet freshly-showered memory. My signature scent early 2000's ( and Volupte -Paco Rabanne) - can't count the number of ladies who bought Rush 2 after I began using it...& men loved it! Why do they discontinue or ruin these beauties! ...why? ...sigh...
Smells exactly the same as Fresh Linen air refresher.
The resemblance with the original Gucci Rush is small, but it's there. Rush 2 is perfect for spring and summer. It smells like a green garden after the rain. Shame that this has been discontinued.

This was a recent blind buy, I found a 30ml in TKMaxx for £30. I had already read reviews for it, so was fairly sure I would like it. I don’t know what age this bottle is, but it smells nothing like the descriptions here. It has a very bitter pungency to it, like a dominant black currant or tomato leaf note (but very harsh & crude). I usually like bitter, but here it’s combined with a sort of burnt plastic smell. It actually smells really unpleasant to me. I would describe it as fruity only - because I can’t detect any floral notes at all. It did remind me of Kenzo Le Monde Est Beau - but comparing the 2, the Kenzo is way more nuanced, & 100x better imo. Quite honestly, sniffing them both side by side & Rush2 smells like utter crap. Odd considering the ridiculous prices this perfume sells for now. Also, it dried down to practically no smell at all after a few hours..a very faint musk.

Don’t know if this just my odd perception, or if this bottle is old & spoilt - or if it’s been badly reformulated at some point, prior to being discontinued. I can’t be doing with checking & obsessing over batch codes & all that stuff, so I don’t know. For anyone missing this perfume I recommended just get yourself a bottle of Kenzo Le Monde Est Beau & you will have a similar, but (I think) better perfume!

Like it. It’s leaning quite unisex and more green than expected, I guess that’s the palm leaf note, which I love - it makes the white flowers aquatic and delicious. Relevant resemblance to the first Gucci Rush, with it’s plasticky base - feels like the scent of natural summer rain in a futuristic city of glass buildings, or a walk in a tropical jungle with bamboo and palm trees, I also get pop art vibes (maybe it’s the packaging). Absolutely adore the zero sweetness, that’s hard to find these days in a woman’s fragrance. It feels fresh, humid and artificially delicious on skin.

It smells like the most beautiful day in Spring. It has lots of flowers and they combine to create a super creamy,lotiony smell. Magic on my skin.
Haven't come across a bottle in years. Miss it a lot.

Ovaj parfem na meni je imao magična svojstva, da divno mi je mirisao na prvu i odmah sam postala ponosni vlasnik, ali ono kako sam ja drugim mirisala učinilo ga je top parfemom u mojoj kolekciji, dok nije nestao sa polica...
Slučajni prolaznici i ne znanci su mi znali spontano na ulici reći kako mirišem neobično prelijepo, očaravajuće i sl.
Zamjenu mu još nisam pronašla...

This perfume reminds me of living in Manhattan and enjoying it’s crazy energy and atmosphere 🔥 I often received compliments of my perfume back then and it was always Gucci Rush II. I didn’t like the Rush I, it was too sweet and obnoxious.
Rush II was feminine and sensitive, sweet white flowers, jasmine. It was very sparkly and festive like wearing pink champagne.

I wonder if I can find it now…

I purchased samples not realizing until after my 1st impression that I didn’t order Gucci Rush. Before I realized this mistake I thought this fragrance was fruity, fresh and good for the daytime and warmer weather. The fruit smelled like peaches to me and reminded me of an intense version of Jessica Simpson fancy love. I will test again now that I realize I bought a flanker🤦🏻♀️

Unfortunately this is discontinued now. Yes ladies the first of the pink trio (along with edp ii and envy me) has disappeared. It is next to impossible now to find this at a resonable price online and in duty free shops unless you want to encounter a fake or something. This was a lovely fresh, springlike alternative to the original rush in the opaque bottle. I can also see (when i look at the reminds me of section) that this is a unique scent as there are barely any fragrances on the market that it smells similar to so no chance of finding a dupe for now. Another reason to mourn.

I have just written my impression on the GR 1. I was so afraid to smell the GR 2. If you know the flankers, you know they usually change few notes, but it is still the same DNA.

LUCKILY, not with this one. While I have a bit repulsive relationship with the 1, 2 was love at first sniff. Aaaand.... I am going against the crowd again 😁

Repeatedly I am shocked at the reviews. GR is certainly NOT the younger sister of GR 1. On the contrary. They are not even at one family. To me, this is completely different fragrance. The notes are blended seamlessly. Yes, I smell berries, but not in a juvenile, teenagery, simplistic way, like perfumes in a drugstore 👎They are deep, dark, mature and have a distinct elegant undertone. I can smell a note that I can't name, which reminds me of those very sophisticated perfumes from my childhood. Somewhere around the 80-s. It brings me happy memories. I think my Mum used to smell like that note - maybe it was the formulation of her face creams. And I haven't smelled that note since then. (Sidenote: I do not understand why has perfumery changed so much. Those scents in the 80-s were so good!)

Well, this is another great example that notes do not give you much clue. Go and sniff it for yourself. And no offence to Fragrantica reviewers, but you can discover that you can totally rely only on your own nose. Because you can be like me, the White Raven😉

In the beginning, Rush 2 left me with one strong impression: "watery berry". What makes it special is, that while it has the full body of the berry notes, it comes without much of the sweetness one would expect. Rather, in its early-to-mid stages, Rush 2 reminds me of shampoo and wearing it makes one smell freshly showered.

The palm tree / narcissus notes come out early and lend just a hint of air and bitterness to the composition. This bitter stage lasts for roughly 1h 30 minutes. After that you get a more linear berry-scent with the black currant beginning to shine. This stage, with the black currant notes getting stronger and stronger also marks the final stage of the fragrance, which alone lasts more than six hours on my skin.

During this last hours, I do not get any hints of "dark" materials such as the oakmoss. Rather than that, it is just the berry notes that are gaining intensity, while some of the watery aspects tone down. By the time Rush 2 disappears around 8 hours after the application, it is pretty much a straight berry fragrance.

In the beginning, Rush 2 has moderate sillage, but becomes a skin scent from hour 3 onwards. Here I would like to add that, although the original Rush is the overall louder fragrance, from the moment both become skin scents, Rush 2 is more strong and stable than the original.

As for my verdict, I would like to say that the emotion Rush 2 evokes in me mainly is nostalgia.

This fragrance so much smells like most girls in the late 1990s / early 2000s smelled like. There was a time, when everything was berry-flavoured. Yves Rocher berry-scented shower gel and body lotion that were popular in those days also come to my mind. Young girls nowadays probably use other products, but to me this is the fragrance profile that I will always connect to this age group.

That being said, I find Rush 2 to be a very pleasant fragrance and personally prefer it over its predecessor. While it does smell less expensive than it is, it is still a very nice representative of the berry genre.

Rush 2 surely can be recommended to girls in their teens and twens, but probably even more so to older ones who have experienced the late 1990s/ early 2000s and want some nostalgia. If you want to bring some memories back, fetch a bottle while you can.

TL;DR: regal early 2000s watery berry, not sweet.

That moment when the freesia faints, the palm tree settles, and the black currant embraces them all… divine!

Nevertheless, is not your typical “pretty-scent” from nowadays with all the orange blossom and jasmine...

It's so nostalgic for me, that I don't even know if I like it for its smell or for the memories it brings up! :)

Very certain a salesgirl strong-armed my mum into buying this 20 years ago or something. My mum was looking for a gift for me. Now she's a soft florals kind of person and not a fancy lady. No idea why but she got me Gucci Rush 2, which smelled too mature for me then, but I grew to love it. Rush had a prominent citrus note which was very sexy. It was kind of fizzy, I guess. I liked it a lot and I think it is a pity it has been discontinued. I think Incanto Bloom and Franck Olivier Nature (i think?) remind me of it, but I am not sure if I would get them.

I love Rush and it’s one of my signatures so of course I was curious about this one but they are totally different. The one thing they have going for them that’s similar is that plastic vibe they both share. Rush 2 is very clean, kinda reminds me of a floral laundry detergent with a dash of hairspray. I didn't get the black currant or oakmoss just the soft white florals with a little rose and that palm leaf. It’s not a bad scent but it’s pretty boring tbh. It’s the complete opposite of Rush which is fruity, earthy, synthetic and spicy. It’s still got a unique edge to it but longevity and projection on this one was not the best. Both fragrances layered together make quite a unique scent I will say but ultimately ended up giving my bottle to my mom and she loved it.

I have a supply of original Rush2 from circa 2001. Quite simply, this is a cleaner and fresher version of original Rush (of which I also have a supply from 1999). Somehow it seems fruitier than the single inclusion of black currents suggests. Curious how dissimilar compositions seem so obviously related; but in the case of these two they do. Because I'm commenting on original Rush2 all I can say is this is an absolutely gorgeous versatile perfume. The black currents are juicy. The florals are sweet. Not sure what 'palm' smells of, but there is a green aspect. Can't say I notice musk or oakmoss, which suggests they've combined cleverly with everything else.

Both Rush2 and the original Rush last all day on me. Despite the eccentric packaging (to which I am indifferent) Rush2 is high quality fragrance in the original versions. An era when Gucci really shone. 🇮🇹

I liked this fragrance, but probably won't repurchase it - I just prefer Gucci Rush.
Gucci Rush 2 is like a younger sister to Gucci Rush - more innocent, less obnoxious, delicate. I get why someone would like this one. I have a 50ml of it, but I'm quite... I don't know... unsure if I wanna finish it to be honest. It is nice, but it's boring to me. If I have to choose the best part about this fragrance - definitely the drydown wins. I love black currant, and combined with musk - I love it way more.
Just a dash of quite weak rose water. I don't get it at all.
Does this not smell like a more expensive Lysol spray to anyone else??
An unforgettable fragrance... A pity it was discontinued.

I think this is one of the most unique combinations I ever smelled (or was... as it seems to be less and less available)
I can not compare it really to anything else. The feeling it gives you is slightly similar to Gucci Envy, but the smell is much more subtle and creamy especially in the drydown. I love how the green and the white floral notes work together. It changes a lot along the way.
I normally don't really like lily of the valley, but in here its totally fine it goes away soon in the beginning and it is not overused.

I was having a coffee at a little independent cafe on Bedford St. in Brooklyn back in 2006 and a woman sat down at the table next to me. She smelled so beautiful that I just had to ask her what she was wearing. "Gucci Rush 2" she told me. I can't remember what she looked like, but based on how she smelled, I think it was either Giselle or Lara Stone ; ) Promptly bought it for my wife.

Almost everybody says that this fragrance is sexy. But I would not guess that in reality it means that in the start it smells like sweaty and unwashed body. Musky and indolic.

When the scent dries down, the sweaty note goes away. Almost.
What is left is actually soft and kind of freesia. It becomes "the perfume for blondies".

Because of the rough start I would not dare to wear it in hot weather.

I love the bottle, or lets say "container" of that one. It is unusual and screams late nineties/early millenial, so I guess it will be fashionable again very soon.
I remember, being an early teen when this came out and to me it is the scent of girly magazines, lipgloss, platform shoes and so on. For the scent itself, I think this is a pretty floral, almost showergel-like. The freesia is most prominent to me. Some green accord, I guess it is the palm tree, comes out also as a rather fort green impression, bamboo-like. To me, it definitely shares the same vibe with Gucci Rush, something sheer, plasticky, unnatural. It is synthetic, but strangely very appealing.

This one is fruity, citrusy and fresh. After many hours it settles to a warmer tone. It can be very heavy in hot climate where I live so I reserve it only for the night. I dare not wear this in the day. I loved it in my twenties, but at 43 years old not so much anymore.
Very light summer fragrance, to me is match green like lemon grass, i both it cose of freesia, but i dicidet the flower very thiny of the end after 2 hours.

I first wore this perfume back in 2003 and immediately fell in love. I had never been so drawn to a perfume before. It is perfect. I wish I could describe it better in words but it's one of those fragrances that doesnt have one major note that sticks out, at least to me. At first spray and for several hours later it smells the same, and then it wears off to a light musk. To me there is something watery about the scent, like freshly watered leaves and flowers. I don't get the black currant at all. I mainly sense a presence of palm and narcissus. There is nothing sweet about this fragrance, it is fresh but not in a citrus way, and floral, but not in the typical sense of floral. It's like I said, watery floral. It is just divine. I want to buy multiple backups so that I know I will always have this. It is such a unique fragrance, and every time I catch whiffs of it throughout the day, it just makes me love it all over again. I would say it is more of a spring/summer day time scent for everyday.
Wow to me it smells like "Nidra" bagnolatte! So clean and fresh...
Fresh, clean and definitely sexy!

Love this little pink sister to the original.
Gucci Rush 2 has the same kind of medical/metallic dna like the original which I am a big fan of.
I adore the fresia, blackcurrant, lily-of-the-valley and oakmoss.
So delightful, uplifting and cheeky at the same time.
One of the scents I hope I will always have in my collection.
Beautiful scent !
Longevity and silage is about moderate on me.

I really can't recall how I acquired this, but I was jolly glad I did. Once the scent has virtually expired, mine came with body lotion, sweet, long-lasting and saucy: it quite converted me to this method of wearing fragrance. True, it wasn't the longest lasting scent but the body rub had animal undertones and seemed to have more staying power.

I quite liked the idea of the oblong kitschy shocking pink bottle, but dang it was hard to get the last little bit out.

For a while I did the two-step with Gucci Rush 2 one night, then Dior Addict the next. Dior Addict won, needless to say. My, but I was a busy girl. It was trollop-ey, imagine Anita Ekberg wearing a tightly corseted off-the-shoulder number with carmine lipstick on. Men seemed to like it, and there was very little innocence about it!
Absolutely love this fragrance!! I find it such an uplifting, happy, energizing and fresh scent from the first spritz onward! Delightful!!
So disapointed when i recieved it and took my first sniff. It smells identical to my Sterilan roll on deo!

I used to be part of the crowd who thought Rush 2 bore no resemblance whatsoever to the original Gucci Rush. But now that I have worn both within a few days of each other, I have changed my mind. They ARE sisters! First of all, they have the same father, Michel Almairac. They were born a mere two years apart from each other and therefore part of the same "perfume trend generation". Like sisters who are close to one another, they are able to play together and layer well with each other. While original Gucci Rush is the louder, bossier, dominant older sister, Rush 2 tries to emulate her in certain ways. In Rush 2, the fruity aspect of Rush's peach is replaced by a sweet juicy black currant note. The original had a strong gardenia note, while Rush 2 has gardenia but it rests shyly in the background, preferring to let cleaner flowers like freesia and lily of the valley do the talking. The original is the bad ass of the clan, sneaking out late to party while Rush 2 stays home and studies but lets the original sneak back in through her window because after all, they are close and she likes to live vicariously through the stories Rush brings home. Rush 2 is the daughter grandma likes better but original Rush is the one who will go on to be famous.

Recently, I bought a bottle, or a "box" of Gucci Rush 2 from a duty-free shop. My perfume is produced in 2017 by Coty who acquired Gucci perfumes in 2016. We may say that discontinued Rush 2 is relaunched after Coty's ownership. As I have never smelled it before, I can not make any comment about reformulation issue.

If you get a REAL Gucci Rush 2, you might be in luck. Alas, even if that is the case, it will probably be past its shelf-life and veering into that smell of oblivion. As far as I know, it's discontinued. In its day, it used to be a light, but not-to-mess-around with smell. It was floral (without being too frau-frau), fresh and heady. One spritz was great for a summer outing, two, perfect for a date.

I really like this Rush version and it is very different to the original Gucci Rush, more different than I remember actually. This is much more fresh with just a hint of fruitiness. Lasting power isn't great, a bit less than average so you will need to bring it along to respray.

I'm a guy and I actually love to wear this.
I think it's better than the original rush.
I find this unisex for some reason.
Love the plexiglass bottle !!!

Oh this is the definition of happiness :) It is sweet, fresh delicious and cozy fragrance. It is my signature perfume every spring because it fits so good in warm but not yet hot days :) It feels like you are sorrounded with flowers from a beautiful garden. It takes just e sniff to give you a smile.

BEAUTIFUL FRESH MODERN LIKE A DEWY CRISP MORNING U CAN STILL GET IT
AMAZING

Gucci Rush 2 is such a refreshing floral. Floral without being sweet or cloying. Refreshing without any sort of aquatics or citrus. Light and airy but with good sillage and longevity. This perfume simply makes me feel happy and it's such a pity that it's discontinued.

this is one of my favorite summer scents-i love white flowers, but one in particular-narcissus-i think it is beautiful-and mixed with oak moss-so perfectly perfect! the black currant is just enough-there is no overwhelming citrus or fruity smell-but i never thought of black currant as citrus-y. more a richness....
the rose and gardenia don't kick in until after the dry down, and i associate the hint of sweetness from the lily of the valley-it almost borders on too much-but manages to stay light-almost green-due to the palm tree, i am assuming.....
i only need one spritz-more than that is too sweet, and too much floral....and too invasive to other people....
lasted at least 4-5 hours-i forgot to check again after that.

Have a bottle of this I bought in 2006 - I, apparently, went on a bit of a perfume spree that year!

I probably liked the pink bottle and I tend to like Gucci fashion.

Tried it for the first time, today.

It's not unpleasant, but one spray of this is almost imperceptible, on me.

At first, at least...

My current handwash leaves a stronger scent, even after it has been thoroughly washed off!

After a few minutes, it has got slightly more noticeable, however; but, it's also become slightly soapy (appropriately enough).

It's not bad, but I prefer something a bit (no, a lot) more rich, complex and intense.

Probably was expecting something a bit more like that from Gucci, as well, given their style.
One of the greatest things the Italians have given to womanhood ( or shall I say the French). Classy and elegant. Suitable for any occasion.

This is a very young fragrance for people who don't like much citrus in their perfume. It doesn't feel sweet,juicy or bitter,all about flowers.it's not annoying at all.so it can be worn at any occasion.
this is one of good works from Michel Almairac and I'm looking forward to try the original rush to see the difference.

This is 'oh so summer is about to begin' to me. It's elegant, fresh but sweet. Long-lasting on me and definitely a compliment getter. I like heavy stuff but this is really special and always in my collection.
Of all the fragrances I've owned this one is my favourite. It smells fresh, yet also sweet, almost tropical on my skin. I absolutely love it!
I was sure this had been discontinued? It just smelt like musky soap to me. I will have to try again i have seen it in stores but would be concerned it is very old stock?

I'm so happy to have found Gucci Rush 2. I even had a man say that this "smells like me", which is one of the highest compliments I have ever received for a perfume :)

About the scent, I find this so be so spring-like and charming. Beautiful, bright and fresh freesias, lightly spritzed with water, with a tinge of green from the palm leaf and anchored by that woody-musk base. Something slightly creamy often appears on my skin at times, too. I love how this is never too sharp or overpowering, which makes this effortlessly chic to wear at anytime and anywhere. I often wear this one to work.

Longevity is for about 5-6 hours on my skin; sillage is soft to moderate :)
Juicy, floral, sweet and light. The bottle is a little clumsy.

Honestly I don’t really like floral scents… but this is delicious. Like the first few weeks of spring, revival of the nature, fresh, crisp. I love the smell of freesia.
Gucci, please do not discontinue this scent!

If pink had a smell it would be Gucci Rush 2. It's not overly sweet, kitschy pink though! It's light, bright, fresh and delicious, dominated by white flowers (narcissus!) and black currant. There is also palm tree listed in the notes (I'd never guess) - so awesome! Girly, lovely, energizing.
There are two downsides:
1. Ugly, plastic bottle.
2. Weak longevity.
Very etheral and unique fragrance. No heavy botton notes, nothing earthy or too sensual. Just light and energetic.

Spring in the bottle.

Crisp and floral, lily of the valley reminds me of the fresh morning, the black currant is the promise of summer to come, palm leaf and moss make freesia a bit mild and it makes the fragrance inobtrusive. I like it, because it is wearable in the office, without turning it into flower shop.

I was in love with this scent when I was younger and used to wear it all day, it's young and fresh. The freesia is what you get first and after that develops a crunchy woody note. I wonder there is no citrus in it but it smells sparkling and bracing to me. It's a good choice for daily use, uplifting and light. No similarity to Gucci Rush (red bottle).
I love this perfume so much!! It lasts all day on me❤️❤️
This is a very light floral. I like it though.

This is the closest I've found to the scent of narcissus which is the crispest floral aroma I've encountered (although freesia is also dominant here).
Smells like the wind on a spring meadow or like the skin after a refreshing shower. Floral perfumes are rarely so fresh without citruses but this one is. It's invigorating and cooling.
I do appreciate the contemporary and minimalist bottle and I think it suits the scent.
I love wearing this perfume. It lifts my mood. It has some type of metallic feel along with the spicy sweet flowers. Top ten for me.

Oh my god I love this perfume! I don't consider it to be daytime, nighttime or occasion specific, it's a freaking all rounder. I am so angry that they have discontinued this beauty. For me, it's like a social fragrance. I think it has a very approachable vibe. It has some sort of musk at the very end but it's mostly freesia, green notes. It's super fresh but it's not just daytime appropriate. Whenever I wear this, it just lifts my spirits and makes me feel alive and confident. THIS PERFUME HAS THAT POWER. I just don't like the cheap bottle. It should've been prettier. Lasting power is 5-6 hours minimum.
It is like a teenage dream! Reminds me of the time of me being 13, but then again gives a feeling of a strong woman!
This perfume is ok, nothing amazing however. It bares the shadow of Rush (probably te freesia) however it's fresher. Staying power is medium, sillage is short after 15 minutes.

Fresh fragrance, although the discoloration of the box stains the liquid. I sprayed some and I have a slight red stain on my wrist. Gotta be careful when spraying this. The fragrance is not that amazing, but it is nice. Very refreshing and aquatic. The freesia is the star of the fragrance. A floral, light fragrance, slightly sweet. Very different from Gucci Rush. The only similar thing is the floral part is there, such as the gardenia and the freesia.
The best smell I've smelled. Moss and rose are the strongest, but smell is soft, a little bit sweet.
I was in a store a few weeks ago, looking at gucci perfumes, and they told me, that they do not produce Gucci rush 2 anymore
I love this perfume!!! There's nothing like it.

Dear GUCCI:
PLEASE do not discontinue this scent as well like you did with the original Envy some time back (big mistake!). The combination of notes in this look distinctive and the (plastic I know!) bottle is simple yet alluring. I have yet to own this scent but the few people who own it LOVE this fragrance and is often considered as a fresher alternative to the original Rush (far too popular!). I plan on making this fragrance my next signature as this fragrance is also very hard to find in my country so I will smell unique (as I am truly a unique person!).
Edit: I managed to score a small bottle of this at tkmaxx for about 27% of the retail price and the scent exceeded my expectations! I kept having to smell my shirt after I had sprayed this 3 times! This scent is indeed unique! Now I just want more! I have to keep looking where to find bigger bottles of this in order to keep my supply high!

ITS A MODERN
Fragrance
Amazingly FRESH CRISP COOLING
Again contemporary
Just AMAZING CLEAN YELLOW FLORAL
I can't understand why they want to discontinued it!!!!!!!!!!

I imagine a distent future, with metallic and plexi glass houses, and interior based on minimalistic facets. The juice is also very minimalistic. Its simple and clean yet still innovative. nothing reminds me of this smell. and I really loofa the crisp musk in this blend.

I don't know what they were thinking when they decided to pour nr2 into this ridiculously cheap bottle (I actually broke it only 2 weeks after buying it :)), but, if all their creativity went into creating the juice hidden inside it, then I'm willing to forgive them! :)

Now, this is A PERFUME!!! Amazing! It looks so simple when you examine the ingredients- put yellow, green and white flowers together and you get a miracle. It's as if a florist made a perfume inspired by a spring bouquet.
It's got absolutely everything - freshness, energy, heavy sillage, sweetness...and that mysterious element that can be best described by - "I don't know what they put inside it but it smells gorgeous!"
It's definitely the fragrance that most people, even strangers, asked me about.
The top notes are combined beautifully - lily of the valley doesn't always behave well in a huge crowd of scents but , in this case, it's blended absolutely perfectly with rose water and fresia. Fresia keeps the energy of the other two scents together and calms them down. After the first shock, you become overwhelmed by "oh-so-amazing" cloud of white flowers. I especially like the after smell of this one- no wood was a bingo. The frangrance eventually becomes even more airy due to musk and oakmoss.

An absolute miracle! One of my highest votes ever!

For me this is the best of Gucci ever. Perfect both for rainy summer days or for snowy blizzards - every kind of weather brings out the magic of it, only in different ways. It could be a bit stronger and last longer but ok - I guess that's just a part of the game, that you need to come closer to be able to feel the rush... Rush 2.

The original Rush is possibly one of my favorite compositions of all time, and I was dying to see what a flanker would be like. I was excited to see that the note pyramid for Rush 2 features gardenia and narcissus, which are two of my favorite floral notes. Unfortunately, now that I've tested the scent, I'm left disappointed. It's a very nondescript green floral. Lily and palm leaf are pretty much all I perceive. There's really not much else to it. Rush 2 is mildly soapy and smells very "thin" and watery. It's incredibly safe, bland, and inoffensive, especially when compared against the original Rush. In fact there is so little tying these two fragrances together that it's very misleading for them to even have the same name and bottle.

If you don't mind the simplistic composition and the very soft sillage, this could be a perfectly appropriate fragrance for office/daytime use. But Rush 2 is not something that I would ever be excited to wear.
I never really cared for Gucci, but Rush 2 is excellent, If only it wasn't in the ugly cheap futuristic.box! I must admit, it is important for me, not as a liquid, but it is important, though.

Light and modest floral scent. I enjoy the freesia note. I find it similar to original Rush. Both have somekind of plastic vibe. Or maybe i'm influenced by the packaging.
This could be everyday scent. Not very good for signature scent, because it's so simple and a little boring.
I liked the original Rush more.

The scent of spring,trapped in a bottle...Real freesias,not the common ones found in gardens,but the wild ones that grow in the countryside all by themselves,the ones that are always yellowish white.The note of narcissus is present,but subtle and polite...My signature scent since 2003,and still adore it!Works miracles with my skin chemistry,always present,never loud or offensive.Lots of compliments,people ask me what perfume I am wearing again and again...

gucci in general has good smelling fragerances - Gucci Rush 2 is fresh, elegant and can be used for any occasion.

the design is cool, but not very interesting. but when it falls down, it does not get broke.

This used to be my signature perfume and I still adore it! It is absolutely lovely, feminine, clean and refreshing. It's one of those vibrant scents that give you a great disposition and energy throughout the day because it is so crisp and youthful.
What a terrible idea to discontinue it since so many people still want this on the market... what is Gucci thinking?

God I hate this fragrance so much, to me it smells like a cheap bulgarian perfume.
Seeing all the positive reviews left me a bit confused though...

This is the smell of springtime to me. I've wanted this fragrance for ages now, but have been unable to find it for a decent and worthy price.

The freesia is my favorite flower, and finding a dominant freesia in an accessible fragrance is too hard...so it only made sense to try this one. I was especially okay with dropping $60 on a blind buy of the 1.7 ounce, when reading that narcissus is also a note. WIth two of my favorite flowers in one fragrance, I figured I couldn't go wrong.

It's very light, fresh, clean, and slightly powdery. It smells exactly like freesias to me, but I don't get so much daffodil. I get the fresh, clean flower accord of freesia and lily-of-the-valley, then there's the complex, dark tropical fruitiness from the blackcurrant and the palm tree.

It's very airy, and it's the scent equivalent of the color silver. It reminds me a lot of this tiny bottle of freesia oil that I have...but the oil is very cheap and low quality, even though it smells just like freesias. This fragrance is freesia-done-right.

It was definitely a great blind buy. I could see this being a great everyday perfume for dry, crisp winter days and fair upper-60's/low-70's spring days. It's definitely not alluring and dominant enough to be used as an evening fragrance, but that doesn't mean it's not beautiful at all.

Very unique fragrance. Only headnotes. Like floral
quicksilver. Light, ethereal, acute though. I love it.
But it's not for everybody.
A very light scent that disappears in 5 minutes. I can't smell it and neither can anyone else. Must be the chemistry of my skin.

I love GUCCI RUSH 2.
It's way better than the RED one cause I hate the patchouli in it.
just roses..but very sexy, so suitable more for night. Gucci envy me are fresh - so suitable for day. both my favorites!

I bought this perfume in 2007. Wear it only on special occassion and now it almost out of bottle.
Just worn it a bit of spray on my wrist to avoid smelled too strong which i dont like and it stays for 6 hrs or longer if i apply more. Even sometimes i could still smell it on the next day.
It has floral scent and i just fell it has fresh image scent.
love it i buy fist other rush (red) and i love it ,so i ask for this # 2 not even try i just order it, love ittttttt
Really, really love tis one.. Nothing compares to it.

A few weeks ago, I met a woman who smelled so wonderfully I actually asked what perfume she was wearing - and I've never done so. She said, "Gucci Rush 2". I'd never heard of it, so began looking..only to find it was discontinued. I found it at an online perfume distributor, and eagerly placed an order for the 1 ounce/30ml size. It arrived packaged very well with samples, and coupons too, so I was pleased with this company. I opened the box, and still skeptical of an online purchase of a discontinued perfume, I examined my "box" of Gucci Rush 2 carefully for any sign of it being a fake, or tampered with. There was nothing out of order. The writing on the plastic sleeve stated Made in France. There was a bit in English, and possibly Arabic? I also learned here that if a perfume has been used before, it will likely spray fragrance on the first pump, whereas if never used, it will need a second attempt to spray. Thank you fellow reviewers for this piece of information! Mine did need a second pump, so I was confident it was new, and authentic. Then, I sprayed my wrist.

I am totally bewildered by this scent. It may have for a nanosecond resembled something about the woman who smelled so wonderful, but on me it smelled more like acetone nail polish remover! I am wondering if Rush 2 is one of those mysterious scents that meshes with one's body chemistry in a very specific way...similar to the genetic variances among people who either love or despise the herb cilantro, with nothing in between.

I would love to smell this fragrance again on the woman who wore it so well, but on me it brought to mind the scent of a newly unwrapped plastic doll.
~sigh~
Update - I received a thoughtful private message from another member here who suggested I try purchasing another bottle from a different distributor because it was possible my bottle had gone bad. Well...I must say this was true because I adore my new bottle of Rush 2! While it does require frequent touch ups throughout the day, I derive a joyful burst of energy with each reapplication. I am relieved to know my first experience with Rush 2 wasn't a personal chemistry issue, but due to an "off" bottle. People compliment me every time I wear it!
Have used this since 2002 ..and I still love it ..the best summer parfyme
Cleanest, fresh perfume I have ever fund. And the only I never get too much of !

An old time favorite of mine. After a couple of years i have purchased a big bottle of this perfume which i love so much. It´s a very fresh, flowery and a little sweet kind of smell with some spice in it. It´s very long lasting and one of a kind. The smell is very unique in a good way and stands out in the crowd. Although it´s an unusual smell it will not offend any one because it´s very soft and cozy. A big love

complete opposite to rush 1..this one is the cleanest, freshest smell. in love with it..reminds me of the discontinued Nina..Not the one they came up with in a red bottle..The Nina I absolutely loved was a white bottle (not glass) with birds embossed on it..and it was just amazingly clean scent..I even called Paris to find out it they really had stopped making it..they said they did..BUT this one is the closest to that one!

I love this fragrance!!! Love love love it. It is probably my signature scent. However there is a difference between the EDT and the body mist. A lot of people are buying the hydrating body mist and thinking it's the EDT, the staying power with the mist is zero. If you buy the EDT and the mist the staying power is much, much stronger. Or you can layer Rush, then Rush 2.
I Love it!
Love this, i found it very similar to gucci rush but a lighter version, love it

Rush II is a sweet floral with some interesting gourmand sweetness to it.

The main thing I smell is Gardenia, the sweet, dense, creamy, almost waxy white flower. There are also some sweet berry-vanilla mixture blended in there, creates a very happy and girly smell. This facet of Rush II reminds me of Valentina by Valentino and Escada Magnetism.

The scent dries down with the sweetened gardenia and hot musk.

It really hits me that Rush II smells exactly, I mean SPOT ON like L'oreal hair mask (moisture repair, yellow tub) that I used for years.

Overall Gucci Rush II is warm, inviting, alluring and quite sensual. The smell is not sharp but distinct. I think it would work brilliantly in cold or hot weather, particularly suited for a dinner date or other cozy occasions.
I love this scent! Long lasting, clean and sexy scent. One of my favourites!

This fragrance reminds a lot the original Gucci Rush, especially because of the gardenia note, only Gucci Rush 2 is lighter. I think that the freesia and the blackcurrant notes make it lighter mostly.

As for me, I prefer Gucci Rush to Gucci Rush 2. Gucci Rush 2 is also a sexy fragrance, only a little bit less. But it's more nice:)

so sensual..
so sexy..
so subtle..
just addicting..
Yes, I'm addicted to Rush 2.
Gucci! I can forgive you this plastic bottle because the scent you have created is simply amaizing!
this one is lovely, and very sexy.
I find it very feminine and original. Also perfect for summer days.

My Grandma gave this to me because she decided she didn't like it i absolutely LOVED it and have been obsessed with it ever since. Only one day it accidentally fell out of my purse in my friend Steves car and he threw it away when he cleaned his car ! :(

I love it! It is mature, sexy, and above all unique!
Bravo, Gucci!
Whenever I used to wear it, i get compliments all the way.
People used to say: " What a strange lovely perfume? What is it? Gucci Rush II!
I will buy it again soon.
My collection misses such crispy, sexy, & fresh fragrance!

Yes I agree with the opinions about a bottle ....not very nice ;/
But perfume itself is fantastic. Very mature for a sexy woman- for a vamp which every woman has inside her ...:-)

I used to wear it for special occasions as i always felt incredibly sexy and naughty wearing it . I do not think it is watery and soft at all. It definitely got "that something" .
I like Gucci Rush 1 more than this. To me Gucci Rush 2 is too watery and fresh. Also - in both cases- I find the bottle a bit awkward.

During my high school years, this was a scent I swore by. It was the perfect thing for day, night, school, dates,... Everything my little heart desired. But as I grew older, I discovered more and more perfumes and Rush 2 simply got left behind in my explorations.

Rush 2 scent is somewhat cute. Very floral like almost every Gucci perfume. It is not THAT commercial as some latest releases from this house (such as Guilty) but again, I've never encountered someone who disliked it. There is that fleeting scent of alcohol when you first spray it on but it never bothered me. However, the lasting power of this one is unfortunately horrible. It just disappears. Without a trace. Luckily, square bottle which reminds me of cassette case is practical for carrying around in your purse so you can put it on whenever you want.

All in all, Rush 2 is a very sentimental perfume for me. I still own a bottle and put it on every now and then when I am feeling nostalgic. But it is not my favorite anymore. Far from it.
I clicked on dislike for this but really it's not a case of disliking it - more that it just bored me to tears.

Super cloying and artificial!! Just need a tiny spritz to make people around you successfully fainted in pain...

Maybe that's why they named it RUSH...so people will be leaving you in such a rush, after they smelt this. Will work for an antisocial person, if such people do exist.

Fortunately I've tried this only, 'coz it seems to me like unisex fragrance rather than for women. And something's wrong in it for me. Too strong for the first time then all of it disappears though. Maybe it ain't so bad, however, just not for me.

I got this a few years ago, and I still have it, even though it's not wearable anymore. To me it smells like a mixture of a floral and a fruity smell, and t is very summery and fresh. It's not my favorite, but it's not bad either.

The first time I purchased Rush 2 was primarily because I loved the packaging. It can be conveniently dumped into and grabbed from a handbag without any thought as to the possibility of it breaking. As one who frequently freshens up, I also found the scent perfect. The scent is unmistakably feminine and sensual, but at the same time unique and subtle.

I do detect rose the most with Rush 2. On my skin it smells like I have just stepped out of a tub of spring water and rose petals. Fresh, yet ironically poetic---the scent invokes memories or conjures feelings of "what ifs", which evolve into sensual, desperate longing demanding immediate satisfaction---true to the name "Rush".

While the strength of the "rush" dissipates as quickly as the longing is subdued, the drydown is like that perfect moment whose memory never fades which you keep trying to replay in your mind long after.

First of all, this is nothing similar to Gucci Rush. I absolutely loathe Gucci Rush, I remember every girl in high school wore that and it gave me the most cloying, headache inducing hours of my life.
I was surprised that I actually liked Gucci Rush 2 and ended up buying it. Somehow I did finish the whole bottle (box?)

Anyway it is very versatile, clean and you can wear it all year round and it never becomes cloying. The green heart notes give it such a refreshing, cool feeling that even in the summer it stays fresh and crisp.
The lasting power is around 3-5 hours but it's fine it you're looking for something light.

This is one of my friends favorite scents, among with the other girls at my age in my country. But I am not too crazy with it.
It is a vert distintive smell, therefore very hard to describe. On me it starts smelling like a clean floral with a green note. After 30 min it smells really musky and almost like a mens cologne on me, and that is what I don't like. However I know a lot of people that love this one, it is just not for me.

Good scent, a like it for summer time. a lot of bees around me. I will buy it again or better try rush but I highly recommend this perfume, doesn't last so long, but I think is a nice, clean floral scent.

Enough longevity, if not, carry a small atomizer and prepare to have a fancy dinner.
But first of all, its bottle is plastic and easy to carry.
How does it smell?
Its good and useful as air freshner.
Doesn't last long at all. 3 hours max. But smells nice :)
for me this is a great fragrance simple, crisp, clean, a bit peppery
I had it long ago now. It made me so happy!

I have both rush and rush 2 and love them both. If you find find rush too strong for you, 2 would be a good compromise? It is so femine and sexy and don't understand why people think it's synthetic smelling.. They maybe haven't waited for the warming up (which happens quickly) before smelling it. I use rush 2 in warmer weather and use the original in colder months. Boys go crazy for it.
Update, omg I went to a work event and I swear every second girl I came across was wearing it! I'm sorry to say I'm sadly abandoning it....
Gucci Rush 2 is way too synthetic... the notes are undetectable and it has the staying power of an ordinary deodorant. and the bottle is just hideos.

A kind of elegant fresh floral... I'd really like it. Loved this structure, the smell still the same since the moment you pull it until the "last breath" of the perfum in your skin. The woody base is very sutil, but perceptible.
I just don't liked cmpletly why I waited more from it's lasting, but...
In the end, I think it's a perfume that works well to day by day use.
i thought it was okay at first... but then i saw the ugly truth. it smells like detergant.

not similar to the original gucci rush AT ALLL !
point taken, has a very unique smell about it :/ maybe its just me but love it. last quite a while on clothes & skin .

8/10

Rush 2 is quite similar to yet much better than the original Rush. It's a bit powdery, softer, still sickly sweet but a little less synthetic. Therefore much more wearable without causing suffocation.

I've loved this for years, I always have it in summer. fruity young fragrance. It's a shame it doesn't get more marketing. I love the fact that you can carry the bottle around with you and you're not scared of breaking the bottle because it's plastic! would be brilliant to take on holiday.
I had this before and my favorite scent to bring on my business trips. It's subtle enough not to shock your colleagues, and it's the perfect, flat "bottle" to pack in your suitcase!
Rush 1 without aldehydes

A very light fragrance,perfect for summer but the staying power is so poor..............,on me lasts about 15 minutes and then is gone.Pity.....I had the opportunity to test gucci rush in a store and it is much much better and more interesting then this one.
I like its mid and end notes more than its initial notes, as it may smell artifical at first.It is very similar to Trish Mandarin Ginger Lily.

I had the opportunity to test it today on my wrist. From the first moment it was so artificial and suffocating that I regretted spraying it on myself..Completely different from Rush that I love, Rush 2 is a wrong composition for me. It became more pleasant and lighter after a few hours, but still not enough for me to like it.

Rush 2 is hardly related to Rush at all. This is an entirely different composition altogether.

Upon first application, I could barely smell it. The opening notes are extremely subtle and intimate. I would describe the rose, freesia and lily of the valley as having a soapy and fresh-like quality.

With the emergence of the heart, Rush 2 develops character. The scent strengthens considerably and shows elements of originality. The soapiness is still present, however I detect a subtle greeness, like a tropical, damp garden smell.
