Rush 2 concludes with a simplistic black currant and musk blend, with this being the only fruity kick you will experience during the development of Rush 2, right at the very end.

I vividly remember a man that owned a perfume store where I used to live, raving on about Rush 2. He had me try it several times but I had to go back to this fragrance 3 years on because the scent hadn't stuck in my memory. Because of that I don't think this fragrance is very memorable, certainly not signature material in my humble opinion.
Love it...don't know why, but it suits me :) For me, the best perfume, and I fell in love ...

GUCCI RUSH 2 is nearly the strict antithesis of GUCCI RUSH. RUSH 2 is cool, slightly soapy, lightly floral, not at all sweet, and rather shortlived in the edt.

The somewhat dark, lingering oriental thickness of RUSH (imparted by mingling patchouli and vanilla) is not present in RUSH 2 at all. Rather, RUSH 2 is a tiny bunch of little white flowers on a cool morning with dew still clinging to kelly green blades of grass.

It's almost as though the Gucci people self-consciously sought to produce a fragrance that would appeal to all those who disliked RUSH. A better name for RUSH 2 might be:
~(GUCCI RUSH)!
I guess I have to agree with amelie with this one. Gucci Rush 2 is not better than Gucci Rush to me though they are both great perfumes with the original coming out on top.

Typical Italian fragrance, Gucci Rush was demanding, insolent, strong and energetic but Rush 2 is fresh and light fragrance that can be easily worn during the day, at work almost perfect, not even a little bit difficult.Top notes are very pleasant and fresh, base notes are more serious, but Italian charm gives that airy feeling. To me Gucci Rush 2 is stylish and cool and the bottle is original,slightly futuristic... in fact Gucci Rush 2 is a fragrance that is wearable in all seasons. Gucci Rush I was a lot more serious compared with Rush 2. I prefer Rush 2 with the youthful elegance.
I love, love, love this fragrance! I could swim in it and still wouldn't have enough! Sadly, on me it has a very poor lasting power. I can't smell anything after half an hour...:-(
Rush 2 is much better than rush 1. :)
i love this perfume. my first sniff of this was from my older sister... fell in love with it ever since. i love how flowery and sensual it smells. i use it on dates and special occasions :)

I LOOVVEEE it!
i used it since my 2nd grade on high school and now im at my 3rd years on college..
this one is great, can tell no more about it.

my best one :D
kind of floral, a bit sweet, suitable for young ladies, and a bit powdery after dried out on skin...

I had a simple of rush 2 for a long time.but I hadn't tried it,maybe because it was a little hard to open the free sample and I wanted to keep it new.
I should say the bottle is innovative.some people find it cheap and not like a perfume bottle,but by the way it's innovative.among all of these pefumes in the stores,no other one has a bottle like this.
the perfume inside...
hmm,there's nothing about "rush",it's a girlish floral perfume with lots of lily of the valley.maybe the pure floral mixture makes it a bit(just a bit)soapy,but I also recognize some fruity notes,that i guess it's black currant.
this is a very young fragrance for people who don't like much citrus in their perfume.it doesn't smell sweet,juicy or bitter,all about flowers.it's not annoying at all.so it can be wore at any occasion.
this is one of good works from Michel Almairac and I'm looking forward to try the original rush to see the difference.
Its top notes are kind of spicy,however it soon dries down to a very feminine aroma,which is clean and light.It's a scent basically nobody will dislike:))
Rush 2 is more floral than woody. It smells crisp and clean.

for me its floral green rather than musk, i just bought it, but its not longlasting unfortunately, maybe i should have bought the simple rush, but that one was way too sweet..., its only 1 oz, so i think it wont last long as i will always have to reapply it

I was not keen on trying Rush 2 as Rush only made me want to rush away from it.

Rush2 is a completely different fragrance, very light floral with a good staying power. To me, after the first burst and after it settled a bit, smells soapy clean. As if you came out of a shower and had used a floral soap.I like it but after a while it gives me an headache, much like the original Rush.
I like this fragrance, but with time I become fed up with it, it's a daily parfume, not for the evening
Very feminine,sensual and subtle fragrance.The best scent i have smelled since long time...

I like it at the beginning. But then I learn about Calvin Klein's Euphoria Blossom and decide that Blossom suit me more.

Rush 2 could be too harsh on the hot weather.

product_name: Winter's Spring Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Gucci Winter’s Spring is a nondescript mimosa scent—one of many, nothing really stands out.

product_name: Winter's Spring Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Literally JUST MIMOSA! I love mimosa, so I don't have any issues with it, but keep that in mind.

It is probably the most realistic mimosa you get out there. Very clean. Very luxurious. I find it very feminine, fragile, innocent. Sadly it does not have a strong projection. For this price tag I would expect more "work". As always, the bottle is gorgeous and elegant. Not for a hot, beach vacation day. Keep it for cooler and drier environment.

I believe it is being discontinued. So grab a bottle if you still can.

product_name: Winter's Spring Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: The sales lady told me this has vanilla notes in it but I couldn’t really smell it. This smells like you just got out of a shower, so fresh & clean but not a powdery kind of scent. I really liked it. Would be good for the mornings.

product_name: Winter's Spring Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: The most realistic mimosa I ever smelled . Little bit too powdery for no nose, but overall it’s a great perfume. This perfume would be perfect to wear in March.

product_name: Winter's Spring Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Comes off shakey. I wasn't sure if I'm getting authentic florals, or gum extracts. After a bit of back and forth, "Winter's Spring" seems to settle into a laundry pod / air freshener aroma, albeit of the highest caliber. This would've made a great laundry detergent. But a perfume, not so much. Falls into the usual, wearable if the host is a beautiful woman category.

product_name: Winter's Spring Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: It is a very realistic mimosa single floral. the light or diluted, or daily version of Un Fleur de Cassie.

product_name: Winter's Spring Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: The complementary hand lotion that's out at upscale hotel bathrooms; nice and functionally light until you look at the price tag. The bottle is a work of art, but this perfume is truly nothing to write home about unless you use hundred dollar bills as Kleenex.

product_name: Winter's Spring Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Smell very clean yellow floral, soft subtle scent which can calm you. Projection is quite well and unexpectedly last amazingly well over 7 hrs in hot weather (over 34c).
In the cool temperatures it last overnight.

This one is a like from me ☺️

product_name: Winter's Spring Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This smells just like a mimosa flower in full-bloom on a summer's day! It's so beautiful and cheerful and it's a strongly yellow floral and decently sweet and slightly powdery and musky fragrance, just like the intoxicating scent from these little yellow puffs of joy. I can smell the slight honeyed almond smell that mimosas/acacia/wattle flowers have too in here.

It's a lovely and linear day fragrance that can be worn in spring or summer and is very feminine and unique, but at the same time I think it's office appropriate and it wouldn't offend anyone.

It's slightly expensive for what it is, but it does smell lovely and its bottle with the sweet little squirrel on the front is beautiful. I'll definitely buy this some time soon! I've been really hankering for a nice and realistic mimosa-dominant scent, considering that that's so rare unfortunately in perfumery.

It's so much nicer than the awful and unrealistic smelling Love Mimosa by Amouage...

product_name: Winter's Spring Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This is the one I was looking for. I've always wanted a soft mimosa with a bit of creamy, powdery touch and this is it.
I think the aesthetic of this perfume is extremely beautiful, combining the name, bottle and the fragrance into one.
It opens up a bit watery, almost smelling like a sweet wet paper. The pepper in the note doesn't really stand out but exaggerates the wateriness of the perfume. The wateriness reminds me of the frost on the mimosa, which is said to be the first flower that blooms in spring.
After the frost is melted, the real spring comes. Powdery, delicate, beautiful mimosa comes with creamy musk, blending perfectly with skin. It's bright spring but not overly bright. Rather, it's delicate, a bit still cold from winter.
I admit that this is a soft skin scent. The projectivity is poor compared to its price.
But still, it's one of the most gorgeous scent I've ever smelled and if you like a soft and creamy mimosa like me, you must try this.

product_name: Winter's Spring Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This perfume is very weak, no joke about it. On skin it had very subtle green floral note that came very quickly and disappeared in a flash. What’s left is a powdery Nivia scent that sticks extremely close to skin. You got to be sniffing directly at the spot to smell it. On clothing it performed better but still couldn’t get much from the double sprayed spot.
Don’t know what mimosas smell like in life but if this is any indication, Nivia!

product_name: Winter's Spring Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: It opens up quite green a little bitter and you'd think you're gonna get an interesting smell afterwards but no it settles down into Nivea body cream(blue tin can) with a slight green floral edge but I mean a hint of it. Cute packaging. Great for anyone who likes very subtle fragrances.

product_name: Winter's Spring Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: A gorgeous, dewy, fresh mimosa! Very true to life. Kudos!!

product_name: Winter's Spring Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Upon first applying a sample of this, it smells very grassy, but with a slight floral element. I assume this is the mimosa. This definitely smells like spring and very nature-y. Currently a week and a half into March, I thought it would be an appropriate time to try Winter's Spring, as we are in the transition period right now in Chicago moving out of winter into spring. Though to me, this smells very much like an established springtime scent, with grass, flowers, and sunshine, which is not what it looks like right now here at all with still some snow on the ground and no other greenery really and bare trees, but warming temperatures finally. So perhaps my location plays a part in when I'd think the time of year would match to this. I can also smell this within 5" of my skin strongly.

5 minutes later and it smells slightly less grassy, but with more of a delicate sweet slightly powdery yellow floral scent coming out. Both this scent and the grassy scent seem pretty realistic smelling. It's uplifting, joyful, clean, and hopeful coming out of winter for pretty, sunny, warmer spring days. It does smell more "botanical" and not really like a perfume unless you wanted to smell specifically like a flower/mimosa and no extra frills, but I do see that this says it's meant for layering. To which this would definitely lend a beautiful and realistic green floral scent.

10 minutes later and I can pick up a little bit more of the pepper, adding some warmth and energy to the mix.

20 minutes later and it still smells the same, but I smell it more within 2" of my skin.

30 minutes later and it's a skin scent. Not sure why there are so many votes for "enormous" sillage, unless there is really that much of a difference between a splash sample (that was still applied heavily) and spraying with an atomizer, but it was never that overwhelmingly large of a projection on me. I do also feel like it smells more like a fresh, clean, herbal lotion scent now, too. It's pretty sunny and positive feeling.

I'll see how long this lasts.

2 hours later and it's fainter on the skin, but I also feel like it's gone more towards just an expensive "lotion" or "body milk" scent as well. It's now more creamy and fresh rather than green and floral. Though pulling back a bit, it does still smell like the absolute slightest hint of green floral in the air though if I move my arm or have it just near my face.

3.5 hours later and it's basically gone. At the 3 hour mark it already was nearly gone and I could only smell the slightest hint of it with my nose to my skin. A bit surprised at the $340 price point it only lasted about 3 hours. But I suppose it was a good realistic floral scent.

product_name: Winter's Spring Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
The smell of powderly mimosa, the smell of cleanliness and expensive body milk.
It's so natural, mild, unobtrusive, pleasant cosmetic fragrance with mimosa. The new line of scents by Gucci is amazing! Expensive but worth it.

product_name: Winter's Spring Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Nivea. Really that's what smells like on my skin.

product_name: Winter's Spring Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Funnily enough, I was wearing Un Fleur de Cassie when I tested 'Winter's Spring', and yes, there is a resemblance. Very high quality then, but with more of a 'clean' scent, less animalic than the Frederic Malle - more delicate and I think feminine.

As the concept of the Alchemist's Garden is of layering these pure perfumes with either an oil or floral water, I tried this with 'A Winter Melody' scented water, but actually I liked 'Winter's Spring' by itself more.

I love the concept of these, I spent an enjoyable half hour in Edinburgh's Harvey Nicols with someone called Ryan who was enthusiastic and well informed (makes a change from orange-faced slightly vultury sales-people!). I managed not to drop my jaw too much when he explained the eau de parfum is about £200. It's clearly good quality, and as I mentioned in my other review about 'Eyes of the Tiger' from this series, I like Gucci's 'take' on these pure essences.

I'm also tickled by the concept of alchemy and the Medievalist theme, especially as I'm steeped in study of all things Medieval just now as I'm painting a series inspired by Medieval cosmology.

If Winter's Spring was a planet it would of course be Jupiter - early spring, as the cold Saturnine snow begins to melt. That time of year when you know within a few days that winter's finally on its way out though it's still chilly.

I do like a green floral (faves are Baiser Vole, Hothouse Flower and of course Chanel 19), and my favourite time of year is spring, so this is a winner, but to my mind it's more for early spring and late winter.

Very delicate, a whisper of warm soft floral under the green of spring mimosa.

product_name: Winter's Spring Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
A true botanical Mimosa, one of my very favourite winter/ early spring flowers. I love "Une Fleur de Cassie" by F.M. but it I very intense, so this one here is a great 'pick me up' every day kind of scent: very botanical and true to origin so unisex for that reason in my book.
I would imagine this to work extremely well layered with Penhaligon's 'Ostara' that these Spanish bastards from Puig decided to discontinue!! (unforgivable).

I love the visuals of this collection and I think both GUCCI and COTY did a great job with this (although I find the pricing of the scented waters rather steep).

Verdict: Good.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Studs Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Although I'm not a big fan of patchouli, this Gucci scent has captivated my heart, elegant...Stud limited edition bottle is unique.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Studs Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Powdery with a touch of the patchouli spice. The lilac stays through the dry down. Just not a wow fragrance in me.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Studs Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Well, I received no compliments while wearing. I slept at friends home overnight the first night I wore this out because of a snow storm - my friend turned on a space heater for me. I woke up in the middle of the night sweltering (from the space heater) and suffocating from the smell of this perfume. I guess as I and the room both heated up it intensified and seriously grossed me out/woke me up. I still think it smells good right out of the bottle but this should not be worn if your body will be heating up/sweating. For example, I could never wear this out dancing or for sports or anything like that. I tried wearing it a couple more times but am really turned off it now. Gave it to my sister, maybe I'll revisit it again in a couple years.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Studs Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
Relax, this is the SAME/ORIGINAL fragrance in a different bottle.
Interesting use of Valentino studs, maybe that's why they have to charge the additional money, to pay the legal expenses.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Studs Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
As they are the same this one is nice and light floral scent just like the original. Violet note is very easy-going, not too powdery like in many other scents.
There is some amber and some patchouli but they don't make it overwhelming.
Still, it's innocent, not guilty.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Studs Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: This smells the same as the original one. Just a different bottle. Wish they could make it more sweeter :)I love this perfume

product_name: Gucci Guilty Studs Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: It is the exact same amazing fragrance as the original Gucci Guilty, but it is in a beautiful new bottle. This is by far my favorite fragrance, it is so unique. This limited edition bottle can be purchased at the Gucci website or the Saks Fifth Avenue website. I would get it while it lasts, it looks even better in person, and is only five more dollars (US) than the original.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Studs Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
i think it is exactly the same notes as in the orignal, just that they have changed the bottle to a cooler one.
I allrady have the original, but i want this amasingly cool and so me bottle :)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Studs Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: The notes sound almost exactly the same as the original. I wonder if it's just a different bottle.
it's freaking amazing the long lasting is 3days
Bad perfume

This is probably the MOST disappointed I have ever been when blind buying a scent from a powerhouse brand, and it’s precisely because of this experience that I refuse to do so going forward.

I don’t want to get all dramatic here but if there was ever a totally legitimate reason to rant about a fragrance, it’s this one!

And here I thought, when I first heard about this on the blogs…I seriously thought that this one had the potential to be a special fragrance that only select people would know about, and just be an absolute treasure to enjoy for years to come.

It’s not necessarily that it’s a bad concept, it’s just SO weak!

You could dump the entire bottle all over your arms and chest and ask a random stranger to smell you an hour later, and they probably wouldn’t even be able to tell you put _anything_ on!

This is the ***epitome*** of a weak and watered down scent, and it has absolutely no projection or sillage whatsoever.

I gave it another try during August, during one of the hottest weeks out of the year here in NY, and 45 minutes after I sprayed four sprays on my arms, I could smell absolutely nothing at all — and this is in 95 degree heat.

I would love to know exactly what happened here, because for Lorenzo Villoresi to have his name associated with this is a complete embarrassment, especially considering that he has so many amazing scents that he has been involved with in his tenure as a perfumier.

Perhaps it’s possible that the bottle I got is from a bad batch? Doubtful given the other folks complaining about this.

Also, and I am **never** one to complain about the presentation, because I care much more for what’s inside the bottle — but for this to be a Gucci release, it’s just laughable…the label is on crooked, and not just on mine but on all the others that I’ve seen as well.

It’s also printed on very crappy thin faded paper. The cap is light plastic with almost no real weight to it and doesn’t fall into place at all either, it’s just sort of “there” on top of the bottle. You could turn the bottle upside down a few times and the cap easily falls off, with no real way to secure it without using scotch tape. It’s just disgraceful, it’s like they didn’t even try!

I could have produced a better quality presentation in my garage with an inkjet printer and standard consumer grade materials purchased from Ali Express.

I will end with this — I have smelled better quality scents with better quality presentations from clone brands that cost 1/10th of what this one cost me, and for both Gucci and Villoresi to have their names attached to this is an absolute disgrace.

I would LOVE to know the backstory of this and find out exactly what happened here…there has to be more to this story than just Gucci wanted to make a boatload of money. They already have boatloads of money, lol, and this specific scent wasn’t even very widely distributed as far as I know.

There’s got to be more to this story…someone screwed up here, big time.

I mean, it was SO bad that I legitimately thought for a moment that I had received a fake / clone, even though I had ordered it directly from Gucci 🤣🤣🤣
an ocean of vetiver reminds me of cartier le baiser du dragon parfum along with some vintage vibes of gucci’s oldies

This fragrance was a bit of a let down considering the staying power...as someone mentioned, this fragrance is labeled Eau De Parfum but it does not project as one, not even cologne level. Initially, a very pleasant soft fragrance. I get musk, leather, and mandarin orange. Overall, this is a good fragrance; a few hours is probably what you will get at best before having to reapply or thinking you never put anything on. Definitely unisex...in my opinion.

re post: Is it me or did they copy "the Art of Shaving-Sandalwood bottle, buy the label paper from the dollar store, forget that when a bottle of expensive fragrance is distributed the cap should securely fit, and also sticky tack the bow on?" Gucci what happened to the flare and finesse that follows the name??
After thirty minutes, this oddly smells like hash. Maybe this is what Nasomatto's Black Afgano was trying to achieve.

What? Poor performance???. I've been tested it on me & with 5 other person. This perfume is very strong & good sillage & longevity. With just tiny spray this will brings u a confidence all day. I adore the 1 hours after sprayed until the dry down. It's full of sweet not, the mandarin but still woodsy. The opening was too strong ginger notes. This perfume was really Forever Now. The bottle & the packaging lovely too. It can be wear at anytime & anywhere. But I'm not going to repurchase it because it's too woodsy for me, I mean this scent is unisex but it's more to men scent. But I'm really sure that the girls out there will adore the dry down. It's sexy & lovely.

mmm poor long lasting
poor sillage
...
dont waste your money with this one; if you want a good Gucci buy envy.

Smells just like a generic perfume,
for it's price and exclusivity I was expecting something breathtaking!

but this was just "MEH MEH MEH!"

I can't believe my luck when I chanced finding a bottle of this and was able to bid and win the bottle for $71 plus shipping. JOY!

The opening is fresh, very woodsy, and aromatic. I barely can pick up the lavender. Powdery tones from the iris emerge, but since this is a Villoresi creation, the development is very calculated and restrained, but stays throughout. So goes for most of the scent--somber, subdued, and a bit dark.

Sweeter, warmer notes emerge with leathery vetiver-patchouli tones, but the sweeter notes barely registers as floral, more like a sweet amber. The drydown is a warm, musky leather with ever so slight resinous touches.

If this is a true Villoresi, the whole composition is probably without synthetics. Smells like it too. And sadly, the scent is diaphanous and fleeting. It wears very close to the skin throughout, and only lasted about 3 hours on me and had to build up several sprays to get decent sillage.

I don't know how this can hold up in cooler weather because here in this late August heat and humidity, I still have to put my nose to my wrist to know that it's there. Because it doesn't project much, it is definitely a personal scent, great for office cubicle wear.

To sum it up, I think it definitely symbolizes its roots, but not really the NOW of Gucci. Forever Now tips way more on the masculine side of the perfume composition. It also smells very familiar. I don't know whether to think it's because it smells like a Villoresi, or because the accord combinations are pretty standard for a leather scent. You be the judge.

And for those who say this smells like YSL Nu, or Infusion d'Iris, it is way off the mark. Forever Now is too dark, too dry to compare to those.

Opens very dark and almost somber in tone. I could have sworn I initially noted oud in the opening, but perhaps this is a blending of woods, black pepper and nutmeg. Fortunately things switch gears rather quickly, and progress to a more vivacious rendering. The Florentine iris is the star of this eau de parfum, and rightly so as Forever Now by Villoresi was commissioned to commemorate the opening of the first Gucci boutique in Florence in 1921. It's powdery presence is noted throughout the dry down. Rose of Bulgaria and Morocco along with ylang-ylang and jasmine create a floral heart, but again are a supporting cast to the iris. Suede, leather and amber give a smoothness and warmth. Complex, opulent and sensual are words I would associate with this modern chypre. (47)

I went into Gucci on 5th Ave. today, not for their fragrances, but for a bag. I saw the Flora by Gucci 1966 and I was drawn to that one...see my review on the EDP.

I then noticed this black bottle..again, I thought of Tom Ford..Why is Gucci trying to "copy" Tom Ford...Well, as they say imitation is the best for of flattery...

Well, as I was waiting for my bag to be wrapped, I tried on the Forever Now scent and WOW....It is so spicy and woodsy. I immediately thought of Tom Ford, but I could not match it to one of his fragrances exactly.

As it dried down, the orange citrus note came forward and made it so nice. It reminds me of Orange tea. Really warm, citrusy and woodsy.

Very nice. I bought the Flora by Gucci 1966 for $200.00 and a bag, so that was all I was going to spend for today. I will consider buying this scent in September.

I can see how this scent can lead more to a masculine scent, but it is unisex. If you are not into unisex woodsy fragrances, this will not be one for you.

I do love the orange that pops out at the end. What a nice treat.

Enjoy it.

This can only be found in Museo Gucci in Piazza della Signoria and their Flagship store (first Gucci store ever to open) and they are both in Firenze, about 5 minutes walk from each other.
I am a fragrance fanatic, especially niche fragrances. However, with all honesty I'm not as "mature" in distinguishing all notes as most people here, but this fragrance is definitely one of the most unique I have ever owned.

PS. I'm an Arab, we tend to love musk/wood/patchouli based fragrances.

At a quick glance, this looks like a Penhaligon bottle. As for the smell, this is very similar to Tom Ford's Ombre de Hyacinth except this has woods in the base and the floral notes aren't as strong. Not a lot of people know about this fragrance and for that reason, i wanted it for my collection. Forever failed to give me a reason to spend $200 dollars. I was hoping this would smell peerless and it failed. Im sure people will buy this because it's a Gucci niche offering and the bottle design is nice.

Gucci Forever Now is an elegant, sophisticated and mature scent for people who are charmed by the beauty of seduction. Fresh for a moment than a touch of spice leading to a wet wood sincere vetiver. A word to describe this 'alluring' with depth and memories of passion.

I haven't bought a new Gucci fragrance for 'forever', so how apt one came along. I'm not even going to talk about the awfulness of celeb endorsed recent efforts, even the sales staff never liked them.

A great fragrance for warmth and savoury sexiness.

A lot of patchouli on impact, black pepper defiantly in the dry down, but in all, clean, (dark)green, non-animistic way. I still have an original Gucci Pour Homme and this has a similar enveloping earthiness (although no so intense/incense)

Gucci's original formula 1966 Flora fragrance is coming back soon, so I'm looking forward to that too.

This is a winner. I found the opening citrus/black pepper prominent, followed by hushed florals and nutmeg-sweet spices. A napped suede/leather note emerges and mingles with a dry iris accord... the somewhat diaphanous opening suddenly becomes thicker and more opaque. In warm weather, it turns *densely* powdery / soapy on skin - but in the most magnificent way. The spicy accords recede, leaving me with a crisp, mildly floral, slightly woody lather. Arguably the best Gucci offering since Tom Ford was at the helm.

This is just an update. I love the sound of this, so in failing to find anyone who has smelled it, I contacted Gucci for information. They were unable to send me a sample, they couldn't tell me anywhere I could get a sample, and they couldn't tell me which UK stores stock it! Their only advice was to go on their website to find all the store telephone number and ring each store directly. They are the most unhelpful company I have had the pleasure of dealing with, so I just don't think I will bother with it.
I am hoping this is similar to the original Gucci eau d'parfum which is dis-continued. The notes seem similar. Somebody must have tried by now!
The bottle looks elegant as well as the notes , defiantly wanna try it out !
I hope this one will not smell like a Lenor fabric conditioner. Sounds very promising.
The bottle looks classy and interesting notes too...
Lorenzo Villoresi? This sounds sooo promising. I doubt it will have broad distribution though

Pepper Rose...

This is a pepper smokey rose with doses of olibanum, incense, elemi, and saffron ambrette.

It is quite pretty (not amazing) and reminds me ALLOT of "Rose Amira" by Guerlain.
It’s not a love for me but a like, it doesn’t smell like anything I have in my collection so I wouldn’t mind one day adding it.

This one is special as it is the only perfume I have ever had that has so distinctly smelled of around 1/2 ingredients max, that being Jasmine and Tuberrose. The scent is special in it’s singularity and the scent is fresh and clear but a little sticky and powdery, if only it lasted longer on the skin!

This perfume made me realize that I love florals. It is linear - and perfect. This perfume is in my top 5, but it just might be at #1 if I had to only have one scent. There isn’t a day or night where this wouldn’t be perfect. I adore it. Interestingly, I liked the Dossier version even better. I eased up my first bottle of my Dossier one, and immediately purchased a replacement. The replacement doesn’t smell as perfect as the first batch (and I’ve owned it now for over a year).

The definition of smelling like a flower . 💐 🫧
real jasmine breeze. Year round , it's bright and clean you get natural fresh sweetness good for day and night and it changer with the weather it adapts .
It's clean and melts on skin smoothly .
Natural beauty in a bottle .
Signature worthy. Feminine energy all the way .

Immediately a pretty scent. There is a freshness and it’s a bit creamy. Feminine. It is not a complex scent - in a good way. There is no note that is busy or loud. The fragrance is very smooth. It unfolds with beautiful simplicity. If this has longevity I will be adding it to my want list.

Equally Easter Sunday service and New Year's Eve. Fresh linen and sweat. A wedding or funeral. Both natural and well maintained.
A balanced scent of fresh mud, stems, and wood in the cleanest possible way. There is something sad about it? Perhaps it is the nostalgic aspects of it, but this makes it feel calm to me. This is a gorgeous perfume for young women as it is age-ambiguous and sweet without going overboard. It layers so so well with other musky oils to become more casual.
Do not let the lack of notes here deceive you, she is versatile.
10/10
Anything with Tuberrose is a friend of mine.

This is a very jasmine forward scent. It has a nice creaminess to it. NOT a safe blind buy.
This is a perfume I would have associated as "mature" when i was younger, now i see it more as "lady who has her sh*t together and probably has a costco membership". It is very feminine. I made my crush sneeze while wearing this perfume so i don't think i'm going to wear it for a while.... lol.
i find the jasmine note to be a bit too overwhelming but overall a solid choice for a floral perfume
I thought I didn't like a strong jasmine scent. But I smelled it once and fell in love with it. It's a beautiful simple perfume that's good for everyday use. Very feminine.

This perfume is like being in the middle of a garden full of flowers. To my nose, jasmine is super prominent in this one. It's fresh, flowery, not too overpowering, feminine and cute! I used to loved it. I didn't purchase it again because I reckon there are flowery perfumes that I enjoy a little bit more, but I had beautiful memories of my university years wearing this beautiful scent.
If you love jasmine, go for it! 🥰

This smells like walking in a garden after it just rained and the rain drops are still clinging to the velvety petals, the aroma is drenched and clean, like sticking your nose into a bouquet of freshly picked flowers, like walking into a beautiful florist shop to pick out flower arrangements for your wedding. This is FLORAL! I didn't think I liked floral fragrances until I realized my favorite perfumes were oriental and chypre florals, but this perfume is in it's own category. It feels like a modern take on a vintage perfume. For me, I prefer Gucci Bloom Parfum (love the amber and vanilla), but I can respect that this is lovely and I'm sure I would love to smell this on someone else.

This perfume has a deceptively short note list, but seems to convey quite a lot with few ingredients. The perfume has that 'just bought a bouquet from a flower shop' sense. It has a certain stemmy greenness and dewyness, supported by jasmine and tuberose that is neither cloying, overly heady, nor bubble-gummy, but comes across as pretty, and fresh. Sillage and projection is moderate, I wish it lasted just a bit longer.

This scent is very wearable, and would be a great signature or wedding scent.
this perfume reminds me of good memories and fun. i love love love this scent but it's not very long lasting

finally got a travel size of this from a friend after losing my full size from a few years ago. very heavy gardenia with a gorgeous little hint of jasmine. my favorite perfume to wear to sleep because it’s soooo soothing

This is one of my absolute favorites and is my go-to floral when I want a pure floral scent. This is like a bouquet of flowers exploded in your face. As much as I love a good balanced fragrance, there's something about the smell of flowers that just sets my soul at ease. And this is PURE FLORAL.
This smells more like gardenia than jasmine. Really beautiful, basic, floral scent but has no longevity at all.

A lovely, balanced white floral fragrance. For those sensitive to the indolic nature of jasmine but still want to give jasmine scents a go, this is a solid option. I gave it to my mum for Christmas years ago when it first released and she is still clutching on to that bottle. We're Filipino, and the florals in this is so reminiscent of our home country. The dry down is also quite nice too. Not too old lady like unlike a lot of jasmine heavy fragrances on the market.
Just a touch of gardenia bomb (although not listed as a note) when I apply it. Lovely dry down. A solid like, but is this sample a love and therefore full bottle worthy? 🤔

Meh.

It must have been one of the flankers I liked because this is just insipid boring nothingness. 🥀
It turns something in me when i smell this on a girl.... It's so good just buy it.

It does have a kind of cemetery/church feel to it because of the white florals, but in a chic and nice way, like a female vampire. Not a perfume I use daily, I had my bottle for years now, but I certainly enjoy it every now and then and would repurchase it once it is gone.
I got a sample: The Jasmine and Tuberose is lovely together, strong but fem like RL Romance. beautiful smell. carries on the wind and brings attention to those around u

My mother got it as a gift , she didn’t like it but she has to wear it because it was a gift from my brother. I didn’t like the scent either 😒. The jasmine is very dominant in this perfume and not a fan of jasmine. Actually I see that gucci flora is better than this version.

The opening smells just like sampaguita, instantly reminding me of the air on Sunday mornings at church. After a few hours, it softens into more of a skin scent. It’s quite linear, but I still love it.
Very green and fresh smelling jasmine. Lasts long but becomes a skin scent after an hour

This was a blind purchase selected only after reviews.
Unfortunately, I can't say that the first test resulted in an immediate success. :-/
I had expected a ladylike, easy-to-wear, warm but still quite discreet classic scent with an elegant but at the same time professional touch. Oh, how wrong I was!
Instead, I was hit with an unwanted scent shock at the first spray; A harsh, and quite chemical scent bomb of quite tacky Jasmine with a slightly dirty undertone that attacked my nose in an extremely uncharming way. Scent memories of my old aunt's cheap bath salts with an overwhelming "Jasmine scent" appeared. To say that I was disappointed is a deep understatement!
But I decided to give it a chance anyway, and for a couple of days I have now tested it more closely and I think we are starting to understand each other now.
First of all; Spray a very small amount at the beginning to get a feel for the scent!
The first scent note of Jasmine is overwhelming and almost makes one teary-eyed in its harsh strength. And yes, I find it tacky at first.
BUT give the scent a chance to calm down, about half an hour, preferably with a little humidity in the air and suddenly the change comes. The scent deepens, becomes weaker but fuller and warmer, almost a little lazy. The artificial pungency goes away and leaves only an appreciated trace of the Jasmine, the floral scent suddenly floats above the skin, with a faint soapiness while a slight animalic pungency ensures that the scent does not become too predictable flowery and one-sided.
I think I now will finally be able to appreciate the scent and that it can actually be very wearable even in everyday life. But a warning; Don't overspray it at the risk of turning into Mrs. tacky! ;-)

This may be the first floral I fell in love with years ago as I usually find floral perfumes without fruit too sharp. It's definitely not for the heat of summer as it's a little heavy for this time of year. To me it smells like a woody floral. Can't definitely name any particular notes in this as I am not well versed in florals. Pretty linear.

Jasmine and tuberose beautifully done. As Morillas is known to do - it's well-constructed and memorable for its seeming simplicity. It almost has the quality of a soliflore with enough additional notes added (Chinese honeysuckle) to make it last and give it support. As a lover of white florals, this was an easy like for me.

It can be worn casually or dressed up, any season, any time of day. I don't think it reads mature, but I wore all kinds of funky stuff when I was young long before young meant sweet and sugary.

I always avoided to try this perfume because I smelled the bottle and it was just average somehow. My favourite is Amouage Honour and I'm searching for a cheaper alternative, this one was listed there. Today at 09:30 I sprayed it on my arm. The whole day I could smell it, even now 5h later I still smell it. That's great.

The scent is more grown up, I see it more for someone 35+ and it doesn't fit my age. Honour is also grown up, but more universal, I could see that one as a bridal scent, this one is nice, is also gentle, but my favourite is still Honour.

I actually sprayed it on the right arm and on the left one I sprayed Guerlain Nettare di Sole, the soft, somewhat creamier version , because I smelled also more powdery reformulated version and the second one may be not helpful for this case, the first one is playful, youthful and still with a lot of grace. I guess what I love is the bubble that I created more than Gucci Bloom alone.

This perfume might not be the most complex, mind blowing perfume but it's grown to be the perfume people associate me with, as I wear it very often and it was my daily perfume for a LONG time.
It is a true white floral fragrance with no bs. The jasmine does not last long on me (honestly, I can't smell it much) but the tuberose truly comes out and remains on me all day. I have come to wear this one mainly in the autumn and winter months as I find the floral notes to suit me when I'm not overheating, if that makes any sense.

Love this!
So, my current search for a most realistic, soliflore- esque for tuberose consisted of this, Do Son, and Tuberoza by Nishane, and this is the winner.

At first I wasn't sure as the jasmine really is quite a powerful top note.
However, the tuberose took over and wow.
Coming from a lover of true tuberose, and the buttery goodness with the slight touch of green real tuberose has- this is it.

Don't get me wrong, I do love jasmine- I have jasmine and tuberose blooming in my courtyard as I write this ;), just is not what I was looking for in this search.

So like I said, I wasn't sure at first due to the heavy jasmine top note. But that dissipated to a glorious transition to the tuberose with just a smidge of the jasmine's green/spice remaining to give this fragrance the well rounded-ness(??) true tuberose has.
I am not familiar with true creeper, however in this, I feel it plays just a supporting role to the tuberose and doesn't outshine. The result is the intoxicating tuberose "soliflore" experience I was looking for.

As stated, I compared this to Nishane's Tuberoza and Diptyque's Do Son.
IMO, this is a more potent, longer lasting version of Do Son. (After the initial Jasmine, that is).
Do Son, IMO, is a constant, albeit light tuberose and very very light, at that...too light- for me at least.
Tuberoza, while lovely, had a little too much spice for me (a little too heavy on the gardenia and marigold perhaps) and not as soliflore as I wanted.
*To make note, I also adore gardenia and marigolds- have these two in my yard as well, but again, not what I was looking for.
**It did have good staying power though, btw.

***@ eimbrown- I think you may be mistaking the combination/addition of the jasmine's touch of spicy green to the tuberose's richness as gardenia; and while some might consider similar, is not the same...???

Anyhoos, if you're looking for a true, near soliflore tuberose experience, with a decent presence and longevity, I HIGHLY recommend!!!
Not as long or dominant on the skin as on my nightie, but a day later, still present and (although only slightly) fills the air when "waved"(??) around.

***I tried the edp, btw.

Lovely true gardenia scent, so i’m not sure how it’s not listed as a note, it’s all me or my girlfriend smell. It’s nice and has an addictive quality but is very one dimensional. There’s not really a progression or story with it, which isn’t necessary for a perfume to be worth the money, but for me the price is too high for a perfume that is so one note. If you have the money, or just want to get a sample, it’s a beautiful, sweet, white floral for layering

When I first got this I oversprayed it a ton and was afraid I didn’t like it. Turns out it requires a lighter hand. These days I spray three max (each wrist and chest), and it’s really lovely. Straight forward; only one note per top, heart and base; which makes it great for layering. This is one I put on when I can’t decide what to put on.

One of my all time favourite perfumes. It smells like the transition between spring and summer with a green, fresh and dewy smell which also has a creamy sweetness to it. It feels like im laying in a sunny garden next to a lake. The jasmine scent is prominent, but not overpowering. It all smells very light, refreshing and sweet at the same time. I do not understand those who think it smells like a grandma; I don't think they're smelling the depth, layers and story that this fragrance is supposed to tell.

Gucci has done a variety of different sent profiles. This one you really got a love a white floral if they added an amber to the base I think it would’ve smelled so much better. There’s nothing special to this way to mature and I’m 35.
delightful. must be the rangoon creeper that transforms the tuberose and jasmine to a level above either singly or in any other combination

The most beautiful tuberose and jasmine perfume.

When I first smelled this, I was transported to my younger years, spending my weekends at the Hindu temple and going to South Asian weddings. It smells of poojas and flower garlands, but also a dewy, British summer garden; so fresh yet heady, and photorealistic. The perfume equivalent of pinning a fresh garland of jasmine and tuberose to your hair.

This sweet white floral echoes my dual heritage beautifully; perfect for summer days spent in breezy cotton dresses, in the British countryside; but also equally as perfect for when I'm draped in exquisite silk sarees.

The perfume itself is quite linear, almost a soliflore. The tuberose is creamy without being heavy and the jasmine is intertwined perfectly with it, without being too loud or sharp like Mugler's Alien. It's sweet but in a green, floral way, without any gourmand or fruity notes to make it cloying. I think it's perfect for layering with other perfumes, to accentuate their white floral notes.

I adore Givenchy's L'Interdit in winter and this feels like it's summery sister.

For me it is perfect for spring and summer weather. Soft but noticeably. I don't see teenagers wearing this scent, I believe it is a more mature scent.
It's being on my desire list for quite some time and finally I got it.

This perfume is a very simple floral scent, but its deeper and more mature. I don't dislike it, but i could 100% see it being a perfume that has to grow on you in order for you to like it.
I would not say that it's something special, and i do want to mention the price being quite expensive.
The lasting power for the EDP is good and so its the sillage, but the EDT doesn't last that long, which makes sense since it's a lower concentration fragrance.
For the EDP i will therefor rate it a 7,8/10 ☀️
A simplistic mature scent. I loved wearing this to work, smells feminine without being floral. Very clean girl vibes. 10/10 for me.

i wanted to love this soooo badly, but it reminded me of an old lady perfume; or like the potpourri in your grandmas bathroom. ughhh what a letdown this was. especially bc i was beyond excited by the advertising for this & bought a whole bottle as soon as it dropped! this was a major flop for me & i was so upset.

Basically all white floral, but I like it! I usually don't like white floral, as they smell quite strong and smothering to me, but this is completely different, it's light and gentle, but definitely noticeable. Very airy, perfect for spring.
Really almost identical to Diptyque's Do Son. Maybe a touch less bright and airy. For tuberose lovers. But the tuberose in here is not indolic but quite tame. Nice creation and gorgeous bottle.
Basically all white flowers, nice and simple.

I absolutely adore this scent! I can see why it is so popular! It definitely is linear, but that really doesn’t bother me a bit! It’s stunning from opening through to the dry down. It’s very photo realistic and natural smelling, while maintaining class and elegance. Every white floral lover should have this in their collection!

I really adore this smell. I believe it's fitting for any woman that's over 25. A little bit mature, but oh that beautiful jasmine and tuberose mix is what makes this perfume truly irresistible. It might be a little cloying so I don't recommend overusing this one, but otherwise I believe this is the perfect scent for anyone who's looking for elegant vibes. <3

This doesn't project at all on my skin. Very light. Maybe I should have bought the Intense version. It does smell nice but not what I was expecting after reading reviews. I am picking up a floral other than Tuberose & Jasmine...not familiar to me...must be the Rangoon Creeper. 😮 I'll try layering it with a stronger Tuberose or Jasmine scent. I adore the pale pink bottle.

*Edit; I layered it with Prada Paradox & it is VERY nice 🩷 Also I tried adding a sweet sugary note with Viva La Juicy Glacé’ Eau De Parfum (PURE sugar which I love!)...It's fantastic! I also tried it with YSL Flowers & Flames...the dry down is sooo good. Try layering & you might be very surprised with your results. 😉

I may be slightly biased as I adore jasmine. But I'll be honest. Although this isn't a hugely complicated scent. When I wear this straight out of the shower I feel like a garden fairy who just flew through a bunch of jasmine flowers. It's quite green to me.
I'd say I mostly get compliments from those who are also addicted to jasmine. So make of that what you will.
At the beginning it is very jasmine then it changes to more vanilla. Very long lasting.
One of my favorites 😍 a unique blend of floral notes and the most realistic scents of flowers 💐
I don't like only jasmine smell. This smells quite linear, but jasmine smell is very realistic, like you just passed by jasmine garden.

Linear and simple, but nice and pretty. Tuberose and jasmine duet dancing together, giving us a feminine, realistic floral performance. It’s quite strong and has good longevity. If you like white florals, especially the mentioned duet, you should definitely try it and let it bloom on your skin :)

Very potent at first. Like you shoved your whole head into a bouquet of fresh jasmine & tuberose. It’s dewy & realistic.

Once it settles it becomes more lush & creamy. It gives you that sweet, almost banana-like scent. It’s very straightforward & linear. Enveloping you in an enchanted garden of white florals. It’s soft, feminine & versatile. Best in spring & summer. Can be worn anywhere during the day & even for a date night in the summer heat.

I love this perfume because it’s easy to layer with other fragrances and lotions if you wish. I once layered this is BBW lotion in sun-ripened raspberry & it was so good; I got a lot of compliments that day.

I was blown away by all the reviews for Gucci Bloom, A friebd of mine was visiting abd smelled divine. She said she was wearing Gucci Bloom. I never asked her if it was the EDT or EDP. So I went on eBay and purchased 4 small vials of the EDT and fell madly in love. Decided I had to have more do went in EBay and ordered 3.4 ounces but the EDP not the EDT. They are decidedly different. I actually thought I liked the EDT more but now that I have both, I love them equally. The EDP is definitely heavier on the tuberose with jasmine whereas the EDT is much lighter. I happen to love white florals. I detest sweet heavy fragrances. I love smelling like a flower garden
This smells like taking an early summer evening walk through a hotel garden right before dinner. Very realistic white floral, absolutely gorgeous, really love this one.
Ooooh smells like smooth and yummy vanilla. Reminds me of my old vintage fragrance, Coty Vanilla Fields.

The most ethereal/beautiful floral fragrance I've tried so far. There truly isn't anything weird or off putting about it, just pure, photorealistic flowers.
Gorgeous!

Jasmine-commited. It reminded me of Glam by Michael Kors that has the same pungency, but Bloom keeps more lightness.

I really like how clean and focused it is. The jasmine isn’t drowned in other notes, it stands on its own, clear and pure, and it's in your face like when you drink and directly inhale jasmine tea. It’s minimalistic, but not boring. There’s intention in the simplicity, and the longevity is great. Nothing extra, just a well-executed linear floral that knows exactly what it wants to be.

This is one of the most magical floral perfumes I've ever encountered. The first time I smelled it, I instantly thought of a photorealistic flower bouquet, like walking into a flower shop or through a fancy garden. It's been about a year now since I initially encountered this fragrance in a Sephora, but I'm still completely in love. It's one of the crowning jewels of my collection. I will admit, this fragrance is not complex and it's mostly tuberose. It's a white floral scent accompanied by a slightly green quality like cut stems, which I understand is not for everyone. But to my nose, which is addicted to anything white floral, it's a simple, elegant masterpiece. It really does smell like a fresh bouquet of flowers, stems snipped, and arranged in a vase. This is a perfect fragrance for Spring, as the white florals are more subdued in cool drizzly weather, although I will probably still wear it throughout the Summer months and maybe even into Autumn as well.
I like white floral fragrances. Totally agree with @Dahmeve; Gucci bloom is simple, clean, and elegant. It’s linear throughout its wear. It projects within arm-length for about 4hours.
Spicy tuberose bomb. Unforgettable.

I had a supposed dupe of this which smelled so nauseatingly sweet I can't wear it at all. Thinking this one would smell similar I put down even trying it for a very long time. Now I finally tried this and oh my god. This is SO good. A flower field or a flower bouquet in a bottle. A photorealistic one too. It smells nothing like the dupe (Bi-es Blossom garden). I am stunned. I must say while it's really good it's still maybe a bit too powerful for me but it still smells amazing
I love wearing this at home because I love jasmine but I know white florals aren’t for everyone so I’d be cautious wearing it out in crowded places

Perfumes are truly magical...I was under the impression that florals do not agree with me. And here we are... hopelessly in love with a perfume called Bloom.

It is light and fresh, there is no vanilla or musk to weight it down, no woods to make it harsh. Just pure flowers, clean, creamy, yummy. And still, some may find it heavy because it projects and lasts like crazy. You have to love jasmin to love this perfume. My kids love this perfume on me, so does my husband and he is picky. I reach this one all year, for any occasion but I do believe spring is her season. This is one I will repurchase once my bottle is gone ❤️

As someone who loves jasmine and is picky about tuberose-based fragrances, I felt that there was just barely enough jasmine in this to balance out the tuberose. It's a pleasant scent, but since it is mostly (if not entirely) tuberose I can't say that I would enjoy this fragrance nearly enough to purchase it. In my opinion there are plenty of far more balanced tuberose fragrances than this (Armani's My Way comes to mind), though this is probably just a personal preference.
Simple, clean, elegant - floral and feminine. I'm almost out of it, I'll most certainly be getting another bottle.

عطر وحدة عندنا كل مامرت من عندي اتقرف من ريحته
ماحب ريحته سيئة تذكرني بزيت باراشوت سيء لابعد درجة

Was gifted this fragrance years ago and have repurchased three times. A gorgeous floral suitable for absolutely any occasion imaginable. It's like a botanical garden from a fairytale universe, yet very sophisticated. I find it to have a very cold/cooling property to it almost like the flowers are slightly dewy, which I find makes it great for layering. It blends well with a lot of other fragrances in my collection and adds a cool, uplifting, invigorating floral touch to any fragrance combo. It does smell a LOT like Do Son by Diptyque however, I find Do Son to be slightly spicier and a tad more complex, and not as dewy or cooling. They both serve a time and place but Bloom is generally a safer choice for office and indoor spaces and definitely wearable for any season. I get complimented on it everytime I wear it.

Stings my nose with how sharp and white the florals are. Not sweet at all to me, either. I got this as a gift.
Makes me a bit nauseous, but white floral lovers, please get this !

This scent reminds me of student life in London. It’s a simple, white floral. It’s green, it’s tuberose and it’s jasmine.
A great everyday fragrance.

This may sound cringe, but to me, this perfume smells like what an angel would. The scent gives an image of a woman wearing a flowy white dress, standing in a garden full of flowers. The kind of woman who doesn't speak much, but it makes you curious with what she has in mind, and she has the prettiest smile but doesn't show it just to anyone.

I got this my junior year in college I believe after choosing from the Sephora holiday samples and I fell in love - I'm such a fan of jasmine and tuberose and this was a nice transition for my second go-to perfume in my life. It's dewy and light and inoffensive. I unfortunately grew sick of it near the end of the bottle and was desperate to finish to it - it's just not incredibly interesting or intoxicating and I think I grew out of its simpliness after a while. It does make for a good work/school scent though.

Found a dupe for this or at least the flankers which kept the white floral with the lush feel.

Rayhaan flora.. something. Very good longevity.
It's rounded and clean whilst feeling lush and slightly dewey as Gucci does

Very similar to Do Son by Diptque. There's pros and cons to both. Do Son has a slight biscuityness (think digestive biscuit) that I find distracting, but it's also somehow "brighter" than Bloom. This is a pleasant and light jasmine/tuberose. It's ever so slightly powdery as it dries down but in a way that is still very realisitic floral. I veer towards saying it's not exactly sweet, though others have described it that way. It's really just like walking into a greenhouse of white flowers on a sunny and dry day. It's not a complex or exciting fragrance, but it's elegant and fresh such that it's wearable for many occasions. I would wear this to the office or any formal occasion where a more flamboyant scent wouldn't be appropriate.

I'm surprised people don't consider this a winter or fall scent. I purchased it when it first released and wore it often during colder periods. This is probably because it smells almost exclusively floral to me, heavier on the jasmine than the tuberose in my memories. My taste has shifted a bit now, but I am fond of this scent still and it made me feel classy.
It reminds me of Diptyque's Do Son! The tuberose here is lighter, more powdery.
It doesn't last at all 👎🏼 waste of money 💰
so simple but so pretty still. there’s something so comforting about this one. and i am a gourmand girlie, i like sickly sweet cloying scents but i adore this perfume
Please pm me, as I insane for thinking this smells like 100% gardenia?

Edit: My bottle found a new home!

Original: I received this as a blind gift and I've tried to like this. So much. Every time I try to wear it I tell myself that its floral, lovely, I like white flowers, its so fun, the bottle is so cute, its from Gucci, my sneezing is a coincidence, etc....

I hate it. I am sorry and this isn't a dig on anyone and I hope I can give this perfume a home with someone who loves it in another town or country (the further the better), but I cannot stand it. And I love other smells with jasmine and tuberose in it so I cannot for the life of me distinguish why I hate this perfume, but I find it develops so oppressively on me after one spray and I have to imagine the Rangoon Creepers is what absolutely does not agree with me.

I will say, the silliage and longevity is insanely long. For those who love it, congrats! Please wave at me from across the street!!

This is not a safe blind buy for how straightforward it appears.

One of my favourites for spring/summer. I am a lover of white florals with a touch of earthy green. Some of my favourite florals include Gucci Bamboo, Dior Addict (which is more vanillic than floral but still), Boucheron Jaipur Bracelet and Cartier Baiser Vole (light pink liquid not yellow). I also happen to adore tuberose and jasmine. So it’s not surprising that I fell in love with this scent.
Sure it’s simple and pretty linear but it’s also effortlessly beautiful on me. I have many of the better known tuberose forward perfumes Michael Kors, og Caroline Herrera, KK, Madonna ToD etc But Gucci Bloom does stand up on its own as distinctive from the others. It is too fresh to be considered a typical tuberose or jasmine bomb. The green notes reign the density and sucrose in, affording it an airy balance. On me this lasts pretty much all day. I love to layer this with the discontinued Tom Ford Orchid Soliel. The two compliments one another sublimely with OS amplifying Bloom’s projection and longevity.

I hope to have a bottle of Bloom in my collection for a long time, as it is one of my favourite florals to wear. Stunning in it’s simplicity. Just sweet enough, balanced with grassy green and the rangoon creeper drydown is lush. Imo signature bottle worthy and I’m not even a signature bottle kind of gal. Too much variety to be confined to one or two scents on a daily.

One of the best white florals I've ever smelled. SIllage is great, longevity is great, but it can be intense and give headaches when you wear too much for too long. Spray maybe 2-3 sprays, one on the wrist and dab it onto the other, then one at the fron of the neck, and one at the back of the neck. Suitable for being in your backyard or your bedroom napping on a spring day. Not a bed fragrance, though. You'll stay up all night.

If you want to smell like dove soap this parfum is for you.
I don't like it

When I tried this fragrance, I instantly felt like I had someone else's perfume on me. I do not like jasmine or white florals. However, if you like these two notes then it'll be perfect for you, because the scent projected nicely and had decent staying power.

When I was 24, my boyfriend picked out and gifted me Gucci Bloom. At the time, I didn’t love it. The white florals felt powdery, and a little too mature. But I wore it to the office, and it became my most complimented fragrance. I finished the bottle.

Years later, I have bought it again, and now, I get it. The white florals aren’t old-ladyish—they’re elegant. Gucci Bloom doesn’t smell like someone’s grandmother. It smells like someone with good and sophisticated taste.

I credit this shift to Alien. Two years of wearing it, and jasmine went from something I tolerated to something I actively seek out in every fragrance.

So yes, Gucci Bloom is firmly in my top three—alongside Mugler Alien Essence Absolue and Burberry Goddess. And it’s not going anywhere.

Just no. I was gifted this perfume. I despised it in the beginning and I hate it even more now. Ugh heavy heavy heavy tuberose. Plasticy and green to the point after it gave me a headache it then resembled body odor. Had to review today bc I was waiting in line and a woman behind me had this on. I pegged it 100 percent. Can’t mistake this linear, boring, nasty smell. I couldn’t get away from the lady fast enough. I can’t take florals other than freesia and Lilly of the valley. Let me tell you this scent gets greener as it’s worn and so does my face around it 🤮🤢 musty and old. Reminds me of a funeral home. Hard N0 for me.

This fragrance... it barely tries. A soapy, flat floral that clings to one profile and never develops. It’s clean, sure, but not in a way that feels intentional—more like a generic detergent vibe. No depth, no surprises, just a predictable white floral dizziness that lingers too long without saying much. There is no way it wasn't designed to be forgettable, blending into the nausea it induced like a scent—if I can even call it that—you’d smell at a random drugstore perfume aisle. A missed opportunity for something bolder.
Pleasant but nothing out of this world. No innovation, just a simple floral fragrance that feels familiar.

Quite a lovely floral scent, although reminiscent of 'Fracas'! But without the carnation! So pleasant ☺ 😊 drying down to a warm lovely Honeysuckle smelling rangoon creeper!
Not old ladies type, but elderly ladies are quite welcome to wear this aswell, as it's so pretty 💖and very feminine!..
This is perfect as far as floral scents go..however, I prefer gourmands. This gets a solid like vote from me.

This fragrance reminds me of a youthful girl, wearing short skirts, standing in the sunset in a wild garden. Pure jasmine scent with no indole odor, green and gentle, floral and FRESH. I like this smell.

I looove this! It smells so feminine, floral, soft... Like a fresh bouquet of flowers. It is perfect for daytime activities, not too overpowering but gives a very nice lingering scent. This always puts me in a better mood. Perfect for the office, errands, brunch. I think I will have to have this in my collection forever.

I think Gucci Bloom solidified my love for floral perfumes! It is my safe space, meaning when I am in doubt or when a perfume I am testing 'offends' me by giving me a headache or something similar, this is the fragrance I run to. I hope they never change anything about it!

activated insect repellent. it paralyzed my nose and attacked my nervous system.
white floral overdose with no fun.
Such a beautiful scent. I definitely sense more notes than the listed. Very feminine and long lasting

I love gucci bloom, and I can see how it might scare some people who aren't used to white florals that aren't sweet bubblegumy, gucci bloom is pure tuberose, so direct that it feels like a punch in the face at first spray, doesn't have much evolution, it's just a very green dry and realistic tuberose, super elegant and grown-up, it's simple but different from everything nowadays
Gucci Bloom is a stunning floral fragrance! The tuberose is prominent but beautifully balanced by the jasmine and rangoon creeper. It's feminine and elegant, perfect for daytime or evening wear.

I buy a perfume for myself every year for Christmas and I got this one this year along with a less expensive one. I got the largest bottle. I having multiple samples of this and even a travel size, I have to say this in an elevated floral. I'd expect nothing less from Gucci. My signature scent for many years was the original Gucci Guilty and why this is not like that at all it has the same elevation of class and sophistication while being very feminine and soft. I'm a strong goth girlie, heavy on the girlie that lives in the south and I like a statement. I'm a lover of all the Aliens and Angels. This to me is just so beautiful and accessible. Highly recommend trying it. I wrote an earlier review that it's like sticking your head in a bouquet of flowers and yet it also is just so smooth and powerful but not so overpowering or sickly.
Adore. Last year my signature scent or I guess the last few years was Utopia by KayAli and this has a similar vibe while being very different still in it's on class and bold.
Looking forward to wearing this most days.
If you like gardenia fragrances you will love this. Pretty much all I smell is gardenia from initial spray to dry down. Not horrible, but not exciting and you must love gardenia to enjoy this.

Simple, white floral scent that doesnt feel too overpowering. Not a complicated scent, but works great for layering other scents :)
Lasts quite well for me and the scent somewhat reminds me of Lily of the valley

This is the exact exact scent of walmart perfume called Island Gardenia
And I actually preferred the walmart one because it lasted longer.

I tried this again and still on me it is this dry kind of worn out type floral scent/tuberose.

If you ever sampled Pacifica Gardenia perfume, you know how realistic gardenia soft floral petal scent that was

And I was hoping this would have that

But this has something very dry like reminds me of dust and floral

I’ve decided I like the aesthetics of Gucci better than the scents. Basic white flowers, which I DO like, but I need some sort of fruity or spicy note to make it interesting for FB-worthy wear honestly. This has no real development, and the base note “rangoon creeper” does nothing for me. It’s giving “LEAF.” Seriously, the Petra Collins ad shots are so cute and I hoped to love it, but it’s a big meh. Maybe a good starter white floral, or for those who want a more minimal/fresh scent. That’s just not me though. I’ll try my sample again on a nice spring day if I don’t pass it to my jasmine-gaga friend first.
Floral. Elegant. Lasting.

This has been one of my go-to spring and summer scents for some time. I love the way it stays on my skin and I love the way it travels. I feel consistently like I'm surrounded by a field of flowers when I wear this. For anyone who loves jasmine, tuberose, hyacinth, lilac and iris, I HIGHLY recommend this.

Just blind bought a full bottle as I love tuberose and gardenia. I feel like I’m the only person who doesn’t like this perfume. I much prefer Kim Kardashians signature gardenia scent. I’ll try Gucci bamboo as my clean white floral next. It’s nice don’t get me wrong but it wasn’t what I was expecting at all, just don’t like the smell. I actually hate it which is too bad!

I tested this and on me it had smell of rotten flower stems and had evoked such sad feelings in me... it was so disappointing, too many people love it. Maybe it is the rangoon creeper, have no idea, other tuberose perfumes I love, e.g. Gabrielle Essence.

When I wear Gucci Bloom in public I mainly get stopped by men. They ask what I'm wearing because they want it for themselves! I think I have left a comment here before about my love of GB, but I thought I'd let you all know how unisex this scent is. It works for everyone. :)

Got a small decant of this one. To me this smells like the better version of Burberry London for her. It’s Burberry London, but then less sharp and slightly sweeter. Heavy on the white florals, clean vibe, office friendly. Wouldn’t want a bottle for myself, but I can definitely see why many like it. Good performance.

This is a solid unisex white floral for people who want something straight forward to put on for any situation.

It's not a statement in the slightest, but that's sometimes what you need.

Yes, it's quite a unapologetic green tuberose. However, as an enjoyer of Cacharel's Eden ,but often sad how it always feels slightly too much, I appreciate how this one soothes into something more subtle in time.

I think this is a perfume you can't enjoy if you don't enjoy;

1) Simple scents

2) White florals with no sweetness

I'd also say this perfume will absolutely smother you if you over spray.

I got profumo over this in the end because of profumo lasting a touch better and being creamy, But I'll certainly ask for this if anyone asks me what I might like as a gift.
I find this floral well-crafted, long lasting, clean, and calming.
Love. A crisp fresh super white floral scent. The best floral perfume

Straightforward tuberose for 8 hours. Generic, like other reviews mention. I have an ick against tuberose; it's more yellow-flower-smelling. The Rangoon Creeper is very green and smells bitter at times, almost like an underlying body odor. It doesn't smell bad as a "pass-by scent" but smelling it up close isn't nice.
The flanker really is better! This one was so generic, pleasant but boring. Tuberose, vaguely floral bb&w gingham. Gorgeous gardenia blows this away.

rangoon creeper is SO STRONG in a way that you're lying in a field, dreamy in your own world. Much green here - dominant very much at the beginning, but beautiful combination with jasmine and tuberose but seems like more flowers are combined (guess that's because of rangoon creeper). Nice scent non the less, and makes it possible to have a romantic day to day perfume. Smells soft and delicious. A tad too expensive though, but worth the femininity, clean and not overpowering, easily can be a classic

This is one of my favourite scents. It’s simple, bright and clean, and smells the same from spray to dry down. My only problem is that it doesn’t last more than a few hours before you need to reapply.
The perfume is saturated with the scent of jasmine
meh
Love, love, love.. and then it dries down. Dry down on my skin after about 20 minutes is quite unpleasant.

The longevity and performance are decent. I used to really enjoy this fragrance when I was starting my perfume collection, but I’ve moved away from white florals and floral scents—unless they’re paired with gourmand notes. It’s not a bad fragrance, but it feels boring to me now.

This is a classic pure white floral, heavy on the jasmine and tuberose. It is a beautifully balanced scent, it leans more to a true floral and does not have any real sweetness to it. It is definitely a more stereotypically mature scent, but don't let that deter you as it is a beautiful one. It has extremely good longevity (12+ hours) and a moderate sillage.
My only advice is if possible, do a wear test before purchase. When I smell this from the bottle, it is a true white floral scent, however on my skin it is much much more green, and I don't like it as much. So I would recommend testing to see how it reacts on your skin.
Feminine and sexy, not too sweet. It’s classic. No wonder it spawned all those spin-offs.
Pulled this from out of my personal stash today! Today’s a good day to put on some GUCCI BLOOM in this fall weather!! Xoxo
Pulled this from out of my personal stash today! Today’s a good day to put on some GUCCI BLOOM in this fall weather!! Xoxo

I'm not a perfume snob so for me this is super nice! I really love white florals and somehow I rly like the crispiness of it! I have a sample of this and a decant of the gorgeous Jazmine and this one is more fresh and lively! It made me feel clean and in a good mood! So I give it points to that! Sometimes I don't want to smell that creamy so I'd like to have a bottle of this!!

Had a sample sitting around for a year or two before I finally tried it and fell in love. Picked up a travel roller at Sephora a couple months later, and ugh I hate it so much now?? It smells shallow, like it needs grounding almost. Same thing happened with a Miss Dior sample, absolute love turned to ... ugh. Going to let it macerate for another couple years and cross my fingers it turns into whatever gorgeous concoction I got to try the first time.
It is practically a grandchild of Anais Anais. Very clean, a little too sharp and linear but won't offend anyone at work.Anyone thinks aldehydes? Not listed, but there is a presence.
This scent gives me a headache.

Musky powerful flowers juice that feels fancy at first, then gives me a headache and dries acidic musk, like a lot of mainstream perfumes. I got tricked by the Florence Welsh promo :( I only wear it a few days in the spring.
A very natural, dense and pollen-heavy floral. Heady jasmin and opulent tuberose. The world was missing such a scent in mainstream. Performs well in summer.

Haha exactly same though with Earthtoerykah comment below. Gucci Bloom is my first perfume ever. I blind bought this cause of the fancy elegant bottle and a FOMO as it was pushed over internet by that time. And after almost 7 years, it’s still like new 😂😂😂 touched few times only to spray for fun, not on my body 🥹 not scent makes you gag, but scent makes you think about your great-grandmother. 😐😐😐

I impulse bought this perfume in 2018 on the way home from Ghana in the duty-free shop. It was my birthday, I wanted to treat myself. I am not sure if I actually even smelled this one completely before deciding to buy, I think my 18 year old self just saw the fancy display and the Gucci label and I was like lets gooooo. I tried it when I got home and I was like no seriously wtf was this and why did I waste my money on it. I think this scent actually turned me away from perfumes for a few years after that. I do not want to say that this smells like a grandma because I love the way that my grandparents smell. But it probably smells like someone else's grandma. As much as I would love to walk up to Gucci himself and get my 100 dollars back, I am happy that I am left with 2 major teaching from Gucci Bloom: 1. I cannot do heavy florals 2. Sample, sample, sample. No impulse purchases.

The worst Gucci fragrance... my mother blind bought it for me as she knows I love white florals but we both came to agree that it smells like a great grandma. I gave it away! My guess is that the cloying grandma scent comes from the rangoon creeper.
it is nothing special. its pretty much just 100% a flower fragrance. I like to put it on after i shower
Smells like deodorant. I choke on it. This comes from someone who loves white flowers.
This is an underrated scent. A nice musky white floral with some natural sweetness. Since I am a floral girl, I needed to get this although I already own Do Son.
made me feel sick :(

I usually don’t wear too many floral perfumes but this is a pretty, light, white floral and it just so happens that I love tuberose and jasmine. The initial spray is a little sneeze inducing but it dries down into a very beautiful and pleasant uplifting scent that makes me excited for spring.
A very safe office fragrance. I’m not a white florals person and this is heavy on the white florals. Good longevity and moderate sillage.
I would hate tuberose if I'd met it in Bloom first, weirdest smell (not scent), more recalling the smell of rotten flower stems in vase....

Really pretty, and leaves a beautiful trail. Something about this scent just makes me happy. It smells, clean, grown, and sexy without being overpowering. It is not a warm fragrance, it is definitely cool, I get a lot of compliments on this one. I also appreciate that the tuberose is not a bubblegum tuberose, it's soft, and sexy. Great for the 30+ crowd, while not being too mature. It's the sexier, more complex sister of Calvin Klein Beauty, which is my opinion smells like Daphne flower. :)

Simple, minimal and linear white flower fragrance. Tuberose is very dominant. I like it's minimalistic scent and that it's not mixed with ambery notes like many other perfumes. The bottle looks like a shampoo bottle, haha, but overall it's a good fragrance.
7/10

A nicely done clean and green tuberose, with a backing of jasmine and what smells like honeysuckle. This is a really linear perfume and very much an inoffensive and balanced white floral.
