Whilst it's nothing ground breaking and it doesn't evolve much, it's a pleasant and easy to wear perfume that I think would suit many occasions.
I already own many spectacular white florals, and I think Diptyque's Doson nails realistic tuberose, so not sure I'd purchase a full bottle of this one. Something in Bloom, in the dry down on my skin, did get a little bit sharp and screechy when sampling this one in the warm weather today, so I do wonder if it would be less screechy in a cooler temperature. I'll have to try it again on a colder day.

I'm addicted to Gucci Bloom. What a lovely fragrance. Love the honeysuckle smell lingering in the air and on my clothes.
I wear other perfumes but keep coming back to this one.

TLDR; Easy blind buy.

Game-changer honestly. Very linear though in its smell - no depth to it but that's what's so lovely about it. I LOVE the green in it.

this used to be one of my favourite perfumes when I didn't have a collection and just wanted to smell good.
and to be honest, I still like it. it's not something special, but it is feminine and classy. I probably would not repurchase it again, but I understand its appeal.

Good option of Jasmine,Tuberose or Jasminum sambac lovers, however you can buy this perfume blind buy. If you love CK beauty perfume you will love this perfume it have the same DNA.

Flory, Clean fresh Calm fragrance, It's suitable to wear it in summer season rather winter and any time during the day. It lasts along.

خيار جيد لعشاق الياسمين أو مسك الروم أو ورد الفلّ، ومع ذلك يمكنك شراء هذا العطر بشكل أعمى. إذا كنت تحب "CK beauty"، فسوف تحب هذا العطر لأنه يحمل نفس الحمض النووي.

زهري، عطر نظيف ومنعش وهادئ، مناسب لارتداؤه في فصل الصيف أكثر من الشتاء وفي أي وقت خلال النهار. ثباته جيد وطويل.

I didn't like this fragrance at first, I wore it when it was so hot in Kenya, but with time it has become one of my top 3 scents that I reach for. It's classy, fresh floral and makes me smell like an elegant lady. The dry down gets even better as it is not as sharp. It's not a safe blind buy though.

This is one of my favorites and one of my most worn perfumes. I can understand how some people don’t appreciate it, as tuberose seems to be one of those notes you love or hate, and this is certainly a strong tuberose scent. But I love it. To me, Bloom smells classy and sophisticated, timeless yet modern. There’s something incredibly luxurious and posh to me about tuberose perfumes when they’re done right. This is also one of my most high-performing perfumes, as other people can smell it on me, I can certainly smell it on myself for hours, and it lasts a long time. This is a perfect springtime scent, but I wear it all year. I find that I like Bloom more and more the longer I have it.

This is the most realistic tuberose perfume, like some reviewer had said.
You have to like fresh tuberose to like this. Pure tuberose bouquet, it can be sharp for some people.
On my search of tuberose perfume, I tried Do Son by Dyptique and Gucci Bloom side by side, they smell identical, Bloom is slightly stronger, so I picked Bloom. It doesn't smell bubble gummy like Fracas or Mancera Velvet Vanilla.
It is not a complex perfume, but I love this. Bloom is very elegant, simple yet beautiful.

I love tuberose and Jasmin, but find some of those white floral perfumes indolic. Gucci bloom does smell more mature, but in a wealthy woman kind of way. I live in Hawaii, so it smells like wearing a fresh tuberose lei around your neck all day.
I love to wear it in the spring/summer because the Rangoon keeps it a little more fresh. It’s a great everyday, in offensive perfume. This is a signature worthy scent.
who does not like white floral has bad taste, the flowers are the delicacy of the gods a gift from God to man, how bad taste here.
Bubble gummy Tuberose that goes into an unmistakable Amarige by Givenchy, that’s the matronly a lot of folks mentioned on here I think.

Today (June 20th, which also happends to be the Summer Solstice) I finished my 4th fragrance in 2024: Gucci Bloom. I bought a 100ml bottle in the fall of 2017, after smelling it first in the Summer. I then asked the salesperson wheter Gucci Bloom or Mugler Aura would suit better for an office, since I worked my first real job at the time and wanted to give myself a treat. The salesperson said Gucci Bloom was better, I ended up buying Aura because Aura intrested me more. I could however not forget Gucci Bloom: its powdery, almost medicinal smell and the stunning water nymph/Ophelia like commercial with Dakota Johnson that I rember seeing all the time on TV. So I went back and bought the biggest bottle they had.

Ever time I smell this fragrance, I feel comforted and mature. Like the well put together woman I want to be. I bought this fragrance when I was 21 and at first I wore it everytime I felt not taken seriously or when I had big life or career events. I wore this for example when I signed the pages to buy the house that I was lucky enough to buy in 2021.

In 2021, I started to wear my 8 oldest fragrance bottles suited for every season as a rotation. Gucci Bloom became a staple in my Spring and Summer rotation. This fragrance is beautifull and etheral in the warmer weather and to me it signals good times to come.

The opening starts of with a strange mix of powdery and green, which if sprayed too much can be very medicinal. This is very brief, because soon all the white florals pop up with the main act being tuberose. It stays pretty linear the whole time and I get a solid work day/ 8ish hours when wearing it.

I feel like letting go of an old friend with the bottle being finished, but I am happy with my big collection to finish bottles.

Massive blossoms of humid, photorealistic tuberose and jasmine radiating from the tropic heat, hanging down from damp bitter green branches. If ever there was a scent so aptly named, Bloom is it. This performs beautifully. On hot days Bloom warms up on the skin and surrounds you in an heady aura as if the climate around you shifts- all without feeling too heavy or cloying. It is enchanting. It is timeless. It is a signature scent.

I wore the heck out of my bottle when it released, and took a long break away from this fragrance for a few years until just recently. I found a sample vial of the yellow Profumo Di Fiori flanker in my nightstand, and I needed Bloom back in my life immediately. Profumo is excellent, masterful even, but my true love is the original EDP... One of my top favorite frags of all time. In an olfactive landscape oversaturated with gourmands, saccharine florals, and sweet musks, I return to a favorite that possesses none of these trendy qualities. Wearing Gucci Bloom once more, I am home again.

I want to like this perfume so much, as I am a huge fan of white floral scents. However, there is a certain bitterness that lingers beneath the strong jasmine smell that I just can't shake off and it turns me away. That same bitterness also makes this white floral fragrance heavier than it should be, becoming overbearing in warmer and humid weather. I do appreciate the staying power of this perfume, however; I can still smell it on me 12 hours after applying it.

Light, airy bouquet of white flowers. Safe, pleasant. That light pink is the perfect color for it: powdery, and don't know why but I get a tinge of an emergent pastel rose from the whole concoction..?
It kicks off in the perfect direction, and then.. nothing.. I think the Bloom accord sets a gorgeous stage, but that stage needs something performing upon it.
(The yellow bottle's ylang does it for me.)

As it dries down, it gets warmer. Very nice. But. This whole darned line has zero staying power.
I usually like perfume with tuberose in it. I think the rangoon creeper makes it smells a little weird. It smells old lady. A little disappointed with the smell.

I impulsively blind bought many years ago and didn't like it. I had forgotten about it in the back of my collection for a few years, but I do like it a lot now. I remembered it being very strong and headache inducing. It performs quite well, lasting on me for many hours. Tuberose is all I can smell. It's also sweet, in a way, very round and flowery. I prefer to wear this at night in the summer, it feels too heavy for the day. This is not for the weak of nose; if you like strong tuberose scents then this is your safest blind buy.

Absolutely gorgeous white florals. Someone close to me wears this and it is just the most natural, elegant smell. She always smells put together and fresh. A white floral bomb, but undoubtedly classy.

Opens with fresh airy jasmine and sweet tuberose. The jasmine is the bouquet fresh type with green facets. The tuberose is bubblegumy but not overly so.

It smells like the type of fragrance my mom would wear. She loves beachy yet clean white florals. This is less beachy yet still has the type of floral I associate with her.

As it wears, I get more of the sweet tuberose. Bloom stays rather linear once the tuberose comes out. I think if you like Armani My Way, you will enjoy this because of the similarities. One major difference is that Bloom stays calm and mellow while My Way is punchy and bright.

This fragrance is pleasant but not for me.

I remember when Gucci Bloom was released.

I was shocked by how natural-smelling, wearable it was. It smells way more expensive than the price point was. The whole thing just screams great judgement. It was refreshing because for a while everything released either smells like molten sugar or half-washed laundry.

It's a tuberose, a bit waxy and creamy, counterbalanced with a green, bordering astringent jasmine. The base is a nice woody musk. Just nice and very pretty.

I was using a sample of this during which two dates praised how good I smelled. One of them even sent me a picture of himself smelling the pillow the day after I'd leaned on it during our date. So naturally, even though I hadn't had such strong feelings about it before, I had to buy it.

And now...I love it. Someone wrote that it's like hugging a put together mum...maybe that's why those dates liked it? :D But for me it's an answer to a need I didn't know I had. I think it's elegant and timeless, yet fresh. I won't comment on the notes, since other people have already done it better than I could ever express myself.

It warms up on my skin so beautifully. I keep smelling my wrists when I have it on. Only downside is, the longevity isn't that great on my skin. If I want it to last a bit longer, I use the old trick of spraying it in the air and walking through it, in addition to putting it on wrists and neck.

I don't particularly enjoy white florals but this was my signature scent for a long while (bought 5 big bottles). It just has something addicting in it. Hugs from the put together mom friend vibe. Inoffensive, simple, fresh, clean, timeless. On me the sillage was borderline scary, people knew I was in because I left a lingering trail - I do tend to spray myself a lot though. I am a bit scared to get another bottle after so long but if I ever do I'll leave an update.
Elegant, fresh, cool and floral. Balanced notes of tuberose and jasmine, proper for all seasons with sensible sillage and longevity. Everything I want from a perfume is here! Happy to wear it😍

I am fan of tuberose as well as jasmin, and this is a beautiful, womanly white floral scent that is fresh and fragrant like holding a bouquet of white florals. It smells almost the same as DoSon Diptyque except for its muskiness.

If you want to smells like fresh cut white flowers this is perfect. I received a bottle of Gucci bloom as a gift a few years ago and this will always ba a staple in my collection. Perfect for day time, date night or upscale occasions, absolutely gorgeous and timeless, so feminine and as I’m in my early 20’s I believe this is youthful too. Once again, this smells like flowers and I love it

A lovely classic, a clean and realistic honeysuckle well blended with jasmine and tuberose. Very little projection on me and doesn't last that long. I don't find it strong or baby-powdery, just like fresh cut stems. It reminds me a little bit of walking in a botanical garden.

Would be nice to layer with some post-bath sesame oil for a nice cozy 90's vibe. For men in particular, this might be nice to blend with something spice-forward, it's more girly at first but settles into a more unisex floral, IMO.

the opening of Gucci Bloom is the most perfect honeysuckle-jasmine i’ve ever smelled. and once the creamy bubblegum tuberose kicks in, i feel like i’m drunk on white flowers. i’m having flashbacks to my East-Texas childhood, shoving my face into star jasmine, gardenia, and honeysuckle. it’s so strong at first you can definitely taste it, but i’m not even mad about that. all the warmth, none of the funk. rangoon creeper is also known as “Chinese honeysuckle,” and i can see why.

as strong as it starts, though, it has slightly poor performance overall, going out in a blaze of glory rather quickly, but leaving a sweet, dark, powdery trail behind. (i wonder if layering this with Not a Perfume would make it stick around longer.)

EDIT 5/31/24: tried this with NaP and, while not sure it improved the performance, it filled in the spaces, boosted the powdery musk at the end, and made it more interesting overall — and did not alter the glorious opening in the least. win-win.

/current edp
Smells just like Gucci Envy Me

an amazing floral perfume, which develops to be a bit powdery. i love this combo, it used to be my signature fragrance for a few years until i switched to gucci guilty.

thus it develops and wears really well on the skin, and even the performance is very good. moderate sillage. even though it has tuberose, for me it doesn’t have the distinct old lady smell, rather it just smells very sophisticated, and can be worn just as well by those under 70 years.

It's excessively floral, as if white flower petals are piercing your nostrils, yet oddly appealing. It consistently evokes the image of a mature Italian woman residing in a quaint village adorned with expansive gardens. Overall, it's a timeless, beautiful fragrance.

I have a bottle of this I was gifted and never wear as simple white florals just aren't my thing at all. Today I decided to try layering it with Fields at Nightfall (Zara This Is Her dupe) and it works so well.

It's very floral still, but with a bit of sweetness and warmth that makes it far more wearable for me. I can't stop sniffing my arm.
What a banger. This is a must for lovers of white flowers. It's like diving head first into a pool of flowers. Reminds me of summer mornings walking through a field.

This is tuberose bomb, very strong. I love it, but can’t wear strong perfumes because of my husband’s snowflake-ish nose. Drydown is soapy jasmine with tuberose. It’s similar gender as May Way, but this one is maybe bit more mature and elegant.

I smelled it in a store and was I was immediatly brought back to that Flower perfume by Avon that I used to love so very much when I was a tween, but obviously more luxurious. Gucci Bloom, I feel, is a bit mature for me, but it's quite classy and suitable for formal ocassions. I wouldn't wear it on a casual date with friends, or a date to the movie teather. It feels quite expansive on my skin, like all of me smells of the sweet tuberose and jazmin, walking through a flowery garden on spring. I really do love it, I just feel it a bit grown up-er than I currently am. Maybe when I'm 35 it will fit me like a glove.

This smells like 95% similar to Jovan Island Gardenia
Walmart perfume you can buy from Amazon

A very clean, mature, floral fragrance. Much too strong for my nose, like a slap of flowers to the face. I never detected anything other than floral notes - it is just pure tuberose. Barely any jasmine. If that's your vibe and you're certain you love tuberose, go for it! Not for me though. I gave it to my auntie.

Clean, fresh, simple — will always remind me of 2017 when I fell in love with the ad campaign (sorry!) and then the scent as soon as I tried it. Beautiful bottle. I finished my first bottle years ago and recently picked up another, and it seems weaker to me now and doesn’t last anywhere near as long as I remember, so is a skin scent for me after about an hour of wear. I’d probably recommend the red Ambrosia di Fiori one in the line over the original now, which is a shame.

It's pretty and soapy. But it's a bit too simple and one-sided in my opinion. There's nothing in particular wrong with it, but it just doesn't stand out at all. I wish there were some more interesting notes to balance it out and give it a bit more flesh.
great
I love it, nice perfume
It smells way too similar to the Febreze toilet refresher I have...

Beautiful and elegant white flower scent! Opens up with white flowers and settles nicely on my skin. Smells well blended and balanced. I would buy this for a summer holliday. It reminds me of visiting flower gardens in Europe when the mornings are still cool but the days are warm.
Boring. I much prefer Michael by Michael Kors for my tuberose blast, which feels fresh, young and sexy to me. Bloom is more grandma pretty, to me.

There are 2 different fragramces this reminds me of. Maison Margiela flower market and/or Armani Rouge Malachite. FYI the Armani is significantly stronger and longer lasting, the MM flower market a more natural take on the scent of the florists.
But, this is undeniably a beautiful scent, and has about the ideal strength and projection for a wedding ceremony. I tip my head to those who have written about wearing this for their wedding day. Its perfect for thr occassion... I'd kiss your hands on bended knee to show my apreciation for tou elegant taste.
As mentioned elsewhere, if you are not a fan of tuberose - beware. This may not be to your liking. In perfumery the white florals of jasmine, orange blosson amd tuberose are rightly lauded as the 3 queens, but as a caveat, tuberose isnt as easy on the nose as the other two. Its not as divisive as full on rose, or orchid say, but now amd again i meet people who arent fans.
Its good, but there are similar scents do it even better. But a queen on her wedding day shouldnt be making eyes water feom ten feet, so this gets my vote for the most formal occasions. Also one spray is probably light enough for the office, so if you want a naturalish elegant floral, this could be for you.
I tried it numerous times and each time it smells like urine. Gucci bloom instense is really beautiful though, just get the instense version

I too wore this on my wedding day, 5 years ago now. There's something endearing, almost nostalgic and dreamy about this white flowers composition. Somewhat, it screams rich and nonchalant about it, as almost all Gucci creations. It really lives up to the house DNA.

The opening has a prominent bubblegum note from the tuberose which subsided almost immediately on me, to make room for a really enchanting jasmine.
I guess that the nostalgic note singing in my mind has to do more with the white flowers overall, than anything else. It's a romantic, tender concoction with a modern twist. I may be biased, as I love a good jasmine, but this is really classy, ethereal in that demure way that so well suits brides on their big day.
If you love white flowers, give it a test.

10/10 though longevity isn't great on me to be honest. The intense isn't as good.
Gorgeous white flowers intermingled with insect repellent, which then morphs into it all rotting away. On a happier note, I adore the design of the bottle.
I personally find this an incredibly overwhelming and nauseating scent. I don't usually mind floral fragrances but this has some extreme power, too extreme for me.
All i get is tuberose. Not for me but if you are into strong tuberose dominant white florals you might like this
Cheira a madame elegante, daquelas que não gosta de passar batida.

If you’re a 100% floral person this is for you, but if you’re 99% or less a floral person, this may overwhelm you. The silage and lasting power is fantastic- but on me it smelled like a flower bouquet from the grocery store. It softens up a bit if you layer it with something more creamy or gourmand but the tuberose will still come through incredibly strong.

Smells like an English noble lady. Very strong, the scent of Tuberose is very realistic, as if holding a bouquet of Tuberose in your hand. This is love for me because I am a girl who loves White Flower scents so much. If you like Burberry London, Kim Kardashian EDP, Diptyque Doson, you should definitely try Gucci Bloom. They all belong to the luxurious and extremely elegant White Floral/Tuberose scent group, definitely the most beautiful fragrances for brides on their wedding day.

Rating: 9/10. Every time I wear it, I think of a scene of a large castle surrounded by beautiful gardens

Heavy sweet tuberose with some jasmine, not to my liking, unfortunately
But I believe the sillage may be pretty awesome!

I got trapped because people compared it to YR Tendre Jasmin, but they are different
Haven't tried Do Son, but it obviously has Narcotic Venus vibes (more banana like tuberose scent). This one is a tuberose-jasmine combo with animalic undertones in the dry down

There are also similarities to Michael Kors Glam Jasmine
Genuinely smells like a dandelion

I chose to wear Gucci Bloom on my wedding day because it is such a classic, classy, well-made white floral for a spring wedding. It never gets too soapy as other white florals tend to, and it has a slight powdery quality that is balanced by a creaminess to it that is just delicious. It's such a pretty scent and brings so many fond memories! This is in constant rotation for me in the Spring.

I have been on the hunt for a good floral perfume that smells classic, but not too outdated, and Gucci Bloom has hit the mark for just an elegant floral perfume. I think this has to be one of my new favorites. Should be obvious, but if you don't like floral notes, this isn't for you. I love that there is no element of sweetness to it, just a pure floral perfume.The projection is good and it's just overall a classy beautiful girl perfume.
I love this perfume, it suits my personality, this is so flowery and soft, no sweet notes in there. Waiting to buy it again and again very soon
The edt has citrus, not edp
@nichefrag I don't know which perfume u smelled but there are no citruses here at all.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
This is OG Bloom's tangy twin I got at a very very good price.

You trade the creamy, syrupy sap of the original for something a little more sparkling and luminous.

You should get this if you feel the original lacks something to energize the composition.

It's extremely fresh and zingy to the point spritzing yourself with this first thing in the morning is up there with a cold shower and a hot cup of black coffee for rousing you from rest.

The dry down is also pretty nice, and a tough different. OG bloom stays quite green and sappy as it simmers, this one terms into a zesty musk. Not quite citrus peel, but in the same family.

It doesn't last the longest, but I also find the OG doesn't last well on me either. So far, only Profumo seems able to stick around long term.

Overall, it's a solid perfume to get if you want something floral to wear in the heat but I also don't think it's exceptional.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Disliked this. It smells like toilet cleaner. lasts long tho

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
The opening is a bit much for me, probably because of the lemon, but the dry down is nice. To me this smells like a more tuberose-heavy version of My Way. I'm particular about how much tuberose is in a fragrance (just a bit, not too much), so I love My Way but don't enjoy this nearly as much. I see how many people could like this fragrance, but the composition is just slightly off for my personal tastes.

EDIT: the dry down evolved to a very rubbery scent. Not a fan.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
It is very cute and potent. It dresses me in the prettiest flowers. I feel them yellow, slightly honeyed with a citrus edge. Contemplating there is definitely orange blossom and tuberose. Lemon and bergamot are adding their super freshness. I detect also neroli. The composition is fresh and floral. Today it is raining, 21°C, but it did not alter the performance of the scent. Sillage is substantial. I am constantly aware of the scent.
Comparing it to Bloom eau de parfum - it is less dense and more citrus. The edp is a heavier floral, dense and heady. Flowers heavy with pollen. I can see the edt having its own fans regardless of Bloom edp. However, it lasts 3-6 hours on me. The edp lasts much better, around 12hours.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
Got a free sample for my mom as i was choosing on what to buy her as a birthday gift. When my mom sprayed it on her hand we both said: It smells like a toilete cleaner spray and not a perfume. As a smell itself its not the worst thing but how could someone wear this? I mean if you enjoy smelling like a walking toilete at your supermarket, you do you.
Overall 2/10 Will be using rest of the sample as my WC spray.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This is lovely! Very floral, but fresh, almost dewy and naturally sweet. Very similar to the edp, but lighter. Perfect for summer. A must try for white floral lovers.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Oooh lah lah! This is the epitome of spring! Pretty light airy white florals mixed with shower clean soap! This is sooooooo soapy and clean! Right out of the shower into a fresh clean day! I prefer this EDT to the EDP. The EDP is too dense, rich, thick, and smells like lillies to me. This is like... Plumeria & Bubble Gum on the dry down!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Чудесный аромат - нежный, женственный, волнующий. Да, немного ассоциируется с чем-то ландышево-диоровским, видимо, такие шутки выдает тубероза. Нестойкий, но оно и понятно - EDT.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I totally dig the original Bloom... I think it's a great blind buy since it's well made and smells elegant without going too much in any direction (it's not too sweet, not too cloying, not too fruity, etc.). But this EDT is too citrusy. All I can smell is orange and lemon with a hint of tuberose in the background. I do like how light and ethereal it is since I don't like loud scents. But the citrusy scents just aren't for me. However, if you love citrus and florals, this one definitely one to try.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Not as heavy as the original, with the inclusion of fresh citrus and an orange blossom that tempers the sharp tuberose/white florals. Lighter projection means easier wear without a headache. Nice introduction to white floral perfume and the bottle with the wallpaper design is cute.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: lasts all day long on my skin and the sillage is great. it is a beautiful timeless white floral, very naturalistic and i dont get any citruses, which to me is great, this keeps the florals quite dense and enveloping instead of fresh and transparent. overall i prefer this to the edp, its similar but more wearable in my opinion. it has a sort of mystical ghostly nuance to it, makes me think of persephone, goddess of spring and queen of the underworld. its not your pretty girl floral, it is your gucci goddess floral. it really goes well with the boho chic vibe of florence from florence and the machine. can be worn year round too!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Similar to EDP. Competently done.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I really enjoy the Bloom range by Gucci and was initially drawn to the eau de parfum version, but I was gifted this one. This one smells fresher, lighter and more citrusy than the original version and it is a more springtime perfume. The original Bloom perfume is definitely a heavier floral scent that you can wear in the colder seasons too. The only downside to the eau de toilette is the poor longevity - lasts barely an hour on my skin. I pair it with Roger & Gallet Tubereuse Hedonie to prolong the scent.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Bloom but zesty and refreshing instead of heady and rich. Great for the heat but it runs away quick. I bought the large size and spray my clothes.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This is my mother's signature sent. It smells like fresh, natural zesty white florals. Its simplicity feels classy and effortless, although perhaps I am biased since that is who my mother is 😅 Me and my mother both struggle with headaches from perfumes and this one doesn't bother either of us, highly recommend for a beautiful elegant scent. I personally do not like the original EDP as it is very spicy to my nose, but this EDT is beautiful.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Sharp, light, lemony, and musky. A very well-done white floral that is very pleasant and uplifting for the spring and summer. The opening is strong and lightly lemony. The jasmine and tuberose smell natural and are the absolute stars of the show. The dry down leaves behind a gently woody and creamy musk. Unmistakably Bloom, this is cleaner and easier wear of the original in my opinion. It's not a powerhouse fragrance so it would be great for the days you want something quieter and that doesn't stick around all day.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: A nice very natural white flower perfume! Perfect for spring

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
It reminded me of my sample of My Way Intense, bubblegum tuberose once again, but this one is more bearable, less intense. Never smelled Gucci Bloom EDP or My Way. It's just okay. For tuberose fans.
I didn't smell anything other than tuberose, some other white florals and musk.
Still like l'Interdit as the best Tuberose scent.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I don't like this scent at all! It's too musky and there's a strong smell of dead, white flowers. It's not meant for my skin!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This comes out of the gate nice and strong but fades after two hours. It's a lovely scent. Decent sillage. Jasmin and Tuberose dominant. I didn't get the citrus at all. A crowd pleaser but no longevity.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
This new version is a little fresher at the start but after a few minutes it returns to being a concentrated tuberose flower perfume, as we know the eau de parfum, or at least I feel a great resemblance to it.
For an eau de toilette it lasts well, I would say about 4 - 5 hours, although after 3 hours it is already very soft on the skin and I can still feel the tuberose even if it is close to the skin. Medium intensity the first two hours and then begins to soften.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Sampling this today and I really like it. Pretty neroli/citrus forward tuberose. I'm not getting a lot of lemon w/ this. My nose picks up more of the neroli and orange blossom. Creamy/ Musky/floral dry down. This is a daytime spring/summer scent. Very uplifting and refreshing while still being a heavy white floral for those of us who love white florals. I like this flanker very much. Has the Gucci Bloom DNA.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This is a lovely white floral fragrance for spring & summer. You can definitely tell that it's a Gucci Bloom flanker. It is similar but not the same. The most dominant notes in Bloom EdP are jasmine and tuberose and jasmine and orange blossom play first riddle in the EdT - I really enjoy this combo. The fragrance is more radiant, airy and uplifting. The orange blossom and citrusses add freshness and zestiness to the fragrance. Gucci Bloom EdT is a great choice for women of every age and suitable for any occasion. The fragrance is pretty long lasting (7h+; becomes a skin scent after 3-4h) and has a moderate sillage. I think that it will "bloom" even more beautifully in warm weather.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Sickeningly tart

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I just bought this fragrance today so i can’t give it a true longevity test but when i smell this, i get a garden with bergamot trees hanging over the bushes full of flowers that just had been rained on. In the dry down i get a creamy floral which i really love!! The original bloom was too much white floral for me but this one, since they added in some citrus, i definitely think this one is easier to wear without smelling “old lady” I’m definitely gonna wear this in the spring!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: A good alternative of Bloom for those who find the original one too much. The scent in comparison is fairly similar. This acts more as a cologne.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Just snagged this after testing in store a few times and it promises to be a perfect Spring scent! I actually prefer it to the EDP as it’s more complex and less cloying. The tuberose still stands tall, but the citrus notes are a great supporting cast to help round it out.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I’m not a fan of the Gucci bloom line , but had to try this since i love neroli and the bottle is gorgeous in real life!
Immediately you smell that sharp white floral and for an edt i was impressed by the longevity and sillage. I honestly think this is better then the original bloom edp, but still not worth being in my collection. I have to 100% love the fragrances i own or what’s the point if I’m not gonna wear it and just look at the pretty bottle!

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: My dad got this for me at the airport before flying to Paris with me when I was 15, so I'll always associate this scent with him and that trip, and it was my signature scent for a couple of years. Somehow warmer and more inviting than other fresh perfumes but still very fresh, floral, so so elegant. I don't think I'll ever get tired of it despite having worn it so much as a teen. Lasts a good 6 hours on me, but sillage is low.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I accidentally purchased the edt rather than the edp. I honestly mainly wear an edp because I prefer a more intense fragrance. However, I ended up being very happy with this regardless!! It’s super pretty ! I love a white floral but this has its own identity. It’s not overly unique but it’s one of those scents that would be great for a signature scent! It’s perfect for any occasion and I can’t see anyone not liking it! I find it great for spring and summer! For an edt, I find it to have great projection and longevity!

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
My accidental love
Gucci Bamboo is called my ‘accidental love’ in my collection. It was a leaving present gift from a colleague 8 years ago. She made me open and spray it in front of her and was hit with a very sharp and detergent like opening that my nose disliked and I had to hide it with a smile and a ‘mmm lovely!’. It sat unloved in a drawer for 4 years and then my colleague joined my new team and the guilt kicked in. I thought I’ll wear it on her first day and maybe use it up at work until it’s done so I don’t have guilt. And surprised myself that when the bottle was done I just had to get myself another bottle. Most of my perfumes are unlike the others. So this one is a keeper for me, it’s lovely on my skin. There’s the obvious fresh, citrus opening from the bergamot, mandarin and orange blossom with a slight juicy floral round sweetness of pear, lily and jasmine. A powdery, very slightly spicy, musky dry down with the sandalwood and a very slightly spicy tease of ambergris with a layer of comfort from the vanilla in the base. I love this on my skin, I get delight from an almost sweet, milky, creaminess that must come from the ylang ylang that gives this lovely, subtle hint of honey every now and then when I move. I see this perfume described as a simple, uninteresting scent, and I know I’ve obviously developed a strong emotional memory to it, but to me it’s a classy, fresh with hidden complex gems that I just love and will always enjoy wearing this.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Too synthetic...nothing fresh and a bit overwhelming.....gives me Yves Saint Laurent "rive gauche" vibes! I will keep as my favorite from Gucci " Guilty stud limited edition".

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This is a lovely fresh floral scent! I get a lot of citrus at the beginning and then it settles into a beautiful white floral bouquet. It's not overpowering, perfect for everyday wear.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: The first EDT I have bought in a very long time. In a collection of over 200+ bottles, some full and some travel, I have maybe three EDT's. This is a super clean, white scent. Floral and musk is what your getting it. A very clean, soapy scent. It smells nice but I never reach for it. Can be worn in any weather.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I love Gucci perfumes and Bamboo is my safe day to day choice. It is safe and still holds a character. I got many compliments when I wore it to the office or to night out friend meetings. A non-boring crowd pleaser. Changes after the first five minutes on my skin and loses the bergamot, remains a more flowery clean fragrance. I wear it every season in California, mostly as a day perfume. Though, I dont like the overnight smell on my cloths as much as I like some other clean perfumes. But still Bamboo is one of my favorites since it was released.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: The woody notes are quite dominating and overpowering. I'm confused how people describe this scent as clean. It is anything but. I don't like it at all

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I love this and reach for it often. I usually stay away from fragrances containing ylang-ylang because it tends to dominate and can be cloying, but in this it is subtle and enhances the fragrance rather than taking over. It’s very fresh and long lasting. I would wear it in all but the hottest weather (UK).

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I have already written a review on this beautiful elegant perfume, it is a soft beautiful clean floral perfume with a non artificial powderiness that comes from the floral notes that makes it so classy, soft and magical.

However, each time when reading reviews, I keep in mind one thing in particular: the year a perfume was made and when the reviews are posted.You see, it is a common practice of perfume houses to reformulate their perfumes and yet release them under the same name as if no changes were made.And it is never for the better, at least in my experience.

So, back in 2016 when this was made, In went to try on a few perfumes in a big cosmetic mega store here in Greece, and it was this one that captured my attention.It smelled amazing on me throughout its stages, and the middle part, as well as the amazing drydown it was what captivated me and made me buy it. However, I hadn’t noticed that there were two different bamboo perfumes, one edt and one edp, so I ended up buying a set of the edp perfume with its lotion, instead of the edt I had tried on. And it was actually the saleswoman fault that didn’t clarify which one she had given me to sample or that there were two.

So imagine my surprise when I got back home, and I excitedly tried it on again and was so…underwhelmed…What happened to the beautiful perfume I had tried on at the store?Why is this similar but different?Why had the amazing drydown never come?So, I looked it up back then on Fragrantica, and checked the notes that I had picked up on, and the reviews clarifying and realized the mistake… The next day I travelled the 1,5 hour car drive back to that store, explained what happened and got my beautiful edt perfume which was everything I had remembered it to be and more.

My bottle from back then was of course of that first year it was released (2016), given that I didn’t want to use it all up(it was a 30ml bottle), but also because in all these years I grew my perfume collection significantly (I don’t want to keep wearing the same perfume each time) ,I still have it in my collection, and it is as beautiful and amazing as back then , maybe even more so, as I have noticed quite a few times with quality perfumes sold by reputable perfume houses.

So now that it is spring here and my perfume cravings have grown,I revisited this little gem, my precious, and it feels like coming back home💕.So, I looked it up online and ordered another 30ml bottle of the edt as a backup, and given that it was difficult to find the edt available, probably this is being discontinued?-so I hoped with all my heart the one I would get now would be from an old batch, and not a recent reformulated version (the newest reviews on this here, made me certain this perfume has been reformulated).I even thought: wouldn’t it be great if I magically got the same exact batch code as my old one ?~mind you it’s 2023 , so we’re talking about a 7 year time difference pretty much…😆. So imagine my utter delight and surprise when I got my perfume delivered today and I checked right away the batch code on the bottom of the box,and compared it to the old one, and it was …THE SAME.😳

I am so happy,words can’t describe, that I stocked up a bottle of the original formula. If you can, when looking this perfume up, check the batch code and if you are lucky and find a 2016 one,get it. If not, since I don’t know exactly when the reformulation on this was done,probably don’t bother.

This one is a classy perfume ,soft but has a presence.It lingers, it has great sillage and lasts for quite a few hours (8 minimum). It is great in all weather conditions, it is all circumstances and hours appropriate, but where it shines even more, it is in drier weather (hot or cold), because it is then that it emits that magical natural floral powderiness.In more humid conditions it will bring out its more fresh floral aspect.

This one, is a perfume as perfumes are supposed to be made, elegance and magic in a bottle ❤️

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Smells like soap bubbles, white flowers. Its very clean. Could remind of a light mix of britney curious, D&G light blue and gucci guilty. Its a very unique smell

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: My youngest son bought this for me for Christmas with the hopes that I would enjoy it and I really do! It's fresh, clean, sophisticated and elegant. I feel very polished when wearing this. It's fruity, but definitely not overly sweet. It's a very classy professional woman with amazing hair and brand-new shoes! :)

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I’ve explained this to people the exact same way rebeccawilkins97 did. It really smells like the vague perfume smell I remember from samples in my mom’s magazines. Because of that, I guess it feels sort of nostalgic, and like it would be worn by the cool woman wearing business clothes and heels through NYC that I think of from those ads, not my favorite.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I like it and it reminds me of lacost touch of pink

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This fragrance heavily reminds me of the smell you get when looking through a catalogue. If you know the smell of an Argos catalogue, that's what this fragrance smells like to me. I hate using the term but this is a very "clean girl aesthetic" scent in my opinion. I wouldn't buy it again but It's okay enough to finish the bottle.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Well, I accidentally bought the EDT instead of the EDP. I have only tried the EDP once, but I definitely smelled that bit of soft creaminess and that it had a moderate lasting power. This EDT version is nice, clean and shampoo-like, but it's more crisp and lacking that bit of creaminess from the EDP. It's also very weak and doesn't last very long. I get about 2-3 hours and then it's gone. It's also IMPOSSIBLE to overspray! I'm gonna go through this 75 ml bottle in a record speed because I have to spray it all the time. I do kind of like this perfume, it's really easy and now offensive, great for work, summer days and other places where you would want to go easy on the perfume. I just think the price tag is a bit much for the actual performance on this perfume. Perhaps the EDP is a better choice than this one, I'm not sure. I will use this one up (won't take very long I imagine) at least, probably won't repurchase.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: The EDP is one of my all-time favorites, but I feel the EDT is a redundant release. For me it lacked all the good parts of the EDP (depth, creaminess and performance). I’ll stick with the EDP.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Oh no, they did the EDP wrong. All of the fresh creaminess is gone. You’re left with a watery citrusy, nondescript fragrance that smells substantially cheaper than its price. I really wanted to love it since the EDP is one of my favorite perfumes, skip this one and get the EDP.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: It is funny how we change over time. I find that I'm gravitating towards floral fragrances with hint of citrus notes especially for this summer. Gucci Bamboo EDT is a classy, modern white floral with a dash of citrus. I also get a bit of woodiness which smells like bamboo to me. I do enjoy it and find that it can be worn in most situations . I don't think its targeted towards very young people eg under 20s , you may need a little more maturity for this. However, I do not think this is vintage. I think its beautiful but it has average longevity. IMO, Its worth a sniff.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This is a clean, sharp fragrance which I bought for the warm months coming up however I don't like this fragrance. The woody/musky notes just don't agree with me after the original burst of bergamot. For me it just smells super cheap and not what I would expect from Gucci. For me this could easily be a cheaper brand/designer.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I love Gucci floral perfumes. They have a common Gucci element to them, a sort of DNA that I really love. I've got Bamboo EDP which is more quiet and sophisticated. The EDT is easier, it's a complete perfume, start to finish, nothing is lacking. A bright citrus opening, some pear makes a lovely way to the floral heart so there is no distortion just beautiful harmony. And all of this settled unnoticably into a wonderful base. Then you catch yourself asking: what smells so good? Bamboo EDT. Dont let the EDT sign trick you. It develops, performs and lasts.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I have Milton Lloyd's Tatti which is supposed to be a dupe for Bamboo. It has that 80's /90's unisex vibe - the bamboo has a zen like smoothness and the florals lift it a little higher into a more feminine leaning scent. Great sillage and longevity.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Perfect fragrance for those who want to smell clean and inoffensive. Not every fragrance has to be loud and announce you when you walk into the room, some fragrances just simply have to be just that, simple. And Bamboo EDT is a great example of that. There is a sour fruity note in the fragrance that actually works well in Bamboo, the fragrance is great as a signature scent, great for the office, great for everyday and great in workspaces where you can’t actually wear fragrance. If you wear fragrance simply because you love wearing fragrances and don’t care for compliments, Bamboo is great for you however, when you overspray, even though it is an EDT, it actually does last and projects very well, even better than the Eau are Parfum version! Very crowd pleasing and one to check out!

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Fell in love with it at once. It's an amazingly fresh, lily perfume. Floral in a sharp mature way. Classy. Would be using this for a long time to come. Wonder if the EDP is stronger. may help with longevity as i use the EDT.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This is a very light soft fragrance. Its like a lighter version of 212 by Carolina Herrera, you can definitely smell the similarity. At first spritz i get a lot of citrus then it dies down into a mild floral scent. It is a perfect fragrance for the office or for those who do not like overpowering smells. I might try the edp when i finish this bottle because this maybe is just too weak for me.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
A clean, citrusy white floral. Reminds me of 212 by Carolina Herrera. Doesn't smell exactly the same but it's in the same scent category in my opinion. My mom disagrees. She loves this Gucci Bamboo EDT but hates 212. I think this may be great as an office scent. I let my mom shop my perfume wardrobe to give me an idea for her Christmas present and she chose this. Since it was new to my collection and only sprayed to sniff I gave it to her. She adores it.

The opening of the this is very sharp. It kinda burns my nose and throat. The dry down is lovely though! Soft floral. It smells divine on my mom. I'm glad she has it.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
Oh my...where to begin...

First of all let me say that I like this scent on its own (you know what I mean later on). It is so interesting because it combines freshness with white florals, making it perfect for every weather condition (even really hot weather).

I love that its freshness doesn't come from green or woodsy notes,it doesn't come from aquatic notes either and it isn't over the top citrusy...it is as citrusy (nothing lemony) as it is needed to enhance and balance at the same time the white florals.

So,yes...I really like it on its own...however... I absolutely love it combined with Versace's Crystal noir body lotion... and that is probably because these two perfumes have similar notes and are 'cousins' let's say...

Crystal noir is headier and more night appropriate because it is a darker beauty on its own and also really shines through during wintertime (cold and dry weather).That is why when using its body lotion I used it on its own.Combined with the perfume it was just 'too much'...

However since Bamboo is a lighter fresher version of Crystal Noir,when I combined it with Crystal Noir body cream (which is also a beauty on its own) it was just...magical!It really enhances the perfume making it cosier and ethereal with better projection,like a comfy blanket,creating a small inoffensive,classy sophisticated cloud of beauty that is just...ugh!It doesn't make it heavier,it just makes it perfect balancing even more the citrusy notes and projecting the white flowers much better giving it an air of pure sophistication!Big Love!!! <3 <3 <3

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
This is better than the edp. This one is warmer, softer and the lily note is better done here. The citrus here isn't so strong like in the edp. The edp was very flowery, but the citrus was fighting with the lily for attention, and it ended up smelling like dirty water. On the edt, even though the lily is not so intense, it is definitely stronger than the citrus, what i really appreciate. It smells a bit soapy, a bit creamy and light sweet.
Think of a poor cousin of Baiser Volé.
If you did not liked the edp, you probably won't like this one, because the differences are really subtle.
If you're looking for a fresh perfume to wear at work,this could well be an option.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This is a beautiful floral with a hint of something a bit unusual, and much nicer than the EDP which verges on a slight urine smell. Longevity is about 4 hours which isn't great for the price but I'm still intending to buy it as I can't stop thinking about it since spraying in the shop.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
So beautiful!
I really don't get the reviews stating that it's weak/watery or bad longevity. Bamboo EDT is really beautiful floral with a nice fizzy citrus opening. Stayed 18h on my wrist, no joke. Reminds me of Vanitas by Versace byt less cloying (tiare usually doesn't do it for me)
I really recommend you to give it a fair chance, don't let negative reviews scare you off. Also, if the EDP is too thick/too much for you, try this one. A pleasant, clean, easy to wear, almost creamy floral with good sillage and longevity.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Very nice. No one should expect it to be anything but weak, alhough Gucci... Bamboo is fresh, has depth. Must be beautiful in spring and summer. This fragance is so easy to wear, I like it for the same reason I like Max Mara fragrances. Right now in the mood for some warm, cozy scent, but this is stil appealling.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This is a basic green neroli and citrus scent that fizzes for about five seconds and then evens out into that dry, nondescript, papery-woody "fresh" scent that Calvin Klein made very popular twenty years ago. Unlike anything from CK, Gucci's note clarity and longevity are very good, and the fragrance feels like a decent fruity-floral, with enough bitterness to be comfortably unisex, but I would implore anyone interested in Bamboo (parfum or EDT) to give Jacomo's Silences a try before dropping the bigger bucks here.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I noticed in the duty free shops while traveling this year that Gucci are really pushing Bamboo as their main women's frag, at least in the Nordic countries and NL.

The EdP blurb states "The fragrance apparently reflects confidence and femininity. It is designed for modern women of character that is multifaceted; the fragrance is intense, graceful and gentle at the same time". Well, I don't get how how it's confident or intense, it's very inoffensive. A wallflower type scent, really. A "don't mind me, I just work here" type of perfume. It reminds me a bit of Versace Vanitas, which is another citrusy, effervescent white floral, difference being that the Versace is a bit arrogant and I find that to be a nice thing.

EDIT: The drydown is somewhat enjoyable. Creamy jasmine comes through and really lifts it.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
Not impressive at all, just as I thought. Fresh, white flowers are on top of everything.
Slushy in my opinion. Not nice and deep, the EDP was better.
The EDP had the same slush, but it had some depth to it, this one doesn't have anything interesting at all.
Boring.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I am a fan of Gucci perfumes specially flora and guilty, but this one is so weak, no character at all ..

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Can't help, this smells like (not so nice) deoderant on me.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I tried this eau de toilette for the first time today and at first I got a waft of light floral, followed by a woody background which is not to overpowering and very pleasant.

However, sadly this does have a very good longevity and faded very quickly. I really wanted to like this fragrance, that being said, it is still a lovely perfume and will have a lot of followers.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Same cold, uninspiring scent as Calvin Klein Truth.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
At first it is very similar to EDP, just a bit lighter. However, after a while it starts to be weird. Very sultry, like all the freshness was gone. Moreover, nice blend of orange blossom and ylang-ylang that makes the heart of EDP, unfortunately is missing in this EDT. I mean it is just decent and nothing more.
All in all, huge disappointment.

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I think I spoke too soon about this EDT!I tried it this morning at Douglas and guess what it's waaaay better than the EDP !For a start it smells beautiful a bit citrussy and quite creamy sweet I was surprised at how much I liked it! This is what the EDP should have smelled like in my opinion, the EDT projects well and has great longevity.Gorgeous
EDIT a little overpriced for an EDT but since it's so nice I think it's well worth it
EDIT I never got the EDP but I got this, so beautifully done

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I see everyone else has the same question I do, LOL! An EDT for an already watered down EDP? Come on Gucci, this should have been Bamboo Intense or Bamboo Noir (although neither of those designations necessarily translates into improved longevity or sillage in the world of mass marketed fragrances these days).

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: why they make EDT for already very weak and poor EDP? it faded away in minutes from my wrist when i've just tried it :D

product_name: Gucci Bamboo Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Yes the EDP is already weak I can only imagine this will be even more watery

Delicious scent, plum, anise, lavender, lavender, leather... Hated for stupid reasons, this is a great fragrance! I enjoy wearing it in the spring, summe,r and fall. Even in winter the nutmeg cuts through the cold!

I have a ten years old batch if this frag and I don't remember its initial performance quite well, but it now stays on me for the entire day and smells heavenly and elegant. I wore it often with my ex gf, which is the reason I wouldn't be using it with my wife, as I feel it a kind of cheating, but sometimes I catch myself sniffing at the cap for no reason. Can't sell it, but can't wear it in the same time, as it draws painful recollections. 3.5 is absolutely embarrassing for the quality of the perfume.
Stole this out of an Ulta dumpster. It smells so good, 10000x better than Gucci Guilty. Performance is pretty weak, but its a shame that this was discontinued
please message me if you have one for sale @spantagaming@gmail.com

This is a very spicy aromatic leather fragrance…
Not for the faint hearted!!

I liked it because of the bottle design I thought it was a flanker of ‘Gucci by Gucci’ which is excellent.
It absolutely has nothing to do with GBG.

This is some weird funky scented juice and I’ve never gotten any compliments wearing it…
However, at least I can check (✅) off owning a beautiful lilac coloured fragrance but I don’t smell with my eyes!!

This makes my list of Top 5 worst designer fragrances.

this has crazy performance for me, considering my mom had it for more than 10 years and the juice is still at like 70%. its now yellow instead of the purple ish colour. i get like 14+ hours and projects like crazy.

Great all around year fragrance. Works almost anywhere. I don't see how people can dislike this fragrance. It's not strong, doesn't have a very niche scent.
Sad that it's discontinued.
anyone know niche parfum smell like this? this was one of my favourite fragrance.
I have this fragrance if anyone is interested in buying it since it's discontinued. ncruze@yahoo.com
Really sad that this fragrance has been discontinued :(...☹️
Awesome plum and berry anise scent . How does it get all the hate? I got compliments all the time from teenagers, mature and elderly. One of my best designers I have. I stocked up on this one.
P.S. Perfumer: Jacques Huclier

This falls strongly in my dislike category. I place it right alongside the Axe products high school boys wore in the 90s and aughts...firmly in the 'don't come near me until you wash that off' category. Made to Measure just never measured up for me, despite trying it out on men and women as an experiment when a prior partner was suprised by my level of distaste for this fragrance. I don't have any issue with the longevity or sillage, it is easily identified at arm's length and lasts a full day. I would categorize it as a clean aromatic scent, that is very sharp to my nose. The lavender, bergamot, and amber come across as synthetic and harsh - they are all overpoweringly forward and never really let go to allow appreciation of the other listed notes.
I am looking to sell a sealed Gucci Made to Measure set (EDT 90ml + after shave balm 75ml + shower gel 50ml) Email: jordantzouvelis13@gmail.com

Disappointing for saying it’s very expensive! Has a similar smell to Gucci guilty eau de toilette but with a strong lavender note and doesn’t last long at all! It also has an unpleasant note which I cannot make out so in my opinion do not buy as its so expensive and doesn’t have much good about it.

This was my very first fragrance purchase about 5 years ago. At the time I thought it was incredible, but my nose has definitely moved to more interesting smells since then. Doesn't last super long from my experience. It's a good, basic fragrance but nothing special really!
Smells great. Completely gone in 2 hours.

I am same as MKZ, I love this fragrance so much I use it all the time. Even having a collection of 400 bottles + I use this Gucci often more than some big box names. So yea, if it's too weak or nothing original hmmm to bad for you I guess open you eyes, and smell the world around you, who knows you may discover amazing things.

P.S. If you don't know fresh fragrances don't last long then you are in for a shock. It's just not possible to make, ok? You can pay 10 times more for Creed freshies and it will still last couple of hours. It is the way it is, get a $1 sample bottle and take a refill with you, apply and reapply. If you want one spray 10 hour bomb get Layton or Oud for Greatness again not freshies :) all the best to you all people.

I've had this perfume for a couple of weeks now and I am disappointed every time I use it, don't know if It's me but it did smell so much better in the boutique that I got it from.
But today I decided that this isn't for me and will be giving it away to my nephew that's in high school cause they're not allowed to have strong scented perfumes in school.
Very very how do I say it kind of regular smell basic but not super basic. Does the job not offensive not loud but not soft at all since I’m a heavy sprayer lovely bottle too.

I'm convinced half of these people have actually never smelt this before, I ran through a whole bottle of this and I enjoyed it thoroughly there's nothing to dislike it's highly safe and inoffensive smells good, just below average performance that's literally it, in a nutshell
Wow was pleasantly surprised by the gorgeous lingering scent the combination of notes are a stroke of genius fantastic performance and quality

My wedding perfume. Blind brought about 2 months before the day and didn’t smell it at all until a couple of hours before seeing my wife to be. All I can say is it added extra perfection to the day. It’s fresh, floral and light. Deserves a lot more respect. I’m glad it’s not so popular though all the more for me

This is a very nice bright, somewhat zesty fruity smell. It's linear and stays pretty much the same from the moment you spray it on and when it disappears into the ether (approximately 2 hours lol). If you like this, be prepared to overspray and bring some to reapply.

My dear mother bought this for me when I was in my mid 20s and I wore it to my brother's wedding, so it does have some personal sentimentality for me.

Amazing smell, terrible performance.

Been wearing this one since its launch in 2013. I've received many compliments while wearing this cologne, both from women and men. The lavender and leather are quite prominent, in my opinion, and combine for an appealing, subtle scent. The problem is this cologne is TOO subtle. Combine the subtly with the mixture having terrible performance (between 1 and 2 hours at its absolute best), and you get Made to Measure.

I would personally avoid buying this unless you're totally drawn to the smell, plan on wearing it to bed or other short occasions, or if you're fine with reapplying it multiple times a day. Personally, I've been so drawn to the smell that this fragrance has stayed in my collection. Can't stress enough how bad its performance is though, and I'd recommend avoiding it solely based on that.
Horrible Fragrance, only last about an hour then turns into a skin scent. Don't Buy !!!!!!

Not at all a bad fragrance by any means but the thing is this one kind of lacks oomph in its charcter.
The plum and lavendar give a shampoo kind of vibe.
I have tried overspraying but no, i am the only one who smell this.
It would have been better if they added a bit of cashmeran or iso e super to make things interesting.
Bottle is beautiful.

I blind bought this because it was at a good price. I thought it smelled really nice, but it was probably top 3 worst performing fragrances I've ever owned, so I sold it. It struggled to last two hours on me.

I don't really get the dislikes on this one. It's very inoffensive, easy to wear, crowd pleaser. Well, it would be, if it projected better. That is my one issue with Made to Measure, as a scent, it doesn't really get past an arm's length. But because of that, I think it makes for quite a nice office scent. However, the price is a little too high for what a generic scent that doesn't project too well. I think there are much better office scents, at a lot lower prices. So for that reason, it's a 4/10 from me, unfortunately.

Now for a totally positive review!!!! Gucci Made to Measure was purchased by me in a fully packaged mini format. I kept returning to it, and just bought a full-sized bottle.
Let's start with the outside: The packaging is so elegant. The bottle is HEAVY glass with thick seams. I like glass. I am an Anchor-Hocking groupie, vintage hobnail goblets. I believe glass is very practical. This bottle is weighted in quality. This heft feels so good in the hands, it almost is soothing. The top is described in the literature as hand finished. It is a beautiful satin-finish brushed pale, pale gold. It is some kind of metal. Lid has very broad shoulders and rests with great solidity on the bottle. The classic ring or stirrup allows you to pull the top off with a nice crisp click from the lid. ( Not magnetic, just a nice fit--they got it completely right. ) What a great ritual it is to reach for Gucci Made to Measure Pour Homme.
The juice itself is clear with a very unusual hint of gray. Is it the glass of the bottle? The atomizer is A+ very much like those on my beloved Dunhill.
The scent: Fastest open I have seen. You pick up the Lavender and maybe the Anise. I think the Lavender is just wonderful. Some orange in the drifting scent. It quickly moves into what seems like the Juniper Berries. I love Juniper Berries and it is a listed note. I think Juniper Berries is often mishandled, but not here.
As for Plum it seems like it is easily overwhelmed, like my experience with Pear. Anyway, I do not really detect the Plum. In the final dry-down with my nose right up close it is strange. Is it Water Lily? Some kind of melon scent. Not a scent, a suggestion more like.
Aside:This is the kind of magic I love about fragrance. Roja, Ohrmonde Jane are just a few that do 'suggestion fragrance'. I don't mind a good knock on the head from Juicy Couture Dirty English. (Very interesting note profile.) So you don't have to walk softly around me at all times. That is why building a broad assortment of fragrance is so much fun.
Great credit to Gucci in its blending of Leather, Patchouli, Amber. It is really neat. . .it is giving the scent what I call a 'fullness' and kind solid base of not-so-sweet. Really you just feel it all--not in isolation of scent.
This scent moves very quickly to a close, intimate scent. Conceived in 2013, I think it is a new direction here in 2021; well-conceived, strategic; a going for lots- of-love blend.
Aside: I think that some of these new houses are going to 'niche' themselves into total obscurity. Gucci is designer, but who cares? We are talking about an illustrious house. They know how to do it. I am a total Gucci fan boy, yet I don't recklessly buy all of them. Money, you know.
This is a 'just for you' kind of scent--like the name--'Made to Measure' One of my all time favorites. Wear it for yourself, and those close to you--literally-- will more than likely love its fresh, sophisticated and delicate scent.
In closing, it felt good to not write a gripey review as it is fun to be positive. Well, heck, they got it superbly right.. so.

my 2 cents:
decent smell,
that won't proyect pass your arm lenth
longevity is about 2 hours
price is way too expensive,
gifted by an ex but only used 1/4 of it and left it to collect dust...
somewhat masculine some lavender and faint leather but very very mild notes
not offensive scent
10 plus sprays to notice it
4/10 overall for me.
Ill pass

Gucci Made to Measure for men is a very sporty scent but, I smell👃the plum fruit more than I smell the bergamot, and lavender. It is very overpriced for what you get. I think I paid $70 for my small (1.6 oz/50 ml. bottle) when it first came out. You're paying or the brand name really, and I very rarely wear it. It can be worn to work or out for dinner. It last on my skin for about 6 hours. I give it a 6 out of 10.🤷♂️
This is a very nice scent but that’s the only positive. Performance isn’t great and is fairly overpriced.

Why so many dislikes on this fragrance...?
it’s a really beautiful light scent certainly something I love reaching for on my dresser in my collection.
Surprisingly my more recent bottle ‘2020 batch’ seems stronger than I’ve previously had in the past.


This is a very romantic scent x.
Smells alot like Gucci Guilty Parfum so think this one might be on it way out
Great fragrance. Seems like people is disliking it for not being loud and eccentric.
علی رغم فیدبک های منفی، من خیلی دوستش دارم. مخصوصا بوی آلویی که در خودش نهفته داره و حالتی راز آلود که به طور کلی القا می کنه به آدم. خیلی هم به سختی توی ایران گیرش آورم

I think it's great!
In fact, it's one of my favorites from this house.
One important thing: You need to try this on skin.
When I first tried it on paper, it didn't really impress me. I could barely smell it, the entire thing reminded me of paper/papyrus and it was rather boring, light and I couldn't imagine it to last very long. So, at an airport I decided to spray myself with it and proceed with the day. It evolves great - so good that it's now on top of my wishlist.
It's a little sweet but not cloying or heavy at all. It's still somewhat light, has that generic vibe to it but it smells really refined and well blended at the same time! I tried it in many different conditions and they all worked great. Australian Summer? No problem. Winter in New Zealand? Still works well. My girlfriend could notice it on me after an 8 hour flight, so I think that's pretty good! Of course I wasn't walking around a lot in the plane but it's still impressive for such a light scent.
Prices are cheap for this one and I don't see it very often, so I'm afraid it might get discontinued sometime soon.. time to get a bottle of this!
I was shocked to see so many negative reviews because honestly.. it's not that bad!

This initially smells like Hugo Boss Hugo Man but less synthetic. My first impression is that this is a fragrance that is hard to dislike, which is confusing when I read the negative reviews.

Personally I find this fragrance easy to wear, yes it's somewhat generic but I personally can't dislike the fragrance based on the fact it reminds me of other fragrances out there. However I'm pretty sure this does not smell like any fragrances in my collection so it's a welcome addition.

It's light and sweet on the opening, there is definitely a fruity/floral note which brings some freshness to the scent. It does evolve to a slightly warmer scent as time goes by which for me makes this scent more suitable for warm/cool days (Spring/Fall). It might be too much for very hot days, however you could wear this during summer nights.

I've had more positive impressions from women than men, which makes me think that the fragrance is designed to appeal to the opposite sex.

It's not a performance monster and does not shout, but it's an amazing safe clean scent to wear on most occasions.

Overall I rate this one a 7/10, definitely worth a try and by no means a bad fragrance as others are pointing it out to be.

Its awesome for a designer for me. This scent is heavily reviewed for being generic and bland.. The plum and berry note is so good. But man once I start wearing, because there was something in the opening that caught me. It grew on me. Then I started getting compliments from women, young, middle age and elderly that confirmed that this was a well done generic cologne. I figure if a 60 year old woman compliments me in Saks 5 Avenue its a buyer. I buy niche and designer(very picky on these). This smells damn good. Its a scent that will please every crowd, if you don't know what to wear on that whatever occasion.
Huge disappointment from Gucci. I couldn't smell any plum or lavander

When I first smelled it right away I said this is for warm weather. I wore it during the summer and I didn't like it at all. The performance was so weak. Then just because I wanted it to be finished so i could get raid of it , I started to wear it also in the cold weather. To my surprise I really loved it in the cold weather.

What a great fragrance this is! Gucci has never disappointed me! It's more of a late night summer and autumn kind of fragrance. Great for formal evenings and nights. It's definitely on a sweet almost gourmand side. You can detect almost any note of it if you will be patient. But the main notes anyone can feel are flowers with some fruit nuances and spices with a dab of a leather.
It's a great addition to a Gucci Premier line for women.
You will certainly feel some class and sophistication while wearing this fragrance. It's not generic or synthetic in any way! All ingredients are of a very good quality.
And one more thing, it has some Los Angeles (Hollywood) vibes to it, if you know what I mean. :)
Longevity is about 8 hours plus. Projection is heavy in first 2-4 hours, then it becomes moderate.
I highly recommend this fragrance for those who love the quality and sophistication!
P.S. Thumbs up for Nicolas Winding Refn, James Franco and the whole advertising campaign!

This is a very lovely fragrance. Beautiful smell. It's very strong and extremely sweet. I wish it was less sweet. The spice notes come through fine; it smells quite powdery. I like it. It's not for every setting though; it can be cloying in the summer especially if you overspray. 8/10

I was gifted this perfume in High School. Soft, very subdued. A generic aromatic on the masculine side, wholly inoffensive and safe for most occasions/seasons. I've worn this to funerals. This lasts 4+ hours on my skin and clothing. I don't dislike it, but I don't love it.

On a bizarre note, I once dreamed, very vividly, that I heard soft sobbing coming from my closet. Upon inspection, I found my poor little Made to Measure bottle weeping quietly in it's packaging. I feel this dream describes this fragrances character in an abstract way.

Today I took a sniff of Gucci MTM for memory's sake (it was connected to someone I used to love passionately). It still smelt so nice just how I remembered it. While the projection is weak, MTM is wonderful as a skin scent.
This is one of my faves from Gucci. Very safe versatile fragrance. This can be worn any time of year or any time of day. Signature scent worthy

I dont understand what everyone's issue with this frag is. I ordered a bunch of vials, M2M and 212 beinf two of them, and I preferred M2M over 212. Don't get me wrong, I loved 212 as well, but this has a bit more of a fruity smell, which I seem to like. Again, I only had vials of each, so it was hard to wear any of them, and they were just 1mL. I just bought a bottle of M2M and I still think it is great. In my opinion, it is comparable to 212 conceptually. It's aromatic and sophisticated, with a fruity top. Luna Rossa Sport was similar, having more of a fruity top.

I smell more juniper berry than plum, which is a bit upsetting. After a few minutes it becomes more woodsy, and the cinnamon peaks out just a tad.

I will update after I have been able to marinate in it for a few days, if I feel any different.

As of now though, I think it's great. A pretty safe blind buy. Just do not think it deserves so much hate

I have all the accessories from this cologne, and besides the negative reviews, it will remain in my top shelves, and I will keep the frame I did with "James Franco" being the face of this cologne hanging from one of the wallS in my bedroom.
This is a very subtle fragrance but very enjoyable for me, I love the shaving gel, it gives a very pleasant shaving experience and leaves the skin vey smooth and with the nice essence from the cologne.
Well, haters will be haters, but we lovers don't care.

This fragrance does not deserve all of the negativity. It may not be the strongest scent. But the smell is very pleasant and intriguing. I bought it in spite of the negative comments because I thought the scent notes sounded interesting. I was not disappointed. The scent is not very strong, and doesn't project very far. But the subtle wafts of the scent while wearing it are very pleasing. I enjoy the fact that I cannot smell it so intensely because this means that I enjoy the scent longer instead of going scent blind shortly after applying it.

This cologne was given to me by an ex so it's obvious she liked it and wanted me to smell like this. I personally liked it, it's more of a day time formal scent, not an aquatic but it's still fresh. It's a safe scent but I did receive compliments on it. Nothing exciting but it does not deserve all the hate. This is a refined and more polished Gucci guilty. A good office or summer Sunday church scent.

Scent: lavender and plum are the most distinguished notes during the opening along with citrus. A hint of cinnamon keeps it from being too youthful. A masculine floral scent.

Performance: I get about 3 or so hours of decent performance for a designer scent before it becomes a true skin scent. Not bad but not great either.

Season: a spring-fall scent. Can be used in the summer also.

3/5
