I smell no lavender, just a dull spice which I think is ginger. On my skin it's just a spicy drugstore aftershave. This one is a scrubber for me.
Calling this "made to measure" is like claiming that H&M makes made to measure suits

I got a good price on this fragrance so i figured i would give it a try, it can't be that bad, but when i got it and opened it up and sprayed it on i was so disappointed, not even worth the great deal i got, i will never where this.

Made to measure... this is actually quite good, hear me out.
You will always have 2 types of reviewers; the extreme frag heads who will knock a scent because the transition to the base notes wasn't smooth enough or the bergamot is over used... you know the type. And then you have the frag head who appreciates a good scent, especially when ladies respond to it.
I am the latter, I have a decent collection of Frags, shave soaps, aftershaves, you name it.

So Gucci MtM... I first got this as a sample from Sephora before heading off to Austria for my honeymoon. My initial impressionot was that it smelled like a mature man's Gucci Guilty, but more refined and more "expensive." Immediately my wife loved the scent, so that's a win. Walking around Vienna, talking to people, this thing will get compliments.

I do have memories attached to this Frag, so I of course like it a bit more, but ladies love this scent... and in the end that's the point!

I love the design of the bottle and the box. I think it is love at fist sight. I love the dry down which is unique for me, gives me freshness. The weakness maybe the performance which lasts only 1-2 hours.
very generic. it smells like shampoo. after an hour it was gone

Got a free sample from Sephora as well.
Nice yet a little too generic for me. Fresh...clean.... below average longevity.
Would be a good gift for a casual person that likes fragrances but does not discriminate.
This scent is not as good as I expect. But any way it's still a good scent. Maybe alot of people dislike it is about sillage and longevity. For this price I think it could be better.

I can never give Gucci MTM a fair and objective review, as it has linked to some intimate memories. I remember enjoying it on my crush neck/shoulder when we sat quietly in a coffee shop, and, then, when I hugged him from behind. At that moment, MTM became the best fragrance ever in existence for me.

With all that distant memories removed, as well as the fact that my nose has got to know so many fragrances ever since, I came back to MTM to give it some less biased judgement. This is definitely a very pleasant scent, yet nothing special about it. The notes are too blended, and none can be discernibly appreciated.

I guess it'd better stay as a memory.

EDIT: So anyway, coming back to this scent after a couple of year, and with all the memories removed, I can say that I can enjoy this scent a lot more than when I made this comment. It has this subtle appeal that makes you want to reach closer to the person wearing this and just take a sniff. Very positive.
Loved this in the store, so Sephora gave me a sample to try. Smelled a bit too feminine for me.

Despite the aggressively negative reviews, I decided to try it on today and it was a pleasant surprise. It is safe and sweet fragrance, with unusual plum note, which makes it different from other perfumes in this category. The sent lasted for about 7h on my (oily) skin, but did not project so good, even after an hour, it was sitting close to skin, so Id say the projection is not its strong suit, and that is okay. Perfumes like this one are not to be smelled by everyone, I find it very unagressive and tamed in its poshness and elegant in its character. Would not be my first choice, wouldnt mind smelling it on someone else.

This scent seems to get a lot of hate, I think it smells really nice, its perfect for a job interview or a nice night date or going somewhere that you plan on being in close quarters with people. It doesn't really project but the smell is nice. I only bought this bottle because my GF really enjoyed the scent, and at the end of the day what she likes is what I like because I am only trying to impress her. Its a pretty scent, it can be worn with work clothes, a nice suit, I don't think it fits a casual setting as it feels a bit to intimate for that but its a good cheap cologne. Nothing that will do amazing for you but it wont let you down, try a sample first would be my suggestion, its for some, not for all and I think people forget that sometimes.

Overall - 7.5 out of 10

Scent - 9 out of 10
Projection - 6 out of 10
Sillage - 7 out of 10
Longevity - 8 out of 10

This fragrance has a rather spicy output, but also is notorious lavender, quite used lately in many of the Gucci men's fragrances. What I like about this fragrance is drying her rather masculine, I think what stands out is amber notes.
It has very low projection, if you will have to notice her overcoat and longevity is also very weak, it shows skin flush. It reminds me of some other fragrance I've already smelled, but I do not remember. If the fragrance had the best longevity could appreciate more. Very nice bottle and very good publicity with the charismatic James Franco

Let me say that this is a normal fragrance its not groundbreaking but its comfy just to wear when you go to college or the office the smell its sweet but light if you are looking for something turn down sweet of One Million or Eros, its the only one of Gucci that I really like I just discovered that the plum also is one of my favorite notes and I can feel it well blended with the Ambar note, I was waiting to buy when the price down, and yes after 3 years I just get a 5 oz bottle for $950 mx pesos with taxes (like $50 usd) I'm glad I get the bigger bottle because it will be my summer scent to work, I use Angel edt in spring but right now with the heat I get a super scent of chocolate and it gets so suffocating; I was looking for something with good smell nice clean and with a vibe of classy but not to use the same as almost everyone in the city (Boss Bottle, Acqua di Gio, D&G) my other option was Savage by Dior, but I think Ill buy it later when I can get a better price.

The Longevity that I get is 8 hours the first 3 with a great (normal) projection and then it goes to the skin, like a bodycream with good projection.

What really surprise me is that I get compliments from ladies and girls who ask what I'm wearing i tought it gets so mainstream that it doesn't stand out but I was wrong with that I think its good for a Dinner or Dates for reasons more personals but Ill use it like a casual scent, go to mall or the supermarket with sunglasses in this summer.
I give it a 7 and Ill enjoy my purchase.

Gucci Made To Measure is a nice light but weak summer mens fragrance. Fresh, versatile, absolutely for hot weather, a decent scent for man and a safe choise.

The longevity is about 5-6 hours and the sillage is moderate with 5-6 sprays. After 2 hours though, it stays close to the skin.
The most distinguished notes I get are bergamont, plum, juniper berries, but I do not get so strong lavender, it is very-very weak as the rest of the notes listed above.

I like it, nothing unique but very versatile for any case in hot weather. The design of the bottle is magnificent!
I do not get the negative reviews or the nostalgy for other different Gucci scents. We are here to talk about only for "Made To Measure". And it is quite a decent summer scent!

Not sure why there are so many negative reviews for this?

Made to measure is one of my favourites.

In my opinion it's directed more for under 25s, like myself.

This was one of the first fragrances I purchased and I have so many memories and compliments from it which might be why I'm so attached to it.

If you like it, don't let these people put you off it. It's supposed to compliment you, not anyone else.

You know, I actually like this one for what it is. A Swiss Army knife fragrance that can be worn anywhere at anytime. Looks like it would bear resemblance to Gucci by Gucci but in bottle only, it actually falls more in step with the guilty line, and I am guilty of loving guilty intense and guilty black. Not creamsicle sweet like intense nor green and aromatic like black, it falls comfortably in the middle while borrowing notes from the aforementioned guilty fragrances.
Citrus, but not overly so. Sweet but not overly so, spicy, touch of leather but not overly so. You get the point. It is well rounded and can in fact be made to measure your season, wardrobe, and not be out of step, very well blended.
To me very similar to ysl l homme in the sense that when you're unsure of what to wear, you can grab it wear it and be just fine. No they do not smell similar but the two are unbelievably versatile. I will always own this,especially when it can be had under $35 at fragrance.net. Have the proper expectations and you may really enjoy this. I absolutely love to wear this in warmer months, as it has more to offer than just citrus and ozone, calone notes with white musk. Another guilty pleasure of mine.
This perfume is like a person who talks but says nothing. It's a smell without real fragrance. Completely hollow.

liked the lightness at first but sillage and longevity are indeed really poor :(
would accept it happily as a gift though :D
GUCCI: should change the name "made to suck" lol.

I don't know how and why I bought this fragrance.
Very poor performance.
5% plum. 95% Generic. Worth a wear if you stumble across a free sample and find yourself bored.

At the top, I get mostly lavender, plums, and leather. It starts off as a very generic masculine smell. I would probably like it if it smelled like this the entire time and it had more reaching power. However, when this cologne dries down on me, it smells like I spilled orange juice on myself. I like the opening smell but the dry down is pretty horrible. Luckily, it doesn't last very long and no one will really be able to smell it on you. I am glad I only bought a small sample/ travel bottle for $20.00.

I have a slightly better opinion on this scent than most it would seem. Probably due to the fact that I got a 90ml for about 1/4 the retail price and had read a ton of negative reviews before ever trying it. So my expectations were understandably low to begin with.

I get a little of the sweet that everyone speaks of in this scent. But mostly I get this kind of a bitter/floral thing going on....very reminiscent of the same DNA in the Guilty line.
Very linear and one dimensional to my nose, but still pleasant enough and something that I could see being a crowd pleaser.

Longevity is very good on my skin, however the same cannot be said for projection. This scent is a sort of a "jack of all trades", but master of none. Yes, it's somewhat "generic cologne smell" and doesn't really do anything to set itself apart as a unique composition.
But with that, also comes the ability to just grab and spray when you need a fragrance that will work in ANY situation and not offend/overpower those around you. So, that's something that my wardrobe could use, even if this juice doesn't really do much for me on a personal level.

Smells good, people around me like it, lasts long, cheap price....and that's enough for me to give this one a pass.
Smells good, but it has very weak longevity and weak sillage. I finished my 100ml bottle in less than 2 months because I had to spray it 3-4 times a day. Not for me
Beautiful botlle,average uninteresting scent,bad longevity..not worth the money..
Very nice fragrance.Reminds me a bit of Ralph Lauren Safari.

Very elegant fagrance. Perfectly fits on a random date or a special occasion. The scent is very sweet and aromatic. Longevity on myself is very good

Plum pudding mixed with rancid soap to add some flavor.

First and Foremost Gucci Made To Measure's bottle is top notch, it was what initially drew me in to test this fragrance out.
The First blast of MTM was somewhat astringent and assaulting to my nose, but within a minute I got this vaguely familiar strangely deja Vu feeling, I left it on my arm and went to test other fumes to see what will become my next purchase.
As I walk passed the Diesel aisle it hits me, I grab Only The Brave and spray it on me, and lo and behold there I have the same scent on different wrists, and coming from 2 different bottles. I was a fan of Only The Brave a while ago I've been through 2 bottles before I got tired of it and moved on, so Gucci MTM was this blast from the not so distant past, but dressed up in a fancier, more elegant bottle, but that's as far as it goes. MTM does have a slightly more sophisticated quality to it, almost like only the brave slipped into a suit for a black tie event, and toned himself way way down to blend in. Made to Measure is not really a bad scent, but its been done before so it can easily be called Generic and Unoriginal. Its Longevity is around 6 hours and projection is very close to skin. (I asked for a few testers of MTM, along with my purchase of A*Men to warm me up this winter, which now takes me to going through 6 bottles of A*Men), if further testing prove this can be a purchase then I just may consider getting Gucci Made To Measure, but for now I'll give Gucci MTM a 6.5 out of 10.

very lightweight, in other words, I can smell it a bit right off, then it is mostly noticable for me only up close, and after an hour or two, not really much at all at that. It might be that I wore it in the summer in the day and it just evaporated real fast. Maybe this needs cooler weather.
It basically gives a quick blast of almost fruity citrus right off, and then turns into a light, warm thin brown leather after a minute or so, similar to the smell of the inside of a brand new pair of shoes.
I thought it was fairly decent, but it is very generic and there are probably hundreds of scents just like this.
I got a free sample of it at Macy's or Bon.Bon.

The negative reviews I'm reading here is needlessly overwhelming. Humans are quick to engage in destructive criticism. But if I want anyone here to churn out his/her version of "Made to Measure", it'd be a cesspit nonsensical products! I'm gonna be buying this anyway.

Two of the scents I recently dismissed are the two I´m wearing the most. This Gucci "Made to Measure" (I never really cared for this somewhat silly name) I first found kinda meh. A better one than the original meh Gucci. Maybe I´m not being so fair; they are both good scents, but in the meh way (here I went again). Anyway, I read on a magazine some person saying this Gucci was his day by day scent and Bvlgary Man Black the night one. Then I gave it another try and now I found myself apreciating wearing it during the day. What otherwise would be simply an example of lack of personality now became a sincerily linking. It's an ok scent that I can wear without preocupation of being noted but sure that smells good and composed, and this is working better than others when I go work. After lunch I can easily reaply. Ah, the other scent is Azzaro Club Men, a simply nice touch by Azzaro. Surprisingly Polo Red Intense is working well as sweet option.

I've had several compliments from both guys and girls at work. A sure fire welcome addition to my slowly but surely expanding collection.

never gonna buy this again.

I know there are a lot of haters of this cologne, but i am i guess one of the few who actually adore it-not even finished my first bottle and ordered 2 more. The scent is wonderful get lots of compliments on it and by far one of my favs

Ok...I went and got a sample from Sephora because I have been interested in the scent for over a year now. My final verdict: this is an awesome fragrance (for me at least).

Its not necessarily unique, but I can't think of a single thing that smells just like it and in this day and age, that's pretty successful. I realized the trick is to spray it close to the skin so that its less dispersed, and more potent at the point of attack (around my neck).

It has been 6hrs and I can easily smell it without looking for it. It's very smooth and easy on the nose, and it's definitely nice enough to be worn in formal occasions. I would even say "signature". I can not speak for the sillage, but I'm assuming it isn't that strong (though within the first 2hr, my significant other could smell it from an arms length away). This one is made to fit like a tailored suit supposedly - for close quarters.

In summation, I really like it though I acknowledge that it isn't groundbreaking. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a pleasant, fruity oriental that is masculine and modern. Its versatile while not being too casual.

Gucci, oh Gucci! How can such a celebrated fashion house stoop this low with Made to Measure? A friend of mine gave me this as a New Year's gift, but I am afraid this may not be a good omen! If this year turns out to be as boring as this Fragrance, I will commit suicide.
I have even come to cinsider displaying this bottle in my sitting room as a piece of art, but I am not sure it will enhance my interior design either. It looks so "nouveau riche"! One thing is for sure: Made To Measure doesn't enhance my perfume collection.

I'm definitely picking up a high amount of negativity about this, and I don't really know why. I get that it's not amazing, but it's not like it's bad. I get the feeling that most negative reviews are because it's just too "blah", which I guess is why I bought it. I wanted something light, not too in your face, and decided this was a good choice for that. I'm, sadly, in an environment where fragrances, of any kind except a $3 aerosol can, aren't the norm, so I didn't want to overdo it. I see this as a really good fit for this situation. It smells good,and isn't too off the wall or in your face. Really good for everyday 9-5 situations.

This perfume is really surprising! To my nose it is extremely well balanced: the right combination of citrus opening, sweet flowery heart (nevertheless decisively masculine) and amber-leather base notes. I decided to try it on at the store because from the card tester I couldn't recognize any distinctive note. I sprayed it on my neck and on one wrist and I could not refrain from bringing my arm to my nose to go for the next fix. I don't understand how one may call it anything other that classy and sophisticated. Walking in the bubble of Gucci MTM made me feel like I was finally wearing something that suited me perfectly, I didn't have any of those "maybe it's a little too much" uncomfortable thoughts. As the evening progressed I received a few compliments from different girls and one insistently kept reaching for my neck saying the scent was just "mmmmmmmmmm!". It doesn't project much, which is something I actually look for in a fragrance. It lasts approximately 6 hours after which only the amber will remain on your skin, making you smell like the neck of a very beautiful, confident, blonde and sexually voracious high school classmate of mine called Maya. ---9/10---
one of the bests male scents i've ever felt!

Gucci Made To Measure is sophisticated and elegant. I love the citrus notes and I can smell the anise, plumb and patchouli in the dry down. This fragrance can be worn either in the day or night. It's great for the hot summer months. It lasts a good 6-7 hours on me.
I love it despite the negative comments on here regarding this perfume. Stays very long on my skin. Get plenty of compliments with just two sprays.
It smells exactly like Black by Keneth Cole, at least in the opening. Gucci knows better than this.

At first I thought it would be some sort of peppery/woody "synthetic" nightmare scent, but it soon settled down into something decent. However, I found myself thinking things like, "this seems like Michael for Men [Kors] but with some missing notes." Unfortunately, I like those missing notes! It's certainly not bad if you aren't going to pay much attention to the scent you are wearing on a given day, but I generally like to wear scents of a different type (than ones I tend to wear frequently, such as "fresh"/sport) or "cheapos." I won't totally dismiss this one yet, though, because it may be good if my sensitivity becomes high again and I can't deal with stronger/bolder scents. On the other hand, my guess is that for the designers, this soon will be considered bold and provocative!

Another wearing: it seems to be a bit too tame for me, so I think I should just move it out rather than expect it to become part of the rotation at some point.

Made a 360 on this one.

At first try I liked it: generic but well executed.
After having bought a small bottle, the weird and sharp top notes irritated me.
Yesterday I tried it again and although still weird, I like it right now.

The "weird" topnotes are also present in the new Gucci Pour Homme (same bottle, different colour). They are a bit synthetic and remind me of really cheap fake perfume you find on markets. However, once gotten used to it, it has something.
Compared to Gucci Pour Homme, Gucci Made to Measure is a fresher and lighter alternative. Not too sweet, which I like, but still fruity. Ideal for at the gym.

7,5/10

It's not a bad fragrance by any means, but like many others before me said, it doesn't break new ground either. It's a fresh scent that's good for casual use, and certainly won't offend anyone within its proximity. It's not particularly powerful and does seem to settle fairly quickly, so it does require occasional reapplying.

I am quite suprised at how many haters there are. I can only imagine that there are a lot of people who are looking for a scent that is EASY to like or something that is trending. I think people are automatically taking the easy route by hating it instead of trying to contemplate a deeper understanding of the scent itself.

For example: Gucci Made To Measure has introduced Water Lilly as one of the notes in a Mens Perfume. I looked at all the other perfumes by Gucci on this website and this is the first instance that they have done this. I don't know what the ratio is in regards to how much Water Lilly is used, but I can say with certainty that I can detect something in THIS Gucci perfume that I haven't experienced in any of their other fragrances. I believe this to be the Water Lilly.

I think that this is a lovely fragrance. Made To Measure is NOT a fragrance with a bang that gets everyones attention... but maybe that is the point.

My main point is that when it comes to perfume, much like Painting, Music, Sculpture; the Arts: it is a critic's responsibility to put in some consideration of why the artist or designer made, whatever it is they made, the way they made it. I know I personally don't know NEARLY as much as a perfumer does in regards to scent so already my judgements and criticisms have little to no weight to them. But what is important is that I am TRYING to understand the creators intent and desire for the piece that I am experiencing.

I don't mean to be preachy but it felt necessary to share that with everyone.

Not to be a wise-guy but I thought the initial spray on the sample card was all right; I even tried some on my clothes but it just vanished within an hour. If it were more potent, it might have a chance but it's a bust as is.

One of the most timid fragrances I have tried so far; it barely registers on me at all - and that's with spraying a healthy amount on cotton! It seems to be taking the industry's current passion for faint scents to a new extreme.

Perhaps it's just as well... if they cranked up the concentration level it would smell undistinguished and conventional. It smells like a leather jacket and perhaps some lavender from about a mile away, caught on the briefest of breezes.

Don't bother. If you have to have a Gucci scent, get the inifinitely better Pour Homme II.

A light floral fragrance which is close to the skin..

I applied 6 heavy sprays

0 10 secs - Initial spray is lovely - clean, crips, class, debonair posh, sexy

10 secs- 1hour 15 mins - 4 inch projection but very very light and subtle - I would not be suprised if many get liitle to zero projection from this fragrnace. This projects a light lavender with floral fragrance, almost unisex, yet on the skin is a harsh woodys, spicy, generic, masculine smell.

1 hour 15 mins - 2.5 hours - 2 inch projection but still hardly anything there. Gets soapy-floral-lavender and tame and has very poor quality and common place

2.5 hours - 4 hours. Close to skin and gets harsh and little smoky on the skin - the quality of this fragrance is very low.

I cannot fathom how this passed testing at Gucci?.. are there many there who just say what people want to hear and not challenge? Where are the quality standards? It's as if someone has said just do a woodsy frag, it will appeal and sell - I don't think this will. The initial smell may fool many, but they won't come back a 2nd time

Thus, Made to Measure during its developement smells like a sophisticated spicy peppery version of Guilty. It opens with a harsh spicy muted mix, soon the specific soapy citrus notes of Guilty appear. The best part of the fragrance is the final stage, when Made to Measure becomes woodier, a bit leathery, the freshness is being smoothed and we get the mild smell of strong black tea with bergamot. Unfortunately, the projection and longevity are very weak, even weaker than Gucci by Gucci has.

Finally, this one is a decent release for the modern market and especially for Gucci brand. Thank God it has nothing common with 1 million; Made to Measure is not sweet and not loud, being a skin scent. It smells like a son of Gucci by Gucci, at least they share the same mood. The problem is that, to my mind, the fragrance is not memorizable enough to become notable at the market.

A great scent, and seems to be a step in the right direction for the Gucci house after the less than desirable Gucci Guilty series. Definitely heavy lavender scent, but the inclusion of plum and lotus flower sweeten things a bit. Cinnamon, nutmeg and juniper berry offer a degree of spiciness, but are well blended. Lastly a warm leather accord rounds out the base offering depth and comfort. I consider this a modern aromatic fougere. Unfortunately this does smell rather commercial/pedestrian and I do not smell anything earth shatteringly inventive here. Despite it all, I predict Made to Measure will be popular amongst consumers. (46)

I work in a duty free shop so I get to try perfumes early. And I am really sorry to be the first one to press dislike on this one.

The dislike here is not because it smells ugly or offensive... It's completely the opposite. It is generic, passively made, and completely unintresting. You get the feeling that you have smelled that, been there before.

The main notes that I can detect are lavender and bergamot which reminds me of Prada's Luna rossa(Maybe this is the reason I feel that this perfume is not new since Luna rossa is a new release too!). I can also detect a good vibe of anise and just a faint hint of cinnamon. Then, after a very long time, the base notes try to appear but they fail. Only the leather can be somewhat detected. You just know that the composition is not right when the base notes fail to appear after several hours. So, you end up with a strong citrus lavender smell which is not offensive but, as I said, rather generic and flat. The fact that Prada released their own version before gucci might be the reason of this review... But really, I want a unique perfume and Luna rossa is much much much better!

Gucci Guilty Absolute by Gucci aims for rugged sophistication but often crosses into harsh territory. The leather opening is intense and smoky, with a sharp, almost medicinal edge that overshadows the cypress and patchouli underneath. While the vetiver and woody base provide impressive longevity, the scent can feel dated and overly dry as it settles. It performs best in colder weather, where its dense, smoky character feels more fitting. Still, it lacks the smooth sweetness and balance found in Gucci Guilty Elixir, which I personally prefer. Overall, it’s a strong statement fragrance—admirable in concept, but challenging in daily wear.

***Yet Another update since purchase on 7/14/25***

So this makes my 3rd entry and 2nd update since I'd purchased GGA on 7/14. So initially I was super aggravated with this frag bc it'd been through an OBVIOUS "reformulation" since production was switched from the U.K. to Spain. Been checking it every now & then to see if Id notice any improvements with performance/scent, and Im happy to say that GGA has definately improved. I am (Now) getting a more potent, smokey leather with resinous woods. Theres also a slight "Gasoline smell" and slight medicinal thing going on which is what I was hoping for when Id first purchased my bottle but was sorely missing. Seems to me as though produvtion in Spain has basically skipped the Maceration process so as to cut some cirners and save some coin, but hey, AT LEAST GGA is definately improving more and more over-time. Longevity has definately improved lasting about 5 hours on skin and much longer on clothes where I can actually still smell it the following day on clothes although quite faintly, but its definitely there! Anyhow, I have a feeling that this fragrance may improve even more over time bc it just keeps getting better and better where initially I could BARELY even smell it at all and what little I could detect was gone within 20 minutes or so. Would I recommend Gucci Guilty Absolute? Honestly, for the $80+ pricetag? Nah, Id recommend Lalique's Encre Noire L'Extreme as a dupe bc imo these smell very much alike except that instead of a slightly smokey leather note ya get a beautiful, slightly smokey Vetiver note and to my nose the resinous woods smell VERY similar. Also Encre Noire L'Extreme last much longer, has better projection and costs less than half the price of GGA. Now you'll also need to let Encre Noire L'Extreme "Maturate" for at least a month bc initially it also has poor longevity, but somehow becomes SUUUPER long-lasting once its matured. I dont belive that GGA will ever reach the Lalique's performance level no matter how long its stored away and allowed to Mature. Thanks for taking time to read about (My experience) with Gucci Guilty Absolute and I really hope this helps someone out who's trying to trsearch and may have any concerns about Blind-Buying this fragrance ☺️. I sure do wish that someone had mentioned the horrible reformulation before I pulled the trigger! And believe me, I CHECKED EVERYWHERE! lol.. Anyways, CHEERS and Blessings!

Releases of this caliber come around every decade, or even less often. So this brash, patronizing, and perhaps somewhat over-the-top title shouldn't surprise anyone. Let's be honest, the chances that any mainstream brand (I'm deliberately excluding niche fragrances here, especially the orthodox, commercially untainted segment) will present a fragrance as bold, original, and ambitious as Gucci Guilty Absolute are slim to none.
Today, history has come full circle, and to think that I had to wait six years for the opportunity to write something nice about a new Gucci perfume for a change, since the 2011 premiere of Gucci Guilty… This scent is so good that I consider the search and nominations for the title of the best fragrance launch of the past year (and there will be such a category in this year's ranking) to be over, back in February…
I'm glad that the brand that until recently I used to wipe my mouth with, for endorsing the mercilessly crappy stuff ordered to be signed with the Gucci logo by its former creative director, Frida Giannini, has finally handed Ms. Giannini a well-deserved dismissal and decided to return to being an icon of truly refined perfumery and style, at its finest, Italian. And it must be admitted that the Gucci brand has a lot to say in this field, so before we move on to the sound of the star of today's post, it's time for a mini retrospection... The image begins to wave, everything becomes blurry, the plucking of a harp appears in the background - and a soft fog begins to fill the edges of the field of vision...
Once upon a time, when herds of Allosaurus marched across the Jurassic steppes, accompanied by Maryla Rodowicz on the balalaika—phew, come back!—it wasn't that long ago!… Once upon a time, sometime in the late 1980s, the grand dream of Guccio Gucci (yes, the brand's founder was actually named Gucio) began to crumble. The company was truly on the brink of bankruptcy when a young, brilliant visionary and multi-instrumentalist, Tom Ford, took over. Ford also revived the bankrupt house of Yves Saint Laurent, so let's just say Tomek knows his stuff and didn't cut corners – for example, by offering Gucci's discerning clientele a tacky, bland, mass-produced product, with the motto: "If others are offering it and it sells, then we will too!" King Ford managed the Gucci family estate wisely and fairly from 1990 to 2004 – and the company prospered under his rule like never before. In 1998, the ginger angel Gucci Envy was born – and two years later, the woody, resinous Gucci Rush* was born.
Unfortunately, the idyll couldn't last forever, as the good King Tom was poisoned by the evil witch Frida and took over the kingdom, much to the despair and ruin of his subjects – STOP!, not this fairy tale again!… Unfortunately, one day, Tom Ford left for his own business, and his place was taken by Frida Giannini, who quickly introduced her own, very "fresh" and drastically different vision for managing the Gucci fashion house, which Ford had just revived. Bravo Frida!… Only what escapes brands like Lacoste, Hugo Boss, or youth-oriented brands like Puma or Adidas – won't quite appeal to a clientele accustomed to luxury and elegance, at its finest, Italian. It's as if Frida Giannini took over the best Italian restaurant, steeped in tradition and with a typically Italian flair for celebrating meals – and suddenly, with a single signature, she erased it, turning it into a fast food restaurant with a menu and service straight out of McDonald's… So we eat burgers quickly, with our fingers and from paper boxes, but we sell a lot and quickly – well, Bravo!, Bravissimo!!! 😉
And you don't have to be a great business strategist or a creative director with a monthly salary of tens of thousands of euros to know that this business model can't work. Old customers, previously well-served by Ford's genius and creativity, felt disgusted and cheated, while new customers, who had nothing to hold onto at Gucci, collectively voted with their feet and left for the competition... Some in search of lost quality, while young ones in search of more desirable and cooler logos... Hey, come back! We'll give you coupons for Dragon Ball and Pokemon cases for your iPhones if you stick around and like our Facebook page!... What do you mean, you don't want it? Hey, shove that case up your ass, you impudent little brat in Lacoste sneakers! Suddenly, it turned out that there were players on the market much better at promoting banal fruit juices for teenagers – which Gucci switched to, presenting the world with min, the Guilty and Made to Measure series… And then the wealthy and loyal customer sulked and took his platinum Visa to the competition... But how? Why wouldn't anyone want to buy the grossly overpriced and bland garbage from Gucci? It's simple, because there have been brands specializing in this area for a long time (and much more thriving), whose position wouldn't be threatened by the arrival of Gucci, a fashion house unknown in this segment. You know, it's like NASA starting to compete with our Bolesławiec, or Rosenthal in ceramics... And they went off to bake ceramic facings for space shuttles, not coffee sets!
Fortunately, someone on the board of the Gucci Group, which currently owns the Gucci brand (yes, thankfully, there was someone else overseeing Frida) realized that the business model she had implemented was ineffective given the competition and, moreover, was doing the brand more harm than good. As a result, the inept creative director was removed from the helm in time to prevent the millions of euros poured into shaping the Gucci brand's image from devaluing at such an alarming rate. Fortunately, Alessandro Michele, Gucci's new creative director, decided to return to the proven path of success, previously charted by Tomek Ford, resulting in today's post, Gucci Guilty Absolute! Yes, the tasteful, refined and exquisite GGA cut is undoubtedly the result of the will of the new creative director, because although the fragrance inherited the inglorious name of the Guilty series – I have no doubt that under the reign of Frida Giannini, it would not have smelled as perfect… And I only secretly hope that Frida will never find work in this industry again – which is what I wish for you, for myself and for every company in the industry 🙂
Okay, now that I've lambasted Frida from head to toe (but she deserved it)—taking revenge for promoting rubbish, tarnishing her reputation, and nearly sinking the brand that gave the world some of the greatest men's fragrances ever! (Ave. Rush, Envy, and GPH 1 and 2)—let's move on to the revolutionary Guilty Absolute. A groundbreaking fragrance, but I have no doubt this one will face more challenges than any other fragrance in history. Firstly, Guilty Absolute is bold, ambitious, niche, and iconoclastic, and the mass market doesn't like such fragrances. I fear the fragrance might end up like YSL M7, which was also ahead of its time and discontinued before, hmm, posthumously instilling in hordes of perfume lovers its equally bold, oud-like bouquet. Secondly, the fragrance inherited the name Guilty, which has negative connotations and is undoubtedly a heavy burden on its leg. Brilliant and demanding, Guilty Absolute is a fragrance on par with the aforementioned and equally brilliant M7, or the equally distinguished and challenging Encre Noire. A charismatic fragrance with character that will either win over customers and become fashionable – or disappear from the market without a trace.
You might ask why the brand chose such a famous name. I'm afraid Gucci might have had no choice, because unfortunately, perfumes aren't created overnight. A fragrance takes a long time to develop, both the fragrance formula itself and the back-end—the advertising campaign, name, graphic design, and bottle. Contrary to what some of you think, even the garbage piling up on perfume shelves isn't created overnight. Launching a new perfume takes time, and it's a time-consuming process that involves a significant amount of human and financial resources. While the fragrance composition is usually outsourced to an external person or company, the production is handled by a dedicated bottling plant, each new release must first be developed and entered into the brand's calendar—so the idea and its implementation are often years apart. I assume Absolute was in development during Frida Giannini's time, after all, a consistent bottle and name for the entire line were approved. Orders for bottles also go to glassworks well in advance and are very expensive.
So when Frida lost her job, and the glassworks called to say that the ~50 million Guilty Absolute bottles were ready and waiting for collection, Alessandro faced a real dilemma. In my opinion, the only thing he could do was replace the probably trivial fragrance composition Frida had previously created with something ambitious—while simultaneously utilizing the commissioned and already owned bottles and the partially implemented/launched campaign. This was much faster and, most importantly, CHEAPEST than starting from scratch with a completely new name, campaign, and bottle—where the existing bottles bear the Guilty Absolute name… We're talking about millions of euros, which, instead of being pointlessly thrown into the trash, were cleverly used with what I consider a better fragrance composition. I'm just speculating, of course, but that's how it could have been – because you'll admit that the scent is completely unlike Frida's "taste," yet it inherited both the name and the bottle. To conclude, a comment from one reader – yes, one swallow doesn't make a summer, but this strange and inexplicable sense of peace – tells me that from now on, everything will be alright, that the bad lady is gone, and from now on, nothing stands in the way of always being alright…
Okay, now that we've covered the extensive and, in my opinion, essential introduction to better presenting this perfume – it's time for the real deal…
What's shocking and simultaneously most delightful isn't the ambivalent name, but the fragrance itself. And what a fragrance! It smells of real, masculine leather, heavy and deep agarwood, wood, and single malt whiskey barrels still redolent with fire and smoke! I would have expected something so massive, deep, masculine, uncompromising, bold, rich, and simultaneously avant-garde from an orthodox, non-commercial niche—not from a brand that, just a week ago, I considered the archetype of a producer of exceptionally poor mass-market products.
The fragrance makes a stunning impression and surprises with its smoky and burnt (burnt wood) bouquet. After the initial dismay caused by its unusual design, its subsequent reception is surprisingly easy and pleasant. Big applause and kudos to the genius of Alberto Morillas for presenting a topic usually considered a difficult and extreme niche in such a way that it becomes digestible and pleasant, even for the average consumer. Of course, I realize that not everyone enjoys the scent of burnt wood, "black label" whiskey, and oud, but similarly tailored scents are hard to find in the mainstream, and generally speaking, this perfume has no mainstream rivals. The rich and multifaceted aroma exuded by this expressive, dry, yet warm perfume is composed of numerous, fantastically intertwined details. Absolute is the smoke of a bonfire and the interior of a noble gentlemen's club, burnt wood or the fire-blackened and smoke-smoked interior of barrels in which single malt whisky matured.
But because the barrels were leaky, the contents were quickly drained, and they lost little of their rich, burnt aroma, acquiring a noble, alcoholic aftertaste. Finally, Absolute is a temple bonfire, where a pile of precious agarwood (oud) chips was piled on the ceremonial hearth, which, in a fit of fanatical barbarism, were set ablaze in honor of some forgotten deity… The chips burned only partially, extinguished by a generous amount of alcohol, which the priest threw onto the fire, generating a vast amount of fragrant steam and smoke. Besides, even a thousand words cannot replace a single whiff of this perfume, rich in subtle nuances and utterly exquisite… Added to this are sandalwood and a wonderful, rough, slightly animalistic, and incredibly masculine leather – finished with vetiver root and blades and softened with a touch of warm patchouli… For me, it's an olfactory orgasm.
Secondly, Morillas achieved the seemingly impossible. He presented the suggestive, idiosyncratic, and distinctly niche scent of a "burning bonfire" in such a compelling yet accessible way that the scent intrigues and captivates even those who normally prefer fresh and casual fragrances (tested on a group of work colleagues, some of whom consider Armani Mania a good perfume 😉 ). This, of course, doesn't mean that lovers of the casual mainstream will immediately abandon their fruity juices and switch to the burnt Made in Gucci scent – but if such an unconventional and simultaneously demanding scent is received so positively, you have to admit, it bodes well for him. Guilty Absolute is distinctive, especially in its initial phase, but it's not a nose-twisting axe with crushing projection – so you won't be hurting anyone with this perfume.
Absolute smells niche and distinct, as befits the combination of notes used – yet it doesn't terrorize, overwhelm, or overwhelm with a loud or overly ubiquitous bouquet. While one might expect a higher volume level from an EdP and, considering the highly intense ingredients used, at least 10 hours of longevity, in practice you can count on a maximum of 6 hours of GGA's clearly perceptible presence on the skin. On skin, because on fabric, the scent lingers much longer and is even less prone to evolution – maintaining that distinct woody and smoky burnt note for a very long time. On the one hand, those 5-6 hours might be disappointing, but I've written more than once that, in theory, intense and highly concentrated eau de parfums and perfumes tend to smell shorter in practice than theoretically less concentrated EdT.
So Absolute isn't a long-lasting powerhouse, nor does it trail behind the wearer, leaving an exorbitantly long trail – in fact, it sticks quite close to the wearer. However, the intended amount of clouds is surprisingly pleasant, easy, and enjoyable to wear – and I personally could reapply this perfume endlessly… Alberto, Alessandro – thank you for Gucci's return in such beautiful style!..... I L.O.V.E. GGA L.O.V.E.

A masterpiece from Alberto morillas. I have a 150ml bottle for over a year and it's become amazing over time. The more it sits the more balsamic and oily it starts to smell which is a good thing. Robust, balsamic, leathery, masculine goodness is this fragrance in a nutshell. 9/10
Well this is super Masculine. Can be little polarising.

With this perfume, a new dimension opened up in my world. I gained another layer of the construction of the world. Once I made my first sniff of this perfume, I was permanently infected by the fragrant dimension/aspect of the construction of the world.

This is not just a pleasant scent. This is an unremovable experience of something elusive. Pure metaphysics.

I am now addressing beautiful, elegant and classy women: make tests if men who wear this perfume can disappoint you, mock you, or insult you. Only men who have been around the block a few times and have something to say wear this perfume. This is not a fragrance for boys in short pants. Test it!

I discovered it just by chance. I wasn’t into perfumes before. I sniffed it when my 16-year-old student went to the bathroom. It was abandoned on his shelf, covered in dust, unused for several years. He got it for his birthday. Of course, I became immediately obsessed with it. I bought it from him for the first price he quoted. No negotiation. I would have bought it from him at any price.

The world was no longer the way it used to be. I can’t imagine me without this perfume; I can’t imagine the world without this perfume. It would be like the world without jeans. Or without leather jackets. Or without apples. I have more than 10 bottles of GGA. It depends on how you count. This perfume is now part of my identity. Just like rock music. Yeah – that's a good association. This perfume definitely is a good match for rock music. I bet there are parallels between a rock heart and this scent. Just like I bet there are parallels between Dior Sauvage and cheesy pop. Once again, I'm addressing beautiful, elegant, classy women: check it out!

I don't think it makes sense to describe how GGA smells, because it smells different to each one of you. It’s a bit like trying to describe a rainbow to a blind person. And the truth of every nose is equally true. De gustibus... Someone – most likely just for fun – came up with an idea of a car repair shop, and the unsophisticated crowd picked it up. Probably because they had no other/better associations. Maybe there is some kind of repair shop here. In a moment, I'll tell you what kind of a repair shop it is. I am a qualified Automotive Technician. Back when there were no electric cars – there were only purebred gas-powered cars. And GGA doesn’t smell like a car repair shop to me. Well – everyone stretches his/her legs according to the length of his/her… imagination.

For those to whom GGA smells like a car repair shop, I suggest an evening or nighttime trip to the forest, where non-deciduous and non-coniferous giants like 1,000-year-old redwoods, larches, and cypresses reign supreme. In such a forest, in a grease-free workshop (and if grease is used, it is made from tree resins), forest elves with large beards tie the logs with leather straps to make siege engines to attack orcs. At night, especially in the forest, it is dark, so you must rely not on what you see but on what you smel. Bon appétit!

I bought this fragrance like 10 years ago. Back then I found it smelling unique and strong. We used to joke about it how it would fit a cigar smoking rich old man well, I was like 23 back then. Not a lot people around me liked this scent, it's not enjoyable if you over spray. I used to do 2 sprays and found that the perfect amount to enjoy this, and believe me people will notice it. When I didn't rock this one enough I gave it to my dad. And now since he passed away I took it back and love revisiting it once in a while. It fitted my dad great.

I remember trying this with my girlfriend trying to find a new scent for me back in the day and this made her actually gag. I smelled it and I also was also disgusted. 2 other people were near us when we sprayed it and started laughing saying how bad it smelled no lie.

No way this is actually loved I could see maybe 1 out of 10 people actually enjoying this stuff and probably upsetting everyone around them. It lingers

I use to chew tobacco and i know tobacco is not listed but this I joke you not smelled like stale chewing tobacco spit you would smell in an old plastic coke bottle. Test before you buy.

No clue how you would even pull it off maybe if you lived on a farm or did barn work in the winter.

****Update since 7/14/25**** So, after having sprayed a good amount of fragrance out of my bottle, and letting it sit in its box since 7/14 the performance and smell has indeed improved over-all. The projection is still quite poor, but the scent does stick around a lot more than it did initially and the fragrance does now have more "Presence" (Thank Goodness!). It also (now) smell way better as initially it just smelled like some sort of nasty smelling, medicinal homemade ointment or something. I'm not sure if this dna will improve any more, but as for now, Gucci Guilty Absolute is STILL a Blind-buy regret for me 100%. Again, it still does wear VERY light and if Im going to compare my experience to what most people's experience with this scent was when they made their YouTube reviews and posted their initial thoughts when this fragrance released, then there's ZERO doubt in my mind that its been through a horrible reformulation bc the way most folks describe their experience is WORLDS APART from what Im getting. Lemme put it this way, Ive tried layering my Iso e Super which is an ultra light, "barely there" woody experience along with this bottle of Gucci Guilty Absolue so that I get a boost in longevity, and the Iso e Super is almost OVER POWERING the Gucci Guily Absolute which is freakin' WILD to me!

Again, because of its resinous/woody nature, this fragrance truley does remind me of a much weaker version of Encre Noire L'Extreme just with what I suppose is a touch of leather in the base vs the smokey Vetiver. With heavy sprays Im getting 4 mmmaybe 5 hours of soft projection on skin and ofcourse its longer-lasting on clothes. I do admit that (NOW) since its had a chance to "Maturate" a bit, I dig the actual scent (Love Encre Noir L'Extreme), but (IF) Id learned that they had switched production from the U.K. to Spain and that the fragrance had been "Reformulated" there, or what I would call BUTCHERED, then I would NEVER have spent over $80 for a bottle. It still ticks me off when I think of how dishonest it is for Gucci to wait for the Hype to be over and for all the reviews to be in to then weaken the fragrance considerably Im sure to make production less expensive bc this was not "a hit" or a "Successful Seller", yet the price has actually gone up?! A total SCAM if ya ask me!

Ill have to get over it and stop my whinning and complaining so that I can enjoy this fragrance for what it is which is a Great smelling, al be it intimate Woodsey/Leathery fragrance. Ill be back to report any further improvements if there are any. CHEERS!

This is a masterpiece
Meant for people who have mastered good taste.
This reminds me of Assam Oudh in the way that it makes every fragrance seem 'bodily' when added to it. By that I mean that florals, for example, seem to naturally emanate from a person's body when Oudh is added to them, rather than like an external application.
GGA does the same very well with layerings of Grey Vetiver, or with Polo Green.
Of course, it's very deeply wonderful on its own as well.

Against advice from just about everyone here, I blind bought Guilty Absolute, and fell in love the minute the first spray of the coffee-colored juice landed on my wrist.

Gucci has plenty of fragrances for the masses but sometimes they like to dance the line between crowdpleasing and niche. This one falls into the latter category (also see Memoire d'une Odeur, by far my favorite Gucci scent along with this one). On my skin Absolute is Jim Morrison without the booze: leather with a rock n'roll edge, mainstream sensation with an underground twist.

It's all about honest-to-god leather. It doesn't evolve much during its run (about five hours on me) but it has nuance and depth that gives it a fascinating and super sexy character. There's burning wood, there's tar, there's smoke, there's a hint of rubber. I cannot stop smelling my wrist and heaven knows I couldn't stop smelling an intimate partner's skin if they were wearing this.

With all that said, I concur with the majority here - you will be wise to sample before you buy. I lucked out but there's a good chance Absolute is not for you - it's very love-it-or-hate it, which is exactly why it works.

I realise I thrashed this one with my first review, but I've been thinking about it for at least 6 months. Hoping my taste opened up to modern style leathers with petroleum notes. I had to do it, and boy am I glad I reconsidered. This bottle is even more beautiful than last time. You need it in at least 90mL otherwise you got a pansy ass size. I'm even open to getting a 100mL Tuscan Leather considering the decant didn't blow me away back then either (decants don't really do the original product justice I've found), but gents! Allow me to get to the short and handy.

Today I rummaged through all the batch codes I can find and found two codes in total. I of course bought the earliest code out of the few options, AND having visited 5 locations for this I had to get it from the shop because online Guilty Absolute was still over $10 too dear for the 90mL/3oz AND no freedom of batch code checking *LONG SIGH*.

3.5 sprays just before getting back into my car, I had to rush at it. It's instantly nostalgic of something, also brutal. That opening blast is raw power maybe by The Stooges. Leather as fuck but it shortly gets even better, the moment of cloying gives way to a molasses, or booze syrupy goodness, or fresh hot caramel. I mean this baby is a liiil sweet! Then the dry down is PWOOOOOF woodsy leather. This one's for you uber mensches. Put this next to your Fahrenheit so you know you got a couple guard dogs for your enthusiast grade collection.

My past 60mL I didn't catch the batch but I believe it's the same as my new 90mL anyway, and this one smells EVEN BETTER! Sillage is monumental, projection is as expected of Fahrenheit, and "fuck you for wearing it" thought everybody around you ;)

Gucci has always been widely ripped off and faked. Buy from an actual brick and mortar, preferably batches 2021 and before (my one is June 2020 as seen above), and be done with the horrors of zero performance. BOLD Life&Leather, dude you missed out on this one. You actually nixed all Guilty Absolute bottles from your possession. Not sure if sad. I bought a mini as I didn't know what to expect especially with people saying it was extremely animalic and barnyardy, but I the love fragrance. I don't get the animalic references at all but maybe I'm still a noob when it comes to notes. All I know is I smell smooth rugged (oxymoron?) leather, with incense like smoke and earthy patchouli with a slight note of something I can only describe as gasoline. There's also a somewhat similarity to a orange likeness to it (which suits the presentation). Now you might think yeah that's heavy as hell and maybe it is in some respects, but it works here.

This is for sure masculine and although it has slight sweetness, it's more of a end result rather than intention. It's not a monster projector but it's not weak either, it's more of a 2 feet scent bubble that has good longevity. So you wont be blowing up a room when you enter it but if people are near you they will get whiffs of it. This is the type of fragrance where less is more. 2-3 sprays is more than enough, because if you spray more and it will change it's charm. Sample first and make up your own mind, for me this is on my radar to get a bottle.

EDIT: With more wears man oh man is this fragrance good, but it's not going to be for everyone, BUT if you like leather definitely give it a try.

This must be the darkest and driest fragrance I've ever smelled. It's the smell of black leather tanning dye, patchouli, charcoal and vetiver. Gucci Guilty Absolute is a fragrance characterized by a distinct and linear scent profile. It is reminiscent of a well-worn pair of leather boot, evoking a sense of history and resilience. The fragrance combines earthy notes with a hint of oil, bandaids, petrol, wood, antiseptic disinfectant, and surprisingly, a touch of blood.

While this fragrance may not appeal to everyone, it is often perceived as a niche scent, only packaged in a designer bottle. Its boldness can be overwhelming, and it is typically worn by individuals who want to make a statement about their personal preferences and interests. The fragrance lasts the entire day, but its projection diminishes beyond 1.5 hours, becoming a moderate projection thereafter. My bottle is from the batch number 8173.

Gucci Guilty Absolute is predominantly masculine in nature, and its appeal may be limited to individuals above the age of 25. Those who possess a brooding personality, who are comfortable asserting themselves, and who do not conform to societal norms are particularly drawn to this fragrance.
It’s not an everyday number. But it’s class and in a larger collection it’s a beautiful addition with something different.

I got Gucci Guilty Absolute as a present last year, I'm extremely positive about this fragrance. It's not an easy going, mainstream fragrance. This is for people who want to stand out. If this doesn't sound attractive to you, then don't get this fragrance.

With that being said. The fragrance is quite linear in my opinion. During the opening the leather and woods are very prominent. The leather leans towards the animalic kind. The woods smell fresh and sharp. Once the fragrance has dried down the vetiver starts to be noticeable. The ingredients smell like they are of high quality. The fragrance is long lasting, and the sillage is good. Call me crazy, but I like wearing this fragrance on hotter days: you simply smell wild, and extremely masculine. The fragrance can withstand heat with ease.

Seasons: All seasons, personally I love wearing it during summer (evenings).
Strength: 9/10
Sillage: 8/10
Remark: If you want you stand out, smell like fresh woods and animalic leather. Then this fragrance is for you. Wouldn't recommend it for daily use, rather for special occasions.

Grade: 9/10

I have this product, when I first smelled it in Sephora, it smelled like an animal. Let me explain, you are on a horse farm and you are on a horse saddle, the surroundings smell of horse shit and dirt. In short, it was like a sacrificial animal market and I did not like it. Then I wanted to buy this scent, I wanted to have such a masterpiece and an extraordinary scent, then I bought it and it became addictive, I use it with great pleasure

I fuckin love this. And I like to re apply even when it’s not time. Another one where my arms staying at my face. It starts out like something medicinal but develops into a nice leathery and beautiful scent.

Ombre has been one of my most favorite of all time much less a leather favorite. This one is trying to take the throne from TF on my favorites list.

The only draw back to this is that tiny bottle and atomizer. I’m using the hell out of it. Oh and wife loves it on me too. Think she likes it more than TF
Underrated
Works well on me, smells leathery, animalistic and woody with a dusty sweetness somewhere. On my boyfriend it's unbearable gasoline musk. I'd definitely get a sample first.

This is two scents in one bottle that seem to fight each other. On one side the piercing sharp gasoline leather accord, on the other side a very uninspiring male designer. I've worn it several times now and still can't say I like it, but it's very intriguing somehow.

This perfume is like drugs, maybe disliked at first try but a small dose after small dose gets people hooked for good.
On paper it is a weird industrial greasy leather factory smell but somehow, I can’t get enough of it, I could smell this all day.

The fact that it is produced by a designer house who typically makes mass appealing mainstream perfumes; and that it is sold for this price made me appreciate the perfume even more.

For Gucci to take the trouble and go out of their comfort zone not only to release it, but to keep it in production until now is a ballsy move that they deserve credit for.

I'd like to think that this is their way of giving back to perfume society, a non-profitable charity for the sake of perfume art.

This scent was the reason I had to make an account. It managed to come back full circle with me and fascinates me. One day a co-worker that shares the fragrance chasing interest with me brought it in. Now I'm no expert nose mind you but first whiff gave me nothing but gasoline. I hated it. Then throught the day for some reason I kept coming back to the bottle to smell it. It kept growing on me and I have no idea why.

Within one shift I went from absolutely repulsed by it to trying it on. The opening reminds me of like i said before, gasoline. However it's not jarring to me anymore. The dry down is where i definitely smell the leather but it gets more soft leather smelling throughout the day rather than just being that brand new leather smell that i usually don't like. Think of like a 15 year old car with well kept moistured original leather interior smell, it's very pleasant to me.

This scent is what i would say offensive at first whiff. This is what you'd want to wear on a day you woke up and chose violence. It's like flipping people off in scent form, but for some reason they might want to keep smelling the scent (like i did).

Longevity I'd give slightly above moderate (4-6hrs), sillage the low side of moderate after about 2-3 hrs it become a skin scent with me.

So, this was definitely an acquired taste for me but has now become addicting to smell. Just has me wishing for more performance, I will definitely be picking up a bottle though!

Smells something in middle from giulty perfume to giulty elixir.
Sharper than perfume, but more smooth than elixir.
Expectations was way bigger.
Strong projection for 2-3 hours.
Longevity is for maybe 6-7 hours.
From cheapos category, i think, Gentlemans Society Extreme is nicer.
From all gucci giulty line, perfume is most liked of me.
This is not bad perfume, good for cold weather, should be good for hot too.
But is nothing WOW, just simple, dayly option.

When I first sampled GGA I was somewhat turned off, but I kept an open mind, sampled again and became more intrigued. I ended up buying a full bottle and am I ever glad I did. If you're careful with the sprays I say it's work safe. I don't wear it often enough to finish my bottle but I ever did run out I'd definitely repurchase. Love it!

If you want to smell (and apparently I do), like a sweaty, lederhosen wearing gas pump attendant smoking a roll-up in the middle of the desert then pick this up immediately. Do not pass go or collect two hundred pounds. Run, Forest. Run!

Your significant other may not forgive you the opening, but the sweet, dry tang of incense and spice in the dry-down will have them wondering how you switched fragrance mid evening.

And where you hid the lederhosen.

Perfectly blended leather woody aromatic.

At first this reminded me of a leather goods store. Then I sat with it and picked up the cypress and patchouli, and that's where I really started to enjoy this fragrance. This is a dry fragrance with only a crumb of that spicy sweet patchouli in terms of sweetness. The smokiness is there, but it's subtle and kind of in the background. I don't find it earthy or animalic, but from reading some other reviews, it certainly appears to trigger that animalic note for some.

The only downside for me is that projection drops off a cliff around the 6 hour mark, but that leather note sticks to my skin long after that. I'm still going to reapply this after 6-7 hours though, because the magic of this fragrance is in the composition.

You probably want to go light on the sprays with this one, as it is very strong.

Is this mass appealing? God no. Only buy this if you know you like leather fragrances. Is this safe for work? Absolutely not. Will it make you smell like a horse? Some people seem to think so :)

Edit: I've since come to learn that this fragrance is considered quite challenging for a lot of people, so I just wanted to add a heads up. I mean it, this is not for everyone. You need to like extremely harsh dark leathers and be ok with the fact that this may come across smelling like gasoline to some.
I can’t stand this. Worst blind buy of my life. It smells like a hospital/doctors office and now that I realized it, I can’t unsmell it.

Blind buy based on multiple positive reviews from those that share the same likes in fragrances and I was not disappointed. Very smoky/spicy with an undercurrent of a petrol scent. Definitely lights up your nostrils and I could see it being somewhat headache-inducing for some more sensitive noses. Does not seems to change tremendously between top-middle-base. If you like Maison Marghela's By The Fireplace as well as Tom Ford's Oud Minerale, it is safe bet you will like this. To my nose it is an interesting combination of the two, albeit leaning more towards the former.

Gucci Guilty Absolute is a masterpiece of modern perfumery. Its rich, smoky leather notes blended with deep woods and a touch of earthy vetiver create a bold, sophisticated scent that commands attention.
BUT….the longevity is a meh,the projection strikes the perfect balance between subtlety and power. A true statement fragrance that exudes confidence and elegance—would be an easy 10/10 for me if the SPL is beast.

Seems to be one of those fragrances that appeals to a lot of lame, “alpha” d-bags. Probably the only Gucci Guilty that I haven’t smelled but still want to. However, its association is enough to scare me away.
Fun game: take a shot every time some wanker says alpha male in their review 🥴

This is a masterpiece created by the master Alberto Morillas, one of the most prolific perfumers of all time. 👑

It's the most industrial 🏭 pertrol-like ⛽ 🔥 leather fragrance with a dominant leather accord that screams alpha masculine vibes!
Niche-level quality and such a complex and well-blended formulation! 💯 🥇

I have actually contacted Gucci who in turn referred me to Coty Inc. who confirmed to me that it is still being produced! 👍🏻

It's a serious formal fragrances, and by the way Alberto Morillas said in an interview that it's his favorite fragrance and that he wears it with a suit 😎

A video review is also available on my YT ▶️

First time I tried it years ago I immediately detected what to me was a very pleasant gasoline aroma and a lightning-like vetiver with thick dusty patchouli coming out after the opening. It became my signature scent. It is now gone from the shops near me but I still see it online and at airports.

Bookish girls, girly girls, and classic ladies alike like it on me: Mmm, it smells like skin. Wear that one that smells like a horse I loved to ride. Oh you smell sooo good...

this became my signature fragance for business. this is a true alpha male fragance, a ceo, boss oriented fragance. wearing it you remind people around you to mind their own business, also it gives you aura, a presence that people will notice you , they wont ask for what fragance you wear, instead they would likely say you smell good. perfect fragance when i need to do serious business with people that wouldnt likely take me serious. also great for introverts that dont want to attract any people when going outside.

has natural suede opening and a fougere woody scent base note, it grew on me unlike sweet scents that gets boring pretty fast after 3-4 uses

Want to love this especially given the punchiness in the opening and the funk in the top notes, leathery with the patchouli and wood coming through to give a complex styraxy resin note reminiscent of the drydown of Bvlgari Man's Terrae Essence and an unusual, patchouli-leather stank which I found very interesting.

Unfortunately this only lasts a few minutes before it devolves into a combination of cheap shoe shop, burnt rubber, hot car interior, gasoline, and barber shop floor. Most of the interesting complexity is gone leaving behind a horrible chemical mess. It eventually dies down to a quieter tarred leather note on the skin which certainly isn't worth the journey.

I am experimenting with layering to try and salvage this perfume and its unique top notes. Although many have described this as a "bold" scent, gasoline and dirty cheap rubber slipper sole isn't the bold message I'd like to get across.

All in all, interesting concept, and I do love the unique, almost stanky funk before the gasoline strikes, which on first sniff do remind me of Trussardi Behind the Curtain Alla Scala or a more leathery Terrae Essence - both perfumes I do love, but the drydown is mediocre and middle period frankly unpleasant. It is hard to wear and definitely not as "woody" as the description may make it seem. Not a blind buy. More power to you if you find a way to love it!

I got this for my Dad for his birthday, per his wishes. The opening is VERY medicinal. I have worked as a veterinary assistent and the disinfectant we used (Dettol) smells super similar to this fragrance. Not unpleasant but you have to like it. I can also see why some people say it smells like bandaids.
Once the top notes have faded though, it does get more wearable. Projection is decent and longevity is great! Definitely a unique mens fragrance, not something you come across often. This would pass as a niche perfume to my nose.

Wow. Petrol and Band Aids. This is the most amazing smell I have ever experienced.
Take my money or I will punch you in the face.
But I am not in a store. It's a mailed sample.
The incredible opening is there to hook you into the sale, if you're lucky enough to like it.

It settles down on the skin, to smell like suede, with the Band Aids still present and stays linear. Given that it's such a distinctive and possibly unique smell, I guess being linear is more than forgivable.

It's probably filling the room, but I think I've gone a bit nose blind. I have no idea how it would smell to anyone entering the space. Letting a little get on your clothes seems to keep this stuff kicking. A few more wears to see if I stay loving this punchy fragrance

I think overall this is a banger of a fragrance. It's edgy, aromatic very good leather note mixed with the cypress and patchouli they play very well together
I think I recommend this to any vetiver lover , you will not be disappointed.

Unfortunately that fades after 10 minutes and what’s left for the next 8 hours to my nose is a linear leather and dry wood note. Nothing else ! Decent sillage and longevity though.

Gucci guitly absolute, une merveille créé pas un grand Monsieur # Alberto Morillas# c'est l'un de mes parfums préféré, le cuir, le patchouli, le vétiver , des notes boisées, le Cyprès , magnifique parfum D'homme. C'est un 10/10 pour moi.

Premieres of the caliber of this perfume, happen once every decade or so, or even less frequently. So this snide, condescending and perhaps somewhat over-the-top title should come as no surprise to any of you. Let's face it, the chance that any of the mainstream brands (I'm deliberately excluding the niche here, especially its orthodox, non-commercialized faction) will present a fragrance as bold, original and ambitious as Gucci Guilty Absolute, is close to zero
What shocks and at the same time delights most is not the ambivalent name, but the fragrance composition itself. And what a fragrance composition! It smells of real, masculine leather, heavy and deep agar, wood and burnt and still smelling of fire and smoke barrels, after single malt whiskey! Something so massive, deep, masculine, uncompromising, bold, rich and avant-garde at the same time, I would expect sooner from an orthodox non-commercial niche - than from a brand that until a week ago I considered the archetype of a producer of extremely poor mass-market. And here it turns out that the last of the Guilty, the culmination and crowning achievement of the entire series (it's an EdP) - is its total negation, a 180-degree turnaround and, ironically, the jewel in the crown!
A gem that smells like the sacred and profane, niche and dark - like a combination of Fumidus, with Black Tourmaline and Petroleum, i.e. the niche of the niche! Frankly speaking, I would not have expected such an ambitious fragrance even from Hermes, Lalique (despite the existence of Encre Noire) and Mugler - i.e. brands bold and confident enough in their position to still treat the art of perfumery in a responsible and uncompromising manner. And suddenly among them there is a player from whom no one would have expected it - and whose launch has completely shattered the order, and the balance of power, in perfumery. Here appears a fragrance that is so sincerely and fervently sorry for its sins ( guilty), that it genuinely washed away and redeemed in my eyes all the previous faults of its brand... Guilty Absolute really surprised me, ba shook and moved me to the living - and believe me, it is difficult to surprise me with something else....
The scent makes an electrifying impression and surprises with its smoky and burnt (burntwood) bouquet, and after the first consternation, caused by its unusual cut - its further reception is surprisingly easy and pleasant... Here a big round of applause and tribute to the genius of Alberto Morillas, for presenting the subject matter, which is usually categorized as a difficult and extreme niche - in such a way that it became digestible and friendly, even for the average consumer. Of course, I realize that not everyone likes the scent of burnt wood, “black label ” whiskey and oud - but similarly tailored fragrances in the mainstream can hardly be found, and in general these perfumes have no competition in the mainstream. The rich and multifaceted aroma that these expressive and dry yet warm perfumes spread - consists of a great many, fantastically correlated details. Absolute is the smoke of a campfire and the interior of a noble gentleman's club, burnt wood or the fire-smoked and smoke-smoked interior of barrels - in which single malt whisky was matured .
But because the barrels were leaky, so the contents were drained rather quickly and did not lose much of their rich burnt aroma, itself gaining a noble alcoholic aftertaste. Finally, Absolute is a temple bonfire, where a pile of precious agarwood (oud) slivers were placed on the ceremonial hearth, which in a fit of fanatical barbarism were set on fire, in honor of some forgotten deity... The slivers burned only partially, extinguished by a large amount of alcohol, which the priest splashed on the fire, generating a huge amount of fragrant steam and smoke. Anyway, not even a thousand words can substitute for a single sniff of this rich in subtle nuances and arcy exquisite perfume... Added to this are sandalwood and a wonderful, rough, somewhat animal and incredibly masculine leather - which was finished with root and vetiver blades and softened with a touch of warm patchouli
Secondly, Morillas has accomplished something seemingly impossible. He has presented the evocative, specific and eminently niche scent of “burnt fire” in such an evocative and at the same time approachable way that the fragrance intrigues and delights even people with a taste for freshers and casuals (tested in practice on a group of colleagues, some of whom think Armani Mania is a good perfume ). This, of course, does not mean that lovers of the casual mainstream will abandon their fruity juices out of the blue and switch to the burnt Made in Gucci - but if such an unconventional and at the same time challenging fragrance is received so positively, you have to admit, it bodes very well for it. Guilty Absolute is expressive, especially in its initial phase, but at the same time it is not a nose-twisting axe, with crushing projection - so you won't hurt anyone with this perfume.
Absolute smells niche and specific as befits the resultant repertoire of notes used - but at the same time it does not terrorize, tire or overwhelm with an overly loud or overly ubiquitous bouquet. Admittedly, one would expect a higher level of volume from EdP and, given the highly intense ingredient used - at least 10 hours of longevity, but in practice one can count on at most 6 hours, a well perceptible presence of GGA on the skin. On skin, because on fabric the fragrance lasts much longer and is even less eager to evolve - keeping that distinct touch of woody-smoky burn in the foreground for a very long time. On the one hand, those 5-6 hours may be disappointing, but I've written more than once that in theory intense and maximally concentrated eau de parfum and perfume - in practice they like to smell shorter than theoretically less concentrated EdT. So Absolute is not a titan of longevity, nor does it drag behind the wearer, leaving a skyrocketing tail - it even stays quite close to the wearer, but this set number of clouds wears surprisingly nice, easy and pleasant - by the way, personally I could reapply this perfume to myself indefinitely... Alberto, Alessandro - thank you that Gucci is back in such beautiful style!
Greetings

I just put on my motorcycle boots, leather jacket, and before strapping on my bell helmet and gloves I reach to out to this one. It just makes that black leather motorcycle jacket more organically present. I get whiffs of the vetiver and leather when I come to a stop, and the petrol note blends with the engine beat perfectly. I did take a shower but did I mention that I didn't shave? Did you people think I would put on Angel's Share for this vibe lol? No!

I gift swapped on Christmas for this (for another fragrance), I don't gravitate towards heavy smells like this due to the heat in my state. This fragrance is surprisingly loud and it's simplicity is a strong suit.

What this does, it does extremely well - so much so that it can either be repulsive or exquisite to some. I'm the latter, I find the smell masculine and aggressive.
