7.5/10, one of the only winter/cold weather fragrances I own. However, it's nice and comforting -- great for general use in colder seasons.

Statement making scent! I usually dont like dark, heavy leather and patchouli fragrances, but Gucci Guilty Absolute is stunning.
Opens up bold, dark leathery but dries down into a leather, woody, slightly spicy cypress scent with some earthiness in the back - all well balanced.
For the cooler months for sure.
Absolute worth sampling.
Exquisite

Opening

Gucci Guilty Absolute kicks things off with an unapologetic blast of raw leather, like stepping into an old leather workshop filled with aged hides and well-used tools. The opening is bold, medicinal, and almost jarring, conjuring images of freshly opened band-aids or even motor oil. But just beneath the rugged surface, a subtle sweetness starts to peek through, likely from the patchouli. It’s not the kind of sweetness that softens the leather’s edge; instead, it weaves itself into the rough textures, adding a faint, earthy richness that complements rather than contrasts the leather's rawness.


Heart

As the initial leather dominance settles, the cypress begins to emerge, introducing a dry, aromatic greenness that plays beautifully with the earthy patchouli. Here, the sweetness hinted at in the opening starts to develop further, lending a slightly balsamic warmth that tempers the ruggedness just enough. It’s not overt or sugary—think more of a natural, resinous sweetness that feels almost woodsy in character. The fragrance at this stage is like being deep in a forest, where the scent of aged leather mingles with moss-covered trees and the faint mustiness of damp earth.

Dry Down

In the dry down, Gucci Guilty Absolute remains true to its opening, but there’s a newfound depth as the woody notes begin to take on a slightly smoky character, courtesy of the vetiver. The patchouli continues to add that touch of sweetness, but it’s well-blended, always lurking in the background, enhancing the leather's natural warmth without ever becoming cloying. The result is a linear yet addictive scent that maintains its rugged identity throughout, while slowly revealing more nuanced facets.

Longevity

Performance is impressive, with the scent lasting easily over 8 hours and projecting strongly for the first few. Even as it dries down, Gucci Guilty Absolute refuses to fade quietly; it lingers in a way that ensures you’re always aware of its presence. It may soften, but the leather never truly lets go.

Versatility

This is not a scent for all seasons or settings. Gucci Guilty Absolute thrives in cooler weather, where its boldness can be fully appreciated. The fragrance is best suited for evening wear, leather jackets, and chilly nights—perfect for when you want to leave a distinct impression. It’s too rugged for a casual day at the office or a summer outing but shines during moments when you want to express individuality and confidence.

In Short

Gucci Guilty Absolute is a bold and unapologetic leather fragrance with a touch of earthy sweetness, courtesy of the patchouli. It’s a statement piece that stays true to itself from start to finish, appealing to those who appreciate rugged, masculine scents with a refined edge. If you’re looking for something versatile and crowd-pleasing, look elsewhere; this is for the wearer who dares to be different.
Masterpiece fragrance. Beast mode too.

I just got a test bottle of this………
4 sprays to the chest and arms:

Somewhere in Northern Europe, a tall, strong, bearded, gothic looking man in his mid 40’s has been expertly splitting logs with an axe in a dense forest in October and he is now sitting inside a moss covered wooden cabin peering into a medicine cupboard, looking for fresh bandages after cutting his hand 2 days ago fixing his truck. His cabin is warm and a wood stove burns brightly, next to a neat stack of seasoned birch logs. The other end of the cabin is adorned with whole fresh animal skins he has trapped or hunted…..fox, weasel, beaver, deerskins and little piles of prepared leather he uses to make knife sheaths and belts and small bags. There is a well used chainsaw there also next to a can of gasoline, 2 stroke and chain oil. Plenty of hand tools…knives, chisels, spanners, hammers, a socket set (metric 🤣) animal traps etc.

That’s what this smells like straight out the gate.
I like it.
Not surprised that it’s discontinued though. It’s very much a niche profile I would say. It’s going to suit some people, in some places, at some times, but you definitely need to get a sample before you buy a full bottle.

This is the leather perfume I have been searching for. Dry woody spicy well worn leather, not new leather like Ombre Leather or fruity like Tuscan Leather. Maybe more like a saddle, an old arm chair in a smoking room. Part of that leather smell can be a bit gasoline, bandaids depending on your scent associations. I get those but I don’t find them off putting in any way.

It lingers a long time but doesn’t project massively after the initial blast. Then it’s a light aromatic patchouli and leather.

Not for everyone, but then if you don’t like leather you are probably not in the target demographic. This is one to spray on your motorcycle jacket or when you don’t feel like some sweet smelling mass appealing elixer.

Super cool fragrance. It reminds me of the most worn out brown leather belt that my dad used to beat me with. No, I'm joking lol. But it does reminds me of a very old skool genuine leather belt. Cool and unique. Not overly complex. Generic woody structures, slightly smokey earthy vetiver adding slight nuances to that very dominating rugged leather. A very present patchouli ''dank''. But you're getting that leather from start to finish. Not something I would wear but I can respect it.

You have to really wear that leather with confidence or else it will wear you. You gotta be ready for it. Good projection and lasts very long

Legendary, bold, iconic leather!

EDIT: I just realized I am getting a type of leather that was present in PP No Limit... no suprise, considering it has the same parfumer behind it. Even tho its strong it is not at all annoying and messy like No Limit. I find that one absolutely atrocious. Alberto is a veteran parfumer that is very loved by fragrance houses for his ability to really capture the brands image and create what is asked to the letter. While this is very stern and bold as well. It got the italian gucci flair written all over it. Meanwhile PP is a brand catering to a more... ''obnoxious'' crowd for lack of better term lol. I think it's not really his fault for making atrocious scents here and there. He's a machine that creates things for whoever can afford it.

This juice is strong and not for the masses! I only find it practical to wear Gucci Guilty Absolute (GGA) for cruising at a bar, just two or three sprays max under my thick black leather shirt and pants to amplify the natural odor of the garments. The top elements that hit my senses are straight raw leather, some hard and dry wood, and a used horse saddle (a faint but fine barn-related aroma). Absolute virility with no sweetness, fruitiness or the like. Can't go wrong with cowboys, alpha men and badass bosses with an attitude. First hour is way too potent, then subsides but does last well over seven hours. Try before buying. GGA is low on versatility yet high on distinctiveness. Requires utter self-confidence and rugedness to style this perfume. Skip if you're under 35.

Gucci really went all out on this one, and I’m loving it! I know I’m late to the party, as it’s been released and discontinued before I ever got the chance to try it. Luckily I managed to snag two 150ml bottles on eBay of this beauty—or beast, depending on your perspective.

To me, it’s perfection with a few limitations on usability. It's definitely not an office fragrance. It’s unapologetic, bold, raw, masculine badassery in a bottle, guaranteed to put some hair on your chest—and probably everyone else’s within a 10-foot radius, man, woman, or child. Some describe it as smelling like chainsaw oil on leather or old leather mechanic gloves found in a vintage Harley Davidson’s toolbox, and I totally resonate with those vibes.

It lasts for days, so be careful not to overspray. Even 90ml will probably last you a lifetime, but I just love having backup bottles of my favourites, especially the discontinued ones. I’d say it’s Definitely not a blind buy even to I blind bought it . I kind of know what I like , one of my favourites is Tom Ford noir anthracite and dry darker frags . in general I mostly end up liking the controversial stuff so I went for GGA . I’d say if you liked the OG Dior Fahrenheit edt the chances are you will love this one too. In conclusion , it’s magic in a bottle, proceed with caution.

Update :

Bought another 150ml bottle 😂🤷🏼♂️🤦♂️ it was a deal , I had to .

One of the most heartbreaking purchases for me, but do not be discouraged as I may have gotten a weak batch or it just does not work with my skin chemistry. This is definitely that industrial petrol and woodsy smell, people were right when they say it smells like a doctor's office to some degree but once you let it settle and you wear it a couple of times, you develop a love and appreciation for it. This fragrance, like dior Fahrenheit, It is a hit or miss. This is one of those “test before you buy” try to get a sample decant or at least spray a tester on your skin or paper first to a nearby retail store, if you find one. To my skin, it smells exactly what you would expect. Pure Masculinity in a bottle, it is leathery which would comes off putting to a person who usually tend for modern, brighter or safer fragrances i.e; blue, bubblegum, aquatics etc.

This is the same category as Lalique Encre Noire, Mancera Red Tobacco, and Tom Ford Tuscan Leather, in my book. Ombre Leather can easily be passed in my opinion but Tuscan Leather, much like this fragrance, you must be someone who tends to love these type of scents.

Personally, I actually love it, even at first sniff. I bought one in discounters, it was fairly cheap for a big bottle so why not? Ever since then, I love the smell even more, although, personally my girlfriend seems to not like it. Which is understandable, due to its vibe it exudes. However, I wear it time after time, it performs great on my skin, overall a nice fragrance for me that is unique, mature, and masculine. Careful though, this is not blind buy safe, so be advised that you should sample or test it out. This is an acquired taste hence the mixed reviews below.

When I smelled again, I really couldn't believe it. If you grew up on a farm and the smell you get when you enter the stall, this is it. It literally stinks! I can't think of any occasion nor a personality where this would be appropriate. You can just stink without it.

If you are checking the reviews to know if you should buy it or no, this message is for you:

DO NOT

Gucci Guilty Absolute is just nuclear. A genuine bomb of petrol. It’s extremely masculine, and very unwearable. This petrol smell is a hit or miss for people, definitely not a compliment getter. Some people may find this scent interesting and some may find it too animalic and harsh. To me, I find the scent interesting from a technical standpoint but I would never wear this. I sprayed this once and it filled the entire room with a petroleum smell and completely out projected anything else I had on my skin. If you are buying this, I do advise be careful. It’s not wearable in almost any scenario. I don’t even know where you can wear this other than a drag race. To be fair the dry down isn’t as petrol like as the initial spray, you get more of that woody note later on but even then it’s very very hard to wear. I don’t recommend you buy this unless you truly do want to smell petrol like.

On my skin, almost pure vetiver, then patchouli. I get the allure — hairy, dominant; it smells like 'Melodie Nelson' by Serge Gainsbourg sounds, like the badly behaved younger brother of businessman Terre d'Hermès. Like other vetiver-intensive scents, this sits on top of me; neither sinks in nor hovers around aromatically. For a linear masculine juice, I prefer Molecule 01 + Patchouli, a cleaner sort of dirty.

I see a lot of comparisons drawn between this fragrance and Encre Noire or Dark Lord, which I understand. After all, there's not much to compare this to in the designer realm, especially in this era.

It shares the earthy vetiver note with Encre Noire. And it has a medicinal accord similar to Dark Lord. But it doesn't smell exactly like either. Guilty Absolute is much more wearable than either, in my opinion. It has a sweetness that tries to surface occasionally due to the patchouli. But make no mistake, this is anything but a sweet scent. The opening is a punch in the face-- it smells strongly of leather and camphor, which I suspect is the cypress note. After the dry down, however, the scent becomes slightly woodier and earthier. It's still all about the leather though, and although it's listed as a top note, it lasts all the way through. This fragrance isn't super complex and it's fairly linear.

I find this fragrance oddly addictive, but it's definitely not for everyone. I've heard it described as a classy scent by a couple other reviewers, which I find a bit amusing. If anything, it's the opposite of a classy scent. It's raw, intense, dry, and dirty. I don't think a corporate suit will be wearing this to a board meeting anytime soon. This is the kind of fragrance an old school biker wears to a metal concert.

AWESOME, testosteronic man juice, very dry, without a hint of sweetness. This scent is to the grape juice/bubble gum boys what garlic is to a vampire. lol Main scents I get here after dry down are leather, let me repeat, LEATHER, mineral spirits and subtle smokiness and earthiness. No gasoline or petrol scent (as in Fahrenheit) but mineral spirits. If you've ever cleaned paint brushes in mineral spirits, you'll know what I mean. Overall, this scent reminds me very closely of the scent of oil based Color Putty®, for those of you who have done finish carpentry with stained hardwood trim.

For such a hyper masculine fragrance, muscular performance is expected and Guilty Absolute does not disappoint. Excellent longevity, projection and sillage. Up the sprays and they'll know you walked in the room or maybe you'll knock 'em dead. hahaha And no surprise - another awesome creation by Mr. Morillas. Dude is a genius. Guilty Absolute is in my top 5.

Applies spicy wood. Strong dry musk gives a stale streak with faint dried lavender/violet that leans formal. Grandma’s powdery perfume.

It’s a little curious. Spicy and projects well, yet wood is laid back and soft up close. What’s peaking out from behind? Dusty musk is an off-putting chore to work past. It dominates the foreground. No thank you.

Faint, yet much needed sweetness balances out dry down. Grungy oily leather in an exotic sandy desert.

Here’s a revised version of the review:

---

Gucci Rush Summer is all about that burst of bergamot—it’s crisp, lively, and gives the fragrance a unique edge. The bergamot really stands out, making the scent feel fresh and invigorating without being too sharp.

There’s a perfect balance here, where the bergamot leads, but the other notes blend in seamlessly, creating a smooth, well-rounded scent. It’s light and easy to wear, with just enough staying power to keep you smelling great throughout the day.

It’s like a lighter version of rush 2 with a slight hint of the og rush. Almost no projection it’s a skin scent. I always loved the projection and longevity of 1&2. It’s nice and soft with some added freshness

I was able to get my hands on a brand new bottle of GR Summer as a total blind buy and I must say I am in love. I have GR 1&2 and love both of them, but this one sooo beautiful and so different. It does have the DNA of GR1 and I am here for it. However, it is softer and different somehow. I am truly in love with this one. And now to use it sparingly cuz I don't want to run out!!! lol
















1
My favorite of all time. I wish I could find a perfume of same scent. I had it long time ago, but still, I remember the scent of Rush Summer on my skin.

At first spray I though, hell no this has nothing to do with my beautiful, exotic, spicy floral intoxicating madness that Rush is. But now, I see, I see what they have done. The original Rush is full of white flowers, however there patchouli and peaches take the stage. Here, white flowers have their chance. Smelling Rush Summer is like smelling Rush which is missing its addictive spicy coriander, sweet vanilla, fruity peach and herbal patchouli. Rush Summer is 20% original Rush and 80% bergamot. It's basically the floral side of Rush in a bottle, great, logical choice by Gucci.

I'm the biggest fan of the original Rush. I don't get the plastic hair spray thing. To me that is a loud statement scent. Rush Summer is like a close relative. This is the little niece of the world famous diva aunt. She wants to look like her, smell like her and in a way she does. In her young ways. I really like it and I can totally see this on me in the summer but there's no way I could switch to this over the original. On me the citrus is very prominent but for the first time ever I don't smell like I sprayed the toilet cleaner on myself. This is an absolutely different scent.

I just bought this and really like it. The notes are accurate with bergamont being the definite stand out note. So if you are not a bergamont fan I wouldn't blind buy. Compared with the original it still retains many of the same notes but it doesn't have that plasticky note which is a standout feature of the original. So if that was too much for you or if you love the original like I do and would enjoy a lighter citrus version you will probably like this a lot.
Still have this and I layer it with the orignal for summer dates.

I love Gucci Rush, however can not wear it in summer. I bought on internet Gucci Rush summer as It is discontinued for 5 yrs now. I am in love with Gucci Rush summer, and would like to find the same scent, not discontinued :) I tried Fancy Love, not at all... Gucci Rush with bergamot... But I am still looking for my perfume! Do you have any clue which perfume could smell like Gucci Rush summer? Thank you!

I am a big fan of Gucci Rush but personally think it should only be worn at night (since it is so sexy). Therefore, I was more than happy to find something similar in smell but more daytime friendly!

Gucci "Rush Summer" is just perfect. It has the typical "Rush" smell (very sexy) but it is more close to the skin.

I like "Rush Summer" much better than "Rush 2". Anyone looking for a daytime friendly "Rush" version I can whole heartedly recommend "Rush Summer"! You won't be disappointed.

A strange way of describing it, but there is a lot of florals in this that come across as soapy to me, not that it's a bad thing. What I'm left with is a beautiful, clean floral scent that lasts most of the day and lasts for days on clothing, it seems!

Wear with caution to work, it might be headache-inducing, just a little goes a long way, great for the cooler weather I think. Still not sold on these, in my opinion, plastic-looking bottles, but thats only a minor thing.

In cooler weather this lovely perfume lasts 6+ hours on skin (in the heat, last 15 min).

Typically, I’m not a jasmine perfume fan (although jasmine is one of my fav flowers), but Gucci Gorgeous Jasmine smells lovely on me.

More of a skin scent, it’s a cozy, soft, rather soapy Jasmine. Very calming and classy smelling. If there was a shampoo & body wash that smelled like this I’d buy it in a heart beat - I wish I could smell like this from head to toe 24/7. I love it!

Oh. I realise after having bought a larger tester of all the gourgeous flankers, that this is not what I have been thinking of for like 14 years. I remember smelling a GOURGEOUS green Gucci perfume called Flora looong ago, and I couldn't afford it or wouldn't buy at the time. I thought I had secured it now. But I see that what I have never forgotten was an older perfume called Gucci Flora, perhaps Eau de toilette or perfume, possibly 2009.
This is not that.

This smells like Earl Grey tea in a British garden in the afternoon, a sunny day in southern England. But really weak, even though I have oversprayed it to sense something.
(Which in a way I am grateful for after having had respiratory panic recently from trying on La vie est belle again and trying Roberto Cavalli le parfume).
It is winter now so this is obviously the wrong season.
I must say this would be perfect for a wedding, a Midsummer party, any kind of nicer event in the spring or summer. It is not going to make those that hate perfume cough or side-eye you.

Smells apart from the Bergamott, slightly peppery and very subtly floral (Jasmine and Magnolia). Hm. Not something i will buy again but it would suit those seeking subtle, floral, fresh, summer, nicer garden parties.

This is suitable for daily formal errands, hospital visits, workplace, park. Morning scent that is clean and non invasive. My go-to for such places. If you like clean sheets or downy this is it. Very very clean is how I would describe it almost could pass for a an actual cleaner. Lol
I wouldn’t repurchase though because it’s too price and doesn’t stay for long.

This is a punch in the face of floral. You don't really get much uniqueness from it, and it's so packed with a floral scent that it's hard to even differentiate the different notes. Eventually it does fade, but it's never less floral. I will give it points for the fact that it literally lasts all day, albeit faintly.

Scent Description: Generic Floral
Sillage: Medium
Longevity: All Day - 12 hours
This is a great perfume, i bought it for my mother and it complements her, she is 57.My sister use it too...she is 27!

This is nothing like Gardenia by Elizabeth Taylor!!! Gardenia is the closest fragrance to a real gardenia there is. This has no trace of gardenia in it. Not even magnolia in my opinion. This is straight up jasmine. Sweet, cloying, syrupy jasmine. I can’t believe people are saying this is a clean laundry scent… Well, it’s amazing how our experience and taste can differ.
EDIT:
I actually quite like this on my stepmom (50+), but I guess that says something as well.
A beautiful jasmine scent! I'm not a fan of florals but this one doesnt ring old lady to me and it's not powdery, the citrus does a great job at making it lively and also elegant.

This is one I usually spray and walk into, but I sprayed my arm more directly for the sake of actually reviewing it!

The florals do start off really strong and I can understand the air freshener comparison, which was not an issue I had when spraying lightly and smelling it on clothing? As it softens, it gets so much better lol It becomes a soft white floral scent with a hint of rose and woody undercurrent

It's best for spring, it would be too cloying for summer!

I like the others from the Flora line more, but this is still fun for spring so long as I'm spraying my clothes and not my skin ^^;
Makes me feel like Papagena wanting to lay eggs when worn in the summertime but like an old lady when I wear it during wintertime. Hmmmmmm.

Absolutely amazing scent. Smells very clean and fresh. The jasmine is dominant but it's not overpowering. I'm not great with patchouli but I honestly don't pick up on that note whatsoever. I love Gucci Bloom but think it's a bit too much, and Gorgeous Jasmine hit just the right spot. Sillage is more moderate, but I kept getting whiffs of it as I moved about and it smelled so wonderful. Longevity seems to be amazing; I sprayed it almost 24h and can still smell it on my wrists. A definite buy for me.

Let me just start off by saying I loved the smell of this one, I'm a sucker for jasmine scents, it reminds me of freshly done laundry on a Sunday morning. Just the warmth of it... This one and the magnolia one were my top 2 picks, but sadly I couldn't decide to buy it since the longevity of it was just too poor. For the price that it has I just couldn't justify buying it, so I'll just conform with sniffing it every once in a while when i visit the store.

This is the loveliest jasmine fragrance that I have personally ever smelled, which is unexpected considering Gucci hasn't made many fragrances that I feel personally drawn to. It's sweet and floral, but holds this unique ability to not come off as powdery or antique smelling; which I feel many floral scents do for me. I get a bit of citrus but it accompanies the jasmine note in the most perfect way. I envision a child of the forest to smell like this, something that was once a blooming field of flowers transformed into a living and breathing creature..it's wonderful. on the skin the bergamot note shines and casts a lovely bright glow over the fragrance! Worth a sniff if you like white florals mixed with soapy and bright notes.

A black pepper note always makes me hesitate, but here it truly elevates this gentle floral composition. You can smell how this was very close to being just another generic mall perfume yet it showed up unique and undeniably sexy.
hate it. don't waste your money

I feel like this is for a very mature woman, sophisticated, well mannered, coming from ancestral money. pleasant scent but doesn't scream for attention. since my budget is limited I will pass on this one but I'll admit it was an enjoyable scent nevertheless.

Unbelievable… what a gorgeous jasmine scent that makes me confused…? Pretty clean really really soft very soft jasmine not too modern not too granny just the middle even a young kid can pull this if she liked it but that doesn’t mean it isn’t a mature scent this is quite mature but without smelling old { modern but mature } The Jasmine is sooo strong to the level i can smell actually tuberose specifically on the drydown
no pepper no patchouli really muted down citruses I can’t smell that citrus much so so soft florals reminds me the littlest of olene diptique lasts less than hour and perform like nothing no performance but the scent is onn spottt really good smelling the heck soft and gorgeous i really like the scent but the performance is pretty much eau de cologne
Don't get much patchouli in this (perhaps at all), for anyone trying to avoid it. Floral opening, softer, slightly sweeter dry-down. Much prefer the dry-down.
fresh, granny, jasmine. Lasts longer than I’d like it to, does smell like an air refresher, the scent makes me sad, not sure why. Not very pleasant to me.
Overpriced and flat for the cost. Smells very synthetic, makes me sneeze.

Goes well with the gorgeous line - I'm not exactly sure I would ever buy it, but it's still a nice fragrance. Too much citrus for my liking, could do well without it. The initial spray was vegetal but once it settled it's a nice creamy, woody jasmine, sometimes a bit soapy. I like gardenia and orchid better than this.

This is definitely a mature scent but not in a bad “grandma” way, like a career driven lawyer who is a hobbyist gardener with a giant flower garden back at home waiting for her with a warm cup of jasmine tea after her long days of juggling cases. It’s a sweet but sophisticated Jasmine perfume, the kind you would wear to formal events or work.

It’s a very clean jasmine scent overall, the smallest touch of sweetness but aldehydic. It’s a softer jasmine too and has a very soft citrus dry down overall. I was given this as a gift from my mother as a “you’re a grown woman now” gift because I moved abroad alone in a country with 0 family, it’s the perfect scent to capsulate this mature period of my life and similar moments. I will savor this bottle throughout my adulthood as long as a I can.
smells like the inside of a Walgreens in a comforting way

This fragrance is okay. Not bad but not great either. It starts as a nice white floral scent but after a while it starts to develop into a cleaning product type of floral. It has no depth or anything that makes it stand out, which is something i’d expect from this brand and price point.

ultimate maternal scent. fresh laundry, spring flowers, and the soft, charged air right before a rainstorm. so spring. it’s clean but not sterile, floral without being overpowering. i've been told I smell "like a mother" when I wear it, and i think thats really sweet. cozy and comforting laundry notes are my fave. a very pleasant everyday scent that makes you feel put together.
Another white floral perfume radiating happiness. Jasmine here is not indolic, it's easily likeable and wearable. Safe blind buy in my opinion.

One of my all time faves. I have trouble with my body just absorbing perfumes, they just don't last on my skin for some reason, but I don't have that with this one or a lot of the gucci flora perfumes. It's not nuclear but it really does last! I'm not normally a fan of citrus smells but the jasmine mixes with the mandarin so nicely, it gives more of a bergamont/tea/cozy smell than an orangeade/summery/beachy citrus feel. I think the citrus just brightens and freshens it up a tad and makes it last. I get a lot of compliments when I'm wearing it!

Tested this in Sephora. The jasmine was recognizable from the start, and reminded me of many other popular jasmine scents although it's softly rendered here. As it was drying down, I liked it more and more as the jasmine became a bit greener and sweeter. The magnolia adds a softy, waxy creaminess, and in the base I got something a bit powdery-musky like a woody musk and hint of tonka more than patchouli. Patchouli was not a main player here. Started out a bit generic, but in the end this was a love for me. Enjoy!

This is my work scent. I got it as a gift, and It's just a nice, agreeable, laundry-like Jasmine scent. I don't like wearing my super favorite scents to work because I don't want that association, so I just wear this which is nice and pleasant.

Agree with previous reviews. On skin and clothes, I got a detergent note not in a good way. It reminds me of Dove deodorant, the original creamy one. It made me feel like I applied this kind of deodorant all over. Not pleasant at all.

Very pretty, but does not merge with my skin type.

A cold, mentholated jasmine bush. A high-end bathroom freshener. The smell of cleanlyness with a hint of Mugler Alien.
I usually like jasmine, but while this is relatively genetle, it has a certain powdery skank about it. It smells quite off on skin, like something diry under something clean, but in the air and on paper it smells just like a high-end soap.

I really do not fancy the underlying powdery, skanky note, but enjoy the top-heavy mentholated realistic jasmines.
Weird one.

Számomra átlagos illat. Fiatalos, hétköznapi, virágos fűszeres. A bors, benzoin, szantál, pacsuli adja a testét, ezen ül a lucskos jázmin. Fűszeres virágillatok kedvelőinek. Olcsóbb virág illatú folyékony mosószert használok, arra kísértetiesen hasonlít.

Initially: the cramped laundry room in a college dorm which has seen every brand of laundry detergent known to man but you can't deny that it smells pretty good when you walk in (compared to the mold/BO smell in the rest of the dormitory)
Then: less like laundry and more like a basic woody floral, not bad, but not special
Finally: the air freshener spray your grandma keeps in her bathroom

I normally love jasmine so blind bought this without hesitation after finding it heavily discounted, but my nose just interprets this as dryer sheets. It just smells so... sterile and flat. Like freshly laundered clothes, but I don't want to smell like freshly laundered clothes, I want to smell of jasmine! I feel like I have been catfished, but serves me right for blind buying I guess.
Smells quite fresh and green, not too common-smelling either. Perfect for spring and summer.

got this in the sephora birthday set. was expecting to not like it, BUTS ITS SO YUM. very cute and dainty sweet flowers in my little flowy dress energy. not sure if I would ever purchase or have as everyday but very nice

I usually do not prefer floral fragrances, but I have tested this one many times and think that it is nice for a floral. It smells like classic jasmine. It is even on my wishlist, which is crazy bc of the price, though I hope the beautiful bottle isn't influencing me too much.

just impulsively bought this from the airport duty free. £73 well spent I'd say. Smells like springtime and childhood running through grass and falling over playing football and crushing flowers between your fingers and also just a tiiiiny bit like my nan
Smells like the laundry detergent aisle at Target. Stings the nostrils.

Out of the Flora range, this might be my favorite so far. The jasmine here is soft and mellow, nothing like the sharp jasmines I’ve recently sampled. It’s been blended into a much gentler, more atmospheric scent. It has a rainy, fresh-green vibe, it feels like a bouquet of wildflowers after a spring shower. For some reason, I get a violet note, even though it’s not listed. Maybe it's just nostalgia, as it reminded me of picking tiny violet bouquets as a child. It has that tender, dewy innocence.

The scent is simple, but in a way that works. Lovely, but very one-dimensional. This doesn't smell like a designer fragrance in terms of depth or complexity. If I found this at a drugstore for €20, I’d buy it without hesitation. But at full price, it doesn’t deliver on the luxury front, especially considering the poor longevity.

Still, it’s a beautiful option if you prefer fresh florals over sweet or gourmand scents (like I do). It’s elegant in a quiet, soft way. I haven’t tried Gorgeous Orchid yet, so the verdict on the full range is still open, but Jasmine definitely stands out for now.

I probably will not buy this unless I get a good deal because of the aforementioned laundry/artificial smell which is more obvious when it dries down. Fresh bright green and citrusy notes in this fragrance highlight the smell of jasmine and I especially enjoy the heady muskiness of the jasmine sambac.

I can agree with the previous review's observation about this fragrance having an almost "cheap" undertone. It has a rather one-dimensional quality, which was ultimately disappointing. The scent is bright and floral, featuring fragrant jasmine. While it’s not bad by any means and I still find it quite pleasant, I don’t find it particularly interesting. I often find myself reaching for this perfume on mild spring days when I'm unsure of what to wear. It feels safe, clean, slightly citrusy, and brings to mind awkwardly posing for Easter pictures with my family.

I love jasmine sandalwood and patchouli, so I had high hopes for this one. Oh boi. So, it's not thaaat baaaad...
The opening citrusy notes clash with the patchouli, giving a sharp cheap undertone to the whole thing right at the start, but after that cacophony dies down, I get a the most plain boring woody flower scent I can imagine.
The scent is quietly sitting close to the skin as if it was ashamed of itself for resembling a cheap Avon fragrance, and quite frankly, it should be.

i honestly love this perfume, its a unique scent to me because you do get the clean jasmine smell but you also get hints of rose and there's a little ?kick? idk how to describe it but its a good type of "kick" i never knew what it was until now, its the black pepper. this is my favorite jasmine perfume ever and probably top 5 floral perfumes with gucci bloom and gorgeous gardenia. its very soft and feminine i saw a review saying its unisex but i dont think so at all, its a bit overpriced but if you can splurge buy the big bottle youre going to want to pour this all over. it has average longevity and projection i wish it lasted longer.

I liked this on paper, but on my skin, it really just smells like baby wipes. I'm generally a fan of white florals, but I think this perfume showed me that I need more greenness and freshness with them than I'm getting here.

This is my least favorite fragrance in the range so far.

Not because it’s bad, but because I find it quite dull and flat: Flora Gorgeous Jasmine smells like clean jasmine, nothing more, nothing less.

I think it will appeal to fans of subtle, clean, or white floral fragrances, but it’s missing something to truly excite me.

I just could'n belive my luck, cause l got this beautiful perfume for a steel, for only 20$ (200Nkr), the shop was moving, so, l also bought another 4 different bottles...

And, it's a BIG, full, 3.3FL.OZ bottle! -Shit always happens, but sometimes dreams come true, l have been sniffing and sniffing this gorgeous perfume for so many ys now, and friday 11th of april was defently my lucky day!

This perfume is sjasmin, and moore sjasmin, and l absolutely love sjasmins, l have a few bottles of sjasmin-perfumes, but this one "take the cake", norwegian say, and, but/hmm/yes, there is this slightly public toilett smell to it, but in fact it's a compliment, cause we all love this (fill in) good stuff!

This perfume smells like when u just open a water bottle and jasmine, in a good way! It’s incredibly refreshing, wonderful for summer days, it smells like fresh linen and jasmine or idk it has a very nice clean, morning dew smell into it that makes it different from other jasmine smells and that I personally love. I wouldn’t blind buy this fragrance bc of how overpowering the jasmine + mandarin combo might be for some, but if you like jasmine scents then definitely go to a shop and give it a spray!
I love jasmine scents and this one is soooo nice. It smells exactly like Rishi jasmine tea.

Couldn't agree more with @breakfastreason
this is what I feel, and it's very screechy to me.
so sad😭 because I really like the perfumer.

mfg: 2022

I thought I would love this because I absolutely love anything jasmine-forward, but I didn’t get the jasmine at all, mostly just the citrus notes and rose. I swear whoever named this scent Jasmine is trying to prank everybody. Upon first spray, it immediately smelled super familiar to me, it reminds me of Febreze air freshener almost exactly. Super disappointing!

An inoffensive light, well rounded, fluffy perfume.
I would say this is great for winter days or summer nights (in BC)

I can't believe I contemplated returning this! It was a blind buy from Costco. Out of the box I sprayed it and thought I will return this. I usually go for gourmand scents. I decided to give it a chance on my Saturday at home. I used it after my shower and it has been so beautiful all day long.
This is like a jasmine assemblage. This also screams heavy floral and is more of a grandma-ish scent to me. I get a lot of the jasmine but not much of the citrus. I love how 'old' smelling this is.

Jasmine flowers without anything earthy or green, very clean white floral. Dries into a buttery sandalwood on me. Unique and 100% unisex. Citrus? Pepper? Rose? Patchouli? Not really. This is a white floral forward.

I tried it at the Gucci store and I decided to buy it for my wife, because I knew I would love to smell it on her.

A pure white floral scent, luxurious and elegant, it enhances her gentle beauty. My wife is not a person who is passionate about scents like me, but she was very happy and loved this gift because it was a gift from me, she also uses it every day because the scent is very pleasant

Old Fashioned classical most natural smelling jasmine and that dirty vibe is from the Sambac jasmine from India it’s very oriental
Love how relaxed I feel upon using this out of the whole line I like this the best I thought I would like this the least
Funny

Beautiful scent 🩷🌸 in my opinion, but whoever says this lasts long is lying. After two hours or so it is completely gone. This is the only reason I will not buy it, it's so sad since I love how it smells.

Edit: I couldn't resist and bought a 10 ml travel size bottle so I can keep it in my handbag and reapply during the day. Love it.
Libre but fresh and soapy. Can't decide if I like it or not
It smells like a jasmine scented dryer sheet, but in the most beautiful way. It's soft and comforting. I love it, I just wish it lasted longer.

I sprayed this once onto my shirt today at around 2 pm. The jasmine smelled a bit artificial, in that it was not photorealistic and one dimensionally sweet/floral. However, it's now 10 pm and I keep getting whiffs of One Day's Jasmine Tea (a favourite of mine), even though I've not applied it. I suppose the dry down might be similar? Either way, I'm pleased.

I absolutely LOVE this fragrance. It smells like fresh laundry on a warm summer day. Jasmine at its very best form !! It’s warm, soft, clean, skin-like, day time, night time, all seasons; I LOVE IT. Good sillage and lasts long too! 10/10 !

It's like a clean fresh aroma.
I don't think it's something special.

This is a clean jasmine scent, kinda soapy and herbal. I don't find it sweet or bubblegummy, to me it has tart citrus in the top but as it dries down it becomes a white floral lotion type of scent, rounded and a bit creamy in a clean way.
Beautiful but overpriced. No citrus.
Smells like grape juice to me idk lol😭😭 I actually bought it because it smelled like grape juice, but it dries down to a beautiful jasmine scent (which I don’t love)

very jasmine forward. i swear i smell ginger or something herbal scented in here, i'm not really into ultra floral perfumes but i can admit this one is pretty nice. it smells very soapy but still in a very perfume type of way.

It has a vintage vibe indeed and smells of body lotion, and not the good scented kind… I really like the Flora line but I think they did Jasmine dirty. The other ones are so pretty, while’s this one is more of an old lady fragrance.

need this shit injected into my VEINS expeditiously but also the longevity is so ass :( the citrus keeps it so fresh and as a jasmine lover this is so SCRUMPTIOUS to me i just wish it would last longer than 20 minutes on my skin broo n e ways i'll be buying a full size and dousing myself in this ^-^

A beautiful elegant floral with a vintage vibe and a hint of fruits in the background. Reminds me a lot of La Prairie Life threads silver but less sharp, no aokmoss and easier to wear. Finished my 10ml decant and ordered a full bottle. I have some issues with the longevity as many fragranticans reviewers have pinpointed but still I like it a lot and I think it's worth the money.
So far, my favorite from the Gorgeous Collection, still got the Orchid to try out though.

Soft but fresh lovely floral. I had no expectations when I sprayed it, so it was a pleasant surprise. Not the biggest fan of those notes usually, but in this perfume they come nicely together. Would rate it 8/10.

Nice atomizer, cute bottle. Sprayed it about half an hour ago and I have gotten truly a lot of whiffs of it during this half an hour (and I love it)
Picked up on the pepper even before seeing / knowing what the notes were! Heavy pepper and soapy jasmine on my skin. Expect the spice to be forward. Surprisingly, I like it! 😃

I went into this fully expecting to hate it because I dislike every single top and heart note listed, but I can definitely say while I didn’t love it, it wasn’t unpleasant at all. This reminds me of walking through a flower garden after a spring rain; it’s very light and clean smelling. I am one of the people who thinks this is reminiscent to cleaning products or bathroom air freshner, but it’s not nearly as astringent or bitter. This one isn’t for me but if you like fresh/light citrus and sweeter jasmines, you’d probably like this.

This is now one of my staple perfumes. I love that it smells fresh and floral, but not overpowering. Most floral scents I've smelled in the past gave an old lady vibe. This one I think is a good middle ground. It doesn't feel too young, it doesn't feel too old lady-like.

i've made a review on this scent before but i love it so much im making a separate update. i will literally forever defend this fragrance. as a jasmine lover, this is truly the most beautiful, elegant jasmine. the black pepper note didn't make sense to me when i first sampled this, but it actually ended up being pretty prominent in a surprisingly good way. it gives a little kick to the fragrance, making it just unique enough but still wearable for daily use. i can see this fragrance working in all seasons and occasions too. the best out of all new gucci flora line imo!
LOVEEE so clean but has a warmer background to it. Super good for fall idk why

Judging by the list of notes, and my overall appreciation of Mr Morillas's artistry, and especially his many great creations for the house of Gucci, I should be enchanted by this fragrance. But, somehow, I'm not - in fact, I absolutely despise it. As several other reviewers have observed, this supposedly 'Gorgeous Jasmine' smells very synthetic, loud, syrupy even, with the note of sweet mandarine mixing horribly with jasmine and magnolia - they seem to highlight each others' worst facets. Although it's not listed, I could almost swear that there's some sweet peach in the mix, because my overall impression is that of a 1980s obnoxious scent to be worn with fuchsia power suits with enormous shoulder pads.
lovely, but you can just get a jasmine cologne instead of buying this. also, feels very soapy.
Mmm so yummy, i love idolic scents especially jasmine. I like the citrus and spiciness that sits on top of the heavy jasmine scent.

I’ve always loved jasmine perfumes, but when I first explored the Gucci Flora line, I ended up going with the Magnolia scent—it felt more unique and intriguing at the time. Still, every now and then, I find myself going back to the store to spray this one, and it gives off such a clean girl aesthetic that I’m constantly tempted to buy it.

I don't want to be a hater, but this is the worst type of jasmine perfume to me. The word that comes to mind is stinky. Remember scent is subjective haha, if you love this I have nothing against that. I truly love jasmine, but this reminds me of bathroom air freshener in the worst way. Sorry Gucci!

This is a very "perfumey" perfume. So technical, I know. I got this as a blind buy on discount, and couldn't pass up the deal. I'm deciding what I think of it for a scent for me. I like it on paper- but when I spray it on my person it's very overwhelming. Strong floral, strong perfume scent, and hits me very hard. I'm hoping the dry down reveals more layers. The bottle is very classy, and the perfume is well constructed. I tried the Orchid and I loved it, so I took a chance on the Jasmine.

I've been working on going thru my already-owned fragrances before purchasing more, but as soon as I'm back in the market for spring/summer fragrances, I'm 1000% sure this is going to be my choice. Whenever I'm near a perfume counter (even with much more "interesting" perfumes) I always make sure I get a spray of this. It's so bright, but not too light, and refreshing without being a freshie.

It's like the most beautiful jasmine soap scent. If you're someone who wants to smell like you just took a shower with a luxury soap all day (like I do), this is your girl. She'll make you smell clean and put together. My dream fragrance for the past year or so. I'm so excited for when I get to finally buy this.

I typically gravitate toward dirty, indolic jasmines, but this fragrance is absolutely STUNNING. I fall firmly into the "smells like fresh laundry" camp—but imagine the most luxurious, bougie laundry scent possible. And really, who doesn’t want to smell like fresh, clean laundry? It has that white flower creamy quality that elevates it even further.

I pick up more magnolia than jasmine here, but that’s not a bad thing—I love magnolia too. While magnolia can sometimes feel more mature in fragrances, that’s not the case here. This scent stays close to the skin, but I can smell it on myself all day, and it lingers on my clothes into the next day, and I'm a smoker. The first time I smelled it, my eyes practically rolled back in my head—it’s that good. I adore this fragrance, and it’s easily one of my all-time favorites.

That said, it's a bit expensive for the longevity and silliage. But I'd buy it again and again just so I can smell it all day.

The Jasmine is green and cool, but it's too soapy, like Jasmine soap. I'm a girl who loves Jasmine, but I don't like this fragrance.

Rating: 6/10

I know there are other notes here besides jasmine, but they’re very subdued. I like this scent fine, but other jasmine scents I LOVE have something making them punchier and less synthetic/dryer sheet-esque. Poor longevity. Might reach for this again to try in warmer weather.

Beautifully done, not the most scandalous or provocative but unique enough for me to have reached for the deluxe bottle and to keep my nose where I sprayed. I have my fair share of jasmine perfumes and this one is calmer on the note, like literally jasmine hit a xanax and is relaxed. The florals are soft delicate round no edges smooth just shaven BIKINI WAX, but again not provocative just smooth. Dare I say it's almost lactonic how creamy these florals get.

I like the dry down on the perfume better than the initial spray, but after a couple of hours my spray is nearly completely gone. I usually love vanilla perfumes, but the other perfumes in this line are a lot better. And if you are looking for a vanilla based perfume there are better options. Again it’s not horrible after the dry down, I could see myself using the rest of my travel size just to get through it but I don’t see myself purchasing this again.

I get almost a gardenia opening, then it settled to White Shoulders with mandarin and other citrus notes. There's a nice tart edge as it dries down to a tartly floral spring feel, but be prepared for Big White Floral, which is really what this is from start to finish. But it's a nice entry in the BWF pool.
Bright and green in the beginning, after being sprayed it fills out to get the citrus and a fuller, riper jasmine. Pretty, elegant more than sweet, smells like pollen.

One of the most beautiful jasmine floral fragrances, EVER made.
It's a fresh scent, a little soapy, some bubblegum, airy, sweet.

This is a beautiful, RADIANT jasmine cantered fragrance with high projection and silage.
It's a little fun, very feminine. Absolutely captivating.

This one will totally encapsulate you and everyone around you in a glorious bubble of fresh & fizzy jasmine.. you will get compliments, people will stop and ask you what you're wearing.
It lasts on my clothing for days.
This is a perfect fragrance for the warmer weather or just sunny winter days.

This is a fragrance that I will be repurchasing again and again.
Meh clean jasmine shampoo. Useful if you wish to wear something you don't wish to offend or want to remember.

sweet opening notes, but nothing special really. kinda smells like clean laundry, I guess becauss of citrus and white flowers. but not in a clean way, more like strong detergent. Too expensive for the non originality of the scent. It lasts couple of hours on the skin , though, that's the benefit.

This smells so good on paper, it has a fresh, clean, jasmine scent that's reminiscent of fresh laundry detergent (in a good way) and I love it. Out of all the gucci floras this is my fav

However, on my skin, the initial fresh laundry smell fades and I'm left with just straight jasmine, which is not a bad thing but it smells almost exactly like my oakcha jasmine blossom, which is a gucci bloom dupe. My oakcha perfume has a slightly sweeter jasmine scent compared to gucci flora jasmine's dry down.

I really did want to buy this because I absolutely love the initial spray. Sadly, the fresh and sweet smell doesn't last on my skin and I might as well stick with my oakcha jasmine blossom.
very clean and fresh, the scent makes me happy and interestingly lasts longer than I expected. I am using a tester and I am thinking of buying it when it runs out.

smells AMAZING, how do people get it to last longer than half an hour?! after about an hour there’s only the slightest scent trail left :( such a beautiful elegant floral fragrance only wish the longevity was longer :((

This is the best out of Gucci's Gorgeous line, IMO. Very sweet, extremely soapy jasmine, and I mean that in a good way. This has a very expensive, elegant smell to it that's perfect for when you want to smell like feminine floral perfume.

No, Gucci didn't reinvent the wheel with this one, but some days I want a break from the more unisex/niche/clean fragrances that have been popular in recent years and just smell like a fancy lady.

This is STRONG. One spray to the chest from a sample vial before bed, and this morning I keep smelling jasmine-forward fresh laundry still at 10 a.m. When I first sprayed it last night it represented pepper so well. The pepper is there, not merely listed. GFGJ smells verrrry similar to Viktor & Rolf Good Fortune- just swap the vanilla in GF for a pepper note. In full drydown the pepper is not as noticeable; but gosh darn it's so interesting while it's there! Gucci Flora Gorgeous Jasmine honestly kinda surprised me, because Gucci Flora fras are typically so tame- and dare I say... boring? It's a perfectly inoffensive, fresh, clean laundry white floral bouquet featuring jasmine, gardenia, tuberose, magnolia, and freesia. ALL the fragrant white flowers. Hyper feminine- I can see Lana del Rey wearing this when she wears a crisp white blouse or T-shirt, jeans, and her famous 🩰. 🕊️

I absolutely love this scent. Fresh, literally gorgeous Jasmine. Hand soap, laundry detergent. This will make you smell like you just showered with citrusy Dr. Bronner's after a long day of laboring behind the counter in the flower shop. I wear it every day when I can.
That said, absolutely not worth the price for how long it lasts. Will get you compliments when someone's close enough to smell your neck, but with the measly amount you'll be applying to make it last the sillage isn't going to be much more voluminous than that.
I LOOOVE it it smells so clean so freshy so floral it's adorable
This scent would be lovely as a hand soap. I love it on the paper strip. Not crazy about it on skin. She's basic. 5/10
mmm laundry soap meets purple cough syrup in the most perfect way

Long lasting expensive soap bar scent.

Reminds me of the Palmolive soap bars from the 90s.. were very glamorous and luxurius to me back then.
First of all, ew. Second of all, ew.
I looove this! It is so fresh and clean and also sweet! Strong on the jasmine! I love how this is not a scent for everyone. Not blind buy safe imo
Fresh and sharp laundry scent. It reminds me of laundry soap and smells so clean--great to spray on clothes for the gym.

As someone who loves both jasmine and shampoo-ey scents, this was not for me. It's fairly generic but stilll very nice on paper and in the opening, but it dries down to a dirty, screetchy, patchouli-jasmine mess on my skin. I think this is my skin's fault though, to be fair, as someone who doesn't usually do well with patchouli.
Idk but it smells like a tuberose scent to me, it reminded me l’interdit at first. A versatile scent both suitable for daily use and a date night. Its a like for me

A nice, simple jasmine soliflore fragrance. I can hardly detect any other notes right after spraying. Base notes are almost non-existent. This jasmine is fresh, clean but the whole scent fades qiuckly and it lasts only about 90 minutes. And that's all...

As others have stated, this scent is reminiscent of a generic, jasmine scented dryer sheet. I appreciate a cleaner take on jasmine as sometimes it can be overwhelmingly indolic, but this scent just doesn’t hit the mark for me. Not awful to the nose, but not something I would be willing to spend money on. Appropriate for a work scent. Your coworkers will just think that you went a little crazy on the fabric softener.

This is a soapy fresh jasmine. It’s what I imagine a shampoo commercial smells like but still feels sophisticated and “perfume-y”. It’s not as sweet as magnolia or gardenia but still in line with the Gucci Gorgeous family.
This is for the girls who dream of becoming cool old ladies in the future

The opening is very citrus menthol urinal cakey

The dry down leaves a scratchy soapy Jasmine with fleeting wafts of pear hard candy and funky, kind of poopy rose and musk.

It's an expensive bathroom for sure, but a bathroom none the less.

Really love the scent, right after spraying you get the mandarin and the bergamot but once it settles you start getting the gorgeous jasmine notes, a very creamy white flower scent, id say plus the dna of gucci makes it feels expensive and rich (there are some cheap fragrances with jasmine in it ive smelled that i cant stand bc of how sweet and powdery its cloying) but this one keeps it classy and i love that, for me its not an old lady smell since its not very powdery, i think what keeps it lively and youthfull are the citrics and the magnolia!

What is very sad is that it doesnt last much longer than maybe 3 hours for me, the silliage was okay for the first hour or two! Thanks to that i dont think its a buy for everyday use like the only one thing to have on your vanity but if you are a jasmine lover it could do it for collecting it!!!

Very nice and pretty Jasmine scent. Appreciate the spiciness coming from the black pepper as well. Quite reminiscent of Givenchy’s L’Interdit. Lasting power is OK but it’s definitely a safe blind buy.

This perfume was nice but it didn't wow me in any way. It's what some would define as an "older lady" scent, predominantly white florals and a hint of fresh pear here and there. It has mediocre staying power on the skin and doesn't project much. It would be hard for me to pick this out from a crowd of florals, as the scent is not memorable. It's not bad, just not great.

An easy reach in spring. This is an *almost* loud jasmine fragrance, with virtually no other notes. I don't pick up the citrus in this at all. And while it may be a bit cloying in the beginning for some, I do think it settles into the skin really nicely. There is little to no progression with this fragrance; it's very linear. It smells floral and warm to me without feeling super heavy or old lady. That being said, I wouldn't buy a full bottle of this. I think it's a nice, straight-up floral fragrance, which is why I bought it, but it's not something I'd wear all the time.

I had to wash it off after half an hour. I had no idea that jasmine could be screechy, but this was an utter nightmare. Just a harsh, cheap smell of dollar store hand soap. God willing, it smells better on you!

Not something that I'd usually wear, let alone buy, but I was sent a sample of it and I decided to give it a sniff. I think it's a very nice, well-rounded white-floral scent, but the benzoin and sandalwood at least make it moderately balmy and perhaps a little creamy. It smells fairly full and round and borderline old-fashioned--let's say classical. It's probably only about half as balmy as the hyper-balmy Clinique Aromatics Elixir (and barely a tiny fraction as complex), but I did initially think that this might, like Elixir, contain myrrh or something similar, as opposed to--as I now see--benzoin. There is a certain sweetness to the ambery aspect but it's all in keeping and not at all obtrusive.
Smells like 80's handsoap or shampoo.
Oddly very bubblegum-y on me. Concentrated in Jasmine in a soapy way
Okay, with this one.. it is very sweet-flowery musk scent. When you spray it, it will make you smile.

I no longer crave buying new fragrances, constantly trying out new fragrances...
The best scent on the market imho. It's so perfect.
L'Interdit's distant cousin.
Amazing longevity on my skin.
Projection - also amazing.
Pleasant and light-not sweet at all. Nice summer scent. Very poor longevity, I smelled nothing by lunchtime and had to reapply. I would expect better from something so expensive.

nothing special just a little generic clean floral perfume. not too citrusy, not fruity or sweet. little bit soapy and creamy.
good for summer/spring or daily use. ok for office or public transport. Jasmin sambac is a note which i am not a fan of. i didnt dislike it but i am not going to buy a full bottle also. tried from a sample.
Fresh floral fruity and herbal on my skin. I smell mostly bright fruits and jasmine. Pleasant and light

Jasmine sounded great but I was extremely disappointed by the scent. It smells a lot more synthetic than anticipated.
It’s not that it’s a bad smell, it’s that I feel like I smell nearly the same wearing clothes fresh out of a dryer that had scented dryer sheets. To me, this perfume is a bottle of designer dryer sheet. I do enjoy the smell occasionally, but to me it is pointless to spend such a large amount of money when I can get that same florally synthetic scent from a $5 product I buy regardless- the sillage and longevity probably being the same or longer.

i really want to like this scent and feel a bit bummed i don't like it. on me it smells very synthetic and while this description feels a bit crass, it really reminds me of public bathroom air freshener. i just feel overall disappointed, it's nowhere near as fresh and light as i was expecting, it's oddly heavy and overwhelming.
It's just ok to me. Reminds me of every other popular fragrance right now: paradoxe, voce viva, born in roma, but with the addition of a laundry sheet scent. It's nice enough, but doesn't stand out.

GJ is soft, sueded, lightly spiced without indoles. Skin friendly, sweet(ish), beginner friendly Jasmine. Smells classy, expensive and sultry. This is the perfect jasmine for those graduating out of gourmand or very sweet perfumes and want to branch out a bit. The jasmine sweetens on the skin in a very vanilla type of way. A reviewer called it a Jasmine milkshake and to my nose I agree with this. The pepper smells nutty but not cloying. The drydown is almost but not quite lactonic and nutty, despite being clean and not being indolic or having musks there are sweetly erotic undertones that will have people sniffing closer. Smells like a high end department store perfume.

I much prefer Magnolia because it’s just more of a standout, slightly stronger and more soapy. In comparison, Jasmine is still beautiful but not mind-blowing. Regardless it is a lovely, dainty scent. I highly recommend the entire Flora line as it is inoffensive, delicate, and beautiful for warm weather.
What a gorgeous scent. Everytime I wear it I get compliments 🩵💙

I’m reviewing this right after Gorgeous Magnolia. They’re nothing alike besides being white floral fragrances.

Opens with jasmine and citrus. It has a strong white floral that is the fresh, projecting type. It does not go laundry detergent, too green, or creamy. It’s more like petals. For some reason, my nose thought pink pepper may be in here but checking the notes, there’s actually black pepper! It adds some warmth.

After the opening, I’m detecting more florals other than jasmine. They’re a bit nondescript. I think a bit of a fresh yet edgy rose. Plus it starts developing an ever so slight smoothness.

In the drydown, it’s sweeter and even smoother. I can’t say it’s creamy but it is smooth, slight powdery, vanillic, slight woody.

I do enjoy this more than I expected since I’m normally not a white floral fan. This treats the jasmine well and never lets it get overpowering by balancing it with bright peppery citrus and smooth ambery warmth. While it doesn’t seem unique, nothing comes to mind as a close comparison. I can see how people would say YSL Libre since the jasmine gets a radiant quality into the drydown that smells like the jasmine in Libre. However, the lavender in Libre makes it very different. This would be a great signature scent for a white floral lover.

Beautiful Jasmine scent. reminds me of the transition from summer to fall playing in my parent’s front yard near the garden. sits beautifully in my hair and on my clothing so much so that your hugs linger longer because everyone who smells you will feel a little nostalgic too. grandma-ish in the best way possible.

Smells just like Downy Unstoppables Fresh scent beads, but in a good way.
I lean more towards gourmands - but after smelling a sample, I ended up purchasing a full bottle.
A floral perfume for those (like myself) who think they don’t like floral fragrances.
My favourite out of the three in this line.

My mind is recollecting something very familiar from '80ties when smelling this one - haven't yet found what it is, though. I like this a lot, jasmine here is subtle yet detectable and not pungeant or harsh as in some perfumes it tends to be. Well made, vivacious, spring-like scent. The staying power could be better though.

I bought this one about a week ago, sampled it at the store first and wasn’t too sure about it due to it being a straight up floral. I’m a jasmine lover, all of my perfumes have jasmine in but they are mixed with fruits and sweetness. My only other floral jasmine is alien EDT which has mandarin and orange in there which you can really detect. That is not one I would wear for the day time though…

but when it comes to gorgeous jasmine it is just one big jasmine BOMB from start to finish on me, (the clue is in the name but a lot of people have said the jasmine isn’t that strong) I can also notice the rose though as it dries down but mostly the jasmine. I kept getting whiffs of this all day from the sample and really started to like it more and more. So much so that I went back and purchased the 100ml gift set.

It’s fresh, clean and reminds me of holidays. It reminds me of being in the sun all day, getting showered, putting a beautiful floaty dress on and spritzing this before you go out for food and drinks in the evening. We have reached summer in the uk and are having a few days of nice sunny warm weather and gorgeous jasmine is perfect! I’m wearing it a lot during the day, it’s really refreshing. I know a lot of people have said it smells like soap or laundry detergent and I might be the only one who says this….but it also reminds me of suntan lotion, I think it’s just because it has that summer vibe too it.

On me this is absolute beast mode, I only need a little bit of this because it projects like mad and it lasts soooooooooo long on me. I can smell it for hours and hours!

If you’re not sure about this one at first, spray and let it settle, don’t write it off too quickly because if you are looking for a fresh, clean, summer scent then this could be what you are looking for. 😊

i am a big jasmine lover, and im always on the hunt for jasmine-dominated fragrances. flora gorgeous jasmine is a fresher type of jasmine rather than indolic and animalic to my nose. i have a sample of this from last year and she was fresh, light, and soft from what i remember. i just sprayed it again recently and it was surprisingly sweet? i dont recall it being this sweet from when i first tried it. overall, very soft and safe jasmine scent (obv for jasmine lovers and not people who despise white florals) that is a bit soapy. currently looking at my bank account figuring out how to afford the full bottle one day :(

edit: finally got a 1oz bottle and im absolutely in love. the scent is soo soothing and relaxing to me, its just very pleasant to smell. it also last a pretty long time, i sprayed in on a test strip that i left on my desk — i could still smell it whenever im walking past my desk for at least the next 2 days.

This is a safe buy, girly, intimiate, soft and sweet. Juvenile kind of sweet with a soapy undertone, and plastic-y in a way. The longetivity is a dissapointment to be honest, but what can you expect from a sweet designer perfume? Still, the bottle is beautiful, and since I recieved it as a gift I’m going to keep it and use it.
Great jasmine scent. It's fun and fresh but also has a mature scent. Perfect for spring and summer!
Easy to wear jasmine. Joyful sweet refreshing scent with uplifting start. Perfect for spring. Elegant bottle.
delicious and sexy jasmine scent that is also fresh, light and airy. wish the longevity was more.

Great everyday fresh laundry detergent scent in a sexy way. Yes, sexy laundry detergent scent. Best during warm weather, the jasmine becomes more creamy and sultry then and less laundry. Not safe blind buy unless you love smelling like laundry detergent with a sexy twist 😆

this is my second designer perfume (other than my ysl one) and it's beautiful. this has such a beautiful jasmine scent and it blows my mind. careful to not spray too much though— in my case, too much of it can make it synthetic FAST. i adore it though. it also lasts pretty long.
I wanted to like this but it's smells so synthetic on me it's almost nauseating. :( I love jasmine, and I've loved literally every other perfume I've tried with jasmine in it, except this one.

I wore this to work 3 days last week (mandatory back to the office). I really enjoyed the bright citrus start on the 30 minute drive in the morning. I get a cross between an orange and a sweet-tart. I'm glad it is starting to fade into a good quality, albeit boring, shampoo by the time I've reached the office because my work place is somewhat conservative. It is almost perfect that the initial burst is bright and awakening for my morning commute yet so short-lived that most of the day is spent with a the completely generic shampoo smell so I am completely worry-free about offending anyone.

I just love the sandalwood in this. Jasmine and sandalwood are one of my few favourite notes. Blends nicely for me. Works well with my skin chemistry. It's lingering in my skin, my hair for 2 days now.

I love jasmine flowers but I don’t love this. It made me nauseous and I had to scrub. It’s not a natural smelling jasmine. I have a cheap jasmine body spray that cost me a dollar and smells like this.

This has a laundry vibe. It’s a light jasmine with little depth, little pollen. If you like soapy scents and jasmine, you should give this a try!

I'm not usually one to love a simple and fresh perfume but this is a really beautiful and simple fragrance. It smells like waking up one morning during your honeymoon in a big green European province. Clean sheets and a flowery breeze and your husband making your favorite tea while you plan what adventure you'll go on today. I have the mini version, I think it's cuter (and cheaper). Longevity could be better for Gucci. My boyfriend loves it and associates it with being 'my smell' since I wore it a lot in the summer when we met. I think I've grown out of it little teensy bit but I use it anyway.

when i first tried this it was too strong for me, but now i can definitely appreciate the blend of notes. very clean and soapy, sharp jasmine note. dry down is great. wouldn’t recommend bc there’s a dozen scents like this already that are more affordable.

Heavyyy soapy jasmine that almost stung my nose. That’s on me for blind buying i guess. This smells like detergent and flowers. A round and sharp scent, it has a nice creaminess to it. Becomes nicer on the dry down. Clean.

Compré Gucci Guilty Elixir pour homme, y de regalo recibí una botella de 30ml de esta fragancia. No me entusiasmó mucho el presente, primero porque es una fragancia para damas y no tengo a quién dársela, segundo porque pensé, si es regalo, tal vez es porque no es muy buena, no se vende y se quieren deshacer de ella. Pero educadamente agradecí el detalle.
Sin embargo, ¡oh grata sorpresa! Qué perfume tan agradable. Dulce, no exageradamente floral, con un toque cítrico y con un fondo con un toque, no se cómo explicarlo... ¿herbal-amaderado? que al menos para mi gusto, lo vuelve una fragancia un tanto unisex. Lo visto con mucho gusto, y estoy considerando comprar la botella grande. Ya veremos.

My favorite of the flora flankers! This is soooo beautiful. It has almost a soap-y, shampoo-y vibe to it. A very clean, refreshing jasmine and magnolia scent. I would definitely recommend this for spring days, a light, beautiful easy reach for daytime. Smells very shower fresh, I love how airy and feminine it is. A winner for me.

I think this is a very classy scent! It does have a vintage vibe to it (deffo intended) and I do adore that about it. Looking forward to wearing this when I feel like emulating a classy, sophisticated vibe.

This smells very light and clean. A good night time, out of the shower fragrance.

Longevity Low
Sillage Low

Really wanted to like it because I love the bottles and would have the whole collection but I only like Gorgeous Magnolia the lavender bottle.

I don’t know if I would recommend this to jasmine lovers. The type of jasmine I seem to be attracted to is deep, sensual, with other notes enhancing it with sweetness.

This just smells like… vintage fancy white soap.

No redeeming qualities about it. 100% no.
every time i sample this in store i have to resist my urge to buy the biggest bottle of this possible, and i usually don’t go for florals. one day she’ll be mine !!

It is straight up jasmine, sweet, creamy and powerful jasmine.
Unfortunately not the type of perfume that I like, if it had a citrus touch that would balance the jasmine, it would be nice, but it is so dense and creamy... It reminds me of the smell of flowers in a cemetery! 😓
If you have been to one of those Chinese stores and smelled those jasmine air fresheners you will know exactly what this perfume smells like.
I had to take it out of my skin and it's really long lasting, too bad for me, but if you like these types of smells, this one will probably last a long time!
Very youthful jasmine scent with some sparking qualities. Drydown smells like kids shampoo, but to be honest, I dont think it smells bad if you want to project youthful/inocent vibe.
It really is gorgeous jasmine :)

I have a few Jasmine scents, my Favorite being TF Jasmine Rouge. I love this. The drydown is similar to TFJR, but the opening is different. To me, I got the smell I would get when I'd ride by bloomed Jasmine on the lawnmower. It made mowing exciting. Very realistic to me. TFJR is a beautiful Jasmine/Orange Blossom scent to me. That's the difference. Both are stunning. Please research all of these fragrances & don't buy from places like "Ulta" if you don't need it right away. That's what drives the costs of these up so much. If people pay top dollar, they will keep going up. Perfumes like this are too much trouble to make a fake. Thats usually going to be Creeds, TF, or Bond 9s, or higher. Top $$$$$ ones. LOVE this!
I prefer richer deeper jasmines this one is artificially sweet and gets lost with the citrusy top notes. It smells like bathroom air freshener and it's too mature for my skin chemistry.
This is a lovely fresh jasmine sent... too bad it has poor performance on me. For the price, I was expecting more than 3hrs.
smells good on testing paper, but bad on me; very classical jasmine; cause nausea

I love the smell. I got this as a gift from my friend. I have never really went for a jasmine scent so this is first time owning this type of scent. It smells like a soft soapy jasmine scent. Easy to wear and not offensive at all!

I typically would never like any jasmine themed perfumes, I do not like white floral perfumes - period. The longevity is two to three hours and the sillage is minimal, two strikes that would usually turn me away.

But this one took me by surprise. I got a sample and wore it for a week straight as I sat at my desk working. I had to keep reapplying every few hours but I didn’t care bc the fragrance brought me so much joy every time I smelled my wrist. As hard as I tried not to like it, by the end of the week I was absolutely in love with it. I wish I could make my entire body smell like the first 20 minutes of this perfume, from head to toe.

The final test of whether it was true love or not came when I had my boyfriend smell my wrist. He pretty much hates all perfumes, it’s extremely rare for him to like any scents. I let him smell the first wrist, which i had freshly sprayed Gucci Gorgeous Jasmine on, and he looked pleasantly surprised & admitted he liked it. Then I had him smell the other wrist, which I had sprayed Gorgeous Jasmine on an hour prior so that it had time to settle in with my chemistry. He grabbed my wrist an exclaimed how much he liked it, he said he liked it even better than the other wrist. I instantly knew that no matter how much it cost I would immediately purchase it.

The scent is great indoors, although reapplying frequently is something you just have to deal with (the fragrance really is quite lovely on me). I think the scent profile best suits daytime in the spring & summer, but is also very nice to wear around the house before bed. I’d even say it’s sexy and would be great to wear as you snuggle up next to your lover in bed.

However, I wore this at Disney World in the summer heat of August in Florida, and even though I reapplied at every bathroom break, the longevity just couldn’t keep up. In the sweaty heat the beautiful scent would disappear literally after 15 or 20 minutes. This scent would be absolutely perfect to wear to the beach or for any outdoor activity but honestly it wouldn’t last in either of those situations, although I wish it would. What is going on with perfumes these days? Nothing last like it used to. I don’t understand why the price point is so high if you have to reapply every two to three hours INDOORS (outdoors, every ten minutes).

Overall, I truly love this scent and anticipate purchasing another bottle when mine runs out. That’s literally how much I love Gucci Gorgeous Jasmine.... I tried all of the other Bloom versions and none of them even came close to smelling pleasant on me! Gorgeous Jasmine was the only one that worked with my body chemistry & very well too!!

This is a floral one, a totally floral perfume. It is classy, very likeable for the office. I'm not much into florals, but this is a pleasant enough one for me to like. It smells professional and clean.

Didn't test on my skin, but this was repulsive. Smells like strong cough syrup. Super sticky chemical scent. Bathroom potpourri vibes. Pretty bottle - I adore this era of Gucci cosmetics/fragrance packaging. Great gowns, beautiful gowns...

Gucci Flora Gorgeous Jasmine (Green bottle) is such a lovely scent to my nose and body chemistry. It smells like gummy bears to me upon the fresh spray and it goes into a deep bouquet of pretty flowers with creamy jasmine to me.

It’s best to go and smell this on your own. All of us have different opinions and scent profiles. I give this a YES plus the bottle is beautiful too. ❤️
50% beautiful jasmine with a tropical vibe, 50% pot pourri rose bathroom freshener in a can (from the $1 store). A crying shame considering the bottle is a work of art.
This lacks class. Just a soapy jasmine scent, no depth.

This is today's sample scent. I hit a couple of duds over the last few days, and this one is the best of the bunch. It is pretty and light, and like other people have mentioned, it gives me a distinct laundry soap vibe. That isn't a bad thing, but not sure if it is worth the price point if that is all there is.

The performance isn't the best on me. It is down to a skin-scent on me in less than an hour, which is a bit of a shame. Probably not one I will be quick to add to the collection if that is the case.

What a disappointment.I love jasmine so I thought this could be the Gucci it could make me understand the buzz and the bottle is beautiful, but the opening is the more boring blast of jasmine, but a very turned of jasmine, damped and musty.
