In the drydown it turns a generic soap. It is not bright and happy or sensual at all.

This was a strong smell with very identifiable jasmine notes. In fact, the only thing I smell is an authentic planty jasmine smell. It's kind of literal. I could see this being useful for layering. I was not a fan as it was kinda just one note and boring smelling to me.

I bought this fragrance for my mother's birthday (she's been using Narciso for Her EDP for quite a while).
The smell on the mouillette was extremely "jasmine-y"; on me, it turned extremely green; on my mother, rather sweet, as if there was kind of a hint of vanilla to it.
It's worth to note that the sillage is heavy: one spray was enough to full the entire living room.
30 mL, almost €90: quite high price, but it's strong and it has an interesting evolution on different skins: it's not so female-directed in my opinion; it has more of a unisex vibe.

I like Gorgeous Jasmine better than the other two fragrances by Gucci in this line, but it is still not my favorite perfume.

I find the opening too citrusy and detergent like for my sensibilities and liking and the pepper note just made me sneeze throughout my wear of this fragrance. Thankfully this does get toned down fairly fast (within 45 minutes) throughout its wear though.

The heart notes are probably my favorite part of Gorgeous Jasmine, but I wish that the jasmine note was a bit stronger and the magnolia note a bit more subdued. I also didn't find the jasmine in this particularly natural smelling, though I wouldn't quite call it a synthetic jasmine either. I did not smell any rose in the heart notes really.

I didn't appreciate the really strong patchouli in the base and its combination with the very strong smelling and incense like benzoin. The amount of woodiness in the base was just right, though.

Gucci's Gorgeous Jasmine lasted precisely 6 hours on me and its sillage was moderate. It is a very feminine fragrance and a scent I could imagine a young woman wearing in either the spring or summer during the daytime, bar the office because of its pepper note.

This perfume was an almost like for me, but the citrusy notes, patchouli and especially the pepper ruined things for me a bit. That is why I'd give Gorgeous Jasmine by Gucci a 6.5/10.

At first, very floral-sweet .. I actually thought, “Oh! Honeysuckle!” But as it dries down, it gets a little headier, more indolic, and a bit spicy. Once most of that indolic quality fades, I was left with a very jasmine-rich laundry product scent (detergent? softener?) .. Fancy, designer laundry products, but laundry products nonetheless.

The cloud only lasts for about 4 hours and then it becomes a skin scent. But I’ll say that while that cloud’s around, it PERFORMS. Very strong, at least to my white-floral-sensitive (scent-sitive? haha) nose.

Fine but an easy pass for me.

From all Gucci of this family, Jasmine is my favourite. Magnolia and Gardenia are too sweet for me. I'm actually surprised as I thought jasmine is a strong sweet smell but this perfume is lovely. It is like green jasmine. I'm looking for more Guccis babies. Hope more green, refreshing and not sickly sweet.
Overpowering sweet synthetic smell. Doesn't remind me of jasmine at all.

My girlfriend came one day to me from the airport and she used a tester there of Gorgeous Jasmine.
I told her immidietly that she smells amazing and i couldnt stop hugging and kissing her.
Now i bought her this aroma for her birthday as she says is her favorite aroma now. For me as well is one of the best i have smelled on women.

A clean, refreshing light floral, perfect for spring and summer.. I bought it on impulse before my vacation as Gorgeous Gardenia has been a spring/summer favourite for 8 years now.

First impressions were good… soapy, citrusy, light jasmine but very faintly detectable darker woody undertones. I am a jasmine lover so I was expecting with more intensity. It’s not really my style as I don’t really go for fresh and citrusy fragrances.. but I make it work.

If you are into light and inoffensive floral fragrances then I really recommend this.

This is not a ‘grand gesture’, it produces light sillage and sits close to the skin, doesn’t last so long to the nose but sometimes I smell it on my clothes after a few hours. I’m often in the mood for skin scents these days anyway especially during the warmer seasons and casual days.

It doesn't smell like a classic floral to me. It is soapy and it is like laundry detergent. If you know similar perfumes please recommend me. Jasmine is a note i like if i cant detect it. Almost all the jasmine or white floral perfumes with jasmine inside is not for me. Headache inducing. But this is the best one so far and i want it. However i might get sick mid way

Oh, give me Jasmine scent any day! This one is on a waiting list to join my collection. I don't see any colourful pictures in my head, no attraction like it was an interesting person. It's not something I'll loose my sleep over. But it's jasmine and jasmine is enough. Maybe I'll find something jasmin based I'll love more. But this will not go wrong with me.

I’m really happy I bought this! There’s something familiar about it but then at the same time there’s not. It’s a very likeable jasmine and I think for people who do not like florals this may be a perfume that they would like as it’s not like fresh and clean floral, it’s warm it’s a little bit spicy it’s romantic. It is Gorgeous like in the name! And for me this is a perfume that transforms throughout the day/night I pick up on different elements of it which makes it really intriguing? While I’m having my morning coffee or while I’m out walking around I get different elements of this fragrance and I really like that.

I loved Emerald Gardenia but they discontinued it so I blind went for the travel spray of this. Not even remotely similar but I knew it wouldn’t be. It’s very clean floral, but it’s a scent that’s way too synthetic, and without much depth. The citrus and jasmine notes compete here rather than balancing each other or having any kind of opening effect to the fragrance. Very weak longevity on my skin. Kind of smells like if Tide tried to release a “luxury” detergent and called it something like “Sparkling Meadows”. Emerald Gardenia is light years better.

It gives me citrus cleaning agent but make it perfume. It’s not strong but just too citrusy for me. It’s an enjoyable clean scent she it gets smoother and slightly sweeter in the dry die’n but not worth it for me.

This smells like very nice laundry soap. The waxy, green, realistic jasmine scent is in there, but I genuinely think Gucci used aroma molecules traditionally reserved for soaps and detergents in this.

It's pretty, but it's boring, and the complimentary notes of citrus, wood, pepper, benzoin, and patchouli don't sing through enough. It's just a huge detergent bomb.

The price is outrageous for what it is.
A straight up, pretty jasmine scent. Not too heavy, a little sweetness, a pop of magnolia, and an earthy base.
Something about it makes me go hmmm... I like it. In the dry down there's this cloudiness to the scent that kind of masks my nose. In this sense, I wish it was more fresh.

That’s exactly what is says – Gorgeous Jasmine. I received a tester as a gift with my other purchase, and I must say I didn’t expect much because I am not very into realistic jasmine or hard-core white florals, but this is so beautiful! At first blast, it’s fresh and floral – just what you’d expect. Then, an hour or so later, jasmine blooms into more intense, soapier self that I would whole-heartedly recommend to all white-flower fans. Then rose joins it producing warmer, sunnier impression, and jasmine begins to remind me mock-orange flowers, which I adore, with slight accents of solar notes and green leaves. Then I begin noticing magnolia coupled with benzoin, reminding me a bit of Zara Violet blossom or even Mugler’s Alien. Then sandalwood adds substance and creaminess, making it warmer.

Also, ever-so-delicate patchouli keeping it mysterious with a cool waft here and there! The tester leaflet didn’t list patchouli note and I thought I was imagining it half of the day, until I looked GFGJ up here and was reassured that I’m not hallucinating.

This is the best jasmine that I ever tried – not too intense, but not obscured by other ingredients, rather, tenderly supported by them, like a flower floating in sweet nectar. Other jasmine scents often peddle jasmine so much that you would be better off just using essential oil instead. Yet Gucci Flora creates an impression of a fresh delicate flower on a green branch, and it’s lovely. It makes you feel lovely too. Very inspiring perfume.

If I had to ascribe a personality to it, I would say it’s a young girl walking in the morning to her first office job, full of hopes and ambition, willing to impress, but also daydreaming about love. She wears white blouse, minimalistic sparkles of jewelry, and wind is playing with her shiny loose hair.

I perceive it as a perfect day or even morning scent, lovely for spring, cooler summer days, and early autumn. It has the freshness and the warmth enough to cover most of the year except the dramatic extremes. I am so amazed by it that I must post it right away, so no comment on longevity yet, but I plan to update.

Beautiful jasmine. Puts Tom ford's jasmine scents to shame. I would still say diptyque's Do son is the best jasmine scent but this is also a bit more stronger of a jasmine that subsides relatively quick.

i really love this perfume... but the longevity on this one is weak!
3 hour wear for that price point? no no no!

it's such shame because it is beautifully blended with the magnolia, jasmine, citrus and rose!
i may end up selling this :/

At first spray, I could smell alcohol, mandarin and bergamot. Then after a while the magnolia and jasmine notes take over. Pretty floral innocent scent, which I like to use on summer days. Nothing particularly remarkable, it is overpriced. It doesn't last long either. The bottle is really nice though.

This is my absolute favourite these days😍
Love,love it 💞
It has a lovely,fresh scent which is longlasting on my skin.

I think I found my signature scent. I see why this is not for everyone but it smells amazing on my skin. 😍
Not a safe blind buy, I'd say.

According to Gucci, the new Gucci Flora's bottle is more elongated and is made with 10% recycled glass and lacquered with a water-based painting, now in turquoise. The floral pattern was created by artist and illustrator Vittorio Accornero in 1966.

The fragrance carries top notes of mandarin and bergamot from Italy, as well as black pepper; heart notes of Grandiflorum Jasmine absolute, Sambac jasmine absolute, magnolia, and damask rose; base notes of sandalwood from Australia, benzoin extract, and patchouli from Indonesia.

Upon touching the skin, Gucci Flora Gorgeous Jasmine explodes with a bright, clean floral bouquet. The citrus notes give vigor and transmit the solar and daytime side of the fragrance. And that's great, because most of the feminine fragrances that explore jasmine as the main ingredient, follow the sensual and nocturnal style that abuses the more indolic facets of the flower.

In Gucci Flora Gorgeous Jasmine, the freshest and greenest nuances exude without parsimony and gain the watery reinforcement of magnolia. But, for me, the rose note – little exalted in the concept – deserves a lot of praise. It brings all the cleansing content of the fragrance, working as the base of a luxurious and fragrant soap.

On my skin, everything is very linear and there is a feeling of losing strength during the evolution. But at different times, Gucci Flora Gorgeous Jasmine insists on exhaling and manages to prove itself resistant to time. And the sandalwood, in the base, sustains the smooth creaminess of this beautiful floral creation. Medium projection, but with good durability, at least on me.

Finally, I want to state my satisfaction with the floral packaging and the beautiful bottle of these new fragrances, which remind me of lacquered ceramic vases, stand out in any collection, and are far from conventional.

Gucci Flora Gorgeous Jasmine is not your traditional opulent jasmine scent, but a delicate and stimulating approach that lifts the mood and exudes quality. Gucci hit the nail again!

I pick up on a spicy mandarin/citrus at first spritz. Then after a few minutes the jasmine comes out. It has more of a refreshing feel than I was anticipating. Overall this is polite and pretty, and not too soapy to my nose. This would be a nice spring/summer daytime scent. On me this became barely detectable after 3-4 hours. I like it and would be tempted to get a bottle if it lasted longer.

It has a cleaning product smell, but for some reason I like that here….

The image I get is fun fresh grandma who’s scrubbed up and in one of her brightly patterned floral three pieces for church. I feel like this is best for teenagers and the over 60 set.

Smells like moth balls on jasmine. Smells really fake and overwhelming. All the nopes.

Ok. I jumped the gun. Two hours later it smells lovely. It’s just those first two hours…

Upon first spray FGJG had a promising opening. A bit too sharp for my taste, but still tolerable. Later in the dry down, the jasmine is clearly present along with the magnolia. I actually found the dry-down somewhat soft and enjoyable. Unfortunately, it's still not enough for me to pull the trigger for a FB.

I've just come to accept that my body chemistry just doesn't jive well with Gucci fragrances. But they sure do smell good on everybody else.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: it's an interesting floral scent, but the peony plus citrus scents throw me off. thankfully this is my mother's type of fragrance so she happily takes it away from me

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: perfume from childhood i remember fondly

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Really bitter at the front, and develops into the smell of department store. Middle of the road at best.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This smells like a pretty girl. It might not be mass apealing or sexy, but it feels peaceful, clean and sophisticated. It has the perfect balance among floral, citrusy, sweet and fresh. Luckily, I'm brave enough to wear in public whatever pleases me and not to please other people, especially men. But I never overspray any perfume because who knows, people can be sensitive to perfumes.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is a nice citrussy, floral gucci perfume. I like it, I wouldn't say I love it, I think it's slightly more mature fragrance. However my partner absolutely loves it!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
i think this is horrible & high key boring but i keep it and let the bottle get dusty because my mom got it for me for the sole reason that it bears my name and the whole thing sadly feels like an apt metaphor for our relationship...

edit:
writing this was an awakening and if someone is looking i have a 30ml bottle 3/4 full for sale with the gold cap.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: It’s okay, I don’t reach for it often though. It’s a classic and mature floral fragrance. A little close to vintage/perfumey/grandma vibes to my nose. Longevity and sillage are moderate to good for me.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: It’s weird that nobody mention that Flora is just the same that Laura Biagiotti’s Laura! I only smell peach and watermelon with floral notes, just like in Laura.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
this right here is the shittiest perfume I've ever regretted purchasing.
smells like a dentist cabinet and the medicinal accord does nothing for this uninteresting perfume, it's so badly blended it's almost a joke. I tried to find my old review just to see how much I was gaslighting myself into liking this mediocre fragrance lmao.
Everybody that commented on It was to let me know how bad it smelled :)
Doesn't smell like peonies, or spices. Or whatever floraly thing this was supposed to evoke, it's just cough syrup.
Gardenia, Pink pepper and some chemical underlying Accord. The florals are not even clean or creamy hahaha.
Coming back to the worst ofender here, the underlying osmanthus-medicinal accord that tries to infuse "complexity" on the creation and actually renders It UNWEARABLE goes to show that It IS just a mediocre floral taking Itself too seriously. Pick me shenanigans.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: There is something in that bothers me. It is very strong. It might be more wearable in winter.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Found a small 5 ml bottle and I'm so happy! What a gorgeous perfume, instant love. On my skin it smells juicy, I can definitely detect the peony and citruses, with a hint of pachouli. It's dreamy, feminine and a safe blind buy. Can't believe it's discontinued, this gem should make a comeback.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: A subtle, light citrus-floral. I am surprised some find it strong or with big projection. It is among my mildest scents. Very safe for every occasion, especially for spring-summer. Pretty, happy and gently fresh. In a gorgeous bottle. I like the gentleness of it, as I not always want statement scent, sometimes I like a pretty subtlety just for myself. When I feel like wearing nothing I reach for this beauty. The current Floras are stronger than this. But this makes me smell great - a cute floral aroma thats not simple. It is a skin but better scent. It lasts well on the skin, easily 12 hours of this subtle projection. And 2 days on clothes. Despite the gentleness! And it creates a scented bubble, even on a bike I feel it, but it feels so natural that I welcome it. It makes the scent a legend.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: my mom gave me a little bottle she has of this and omg, i cant. its genuinely the most iconic, it-girl, "she smells so good" perfume ever!!! it's slightly citrusy but very girly and doesn't smell synthetic at all!! i love it so much, i wish i had a bigger bottle of this <3333

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Im so glad I do own a full bottle of this gorgeous complex fragrance altough I have a very conflicted relationship with it. I love how the fragrance opens up very rich and develops very interestingly toxicating and sexy, how osmanthus shines through uniquely, I can not wear it because its giving me carsick feeling. It was a love at first sight at the store, i just bought the bottle but joke was on me when i actually try to wear it throughout the years, I never could, tried in 4 seasons, day and night, to bed and to office but no, it just too overpowering to me when its on me. However its not an obstacle to love the scent, reminds me also that back in 2000’s and 2010’s designer parfumes were so complex and distinctive, not like many similar to eachother like nowadays perfumes, more like todays ‘niche’ perfumes and we didnt have to pay min 300$ for a bottle. Anyway, it is a real gem with high staying power and great floating sillage. A beautiful flower garden feeling without being boring.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is my ALL time favorite perfume. Really disappointed they discontinued it. Now i just buy dupes :(

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I flat out adore this fragrance. It's just the right amount of everything to my nose, soft and feminine, without being just "girly." Why, oh why did they discontinue it? I have a couple of back up bottles of this, and when those are gone I will be so sad. You can still find this gem on places like ebay, but the price is usually ridiculous. I know that Soki London did a perfume that was supposedly inspired by this one, and I have it, but it's not nearly as beautiful as this old favorite. If Gucci ever brought this one back I would be at the front of the line buying it. Beautiful perfume.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
The OG Flora, bestest floral fragrance of all time. So elegant and feminine. I don't really understand why they ruined this one with the flankers that no one asked for. I have an old bottle with me with a few mL left and I sniff on it every few days because i find this one hard to find now. It really is an all rounder for all occasions and all seasons.

IG: the.scentedjourney

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Love love love the older edition, can't remember the year probably from 2006 to 2008.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I dont know why so few votes, but this is a dupe, or actually maybe even the OG Hibiscus Mahajad! On my skin smells the same. A bit soapy but in a luxurious way, love it 😊

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Gucci always breaking my heart. Will always be my favorite designer fruity floral. Smells almost like an orange gummy bear and has excellent longevity.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
It's a good fragrance but a little old fashioned
Similar to jadore by Dior a little warmer

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
When this fragnance came out my mother bought it to me as a birthday gift.
Why? She knows I love perfumes and own bunch of old bottles and testers and that I bought to her few also. I attached her to few fragnance actually. So she choose this because it was "just out" and saw in my room open magazine left on the page where it was commercial for the perfume. Thinking I probably like it. Rest she didn't know. She didn't study composition or anything else. So there you go. We can call it blind buy. Was I happy? Did gods spoke to my mother? Probably. Because I did accept it, not because it was birthday gift, but because I find sense in this simple composition. Yes, that's how I am.

Do we must start with complaining? Yes. Because they discounted this scent and invented something "new", endless rows of variations, like trying to throw something at us to stick. What sticks to sell it stays. Frauds! Shameless frauds! How long will people put up with their madness? I have to stop here, before I get way too honest, or angry... Reason I boycott Gucci is in facts that they behave reckless and opportunistic, like others. Despucable and disgusting. Suitable to the world order we live in. The collapse of the civilisation. Where greed grabs and runs...

I have first addition bottles. Yes, still one from mom and 2 others. Which of course I don't use much. Reason is obvious. One almost empty is from mom.

Flora is by now a legendary pattern from Gucci archives. used on their scarf, designed for Grace Kelly, year 1966. The similar elegant design followed decoration of the very very nice bottle. Black and white. That black cord ribbon. I just love it so much. Made to to give attention to the contrast inside the composition of this wonderful perfume. Oh yes, the contrast. That's why this perfume is good. It celebrates the contrast, that exist in every female. It's part of our nature. There you go. If I can find our feminine born nature in the composition of the fragnance and I mean in the way notes are chosen I can respect that. Even if I don't like it. Because I understand some other female will like it and wear it with pride. Perfume must reach level of being parfumery art. This one does. In every aspect. Did you ever pay the attention to Sandro Botticelli's 'Primavera' painting? You will see Flora there. That's exactly what this fragnance is. It's a happy perfume even tho it is in its spirit contrast. It's like "I have ovulation, my skin is more dry today... But I love to be a woman." That's Flora. BTW. The "Flora" on the painting is pregnant. Bringing life. Bringing future. A miracle of living.

Did Frida Giannini though of all this, that I wrote, or any, I don't know. I can and do hope she did. The blending of this perfume is perfect. The layering is perfect. The penetrative power, one note into other is perfect. The silage is perfect. The lasting is perfect. The dry-down is perfect. The radiance of color is perfect (deep amber color). The decency of the composition is perfect (not sexy, not vulgaire). Big mayority of so called modern perfumes you can't layer during the day. This one you could. And NO. Flora doesn't have dupe or similar scent to replace it. Forget that. It's unique fragnance.

Top notes are Peony, Citruses and Mandarin Orange, calm aldehydes...
I want to write about Peony. If you have garden. I do. Then you know how hard is to grow them. How different they all smell. I dare to write, that inside Flora it's not pink peony, most known color. I think, because I have them in the garden and I can smell them, inside Flora it's yellow ones. They smell slightly of vanilla/honey. But why would fragnance open with Peony splashed with adorable skin of Mandarine, Orange and some other citruses, the pretty sure Bergamote and Kumquat. I smell bitter Orange also and a bit of neroli. Beautiful. Ohh sooo beautiful. Such a magnificent opening. That itself could be simple nice Cologne. Or soap. There you go Gucci! Make the soap. Then I will change my mind and support you by buying it. Just imagine taking shower with this opening soap. Ohh yes. The opening last around half an hour. Sinking into skin. Acting with your skin. Then it becomes even more beautiful. Peony floating. Did you ever think why Peony?
The ancient Greeks believed that it was an emanation of the Moon that glowed at night to drive away evil spirits, giving protection horses wherever it grows, safeguarding shepherds and their flocks, keeping the harvest from injury and preventing storms. However, much like the mandrake, its collection was surrounded by taboos and danger. Pliny said, “that of necessity it must be gathered in the night for if any man shall pluck the fruit in the daytime being seen of the woodpecker he be in danger of to lose his eyes“. Oh yes. Plants are magical creatures. Ancestors knew that. We forgot that.
In the mediaeval period, the peony was used to ward off evil in its various guises. Culpeper said it was an antidote to any sickness caused by demonic possession, such as epilepsy. Gerard said it healed those who had been bewitched. The seeds steeped in hot wine were believed to prevent nightmares or strung onto a necklace to protect children from convulsions, ward off evil spirits and madness. Pennsylvanian Germans also used it to prevent fits, washing with a rag that had been tied to a peony. The plants were often grown near the door of cottages as they were considered to be able to drive away witches and storms, fairies and goblins. Peonies were widely believed to prevent nightmares, advocated as such by Pliny, and even Francis Bacon who said that it protected against “the incubus we call the mare”.
I grow one infront of our house entrance. White blossoms.
Peonies have been used medicinally since ancient times. In Chinese traditional herbalism, peony root (Bai Shao) is still used in the treatment of a variety of conditions, including gout, menstrual cramps, migraine.
(klinheartwitch)

Do you understand now WHY the Top note is magnificent witch Peony?

Let's continue...
After citruses calm down completely and settle themselves to stay till the end and they do, particularly Orange, we sink into
middle notes. Osmanthus and Rose with aquatic additions and green notes (I assume fresh grass). Not much some would say BUT if made good and with sense and quality, it's enough.
I adore Osmanthus. Again. Do you wonder why Osmanthus is Middle main note of Flora?
In traditional Chinese medicine, Osmanthus tea has been used as an herbal tea for the treatment of irregular menstruation. Still believe parfumery is just a business? This Oleachea plant (gods plants) is telling us the story of "Breaking the osmanthus twig and mounting the dragon" another euphemism, in this case, for sex. Osmanthus is beautiful. Alluring. Confident. Slowly intruding... Captivating everyone around, leaving them wondering "what is that?" Together with Rose of which we know no name I can definitely say It's not Bulgarian rose. Typical for the so called floral fragnance otherwise. It's more calm Rose. I have a lot of Roses in my garden. I raise them as hobby and collect rare ones, yet I can't smell out from Flora which one they used to compose it with Osmanthus. Definitely it doesn't overshadow Osmanthus, which is fantastic, because Flora is, let's be honest, BEST modern Osmanthus fragnance.
Lying peacefully on the base notes of Sandalwood, Pink Pepper and Patchouli... Is there some vetiver? Possibly. A hint. This base is so nice. It's so fitting. It's so wonderful...I am in sorrow for this fragrance. Gucci shame on you for the eternity. Because this fragnance could be a perfect gift to a woman after giving a child to her husband.

Let me finish with... Osmanthus.
Fragrant plant symbolized True Love and Faithfulness and the fruit tree - Fertility and Peace, and the custom had the meaning of "giving birth to noble children" and "many children and many grandchildren".

That's what Flora is.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: If anyone has this original Gucci Flora EDP or EDT and is willing to sell please message me as this is my signature scent and I cannot find it anywhere!!! 😭 thank you in advance ✨

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Such a pretty and uplifting floral; juicy and lightly honeyed citruses and warm peony. There's a little throat-tickling pollenated feel that persists from the opening as it begins to drydown, I like it a lot.
Creates a nice shell around the body, compliment getter.
Perfect for warm and bright sunny days.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Finally finished the 50mL bottle after almost 5 years, except for the bit I moved to a rollerball.

It didn't go bad, kept out on my vanity. Sprayed in the morning, the florals lasted until lunch. The citrus peel scent lasted until the end of the work day but the pink pepper and a bit of sandalwood last FOREVER. I'd smell it on my coats after they'd been packed away all summer.

The scent doesn't reach too far sitting in an air conditioned office, but while riding bikes, my husband could smell it wafting behind me.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I have a second bottle already, I like this fragrance a lot. It has freshness, floral notes, citrusy, sweetness - everything you might describe as classic "feminine" components. It's suitable for all seasons, day and evening. Easy to wear but at the same time classy.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: You spray this and you Just smell citrus freshness, very breezy it settles and starts smelling rosy and more élégant. Perfect for daytime

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Very powdery, sweet floral scent.
It reminds me of those soft pastel, rainbow colored, pressed powder pellet candies stacked together in the clear wrapper. Only floral instead of fruity.

Really lovely, but not my style.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
the fragrant is so feminime, floral and sweet also rose scent I think of being a beautiful elegant princess with fragrance but not really my thing so I give this to my bestfriend and she loved it very much

6,5/10

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Fresh, floral and a mature, grown-up version of yellow gummy bears, striking a perfect balance between sweetness and a subtle hint of spiciness. Its versatility makes it ideal for everyday wear. Regrettably it has been discontinued.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is one of my all time favourite scents. I’m on my second bottle and I use it sparingly as it projects so well. For me, it’s not an everyday scent although it was 5 years ago. Now I use it whenever I just want to smell delicious. Usually on a night out or on a date. Its just as the notes describe. Floral, fresh, fruity, sweet and warm. An overall sexy female scent. I feel like everyone needs this fragrance in their collection!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I absolutely love Flora by Gucci, it is very feminine and soft, perfect fragrance for every day. On me it has decent projection for about 4hours and then it’s a skin scent that lasts up to 6 or 7 hours.
Truly one of my favorites, so sad that its discontinued.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Smells like Haribos jellies to me.Beautiful but a bit too warm and sweet for my taste,lacking freshness,more like warm orange juice or melted gummy bears.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Dearly beloved, we are all gathered here today to morn the loss of this shining osmanthus star.✨

I’m gutted they discontinued this gem of a fragrance and replaced it with such basic floral notes in the new rendition! This was a sweet but also fresh & clean osmanthus sent with a honey suckle vibe to my nose. Finding a sent with strong osmanth notes can be really hard, so I’m sad to see this one go. But I’m stocking up while I still can for decent prices.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I get fruity florals with orange candy. It's pretty and feminine. It isn't girly, it's for a grown woman. Not mature, just sophisticated. Good longevity and projection. Too bad it was discontinued. It's a loss in the fragrance world.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
The first Gucci scent I’m interested in and they discontinue it!

Many notes I love: osmanthus, peony, sandalwood, rose, orangey notes. I got to test it out a couple of times and was just about buy it and then poof, gone. This felt like a warm, truly feminine and happy floral, something I could have worn even in the Finnish winter and even all year round. I really like the bottle, too.

Hopefully it will make a comeback!🥀🌹

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: when i tell you i broke down when this was off the market. my mother owned this and i always took it off her because of its warmth. the beautiful peony trail always left my skin and i felt so beautiful every time. lasted for ages and is the perfect comfort scent

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I feel so sexy every time I use this perfume <3

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Treat all my reviews with a grain of salt because I have an odd chemistry so that there are very few perfumes I can wear successfully. (Amarige, Amarige Mariage, Organza, Opium, Raffinee, and Jo Malone fragrances are some.)

I was really excited, but it just goes to show that no matter the reviews and no matter how wonderful it smells on the card, just don't do a blind buy - especially when one has funny chemistry!

I can really describe this fragrance because on me, it was so blah. No peony, no rose. Just some vague floral something. And just powdery. I luckily didn't smell patchouli, but didn't really smell any of the other notes that were supposed to be there, either. Hopefully my daughter-in-law likes it... Hubby couldn't even smell it, BTW, and was absolutely unimpressed.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I was looking for a fragrance with osmanthus and was recommended Gucci Flora. I am so happy with this recommendation! While osmanthus is weak here, Flora is still amazing to me. Truly rich scent, literally and figuratively. It smells like wealth and has richness in its depth. I can see how for some people it might seem generic, but everyone should try it on their skin to see how it will open up. It is a great fit for day and evening, date and work. So it is a very practical fragrance, my second favorite now <3 after Nomade.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: A nice floral.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This smells so sweet and deliciously honey-like. There is something in this though that triggers my tongue to feel numb. Such a shame, because it really is a beautiful scent, projects even with only two sprays, and lasts forever on me.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Obsessed! I would bath in this if I could
And its a shame that it us discontinued as its a true gem, long lasting, orange-y, warm osmanthus cloud that gives you expensive-bodycare-vibes

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: A powdery floral that I can taste in the back of my mouth immediately. No sweetness or warm spiciness at all. I really wanted to love this. I’m still trying to make it work. The bottle is absolutely stunning!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: It's a pretty fragrance, if not a bit on the heavy side. It comes across as somewhat matronly, but not overly so. Creamy strawberries wrapped in roses (I know strawberry isn't a listed note but that's what I'm getting).

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Smells old on me for some reason

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This smells like an Ambery / orange scent. It’s deep and dark . I smell no florals really at all… I think the notes are misleading. It’s not a bad perfume but this is definitely not for me . I knew it at first sniff and it just wasn’t my cup of tea. It is also one that is kind of headache inducing too. Had to let it go ✌🏽

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This perfume was amongst the first perfumes I bought when I started working, it wasn't that expensive for someone who just starting working on entry level pay an yet still a designer perfume haha...

I bought 50ml if I'm not mistaken and finished the whole bottle but still keeping the bottle as display because I wasn't planning to repurchase. Then I heard this perfume is going to be discontinued or maybe already discontinued by now, decided to buy full bottle. Now I remember why I bought this at the first place...such a gorgeous floral scent, it doesn't scream feminine but still smelling feminine. I can't describe it exactly with words. I'm gonna enjoy this scent until the last drop and might purchase a back up bottle if I still see it being sold.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Really nice, elegant, floral perfume.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Such a beautiful floral fragrance. Feminine and classic. My favourite springtime scent. Such a pity its been discontinued.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
🌼powerhouse that does not last🍊
this is a beautiful powdery scent, you can really smell the osmanthus. such a shame it has been discontinued, I liked using it every so often to lift the mood. it is very sharp though. if only it lasted longer on the skin - sadly the latest formulation disappears within a couple of hours.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: WHY must brands discontinue the best from their brand always? Gucci is being added to the infamous discontinue list along with Guerlain, Versace and Thierry Mugler. This scent is what I would pick if I had to choose a signature scent. This fragrance has niche quality to it. It projects like a beast, lasts forever on the skin and gets major compliments. I have gone through maybe 8 or 9 bottles at this point in my life. I hope they reintroduce this scent in the new bottle design, otherwise I will have to stock up.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Tried this once in store and can't quite forget it so I quickly grabbed a bottle when I heard it's getting discontinued. To me this is a truly lovely osmanthus fragrance, sweet and girly. Usually osmanthus notes don't last long on me but this one stays for a rather long time!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Had this for so many years now. It’s mostly citrusy to me, but not fresh citrus
It’s a creamy mandarin + osmanthus nectar
So damn original

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This is my top 3 fragrances. Please keep it continued. I watched in a video from Soki London that it will be discontinued this year, which is soooo sad. It is way fresh, clean, floral and non-cloying in hot and humid weather.

Please please please keep it continued !!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: The Best Gucci for Women.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This is SO pretty. I’m not a floral girl, but one sniff of this and i KNEW i had to have a full bottle!! It’s light, dainty, and a bit shampoo-ey without being soapy. It just smells so… PRETTY!

On first spray, I immediately get hit with the pear. It’s gorgeous and juicy. The citruses are not loud, but they complement the pear so well and gives it a bit of a sparkly, bright edge. The osmanthus really shines through for me even at the opening, and it’s what made me immediately decide to get it. I love honey oolong osmanthus tea, and this is definitely reminiscent of it to me!

Love love love. I’m definitely looking forward to buying the biggest bottle. I can already see myself going through my 50ml quickly—and I only just got it today! Thank you Rhonda Lareese for the recommendation!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I can't believe I missed this perfume so many years ago. I was looking for the perfect all year round work scent that matched my taste and style. I smelt Gorgeous Gardenia EDP tonight and yes it smelt nice, sweet and creamy which is my type of scent, but I needed something a bit more serious, so the sales person brought me this and it's so beautifully balanced. It's elegant, just sweet enough and with that citrus note, it gave the fragrance some sharpness but non-offensive. Others might think it's just another floral scent but as a work scent, this has it all. I would wear this for other occasions also.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Received this perfume as a gift twice for some reason? It's not personally one of my favourite scents, if anything a little too strong for me. I tend to use this as an everyday perfume, and it actually does last quite long, particularly on clothes, and has quite strong sillage. I've worn this to work a few times and it tends to last a 6hr shift pretty well.
Not my favourite scent by Gucci, but it's slowly growing on me...

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: very soft, almost smells like honey/nectar to me (maybe it's the osmanthus). untimately i prefer a perfume that stands out a bit more, but this is sweet and gentle if that is what you're looking for. would make a great subtle, inoffensive everyday scent.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Its got a nice soft fruity floral smell, but the more I think about it, it starts to remind me of something a young nurse/highschool teacher would wear. Maybe too much of a safe/basic/forgettable scent to me. The dry down has much sweeter notes.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I am obsessed with this perfume!!!! the longevity isn't the greatest as I usually get maybe 3-4 hours out of it but nonetheless still a favourite of mine. the only words I can use to describe is feminine , sweet and very cool. the note I can smell the most in the fragrance is peony. although I don't mind because I love the smell of peonies but id definitely repurchase a million times if I need too

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This Perfume when I first spray it, brings the promise of a great citrus floral fragrance, however not long after I spray it (I'm talking under an hour), It becomes an Osmanthus skin scent on me. I wish I got what others get from this perfume. I will keep trying and see if I can get more from it, but so far I have worn it in hot, warm and cool weather and I'm fairly unimpressed..

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Not really a fan. It is floral, yes, but it's more sour than it is sweet. I understand that it has citrus notes – and I love citrus scents. But not this kind. It's a very in-your-face kind of citrus with no depth to it. I was expecting a stronger rose, but it's not quite there. Maybe it's just not for me.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I have been testing it for 3 days now, everytime I use it I start coughing I guess I’m allergic to one of the ingredients.
The smell is not pleasant to me its very suffocating even in winter.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This scent is just magical and it makes me feel optimistic, charismatic and sensual all at the same time. I live in a cold climate where it rains alot and this cozy, uplifting scent works perfectly during fall and winter. The citrus notes paired with the osmanthus creates a fizzy fresh citrus peach like scent. While the sandalwood makes it woody and creamy. I find the edp to have almost an amber like quality to it which makes it super long lasting and sophisticated. I have both the edt and the edp. I like using the edt for work since it's not as loud and is a bit ''see through'' while the edp you get such a luxurious long lasting blend, and a versatile perfume for your money. If I could only have one I'd go for the edp.

So I sprayed two spritz of this at 2pm, and later in the evening at 10pm I walked passed my boyfriend and he was like woow what are you wearing? He said it smelled like a breath of fresh air, as he smelled closer on my wrist he said it somehow also smells like caramel, like a caramelized orange without being too sweet or synthetic.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: creamy sweet green floral on my skin. I smell it on myself throughout the day and it makes me think fresh cut flowers and sweets.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Thick and syrupy but not cloying or too sweet. This is a beautiful floral orangey fragrance to my nose. It's not my usual kind of smell, the notes were weirdly addictive when I tried a tester in the shop. I could not stop going back and sniffing the paper! This is good in all weather, apart from really really warm days i think. I think its more daytime appropriate. I've not had compliments when wearing it but I like it, and thats what is important that you like your fragrance. Its really long lasting, couple of sprays will keep you going all day.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: The first time I wore this, all I got was a watery peony with a few whiffs of creamy osmanthus. On the second wear I picked up on the pink pepper note which was a little too sharp for me. But on every other wear, it's a beautiful creamy floral right from the start, and it stays that way with no unwanted sharpness or surprises. There isn't much to say about this one. It would be easy to say this fragrance is boring. Very pleasant, great for year-round and day or night. Flora doesn't have the "wow" factor I normally look for before investing in a full bottle. That said, I'd love to have this in my collection someday as it's a truly lovely scent.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This fragrance is amazing. In my top ten. It's a beautiful warm orange and fresh osmanthus fragrance, with a lovely.... brightness. Maybe from the pink pepper? It is the fragrance I reach for when I have an important meeting, or want to feel optimistic.

Simular to Givenchy Ange Ou Demon Le Secret, but more professional. So if you like that fragrance, you would probably like this one too.

Perfect for work. Great projection. I always get complimented when I wear this fragrance.

Makes me feel happy, classy, and sophisticated.

A safe blind buy.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Pretty and smooth with quirkiness.
Sweet, soft creamy floral.

It's very feminine and delicious scent.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: this one made me feel like I'm a rich haunty girl from a weathy family haha A friend sent me this gift and I guess that's what he meant to say about me hehe. I don't see citrus in it tho. Only flora, a bit woody but mostly floral. it's kinda too much to use during day in tropical weather.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Flora has been an unexpected disappointment to me.
I thought I would love it judging from the notes and the glowing reviews but it does absolutely nothing for me.
It's by no means a polarizing or challenging scent - it's what I would describe as inoffensive and vaguely pleasant.
Like others, I get a warm orangey/apricot note - not really citrusy, more of a honeyed sweetness.
That is all I get though. This is how the perfume goes on and this is how it stays. It fails to develop and is completely inert on my skin. Another reviewer described it as champagne. Well on me it is flat champagne unfortunately.
It's quite a saturated smell but it doesn't project and leaves no sillage either
I've given Flora more than a handful of chances, in all kinds of weather and nothing seems to change my experience.
I wish I could smell what others do.

Edit - 1/5/24 - so I've discovered, from smelling other osmanthus forward scents, that what is happening here is that the osmanthus is just overtaking all the other notes. I really smell only the osmanthus here. Nothing else. What a shame.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This a very warm, sweet, almost gourmand floral. There’s something about it that I also smell in Bamboo, which must be the sandalwood. It’s very creamy and almost vanilla and powdery.
I get none of the citrus.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Fresh champagne in a bottle. This fragrace is really pretty. I would describe it as a very perfumy fragrance thats smells very realistic of citrusses. Its like cutting into a citrus and smelling the juice. Then the florals come in. The fragrance overall has a sparkling (champagne) type of vibe to it. Still not anything special.
Lasts all day

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I absolutely love this perfume, I am really impressed by all Gucci fragrances (I honestly can't say I dislike any of the ones that I have smelled). Their creations are so well balanced and this is so rare nowadays, I don't like perfumes where I can pin-point one scent or the other, or the ones that have a messy multi-smell that ends up smelling like "the Mall", but Gucci does the exact opposite. I don't know how they manage to create such perfect accords.

I got Flora in a set of minis and it was the one I used last (I tend to conserve the things I like so this was the hint that I love it). Besides the extremely pretty bottle, I think this scent is to die for. It is indeed floral but not heavy on the roses (which I do smell, but the top notes of fresh yellow or white roses, no the deep smell of red ones), the flowery parts (must be the peony, although I can also sense some fresh violets) blend well with the citruses which are not lemony at all, but rather more prominent as the delicate fresh-sweet smell of mandarin peels. The sandalwood is there to support everything, while the osmanthus creates a savory middle you almost want to eat. All these smells are somehow equal, with neither battling for dominance, again a rare find at least on most perfumes I've tried.

I am thinking of buying a full bottle but an EDT not EDP, as I feel this perfume works better will less sillage, the EDP I have would fill the room and choke me if I spray it (I currently just dab the mini-bottle on my wrist and neck and it's enough). The dry down is not instant, I love how I can still smell the top and middle notes for hours which usually does not happen with a lot of perfumes. The scent follows me all day and I can't get enough of it. It's such a complex perfume, I love how I can find in it a bit of everything: a daytime perfume which can also go well on a summer evening date. It's so versatile that it can make you jump for joy and works well as a pick-me-up, but it also gives a boost of confidence and femininity to make you feel sexy and ready for anything.

Definitely recommend, even as a blind buy. Unless you are somebody who likes strictly oriental perfumes, you would love this. It's also perfect for a gift, you really can't go wrong and I can't imagine somebody not liking it.

Later edit: I found a dupe (based on reading a thread here), it's La rive - Madame in love. They are very similar, unfortunately the dupe had a bit of stickiness when I sprayed it on my hand, typical of drug store cheaper perfumes. The scent is not identical of course, the dupe is heavier (especially the flowery scents) while the original is more open, clean and more fresh (citruses prevail), most likely due to the quality of the ingredients. But considering it's 10% of the price, it's worth it. I have to say the dry down, after several hours, is identical: a sweet, fresh violet scent.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I absolutely love this perfume! It smells delicious on my skin as it's very fruity and just a little bit floral! I love it for spring and summer days when I just don't know what perfume to choose and I want something clean but still sweet and delicious and very feminine. This is my favourite clean designer perfume. My second favourite will be Chanel Chance Eau Tendre, which is very pretty too. It's a little bit more floral, but still delicious :)

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This was a blind purchase for me based on reviews I read below! On the first spray I got a nice whiff of a citrusy orange scent that was very pleasing to my senses which lasted for over a hour or so. Next was a lovely powdery rose scent that is just lovely, beautiful. My husband said I smelled yummy!! These are the notes, including the, pink pepper and patchouli, that I smelled the most on my skin. It has a long sillage for me with over 8 hours of longevity!! I love it so much that I will most likely get another bottle which I enjoy looking at, for it has a vintage design, Safe blind buy for floral lovers!! Oh yes, as time goes by the scent just get better!!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I'm here for an edit: Gucci flora smells soooooo nice but i'm so disappointed by the performance 😔
When i just spray it's very strong but 1 hour later it becomes a skin scent
Poor performance unfortunately i wish it lastes longer and projects better

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This right of the bat gives me a feeling of peace and summer. A fragrance that smells so heavenly yet so reserved, it is one of my ultimate floral fragrances that I must get but there is something that is putting me off from buying this so I am basically fluctuating between love and like. I haven't tested the EDT version but maybe it will have a different kick to it than this EDP version anyway I still love/like it and think it is a must for floral fragrance lovers. You can't go wrong with this formula. Simple yet amazing.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Gucci Flora is just beautiful. It screams perfection in all ways, it's just the perfect fruity floral perfume. It's my favorite scent in the whole world! I'm just afraid this is discontinued... They sell Gucci Flora EDP in online shops now and then but I'm not sure it will last. Last year I couldn't find Gucci Flora anywhere and just now found it online for a perfect price! I then purchased the Eau Fraiche version instead, which is equally beautiful.

If you're like me and can't find EDP anywhere, really... go for the EDT! It's not a weak or watered down version at all. It's slightly more fresh but still great performance trust me! Flora EDT has better performance than many EDP's out there. Even better performance than most fragrances from Chanel and Thierry Mugler.

Edit: The EDT actually has slightly better performance than this one. I love both scents but I will keep purchasing the other one since it's more inexpensive and slightly more fresh.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This. Is. A. Masterpiece.

Being the miserable geezer that I am, I submitted a review of "Flora EDT" many months ago where I think I stated that it was too weak, and I couldn't smell much of anything. In the name of transparency, I did have a tiny sample, and suspect there are some minor differences between that and this here EDP.

"Flora EDP" is, however, the most beautiful, feminine, elegant, kinda-sexy scent. Yes, Perfumites. I actually find this a little bit sexy. Is it weird to say: If I was a guy, I'd love smelling this on a girl?

The opening of citruses and mandarin orange is - no joke - possibly my favourite citrus opening. It's probably tied with "Coco Mademoiselle" is that respect, actually. But - by Jove - it is heavenly. It's beautiful, soft, vibrant, and glamourous.. And warm! Did I mention warm?! That orange is warm and enveloping with zero sharpness!

How is peony such a perfect floral note? Gentle, sweet without being cloying, and ever-elegant! The added osmanthus does have that gentle slight apricot smell that is a little syrupy and bloody divine! The rose is very subtle. For those terrified of choking, heavy rose - FEAR NOT! "Flora" cradles you in her soft, sweet, gentle hands.

The patchouli really helps this last! As gentle as the scent itself is; it actually hangs around. Rest assured, you never get that dirty patchouli scent here; all the patchouli does is help this last, and GOD BLESS IT FOR THAT! The sandalwood and pink pepper are present, but don't overwhelm. I honestly think the pink pepper stops this from devolving into something boring. When you sniff yourself a few hours into wearing this, you get a nice, gently-invigorating kick from it.
The sillage and projection aren't monsters, though...but, in this perfume …I feel if it invaded your nostrils, it would ruin the gentle nature of "Flora".

The bottle is perfect: Heavy glass, unique hexagonal shape, delicate cap, and adorably pretty black bow. I also completely acknowledge this is a PERFECT spring scent, but it's so damn comforting and warming that I'll wear this year-round.

One of my absolute favourite floral scents: A gift of warm orange with fresh peony.
A modern classic - and deserves to be recognised as such.

Stunning! Stunning! Stunning!

***

Kitty rating: 10/10 (Darn tootin').

~Compliment Counter~: 1 compliment 😁 "Ooooh, you smell nice! Can I have a spritz?!"

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: For me, it is a very, very, VERY bold floral, almost with notes of caramel and heavy sweetness, not light at all. The smell literally doesn't go away even after scrubbing my skin hard. Upon spraying I was greeted with a slightly more grassy tone than floral, which dries down into the aforementioned caramel heaviness. A little too heavy for daytime wear, definitely nighttime, special occasion kind of fragrance.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Smells sort of like a fresh warm orange. Very citrusy and fresh smell. It’s also very longlasting!! However, don’t know if it works well on my skin. If you smell me from a bit of a distance you get the fresh citrusy smell, but when I put my nose just right where I sprayed the perfume it smells really weird. I still wear it as long as I know someone won’t put their nose right on my skin

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This is a crowd pleasing perfume
Gourmand sweet creamy and fresh at the same time
The pink pepper gives it a lovely sharpness at the end
I used to wear this yeaaaaars ago and i remember loving it, so i bought it again this month, oh man this is soooooo nice and clean 😍 lately i've been wearing heavy complicated perfumes so it was nice going back to this effortless perfume 🥰

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: When initially sprayed this gorgeous fragrance slams you with a fresh bright scent but a few minutes later the most beautiful peony, warm cozy sandalwood scent is left. I could smell it on and off of my skin for hours. It felt like a big hug from someone that you hold dear. I am in love with this beauty.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This smells more green than floral on me for some reason, and is very harsh on my nose. Dislike.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Recieved as a gift and it does not smell good on me at all :(

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: A perfumery classic. Sweet, flowery, non-invasive. I dare say a tres chic perfume! I like it, I like it, I like it. On my skin the note of osmanthus is perceived very much and it is the thing that catches me most in this fragrance. Everything is bon ton, nothing out of tune, everything is linear like the bottle and the pack that contains everything. What can I say .... the class is not water !!!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is amazing... the opening is very fresh and fruity! Imagine freshly squeezing a juicy orange and lemon and putting it in a spray bottle and spritzing it in your face... thats what this is! Although it dries down to a beautiful elegant sophisticated soft fruity floral.. to me kinda reminds me of a orange Creamsicle but not sickeningly sweet. Last about 5-6 hours on my skin (perfumes don't last on me well anyway 😑) all in all its glorious and will be repurchasing in the future.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: The stunning bottle won me over and I ordered a sample, sadly it settled horribly on me and smelt like bug spray :(

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
In the first 15 minutes this was like golden-orange flowers on top of a bed of whipped cream in the sunshine. The cream is subtle, it’s not gourmand cake-strong, but I’m glad it’s there. This fragrance is both warm and cool, like one of the first nice days of spring where the sun feels amazing but the breeze is cold. Gucci Flora initially made me think of Princesse Marina de Bourbon Reverence, even though they have little in common note-wise. So, I sprayed Reverence (which I am fond of) on my other arm for comparison. Both perfumes definitely smell juicy-floral in the first hour. Though they are like sister scents to me, Reverence smells more green/woody.
Gucci Flora dried down to a beautiful peony-Osmanthus-whipped cream scent on my skin. I will strongly consider buying a full bottle when my sample is gone. I could see this being a new signature for spring and summer.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I really enjoy the entire Flora collection, the gardenia is my favorite. This one is confidently balanced and whimsical. It does a good job not becoming the same fruit-patchouli a-typical fragrance we are used to.

I will say, this is not ground breaking or particularly unique, but I love it for the same reason I do the others; they smell clean and almost crisp. There's an element to them that make me feel very classy and put together. The offense just isn't there.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: The name Flora is misleading: it smells just fruity! Peaches and all other tropical fruits. I think japanese osmathus has that fruity scent. This is very appropraite for summer, it's like Ralph by R.Lauren grown up version.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This is beautiful! Feminine, elegant, luminous, soft and uplifting. It smells like something from another era, but doesn’t smell dated, if you know what i mean.
The opening is warm and floral,later it turns into a soft and slightly sweet powder with a floral touch. I posted a topic in the forum looking for a perfume that smelled like a flower warmed by the spring sun and to me, this fragrance feels exactly like that! So pretty and sexy! And peaceful at the same time. This is just delightful!
I am excited to try the edt!
I imagine a lady from the 1800’s wearing it. She is beautiful and feminine, loves to have fun and has a captivating naughty laugh.
Sillage is soft ( turns quickly into a skin scent, unfortunately). Longevity is moderate.
I recommend it to all women, regardless of age.
Final note: 10/10

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Flora EDP is a beautiful perfume. So Simple and yet so fresh, flowery, juicy, well blended and ultimately so feminine. It's a perfume that lifts you up, makes you feel innocent and pure like a flower. A pretty scent to be worn everyday and also in special occasions. The scent for as much as I can remember hasn't changed but I do remember that the bottle and packaging used to be more elaborate whereas now they're much simple.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
It's like a thin powder of thousands dried flowers : roses, carnations, violets... and other
And i also hear in Flora scent of cacao powder with a little bit note of burnt sugar & floral pollen. Pink peonies and osmanthus echo from far away.
Such join of notes, on my opinion, gives Flora a delicate chic.

Warm, bodily, cozy, alluring fragrance for autumn.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
The osmanthus flower is a very peculiar floral note...it can get very sweet & sickly. I love this note, but I haven't found a single fragrance that doesn't turn into pee on my skin with this flower...

But for some reason Gucci Flora EDP does an OUTSTANDING job preventing this from happening.

First spray a burst of peony, oranges & citruses (no lemons) which quickly settles into the sweet osmanthus and later into a slightly peppery candied patchouli.

Basically a sweet, summery floral with a dash of citrus and patchouli, actually smells very very sweet like candy on my skin.

I absolutely love it, it reminds me of springtime, smells innocent and classy, perfect for me. One of my favourite hot weather scents...want to purchase it again!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This was my first gucci fragrance and even though I have ventured into others by this brand, this will always be my first love. This was what I wore when I first started my career. Very few clients but smelling like a sweet, floral boss.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I got it in the 100 ml tall metal gold bottle with the Gucci logo pattern. The bottle is just to die for. I assume it is either a special tester or a limited edition bottle.

This is a fresh floral perfume with no character. It can be used as a sample uniform fresh floral. It is pleasant and inoffensive. This would suit any season, any time of the day, any age. Very very generic.

Probably it is so generic, that can be named "A Perfume".

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: MrsTeeFee- same here!! Well for the EDT at least, I don't think I've tried this once yet). Since I've always really loved the bottle since the EDT came out I kept testing it thinking it was a bad tester before, or my allergies, but nope, nada. I too cannot smell ANYTHING except maybe the tiiiiiiiniest hint of generic flowers. Maybe we're just anosmic? I want to try the EDP because hopefully I'll be able to at least smell something, since I have piterally no idea what this perfume is all about, but after reading your review my hopes aren't high :( lol. I've never been anosmic to anything before so I really want to know what the deal with this is. What am I/what are we (not) smelling?

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: All the P&G produced scents are slowly on their way out. Gucci and Coty plan on taking it to a different direction. Can probably say bye to Premiere, Gucci Oud, Flora, Classic Guilty collection, Gucci by Gucci, and Envy.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This starts out really really strong and then it intensifies even more. Overpowering doesn't even begin to cover it. Headache Central! Too sweet, too retro, too much like laundry detergent. Not actually even particularly floral to my nose!! A real disappointment.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: If I'm being honest, I find Gucci flora EDP very generic. To me it smells like light fruity floral shampoo/hairspray, but not in a bad way. Overall it is a like, but not a love. I will use up my bottle and probably not repurchase.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Now THIS is a perfume! Enough said!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This is smooth, but still flowery. I mostly get the flowers with a faint vanilla like sandalwood and peach (osmanthus), these notes keep it from being sharp. It's almost creamy. It still smells like something that could've just come out today. Gucci Bloom gives me a headache, it's too sharp, but Flora is perfect.

I bought Flora EDT right when it came out in 2009, and it's the only perfume bottle I've ever finished. I just bought a new bottle of EDP with a December of 2018 batch code and it smells so similar to how I remember. The EDP is just stronger, creamier, and less sparkling... which is perfect for me. I forgot how much I love it. I'm buying a backup, and I don't currently own backups of anything.

Yay for finding a new signature scent, even if it's not "new" to me!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: It smells like nice clean laundry. Nothing special. Love the bottle and the name

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I have the EDP an at first spray this seemed like it would be too much--it's a little like flipping on a light in the middle of the night--a bit startling. It settles down quickly though and feels like a proper, confident woman's scent. After it settles in, it's neither too sweet or too sultry. It's unapologeticly feminine in a bold way.

I have a soft spot for peony and rose combined and those two notes come through well on me. Anything with sandalwood is typically appealing to me too. I do find that this changes as I wear it, but it's a powerhouse of longevity on me (rare these days) and the changes are subtle and slow, with the sandalwood and pepper featuring more than the patchouli. The slow pace and subtle change after bold opening might make these changes hard to detect on some skin though.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
It's kinda generic. It's kind of a sugar bomb. And for some reason I still like it. It reminds me of walking past a Victoria Secret, and not in a good way. But I'm still wearing it and have been all week so there's something to it. I like the way it wears down, but on first spray it's overwhelmingly underwhelming.

I don't get citrus off this and I wish I did. I wish the citrus was sharper. I definitely smell peony, pink pepper and patchouli though.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: People love this I know but to me it smells awful. Its so overpowering. I thought maybe if I tried on my skin, it would settle and smell better but nope nope nope.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
☆ Hello Miss Gucci Flora , Where should I begin?
This smells delightful, and the lasting power for the eau de parfum is lengthy with impressive projection. She can be worn all four seasons because this blossoms according to the climate always setting a tone of femininity & divinity. I reach for this one often because I can always just spray and go not worrying about touch up’s with it’s astounding lasting power. Peony & Citrusy whispers surround my space & it brings a delightful comfort for my senses to adore. What’s not to love? ☆

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: so feminine and floral. lasts all day on my skin. quite strong on first blast. can be overwhelming when overly sprayed.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Warm, fresh, cheerful. Often when I can't decide what to wear, I reach for Flora. It is a beautifully blended, sparkling, sweet(ish) floral that is suitable for any season and occasion.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: To me this fragrance is beautiful and undeniably feminine. It starts out fresh and clean smelling at first spray - then as the scent develops there is an interesting mix of floral notes but the dry down that I'm experiencing now is warm and enveloping, sensual and sort of oriental. Perfume is different on everyone and I just love this scent on me! I feel like a woman wearing this! There is such as difference in store bought and high end fragrances. This is a well rounded, full bodied scent!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: A perfumey perfume. The name suits. Flora is a simple but lovely well blended and balanced scent for lovers of fresh floral fumes.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Great concept/notes, but too powdery/makeup-y

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Flora is a masterpiece of balance! It's beautiful, sensual, and fresh. On me it smells like a clean skin after shower with an expensive floral soap. It holds its own throughout and doesn't fluctuate between the notes. Impressive sillage and longevity. I'm so glad I've tried it as it is really unique among a sea of sugar bombs. Sophisticated sweetness is all I can say.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: When I think about notes, Flora is actually more fruity. I smell peach, melon and rose. I absolutely loved it for summer nights back in time. I didn't care for EDT, but perfume version is more sultry and juicy.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Somebody who was a friend wears this and I no longer have that friendship, so wanted to test this fragrance. It’s not for me, too fruity, reminds me of fruit tingles. I do, however, love Gucci Bloom, the original one. My husband recently treated me to a big bottle of Bloom, gorgeous, full blossom, summer fragrance.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is a warm inoffensive fragrance. perfect for daily use especially evenings. I can't distinguish any peony in this which is good, since peonies can be sharp at times. The rose is soft and the base is Amazing!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This fragrance is a little too strong for me . It’s sweet , but not a sexy sweet it’s more of an older lady kinda sweet.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: OMG, this is officially the one on top of all perfumes i've ever used LOL, to me, it smells FREAKING delicious, like foods, like I just wanna drink or devour it if I can! Surprisingly, I tend to fall for any perfumes that has rose or citrus notes within, and Gucci Flora has both! Now you know why I'm so obsessed over it! LOVEEEEE ITTTTT

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I’ve had my eye on this perfume for some time now. I own a small vial sample of the EDT and fell in love with the soft citrus smell. To my surprise the EDP version has the most beautiful Osmanthus and Rose notes I failed to noticed on the EDT version. I’m glad I was able to find this gem at my local Ulta store on sale for half the price. Absolutely gorgeous.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Love the bottle love love the perfume!

This one makes me smell so expensive like I'm walking out of a palace. BEAUTY !!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I also like Flora by Gucci and is a very femme parfum so beautiful and a new intense version won't hurt...

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Beautiful! Absolutely stunning! This creamy floral is a dream come true. I’m picky and this is the only Gucci I like besides bamboo. I don’t like florals too much but this is beautiful the peonies really stand out and the citrus notes do as well. I love it

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Im pretty picky with florals. I like them fresh and natural. Im a keen and very experienced gardener so I like to think I know my flower scents after all these years. My gardens are dominated by scented plants and shrubs.
This fits the bill. Very ladylike and it will very much appeal to the English roses out there.
The peony, osmanthus and citrus dominate on the opening. A delicate fruity floral scent that reminds me of one of my David Austin roses. No surprise that there is some rose in here. It's very low key though.
There is a nice bit of kick from the pepper. I can just about detect the patch at the back.
A lovely casual scent for warm and lazy days. Very feminine. It's a shame it retracts to a skin scent so quickly. Moderate longevity but mostly as a skin scent.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Gucci is one of the best brands for parfumes on the market in my opinion, love premiere, guilty and also this one. Its floral sweet and little powdery. For any occasion.Last all day on my skin

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Omg. I wanted this perfume when it came out bc I thought it would be a great mature replacement for viva la juicy as my new signature. I was 23. I finally tHought I'd gotten around to buying it 3 years later. I didn't care much for it anymore and I couldn't figure out why. 5 1/2 yrs later my bottle is still full and in great condition still. Well it turns out I'd accidentally bought the eau fresh version. Well I finally have the original and it's everything I remember smelling on that shopping day on rodeo 8 yrs ago. I love it

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Love love love Gucci Flora EDP. My “happy” perfume. Seriously. The scent makes me happy. But its so expensive here.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Wasn't a fan.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Floral-fruity resinous peppery. It does have some metallic note as others mentioned in reviews. For some reason this 'metallic' reminds me swimsuit, therefor for me it is more as summer perfume. EDT is more fruity, but EDP more floral and airy. It is feminine, elegant, lovely and dreamy.
