There is something that makes it classy. Sugary, but not too sweet. Pepper and citrus note in background. I wish I could like it more, but alas too synthetic resinous for me.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Love the peony opening! The citrus can seem overpowering at first but fades fast for me. I get a very warm, woody, floral. Not cloying or powdery to me at all, just very straightforward floral with those warm undertones. Received compliments almost immediately after putting it on. Still, if I had to pack a suitcase of perfume to take to a deserted island, this wouldn't be one of them. For me it is lacking something- maybe because the citrus doesn't come through so much. I also find that it doesn't last long and I go through it pretty quickly if I am wearing regularly. (And I am not one of those people who needs everyone in a mile radius to smell her- I prefer a soft sillage which I feel this has).

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I'm not a big fan of this or the EDT. They both smell sour, medicinal, and metallic.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Received full bottle as Christmas gift. I love the initial floral burst but gosh, 1 sprint and i feel nauseous I dont even know why. I checked the notes and I cant figure out what gives me headache. Perhaps its composition. I would say this is my kind of perfume if it doesnt give me any headache. Im selling mine away. I dont think Ill be able to wear this.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
An underestimated one. Not unique. Not groundbreaking. But somehow it's beautiful and has quality in its simplicity. It's far from Bloom, their newer release, but it's not that much lower.

What I smell is a softly sweet balmy scent, sweetness that couldn't bother anyone, very feminine, a moderately sweet peony. The perfume is not as citrusy as the notes indicate.

A lot would state it smells shampooish. Just like Chanel Eau tendre. In fact if you like the latter, chances are you are going to like Flora too.

The osmanthus does get prevalent, with its fruity apricoty ascents, does not dissapoint. Simple and cute. Sweet and sour.

The scent deepens with carefully measured additions of santal and patchouli never becoming overpowering. Basically it's how Miss Dior Blooming Bouquet should have smelled like, but instead we got a mih meh smell.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Super fresh and powerful fruity floral scent. Perfect for uplifting mood. Maybe sharp at first sniff but it gets softer later. Every time I'm wearing this one I feel like I'm laying on a field of peony and osmanthus and has citruses juice splash all over you. Hahaha

It has incredible longevity and super strong sillage (obviously because it's EDP). So please be careful to not spray it too much.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: My 89 year old mother and I had our own bottles of this. Unfortunately, something in this scent made me very nauseous...a real scrubber for me. Strangely, while my mother did not have the same reaction when she wore it,those around her consistently commented her perfume made them nauseous!!! Am still wondering what note/s caused the negative effect?????

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I like this scent but I find that I do not smell it after putting it on for long. I don't know if others are aware of it but as the main reason I am attracted to a scent is that it makes me feel good, this one falls short. I keep going back and trying it again and again as I would really like to love it! Flower Bomb does more for me!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Flora for me was like when I first experienced Si by Armani and Flowerbomb by Viktor & Rolf. Like those perfumes it's a mature grown-up scent with more complexity and a little more 'shade' than the colorful sugary sweet girly trashy celebrity gourmand perfumes out there. I've gone through many perfumes like that and just like you stop wearing clothes that don't fit you anymore because you're in your 20's and not in junior high or high school anymore you finally decide to wear more sophisticated adult fragrances like this one.

Like it's Latin name Flora this is a floral. It opens up with a citrusy rose top, all green, leafy, herbal, rose-scented but with those citrus notes around it. Smells almost like neroli but more subdued and more green and herbal. The pepper note is noticeable and the patchouli which gives this that green coloring. The sandalwood is also coming through and some musk. It smells more unisex than feminine and has some pretty good longevity/sillage if you get the Parfum. The Toilette is more like green floral toilet water and lasts a shorter time. It's a clean but not soapy herbal aroma.

Flora might be too 'mature' for some 18 through 20 something year olds chained to the gourmand celebrity fluff but it's easy to enjoy and appreciate. This is good for autumn and winter and can be worn with like a formal black evening dress, a coat, or business suit. She takes herself seriously and exudes healthy confidence as opposed to assertive-aggression, she is peaceful, secure in her world, a little dark but more in the contemplative sense, calm, intellectual, bookworm type. Think Belle from Beauty and the Beast. This is an awesome perfume. I don't see it in any Macy's so I would look for it in the online sites like Amazon.com or eBay

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
@toni64 the current bottle & packaging are the reformulated version but still has all the notes that the old one does. But to me this black cap EdP version has more wearable than the vintage one. I felt like it has lose it's strong characters a bit. But still got same perfomance from both. But if you love this EdP, go get the gold cap version as a back up, as much as you can & you will not regrets. My personal rating, BIG 10 TIMES LOVES FOR THE EDP GOLD CAP VERSION & just a like for the EdP black cap version.

@perfumgoddess23 me too. I do wear different perfumes 7 days a week. I feel bored to smell the same perfumes on me everyday. Need something to lift up the mood each day. Even when I'm on my travel I bring along some of my miniatures

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I'm confused what is the difference between Gucci flora edp in white box with gold label on bottle and Gucci flora edp in coloured box with flowers with black label on bottle. or is it just been updated. If it has which is the better perfume???

Thanks GGLiCious I ended up purchasing the black cap label bottle as the gold label was way out of my price. Hope its as nice as gold label so thanks for your help

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I'm not sure how I feel about this yet. It is a clean, floral scent that is perfect for everyday wear.
However, on me It pulls an ever-so-slight "cleaning product" smell and has a bit of a "burn your nose hairs" pungent quality to it especially at first so that would prevent me from wearing it really often.
Overall though, It's a nice non-offensive perfume that I could see working on any age woman. I just wouldn't personally wear it very often.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is a very sweet perfume, I liked it a lot and wore it in winter. But in summer the scent gets a bit too heavy, and definitely not a nice smell if you sweat a little bit... And for some reasons the scent is a bit childish. As the name goes, it is probably more suitable for flowery happy teenage girls.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: My sister used Flora today and I completely remembered why I loved it. Flora used to be one of my faves back in the day and definitely back on my wish list. Gucci's enchanting fragrance is sweetness mixed with floral. Amid fruit and flower extracts, it is unique, sophisticated, sexy, and edgy. Inspired by princesses from the past, present, and future. Completely ethereal, Flora is for the female who is classy, and loves a touch of nostalgia. This fragrance lasts for hours which is a plus for many. If you like sweet scents that are clean this is the one for you!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I have the first batch and it is quite different from new formula. The old one is rounder and warmer, osmanthus is the main note. The scent develops very nicely from bright peony and citrus opening to osmanthus and rose and then to woody base. It is very long lasting and has great sillage. The new formula is soapy and a bit screechy to my nose and contains less osmanthus.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Gucci flora EDP

Right oh.
I very much liked the beginning and heart notes of this fragrance.
There is a sweet note in the base which annoys me.

I've also tried on Gucci premiere EDP today, which is in the same strain as this, escept premiere is more peppery and floral.

See I'm at the base note stage and I don't know if I want to open my new flora, as I could still swap it at this point.

I wish everything was made in 30ml sizes!
Premiere was a rip off $230 for a bottle, flora, about half that, and I got mine on sale further reduced. That's the only reason I got it. Four letter word: sale

Sorry to be a killjoy.
It lasts ages, and is in general I nice fragrance. I'll give her another shot in a day or so

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Gucci has somehow figured out how to bottle a beautiful spring day.

I get mostly delightful osmanthus and peony with hints of citrus. It becomes a little sweeter as time passes. After a day at work I could still smell it quite clearly. Longevity is excellent.

One coworker would smile big and say 'gosh you smell good' every time we crossed paths lol. This stuff is absolutely uplifting.

Spring days and smiles for everyone! :o)

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This scent is unique, it just says "Gucci Flora". I smelled this on my colleague and she recommended this to me as one of the longest lasting perfumes of her collection. Got it and tried it, it has become my signature scent now. Love it so so much. It has the Chanel No5 FEEL to it, but does not smell like Chanel No5.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Pleasant and sweet. I would call this "fruity floral," and I get a ton of peach and apricot in it, even though it's not listed, mixed with cut grass at first, then by itself. It would have more dimension if it were a little bit drier.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Okay, this is going to sound really weird, but to me, Gucci Flora smells like... grass. But not dirty grass—it smells like clean grass surrounded by white flowers, and on top of all that, I smell baby powder. I really like it; it's my current signature scent. I always get compliments when I wear it, which is nice. I almost never wear it alone—I love layering it with Victoria's Secret Fresh & Clean body lotion. The combination of the two is absolutely beautiful.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I don't know why I've been avoiding Gucci perfumes all this time. Recalling in my memory there was this episode 4-5 years ago in the perfume store. Gucci Flora line had just reached the market and everyone was so excited about them, so they were way too popular at the time and mainstream. That's something I dislike because people want the same product and we end up smelling all the same which is boring. Long story short, I sniffed all of them and found them very alcoholic, but I admit it was my fault because I was sniffing them all at once without leaving the right amount of time to my nose to relax.

During all this time Gucci Flora meant nothing to me and I was not even interested in them. But one day my female cousin told me she had smelled Flora on her friend and loved the perfume. That's when I started to gain interest in it. As soon as I found my self at the shop I went spaying it on my arm and paper strips and guess what? I loved it even better. This is so feminine and elegant and classy. It is a fruity floral to me. I love the peach note and peonia. But this frag wouldn't have been so special if it didn't feature the pink pepper note. You see there is this sort of continuum between Gucci Flora, Guilty, and Première and the element that acommunates them is the Pink pepper that confers the sour, tart feeling. It it wasn't for this note they would be floral or oriental scents like so many others in the market.

I've smelled both the edp and edt of flora but the edp is way better and with more character and more longlasting. The edt lacks something, it's not that deep and the peach note that I love so much is not prominent. Flora edp is perfect for any occasion and season. Whether you're wearing a casual and chic style, a dress, a tailleur this perfume will always go perfect. Definitely a great frag to have.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is something you'd either like or hate, nothing in between. To me it smells like a sour compote. No... just... no .... I don't know how such a huge brand could do such a concoction and women love it....

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: In the dog days patchouli comes up stronger than ever but it’s not invasive and headache-inducing. The perfume becomes very pepperish but at the same time remains cosy-floral and lasts the whole day — I sprayed it at 8 in the morning, I’ve been out and about until late this afternoon, gone through a sweaty jogging session and 13 hours later the scent is still here. I can’t help but love it. I’ve almost finished my bottle and will surely repurchase one.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This one is easy to like, Good lasting power and projection, the mix of flowers and citrus, sweet but not too sweet. Nothing extraordinary more like simple, clean and nice. I am probably getting the second bottle soon.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: First time when I got it, did not like at all! Later I fell in love with this perfume. Now I wear it constantly.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Okaaaaaay. I wanted this for a long time but it came out not something as I expected. I thought this was something more "demure" but it's actually really strong. I was expecting floral and just slightly sweet. It's really sweet and oddly it smells like really thick and sweet liquor. There's a bit of "green plant" odor of an undertone. I prefer something more lighter yet sophisticated. This fragrance plays between a day and night scent for me. But I think I can still use this. Nice try.

After 4hrs..
Dry down, I like it.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Top Notes Citrus Mandarin Orange Peony

Middle Notes Rose Osmanthus

Base Notes Patchouli Sandalwood Pink Pepper

Flora was the Roman goddess of the spring. Each year on the vernal equinox when spring arrived into the city of Rome, the citizens adorned themselves in flowers and laurel leaves and scattered flower petals on the streets. The Floralia held around April 27-28 was the Spring Festival in honor of the Goddess. Of course it was just a drunken and debauched feast day, and there were grapes being fed to Senators and soldiers by pretty maidens in gossamer gowns. It was a toga party. But can you imagine that aroma of flowers everywhere? There would have also been the smell of incense. I wanted Flora to smell like the Floralia, a hedonistic cornucopia of fruits and flowers, woods and incense. But no such luck. This is only a whisper of the Floralia. When I closed my eyes and inhaled the scent, I thought I smelled green leaves. And I did. It's patchouli. This has a green herbal patchouli but it was not very aromatic, it was faint and in the distance. It smelled like green grass as well, and it reminded me of garden bushes and shrubs. It was also reminding me of the opening to Quelques Fleurs with those green notes and citrus. This also has green notes and fresh citrus. There is a pleasant mandarin orange scent at the first spritz of Flora. Then the osmanthus scent wafts into the air. Aromatic, green, but again, a whisper, almost like we're leaving the Floralia on one of the roads outside of Rome, or about to enter into Rome and can only vaguely make out what's going on. The osmanthus is a note I enjoy in fragrance and it's the biggest accord here. Then I smelled some rose and peony flowers very pink and soft, delicate and dreamy. The scent of flowers gives way to the sandalwood in the dry down. It's a linear scent as in it does not develop into other scents nor does it every become heavy. For me the true Flora or Floralia scent is Paris by Yves Saint Laurent and Quelques Fleurs super floral fragrances. This is not floral enough for me. Someone mentioned that it smells like herbal-floral shampoo and it does. I have a shampoo and conditioner that smells just like this. I do enjoy it. It's refreshing, it's a quiet little spring scent and very relaxing, soothing and sweet. I enjoy putting it on after a shower. It does not have a long life in fact sometimes it's on me 2 hours other times 5 but that's not enough time for me. I would say it's moderate not too weak but the longevity is not to my liking. I also feel it sits close to the skin and doesn't throw out much sillage. It's pretty.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This smells exactly like the fragrance used in some Alberto culver shampoos and conditioners. It is pleasant and different but after you have smelt it in a conditioner, you don't really want to wear it. At least that's what's happened to me

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Ok, burnt shampoo!!?? Sorry, it is a very pretty sweet floral...easy to wear, nicely constructed and oh so very feminine too!!! I had it and used it all, thinking of getting another one as it smells soooo pretty!!! I like osmanthus as a rule, it has a smooth creamy vibe...
Lovely scent!! Springlike and charming!! young and romantic even

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This fragrance has an uncanny resemblance to the scent of burnt hair. Wash your hair with a citrus/fruity shampoo and then set it on fire, and this is the result.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: What comes to my mind smelling this fragrance is a floral dance. Youthful and vernal, it is a fragrance for chic girls. I get the urge every spring.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
When I wear this perfume, the moment I spray it on me, it is as if Donna Summer's I feel love begins to play out loudly. I mean it! I really love Flora EDP.
If I had to choose just one word to describe it, that word would be ethereal. Maybe it's the combination of the base notes and the osmanthus, when it dries down is simply perfect on me. The patchouli, which can create olfactory tragedies, is smoothly blended with the sandalwood and together they add depth to the scent. The projection is good, not too invasive but noticeable. Bright, feminine and kind of mysterious. Thank you Frida, this is pure perfection.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This somehow gets me a lot of compliments. I used to love it very much, but it's one of those things that I get tired of eventually. Gets rather unpleasantly sour during humid days. Maybe it's just me, though.

It's been nearly a year since I last used it. I'm sure if I re-visit the bottle on cooler days, I would find that I like it again, even for just a season.

In any case, I'll give it a thumbs up for all those days past that I loved it very much.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
The fresh florals are very apparent, which pleased me. Most florals give me a headache but Flora smells like a clean spring. It's clean, slightly bitter, and not heavy at all. The dry down is warmer and the rose is slightly overpowering.

There is one thing; I applied this to my wrist, and my skin immediately itched and formed a slight rash. This is not something that has ever happened to me before, so perhaps Flora is just not right for my body chemistry.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I loved this perfume at first but honestly it's one of those fragrances that you get sick of really fast. I can't wear it anymore. It literally makes me feel nauseous. Super eh

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
It was my top5 favorite but now i have so many perfumes that i forgot about flora gucci.

I love the scent, before nothing was like it, but now i can smell other fragrances with similar scent. Britney spears midnight fantasy is one of them which is far cheaper & has good staying power. But i do find the smell of flora gucci better than the others.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: It has a very light scent and one of the best floral perfumes tht i have ever seen.it,s frsh and citrus theme causes you to feel freshness and it doesnt disturb and tired you.i recommend it to young active ladies.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This perfume is not what i expecting to love. I've imagined of a sharp and heavy floral scent with a citrus opening. I was wrong.

All i can smell is sweetness from osmanthus flower, peony and rose come together at middle. It's a warm, sweet, happy scent. I'm very enjoy this. It's easy to wear, suitable for all weather. Not too in-the-face scent, no harming. Love!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Flora is a welcome change from a fruitchouli or a vanilla-based scent. It's a heady, warm and very sweet floral.

The opening is characterised by a juicy floral centered around the fruity, apricot-like osmanthus, which was lovely when combined with some slightly sharp citrusy accords. This developed into something a little more soapy and watery, until the scent really started to unnerve me. I then checked the notes and realised what it was: patchouli. That horrible, stomach-churning funk when combined with very sweet notes will always be my nemesis. I did not enjoy the dry-down of this at all. Soft to moderate sillage; longevity is for about 5-6 hours.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Very similar to the others of the flora range. I think this scent is a bland watery floral sort of thing very much like D&G The One which I also don't particularly care for. I think it is the rose in it which ruins it for me as my nose is very much put off by anything rosey. Lovely scent but not for me.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This perfume was totally not what I was expecting when I went to spray it. I was imagining some kind of heavy, yet conservative "Anais Anais"-style floral. Gucci Flora EDP is a sparkling floral fragrance. It smells like an old-school chypre without the animalic elements. Flora is rather linear in its progression, slightly soapy and more fruity than floral in my opinion.

A nice scent of citrus, osmanthnus and peony. Acidic and sharp, it reminds me a bit of sherbet lemons (some say cat-pee, which I sort of understand how this could evolve as such on certain people's skin but not on mine). Obviously skin chemistry plays a big role in the evolution of this fragrance. This is definitely a try before you buy.

I also don't know anybody else who wears this fragrance, if that's something which matters to anyone.

Unfortunately, like most other Gucci fragrances I've tried, the silage and projection is not good. As an eau de parfum, there is a nice scent cloud for around 2 hours or so, but then the scent dies off considerably. By around 6 hours in it has become a skin-scent.

Overall complete longevity is 7-12 hours, but like I said this fades considerably in silage during that time.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I am a fan of Gucci fragrances... But flora...It's too bitter for me, I don't like it...

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Amazing lasting power. Floral but fresh. A little sweet but just the right dose. I love it!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I love this scent! Who created this (nose)?

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I love this scent. A juicy beautiful floral, which is clean rather than sweet. A little powdery, but not too much. I always get complimented on my perfume whilst wearing it.

I wouldn't really say this is overly floral, as the name would suggest - this smells more fruity to me. It packs quite a punch and lasts all day quite easily, but the scent isn't too overpowering.

I wear this all year round and either day or night, it really is lovely and a perfume that I have purchased again and again.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This was close to a "want" for me, but I found it is MUCH different on skin than on paper. Perhaps it's just my chemistry, but -

Flora EDP starts off with a fuzzy, sweet, floral, citrus combination - and that's where it loses me. The citrus is lemon & something more along the lines of shampoo-based-soapy mandarin, and the peony is undeniably sweet & strong. The sweetness is very much on the sugary side - not gourmand, but sickly sweet & sharp. The drydown is just a slightly softened version of the initial jumble. So, while it's linear in it's progression, it's still feels like a clustered, clumsy mess.

For a refined & more blended scent that shares similar characteristics, try: Creed's Asian Green Tea, or even Miss Dior EDP for that sweet citrus!

I'm wondering if the EDT is more polite, because I was really hoping to make this 'fume work!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I have always loved the Flora scent, so when Gucci released the EDP version I was like YAAAAY because it had to mean that the only thing wrong with the EDT version - it's longevity - would be fixed.

WRONG!

This version of Flora is more rounded, more deeper, but still that feminine, fruity/floral, scent that is like heaven in a bottle. I imagine this is what running in a field with flowers in my hair would smell like (I live in suburban australia, so forgive me if running in a field of flowers smells nothing like this)

but COME ON you would think being an EDP it would have to have decent staying power, or at least be miles better than the EDT. I sprayed at 8am, by 10am it was very weak. Might as well have saved my $$ and bought another EDT bottle. I even layered the body lotion with it aaaaand nothing :( I shouldnt be that surprised, Guilty Intense was not much better than regular Guilty in the longevity department.

I am thinking Gucci is jumping on the "make it weak, customer sprays more, customer uses more, customer purchases again sooner" bandwagon. At least there will always be Chanel.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Lovely, sweet, green leafy floral, not to be mistaken for a fruity-floral. The juice is actually quite rich and thick. Longevity on my skin is 8+ hours and projection can be loud if sprayed with a heavy hand.

Side note: I love the bottle.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Opening is really sweet, which is something that I like, then more sweetness and flowers, good staying power 4 to 6 hours and more if you put some on your clothing, however the price is really high, try to get a hold of it as a sale opportunity.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I don't have it but i have smelled it and i like it !

- Flora is a very warm and fresh floral fragrance in the same time .


- I think it is not for young ladies or teenager but for mature women .

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I thought I loved this, but I do not. Wish I hadn't purchased it, I never feel like wearing it. There is some heavy, thick note that I don't really care for and the perfume overall seems too sweet.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Dreadfully boring. A very sweet floral. Overpriced and overrated. It fails to inspire any sort of mood or emotion in me. Just the regular bunch of flowers, in a done-to-death combination of rose + peony + citrus + some sweet watery floral...but wait, it gets worse...in Gucci Flora that generic (but usually lovely/fresh/pleasant) combination is intensified and made cloyingly sweet by the addition of patchouli.
So I guess that just makes Flora even more intensely and in-your-face generic than the regular, lighter rose/peony/citrus combos.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I feel it a little bit too sweet and a little too acidic. Maybe it's because my skin type and pH. Anyways, a beautiful blended scent. Young but immature. For girls between 15-25 years. I may say that I prefer more deeper scents such as Bvlgari Jasmin Noir or Very Irresistible Givenchy. For those who want to keep it simple, in a white laced medium length dress and some flats or a fine sandal, in the summer sun, this will be a well balanced perfume. Cosy, floral but fruity and childish. Maybe innocent and seductive in a naive way.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I could wear this any season, it's beautiful, great silage, great longevity.
The initial citrus is brill, not sharp nor sweet, but its fresh and zesty. Soon the best osmanthus note appears, I love osmanthus and this is perfect!
It's the ideal floral perfume, well blended, and by far the best in the whole of the Flora series!
Great job by Gucci, their best perfume! Love it!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I really like this after the first few minutes. It's great. But....when first applied I get hair products and musk/smoke.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Quite good floral scent. I think there's also a dominant sweet fruity scent in it, so it's fruity-floral.
Fresh, but not too much. Also not overwhelmingly sweet or overwhelming in any other way. Delicate and clean. There is some kind of medicament scent in it, but it doesn't bother me.
It's a daytime fragrance and perfect for summer/spring.
Also good for a day in office or school. An everyday scent.
Very nice!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Best floral perfume ever!!! One of my top 5. Can't find any other floral fragrance better than this. Gucci Flora EDP is so gorgeous, rich, elegant, and sophisticated.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
It has a light powdery, sugary sweetness and is fresh and peppery, held together with a slight sweet musk.
I like it - its interesting and has a nice fresh/dry note that honestly reminds me of new carpet (which I like anyway). Like when you walk in to a carpet shop -a clean, dry, fluffy scent.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
One of the best floral fragrances out there :)
Fresh but not sporty or overwhelmingly citrus
Slightly sweet but not sugary
Special, not a typical floral
A little bit heavy so one spritz in the air and walk through it and you're good to go
Oh and the bottle is amazing (I'm a sucker for cute bottles) :D

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I liked it at first sniff and bought it. But I regret it. There is a floral note that I don't like at all!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Follow up to previous post;

Having worn this for 2 days now, I can say I really do like this. I do not like any fruit in perfumes, and looking at Osmanthus in the notes info, I see it is apricot/leather. I guess I am picking up on the leather/patchouli/pepper as opposed to fruit in this perfume.

It is almost chypre like. Slightly mature but also wearable by women, but probably not teenagers.

I would call this a "business" scent, elegant, refined and classical, and is close to the skin but I find that appealing as my husband has to get close to smell it !!!

However don't let that put you off, it is well constructed and I will be sampling more Gucci's as a result.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I am very fortunate in that my husband likes me to wear perfume, and if he goes to the city he often returns with bearing perfume gifts.

I was given his last night, at some ungodly hour, on his return. As I was wearing Obsession, I chose to wait until after my shower this morning to try it. I have never purchased Gucci before, so this gave me an opportunity to test something I would not have bought. My husband has a good "nose" and chooses such lovely perfumes for me.

Once again, he has brought home an Olfactory delight. I often get so caught up in doing research here before I buy that I prejudice my choice.

Anyway to sum up, I really like it. It hits all the right notes for me and him, and will make further comments after a day or two of wearing this.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I want this perfume so bad and I'm just waiting to pick it up on duty free on my first travel abroad this year! I think that Thurea did a great review of Flora EdP, so I won't bother giving another one as I feel the same way! Great fragrance, just lovely.

PS! I've finally bought me a Flora EDP 50 ml. and I enjoy every bit of it! I can't really understand some of the harsh reviews below, but I'll tell you one thing. If you've smelled Flora from the bottle in perfume stores and it smells weird or sour, please don't let it scare you away as the testers are often treated badly and lights and warmth will destroy the fragrance. If you try a brand new bottle, I can't imagine anyone not falling in love with this juice! One of my favorites! :)

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This is a unique, young lady.

At first spray it's very light on the floral and just sweet, lemon candies, the chewing kind. After a while, it's like I don't understand why it's even called "Flora" in the first place. The different kind of sweet citrus fruits, patchouli and the ever so slightest hint of peony is what radiates softly from where I sprayed it, after about 10-20 minutes of dry-down time.

It's unique. Definitely. Many times in the past when I've walked past someone I've detected the subtle traces of this in the air, and since this was a blind buy, I smirked and went "So THIS is that perfume!" when I sprayed it. It's almost as if it sparkles and tingles slightly in your nostrils when you smell it, as if beaming a smile of citrus and bright florals. It's beautiful and everything you could possibly ask for in a signature scent.

Unfortunately, while it has outstanding lasting power, its sillage is so soft it's near indetectable. I'd had hoped for something more potent from an EdP, but I guess that's the charm and personality of Flora: The sheer tenderness of it.

I'm in love.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Very unique and smells like nothing else out there, that it can be compared to.
Another masterpiece from Gucci, long lasting, beautiful development of notes, excuisite and very interesting. Among my top 10 fragrances.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
(English)
Earlier hottie is, but nothing too, after some 15-20 minutes it gets sweeter, only a sweet synthetic, artificial, nothing comfortable or cozy, it has a smell of medicine is almost childish. Can be used on a daily basis if you do not cause headache, it was a blind purchase and I will not buy again.



(portuguese)
No início é gostosinho, mas nada demais, após uns 15-20 minutos ele fica mais doce, só que um doce sintético, artificial, nada confortável ou aconchegante, é quase cheiro de remédio infantil. Pode ser usado no dia a dia se não te causar dor de cabeça; foi uma compra cega e eu não comprarei de novo.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Seems I'm just one of the few here who got vanilla from this EDP after I tested this from a department store. I liked that it was a fresh vanilla as opposed to a warm one (a warm one would be cloying here in the tropics), which I found quite unique and more attractive than the sweet vanillas which abound nowadays, but was surprised upon looking up the notes in fragrantica that there is no vanilla. I was even more surprised after purchasing a bottle that it was totally different from how the tester in the store smelled on me. Perhaps the tester was spoiled? But funny that I liked the "spoiled" scent better than that of the fresh bottle. Flora's scent is off-putting and I almost couldn't stand sniffing it on my skin. I don't kmow for sure what osmanthus smells like, but if that's the strongest note as voted by reviewers here, then I'd be more wary of that note in future purchases. I don't get any citruses on my skin, but I do smell citrus and mandarin orange when sprayed on clothing. Too bad, because the citruses are the only thing that balance out the cloying (osmanthus?) note for me. Flora is just okay for me but I wouldn't think much of parting with it.
EDIT: I live in the tropics and I tested this frag in the rainy season. It was much more humid then; but now in the cooler and drier months of January and February, Flora gets much better. The citruses become a bit more noticeable and balances out the osmanthus.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This bottle has a lovely design. Everything about him is perfect and good quality. Since the hexagon has a heavy glass, finishing first and when we open the box, the internal black pattern with flowers on white makes it an elegant and delicate gift.
The scent is mild, springlike absolutely accepting a good summer.
I'm already famous for citrus detest, but here's an intriguing citrus, the top notes, citrus and bergamot does not scare me, the pink pepper is very calm this scent, his only fault is that 'strangely' is called Flora (me sends the flower, but feeling he came to understand this name in the broad sense of the word), is classified as a floral, but the flowers are so shy that you hardly feel them. Its floral notes are very timid even, you know they are there in the whole of the work, but do not feel alone.
And seeing the review below, I'm not the only one who thinks that it.
In the evolution allows the combination of patchouli, sandalwood but that makes a marriage work with citrusy.
It is very comfortable, there is a striking floral, or a perfume that goes a trace or something, who will only feel approaching.
He makes the kind gentle, meek and gentle, for those days when you're dreaming and needing to see everything in pink
Well, there is a floral that is not floral, citrus is no burning nostrils, soft and lovely.

Este frasco tem um design lindo. Tudo nele é perfeito e de boa qualidade. Desde o sextavado, tem um vidro pesado, acabamento de primeira e quando a gente abre a caixa, a estampa interna preta com flores em branco faz dele um elegante e delicado presente.
O perfume é suave, absolutamente primaveril, aceitando numa boa o verão.
Eu já sou famosa por detestar os cítricos, mas está aqui um cítrico intrigante, as notas de saída, cítricos e bergamota não me assustaram, a pimenta rosa está bem calma neste perfume, seu único defeito é que 'estranhamente' se chama Flora ( me remete a flor, mas sentindo ele passei a entender este nome no sentido amplo da palavra), está classificado como um floral, mas as flores são tão tímidas que você quase nem as sente. Suas notas florais são muito tímidas mesmo, vc sabe que elas estão lá no conjunto da obra, mas não as sente individualmente.
Na evolução permite a combinação do patchouli, mas é o sândalo que faz o casamento funcionar com a saída cítrica.
Fica muito confortável, não é um floral marcante, nem um perfume que vá deixar rastro ou coisa do tipo, só vai sentir quem se aproximar.
Ele faz o tipo delicado, meigo e gentil, para aqueles dias em que você está sonhadora e precisando ver tudo em cor de rosa
Bem, está aí um floral que não é floral, é cítrico sem arder as narinas, suave e encantador.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Initial Spritz: Lilly is the most prominent
5 min later: it's a very light & clean; I smell lemon and white flowers
30min later: That harsh lemon /acidic note has disappeared ...it reminds me of J'adore with a drop of vanilla or a lighter version of D&G l'eau The One
1 hr later: a shy rose tried to shine amidst white flowers, vanilla and lemon
5.5 hrs later: apricots and white flowers, still very similar to a less acidic less musky J'adore
9 hrs later: a nice warm apricot scent

On my skin there is no patchouli ,sandal wood or peony.

Overall Gucci flora is light but long lasting. It stays fairly close to the skin and I keep having to put my nose right up to my arm to smell it. It is not linear so if you are repulsed by the initial smell give it some time to develop. It is a good scent for those who don't like strong perfumes and those who gravitate towards fresh / floral scents.

Skin Type: oily
Office safe: yes very
Potency: Medium ( 3-5 sprays)
Timing: spring & summer
Projection: sits close to the skin initially arms length after a few hours
Longevity: 10 hrs +
Price about $49 for 50 ml perfume & lotion at Winners
Packaging: 8/10

Will I Repurchase: yes

Disclaimer: my experience may be different from your experience based on my skin type, my chemistry, the season, and my personal tastes

I really like this scent. Some people think it smells like baby powder, and I get that.
I first smelled Gucci Guily EDT on my sister. She used to wear it when she went out on the evenings. It was through her fur coat, curled hair, statement necklace 'glamorous phase' :) so to me this will always smell like those things.

Gucci Guilty Eau was a gift from her to me, as she knew I loved the smell. Although this is a different flanker, it smells enough like the original to me. I really like it for when I am wanting something clean and soapy that smells classy.
It's a good choice for work as I don't think it would be likely to offend.

Was meaning to get EDT but accidentally bought Eau instead. I didn’t like it on first spray but couldn’t stop sniffing my wrist after. The silage and longevity are so so terrible. This smells like expensive soap very powdery from the musk. Dry down smells more like baby powder. Sadly due to its terrible longevity and silage I only use this to sleep. Very comforting. This would have been a perfect scent for white crisp T-shirt and jeans if longevity was better.

I have three Guilty flanker samples, and I think this is my favorite. It's simple, classic, and comfortable.

Maybe a little bit on the generic side, but it still just smells really, really good.

Unfortunately the sillage and longevity are almost nonexistent, so this won't be a full bottle purchase for me, but I just like smelling it.

If this perfume is a girl, then she’s the type of girl who is well mannered. She’s not overly perky and girly but she’s still fun to be with. She can be very sexy but is still able to roll up her sleeves and get her hands dirty if she wants to. She’s elegant but approachable. This flanker has the best of both worlds and is able to succesfully balance all of its components.

An underrated, easy-going white-musk-based perfume. The floral note in the pyramid above shouldn't be (Lily), but (Lilac) instead.

It begins so musky, but after leaving it to rest this perfume resembles the smell of (baby powder) in a refreshing manner. It isn't dusty; it rather feels aquatic and cold.

It smells feminine, innocent, clean, fresh, soothing, and charming for casual and sportive wear during spring and summer. It's really refreshing, and that special fruity sweetness is quite addictive. The sillage and lasting power are both amazing, from full bottles--at least from my bottle. Even after you stop noticing your sprayed scent, it remains a compliment getter.

P.S. It seems some production batches have performance shortages, as I can realize that from few reviews, and that's a common issue in the industry. The performance from my bottle is adequately loud and very long-lasting, 8+ hours. I'm sad for reviewers with non-satisfactory experiences.

Sexy, Subtle version of Guilty with MUSK,,,the "Good" kind too~ Perfect for those that thought any of the Guiltys were too strong. The Musk in this reminds me a Clean Skin, by Clean, the add a tiny amount of Guilty~STUNNING! I only have a sample, I wore it all day, plus I sprayed a card & it's in my purse, sprayed my shirt to see how it smells on that shirt in the morning. Great Test. Lay in across a chair or whatever when you take your shirt off go **Straight** to it the next morning. See for yourself how it lasts on your clothes. We all get nose blind.I will wear my sample all week, it may be my Weekend present, Haha...~My skin EATS perfume. It's Hair & clothes for me most of the time~ Love it :) Natalie N on YT
Update! I have the FULL Bottle & am still in love. My favorite Guilty b/c it is the lightest & mixed with Musk. Good for anytime. MMM mMMMM Natalie N on Youtube~

Are these notes right for this? I'm getting lilacs and violets with a touch of musk and nothing else; no fruit, no lily and no watery notes. This actually smells like the gentle kid sister to the original Gucci Guilty--sort of like Jo and Beth of Little Women in perfume form, LOL!

Gucci Guilty EAU pretends to be a light smell of flowers. This is this quiet girl in the classroom but when she speaks out, the class would shock.

Well... this is how I perceive this baby. Starts quiet and soft... but at the end of the day, you will still have a strong kind of smell toned down, if that makes sense.

I TOTALLY LOVE IT. And I purchased it the second day I sampled.

I use to use strong perfumes despite the hot humid weather, this is perfect because I can have strong notes in a soft perfume. My chemistry goes well with this.

When I saw the notes, I was really surprised. Tbh I didn't expect either the litchi or the aquatic notes. I was expecting powder, vanilla, black currant, even coffee, and maybe jasmine.
Something spicy, too light.

I'm not opposed to aquatic notes that so often smell synthetic or like hairspray, sunscreen, cosmetics, etc. For example, Gwen Stefani's (discontinued) perfume was VERY synthetic, and it was just fine by me.

Gucci Guilty -EAU- is more than I can take because it goes beyond smelling synthetic, to me it is overwhelmingly medicinal, like an antiseptic. I feel as if I smell like a first-aid product, or maybe I smell like a hospital? That antiseptic accord is so strong I can almost "taste" this fragrance in my mouth; it's medicinal on an institutional level. Meaning, it smells like a disinfectant cleaning product so strong, you can't buy it at the grocery store, only hospitals, asylums and prisons can buy it from some industrial supplier. In this sense, the name 'Guilty' is fitting.

There's a soft floral dry down (more powdery than creamy) but that school nurse's office smell lingers in the background even as the lilac takes the stage. The lilac stays very close to the skin and is gone fairly quickly. All I'm left with is some powdery musk very close to the skin, and then a short time later it's completely gone and the only thing that remains is the feeling of inflammation in my face (my sinuses).

I haven't had a perfume physically irritate me this much, ever. I don't think I can even finish this sample, and that's unheard of for me. Yikes.

My favorite Guilty flanker! At first Guilty Eau was not an obvious love for me, cause it's subtle. But subtle in a sexy way. There's something subtly sweet about this. Like a natural sweet smelling skin scent. This is a warm fragrance. Also there's something powdery in there. Not listed in the official notes, but definitely there none the less. I have a feeling that this might become one of those "I'm not sure she's wearing perfume or if that is her natural scent but she smells so damn nice!" ...types of scents. Precisely because of that characteristic I have now moved from like to complete love with this fragrance. I tested it today, if I can't shake it off my mind by tomorrow I might have to splurge and add it to my collection. It's very different from anything else I own. Tbh I can not smell any of the individual notes listed. Call me crazy but I almost sense an old school makeup-y/baby powder/ facial cream kind of smell to it. In a Good way! In my books thats definitely not a bad thing at all. I recommend smelling this out. It's unique in its own way.

I think this smells like a relationship you really wanted to work but just wished it never happened. I had really high hopes for this. Im a huge fan of Guilty intense so I really wanted to test, and plus I was in the mood for a new spring/summer fragrance. I intentionally went without any perfume into Sephora one day. Sprayed this on the inside of my wrists and it hit me. Not really in a good way. I cant really describe it but almost as soon as I put it on, it was gone. I was shocked. It dried down to a really powdery light skin scent. I expected something really fresh and aquatic but musky and angelic at the same time. I feel cheated on by Guilty eau.

So initially i wrote this review for the Gucci original but its actually for this one!
Ulta had a good selection of the Gucci guilty team and other Gucci perfumes, so after testing them all on paper, this one won a place on my wrist. It instantly reminded me of these elegant perfumes mature ladies wear to fancy events, of course a more youthful version - I used to go to the opera a lot as a kid and this scent brought me back to that amazing spring night atmosphere with ladies in sparkly dresses and with their mink boleros on, where their perfumes would all blend together with the scent of the white flowers of the night - must be the lily. As time passed by it became more intense, in a good way. It def distracted me while working out - at first I thought maybe a window is open and this aroma is coming from outside because that flower note smelled so real. I love it and prefer it over all other Guilty scents.

I love this fragrance. It's very warm and inviting...the musk and the white floral are perfectly paired. Lasting power is so-so but overall it's a beautiful perfume and my personal favorite from the Guilty collection of fragrances.
@Mademoiselle: "Guilty Girl" would be great >lol
This is a so-so fragrance that's a little boring in a My Burberry sort of way. Kind of like hairspray.

This is indeed very-very watered down version of original. There's not much left of allure of the original.
Lilacs, powdery and spicy notes are almost gone completely.
It's still kind of nice, but there's not that essence in it, that I liked about Guilty. I think Guilty ifself is a light fragrance, it's doesn't necessarily need an Eau version.
What can I say, people who adored Guilty need to try it anyway, I guess.
It's a relief they did not name it Guily Girl, a la Dior :D
Sounds great. And another aquatic fragrance for 2016, seems like watery stuffs will be the trend in 2016.

Gorgeous scent, this is a big love for me. This is a very approachable clean western Oud that still maintains a middle eastern vibe. There’s no cumin or “funk” in this unless you think leather is funky.
In the initial opening there’s a lot of sweet rose and tart blackberry, it’s a little naturally sweet and jammy, not overly/synthetic sweet. Around 30minutes the leather and Oud come out more, the patchouli is light but detectable. Everything here is pretty evenly blended, no one note seems to dominate, and it stays in this realm for several hours with better than average projection. At the 7 hour mark this has become a warm dry amber with a 1-2 foot scent bubble.

Durty, fonky cumin-laced oud. Yes there's patchouli, berry, and rose, but they're challenging to detect against the strong animalic backdrop. For advanced noses only - if Ombre Nomade is too much for you, back away slowly. I like the smell per se, but I'd rather not have it represent me in the world. Good for dirtying up too clean frags in a layering combination. Voice of the Snake and Guilty Absolute Femme offer gentler and more wearable remixes of this DNA.

Strong oud oppening. Slightly fecal (perhaps due to the aerobic oud).
More pleasant on the drydown, however the Rose is barely detectable.
If you are looking for a rose fragrance I'd recommend trying the Guilty edp.

@POTFORTY2, so you are suggesting Morilas did a time travel in 2018 (potentially 2017) to go forward to 2019 and get the DNA of royal oud and give it to Gucci?
I own a lot of Arabian Oud bottles and although they are really nice and high quality but mostly are inspired by other perfumes.

This bears a shocking resemblance to Arabian Oud Royal Oud (which is $1500 retail). I wouldn’t be surprised if Alberto Morillas drew his inspiration from that cologne on this one as Gucci Intense Oud is similar to Black Afgano.

This is the best masculine rose I’ve ever smelled and the only rose scent I’d actually really wear. It’s a smooth fresh rose with blackberries smoothing it out. This one is very underrated years into collecting I’ve only found one other fragrance like it. It is unique and smells awesome.

This beery/rose/oud was a better men's rose fragrance than most of its competitors, and it will be missed. It's not particularly complex or multidimensional, but it sits on the skin well and doesn't overstay its welcome. In many ways, it's a less jammy (and less expensive) alternative to something like Rose d'Arabie, but somewhat more versatile.

So this has a similarity to Guerlain’s Oud Essential. I’m a Guerlain addict, so this pains me to say, this is better. The blackberry puts this over the top. THIS IS IMPORTANT. This is a total departure from the rest of the Gucci Guilty line. If you get this thinking there will be even a hint of the Guilty dna you will be disappointed.

Saying that; this is my favorite in the entire line. It’s predominantly Blackberry, rose, and oud. It’s a bit mysterious on a masculine wearer. Black tailored suit, black button down shirt, no tie at an evening out. It’s also perfectly unisex. If this was in a niche bottle, people would love it. I think the fact that they included this in the Guilty line may be where some of the criticisms stem from.

If they had called this Gucci Blackberry Oud, I think, knowing what you’re getting, people would’ve raved about it.
I don’t wear a lot of rose fragrances myself, but this is my favorite. The performance all around is solid.

I think I’m lucky I didn’t blind buy it
Bought a sample and tried it out
The original dna is present in the first moments of the scents not more than half an hour
When it settles down it’s a weaker less pronounced version of Gucci by Gucci oud
The same so called “oud” is used I Both frags that it makes them undistinguishable
And since I already have the superior one which is the later I don’t need this nor do I plan to get it
Performance is weak and that adds to the reason of passing out on it

Pretty similar in vibe to absolute pour femme, but with some notable differences. The rose accord in this takes a more powdery slant, whereas the rose in absolute feels more citric and sharp alongside a more prominent patchouli+cypress accord. I wish the cypriol was bumped up to take the role of cypress, because that balanced out the juicy berry+rose in the absolute. The end result is more powdery and soapy, but with a clean and deep oud accord + soft leather running through it. It is marginally more masculine than absolute pour femme, though I find the two are firmly unisex based on my skin chemistry. The gucci guilty absolute series (male + female + this oud) was an incredible set of flankers that came as close to niche as any designer has gotten in the past decade or so. It's a shame its been discontinued, and I recommend picking this one up but under a 100 dollars, it's definitely niche quality but not worth breaking the bank for.

This is my second comment/review, just to tell you how much I love it! Smells like berry liqueur or a berry (fruit) punch. The blackberry here is predominant and sweet, but the oud adds a sour/slightly bitter kick that drastically calms down in the drydown. It has a boozy smell-the same sour effect alcohol would add to a sweet berry punch, perfect to balance out the sweetness. It smells like it has vanilla, something not creamy but smooth and round must be the amber. I would honestly wear this on a night out. Black dress. 1 gentleman in the comments below said this was too sweet for him to wear and it leans way more feminine to him, which I can foresee many men thinking the same, but no doubt, men would love to smell this on a female

Love it. Maybe its the pepper, but something makes this just unforgivable in the beginning. But after the opening, it apologises, and you forgive it. Starts off putting, musky, old, bitter not sweet smell with a bit of oud. Then later becomes a soft, soft sweet(not enuf to say jammy but almost) rose and oud combination. As a woman, id wear this out on a date, jst put it on 30 minutes be4, otherwise he might drive off while u go get ur purse in the house😐

I blindbought this, hoping to get something with the Gucci Guilty Absolute DNA plus Oud...but...just like Patrickchula (below) this started out as a hate/refusal.

As soon as I sprayed it on, it smelled like a bush of roses in which a dog had pooed. Fortunately, the potency of the oud and rose combination wore off quickly...and 20-30 minutes into it, it smelled like an old lady which had stepped on dog poo...1 hour into it, it smelled very comforting, like my grandma smelled when she put on Bulgarian Rose Moisturiser. By the time I got smelling the drydown ... I was hooked. It's quite creamy and rosey but once you finetune your nose to it, it's classy, refined, undefiantly bold...as in it definitely shows confidence without being arrogant. I hope this makes sense...I have tried to describe it as precisely as possible

I have been watching this…I finally bought it. I gotta admit. This started out as a Hate.

0 hours: hate it. Regret. Sadness.
2 hours: hmmm. Sorta like it.
4 hours: kinda like it.
6 hours: like it? Really like it?

This is the first Oud fragrance I’ve ever worn, so that smell was a little weird to start. I have so many Gucci Guilty. My first ever bottle was EDP this time last year, and now I’ve got 20 bottles.

I’m going to wear this a couple of more times. Then come back for a final rating.
don't look for the old formula this is waay better creamier and stronger . unisex not that unique for an oud perfume though

There is no better oud out there for this price*!!! I can admit that I was initially put off because it's in the gucci guilty line, but once I tried it out I was immediately in love!

This fragrance is powerful, without being overpowering. The oud is very present while still allowing all the other notes to shine through, and it has the perfect amount of sweetness to keep it on the sensual side. It is my go-to for a night out because I feel sexy in it and it LASTS- it will definitely be present, not just lingering on me even after a full night of dancing!

Both me (female) and my boyfriend can wear it and get compliments. Great value, great versatility- if you have been looking for a good oud but aren't quite ready/able to spend 300+ dollars on one this is your best choice.

10/10- will hunt it down and repurchase when my bottle runs out even if it gets discontinued.

*When I purchased my 90ml bottle it was around 90 USD.

Add some oud and rose to one of my favorite long lasting aftershaves, Pinaud Clubman Special Reserve, and you have Gucci Guilty Oud!

The oud isn't overpowering. I get a fruity opening with some oud. As the fragrance rolls on, you smell the oud but the rose, despite being a top note, doesn't really become prominent until further into the dry down. It's one of the more interesting fragrances I own for that reason.

Others here write that they're getting great projection. The projection is ok on my June 2018 bottle but the scent hangs around for what seems like half a day!. The longevity is excellent and surprised me to the point where I had to edit this review several times. I find myself smelling whiffs here and there 10 hours after applying 4 sprays. I have a bunch of rose and oud fragrances but I think this is the best of the bunch.
While it does open with a lovely rose oud, the rose quickly takes the back seat, and a fecal oud takes the lead. Not for everyone, not blind buy worthy.
Feminine leaning nothing special but it’s a beautiful take on ♦️Blackberry + Rose + Oud.

So, when I got this when it was still kind of affordable, and given the quality of this fragrance I still think it's worth the price even if you have to pay $100 for a 90ml, it's so good that I would say that could be worth it if you're into fragrances like this. I would describe it as completely unisex but I would warn that initially I was turned off by the fact that I think it even leans ever so slightly feminine which will turn a lot of men away. It's very slightly smoky with the oud, but it's blended so well with the rose and the blackberry note that it doesn't give off too much of a smoke vibe. It's fantastic though, I think this could eventually become a favorite but as of right now it's maybe not quite there yet. It's a good signature scent though because it has more versatility than your average oud fragrance, it's very office friendly, and I think you could wear this almost anywhere although maybe it's not quite sexy or obnoxious enough to wear to the club or on a night out where you're with your buddies. It is, however, very romantic smelling and I think it'd be a very good fragrance for a night with your significant other to a very classy restaurant. It's very, very elegant in a way that Gucci seems to excel at with their fragrances.

Buy this is you like fragrances in the style of Tom Ford's Black Orchid or Dior Homme, or other highly unisex floral fragrances that are popular with men. ~$90-100 is probably the sweet spot for buying this one at the moment for the 90ml. B+ to A-, I'll have to wear this one more though because it's so interesting.
I just tested this today and it’s heavenly. I need a big bottle

Omg this perfume is beautiful. It it smells like Gucci absolute pour femme with an added light oud vibe, the blackberry and oud blend very well together, not your typical oud/rose smell. I recently purchased it, and I am very happy with it. It is definitely unisex, with a universal appeal. Such a shame it’s discontinued, luckily is scored a new bottle, thinking about buying a backup if I can find one for decent price . If you can find this don’t hesitate picking it up, can’t see anyone not enjoying this one.

Scent 9/10
Value 8/10
Longevity 8/10
Projection 8/10
Overall 8.5/10
I'm not into Gucci fragrances but this one is really nice.
any one want new bottles of this dm me, am in dubai

Unfortunately, this is a masterpiece from Gucci, which appeared on the market for a very short time and failed to gain much popularity. Again, very good hit and amazing aroma! Gucci, as always, do not cheat and this perfume is proof. very rare and difficult to find! Worth every penny! Very agarwood..very potent...very fine creation and now very expensive! Top of the top!!!
P.S. Nothing simmilar to Polo Supreme oud!!!! Gucci Guilty oud is more niche quality!
Nice sophisticated and classy smelling oud. Dries down a bit powdery. Very similar to Polo Supreme Oud but without the cinnamon.

The initial combination of slightly fecal oud, rose and thick musks give the distant impression of someone having sprayed a rose deodoriser in a stinky toilet. It gradually mellows into a basic woody rose with green touches for much of its life, before settling down on an inoffensive woody base. Overall an above average designer oud, certainly far better than the abhorrent Boss Bottled Oud, but still very much in the cheap designer class and kind of boring apart from the pop of green early on in its development.

Definitely get the rose, but not as much as with the regular Gucci Oud marketed to women. Good dressed up fragrance for a man. Tuxedo, suit and tie for special occasions/weddings. Can be worn casually in cooler weather or at night if you don’t mind the feminine rose.
same rose used in 17 oud mosaic by banana republic. i love this rose. it is much oudy in 17 oud mosaic. i like them both. longevity and projection are perfect.

If you like rose oud but are bored out of your brain of them this is a great pick up.

I think the quality is evident from the first spray with a really great blackberry note. Later the rose oud shows up behind it to create a great combo, with some earthy greeness trying to get in on the action too.

This is unisex imo.

If there were black colored Rose's, I would hope for this to be how they smell. I picture Bruce Wayne in a tuxedo wearing this.

Upscale Sophistication from the Blackberry, Patchouli and leather that wrap themselves around the heart of Oud and Rose.

To me more masculine but could see a confident, sexy lady pulling this off.
Hey guys how does this performs? sillage is room filling?

I love this stuff. Opening is quite piercing with spices, oud and fruit but I enjoy it. Tons of rose/oud fragrances on the market but this one is done very well. Performance is fantastic and the overall smell is beautiful, sexy and opulent.

8/10

What seems to be less talked about in this fragrance is the almost cumin-like spice that’s present. Maybe he mingled some spices in with the pink pepper accord? I get a clean, non-B.O. cumin note under the top notes that reminds me of a toned down version of Guerlain Bois Mysterieux...as in the Guerlain, it does burn off and fade into blurry musky-ness. I think this one and Pour Homme Absolute are worth having side by side.

As you see my collection I know a thing or two about fragrances, I got out of them and kept the gems, but I miss it so I return more obsessed than ever. This composition has been done many times, rose oud, the two notes play well together obviously. This is a A M creation and I can tell. These designer houses want to put all the money in marketing and seek genius arts such as this one to create a “high quality” smell for us. If you want true quality and art , go niche.
This stuff has only been on my hand for a couple of hours and it’s not backing down, projection is out of this world and the smell is starting to change , top notes are heavy on the rose and it plays well so far and isn’t going anywhere soon. The leather amber and oud are starting to dance and I like it. I haven’t owned any Gucci Guilty frags and don’t plan on it YET. I will try absolute as it’s right up my ally note wise . I put this on hand only because of who created it, A M is a genius. I probably will add this to the collection from a discount website and I would never pay $160 for this..
great rose oud blend
Seems of good quality
Scent 8/10 if you like heavy rose
Projection is beast
And so far longevity I can tell is going to be monster

Oh wow...this one! Went to the Downtown DC Macys today on my lunch break and this was the only oud they had. The nice lady asks if I want a sample, of course I said yes. Very aromatic and oudy opening, surprisingly niche-like for Gucci! The dry down reminds me of getting all dressed up with nice perfume and you cant resist your partner so you guys get it on before you can even make it out the house, and your left with the scent of sex and perfume. Sorry to describe it that way but that's what I get. Welcome back Gucci!

Rose dominant oud. Slight animalic component fades after the first hour and becomes overall more pleasant and subdued. The rose also fades slightly but remains dominant over the other components. Rose prominence is far too feminine for my taste. Yet I can appreciate the quality of this fragrance. Excellent projection. Still, would never wear this.

Update 11/26/20: I’ve become enamored of rose scents and bought this and love it. Have not worn to office but might. Longevity is only 3 or 4 hours but great scent.

The scent is so soapy yet it lures people to focus on every detail of its host. It’s like berry blast. The smell of Coca-Cola mixed with oud just keeps hitting my mind. Be careful not to over spray, you do not want people to choke when you pass.

I can see how this really stands out and for anyone accustomed to the typical designer lines carried at the dept. stores seems exotic. In its most basic form this is simply an oud rose, and a far cry from anything original although perhaps a new marketing approach. By comparison to the popular fragrances, it's mysterious, middle-eastern, and dark. If you are more accustomed to middle-eastern fragrances then this will smell fairly common. The juice may even have a few drops of oud in in which are detectable in the opening, which is fairly compelling, but underneath lives a typical leathery synthetic oud that is common in most of the decent oud fragrances available. The rose is sweet, and there is a noticeable jasmine-vanilla-patchouli combo that rings the Mugler bell and makes this in my humble opinion much better suited for a woman than a man. A fruity berry note is tucked in there, and a typical salty synthetic ambergris and musk that smells very 1998. A warm sandalwood is overcrowded by the glut of notes. As it dries down the composition reveals itself to be overloaded and a bit sloppy. Not impressed by this, there are middle eastern roll on oils for a few dollars that are superior if you like this vibe

Alberto Morillas has established a legendary status in perfume world by giving us so many classic over the years like CK one, Amouage opus vii, Bvlgari man series, Aqua Di Gio series etc. I was excited to see what he had come up with by combining oud with his signature fresh notes interplay that he is so famous for. And I must say that I am not disappointed.
It opens with a sweet blackberry and a hint of spice. However these top notes are short lived and in the middle, rose and oud takes over. The oud here is not bitter but has more natural woody feel to it. In the end a touch of leather gives it a slightly mysterious heaviness.
Performance is absolutely beastly
2 to 3 sprays lastwd over 12 hravon my shirt and had huge room filling silage all day long.

nice long lasting, unisex. dark and mysterious. classy. a little gasoline-like, but in the best kind of way possible. I think Oud is an acquired taste, like coffee. But once you get a taste for it, it can be addictive, imho

I work in retail, and i'm usually not very happy with modern fragrances being too sweet and "safe", crowd pleasers.

I must say, i'm impressed with this one though. I'm a big fan of Oudh, and this is a very good take.
Opens with a bright slightly medicinal Oudh, but not overpowering, very well balanced. Then turns to that familiar, Sweet wood resin, and patchouli.

The dry down however? turns more dusty powdery, and reminds me of that fusty smoky top note of Nasomatto Black Afgano.

Longevity: pretty ok
projection: pretty good

It starts off with a juicy and a little bit smoky rose , the oud is in the background, then the cumin note kicks in and ruin everything for me , it's the most potent note and is very discernable. It doesn't disappear until the late dry down (after 7-8 hours) and you are left with a gorgeous woody,rosy and powdery aroma.

This is a really beautiful scent, very sophisticated, soft, fruity, and surprisingly oudy, projects heavily in the opening, then calms down to a gorgeous, wearable Oud fragrance. No regrets here, love it. If I want a more masculine experience, I pump one GGAbsolute, they go well together. It is 9/10 for me, was waiting till it hits the discounters, but unfortunately (or otherwise) I could not wait.

This scent smells more like Amouage Lyric Man than it does any of the modern designer oud iterations. It has a sparkly opening of fresh/fruity musty oud but very quickly turns into a powdery rosy scent. If I was in love with Lyric Man, this would be my new King. Unfortunately, I am not in that camp and prefer the scent of Gucci Gucci Oud over this 'Guilty' Oud.
Very glad I tried before blind-buying as it is still quite expensive.

Begins with a light balsamic oud aroma and then transitions into smelling something like how a tart beer tastes. The similarities to Guilty Absolute Pour Femme are definitely there, but I think the added oud makes this wearable by men, and it would be a great spring fragrance for well dressed men. That’s the only season I could see a man wearing this in though, as this fragrance occasionally smells like you’re walking through a garden nursery

Beautiful and elegant. I liked it but wont pay for it unless reasonably discounted.

Rose oud berries combo.

Similar approach to LV Ombre Nomade minus the spectacular smokiness of LV. Gucci is also weaker and way less quality.

Below average projection for an oud scent but acceptable longevity on skin.

Well!! my experience with the Gucci Guilty Absolute for both genders wasn't successful at all! I couldn't endure the complexity of the so fruitful blackberry note next to the annoying woodsy note in Gucci Absolute pour femme at all, and found the men's version so harsh for my taste!
So when this came out I was hesitant to try it out, But I did,, and,, OH MY GOD! It was an easy LOVE for me with no doubt!!!


Comparing it to its sisters:
Gucci Absolute pour femme
I guess it does indeed share the same Blackberry note in GA pour femme, but its so smooth, so pure, and lovely here, but it doesn’t stay for the whole life-span of the fragrance, however it keeps the scent sweet along with the roses; and I'm glad, actually so glad that I don't get the cypress and the other annoying woodsy notes that are included there!! instead, Alberto Morillas replaced these notes with a heavenly luxurious oud note!!

Gucci intense oud:
Both are extremely successful oud fragrances, Intense oud is more subtle, less sweet, and more smokey, has a perfect niche quality, pure ingredients and for that I give it 4.5/5, leans to be more masculine than unisex, but I wear it no matter what.
Gucci Guilty oud is an easier, less serious concoction!! a beautiful mix between oud and sweet fruity notes, I give it 4/5, and finally a perfectly unisex fragrance!

This was an immediate love.

Gucci Guilty Oud gives you a light, sour oud from jump. The blackberry is prominent, providing a sour sweetness that comes off a little playful. It’s not overbearing by any means - and I think this is aptly marketed as a unisex scent. I can’t say that it’s an extremely unique scent - but it is done very well - and is pretty true to the note breakdown. Unfortunately the blackberry goes away a little quickly - and the scent itself seems to breakdown rapidly. With that said, the scent that remains is nice - mostly oud and rose. It’s a nice entry for oud lovers and newbies. Not scary, not risky. I would recommend.

7/10

Andy is right on the money, this is a subtle oud, it's a component in the blend, but it doesn't dominate nor do the rose or the blackberry. I am in the same boat as theBSR, "oudy-oud" fragrances are not my bag, but this is really pleasant.

This is a well-blended, hearty-yet-fresh fragrance perfect for the winter. The leather and oud combine to give this an old-school lightly animalic opening, and I told the woman at the counter that "I'd bet there is a decent amount of patch in here because it would fit right in as a Tom Ford private blend fragrance." Sure enough, there it is, adding to the rich, indulgent base. Very nice touch.

Great, great fragrance - another winner from Alberto.

I confirm: Morillas is back, and Gucci just had a (needed) earthquake!

When I tried Guilty Absolute, it has been a "coup de foudre" (litterally a "thunder hit", meaning love at first sight in french). One week later, it was on my shelf. (Yes... despite the love, I m patient enough to buy at online discounters for 1/3rd of the retail price)

With Guilty Oud, it's an encore. A beautiful fragrance with good projection.
Rose is present, but no worries, it's subtle (I hate strong rose oud fragrances).
Berries on top, then a subtle rose and clean patchouli (no worries, it's very light, no Zino here, haha!), and then an amber and oud finish. Great frag, even if the oud is the usual aromachemical, and clearly not the major note here. Gucci Intense Oud remains the best choice, but at current ebay/discounter pricing (~$60), it's also a winner!

Fall/winter evenings, 25+

The third Alberto Morillas composition of late from Gucci, Gucci Guilty Oud, follows two successful releases (at least to me) in Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Homme and Pour Femme.

Certainly the most-recent Oud feels like a logical continuity from the next-most-recent Femme, as there is an overlap of berries, rose, patchouli, and amber (in order of descending prominence).

With Femme, we get red berries, but in Oud, we get a sharper, more distinct blackberry note that sings from the top, surely the brightest part of the entire fragrance, but nevertheless (similarly to Femme) quickly drying down into a rose/patchouli/amber blend, with very subtle hints at leather and woods.

Oud's performance is strong, a bit denser than Femme (and perhaps even slightly edging out Homme), with a couple hours of great projection followed by another 6+ on skin.

Certainly these latest releases feel of niche quality and execution, and in the case of Oud specifically, a synthetic, smooth oud serves nicely in lieu of a richer, albeit more animalic or medicinal, counterpart, seen in higher-end offerings.

Pricing ($137-$146 for 90ml via retail) is higher than Femme and a lot higher than Homme, but I'd expect Oud, like its predecessors, to be available on the secondary market at a significant discount. It's a bit of a tough sell at retail, but under $100, it may turn a lot of heads like Gucci Intense Oud did years ago.

8 out of 10

Opens juicy and sweet with the blackberry and oud combining for a (sadly) fleeting boozy aspect. There is nothing stale about it, as the overall impression is fresh. It loses its fruity top note quickly (as in Lalique's Rose Royal) leaving behind bright dry woods and what smells to me like rose d'mai. It wears close to the skin, and if you get close; you'll smell the pink pepper. This is a great grab-and-go choice for me. It's very pleasant and totally inoffensive. I'll probably wear it a lot, but I think on a man this would be really sexy.
Can't wait to smell this fragrance!

I was really hyped on this fragrance. I loved Absolute. I thought it was intoxicating and upon second smell, I needed a bottle. However, this is a miss for me. I smelled in a Gucci store this week and it smelled like too much oud meshed with some stale fruit, and not in a good way. I was going to blind buy this, but I am so glad I did not.
