Let me start by saying, I HATE OUDY OUD. I never understood why anyone would want to smell like a wet basement. That being said, I will always smell anything just to give it a shot.
I went into Gucci at the Americana Mall in Manhasset and tried it. I m so glad I did. This is one I will absolutely be picking up for the Fall.
The blackberry gives it a juicy opening and the oud is not a gross oud at all.
I'm a fan of GG Absolute, and this follows that up nicely in the daring fragrance department.

Ok soooo, I just left the Gucci store in the King of Prussia Mall. Of course I couldn’t leave without putting my nose on their latest release, GGA Oud. I sprayed it on the back of my hand and also sprayed on a test strip. In the opening I get a bright blackberry mixed with some OUD. I pocketed the test strip and went about my day. After maybe two hours, my hand smells like straight OUD... so disappointing. 3 hours later I go to retrieve the test strip from out my pocket. Wow somehow it smells better on the test strip. It actually smells like a blend of notes. I guess this composition doesn’t seem to agree w/ my skin chemistry AT ALL. But even on the test strip the fragrance is a 4/10. Please give this a try on your own skin, you may have a different experience.

I’m a niche perfume snob and I have more than a few ouds whether it be Roja or MFK or pick your poison. Saw this one in the Gucci store in Phoenix today and tried it and bought it, no questions asked. A superb blend from Gucci here and a definite keeper. Not just another Oud to my nose. The Oud is easily noticeable and very smooth. Great job Gucci.
Hmmm...

After having tried Gucci Guilty Absolute, I am so excited about this one! Has anyone actually tried this? Please stop comparing to M7 when this has just been released!!

I can't say I have been following Alberto Morillas works but it does come as a surprise that what I have owned without knowing the perfumer has been a big eye opener for me. What a great living legend Master Perfumer!!
Tried this last week in a gucci store, a little pricey though but well worth the money, builds on the success of Guilty Absolute, i think this will be a major hit for gucci!
Can wait for Flora Oud and Rush Oud
cant wait to get my nose on this

Love Love Love! Morillas is doing incredible things at Gucci!!! A true unisex scent! Oud rose combo isn't too strong and very wearable. Very sweet and fruity! Smells like a sangrias or dark red wine in the opening. Then the leather creeps in and smooths out the sweetness and you get some earthiness from the patchouli and the dry down is a nice smooth slightly sweet balance between rose and oud. AMAZING!!!

product_name: A Forgotten Rose Perfume Oil Gucci
review_content: This had a lot of potential and also the rose here is very pretty, but the musk has some smoky/barnyard nuances, which makes this rose smell dirty, but in a bad way. It is compared to another Gucci A Song for the Rose, I would say A Song for the Rose is a bit lighter, brighter rose, which projects nicely, doesn't just sit packed on your skin as Forgotten Rose. It's in oil concentration, so behaves differently and, of course, has that oily smell to it.

product_name: A Forgotten Rose Perfume Oil Gucci
review_content: I get why this rose was forgotten

product_name: A Forgotten Rose Perfume Oil Gucci
review_content:
Smells like rosewater and lasts about as long. Ok, I'm being factitious, yes there's a bit of pepper and musk but, still, that's it. Perfectly pleasant and worth the twenty quid I paid for it but no more.

If you want an idea of what it smells like, try Yardley English Rose or if you want something that's a full on, realistic rose scent that really lasts; get Tea Rose from Perfumer's Workshop.

product_name: A Forgotten Rose Perfume Oil Gucci
review_content:
This smells lovely but has absolutely no longevity on me. After 3 hours the perfume has disappeared completely (no exaggeration). I can only write that up to either a bad production batch (unlikely) or weak formulation (probable).

Comparing this to Dior's Rose Elixir Precieux it is like comparing an 'eau de cologne' to an 'eau de perfume' where the latter lasts for 12 hours or longer. As an experiment, I put both perfume oils on this morning (11 hours ago). The Gucci perfume had no scent left after 3 hours. The Dior perfume oil is still smelling as if I put it an hour ago.
Oddly, both perfume are based on the essence of the same type of damascena rose although from different countries (Gucci uses rose from Bulgaria and Dior from Turkey) so the difference shouldn't be big, save for differences between manufacturers. The Gucci perfume oil is a very light formulation of the rose, almost as if they were holding back on the concentration, and the pink pepper is quite subtle but just enough to add some spiciness to the oil. The dry-down leaves a delicate rose with a soft musk but disappear much too soon.
This is a shame because I added this to my collection in order to have a rose perfume oil that was a little lighter and smoother than my Dior and would provide me with more options when layering. However given the high price for this 20ml perfume oil, I must confess that I'm terribly disappointed.
I had high hopes for Gucci's new exclusive range and to be honest, I really do love the violet/orris perfume oil but there is nothing in this rose perfume oil that justifies this high price.

To save you from the disappointment I would steer clear of this one. If it is a rose perfume extract you're looking for, the 'Dior Rose Elixir Precieux' is a better option.
That notwithstanding, I do suggest that you try Gucci's other perfume oils like the violet/orris ('A Kiss From Violet') which is both rare and beautiful or the woody ('Ode on Melancholy') perfume oil where cedar and sandalwood plays softly together.
Unfortunately, this time and with this perfume, Alberto Morillas let me down.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: My mother hade this one, and was one of my first experiences in this world of perfumes. Will give all my collection for only 3 sprays from this bud is nowhere to be found.😿🩷💞🩷😿

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
Gucci No. 3 starts with honey and sunshine, rays of aldehydes and ribbons of dry coriander. My nose reads the rose and narcissus as intertwined, a duet of dew and oil, velvety and waxy, pretty and funky, both sipping icewine and getting their toes dirty in the earth. They dance seductively to Prince's "Cream"—'you're filthy, cute and baby you know it.' The air is soap and sweat and leather and hookah smoke.

Things get amorous in the horse stable, and under the stars there are 23 positions and a one night stand, and it's woody in the woods—patchouli and vetiver, so it starts off light and proper and settles hot and heavy. To be clear, this is not an aggressive scene—it's sensual, the peignoir is on the floor, yet it's discreet at this stage. Its transition from bursting green to sensuous earth tones is a reminder that nonlinearity can be a real thrill.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: My favorite leather chypre. I smell a lot of honey in this, and it’s so pretty combined with the rougher greens and aldehydes

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Alberto Morilla’s first creation. An all-time masterpiece for me!

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: You could get this in the late 90's and early 00's for $10 a 100ml bottle at TJ Maxx and Marshall's. They had so many. Why didn't I buy 10? They also had a ton of Fendi back then. Oh well I have a hoard of vintage Halston, Ysatis, Antaeus, Mitsouko, Paloma Picasso, Knowing and Private Collection to make up for it.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I have two bottles of Gucci III. One earlier without the green dot symbol and one later with the green dot. Both have gone slightly bad in the top notes: the earlier one seems higher in alcohol and has an acetone like opening while the later is more oily and has gone rancid. However, in the earlier bottle the alcohol/acetone note disappears after some minutes while the oily/rancid note in the younger bottle sadly lingers on.

Once the bad opening in the old bottle has disapeared, the scent is remarcably well kept. A wonderful earthy green pine forest punch, where the damp mossy ground smells both chalky dry and mysteriously deep like the bossom of the earth.

In the old bottle I can't smell any flowers, while the younger bottle is a bit more cheerful with early spring flower vibes. But I like that strictness about the older bottle. Very old school, with no sweetness what so ever, yet could have been a niche scent of today I guess. Classy and clean. Totally unisex. Love it!

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Another very classic lady for sure. It’s rich, sophisticated and elegant and has a lot in common with Trussardis Donna, though it is more reminiscent of vintage Hermes' style-wise. Floral, spicy and leathery with accents in all the right places. Like an italian speaking french. Or vice versa. Quality is outstanding and the longevity amazing. If you are still in love with floral chypres and haven't smelled Gucci no. 3 yet, you should go treat yourself if you can still find it. It's beautiful.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Another of Halston's children along with Armani pour Femme (1982) and Niki de Saint Phalle. Giorgio Red would continue this theme, heightening the incense and spice notes. All are very soapy and comforting.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
Baptized with bright bergamot, jasmine wrapped in beeswax stabilizes the base of civet leather. Clear and emerald green narcissus, with powdery iris, rose, penetrating moist oakmoss, smooth patchouli, gradually layered.
Why do you say №3 has a very classical beauty?
Because it is conservative, regular, balanced, and especially polite.
The fleeting fragrance and lack of tension have not changed the aesthetics of the era. №3 is difficult to impress the public and set off a trend.
Gucci's obscure perfume is not only №3.
The demure and reserved №3 is like a low-key lady. The lighter the daffodil fragrance, the more it highlights its delicate elegance. It is quite different from the impression given by the Gucci brand.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I have a vintage 60ml bottle sealed for sale or trade. Thanks

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: wow so expensive on ebay while here in Jakarta, got it for 20 USD.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
This is beautiful! I was lucky to get a sample from the 80's that was still great.

I mostly get oakmoss, narcissus and green notes. The longevity is great also. Unfortunately the oak moss gave me an allergic reaction. Still, I loved the smell and it wasn't overpowering like a lot of classic perfumes can be.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I’m finally excited to post a review about this one.

Some might not agree but this is based on my wardrobe. This is Fendi Donna’s tinkered and attenuated version. But do take it with a grain of salt. Attenuate doesn’t mean a poorer iteration. To me Fendi Donna is much potent of a combination of leather and coriander with hints of rose.

The Italian houses really did make good use of this mulled wine and leather accords but this one covers up the glamor with aromatics and greenery. I’ve heard this being compared to Givenchy III or even Miss Dior. Let me make their distinctions:
-Givenchy III - coldest of the three and with the highest amount of galbanum.
-Miss Dior - warmest and muskiest of the three. This is wonderfully herbaceous.
-Gucci No.3 - rosiest with a nice emphasis on leather.

In no way the three are similar but they can be used as reference points as green chypres. Gucci No.3 is the sum of all the wonderful aspects Made by chypres during the 70s.

There’s a beautiful fruity pink rose in its opening. There is a honeyed aspect just like what the olden Givenchy III had. It has the beautiful and gentle herbal nuances Miss Dior has. It’s really impeccably done and well rounded, smooth.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: At first I really liked this fragrance. But shortly after I found it to be too strong, started giving me a headache. I think I ended up just tossing it (no one I knew wanted to "adopt" it).

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
Vetiver & oakmoss based fragrance.

More like the usual "poor homme" labelled fragrance with dirty vetiver, herbal oakmoss, grapefruit, coriander, patchouli, and musk. I can't detect any narcissus, or leather! The jasmines, & lily of the valley shows up later but bits with some amber.

I had the chance to purchase this with a grand incredible price but thank GOD I didn't do so, its overly common and wasn't that incredible as I thought it were. Nope.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I was given a splash bottle of this in high school and used it sparingly, then went off to college and left it at home. Flash forward more than twenty years later and I find the bottle in a drawer at my mom’s house - right where I left it next to my David Bowie scrapbook - and literally shrieked with delight. It was kept dry and cool and is just as lovely as it was in 1987. I now dole it out like unicorn tears and pray it lasts at least another few years. So much love for this warm, embracing fragrance.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
The smell is so masculin and “ACTIVE”.. if you are a man you can wear it and no one will notice. If you say “they just don't make em like this anymore..” I would say probably because of the QUALITY of the ingredients.. and maybe it was the trend from 70’s-80’s that women refused sweet perfumes and loved to show and act as independent and “actively tough” .. but now they are relaxed in the fact that it is possible to be independent, working woman,leading an executive job and be themselves...
This perfume reminds me of YSL Pour Homme.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I'm willing to pay for Gucci 3 but I am so hesitant because of "greed" of people putting alcohol in it or mixing a similar batch & re-pkg. How can you be sure its the Real thing?
A post stated that it smelled stale & not like she remembered.
Any suggestions besides reading the feedbacks?
Back in the day there was store that carried hard to find colognes- perfumes.
Thanks for any guidance

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
Why, oh why they don't create scents like this anymore?

This is the perfume I deeply miss, probably forever. I bought it when I was 20 years old in the late 80's. Time filled with joy, youth, beauty, friends, colourful fashion, disco music and everything seemed to be possible.

I love the line Bstefcorbin wrote: "I used to spray this with abandon! Never thinking that the party would end!"
Everytime I wore this scent I got masses of compliments and life felt like a never ending party.

Gucci No 3 is a gorgeous perfume. Rich, elegant, sophisticated, uptown girl kinda scent. This turned heads I can tell, and boy it lasted unbelievably well on your skin or clothes.
I've been wondering would it be worth it to buy a vintage bottle. Would it feel the same as then, nearly 30 years ago? Surely it isn't a youth potion and I don't get any younger but to get the feeling of that great decade of 80's. Who wouldn't pay anything to get some of those times back...

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I definitely get the similarity with Nobile, released a few years later. This is more floral which I expected. Not a bad thing.
I got a few bottles of this cheaply to on-sell to offset the cost of my other fragrances, but now I've tried it I'm going to have some difficulty letting them go. Bother!

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
In the category of "Wow, they just don't make 'em like that anymore" comes this incredible floral chypre. Aldehydes, narcissus, and oakmoss combine to make a potent fragrance that is intense, woody, and mysterious. Leather, coriander and orris are up next, to set a complex and refined base, with amber, patchouli, musk, and sundry softer florals lurking just beneath. Simply fabulous. Such a surprise in the unassuming bottle!

Update: As I was writing this review, someone walked behind me and said "Oh wow, what is that cool, earthy smell? Like essential oils or woods. Smells so good!"

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I used to spray this with abandon! Never thinking that the party would end!

I still have my navy leather Paloma Picasso XOXO belt from those days; and thanks to my old pal Cindy; I have this again!
To me it smells like the inside of an Italian leather purse, wafting cool refrigerated air ~ a pack of assorted Nat Sherman's; Chanel lipstick and powder compact; fruit flavored trident and a little something from Pablo Escobar.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
It's weird, but the opening accord, aldehydes, orris, and narcissus, somehow also has a brief period where they combine to smell like clover honey on my skin...

In the heart, I get wonderfully oily narcissus, a touch of rose, a touch of leather, and a surprisingly soft white musk (soapy) note. The next morning, the honey scent remains, cause for early morning smiles!

Mostly a skin scent on me, this is lovely, but not unique, and given the price I prefer it's smell-alikes. Scherrer 2 hits that honey note, with greater sillage. On my skin, Givenchy III's heart matches Gucci 3's heart accord, with sillage in the 1 foot region.

This is a great scent, but I have issues with the idea of spending $40+ for a partial bottle, when the alternates cost less ($18 for a FB of S2, GIII a little more), and have more sillage.

I recommend testing before buying- unless you find a vintage bottle at a *really* great price.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: One of my favourite chypres. I treat my remaining two half bottles like holy relics.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
Startled to see that rose is not often mentioned in the reviews here.

For me, this is mainly about roses. Smoldering roses, leather, oakmoss and patchouli.

Dark and beautiful.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
okay so i dont think i like aldehydes. its all i get at the opening and it just smells bad on me. kinda harsh and cold and like soap. as it settles i dont get any floral. i get leather, vetiver, oak moss, and it is warmed a little by the amber. i think for me without the aldehydes it would be amazing. just as it stands it comes off so harsh to me. maybe my tester is old. it kinda reminds me of like rolling around in the mud in a sexy kinda way. it really has a woody vibe to it. maybe a perfume for someone who likes to hike? i think after the opening it smells okay, but i really dislike the opening. i imagine a woman sitting by a camp fire that is almost out after a day of hiking. she is sexy and a little mysterious. dark and a litte cold, and as the embers go out you want to be next to her, alone in the woods.

it almost has a unisex vibe no my skin, since im not getting floral. another person said tabbacco leaves and i get that too.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I used to have a mini of this somewhere. It smells like an expensive drink. It was warm, a bit soapy, and has a tingly champagne note. What remains on the skin is gorgeous----rich yet fine soapy chypre where no single note dominates. Everything is well blended and uniform. I was just too young when we met ( I was 13). If I smell this again, I am very positive I will like like it even more.

I wish they make fragrances as beautiful as this again. It is a nice memory fragrance---something a man will remember you by. Sigh.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I love this fragrance, but on me, it does not smell of leather - it is earthy, green with a soft floral lingering presence. Definitely sexy...smart...confident, yet flirty. I think it is very seductive - I definitely get a reaction when I wear it. It can be worn at work, on the weekend getting cozy and out on the town. A "classy" scent. More of a Fall to Winter scent in my opinion because it is heavy.

When I was younger, I would smell it from the bottle and think it was too green and strong, but after a half hour on the skin, it becomes wicked. Definitely for a woman who is confident and sassy and can handle the attention. Not a girly fragrance. Much too seductive. You have to wear this one..not smell it from the bottle because it comes off as too strong, when in actuality it really transforms and becomes a soft, spicy, fresh yet warm scent that lingers for hours. I tend to think it smells best on truly strong and sensual women...must be something in their chemistry.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Just bought one on ebay. I think it's either fake or gone off. Smells stale and musty and nothing like I remember it. The juice is dark brown, not golden as I recall it. Boo.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I got this fragrance as a Christmas gift in the 80's. At first wear I didn't think alot of it, but over time it grew to be one of my all time favorite fragrances. I liken it to a fine Scotch. This is a fragrance you grow to appreciate.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Though not identical, you can still get vintage Cachet at low prices, which is a good substitute for Gucci 3. If you need tuberose in it, however, you won't get that from Cachet. If you do try Cachet make sure it is made by Prince Matchebelli and not the new company (is it Jean Phillipe?). And it's not all that far from L'Air du Desert Marocain either (dyrdown)!

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Love Gucci 3. I transform when wearing it. Mysterious,worldly, confident.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: When I wear it, I feel sexy and self confident. Indeed, the best fragrance from Gucci. So hard to find it. What a pitty!

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This was another great fragrance from the early 80's. These reviews have conjured up the scent for me and brought back lots of memories of great times spent wearing this lovely fragrance.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I shouldn't have liked this perfume.

I hate tuberose.
I dislike chypres.

The combination made this perfume absolutely amazing.

It's tragic that it's so hard to find now. I suppose it was never a big seller - I never smelled it on anyone else - it wasn't a "Coco" or "Giorgio" of its time.

I wore it when I was at school - which is amusing as it couldn't have been less of a teenager's perfume - but when I went to a reunion recently a classmate that I hadn't seen in years asked me what it was that I used to wear back then. She was gutted that after years of wondering and smelling and trying to remember what it was I used to douse myself in when we were getting ready to go to school dances the perfume she always used to borrow was discontinued!

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
29.march 2012

"-But i am not into green perfumes with aldehydes."
"-Ahhh, who are you kidding?"
"-No, really! I don´t like that very much."
"-eeeehh, shut up and enjoy!"
"-Does it suits me well? You think so?"
"-Good enough to stop pretending you don´t like it THAT much!"

This is kind of dialog was going in my head while i was wearing this perfume for the last 30hrs.
Have you heard stories that perfumes don´t last at all, or max several hours? Well, forget it with this one!!! It´s been almost 36hours on my skin now, i have had a busy day at work and i can still smell it on my skin! After 24 hrs it was still going quite strong! 2 sprays only!!
The scent itself you ask?
Well, i have both EDT spray and pure parfume and back in the days i started with a parfum. I liked it very much. I found it to be beautifully floral with an interesting undertone of green notes. It was a summer period.
So i went for a EDT now during an early springtime. A bit different. It starts as a sharp green one. Maybe too much green even, more than i expected it to be. That bothered me, so i was undecided. Vetyver is sharp, but it battles with tuberose. Vetyver wins, tuberose (and some other flowers) fades away defeated very quickly. It stays green BUT turns after an hour into deliciously leather scent. This is a worn leather. It has been worn for a long time and became soft, worn and inherited all the scents of the owner (in a good way, you know that smell when you put on a vintage leather jacket). She has been using some rose perfume by the way while wearing this leather jacket and even maybe some "Magie noire", so all those scents are mixed together give you an impression of what it smells like on a drydown. Bold. Outstanding. Vintage.
I would say this one has even more of a vintage feeling than some other vintage scents even older than this one. Still undecided about the weather, which one it suits the best, must be autumn. Can be perfect for a girl in her late 30´s i think, but it is not a written rule.
This classy Gucci along with Gucci Arte ARE the top scents of the house of Gucci in a matter of quality.
Aplause! Bravo!

UPDATE (a year later, late winter in cold northern Europe):
I have been using it since quite some times and i must admit that this perfume has moved from "Like" category to "Love" category. This is finest quality Gucci which is one of my all time favorite Gucci´s now ever. Exceptional lasting power (i have EDT), great potency and simply unique. Don´t overlook it because it is chypre and you mucght dislike chypres. If you like/love "Silences" by Jacomo, then this one is even much better. I love them both but "nr.3" is way over in terms of quality and composition to my nose. I personally prefer it to "Silences" because it has tuberose and leather amazing combination. I do have severeal bottles, but i would love to get some more whil i can to be sure i never will run out of this supreme masterpiece.
Love it espcially during cold northern winter time.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I have this perfume ooops sorry EDT in the 120ml spray bottle and love it. You only need a couple of small sprays and it lasts all day which is fantastic. It is such a sexy smelling fragrance and makes you feel so special when you are wearing it you are almost smirking when you walk past people because people just stop what they are doing and smile and ask what are you wearing it's gorgeous. It is such a shame that it is so hard to find and when you do you are looking at paying well over £120 for this size. I was very lucky when I got this as I swapped it for an item I had on an online site and this bottle hadn't been used or if it had it was only once or twice and was boxed. On receiving it I checked it was genuine and sprayed it and thankfully YES it was genuine and had the lasting power that I remembered. Like most wonderful, long lasting, popular fragrances the manufacturers seem to discontinue them at the height of their popularity and then make a similar fragrance that isn't as strong or long lasting. It's such a shame this has been discontinued and no doubt if it is brought back (which i'm sure they will) it will prob not be as rich and long lasting as the original (but I could be proved wrong? Fingers crossed! Lol) This fragrance is for a female in her 30's plus who knows what she wants and feels secure in herself (or wants to give that impression! Lol) and also wants to turn heads and is (or wants to be) a little bit flirty. It is an intoxicating fragrance that even though it is strong is somehow not offensive during the day in the office but sultry enough for the evening to let people know that you are there but once again NOT in an offensive way (if that makes sense? Those who have this or have had this or smelt it will know exactly what I mean) If people are desperate for this I would say check on ebay or some on-line fragrance stores as some stores on line do seem to have it (from looking on-line in the last few days) Luckily for me I (as I have said) have the 120ml spray bottle so this will last me quite a long time especially as I will not have to spray it during the day also. If you can get this fragrance it is well worth the money (there are some on ebay at the moment selling 30ml, 60ml and 120ml just for your info) I am holding onto this baby and will wear it when I need cheering up, want to feel sexy/flirty or when I want to feel like I can achieve and do anything and no-one will or can stop me (so quite often then)! Lol! The fragrance actually reminds me a bit of Estee Lauder Youth Dew (the original NOT the amber although that is lovely also)as it has similar notes but doesn't have as much of the powdery smell. xxx

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Well, this perfume has been discontinued for more than 10 years now. I happened to find - and buy it, of course - the 120ml bottle at a perfume shop in a small city. What a great treasure! I wear it at my job and everybody asks me which perfume is this. I just reply "Gucci", but you know what I mean!

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I like this. Very vintage and unique. I agree that the leather sensation is powerful with Gucci 3. Thank you to the review that talks about working with horses and how this fragrance completely reminds you of that experience!! I am going to wear it next time I go riding!! The more I think about it, the more your description is totally accurate of what this perfume smells like. I wonder if the makers had that in mind; especially considering that is used as one of their primary symbols.

Also, after 3-4 hours I smell fresh tobacco. Not smoked, but the kind that sits in a bag waiting to be put in a pipe...interesting.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: And I want to add that the amber really has a kick here! All in all the leather note accentuates this fragrance, making it heavy but sexy scent. For a confident high-fly women 35+ !! :D

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: A heavy scent but classy! Really "made a statement" fragrance. And I remember wearing it on my wedding day. I must admit that time was my first encounter with aldehydes. And I am proudly announce that I still keep my "vintage"; a 7,5 ml parfum (o.25fl. oz) as a gem. Well suited for a dinner out, going to operas, or galas with fancy gowns, sophisticated pearls and high heels

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This is the "smell of my childhood" as my mother used to wear it when I was small. I am sad to hear that it is hard to find now as I was thinking about getting it...I hope it will find its way back to the shops!

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
Hi to all the women who likes this perfum.
my problem ladies, that i can't find this
lovely & fine fragrance. please is anyone
of you can tell me how & where can i get it.
i live in Span, there is no possibility
to buy it here. thanks

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: There was a older lady used to come into the market that I used to work at all the time and she used to wear this I could always tell when she was in the store because I could smell this perfume even before I could see her. It smelled so good but this is a very hard perfume to find now.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
Gucci III reminds me of when I was a young girl. At that time I had a great interest in horses. The soapy leathery smell resembles the care for the saddles and bridles.

We were a bunch of girls in the saddle room. First we used a hard yellow half translucent leathersoap and with that worked up a foam. After that we gently washed the dirt away with damp cloth. And then after drying, we used a lot of red-brown colored leather fat, in order to make the leather soft and smooth. The smell in that room, just next to the horses, was just amazing and represented everything we loved.

So, what I get most from Gucci III is a beloved soapy leather combined with a large amount of patchouli, which in this metaphoric description actually would be the warm, sweet, slightly animalistic note from the horse itself, or the dirt from it. The floral notes then? Well, on my skin, the flowers are very weak. Weak, but also delicate and beautiful.

Try before buy is my recommendation. I love it and I will buy it but I'm having a hard time to find out when to actually use it. I'm going to finish my mini first, and use it in different occasions to see where it actually works for me.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I decided to test the Edt

It does smell the same as the parfum only less intense and the lasting power is not quite as good (as is to be expected).

On me Gucci 3 is very fresh but at the same time inviting, the adelhydes and bergamont are very dominant in the top notes lending a soap like characteristic to the composition but it is very pleasant. these notes are present throught the perfume though they loose some of their initial strength.

the rose in the heart is completely lost to my nose; on me there is nothing floral about this compostition.

I clearly detect the musk, leather and amber in the dry down which give the fragrance a sexy sophistication.

There is nothing pretty or girly about this scent but instead there is a mystery, the scent dares you to invetsigate further and eventually seduces you with its uniqueness.

It is not a fragrance for girls but is a potent weapon in the hands of a mature woman who knows what she wants and knows how to get it.

Here's a little secret: I plan to wear Gucci 3 on my honeymoon.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
Warm aldehyde opening that feels a bit old fashioned, but elegant, mysterious and powerful... I guess phase when Gucci was releasing their old perfumes was the best thing they've ever done. I admire their one of latest Gucci by Gucci (it has some interesting edge), but Flora- it might be nice, but no, definitely not Gucci. It doesn't smell Gucci in my opinion- it's bad example of wasting good name on such bad compote. Which smells like perfume named Kristine N.2 and costs like 3$ for 15ml.
Gucci 3 is such perfect leathery chypre. Warm aldehyde with green notes and later I detect soft beautiful lily of the valley, jasmine. Warm, comforting and expensive it is.
Shame they discontinued it... I guess if it would be available now they would ruin and reformulate it (due to it contains oakmoss, bergamot and jasmine).'-'
Later it continues to develop and is balanced sour and sweet accompanied by leather and woods soaked in sweet floral oils. It runs in my memory wardrobe and picks out various memories- elegant evening dress and massive gold accessories (where did they come out? o_O). I am sitting on a bench in garden and enjoy the smell of various flowers there. Other, I am in forest and there is place where lilies of the valley grow, I pick a very fragrant bouquet and take it home. Yeah, this fragrance smells of my childhood.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
this is a very long lasting fragrance. it has a unique scent that is very intriguing.

it's a good perfume and although i may think that others may be more beautiful i'll have to that i have never smelt anything similiar.

i have the tiny parfum and i was considering buying the 4.2 oz toilette. (i heard it's very hard to find in the US but it's available at a store in my country at a very reasonalbe price so i thought i'd a shot)

so i would like insight from other reviewers as to whether there is any significant difference between parfum and the toilette.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Hi Ladies, I have a mini of this if any one really wants it, please let me know, I am new to this website so Im not sure how to contact members individually, any help would be greatly appreciated!!

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I love Gucci III, wore it when it came out in the 80's, but it never came off as "dark and sexy" or a heavy fragrance on me. It seemed very light and sparkly! My best friend sniffed in my direction one day while I was wearing it and said "Isn't that perfume a little too pristine for you to be wearing?" My DH referred to it as my "Barbie doll" perfume. I would wear it again if it was still available, and, no, I haven't found anything comparable. Let me know if you do! (I still have a couple of minatures to wear on occassion.)

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This is my favorite scent EVER! I can't believe it is unavailable...has anyone who loves this scent found a comparable fragrance?

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: agree with you. I feel very confident when using this one. and proud of being myself. not everyday frag, but when I am bored with feeling clean and fresh, when I feel that I hate crowds it's a good one. I have my own space wearing Gucci 3, and I'm glad that I have my own bottle.

product_name: Gucci No 3 Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Deep, dark, somewhat leathery and strangely woody. This is a sexy fragrance and is not for the shy. If you do not enjoy aldehydes, this is not the one for you. It's an '80's' perfume to be sure. I don't get any tuberose or lily from this. To me, there is a good deal of bergamot-green-smell at first spray (but by no means is this light or citrusy-it's all heavy) and after that, it is straight to dark and sexy. By the time it dries down, you have a lovely amber patchouli mix. I love this one and feel very confident when I wear it but it is certainly one to be applied lightly. Not one for the board meeting at work if you know what I mean.....

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
This is a beautiful perfume…but it’s just not very ‘me’.

I usually love a tuberose but the addition of honeysuckle means this is just too floral for me. It’s a strong and confident feminine fragrance which I think is lovely.

It’s not the longest lasting perfume so be prepared to respray to keep up the good work.

I’m giving this to a friend that I think this will smell incredible on.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
This was the perfume that got me into perfumes. It made my brain feel things it had never felt before. I don’t care if anyone says it smells like grandma. It does but that’s not the point. It is gorgeous, sophisticated, and soft. I want to be hugged by someone with this scent 🥹🥹🥹🥹

However, like all amazing perfumes, it doesn’t last 🙃. Same longevity as Mojave ghost…

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
This is phenomenal. Such a masterpiece really, because it's also so simple but so well done. Flowers. A lot. Roses, tuberose, jasmine, directly under your nose. But also something elegant and refined, intoxicating and veeeeery feminin, like a real woman - not a girl. Like black dress, red lipstick, but classy. It's how I imagine a young Monica Bellucci would smell. I love it, it's signature scent worthy.

Edit: it fades away really quick though, you have to spray every 2 hours to smell it... pity

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: The most elegant white flowers you can wear, this brings opulence and leaves a trail wherever you go. Not a safe blind buy, that’s for sure, but definitely worth having this in your collection.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: The orris and ragoon creeper add such a unique and beautiful touch to this very fresh and creamy Tuberose perfume. Holy smokes is this pretty

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This smells incredibly sexy to me. What is it about tuberose that just makes perfumes so damn sexy?? I think if you love tuberose as a note this would be a pretty safe blind buy. It's creamy, seductive, elegant and very womanly. Florally rich, yet with a sweetness that keeps it from being too heavy. Perfect for date night, but also versatile enough to wear at any time.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: ماي زهر

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This one actually turned my stomach… Although I adore florals and tuberose this is so strong and pungent and feels very cold. I agree it has a church vibe. Not a safe blind buy

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
So pleased to finally have this in my collection, fell in love with this scent immediately after I first smelled it. Note , this is definitely not a safe blind buy noting that the tuberose note is immense but as a tuberose fan, I’m in love with every bit of this scent, definitely one I plan on holding onto for an incredibly long time, it just transports me to heaven.

Personal opinion: 11/10
Beautiful projection and a heavenly scent trail that lingers everywhere u move

Definitely a top 10 in my collection

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Absolutely glorious, lovable, sweet, intoxicating femme masterpiece. Will teleport you to a sunny spring day in a lush garden somewhere in northwestern Europe.

Wife loves it.
I love it.
Win-Win.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: classy white florals. Super inoffensive. Appropriate for church. When you wear this, you wear pearls.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
My go-to for Indian festivals and weddings … this one is pure floral opulence. The Indian tuberose takes center stage in the most wholesome, regal way. It’s rich, creamy, and drenched in elegance. Feels like magic in the air. This is, hands down, the prettiest floral bomb in my collection. A stunner!

– Bhavna Darira Chesan

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I really enjoy this scent: it’s sweet, powdery, floral so it’s fairly easy to love if like me you like that classic style feminine scent. Lasts a good amount of time for a white floral as well. However, for the price it isn’t super interesting, I’ve smelt cheaper perfumes that would be just as nice for daily wear. This is also one of those perfumes you’ve definitely smelt before (or at least it’s similar enough to the other Bloom flankers that it feels that way). I’d shill out for something like Do Son as a warm, smooth floral over this one.

Edit: So I’ve actually come to really like this scent, and found a discounted bottle so have bought a full size. It’s like wearing a cashmere sweater, fluffy and comforting. Because it isn’t super complex, it’s easy to wear at any time and stays on clothes smelling nice for days. Maybe I was a bit harsh in my initial review 😅

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I prefer it to the original, but still find it to be slightly one-note. Smells like a perfume shop/ perfume area in a nice department store. Absolutely nothing offensive, just a very pleasantly done rose tinted white floral.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
This smells like a rose tuberose bouquet, and not hypothetically
Like a real. Absolutely life like bouquet nothing synthetic about it. Because i have a rose plant and a tuberose plant at home, i know exactly what they smell like. This one captures the essence of those flowers beautifully.
Reminds me of events, birthdays.
Its perfection
I never usually like scents off of the first whiff but this one? Love at first sniff.

Edit: i layered it with some pandan leaf oil and its become even more life like. Smells like tuberose after it has rained.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: For me it doesn't smell sweet at all, but very green. The roses aroma is very defined and elegant. It also remonds me of strong bitter green tea. It also lasts long on my skin, unlike most of others parfumes.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Smells like the original bloom mixed with ralph kauren blue, very pretty

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Interesting blend of Tuberose. Kind of Versace blonde but different, probably cause of the Damask Rose. Who ever said this doesn't last, makes no sense. Turberose is one of the strongest scented flowers. And you can definitely smell it here.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: It’s Gucci Bloom with sweet, jammy roses, a soft base, and a little more staying power. It smells the same all the way through, and lasts for 6-8 hours. If you have both, try wearing a spray of the original Bloom with Ambrosia.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: THE MOST BORRING PRODUCT ON PLANET EARTH..!!!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: You too can smell like a bag of wet dirt. But it's a bag of wet dirt with a Gucci logo slapped on it so people can pretend it's luxury product and not just simply a sad sad little bag of wet dirt.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
It's raining heavily and you can see the flowers in full bloom outside, while you lie lazily on your couch, and then you randomly decide to spray this just for fun.

You wouldn't be able to tell that you've sprayed any perfume at all and would wonder if the garden made its way into the room. It's that pure and natural.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I have lived within the 'clôche' of this perfume for two days to form an opinion about this, what appeared to be and really is, a lovely perfume. by a 'deed' this morning, chosing my perfume for this day, I never anticipated what happened. I chose Chanel No.5 and by spritzing that classic perfume to pulse and nape of the neck (I have to formulate that somewhat elegantly, isn't it) I suddenly got a 'vision' about No.5 and 'Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori' (Ambrosia hereafter). they both got a lift. I love flowerperfumes. I immediately smelled the superiority of No.5 but this didn't diminish the Ambrosia. I noticed the No.5 was superiorly mixed and macerated, to form an elegant and well-known, nevertheless again, superrrefined perfume and herewith we see that, for me, Chanel No.5 isn't yet, obsolete or oldfashioned. it superimposes itself on those blatant categories. but by its very chiqueness and sophistication it also affirmed my thoughts and feelings about Ambrosia. that is also a very well blended (now I have the right word) and enduring perfume. because I tested it for two days I noticed that the best thing to do was to just let this 'clôche', this bubble perfuse everything around and in it, which it did in an at first, lovely loud and pervasive tuberose intrusion and then, with the more molded and suffusive caprices of the white flower-indole scent. Jasmine and Tuberose are difficult to evade. I think the Honeysuckle was swept up by the hardheadedness of said Tuberose and Jasmine. it was a pity I never noticed the Rose and Orris, but they were of course also enveloped and on the other hand, also 'informed' the Tuberose and Jasmine. when then you compare that with No.5, here is a Jasmine and Rose that live happily ever after, with a clear and separate Ylang perfume, yet all blended to this powdery and flowery presence of a Haute Parfum. I think Ambrosia is just a perfume for these times, heady, present, 'harmonized' by Alberto Morillas. then everyone has her's, his's, own perfume history and I started in 1974 and then came of age in the 1980s with Coco, Poison, Obsession, Giorgio, Knowing, Opium, Gem, Rouge d'Hermes, all the bewitching flowery over-the-top perfumes which I loved and loved and for which the end is (for me) nowhere in sight. yet I was able to separate Ambrosia from these legends and find it a harmonious, lasting, Tuberose friendly perfume. But it also redefined No.5 for me because I suddely smelled its femininity, its Hauteté, its well blended character, and its timelessness.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: As a lover of white florals, I'm always in search of the next one I'll fall in love with. To me this one smells creamy, powdery and sweet. It has some depth to it but it's not as warm or tropical as Profumo di Fiori. Although it's heavy and round, it's not quite as indolic or heady as other white floral fragrances I've tried.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Goodness gracious -- sweet, absolutely intoxicating blend of honeysuckle (Rangoon Creeper is Chinese honeysuckle), tuberose, and jasmine. Voluptuous, decadent, indulgent, luxurious, it's beautiful but quite heavy, so I'm thinking it's best applied with a light hand and may be too heavy for hot summer months (will try it once it gets hot here, to test it out my theory). I'm not exactly sure I detect the orris specifically, but I'm thinking it might be what gives Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori its heft and significance compared to the much lighter original Gucci Bloom -- pretty but way too light and fleeting for me. I really love GBAdF but it's definitely a very specific smell; you have to be in the mood for a very thick, sweet, delicious-without-veering-into-gourmand territory, floral perfume with a LOT of character and large presence. In spite of its beauty, I could see how it could be just TOO much on very hot days, in close quarters, or in office environments (don't want to choke people out!). Even though it doesn't smell at all the same, GBAdF has some of the same lush, over-the-top character of a #1 favorite of mine, Elizabeth Taylor White Diamonds, which I find myself most often wearing to bed, to be enveloped in its overpowering dreamy beauty. To my nose, both scents are extravagantly gorgeous, not for everyday wear, and must be approached with caution!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: So simple, yet so sophisticated. Tuberose is absolutely beautiful. It gives you this wonderfully elegant vibe without fail.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Klasik sümbülteber kokusumu ilk bloom verisyonundaki.gibi duyuyorsunuz tek.fark.koku 15dk.sonra çok klas bir gül kokusuna donuşuyor ve sumbulteberin ilk versiyondaki hali.gibi surekli.burna gelmiyor olusu en cok bunu sevdim. Daha kadinsi versiyonu ve asla.agır bir koku diyemem.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This is gorgeous and a very indulgent, luxurious jasmine scent. It lasts for solid 8 hours on me. My most complimented fragrance by far.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I heard people say Gucci Bloom Ambrosia was better than the original Gucci Bloom so I bought it to try, and I feel... well, there's not much of a difference. Gucci Ambrosia has a warmer sweetness, more depth, and less soapy scent because of the addition of Rose notes. But that's all the difference. In general, it is not too different, people who are not observant enough will not be able to recognize it. Longevity and projection cannot be improved compared to Gucci Bloom OG, still poor. If Gucci remade Gucci Bloom line and improved its longevity, it would certainly be much more successful.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I liked it when I sprayed it on a test strip. But on my skin? A WHOLE other story. It became oddly green and spicy. It honestly reminded me of...tomatoes. I had to check the notes online to make sure I wasn't crazy. Nope, all notes I generally enjoy. Hard pass for me, sadly.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I’m a guy and I’m in love with this perfume, any one thinks a guy can wear it? Could it be unisex?

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Definitely more seductive and provoking fragrance compared to the Yellow Bloom by Gucci. The red color perfectly matches the character of the fragrance. It's more feminine, seductive, dark mysterious, however it's a bit mature as well.

Interesting fragrance, but not as unique as the yellow one. It has some generic feminine notes that are present in lot of fragrances. Still good if you are going for seductive dark/mysterious mature vibe.

Kinda imagine absynth bar with old polished wood and lady dressed in black with red elements is wearing this. But it is not too dark, it also has that generic female perfume vibe going on (maybe 25%).

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Ambrosia was my birthday gift back in June and I used to think it was perfect for summertime – well, I love it even more now that it is fall! This is somehow smoother than Profumo, tuberose, rangoon creeper and jasmine create a majestic nectar that is both sultry and decadent, transparent and voluptuous. The performance in November is excellent, in hot weather it was a bit too volatile. Ambrosia is not the kind of perfume that goes unnoticed as it is a heavy floral with a trail that lasts for hours. Love, love, love!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: You know , I’m not sure what it is about this particular one that I like . Typically I hate white florals and jasmine but something about this one I really like . It’s dark in my opinion, a nighttime perfume , maybe just a night time more sexy version of the og bloom. . Idk but Im just now realizing I actually like this , or maybe my tastes have just changed that much ,

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Ambriosa is a clean strong (not cloying) bouquet of white flowers. It is a safe one if you are into florals and looking for a signature scent.

However on my skin this one does not last 3 hours max and abracadbra am left with nothing 🥲
But if you are a fan of l'interdit you will like this one

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Skin test.
So I gotta say this line, they're all so similar...
Ambrosia isn't what I'd call rosey at all.

This is another creamy sorta thin white floral.
This has a coldness to it, the yellow one has a green ish tint, the edt has citrus but on me goes flat.

Rounded, watery white floral, clean

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
The Bloom line has been, without fail, very sweet—each flanker being an episode of a warm, feel-good comedy series, with a different set of memorable guest stars each time. Tuberose is the star of the show, with jasmine as the quirky deuteragonist that everyone loves. However, tuning in this time, Tuberose has a formidable co-star—Orris root. The rose is a subtle support player with a few memorable one-liners, and honeysuckle is the plucky, cheerful comic relief, but it’s the orris that steals the show.

Ambrosia Di Fiori is a subtler, more sophisticated, powdery affair than the rest of the Bloom line. It’s also the least sweet, at least on my skin. The rose adds a bit of aromatic flair. The tuberose is more understated here, less bubblegum and sexy and more subtle and mild, adding softness. The drydown is semi-sweet and powdery, though not quite cosmetic powdery—more root-like and earthy. I’d compare it to Chloè but without the fresh or sweet accords.

It performs decently well, lasting on my skin for about three or four hours before fading. If you like the idea of a less overtly sweet white floral with a mature and earthy edge, I say Ambrosia Di Fiori is worth a shot.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
This flanker of Gucci Bloom is so much better and more realistic smelling than the original perfume from this line... the original Gucci Bloom smelt so synthetic and sickly sweet to me but Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori smells like a lush bouquet of white flowers!

If you like honeysuckle and tuberose, you will LOVE THIS!!! It as all about these two white florals in this fragrance and all of the other notes in this just buoy the smell of these two flowers up and enhances them. I next get a good dose of jasmine, but it never overpowers anything else in this perfume and I find this really well balanced.

I also think that the addition of orris root in the base was a BRILLIANT idea and it added some depth to this perfume without drowning out the florals with woody notes. I get a tiny hint of a very romantic and lush pink rose too, but it is only just a hint.

This fragrance also had a moderate sillage on me and was not too strong or too light a sillage and it lasted just over 7 hours on my skin. I thought that it was a lovely and feminine fragrance and I could imagine wearing this either day or night during the spring or the fall to really enhance those floral notes.

I give this fragrance altogether an 8.5/10. It is worth spending money on a full bottle of this and I think that it is the only Gucci Bloom you will ever need!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Nice

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Absolute love, my go to clean feminine but not to green fragrance. The tuberose is perfectly balanced with the jasmine. I even get a hint of something gourmand when it sits a bit longer on the skin. I think that might be the orris root on my skin chemistry. 9,5/10 would repurchase.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I apologize to everyone who genuinely loves this perfume but to me it smelled like chicken or instant noodles seasoning upon initial spray. I put it down right away but it was very amusing. I checked on the dry down some minutes later - generic green slash floral scent, very uninspired. The last chance I gave Gucci after the mess they call Gorgeous Gardenia. I just don't smell any sweetness in any of their perfumes at all, as if they take a firm stand against sweet perfumes. A world famous brand trying to appear niche would predictably end up with something... Like this. Oh well. Farewell Gucci!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: On my nose, this Bloom variant smells brighter, juicier, and more luxurious. It is an alluring blend of tuberose, honeysuckle, and powdery iris notes. Smells very modern and poise, yet has commendable longevity

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Just got this, and it smells so familiar. Then it hit me, is resembles Estee Lauder Modern Muse. At least to my memory 😅 Better though.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
This is a treasure find for me.
I remember that first commercial for Gucci Bloom ambrosia.
They built it up with advertising a few months before it hitting the shelves.
They did it sneakily. First the occasional billboard type with no text Just beautiful bohemian style setting with flowers and vines trendling down. In what appears to be Eutopia or Eden. While a natural spring water pool/pond have exotic blooms floating asa few lucky lovely ladies get to bathe in what is the most intoxicating floral bath one could imagine. Then, it just says BLOOM. It was only here and there at first But then the adverts subliminally hit television usually evening. Magazines, of course advertising posters. Increased gradually. All I know is I had my alarm set for the day it came out and the time. Believe it or not. The only store that carried it was Macy's. The Gucci store didn't even have it. Nor the website.There were no samples available. I got .y bottle. It's worth every single penny. It doesn't have just Honeysuckle. It has Rangoon Creeper. (In the same family) Where generic Honeysuckle smells like a straightforward white flower. Rangoon smells like white flower, creamy jasmine, and a slight maraschino undertone way down deep. It's also made with Orris butter. That gives it a briocche sweet bread, sweet cream scent.
Yes you get Tuberose A nice floral, creamy and smooth tuberose. (Nothing heavy, animalistic sk*nky-type) Jasmine is a fresh green, and wet jasmine. The Quality, Silage, projection and longevity are phenomenal. Especially for a designer fragrance. This could compete with a nìche house easily. If could compare it to any other perfume. It would be very very close to Amouage Love, Tuberose. If you have one you don't need the other.
IMHO, the selection pyramid is not accurate I think because many people may be familiar with essential oils and not the actual flower. Also, Maybe they are not familiar with the Rangoon Creeper scent and it's notes Or the difference between Orris and Orris butter. I think it would change the pyramid a bit. Because the Creeper and tuberose are evenly matched. But the creeper is most noticeable of all the flowers Especially at first. The orris stands out very well. I think it's overlooked because it's Orris butter from living Orris. Which gives the perfume a sweet, cream delectable note. Unlike "garden-variety"
orris. Which is powdery scent most people are familiar with. This is definitely one of my very favourite perfumes.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Echoing what a lot of others have said, this fragrance just doesn't have anything special going on for me. Maybe it's good for layering, but honestly it's very strong, so I can't imagine layering it with anything else. It isn't necessarily unpleasant, it's just nothing special imo. It's a very heavy white floral, which I do normally like, but this one just feels like too much and too little at the same time for me.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Love this perfume. Smells like a big bouquet of dark red roses. It’s very warm and intense but I think it’s a little overpriced. It lasts long and you can smell it far away. It was definitely love at first smell<3

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: It's uh... Powdery, watery and mostly a dance between honey suckle and tuberose. Dries down sweet and creamy, but not too much that it comes off like a child's candy-scented cologne... The jasmine isn't as straightforward as that of the original Gucci Bloom, but still a very pretty scent. A sunny floral fragrance, but ironically might not be able to withstand the heat from sunny weather. The whole bloom line is pretty light, but the staying power of this one is pretty weak. Also, if you don't like the combination of flowers with cream, this might not be for you. If you want a slightly more mature watery floral scent, this is definitely not it.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I love the Bloom line. My mom gave me Gucci Bloom Gocce Di Fiori and that was my introduction to Bloom. Then came this decant of Ambrosia. I love using it for bedtime; this scent is so delicate and pretty. I want a big size of this but I imagine the longevity isn’t the best.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I really like this perfume, the tuberose and the honeysuckle is really overpowering so it gets a little boring after a few hours. The longevity isn't great, the scent seems to dissappear after 3-4 hours and needs reapplying, however it is a nice and pleasant smell for everyday use.
Edit: I tried layering it with Acqua di Colonia by Santa Maria Novella, and surprisingly the smell of this perfume stood out as more creamy and sweet! Love it.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This is essentially the sweetest, most rosy, and powdery out of all the Bloom flankers. I feel it's the flanker best suited for the winter season because of its honeyed sweetness, creaminess, and the warm, cozy musk. This selection is my N°1 out of all the Bloom flankers. I love the elegant undercurrent of powdery-sweet may and damask roses with a touch of buttery orris. All rather unique qualities for a modern tuberose-centric frag.🥇

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This gives honeysuckle and only honeysuckle on me, which I absolutely love. It feels very southern belle, hot sticky summer night to me. Its very strong but doesn't last super long on my skin, around 2 hours. I do get a ton of complements on it!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I like it
But the tuberose is quite green and the rose 🌹 really tamed. I enjoy this one and love the original

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Gucci is absolutely KILLING it with these releases. Morillas is a damn genius.

Although I *think* I prefer Profumo Di Fiori slightly, I adore this as well and I'm thankful to get to try it on! Longevity&sillage are good.

Profumo is like...a languid, sticky tuberose affair on an early September evening. It's golden, naturalistic, hazey, and a little narcotic.

Ambrosia however, is a gorgeously romantic, chilly evening spent indoors with your paramour on the end of winter and edge of spring. It's velvety loveseats, fresh bedding, open windows to the brisk night air, and wafts of manicured gardens.

I easily detect as much jasmine tuberose, but not nearly as much honeysuckle. This one smells a little more like the original Bloom than Profumo does. The florals are everything, and they're beautiful, but not too *prettied up*, you know? It actually makes me feel some type of way...it's truly lovely.

Just...lovely. 🥺

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This is a phenomenal fragrance that I had a tango with at first. I sprayed in store, fell in love, bought it , but when I got it home and sprayed it amd went in for work, my first impression was that I couldn’t pick out any single note from the incredibly well blended floral composition. So creamy, tiny dusty heavy floral. Beautiful but so blended that in the first week I couldn’t imagine wearing this and not really being able to smell the notes in it. It was like i was in the scent cloud and couldn’t smell it from inside. And something felt stuffy to me that week. It bothered me that there wasn’t a stand out scent so I impulsively gave the bottle to my coworker when she complimented the scent. When she started showing up to work wearing it I was like what is that gorgeous smell on you?? … it was the bottle of ambrosia I gave her 😂🤷♀️💀so I found a small one on super sale and picked it back up again. If you’re in to floral like me, this is the perfect date night cozy winter feeling floral that almost feels like a vanilla amber but isn’t at all, and has nothing masculine about it. I needed to just use correctly to appreciate! And I learned not to layer this one… Anyway 10/10 for me.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: There is a hint of tobacco with the rose which makes this perfume a unisex smell in my opinion. Any one shares my opinion that a man can reach out to this flanker?

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: The original bloom is the best in my opinion. This one has too much rose making it way more outdated. I once accidentally bought this one meaning to buy the original bloom and when I sprayed it, I couldn’t stand it! So although this is a flanker, I don’t see much similarities. Smells too mature!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: White florals with creamy natural smelling tuberose (eg. as opposed to So Scandal which is nice in it's own way but just not as actual bouquet floral but artificially sweetened) pretty simple but quite heady.. one to use with a light hand. The rose is not really detectable, as others have said. I'm not mad keen on this kind of thing but it's a decent enough white floral.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Smell almost exactly like the OG but..fresher? It’s not a blast of only jasmine, I can smell honeysuckle in it and it’s so delightful. This is OG with more dept, definitely creamier. To compare I feel like the OG’s middle notes is a light sweet floral scent but in this intense one with the oris it becomes more mature and a bit powdery.
The projection and sillage is better than the OG but honestly I love them all

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Short: Creamy, slightly green and dewy white floral, similar to the original Bloom, but bolder and more mature. There is quite a big projection and longevity is great.

Long: A clearly tuberose dominated perfume with some influence from the jasmine and some other delicately sweet florals (rangoon creeper? - I am not familiar with it). It smells creamy, but not dense (Love Tuberose, Cocaine, Orchid Soleil are sweeter and thicker in comparison), it's softly dewy and slightly fresh too. Doesn't seem like the nightbloom florals, there are no indoles, rotten qualities, anything grape-y, no vegetal, tropical humidity or sweetness, no strong animalic sides, the only thing I notice is a bit gasoline-like and rubber undertone. Some greenery from young flower buds too. It's quite bold and statement like, but not full on that. No strong golden vintage opulence about it as well.
In comparison to the original Bloom - Ambrosia di Fiori is a more mature tuberose, whereas Bloom is softer, brighter, more youthful and jasmine dominated (clean, sterile, morning type of jasmines). That same jasmine note doesn't leave Ambrosia di Fiori composition throughout, giving it a weird, sharp and synthetic mutter. Not similar to My Way (that one is sweeter and there are string grape-like tones), slightly similar to Do Son EDT, EDP and current formulation of Fracas (though Fracas is noticeable on orange blossom and fruity tones too and I'd say it is slightly softer perfume as well).
As I am not a huge fan of lush, strong tuberoses, this is too bold for me.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Like a lot. Remember me Burberry London for women, that was a excelent perfum

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This reminds me of something, but can't remember what. Anyway smell kindla like old kind lady. It's ok, but for more mature women.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Testing this side by side with OG Armani My Way and to my nose identical! I like them both, but not a love.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Sadly this is giving me a headache. One of the rare ones. It’s quite nice and sharper than I usually like my white florals (I like them very very creamy) but great for spring summer seasons.

Edit: I think the honeysuckle is to blame.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I wasn't into the OG Bloom, but ordered a couple minis of different flankers to see if they may have the tuberose I desire. I ordered this one and the Profumo flankers. I immediately liked, and on subsequent wears, bought a full bottle and backup of Profumo, as it performed way better and smelled more pleasing to me, and was the only one I could distinctly smell real tuberose in. I liked this Ambrosia flanker as well, and ordered a FB, but after a few wears decided this one isn't for me. I mostly get a sharp jasmine, honeysuckle, and rose blend here, which comes off as very soapy, a bit mature, and a bit harsh like bug spray in the opening, and dries down to a barely-there skin scent that disappears way too fast for me. To continue being able to smell this scent, I need to reapply every hour. I felt the performance was the same in the original Bloom as well. Profumo will last 3-6 hrs on me, depending on weather, and will linger in my hair or on my clothes overnight til the next morning. I don't get noticeable tuberose in Ambrosia at all, at least not the type of tuberose you'd expect from Carnal Flower or any of those similar smelling tuberose. If there is tuberose here, it's that overly sweet neutered one like in My Way that unfortunately seems too synthetic and different from the quality tuberose I love for my preference. This flanker may work beautifully with other peoples chemistry, but for me, I prefer the yellow Profumo flanker, as that one smells the best IMO, has hints of real tuberose smell, and gets me the most compliments.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: i'm no expert on white floral fragrances as they're not really my thing but i got a sample of this with something i ordered and i was very impressed. super heavy creamy slightly sweet white floral with some delicate green notes but i don't detect any rose. this is also one of very very few fragrances i could still smell on my skin the following day as usually my skin just eats even powerhouse fragrances up.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: My favorite perfume for this summer 😍

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
This is a beautiful fragrance. The florals are so realistic that they almost make me melancholy, like a beautiful, hot, lonely summer afternoon with nothing to do.
I love Ambrosia and Profumo equally. Ambrosia is sweeter and the tuberose is potent whereas Profumo feels greener to me. Both gorgeous, just depends on my mood. The bottles are also so gorgeous! Ambrosia isn’t a gourmand kind of sexy, but its smooth and creamy florals are so beautiful that it has an undeniable sensuality all its own. In the deep dry down the Ambrosia is reminiscent of a luxurious lotion or soap-not in a super clean or aquatic way though. It just blends so beautifully with the skin. Even when I’m not in the mood for this I can still appreciate what a gem this is.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Super-floral floral!
I think GBAdF is the only perfume I have that has 100% floral notes in its top, heart and base. But it is predominantly a tuberose scent and a glorious one!
It greets you with a fresh, clean, non-indolic jasmine but soon the lush tuberose reigns! It overthrows other floral notes to be honest. I cannot sense the rose or orris except in the very late dry down. The tuberose here is more creamy than in the original GB, a tad sweeter and has a less (but still has) green facet, so I probably didn’t need them both simultaneously as the differences are subtle, but I am obsessed with white florals.
I’ll forever be grateful for the house of Gucci for modernizing tuberose and bringing it back en vogue 💕💕💕 enamored!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I never thought I’d like this as much as I do! I’m seldom a floral lover, and this one doesn’t hold back. The projection on this is impressive, very bold jasmine opening, damask rose tones come through within about 20-30 minutes. A loud summer floral with bold personality. Impressive longevity and projection for a designer fragrance

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
A randomly received (unwanted) sample of this in a Sephora order is what got me sticking my nose into perfumes after decades of avoiding them. To me, this is stunning. It is so unabashedly floral, a true ambrosia of some of my favorite flowers in all their beauty. I feel like this evolves to give each flower a turn to shine, sparking a lifetime of memories and associations. Such beautiful scents bring memories of happy moments, as the gardenias of my childhood, the jasmine growing outside a former lover's window, the honeysuckle of a single sun-soaked summer, roses which have sprinkled my life on various occasions. These are not memories of perfumes but of the flowers themselves, gifts from nature that have given me real happiness from their beautiful existence. It's difficult for me to express exactly what I mean, but some of those memories were moments of beauty and happiness stolen from darker realities. Whatever else was happening, my gosh, those flowers smelled glorious.

The florals are rich and beautifully balanced, the evolution is a kaleidoscope of exquisite specimens brought forward in turn until they combine into the sparkling sweetness of buttery orris. I can feel something like pollen on my skin. I am savoring my tiny sample, and every time I take it out and apply it, I have to stop everything I'm doing and drink in this precious magic. I get drunk on its beauty and whatever else is happening, my gosh, this fragrance smells glorious.

I haven't tried the original or any other flankers and I don't want to, I'm not willing to risk how this makes me feel. I love white florals and have others, but nothing like this. It is all floral and quite sweet on my skin, but it lives in a class all its own.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I was out shopping today for birthday presents for our friends' daughter in Kohl's and of course I'm going to take a peek in Sephora. I haven't been able to sample to many of the Gucci Bloom line because they are always under lock and key at Ulta and the last time I was at Sephora Bloom Ambrosia is always sold out. Now I like the original Bloom but I thought it lacked depth, and the one in the yellow bottle gave me a headache w/ all the solar notes so I hated that one. But when I smelled Ambrosia, I knew I found the Bloom flanker for me, and I bought the last bottle they had on the spot. The salesgirl said it is one of their best sellers and I can see why. This is a divine tuberose perfume and blows most of what is for sale at the beauty counters out of the water. Gorgeous honeysuckle and jasmine start you off but when you get to that creamy and lush tuberose in the heart it is like pure heaven. The buttery orris and slightly powdery rose give a nice and lasting finish for this heavenly perfume. This is gorgeous and well worth the money. This is a year round signature scent. Ambrosia is buttery, lush, floral sweet (not candy or fruit sweet) musky and divine. A very feminine perfume. Beautiful.

Edit:4/21/22 Ambrosia di Fiori lasts all day w/out reapplying. Well worth the money.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: this one was my signature during the best times of my life and therefore i will always associate it with such joy and delight. i pick up a lot of honey which adds a gourmand personality to such a gentle floral scent. absolutely beguiling. worth the money.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: So I just tried this in Ulta, I kept thinking what does the remind me of? Finally I checked it out on fragrantica and saw in the “reminds me of “ section that FM Carnal Flower was mentioned. Ok so I realized it’s quite similar but not exactly the same (don’t come for me LMAO). It’s very floral and I can see wearing this now and summer wait actually this would also work for winter. Lasting power is amazing!!! Sillage is also great. Definitely a I’m here and this is what I’m wearing type of fragrance.
