This comes off sweeter and not as green as Carnal Flower more of a sharp tuberose white floral. Do I recommend yes I’m buying a FB asap! 10/10

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Honestly? This is like a little slice of heaven for me.
Heaven.

This perfume centers around a spiced tuberose. Along with that I can smell mainly honeyed white flowers (lily, jasmin?) and woods. It's so fresh, I could swear I can actually smell the pollen. I become a bee.
I find it vegetal, dry. Botanical, humid, exotic.
I see little red and black frogs on pods. I feel engulfed by tropical greens.

My best friend finds a heady incense and rose.

Two sides of the spectrum?
Maybe that's part of the magic.

Signature scent worthy.

Love it so that I sought and bought the main, original GUCCI Bloom along with the yellow (mustard) coloured version, Profumo Di Fiori.
Neither smell enough like this.
The original actually makes me nauseous shortly into the wearing. At first I can handle it (petals in water, captured by the ad campaign) but after a short while it becomes unbearable for me (muggy, muddled, too sweet). We're incompatible. Something in the original doesn't mesh well with my senses and makes me feel incredibly queasy. The mustard is nice enough but perhaps too much like a mix of this one and the original, along with a laaaarge helping of Ylang-ylang. Too much of the original in there and not enough of this one. They're both very dewy and pitch potent.

This version is perfection for me.
Other than being comparatively soft in projection.
It is a concern that if it were stronger I may not find it quite so alluring.
This is special to me, genuinely like a little slice of heaven. This is the only way I can describe it.
I have honestly dabbled with the idea of having it be my signature scent and would recommend it as such to others. It is a real beauty, a top favourite. Only wish I'd backed up and bought two more bottles of this instead of taking the blind plunge topple, getting myself those others thinking they might be just as good.

I got it right first time.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: A sweeter, more powdery version of the OG. I love it!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This screams hot summer night to me. A little too heavy to wear during the day for me. Lasted around 6 hours on my skin.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Sick of winter? Want to pretend, spring has sprung already and you can leave your warm and spicy scents behind for awhile? Well, here you go. Spring in a bottle. Sweet, sunny, youthful but not in an exclusionary way. All are welcome to to wear a mantle of flowers and feel young, fresh, and joyful that the sun and flowers are returning. It truly is delightful. Long lasting too! and that's my corny ad for this lovely, lovely fragrance.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: When ever I spray this perfume , I feel like I’m in the middle of an orchard full of flowers 🌺, wonderful mood booster, perfect expect for week longevity.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I’ve been looking for a rose scent for a long time that is not too ROSEY, and has a contemporary aesthetic. This one develops wonderfully through a white floral start to the rose/orris dry down. Love!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
HONEYSUCKLE! So much honeysuckle.

The top note was sweet, too sweet tbh. When that died back after about 5 minutes what was left behind was honeysuckle. Clean, true, fresh, bright honeysuckle. Four hours on and it's mellowed a bit, but it's still there. The notes say the basenote is Orris root, " powdery earthy rooty scent, with woody, violet flower nuances" and OK, seems right enough. We'll say that's what's balancing the honeysuckle for the afternoon part of this now closer to the skin scent experience.

This was a skin test while popping in and out of stores on a snowing, 25F degree day. All of that can impact the scent experience, but under these circumstances I loved it. Such a great, true scent contrast with what was going on around me.

I like the original Bloom and this one make sense to me as a flanker. Same base, same personality, but the prominence of the notes has been changed. Loved it.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I'm not really sure why anyone would buy this if they didn't like the OG Bloom... because this is almost exactly the same... you can see that in the notes. But weird purchasing habits aside, the original Bloom is one of my favourite fragrances for spring, so I kinda knew I'd love this - and I do.

This is a sweeter, less heavy version of Bloom. I think I can really smell the honeysuckle in the beginning, which I love. This version doesn't trigger my allergies like the original does, which I like. It also doesn't last as long, but I just keep a purse spray and reapply after a few hours, which I don't mind because I like the opening the most anyway.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Very floral, especially the opening. Tuberose and jasmine in a big loud an synthetic way. Modern mass designer base that isn't unpleasant, this one has a bit of creaminess going on. Gone after 2 hours. Poor mans version of Rouge Malachite. I like it better than the regular Bloom, but still not worth it. If you like floral opt for Bamboo or Flora of the same house, they last and will get you tons of compliments. This one won’t.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Am I the only one getting Miss Dior Cherie vibes from this? It’s not listed, but there’s a very prominent note of berries to my nose. And a musky base.

“Ambrosia” in italian is frequently used to refer to liquors and wine, so even though Gucci Blooms are marketed as florals and this specific scent is listed as a floriental, I was expecting something sweet.

And I was right: to my nose, it smells like a fruity floral. It reminds me of a Portuguese cherry-like liquor, Ginjinha. Some boozy notes would have been fitting and might have made this fragrance a bit more complex and less linear, but overall I find it a pleasant scent.

I agree with some reviewers below about a certain chemical harshness, but it’s not off-putting. The white flowers are indeed very green and the rose is faint to my nose. The flower I smell the most is a green jasmine, with some bubblegum tuberose following suit.

It’s too sweet for the summer and too light for fall or winter. I think this might be a perfect scent for rainy spring days.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: None of the gucci blooms are worth wasting money on. They last next to nothing and costs the white out of your eyes.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Initial sniff I really enjoyed it but as time went on, the Tuberose totally took over the whole thing. It’s all I smell now. I personally think this could’ve been blended down a little bit smoother.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I received a Gucci Bloom sample, two flanker samples, and a Gucci Guilty EDT sample with my Oud Bouquet purchase from Macy's. Overall I have been very impressed with these Bloom fragrances. I saved this one for last, because it has a rose note included. Rose is one of my favorite fragrance notes, so I expected to like this one the best.

Gucci Bloom flanker test... GO!

Very green in the opening. So simular to Profumo (the yellow) flanker, that I actually checked the tiny bottle to make sure they didn't accidentally attach the wrong sample to the wrong card. But, nope, this is Ambrosia (the red) flanker. Can't say I am disappointed, as I love this opening. Rangoon creeper is a lovely green scent, and although it is not a listed note, I am pretty sure that is what I am smelling.

When this settles, it is much lighter than the original. It smells very different. Less creamy. I get a hint of green, sweetness from the honeysuckle, tuberose, and maybe a hint of rose. Like a hint of clean rose. Not exactly a soapy rose, but a clean green rose.

This is not a typical fresh pretty rose fragrance for rose lovers. The rose is way in the background, mixed with white florals, and very green. Like smelling a bouquet of flowers and stems, with a single rose in the midst.

The scent aura is not as strong with this fragrance, but I can still smell it around me, just MUCH lighter.

As it drys down, it gets a little sweeter, and the rose becomes more noticeable, but it is still very light. I would say this is my favorite drydown of the three.

This is not my favorite of the three, but it is still a very pretty fragrance, with a beautiful scent aura, and a really beautiful dry down. If you like light pretty clean smelling florals, you may really love this fragrance.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Ambrosia is definitely the slightly sweeter version in the line like others stated it’s kinda of creamy/buttery. When I sprayed it on I immediately thought Tom Ford Orchid Soleil; just more florals less plastic/cereal note. I like sweet so I definitely prefer this over the original Bloom; and for a dominant tuberose scent (where I usually associate tuberose as mature) this is sexier.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This smells so delicious. Opening is a bit green and mentholated, but wait to see the drydown. It is creamy, buttery, sweet, almost coconutty. Dense and rounded. This one is the most bubblegummy tuberose of all of the Blooms. It is also the sweetest and somehow reminds me of summer. Like it almost has a bit of monoi. Sexy, grown up perfume. Love it.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This smells so good on me! The slightly sweet honeysuckle and tuberose is beautiful and feminine!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Like all the Blooms I have tried and own, Ambrosia is quite a lovely scent. Pretty, feminine, and east to wear provided you enjoy tuberose and jasmine, the two notes that together provide the common thread from the OG through all the flankers. Ambrosia is no exception. It's pretty, very floral and feminine, and easy to wear if you are a fan of tuberose.
Unfortunately, Ambrosia shares the same problem I have with all the Blooms I've tried and own (the OG and 3 flankers). The longevity is very poor and the silage is moderate at best. My bottle of Bloom is full sized, and the three flankers are roller balls, which may be part of the problem. However, it's a big enough problem that I will not be purchasing any other full bottles, which makes me sad because I enjoy them so much while able to smell them.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I just bought this today and I love it! Its just so yummy smelling. Next I will try some f the other Blooms, but when I tried samples this one stopped me in my tracks. Love it.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This is a lovely white floral, and one of the first perfumes I ever purchased. It is a classic for spring, and it smells nice in the fall too, though it's totally different from one season to another. For some reason, I dislike wearing this perfume in the summer or winter, and generally avoid it. This perfume is heavy on the honeysuckle and tuberose; orris also stands out to me, but there are other reviewers who say they don't smell it at all. I will say it does smell slightly "sharp" on my nose. It isn't something that keeps me from wearing it, but I tend to spray my outfit with it rather than my skin.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
It is a lovely scent--I get the honeysuckle and tuberose more than the jasmine on first spray and the dry down is quite nice but ...it does not last long on me at all. And where is the "Rangoon creeper"? LOL...I have no idea what that is but it sounded appealingly exotic and this perfume is *not* exotic. It is sweet, serene and pretty so if I ever want to impersonate a sweet and serene and pretty girl, Imma wear this. ;)

This is also the first straight up floral I have tried since I used to "borrow" my mother's perfume and maybe it is that mum association that makes me want to spice this up! I am considering layering it with a little sandalwood...it may seem like blasphemy (like when I layer Chanel 5 with patchouli) but I think it might work....

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Does anyone else get Narciso Ambree from this?
I sprayed it on my arm and that’s what I immediately got. It must be the tuberose I guess.
I will try it again later on so I can fully absorb the scent.
It has a peculiar smell so far. It has the DNA of the original for sure.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
A delicious scent that I love along with my husband, it is a divinely beautiful scent. I love this floral scent with is so lovely and projects with a very good intensity, so much so you have to be careful not to over spray. It is the only Gucci Bloom scent that last all day long on me.

The Jasmine and Honeysuckle blend so good together where you can't pick out one or the other which is more prettier to me less linear then it will add the rose scent to it bouquet. A enticing, alluring beautiful scent which is signature worthy. Add the Orris for a feminine dry down that is a warm, light powdery, creamy floral scent. I Love This!!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Bad choice, extremely weak and short-lived!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Liked on paper, but 3 separate wears and its a no-go. Too syrupy sweet. I love honeysuckle, but the tuberose . . . ugh, it is just toooooo much. The lasting power is basically 2 hours tops.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: It's hard to review all these flankers without comparing to the original, and each other. Ambrosia is indeed very similar to original Bloom and especially Gocce di Fiori. I was hoping for more creaminess in this iteration and although I do definitely get that here, the opening has quite a strong woody note, like dry pond reeds, that I find off putting. The dry down is thankfully reed free, but has a bit more of a mature feeling to it than its predecessors. Not sure it's quite the flanker I was hoping for but I'm reaching to find unique elements, as there's barely any difference between them at this point. Overall, it's still a very beautiful, creamy white floral.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I really loved this perfume on paper! It smelled so amazing and soft. Unfortunately, on my skin, the honeysuckle is the most prominent note and does not go away. It lasts for hours, which is great for anyone looking for such a strong honeysuckle frag. I wish it developed better on my skin, but with my Ph it's just pure honeysuckle, which is disappointing for the price and potential of the perfume. It may be better on other people's skin, so try it out! Like I said, it smells so different on paper so make sure you do a wear test on yourself :)

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I am absolutely smitten with this!!! I did not think that I was a white floral fan because everything I have tried in the past (that was predominantly white florals) bored me or reminded me of cleaning products. THIS is truly beautiful!!!! I don't have the "expertise" to explain why this is so good...but I'll try anyways. It has a depth to it but somehow it still feels fresh (not stuffy or powdery). It ~feels~ creamy somehow?...which is what I think I was missing from other white florals. It also has a slight natural sweetness to it but nothing that would make me classify this as a "sweet" fragrance, it just stops it from turning sour on me. I would 10/10 recommend that you sample this on the skin because smelling it from the bottle does not do it justice ♡

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
This is the most beautiful fragrance I have smelled in the last few years. If you love white florals. I would say if you’re wanting a Gucci Bloom fragrance please get this one. Not that the original isn’t good but this version is just that extra indulgence I was looking for. It’s different enough to own. The opening is similar to the original but very quickly you can tell the jasmine is softened by ROSE and honeysuckle and there is a powdery softness from the orris root which is the root of the Iris flower. The dry down is sweeter and very velvety, the tuberose is incredible with the rose. it’s so creamy and a little heavier but not cloying. It’s not indolic or animalic. It’s like warm white flowers with Bulgarian rose petals and heavy cream. It’s so comforting and exceptionally well blended.
A true masterpiece.
Thank you Gucci. God I wish I got the big bottle!!!
❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Wooow, one of my favorites! Smells like Gucci bloom original but little heavier, with heavier rose and tuberose. Smells like a summer night in south of Europe, where there are flowers everywhere and people are happy and sunburned. Smells like a nice expensive vacation, i blind bought it and it takes me back to wonderful memories <3 if u love flowers and love the smell of summer nights, this is for u

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: The freshest and sonorous of all Gucci Bloom, not so sweet and smothering, a little sour, reminiscent of sour rose hips, rice, white flowers, orange jam, some bitter herbs. Very persistent perfume for winter

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: My favourite of all the Gucci Bloom line; opens with strong freshness and green notes and dries down to a lovely cream tuberose with a hint of rose...sillage is not the best, but it lasts pretty long on me. Perfect day scent for spring/summer and autumn

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: To my nose, when I compared all the Gucci Blooms, this one was the creamiest of all. Its not creamy ENOUGH for me though...Im wanting it to get that whipped cream feel of Love Tuberose but it never quite gets there. Although I own this and I love it, I think the rose opening isn't my favorite. Its a very natural Tuberose. I have also noticed this performs better on skin than clothing. When sprayed on skin, it develops better: the rose dissipates, the tuberose becomes more creamy. On clothes, the rose stays and the perfume doesnt really develop at all...stays kind of screechy? I also noticed original Bloom smells great in the heat, this one was better in the cold. I haven't been complimented on this yet, which is a shame because I have smelled the OG Bloom on others and literally swooned with delight, so I'm wondering if I should have gone for the fresher original. When this one empties I just might!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I'm not a fan of green tuberose fragrances. I like tuberose fragrances that are in full bloom, where lush flower blossoms have reached peak of scent and are creamy, milky, or even lightly indolic. I don't even mind dark tuberose perfumes as in Flos Mortis, where the flowers border on decay. But, this is too green for me. There's barely any sweetness to balance out the greenness either. I still prefer original Bloom as it seems more balanced to me. Still, I can appreciate this is a beautiful scent. It just isn't a beautiful scent I want to wear.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: the name is certainly apt! it smells like walking through an english cottage garden. unfortunately the honeysuckle is just too OTT for me. i do like the tuberose that comes through, and it's a lovely fresh floral - i cannot overstate how natural it smells - but wow that honey is overpowering

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I own and really like the original Gucci Bloom, but this, in my opinion, is better. I love that it has an even stronger tuberose note and it seems greener and fresher than the original. It has that same warmth that the original Bloom has, but it's more tempered by freshness. I don't know if the two are different enough to justify owning both at the same time. But if in the future I finish Bloom, I may replace it with this.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Bvlgari Splendida Tubereuse Mystique and Gucci Ambrosia di Fiori are almost identical with the exeption that perhaps Bvlgari is litlle bit sweeter while Gucci bit heavier and slightly more intense . Both beautiful and extremly feminine . Both pricey as for mainstream frags .Perfect for fall/winter .

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I have the original Gucci Bloom, and I got a sample of Ambrosia di Fiori, It smells just like Gucci Bloom but it's more fresh and i can smell a bit of rose, which makes the scent sweeter. I must say, I prefer this one compared to Gucci Bloom. I will buy a 30ml bottle for christmas :) A lil' gift for me :p

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: It has tuberose??? To me it smelled like weak patchouli, something sweet and sea water note. Armani Si vibe. Disappointed.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
An absolutely beautiful white floral.

It's a sweet tuberose/jasmine combo sweetened so lightly with the another flower in honeysuckle, & a touch of floral powder with orris & rose.

Beautiful all around, a love-or-like fragrance. A modernized classic smell.

Smell extremely similar to the original Bloom. I'd need side by side comparison to tell the difference.

A lovely spring day wear for any lady of any age.

Love!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: First five minutes it's realistic floral with hints of green leaves. White flowers and yellow pollen, only bumble bee itself is missing. I wish that it would stay longer such strong and clear floral as in those first minutes, but over time it turns to more yellow sweet-ish. Doesn't seem interesting and I don't get any associations, it's just yellowish sweet. It's nice, clean (not soap) scent. Not really office type perfume as it's rather sweet, but probably it will be inoffensive for most. Mostly summer, but can fit any season. More as day time perfume.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I had a sample of this with a broken sprayer, so this morning I just popped it open and dumped the whole thing all over me. I get a very salty scent from this fragrance; I'm trying to figure out what it reminds me of. Maybe Bvlgari Aqva Divina but with more white floral. It's nice to wear for a day, but I won't be buying it.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: abigailtorres632, thank you for putting into words what I have been trying to formulate since smelling this! I was expecting this to be at least tolerable as the original is, but when I sprayed it, I instantly recoiled and dry heaved! I couldn't even begin to discern what I was smelling, I just had to get away from it posthaste! Now reading what you've experienced I have to agree 100% that this does have that same horrible stale almond/heliotrope strangeness that Beautiful Belle and Beautiful Belle Love have and I had the same gagging reaction to both of those scents, too.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Bloom Ambrosia is intoxicating. Upon first spritz is a bit sour for about half a minute. I am not sure why but it is. Perhaps it is the Rose note.

Then all of a sudden it hits me. A lavish sweet Honeysuckle. I adore Honeysuckle so this is very pleasing. Then I detect a very straightforward Jasmine.

As Ambrosia develops I pick up on a glorious dominant Tuberose. This is a creamy, dreamy Tuberose. My senses get sent to the Heavens....Lahhh!!

The Orris adds an Earthy velvety dimension which is quite balancing seeing the bouquet is undeniably lush and buttery. It could become heady without it. If you love florals this is for you. A must have for the Floral lovers out there.

The sillage is strong at first then it is moderate but that is okay because I wear this baby for my pleasure. Longevity is about six hours. Not bad for a modern floral. I highly recommend!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Love this flanker. I am drawn to anything creamy with tuberose/white flowers and this fits the bill. I wasn't that keen on the original Bloom, it lacked depth for me as did the other flankers in the range. I sampled this on holiday and fell in love, it has a creaminess which I adore. Some of the more commercial scents are all very 'samey' these days but Gucci has done well here. For me this should have been the original Bloom and I hope it's not discontinued going forward.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I have a sample and wore it for the first time today, fresh from a shower and moisturizing my skin. It is beautiful and very similar to the original Bloom, but as others have pointed out, the rose makes it deeper, and in my opinion it lends a velvety component to the scent. The question now is whether or not to purchase a full bottle since I have the original, and many white floral perfumes. I must say that the quality is there, as in others in the line. What I may do is wait until I finish the bottle I have and purchase this one next, or drop hints to my husband before then. Another Fragrantician said something about the wonderful things Gucci is doing with tuberose, making it popular with younger people who would run away from an older white floral, screaming "granny scent". I would be happy to see florals in general making a comeback. Maybe I'm too frou frou, but I enjoy smelling feminine, and this one is definitely that!
EDIT - I didn't realize at first that this has orris in it, which accounts for the velvety feel I attributed to the rose. The projection and longevity is stellar, especially on clothing. I don't recall the last time I purchased a perfume where I could still catch whiffs of it 24 hours later. This is a big love for me!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I have a sample of this, and was enjoying it, until I got a whiff of the horse-hay that abigailtorres632 mentioned in her review. Removing from my wish list. Test this before buying.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Finally I have a sample in my clutches.

And I love it. Gucci has made some very good Tuberose centered scents in this line. I liked the original a lot, and unfortunately I cannot compare the two because I’m not sure where my sample lays. I can say that Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori is warm and full. Leans more toward cold weather in my opinion, not sure I can pull it off in Summer.

I own a lot of perfume, too much really...and I already have many Tuberose scents that I love. That said, I would not hesitate to pull the trigger on a good deal, I just can’t justify full price, though that’s not to say Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori is not worth it.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Really nice scent! I tried the regular Gucci Bloom as well, which is also nice - a very fresh tuberose floral bouquet. I find that the Ambrosia di Fiori is very similar, but has the addition of a sweetish rose scent, which kind of softens and deepens the Gucci Bloom scent subtly, making it easier to wear for a daily scent. I don't usually like straight florals, but this one is beautiful!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Rich succulent white flower powerhouse that is very well done. There is also a dark green note (maybe the orris?) that takes this to the next level. The dark green note doesn’t make this masculine, but as a guy I am drawn to it and I’m thinking I can layer this with something else to make this my own. A lot of design houses have scents like this (think Prada La Femme Intense or Armani Prive Vert Malachite) but this one is hard to beat and much more affordable. Thumbs way up.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I wanted so badly to love this one! It's a no from me. Very disappointed. It is a stale version of Gucci Bloom - like an unfinished Gucci Bloom sitting on the table waiting for the other notes to complete it. This is devoid of the natural floral sweetness of the original but instead has the horrible flat and bland aspects of the unfinished DNA of the original with the addition of something that smells like a mixture of blanched almonds and hay! I do not know what causes this but it is repulsive to my nose since I hate almonds - it's that same stale, musty almond note that ruined the Beautiful Belle Love flanker by Estee Lauder. I've been smelling similar notes on the market and just been turned off by it.

Edit: Spraying it again it really reminds me of the park when in the horse carriage lane, the smell of horse maneur mixed with hay. Not good... I love well done indolic fragrances this just isn't one of them. Terribly out of balance, flat with an off-putting stale maneur/horsey-hay smell.

Edit No 2: this is seriously giving me Beautiful Belle vibes mixed with Beautiful Belle Love on the dry down - nothing at all like the original Gucci Bloom except the borrowing of some notes. Totally giving me an Estee Lauder Beautiful Belle vibe, as a dupe, an hour after spraying.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I enjoy the Gucci Bloom line. This popular Gucci release has made tuberose scents popular again. The original was a creamy, lush tuberose fragrance without the headiness or the 'poopy' indoles. Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori is much the same, with an interesting addition of a red rose accord.

Admittedly, if you own Gucci Bloom or another of her flankers, you probably don't need to own this one too. There are only very slight variations between them, and to an untrained nose, the differences are barely discernable.

The rose adds a touch more depth to the white floral centric composition which works nicely as an evening or cool weather alternative. If I had to pick a favourite amongst the Gucci Bloom flankers, Ambrosia di Fiori is one I would happily wear. I enjoy white florals and rose-based scents, so the pairing of these two notes appeal to my taste in fragrance.

If you found the original a tad too fresh or too green, Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori may be more your cup of tea. Not to mention the packaging is stunning with its striking red bottle, a popular choice for Christmas shoppers late last year.

I own enough tuberose scents to last me a lifetime, so I haven't considered purchasing Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori, but I would never be opposed to receiving it as a gift from a loved one.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Although Ambrosia di Fiori has some ingredients common to the whole Bloom family, like tuberose, jasmine bug, Rangoon creeper, and velvet orris, emotion-wise, it would be the closest to Nettari di Fiori.

They both have that feel of a "night-time" summer air heaviness, a flower palette that you would wear to last and impress. But Ambrosia takes it up a notch and makes it LUST. It's very seductive and sensual, the bottle cries of desire but is never blatant. It's more than a flirt but less than an invitation.

It's genuinely an amazing and charming scent that makes a great addition to the line. Give it a few seconds for the mid and base notes to kick in and take you on the mysterious journey. There's something about the cocktail that you'll always remember.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I thought it smells like modern Gres Cabotin at first and It is also more strong and mature than classic Blooom. I like it a lot.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Unfortunately too heavy for me, I’ll stick with Bloom EDP & EDT and Bloom Acqua di Fiori.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Had high hopes for this, I'm looking for a white floral for layering. Tested it today and it's a very heavy scent but not that pleasant to be honest. It was oddly ... Over ripe and meaty. Might be 'indoles' I have heard speak of? Intense definitely

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I'm glad I tried this first. I wasn't sure if I liked it, but I soon realized I didn't love it. Then I asked 4 people separately what they thought of it on me. Not one person liked it. It got ratings of 7 out of 10, 3 out of 5. I think I like it more than the original, which I didn't like very much. I like Bond No.9 Saks for Her much more and have gotten compliments every time I wear that one.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
A rich, white flower fragrance. The opening is fresh-flowery, while the base is lush and warm-tuberosey.
It's quite mature but very charming. Works all year round.
Definately my favourite out of the Gucci Bloom line.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
- Merry Christmas! 🎄

Ambrosia is even better than the original because it is more intense. Ambrosia is sweet like the original but more creamy and buttery, sophisticated and elegant. As said below, it's Tuberose Creme Brulee to my nose. Excellent use of orris here! It does indeed smell like Gardenia due to the added butteriness. Yum! I'm in LOVE with the entire Bloom line (except Acqua di fiori).

My hubby bought me this perfume for Christmas but I've smelled it many times at perfume counters while waiting to open a bottle of my own luscious beauty. I feel so happy and lucky to have this bottle in my collection. Merry Christmas to you all!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Gucci at its best!I finally got a bottle of this gem and well it is just gorgeous.By the way it borders on gourmand it actually gets sweeter with time,thick tluberose and plushy vanilla make Ambrosia opulent and sensual,what a beauty.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Well, who would have guessed Fracas is gonna be reincarnated and 71 years later Gucci Bloom Ambrosia will arise.

I love it

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Now that it is cold this is the right Bloom to wear! i wore it last night a d the smell was so rich and gorgeous it could not go unnoticed in fact I got complimented and it felt so good.Def an amazing fragrance by Gucci I feel like this is what original Bloom should have been in the first place

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
To begin with correctly, Ambrosia for the Greek mythology was the drink of Olympian Gods. A sweet and deep dark red wine. For a strange reason, perfumes in dark red bottles are a 'like' for me.

I very liked Gucci Bloom EDP when first came out. Maybe cause I am a fan of white florals. We connect white flowers to unfortunatelly 'bad ceremonies' if you get my point and mostly with tuberose. It is an overdose of 'watery' tuberose and the good thing is that lasting power as well sillage are so good that I even got complimented from a harsh judge, my mother! Why I say all this and don't go str8 to Ambrosia? Because Gucci did a good work for white flower lovers.

Now about Ambrosia EDP edition. Aren't there too many editions already? Ok maybe Acqua di fiori is the only edition that goes to an another direction. Here, when first smelled, I said yes, I like it. Then test again and thought that I smelled a win-y jasmin or let's say a red wine aromatized by white florals. Damask rose is in perfect balance to give it a sweet twist, you almost don't get it and there's also a whisper of green freshness-musky-earthiness. At this stage,it reminded me a bit of Narciso Rodriguez Pure Musc. Here jasmin/honeysuckle are the stars. Don't expect something new and crazy but expect a more serious if not mature, more linear, more womanly, softer edition of the Bloom family.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
More sassy and intense than the original,
I too get fracas vibes
To me this is a sophisticated scent, I can see a smart woman who has her life together wearing this.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I'm wearing Ambrosia for the first time today. My initial thoughts: this Gucci Bloom fragrance lies exactly in the middle of the original Gucci Bloom and Gucci Bloom Nettare de Fiori, both of which I like a lot. Its tuberose is a little "louder" than the OG fragrance, while it contains a bit of the earthiness/spiciness of Nettare.

So far, its strength and longevity on my skin is right there in the middle, as well - OG Bloom doesn't last at all on me, while I can still smell Nettare's spicy/herbal notes hours and hours after I spray it on. I'll have to see how long Ambrosia lasts.

UPDATE: I realize that this fragrance reminds me of Korloff Majestic Tuberose, only not as spicy. I layered the two today and they smell great together!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: With this one I really smell Fracas similarities. It's Gucci Bloom softer but also far more well rounded. I still prefer the original, though.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: A sultry, feminine white floral that manages to be daytime acceptable. Conveys hot, humid, sticky summer nights after a thunderstorm, with the very faintest rot/indolic smell. The honeysuckle and tuberose are strong and lasting, with soft orris underneath. It's not as strong a tuberose as something like EL PC Tuberose Gardenia, so with a light spritz you can probably wear it to work and not make people around you faint. Heavier application is date night appropriate. I never tried the original Bloom, only a card tester of the Nettare flanker which didn't impress me at all but I love this.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This perfume is so gorgeous! The longevity is just amazing and the scent of tuberose, which often doesn't work on my skin, is beautiful. I am just overwhelmed by this. In addition to my skin, I sprayed a tester card and put it in my purse...I can still smell it when I'm a couple of feet away and it's been 36 hours! This would be a great Christmas gift; safe, but beautiful and special too. I'm so glad it has "ambrosia" in its name, otherwise, I may not have reached for it, and what a shame that would be. It's so very pretty!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I love original Bloom with its powdery and slightly sweet tuberose but I have to admit that Ambrosia is even better because it is more intense and it is so creamy and sophisticated and elegant.I think Ambrosia is the best Bloom so far.Also sillage and longevity are both great.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Very similar to the others from this line, but more mature. The opening is earthy and a bit powdery, later i get fresh white flowers. Very pleasant and elegant. For white floral lovers definitely worth a try.
Overall, it’s sensual, confident and feminine.
I really like it.
final note: 9/10

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I purchased my bottle from Macy's earlier this week.
I have to say: I ABSOLUTELY 100% agree with the poster below me. This outclasses ALL of the Gucci Bloom flankers. Damn! This perfume is GORGEOUS! A little FYI, I do tend to lean into being more of a niche chick in acquisitions. But, to ask me, I'm not really one way or the other. I buy and wear what I like. I don't care who makes it or whose name is on it. That's the truth. I actually roll my eyes when I see designer ads. But, I keep an open mind and nose when it comes to the juice. Wow! This one is nice. A dense, rich cold weather floral for us flower loving hippie chicks.Thank you Gucci, from the bottom of my flower laiden heart.
Peace out sisters!
& my brothers.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
With Ambrosia di Fiori, Gucci outclasses every Bloom flanker, making the jus more carnal, creamy and intense, rightly observed by you, without depriving it of the original lymphatic green freshness.
Even the red color emphasizes my subjective perception.
Despite it contains discordant ingredients, typology ideally reminds me of the last masterpiece I tested at Bvlgari, Tubereuse Mystique, and honestly I wouldn't know which one to choose between the two.
Remaining on Gucci theme, my choice at this point would fall on 'Ambrosia', downgrading to the second place (I mean as a purchase order) 'Nettare', that I've had on my wish list for a long time now.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This is the best of the Bloom line. It has the sweet, warm, creamy quality that I expect when I hear "tuberose perfume". It carries some of the spectacular deliciousness of Love Tuberose by Amouage (which is signature-worthy to me)...But underneath it all is the smell of Gucci Bloom, which is clean, fresh in a modern way, with a nice honeysuckle note. A bit perfumey, but elegant, and versatile. I could happily use a full bottle, but I long for Love Tuberose more than anything. Either way, I happily reapply with great pleasure.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
i love this new scent !!! at first spray it has a unique different type of scent - maybe its the creeper note (not sure what that is suppose to smell like lol )

BUT then it develops into a beautiful luxe tuberose scent !!! and that stays with u forever !!! i dont mean forever like powerhouse strong lol i mean like it lingers beautifully :) so if u love tuberose give this a try :)

and i love the dark red bottle..........i hope they come out with more flankers in other colors lol - i know more flankers omg lol but im a sucker for them lol...........would love to see a bloom in a purple bottle with a lavender or orchid vibe......maybe a bright yellow with a citrus vibe & im sure black for the night vibe is not far behind lol

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I was very eager to test this newest flanker of Gucci Bloom. The description looked promising - but the scent itself doesn’t bring anything new to the table. It’s very similar to the original Bloom, only a bit stronger, creamier and sweeter. In terms of performance, it is definitely an improvement on the pilar fragrance; but in terms of creativity, I’m afraid that it’s the case of same ol’ same ol’. At least the bottle is beautiful.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
Tuberose Creme Brulee´.
It is creamier,´sweeter´(warmer,´ thicker´), than the original Bloom.

A scent of excellent quality and class.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: I got a strong smell of orchid from this, I'm surprised I didn't see it in the notes!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I tried this today, it is a very nice fragrance at the same time it smells like something I may already have in my collection. It is definitely a well made gourmand much better than the other fragrances those other companies released this fall. I was not impressed with "Memoire d'une odeur", but I would purchase this once I am able to find it at a discounted price.

I decided to purchase this one, I found it at a discounted price online. I cannot wait to add it to my collection.

I used this fragrance for the first time, I layered it with the Bloom Guccie Dry Body Oil, It made me feel like a princess. I am not sure it is a fragrance for the winter, I think it is more for spring and fall. Anyway, who cares, wear it whenever you feel like it; after all it is your perfume and your body do whatever pleases you. Forget the haters.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: This is a very rich natural smelling tuberose. Not very interesting but definitely high quality. I like it!

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content:
I love Gucci’s Bloom line. The Bloom EDP made tuberose palatable to younger generations, shaking off vintage dust from the accord and proving it’s the perfect floral note for people of any age. The “sequels” have also become must-sniff. They aren’t just cash-ins; rather, each flanker recontextualizes the original EDP in a different light. Ambrosia di Fiori, Bloom’s fourth flanker, perhaps bests all of its siblings. Here, there’s that irresistible harmony of tuberose, jasmine, and honeysuckle, only now, it’s been deepened. Under the “Bloom-ness” is a creamy orris shaded by rose—a dry-down to fall in love with.

Beautiful scent, beautiful bottle. And longevity? I tested one spray on my wrist in the afternoon, then woke up the next morning with Ambrosia di Fiori still radiating.

product_name: Gucci Bloom Ambrosia di Fiori Gucci
review_content: Gucci this new scent is amazing..I will be wearing this new parfum this winter..it smell's so good Ladies go try it.. it's very nice..

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: A soft aromatic, pleasant, hygienic (but not soapy) scent. Very linear, many might not find it thrilling enough. Nighttime synthetic white floral vibe can be smelled up close. Any citrus types notes that might be here are held back. Up close, it dries down to Gucci Guilty Black but a half point better. The scent decant sample spritz behind each ear and two on the neck lasted my work day. Don't be afraid of the salt note. It adds more of a semi savory facet to the fragrance or a support for other notes, you won't smell like salt at all I'd get this as a (why not) purchase once my collection is filled out for less than $60 for a 50ml if I could find it but I can make a case for just buying it now as well but I'm not impelled for the price and the scent yet for a number of guys: I could recommend it as a signature scent. Very nice for the office, semi formal and formal occasions, dinner with your lady or in a co-ed setting. For the every day average guy, this could be his dressed up fragrance. Ladies will think that you smell nice/good and maybe sexy due to the pleasant hygienic factor and gentlemanly noon to 8 vibe of the scent.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: My girlfriend and I really enjoy this fragrance, it's my most used so far and I feel like I can wear it any time. On my skin, the performance is very solid and I only need 1 or 2 sprays.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: The start is good,a citrusy beginning but just a downhill from there,I used it 5 days but was disappointed everyday,initially I thought I was hallucinating this can't be the Gucci standard,the musky dry down is the worst part,just can't take it,it was a blind buy and I am fortunate that it was just 50 ml,not the full bottle.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Smelled this at Sephora
Reviews are not lying this doesn't last wow I was actually very surprised .

Sprayed both on had and on paper within 30 mins it was faint I sprayed it before work and I had my coworkers smell it and they all said it was undetectable on my hand and on my paper.


However I also sprayed the Gucci EDP which I’d recommend cause that lasted like crazy. It’s got that Gucci guilty DNA with a dirty earthy rose spice to it.


I’d stick with the EDT if you’re looking for that OG guilty cause it beats this which is honestly sad lol

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: This fragrance is amazing, like the edt but more depth with a little hint of spice which makes more rounded. It is like everyone else is saying and it is the worst fragrance I’ve ever tested in terms of longevity and sillage. I’ve used a 10ml sample in three days and it’s still not been noticeable. If I blind bought this I would seriously be writing a complaint to Gucci about the matter, and to be honest trading standards- that sounds like an overreaction but it’s just a rip off, no way is this to standards of a perfume. Very sad

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Crisp, pulled together everyday scent. It’s overall solid but not head turning.


Rating: 7/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
@Swang

Anything to say about the scent or just another rant about newbies, seasons and sexes?

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: I hate lavender but I LOVE this. Good old Gucci guilty

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Your Christmas Present from your ex. Your mate who isn't really into perfumes because thats a bit "girly"'s choice. The 15 year old lad's first perfume. Tight blue jeans with chunky trainers and a shirt that shows off you've been to the gym recently in a bottle. It is a mass market, buy me on the promo stand in the Department store fragrance. It is possibly my least favourite fragrance I have ever smelt, and it unscrupulously hawked by retail assistants at you as "male looking to purcahase perfume and wants to do so for around fifty quid". I personally think its quite an offensive smell: because its the smell of the bathroom in a nightclub because the bossman at the sinks is selling sptrizes of it. Don't choose to smell like that person- there are so many other options.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Smells decent but the longevity and projection are laughable.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Pay special attention to the comments of those people who started their fragrance journey two weeks ago and have 3 bottles of perfume in their collections ;)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: This has to be my worst blind buy. Paid big bucks for a fragrance that doesn't perform and lasts like 30 minutes. They tried to clone Bleu de Chanel, you can connect these two but the performance of Gucci is a scam. Could be ok for a casual or gym scent. The bottle quality is great, the cap is harder to open..

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: My first ever fragrance was euphoria men by Calvin Klein. Rocked it for a while and then started collecting and realized how awful the longevity and sillage on it was. This to me is like an elevated euphoria. It keeps those amazing fresh spicy notes but brings it up a degree. The longevity is definitely better but it is a bit disappointing for an EDP. Their ability to make a masculine rose based fragrance and work in that spiciness is super impressive and is a no brainer for anyone who loves fresh spicy scents and has some money to spend.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Received a miniature as a gift for another purchase. There was no atomizer hence I only dabbed on skin.

Scent profile is familiar and looks like they've tried to imitate Bleu de Chanel. Versatile fragrance; all seasons and any occassion. Nothing new for the enthusiasts so they can skip.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: It is such an aggresive smell makes my nose hurt, it smells like a lemon scented dishwasher, i don't get it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Can anyone explain Why EDP has much better performance than parfum ??????

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is what a sophisticated gentleman smells like. Office safe and even great for a date night when it’s cool out. Gucci guilty parfum & black are the only two you need, although the new love edition is pretty good too.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I don’t know. I think this is a fragrance I regret buying. It feels like a very classic office perfume—probably something everyone has smelled at some point in their life and found ordinary. It was recommended by a staff member at duty-free. With my tired nose at the time, I decided it was worth buying, but I regretted it later.

It’s a simple spicy aromatic fragrance. The projection isn’t great, and the longevity is poor. However, it’s suitable for all seasons.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: idk, kind of generic and typical. Smells like something you wear for other people/compliments than something you want to really be smelling on yourself. I guess the dry down separates it from Axe/Lynx/shampoo etc. It's safe and unthreatening. Nice scent for the cattle.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: this fragrance is pretty good. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. It is kind of generic and I don't like the sharp edge that it has on the opening, the dry down is better and the longevity is pretty good. I would give it a 7/10 overall.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Smells alright on paper but unfortunately for me it smells a little like vinegar on skin.
Wouldn’t purchase it myself but received it as a gift.
Doesn’t last very long.
Wouldn’t recommend.
Of course try for yourself first as it could smell nice on your skin

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Gucci Guilty isn't a match for my personal taste. The blend of lavender and warm spices, particularly the nutmeg, feels somewhat contrived on my skin. The lavender is definitely the dominant player, and coupled with the juniper, it creates an aromatic persistence that becomes almost nauseating by the time the warmer nutmeg accord emerges. It's not an offensive fragrance, and I wouldn't mind smelling it on someone else, but for me, the lavender and juniper are just too relentless and overpowering.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: This Gucci Guilty Parfum is seriously intoxicating! The lavender and juniper in the opening are so fresh and inviting, and it dries down to a warm, woody scent with just a hint of sweetness. It lasts forever too - I can still smell it on my clothes hours later. Definitely a winner for fall/winter.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Really really love this one! Juniper + lavender, citrus and woodsy is a great combination! Longevity and projection are lacking…. 8/10 for me

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: I got a sample from macys. When I first smelled it I almost ran to the store to buy a full bottle. I love this smell however. It wouldn’t last more than 30 minutes radiating 2 ft and it would completely disappear from my skin in like 3-4 hours. That’s with spraying 2 times on each wrist and 4 times on the neck. That’s 8 sprays. Even on my shirt you could barely smell it after 5 hours.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Best opening in a designer fragrance I have ever smelled to this very day, but too weak and turns rubbery-play dough smell quickly. What a shame.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
An ancient atmosphere. Intimate.
Beautiful.

It doesn't disappoint on me.
Lavender? Yes please.
A cold forest with an animal skin on your shoulders as you walk through it.
Or Twin Peaks lashed by cold winds from the surrounding woods, you take refuge in an old-time hotel with wood on the walls and an old-fashioned feel.

Woody and animalic on my skin. Evening, no, more...night.

The progenitor is a blockbuster and I appreciate it, this one is more mature and masculine and with that touch...fierce. I don't know, I feel the animalic part a lot.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: العطر جميل جذاب فخم راقي ،، العطر خريفي ربيعي ،، العطر يصلح للرجل الناضج فوق 30 سنة ، سلبياته سعره مرتفع اداء متوسط

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Haters! Seriously tho this smells great. Creamy, woody, juniper. Very nice.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
STAY AWAY. Awful fragrance that lasts 20 minutes and doesn't smell good to start with.

Smells like a "cologne" ass cologne. Like a greasy douche highschooler should be wearing it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Nose Note #57

Good example of an "aromatic" fragrance. It's thick enough and sweet enough, but at times the DNA feels sickening, even though it's not a beastly perfume.
Quite memorable. The Guilty OG is just the same, but without this thickness and it's less sweet.
The first dozen of wearings I thought it was amazing. Now - not so much. It gets tiring rather quickly.

I think it's redundant if you have the OG or anything in the same ballpark like YSL Y

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Man I like this one! Prob my fav of the Guilty line.. thought it was the elixir but this doing it even more for me, if you want the Guilty dna slightly dirtier and not as sweet as the elixir then I say do the parfum!

This gives me guilty dna fused with little chanel bleu parf and yes the woods of polo double black! This is a beaut! And I don’t need anymore fragrances! Ahhhh! 🤣✨😍👌🏼

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I think this fragrance's score on Fragrantica is much lower than it should be. A wonderful transitional season scent with a dark and just the right amount of sweetness. I think there is no harm in wearing it in summer and winter.

I don't know Guilty DNA, I've never used a flanker before. But I can safely say that it is a very safe scent. This stuff smells incredibly masculine. A creamy, sweet woody scent. Not very distinctive, but that doesn't change the fact that it smells very good.

I think it has a scent that suits all ages. But if you ask me, it is a fragrance that would suit more mature people. I was hesitant to buy it after reading the comments about its performance here, because I really liked its scent when I first smelled it. But contrary to the reviews here, this stuff stayed on my skin for more than 7 hours and the fade was amazing for the first 4 hours.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
A very manly fragrance and a sure compliment magnet. Not worth the full price but definitely something to grab when on sale! Smells good on my skin but hardly last an hour. On clothes it stays longer and keeps a pretty decent sillage throughout the day. Would not recommend spraying too much since the smell of Juniper and dry wood can be quite overwhelming at first.

8.3/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Smells sweet and warm, good for men, not a boy.
Lasting is weakest and baddest thing here 2-3 hours.
Miss them .. Always think to buy again, but remember how short they last.
After fucking fabulous, probably second best office perfume.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: I don't like jared leto and i don't like this scent. Smells artificial and like old men. However it does carry some class with it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: A blander time was never had. Go for the EDP, absolute, cologne, anything else in the line. Not at all bad, just too boring to be as subtle as it is.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: I really, really love the scent of this one - but I hate to say this: the performance is really poor. Perhaps it was my particular batch, but with my usual 4-5 sprays , the smell only lasts for about an hour or two. Really dissapointing because in every other way this fragrance is beautiful

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Scent: Awesome
Performance: Wretched

I hate when companies make something that smells amazing but disappears before anyone can smell it. Even with it being so easy to like scent-wise, I could never recommend this due to it becoming a skin-scent within thirty minutes.

It smells close to the original Pour Homme, just a little more woodsy. I would likely buy the original again but not this one, as I get moderate longevity and projection from that one.

Also, I think they're both very similar to Diesel's Only the Brave, which smells of slightly lower quality (more "synthetic") but performs much better and costs much less.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Dont get not worthy no longevity not unique

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: It smells like a shampoo 😁

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: This scent was almost aquatic to me, I smelt this on my male coworkers arm but then again, I might have been picking up on skin chemistry- I also find the Lavender note almost undetectable-beautiful - I might be getting this mixed up with the regular guilty…. not sure

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Its a designer fragrance , hence like most its geared to be mass appealing so it has that factor to it , which is why it feels synthetic most synthetic perfumes give my nose a weird itch and makes me sneeze a lot, happens with designer ones mostly not sure what exact ingredient it is that makes be feel like that but ya. It's also very unique fragrance in terms of designer, the patchouli in this is very prominent but its not a clean patchouli its more of a dirty one.
Its pretty strong lasts long but I get nose blind from this pretty fast

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Very nice! Lots of fresh pine and soft lavender woods. The nutmeg adds a slight sweetness. I’m giving this to the hubby so I can snuggle with it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
The EDP was fairly unique and an enjoyable experience. To follow it up with this is terribly disappointing. A jumbled sweet woody “fog”. It smells good, yes, but nothing more.

Go give the EDP a try!

It’s a 3 out of 10 for me.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Just a normal guy scent. like its good but its not ground breaking in any way, lowkey reminds me of the deodorant i use 💀 idk i just got a sample spray at the mall cuz a band member i like uses this

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: I had the sample vial of this fragrance. Sprayed it on my skin, and it smells really sweet, smells sort of like bubble gum and wood. I personally don't enjoy the scent

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: It mostly smells good, like a very typical black tie, sexy masculine scent. only problem is for some reason I get just a tinge of pee. Am I the only one? I wonder what note causes this. I have a couple other frags in this category of frags that smell like a tux but this is the only one that has a slight pee scent. it's honestly not noticeable in the air but you can smell it on the skin before the dry down.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Opens with sweet lemon and soft, aromatic mintiness. The floral accord adds a nice dimensionality, with a creamy-orange vibe that blends seamlessly with both the sweet lemon in the top and the soft vanillic amber in the base.

Then it very quickly dries down into a more muted ambery sweetness and smooth, papery wood.

It's classic, suavely masculine, and safe.

As with most woody-aromatic fragrances, I love the fresh, dimensional opening here, but within five minutes it turns papery and flat on my skin and loses appeal for me.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Typical woody citrus men's cologne in a boring way.
2/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: extremely weak but smells good

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: If you love Guilty you'll like this, darker and richer than the original. However, the performance is abysmal. You can't even get 4 hours out of this.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: It's not really special is it. Maybe something like the original, minus the aromaticness of an EDT. The EDP and Absolute version are far superior.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Opening makes you think that it's going to be the best shit ever. After 15mins it dries down and becomes extremely boring and generic. So much so that it makes me think that this perfume is a scam for people who don't know that perfume needs to dry down to know what's the real scent.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Smells lemony fresh with a hint of musk. Overall a solid frag.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Smells good. The only bid disadvantage is last only for 1-2 hours and then dissapears
Gucci can have better fragnances which last more.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Smells good. Somehow lasts less than Dior homme cologne though…

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Straight up Halls cough drops. Medicine, synthetic sweet, and funk. Hard pass.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This is the daddy of Gucci Guilty line.

Throughout the years I had the experience of wearing almost every single version of Gucci Guilty and recently after release of the Elixir version I wanted to try them all again.

Previously I owned Guilty Black, EDT version, and currently I own Cologne and Parfum. This is by far the most mature version and the most elegant one, yet still super pleasant. The second best in my opinion is the discounted Black.

Gucci guilty EDT was always a fun one but it just lacked the maturity. The perfume version has all of it. When I was deciding between EDT, EDP and other versions, I asked myself what would I like to wear on a really important date, and the answer all the time was the Parfum.

The Elixir is also really serious and smells really nice, especially in the dry down, but in my opinion it has nothing in common with other Guilty versions. So I don't even consider it a Guilty flanker. Totally different DNA.

When it comes to projection and longevity, on me ir projects a lot. I can smell it around myself for hours and interestingly enough I never go nose blind with it. Maybe it's a different batch but mine is really, really strong and really strongly projecting.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Nothing special with the scent, a sweet classic with lavender dominant. Safe to blind buy.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: It's a complicated scent that I cannot really pinpoint, but I absolutely love it, and I must note one thing; unlike other colognes, this one seems to smell differently and a bit weirder after it has been worn for a while, so just be warned of that if you buy it, but I absolutely love its fresh feel and scent, and I recommend it fully. 8.5/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This scent reminds me of a white early 90s Mercedes E Class - No idea why. Also of a memory spent sat in some girl parent’s garden as she tried her best to impress my brother…no idea why I was there I just remember feeling like a gooseberry and bored AF.

Maybe her mum owned a white merc?

I don’t really know if this moment actually happened. I don’t know if it’s part of a lost 90s summer or part of a dream. A shit dream. I don’t really know if I can trust my recollection as there’s factors that deceive and elements that are fact.

That is the long winded way of saying that though this iteration of the Guilty fragrance line is pleasant; I can’t trust any part of my experience of it as though parts of it are fine and nice they’re at the same time tediously familiar and banal.

I think this is a good fragrance but it’s not got anything about it that makes me think that there’s a story behind it. It’s creativity via marketing and margins. Ultimately it’s just a thing that is there without any fanfare or deeper presence - I bet when it was launched there was little relief or anxiety about its potential or performance. Just a sniff, and on to the next one.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I was debating giving this a 4/5, but I realized a review like that comes across as recommending the cologne. I do not recommend this, you will not only get limited compliments, after wearing this for a while, you probably will start to dislike this scent a bit too.

The scent isn't bad, but it isn't that good either. It's not super basic but at the same time you won't remember what it smells like if you don't have it on at the moment. Silage and projection are alright. Pretty much the classic 3/5 cologne.

However, I would say that 1/5 guys could definitely have this cologne work for them, and if you really like it on YOU, then go for it. I would just say that for most people hold off.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: A very screechy and artificial smelling Chanel AHSEE.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: a bit boring

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Smells cold and fresh, not a strong perfume but you can smell it over few hours here and there.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: smells like a 5 dollar axe spray with a hint of bo

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Smells like Felce Azura talk, if you enjoy it then you will like this scent. I think women can wear this aswell.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: This was #32 in my "Tour de Fragrance" tested out in May of 2023. My history with Gucci fragrances has been very mixed. I disliked this one enough to give it away, primarily because the EDT, which I gave away because of it's performance, actual smelled far fresher and better. This scent is heavy enough to be almost oppressive for the first hour. I like some nutmeg and musk, but both are overkill here. It is a cool black bottle. That's all I can really say for it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Performance could be better but the scent alone is really good and well blended and addictive.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Skip. I beg you. 100$ per 50 ml , and the EDT has such better performance. This us a joke of a scent. Sure it's the EDT with a BIT more characteristics, but don't let the notes fool you. This isn't special at all. EDT performance is better, this is more expensive, and tbh, its not as bright as the EDT, and it's a citrus forward scent. So yea I want bright. Stay away from this, it's actually not a EDP or parfum performance at all. I know parfums sit a bit heavier. I have EDTs that put last this. If you want something unique and fresh spicey citrus, get something like bogart one man show ruby. You can buy 5 of those for price of this, and the performance is infinitely better.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Imagine that someone aged the original Guilty in a wooden barrel for a year. That's more or less how this smells.

While the concept seems intriguing, I was honestly a bit disappointed throughout much of the life cycle of this one. Too thick and heavy for a relatively light fragrance dna. So much so that it drowned out a lot of the things I like about the OG until the tail end of the dry down. Once you reach that point, this smells very nice.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
In case anyone else is curious... I was wondering who the perfumer was for this as I'd seen Alberto Morillas listed and then another site showed Jacques Huclier.

Per his Instagram, it was Jacques Huclier who created both this and the eau de Parfum (and also Guilty Black and the original. No mention of Guilty intense but I would guess that was him as well).

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Typical designer scent with a flashy, vivid, and mass-pleasing top note and then NOTHING. It has a very very boring common DNA. Nothing special, you can buy any mass-pleasing cheaper fragrance and honestly you will not get more from this one.
5/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
It is very masculine and a bit classic ( because of the nutmeg). I am not a big fan of nutmeg.
I like the patchouli that is strong in the opening but don’t like the nutmeg which is too strong in the dry down. It is still better than edt or edp. But guilty black is better. Elixir is even better. But the best of all is the Guilty Absolute! But it deserves a name on it’s own because it is very different from the rest of the line. It also applies to elixir which is also different from the rest of the line.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
It's taken multiple wears but I can finally smell this more clearly, and best of all, for more than just an hour or two.

Clean masculine elegance right here . The original Guilty edt but he's all grown up now, salt and pepper hair and beard. It's so rare - and welcomed - to have a scent profile like this be aimed at the 35+ crowd.

Very fresh with the juniper and lavender but there's a hint of mature, old school fougere too with a touch of Zino-esque patchouli; the way it and the labdanum interact with the juniper has echoes of Bond's wonderful Cooper Square (which itself calls to mind the original Calvin by Calvin Klein).

The difference here is the orange blossom, rendered so differently than normal, it is not fresh or fluffy or indolic but instead just a slightly honeyed warmth that blends perfectly and leaves Guilty Parfum smelling brighter and warmer than Cooper Square, Zino, and others, which makes it much more friendly and to my nose, enjoyable.

In summary, silvery lavender and silvery woods, ethereal orange blossom with hints of smoke, honey, patchouli and dry white tobacco. The late drydown smells of the white tobacco with a bit of vanilla.

Longevity is about 12 hours but the last 4 will be a pure skin scent. Projection is only decent for a couple hours but I imagine it will bloom more in the heat.

It smells good from top to bottom. Classy without pretense.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: I like this version a lot more than the original Gucci Guilty. That one smelled thinner and sharper to me, more a typical men's fragrance. This one is sweeter, fuller, rounder. I smell mostly juniper, patchouli, nutmeg, and lavender. The orange blossom comes across as sweetness to me, like it's orange blossom, but it's not a super heady white floral by any means. This Parfum is masculine, but somehow I still feel quite comfortable wearing it. It's not overly sweet, not vanillic like many of the men's colognes are these days. It lasts probably less than 6 hours on my skin, but what I got in my hair lasted past the 7 hour mark. I would recommend this one - I have the women's version that came out at the same time.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Best Gucci Guilty

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Just like the original

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: I absolutely love it

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Edit: liking this a lot more now. See my updated review a few above this.


I'm revisiting the Guilty line after falling for Elixir and so far, am disappointed. I'm one of those that gets minimal longevity out of this. It's not exactly that I can't smell it after an hour but the periodic whiffs I do pick up are so non-descript, a silvery sort of dry woods that might be juniper + labdanum but might just be something from thr lab like norlimbanol. I have to presume it's my nose because, while not a huge fan of them I still can't imagine Gucci would release the scent that I'm smelling, if that's how it smelled to all.

I will give this a few more chances when I'm out and about and come across it. The opening smells promising and even shows some depth, something like the original Guilty but with some hair on its chest, so I do hold out a sliver of hope.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Love this fragrance I can't wait to try the new exlir

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
clean herbal alcohol-ish top note.
to my nose it's a darker, more night time-y version of chanel allure homme sport eau extreme.

perfect for corporate settings. smells like you're in hotel reception or a banking lobby, reminiscent of walking into the airport before departing.

impossible to hate since it's made so well, but lacks originality.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: I absolutely love this one people can hate all they want but this is a dam good fragrance

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: I can't make out a single individual note on this perfume, not during the initial spray and definitely not during the drydown. It's a generic, pleasant fragrance that doesn't perform too well but is otherwise inoffensive. Probably good for indoors AC wear only.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Its a nice dark floral yet fresh at the same time, its definitely overhated.
7.5/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Not here for the review but really need help in this , really like the scent , prob is the projection and i am searching a alternative could be niche could be a dupe , dont mind , the scent profile is soo good but realy lack of performance and projection is like an intimate kind of scent

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: I've smelled this and black and own the edt. Of the 3 I would probably pass on this one. The edt pushes off with a little fresher pop and the black has that darker scent if that's what you are looking for. To my nose the parfum is a toned down edt with less longevity.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: I’ve hated all Gucci Guiltys I’ve smelled so far and this is no different. “Ew!” was my reaction using my sample multiple times. My bf doesn’t think it’s that bad but I think he just likes the name and bottle haha. The juniper and labdanum make for a gross mix. Sort of like absinthe.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: First time trying anything in this line- Smells like a salad dressing. Projection is a complete joke. Scrubbed it off after an hour.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Really masculine, shaving foam like opening with citruses and herbs ( my nose picks up a yummy green scent of rosemary) dries down to a warm mature woody scent.
