Feels very classy and sophisticated. The patchouli adds to that barbershop edginess (See Davidoff Zino). This feels like an alternative to Dior Sauvage Parfum,to which it's extremely similar.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Received a sample of it today and it’s really nice.
Although I’m not keen on the original and doesn’t really last long but the Parfum version has a different scent and last a lot longer.
I love it it’s actually nice

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: i always liked this line. it's so.. italian, well dressed, clean bit ''gangster''. you will see that dna here again. the opening is a very piney juniper, masculine lavender with a splash of citrus. its bright and dark at the same time. the mid is heavily dosed labdanum and orange blossom with a hinge of that nutmeg spice patchouli pushing thru all the way till the end. all together you're getting a intriguing clean warmth. as it settles fully you get a warm woody, musk. its easy to like for people. average performer. versatile as always. but for the price i wouldn't pick it as it doesn't offer enough in my opinion. a bit boring but still good.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Buy it, yes definitely
Long-lasting average
Unique yes
Mesterious yes
Morning for me
Buy it again no
Worth the money yes
Sappy floral yes
Addiction yes
Memorial yes

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Elegant and attractive fragrance.
Smooth labdanum, smells better than Bleu de Chanel edp both being labdanum heavy
this to me is a better smelling version of Bleu de Chanel Eau de Parfum with same performance

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: I love the entire Guilty line, Black is my favorite, OG, EDP opening is really unique with the Rose but becomes the EDT really quick.....This parfum, cost alot, I just wanted it cause it smells awesome to me...I am wondering if I maybe purchased a bad batch at Dillards. I never have performance issues with frags people all say are 2 hours......I get 4-6 out of just about everything....I literally get 30 Minutes of this, smells amazing, but gone.....Maybe hour if soak my clothes....Must be a bad batch, or needs to mature maybe.....I wear it though, best smell of all of them imo. Perfect office frag, night out but performance is suspect....Especially for the price.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This would smell sexy and delicious on anyone who wears this, girl or guy.

I get 6 hours plus longevity so not sure why others are saying it's weak.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: I really like the smell, its so good, I get a miniature 5ml bottle to try and unfortunately on my skin dont last more that 1 hour, it dissapears completly :(.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Up close it smells like there's a fecal type of oud in here 🤢

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
After my initial shock of the fragrance dissipating off my skin just an hour from spraying at the mall, I ended up with a 90 ml tester bottle since it was half off retail price. Why not? While it lasted longer than an hour, the performance overall is still no different to an EDT concentration with the drydown struggling to cling on for dear life about 4 hours in.

The scent itself smells like something ChatGPT would come up with if you asked it for the most mass-appealing, least offensive and safest concoction. It is a bit citrusy, a bit soapy, a bit floral, a bit spicy, a bit woody and a bit musky; it is a bit of everything and hence also rather unisex. It is not great, it is not terrible but it is definitely overpriced and underperforming compared to Armani Code Parfum as an example.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: It's a Wonderful fragrance just buy it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is a great scent and can totally be unisex. It's a bit sweet, soapy and has a seductiveness about it where any gender can pull off. A truly wonderful modern fragrance. My only problem is the price tag that is way out of the budget I am willing to spend on a single fragrance.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I really liked this, a deep dark floral woods and spice. Has a sappy almost smokey quality

Someone told me this smells like walking through the fragrance section of a department store and i agree. The parfum is similar to the edt and black but goes its own direction. I don't get as much lavender and really no citrus. Poor projection alright longevity and pretty overpriced

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum is an aromatic, woody and slightly citrus fragrance.

The opening is citrusy, but less prominent than the Eau de Toilette version, yet still fresh, herbal and floral. There are notes from the original version that have been taken up but giving them a less sparkling and "darker" twist, because there are lavender, orange blossom, patchouli and musk, but the smell is less youthful and playful, it's more towards a mature aroma.

It has the recognizable DNA of the Guilty Pour Homme line, but it is less versatile, it is as if a person who was young 11 years ago has become a little more mature today. It remains usable all year.

In terms of longevity, it was with me for about 8 hours, but unlike the EDT and EDP versions that have a greater projection with me, this one stays close to the skin from the beginning.

The smell is good, but is a little expensive for its performance.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: It smells soo good but it lacks performance it doesn't even stick to clothes for more then 2 3 hours tops 1 hr on skin way too expensive imo much better fragrances for the same price

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: This Gucci fragrance is not my absolute favorite. I tend to think that Gucci does not make the best fragrances but when I smelled this at the department store, I thought it smelled of crud. However, when I wore it, it did not match with my body. I would strongly suggest that someone either try it on their scan and walk around the store, or get a sample before buying. The top notes can be very strong and the intensity can be a little overwhelming. For the price point, it is fair. If this is the type of fragrance we’re looking for.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Reviews on this fragrance are yet another reason to hate the Frag community. You could put sh*t in a bottle and they’ll eat it up (4.5+ rating) as longs as it projects, lasts, and smells unique. This really great scent though?…well, na smells too good to most people and not like a patchouli covered poop bomb so we’ll bash it and give it a 3. I have learned to not trust this site or the influencers very often in regards to whether something is worth buying/testing.

Price: You can get 90ml under $100 in a few places which is as much as I’d spend for it. Never go full retail.

Scent: This smells divine, and I have received more compliments on this in the week I’ve worn it than any I can remember. My favorite part is the opening. This opens up fresh and invigorating and drys down into a warm scent(not sweet) perfect for fall or spring. Could also be great for dates or with enough sprays, worn in winter. Probably too warm in the dry down for summer. My wife’s new favorite scent for me to wear!

9/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: The safest of all the flankers, very well blended. Scent is truly amazing if you appreciate well blended fragrances, it has that depth from the labdanum and patchouli while keeping it almost sparkly from the juniper berries mixed with lavender. However for the price tag and its slight performance issues, I wouldn't go as far as to recommend it to anyone unless you enjoy the guilty line and want the best smelling one, and if you have money to spend lol, other than that, I got this as a gift and extremely happy with it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: This smell is just intoxicating. My review is very subject. But I have a guy that I have loved since I was 15. He doesn't smell like this, but the second I smelled this perfume when I was 22, it reminded me of him. The smell of this is prob a bit sweet for a man. But I really love it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: The longevity on this is absurd. Absurdly short-lived. I tested it in store spraying onto the back of my hand and carried on Christmas shopping. Barely half an hour later, it has faded into a ghost of itself with no discernible drydown to speak of. I was incredulous. Parfum concentration? Gucci, you jest.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Has to be the most repulsive smelling perfume I've ever smelled, I don't know what note gives me such a reaction to this fragrance but every time I smell it I gag.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I love Gucci Guilty Parfum.
Having also tried the EDT and the black version, I can say this one is the best in the little differences it has compared to those two.
Woody, citrus, with a little Incense or smoke in the deepest after tones.
Very masculine, safe for pretty much any setting as its not too heavy and strong even when over sprayed.
Only disappointed it isn't stronger for being a Parfum, performs like a edt or edp in my opinion.
9/10.
Very much a signature scent for any climate.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
As previously written this is Gucci Guilty but a little darker with floral/sweet touch. No citrus. It's not bad. In drydown I get some nuances from Sauvage Elixir but only a touch and I think this is mix of lavender and spices (nutmeg).
Still, this smells good for about 20 minutes. Then it turns into generic side, then it becomes skinscent as @The Wolf stated.
In comparison, the EDP has beast mode on me but the Parfum version performance is abysmal.

Basically I have the same problem as user @ThatMakesScents.
Half an hour and I can hardly smell this. I thought I was nose blind or something but as I said EDP I can smell the next day!
I can confirm as well that the drydown is boring and generic as fuck.

Also the price is ridiculous. Eventually I returned my bottle to Notino

2/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Opening is very familiar from multiple scent memories and also feels extra alcohol'ic - I think spices have a lot to do with it, then you start to pick up green and evergreen aromas, some of the spices in this cologne are very peculiar and not your common norm - it may not agree with many general audience nostrils, later on it gets more dense and muddy/earthy, combined note of lemon in all of this mixture it started to give me the hints of urine. Gucci is known for their out of the norm and daring approach to designer mens fragrances, I think this is no exception, if you like something different, you may want to test this, and test it on your skin, these oddball note combinations may work very different on your individual skin. I would def. not classify this as your typical mass appealing fragrance

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
A blue fragrance with an herbal touch. One of the notes reminds me strongly of rosemary.

Very nice. Takes a popular scent profile and gives it a twist. Perfect if you want something different that isn't "weird".

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Got a sample of this and immediately ordered a bottle, fresh, spicy, slightly Smokey and woody. Great stuff. Performance on me is great.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: This does smell really good; it smells like a cross between Dior Homme 2020 and Dior Homme Sport (which are obvs very similar). If I didn't own the Sport, I'd go for this. 8/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I love this fragrance, some qualities to it may smell familiar but I’d say it’s something of it’s own and goes in it’s own direction. Super mass pleasing, super versatile, great quality, and for me I get more than 8 hours longevity and when someone gets close to you they will smell you hours after spraying when you think the scent is gone. Still smells unique to what most people are wearing nowadays, great fragrance for any occasion and any time of year if you can find on discounters for under 120 it’s for sure worth it.

Fresh and clean citrus lavender opening smells very nice

Mid is a sexy spicy dark floral with woody nuances

And the dry down is a nice masculine earthy but clean dry down that lasts a good while.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: There’s a weird play dough vibe in this one that ruins it, get black or the EDP way better

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Generic. Not offensive but lacks identity. It's just there. The citrus is overpowering in the beginning and I am not a fan. Very sour. Fades to something more elaborate, but so unbelievably generic. I wouldn't waste my money.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: this is the epitome of hot guy fragrance, to me it is exactly what hot guys smell like! but that scent profile is very common and probably isn’t worth the brand price tag. not unique but if i smell it on someone i love it

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: really unimpressive, overhyped

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: I legitimately do like this fragrance a lot however performance is very mediocre, especially for the cost. Projects well for the first hour or two and leaves a great sillage, but doesn’t perform well enough to be anything more than a date fragrance. It’s a pretty safe blind buy if you like anything else in the Guilty line (barring Absolute), but I don’t think the price reflects the quality. The nutmeg makes this scent for me, it’s basically a mature, dark version of Guilty Black. Will it get compliments? Yes, but this is too pricey for that to be the only reason you’d buy it in my opinion.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Nothing groundbreaking, unique, or even noteworthy.

I’ll start on a good note; Gucci Guilty Parfum doesn’t smell cheap. It’s smooth and well-blended

Then again, this fragrance smells good… But that’s it.

Very lemony in the opening, until lavender and patchouli kick in. Which doesn’t really affect my opinion. It’s just meh.

I agree with many of the reviewers here; Gucci Guilty Parfum’s performance is abysmal for a mid-to-high end designer fragrance.

Pass.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: It's good,nothing new. Along the lines of your le male le Parfum, bad boy , Azzaro most wanted, those black bottles from last year. Boring release imo

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Gucci Guilty Parfum smells good for about 30 minutes then it gradually fades to meh. The performance is trash for a Parfum and especially for the ridiculously high price. I redeemed points for it but even then it's a waste.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Pleasant fresh woody lavender. Aromatic lavender mixed with teeny tiny bits of the other top and mid notes, over an ambery woody base. Moderate initial projection fades over ~2hr, longevity 6-8hr.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: It smells good and you can't go wrong with this. But there is nothing special about it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Its nice but thats just it: Nice. The performance is meh and for a retail price point of 163.00 USD on Macys I would be hard pressed to find one reason to buy this over fragrances like YSL Y Parfum and BDC Parfum that not only have better value per ML (You can get .4 ounces of BDC Parfum for 3 dollars less) but are masterpieces of designer perfumery while this is just nice. If the price was like 90 bucks for 3.3 It would be fine but for 163.00 and only 3.0 OZ thats a bad deal.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: It smell great but lasts 2 hours so you have to overspray a lot..But it does smell great

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: aromatic & masculine. what else is there to say

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Let's start with the good. This smells good for about 20 minutes. Then it turns generic, and then it disappears. I like the house of Gucci (Guilty Absolute is my favorite leather in the world) but it's like they're asleep at the wheel. I think they only put effort into alchemist garden line (many of those are disappointing as well) but some are good. Armani, Prada, and Givenchy have better offerings in the mid tier, designer space. This doesn't smell bad but it's completely forgettable and performance is trash. I do love the bottle anesthetics but the juice and the fragrance brand feels like it's sleepwalking through these releases.

TLDR :
It feels like they put more effort into the inspiration and "story" of this fragrance, than the fragrance itself. Make sure you test this out and don't be fooled by the first 20 minutes which are good. Because after that, it becomes boring/generic and then disappears!

Scent 4/10
Performance 3/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
As of a “Parfum” I d expected more performance.
So what is the different betwen Parfum and EDP?
I guess not much.
Scent itself pleasant, Performance could be more.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Gucci Guilty Parfum takes the mainstream designer fresh opening in a slightly different direction. Usually the citrus opening is sweeter and more sparkling, with notes like bergamot, which has a sweet lime smell. Guilty Parfum's opening is much sourer and more bitter, with lemon rather than bergamot. It's got a tart profile with the juniper, but still smells fresh and pleasant. Some soft, warm spiciness from the nutmeg comes through in the mid, which actually reminds me slightly of La Nuit de l'Homme.

Into the dry down was where this fragrance fell short for me. I'm not sure what it is, but I get a headache-inducing, almost plastic smell which I also got from YSL Y Parfum. It might just be my nose, but perhaps worth a test first.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: So refreshing, natural, unique, patchouli is so noticeable, mid longevity and silage, absolutely recommending it. Scent 10/10 performance 7/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Stop buying this crap. A FRAGRANCE SHOULD LAST LONG. Period. This has zero longevity,zero projection,zero scent trail. I hate to say this,but you have wasted your money on PURE CRAP PARFUM. And this dna is inherently broken anyway.
2/10.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: The Main Accords list says it all: a spicy, woody, aromatic. I'm not getting anything unique or standing out; a basic scent in the modern amber-woody category. Performance is slightly below what I expect from an EDP. If you like this neighborhood, then you are sure to like Gucci Guilty PH.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: As others have said, it's very reminiscent of dark florals with heavy dose of labdanum. Projection is okay and longevity is decent but honestly the price is steep for just "okay." Not a fan of the patchouli. Pleasant and modern but I would not buy again.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
The opening is a bit generic, but after it settles it's linear & I love that clean, slightly fresh spicy lavender type smell.
I sort of regret buying it because it sits pretty close to the skin (I wish it was a bit louder), but the main issue is longevity...even on clothes, I can barely smell it after an hour or two.
How is this considered a "Parfum" which should be the most potent, is beyond me. It's more like an Eau de Cologne.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: I like it. Modern masculine scent. I get woody, fresh and spicy. Could be a signature scent. Perfect for spring and fall. Can be worn during the day at the office and evening wear as well.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Huh..

This smells a lot like Diesel Only The Brave. That same, fresh, slightly-green, slightly fruity-sweet bubblegummy aromatic smell.

Guilty PH Parfum takes that green, fresh, clean core of the Gulity PH line made up of lavender and green notes , and adds an lightly-woody incensy accord.

Green, fresh, slightly-sweet, clean, musky, lightly-wood, and lightly-incensy.

Very likeable and mass appealing, like Diesel's OTB. It does also smell slightly like Versace Dylan Blue. Similar fresh, slightly-sweet, and lightly-incensy drydown. Dylan Blue, however, is much fresher and sweeter. Neither is gourmand-sweet, though.

Mild/warm weather wear for the young crowd.

"Like'

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: I expected this to be another pleasant scent. Upon spraying it, the initial sprays had me like, "hmmm this smells good but there's also something going on with this." There was an opening of freshness with a hint of spice. But something was lingering that kept me from just feeling like, "OMG this is beautiful!" After about 5 minutes it was nothing but patchouli screaming in your face. That lasted for at least 30 minutes. No other notes were detectable, which was unfortunate because on the open you could tell it had ability of being something great. During that 30 minute window others were also like OMG that doesn't smell good at all. And then after 30 minutes or so it was a really soft well balanced scent. The patchouli was still there but had found its place in between the other notes. Unfortunately, the time it took to get there made the fragrance just a skin scent, about an hour. Maybe if you over sprayed you could get better projection. But the half hour of Patchouli is what prevents me from saying this is full bottle worthy because it was so abrasive and unpleasant. Scents are subjective so someone else may not find the patchouli as offensive. Ultimately, it found its way but it was a roller coaster getting there.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
The opening is very good! After the opening there is not much left. I was expecting much more from a parfum. It stands in the shadow of eau de parfum. Which is very unique and the longlivety is much better.
But.. for as long as the performance is there... I do like this fragrance.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
PERFORMANCE on this is DEAD. Been wearing it non stop for 3 days . I get maybe 15 minutes on skin and clothes. Purchased from Sephora brick and mortar store. No reason to believe it is a fake. Black which I loved was the same thing. I thought maybe the Parfum would fix things NO just paid way more for the same experience as Black and now have less money to show for it and a new air freshener for the toilet.
You have BEEN WARNED.
To the guy posting above me saying the complete opposite I give you the bird in advance.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Many years have gone by since the initial release of gucci guilty. I'll admit - i've never intentionally smelled any of the gucci guilty iterations - except the one in the green bottle. that one was nice, but i never bought it. When i saw this "on sale" on fragrancebuy, i impulsively made the purchase. i'll admit - i was excited to smell it! So...i've had it for 3 days now and i have to say - this is the ultimate "meh". It's pleasant - but not worth diving into a note breakdown. it's an easy grab - but probably not one i will consider a "go to" scent. It's people pleasing - but wont make you stand out from the crowd.

It's a good scent - far from great - far from memorable. Which i suppose is what i expected...but maybe deep in my heart i hoped it would be something more.

I will say that there is some kind of creaminess about this scent that totally turns me off. It's most notable in the first 5 minutes. it's like a juniper/sandalwood mixture which triggers a nauseating response for me. Again, it doesn't last long - but it's definitely there.

This is a hard one to recommend unless of course, you don't already have a mass appealing scent in your arsenal.

5/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Wow! This is an incredible fragrance. I can’t believe I’m saying this 😀? But imo, Gucci hit it out of the park with this one. Like me, If you’re a fan of Gulity Line ? Then you’ll (most likely) really like this. Mix the EDT with Black, and make the 2 into a legit elegant Parfum. Then boom! You have Gucci Guilty Parfum. It’s a little steep in price. But who cares 😀? To me it’s worth the $. The silage and performance are above average. The bottle looks great on your shelf, or wherever. It stays on skin for a good while, even after it’s done projecting. The only mistake I made was, not getting a 5.0 for only 30 dollars more. I’ve been wearing it a lot more than I thought I would, lately. You could easily wear this year round for many occasions. Enough.. Just get it. A 10/10. Really, it is.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Gucci fragrances in the late 90s/early to mid 2000s, were the best designer scents ever created. What happened to this house? Aside from from guilty absolute which was amazing, this house can not release a good fragrance anymore.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Eau de Parfum smells 10x nicer (black bottle.) Parfum lasts 10x longer (dark gray metallic bottle.)
Overall, nothing exciting or super nice. Current trend notes, very forgettable. At Notino I also smelled Black Afgano and I was mesmerized by how stunning it was. I will have to faze into niche and/or indie perfumes. The current state of designer fragrances is rather sad and disappointing.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Very pleasant, hits all the sweet spots in terms of freshness, sweetness, woodiness, ormatics. Extremely versatile both in terms of season and context. I can't really compare it with other releases in the Guilty collection as the only one I know is GG Absolute which is a completely different scent.
It's the perfect scent to give as a present as it is almost impossible to dislike this one.
However, if you already have a sizeable collection with a little bit of everything, and you aim for variety, chances are that this piece will smell a little bit redundant. Or maybe not, depends on how you built your collection.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Perfectly nice, perfectly pleasant. Guilty Parfum is a big, green, spicy dose of…something. It carries the DNA of the line very well, so if you’re familiar with the original or Black, you kind of know what you’re getting into here. I get a type of lemon/lavender vibe with added green accents and floral touches, and that’s really the bulk of the fragrance. It’s masculine, easy to wear, easy to like, dress it up, dress it down…it’s got versatility in spades. And it’s not even a blue fragrance. It’d probably be a good alternative as a dumb reach with an extra point of sophistication. But that’s really about it. Nothing about the fragrance makes me think it correlates with its name or the image Gucci’s creative directors have created for it. Not that that’s important, it just feels a bit of a missed opportunity to offer something bold.

Being mildly acquainted with the Eau De Parfum from 2020, this Parfum feels like a big step away from avant-garde styling. Guilty EDP had the salt, vinegar and rose thing going, which sure made it interesting, if ultimately not that appealing to my taste. Guilty Parfum is so polite, it feels like a giant leap back towards the bosom of safety and mass appeal, which I don’t fault Gucci for at all. This line is their cash cow, after all. Still, I can’t help but think it’s a bit like Disney Star Wars movies. When too big a risk was taken in Last Jedi, backtracking was necessary in Rise of Skywalker. Guilty Parfum is kind of like The Rise of Skywalker of fragrances. It gets the job done, even though you’re sure it could have been better.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I’ve always enjoyed the Gucci Guilty line. There’s just something so pleasing and youthful about them. This one I think is my new favorite, though it might be tied with the EDP version. While the EDP felt like a super bold and daring entry to the line, with its acidic vinegar/chili pepper opening and soapy/floral rose, this one plays it a bit safer as far as composition, but the quality and depth of the fragrance is definitely increased.

When you smell it, there’s no doubting that this is a Gucci Guilty flanker, it’s instantly familiar. It’s much more similar to the EDT than the EDP was. However it’s also significantly deeper and more dark and resinous fragrance, it’s really quite beautiful. Honestly, if you’re looking for a luxurious drydown of resin and balm-y notes without getting too thick and gourmand/warm, this is it right here. It’s divine. It’s not as sweet as the EDP, it’s still got floral elements but it’s much more woody and resinous which I absolutely love. The EDP could be a bit too sweet, even in the cold. This one plays it just right, it’s still fresh and clean enough (just not very bright) to be super mass appealing and likable while being dark and woody enough to win over the enthusiasts and connoisseurs who favor complexity and depth over mass appeal.

Projection is down as expected, and longevity is up. The base notes are the strongest here as expected again, so the opening isn’t meant to be super sharp or bright and attention grabbing, it’s all about the long game here… in that regard, this scent serves as an excellent foundation for layering as well.

I do not get any incense or scratchy chemical notes like I do from BdC or AdG Profumo. This is way more smooth and much more pleasing to me.

Good for all year round, day or night for me. Though by nature it will be most well received in slightly cooler temperatures and/or in the nighttime and evening hours. Not an “after the gym” freshie whatsoever, this is more romantic and mysterious. Not attention seeking or loud whatsoever. More for a reserved gentleman type vibe, not a loud club-going f**k boi (no offense). It’s casual enough to rock with any outfit though.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Just smells so good. Fresh, clean and definitely masculine. Nothing ground breaking but no denying it just works.

8/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Great sophisticated nighttime/colder weather fragrance. This is my signature scent that I have been looking for. Good performance, incense-cedar smell, dark floral, fresh citrus and spice up top. If you like the incense in bleu de Chanel parfum or acqua di gio profumo, you’ll like this as well because that’s the case for me. I don’t know what the original guilty smells like so I can’t compare this to that. Apparently this is new too so not a whole lot of people out there will smell like me, which also makes this a better candidate for my signature scent.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
An excellent release from Gucci that isn't getting enough credit because it's not as daring as Guilty Absolute. However I would argue that the amount of florals in this fragrance make it just as daring for a designer. Many people here are experience with niche and unisex frags and won't see this in the same context as a normal dude at Macy's.

Heavy florals. Dark, floral, sweet, feels vaguely Gothic. An evolution of the original Guilty, if they called it Gucci Guilty Noir it would have made sense. Feels like a bouquet doused with labdanum being shoved in my face. Longevity is good,easy 8 to 10 hours for me. Projection is restrained which is how I prefer my frags but that might be a minus for others. Surprisingly formal and reserved,wearing this to work with no issues. I don't think this will work in temps above 70 though due to how floral and sweet it is.

Easy 8.5 out of ten for me. Retail price is high but I'm glad I bought it for full price because the only say I have in fragrance design is how much money I spend. Vote with your wallet. If you want more daring frags, buy them and try and hype them up so we don't get stuck in a rut.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is really classy and elegant scent. It's clean, fresh, fruity and a bit naughty :D

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: The guilty line has a very unatrractive bottle. With a better look, this fresh scent line would sell better.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I basically get Gucci Guilty but a little denser. It's Nice.

I really liked BLACK but the performance was abysmal. This smells heavier but after an hour or so in I don't see this being a heavy parfum as far as performance goes. It has some depth and it will last longer than the other variations.....I THINK. Too early to tell and the weather is really dry right now. Under a long sleeve shirt with heat I get pleasant wafts of GUILTY like I have always known it. I doubt they did anything extreme to get to this.

Nice but 90ml for $155 IMO is overpriced. I will enjoy the bottle regardless.

Update,

Average to moderate performance.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Leans a bit too feminine for me.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: It is very similar (especially drydown) to long discontinued Memoire D'homme by Nina Ricci (from 2002), which i own.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Might be my all time favorite Gucci Guilty, that extra spice kicked in really does it for me. Might be the first Gucci Guilty I buy a 2nd bottle eventually. Very nice, I love that it deviates a good bit away from the standard Guilty scent...its there but totally reconstructed . Great release , 115 would be more price appropriate but it is what it is, great release.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Very rich, very spicy fresh as well. I'm a fan! Projects very well for the first 2 hours, still testing on longevity but I'd be surprised if it's poor. Price is high but it is a higher concentration - almost expect it nowadays, would expect other designer brands to follow suit.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: I'm impressed with this release from Gucci, the notes are blended well and it's subtle, this one is versatile and can be worn during the day and night. The price is steep for the 3.0 oz at $155 but in my opinion it's worth it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: This might be one the most pleasant crowd pleasing scent in my collection. It’s orange blossom, sage, incensy is blended to a perfect scent that’s impossible not to love. Well done Gucci

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: It’s sweet off the spot!! Definitely a sugared iced lemon tea with soft and warm hazelnut nuances. The spices in here are very neutral, almost like as if V&R Nightvision edp had a baby, it’s a more toned down version of it! I will say it is pretty light for a parfum tho.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Been there, done that…
With every new flanker of Gucci Guilty line I am more sure that both Absolute (Femme & Homme) are the best. Gucci is struggling so hard and they just can’t do anything new and better than Absolute flanker. They need to go back to 2018, take the same idea of creating bold and daring fragrances and bring it back to 2022.
Upon initial smell I knew that I have already smelled that and I am glad that I didn’t bought it blindly. Notes are very promising: cistus, nutmeg, juniper… The opening is strong very intense and indeed it is a PARFUM concentration (as on bottom sticker). We all know that smell… Imagine Dior Homme 2020 woody vibes with Versace Dylan Blue base, even Burberry Hero is more original, safe and quite generic, but still in terms of smell more original (both are produced by Coty). Sorry to disappoint you guys, but it is what it is. I only wish that they would make something between Absolute and Envy. Real modern classic with some spicy kick.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Fan of the guilty line for what it is. My fav is Guilty Black (not ashamed) but the performance is so poor. L’eau is a good flanker as well. I own the EDP, absolute, and the original, too.
Just tried this new parfum at an Ulta. I passed. It’s def a parfum and very long lasting on my skin. I’d think twice about spraying it directly on a shirt, it might leave an oily stain. It’s a legit parfum.

But honestly the woody juniper direction that this one took just didn’t do it for me. I kept getting strong vibes of the original Hugo by Hugo boss, with the connected screw on cap. It was the juniper-fir-balsam thing. Granted there are major differences, but that’s what it made me think of.
I tried it because I was hoping it would be like Guilty Black or l’Eau only with better performance. Alas, no.

If you do like it, it will certainly perform for you.
Cheers

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Really wish people would just leave their hate at the door…stop judging and comparing to scents that have nothing to do with this….the entire Guilty line (with the exception of Absolu) is a very wearable, every day scent that people can get a lot of use out of. Having smelled this, I have no reason to think this is any different.

This place is supposed to be a tool and database to help people choose scents. By comparing this to scents that have nothing to do with this (most likely never having smelled it with your highly refined noses so high in the air) you’re just hurting people who don’t know any better. Save it for FragranceOne if you want…but not these pleasant scents that everyday people would LOVE and get a ton of use out of…you know…the plebes and peasants of the fragrance world that you GODS look down upon from Fraglympia.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: I’ve had it for a couple weeks now & to me it’s just a stronger more refined guilty intense. Its like how Versace made Eros parfum & Gucci did the same with the same guilty dna just a refined parfum concentration. Doesn’t smell that different from the guilty dna. The dry down lasts forever though on skin & has a strong musky dry down. I like the edp a lot better. But this parfum is pretty strong oily resinous smelling.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Parfum Gucci
review_content: Can't wait for the first reviews. Not available in Europe yet. Hope that it soon will be. I will update this comment with a review. And hope it will be a good one.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: tried this on a whim and it smells exactly like mouth wash, especially the listerine one, mixed with something spicy I guess

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Tried this at the store and couldn't smell anything. I don't know how this has such a high rating. I ended up buying something else that had a smell.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Both amazing quality, elixir is all season.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: elixir is better, this is more sweet and ambery

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I was actually excited for this one, it's rare for me especially coming from Gucci, I also happened to predict this fragrance, but as for the scent, "it's good, but not good enough" -(prime)Jeremy fragrance. I was hoping for more booze barely had any, bitter almond with orange blossom, with a subtle sweetness in the opening, which is not my favorite, drys down to a nice sweet vanilla, but honestly nothing more, projection isn't as good as the elixir, also doesn't smell as good as the elixir, not as smooth, a bit disappointed, but definitely try before you buy, especially when it's not cheap🫡

Edit:: so I'm late in the dry down, and it's a smooth sugary sweet amber, and the longevity is very good on par with the elixir, I think it's good but not to my standard 🤷

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: If you do have Tom Ford fucking fabulous, you don't need this one. It's The same smell

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Love both but I'll stick with my exlir

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Nice scent, but nothing special. There are a lot of fragrances that smell like this. Not worth the premium price tag imo.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
bombatik




,

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I've come to the conclusion the fact this fragrance is an elixer and the atomizer sprays like a garden hose explains my negative experience. I baby sprayed a test strip today and found the scent profile to be balanced and very good. It was no longer coming off as plumbers putty but rather fresh.

It was pissing me off not being able to understand why it gets good reviews.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Another bullet dodged with these new releases. Let me start off by saying that I really like the original elixer and I was excited about this one. I finally got the chance to test it out today and wow it is like 99.9% identical but now it's so much weaker & a little chalky.

It's bad on my skin, But on clothes it smells decent. But everytime I smell this thing, my mouth becomes immediately dry! Why?! It's so weird. I've never has this experience with other fragrances before! I'm guessing the rum accord did that.

Bottom line, I learned that no new designer release this year is worth purchasing. AT ALL.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Got my nose on this today. Same ball park as GGE as some have stated. The leather facet is most promenant compared to GGE.
However, for striking similarities this is reminiscent of Ambre des Abysses by Houbigant. Whilst ADA opens fresher. The drydown is nigh on identical. I must say the opening is far better than GGADP. For the opening five mins it had a play dough, putty like note that I did not enjoy at all. Once that subsided it was very good.
Redundant for me as have GGE and ADA. Can't see owning this would add any value to my collection including occasions as to when I would wear it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: @RC2017 once you put that putty note in my head I can’t stop smelling it! You’re 100% correct. It wasn’t so bad I needed to wash it off, but yeah glad I only sampled this.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Sprayed once on back of hand. Same plastic putty smell that made me never give either release a chance. The opening is so fucking off putting. Then it hit me. Son of a Bisch! This is a Quentin Bisch creation. Where Ganymede's opening is so unusual that I can't place the scent, Elixir and Absolu reeks of plastic putty and I can't stand it. After about ten minutes I couldn't take it anymore and rinsed it off with plain water. That's when I could finally smell the drydown that was coming. I fucking loved it! That drydown, I'm going back to Sephora to try both fragrances on each hand.

Edit: The opening is terrible and hangs on waaaaaay to long. That plumbers putty smell eases up but never goes away as the fragrance develops. I waited a couple hours until I had enough. I rinsed Absolu and Elxir off with water and only then the scent was amazing. Crazy

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I "absolutely" love the original Gucci Guilty Elixir, and it's my fav elixir of all time, so I had to get this one.
Found it on a site at a good discounted price and pulled the trigger.
It was love at first sniff, just like the original.
Gucci Guilty Elixir - A bit more fresh, airier, and lighter
Gucci Guilty Absolu De Parfum - It opens as a dark boozy version of GGE, lot of almond and nuttiness, can't really smell the Red Pepper, and in the dry down its much more leathery, and darker.
They both have the same DNA but also have their own uniqueness.
GGE - whiter, fresher, airier, floral
GGA - darker, nutty, boozy, leathery

Is it Redundant ? for a normal nose, Yes
Do I regret buying it? No

Love both the versions of the perfume. I'll keep one for day time and other for the night out.

Note: It is a beast mode just like its predecessor, I easily got more than 10 hours on clothes and 7 hours on skin.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Took me a good few minutes to notice much of a difference between this and the Elixir, and even then it’s very subtle. As others have said, this is a lot less floral with the leather and rum notes really coming through on the drydown. I still prefer Elixir overall but it has rich booziness to it that is ideal for cold days and Xmas time…

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I tried out a small sample is basically the same in the opening as og, but this one the dry-down is different it will be vanilla, dark, bold, leathery and rummy, definitely like a more grown up version of the previous one, and they removed the plastic smell for the orange flower of the og which is a better formulation now with this.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Not really close to any version of Myslf. Sure it shares orange blossom but that's it. This is similar to the original Guilty Elixir but without the wintergreen root beer nuance, and instead amping up the smooth pimento/nutmeg spice and the dry slightly petrol leather, too. On my skin this is quite a bit darker than the original and feels decidedly autumnal evoking shades of burnt orange and burgundy. Not as groundbreaking as the original with its neo-oldschool floral leather approach, but just as good and undoubtedly leagues above the majority of new releases both mainstream and niche.

About 7 hours into my first wearing and this projects less than Elixir and seems like it will not last quite as eternally long. This is actually preferable to me as my one big complaint with Elixir is that it's just too strong and long lasting, interfering with the following day's scent. Also, on me this is a lot spicier and less sweet on skin than on paper. I'm getting a noticeable somewhat piney labdanum and red chili note at this stage, mixed with vanilla benzoin and leather. Delightful!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: This is a good release. Not the greatest or something spectacular. But for the colder months, you can't go wrong with this one. It's spicy and boozy. The drydown reminded me of Joop! Homme Wild. And then I looked up the notes and then it hit me. It is the rum. Only weird thing to me is that people rated this as a beast of a fragrance, but on me it has really moderate performance.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Is there no more creativity in the designer world? This literally smells like an over oily version of MYSLF. So disappointing. It’s not even worth trying mainstream LVMH designers anymore. Everything’s got that overly sweet synthetic nuance you smell when you walk into a Macy’s department store.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Having loved Reflection man 45 but not the price tag, Gucci Guilty Elixir was a fantastic substitute.

I tried the Absolu in Birmingham airport after a frag buddy put me onto it stating that it was a less floral, but richer fragrance.
I wasn't expecting much difference because lets face it, a lot of these flankers are just money spinners.
However...

This new release is a beauty!

As my friend said, it is indeed a deeper, warmer, richer version of the scent with the florals toned down.
The opening notes of Rum, Almond and Orange Blossom give it a really nice twist on the Elixir, then once the Tonka and Vanilla join the party it keeps the same kind of vibe.

Now you're gonna get really mixed opinions about this frag, this is Fragrantica.

My advice is to try before you buy on your skin and see how you get on.

Personally I really like it and I will wear it alot this Autumn/ Winter.

Enjoy

HS75

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I suspect it has to be on skin to get the true scent of this fragrance because on test strip both the Elixir and Absolu smell terrible. On test strip it smells as stated by reviewer, Olere Novum, a synthetic chemical plastic putty. How can anyone rave about that scent? Maybe today I'll test it on my wrist. There has to be a reason for it's favorable reviews.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Very similar to Elixir. If you love the scent profile then it's worth having both as together they offer day (Elixir) or night (Absolu) versatility, and cover all four seasons (Elixir for warmer and Absolu for colder weather). In the drydown I caught some similarity with Afnan 9pm Elixir, almost as if a hybrid of GG Elixir and 9pm Elixir. Having checked the notes there are several key overlaps in the dominant aspects I notice most: leather, pimento/red chilli pepper, labdanum, vanilla. Smells great and seems like a top performer so far.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: It doesn't have the versatility of elixir the dry down is Elixir with leather and the opening is more sweet boozy do I like it ? Yeah for sure but for me the OG elixir is better with this floral notes mixed with benzoin.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Finally got my nose on this fragrance. It's really well done but not what I expected at all with the rum, almond and leather notes being added into the absolu. I was expecting some Guerlain ideal dna mixed with the guilty dna. The initial spray was the same as elixir, but stronger and sweeter with a slight boozy scent. Then leather started rounding out the fragrance. When I was outside I notcied the red pepper really shining threw when I got warm from the heat outside. It smelled just like the produce section at a store, and a pepper, but mainly only when I was warmed up did I smell the pepper accord. This absolu is absolutely beast mode. I sprayed this on my hand around 11am. Could still smell it on my hand even after my shower in the evening.. And I even scrubbed it off so I could wear my other newest fragrance, but it was still there. Not as prominent, but it was there all the way until I passed out around 11pm 12am midnight. Even after a shower and reapplying another fragrance to my hand where gucci was, I could still smell it overpowering my other fragrance until I fell asleep. Probably one of the most powerful fragrances I've ever sampled.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I never liked the OG Gucci Guilty Elixir very much. The OG Elixir has a thick synthetic chemical plastic putty smell that I find very off putting. That is still present in this 'lil gem, but it is muted by the almond, red chilli pepper and rum accord.

I agree with everyone who is saying GG Absolu is similar to the OG Elixir ... it is, but it is better. It smells better, the harsh chemical accord i get so strongly in the OG is less obvious in Absolu, and the overall scent is improved. I would gladly trade my OG Elixir bottle for this one, but I don't think it is good enough to waste $195.00 on it. Maybe I will get it in 2026 when it gets down closer to $100 at discounters. But for now, I have a dozen or more other orange blossom fragrances that smell a heck of a lot better.

7.0/10 and a Fragrantica score of 3.85

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Admin, please post the nose behind the fragrance. Was this a Quentin Bisch creation also??

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Smells like a mix of so many things nowadays. Nothing I would waste my money on at all

Don't get me wrong, this is not hate, this is still noticeably a very good fragrance that will attract a lot of masses but you know it's just another one you smelled before

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: same as the elixier

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Received a sample of this from a fragrance store and to me this smells like if you chewed a hubba bubba with some almonds and then ate a piece of candy. The drydown is insanely sweet and i honestly think that the people around you would become nauseous if they got a whiff of this every 5 minutes. Not a bad smell, just really really heavy. Please don’t apply this if you’re gonna be in a confined space for a long period of time 😭🙏🏻

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Tested this in store and then managed to get a sample. I don't have Guilty Elixir as to me there was just something a little off-putting in the opening, almost minty/black licorice like. I do have the newest Guilty Love Edition though as it is like a lighter/stripped down version of the Elixir and I love the creamy white florals/candy-like sweetness it has.

This new Absolu de Parfum still has that same backbone to it as Guilty Elixir/Love Edition, just now with the added rum and almond giving it a slightly sweet booziness mixing with the spicy red chili. As it starts to dry down a bit you can tell there a bit more of the amber/vanilla sweetness than the previous ones, and you can start picking up hints of leather throughout for the first couple hours. Then as it has fully settled it smells pretty much just like Guilty Elixir with mostly just the vanilla sweetness. It kind of feels like mixing Love Edition with something like Hugo Boss The Scent Elixir.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I just tested this in store and I own the elixir. If you are trying to avoid redundancy then it’s a skip. If you like the elixir dna and like the subtle differences then you do you boo. Personally I’m getting a little tired of flankers at least those with heavy reminder of previous ones. But I guess that’s the point of a flanker. If I graduate to this it’ll be after I empty the elixir. All in all it’s good. If you like the elixir you’ll either love this one or like it as well.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: When did they add all this notes? 😂

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: It's warm, It's cozy, don't over 4 sprays you may ruins the esterogen party

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: If Elixir is your rich boyfriend picking you up in a Bentley, Absolu is the same guy after 3 rum & cokes, stealing a Lambo outside Club Space, and drag-racing it down Biscayne at sunrise

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Better than the previous elixir but still too similar to the elixir that I own to justify a purchase. To me
It would be like chosing between bdc edp or bdc parfum.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Instant buy. No questions asked.

I already had something of an unhealthy obsession with the Elixir. Went through almost a whole bottle since acquiring it.

Bought this (15% off @ Macy's doesn't hurt as much price-wise) and am thrilled to have it.

I am a hardcore fanboy of men's fragrances utilizing white florals. Orange blossom? Count me in!

I know florals, particularly white florals, aren't everyone's cup of tea, but they sure do work for me.

This is a MUCH smoother, more well-rounded iteration of the OG, with the same overall structure. A bit less 'astringent' if that is the term. Longevity and projection are both above average, and easily on-par with the OG. Seems to have more depth, and a slightly darker edge. A slight touch of booze. I love it.

Is it similar to the original? Yes.

Is it worth it? If you like the DNA, then also yes.

Similar to the arguments being had over in the BDC l'exclusif page; I personally don't find that fragrance to be worth it. I do, however, believe that this one IS, for me. The next person may or may not agree, and that is fine. I am very happy to add this one. Now to wait for Fall......

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I got a sample today at Macy's, smells like Elixir and Creed Delphinus/Centaurus had a baby. Has that cherry chloroseptic waxy note from Delphinus/Centaurus in there. It's maybe a heliotrope and geranium combo. I really like it, but not better than the OG GGE though. I'll update on strength soon, seemed weaker than the Elixir on first test, not as potent, could be a huge decision factor.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
This fragrance is already on shelves at Macy's. It smells very similar to the elixir version but smells a bit creamier, sweeter, denser with a mild dose of spices. If you like the elixir you'll likely enjoy this one and it shouldn't feel like a redundant buy. But keep in mind you will definitely know its a flanker to the elixir. I will say the performance on the elixir seems to be better.

8/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
If you can imagine the Elixir with a little spice and booziness added, but less orange blossom, then you have a pretty close idea of how this smells. The elixir smells amazing, so this one smells good too. It does definitely seem to tone down the orange blossom (sadly) so you trade floral for boozy.

The dry down smells strangely somewhat similar to Stronger With You Absolutely. I prefer the Elixir, because it smells way more niche and unique (sometimes even a little medicinal, root beer like). The performance and projection is good, worse than the Elixir tho. For me it just doesn’t have the same magic the Elixir has.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
You guys know that tou can simply ignore it if you don't like fragrances that are not extremely masculine, right? No one is forced to buy every new single flanker brands keep releasing, thank God!

I'm interested to try to this. Rum and Orange blossom sounds interesting.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Omg people crying about Gucci elixir being feminine when the Top Men perfumes are Dior homme Intense ,Layton , Guerlain edp,and the new fresh men perfumes are all about sweet fruits and Ginger.
And honestly Gucci elixir smells more manly and vintage compared to most of them.. OK yeah it's not Beau de jour or Terre Manly but no way feminine.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Tried this at the counter yesterday and it’s very similar to PDM Pegasus but obviously different with the chili. Compared to Pegasus I found this to be even more cloying, and very gassy/rubbery in the dry down. Major scrubber

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Love the elixir, its my signature for special event. Did they change the parfumer or its still quentin? Anyway cant wait to smell this

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Again, what pathetic people deliberately give low ratings to a perfume that hasn’t even been released yet.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Dick count so far as of 18/6/2025 = 6
I expect this figure to rise exponentially until the people with a penchant for being pegged move on to something else.....
I'm really looking forward to getting my nose on this one.....

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Are you all freaking afraid that you will develop a love for pegging when you start wearing colognes with orange blossom in it? We are all having fun in a very feminin hobby, embrace it!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: This looks interesting! Guys, if you are insecure with a perfume being "too feminine" just don't buy it, bruh. Stick with your shower gel, Aventus-smelling fragrances and stay masculine. :D

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Yes, another “ultrafeminine” fragrance for men! Excited to try it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: How many tar-tars are gonna mention their hate for flankers??

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Here we go again, more endless flankers with stupid non-scientific names and ever-increasing prices. The price of the Elixir was absurd enough at $185/75ml or something in that range. This one will probably be $200 easy and will also probably lead to the discontinuation of Gucci Guilty Absolute - one of the greatest modern fragrances for men. The madness needs to stop. I was hoping that we had reached peak Elixir, but now it appears we haven’t - we’re just calling everything Absolu now. I have no words left

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: another orange blossom ultrafeminine fragrance for men, yuk.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: There you go again!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
Autumn in a bottle.
Magical elixir.
If you miss Midnight Poison, you should check Gucci Guilty Absolute out.
It has similar fizzy patchouli, red rose and intriguing cypress notes that are adding a masculine edge like in Midnight Poison.
I feel also the unique spiciness of pink pepper, refreshment based on bergamot.
Beautiful background of woody notes and charming juiciness of blackberry.
Vetiver and amber also can be contemplated here.
The bottle color fits the scent perfectly.
It is a modern chypre.
Classy and serious, but with a magical twist.
I can clearly picture a dark angel rocking it.
On me it gets shy after an hour or 3. I keep catching wafts og it but it does not project much, unlike Guilty edt.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I had high hope for this but all I got was sweet rose, perhaps some blackberry right after spraying. There's a depth to the rose due to the woody notes, there's something 'stately' about it, like old polished furniture. I thought my grandma used to wear this but turns out it came out in 2017...

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I blind bought this afywr reading the notes and I love Alberto Morrilla’s work. He’s my favorite nose. OMG this is beautifu. Best blind buy ever. Reminds me a bit of For Your Love (also Morillas). Buying a back up bottle!!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Haha! After the first smell i got the La pathere and the La fille de Berlin out of my budoir :)) just like these two layered. Anyway.. it s very relaxing chypre rose scent like a warm hug all day long. I love it!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Yo! This is some good 💩!! It's a nice grown woman fruitchouli! The woods and that amber really blend the scent for a well balanced juice. Performance wise, this last all day!! Not a screamer and it's not in your face, nor will it choke people out. It's bold, kinda sexy, kinda dark, surprisingly work appropriate, especially for important meetings where you need to show up commanding attention and mean business! Ha! GGAPF is a forever gem in my collection.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Wow I didn't expect so much blackberry , i didn't like it because too fruity for me but nice scent

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Love it! This and White Patchouli form TF are my favorite patchouli dominant fragrances. Perfections!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I agree with Julie! I looovvveee this flanker! It has so much character. The patchouli is just right...its like a sexy fruitchouli. The rose, woods and amber make it womanly. 10/10!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Love love love ! I want to drink it ! It’s soooo good !

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
Perfect execution of brash and bold--dare I say, just a little trashy (in the best possible way). And "trashy" is an aesthetic that usually manifests in heavily gendered ways but this seems to actively play with gender. It's got that synthetic woods fuckboi frag dna at the base but the rose/blackberry is SO jammy, thick, thorny, sexual. Instead of neutral androgyny, it evokes exuberantly crossdressing (in either direction). It smells like the color of the bottle.

Very linear (again in the best possible way): a perfume that gives you everything it's got right off the bat for an explosive first impression. The patchouli gradually gets more prominent throughout the long wear but that's about it as far as evolution.

A surprising comparison: when I first tried Marissa Zappas La Divina I was instantly reminded of this; the wood accord in the base is a dead ringer. But you'd never mistake one for the other; La Divina is going for silky elegance and while it's a beautiful perfume, personally I think GGAPF's partybitch approach just does more with these notes.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: For some reason this smells like blackberries found randomly in a frozen part of a forest covered in snow, very cooling. Love it

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Gorgeous fall fragrance!! Definitely not a blind buy. At first, I did not like it that much but in a few minutes, it blends really nicely with the skin and becomes addictive. For me it smells like this woody, juicy, warm scent that is almost your skin but as if your skin is a fireplace full of berries. I feel like that is the best description for this scent. I always get compliments (mostly by women) when I wear this but think twice before buying if you smoke.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
Bewitching. Dark rose in a cold deep misty forest. This is pure aphrodisiac bottled up. I put it on and wore it the whole afternoon. I can't stop smelling myself. Masterpiece.
The cypress adds a captivating cool camphor note and the woods bring down the sweetness and make it a spicier and less sweet rose. I think this leans more unisex compared to other rose scents. It's like a deep forest spa scent.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
A very grown-up scent that feels unisex. It is not masculine, but it would smell good on a man.
Predominantly roses, a bit of blackberry as effect of rose-cypress-patchouli more than the actual fruit. It is a bit gloomy and as such a perfect match for autumn, but fresh, chill spring fits it also well. A scent to go into forest in :) The only one I know. It does have similarities to Lalique Amethyst.
It is an earthy, woody, serious rose. It changes in far drydown - sweetens considerably, with patchouli, rose and woods. This stage is the best -occurs after 8 hours.
The issue I have with it is no sillage. It does not project on me.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Screechy at first, but in the best way. Cools down into a sophisticated and mysterious rose. Not powdery nor overly sweet.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: This fragrance is fruits done right!! It's an absolutely stunning blend of berries, roses, woods, and patchouli. It feels like a sophisticated, elevated designer scent—very classy and mature. Unfortunately, the longevity and projection leave much to be desired; it lasts only about three hours on my skin before fading away completely. Why does it have to be this way? WHY?!?!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: the scent is ok, inoffensive and kinda generic, but something in this triggers my migraines

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: This is my yes I can still be a little bit chic with dirty hair on a Trader Joes run scent.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I am a fragrance snob but I love this little designer gem. Deep, sexy grown up scent that will turn heads and get attention. Wear when you want to make a statement.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I can say this flanker is definitely different from all the Gucci Guilty's I have tried. Its fruity (almost berry) smelling, slight floral (adding a sweet sugary) scent combining with a woody note. It smells nice , on paper it smelled masculine but on body and clothes I never got that masculine scent . However, men/women can wear this. I notice that this is a soft fragrance, it lingers throughout the day but its not powerful.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
First a blackberry, which is not too ripe, together with the smell of bush leaves right after the rain. Then a super nice combination of rose and vetiver which is holding for quite long. For me it's one of to-go's for winter evenings and/of generally for colder days with more humidity in air.

Drydown is similar to Perles de Lalique.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Really nice flanker! It opens with blackberry (which is not too sweet or prominent) blended with a blast of citrus and pink pepper. Then you get the most interesting part with the vetiver! The bulgarian rose is more green than sweet, which I love, the cypress isn't very strong, the vetiver takes over. In the dry down I get woody notes, rose, patchouli and vetiver, something very creamy and easy to wear during any season. It's discontinued, but I still have a sealed bottle if someone is interested

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: i think of a woman who’s full of passion when i smell this. it opens up with fresh blackberries, then blends with leather and roses. she seems careless but is truly poetic and likes to hike, sometimes drinks wine under the pine trees. all i can smell is passion honestly. a girl/woman who’s so confident and grounded, connected with herself and nature. it also feels like a dark fever dream in the woods when you smell it. its dark but its not harsh or loud at all, instead pretty gentle. this is so leather jacket, red lipstick, lana del rey vinyl, witchcraft, whimsigoth, dark forest nymph, femme fatale, red wine, roses, anaïs nin books and i love it. also this is incredibly romantic, perfect for dates or to feel like you’re surrounded by a blanket of love.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme is a dark, sophisticated, blackberry patchouli fragrance. It really blooms in cold weather and I'm totally in love with the ambience.

At first sniff, I wasn't sure if I liked this or not. However, that initial reaction usually signals that I will soon become obsessed with a fragrance.

@Yellowmoon clued me into layering this with Badgley Mischka Forest Noir. Omg, that blend turns into the ultimate, gorgeous Christmas scent on another level!

Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme is not your run-of-the-mill, boring, crowd-pleaser fragrance. I'm certain I'll buy this again when I run out.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Lovely perfume but on my skin it still a very classic soapy blackberry, not a photorealistic one but still fresh and juicy. I wish the woody notes and the rose came through a bit more. Very tame patchouli. Linear scent with a moderate silage and projection

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: The berry opening is so stunning but it doesn't take too long until it settles into a more musky, woody scent. Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme smells like Christmastime berry wood-scented candles. It's elegant, but I feel it's missing sweetness so I like to layer it with Signorina by Ferragamo for the Pannacotta note.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I bought this perfume when I was 16 years old and in high school by saving money. I don't think it really suits that age but I liked using it. It is both fruity and woody. I don't still use it daily but I prefer this when it is cold and glooomy outside. Also I use this when I'm wearing a leather jacket. I think it suits that leather vibe perfectly. This definitely gives dark feminine energy. If you're more into lighter and sweeter scents you probably won't like this but if you like femme fatale perfumes this one is for you.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
A slightly medicinal rose infused with a dark blackberry elixir. It's warm and sweet, but there's plenty of contrasting depth from the smoky patchouli and darker foresty woods to keep it from veering too sweet.
Perfect for cool weather, so spring & autumn preferably.
Quite strong coming out of the bottle, but mellows down to a comfortable arms' length projection.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Ok, I bought this 2 years ago. I didn’t like it. I couldn’t get over the heaviness of the patchouli. It was just too much. Initially gave me a heavy licorice scent that was nauseating. After macerating for the last couple years, I came back. It mellowed out and yes, is going to be a go to for fall. It could still be cloying for the humid summer months. It’s not fresh but syrupy berries wrapped in the leaves of a Christmas tree. Not cough syrupy. I love the contrast. The Smokey patchouli does taper off in the dry down. Gorgeous parfume to wear with a long coat and some heels. I do not see ladies under 25 wearing this. This is definitely a date night winner!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
My love... I bought it couple of months ago and wore it almost everyday. It's fruity, sexy patchouli bomb. Opens with a juicy berries and then turning into a dark rose- dirty patchouili blend. Smells divine. It's a little bit masculine I agree but I found that masculinity so sexy.
One day while I'm wearing this, one of my work friend liked it and asked the name of it. And he said "starting today, this is and will be my favorite perfume" Since that day, he is wearing this scent every fricking day😂 and I can't because I don't like smelling same with someone so close... 🥲

08.25 EDIT: My colleauge quit.*yay* I'm so happy to be using this gorgeous perfume again.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I love this. It's the scent I wear when I'm gonna be the one paying the bill. It's rose and berries done in a stunning way, however, I would love this more on guys, and the original guilty too

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: During the pandemic this fragrance was bargain priced so I indulged. I like all the Gucci Guilty fragrances and Gucci Guilty Absolute pour Femme smells great on guys. Radical Faerie perfume, although strange bedfellows to think a Gucci scent would be a match. The god Pan.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Love at first sight! Tested at 1 pm today and bought at 7 pm. If you like Coco Mademoiselle, you should try Gucci Guilty Absolute. In my opinion it is suitable for every season, very inoffensive and comforting. Peppery fresh start, 10 minutes after it's rosy, woody and spicy. Lasts quite a bit on my skin and clothes.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
Strong florals and a hint of blackberry, but the patchouli is much too overpowering for me. I don’t get any woody notes. Has moderate sillage and lasts about 5 hours on me. In terms of perfumes listed as similar—
❌ Mugler Angel Nova: much more rose-heavy and fresh
❌ PDM Meliora: sweeter and more green

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: A disappointment. Opening is meh, barely smell any blackberry or rose. Drydown is a pleasant creamy woody, but not enough of the cypress for my taste.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: This reminds a lot of este lauder pleasure from the 90’s . And while pleasure had a strong love or hate personality.. guilty absolute tends to be more agreeable. And it is sad that it didn’t get the fame that it deserved.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: A super sweet freezer burnt popsicle, drys down and smells like lip balm.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: It's fresh and very fruity, not my style at all. It's not very strong, longevity is average. In the beginning it was little bit powdery. Overall not bad, office friendly perfume.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I’ve worn this a lot and I loved it. It was like nothing I had smelled before.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolute Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
This fragrance was a journey for me but I feel like Gucci could have done so much better with this one. Opening hits you pleasantly with juicy blackberry. Wish blackberry was used more in fragrance because it smells so good. The opening is also very fresh. Then the blackberry disappears VERY quickly (maybe 15 minutes max) and you're met with sharp woods. As it dries down, the sharpness of the woods mixes with a mustiness that I can't comprehend. I did try this on a hot day, the scent kept turning warmer and more sharp on me. Maybe it's more suited for colder weather? Give it a try on your skin - this is not a safe blind buy.

The good part is that it lasts very long - but I did end up scrubbing it off. It was giving me a terrible headache because of its projecting power and I just didn't like the sharpness.
