This perfume smells exactly like my first signature, Viva la Juicy La Fleur from Juicy Couture. I was so scared that my signature will be discontinued as it's hard to find in a Juicy Couture stand anymore, but now...who cares?

Delicious red berries, sheer and light white florals (gardenia actually), pear? Hmmm what about patchouli that I can't detect and frangipani that I am not familiar with? All I know is what I said. I should have been angry because of the copy of my favorite perfume, but to be honest can't wait to try it on my skin and examine it more.

I thought I wouldn't write a lot, but what I want to mention is that maybe I am growing, I am changing my taste in perfumes and why not try a similar one with a bit different notes? It's not scary, I wished that I will never change, but it's natural and maybe I like it. Romantic, young, sheer, flirty, tender, fresh, playful, this is Gorgeous Gardenia Flora by Gucci!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: Do you remember in 'Sex and the City' when Carrie see the shoes she covets in the store window and says "Hello Lover.." ??? This is the exact reaction I have every time I see this bottle. I love the bottle, I love the bow, I love the pretty pink juice color...and I LOVE this scent. I have a lot of trouble with floral sometimes and had thought Gardenia may be one of my trigger flowers. But for whatever reason on my skin I get hardly any Gardenia at all. I love that it's a sweet floral as opposed to a powdery one which I cannot handle. I love that it's fruity. I LOVE the way I feel wearing this scent. Happy the instant I smell it. It seems to last on me well. If you have trouble with florals you should give this one a sniff. Not offensive to me at all and my nose is SO sensitive.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: I really like this, but wish it was stronger and lasted longer. Light, pretty, feminine scent. Crisp, fresh, and floral. All the comparisons to Viva La Juicy... must be something to it, but I don't care for Viva, but I love this. Happy Smelling! :)

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
What a pretty perfume! And I do think "pretty" is the word I'd use to describe it. It's giggly and fun, but not immature - it's sweet and feminine, but not syrupy. It manages to retain an air of youthfulness, while conveying sophistication.
I'm very pleased to have a little tester vial. I prefer it now that the weather is getting a little cooler, than in the summer, when the sweetness intensified on my skin. As previously mentioned, longevity is a little on the ho-hum side. (2.5 hrs on me.) I can stretch this ever so slightly longer if I apply a non-scented hand cream to my wrists prior to applying. I adore the pear and frangipane notes and am absolutely elated as always to find there is not a trace of my nemesis patchouli on my skin, even though it is listed as a note... YUSSS!
With its "pretty" price-tag, I'm not convinced it will find a home with me yet, based on its disappointing longevity primarily. I do give the scent a strong "like" rating though.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
really really fresh sweet fruity note for the opening. pear note is last more than an hour on my hands. and then gardenia and frangipani take parts make it flowery all around.

what i get for top to bottom are pear and gardenia. i am not really happy with the longevity. it's doesn't last on my skin. i have to replenish it twice. the good news is, it is very wearable and suitable for daily perfume. teenagers definitely love the scent. overall, it was pleasant, very safe scent and nice gardenia.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
I am very disappointed at this perfume.
I have recently bought it. I was looking for Dolce and Gabana
'L'imperatrice", which is a perfect mixture of a playful and classy perfume for summer. Unfortunately, it has been discontinued.

I tried this, which in the beginning gives the impression that it's fruity. But when I got home I wore it and got shocked: there got to be a problem in the mixture. THE FRUITY and FLOWERY SCENT ARE AT ODDS with each other. There is no exquisite transition between the two.

Also, it fades quickly, leaving a smell of flowers. I am not really into flowery scents.

Too expensive for an eau de toilette, and too unsophisticated for a Gucci perfume.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
In the beginning I can smell some fruitiness but it soon turns into rich and full white flower. So that's got to be gardenia. It's very classy and beautiful, almost fresh white flower scent.
I'm not so fond of white flowers so I wouldn't buy this. But I can really recommend this to someone who has different taste in perfumes than me. This is not suffocating like I mostly feel about white flowers.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: It has Marc Jacobs daisy eau so fresh vibe, but this is maybe more sweet and lasts longer. Very airy, fruity. Just gorgeous.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: Gorgeous, I really really LOVE IT!! On my skin is fresh and fruity. My favourite one and a big plus is that my boyfriend absolutely adores it :)

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
This is gorgeous. When I wear this, I get pear from the first spritz until the end of the drydown, with a lot of gardenia echoing behind it. It's a lovely juicy floral. It lasts several hours and is so pretty. A definite improvement on the original Flora by Gucci!

I don't love the patchouli in this so it won't be my everyday frag; however this is lovely for the spring months in NYC when the cold starts to thaw and the sun comes out after the dark winter months. Very pretty and fresh! I have a sample vial right now and this may eventually find its way into my permanent, full-bottle collection.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: This is a really sweet perfume! It smells like Viva La Juicy with the Angel patchouli vibe! The opening is nice, and the overall sent as well I have to say, but it's just way too sweet for my liking.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
Gorgeous Gardenia is definitely an instant love for me.
Been eye-ing this for quite a while and I am happy I finally made my purchase today. I normally wouldn't really settle for floral perfume but this is just too pleasant to resist.

It is not overwhelming with a balance of fruity freshness to it. Love love this one and lasted longer in colder temperature.

This is definitely my new daily office scent.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
This one will always hold a special place in my heart as it's what I wore on my wedding day!

I am the first to admit that I don't usually go for floral scents (in fact I despise most floral scents)but this one really surprised me! There is a bit of a fruity tang to it and also a slight sweetness too!

Definitely one to try if you find some florals too over powering.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
Gucci could have mass-marketed a modern composition featuring the bodacious gardenia flower to captivate younger consumers and entice those of us who love gardenia already, BUT NO - this house had to release some played-out fruity/floral composition (a la Viva La Juicy) and tack the ill-fitting name, "Gorgeous Gardenia" to it...in 2012. (???)

I would have thought (hoped) this would be a sort of entry-level gardenia-dominant scent along the lines of the easy-to-like Generous Violet that Gucci released. Generous Violet was definitely violet-y, but was well-balanced and soft enough to appeal to those new to violet fragrances and established violet-lovers, too. Why couldn't that structure have been used in the creation of Gorgeous Gardenia? If there IS a hint of gardenia in this composition it is present only because I am willing it, with all my might, to appear underneath all the saccharine. Bummer and a fail (to my nose).

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
I surprised myself by liking this. It's certainly reminiscent of Viva la Juicy and other heavily fruity florals and less of the traditional white floral than I expected. White floral gals, don't let the name fool you.

It may not be listed in the notes, but it smells suspiciously of caramel. Perhaps the sweet fruits just create that accord. I get mostly red berries and sugared gardenia petals.

I've worn it a couple of times and enjoyed it. My eyes don't water with elation at the thought of it.

Edit 10/12/15: The more I test this, the more I'm absolutely convinced that this shares the same aroma-chemical base as Viva La Juicy. Now, I personally like the smell. But I do find it a bit disconcerting that the major fragrance companies find it sufficient to take one ingredient and dump it in a perfume in large doses, without nuance or finesse, and then stick a hefty price tag on it. Forget fruits or flowers, this basically dries down to that single note I don't know the name of. This is where the caramel-like smoothness is coming from.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
This smells absolutely delicious. It is impossible to dislike this perfume. It is one of my new found favs. I have tested this many times before -but usually I have tested this on my clothing while out shopping along with about 30 other fragrances so for that reason it didnt shine or stand out to me for a while maybe it was overpowered by all the others. However a lady sat infront of me on public transport the other week and she smelt divine- i was so tempted to ask her what it was she was wearing as it smelt vaguely familiar-then it came to me like a lightbulb that it was gucci gardenia- so to cut a long story short i ended up buying this diamond that same day- luckily it was payday haha!

Anyway, ever since, i have been using this perfume for work along with special occassions- it is so fresh and fruity and somewhat aquatic also. It is such a beautiful fragrance to me. Pear being my favourite note- it is especially delicious- all pear lovers must purchase this! It makes me feel romantic spiritual optimistic and hopeful for the future- it is such a springy positive uplifting fragrance. I smell some slight tuberose in this too along with cranberry. I simply love it- it might be the pear bias- i dont know but this perfume is beautiful to me- it is in one of my top 5.

scent- 9/10
lasting time- 6.5/10
radiates-7/10
Packaging=7.5/10

Truly beautiful romantic spiritual hopeful inspiring scent.

Wouldn't say this one is directed towards young girls infact I would say it is more aimed at middle aged women. But it is beautiful for any age because it is beautifully blended and gorgeous. It epitomizes femininity.

Not that familiar to La fleur- only on first spritz the dry down is completely different. This lasts much longer and has better silage than la fleur and smells more floral and aquatic and is for an older audience.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
Maybe I'm crazy but I was expecting to smell a sort of Gardenia solifore when I tested this and instead I got a disappointingly generic fruity floral.

I believe most of the Flora line are supposed to be directed toward younger girls so if that's the case then it makes sense in that regard but I'm still disappointed because I generally like Gucci fragrances.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
Was browsing today at perfumes (as usual) and decided I just wanted to spray something light and floral. Well as gardenia is one of my favourite scents I decided to go with this offering from Gucci. The name of the scent coupled with the plain but elegant bottle suggested to me this would just be a nicely done almost one note perfume of gorgeous gardenia. If that is what you are looking for then this is most definitely NOT it!! In fact I struggled to positively identify ANY gardenia in this at all. Imagine my disappointment.

This is another example of getting the advertising completely wrong, this is not for gardenia lovers. What I did get was quite a dense perfume with a 'masculine' vibe. Quite spicy, with a syrupy rather generic floral note (could've been anything quite honestly). A strong one when first sprayed but unfortunately didn't last all that long on me, maybe 3 hours at best.

I agree with the reviewers who are likening this to 'Viva la juicy', also pretty much all the Nicki Minaj perfumes (they are indistinguishable from one another to me) plus lots of others that have followed the syrup floral trend, but this one has a masculine vibe added and a dollop of spice/patchouli. I didn't altogether dislike it but the 'Gardenia' in the title seems to be for decorative purposes only.

Would not recommend anyone paying the asking price, extraordinarily run of the mill and smells more like a celeb fragrance, not bashing them I love some celeb fragrances but this is no better quality and not as good as some tbh. All in all a disappointment, if u like it save your money and pick up 'Pink Friday' or Viva la Juicy instead, both of those lasted longer on my skin.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: love love love this one so much.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
This perfume is unique in my collection. While other of my perfumes remind me of sophistication, grown-women and femininety, the Gorgeous Gardenia reminds me of Tuscany hills, bare knees, citrus trees, reading poetry in the shadow, summer kisses and late night walks in Rome.

For some reason this perfume reminds me of a young woman in Europe. Not Italian but in italy. Like in that movie Stealing Beauty!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: Much much better than the Viva La Juicy ones;alot more intense, more depth, silage is fantastic, staying power is superb. It smells divine. Id say its the grown up version of the Viva la juicy la fleur which I don't care for anymore. This is a fragrance for 25+ women who love a rich fruity white floral that smells expensive and not cheap or teenish. I use it on date nights or evening walks on the beach. The price is "assgrabbing" aka abit high but its so worth it.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
a warm and a bit sour sweet fruity perfurm. There is no floral on me. the bottle is nice too. It is not the heavy or diva or noir or mature type. So it is suitable for office and date. The only concern is it becomes too weak after an hour or so. I can steal a hint of faint wonderful scent occasioanlly but it is really faint. It is a skin scent within an hour.

Only if it have better longevity and sillage...

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: This fragrance smells just like Dole pear fruit cups with syrup. I don't smell any of the "gorgeous" gardenia that always stops me in my tracks when I smell that flower in the air. If the smell of that flower is what you seek, this fragrance will be a disappointment. The sillage is weak and so is the longevity. This scent does not evoke anything....except maybe onesies smeared with pears.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: I own this and do like it, it's a watered down version of Viva La Juicy, and smells almost exactly like viva la Juicy La Fleur. It's pleasant, inoffensive and "easy". I completely agree with Esteban747 that there is NO gardenia that I can smell. It's more of a generic fruity-floral. I also agree with another reviewer that said this smells "pink" . To me, if colors had a smell, pink would smell like this or Miss Dior Blooming Bouquet.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
Gardenia. Are you kidding me?
If (like me) you are happily wishing to smell a clear, heady, green and fantastic gardenia, then forget about it before this perfume crushes all your dreams.
This is a sweet fragrance, a mash of "berries" and pear plus a spoonful of sugar, and then some sugar, finished by more sugar.
Yes, this may appeal to some, but to me this is deceptive. first of all because the name is misleading. And even worse, the gardenia never arrives. NEVER!! I swear this felt as if I was stood up by a flower! where is she???
If you like sweet fruity, heavy scents, then go for it. But if you look for a nice, white flower scent, don't even bother.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: I find the whole collection of these rather safe, and quite linear. Gorgeous Gardenia is the only one that stood out to me, although there is no gardenia to be found here (one of my favorite flowers..ever). Pretty, office-appropriate, and good for those sensitive to smells. Gorgeous Gardenia is soft, and really nothing to fawn over. A Viva La Juicy for grown ups. Don't get my less than enthusastic review wrong, though, I do own this and wear it often!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: I find this much more floral than fruity. Although the red berries are noticeable. I really am pleased with this fragrance. I not a huge fan of any of the women's gucci fragrances as I find them far to strong! This is about the strongest fragrance I can cope with before getting a giant headache. I really like this scent on me and I get. A lot of compliments. Nice for daytime during spring.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: lasts for seconds, smells average and the bottle is tacky. such a disappointment.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: I really like this one. It's simple, slightly sweet and pleasant. This is the kind of scent that would be nice for running errands or work. My boyfriend didn't particularly care for it. While he never said he didn't like it, he called it a "corporate" smell. When my sample is gone I will part ways with this scent. I don't love it enough to pay what it goes for. I'm having fun sampling it though. On the right lady this would be quite nice.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
I'm wearing it today. Thanksgod, I didn't buy it. I think that no gardenia nor any real flower passed by here.
It doesn't smell gardenia at all!
It is pleasant, but so artificial! A fruity floral like so many out there.
I think that Gucci went a downhill and never recovered. I was never a fan, but quality has become worse.
Gorgeous Gardenia is a nice feminine fruity floral scent with good staying power, a vague smell of frangipane among the mess and as a final result it can be worn easily as a light scent and you will perhaps receive compliments. It has the fabric of the 2010s crowd-pleaser: non-descriptive.
You will smell "girl", clean, floral with only a tiny drydown of generic musky-something.
Perfect for daytime in spring among the crowds, but there are other options for a fraction of price.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: I smelled this in Nordstrom a few months ago and it's really beautiful. The scent is really sophisticated, definitely my favorite in the line. I don't own it because it's incredibly expensive, but if the price goes down drastically, I'll definitely buy it. It's very soft, romantic, and feminine. It's much more interesting than the others in the line that I smelled. Unfortunately it's an eau de toilette, so it probably doesn't last very long, which is ridiculous considering the price. I still definitely recommend it if you can afford it!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
Sweet red berries paired with creamy pear on a sugary base with light patchouli and a little musk. More fruity than floral, by several orders of magnitude. Gardenia? Not really, but gardenia is more a matter of interpretation, and in this instance, it is a sadly sexless affair. Innocent, not sultry; abstract and pretty, no traces of anything remotely animalic or indolic.

It has the sugar musk base I associate with celebrity scents, BBW and VS, but slightly refined and elevated. A pretty, soft, sweet fruity floral, with decent longevity. office safe and linear, but dependable and consistent. If you are looking for gardenia, look elsewhere.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: Oooh this one is tooooo sweet. It's not what I typically prefer, and it's rather strong. However, it's a very recognizable scent because I went to the movies and smelled it on another girl sitting next to me. Definitely not a fragrance I can wear during cold weather seasons. I will not repurchase this one.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: I have to agree, it does remind an awful lot to Viva La juicy, it might be a watered version of it, still pretty in my opinion, a bit less provocative and more easy to wear!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
After using such fragrances as Annick Goutal's Gardenia Passion, I just want to chuckle and pat this little number on the head! First, there is not a whit of gardenia in it. At all. Second, it is derivative of at least 2 very popular fragrances out there: almost as if Angel and Flowerbomb had a baby! The kind of out there bittersweet of Angel plus the rather soft baked sugar cookie with maybe some floral candle burning near the counter, maybe near that some birthday bouquet. And about half way to the drydown, I swear I smell cherry popsicle, until that drifts away and dark cocoa is left on the burner.

I have to say this is my 2nd review of the Gucci Flora set and I'm thinking the Magnolia is better but still, awfully derivative of the popular creations one might find INCLUDING the Britney crapola you can get (seriously just Fantasy in a nicer label/bottle).

I'm sticking to my Gucci Rush, at least with that it's with me all day and I feel the coriandre was JUST crushed moments ago and on the counter next to a bowl of peaches and cream (and vetiver, and rose)...

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: Lightly sweet, fruity floral, not a real Gardenia you expect, soft, Generic, but great start for junior perfume collectors.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: I tried it today an' I fell in love !sooooo yummy ..delicious !it's my new signature for summer

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
Out of all the Floras this is my favourite,it's a lovely and sweet floral fruity,very easy to wear.
I like the gardenia and frangipani which add richness to the composition on a nice base of patchouly and sugar.
It does get rather sweet which I love but it's not a groundbreaking scent in any way, just very pleasant.
Longevity is pretty good sillage is moderate.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
This is a feminine and pretty scent, sheer and delicate. Fresh and floral notes, prominent gardenia and red berries, and also a whiff of frangipani once it's settled on the skin. Some aquatic notes as well I think. If you like Chanel Chance Eau Tendre or DKNY Be Delicious Fresh Blossom, give this a try.

But for me, unfortunately I don't get any patchouli, which would have added a needed depth, and I feel it has a chemical plasticky undertone. I have a miniature, will give it away.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: Though it smells fresh and floral, i find the price tag way too much for its longevity.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: If femenine have a name this will perfect to describe it, it sweet, clean , classy, sexy, is powerfull , but no loud!! Is perfect for day or night, I dont like gardenia, and dosent smells like, is a perfect ladish in a bottle, just love it ,,, rOmantic , elegant, femenine,sexy, master piece!! goshhh too much!!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
This is my first love in a perfume, can't remember ever loving a perfume before this (like your first boyfriend/girlfriend), and it has to be the first proper, grown up perfume I owned as well. I convinced myself I needed it as the number of times I would regularly go into Boots to spray it on myself before owning was actually rediculous haha.

In terms of the smell, it's fruity and contains another scent I cannot detect apart from the pear/apple (guessing it's the gardenia or patchouli as I have no idea what they smell like?). For an EDT, the lasting power is amazing. This lasts pretty much all day for me.

I'm still in love after having this for 1/2 years with the classy, clear hexagonal bottle and the feminime pink perfume liquid. The bow under the spray is cute too, but gets annoying as when you pull the lid off, it can take the bow off as well.

EDIT: Rang out of this at the end of the summer and I NEED IT SO BADLY, this juice really is gorgeous. Since it's on sale at Boots and Debenhams, it's making me want to justify buying it when I already have enough perfumes :/

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: i had it once, was nice , but didnt last long on me

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: I like it but fades in 1 hour. So disappointed in quality. It actually reminds me a lot of Sugar Lychee for some reason. I did not put them side by side just yet but I will. Other than that the smell is beautiful.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: This is a wonderful fragrance, but fades quickly. Does not smell anything like Viva La Juicy.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: This is such a pretty light scent. Perfect for summer. In the past perfumes have turn on me, smelling peppery or soapy but tested this one and is just lovely. Husband loves it. now both my 29 and 16 year old daughters wear it too. It is a delight.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
Not a gardenia fragrance, but still a good one. GG is the first perfume I loved and purchased, and to put it frankly, I got bored after a few times wearing this, so fruity, so sweet and girly, like flowers soaked in sugar, still like it but not me at all; so I just put it in the corner and forget about it.
When I came home one day, bringing a few paper tester for my mum and asked if she liked those. To my surprise, she asked me why I didn't wear GG anymore? It smells so good on me and it's the scent that she loved most.
So that's why I come back to gorgeous gardenia. And fell in love with it again. So subtle, so fresh and lovely. Gorgeous Gardenia is a young quiet pretty girl, not loud or stand out from the rest, but still a lovely friend that you can count on.
This is the one that I will always reach out when I don't know what to wear. GG would never be my signature scent, but always be a must-have in my perfume collection.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: all i get is sweet cherry pear. no floral. i think this is definitely an under 25 yr old fragrance. i imagine a young girl 18 wearing this with jeans. casual. i honestly think its a little trashy. i think its all the cherry on me. maybe if the cherry showed up less on me it wouldnt remind me so much of young girl trying to get laid. i bet my husband would like this fragrance. i think more business casual. or if you are in sales or an account manager. i think on the right girl it could be pleasant its just a little too young and cherry on me.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
After a few minutes it smells like the more sophisticated older sister of Viva la Juicy. The scents are very similar. Long lasting.

Gardenia? Not at all.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: Smell very badly. Like sugary benzoin or something, very synthetic. Very dissapointed.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: This is my favorite of the Flora collection and like the others, this is definitely an abstract floral. I can smell the gardenia in this, but the sweetness from the sugar and the fruit turns up the sweetness of the gardenia while completely toning down the indolic, jasmine-like quality gardenias can have. The result: sweet gorgeous gardenia.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: I completely agree the opening of this smells ALOT like Viva La Juicy without the caramel dry down. Viva La Juicy has a strong caramel dry down which, in my opinion, makes it perfect for year round wear... BUT this fragrance has the sweet dry down of gardenias and sugar which makes it perfect for spring and summer wear. It is definitely more "sophisticated" than Juicy... This fragrance also has the stronger floral fragrance which triggers headaches for me. For this reason I will stick with Juicy because the sweet caramels water down the florals making it more bare able for my head. However, I do love both of these! Just wish I didnt get the headaches!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
This is a grown up version of Viva La Juicy, if you feel silly wearing that one. Bottle looks more grown up for us over fifties. But they are both lovely. Usually Patchouli turns me off, it must be very subtle here, I wouldn't have suspected it as a note. Can't go wrong with this, good and safe for the office.

11/9/17 update. I often spritz a bit of Liz Taylor Gardenia on top of this to “amp up” the Gardenia aspect, which is, indeed, light despite the name.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: I've just noticed there's patchouli listed as a note. Surprised to say the least as I do not detect this note at all.I am not a patchouli girl...never been never will be. When I think of patchouli I think of TM's Angel, that's honestly vombomb inducing. So happy with this scent beautiful, classy and sexy xx

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
At first I could only smell a very sweet, almost intoxicating Gardenia on my skin. Then the red berries, pear and a more honeylike sweetness came through. Not much of a drydown on me, the sugary gardenia stays until its all gone. Can't say I can smell the aquatic note anywhere. Wich for me is a good thing;)

Longevity is poor (on my scent-eating skin) and so is the sillage. But this one gets compliments from others :)

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
I absolutely agree that it's very similar to Viva La Juicy. Very warm and sweet. The difference is it's more floral and lovely and it lasts longer on my skin.
I loved this the most in the Garden collection.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
i do agree. it is a light hearted and longer lasting VLJ to me. i don't own either but have sampled both and i kinda like this better. it comes off as a fun loving and happy. i like the very crisp pear note in the beginning it eventually gave way to a sweet gardenia note.. very pleasant and reminds me of a young woman during spring who is free and happy without a care in the world.

longevity 8
projection 7
sillage 8

overall this is a pretty and vibrant perfume.

thumbs up good stuff!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: On me this smells almost exactly like Viva La Juicy, but VLJ has sweeter notes (because of the caramel I think?) and this one is a bit more floral. However, the longevity of Gorgeous Gardenia is horrible. After 1 hour, I couldn't smell anything. Although this is an EDT, I don't think this is a good representative of a typical Gucci perfume. I have the Guilty EDT and it lasts a lot longer. The smell is nice and pleasant but I had to return it because of the similarity and the disappointing longevity.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: As for Glamorous Magnolia, I'm disappointed that this perfumes ends on a heavy sugary base. And has nothing to do with its name. The base notes ruin it for me. Will have a try with Gracious Tuberose, although keep reading it has very poor lasting power :/

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
It starts very pleasantly, with sweet notes, suitable for a sweet girl. However, after some time, on my skin it develops into very subtle, ladylike scent, perfect for a young lady. Moreover, base note is really magic, delicate sugary patchouli. I will definitely add this fragrance into my 'want list':)

Update: I've tested it again today and I am deeply impressed. What a charming scent! I am in love with it.

Update2: I've tested it once more to check if it is not too sweet in high temperatures. Happily, it is not! However, patchouli can be really intoxicating in warm environment, so it is important not to over-spray in hot summer.

Update3: final test in mid summer: it smells like a blooming garden! Awesome.

Update4: I've bought it and I have to say that it smells good either in high or low temperature. It is suitable for all seasons. Rare feature.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: Unfortunately, to my nose, it's very linear. All I get is extremely sweet gardenia. I was hoping in the dry down I would get some of the patchouli, but not on me. Still, you can smell the expensive, if that makes any sense.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
I find it very girly. It's sweet, fruity floral and youthful. There is a similarity to Viva la Juicy but this one is much better.
The thing I don't like about this perfume is that just like Viva la Juicy it reminds me of Fa pink paradise deodorant.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
If this scent was a lady she'd be: elegant,composed, always polite never rude,stylish and sophisticated, and is the epitome of a sweetheart. The kind of lady everyone loves and wants to be, She has that classic beauty e.g Kate Middleton, Grace Kelly or Audrey Hepburn.

So the hunt began. In Debenhams I find this little beauty, 10-15% off its original price of approx £75,(approx $120-$125) paid like £65 (approx $106) for a 100ml bottle, (3.4 ounce); I was sold could not resist. It has a subtle sweetness I've never come across like it before, maybe because I'm used to a sweetness of Britney Spears Fantasy range. Subtle sexy classy, feminine, just what I wanted and needed for stage I'm at in my life. I've never gotten so many compliments wearing a perfume as I have with GGG. It is sweet, but it is a grown up subtle sexy sweetness, not cloying at all. Very versatile scent, easily could be worn: to work, to class, cosy night in, on a night out or on a romantic date. It is a 'close to skin scent', but that is what makes it sexy, because it isn't so evident and out there like a lot of scents out on market.

out of 10, (for favourites): easily a 15-20, I love it , it's my new signature scent.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
I hate this perfume - it's very sweet(almost syrupy), synthetic and patchouli-ed!

I want to get rid of it - I have a 100 ml bottle (95 ml full) - sprayed twice - anyone keen, please msg - I'd be happy to sell it for really cheap =)

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
This perfume will always be special to me because it's what I wore on my wedding day. I had the hardest time finding for a decent price. I ended up buying off ebay, and I'm so glad I did!

If you love Gardenia as much as I do, you'll LOVE this perfume. I actually did a comparison at Macy's yesterday...I smelled this perfume (I keep a sample vial in my purse) and then smelled Ralph Lauren Blue. You can smell the fruit in the Gucci perfume. It's a good gardenia scent that's not too old lady-ish and over powering.

Very classy. This lasted all day, but was never overpowering. And I still get lots of compliments when I wear it. My hubby LOVES this one.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content:
If Juicy Couture made this, I would get it...
But this is Gucci we're talking about, and it has WORSE quality than VLJ.
Check this out, I used to have this, then I got VLJ, I got so freaking angry for having paid a buttload of money for this mediocre perfume that I gave it to one of my friends that also liked VLJ (we live in Argentina, that means: no Juicy Couture and really high prices for every luxury good).
again, this is Gucci, at least longevity should be better! You did well with Flora! Come on Gucci, stop making this overpriced crap and go back to the basics.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia Gucci
review_content: Everyone compares this to Viva La Juicy, but as I was putting it on today I actually found it to be reminiscent of Angel! Now that I see patchouli is a note, I figure that must be what it is. Funny I didn't notice it as much the first time I wore it, but I feel like this is the love child of Angel and Viva La Juicy :)

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: glad i only bought a small decant cuz trust me, i LIKE smelling like my granny in a sorta vintage glam way, but it really is so powdery. I was hoping for something that smelled like the north shore of oahu BUT no I do not get this. I guess I sorta feel like I'm in that movie blue hawaii, though. I do love that movie.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: I truly do like this, but it does remind me STRONGLY of 1980s Mr Bubble Bubble Bath. I specifically say 1980s only because I haven't smelled it since then, and don't know if the scent has changed. Sweet floral, with soapy notes. If I didn't associate it so strongly with Mr Bubble, I would probably say it's a waxy, sweet and heady floral.Lots of tiare flower for me, with a solid amount of ylang ylang.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content:
The fact that most people came to know Alhambra’s version before the original is just proof of how middle eastern brands are opening peoples minds to niche profiles.

This is lovely, and credit where credit is due (albeit this is… strikingly resembling of Terracotta by Guerlain thats been around for years but shh)

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content:
I really adore all the notes of this perfume. However I tried it today during long walk (nice, fresh, warm weather, a bit windy-perfect for perfume introduction) and here are my thoughts.
This Nymph is very opulent. Material- thick tropical white-yellow honey. It has lipstick olfactory sensation...
Perfumes that are in the same family (but better):
Chanel Beige (it's much more transparent, playful, higher vibration, boheme)
Vesper Glitz Ex Nihilo- it's bright, joyful life celebration. Very sparkly and high toned.
This guy is just heavy, opulent, low frequency. Like a big round fat molecule. Sad. Cause flowers itself are BEAUTIFUL

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: As someone who grew up in a tropical country with a large frangipani tree in the front yard, this fragrance reminds me more of mimosa than anything else. Frangipani itself doesn’t smell this sweet, creamy, or indulgent. Its natural scent is airy, light, and delicately sweet—almost as subtle as water. Jo Malone’s Frangipani captures that authenticity beautifully and is the closest to the real flower I’ve encountered. I haven’t smelled tiare or ylang-ylang in their natural forms, so I can’t speak to their influence here, but this fragrance doesn’t evoke the true essence of frangipani to me.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: I thought this would be right up my street as I love frangipani and tiara flower, but I find the ylang ylang is overpowering in this scent. If this had been swapped out for coconut im sure it would be divine. The ylang ylang makes it smell a bit plastic and overpowering at first. This is a perfume that you really need to let settle for a good few minutes. Once this dries down, it actually has a beautiful tropical flower scent. It smells very much like Hea Poi monoi oil to me. I still feel this is way overpriced for what it is. It’s a nice/pretty perfume, there is a uniqueness about it, but nothing special.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content:
I was lucky enough to test this one out at the local Gucci boutique today. Upon first spray, you are greeted with a bouquet of photorealistic tropical flowers: thick, oily, sweet and heady. The overall perfume, however, does not smell especially tropical at all. It lacks the coconut, sandy amber, or sunscreen notes that usually accompany such flowers as plumeria, Ylang, and tiare. Presenting these flowers in this botanical, under embellished way is quite unique and unexpected.
I placed the test ribbon down for a minute to test the other perfumes in the Alchemist Garden Collection. When I returned to it, my nose was graced with another photorealistic scent: blue cheese. Yes, a high quality blue cheese I'm certain (this is Gucci), alongside the now muted tropical florals. I instantly knew the culprit: an unlisted osmanthus note. I own a small sample of the natural absolute at home. At first sniff, it is quite pleasant, displaying fruity-floral facets reminiscent of apricots, honey and white flowers. As the absolute dries, however, it develops fungal, buttery, laconic nuances absolutely characteristic of the aforementioned cheese. That is the case here, and I wouldn't be surprised if Gucci is using an all natural osmanthus absolute, as this material is not exorbitantly expensive. Unfortunately, I never made it to the perfume's dry down, as my nose couldn't tolerate this note longer.
If Gucci's intent was to capture the most natural, three dimensional, representation of these flowers without any cliche synthetic ingredients to distract: they have succeeded in leaps and bounds. This is perhaps the only perfume I've encountered, however, that leans too natural. I believe a synthetic osmanthus accord might have worked better, or perhaps none at all.
While blue cheese is absolutely delicious and pairs wonderfully with honey and apricots, it is not something that I especially want to smell like.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: The bottle is so gorgeous, but the scent does not keep up. Extremely dry yellow floral, which dries down into a just opened magazine like smell. Just get any other beachy suntan perfume, get JHAG "Lust for sun"

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: idk if i’m missing something but i smelt this today and it smells like mouldy cheese plastic?? like it is not sweet, not florally, not tropical at all. i just smelt some weird dense heavy mold or like plastic cheese. it was by far the weirdest thing i’ve ever smelt and im disappointed because the way everyone described it made it sound delicious…

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content:
@cassiopeia1957
You must have had cold or blocked nose when you tried the Alhambra dupe "The Chant".
"Green" is not a word you can use for this perfume.
I have it and it's sweet vanilla, tropical flowers and lotion like well blended beauty.
If one doesn't want to spend much but have a great quality dupe, I say go for it, won't regret it!
I always find the best dupe along with the original and I don't have to worry how much I spray everyday at work.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content:
i have tried this in the airport and i loved it. it’s angelic. on another end i have tried maison alhambra dupe and it’s nothing like the original it is insanely green before it becomes warm sweet or powdery. Very long lasting however quite different and disappointing if u are chasing the scent of original.

So my tip is to avoid that alhambra dupe all together 😅🥲🥲🥲

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content:
I agree with Marialena888 below--I haven't smelled the Gucci OG, although I had samples of Gorgeous Gardenia and was less than impressed, although I didn't dislike it--and so everything I am saying about this fragrance applies to the Maison Alhambra impression, in its equally beautiful bottle with its luxe trappings and its bald appropriation of the brand name. To my nose, The Chant smells like a creamier, yellow-floral take on Elizabeth Taylor Gardenia, which will sound like a slight unless you read my rave review of it. I think Gardenia is my all-time favorite bargain white-floral soliflore (not really a soliflore so much as a slightly abstracted impression of the gardenia). At any rate, I get the holy yellow-flower trifecta with The Chant, which is to say frangipani, ylang-ylang, and tiare (orange blossom might have worked too), and I get it in sufficient doses that I simply can't imagine needing the overpriced original of this, even though I love the pretentiousness of its Mallarméan name. The Chant might be a streamlined version, for all I know, but it doesn't seem like a reduction. You get what you're promised with this bold and boisterous island queen.

On another note, please, please, please fix it so that the horrible pop-up mattress ads stop. Believe me when I say that it is counterproductive as a marketing tactic. The interruptions every 15 seconds just make me want to stop reading and posting reviews or otherwise interacting with this site. I can say with the utmost confidence that I am never ever ever ever ever ever ever going to buy one of those mattresses. I would sleep on a bag of rocks out of spite before I would reward that sales approach.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content:
Blind bought for the frangipani and the exquisite bottle. Wasn’t entirely thrilled…

It’s well-blended, yes. But it gives me a headache. It’s quite a powdery floral, and quite strong, especially that first blast. I get zero tropical vibes. It does eventually calm down, but it’s just lacking wow factor for me (or maybe it just doesn’t suit my personality and taste??).

I wish I could feel the same as all the other reviewers here who love it… I mean it does cost like a million dollars for a Gucci perfume, so at this point I’m trying to force myself to like it.

This is better suited for a girly-girl… a soft, delicate lady.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: The simplest way to describe this fragrance is fresh musky angelic and heavy on the musky side, before I read the notes I thought it had gardenia in it, it’s kind of similar to the gardenia in bloom Gucci but a much more beautiful version, it performs great and it lasts, if you like floral musky perfumes u might like this, definitely unique

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content:
If you’re new to the yellow tropical floral notes just like me you’ll find this to be (not your typical floral scent)
If there is anything on earth called a ( flower milkshake) it would smell like this . It’s a floral , creamy , milky, herby , warm yet summery.
It’s luxurious but not meant to be treasured for only special occasions. I can imagine myself wearing this first thing in the morning and last thing before I go to bed.
I would like to try the other suggested alternatives mentioned in the reviews like terracotta and narciso, but the moment I tried a chant for the nymph I couldn’t keep it off my mind.
I only wished it doesn’t cost a fortune.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: It looks better than it smells

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: I have a fantastic clone of it by Maison AlHambra called ‘The Chant’, even the bottles look similar. It’s overpowering at first (pure loud FRANGIPANI), but after it settles, it smells like an exclusive bouquet of creamy, buttery tropical flowers, frangpani, ylang and tiare, with abit of warmth and sweetness from (non-gourmand) vanilla…the tiare and vanilla combination may come off abit coconutty, like freshly shredded coconut. I also detect an unlisted turmeric root or curcumin note in the background, adding a mild bitter-sweet-spiciness. It’s a STRONG scent and can be headache inducing (it does soften considerably after about an hour), do not overspray, it lingers almost the entire day too, especially when sprayed on fabric. I don’t think it smells particularly beachy, but it does bring to mind beautiful island girls wearing leis. It smells like something that Guerlain and Lush would collab and release, if you can imagine that, naturalistic Lush-style raw floral scent, but with that powdery Guerlain-esque feel in the drydown. Very feminine, sensual and mature. Not worth the Gucci money for me…if you really like this scent but can’t afford it, get the clone, it’s disgustingly fabulous for the price. I do like tropical florals, and this is a very straightforward, intensive, and luxurious one, no fruits, no woods, no citrus, just straight up flowers with a tiny pinch of vanilla and spice. If you enjoy Guerlain’s Terracotta, Lush’s Lust or Sikkim Girls, you will most likely enjoy this (and it’s clone) too.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: One of the best full-bloom gardenia scents I have found- totally photorealistic, no bubblegum, piss, or added fruits- just creamy, sun-baked gardenia in the peak summer heat. Wish this wasn’t a million dollars.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: It was a blind-buy for me. I got a headache within first 10 minutes of wearing it. I'm not saying the fragrance is bad; it's actually very well composed, comforting and people seem to like it, but there is that one floral note that makes me sick in an instant, and I can't help it. Don't think the fragrance has beachy/sunny vibes of e.g., Sol de Janeiro, Tom Ford's Soleil Blanc or Bvlgari Omnia Paraiba - it doesn't. It is darker, creamier, more balanced, and to my nose it's more of a moss garden than sandy beach scent.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: Let this sit! I did not like it when I got it and it has been macerating for a few months! I’m very excited to wear this sparingly as it gets warmer!

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: Very feminine floral for a woman. Very elegant and beautiful. This would be perfect for a bride in her morning wedding day when the sun hits her skin as she recites the vows.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: This scent is beyond delicious. It excites every fiber of my being, sending me to a near trance-like state. I'm in love.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content:
There's already a replica by Lattafa and it's called The Chant. Even the bottle is the same.
Check it out.
Sorry, I meant to say Alhambra and Lattafa is its parent company.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: Identical to Lataffa La African Drummer. You’re welcome ☺️

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: One of my favourite perfumes! Smells like the Lana Del Rey - Salvatore song. Out of all the Gucci’s Alchemist’s Garden collection, this one is the sweetest one in my opinion. Such a feminine scent out of a fairytale!

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: Tropical, like a stick of Zebra Fruit Stripe bubblegum. This stuff starts out as a semi-sexy light floral bouquet and quickly deteriorates into eau de extracts. There's every chemical fruit coloring gummy bear enhancement at work here. Borderline gnarly. Smells like modern Amouge. Yeah it can smell nice on a beautiful woman but so can anything. If you're wearing this stuff, keep your distance...unless you're Elizabeth Hurley.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: This does open strong, as others have said, but it quickly softens to a lovely powdery scent (and I don't like powdery scents). I have a 30 ml and would consider the larger bottle, but it's way too expensive for what this is.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: Opens with frangipani so strong it smells like black tea (in a good way). Beautiful summery Southeast Asian vibe, like the scent when you just came out of a Balinese spa.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content:
This is a really lovely perfume by Gucci! It smells very summery, sweet, floral and tropical. I could imagine a beautiful Hawaiian Hula dancer with long and shiny black hair, a grass skirt and a tiare and frangipani lei around her neck. The ylang ylang is quite noticeable too and it lends an indolic and banana-sweet loveliness to the composition. Finally, I'm treated to a warm embrace of sensual vanilla in the dry-down.

I wouldn't call this a photorealistic interpretation of any of the flowers herein, but I'd definitely say I can smell them and this is only slightly synthetic smelling. The frangipani is probably the least realistic of the notes, the ylang ylang and tiare being much more realistic in this one. Like an ylang ylang and tiare monoï oil, which is equal parts white and yellow floral.

I got moderate sillage and an 8 and a half hour wear from A Chant to the Nymph, which is quite good for a Gucci fragrance. I could imagine this being worn during the day in either spring or summer to more casual events or when you want to feel like it's summertime. I'd call this an incredibly feminine fragrance as well and the beautiful pink bottle this is housed in hints at that.

Altogether, I'd give A Chant for the Nymph a 8.3/10. I'd definitely reccomend this one, which is not something I'd say about most Gucci fragrances.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: Smelled at airport. My favorite of the line. Floral lovers only.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: This Gucci creation is such a beautiful tropical warm ever so slightly powdery holiday scent. I love frangipani, Ylang Ylang, Tiare flower and vanilla so this was absolutely a no brainer blind buy for me and I’m very happy!! It is very similar to Aerin Hibiscus Palm without the spicy ginger or lotus notes thatI struggled with in that fragrance. ACFTN is smoother and more luxurious as well, the luxury aspect may just be from that gorgeous bottle though! This is my new go to summer holiday/staycation scent. The only downside is that the staying power is extremely lacking for the high price tag but I love being in the scent bubble while it lasts.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content:
The image that comes to my mind when I smell Gucci A Chant for the Nymph is the following one...
You are carefully kneeled before a large wooden chest of stored clothing relics from your mom... you open the lid and find tenderly folded on top a powder pink, dusty rose colored soft mohair sweater. You carefully pick up the sweater and gently nuzzle your nose and face into its cozy softness, and inhale... It is a dusty rose, soft mohair sweater, warm, mother's hug from yester-year. Beautiful, tender, soft, cozy, pale pink, dusty rose, comforting, and almost eerily nostalgic.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content:
To start off, I want to say I was inspired to test this fragrance because, not only have I been curious about this line since it was announced, but I am a HUGE fan of Hwang Hyunjin and he once showed off his bottle of ACFTN and said he had to purchase it as soon as he smelled it. A pretty big endorsement for something he wasn't paid to promote.
I finally decided, since I have plans to visit Korea in the summer next year, I need to figure out which scent to bring, so this immediately came to mind and I needed to test it before shelling out the insane price tag.
At first whiff of the nozzle, I have to say, though it smelled how every review I'd seen had described it, I was still a bit surprised. This one, while beautiful, is not as unique as something I'd expect at this price point. This is a balmy, sweet fragrance of yellow florals heating up in the summer sun. It absolutely screams summertime, but not in that day-at-the-beach sort of way, though it definitely does have a suntan lotion element to it. This is not sporty or aquatic at all. I have heard some people say it smells like there's coconut in here, and though I definitely don't get coconut at all, the creaminess of the vanilla in the base makes this a very, almost syrupy, sweet scent and I can understand why they're confusing it for coconut. It's thick and rich, but not quite sticky. The star of the show really is that frangipani and the way it all heats up on the skin. For me, the scent really didn't have an effect for me until I tried it on and let it sit for a couple minutes. Working with my chemistry, it took on this almost lipsticky quality that was beautiful and really made ACFTN start to smell expensive. I sprayed it on around noon and it carried up until about 8 pm for me, so I definitely don't think it didn't last a good while, but that's just on my skin and personally, I don't need my perfume to last for 3 days to make me happy.
Now let's address the elephant in the room: the price point. I love Gucci as a fashion house, but I'll definitely admit, the price point is absolutely ridiculous. While I was at the counter, I did smell a few different offers from the line and I have to say, for almost $400, I was expecting a LOT more. I don't think any seasoned perfumehead will be overly impressed with this line. The fragrances are lovely and some are very strong, but they are all a bit too simple and reminded me of other fragrances I either own, have owned, or have smelled. I truly didn't find anything overly unique or groundbreaking. If this doesn't bother you and you just want something both beautiful and of quality, then I think you will appreciate this line for what it is, but if you are looking for something individualistic or a good bang for your buck, then I definitely would look into something either a little more niche or a designer fragrance with less streamlined notes and at a fourth of the cost.
Now for me, I think I still intend to invest in this one. It's currently winter and I don't think I am too put off by the price point that I wouldn't be willing to purchase this for a beautiful summer scent. Though it is not too unique, it worked wonders with my body chemistry and is likely something you won't be smelling on too many people. It can definitely work as an everyday fragrance for warmer climates. I do appreciate the bottle, I appreciate the love, care, and inspiration that went into this line, but I do wish at least the 5 different options I sampled were a bit more daring. I am going to opt not to rate this one as I normally would, as while I do like this fragrance and would like to wear more of it, I'm not able to say it's my favorite fragrance of all time or that it's worth the price I'm willing to pay for it. But to each nose, their own, and if this one drives you wild, then nothing I've said here matters. All I can say is, when I am able to order my first bottle, I know we'll be very happy, together.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: A unique and refined floral, I find myself gravitating towards this scent when I’m in direct sunlight, the sun makes the heavenly flowers sing on my skin and it’s addictive 🤍 Intense tiare and frangipani with a light ylang, and a faint vanilla in the background that brings out the creaminess of the florals, GORGEOUS 🤍 I fall in love with this scent every time I wear it and I don’t think I can be without it, it brings me so much joy, it is sunshine in a bottle! Yes it doesn’t stay on for long but I am more than happy to overspray and keep spraying it on and immersing myself in this absolute olfactory delight again and again 😇

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content:
It's the early 90's and you're still sandy and sweaty from a beach trip with your family. This is the smell of the Herbal Essences suds in your dirty hair. Not terrible but not really a scent memory I long to revisit.

Edit: I stand by all the above except that apparently I DO want to revisit it. I am HERE for the dirty-beach-hair ylang dry down.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content:
creamy, seductive in luxury way..
one of the most feminine scent I've tried.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: I have loved this scent since I first smelled at Oberpollinger. It’s beautiful! A perfect simple tropical floral scent that smells real and isn’t overly complex. To me it’s just not quite worth the price for full bottle. As much as i want that gorgeous bottle!! I have a sample size vial and enjoy it so so much. I will buy more decants in the future when I run out. I get the clean makeup powder note after dry down. It’s really nice. Almost borders on laundry smell though, but not quite… it’s a reall beautiful scent in a gorgeous bottle!

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: Here for the notes for the dupe, Lattafa’s The Chant, which is amazing.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content:
An elevated take on Terracotta - creamy, sweet (but not sugary), and very tropical scent. Warm and inviting with uplifting soliflore elements. I see the comparison to La Dompteuse Encagée, but that one is sneezier with no sweetness and a touch darker.
Only lasts around 4 hrs, which, for the price, is very disappointing. If it lasted longer, I'd definitely recommend purchasing for the warmer months.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: I got a sample of this, alongside guerlain’s Terracotta and Narciso ambree. I like this one a lot, but out of the 3 creamy tropical floral scents, A Chant has the weakest performance. Really beautiful while it lasts, though. The frangipani and tiare mainly come through for me. It’s a cooler scent than Terracotta, and I might like it more if it could just last on my skin. As beautiful as it is, it’s not worth it for the price imo

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: I feel the sweetness in this is too cloying with a powdery effect that makes me want to cough. that might just be frangipani though, I’m not well-versed. I think this would be too sweet for a lot of people, me included

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: This is lovely. It's a very soft floral. Very feminine. This reminds me of a garden of flowers in the morning. Very fresh and delicate.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: I absolutely love this perfume. It smells like a flower garden. I imagine this is what fairies smell like LOL it’s creamy, not too loud, it’s just beautiful. I wouldn’t say it’s an everyday perfume. I agree with another reviewer you wear it when you feel beautiful 🥰🌸🌼💖

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content:
This is a very upgraded/classic version of a summer perfume. The frangipani is far away from overpowering, is super creamy. The imagery that comes to mind is a fairytale princess during summer time, hanging out by a lake with her animal friends, decorating her hair with the lotus flowers 🌸 from the lake.
If you watched the 1941 version of Disney’s Fantasia, I am sure you remember the beautiful centaur girls. Now imagine them going on a beach holiday and the little angels spray their hair and ponytails before they expend a starry night at the beach with their boyfriends. This would be their perfume.
This is really expensive (for me that is) so is not on my buying list. But if I ever received a bottle I would gladly wear it.
This is not for everyday. This is an: I feel beautiful 😻

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: All the things; beachy, tropical, creamy flowers, not too sweet. Except very occasionally I detect a rubber note in it, which stops me forking out. This is the least sweet perfume in this kind of genre I've smelled.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content:
The Chant is gorgeous. A very unique modern iteration of a classic scent.
La Dompteuse smells very different and leaves dark stains.
The closest to the Chant are:
Narciso Ambree and Intense Tiare.
Terracotta is also similar but much warmer and smells more dated.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: I got it because it smells like one thing I always smelled in my childhood. Although it is so expensive, its pure gorgeous smell makes me feel sweet all day! I love it but it would be better if it has more potential.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content:
So beautiful! Tropical but without that dreaded coconut-y feel and I appreciate that so much!
It smells soft and gentle like a breeze that carries sunshine and tropical blooms. Just wonderful!!
This is, in my opinion, masterfully blended and look at who the nose behind this beauty is: Alberto Morillas! No wonder I love it so much!!
Definitely a beloved fragrance, personally. I will cherish this beauty for a long time! Plus, that bottle is stunningly gorgeous ✨🌴✨

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: Beautiful Monoi and ylang- ylang scent. Very tropical, lush and sensual. But to be honest...for that kind of money, nope, I have the same lush tropical vibe with Terracotta from Guerlain. This scent is beautiful but nothing groundbreaking. And by the way, Terracotta is better, more natural smelling. You still can find Terracotta for less than $100 online...but hurry up before is gone forever...

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content:
I absolutely love the opening … it’s not just plain tropical but it has something smooth I can’t put my finger on..

I had been eying this fragrance because of the notes and yes … the packaging… but didn’t want to blind buy as it’s quite expensive and I couldn’t sample…

But then The Perfume guy mentioned this in one of his YouTube videos and then I also found it on sale (which never happens where I’m at) and just took it as a sign and I took the plunge…

And I’m so glad I did…

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content:
So strange, a few people noted this is a subtle fragrance, to me it kicks quite a punch! Which might be partly because there's a note in here I don't quite get on with (not sure which one). If a fragrance can be 'humid', this is it! Tropical without the coconut. Interesting scent!

I like to sometimes sample perfumes in this price range out of curiosity, none have ever really impressed me but a girl can and will try, for fun.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content:
A real tropical wowser. Creamy, coconutty (no coconut just the florals though) indolic, a real lush, tropical flower vibe. Very fresh too, and somehow you can feel the sunshine it has a warmth to it. Maybe just associations. Also a little graininess which I think is the ylang. I was tempted to say there is something old school about it, I think the creaminess of the florals, I could have guessed some tuberose also. I know someone who is going to absolutely love this scent, I think this has to be your genre to truly appreciate it. I do love my tropicals but more the fruity green kinds, less the indolic and salty or coconutty genre.

** 200 samples up for swap - check my swap shelf on custom lists and get in touch let's do a bundle swap! UK only **

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content:
This has a definite holiday in a hot country vibe, like being surrounded by tropical flowers in 30°C+ weather and wearing suncream by the pool, but in a coconutty way rather than chemicals. It is very heavy for a floral, and somehow manages to give me a slight headache which is the first time a perfume has ever managed to do that!

It reminds me a bit of Burberry London, which I guess is the tiare flower? I don’t get much ylang ylang, but the vanilla and frangipani are there. It’s thick, creamy, oily and sweet. I could see this being worn all year round, as it’s warm enough to be worn in colder weather as a reminder of tropical summer holidays.

It is quite linear as others have said, very feminine, but I don’t have such a problem with projection and longevity. One spray on my wrist is enough to suffocate me for the whole day! It’s definitely a unique scent, in my collection at least, but it’s gorgeous. The bottle is stunning and I love having it sat on my desk in the box, but unfortunately something about it does make me feel ill and it’s too expensive to keep for the sole purpose of being a decoration, so I’ll have to part with it☹️

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: Lasts forever on paper, and not at all on skin.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: Beautiful presentation with a lovely tropical floral scent, similar to others. Very good performance. I like everything except for the price.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: I am in between in love and like with this perfume. The bottle is gorgeous. For me, this is a luxurious and comforting slightly powdery interpretation of 60's doll head meets Tipanie Monoi Oil meets a subtle grape-y bubblegum. It smells like modern take of a wealthy jet set woman in the 1960's all dolled up for vacation somewhere tropical--white eyeliner rimmed waterline, mascara on the lower eye lashes, pale pink lipstick, Monoi Oil on the skin and the hair volumized big. This isn't the local beauty of tropical places like Coqui Coqui Fleur Des Ilhes but a very beautiful visitor.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: A lovely yellow tropical floral with bubblegum, slight indole & vanillic undertones. Perfect for a trip to Bali or when you want a tropical escape from life’s everyday mundaneness. Performance could be better but it smells good. Soft and sweet. I get compliments on it.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: leans feminine very beautiful on a women or a man

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: Very beachy & tropical scent. Something to wear to a beach resort, if that’s your type of thing. It’s interesting enough but difficult to wear for most occasions. I think most people who aren’t actively thinking of the notes would interpret this as sunscreen, though in subtle ways its more complex than that. There is something enchanting about it as it dries down, but I’ll have to see how long it lasts.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content:
I agree with other reviews that this fragrance is more on the subtle side. Upon the first spray, you get a wonderfully creamy frangipani note, that then settles down to a warm skin-like scent, that smells like you've just spent the sunny afternoon laying in a field of tropical flowers, and slathering yourself in sunscreen. It's also a simple, linear fragrance, that sadly only lasts for an hour or so.

While the scent is genuinely nice, this is extremely overpriced. Right now, I can't find a bottle anywhere for less than $299. Honestly, I don't even think I'd buy this for $50. The scent is pleasant enough, but it isn't anything special, in my opinion, and the performance of the fragrance is sadly lacking.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: A subtle creamy yellow floral fragrance. Stays fairly linear but its well composed and very pretty, would be nice for layering in the spring or summer. Doesn't last at all neither does it project much. Maybe if you spray half the bottle you'll get whiffs of it for an hour. I can see the similarity with terracotta but with less of a presence. Layers nicely with Soleil blanc or any nice warm skin scent (l'ambre de merveilles hermes or jpg classique). Pretty bottle and name but overall unimpressive on its own.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: This is a pretty, feminine perfume but way too pricey for something that projects so little after an hour.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: So beautiful BUT on my skin you need to let it sit at least 10 minutes before its beauty is revealed. First spritz is a bit of an overwhelming mess and then suddenly each individual note appears and SHINES!! Creamy, strong frangipani scent similar but less synthetic than Guerlain Terracotta. Beautifully tropical and the perfect holiday scent. Very sexy.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: The ylang-ylang is strong on this one. I love it because it reminds me of my childhood when I used to pick ylang-ylang flowers from our backyard. Comforting to wear before going to sleep. The only problem is it is quite expensive.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: I tried it a couple of months ago at Saks on the blotter and I loved it, it lasted on the blotter all day. This pink bottle grabbed my attention as soon as I saw it here on fragrantica and thought I would love to add it to my collection. It's expensive so is not something I would just go and buy out of the blue specially since I have so many perfumes and had made the decision to barely buy anymore. Well, the other day I decided I would buy it so I applied for the Saks credit card and got 10%off. When I received it I applied it and it didn't smell as good as on the blotter, also it didn't last at all, maybe 1 hour at most but could barely smell it. I tried again the next day and the same thing happened. I always apply on clothing also and it was not there either, even as much as I love the beautiful bottle, heavy metal pink cap and packaging I made the decision to return it even if I also lost the 10% off discount. I will reconsider buying it if they make an intense version of it that actually lasts longer.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content:
I love this! I just wish so much that it wasn't quite so expensive... To my nose this is just a perfect creamy frangipani with a hint of vanilla. A couple reviewers below mentioned that it smelled like a creamy, oil like concoction and I 100% agree. This is like the best oily tropical flower vacation in a bottle. I wish this lasted a bit longer on my skin... It really fades away after about 3/4 hours. That being said, I did use a dabber sample; I wonder if it might last longer being sprayed?

Going off of memory, comparisons to other fragrances:

Soleil Blanc: Not so similar to my nose - this one doesn't have any of the sweet pistachio/coconut accords. Soleil Blanc is more edible and sweet and less floral to me.

Guerlain Terracotta: Definitely shares a similar vibe but this one is missing the coconut and jasmine in Terracotta. Terracotta's florals read very sweet jasmine on my skin. I love love love Terracotta too and i'm guess if you love one, you'd love the other.

Love Tuberose: Another of my all time favorites and definitely, again, similar creamy-sweet-floral vibe. This one has no tuberose and, on me, has less vanilla sweetness and more tropical flower sweetness (if that makes sense).

Beige: It's been ages since I've smelled it.... but I think I remember Beige being less tropical and more of a refined, easy going, every day floral. It's just more Chanel :)

Lastly, I wonder if anyone can compare this to Chantecaille's Frangipane? I haven't smelled in about 12 years... And, for that matter, i cant find it to purchase online anymore...

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content:
What a pretty name for a fragrance, and such beautiful packaging to go with it! I only bought the $20 sample, but even that comes in a lovely white linen-look case with gold engraving.

This definitely smells like summer. It has some suntan lotion vibes, and I also get the unmistakable hint of swimming pool smell, though it’s pleasant and not overwhelming.

The previous reviewer compared Chant for the Nymph to Terracotta, and I definitely see that similarity. However, Terracotta had some warm, doughy note that I personally found off-putting, and Nymph doesn’t have that note. To me, Nymph is the most similar to the discontinued Aqua Allegoria Lys Soleia (which also gets compared to Terracotta). I tried Nymph on my left arm at the same time as Lys Soleia on my right arm, and they were about 90% similar to my nose. They’re both sweet and summery in the same way. Lys Soleia was ever so slightly fresher, but I think most people would fail a blind smell test if they were trying to tell them apart.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: This smells like Guerlain Terracotta; especially in the drydown. It starts off more creamy in its opening but shorty thereafter I get hints of my beloved Terracotta. While it is still lovely with an absolutely beautiful and oh so feminine bottle, if you have Terracotta you don’t need this. Please visit my YouTube channel Deborah Day for more perfume reviews! xo.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: I know I don’t like it, i insisted to blindbuy it. Now here I am looking at the perfect bottle without having any courage to wear the juice inside. Tbh, smells like old woman.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: Hm Simple enough, I just don't think it's worth the $370 for 100ml price they want for it.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: Tropical scent at its best 🌴🌺 Gorgeous blend of vanilla with the tropical flowers in an exquisite bottle with decent longevity ( for Gucci ) and moderate sillage. I can still smell whiffs of it after an 8 hour wear. It radiates serenity when you need a peace of mind. One of the best blind buys for me in a long time❤️

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content: Soft, sweet, tropical and lovely! Frangipani is prevalent upon opening and in the dry down the ylang, tiare and some vanilla are prominent.

product_name: A Chant for the Nymph Gucci
review_content:
What a gorgeous scent in a gorgeous bottle. Honestly, I’m not into pink but this bottle is literally beautiful.

From the bottle, a bit exotic and oily scent was strong (I guess it’s frangipani) but in some time after I sprayed it on my wrist, ylang-ylang and tropical flowers started to head up. It smells a little bit plasticky, but all those tropical/ exotic flower fragrances are covered by creamy vanilla, which makes this scent balanced and pretty.

It’s quite a simple and straightforward scent. It does not really change as the time goes by but I don’t mind.

The name of this perfume is also beautiful, and matches the fragrance perfectly. Wearing this makes me feel like I’m in a mythical, tropical forest with yellow flowers.

product_name: Flora Gorgeous Gardenia Limited Edition Gucci
review_content: One thing that confuses me: my sample has a pear listed as the top note, and it is indeed very prominent when I spray it. Very fruity and juicy opening, but dries down to a heavier and sweeter syrupy smell. One reviewer said it's a bit bubblegummy, and I second that. I’m should supposedly be getting red berries initially, which are completely missing to my nose. Overall: like the opening, meh on the dry down. Not quite what I wanted it to be overall.

product_name: Flora Gorgeous Gardenia Limited Edition Gucci
review_content: Something about this scent just puts me in a good mood. It’s very juicy and sweet but not so much so that it becomes childish, the florals add just enough maturity to it to stop it from becoming sickening and heavy.
