I don’t get the VLJ comparisons honestly, to me this definitely has significantly more freshness that keeps it from being offensively creamy and fruity in the same way that VLJ is to me. There’s nothing incredible about this scent, but for what it is it was done very well. I blind bought this years ago and have never regretted it.

product_name: Flora Gorgeous Gardenia Limited Edition Gucci
review_content: I can't take this perfume seriously. The floral scent is okay but somewhat like smells bubble gum/ play dough to me. The performance is bad. I can't smell anything like 20 mins later after I sprayed it unless I get very close and sniff it on my skin. Disappointment.

product_name: Flora Gorgeous Gardenia Limited Edition Gucci
review_content: This perfume is nice, its a fruity floral and, to me it smells extremelyyy similar to Viva La Juicy Couture in the pink bottle. I used that one for many years and this instantly brought me back to that one. The dry down is slightly lighter though and the overall scent of this one is more mature than Juicy.

product_name: Flora Gorgeous Gardenia Limited Edition Gucci
review_content: I got this a few times as a sample and once as a miniature with the other five or so of this collection. There wasn’t any of them that I found overly appealing or anything special. There was one I liked and I can’t remember it’s name-clearly didn’t leave that big of an impression on me. Nice, but that’s about it...

product_name: Flora Gorgeous Gardenia Limited Edition Gucci
review_content:
This is like a more playful and whimsical cousin of Original Gucci Flora.
I think its lovely for spring. Got a sample and ordering a full bottle.

product_name: Flora Gorgeous Gardenia Limited Edition Gucci
review_content: There appear to be three versions of Gorgeous Gardenia, but I'm wondering if there are actual note differences or just bottle differences?

product_name: Flora Gorgeous Gardenia Limited Edition Gucci
review_content: it smells amazing, this is perfect for a blind buy. not too sweet, not too woody, just right!!!!!!! I am so sad that it is limited edition

product_name: Flora Gorgeous Gardenia Limited Edition Gucci
review_content: This is lovely, I like it, mix of warm florals, with some juiciness...i find it is less sweet than the original, but they are still quite similar in truth...I love the top notes, it has a fresh undertone, but the base is more gourmand, it isn't like groundbreaking, but it smells great, feminine, and definitely a tad more complex than the original...not sure I would buy it, but I would wear it...

product_name: Flora Gorgeous Gardenia Limited Edition Gucci
review_content: This is the opposite of what I expected, it's Flora Gardenia still but watered down not made stronger :/ And it's no sweeter despite the brown sugar, it's sort of fluffier and less fresh, which I guess is due to the pear being removed, or at least tuned down, also some faint marzipan. Like the original, this is better when it's dried down to almost nothing. That's how I wish they were all the way through.

product_name: Flora Gorgeous Gardenia Limited Edition Gucci
review_content: Not sure why the hate. It makes me smile everytime.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: managed to get a bottle of this for 60euros from a reseller. this smells like a blond slavic diva with big breasts in the early 00s. love it so much. unfortunately the latest version did not perform that well/

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: It looks like a treasure box, need to try this ASAP.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Will never forgive Gucci for discontinuing this

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Stunning 😍! This one is definitely my kind of fragrance! I love those moody sexy fragrances! If you like soft pretty florals this may not appeal to you. This is for the women who like the sexy sensual fragrances. It’s perfect for a date night or a bougie gala! There’s something creamy, perhaps the honey, that makes it a cozy comforting scent! I wish I purchased a larger bottle! Gorgeous!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Gucci by Gucci EDP is a sophisticated fruitchouly that balances well the sour notes from the underripe fruit, the sweetness from the honey and the dark woodiness of the patchouli. The creamy tiara, smoothens any rough edges.
Gucci by Gucci EDP is for the confident woman with impeccable taste and depth of character.
If you have it and tried it in the summer and found it overpowering, please revisit it on a cold winter evening, just enchanting.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Used to have this perfume about 15 years ago. It was such a heavy, rich warm scent. It smelled like old money. A love it or you hate it kind of perfume. Very classic and great for the fall/winter.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Love this scent! It’s the best thing I’ve ever smelled and brings back memories of the best days of my life. It’s such a shame that it’s discontinued. Does anyone know something similar that’s still available? Help a girl out! 🙂

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: My definition of old money perfume, it is rich and warm without being too sweet like most of fragrances in the market, it is a shame they discontinued it, I love Gucci guilty, but this is way superior. I am holding on my half-filled bottle till either I find another one or get over how much I love it !!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: One must truly love patchouli to be able to wear this fragrance. Big, big fruit-chouli

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I am looking for a bottle of this. I ran out of my favorite dark bottle. I have the lighter bottle of Gucci by Gucci, but it’s not my favorite. If anyone has one that still smells great, please let me know.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Nose Note #41

Great. Fruity, slightly sour and has a bit of darkness. To me it's just about unisex, I liked wearing it. On a woman it feels elegant and sophisticated. Not very loud, but lasts long.

Too bad we will never see it again.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I was hoping I'd love this, but for the first 20-30 minutes it smells like nail polish. I got a bottle from Mercari and it seems legitimate, but maybe it isn't? Maybe it's the patchouli? I don't know...The drydown is beautiful, but doesn't project much.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Absolutely beautiful fragrance. This was my mother's signature fragrance when I was a child, and I vividly remember when it was being discontinued, and we went around every perfume shop and department store in the area to purchase every last bottle we could find so she had a stockpile for a couple of years.

My mum passed in March and I picked up a couple of minis off Ebay to smell for the memories, and gosh, not only is it so nostalgic to me, but it is just a gorgeous, warm, sticky, deep syrupy fragrance. My mum was a fruitchouli woman through and through and this is an incredible fruit and patchouli combo with lashings of honey. I wish Gucci did not discontinue this, not only does it smell incredible, it also performs great. Safe to say the mini-memory-bottles will not suffice and I hope to purchase a full bottle, or two, of this one day.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Honeyed patchouli done so well. Here the patch just blends in with my skin and makes it incredibly warm and sexy instead of being too green and earthy like some patches are. I started by purchasing just the lotion, fell in love and recently acquired the perfume for a good price on mercari. To my nose the most similar perfume out there would be the Intense version of Coco Mad (the original is too green patch heavy and makes me sneeze!). This is unisex but fem leaning. I’m sad it’s discontinued!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I fall in love with this sophisticated fragrance every day. It just works ideally to lift my mood with the freshness.🥰

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Warm, cozy, honeyed, light patchouli. Unisex, hippie vibes. This is really unique. Different than anything I’ve come across—current and from years past. I like it, though may be even better in cooler weather.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I found it in my moms bathroom, she did not use it so i took it, it s almost full and it smells beautiful, dark and sexy but by the batch code it s almost 6 years old and the bottle was used a bit so i dont know if it s safe, if anybody knows please let me know. This smells like the bottle looks, maybe a bit off in my bottle cause it s old, but a warm sweet sexy not green not too dusty pachouli with white flower. I get the hype

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This is the only "unisex" perfume I love! It smells so pleasant and different.
Some users wrote that it reminds them of a glamourous hippie and indeed I look like one wearing this perfume: a dark leather jacket, a chic white blouse, nice pair of blue jeans and leather shoes, with some silver earrings, watch and bracelet, a dark nail polish and wavy and long dark hair. Simple and chic.
It is the perfect autumn fragrance to me and still holds a special place in my heart. Bought it around 2012 when I was a student, travelling a lot, enjoying and romanticizing life. It also gave me the image of the free spirited, optimistic, bold and beautiful woman I wanted to become.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Glamourous hippie, youthful but not juvenile, radiating warmth on day 1 at a music festival.
Unimpressed when I tried this a decade ago, but it’s grown into a love over time. The pear balances the guava here, rounds and softens the fruitiness, no sharp edges. The tiare flower is gorgeous, creates a wonderful sillage in high heat. The combo of patchouli, honey, and musk could resemble the skank experienced on day 3 of a music festival but not here. Instead, perfumer Ilias Ermenidis works some alchemy to create a clean, yet earthy, second skin effect. Big love for me.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Ordered a bottle from a seller on Mercari who was downsizing her perfume collection , I loooooove it ! Warm fruity patchouli . Makes me happy . Someone told me I smelled amazing while wearing it ! It’s July 84 degrees and wearing it with pride and ease !

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Scent and memory is an amazing thing. I had a sample of this way back in the day and I can still remember almost exactly how this smelt today. It's an amazingly beautiful fragrance and I wish I could get my little paws on a full sized bottle right now, especially since my nose has matured and even though I love the sweet and balanced fragrances, I love some of the mature styles too.

This is like a dark dreamy forest where magical and mythical classic book fairytales come to life (this is what I picture as the memory of this scent is so enchanting many pleasant surreal things spring to mind). There is something mysterious and haunting about this perfume and almost something slightly edible. This is perfectly balanced and ideal for both men and women. The patchouli isn't nasty or harsh/overpowering, every note is beautifully complimentary in perfect harmony.

When people say this reminds them of Britneys Believe they definitely mean the original formula (with the metal plate) the new version of believe isn't as lush or deep. Original Believe is so beautiful as well 😍

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Absolutely lovely. Warm, comfortable, and inviting, also grown up and well blended in the extreme. The patchouli here reminds me of that in Gucci Guilty and also Jimmy Choo. It's not a green patchouli, as in Coco Mademoiselle, but has a greenery about it, possibly owing to the guava.... Not sweet, not bitter, not sharp or tangy or tart to my nose. Just perfect! If you want to create a perfectly blended patchouli, this is your model.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Gucci Gucci does have a hippie vibe. Heavy on the patchouli but it is still wearable. The honey and fruity notes keep it fun and youthful. I agree w/ @Favabeans This is the fruitachouli mothership. A good way to describe this perfume. It isn't something I would buy now. I have enough fruitachouli's, they were something that was easy to get my hands on when I started collecting 2 years ago so the vibe here is a little played out for me, but they are wearable and crowd pleasing. That is why I own quite a few of them. You can wear them anywhere and around anybody most of the time. This reminds me of Judith Leiber's Topaz which I already have but I like Topaz more.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Smells like a glamorous hippie. Totally captures the Gucci essence, I can see Zoe Kravitz or Florence Welch smelling like this. This is extremely patchouli heavy and to my nose the fruitiness is fleeting or not there at all. Ordered a sample of this being that it's compared to one of my faves - Britney Spears 'Believe'. While the similarities are there with patchouli and guava, they are not the same. This one is way heavier, more mature, and suited for colder temperatures, whereas Believe is more refreshing and sweeter with the added clementine and better for warmer months. Since this is discontinued, I'm wondering if my juice went bad because I have tried this with sprays to the wrist and projection and longevity is weak to my nose. I will edit if my experience changes! PS. The bottle looks gorgeous.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Smelt lovely when I first sprayed it but it disappeared on my skin. What a bummer.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I used to own this fragrance before I became a fraghead :D I gave it to my mum, because while I loved the smell, it felt too grown up, sophisticated and stylish for me to wear to high school. Today I got a bottle of Adam Levine for Woman, which I blind bought because I wanted something like Santal Majuscule, and to me, upon first try it reminded me a lot of this... will be trying it out more, maybe I'm grown up enough for it now :p

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I thought Tom Ford Ombre Leather was impressive and unique! Then I smelled this...

This came out in 2007?! It's so ridiculously similar to Ombre Leather I can't even believe what I'm smelling. Different notes, but such a similar scent. To me, this perfume smells like a mix between Ombre Leather and David Yurman Limited Edition.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
DISCONTINUED FRAGRANCE REVIEW
NO.#12 / 10.

This is Britney Spears' "Believe" cashed-up auntie.
BS's (hehehe) "Believe" is a green, heavy, guava-and-earthy patchouli scent. "Gucci" is the same - just heavier with some honey.

I got a used bottle from eBay (because... Auntie's discontinued) and, as such, only spray it occasionally.

The green guava scent adds a decent amount of sweet juiciness, and the patchouli *really* grounds it (an 'earthy' pun? What a win). The patchouli is wildly noticeable here, so if you hate patchouli; it's pretty much guaranteed you'll hate this. Tiare flower is a more tropical flower, but...I honestly don't find this perfume particularly tropical as such. The honey is quite the nice and is absolutely most noticeable in the dry-down. It certainly mingles with the ever-present patchouli.
It's a heavy (probably because of that patchouli and white floral tiare flower) womanly scent that's kind of reminiscent of "Ricci Ricci" (not scent-wise at all), and the added sweet, luscious honey makes me think of a wealthy aunt who gives bear hugs and loans her over-the-top jewelry.

By the sounds of things, this used to be a powerhouse, but my bottle isn't. I can smell it, but it would never gas out a room of people. Unless I spray like an unchecked garden hose, it settles to a skin scent in half an hour.

Damn sturdy bottle. It's a good weapon for catapulting at your opponents.

Overall, not really my kind of scent. At least not until I become an aunt who wears tiares (see what I did there?) and chunky bracelets. But - hey - there's still time.

P.S. Is anyone else a little bewildered by all the scents by Gucci called..."Gucci"? How many do we need? Can we get a team together who can conjure up some more original names? I suggest someone in marketing.

***

Kitty rating: 6.5/10.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I was lucky enough to score 75ml bottle + 200ml lotion (from private collector I know personally)
I am in Guava Pear Patchouli Honey HAVEN.
WTH Gucci? Bring this back! I know this consider to be “fruitchouli” and not unique by current standards….but DARN ….this is delicious. It is sweet but not candy sweet, its a rich sweetness with a lot of depth and warmth, that makes it sophisticated, sexy and cosy at the same time.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I hate all the notes listed in this one, but I love the fragrance! Actually it's the only gucci I like and own!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This could be a lovely scent if the patchouli wasn’t there messing it up totally

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Just wearing this again today, I forget how great it is, as there’s so many new things to try and wear and I haven’t revisited it in a while.
One spray on my arm is filling the room.
It’s sooooo good. Could easily be a niche release in this day and age.
Batch code on my current bottle is in the 8000s, I have many others in the cupboard that I can check but I know they all smell the same as I give them all one spray to check before storing away.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: after falling in love with a sample of the 2007 vintage, i bought a bottle off ebay without box, and no batch code. yes, i was silly and asking for trouble. can anyone narrow down the production date based on the manufacturing location? it's Scannon SA, F-75008 Paris.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This fragrance was unique. Smells like money. Smart, sexy money.

One time (early 2000s) I walked past David Duchovny while wearing this. He interrupted his own conversation to say “God DAMN, you smell good.” I felt like a bad b and smelled like one, too.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This legendary one time beauty was inexplicably discontinued a few years ago. Found a genuine bottle from 2018, but alas, it's an incredibly watered down reformulation. A shadow of its former self. This used to be a thick and heavy room filler with just a single spray, and it would last for ages. This version lasts one hour, two hours tops, and even grossly overspraying won't help. No, it's not my memory, nor is it my nose. Just read the reviews below. Many are experiencing the same thing. Those with great performance are the people with vintage bottles.

Fruity, honeyed patchouli that is to die for. Well, at least it was, once upon a time. THE most intoxicating, most glamorous and sexiest scent I have ever smelled on a woman.

Requiescat In Pace.

SHAME ON YOU, GUCCI! *shakes fist*

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I have a 2017 version of this. It’s not at all like I remember it being :/ it’s a lot of pear and guava and with a dark patchouli honey base. But it used to be sooooo much thicker and darker. This is totally watered down. It’s a travesty that they reformulated this and completely ruined it.

Only good thing is though that this is now wearable during the day to the office and I can get a nice fix of patchouli whenever I want :)

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: One of my favourites. When I first bought it, I thought it was an old lady perfume. I've had this bottle for 6 or 7years and have grown into it. It is the most inoffensive and non irritating cheap perfume I have. Longevity is great. My bottle is from 2013 and it's divine.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I used it a long time ago, although it is no longer produced, I found it somewhere and bought it. It opens with guava and pear. I feel a very intense sharpness and sourness at the opening, the perfume turns into a beautiful and sophisticated honey scent as it stays on the skin. With patchouli, the perfume gets rid of being too sweet. Frankly, I don't like the opening because I get a sour/metallic feel, but then it turns into a really nice smell. It's a unique scent for me. It is neither too fruity nor too sweet nor too woody. I like it more in winter, but it can be used in summer evenings by paying attention to the number of sprays.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: There must be batch differences or people’s perceptions are vastly different. I have a tester purchased in 2021. This could never be described as “light” or “fruity” in general to me. It is a heavy patchouli fragrance with thick guava. Not sweet or fresh. 8/10 only because this is a very formal scent, requires cold weather and the right occasion with good ventilation. Serious heavy vibe, excellent for what it is @perfumisabunny

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Unlike any perfume I’ve been able to find, I’m so sad it’s discontinued, and I’ve resorted to buying from eBay. I’m not sure how someone has managed to buy a reformulated one, unless I’ve missed something? I’ve used this since it’s release, and there was only one version and then it was discontinued, and is no more. Eden perfumes do a similar scent called Bye Goochi, but it’s not quite the same (although the dry down is very very similar, so it will have to do when I can’t source it anymore!).
Th EDTof this is my signature, wear anywhere, any time scent. It matches any outfit, work, date, sleep, it’s sooo versatile. I love the EDP too, but the EDT beats if for me, as the dry down is slightly fresher, both are amazing though and I have back up bottles of both!
I’m not a fan of Gucci in general, I quite like bamboo and once used a bottle of it after a blind buy on a plane, but gucci by Gucci is such a stunning scent, so well put together I don’t even have words to describe how it smells. For those saying it doesn’t last maybe it’s a bit of noseblindness? As although the sillage isn’t huge, this lasts so long on me, I can literally smell it the day after I’ve sprayed it. Love it.
Edit: I can still smell this as a skin scent the day after I sprayed it, the edt has gone though.

Edit. Just adding that I’ve bought this perfume regularly since it’s release. There has been no difference between my vintage bottles from the time of release or the newer ones I’ve bought or been gifted in 2018, 2019 and 2020. I’ve bought many, many bottles of this and the EDT, and due to keeping back up bottles I can directly compare different years. These are my signature scent, I would know. All my bottles are stored in the cool and dark.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I was able to get a vintage bottle of this recently and my friend bought a current bottle and we compared them, they smell similar at first spray on top, but the drydown of the vintage is amazing where the current formulation falls flat, and smells like BO. Reformulation of perfume today is truly an olfactory tragedy.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I find it difficult to put my finger on this one. I notice the honey the most, and light sweet flowers. I wish this was a little stronger as I think it has the potential to be really beautiful but doesn't stand out enough. Still very wearable and the little horsebit on the bottle is charming.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: A good mix of patchouli and honey added with a hint of juicy guava. I really really love the scent but it doesn't perform and last that well on me. It smells very soft and sits close to the skin. Maybe I'm used to stronger perfumes such as Alien by Mugler so this one feels "not that noticeable" for me. But still, I love to wear this for date night or just going to bed.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I wear this everytime I go out at night time, it makes me feel soo confident and like anything could happen :) I love how deep it it is without beeing sweet. My perfect ember <3

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Agree with Violinhead8120 - Beautiful scent but no longevity at all, all the yumminess of honey and patchouli gone in less than an hour.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: It's marketed as women perfume but smells more to unisex. Moderate projection & quite soft but long lasting 👍🏻 heavy patchouli+honey indeed but it's not a sweet honey...

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is a stunningly beautiful honey and patchouli fragrance. Perfect for autumn or winter - day or night (but like, a cozy night in or a really low key cozy bar, not a date night or "night out" scent). I even like to put this on before bed when it's cold because it just feels so warm and comforting. It doesn't have a lot of longevity, but that's ok with me. I actually blind bought this fragrance (second hand as I think it's been discontinued) and I ended up loving it so much that I bought a backup!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
(Here’s my Un-entertaining, all too long, painfully informative review here lol - please keep this in mind before reading on). Gucci by Gucci is pleasant in theory, definitely unisex, and I would love to have it as my boss-woman signature....but there’s no longevity. The scent disappears from my skin within 1 hour, and 2 hours if I have my skin covered with fabric where I sprayed the fragrance. Unacceptable. I have colognes that last longer. I had to double check to make sure they didn’t accidentally send me a Gucci by Gucci Eau de cologne. Nope. It definitely has EDP on the label. Overspraying does NOTHING to help the longevity, either. If I spray it anywhere skin has to Be exposed? Forget it. 1 hr MAX. My bottle was manufactured in 2018 with batch code 8016, so it is more than likely a dreaded reformulation (this is my first time trying this fragrance). How do people get such good longevity with this? Maybe I become anosmic to some patchouli heavy fragrances. Jimmy Choo EDP is the only patch-dominant fragrance that I can smell on my skin for 8+ hours. I definitely become anosmic to another patch, Chanel Coco Mademoiselle, after a couple of hours, and I discovered that on days when people were making pleasant remarks about my fragrance 6+ hours after I had applied Chanel Mademoiselle and I told them thanks, I could not smell it on myself at all - so that was very much a pleasant surprise that my scent was perceived by others in spite of me not being able to do so.

Gucci EDP has quite low to nonexistent projection even from the initial spray, and I have to put my arm directly underneath my nose to smell it when I first apply it, so it’s very faint but has presence (at least for a full hour lmao) whereas with Mademoiselle, I get actual strength from it, and can at least catch wafts of it radiating off my skin for a couple of hours. Not with Gucci. I’d be lucky to smell myself after 1 hour and then it disappears completely. So with that said, I’m leaning towards this being a dud for my skin chemistry, sans anosmia.

The opening is just a patch and musk and a tiiiiny smidgen of raw honey and.... dare I say a hint of chocolate?? Cacao?? My nose definitely picks up on some cacao. The opening of this fragrance takes itself moderately seriously and professionally without being stuffy, standoffish or unfriendly, and so that should match the person who wears it.

The dry down of this fragrance on bare uncovered skin is where everything falls apart - I never get the beautiful, UNIQUE dry down that I get when I have fabric covering my skin... So, with bare skin, the dry down of this just turns murky, stale, no fruits, and the fragrance Always just falls apart, BUT if my skin is covered with fabric after I apply the perfume, the strangest thing occurs: it almost ‘lifts’ and transforms into a slightly brighter, more feminine version of itself with the fruits flanked by beautiful patchouli and honey. The dry down makes the fragrance still professional and serious, but lighter, friendlier, calmer but still with an ambitious competitive edge, and still with a penchant of taking no bs, which is what I want my scent to evoke. Even then, I only get to experience this beautiful dry down for 30 min. Weird. Extremely unique for being a designer, but I’ll never know....

I’ll be selling this.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
My queen bee scent.

It's not discontinued but they've changed the formulation. It doesn't smell like it used to smell 10 years ago.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I love love love this perfume, its addictive, its my all time favorite go to perfume every day - I never tire of it - its sweet yet dark maybe even slightly spicy, its intriguing and alluring. Its a gorgeous balance between the patchouli/musk and honey/pear - I don't get any floral from it and its not so heavy to give me a sore head (so many perfumes do). Its not a 'young fun' fragrance its warm, sophisticated, unique, amazing. I keep reading that its being discontinued - its hard to get in stores but I can still find it online so will stock up and hope to find something else I love in case they do discontinue it. I'd like to say its underrated - but then I wouldn't want everyone to discover it!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
The opening was promising, but this dried down to a slightly more cloying version of Narciso Rodriguez (if I recall correctly; the EDT) on me. I love that one on others, but, eventhough I want it to, it just doesn't suit me.

My fiancé agreed, he also liked it but he said it was too "lovely and friendly" for my personality. (Whatever that implies 😏.) Where I associate this with a flirty and preppy professional, he was reminded of a "very sweet and cuddly grandmother".

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: had this back in 2007. Wasn't interesting to me.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Testing from a rollerball sample.

Whenever I see this perfume, I think of KathleenLights, because she really loves this one. I can see why. It's a sweet, honeyed patchouli, with an interesting guava note. The guava doesn't read as straight up fruity ripe guava, but a perfumey guava, sweet in a fruity way, like a guava filled pastry, to give this perfume that something unique it needs to prevent it just being another patchouli.

Gucci by Gucci is also VERY musky on me. It gets warmer and muskier, the patchouli gets a little crisper even as it dries down, to cut through the musk and honey. The patchouli is clean, but the honey is warm and maybe a tiny bit animalic, and the combined effect is perfect for the '70s advertising they have for this perfume. It does smell a little retro, sensual in a hot skin kind of way. I used to get a "bad breath" smell from this on my skin, luckily I don't smell that anymore.

I like it, it's different and more daring than other fruity pathcoulis out there. I see it's more widely available online than it used to be, so that's a great thing if you love this fragrance!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: It is very long lasting lasts for days rly, the silage fills the whole apartment only from one spray. Not for me rly, it gives me headache, my mom likes it, I dont so make sure u try this before buying it, it is either love or hate, no in between.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I checked the serial number of this fragrance and it said it was manufactured in 2019 . So it was still being made up until last year . Not discontinued?

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I really hate it when I LOVE a discontinued perfume!

Anamandy's review is exactly how I perceive it, a perfume centered around a Woody Spicy Sweet Patchouli with a backstage of fruit and floral, I can't discern them individually.

It's intoxicating and mouthwatering good without actually being a gourmand.

Whenever I smell it, Gucci No3 that I used and loved so long ago pops in my head, I might be hallucinating or maybe something is in common..

Bad Gucci for taking this away!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: The patchouli in this smells a bit like plastic and more than anything, METAL. It's a little sweet but a bit bitter, as well, it's a crossmix between feminine and masculine, but still stays more on the feminine side. I've DEFINITELY smelled it somewhere before, but around over a decade ago. I think my godmother used to wear this. I can't put my finger on any of the notes, other than patchouli, when I wear it. It's so odd. I pride myself on having a good nose, but it just smells like patchouli ft. perfume rather than a perfume with patchouli in it. It's a woody, sharp patchouli, and I don't get the guava AT ALL. I wish it did have more fruity notes incorporated in it, though - just to elevate it a bit and make it more wearable. I don't think it's awful, but I do see why it got discontinued (giving no offense at all to those who adore it - i apologize it got discontinued to those who really love it), I'm just stating that I can see why many dislike it, if that makes sense. It's a matter of skin chemistry here. It just doesn't smell "all that" on me.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Back in the day, I used to "blind buy" fragrances all the time. Many a time, I was left unimpressed and disappointed in the purchase. I believe it was due to my impulsiveness and inexperience. When I was just learning about fragrances, I wasn't sure what all the notes smelled like from the description so I was more willing to throw caution to the wind when making a purchase. Fast forward 10 years. I know what I like and what I don't like now. I know what notes I'm drawn to and which ones I'm not. I now have an instinct that is much more hoaned, when making a blind buy. I am happy to report that I am very rarely let down from blind buy purchases I make nowadays.
Working in a store that carries fragrances is both exciting and daunting. So many fragrances to research! Haha
I take my time and I look at every one and then I google the ones that I am most interested in to read about the notes, the prices, the availability and finally, the reviews. I take all of that information into account before I jump at a blind buy now.
When the feeling of confidence kicks in, I go for it! Or, if I'm feeling really unsure, I take a pass. Sometimes I'll research a scent for hours before making my mind up but in the end, all the digging around is worth it.
I finished work on Thursday and decided to take a look at the fragrance section before leaving for home. (Believe it or not, I do not do this every day! Haha)
I knew that we had just received a large shipment in of fragrance in that day and was eager to see what we had. I picked up two for men (Versace Oud Noir and Gucci Made to Measure) and three for woman (Gucci by Gucci, Versace Vanitas and Dolce and Gabbana Light Blue.)
I stood there with my phone and looked up all of them. No to the Oud, too manly. No to Made to Measure, too boring. No to Vanitas, too similar to Chloe, which I despise. No to Light Blue, has been reformulated and is now screechy.
Hmmmmm.........Gucci by Gucci. Ding, ding, ding..........we have a winner!!!
59.99 for a 50 ml. bottle plus my employee discount, not bad!
Unboxed it when I arrived home and smelled the nozzle. I knew instantly that I was going to love it. I wore it the following day and had that huge sigh of relief, knowing that I had made the right decision.
When I first sprayed it on (I always do 2 or 3 sprays on my chest/tummy area) I noticed a "stinky" note but it didn't scare me, I knew it would settle down and it did. I'm hit or miss with patchouli but it's smooth in here. The musk is light and also smooth. The honey brings a sweetness but it's also smooth and gentle. Overall, it's smooth and well blended and to me, it's a confident, sexy, "power" scent. It's not in-your-face or aggressive. It sneaks up on you, gives you a warm hug and steals a kiss! Alluring!
I've read other reviews stating that they wished it was spicier but I think we have enough spicy scents out there already. I think that this one is perfect just as it is. Absolutely stunning for cooler seasons.
Lasts all day on me and I continually get wiffs of it whenever I heat up and am moving around.
The bottle itself is also drop-dead gorgeous!
It's sad that it's been discontinued but I'll certainly enjoy it to the very last drop!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Wow!! What IS this???? I have a decant from generous Fragrantician and had no expectations one way or another, other than her reassurance that it is gorgeous, and that it is. I am completely baffled at the notes listed here, because this plays on me like a resinous, amber-y, woody oriental. If that is from patch and honey, all I can say is that I have never encountered a patch like this! This is not your hippy variety patchouli, and as Amandy points out below, it's apparently the source of the delicious woodiness. I swear I smell amber! I get no guava, no distinct tiare, and no pear. Gucci is a whole. What I mean to say is that if you smelt an apple, your brain would say "That smells like an apple!", or if you smelt a vanilla bean you would think "That smells like vanilla!". What I am quite inelegantly trying to say is that Gucci smells like Gucci on me. I can not break it down or isolate any single note. It does remind me of TF Noir de Femme a bit, but the notes listed in NdF fit what I am smelling. This is a very interesting and beguiling fragrance indeed!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Hello 👋🏻
Okay so .. Not what I was expecting at all based on the reviews I read..
It actually is how do I explain this - A FRESH slightly sweet woody (spicy scent)
I know there is no wood in the notes but combined with the honey and the patchouli it creates that result

If you like deep scents and one one that you can wear during the day that is going to stand out and not annoy ppl in say a date/ an office setting/ movie theatre but be addictive , then go for it .
Reminds me a little of Gucci rush vibes and Hugo boss deep red - in those category of perfumes.
Youthful Classy 22-48 yrs old 8/10
Crowd pleaser 8/10

Silage 7/10
Staying power 7.1/10
Gift worthy safe 8.8/10
Memorable 7.9/10- 8.3/10 depending on how you dress ( matches neutral colour clothes or shades of white black or cream not grey coloured clothes too warm to suit that)

Best of luck and happy Purchasing lovelies

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I don't understand the patchouli note in this scent. I don't smell it – at least not in the traditional hippy way. Nor am I getting it in an earthy way, as is in Prada Amber. Nor is it green. What I am getting is a gorgeous, satiny wood. I am really amazed by that considering there is no wood listed in the notes for this fragrance. If I were to visualize this fragrance it would be glossy, like a sleek, smooth, polished piece of ebony wood. The fact that this has no wood sent me on a search to find out more about the Patchouli plant itself. I was able to find out that there are several varieties that are shrubby, and the sap is often extracted from their woody stems and put to various uses. The most widely used this way are Java Patchouli and Indonesian Patchouli, which are prized for their sleek wood notes. If that is the type of patchouli used here that could explain the beautiful wood notes I'm smelling.

When taken as a whole, this composition is very rich. The fruit, honey and spice notes are very light, seemingly only there to accentuate the beautiful patchouli. I'm not getting Tiare outright but there is a creamy, buttery richness to this composition that could only be attributed to that. But it is the Patchouli that is the star here and in its present form is extremely seductive, sexy, and glamorous.

I'm still finding it hard to believe that a note I normally dislike so much can be so beautiful. But from first spray to the silky end this was a head over heels love for me. I am so sad this gorgeous scent was discontinued. I am actually baffled by that.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This is a memorable and very unique perfume. Sooo sexy, sweet, spicy and ultra glamorous. You will stand out wearing this. It's one of my favorites. I love the unexpected notes and how well they blend. Patchuli is toned down and made modern blending with the honey. White florals and guava and pear are so delicious and add sweetness without being gourmand. It's mysterious without being dark, and spicy without being heavy or too young. This is a masterpiece. I love it.

So sad it was discontinued, this is far superior to Premiere which I feel was probably meant to replace this. Premiere is much softer and more powdery. Feels more makeup country and less special. This on the other hand is a masterpiece. I hope they decide to relaunch it, because this is like nothing else out there.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This was my first ever 'real' perfume purchase. My husband loves this scent on me and he is very picky and hates perfume in general, so that says something! This scent is special.
To my nose, this is a spicy honey scent - honey with cloves, cardamom and a hint of cinnamon. Very feminine, strong woman, sexy vibes. Not for the faint-hearted.
I will continue to adore this scent until my bottle lasts.❤️

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This fragrance can be summed up in one word, intoxicating.

The honey and patchouli are a match made in heaven. The light and airy sweetness of the guava compliments it so nicely, not leaving it sickly sweet on the skin. It has a bit of a bitter thing going on but in all the right ways. This isn't a dusty patchouli at all, it's a deep, almost chocolatey one.

I know this fragrance has been sadly discontinued but if you can get your hands on a bottle, do it!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I found it at a duty free store for 15 bucks! They were selling off the store, I really like this scent, to me smells like a fancy girl

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Another legendary perfume discontinued... i dont get this industry

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: So upset that this was discontinued, it is by far the best fragrance to ever come from the house of Gucci, with incidentally their best ever packaging. The opening is a hit of unadulterated, juicy guava, then it quickly transitions to a carnal, musky, deep scent, reminiscent of NR For Her but much sexier - luscious and dripping with honey. The fruits are subtle, which is exactly how I like my fruits; the patchouli is deep and earthy, and beautifully blended; the honey is sensual and inviting. There is the slightest hint of second hand tobacco that lingers after a decadent night out. This is dark glamour in a bottle, a very voluptuous scent, warm, sultry and oozing confidence.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
The opening notes of patchouli reminded me a lot of Midnight Poison, and this nostalgia is the primary reason why I got Gucci by Gucci. Of course, patchouli is really the only thing these two share together but it's still better than nothing.

Either way, Gucci comes with a powerful burst of patchouli which later reveals a beautiful cool toned, almost icy tiare flower scent which starts dominating the overall composition. The dry down adds a very delicate honey and white flower base with some remnants of patchouli. As for pear and guava, unfortunately I didn't seem to notice them no matter how much I'd spray on. The scent is still gorgeous, refreshing and quite unique. It would be really interesting to see whether it'll perform great during warmer days.

Gucci by Gucci left a pretty decent trail but I wish it was somewhat more long lasting because the scent is so fantastic that you'd want it around you for longer.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
When this was still available in stores, I accidentally soaked my whole nose area with a leaky tester bottle that I wanted to sniff. Of course I didn‘t try it again soon, and then it was gone from the shelves. I remembered it as a sharp but good fruitchouli, and got me a sample not too long ago to retest, mainly because I love guava scents.

When I first used it, it smelled so different from what I remembered. Guess a soaked nose is not the same as one little spray on the arm. Not very fruitchouli-like at all.
The tiare note is really strong at first, it smells warm and creamily floral like monoi oil, but with a dirty patchouli underneath. The patch reminds me of the original Mugler Angel, but the rest of scent is different and quite unique. The overall feeling of the fragrance is tropical to my nose, but the notes shift in and out. Sometimes I smell sweaty patch, sometimes sexy warm skin, sometimes a clean honey-shampoo, sometimes fruitiness. Even after several tries I‘m not 100% sure what to make of it - It can be warm and sensual, but then a scratchy note emerges that really ruins it for me, something artificially clean.
So, in the end I think Gucci by Gucci has really nice and interesting notes, but it could be done better. I would love some more juicy guava instead of that scratchy-clean thing. Not for me, but I could imagine that this really depends on the wearer‘s skin and works better on others.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This smells like sex in a bottle: it is so delicious, warm and sensual. I love the Gucci scents, so it was no surprise I loved this as well.
I didn't find it masculine, it is a real musky/patchouli vibe (I love patchouli on its own too). So much depends on how a perfume works with your body chemistry: this one, for me, is a winner.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: i have a miniature of the edt, and a full bottle of the edition de luxe. they are wonderfu. this is what i thought guilty absolute would smell more like based on the tester but i was let down. this is warm but not suffocating, woodsy fruit, like berry syrup on pancakes in a cabin in the woods

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I went to the store and tried it on after reading lovely reviews. My friend absolutely loved it on me. It smells like dark enchanting woods. Gucci by guuci has that allure about it. It lasts for good 8hrs on me, give or take which a feat in itself since nothing lasts that long on me. It smells of wet soil mostly which is all patchouli, also sweet and fruity at the same time. Maybe that's the guava and honey in it. It's a great combination. It's cool but without being chilling. It's a lovely fragrance for a night out.
The store I went to had a last few bottles left then and I had to buy it. It's a shame that it got discontinued. It's such a timeless fragrance. I cannot fathom why anyone would do so.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I have just recently written under another heading (Paco Rabbane's Black Excess Los Angeles) how the fruity + just enough woods & musks & resins etc to keep it from smelling literally like a bunch of fruit is a standard idiom that 'fume-houses very often have recourse to for their 'flankers', and which can get very boring!

But this is the mother-ship of that idiom! ... the one that sets the bar. I loved it instantly the first time I tried it ... I can't remember exactly how long ago - but a fair while; and even now I can't fathom what it is that it smells like; it just is what it is - it smells like Gucci Gucci & gorgeous & inscrutible, and that's about all that can be said, really - it's such a beautifully integrated whole - sufficient unto itself!

One thing I can say about this though is that it sets my déja-vu haywire - some 'fumes do that - some more than others: and this one does it to me a very great deal ... but without ever connecting with a specific memory. I think the explanation when that happens might be an early encounter with someone wearing it - possibly a very brief one ... and also possibly a very long time before.

And I also agree wholeheartedly that discontinuing this is just completely insane - about as insane as Creed's discontinuing Bois du Portugal. But I cannot fathom marketting 'logic' ... can anyone fathom it? ... including the markettors themselves!

Sometimes I wonder whether it's because they just can't anymore - whether some crucial constituent has ceased to be available, and they would rather scrap it than be putting-out an inferior generation of it. At least that would make sense ... infact not only make-sense, but show-forth a certain integrity.

The consensus here seems to be that this is patchouli-dominated. A very versatile note, patchouli, isn't it: the number of times I've thought "no! there isn't patchouli in that!" ... & then on further consideration have begun to perceive how it 'slots in'.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I'm in love with this scent! It smells just like sweet honey. The patchouli makes it sexy. This lasts all day. I wish they didn't discontinued this.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This is one of the most sophisticated fragrances i ever knew
I think it starts quite like Narciso Rodriguez for her.
Then it gets sweeter and sweeter, I can definitely smell guava, like pure guava in the middle.
And by the end there is a hint of honey and a bitter scent that I cannot identify.
A bit powdery, a bit fresh... quite intriguing. Sillage is discrete. But also sexy, you smell it if you get close.
Sophisticated. I would say that this is the perfume for a Lady Boss....
Smells like power. Like a CEO lady that bosses people around the company wearing her perfectly adjusted outfit..LOL
NO, definitely, this fragrance is for a strong woman. Who is in charge. In control.
I love it. It is my business fragrance. And yes, I am a Capricorn.
Someone mentioned below that it is a Very suitable fragrance for capricorn females.
I agree.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I really like this fragrance. I like most Gucci frags, they are beautifully balanced but I also noticed that they develop better and have greater sillage if your skin is warmer.
This little number is another example of blending done right. Yes, the patchouli does take the front stage, but for no longer than an hour, and it isn't bad. The drydown is a sophisticated interplay of honey and patchouli. For me, it is a scent that I would go to on those day I can't decide what mood I am in as it does have that neutral sort of aura, and I think it's important to have one of those, for me anyway. Good sillage (better if your skin is warmer) and longevity.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Gucci EDP is mainly patchouli and guava on my skin. Patchouli and guava are naturally quite bitter, so this fragrance is also quite bitter and sharp. The honey makes it somewhat sweeter, but the bitterness rules in this fragrance. In the drydown there's some musk and tiare flower, but I'm missing some depth and softness here.
Sillage is moderate, longevity is about 6-7 hours.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This fragrance introduced me to the world of chypres and I have never looked back.

My first encounter with patchouli (one of my favourite notes since). Very well done! Honey is tricky on me, but the way it blends with patchouli and Tiare here is just wonderful. This comes off as cool and earthy, with a little sweetness from the tiare and guava. Works really well during cold, rainy weather.

My only issue with this one is the longevity. I am willing to overlook the poor sillage as long as it lasts at least 4 hours. Not so with GGI. Still, I will have this in my arsenal for as long as it's readily available.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I reach for Gucci when I'm feeling a little mysterious and confident. The EDP version is my favorite of the two, the EDT was just a little boring to me. But mmm the darker, honeyed EDP...It's rich, classy and sexy smelling.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Nice dark well designed fragrance. Long lasting with well balanced notes. It may be mistaken for niche fragrance, and it is a massive compliment.
I keep repurchasing it, as it is one of these scents that I like to go back to.
10/10 from me!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: smells like mess

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This perfume is disgusting. Just a mature scent that made me nauseous. I guess I could see a 55 year old wearing this? But not me. It smells like Patchouly and cigarettes somehow. Awful!!!!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Very lovely opening. Fresh and fruity, which smelled great combined with the tropical tiare. The opening/mid don't last very long however, since a very spicy patchouli shows up rather quick. It is balanced by the musk/honey notes. The honey is not the sticky kind; it's more of the translucent, powdery veil kind of honey. A very nice rendition of the note, imo. The patchouli kind of ruins it on my skin, it's too earthy/spicy/dark. According to friends, this Gucci smells like an 'oriental shop' on me, which is not a good thing. Longevity is great and sillage is huge.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I immediately get tropical fruit punch-y guava and juicy pear from this. The honey is mild, mostly serving as an undercurrent for the fruit for the first few minutes. This perfume changes considerably as it dries down, which is rare for me to experience. It becomes muskier and more animalic as it dries, which I like. Surprisingly complex. This feels mature for me until it rounds out. It reminds me of my auntie until then. Best sprayed lightly.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This perfume reminds me of Narciso Rodriguez EDT, has a type of masculinity, sexy, and mysterious, I think Narciso's perfume lasts more on me and the musk within gives a deeper rich mixture ;)

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
عندما اتحدث عن عطور المرأة
غالباً ما اختار تلك الروائح و ليست العطور
تلك النسائم المغوية ، تلك التي تملأ الرجل بالآثام
تلك التي تحدث ربكة في المكان
تلك التي يجب ان تكون قريبة لجسمها
فانتشارها مصيبة ، فوحانها في المكان غيرُ آمنٍ عليها ..!!
..
هذا العطر ينتمي لتك المجموعة
نفحات تشبه عطور نارسيسو
جميل لابعد مدى ، ثابت و كثيف
..
سأحصل عليه قريباً ، انت تنتمي لمجموعتي الماجنة

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
@JellyBeanTree

This fragrance will be discontinued soon. =

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I purchased a lot which included a 1 oz bottle of this scent, but then forgot about it! I was looking for something else today and found this one, so I decided to finally sample it. At first I wasn't sure what to make of it, but I thought I'd just ignore it for a while and see what happened. There is a floral element here that I'm not all that fond of, but it's not terrible and it does create some contrast. Otherwise, I really like it, (the notes seem right but there also seems to be a hint of something incense-like as well) and I was thinking it reminded me of something else, perhaps Phoenix by Keith Urban or EL's Sensuous Noir or Jesus Del Pozo's In Black. It's hard to compare these because I can only handle these scents once or month or more, but I do like them occasionally. At this point I'll keep the bottle and give it another chance before deciding to swap it.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
If you love perfumes like casmir and chergui, you will love this.
Its thick sweet and balmy with a medical and small masculine touch.
Its very dark and sexy.
Its not something I would usually go for but i will use my little sample up.
I also smell a lot of amber in this.
Highly suggest trying it before its hard to find.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This perfume is definitely a Signature scent Type. One you can be remembered by. IT gives the wearer the feeling of being the centre of the party, the woman talked about and written about. Of someone who is definitely inside and being commented on. This perfume is not for wishful and dreamy girls. The ad suits this frag 100%. Even if you don’t possess a natural "allure", this will lend it to you. Even the dullest of the dullest (pardon my french, I am only trying to make a point ) will come across as a woman of mystery. Dark and dangerous, definitely not a grinning naive bud. Wear it when you want to prevail, when you don’t want to be a victim and it will keep you afloat. This is a perfume for a woman who is determined to live and accepts that life isn't all ROSES. A masterpiece by Gucci.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
first minutes: chocolate + jasmine + patchouli - dark somewhat dirty mix
after 15 minutes: beautiful crystaline tiare flower + crispy pear/guava. Spacious.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Weird. I wonder if there's something wrong with my sample, or this fragrance just doesn't work with my body chemistry at all...'tis nothing like what so many of you describe.
There's almost no sillage whatsoever (have to basically rub my nose on the spot to smell it), short longevity and the scent feels somewhat sharp.
I get patchouli with an almost undetectable hint of honey and LOTS of musk. Quite unpleasant.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: It is a very good composition. I love the patchouli in it. But Had to scrub it in half an hour because the guava became too overwhelming.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Does anyone know, has this one been reformulated too? I have a mini of this, i suppose it's older and i smell a very nutty note, its delicious. I also bought a new 50 ml bottle today and its smells nothing like the mini! at all, so dissapointed! i bought the new one in a big chain of perfumeries os no chance of fakes i suppose. what a bad idea this was, i hope I can sell it away..

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I could never understand why anybody wanted this fragrance because I find it revolting. It puts me in mind of someone eating a strong curry in a church with wafts of incense floating around.
I know it must suit some people beautifully because it sold well when I was working in Myer for Trimex.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: dark, strong ,bitter and sweet . just for winter.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
GUCCI BY GUCCI edp..
Another perfume that is slowly bidding us goodbye, slowly making its exit, fading away.
In my country, it is EXTREMELY difficult to find it , searched every mall and every perfume counter, the salespersons would shake their heads at me "no, we dont have that here anymore". It is a rare item, you'd have to risk ordering online on Gucci website, which is not an option for me at all.
One day i got lucky, found a miniature bottle of this in a secluded perfume shop and i was over the moon.
It's deep, mysterious and mature scent. Not exactly sexy or seductive. I cant imagine young girls wearing this scent to college. I wont use this for datenights either but definitely yes when im in a presentation at work with grim hard-to-please bosses , put on my most persuasive smile, some twinkles in my eyes , strut my confidence around the room, drowning them with my GUCCI BY GUCCI EDP.
.

To me, oddly enough, GUCCI OUD and GUCCI BY GUCCI EDP smell alike. They could be sisters..? I know if one miserable day i cant find Gucci by Gucci anywhere else anymore, i can always pick up Gucci Oud to replace it and blow out my sorrows.
What do you think?
They DO smell alike , right..? tell me what you think. Please.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I blind bought this... I'm tempted by anything with honey. I do detest patchouli as a whole, but find it irresistible when well blended. (Like Black Orchid)

I don't hate this, it's a like... very "meh" because it's not strong at all. If it was stronger, my feelings would go to love or hate easy. But it's just ok.

It's like Jimmy Choo EDP without the toffee. Very much a pear/patchouli scent. The patchouli is green/spicy and not hippie/body odor or medicinal/minty. And then the honey and musk takes over. And that's it. A musky honey/patch/pear.

It's ok.

I got the EDT too, and on the first spray, I think I prefer the EDT. Brighter, more character. Creamier. Sparkling without being too fruity/light.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
WANNA CUDDLE?
______________________________________________________


I fell in love with Gucci's Rush some time ago and went to the store to purchase it. The saleswoman was somehow impressed of my knowledge of Gucci fragrances. She asked if I knew 'Gucci by Gucci'; since I didn't, she introduced me to it and it changed me.

Rarely did a fragrance catch me with guard down - but "Gucci by Gucci", just like its male counterpart, did. It somehow resembles a big soft hug from the rich aunt on Christmas Eve. It's soft and inviting, it's very present, but not obnoxious. It reminded me of cold winter evenings, spent with a loved one in front of the fire place.

The honey and musk notes fortify the core of this fragrance, patchouli, making it by far one of the best patchouli fragrances out there.


Longevity: - 9/10
Sillage: - 10/10

All in all: 10 out of 10 points

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This has a dirty, sexy, retro-70s vibe that I like a lot. For women who like bold, assertive, slightly masculine scents. Best in fall/winter.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I must admit, this is my favorite patchouli fragrance ever. It’s most impressive because I usually dislike strong honey notes, but this scent is refreshingly bold and complex. Gucci Gucci is certainly not mainstream and that in itself is a plus-- there is a dark sense of refinement about this fragrance-- I feel like I am transported through time and finding myself on a date with the Great Gatsby himself. It feels very much like a vintage piece but the tropical notes suggests a modern flair.

I tended to hate patchouli as a main component in most perfumes, as it tends to give a very dirty earthy vibe which reminds me too much of wet foliage for some reason. Even when blended with fruits or florals, it’s easy to become completely overwhelmed by the herbal-ness quality that I’ve often find myself a little queasy.

This is not the case with Gucci, as that “wet plant” quality seems to have been noticeably curbed, the patch here feels lush and opulent. It maintains a dark and boozy personality throughout; while the honey adds to the warmth of this fragrance, the patchouli stays cold and mysterious. Guava and pear top notes are subtle and are quietly overshadowed by the tiare flower which gives this fragrance a very tropical floral accord. Sillage and longevity are very good on me and I absolutely love the dry down, it smells like wealth, power, and seduction…this is confidence in a bottle.

Gucci feels very mature to me, and I don’t mean age…I mean sophistication, class, and elegance. It’s beautiful but I can’t imagine everyone loving it the same. I maintain that certain fragrances will choose its wearer and not the other way around; this is unfortunately the case with Gucci. If you can find a love for refined patchouli and honey, this is a great and nostalgic adventure. Worthy of a test but not a safe blind purchase.

Vienna.Pink

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
scent : 6/10
sillage : 8/10
longevity :8/10
100% night fragrance
too feminine for me
reminds me a little bit of Narciso Rodriguez For Her
patchouli scent

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I adore patchouli and hate the honey note so I just had to get a sample. Indeed they are the most prominent notes in this composition, the rest adds the creaminess and mitigates this crazy pair. Patchouli and honey just don't go together.

The scent is very loud, sweet, rich and deep. For me it is way too much. I agree with the review of Zoranna, it has something of the 70's vibe. If it was a woman, it would be Mary Jane Watson (from first Spiderman issues), extroverted and intimidating sometimes, but definitely attractive and likeable.

It smells best during colder days. I wouldn't call it sexy.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I do not like it at all, glad I bought a sample first.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I haven't seen the advert, but this scent definitely puts me in mind of the 1970's, in an airport executive lounge with orange and beige decor, wearing a DVF Wrap Dress... so classy in it's own way...there's a sweetness which sits the right side of cloying and it's done better than the modern sweet fruit-chouli and sickly scent trends that dominate recent launches. It's a creamy scent and I can see why many would love it. I am not a fan of patchouli and this note dominates for me, along with amber, a note I dislike. Amber isn't listed so this was unexpected. I can't detect tiare (which is a shame as I love this note and it often gets paired with coconut which is sacrilege to me!). I can't detect honey on my skin either which is a good thing for me as that scent makes me nauseous. There's not much staying power or projection for an EDP in my opinion. However, if the notes are appealing to your own tastes then it's definitely worth a try.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I got mine as a gift and unfortunately, I didn't like it. I even wondered at first if it was really for me since it smelled so masculine. Well, it turns out that it's for women but it's something my nose does not agree on. This is just a big punch of amber (though there's no amber listed on the notes but that's what I smell) when you spray it on that dries down to a very masculine woodsy smell. That's all I got from it. It's a perfume that's trying to be complex and I guess it is complex but that does not automatically translate to something that smells good.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Gucci is a wonderful, musky honey smell. It's just a very elegant, night-time fragrance. I do tend to avoid wearing it too often since it reminds me so much of my mother (it's her signature fragrance) but it is a lovely perfume. Lasts for quite a long time, perhaps 3-5 hours.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
First spritz is hairspray-esque--but give it a minute.
Rich honey and the powdery Tiare flower add sweetness to the musk and patchouli.

Strong on my skin, and lasts. The bottle suits the scent.

Not a dinner-date, but an evening out for sure.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: absolutely love it! it´s just "so me" - dark, not sweet, mysterious, sexy, adult, sophisticated

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This is my go-to fragrance! Light enough for daytime, but sexy enough for night.
I'm very picky about my scents, and I dislike most women's perfume - too basic, flowery and powdery. But this . . this is sophisticated, mysterious, and still feminine. All the notes are well balanced, nothing jumps out at you. I'd describe it as warm and earthy, but still delicate. The tiare and guava makes it just a hint tropical, the patchouli and musk make it exotic, and the honey smooths it out. Just wonderful. Amazing if you want something feminine, not girly - sexy, not sweet.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: As stated before, I cant see the fascination with Gucci frags that my friends have as like Chanel, they dont last on me. I can smell the pear in this, bit unisex for my tastes. The Iceberg frag is cheaper version of this

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Much like Gabricookies, I don't detect honey at all- and given that honey notes are the sheer killer of any perfume for me, thats saying something. I get a strong patchouli at first, but not the old boho hippie vibe that some have. This is a very refined elegant note followed and matched with a floral note and slight fruit at the end. I didn't think I would like this when seeing the notes, but I got a bottle in a swap and its fast becoming a favorite. I had a bit of worry about whether the "maturity" of this would end up smelling like a granny,but this mellows into more of an incense vibe. It lasts forever on me, and even many hours later I will catch a whiff even when it should have long gone silent to my nose.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
A very pleasant, warm, sugary pear develops into a musky honey/patchouli combo with the sweet tiare waffling here and there. This scent is inviting, rich and seductively mature. A very well blended, well crafted masterpiece of warmth. The top notes easily transition to the base simultaneously. What's not to love about this? It's sweet, powerful, and sensual for a crisp fall evening of glamour!

8.5 out of 10

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This stuff smells great, and I think it is the perfect balance of musky honeyness and freshness. It's a little light on me but that's OK. I would describe it as a sexy scent, for sure.

Unfortunately, on me the longevity is just non-existent. I can spray 3-4 sprays on the back of my hand and it is a skin scent within 15 mins, and gone within an hour. I haven't experienced longevity this bad with anything else except TF's Cafe Rose (how weird, right?!). It's actually making me wonder if this has been reformulated, but no one is saying it has, so it is probbably just me and my unlucky skin chemistry. There is also no sillage :(

A bummer about the poor lasting power (and non-existent sillage) but it smells great, and wasn't too expensive for a big bottle. So I guess I'll keep spraying every half hour :)

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Hot perfume for hot girls who feel confident, elegant, mysterious and will be a center of attention by her destiny. Gucci always perfect for my body especially this baby.
Perfect base note of patchouli, honey and musk are really awesome works on my body chemistry. I feel like hot, strong and confident woman when I wear this. Also the longevity is crazily 24 hours. It is just perfect one!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I love this scent!
I really like patchouli but it's hard to find a patchouli that doesn't smell old and musty. Tom Ford's White patchouli is sadly a good example of that.

Gucci by Gucci gives me a very fresh patchouli vibe (you won't get a classier patchouli scent by the way, trust me), but at the same time it's also very creamy. I didn't think these two thing could go together, but they do!
I do get the Tiare flowers as part of this creaminess, and there is a slightly fruity note that I couldn't put my finger on. I don't detect honey at all...

I love this frag because in my opinion it perfectly balances the aggressiveness of patchouli with all the other sweet notes: it's a women's scent, but it does never get too feminine.
And of course the gorgeous bottle and advertisement can't go unnoticed. This fragrance really evokes a distant luxury, a modernist vibe from the '70s perhaps. Not very romantic or glamorous, but still quite elegant and... natural. More Farrah Fawcett than Doris Day :-)

8.5/10

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This was very strong at first spray and I was afraid this scent would be too heavy for my liking. However, after the dry down, the scent ideveloped into a honey, white floral and patchouli blend. Smells very expensive and the longevity is good. This smells very similar to Narciso Rodriguez. Beautiful fragrance and lovely bottle design.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Strong for my taste, mostly I get musk and something spicy from it. And yes, there is some honey and patchouli, but the whole thing is not as sweet as you might think.
At least I don't consider is sweet.
Masculine and woody in my opinion.
The scent might have it's charms, but I guess I wouldn't wear it.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This was a blind buy for me and I definitely don't regret it at all. It's so far very deep, sophisticated and charming smell on me. I get a bit of masculine vibe but in a good way. And I also get a lot of compliments wearing this so I can picture this as my new signature scent for sure.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Gucci by Gucci EDP is not being discontinued its still available to purchase on the Gucci online store and even if you go on the Gucci website and click on Gucci perfumes it has Classic Gucci perfumes for her Gucci By Gucci EDP if this fragrance was being discontinued they would removed it from the official Gucci website for sure.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: A whiff of this, and I think class, sophistication, maybe opulence. Epitome of feminity. Longevity rivals that of Mugler's Angel. Leaves a lovely silage trail. Its a shame it is being discontinued.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Got a 1.7oz via Overstock.com for about $48! Score!!!!!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I got a 3ml decant of this from a website and tried it on. My husband walked up to me and said... "You smell amazing, almost like sex, or the possibility of.".... YES! That is DEFINITELY how I feel wearing it! SCORE! Love this perfume! I was looking for something sweet, hint of musk, dark, and the possibility of "kink". Something that would be fitting for 50 Shades of Gray if you know what I mean! ;)

It starts of very boozy like you have been getting nice and intoxicated and ready to loose your inhibitions. Then it settles and that sweet honey comes out spiraling with the musk and fruits. Its a beautiful combination. So feminine. So sexy. So captivating. The scent of a woman who is empowered and confident. It doesn't smell "older" like a lot of musk scents do. Perfect for ladies who are in their mid 20s-30s and coming into their own and not afraid to flaunt it!

I hate I am falling in love with it now that it is being discontinued, but I got a couple bottle on Overstock so hopefully that will last me a while. This will DEFINITELY be a date night/ going out on the town scent!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is a classy classy scent. To be worn when I'm on a hot hot date. I just love it! And I'm on my 5th bottle and still going strong

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
For me this is PER-FEC-TION! This is my signature scent and I am so dissapointed that it was discontinued.
Musky-honey-patchuli madness with some heavy florals. Dark, feminine and seductive. I feel like an irresistible goddess when I'm wearing this fragrance.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Power perfume for the modern career woman! I'm convinced that you will be noticed wearing this! Gucci by Gucci is confident, metallic, demanding, deep and overwhelming. I definitely recognise this scent from shopping centres, hairdressers, cruise ships, etc... Unfortunately, to my nose there is just an overwhelmingly strong scent of something that reminds me of burning industrial chemicals or a nail salon... An extremely heavy monster - I split a tiny drop of this on my skin from the vial and after some very vigorous scrubbing it is still holding; however, it's calmed down now and is just a sweet patchouli floral smell. Absolutely not for me!

UPDATE: I wanted to understand why this perfume is so popular, so approached the vial again (with extreme caution) to determine what the top notes were that I couldn't stand... ah, patchouli and honey! I don't love the combination of either of those in extreme dosages, but I'm now beginning to understand how those notes mix to create a velvety scent which others enjoy :)

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Gucci by Gucci is my choice "going out" scent for the incredibly boozey quality it has haha. Firstly, the bottle looks like one of those vintage heavy crystal liquor decanters. And the scent...usually at first spray I always let the alcohol evaporate before I take the first sniff, with this one the alcohol compliments the experience and I feel like I am smelling a real Jamaican rum cocktail in front of me.

The start is juicy, sweet and sharp. It settles down and is still boozy, but the juicy pear goes away. The pairing of honey and patchouli sounds like something that could be heavy but it is simply a lovely pairing here. It is sweet but dark and a bit smokey too. Despite these two heavy notes, the fragrance is not at all heavy on me . My only complaint is that it stays very close to the skin, I am a modest sprayer so I don't mind much but I can imagine this being a deal breaker for some who enjoy strong sillage.

oh yes and the video ad... the ladies and their hair and makeup, the sleek 70s dresses, the luxe decor, Blondie, Lynch... there are so many things I love about the campaign as corny as it is

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Upon spraying, I get a sweaty/ BO note which I really dislike. Once settled, this reminds me very much of Gucci guilty, only still with a sweaty undertone. Pass.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is a nice fragrance, but somewhat overpowering for me, with a bit too much of a sweet note.
