product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This is definitely going to be my go-to Date Night fragrance.

It's got attitude, charm, sex appeal and is incredibly feminine. This is such a great scent, and lingers around in an enticing veil. Way too sexy and deep for work I think. This might become my event/function/party/night out staple.


At first, I got an almost boozy amber which then gave way to the fruit and tiare and that thing that Gucci fragrances do (I find it in Guilty as well) and after several more minutes, chills out and develops into what is a culmination of all these terrific notes. Warm, melting honey on the flesh. Eyes open and a smile curves lips. Sheets are everywhere. A stolen kiss. Outside, night shines in through the window, it's summer. An unexpected love affair.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I absolutely LOVE honey.....but sometimes patchouli is all I can smell in a fragrance when it's presence is so dominant. I have several with lots of patchouli that I totally love. However, there are just some mixtures that my nose can only smell the patchouli.....makes it too masculine for me *boo hiss* I was so hoping to love this. Someone suggested layering with Elie Saab. Maybe that will make it wearable for me, because I love ES.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Many people like it a lot - but I am not among them. At first, I only smelt some aldehyd, it gave me a headache. After a while, there was the honey&patchouli mixture, but it seemed too artificial to me (and I still felt dizzy&uncomfortable). I tried it 14 days ago, but my impressions have not changed... Sorry Gucci, I am not buying it!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
What an interesting fragrance to review! The first thing it made me think of was a red gummy bear or other small fruity sweet (guava+pear+honey?) fallen on skin covered in creamy oily smelling suncream (tiare?). Sort of nostalgic, feminine, almost but not quite girly atmosphere. At the same time though it has the feeling of being perfectly polished, like a dainty young lady who always has perfectly manicured nails and wears skirt suits. Not at all me, so I felt like I was wearing a young, classy woman's (very nice but somehow wrong) perfume, not MY perfume. I think it is perfect as the first "real" perfume for a young, feminine and very well dressed woman (not girl) or anyone exploring their soft/feminine/classy/pink side.
What really keeps my interest in this scent is the "mystery" note: In my opinion it is thyme (or possibly another herb) which gives an almost savoury/salty note which provides needed "resistance" to all the sweet and creamy notes. This is what keeps the largely fruity/creamy and inoffensive perfume from being boring or "sticky" and sets it apart.
On me this has very good longevity, sillage is moderate, gradually reducing.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Liquid velvet - intoxicating, precious and warm.
I wouldn't add or change anything. Just perfect ♥

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I am not really the biggest fan of Gucci's fragrance canon (with the distinct exception of Rush and Pour Homme II) but I was pleasantly surprised by this fragrance. It is not particularly complex or deep, but it is well done and the notes work together nicely. Mild, dry patchouli is tempered out with rich honey. Guava and tiare are provided mostly to balance out the honey-patchouli in the forefront, and the effect is lovely. It is seductive in a mature, womanly way and not a sexy/trampy way. Sillage and longevity are mildly disappointing, unfortunately. But the bottle is pretty and the color scheme of fragrance's presentation is absolutely perfect. Overall, it's nice.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Really not sure what to think of this scent. At first it nice but the scent is weak, i can barely smell it. I get whisps of watered down honey and nothing else. The dry off on my skin sometimes smells like old frying oil?? or something thats been deep fried.
I really want to like this perfume as i love all the notes in it but theres times i spray it and it just smells odd. Maybe its just on me, but the honey and tiare i can smell in it.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Is it true that this perfume has been discontinued?? I like this perfume so much, it is a rich, sensual, seductive and glamourous scent. Perfect for the night out. Longevity is about 7 hours on my skin. I have to order this perfume once again. Fortunately, there are some bottles available on the website.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Absolutely love this fragrance and am so sorry it has been discontinued. Every time I wear it I feel empowered somewhat like a femme fatale kinda Betty Davis-esque.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Warm honey, patchouli, and something slightly astringent at the start. (That could be the rose, actually? I've seen it listed as a note before, although it's not here.) I've been wearing this for several weeks straight, and I love it. This sounds a bit bizarre, but it makes me think of the colour and texture of mahogany.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: not agressive but not welcoming either, passionate but pretentious, sensual but definitely not flirty, a woman with her head high, killer eyes, and walk of confidence. Men may find it love or hate, some are intoxicated while others well, intimidated

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Woah. Good thing the reviews are better and more artful then the ad. The ad is silly. I blind bought a mini bottle based on the notes and the reviews. I will update. I am a big patchouli fan.


Hmmm....hello patchouli....are you in there????? I like really strong patchouli.......on me there is none at all, like I cant even believe other people are smelling it at on themselves. People are saying it was "heavy patchouli" on them......I was hoping for that. Not so on me, I am bummed about that. Its easy to wear, soft and very light. I would buy a bigger bottle eventually. Does Not come on too strong, is almost too sweet for me but then approaches the mark and backs off. Comforting, normal smell that I feel like I have smelled millions of times before. Its like honey i guess, although I cant tell the difference between honey and just like...a sweet smell. Like if I smelled it on me I would not think...ohhh yeah honey!!! Its just sort of a mild sweetness. Funny how everyone is like.....it smells so different!! I wonder what my chemistry is doing to it, it just sort of disappears in a very mild waft of something normal and faint.

its uplifting, mild, nice. I would get a bigger spray bottle some day, but im not in love with it. It needs some darker more spicey notes. It would be nice layered over something maybe. like actual patchouli. I feel like other people would like it on me more then I like it on myself in some way. Its doesnt last for that long on me eithor, but its nice.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Modern chypre, is not entirely female, i'm male and want for me! It's mature but it is not dated, dense, elegant, romantic. Great longevity and moderate sillage. Tested and is in my skin there 24 hours, even after bathing

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I smell oud in this !

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This perfume is simply amazing!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Gucci by Gucci is a really feminine perf, and the scent lasts long on the skin. I really smell honey and some other notes i can't define. Not overpowering but noticable scent. But there is too much alcohol and i worry about my skin. Anyway good frag:)

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I don't know if it's my skin composition that does this, but on me, this perfume sits way too close to the skin. And this is coming from someone who actually PREFERS perfumes that don't have too strong a sillage; who prefers when a perfume is a more personal intimate thing that only those who are standing in your "bubble" or give you a hug can smell. But this one, even I don't really smell it when I stick my nose right on the spots where it was applied. So definitely not something I would put any kind of $$ on. Soap probably has more olfactory presence than this.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: After falling head over heels in love with the EDT version of this perfume I had to buy the EDP version also. The EDT is fantastic for during the day but the relatively weak lasting power made it difficult to wear on nights out without having to carry the entire bottle around with me. So when I got my bottle of the EDP in the mail I was very excited to try wearing it out. You can tell right off the bat that they are directly related; the initial patchouli opening coming in strong but then softened by the sweetness of the guava and honey... But the EDP version has a much deeper, smokier almost, honey note. The patchouli stays warm and snuggly for much longer, also. Very warm, dark, and seductive. Lasted much longer on my skin than the EDT. Looks like I'm set for day and progressing into night without having to drastically change smells. Both are classy, elegant and sophisitcated but this is definately the older sister of the pair, who spends her nights on the town surrounded by admirers.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I really struggle to find suitable evening fragrances - they either just turn too sweet on my skin or are too overpowering in some way. This EDP is a rare thing for me, because it is very much an evening fragrance, but it never gets too sweet as it develops. The patchouli and honey balance each other very well. When you first spray, the patchouli dominates, but then a pretty honey note comes thorough. I can't really detect the fruit in the top notes, perhaps because the patchouli is so prominent.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This opens with the guava and pear, which is fruity, sweet, and candied. If you're into that, that's great. If you're not (like me), that's fine, because it doesn't last. After the fruits fade, it's mostly patchouli and honey with a bit of smokiness. For some who are not used to patchouli, this may come across as a bit too much, but those like me who love the likes of Angel, Chanel Coco Mademoiselle, Black Orchid and more, this really isn't that challenging. It's less intense than Prada Amber (the original Prada), which I personally consider a real "Patchouli bomb" but it does have a similar quality to it. This stays close to the skin without much sillage, but I'd say it's a nice evening fragrance for going out. I don't get the "masculine" vibe that some people have described, but who am I to say what is masculine and feminine?


In terms of strength, while it might be considered "sweet" in the beginning, I never get the sense that it's overwhelming. It's significantly faded after about 3 hours or so and you mostly get a nice patchouli with honey that only people who hug you would be able to smell.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
The patchouli is barely there; I get mostly middle, top and "veil" notes out of this. It just kind of hangs there. My husband has said "gee you smell good" when I wear it, but I personally don't feel good in it. It wafts up and I get a "what was that??" feeling and then I'm realizing "oh, that's me."
A lot of fruit listed here, but I barely get any fruit. Some pear.
Might be good for the office if you're into patchouli and sweets but don't want the heavy frags that project "old lady" or "hippie" or "teen sugar." This is definitely light.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Like it, wore it. The EDT is better. Very deep; for evenings and winter. Hard to find. Is Gucci re-launching it in a more modern version?

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
i smell patchouli and honey, equally.

oh yeah and its a darkly light scent, it really is! i know that doesn't make much sense but its winter-y and spicy but only a whisper on my skin. a few other reviews mentioned how heavy it was on their skin and i'm like, "SAY WHAT?!" even when i first spray it, it fades to a beautiful sweet honey dusted kiss. a light, sheer, warm hug. in fact, its so light that i had to re-spritz before i left work. 3 hours later and its still wafting gently to my nostrils, hahahaa. (sorry that sentence sounded ridiculous and made me laugh.)

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I think it's one of the unique fragrances. I love it ^^

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Gucci is very heavy on patchouli, with the addition of some sweet notes. This fragrance is deep, dark, sweet, heavy, mysterious, and bordering on unisex. This is strong stuff, and I am a bit overwhelmed by it. I am a patchouli lover, but the patchouli in this is a bit too much for me.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Hmmm this is a hard one to describe. When I sprayed it today my initial impression was OMG that is some strong stuff. Gucci is known for good quality perfume that lasts. That is what I always love about Gucci. So I sprayed it on my arm in my bedroom. A tiny spritz and as I sit here the whole room is filled in this gorgeous aroma. Fresh and very clean. This is a heavy fragrance no fruitiness, no candy smell... it's all Gucci. I think my only reservation might be that the fragrance has a unisex smell to it and I tend to run from anything that is not totally feminine. This is the only think keeping me from falling head over heals for it. The bottle itself is indeed gorgeous, stout and very well made.

Edited: I gave my nose a day of rest and sprayed Gucci Gucci on again. I must say that perhaps I did not give it a fair shake. This is a complex scent and I got on Macy's site and read the description. I think it's a fair description of the scent and as I wear it I am smelling more femininity. I'll continue to experiment and see where it goes.

Edited about a week later: I have fallen in love with this perfume. Now that we are in Fall weather a true love affair is brewing. I have decided that I enjoy the mild unisex note this perfume carries. It's not masculine. The aroma is pleasant and warm and deep. A great perfume for the Fall and Winter months.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Usually i hate heavy chypres. But I can't deny that this perfume is one AMAZING masterpiece. It is gorgeous, sexy, I loved it even when I was pregnant (I couldn't stand many smells then!). It reminds be a little of Coco Chanel, a bit more "serious".
p.s.
I hate the commercial. it is rather embaressing. Steals some of the big perfume's aura, not to mention David Lynch's credit (can you believe he directed that piece of crap?)!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This is very sweet, enveloping honey with a strong and sensual base of patchouli. The patchouli isn't masculine, it's actually very warm and womanly. The white flowers and fruit give a lift to what might otherwise be a heavy gourmand. This fragrance puts me in mind of a buxom brunette with limpid eyes and a languid and self-assured manner. Doesn't quite sound like perky old me, but, heck, some of the time we put on perfume to explore the hidden aspects of ourselves. Beautiful, and enough sillage to fill a room.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: this is one of my favs i love it! the sweet honey makes want to just drink this stuff! a nice day or night perfume a keeper ;]

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I bought this several months ago. I have only worn it twice. I find it strong for my taste. The honey and patchouli notes are quite heavy on me. I do agree with another reviewer who detects a minty note as well. I was going to return it but it smells amazing on my son!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I bought it after three days of trying perfumes... at first, I loved it. After I bought it, I liked it but I was not in love with it. It is a good perfume though. It turns too sweet on me i guess...

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I love this frag, yet it disappears on my skin after only a few (and I do mean a few- three tops) hours. I am a huge fan of chypres, and I wanted so desperately for this to work. Not strong enough for my (perhaps) excessive taste and love of sillage monsters with a scent life of no less than 24 hours.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: It smells very sexy, definitely for a grown woman. Very provocative. The opening was very honey like, some patchouli and musk. Hours later is softer and a little more fruity. For a night at a bar, and cold winters.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Gucci by Gucci is by all means for honey lovers. Its delectable, sweet and alluring. The guava and honey infuse to give you a exotic cocktail of fresh crispiness and sweet shivers of excitement.

I have worn this scent both during summer, and going into winter now, and the scent pretty much holds to it's longevity on me, 5 hours, the only difference is in the colder conditions, I have found the patchouli
to infiltrate that almost innocent gauva/honey combo, and you get this dirty, almost dark feel from the earthy patchouli, which is what most people probably sense as the masculine component.

Also in the colder climates I have to say the projection is a bit better, although not by much. where it would project just 2inches in warmer weather, it's projects about 4 inches in wintery situations. It certainly does give that warm sensation of when you get home and remove your jackets and attire and you're left with your shirt and that warm body temperature is expelled....

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Quite musky, heavy patchouli. I smell a lot of tiare & guava which gives a tropical slant, but not in an Escada way.
Mature, sensual.
Strong & long lasting.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I would never have picked Gucci Gucci myself. When a friend gave me a little gift set with lotion, shower gel and a small 5 ml sample, I sniffed it later at home and thought back about what I could have done to deserve this. Didn’t she like me anymore?? I decided that I would keep it only because it was a gift from this particular friend.

Occasionally though, I would splash a little touch of it, more to get done with it than anything else. Sure enough, with time, I have come to love it, and how. I LOVE, love, love it. The initial burst of guava, honey, patchouli and musk smell super sexy to me. It has this sweet, smoky, sultriness to it that I adore. At the same time, it smells (and IS) expensive and classy.

Later, when someone asked me what perfume I wanted as a gift, this was the one I wanted. So much for disliking it.

But, and there is a but unfortunately, as is almost fated to happen with the fragrances we love most, it’s gone in the time it takes me to walk around my house! - Okay, it isn’t that bad, but one hour after layering lotion and fume, it’s all but gone. There's only the slightest, lightest hint of musk. I’m so so disappointed by this aspect. I’ll just have to get a small size and carry it around with me on days (or rather nights, since this is an evening fragrance) I choose to wear it. Does last longer when sprayed on clothes, but sillage is next to non-existent *sigh*

Love it still. Would buy it again…and again.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: absolot lovely luxurios but for above 30 years old women

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Gucci by Gucci ... it smells so good I think! but was a little disappointed that it is not in so long, it's a pretty expensive perfume, so little it should stay, I think.
But it smells so good, you feel a little sexy! When you get a little closer to your skin, you feel it a little musk, honey and maybe a little spicy scent, perfect evening fragrance!!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Rich, dark, strong scent. Help to feel sexy and powerful. Perfect, dark make-up and this scent- very good combination!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I cannot speak professionally about the components, but all I can say is I get a warm & comfortable feeling from this perfume. It smells very classy and sophisticated for a non-niche perfume. I would consider similar to La Perla and Narciso Rodgriguez.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Sweet & seductive, but on my skin, VERY similar to Vivianne Westwoods 'Boudoir' with its dirty,sexy, damp smell. Longlasting!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Excuse the phrase, but the term "power pussy" comes to mind when I smell this. It's a fragrance I can imagine a managing director of a huge investment company wearing, small men and women wilting in her wake as she makes the rounds. Much too strong for me, but it's definitely powerful and unique. Has a masculine twist to it.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
What do you know...this is the perfume I sometimes have smelled on other women,thinking... Mmmm -
I wonder what´s she is wearing ?
By accident I found it !
Without knowing the notes I tried it and fell in love too.
The opening notes made me think of Strawberry pie, but that was. -
Guava and Pear....... ok ?
The lovely tiare is simply gorgeous, sweet but calm. not a screamy note anywere the base is lovely too . I usually dont like honey rather than eating it, but mixed with patchoulie and musk irs wonderful !
The subtle scent makes me think óf Elle Intense. but this is still different. Another frag it made me think of in the beginnning -are - Prada tendre.
This is a VERY well made perfume, to me for both day and night.
Dont be scared of by the dark and a bit old fashioned bottle...
This is a dream come true - for .... - a perfumista like myself !!!
Now - I am impressed by Gucci !

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: It's funny I'm Capricorn with rising in Aries, so is not strange that I like this perfume. I don't believe in astrology and say that this scent is for every woman that likes musky woody florals with a twist of sweetness and a peppery note of patcouli. I like that it's not another gourmand heavy vanilic fuity floral. It has warmth, depth, and is very versatile. I believe it can be suitable for morning if you apply a bit. I smell orange here, although is not listed. Also, I would swear I smell amber too, but I suppose this is honey that deceives my nose. It seems to me woody also........ Tiare is not prominent I think. Pear takes the first stage, together with soft patcouli. It is a quality perfume, not masculine. Warm, femminine, confident, although not an extraordinary one. Very well blended, and so abstract that can reach the taste of those who like florals, fruity patcouli, leathery smells and maybe chypres. It's not a chypre though....

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Gucci by Gucci is confident, sophisticated, no-nonsense, and seriously sexy. Someone mentioned this being an 'alpha woman' scent, and I agree. A femme fatale in a black suit and classic red lips. She's all about the clean, basic lines, rich fabrics, and prefers darker colors. Has a masculine vibe while being all woman. Very sweet, rich and deep scent but quite straight-forward and not too complicated. A dark and smooth honeyed patchouli laced with musk and a touch of fruits and flowers. Reeks of class, high society and expensive tastes. Best for evenings, perhaps a sexy night out with a black dress made of french lace...but if you're a boss, you can wear this to the office.

JUST FOR FUN: Perfect for a CAPRICORN or those with a Capricorn rising, the scent, and even the bottle design fits them to a T. Classy, somewhat stand-offish, ambitious and highly determined, it's definitely made for the Capricorn woman alright. Also would suit an Aries woman.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Very sexy, deep,dark, relaxing, soothing. Like it from first sniff. Nothing I don't like about it. Perfect from top to bottom. Very smooth, not abrasive. One of my favorites.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This is one of those fragrances you really have to fall in love with. I must admit that the initial blast is enough to put one off. it requires a lot of patience as will eventually develop into a wonderful rosey bouquet.

It isnt my favourite, and I will not invest in another bottle of this stuff however, the EDT version is to die for.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Terrible, terrible and more terrible. Whoever thought honey and patchouli and haitian vetiver would go together was out out of his or her alleged mind. Run, run, far away from this one!
The notes do not mesh, this is a sweet, sticky, funky mess. It screams 'mistake' or "what were they thinking" with every sniff.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Simple and special, has a lot of grace and style. Love it

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I am not fan patchouli mainly because it gives me headache but this one is really well blend. It has that smoky effect too and really sophisticated elegant scent. Some might find it cloying (if sprayed too much) so one is enough. Really classy scent and must have for winter!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Honey,patchouli,honey,patchouli.....
Sweet ,in a adult way . Here, the honey and patchouli make a good team , transform it into something seductive, mysterious.
From my point of view Gucci by Gucci is unisex.
Longevity : 4-5 hours.
Worth the money.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: First, I found it too mature and heavy like some parfume from the 50's but once I sprayed it on and waited 5 minutes...OMG! I'm only 21 and i am absolutely in love with this fragrance! Very-very classy, deep and mature, in a pleasant way. Patchouli and honey stands out, but this parfume smells perfectly balanced. This is one of my dream-parfumes. Sexy in a confindent, calm way. Really love it!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
The bottle is the reason I've put off trying this. The first time, I only sniffed the bottle rather than spray directly on my skin. The bottle is too intimidatingly classy -- felt like a twelve-year old wearing Chanel Coco. I finally went to Shoppers to enjoy browsing in peace.
Immediately, I detected patchouli and honey blanketing dried, rather than fleshy, peach. The honey seems to have wrapped itself around the peach and (especially) the guava, which served to dull the sweetness of both fruits. Together, the patchouli and honey gives the perfume its warmth, which I envision wearing with softest cashmere sweater, a Michael Kors large-face gold watch and sumptuous suede boots. The drydown is dry, dark and soft. Smokily alluring lending from amber and faint spices. Very classy and sophisticated for day or night (just amplify with another squirt or two). Sometimes, it smells like smoke, dark tea and molasses. I can see a masculine executive wearing this in the office. I would happily share a bottle with my husband. Suited for confident individualists who are open to scents other than the usual sugary-florals.

Sillage: on my skin, about 6" (with one spray)
Longevity: about 3 hours on me
Rating: 3/5

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I don't really like it on paper, and one working day I sprayed it on my skin...and it's a gorgeous smell. It doesn't smell too feminine yet a bit masculine I supposed. I had a good feeling all day while keep sniffing it, and got many compliments. So I wouldn't hesitate to get the big bottle of this beautiful fragrance for what I have now is purse spray of 15ml with stunning liptick-like casing of Gucci pattern.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I introduced Gucci to Elie Saab. Mixed together on my skin they made sweet love. and I'm thrilled. I'm still partial to E.Saab but this together was/is great! I should be a matchmaker! Lol.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: What is to add after many wonderful reviews... There is a maturity to this scent, but it carries with it the sweetest kick of mild honey paired with a softly stated patchouli. Gorgeous for cool months, distinctly identified.... It's one of those, "I know that smell"...... Love it!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I don't find this to be a fragrance for 30+ as others have said, though it wouldn't be appropriate for a teenager. This frangrrence says "Hello! I am a confident and sexy woman. I know what I want in life, and exactly how to obtain in it."

To me the Gucci by Gucci woman is sophisticated but wild. Men are driven crazy by her, women admire her. She is ambitious and confident. When I picture her I see a young 25-35) successful, and strikingly radiant career woman - the one all the men ogle at, the reason why the company must hold sexual harassment lectures. But she is so much more than just a pretty face; she is clever and witty. She is driven and passionate.

On first spray, i find Gucci by Gucci a bit harsh and cloying. However, after ten minutes this settles into this beautiful, warm, sweet and sensuous aroma. This fragrance just melts so well into my skin. It becomes musky, but not your grandmother's musky, but rather sexual creature kind of musky. It has the same sophistication as a Gucci bag from the classic line. Really quite lovely.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: (my picture of gucci by gucci, as described, is probably very very inspired by the commercial...;)

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: This perfume will always remind me of Rome, since i tried it on a few times when i was there on vacation in springtime 2008. That warm scent that melted in with the beautiful ocra, yellowish, brickcolored surroundings in that old city...a strong memory for me. I actually detected some cardamom in Gucci by Gucci but it couldn't have been, since it's not an ingrediens in the perfume. Still something about it reminded me a bit of cardamom. Still, a warm spicy scent. Glamourous and goldy in some way, i can imagine a very elegant, warm person wearing Gucci by Gucci. Dressed in sexy, elegant clothes with a touch of mysteria around her. She is probably laying on a luxury, antique divan surrounded my people dressed in gold and silky clothes. Incense in the air, dark outside... well, that's just my picture.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: call me crazy, but theres something about the opening that reminds me of sweet oatmeal raisin cookies, fresh from the oven..

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: i love the fresh & clean smell of it. it lasts long and i would recommend to anyone.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: If Dior's Pure Poison and Thierry Mugler's Alien were making a baby, this would be their baby. A lovely baby.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I don't think anything else I've smelled from this house has been as lovely as this perfume. When I first sprayed it, it seemed identical to For Her by Narciso Rodriguez. It had the beautiful white florals and the rich, sweet scent of honey. As it dried down, the sweetness increased quite a bit, and the scent of guava became very clear. It's such an unexpected combination--juicy guava drizzled with honey. It had the potential to become another boring, wimpy, fruity-floral, but Gucci gave it enough richness and depth to prevent that.

I see this as an evening perfume. I think it's magnetic, lush, and very sensual.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
Most of all I feel the musk and pear notes in this fragrance. It smells attractive enough.

I like it. But usually the pear note reminds me about the masculine fragrances, that is why I can't say that it's my cup of tea. I like more this edp version than edt.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: For women over 50,60... I could remember my grandma wearing s.thing similar...

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: What I love about this perfume is how no one has it. I love the spice, the musk, the deepness. This is perfect for a cold winter day. The richness of this, could only be Gucci.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: Sexy as hell Without a hint of rose or vanilla anywhere! I adore this fragrance! Compliments galore!

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: I love this perfume. It is strong but not heavy. It could be unisex, I agree. I love the masculine notes in it. I wear it mainly in Autumn/Winter. A must have category.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
I tested this as soon as it was released years ago and found myself enjoying it. But I would not man up and own it until a few days ago. I love all of the notes included, so this is a joy to wear. But it's the honey, patchouli (the "masculinity" that everyone is identifying) and top notes that make this a must-have for me. This is somewhere between unisex (on skin) and feminine (on fabric). I can't find anything that I don't like about it AT ALL. I'm probably just a Gucci fan at heart.. LOL

Side Note: The EDT is extremely feminine, IMO and I'd recommend it to any woman..

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content: i bought this for my mom years ago when i knew nothing about perfume. at the perfume counter smelling all these different scents and trying to work out which one to pick. than gucci by gucci was presented to me after i described my mom. some of the comments mentioned that this is a rich lady scent, elegant but strong, knows what she wants. i think this describe my mom pretty well. it is sweet but a grown up sweet. i found it a little masculine too with a smokey feel. it didnt strike me as a pretty floral which was one of the reasons i got it. i wouldnt wear it personally, though i like it.

product_name: Gucci by Gucci Eau de Parfum Gucci
review_content:
This is one Fragrance that I have got and I cannot put my finger on. I still find it difficult to describe it in words. It is not floral, it is not fruity, it is something complicated. I have tried so many fragrances and haven't smelled anything like it. Is it only me?

This was an impulse buy, the result of trying 10 million perfumes in one go and completely confusing your olfactory glands. The same thing happened to me when I bought Kenzo flower.

This will be an amazing layering frag and a stand alone one too. I have to be in mood to apply this. It is a masterpiece on its own and lasts all day.

A beautiful creation from Gucci and is unique IMO.
This will be a try before buy. Longevity is good for both EDT and EDP (I have both EDP and EDT version)

product_name: A Winter Melody Scented Water Gucci
review_content: Now this scent is not something I thought I would like, as the cypress is the leading note and it smells kind of like a room spray. But this beautifully blended scent reminds me of Christmas and I actually really like it for very specific events. I love damask rose, and thought it doesn’t really shine, it gives the scent a nice depth. I would love to layer this scent.

product_name: A Winter Melody Scented Water Gucci
review_content:
A winter melody begins with a strong and violent flow of bergamot, its intensity quickly disappears, but some of its components remain, which is one of the characteristics of the fragrance with the presence of metallic notes in the heart of the fragrance that reminds me of Creed Silver Mountain perfume and this smell lasts for some time to end with a light floral scent that makes it more feminine. However, I see that the fragrance is suitable for both genders.
The performance of the fragrance is average and did not present anything new

product_name: A Winter Melody Scented Water Gucci
review_content:
Unbearably woody on my skin. Cypress all the way. Pungent, strong, unscrubbable. If you are into hardcore woody fragrances, this is quality juice. On my skin most wood translates into bitter sweat and is agonizingly hard to endure.
Gorgeous bottle...alas!

product_name: A Winter Melody Scented Water Gucci
review_content: I am a collector of rare and exclusive perfumes, with some more widely available beautiful ones there too. I expected to like this - my initial feeling was that I was very wrong. The top notes are nauseating. I felt sick, got a slight headache, my tongue swelled, eyes watered and I started sneezing. Obviously strong enough for allergy, which does not happen often and also a really sickening smell. I could smell patchouli (which I hate) although I haven't seen this listed in the notes; I would describe this as a very strong musky cypress, like damp, slightly rotting wood in a forest that, as it dries down, develops a sweet, rotting rose petal note onto the wood. I can understand the incense connection because of the heavy, warmed patchouli oil overtures. It was a definite dislike from me, one I wanted to wash off my skin. I was looking for a similar perfume to my beloved Tiempe Passate - the former is beyond beautiful and seems to melt into your skin as though it were your natural scent, whereas this one seemed to sit thickly on top of it. I persevered and as the base notes came through it became more intimate, pleasant and musky. I would say that this could work better if it was layered up with, say, a bright violet or mimosa. However, the musky, woody cypress was still a dominant feature and it continued to have a slightly sickly smell reminiscent of patchouli oil. This could be unisex, which I tend to like, but for me it leaned a lot more to the masculine.

product_name: A Winter Melody Scented Water Gucci
review_content:
Beautifull bottle! great vintage style, but not unisex ...
For me Gucci disapointed with Guilty Cologne: smells synthetic and plastic, it could be a vanguardist and original cologne but faillured and the brand thriumphed with Memoire...

product_name: A Winter Melody Scented Water Gucci
review_content: As bizarre as this may sound, this dries down to smell nearly identical to D&G Velvet Incenso, only softer. Having sprayed this on my arm two hours ago at Saks then comparing it at home to my bottle of Velvet Incenso confirmed this...very strange🤔

product_name: A Winter Melody Scented Water Gucci
review_content:
I am appalled by how much I personally want this just based on its looks, and I can see thus far all other reviewers are beguiled mainly by its pretty presentation. Of all of Gucci’s premium line, this is the one I love most; there is something very bracing about the Bergamot, a highly mentholated gelid opening that does indeed feel like an agreeable winter’s day, when the snow has settled and the sky has loosened its grey cloak slightly. But that might for me, also be the primal response to another Icy cologne of my childhood, by German House 4711, in its pretty miniature gin bottle and green label and dinky red-topped cap, sitting on my Grandma’s dark brown teak vanity like a little jewel. the predominance of bergamot in both seems to indicate a strong connection, and 4711 cologne is a much more economical yet effective option, by a wide margin. Winter Melody is further, not aided by its poor silage for its price. Longevity however is decent and it does shift beautifully into a languid rose a few hours later, but practically a skin scent.

That bottle though... Paired with 4711’s Ice cologne, is an Instagram still-life in the making...

product_name: A Winter Melody Scented Water Gucci
review_content: The citrus is strong.

product_name: A Winter Melody Scented Water Gucci
review_content: I want to buy this just for the bottle and packaging ... amazing ...

product_name: A Winter Melody Scented Water Gucci
review_content:
This new Gucci line is very nicely presented. When I am able to sample them. I will get back to you on the scents in these
lovely new bottles. Very high end. Nice!

product_name: A Winter Melody Scented Water Gucci
review_content: Wow.. this New high end Gucci collection looks amazing....

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: this is interesting in the way that smelling your finger after touching something gross is interesting. very strong and weird, definitely not something for everyday wear in my opinion. strong, earthy, almost oudh-y and slightly sour coffee and something I can only describe as the scented candle department of an interior shop. not something I would wear

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
If you have the purple Guilty elixir pour femme you, stick to that, you don’t need this.
They grabbed that DNA, added some coffee ground and bitter almond with a hint of citrus, and call it a new scent.
Nope, it’s almost the same with a disturbing citrusy coffee opening which gives an elderly feeling to the whole creation.
Can’t complain on longevity and sillage. It’s so strong we had to drive home with the window down, because it made my husband’s tears flow.
Quality ingredients used here, that’s for sure, but the overall result is just so unnecessary.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: almond and citrus with coffee? weird & disgusting scent. i could never.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
I don’t understand why people are rating this so low? Because this is beautiful 😍
Where I live people rarely compliment each other, but this fragrance got me so many compliments today. It has such a nice scent trail that even my biggest hater at work complimented on how good I smelled.

Overall scent: 9/10
Longevity: 9/10
Projection: 8.5/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
I smelt this from one spray from a sample on my hand and I fell in love straight away so I just had to buy it. It’s gorgeous.

Without looking at the notes I wanted to see what notes were in it before I read up on them and I instantly smelt amaretto, black grape liqueur, juiced plum and dark berries, almond and patchouli, although the plum and berries aren’t in the notes they are there. I get tuberose, white floral and also a coffee note but not strong.

It’s luxurious and juicy, deep and dark, vampy like amaretto and cherry coke. Very boozy, very rich and very gorgeous. I can also smell a little coconut and a little liquorice

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
I’ll just mention the elephant in the room then: PATCHOULI.

Will have to come back to this after some maceration time. Hoping to find that the yummy base notes have developed.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
I don't get the top or middle notes. Just straight base notes on my face. I personally feel this perfume is suitable for men. I just prefer feminine perfumes. Not a safe blind buy.

Rating: 0/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
Oh!! This is sooo sexy! Smells expensive! Gucci Guilty Pour Femme Absolute is pure seduction ❤️ dark, bold, and unapologetically sensual. The moment it touches my skin, it’s like slipping into a second layer of confidence. I picture myself with red lips, my burgundy bag in hand, and my black Louboutins clicking against the pavement every step leaving a trace of mystery in the air.✨✨

This scent isn’t for the shy. It’s for the woman who knows her power, who commands attention without saying a word. With its deep notes of blackberry, Bulgarian rose, and golden wood dangerously elegant.

10/10!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: That dry downnnnnn <3 <3 <3 <3

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Been huffing my wrists while draining my sample. I'm in love! This sweet, boozy, dark and smokey scent is GOOD! 🖤 It's lasting well on both skin and clothes.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I work in cosmetics so I get a lot of samples of new launches: this is lovely! I think it's a very beautiful fragrance for autumn, specifically. It has a nice amount of "booziness" to it which are reminiscent of increasingly early sunsets, holiday dinners with family and a cozy autumn breeze. I can smell an almost wine-like scent in the opening but it does dry into a richer amaretto. The coffee and patchouli give it a bit of mature sophistication so I don't imagine younger people would be too drawn to this. While I enjoyed my samples, it's not a fragrance I'm going to rush to add to my collection because it does struggle in a few places - all the different notes give it a bit of an identity crisis. I don't know if it's trying to be fresh and floral or warm and cozy. I also find the almond note is very strong in the dry down. That's going to annoy people who don't love almond fragrances. This fragrance evokes more of an environmental mood rather than saying anything significant about the person wearing it so it will be interesting to see who becomes a typical purchaser. In comparison to some of the other fall launches, I'd give this one a 7/10.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: People giving low ratings and voting on a perfume that hasn't been out yet are the same type of people who go through influencers/ new celebrities old posts to find something controversial about them in order to get them canceled. Get a job!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Tested this today at Pharmaprix, absolutely a gorgeous scent, great for fall. The longevity and projection are 10 out of 10, this is the next fragrance on my list!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Not my scent profile but I am intrigued, props to Gucci for creating a more unique scent in contrast to the recent bombardment of vanilla gourmand perfumes. (Which I love but it gets to a point!)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I bought it today and love it. Right on time for the fall.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Again, what pathetic people deliberately give low ratings to a perfume that hasn’t even been released yet.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I think both the Pour Homme and Pour Femme look unisex to me.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Absolu de Parfum Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: This looks interesting based on the notes and I like the colours of the bottle and the ombre effect. Looking forward to trying this.
Patchouli and an earthy soapy rose, the earthiness makes this fragrance this fragrance lean masculine. Very nice, definitely high quality.

I’ve been wanting A Gloaming Night for ages, and finally for this year’s “ber months” I took the plunge. ✨
# autumn 2025 🤎
It’s festive, spicy, deep, and utterly beautiful … cinnamon, vetiver, patchouli all in perfect harmony. And the bottle is stunning .. A ruby red jewel in my collection.
Wearing it feels like stepping into twilight … magical, elegant, and totally indulgent. I’m officially hooked ❤️

- Bhavna Darira Chesan
A strange and rich one, didn't like the opening but then kept returning to smell it. A bit too spicy but then it becomes sorta intoxicating?

alberto morillos comes thru again. i like a lot of his frags. they have a magical depth to them that comes out in his spicy, woody, incense gucci alchemist series. altho i am, surprised how many other frag he masterminded under different labels including my favorite eau cartier.
unfortunately it doesn't last so its relegated to bedtime so at least i can enjoy it for awhile

Epic home bringer that Gloaming Night, should've started the Alchemist's Garden with this.

Perfect craft, not sure how excitement and nostalgia can coexist so well like that, with the charm and style to it. It's a movie. Get the mature snug, not too much going on as far as multidirectional, got the rare standout, dense and solid. Opens up dark brown earthy, actually bit fresh fruity too, two days in don't get the Cinnamon yet, immediately Patchouli starts unfolding upon the bitter opening with sheer omnitemporal class, this was elegant in ancient times as well as having futuristicals to it in the present. All purpose, shut pretty much any scenario down with this because it will as well appeal to mass. Stunned by and very pleased with the blind purchase.
An earthy deep dry herbs mix on the fresh side.

This fragrance is absolutely stunning! It's warm and spicy with a hint of sweetness, perfect for a cool evening. The cinnamon note is prominent at first but settles beautifully into the woody vetiver and patchouli base. It's long-lasting and I get compliments every time I wear it.
Am I the only one who can hear a little bit of Creed Aventus on the dry down? The start is a pickle juice with a mix of Noir 29. Vey unique, and somehow I like it.
This is terrible. It smells like makeup / old women

Such a great perfume. I can smell each note, but the cinnamon ties everything together in this kind of earthy, kind of sweet mix that really is something so unique and special. I just used up the last of my small decant of this, but I’m currently sitting, sniffing myself, enjoying this last hurrah of A Gloaming Night because I’ll probably never get a chance to smell it again. Completely unisex, moderate longevity and sillage. Very worth getting your nose on.

Just barely makes grade. Another semi-charming, earthy blend.

Somewhat remiscent of ATH'S Homme or House of Sillage's Dignified. But lighter, more subtle and frankly better, and more refined.

That said, this scent profile is more glooming than gloaming. Starts bland and goes nowhere fast. Another from the series that's more collectible than wearable.

This one is outstanding, and everything I "hoped" The Last Day of Summer would be when I purchased them together. With a large collection I grow tired of the typical floral/sweet/gourmand/woody tones that I consider safe and mass appealing. I'm always on the lookout for something unique that will stand out and give me a moments pause when I apply. I will admit this and others like that will not be everyone's cup of tea, but for ME it's more about the experience and having gentle reminders throughout the day that what I'm wearing isn't like anything else I can smell on others around me. This is an Oriental base with just the right amount of sweetness. For what it's worth I feel this bares no resemblance to Gris Dior which is another favorite of mine.

I can understand the comparison with The Noir 29, they are not exactly the same and you can definitely tell them apart. A Gloaming Night is a more brighter version of The Noir 29.

Good quality ingredients and good longevity as it should be considering the high price.

very unique smell, i can't tell if i like it or not. perfect for an overcast cold fall day tho. smells very wet forest/swamp-like....i imagine this is what an ogre would smell like. drydown is veryyyy nice
Don't get the hype about this and the crazy prices. It reminds me of mens colognes from the 90s...or mens cheap shower gel....

Reminds me a lot of noir 29 and gris dior. I also get brioni intense. Since I enjoy these fragrances quite a bit, I thought it was safe to blind buy, and I was right. I think this is like an earthy noir 29, but I don't exactly smell the earthy notes unless I come up close and take a sniff on my arm. But overall, I think it's pretty great. Kind of feels like I'm walking through a calm dimly lit street somewhere all alone. But not in a creepy, scary kind of setting, just serene and peaceful.

This scent is a hot patchouli bitter sweet experience. The cinnamon and vetiver are mixed with other dry wet/minty dirt notes, it feels very bizarre. At some point it reminds me of some herbal tea.
I guess that it can be great on some people but I don't enjoy it. It feels a little half done, like a chemistry experiment that has an specific herbal odor...

I tried nearly every fragrance from the Alchemist line and found most of them very average, and massively overpriced. I never got to try Gloaming Night because it was always sold out until today; and now I understand why it's popular and sold out.

Gloaming Night was love at first smell, and the best from the alchemist line. I'm very picky about cinnamon and because of that, I've never bought one... until now. This fragrance is an excellent cinnamon. Spicy but not overpowering cinnamon and patchouli. Smells expensive, luxurious, and is classy. It's simple, and I wish it was a little more complex, but succeeds in what it is. Gucci finally hit a home run with this one.

Bottom Line: Best from the alchemist line IMO. Voice of the snake is good if you're not already familiar with that DNA (it is done better elsewhere) last day of summer is a solid option but it's also not super unique and Eyes of the Tiger is great but admittedly, very simple in a crowded genre. This is also simple, but it's great at what it does.

Scent: 8.8/10
Performance: 6.5/10

Edit: Hortus is now my favorite from the alchemist line and the entire house of Gucci. Unfortunately, you can only find it at select boutiques and online for a price that will make your heart stop

Beautiful cinnamon and patch combo a little slick and spicy reminds me of autumn 🍂 and evening outdoors with freshly chopped wood sitting next to a burning campfire
hot cinnamon tea in hand burning light herbs in my incense burner mmm mm…

I love it so so so so so so much
Very unique... this feels natural, greenary, bitter... somehow it feels like I am being a lonely sexy woman in the woods. . .under the gloaming moonlight??
Highly recommended....
Yesterday my boyfriend was wearing it and was also great.. it's unisex fragrance.
.. I felt so horny when I was hugging him ...the perfume...so good....

You can order samples from theperfumedcourt!
I really enjoyed this, but I don't think I could pull it off. But it is so gorgeous. Teeny tiny bit gives me Nirvana Rose vibes but definitely way way way less rose.

I get patchouli, rose, and a very clean soapy vibe (upscale, dry and clean linen, freshly pressed with steam lifting from it). They backed the otherwise harsh woody chemicals (vetiver, etc.) with fresh chemicals, making it wearable even in an office, I would think. Still, it has this kind of faint vinegar smell which I don't necessarily like, and at the price point I would never buy it. That vinegary smell comes from lily of the valley aroma chemicals, I think and it does actually taper down in 10 - 15 minutes.
Does anyone know how to order samples of The Alchemist’s Garden perfumes by Gucci?

Similar to Gris Dior in the sense that it’s a patchouli-forward chypre that is very unisex. I always thought Gris Dior smelled like a women’s beauty department of a high end department store, but this Gucci definitely does not smell as feminine as the Dior does. Solidly unisex IMO. Added to my to-buy list, but I’d never buy it unless I got a big discount
Tried this at the local store. Love it. It’s sweeter than expected and that’s good. Can’t stand vetiver being too dry. Easy to wear. Should be able to layer with leather nicely. Love the red bottle.
Awful. Nothing like the description or the notes. I do get patch, but also rose? Somehow manages to be screechy and harsh while still sitting close to the skin.
I have a bottle for sail 100ml sealed .US only

I brought Elle In Paris Eau De Parfum today and got flashbacks. Top notes are Raspberry Leaf, Black Currant, Pear and Sorbet; middle notes are Rose, Magnolia and Jasmine Sambac; base notes are Musk, Patchouli and White Woods.

I got a small sample of Envy, and it’s a shame it’s been discontinued. Delicious. It reminds me a bit of Miu Miu. Fresh, like dewy cut grass, with a dry, mossy thread running through it. There’s a sheer white floral sweetness that makes it feel creamy and luminous: magnolia with a lemony glow, a touch of green jasmine, and just a hint of blooming rose. Sometimes it makes me think of Carnal Flower, though thinner, less rich, less solar. The bergamot actually comes forward more as it dries down, and once you know there’s pineapple in it, its juicy sweet-tartness sticks with you. It wears so easily, sharp but elegant. It’s instantly likeable.

Best womans fragrance of all times.What an amazing thing...i had a friend when studying in italy she were blonde, and so chic... She had a ton of fragrances but everytime she were wearing that she were like a goddess...amazing..
I agree with Mandie731! I've worn this since it first was launched. I currently have two 1.7 oz bottles but sadly one has gone bad :(

If I had just one wish it would be for Gucci to bring Envy back. Please, Gucci, I am begging you!! Ok, that may be a tad dramatic, but it really is such a shame this was discontinued. For a perfume made in the 90s, this still smells so modern. It's hard to believe it's nearly 30 years old. I will cherish the rest of my bottle for as long as I can and only use it on very special occasions, but I will be bereft when it runs out.

Used to wear this perfume when I was in University and recently I tried Le Jardin de Monsieur Li at Hermes, that reminded me of Gucci Envy, and another perfume with similar scent is 5th Avenue, 70% similar
I loved this so much growing up - bye bye, old friend :(

I adore this. Would be my signature if it was still around. It's definitely unique and meant for someone who is an aficionado of green fragrance.Just reeks class and old money.

It's a master blend of florals, greens, and woody notes. Opening to me is Freesia, Pineapple, and Vodka; settles into Lily-of-the-Valley, Hyacinth, and Iris; later notes as it ends are base notes are Oakmoss, and Musk.

I have both the EDT (clear bottle) and EDP (black bottle). The EDT is fresher florals in composition whereas the EDP has more of the powdery iris/violet and sandalwood. But, they are similar enough to where when you're wearing it, you definitely know it's Gucci Envy.

Absolutely broke my heart when this discontinued and I treasure what bottles I do have left. I consider it a treat.

This is one of those discontinued fragrances I own that I'm scared of using bc I know I'll mourn after it once it's gone.

Sexy and clean can contradict each other, but I think they go well to describe this perfume. Imagine a garden full of white florals - particularly Lilly of the valley - after a rainy morning. The refreshing scent of the rain amplifies the smell of all of the plants and flowers, and a young lady who is wearing a musky perfume is now walking through her garden, relieved that she doesn't have to water them.

Envy combines a variety of green notes and musk into this lovely, ladylike potion. Lilly of the valley is definitely the leader in this team, but you can also feel some freesia in there as well as oak moss. Feminine and charming while also having this enchanting, not really seductive but heavily attractive quality to it. I wish Gucci would bring this back and not make it body spray longevity, unlike their recent releases.
A really novel white floral fragrance. I still reach for this even if its been around forever. The top fruit and green notes really give the white florals a unique spin.
Clean, fresh and iris. I am selling a perfume inspired by Envy on my etsy and ebay shop. You can reach me out for the link.
I had this back in the day, maybe early 2000s? I wore it out dancing, primarily. It was a wonderful feminine, green scent. I wonder if it's still sitting in a bin in storage...

I've been wearing this since it came out in the nineties. It is by far my most complimented fragrance hands down. Delina really reminds me of Envy but not as sweetly piercing. It will always be in my collection as long as I can find it for a fairly reasonable price. Thank goodness I still have 3/4 of a 1.7 oz bottle 🥰
Unforgettably intoxicating feminine scent. I wish Gucci would bring it back!

Gucci Envy
(50 ml., thief shop, 25 usd, fairy mint condition, 1997 batch)

Me & my hubby, finding some activity to do.
On this beautiful raining Sunday, we decided to go to Japanese thief shop, fairy far from a town.
Big warehouse.

I found Envy, green bottle. Sit in the shelf.
The shop is humble and let us test.
I split one tiny spray on my hand.

I got instant eyes-roll, it is the best mossy green white-floral I have been tested so far, like I can’t explain.

It is very clean, soapy and modern.
No we not talking about pass modern.
It is very now, I don’t mind wearing this at all.
In 2024. It is minimalistic clean white floral.

Comparison to the classic release in around the same times, you could feel the scent indicates the era. Pleasure by Estee. Something like that.
No but it is not the case with Envy.

You know, I pay certain amount to enjoy Fleaur Diamantine by Maison Crivelli but damn like, there is no major difference, Ms.Envy might be the same teir.

My 2nd throw back time fragrance that make me feel something like this apart from Parco pour Homme.

Old perfumer is something else..
Why, I have no idea, why?
Why they can create something like this..
Since 1997 and hold up until this day..?!??

Addendum (Ps. But yeah.. as much I am enjoy this scent, the classic floral green blueprint. I can’t recommend you to pay abusive high price for this.. unless you have strong nostalgia. You crave it, to evoke something inside. Please don’t hold back..)

I found an incredible deal on a vintage 100 ml bottle, but it wasn’t packed well and leaked during shipping. So, these are my notes on skin from the tiny bit left and from the contents on the cardboard box.

It’s a definitely green floral, but not harsh, and the woods are prominent. My guess is the woods are more prominent for me than they would be typically because the bottle leaked slowly in transit, so it’s been exposed to air for a while. The pineapple lends softness to the green flowers. It seems to have a rounding effect as opposed to emphasizing the fruit. It doesn’t exactly smell like vintage Cristalle, but it creates a similar feeling. But take this all with a grain of salt, because my sample is odd. It does make me want to find another bottle, however.

Was curious to try this popular late 90's creation, so I got a mini. I transferred some of it into a spray vial so I could wear it properly, and gotta admit I'm not into it at all. It's not that Envy is bad, it's just not my thing.
It's mellow and green, smells way more simplistic than the note pyramid.
Some fruit, a little floral, with an underlying smell of dewy grass. Longevity is pretty good, though.

Gucci Envy was a fragrance I first smelt when I was in my late teens. A boyfriends mother had a tray of fragrances in the bathroom, and I would see her get ready to go out for the evening and usually reached for this. She always dressed sophisticated and chic. The fragrance really suited her. I remember thinking, "Huh! Is that what elegance smells like!?" As a person who grew up in a household where both parents disliked fragrance, I rarely got to enjoy any until I lived on my own. I remember wanting Gucci Envy but couldn't afford it at the time, and by the time I could, it was gone. Gucci Envy should definitely be brought back it had all the right notes that made for a fresh yet sexy classy fragrance. It is truly a feminine scent.

first i am getting a dewy green floral with woods. i think i get iris, oakmoss and lily primarily. strangely, in the beginning it smells exactly like something else i've tried but can't place. it gets a bit soapy after about 20 minutes, and i think i am getting musk and hyacinth. i think maybe mine has gone off honestly, as it's a partially full mini bottle. it just stays fairly woody with an odd toasty sort of smell in the background. however it doesn't smell like that in the bottle, so i am unsure, could be a skin chemistry thing.

I used to have it in my 20ties. I loved it. It was green, juicy, soooo feminine. After it was sadly discontinued I tried to find sth similar and never encountered anything even close to Envy. Wish it was back!!!
please bring it back!!! when this perfume was discontinued so was a part of me...

This scent accompanied me through my moving out my parents house to study and my first heart break. Had Gucci brought it back, I'm nt sure I would have purchased it because of the scent association attached. But this was a beautiful scent. Green, fresh, clear, lily of the valley scent that is worth to be brought back to life.
I used to love this, please bring this back Gucci!!!

Gucci hear me! I need this piece of my best years back. I loved this. I still have my old bottle in my collection, I don’t wear it but sometimes I need a dose of a good smell and it always makes me smile. It was strong and light at the same time, love it!

This was a favourite of mine in the late 90s. Gutted it was discontinued, however I found a good dupe here in the UK - it's fragrance 042 by Eden Perfumes. Not sure if it's available elsewhere though. I'll be wearing this regularly now. Marks a change from all the sweet perfumes and this is such a beautiful green scent despite it being so green, especially at first spray and the first few hours after. It just makes me feel happy and energised from the instant I spray it on. It doesn't smell synthetic at all. It can almost be unisex but still retains enough femininity for a woman who is into fresh, green, floral fragrances. One could even say there's a vegetal element to Gucci Envy.
I loved this back in the day. Fresh and summery. Smells floral but also slightly like celery.

I miss the fragrance so much. I wish Gucci would bring it back without reformulating. I treasure my left overs which are over 20 years old and still smell just as amazing as when I purchased the bottle.

Very nice and pleasant, but nothing special really. I did'nt wear this back in the day so I don't have powerful memories of this. It's just another floral fragrance like EL Pleasures or EA Fifth Avenue. Nothing to write home about.

The first fragrance I got into. It was the last year of college and our class had taken a trip to France. My roommate had bought a bottle, and I had to know what it was. I used Envy for years after that, until the green aspects of the fragrance started to sit on me wrong.

Some 15 years later, I check in here and realize that Envy has been discontinued. I then found an old bottle in storage and tested it out. The opening notes after application went somewhere odd and I worried that it had turned, but after that it became the Envy I remembered. For me, it sits firmly for me in a category that I've come to label "perfume perfume", and is what I associate with most of the larger designer house perfumes, Guerlain excepted. Envy is not trying to be any one thing outside of a green-noted floral with wide appeal, and there's an elegant simplicity to that. There may not be perfumes that do this exact thing as well, but there's plenty of other scents out there to fill the void that Envy has left in the perfume world. Explore the world of smaller perfume houses--this scene has only gotten larger since the late 90s and early aughts.

This was my signature scent for over 20 yrs. Hard to find fresh bottles without paying an astronomical price. It was always my most complimented fragrance ever. The bottles I have, have turned, sadly. It would last until the next day and the sillage was moderate and very pleasant.

I am huge fan of Envy for Men and thanks to other members of Fragrantica I have found perfect clone. I was curious when I found out when the same brand has also Envy for Women clone. I think that this one is also a spot on! Guys try Eclat 042! I am not promoting this brand, but this is crazy how good their fragrances are!
For Gucci Envy lovers, Atelier Flou's Paradis Paradis is almost what legendary Envy is, with a slightly powdery undertone. Great surprise.
This scent brings back a lot of memories for me. I can cry when I smell this.
Very unique. I swear there is tonnes of mandarine in this. Green mandarine oil and red mandarine oil, but it is not listed as a note ???

I get it in absolutely bargain price. I did not know is discontinued. The scent is strong and fruity green, bit flowery with hint of creamy vibe. It stays @10 hours on my skin, siliage is to the arm lenght. Very pleasant perfume.

Decided to wear this today as I still have my vintage one from over 20 years ago. Haven’t worn it in a few years. It still smells ABSOLUTELY fresh to this day. Has not turned one bit! It is so green and invigorating. I’m not one for green notes ordinarily BUT this lifts your senses. I thought it was a simple green fragrance with some floral tones. A simple pyramid. But gosh that’s one full pyramid. For me the bergamot is the overall impression of the fragrance even if the floral is the main accord. Yes I can smell Lily of the valley BUT that bergamot makes it PEAK your senses. Love the fact this still has that rare oak moss base in it. Nothing artificial about this, although it still smells perfumey. This isn’t my style but I appreciate it. Gucci clearly has a fan base here but I don’t think they’d be able to replicate the authenticity of this without the oakmoss. Even if the aroma chemicals and new molecules can replicate such smells I just don’t think it would be the same.

With endless midwinter nights, snow flurries, you may need a scented calendar.

Hyacinth is an Advent and Christmas flower in Sweden

Envy/ Gucci on the other hand, is a spring fragrance, with bright flowers, greenery and a hint of the cream Nivea (does it mean snow?) that deepens and supports.

Just like Anais- Anais makes me feel like a little girl, something everyone needs a little now and then.

I probably prefer Hyacinth's deeper and for me spicier notes.
Enjoying celebrating winter party already now.

I miss this perfume so much. I am forever in search of green, fresh, feminine fragrances. Issey Miyake's A Scent hit the spot for a while, but even that is discontinued and I am using a bottle I found on Ebay. Chanel Chance Eau Fraiche is my main go to scent. By chance I saw the reviews here mentioned a good copy of Envy on the Perfume Parlour website - Florence Spite II For Women, and so I ordered a 13ml spray and...wow, it is even better than the original Envy! It has a gorgeous musky base and is long-lasting, with all of the green freshness I miss so much. They also do body wash, body lotion, diffusers, candles etc in this beautiful scent. Thanks to those of you who recommended it.
Ladies, try Cartier La Panthère Eau de Toilette if you can't find a rare bottle of Gucci Envy.

Gucci, I beg of you, bring this back!!!

I wore this to death in my late teens and early twenties, it was perfection. Green and fresh but so sexy too, signature worthy! So unique too.

I tried a dupe of it recently but that unfortunately had a note in it that made me gag, I was so heartbroken. Managed to find a half used bottle on eBay for a bit of a steal as I have to have it in my collection.
Holy grail of all time, if anyone in NZ has a bottle message me!

I have a miniature version of Envy and oh my God it still smell so good after 20+ years! (one of my precious retro collection)
This used to be my very first citrusy, lime-y, green perfume back in early y2k. It has a lime-y, greenish fresh scent with uplifting spirit. I cant find any perfume with the similar scent. That's really sad.
Please bring this perfume back Gucci!
please bring it back !

It's unique! Fresh, green and flowery!
