Beautiful. I purchased it blindly from a person who often sells hard to find perfumes. I like rare scents (as in hard to find and/or discontinued etc). I first smelled it during winter and it reminded me a popular scent from the 90-ies, and even though pretty then, it seemed to be lacking the depth. Indeed, after I used this today (a warm , but not hot, June day), it opened up probably twice as deep, but interestingly not the same correlation with that unknown scent from few decades ago. The scent of Gucci Envy is almost completely new to my nose, thankfully (in this case.) It's fresh, citrusy-floral. It smells sweet to me, but not in the traditional sugar/vanilla way. The sweetness comes from the sweet fruits and flowers used to compose this masterpiece. It's strong too, which I appreciate, but not overbearing and seems completely easy and non offensive. I'm not sure how long it'll last but because it's discontinued, I recommend it to anyone who likes quality and beauty in a citrus floral perfume and is fortunate to find this hard to come by scent. Also, I'm not entirely sure, but I think it reminds me Elizabeth Arden 5th Avenue. In fact they share the following 10 notes: Lily of the Valley, Magnolia, Jasmine, Iris, Violet, Rose, Bergamot, Peach, Musc, Sandalwood. It also reminds me Issey Miyake The Scent (EDT) :the notes they share are citrus fruit, Hyacinth,Jasmine, Cedar (and maybe more, but Fragrantica only shows these.)

It's funny. Envy is such a murky emotion. I envisage it as a mucky khaki colour. Yet Envy the perfume is as clear as a piece of bright lime/leaf-green glass, letting sunlight pour through. So named because of the sharpness and acidity of the concept perhaps. It is citric, lime-like, a tiny bit floral, something rounds it out but I don't know what. I don't get peach but maybe the genius Roucel rounds out and warms up any possible harshness with it. Where lesser agents would have dumped a dollop of fruity sweetness in (to apologise for the citrus) and unbalance this composition in favour of sales. But instead this sings clear and at a high pitch. It is an abstract representation of envy, very green, juicy without sweetness, well lit, transparent. I remember when it first came out Yuzu was mentioned as one of its notes. Lily is brought in to sing with the sharpness, yet lends a softness. So many contrasts and intrigues in this.
Persona by Ingmar Bergman 1966

Envy is a pretty decent fresh green scent. I am reviewing my miniature from the early noughties. Composed by the excellent Maurice Roucel, I expected a dream green scent. While it is excellent at times, notably its opening and drydown, overall it is not the ultimate green for me, thanks to an unfortunate sour phase. It has shades of Cristalle EDP, Jardins de Bagatelle and Eternity - three acclaimed, fresh, floral scents from roughly the same era that I find slightly off-putting due to an astringent/sour note.

Envy opens with bright fruity notes, with pineapple being most dominant. I don't usually like pineapple, but this is probably the use of the pineapple note I have come across. There is a hint of peach in there. Bergamot adds crisp tartness, tempering the sweetness nicely.

Some clean, fresh yet soft florals emerge on the skin after a little while as the fruity notes subside. Green lily-of-the-valley leads the way, and is the most prominent floral note to my nose - it is beautifully rendered. The other florals emerge - namely some soft hyacinth and a hint of jasmine, which along with the lily-of-the-valley, develop to form a clean white floral accord. Some violet leaf adds a slightly metallic edge, and here it takes a slightly unpleasant turn - becoming a sour, slightly sharp, Eternity-like white floral that overstays its welcome on my skin.

The drydown is not truly chypre-like, as I was expecting, but instead becomes a musky, slightly mossy, woody accord. The sour phase subsides, and the drydown is a more pleasant phase of Envy. Remnants of the white florals are present, primarily jasmine. Sillage and longevity are moderate, and it is feminine-leaning in my opinion.

Green and crisp until the end, Envy is nicely crafted fresh green scent. Missed by many, it is a pity it has been discontinued. However, thanks to its sour phase, it's not a must-have for me. 3/5.
Does anyone have a bottle that they're willing to sell?

Smells like baby wipes at first, there's also a heavy sunscreen note in there. Really reminds me of taking a vacation to florida as a kid, that humid summertime smell. Pineapple is probably the most potent note. VERY summery.
Does anyone by chance have a bottle of Gio (Giorgio Armani 90's) that they'd like to trade for Gucci Envy? I have a 1.7ounce bottle that's nearly full:) Might be a long shot but still asking...

I think fruity notes were (and still is) so prominent in commercial fragrances that it has become a second thought in consumers' minds. For a green floral, this is actually primarily pineapple and not lily of the valley—although I've never smelled the real flower, take one look at Guerlain and other famous creations, you know this is not it.
For those contemplating on buying this discontinued gem at an outrageous price, think about what it is that you're drawn to; I recommend searching for green chypres with pineapple. There are some Creed Adventus imitations with exaggerated pineapple note that is similar to this, as well as Amouage Interlude Woman if you want a intensified "nuit" version (kiwi + incense) 🙂

Ah. This green dream....
I bought it upon its release, and kept wearing it for years.
Back then I was penniless and without direction in life. Then one day I came across Envy at the perfume counter of a newly opened shopping mall in Florence.

That place was filled with all the most beautiful things, and I used to spend hours there to window shop as my wallet was always very hungry. It is there that I met with Envy, the vivid memory of that moment etched forever in my heart.
I remember browsing and sniffing a number of perfumes and then gravitating towards its uncommon bottle shape. A spray, just one in the air... and my heart went BANG!

I fell in love instantly. The scent made me feel a million dollars, it spoke to my core of all dreams I had. Hyacinth, green notes, a timid (very) freesia - the muguet, really, is not detectable per se as a note. I smelled grape too, vine precisely, though there's none in the composition. Instantly, I grabbed a bottle and reached the counter with determination. I knew I'd never regret spending that much on my dreams.

At today, whenever I spray it, my mind goes back to the young, penniless girl. And I marvel at her knowing of what truly matters in life: how we feel about ourselves. Envy is a perfume that exudes confidence and joy.
Forever in my perfume armoire!

Carolyn Bissette Kennedy didn't wear this. But when I smell Gucci Envy, I picture her. Why? Something about the combination of clean florals, green freshness and comforting lactonic cream remind me of the pure beauty, and chic aesthetic she personified. Envy is a perfect white Oxford shirt tucked into a camel colored pencil skirt. It's the type of blonde women will spend thousands to achieve. It's being sexy, being rich, being clean. This isn't classified as being a lactonic scent like it's cousin Rush, but there's something so very milky about this. Perhaps because its reminiscent of the Pantene Pro-V conditioner that was all the rage in the mid 90s.

Song: Celine Dion - It's All Coming Back to Me Now

I was finally able to get my hands on a bottle of this masterpiece and have been hesitant to write my review, simply because it is my absolutely favorite fragrance of all time, and I've decided to make it my signature scent. I just don't think words can accurately express my love for this fragrance, and if anyone from Gucci is reading this, I beg you to bring this scent back, exactly the way it was originally. Maurice, you are a genius, a fragrance god, for coming up with this divine concoction and I bow down to your excellence. I was first introduced to this fragrance back in 2002, during my high school years, and whilst I didn't quite understand how masterful it was back then, I still enjoyed wearing it. I do have some scent memories attached to this fragrance, but that's not why I love it. I just think this fragrance smells downright amazing. I am not a huge fan of Lily of the Valley, but for some reason, I think when it's mixed with the Hyacinth, it just works. I absolutely love how when I wear this fragrance, I can actually smell it on myself. It is not one of those fragrances that I become nose deaf to, it creates this beautiful scent bubble that lasts a very long time, 8+ hours. There are some fragrances, like Baccarat Rouge 540 that do this disappearing act while wearing it, and you can't seem to smell it on yourself. Envy does not do that at all. In terms of what this scent smells like, it's like the most insanely beautiful green floral scent that has some freshness and a crispness to it. It is extremely unique and just stunning overall. I think what I love about Envy the most is that it's not too much of any one scent profile. It's not too floral, it's not too green, and it's not too fresh. It is purely the best combination of all those things. I suppose there is a hint of a fruity quality, with the pineapple and the peach, but they are not what stands out, they're there in the background giving the slightest touch of sweetness. The combination of base notes is another aspect that really intrigues, and I love a good oakmoss in the base. It is interesting to me that there is Jasmine in the heart and the base, and Jasmine is another floral note that I am very partial to. In terms of when this scent is appropriate to wear, I would say you can wear this all year around if you live in a moderate climate, day or night. If you live in a place that gets very cold, I would say, probably save this for spring/summer. I have two backups of this fragrance that I hope will last me for many years without them going off... I am using what I have very sparingly because I never want to be without this. Just sniffing it from the bottle gives me joy. I pray that Gucci brings this back, it is a shame they discontinued it! I love you Gucci Envy!!!

I gifted my wife with this beauty on two separate occasions, many years ago. So so sad it’s been discontinued 😟 But why Gucci, why ??? 😩

“Let us spread the scents of peace and kindness. The two most beautiful fragrance in the world” 🙏

The most beautiful, truly green perfume composition. Shame it was discontinued. This fragrance represents well what Tom Ford era did for Gucci (look at Gucci now, the clothes and fragrances are hideous, tacky, and for the desperate, followers, and posers). This scent is sophisticated, fresh, and feels like a privalege to wear, since its discontinued. Maybe because my bottle hasnt been protected from heat or light, but it does not last at all. Expensive online but worth it.

This perfume had been with me through countless events, parties and date nights. The longevity and sillage is beast mode. It smells so classy, elegant and whenever I wear this I feel extra special. I loveee this! Sadly this is discontinued and the exorbitant prices at the market makes me want to really hold on to my last remaining bottle for as long as I can.

Envy was the first fragrance I fell in love with and the one that made me discover the world of perfumes several years later so beware, this review is filled with a lot of nostalgia.

Not a usual pick for a teenager, right? Well, it was handed to me by my mother, who actually hates it, and it immediately became my favorite scent, shoving aside all those woody and vanilla frags I had on my shelf. Ah, those high-school days when Envy blended so well with cigarette smoke and wild trips! It’s crisp, stern and so chic, makes me think of 90s Kate Moss.

To me, it’s truly a masterpiece, a piercing blend of oakmoss and lily-of-the-valley. It’s a pity it got discontinued, I wish they’d create green florals like this again. I’ve only got 15 ml left now and I can’t make myself wear it, guarding it like a dragon. I got CdG Celluloid Galbanum in hopes for finding the familiar scent but it’s not the same, it’s green, yes, but more simple and bold.

Music: The Velvet Underground.

Every time I smell a new green perfume, in my heart I'm hoping at least one will smell like this one.

A true green floral, the deliciousness of sour sweets, fizzy, zingy, zesty, and yet smells expensive and like nothing else. Longlasting with a good cloud for others to pick up on, without being a "beast"; it's just fantastic quality.

In the innocence of youth, this was an unopened hand-me-down from my mother, and since it was my only "proper" perfume at the time, it was practically my first signature scent so I wore it out everywhere - including clubbing! How I wish I could save some of those sprays wasted on crowds of Axe wearers (kidding, sorta). Snagged a backup bottle a few years back but I'm constantly on the hunt for a dupe and no luck yet. Instead releasing rosy or 'intense' flankers every year, brands should bring back discontinued gems, which would sell far better.

Wearing this right now for the very last time since I recently sold my bottle and will be shipping it out today.
It's a nice spring/summer scent. It has a nail polish smell to it if you know what I mean.

Lily-of-the-valley is my childhood flower no. 1. I associate it with the ceremonies at the end of semester and start of the long summer break; we all went picking the flowers in the nearby grove and handed to our school teacher before heading out to have ice cream and ride our bikes to the nearby lake.

Envy however is a grown-up lily-of-the-valley. It has all the qualities I appreciate in a springtime fragrance: subtle, crisp yet soft, green but not harsh. Pure pale green elegance.

Yes, Gucci should bring this wonderful fragrance back. Green floral with an attitude. Complex yet in a way simple and very versatile. Perfect balance between floral, green and spicy notes (those stand out the most to me) - the result is a fresh scent that is not boring or forgettable. I find it almost juicy. Longevity is great. The bottle design perfect. I layer Elizabeth Arden's Fifth Avenue and CK One and that ends up smelling similar to Envy but the result is not as complex. Still - for those who are not able to enjoy this scent this could be an option.

I love this fragrance and I really want Gucci to bring it back. It's the perfect scent for the modern world.

I am so bored with current perfumes and perfume trends in general, but this one was always a winner!

Different, fresh, green and envokes confidence and relaxation in all who wear it!

What a nice meeting! What a different thing from current perfumes!

When I first smelled this perfume there was that magic in which I found myself thinking: "I have smelled this before". That part of my brain that always searches in the back of my memory was stimulated and started trying to connect the scent with any past experience... This time, however, my brain did not find it.

Gucci Envy is a green floral. And there is no way to describe it better. It is a gentle breeze that brings the scent of sprinkled flowers in a sea of fresh green grass. Its sillage and duration are so good that you can spend hours walking through that idyllic meadow that has been evoked in your mind. Today I have used it again and I have had a ficticious walk all morning, appearing to be a sunny one despite being really cloudy outside. It makes me feel serenity.

Sillage is moderate-high and projects very well for a lot of hours. Its duration is more than 10 hours on my skin.

It is a perfume that, in any case, will shine much more in spring than now and it will probably be the first perfume I will look for as soon as spring blooms again next year. What a great shame that this jewel is discontinued!

Scent 9/10
Duration 9/10
Sillage 9/10
Versatility 7/10
Packaging 6/10
Would I buy again? Yes, although it is most likely not possible

do not like it. feels very green, and fresh but like not deliberately but like a hogdepodge of unripe fruits and lawn clippings. havent yet gotten myself to try it on my skin so my opinions are just on the smell straight outta the bottle.

stole it from my mom because the bottle is pretty but i wanted this to smell nice as well. might smuggle it back into her collection.

for me , it’s a masterpiece !
so clean and classy .
i love the bottle too .
I hope one day they will bring it back .

One of my favourites. I still have a few bottles but I also found a very good dupe on Perfume Parlour. I wish Gucci would bring this back though. Last time I was in Rome, I asked in a perfume sop whether they had any out the back. The young sales assistant looked at me in disdain and "ma quella è vecchia"...well in my opinion, you really can't beat some of these older fragrances.

I miss this so much- it was my favourite ever. Long lasting too! I probably nearly drowned myself in it in the 90s.
I’ve found something quite similar, totally by accident- I was in Lidl smelling the cheap perfumes and one leaked all over my hand. I was very annoyed until I sniffed my hand and realised how similar it was to Envy! Perhaps not so metallic, slightly more soapy once dried down, but for £4.99 I’m happy sniffing and reminiscing :) it’s called Suddenly Essence De Esplendor. Well done Lidl!
Eden Vegan perfumes based in the UK have a good version of Envy, hope this helps some of you missing Envy. Mine lasts most of the day - I enjoy it more than I did the original! Its No. 42 named NV.

I love this perfume.
I bought bottles after bottles every year when I was in highschool.
It was my signiture scent.
I still own a new bottle but I don't want to use it yet.
I wish Gucci brings it back.

It's fresh,lemony,bitter,fizzy.

Very long lasting,Great projection

This was the first designer perfume I ever purchased. It was in 2004 and I was only in high school. I never wore it much because it smelled so fancy and I didn’t really have anywhere fancy to go. I gave it away to a friend a long time ago, we actually traded. I remember I absolutely loved this, but it just felt too grown for me at the time. I wish I kept it as it’s hard to find nowadays.

The Green Juice was my all time favorite and my signature scent in the late 90s but a reason behind its discontinuation may be the performance. It last only 15 minutes on the skin at most. In my opinion it is one of the worst performing fragrances I’ve ever owned. A house cleaner broke my bottle some years back which is how I learned it was discontinued. I quickly bought up three 3.7 bottles and two 1.7 bottles for a large price. As lovely as this fragrance is, the $399 and $699 prices online sellers are now trying to acquire for this fragrance is not worth the money. If it performed like a beast, perhaps. Unfortunately that is not the case. The description on Fragrantica is correct. Flowers, metal and minimalistic. Very beautiful and unique. Too bad it lasts less than 1/2 hour. I’m spraying it on clothing to see if the fragrances last better that way.

My first love and my eternal love.

從鹹魚上淘回這隻，幾乎全新，留個念想。上身的瞬間，記憶湧現，上一次相遇，至少是十年前。

以下是我在知乎上回答的——

香水于我，是记忆，也是情绪。

18岁开始用香水，到现在已经快18年，我不介意暴露年龄。未成年便被送到澳洲念书，虽然很多人都说人的三观的形成早在其12岁以前，但那时候的我，除了终于知道独立生活的不容易，也对这个西方新世界的一切充满好奇。很庆幸我在各种场合遇到了各种各样友善的鬼佬，都是长辈吧，他们教会了我英文的典故，以及西方的礼仪。

并没有人直截了当地告诉我喷香水是种必要，只是作为一个从小就嗅觉非常敏锐的人，我觉得香气可以悦己悦人，何乐而不为。第一支香水是Gucci的Envy，可能是哪本星座书上写过这是天蝎座的签名香吧。前前后后用完过四五支，差不多十年前有一次喷它突然皮肤过敏了好几天，便戒了，但它依然在我青春的岁月里占据了非常重要的一段时光。再后来的十几年，陆陆续续买了三四十支商业香，有些也算是挺冷门的，比如Cerruti 1881，或者John Galliano。但相对来说在某一个时间段内用的香水还是比较固定的，于是，每一支都成了一段记忆的承载。有颇不成功的明撩暗恋，有与大学挚友熬夜做建筑模型的亢奋，有打工生涯的辛苦，通过香水，通过嗅觉，帮我巩固记忆。

这两三年突然入了沙龙的坑，人的占有欲之可怕，简直一发不可收拾。如果不是财力有限（qiong），我可能已经拥有一个香水帝国。当我接触了越来越多优秀的香水，也通过一些相关书籍的阅读和同样爱香水的朋友的交流，对不同香味的接受度就越来越广。依然会欣赏很多并不复杂的花香果香调，但嗅觉一直在跟我说，它需要更多复杂层次的刺激才能被满足。

但也因为如今一天都不会只用一支，所以香水与记忆的关联变弱了。开始在网上写香评，可惜没有专门学过，所以没法从比较专业的角度去剖析，多只是一些对每支香水的主香调的感受，相对主观。

除了以上，“明白或者获得了什么”？因为喜欢香水，所以会关注其周边，书也好纪录片也好，本身又对心理学感兴趣，所以会去了解不同国家地区不同人种不同年龄对香水的不同喜好，特别是在工作上，会提前了解下客户背景，选择相对应的香水，通过香水拉小陌生感。

To me, parfum is a tool of communication, a media to find the same kind.

When I had my first serious job in the mid 00s this is what I wore if I'd had a late night and needed to pull myself together in the morning.

It was like the olfactory version of a bauhaus building to my mind, functional but ahead of its time in some way. Not a scent that cosseted but one that made you stand up straight and get things done. On me it had a cool bitterness, but a little warmth in the background to keep it balanced. A good one.

This was given to me as a gift, Christmas '99. It was my first designer perfume and boy, did I feel sophisticated wearing it! Far more grown up than any of the cheap drugstore type perfumes I was used to, this was very green and fresh and it opened up a whole new world of fragrance to me. I loved the dewy lily and clean breezy vibe, but the longevity was fleeting on me. Funnily enough I don't think this is the kind of perfume I would ever wear now, but it's a really nice little scent memory.

I’m fairly amateur so don’t know much about notes. I know the key one here is lily of the valley and I can only say I haven’t liked a single other fragrance that has this note so I think that says something about the uniqueness of Envy. I just received the edp version today and experienced fresh devastation at its discontinuation. They smell very similar to me, I’d say the edp is a richer version of the same fragrance. This was my signature scent from when I first tried it 15-20 years ago, up until it became too rare/expensive to replenish. I’ve never managed to find anything quite like it and have amassed a fairly big (by my standards anyway!) collection in the attempt. I’ve discovered new loves over the years but still don’t have a signature and not sure I ever will again. I’ll be using my last 10ml of edt very sparingly in case it’s the last bottle I ever have.

Triedthis fothefirst time today. Winter test.

Well well, I can see why people like this, buuuut, not all the hoopla.

The hyacinth is out front, its very nice buuuut, theres zero chance I'm paying 400 bucks online.

Dupes:
the scent issey miyake, this is a tad more fresh, on me the hyancjnth is a bomb, envy is a big more restrained. The scent last ages.

Peace love and juicy couture, which is not like the other juicy couture, its got the same feel as both envy and the scent issey.

I must say I wore this back in 97’ and loved it ! I found it again and I am so happy ! It’s like catching a unicorn ! I love this fragrance and it’s back in my collection . I wish they would bring it back instead of bringing out another sweet fragrance that smells like a thousand others .

I have been searching this beautiful fragrance for years! I had a bottle when I was 17 and loved it. (I’m now 31) So about 2 months ago I happen to find a 50 ml bottle in the back of a small store. I asked the seller if they had any samples and of course they didn’t. So he opened the packaging and sprayed the fragrance.... OMG It smelled divine!! Exactly how I remembered it. I immediately bought the bottle and I am so happy to own it again. I think the fragrance stayed good for such a long time due to the fact that the fragrances in that little shop are stored in the back and it’s a bit dark in there. But I also feel like fragrances that where made years ago are from far better quality and therefore stay good for years!!

This is my special one, I am dreaming to get one day it back. I have checked all new Gucci on the counter and infamous Rush but all smell bad on my skin. This was my first perfume I got when I worked and lived on my own. That's totally office scent but with Gucci type of sexyness. Hyacinth has specific scent and I am the one to love it. Chanel brand is another one to deliver it, but I am feeling sad that Gucci Envy is gone. That was youthful elegance and seduction without any big fuss.

After reading all the positive reviews I had to have this one. I bought a pure perfume splash, and when that didn't do it, the EDT. But for some reason I am not getting the same amazing experience as several of the other reviewers. I get a skin scent, nothing with strong projection. But sadly, it's a celery scent and not much more. Celery! So disappointing. I think my bottles were authentic but maybe after all these years the juice has turned, or notes have disappeared... . I would love to experience this fragrance so I'm trying for a 3rd time from another source...

Bought blindly maybe 12 years ago 1.7oz for $6 at Target as they were discontinuing it. I immediately understood why it was on clearance. Green, floral, boring. It left me all "meh" and uninspired, and I rarely wore it, so I eventually sold it on eBay. To one of you, it would seem, because it did fetch a surprising sale price, indicating it was well-loved and "meh" was the minority opinion. I am glad to know it went out there and made someone happy. If you are the happy owner, maybe return the favor and pony up one of my long lost loves? Guess original in the twist bottle, Angel the pre-2004 version, Ninja by Designer Imposters, or Oleg Cassini the Jovan version would suffice. But of course you don't have those, because they are irreplaceable and long gone...point being, I don't love Envy at all but I deeply feel for you who do! Maybe that would be a good idea for their next release: Gucci Empathy. Thanks for reading...best wishes as you down-vote me for not loving your beloved! I don't blame you my friends, I respect you for being loyal and passionate like that. ;)
heard on forum: "perfect Gucci envy replica. It is from the perfume parlour and it’s called gotcha pride. Any fans of envy will not be disappointed and it lasts all day!"

If I could wear only one scent every day for the rest of my life.. this would be it !
A scent from my youth..
Probably one of the best I ever had.
I got so lucky today and bought a small used bottle at a bargain price.
I` m sitting here like Gollum with the ring and feel so gratefull.
This will for sure be my special occasion perfume... and I will for sure have to get more.
So lovely, feminine, clean and sexy this is.
Lily of the valley, Hyacinth, pineapple, oakmoss and woodsy notes.
I am enchanted, intrigued and bewitched at the same time.
Pure love in a bottle.
Silage is heavy on me and longevity is amazing.
I feel dressed in a perfect way with this beautiful perfume.
Bring it back pretty please !

Since I wasn’t interested in perfume in the 1990’s, I can amuse myself today by discovering “vintages” of the recent past, like Gucci Envy. I love green notes in perfumes, from the original Cellier Vent Vert to 1970’s greens such as No. 19, Givenchy III, Aliage, and so when I read that Envy was a worthy green perfume, I picked up a bottle a few years ago. Prices for Envy are going up and up since its discontinuation, but I found a good deal on the parfum, which comes in a beautiful, sleek atomizer.

And Envy has definitely earned its place among my green vintages. The published note lists are perplexing so I will just try to describe what I smell. Galbanum, of the chalkiest and smokiest kind, LOTV, fresh cut grass, and cilantro. A number of reviewers here with reliable noses describe Envy as a sweet green floral, and yet I get no sweetness at all in the parfum, just the slightest fruity undertone of melon. Perhaps the EDT and EDP are sweeter?

The most intriguing aspect of Envy parfum is its green-tinged muskiness, via the cilantro/cumin note, which would seem poised to deliver the erotic impact promised in the ads, but somehow does not, since it always remains a vegetal musk, rather than a fleshy one. After wearing Envy parfum a few times, and being nagged by a strong sense of déjà vu, I finally realized that Envy is very reminiscent of vintage Coriandre, another favorite vintage green (comparing parfum to parfum formulations).

I've heard Envy was a grape vine flowers soliflore.
Grape vine blossom has a very pleasant delicate scent which is not similar to any other fragrances - something like linden + ether + aspartame sweetnes + orange? + wintergreen. It slightly resembles White Musk by Body Shop but is greener.

I do detect grape vine blossom in Envy, but it is heavier, and more wax-y, not so fresh as in the nature. Like a grape vine blossom scented candle.

This is the most uplifting perfume for me.
Spring flower garden in the morning, very wet lily of the valley.
Must have for special occasions nowadays since I am running out, and it would cost a fortune to replace it! sad, very sad...

It was my first real perfume when I was around 18. Now I am 36 and have never found so good perfume anymore. I miss it every single day.
Gucci, hurry up! It´s time to create it again!
Love it and miss it ❤️

Gucci doesn't care about their customers. They don't reply for any messages... I don't even know if there is any way to contact them ? So many people cry over their discontinued fragrances and they don't give a f***.

Its a young, happy , fresh! Beautiful fragrance! Very feminine! Gucci! Please, Bring it back us
I got this beautiful perfume in 1997 of my now late husband. -I miss the nice perfume, but I can't say the same about the husband
I used to wear this back in 05 and 06 when I was still dating my husband. Gucci please bring this back!!! I am dying to smell this again!!!
Stunning perfume! It reminds of me big green garden filled with colorful flowers, big trees and also happy days, warm family memories, childhood... But such a shame it is discontinued!
I wish Gucci may again bring it back to market. Gucci Envy was marvellous product, why did they discontinue.
A personal favorite . iconic package I do still have a LOT of 30ml bottles of it and one 100 ml.

Cristalle de Chanel reminds me so much of
Gucci Envy! It is also a Green Floral...
But yet it's such a shame that they discontinued this beauty! Elegance and Classy but nothing to Envy"
Anyone have some they want to trade??? My forever favorite,and now it's so hard to find...Help..Email me gisselvazquez@gmail.com if u can help :)

Gucci Envy was my signature perfume at the university. I bought a big 100 ml bottle and often people asked me what I was wearing because was classy, green and easy.
I add my voice to the choir: Gucci bring back ENVY!

Gucci Envy used to be my signature scent. It is absolutely breathtaking and nothing quite like it on the market today. It is fresh but luxurious at the same time, very very recognizable but in this case it's not a bad thing. I wish Gucci would bring it back one day, it's a shame that a scent like this is discontinued.

Gucci Envy, to me just one of many really, seams simular to Ralph Lauren Glamorous, also discontinued. I see a 30ml for 199€- crazy prices!!
Would gladly swap mine for something else..

I was given a big bottle of this for Christmas several years ago, and initially I really liked it, but after a while, for some reason, it started to irritate me. So I shoved it to the back of my perfume collection and haven’t touched it for a couple of years. I hauled it out yesterday and dusted it off. It’s still pretty, but it’s very white-flowery on me – I don’t get any pineapple or rose or sandalwood or pretty much any of the other notes. And I think I’ve figured out why it irritated me – a) the white flowers take over after half an hour or so, b) after four hours it had mostly disappeared and c) what was left took on a rather sharp, almost-but-not-quite sour green edge. Sillage was very weak as well. I’m going to try layering it with something else to see what happens, as I the first half hour of this is rather lovely. If anybody has any suggestions, I’d be happy to try them.
Gucci Envy' why discontinue this Beaut! Sexy green fresh and crushed florals..amazingly memorable. What a shame Gucci..please come back! Gucci Envy

Crushed dandelion stems, oozing green and astringent juices; grassy citrus, zesty and dry. A light, young, fresh lily note without the slightest indolic roundness. The first 20 minutes define a 'green' scent. Then slowly, a mellow lightly musky note creeps in. A dusty vetiver, light wood and sandal, a tiny hint of rose. Individual notes are rather indistinct, the overall composition goes from bright green to shadowed woody green. Too sharp for my taste, even with the more mellow drydown; sillage was modest, longevity ~4 hours.

This "old school" complicated, but in a good way, scent is very very 90s. It's converted to elegant and evening usage for me. mufulia describes the initial notes correctly, but it graduates to a mild powdery yet creamy floral/fruit hybrid than it finalizes into a musk that is very tolerable.

Gucci, what have you done? Discontinuing this perfume was NOT an option! There is virtually nothing on the market now that can compare. The closest I've come to such an exquisite smell is with Ck One: nice, but too obvious, not delicate, smells like evergreen car freshener. Armani Aqua di Gioa: meh. Just plain old cool, but like ice left in the freezer too long. Shisheido Zen: blah, should have gone easier with he sweet citrus. like dollar store orange candy. Versace Eros: very , very nice, but where is the pineapple? I think this is the note that sets Envy apart. I can't seem to find a scent that is at once fresh, spicy, floral and a tad sweet. Perfect equilibrium. I just want it all... How, oh, how will I ever replace my Gucci Envy?
This one gives me headache every single time... It's too intense, as in intensely green

(If anyone wants to try this, happy to swap a decant for my want list.)

The words "fresh spicy" always scare me - it reminds me of perfumes like Gucci Envy. I enjoy green scents, but fresh airy green with a hint of sweetness, never spicy green. This one is too strong for me.

Ooooh, I was into the greens in the early 2000's! This one was my favourite greeny! While I'm more into the warmer scents - the gourmands and oriental florals now, Envy still owns a special spot.
While smelling it today, I notice a lot more pineapple than I had before. And the peach.... More fruity than I remember it. Yet, beautifully fresh (bergamot is working hard here) with some feminine prettiness thrown in for good measure.
Oh how I miss you long gone friend...

This is such an easy to like fragrance. It reminds me of a more grounded, younger Diorissimo with the Lily of the Valley and the aromatic green smell. So lovely.

Someone I worked with years ago wore this in my first office job, and on her it always smelled sunny and almost tropical. I never did buy it back then but now as it is so scarce, I feel like I should have.

I think this is fresh, sexy, very wearable by all sorts of people and just very easy on the nose. I do love it.

This is a fragrance which withstands the test of time.

My first experience with it was in the form of a rollerball tester over 10 years ago. It started green, subdued sour green giving me the impression of juiciness, fresh wet grass. Almost appetizing. The green stayed with me for around 4 hours. There is some faint floral, citrus and woody as time passes.

I am glad that when i re-visit it after 10 years, it smells exactly what i remember it to be. No reformulation.

I like it more now that i have a spray bottle. It gives more sillage than the rollerball. Envy performs well for all weather and season, although i like it the best during summer rainy day. 10 years ago, there were more green fragrance (i had Les Belles de Ricci and Pastel de Gres for example) so Envy wasn't my favourite. But les belles de ricci and pastel de gres are gone now (or just impossible to find?).

Envy is getting more difficult to find (even on-line) comparing to say 6 months ago.
If you are from UK check out this perfume in Westfield shop Beauty Base. Still you can have it! I was so happy to find it here.
very green and fresh, but not too soapy and still perfectly feminine! What a delightful scent great for daytime wear. Like waking up in a dew filled garden -- lovely!
the perfume of my childhood
I can feel like being career woman with this scent. Too bad this is discontinued.
This one is a legend

I wore this scent religously in the 90s. A lucky chance made my sister buy, dislike and give it to me.

First off, the brilliant name says it all...ENVY. Of course its liquid is toxic "green with envy" and kept in a slender glass bottle.

Most striking is the hard Hiacynth-punch in the nose. Or maybe it's a blend of Hyacinth and the poisonous plant Lily-of-the valley. I feel very self-confident, I'm sharing a desire to have something, I'm envious.
Floral and fresh smell looks like a Cologne for me;not a big surprise

In the late 90s, Envy was the fragrance I would often reach for on a night out, to dinner, clubs, bars, etc. And that's about 4 nights a week. I don't really remember how I acquired it. Was it at a department store or at the airport? What decisions went into this purchase? Why can't I remember any of this? It has only been 18 years.

I can deduce why this was my choice on night outs though...because the other choices in my "perfume armoire" would have been Oscar, Victoria, Chanel 5, Chanel 19, Caleche, Madame Rochas, Miss Dior, Diorissimo, and other classic fragrances that I did not feel would be appreciated by my fellow partiers. And at that time, as a young woman, I wasn't brave enough to wear scents I was sure would make people talk about how I smelled like an old lady.

I would have to guess that back then, I found Envy to be modern, edgy, and appropriate for my age group. Another reason I wore it at night probably had something to do with Chanel 19 which was what I wore when going to more formal nighttime affairs. I thought, with the similar green juice, and the similar coolness, (as opposed to warm) it exuded similar confidence, elegance, and aloofness as Chanel 19, but with a contemporary and less snobby vibe.

As I sniff what's left in my bottle today, I can tell the top notes have gone missing. In reading the top notes up there, they are all ones I like, so I can see how I would have liked the blasts as I sprayed. But in looking at the middle notes, I'm also understanding why I just don't like it anymore. Lily of the Valley is one of the notes I really dislike. I just smell a bunch of green sharp florals now.

It would be helpful for my review if I could get by hands on a fresh bottle to test, but I guess I don't need to recall that badly how it is that I liked this fragrance. I'll just move on to all the perfume that are new to me. The perfume choices I have now compared to the 90s is just mind-boggling. Hurray to the Internet, Fragrantica, and perfume choices!

I've waited a long time to try this one...totally worth it! Wonderfully, stridently green, with a cool almost metallic vibe to it...Hyacinth, Rose & Lily of the Valley are hand in hand, not fighting each other. Classic & very elegant, I love it.
i bought this so many times...but i'm not sure the last one is ori for me ....

I just bought a 1 oz. bottle on Zulily. They list new perfumes 2 or 3 times a week. I've seen some older ones or discontinued ones here and there. I haven't had issues with anything I've gotten from them.
I actually haven't tried Envy yet but from the reading the reviews here it sounds like I will like it! I guess if not I will have one up for swap... lol
I had this in my very early twenties. I remember it as a bright, strong green floral which I absolutely loved. a very bold fragrance but very elegant at the same time

I meant Tendre Poison of course, I corrected my error, Dear Endymion, thank you for your kindness:)
And a big sorry to everyone whom I may have mislead.
As regards Envy - I'll keep looking and sniffing around;)

@LadyPilot
Don't worry, Dior Poison is NOT discontinued :) Furthermore they lately released a perfume extract version.

My second review of Envy:

I've had at least 3 or 4 bottles so far and I have no confirmed information whatsoever as to if it has really been discontinued, except some gossips. All bottles I've had looked and smelled exactly the same.

Dior Tendre Poison IS discontinued. So is Armani Sensi. Most probably Paloma Picasso Tentations too... But Gucci Envy which you can get almost everywhere??? Or Gucci Rush??? In every Rossmann and the like?

How can you tell whether a bottle of Envy is a fake or not? What if it smells exactly the same and as long as the previous bottles that I had back in the early 2000's? What if I bought it at a regular network store and not in an online store? What if the labels at the bottom are the same as they used to be 10 years ago?
The fact that it's not on the official Gucci website is not too convincing - many houses advertise only the brand new scents they have just released or the most popular ones (e.g. Lancome).

What if there are some respectable online stores (not just amazon or ebay) that offer it constantly? And what if I see it every now and then in real-life stores, such as Superpharm ? Are they all fakes? Even if they are, I don't care as long as they smell 100% the same - and THEY DO!!! Which is, b.t.w., hardly ever the case with fakes...

I'd be really grateful for any justified information regarding this perfume though, I'm not interested in gossips or urban legends. I just want to know for sure.

Love love love "Envy", I do intend to buy another bottle and for the time being I see absolutely no good reason for saying "Goodbye" to it. Please show me one, if it actually exists, I'm ready to face the truth!
Best wishes everyone!

Worth every penny I paid for it on Amazon. Clean and fresh yet strong, the white and purple flowers are a fantastic mix and drydown is musky with Jasmine and Sandalwood yet retaining some florals. This scent for me is an absolute masterpiece. Why Gucci have discontinued it is beyond me. I keep trying to find a replacement but have failed so far.

The longevity is great, lasing all day. It's class in a bottle.

I'm a tad annoyed of all the reviews on this page for "Envy Me" .... we are talking about "Envy". The Original, this should be a nostalgic tribute page to "Envy by Gucci". "Envy Me" is a TOTALLY DIFFERENT perfume.

This was one of my ATF's, whats up Gucci? Why did you discontinue this? I think it was too expensive to manufacture, as newer perfumes are all synthetics. I enjoyed smelling like a fresh cut vine and I've been heartbroken for many years! Don't be a sucker and buy "Gucci Envy" online as those are all FAKES. Gucci STOPPED manufacturing Envy in 2002, so if you do find an authentic bottle it would be at least 13 years old, and unlike wine, perfumes don't always get better with age.

It's been discontinued for few years since I knew the sad truth.
ENVY is,and will always be my No.1 women fragrance in my life after I tested so many female fragrances.
It's elegent,like a smiling lady wailking to u.
It's devine,like a angel's touch on your face with warm glow.
It's relaxing,like playing in your grandmother's gardon when childhood.
There are so many thing I want to say to praise ENVY,but I can't,just because so many.And I exactly know if I only have one choice left,then ENVY will be mine.

I like this, it contains some of my favorite notes (lily of the valley, hyacinth, iris) and is green enough to suit me. I haven't yet worn it enough to decide if I'll repurchase once my small bottle is gone but it has definitely earned a place among my green florals.

Ohh now I understand why my friend brought me Envy me from the USA..
I wasn't familiar to Envy till recently I tested it a while ago and eww it smelled like ...blood. don't know what possessed me but I got a half used bottle and wow..i remembered I used to have a fake of this in high school with the same box I kept my coins in it:)
im not sure I would call this green it smells very peppery to me-maybe its the woody notes. I will wear this to work and going out I enjoy it a lot mostly because it reminds me of my teenage years but also because its a versatile perfume. Who knows maybe I'll buy a full bottle one day.

Once I ate this huge Zee Sweet white peach. It wasn't too sweet, and it was very refreshing. I must be blind but I couldn't find this brand of peaches being sold here in the supermarkets anymore. Gucci Envy became my craving quencher. It doesn't smell like a peach would but rather what that peach would taste like. It is not a sweet ripe peach, there is still some crunch and some 'sparkle' to it, like a slice of peach in carbonated soda. Of course there's that lily-of-the-valley, freesia and hyacinth that many people mention, but I'm really here for the peach.
I was in a state of panic, when the shop I have made purchases from over the past 10 years, informed me that Gucci Envy was being discontinued and hence all the Caucasian tourists were buying up the remaining 30 mls by the busload. Initially, I thought it was just a load of crap to get a frenzy started, but as I started to check around in all the physical stores, I realized I couldn't find any 100 mls. In the end I suckered myself into buying 4 or 6 bottles of 30 mls so that I can douse myself healthily in it for the next couple of years.

misslmamma
You can buy Gucci Envy from several online perfume websites.

Finally managed to pick this up! I LOVE it. I like Envy Me, although I must say, I did buy it for the bottle, but I like it. I don't love it. But this? This I love! What is a bit strange however, is that I have taken quite a dislike to Envy EDP (the black bottle), so I was a bit scared to try Envy. Now I see why so many women love it! Why they even made flankers for it is beyond me. They pale in comparison. Envy is light in a heavy way. it is a strong scent, but not heavy in the way you would select a heavy perfume to wear out to dinner on a cold winter's night. It lasts all day on my skin and works well on me. I don't know what I'll do when I finish the bottle! It also makes me more eager to try Envy Me 2.

This will always be my signature. Hard to come by now but can still get it on eBay. It just works with me, and stays on me.
I WISH they would release it again!!
The first time I smelled this I was really in love, however, I find it too strong now for some reason I am not sure why. I know so many people who seek this out. I still have this, though.
I love the lily of the valley + hyacinth combo. It smells so fresh and reminds me of Easter.
Got this back in the late 90's.... loved it and I want it again....soon!! Very sexy green floral fragrance which suits me perfectly... oooh and did I mention sexy!!! Yes... I want another bottle!

IT IS NOT DISCONTINUED!!!
Perfect for a sunny spring morning, when a maple tree blooms outside my window with its lovely blossom in the colour of this perfume. Envy encompasses all early spring scents of blossomiog fruit trees - apples, wild apples, cherries, plums and pears, it's as magical as April itself...
If you're looking for a dupe of Envy, go for Oriflame's VOLARE MAGNOLIA:)

I have not had this perfume since 1998 and I can't believe I ever stopped wearing it. I just got a one ounce in the mail and I think it smells even better than before. In my top ten for sure...I hear it has been discontinued:(( hard to believe a scent like this would be- such a rich ,multilayered, green scent....
I like it when it's hot. It's fresh and light but still has good lasting power. I can definitely smell the pineapple in it which I think makes this one quite unique.

Its nice, but i cant stand it.
I see why people like this scent, But this kind of lilly of the valley which is prominent note. On the borderland beautifully balances the fresh categories and flowers of the meadow. Then there is the green grass, no citrus, and so cool to accept. Hyacinth with cedar and bergamot and again glade with flowers and lawn, all the rest of the mixed ingredients. Pineapple does not go on the lead nor the jasmine either. Perhaps it would have been more interesting if something had dominated, except lily of the valley.
It is not my type.
Longevity is qiut good, but i had to throw away my sample.
oh God, this scent is so nice so elegant green crispy perfect fresh scent.I like so much and i am happy to i have in My colection usch à beauthiful frag

I use to wear this when I was in my early 20's. It was my go-to summer scent since it was such a fresh, green girly floral. I can still remember the smell of the lily of the valley mixed with the green and slightly citrus notes. Perfect for warm, summer days and nights.

A beautiful scent, at first I can feel the notes of bergamot and peach, then I detect many flowers, jasmine and violet come together with lily of the valley, with an interesting green touch. In the end I can feel sandalwood, cedar and oak moss, but all very rounded, not a single note calls out more than the others, but all goes together in no haste, an aroma that reminds me of cleanness, something fresh and new. I’d define it as a very sophisticated and chic fragrance. Its longevity is great, sillage is good, it is not invasive and goes well day or night. It’s a pity that concerning its fragrances Gucci has been decaying in both quality and originality, if only they had kept the ones from Tom Ford era they would now be classics and best sellers until today without a doubt.

Gucci Envy is a true unique beauty! I already posted my full review and another post about a similar fragrance but I just had to add to add this because of a new experience I had with Envy.. Well my mother decided to try Envy and she liked it right away, mind you my mother is not big on florals.. But throughout the night I would get a hint of Envy wafting off of my mother and boy did it smell amazing! It was a bit of a different experience from smelling it on my own skin, and a great one at that.. It made me appreciate the beauty of this fragrance even more! Now my mother is an Envy lover also.. This stuff is a modern masterpiece!

I bought Envy during times of University graduation, a day before most important exams.
I passed exams with four excellent marks and three out of four examiners(men!) asked me which perfume I was wearing. The woman didn't ask)

What can I say, it's super-classy first of all, elegant and chic. At those days I didn't classify it as a green fragrance for example - to me it was just a mood. So the mood of Gucci Envy is I WILL DO IT. I will do it with all the confidence and intellegence as I can
I have read so many reviews about Gucci Envy but the mystery is that noone is able to describe it apart that its green-grassy-tasteful-smooth-unique...ENVY.

Ups, creo que siempre había olido algo echado a perder :(

Hoy lo encontré por casualidad y reúne muchas de las cualidades que me gustan en un perfume: con personalidad, con estela, fresco, femenino, floral, cítrico, luminoso, cremoso; lo cierto es que yo no lo conocí nunca! hasta hoy, porque? no se, pero ya lo tengo :D

Si lo ves, no dudes en probarlo.

For Gucci Envy fans! There is a new natural Italian fragrance by the company "Natures", that smells very very similar to Gucci Envy.. I was so shocked when I smelled it because it smelled nearly identical.. It is cheap, affordable, and there is a whole line of cream, body wash, deodorant, and the EDT.. It goes by the name of "Gelsomino Adorabile" in english " Adorable Jasmine".. These products are great quality and natural! Some of the notes are Peach, Melon, Bergamot, Jasmine, Rose, Hyacinth, Vanilla, and White Musk! It is amazing! So close to Envy!

Wore this fragrance sometime ago and just re-visited it because I was given an unopened bottle that a friend had forgotten about......Why did I ever stop wearing this? Envy is a perfect balance of smokiness and clean....How often do you find that combination in a fragrance? Envy stays close to the skin, is strong but non-intrusive and offers great longevity.....it's a real gem.

I miss this perfume. I couldn't find this anymore in department stores. So sad, it has been discontinued. Actually, this was my JS prom perfume. I love this perfume so much. Gucci should bring Envy back!
Starts off well enough. On initial spritz, it reminds me of fresh spring flowers.Within a few minutes however, it begins to smell like flyspray. The perfume does not last long

I have been so curious to try this ever since I really fell in love with Envy for men.. It seems that I love fragrances from this time period! They were so unique but modern and sexy.. Well I got myself a little 1.0 ounce bottle and I sprayed one spray on myself just to get to know this Envy.. It sure smells alot different from the men's version but that is because the composition is completely different.. The men's is a spicy oriental whereas this is a fresh green floral but I can see why they are counterparts to each other though.. Well it starts out really fresh and has a interesting synthetic like blast in the opening that I find really nice because it is suppose to be there just like the synthetic hairspray note in Rush for women.. I detect some pineapple in the opening but it starts to fade and more and more florals start to come out.. Now I do not have much experience with women's fragrances so I am not good at distinguishing floral notes but I am learning.. I think I am smelling a lot of lily of the valley, magnolia, hyacinth, and maybe some jasmine.. It is a true green floral, a huge cocktail of florals, many more than the ones I listed.. Once the top notes start to dry down and the florals really start to come out I start to detect this gorgeous metallic vibe that runs throughout Envy.. Maybe it is the lily of the valley, the hyacinth or both together, I do not know but it is so unique and beautiful! Than as it dries down there is a hint of musk while the florals still remain prominent but very fresh and clean.. It did not smell overly feminine on me to the point of not being able to wear it..It is basically all florals but they are blended in such a way that it smells very fresh, clean, but not to over the top feminine, of course only if worn in moderation! I heard that Envy was also inspired after the scent of vines and yes it does resemble fresh cut vines and flowers.. I like it because it smells of perfume and not of fruits, candies, or deserts.. It smells like something from its era, very modern and unique but still smells like perfume and not some type of food or cheap body spray.. It is very classy, sophisticated, sexy, clean, fresh and unique.. Oh I miss the times when Gucci use to make things like this..

Each time I look at my bottle I want to cry.
Why such a beauty was discontinued????

It's fresh, green, little spicy and sophisticated and ohhh so special to me.
I have so many beautiful memories with Envy.
Envy is not loud, it's stays close to skin but is extremely longlasting.

Love and I'm finding a good replacement for it but still nothing can compare to my lovely Envy.
One of my "Lucky 4" faves back to the 1995-1999 (Other babies were Eau d'Eden, Salvatore Ferragamo and Ultraviolet). Clean green, light and comfortable fragrance, gave great vibes.

One of my all time favorites, I wore it everyday in the late 90's for several years. The scent is of clean exotic fresh cut vines. I am so upset that its been discontinued and the prices are skyrocketing for it on ebay. Also be careful of fake Gucci perfumes on Ebay.

I'm not sad to hear that Gucci Envy has been discontinued. I loved it when I first bought it in the 1990s, however it wasn't long before this punchy perfume was giving me blinding migraines. In the bin it went. So glad I don't have to smell it any more. It could knock a rhino out!

It's so green, smoky, fresh and beautiful. A real sparkly floral with stems included in a smoky hot lake bath. It dries down to a nice floral musk with a little spice and cream. I imagine a misty garden on a spring or summer dusk, the day after it has rained, relaxing in a hot lake with steam emitting from the water. Two sprays will do, nothing more. for days and casual nights out, preferably at the time of dusk, in the Spring, and Early Fall; crowds are welcome.GREEN the color of envy.

One of my regrettable blind buys from TJMaxx in the late 90's. Let's say the perfume memory is strong. Very green floral and sharp. One day I will learn my lesson with cedar and what it works well for me with what notes. Cedar + Lilly of the Valley = headache for me. I see now that bergamot and pineapple are notes. That may have contributed to it's tartness I also perceived. Overall, it was a no for me. It didn't mesh well with my body chemistry. I gave it away to one of my friends and it worked okay on her.

Finally, I found a perfume kiosk that had a tester bottle. Big floral scent but not nauseating. Fresh and soft green but still staying floral. To me this is an attention getter. Estee Lauder's Beyond Paradise is floral but cloying and piercing. Bois de Jasmin loves this and Rush. The latter is thick and milky, orange-citrus. Envy feels like fresh scented breeze. Like but wouldn't pursue a bottle. Am afraid to fall too much in love with a discontinued fume.

One spray on me,
Sillage: two feet
Longevity: four hours then fades to skin scent for next three
Rating: 4/5

Update Sep28/2013: Found a bottle in a consignment store tucked on the bottom shelf. I don't think the previous owner sprayed more than once or twice as it is like new and still in the plastic box casing with fliptop opening - score!

So sad it's discontinued. Just like the time knowing Michael Jackson is passed away. That u know ur memory is still there but u can never go back to the time. It's my 1st perfume that I used to wear on the summer afternoon,walking in the quiet suburb streets looking at the trees and flowers. I still have one bottle of it sitting on my table that sometimes bring me bk to these afternoons but its sad to know u can't find it anymore one day when U finish this last bottle.

I had this in the early 2000's and its a nice flowery scent with lots of staying power. Its one of the nicest fragrances I had owned that time. Scent is fresh & I really liked it. Didn't know it was discontinued though.. :(

a 4.5 of 5 for me. Nice daytime scent!

I am so sad that this beautiful fragrance is no longer in production. I wore it daily and everyone I met commented on the fragrance from friends to stangers. I never have had such a perfume that I felt was a part of me.
I start my long search now for something that will come close to what I have lost.

I bought a bottle of this 10 years ago and never appreciated it until I just found it in a box that I didn't unpack after moving! It's an amazing scent and I am sad to see it discontinued. I'm happy that my bottle is almost full though! To me, this fragrance is a bold, bossy, spicy floral that is perfect for a warm summer day. The name absolutely describes it perfectly as it makes you feel like you stand out in that it has a unique quality in it's balance.

I used it several years ago with love...beautiful, green, fresh and very unique scent..stayed on my skin a long time.

--update..it is almost impossible to find it now, except a few around in the market that is sold for extremely high prices. @Gucci Cannot believe you'd discontinue something as extraordinary as this and try making new ones that cannot remotely come close to it. Seriously.

Funny, I tried this on around ten years ago and it didn't suit me at all, maybe it was the EDP. I recently bought a half full EDT and it is lovely! Lilies and magnolia, two of my favourite flowers and now I have found a perfume with them in which I like to wear, I'm very happy! This is more of a daytime scent for me - work or when I feel I need something green and floraly fresh. I have in the past associated this with more sporty, urban (slightly ritzy!) women than myself but it sits very nicely so I'm giving it another go!

Does anyone know what the green notes are, please? Or does that refer to a particular flower note? I am warming to greens more again but there is a note here that I suspect is in one of my all time favourites, Y by YSL (listed as a chypre fruity though I can't smell fruit in it, it's far more floral chypre to me!) and I can't place it...hm, a mystery...

I've just got myself a bottle from one vintage perfume store. I hoped for translucent urban lily of the valley and I got. It is also accompanied by watery-green feeling which I like. can not say anything regarding staying power and projection so far. I hope for a nice aura around me with this perfume as I guess it can project well.
i love this fragrance so much.1 of my signature scent.i can ware it all year round in any seasons.oh and you have to buy the perfume one not Eau de Toilette so it't last very long.(at least on me.).
The black bottled eau de parfum was better than the eau de toilette. My favourite fragrance which could be worn day or night. Just wish they'd bring it back!

This is ok, but nothing special. I can see why so many people like it but on me it just smells perfumy, powdery and headachy.

EDIT: Wore this to work today and I'm liking it a little better. It dries down into a nice mellow floral, even though the powdery element is still a little old-ladyish (although anything powdery smells like old lady to me, so that could just be a personal association).

this is the only scent I can't stand. In the bottle it's not very bad, but once applied on the skin, it smells terrible. not kidding. I had a small bottle but gave it away.
After that I started believing that each scent combines differently on each one's skin. that's why I don't think it's very big deal when someone I know has the same perfume I do....
you can smell the gucci rush 2 in it
One of my favourite perfume! I've had this for so long and the smell is musky and sexy. To die for :)
This is my most favourite perfume. It is elegant and classy, light and uplifting to the senses. Definitely a day into night perfume. I was so upset that it is now discontinued.
This was one of two perfumes I owned that went completely 'bad' on me. I really tried to wear it but couldn't get it right although I loved all the seperate notes.

I just bought this edt online and i was very happy and a little surprised by what i got. On me this is a gentle flowery fragrance, different from everything else in my collection. Its not too strong but it is noticeable in a good way. Smells a bit expensive....but what i like most is that thetes absolutely no "old lady" scent here at all..it smells modern
.kinda. i have to suggest smelling it for yourself as it seems to react different with each persons chemistry.
çok modern, aynı andan hafif ve kalıcı olmasına rağmen bir Gucci değil.

i had it, i used it all, and i did like it..
whether i would get it again i am not so sure... there is sooooo many other fragrances to try yet, so i probably would not...

for me a little too dry and maybe a little boring...

Clean, yes, interesting, not so much... Sorry Envy...

This was my first perfume i had during my early school day after received as a birthday gift. During that time i even did not know this perfume is for women. But i did really enjoy wearing it and got many compliment from my friends especially boys. End up many of my friends also borrow my perfume.

It smells really green, fresh and sophisticated. I think it can be unisex too. I really adore it. Since it has been discontinued it quite difficult to get in my country.

I love this so much, why have they discontinued? There is nothing else quite like it.

I first smelt it on a colleague and had to ask what it was. I went out and bought some the next day and have loved it ever since.

It is fresh and clean smelling with a note that kind of clashes somehow, like a note gone wrong, but this is what makes it special and sets it apart from your run of the mill florals.

If you like a light, non heavy floral with a depth and a great high, green note, this is for you.

Think freesias and Lily of the Valley with something daring and sexy thrown in to just to be different. Fabulous.

It's strange because I like this but I also find it to be slightly astringent. Maybe it's because I'm just not used to some of the notes contained.
I say astringent because it smells exactly like an aftersun gel I used on holiday once.

Refreshing, green...flowery and somewhat aquatic. I haven't smelled a "perfume" like this before for sure. It's something I would love to have as a face mist straight out of the fridge on a really hot day.

A certain perfumey element that's within the mixture of flowers helps it smell that bit more refined rather than smelling like a hair or skin product (to my nose anyway). I can imagine this would get alot of compliments.

I don't think I could think of a better perfume for sticky hot days when you want to feel clean and refreshed.

:)

Probably the greatest green floral ever made, except for maybe Chamade by Guerlain. This one isn't harsh at all, and it's not too powdery or heavy on galbanum like many of its ilk. It's simply a smooth, grassy-green lily fragrance that pumps out decent enough longevity and still smells pretty natural. While Envy is a pretty "safe" fragrance, it doesn't really need to be obtrusive or make a huge statement. It takes some talent to be able to create a green floral so pleasant yet natural and soft-spoken. If you can find it, then get it, at least for reference. Even if you're a dude.

Oh Envy! How I miss you!! I "envy" the ones that can still wear you! :D I have to buy myself another one as fast as possible! It's very light, but doesn't pass unnoticed. One of the few fragrances I've worn till the very last drop.

Edit: I could get another 30ml bottle of this throughout time, but I still envy the ones who can wear it because, since it's discontinued, I just can't wear it freely. I want to be able to, at least, smell this for a long time so my little bottle is here mostly for appreciation, not for wearing!

I adore this fragrance, though it goes all weird on my skin.

Opens with sweet, mildly heady lily-of-the-valley and hyacinth synthetic bouquet. Mildly reminiscent of Metal by Paco Rabanne without the intense treemoss(though it's still there). It cools down into a crisp green floral with the odd metallic "violet leaf" note so popular with men's fragrances in the 90s. I can't say this is my favorite part of this fragrance(and I'm a man), but the effect is diminished on fabric. It develops further with a green feel similar to Futur.

The big surprise is the drydown, which is an homage to the legendary Grey Flannel. I actually love this about the fragrance, because there's something in Grey Flannel that makes my sinuses start to seize and swell - not so with Envy.

Projection is metallic and 90s robotic masculine, but up close it stays a tender muguet fragrance. Fresh and romantic, this fragrance is still modern and relevant.
Is this fragrance still in production? Can't find it anywhere.

Elizabeth Arden 5th Avenue = Gucci Envy woman,They are twins.

The lilac and lily of vally strongly prove this truth.
I VERY RARELY get headaches from fragrance, but this one does it to me. It's sad, too, 'cause I like it.

I had a large bottle of this on my dresser along with my other fragrances when my son & his fiance came to visit. His fiance & I like to sample eachother's fragrances when possible & when she saw my bottle of Envy, she admired the bottle, "Oooooo, what is this?" I began to describe the dazzling green, the blend of the florals, how it made me feel like I was surrounded in a beautiful sunny, breezy meadow full of flowers. And I knew she'd love it as much as I did. I was right! She just HAD to have some, so I gave her mine.

It is one of my absolute favorite green fragrances! Several occasions of being asked for the name of what I was wearing because it smelled clean & not too sweet or head-y. Absolutely fabulous!!!

From the first moment I was bowled over by Springlike sweet blue hyacinth over crisp cool tart grassy notes. The sweet/sour blend just gels perfectly. There's nothing sharp at all, it smoothly rounded, and it's upbeat. It's sort of a sweeter kinder and happier version of Mitsouko. I admire but I don't like sad/sour green Mitsouko; I love Envy. It's a quite amazingly wearable and comforting green April garden scent

It lasts quite well for several hours of delicious vernal freshness and then fades suddenly. All in all it's a lovely perfume that makes anyone feel young.

Where has this beauty been hiding all my life and why oh why now just as I've found it do I also find that it's being discontinued???? I'm all mixed up by the joy and woe of it. Guess I can stock up and use it sparingly. Don't like that situation, but it's way better than never having found Envy at all.

Green fragrances are on the whole difficult for me to wear but Spring is here so thought it would be nice to revisit an old favourite. For the first couple of hours Envy is pretty loud,fresh and very green, but this bold beginning paves the way for a beautiful floral/cut grass heart. Eight hours in and the cedar and oakmoss make their presence known, supported by the feint sweetness of the Jasmine. Now there is a subtle peppery quality which sits so close to the skin, only those you want close to you will notice how special it is.

This review is for the Parfum.

Usually Lily of the valley and my chemistry work wonderfully, however all I get from this is strong celery. This is just my chemistry though, green fragrances and I just don't get along - they will always turn to celery on my skin.

2/14/2012- Gucci Envy is said to have been SJP's signature fragrance, worn regularly on set during Sex & the City filming. Now, sadly d/c'd, but still available via various etailers. Stunning! Sparkling, bright, green, gorgeous, fresh floral. Just beautiful- An absolute treasure to own & wear. This is the frag. I'm most often complimented on :) The bottle itself is an architectural piece on my vanity tray! (I know, I know- I keep it covered, yet close-at-hand, because I wear it so frequently). With the long-lived free-advertising buzz created by SJP (who is rumoured to be a very serious fragranista herself, & created her own frag's- purportedly inspired by Gucci Envy), indeed it seems odd that this stunning beauty was d/c'd... Maybe yet another LVMH casualty? I 1st discovered this stunning beauty @ TJMaxx, was hooked immediately, tried to buy more (etail)- learned it had been d/c'd, so I went a little crazy, purchasing a large supply from Perfumania.com. Stored in basement since purchase (dark- in the cardboard case box)- Now, I have too much to wear in a lifetime! I'd love to swap some excess bottles for various frag's (I don't reside near a large city, and have access only to what's carried by non-flagship dept. stores). What I have are the large 1oo ml./3.4 oz., EdT bottles as pictured (my cost was ~ $75). I'm interested in scents like Miss Dior, Dioressence, Aromatics Elixer, and/or similar strong, woodsy/earthy/spicy scents- Those w/ great longevity & projection/sillage. Open to suggestions, (easygoing & flexible re: roughly fair trade), not limited to my "have" or "want" lists. If any member may be potentially interested in a trade, kindly pm me?

A really good classy, sexy smell. When I wore this, people always were like mmmm, what do you have on??? For me it doesn't smell like other perfumes. When you have it on...it's definitely Envy from Gucci and no other! Fresh and spicy!

I bought Envy sometime in 2000, and I've kept a small bottle because it's a fresh lily of the valley scent. If you spray too much then it's a headache, and for some people it's too green. It's the sharp green that initially turned me off from it because it was almost medicinal and overwhelming. Those notes quickly pass on my skin and move into the floral part. I would wear this in the spring, but never in warmer weather.

product_name: A Kiss From Violet Perfume Oil Gucci
review_content:
A dirty, stinky musk ruining a gorgeous iris-violet combo.
Not a fan of this, at all.
A little musk could work with this, but, this much? It's ruined it completely.
Nope.
It smells like new shoes, in a bad way.

product_name: A Kiss From Violet Perfume Oil Gucci
review_content: God, I love the direction Gucci has taken. And I love violets! This is up there with Bois de Violette, but the character is entirely different. Sweet, glamorous, vintage without any stuffiness. I was surprised by the strength and projection of a little oil on one wrist. Too bad about the price.

product_name: A Kiss From Violet Perfume Oil Gucci
review_content:
This smells like love hearts! the sweets!.
Honestly its a sweet, but sophisticated smell, however, I would not be paying £250 for this, its most certainly a lovely perfume with good lasting power.
I smelt the whole collection, this is one of my favourites.

I owned GPH II back in the day, and while it's not an exact 1:1 clone, Mineral Grey really does smell very close. I'd say about 85 to 90% of the way there.

Worth picking up a bottle if you come across it and miss GPH II.
I have a 40/100ml bottle for sale. Without original cap though, but smell is still as fantastic as ever. Write me a message here or on email: m.vejbjerg13@live.dk

This is perfection. It has made the cut in my final list. 99th percentile. Ivy League Summa Cum Laude honors. A magnificent impeccable tea fragrance, I have never tried a “bad formula” of it. It cannot be found cheap, regardless. Fact. Fresh water and tea done with the warmth of a supple bespoke suit and leather briefcase from the good days of Gucci. It will forever have a place in Valhalla with the final 6.

Hello fragrance fam!
On today's reformulation guide, were covering Gucci Pour Homme ll. Pour Homme is an easy to wear tea based scent, released when Tom Ford was the creative director at Gucci.
I believe there were three reformulations of PH ll. My years are a close approximation, make sure to compare your bottles with the descriptions to help date your bottles.
*The first and second batches are very similar with the first having slightly better longevity. The third version I've read is not as desirable, as the first two.
1. Pre-2010 The first edition is easy to spot, the liquid is going to have a slightly green color. This is because they used trace natural ingredients in this formula, like oakmoss. The batch sticker is clear.
2. 2010-2016 Some of the trace natural ingredients were isolated after a reform. This batch will be a blue slightly cloudy color. It will have a clear code batch sticker.
3. Post-2016 they reformulated some fixatives from the original formula. This batch is a very deep blue color, with a white batch sticker.
Hope this helps and enjoy the Journey!
If you need additional help referencing batches, we have photo reference guides within our store.

I stumbled upon an indy fragrance yesterday that smells exactly like Gucci Pour Homme II from a company called Adora Oud. They have a fragrance called "Omar" that is a dead-ringer for it. If you're ever in the Chicago area, I suggest you check it out. They use pure extract and it's not 10 years old, so it smells fresh. It also has better sillage and longevity than the OG ever did.

Too bad its discontinued. Gucci house are out of their damn minds.
Even though it doesnt last long and the projection is weak, but it truly is one of a kind and you’ll never find something like it.
I truly miss this gem. My scent memory vividly remembers this smelling like tea, cinnamon, and myrrh. It was fabulous.

There are so many clones and many of them are quite good, but none can quite capture the essence of the original. 9/10 fragrance.

From top to bottom, it deserves applause. It makes you feel truly worthy & blessed.
