The time has come for the last (chronologically) of the great Guccis... a fragrance which, according to the name, is a variation on an older classic, but with a completely different character and purpose... And it turned out very well, which is as rare in the case of sequels as a flash of intelligence in a professional. boxer…

It seems to me that trying to beat the perfection of Gucci PH would be difficult, if not impossible - that's why it was very wisely decided to create an opposite to the spicy classic... The PH II composition is the extreme opposite of its older brother and is also its wonderfully tailored counterweight, worth wearing. named after a phenomenal ancestor…
Pour Homme II is delicate, light, airy and sensual... of a seemingly delicate style, it is an extremely endearing, charming and elegant fragrance... it works well under a white collar, as well as for a casual getaway from countries somewhere in Poland... While the arrangement and color of the Gucci PH cork is intended for evening use (in winter, but with the possibility of setting it during the day, which he likes to do), the second pair was intended to be used during the day... and it copes with it perfectly. ….

It's true that many people, including myself, complained about the poor projection and aftereffect of this fragrance for the first time, nothing could be further from the truth... Gucci PH II is a delicate and discreet fragrance, which means that the wearer's nose gets used to it very quickly, which results in received by the recipient from every touch.
However, since my launch has already been made available, nothing could be further from the truth and there is no need to repeat the application after a few hours, or even more so to spray countless amounts of clouds on yourself.... Ladies from an external source that Gucci PH II is perfectly testable after 6-8 times and smells wonderful afterwards :)
Simple, standard application of 4-6 sprays…
Zapach otwiera się w niezwykle delikatnym otwarciu przywołującym mi na myśl fiołki, jakiś delikatny powiew nuty owocowej, słowem niezwykła filigranowa subtelność… by nie było zbyt słodko całość urozmaica delikatna nuta białego pieprzu, której moc oddziaływania zestrojono z resztą kompozycji… (Panie Jacobs, trzeba było się uczyć od innych, jak robić to dobrze, nim wypuścił Pan swoją wersję gazu pieprzowego o sugestywnej nazwie BANG!)
Tym właśnie mnie ten zapach podbił i położył na łopatki… zaczyna się tak niewinnie i ujmująco, że nie mogłem oderwać nosa od nadgarstka… cóż za lekkość i anielska wręcz transparentność…. nic nie dręczy zmysłów, wszystko zmieszane ze sobą w jednolitą, harmonijną całość, która ani trochę nie nudzi, czyniąc z PH II zapach idealny na wiosnę i cieplejsze pory roku… ten zapach aż rozświetla swym blaskiem aurę wokół nosiciela… wysublimowane piękno, delikatność i prostota tworząca tę kompozycję po prostu mnie zniewoliła…
Jeśli najpiękniejszym miejscem na świecie jest Barbados, to wyobrażam sobie, iż właśnie tak musi pachnieć ten raj na ziemi…

Do tego dochodzi niezwykle pasujący do charakteru zapachu kolor cieczy, będący niewinnym i nieskalanym błękitem doskonale podkreślającym rolę i przeznaczenie pachnidła… całość zamknięto zapewne w nawiązaniu do nazwy w identycznym dla Pour Homme flakonie z grubego szkła, opierającym się na grubym szklanym denku… prostota i kwintesencja dobrego smaku…
i od razu wiadomo, że zapach jest dla mężczyzn, bez konieczności czytania etykiety…
Całość zwieńczono korkiem stylizowanym na szczotkowany mosiądz… po prostu poezja…

Szkoda natomiast, że po wypuszczeniu tego zapachu i nastaniem innych – dobry smak i fason, z którego dom mody Gucci słynął przez dekady został obrócony w perzynę…
Cieszmy się zatem tandemem Pour Homme/Pouur Homme II, bo nic lepszego ten dom mody już nie wypuści….
A jeśli jeszcze gdzieś głęboko w Waszych sercach tli się iskierka nadziei na korzystny obrót spraw – to powąchajcie Gucci Guilty…. przejdzie Wam… (osoby o delikatniejszym zmyśle powonienia, są przed powąchaniem męskiego Guilty proszone o konsultacje z lekarzem 😈 )
Fragrance notes:
Head: violet leaf, bergamot,
Heart: cinnamon, pimento pepper, black tea,
Base: olive tree, musk, tobacco leaf, myrrh,

A perfect fragrance.
Warm, sexy, very elegant, confident, not so invasive for other people and has 8-10 hours of longevity easily
Perfect for tuxedo and very elegant occasions.

Very well pleasant.

The only negative fact that it very difficult to find.

I had this for years and today I tried it for first time. It was a gift from a friend of mine. It is really nice and easy to wear. You need it when you wear a linen shirt on a nice warm summer day. I thought it might have a weak performance but it was not. It was soft and light but it was there all the day. It reminded me of Five O'Clock Au Gingembre Serge Lutens but Gucci pure home is more rounded and balanced than Fice O’clock. I would say that Five O'Clock Au Gingembre is like a cup of classic bitter green tea while Gucci pure home is like the lightly flavored and sweetened grean tea.

My favorite scent. I had the chance, right when it was d/c'd, to buy like 5 bottles off a clearance rack for 30$ each, and to this DAY I am kicking myself that I didn't do it.

I've never considered this one to be a strong fragrance; it lingers closer to the skin, and for good reason - the mix of scent notes gets drowned out if any one of them becomes "too loud". For me, I can pick out the tea, the cinnamon, the tobacco, the violet freshens and softens, the bergamot adds just a dash of ~zest without taking over (which is something the clones have a problem with; more in a moment). It's just a very well balanced and unique scent. If it was to project more, I don't think the way the notes come together would survive.

Despite being more of a skin scent, spray this on a hoodie though and toss it in the bottom of the laundry basket. If you fish it back out a week later - you can still smell traces of it. It doesn't really project, but it does stay put.

I've still got about 60% of an OG bottle left, and I use it VERY sparingly. I lean on two dupes instead.

Dua's Man Card VIP is a dupe, and it's what happens when you try to crank this fragrance up - bergamot takes over. When I initially got it, I could smell all the notes and the DNA was there, but the berg was still a bit too strong. Now that the bottle has sat for a bit, when I spray it, I just pick up the berg. If you want a dupe of this that leans a little more citrus-spice, Dua's is a good pick. I do use it, but not as much as Alexandria's.

Alexandria has "The Pour Homme II", and to me, it's like 90% there. For starters, they tinted the juice blue to try to match the OG, so points for presentation. Alexandria's doesn't try to amp up the OG and increase the silage, it's much more balanced and stays closer to the OG. The bergamot doesn't take over, and I get the tobacco and tea notes more than I do with Dua. The only thing is that Alexandria's feels ~slightly flat, and for me, I think it's missing the violet. It's just missing a touch of sweetness, a touch of something fresh - it's just not quite as "bright".

Alexandria's is what I go to and use whenever I wanna pick up this bottle, since it's so close to the OG for me in terms of scent and presentation. I only ever touch the real thing for very, very special occasions.

This stuff is amazing and super hard to find nowadays.
The scent is very distinctive as well.

It's a super-chill Sunday afternoon. Sunlight’s strippling the lounge through the net curtains. I have a playlist just for Sundays - f l o a t i n g - adding a gentle fusion of mellow sonics. And I’m pleasantly high from the mahjoun I’ve recently injested.

Also, I’m having a wee tea ceremony with a fresh pot of chamomile tea infused with lemon juice and honey. To further accentuate this exquisite moment, I’m wearing the ideal scent - Gucci Pour Homme II. Full hedonism in effect.

So pleased to have a bottle of this heavenly blue juice (and what a stunning looking bottle!). Such an intelligent and enigmatic fragrance. Very understated, very sophisticated, very Zen. It’s a relaxing, meditative mood-enhancer and I’m a major fan.

P.S. All-time bedtime favourite.
I am down to my last few sprays of Gucci Pour Homme II, and refuse to spend the 80% mark up price on ebay. I'm not that irresponsible. "A fool and his money are soon parted."

Layer Yves Rocher’s Tendre Jasmin and Comme des Garcons’ Red Series Carnation. OMG…its like the stronger more intense version of GPH II. Lasts easily at least for 12 hours here in tropical climate.
What's wrong with the Gucci? They discontinued all of their great fragrances? And they kept only worthless fragrances 👎👎
Still rocking my 10+ year old bottle. This is my personal favourite signature fragrance.

Serenity, confidence. All notes contribute to that.
I can sense black tea (the star of the show, smoky and calm), violet, tobacco and probably cinnamon.
But it's like all notes perform at half-speed here, none of the notes reveals its full potential.
It's their sum that creates the full presence, deep and masculine, but because of this effect, the scent still feels somehow transparent, almost diluted.
So it's indeed like a mirror, or rather a negative image of the first Gucci Pour Homme with its dark incensed aura.
Gucci Pour Homme II goes on the bright side like an ice tea with perfume ingredients added.
Violet leaf, for example, usually turned to moss or petrol in most masculine fragrances; here, it's sky blue. Same for the spiciness of cinnamon: every note speaks serenity because of its tight measure and proportion. A great scent.

One of my favorite blue fragrances ever. It is fresh yet warm and cozy. I love how well blended this one is with violet leaf, black tea, and cinnamon, while being slightly aquatic, with a elegant, clean, musk . I still have about 2 ounces left and am very hesitant to use it. I love this one but i dont use it because it’s worth much more then it smells imo, however it is a great addition to my collection. I just remember when this was $120 now it’s $750 . It makes me want to sell it but it’s hard to let go .I would recommend this fragrance over most to any man as a signature scent, but I wouldn’t recommend paying anything over $200 although it is a collector’s item .

I bought a 3.4ml of this in the original bottle with about 15% remaining for $70 which isn’t actually a bad deal. After hearing so much about this I had high expectations and when I first smelled it I was disappointed. After wearing it for a few weeks I realized how much I liked it. Opening is great fresh black tea notes with a little aquaticness. Dry down still smells aquatic and like tea but some of the spice notes come out. Mainly cinnamon and cardamom. Is this the best fragrance I have ever smelled? Probably not. But it is definitely in the top 5. However projection and siliage are pretty weak so I would keep this as an spring/summer/fall indoor day fragrance. Bottle design is also beautiful. I also bought duas version of this. Man card vip. It lasts a lot longer and has better projection but has less of an aquatic note and more of a cinnamon cardamom vibe.
9/10

You wear this for yourself!
Don't compliment me on this one, because I don't care.

So relaxing it can calm a dinosaur.
I am willing to buy all the bottles in the world, If any.

10/10
Fruity, feminine, weak. Gets muddled into something indiscernible in the dry-down.

Gucci pour homme II, has been discontinued, it is a master piece, blend of tea, tobacco, cinnamon. It is unique, so pleasant smelling. Literally i think it is the best perfume i have ever smelled. I have preserved it, very hard to find this nowadays. one must know how it smells in a life.
A nice sharp and fresh black tea vibe, pretty good but not worth the price tag it has right now.

I was lucky enough to find this in an independent perfume store early 2022 for its normal selling price 100 ml for about $95. I own this & the vintage bottle L’artisian Tea For Two & remb now that this is the one they always compared side by side & When I smell them both I think of the unsmoked cigarette tobacco in the soft gold foil inside the ciggerette pack along with the black tea bags in the box..I wear my Tea for Two almost always because of the rare gem that this has become. And while not disrespecting either one and honestly not knowing which one came 1st. The Tea for two in my testing is a little bit better in every way as far as the scent (which is the same) popping a little more on skin because they are literally as far as my nose can tell are the same fragrance!..Tea for Two cost more originally. But now wouldn’t chase this one down when you can just purchase Tea for Two from the Niche House of L’Artisian…That’s my two cents from someone who has em both.
Smells exactly how I would imagine Jesus to smell, if he smoked Marlboros and drove a Vauxhall Calibra in the 90s

Back in 2012 I was working in a 5 star hotel in Poland. For the first time in my life I was exposed to so many beautiful smells - perfumes of the guests - but the best smell was the one coming from my ugly co-worker who had bought some random perfumes in Cyprus. I asked him about the name, but he had zero idea. One night we went all out for some beers and I ended up sleeping at his place, because I passed out. I woke up, took a shower and asked him to use the perfumes so I won't smell like alcohol at work. He brought me Gucci Pour Homme II. I still remember smelling it on me for a full day, performance was 12h+ with a strong sillage. I was young (19) and poor, but it made me feel like I'm more mature and rich. Same day one of the guests (amazing milf) asked me out for a drink. I couldnt do it of course, as i could risk losing my job, but it felt great.
I finally got them two years later, and they smelled like heaven, but the performance was crappy - around 1-2 hours. not mentioning the sillage that was just a skin scent.
Gucci Pour Homme II was MY SMELL, I know I would be using it forever if it wasn't discontinued.
Spicebomb does a great job copying that smell and I guess sooner or later I will buy it.

10/10

Why did Gucci discontinued this? Same with Gucci Rush for men - they got rid of all their best stuff.

This is a delicious and seductive scent. It's a comforting scent, cozy and warm but also sweet and elegant.
Iconic 2000th fragrance. One of the best smelling fragrances ever created, along with Emporio Armani-white for him. Absolutely dreadful performance, 2 hours longevity at maximum

Alexandria Fragrances just made a new clone of this one- called The (tea) Pour Homme II
It’s quite good- and way more affordable than eBay prices for the OG
I have a 100ml basically full bottle (sprayed no more than 5 times) of this, which I would love to trade or sell. Send me a DM if interested!
This is the best perfume I've had. Somebody in the comments suggested the Man Card VIP from the Dua Brand is close to this. I just got it delivered and to my disappointment it's not even close.
rahlp is absolutely right, just get the black moschino teddy and problem solved.

This stuff is overrated, it smells like Moschino Toyboy not even kidding, this is Toyboy with a hint of cinnamon and spices. Toyboy has more depth and I find it more appealing with the dark masculine rose. This thing has a dominant Tea note thats all, nothing special. Surprisingly only one person has commented that this is similar to Toyboy

The notes have been well explained here, and yes, it's a beautiful and unique fragrance. However, the prices range from $500 to $850 on ebay and that is just ridiculous. I bought my bottle for $60usd about 10 years ago and it's still 90% full because I use it sparingly in my large collection. The bottle is heavy af and is of high quality, even the cap is thick, heavy. I can say HiM Hanae Mori is the closest to Gucci2 in my collection, but more woody and lot more cinnamon. Imagine HHM but a lot smooth and a lot more memorable. I hope they make a dupe of Gucci2 so more people can put their nose on these juice.
Favourite fragrance so far, so relaxing and easy going. Too bad it's so expensive to get nowadays as I think this is a classic.

Very delicious spice demi-sweet fragrance, with solid masculine vibe, but I can see a confident and assertive woman wearing it.
The citrus influence is negligible, violet is noticeable, but tea and cinnamon are the royalty in this masterpiece.
It says black tea, but I get strong sniffs of a warm infusion of roasted matte leaves. I can almost "drink it".
When I was a kid in Brazil, we had this "Mate Leão" tea (today it's owned by Coca-Cola), very popular late afternoon drink, that was delicious, warm and obscenely cheap.
Reminiscences aside, this is a very comforting, and friendly scent, and as noted by a fellow reviewer, The Moschino Toy Boy has the same tea note as their scent profile "protagonist".
In Gucci pour homme II, the main characters are Black tea/ Matte and Cinnamon.
In Moschino Toy Boy, the main characters are Black tea/ Matte and Rose.
I have both and I enjoy them very much, I use Gucci pour homme II a lot less, due to the very expensive replacement price. Moschino Toy Boy comes handy, but I know that they are not in the same ballpark, as the rose is still a challenging note in western man's perfumery.
If you have this fragrance, please enjoy it by any means, it is an absolute master piece.
If you don't own it, the high price tag makes its purchase one risky difficult decision, unless you have a lot of disposable income to indulge your senses.

I own 2 bottles (one partial 10-15ml on it), and I found that Perfume Parlour, Florence Man B 0589 that I bought from sone one is a spot on clone of it.

The opening is strong, but not harsh. It’s an Extrait de Parfum, but after 15-20 minutes, it’s very close to GPH2.

I wore and tested them, side by side, and they were almost identical.
Keep in mind that GPH2 has macerated longer, has better quality ingredients, but in longevity and projection, Florence Man B 0589 stays on skin way longer, keeping the same profile as GPH2.

Back to GPH2. A fantastic fragrance that unfortunately, got sacked. Gucci keeps other scents instead of keeping GPH (1 & 2).

But hey, they are launching Gucci an elixir soon.
B.S.
Sophisticated tea and cinnamon scent. It's a light scent, only slightly sweet. The smell is very comforting. I wear this only for myself.

Fine tea scent!

But the cinnamon is very intense. You have to like that. Many celebrate this fragrance as the best designer ever, but GPHII could not inspire me. The cinnamon is too strong for me.

Green, soft green, not zesty but smooth and relaxing, and spicy (but also soft) scent. I’m don’t catch the citrus in the opening but a hint of violet maybe, then it turns smooth green immediately and stays that way for the duration. There is a semi sweet undertone to it I can’t quite pin the note on, cinnamon maybe. The combined result is really good.

Pretty unique and signature worthy. Shame it got discontinued.
A masterpiece of a fragrance. Probably one of the best scents ever created! We beg you, bring it back.

Review of 2013:

GUCCI POUR HOMME 2 this is by far my favorite gucci scent next to gucci pour homme 1. The black tea is very proninant throughout the scent which is very very nice i dont really feel the bergamot in the opening a very slight tinge of violet leaf then the scent goes immidiately in the heart notes. In the heart notes the cinnamon,pimento,black tea are present its just that the black tea is more noticable.
At the base the black tea is still there i do get a hint of tobacco i dont know about the olive tree or myrrh as i dont know whats the smell of myrrh the musk barely noticable. My experience on the overall scent is black tea. This is a tea based fragrance and its good very comforting smell i think its a pretty linear scent and it does not evolve that much which i dont mind. When i spray it i imagine myself in a cold weather in a high rise building in a patio chillin and relaxing cold breeze in the air sipping on a hot expensive black tea leaf (those you buy in china town or expensive tea shop not the cheap grocery tea ones) and warming me up comfortably. The projection is poor to moderate but this one stays longer on the skin 6-8 hours on average thats very good and also FYI this is the only old gucci scent that is still in production its a good thing this is still available everywhere and as far as i know they have not discontinued this one YET so grab it while you can i did not hesitate to buy 2 bottles of GP2 all in all GREAT AND A CLASSIC IN MY BOOK.
longevity 8/10 6-8 hours on my skin
projection poor to moderate 6/10
overall smell 9/10 ill give high remarks on this one as i enjoy the overall smell
uniqueness 9/10 very unique i have not smell any similar scent in my collection or any fragrance in my experience.
price vs quality 9/10 you can basically get it at 74 usd which i think is very much reasonable
versatility cold weather scent day or night, works good on summer nights.

Recap 2023:

10 years have passed 😂 and i still have 2 bottles of this, the other one is still sealed, it’s an awesome tea based scent cold, calm, clean and very refreshing at thesame time truly vintage and a must if you’re into collecting fragrances. Scent is timeless and never gets dated.

Last solid release from Gucci before TF left.

Was my signature fragrance.

I rarely reach for this as my bottle is about 90% full but dang this is such a relaxing scent.

The green notes, spice and that tea note!

So nice..

A very special fragrance that brings me back to a time of wonder and progress back in 2007.
Its normal for a specific fragrance or scent to take you back to a certain time period but this one does it for me. Its nice tea, spicy, and green notes are very well blended as of they were made for each other.
I love this fragrance and its price is only justified for how special of a scent this is.
9.5/10.
Wish I could have the older first batch again as that one lasted forever.
Manhattan from City Rhythm is strikingly similar to this

A very good and solid fragrance. I have the light blue greish version, from 2007. The lastest batches were more blueish.
It is one of the fewest fragrances that my wife sensed it and complimented me on it, and not after aplication. I am saying this because I saw some reviews in which people said that this one doesnt have good performance. Mine is more then ok on that level, the projection. Longevity is indeed avarage, a couple of hours tops. In the seventh hour after aplication it's almost gone.
But It has more then enough strenght.

It is in the same vein as rush and pour homme 1, it has the same backbone of those. Different openings, but the undertone is very similar in all 3. Can't remember envy for men, but probably that one is also similar with these.
But especially in the drydown, it is very alike rush for men.
The opeining in this is similar to Must de Cartier for men, very cucumber like. The Tea notes appear after half hour or so.
The myrrh is there, from the begining to end, more pronounced after the first half hour.

If you can find a good deal, go for it.
By any means, do not pay the loudacris prices that this one has online on ebay.

@darian_sparks If i remember correctly, the demise of some of the most amazing fragrances ever created (GPH II, GPH (2003), Envy, Rush) was the decision of Frida Giannini. She was creative director from 2006-2014 after Tom Ford left.
I think she pushed for the discontinuation of fragrances that she was not personally involved in. Maybe declining sales may have been a factor, not sure. Worst decision ever in the world of fragrances.

This cologne has a very warm, comforting, relaxing vibe and has garnered me more compliments than all the other colognes I wear combined. Everybody seems to love it, but few people are wearing it.
Yes, I agree projection and longevity are average.
The component notes are all there - tea, bergamot, olive leaf, cinnamon, violet, pimento, myrrh, musk, and tobacco - all blended very well. To me that sounds like a combo that shouldn't work (on paper), but it totally does. I don't get the "cucumber" that some folks smell, or "fart cucumber", as one reviewer put it. That review was posted in 2021, after Gucci discontinued the fragrance, so maybe he bought up some oxidized, poorly-kept specimen off e-bay.
By the way, this contains a black tea accord, not green tea note as one would find in Silver Mountain Water, for example, which smells entirely different.

When my supply ran out, I used Hanae Mori HM for a while. It's a fair proxy as they do share cinnamon, violet, and bergamot notes. GPM II could be worn year-round in my opinion, maybe a little less-suited for Summer. HM is primarily Fall scent in my mind because it has a earthier, raked-up-fall-leaves aspect. At any rate, HM is super hard to find now so I wonder if it was discontinued.
Parfums Vintage makes a spot-on, I mean SPOT. ON. clone called Imbue, but I've only bought that once since feel all of their products are over-priced (but excellent quality!) The Dua Brand also makes an excellent "inspired" cologne called Man Card VIP which is my current favorite. I feel confident saying the projection and longevity are better than the OG, but maybe that's just my poor memory. (I don't have the original around to compare).
Several fragrance oil houses make fair, but not great, versions of GPH II. Musk and Hustle is better than most of them IMHO. They make roll-ons which are good for sprucing up later in the day as the projection fades.

Does anybody have any idea or opinion why Gucci discontinued this? Sometimes fragrance trends and corporate decisions boggle the mind.
on scent alone 10/10

Upon first sniff, I get a cucumber impression, which presumably is the violet leaf and bergamot. Then there's the tea accord, which to my nose is more green than black tea, even jasmine tea. This intertwines nicely with the chilli. At the base, the tobacco leaf is subtle but adds depth to the composition. The longevity and sillage are a little underwhelming. If the performance was better, this frag would've become iconic.

There's something icy-cool while simultaneously calming about this fragrance. The bottle design captures this really well, with its grey-blue liquid and mellow gold cap. It's not a loud scent - it's quietly confident. This would work well in the daytime, in spring and early autumn. Masculine but in an ethereal sort of way.

Perfect trifecta of fresh blue/violet, spice, and tobacco/tea that combine into a singularly transcendent experience. Good projection and length that’s warm, alluring, classy, and energetic. Not common or familiar and quite complex, but easy to like.

While dining out, a girl I didn’t know could not stop obsessing over how good it smelled. My longest signature scent.
I have a partially used bottle, still smells perfect. If anyone in New Zealand interested pm me

I look through my fragrances and I see a lot that of blue fragrances . It all started with this one for me . This was what I wore to be different than those who wore Acqua Di Gio . I wasn’t a collector when I got this for the first time so I thought this was as good as it gets in the fragrance world not knowing much about it . It was Gucci with a Gold top and smelled great so I got it ! This brings back memories for sure . While it is Ozonic and fresh it has a herbal accord at the top . I like the light citrus with bergamot in the opening but I love how the violet leaf blends into the dry down where it takes on the more herbal aspect with black tea, cinnamon , and tobacco leaf . I pick up the black tea and cinnamon more so than the tobacco leaf . It has a beautiful musk to it ! It’s a shame that this is discontinued . I have a lot of discontinued fragrances and I don’t where them as much as I’d like to because once they are gone paying $500 is not a option for a designer fragrance ! All though I love it, I don’t love it that much ! I will say that this is the first blue frag that made me realize that blue fragrances can also be warm and cozy while yet being fresh and bright !

I miss this juice so bad. I purchased this when it first released right out of high school and it became a daily wear instantly. I really wish it would be redone for everyone to enjoy at a more affordable price. I can't push myself to pay double what I'd paid 15-16 years ago.

OMGoodness 😳😳!! The Bergamot, tea & violet combo is to die for & they sit on top of the spices. I’m not a fan of cinnamon so that note kinda takes away from the overall enjoyment/ experience, thank goodness it’s not loud though. I can also smell the spice of the pimento right next to the cinnamon, which I do not care for, but gives a masculine twang.
Overall it is a pleasant scent, completely inoffensive unless you just can’t stand a lil spice.
A very light wearing, 6 sprays & the projection grows every hour. Approaching the 4hr mark I begun to get really bored & irritated with the scent.
Best tea fragrance I’ve tried so far, but Pure nostalgia..-Not worth paying more than $100 for a bottle.

Unisex- This would smell better on women w/o being sweet or too flowery

I have about 20% left of a 3.4oz bottle. I’ve been rocking this fragrance for almost 20 years, now I save for special occasions. One of my sneaky good “you smell so good” fragrances. Clean & light yet warm & sweet. The prices right now are insane since it’s hard to come by but that’s the case with discontinued classics.

Tea can be a very, very difficult note to pull off when it comes to fragrance. Take Creed’s Silver Mountain Water, for example. Venerated by many, but hated by many more because the tea note they incorporate into that fragrance can come across as inky and/or metallic.

Amazingly, Gucci managed to pull this one off. And not just by the skin of their teeth, either. GPH2 knocks it out of the park. It’s masculine, but I think it could be pulled off by a woman easily enough. The tea and the cinnamon are what come across strongest to my nose, and it’s such an interesting blend. Airy and light, but with a deep underlying sweetness to it. When people talk about ‘niche quality’ designers, this one should be right up there with the best.

That said, I don’t think that I can say in good faith that this fragrance deserves a niche pricetag. Don’t get me wrong, the scent is incredible and smells like nothing else on the market today. It’s versatile enough to be a signature scent, and the presentation is fantastic… but for three, four or five hundred dollars? Forget it. If you can find this one for $200 or under, I’d say it’s a worthwhile enough deal for the right person.

Why have none of the clone houses jumped on this one yet?
Try as you may, you will not find another fragrance quite like GPH2. Imitated but never replicated.
But I wish they would...

EDIT: Thanks to @Vapor Trail for reminding me that Parfums Vintage Imbue is apparently a decent clone of this gem. Very interested in hearing comparisons from someone who has tried both...

Rotten oranges, anyone?
2010! Still hunts me!
Maybe it was in a bad phase
One of the most unique great smelling tea perfume out there, smells like manly Tea. Way better then their newest line up in store today.

I went through a few bottles of this around 2010. It was fantastic, I was sad to find out this was discontinued.

Tried Spicebomb (regular version, not infrared or extreme) today and it felt exactly the same. I'm sure there are differences but as soon as I took a sniff it took me right back. The drydown is very close as far as I can remember.
Every summer I return to this scent, it’s been 12 years I’ve discovered it and I’m still inlove with it… there is nothing similar on the market to replace it, in my opinion.

I been on the fragrance thing for awile now. I often wonder why one company will just bankroll a good fragrance right to the bank with a hundred flankers. Like Gucci is one who's fragrance department just don't see the true demand. Like do they realize this fragrance is practically worshipped like a new religion. I recently purchased a new perfume called Toxicity by the house of Genre Parfum on Etsy, though missing the violet note this perfume smells almost identical to GPHii. I tested both side by side on skin and yes GPHii is back baby! Toxicity lasts way longer too. Go check it out, it's an edp.

There is only one perfumer I buy fragrances from just because they made it, and that is karine dubreuil who made this fragrance. She is the master of sweet fragrances that are not too sweet that it will make you sick. Check out her perfumes from Lalique. You will NOT be disappointed. Also this fragrance this very unique and awesome in colder weather! That tea and cinnamon go together so beautifully.

I've had this juice for awhile and rarely used it. I have Gucci Homme, older brother perfect for the fall and winter months and absolutely L-O-V-E it.
You know when you come across a cologne or purfume and expectation is so high you're kind of disappointed because it didn't stack up. This was my experience at first, but I never gave it up. I knew that my nose meter would come around and appreciate the complexity blend.
At first spray, both black tea with violet leaf give a fresh aromatic blend. Tobacco raises the wow factor by giving it a smooth warmth blend and helps to calm the violet leaf. Myrrh gives that perfect final touch with a sweet slightly smokey vib.
Longevity and Sillage is excellent lasting at least 6+ hours on my skin.
This is a really gentleman's cologne perfect for the summer months and absolutely 💯 perfect for the day or night wear. Am I glad I never gave it up, now I'm wearing when go out with some friends for a good time. 9.5/10

Sooo a coworker just breezed by me and I immediately pounced on him thinking he was wearing this particular scent. Of course he wasn’t wearing Gucci Pour Homme II. It just so happened to be Maison Margiela Across Sands.

I haven’t read any further below but has anyone else caught experienced this? Please let me know I am highly intrigued!

I believe the most similar fragrances I’ve smelled to this are women’s fragrances from around the same period (‘01-‘10).

For example, Marc Jacobs Daisy (og) and to a lesser extent, RL “Ralph,” have a somewhat similar overall feel/vibe in the air, though they might be a bit overtly feminine for the average guy to wear. If the feminine notes were replaced with cinnamon and tea, we’d be cooking with fire.

Another is women’s DG Light Blue (og or intense), which is a lovely, perfectly unisex frag in the same postal code as GPH II, primarily the top (no warm cinnamon base; though there is something in the base that adds a degree of warmth).

I remember smelling something on a few women in ‘07/‘08, which I thought had an interestingly similar profile, but I never thought to ask what it was. I eventually asked one lady at work (thinking it was somewhat similar to my GPH II and that it might be the same scent I had been smelling around). She said it was Sarah Jessica Parker Lovely, HOWEVER I’ve never followed up and smelled that myself, so that could be garbage information.

Otherwise, I’ve always thought YSL L’homme could be a good substitute signature for GPH II, despite not smelling like it. But they are similar in personality and are equally high quality and addictive IMO.

Anyhow, my point is to please ask the women in your lives to smell your GPH II, then ask them what women’s fragrance(s) it reminds them of and let us know in the “reminds me of.” Thank you in advance for your efforts. 😊
I am looking for a bottle, EU, shoot me a message.
Why Gucci would not re release this. It's better than any Gucci mens fragrance they have out today
A pleasant, unique and well-balanced scent, that works in many different environments. Stylish and pretty unisex. It's hard to imagine anyone would find this scent offensive in any way.

What an amazing amazing fragrance this is, a total masterpiece and a gem of a fragrance. It's so soothing and calming to the senses when you keep getting whiffs of it from your skin.

So happy to have this added to my collection, went into a random shop last night to check out some fragrances and saw a last piece 100ml bottle of this sitting on the last shelf. The guy didn't know its true worth and sold it to me for 66$ ;D

Had a 50ml before which i got for about 70$ cux of the prices hiking but I'm so soo happy with this 100ml bottle. Plus its not just the scent, the bottle also looks like a work of art tbh.

This is such a cool unique scent. I liked it on other people so I bought a 3.4 a few years ago but I used maybe 5 sprays since I got it. Probably will fill up a travel size and trade the rest or sell it for something else.

Gucci 1 and gucci 2 are excellent scents that can never be underestimated. Their compositions are like flawless. Your appreciation may even be insufficient. Hundreds of niche perfumes that copy Gucci 1 and 2 can't even come close, I can say clearly. Don't wear those who belittle them. I bought HiM by Hanae Mori before I ever smelled Gucci Pour Homme ii.

I really enjoyed HiM so I pulled the trigger on a Pour Homme ii sample.

Honestly, I was a little disappointed in the real thing. I would save your money (a lot of money) and just get HiM by Hanae Mori. I think it pops more than Pour Homme ii and I actually think the scent is better as well. Don't get me wrong, I am all for buying the real fragrances whether it be discontinued or it's expensive, or both, but in this case HiM is the winner.

**1 Month Update - Ok, this is a lot better than I had originally presumed. Also, I feel that HiM is only about 80% like this Gucci Homme II fragrance and not better than Gucci. Pour Homme II just has this "weird but addicting" sweetness to it that HiM by Hanae Mori does not have. It's a sweetness I've never smelled before, but I like it. So, yes, Gucci Pour Homme II is a really good fragrance, but at the price point it's at today that is for you to decide if you want to have it or not. Personally, I'll be very excited to add this to my collection one day.

this perfume is the best and most beautiful scent for a man, which captures beauty and discrete masculinity perfectly. Found this for my man, he loved it. Sadly it went out, and I have not found this scent again - have tried to find it amongst different brands, also Armani Privé collections and so on. But male scents seem to again mainly have that either over masculine pushy stench, which for alot of women is a bit of a turnoff as it is just too pushy (hence reminding me of Middle Eastern men whose culture do not accept a no - btw. I am Middle Eastern myself, so it's not hate, but just inner knowledge of the tacky over the top taste - which they indeed have) - or the wayyy to much citrus which can in fact give a bit of a guy who went to the gym and didn't shower, but immidiately covered his pits with perfume to cover up the sweat stench - vibe. Also not good.

This perfume was perfect.

Gucci please relaunch this -

With all respect to Rowan's magniloquently negative entry -- I really enjoy his prose, but I could not disagree more with almost every aspect of his review.

This stuff may not be definitively "sexy" (though that's really a subjective thing), nor does it scream from the rooftops at how alpha male it is (it certainly is not), nor does it last until the second coming (though I will say I think the previous reviewer vastly overstates its lackluster longevity). But you know what? It still smells gorgeous and comforting. Again, subjective judgement here, but it is plain to see that I am not alone in this opinion. Yeah, I wish it could be stronger, last longer, and oh, by the way, be AVAILABLE again. But it still smells wonderful to this nose, and I'm over the moon that I horded 3 full bottles before the prices went absolutely ape shit.

My proposal to anyone and everyone who loves this stuff as I do: Please join me in requesting Alexandria Fragrances release a clone of GPH2! In their typical parfum extrait strength, this would be absolutely magnificent, would it not?

PS: It seems a certain very sensitive soul took uncommon umbrage to my audacity for disagreeing with his point of view. So much so that he felt the need to go on the offensive. To this person I say this: Suck it up, buttercup. Nothing I said should be taken as an attack on you personally. I simply disagree with you. Relax, it's bound to happen.

"A review is an opinion articulated for the benefit of others. Some people actually spend money based on the reviews on Fragrantica which is why blinkered, unrealistic hyperbole is not only misleading, but costly."

Yeah, no shit, Sherlock. Having a different point of view is not tantamount to hyperbole or propaganda. One opinion is no more or less valid than any other. Get over yourself.

"There’s nothing wrong with having an opinion, but when it’s contrary to reality it becomes a delusion."

Who dictates reality, Rowan, you? I don't think so.

"De gustibus non disputandum est
(which, for the benefit of my snarky Philistine fanboy, means “there’s no accounting for taste”)"

So much to unpack here. But your semi-apoplectic response to a simple difference of opinion has me thinking you are either a bit insecure or victim of serious anger issues -- or both. Why else act so triggered by others whose only transgression was to disagree with you?

"PPS - “Ad hominem” is another Latin phrase you should probably learn, stultissimus"

Says the guy making ad hominem attacks and upping the ante with name calling. But hey, kudos for looking up some Latin to impress us all with your rapier wit. "Ad hominem" attacks reduce one to looking like a petulant child, regardless of one's choice of flowery prose. I haven't and won't take that bait. But hey, you do you.

Maybe you should step away from that computer and live life, spend some time with loved ones instead of raging at strangers on a fragrance site. Your unprovoked attack in response to an honest opinion in a public forum does not warrant either the venom or the effort you've invested in it.

Be better, Rowan.

Agree with Apulian that GPH II is totally overhyped

As with so many disco fragrances there’s a fan club that behaves like a cult, furiously regurgitating hyperbolic praise.

It serves no purpose when a page like this becomes an echo chamber of febrile masturbatory evangelism completely untethered from reality.

As Cicero would have said, “Cui bono?’
Most likely sellers trying to justify their extortionate prices - or their victims trying to justify the absurd prices they paid for a crappy fragrance to convince themselves they weren't ripped off.

I spent years and years trying super-hard to like this stuff - but it is mediocre at best and performance is so abysmal there’s no point even wearing it in public because by the time you leave the house it is undetectable.

Inspired by the GPH-style packaging, I bought SEVEN goddam bottles of this stuff back in the day when it could be had for the price of a couple of packs of cigarettes - because it was ridiculously cheap, and a good stocking filler for teenage relatives.

There's a reason it was always discounted.
It was discounted because it didn’t sell.
And there’s a reason it didn’t sell ...

It didn't sell because nobody wanted to buy it

Seriously, what’s the point of pretending the performance is fantastic when it’s quite obviously not?

Repeating a lie does not make it true.

Gucci made gigalitres of GPH II, only to find that it was doomed to follow in the footsteps of Gucci by Gucci and Made to Measure - a commercial failure that was heavily discounted for over a decade because NOBODY WANTED TO BUY IT.

Really enjoy wearing the original Gucci pour Homme, but not once have I ever felt a burning desire to wear GPH II.

It’s the answer to a question nobody asked.

GPH II is a fresh gentlemanly fragrance featuring tea and tobacco, with a herbaceous green violet leaf - it's nice but it's nothing special.

GPH II becomes a skin scent within an hour and longevity is maybe three hours max - in Winter.

Infuriatingly weak - with the performance of an eau fraiche.

GPH II is a pleasant but uninteresting fragrance hamstrung by suboptimal performance, as unisex as a hermaphrodite and as ascetic as a pope.

A review is an opinion articulated for the benefit of others.

Some people actually spend money based on reviews on Fragrantica which is why blinkered, unrealistic delusional hyperbole is not only misleading, but potentially harmful.

There’s nothing wrong with having an opinion, but when it’s contrary to objective reality it becomes a delusion.

De gustibus non disputandum est

PS - Writing a review does not represent a “considerable time investment” unless you’re a complete idiot.

In the beginning I did not really like this fragrance, I got it as a present early 2008 – it stayed somewhere in the back for many years until I rediscovered it a couple of years ago and start appreciating it more and loving it at last until my bottle was finished, looked for another bottle and find out it was discontinued and a new bottle would cost me more than 4 times retail
R.I.P. to one of the best smelling,calming-designer fragrances.Also big respect goes to the women which was made this masterpiece ❤ Karine Dubreuil ❤

I bought my first bottle in summer of ‘07, which was the most magical year of my life up to that point (got my first “grownup” job, had worked hard to get the best body of my life, and met the stunning woman who is now my wife and best friend). This was the scent of that year and our first few years of marriage.

It was soft back then, but not as soft as just before it was discontinued. It was warm, classy and exotic. It was the warm soft cinnamon, spice and tea WITH the airy ozonic/aquatic nuances that made it magical.

There was a guy from New Zealand at my new job who looked like the singer of Trail of Dead. He was a very intriguing person, dressed and behaved much differently than anyone I had met before. He bought a bottle on his lunch break one day and was so excited, he insisted that I spray some on even though he hardly knew me. I loved it and bought my own bottle that weekend. My sister and lady friends could rarely smell it on me (though I was a two spray max guy until just a few years ago).

I rarely think about it, but when I do, it sort of feels like Gucci burned a photo album of mine when they discontinued this (being overly dramatic). When time travel catches on, I’m going straight back to ‘07 and buying several bottles for myself. I only have about 20 ml left.

All this said, I can’t deny that nostalgia (and of course discontinuation status) is responsible for a good deal of GPH II’s current perceived value. If production had never stopped, I bet there would be plenty of “meh” attitudes floating around in the forums about this. If you don’t have memories with it, it may not be anything special and you’ll likely be bummed by the performance (and for the cost, you could easily buy 2-3 of the best frags in existence, and spray all day, with zero anxiety since they aren’t discontinued).

i know i will receive a lot of "hate", but i have to say gucci pour homme 2 is super-overhyped. i have few discontinued fragrances and this is the one i regret the most. luckily i found it in a little store for a good price, thanks god i didnt pay crazy money on it. the scent is good, a light spicy blend with a pleasant note of tea, but u can also feel violet and olive. it's quite relaxing and mild. so, nothing bad but nothing groundbraking for sure. everything is soft here, especially the performance...i bought it during the winter, so i thought "yes, it's soft but eveyone says it's a spring-summer scent....". so i waited until the warmer seasons, but it's still soft, it' s DAMN SOFT...when the scent is good but nothing crazy your hope is that the performance can save your day, but no...the performance sucks. i cant believe how it is soft. my love and my thoughts are for everyone has paid a lot of money on it, i think they're still crying about it. overall, grab it only for a very good price. what u get is a pleasant smell with a bad performance.
gucci pour homme 2 è un buon profumo, speziato e fresco ma niente da raccontare ai posteri. ha una delle peggiori performance sulla mia pelle che io ricordi. l'ho trovato a un basso prezzo in una vecchia profumeria, se l'avessi pagato quanto è attualmente quotato avreste avuto mie notizie al telegiornale..

Not a masterpiece, but not overhyped either.

Gucci Pour Homme II has an excellent scent. It is just gorgeous, but the thing is... It is so light and so subtle, to the point that it's very easy to get anosmic with this fragrance. The performance is not good, but the scent is great and unique. That black tea is beautiful here, accompanied by cinnamon and a hint of violet and tobacco.

I'm actually surprised there are no mainstream dupes for this one yet.

I just got a tester bottle of this one for around $34 (converted), and I think it's an awesome deal. I feel so much better because it is also a blind buy and a successful one indeed.

If you can get it for a similar price, I'd say go for it! But for those utterly high prices some people are selling right now, nope. You can get some much better fragrances, especially when it comes to performance. If you're willing to pay that amount of money for a nostalgic reason or if you really want it, then again, go for it!

Batch Code: 7207 (CheckFresh shows that it was produced in late July 2017)
This was so syrupy on me.. not what I expected. At least I won’t be sad I can’t buy it anymore

One of my all time favourites, can't believe it has been discontinued, a slight Fahrenheit violet leaf note mixed with a calming tea note and spices, my wife and daughter can't stand it, they say it smells like fart cucumbers 🤣 but I don't care I still wear it whenever I can, glad I bought 3 back up bottles dirt cheap before prices went ballistic

Now, this was a proper men's fragrance.

I am not one complimenting much about other's people fragrances (I am so picky that more than often fragrances on people are gag inducing so I avoid commenting for politeness, indeed if I like what they're wearing I go straight and buy myself a bottle).

But i remember clearly some years ago (it was 2013) i had to voice my appreciation when i smelled this on a man sitting in front of me at a dinner. The bloke was handsome but the perfume even more. It was Gucci II, blue juice in the metallic blue bottle.
Smelled spicy but fresh with some green violet, not fruity or oud-esque,nor ambroxan loaded like everything we can smell today all the way. Very refined and classy, not loud, just right, pure gentleman.
To date, the best Gucci for man ever produced.
They discontinued it.
But wait, at its place now we can enjoy useless scentless products like Memoir d'une Odeur.
That's progress.
One of most Calm and relaxing scent. Very beautiful

I remember I bought a bottle about a year after it was launched.
I have many perfumes but these is the only one that makes me happy when I wear it.
Inoffensive, gentle, and beautiful smell of violet leaves and tobacco mixture.

Super easy to wear, inoffensive, and "clean" smelling.
Projection is soft and longevity is around 6 hours.
This fragrance leaves YSL l'homme libre in the dust IMO! This has a lighter violet leaf note and much more balanced + natural smelling.

I recently just acquired a bottle, it was 2014 batch. The opening really reminds me of Toy Boy by Moschino, then after a minute there's a bit of Fahrenheit mixed in. It might be the violet leaf.

So it's basically 80% Moschino Toy Boy + 20% Dior Fahrenheit.
It's funny and very sad that only a year ago you could easily purchase this fragrance for no more than $50 on eBay and other second hand markets. Gotta love US capitalism and inflation!!!

Picked up another bottle of this and gave it another try. It took me some time, but I'm liking this one much more now. It grew on me. For anyone looking for a cheap substitute, look no further than Nikos Sculpture "God's Night". It smells 90-95% similar, but it's not long-lasting. For $25, it's a worthy clone.

To my nose, this is the best smelling frag. ever.

Whenever i'm in a mood less than positive i just pop the cap open n sniff on the sprayer ( i dont want to spray it, would be such a waste) , and it never fails to lift my mood up. I guess it's the tea, maybe, that's making you feel relaxed and calm in an instant. goatdang!!
projection and longetivity-wise , pretty weak. (it's hot and humid where i am). Nobody can smell it, but I don't care as long as I can smell it on myself, im good!
Best smelling frag i tell ya!

I am still new to all this whole fragrance world, but to me this one smells very fresh, warm and spicy.. definitely ozonic and aquatic. I kinda love it, especially the herbaceous powdery dry down. A rather formal and serious vibe, but definitely perfect for day scent, spring/summer or relaxing afternoon on the beach!

Gucci Pour Homme II is a true MASTERPIECE! The top notes are one of the best in any fragrance I have ever smelled, to me better than BdC! Fresh, ozonic/aquatic (violet and tea) opening with a beautiful addition of the citrus is literally to die for! The dry down/base is almost like a totally different fragrance, it really goes from ultra light and addictively fresh to super sexy/rich/spicy! Its truly amazing how distinct the notes and transitions are! I get a very natural smelling clove in the mid (not cinnamon at all) that stays until the fragrance is gone(its actually not a natural clove its Cinnamal creating this note, I read the ingredients;-). The tobacco + olive wood is in the back seat while the clove is in the forefront. Its not a loud, annoying, ultra projecting fragrance and I don't think it was meant to be, its very fresh and sexy and does last quite a long time. Its more intimate but the scent trail could/might/arguably be one of the best of all time! I have been testing/wearing/collecting fragrances for 25+ years and this has to be in my ''all time top 5'' (designer or niche, does't matter), its that good! Versatile, its an all season, all occasion and nearly all temperature fragrance (isn't the best for super hot days or the dead of winter). This 'was' a signature scent for me, now that it has been discontinued its more of a special occasion fragrance because its becoming more expensive and much harder to find sealed/authentic bottles. I will easily pay 2x retail for this fragrance, no I wont pay the crazy $300 for 100ml but I will drop $100 or so on a 50ml just to keep my stash up. If you missed out on this fragrance or really want to try it out pick up a sealed 2ml sample on ebay, I have quite a few samples in my collection for traveling. BEST fragrance Gucci has ever put out! 10/10

I love it! It's a freshy and spicy perfume, but also smooth and elegant. Very versatile and suits both day and night, and all seasons. It's one of my favorites.
As a woman who likes men's perfume it's the ideal perfume, harmonized and not too heavy.
Although, it is a bit too weak and doesn't last so long.

Gucci Pour Homme II is just such a pleasant fragrance.. It's only downfall is how subtle it is! I am almost finished with my bottle & am looking for more! If anyone has a bottle they might be willing to spare send me a message & I will see what I can offer you..
The smell is even better than the beautiful bottle. Probably the most calming scent in my collection. Shamefully discontinued.

Green, spicy violet leaf.

GPH II smells like a herbal tea note, mixed with spicy cinnamon, and watery violet leaf.

That combination made spicier with chili pepper and fresher with bergamot zest. There is a very slight bitterness from the myrrh.

The overall combination is a fresh spicy, herbal violet smell.

It's pretty nice and inoffensive. Easy wear for warm days but not fresh enough for hot summer days.

I think people cried too much over the discontinuation of this. It is nice but nothing as ground breaking as people made some of us believe.

It does smell like HiM by Hanae Mori but GPH II has more violet. It is in the same vein as YSL L'Homme Libre Libre did suited me better. Ironically, that one is discontinued, too.

GPH II is a warm weather wear for all ages.

Big "Like"

Charming little spicy tea fragrance I picked up while I was buying some other frags, never thought I'd get to sniff this discontinued gem. The hype is real but is it justified?

Mostly from this I get a spicy tea fragrance, with that violet leaf offering a green, slightly bitter freshness to it. Easygoing yet unique. Relaxing kind of fragrance, with a blend I’ve never quite smelled before. It's soft fruity drydown is so chill, it's little a little lullaby to your senses. Works great in hot weather too. Also reminds me a little of Byredo Gipsy Water but this is better.

It’s a pretty solid little alternate freshie, considering swapping out the 25ml I have of it but it's also likely to grow on me, such a smooth little blend it's really hard not to like so lets see!

My favorite fragrance out of my collection, like it so much I want to hold on to it since it’s discontinued.

Very safe fragrance for any occasion, has a calming but cheerful scent to it, cannot go wrong with this one, however $140 for a bottle??? Id pass, it smells great but performance is not worth the price.

I’m only going to wear this on very special occasions during the spring and summer, particularly indoors.

The"Belle Epoque" of Gucci. Old times,spectacular fragrances,tones of compliments. Whith this one, my secret friend in my stolen hearts stories...Such a beautiful,strong and bild,scent! I m sniffing my empty bottle... Please, bring it back!

It boggles my mind how people think this is a Cinnamon scent.

This is a Clove scent.

Go to your spice drawer and do a comparison if you don't believe me.

This smells exactly like clove for the first hour, I could just put clove oil on and achieve the same scent with better longevity.

However, when the tea and very slight tobacco comes in, it becomes a very pleasant expensive smelling scent. It's too bad it wears off at about hour 3.

Luckily I bought my 100ml right before it was discontinued. I will keep it because I really enjoy the clove smell. Pleasant smell, reminiscent of that era. A sweet but masculine clove without the cloying gourmand category affixed to it. NOT WORTH CURRENT PRICES.

Tea tea tea. I can only smell tea with a little bit spicy. I'm a heavy tea drinker, this smell reminds me of the expensive tea that I own. Sometimes make me feel crave for tea. On my skin, longevity is about 3-4hr with 1hr+ low projection. It can be worn all year all season.

still one of my favorite fragrance. very relaxing. I use this when I sleep.

At first I found this fragrance too cheesy, but then it started to grow on me. I just had a sample and I was getting complimented far and wide. If somebody is willing to sell at a fair price, dm me in private.

Gucci pour homme, the older brother, typically gets all the fanfare. I definitely appreciate GPH and realize it’s place in terms of being a groundbreaking scent for the time period.

The tragedy is that, because of the GPH shadow, GPH2 gets somewhat overlooked.

While obviously gph2 has its fair share of fans, it doesn’t carry the lore of that which gph has.

I’m personally more partial to this. As someone who doesn’t really like tea based scents, I feel like this changes my whole perception of how tea can apply to fragrances. In this case, with the strong tea + cinnamon, I can’t think of a more relaxing combination.

This is like chugging a big bottle of water after a long run - or a nice afternoon nap after an all nighter. It’s so calming and refreshing - while never coming across as a “freshie”

I genuinely believe that GPH2 deservedly fetches the high asking prices, as I don’t really think there’s an applicable replacement. While hanae mori is close, I find that to be heavier - more suited for fall and winter - and less calming and refreshing. There’s also a bit of a metallic or mineral note in that one.

Regardless - this is a stunning fragrance - doesn’t matter your age or style - it’s beautiful. A true 10/10

I'm lucky enough to own a 3.4oz and I enjoy it tremendously this time of year (Mid-Spring). It's rather soft so literally impossible to over-spray. However, if you try to go heavier on this to get better projection, I guarantee you'll end up going nose blind. This fragrance was meant to give a smooth and soft sillage... not project like a monster. It's blended so flawlessly with tea, cinnamon and ginger as the stand out notes. If you are seeking a bottle don't be fooled by the hype here. The $200+ prices on ebay is price gouging because this juice is so rare nowadays. But there's a buyer for anything rare. Heck, last month people was paying $30 for a roll of toilet paper to wipe their arse.

As for the high asking price I'm saying not to blind buy at that price. Of course if you already smelled it and find it worth that price then that is understandable. After all, I can see some people falling in love with the buttery smooth composition this delivers. For instance, my wife loves this one and asked me not to sell it. So I'll keep it for now (wink, wink).

Lastly, I have to disagree with those that say GPHII smells like HiM Hanae Mori. I'd say they are in the same vein mainly because of the cinnamon. But totally different scents. Actually I prefer the HiM. Fight me.

What's the one secret note that makes the fragcom go crazy? "Discontini-oud"

Worth the hype? No.
Worth the current price? No.
Is it a good scent? Yes.

Opens with a spicy (chili, ginger, clove) violet leaf that lasts for may be less than half an hour, at which point the black tea comes in. The tea note stays for a short duration, eventually giving way to a very generic cinnamon drydown.

The opening is reminiscent of the smell near street food vendors in the subcontinent -- combined aroma from freshly cut cucumber, tomato, cilantro, mint, green chili, ginger with hints of spices -- Not bad for the western consumers, perhaps exotic too. But South Asian folks might have a different association.

The fragrance is at its best in the first hour, then it becomes any other designer release. If this was not discontinued, there will be no hype around it.

Not a masterpiece. But when I crave this I want this, not a dupe or anything similar and now it’s gone. Unisex, sweet spicy a little fresh. It can warm and it can cool depending on season. The scent itself is great the dupes don’t compare. It always smells familiar, and somehow unique. It has weak performance on skin, but it sticks on clothes. Something about that yummy soothing blue juice makes me so happy. Not something I wear regularly but it certainly has a spot in the collection. There are trash scents that have stood the test of time and yet this gem has been discontinued. So sad.

I can feel the bamboo, tea, Tobacco

kinda dry but not desert dry.

I have a 3.3oz bottle at about 99% full.
baunya enak banget. kalau saya sih ini parfum cocoknya buat malam hari. longevity is so so. scents is extraordinary. close to skin. for collection only because its has been discontinued.

Beautiful. Extremely versatile, attractive, playful yet artistic. The tea and spices combine seamlessly to create something absolutely magical. One of my go-tos, HdP 1899, has similarities but isn't nearly as blended; individual notes stick out much more. Here, everything meshes so that you could technically pick out individual notes, but the overall impression is that of a scent all of its own.

I actually get very decent performance out of this. It doesn't project heavily but it's the kind of scent that draws people in, like a second skin. Considering that, I think it's perfect for what it's trying to do - if it was stronger I might actually be reluctant to wear it.

I have a tiny 5ml decant but I might have to splurge for a full bottle soon - hopefully I'll find it at a decent price.

I have to say, to my (extremely) untrained nose it does have a Spicebomb vibe...or should I say Spicebomb has a Gucci Pour Homme II vibe. Clearly ahead of its time; although not unique today, I imagine back in the late 2000's there wasn't anything smelling like this.

Had I got my nose on this when it was first released I think I'd have been in love with it. Now that there are options with a similar vibe but with better performance, I see very little need for me to hold on to my bottle especially given that there are others out there that value this scent so much more than I do.

@Br'eau
I definitely think you're right about the tendencies.

But in some cases (like mine) it's just late expression of continuous love

This fragrance has been in my top10 since 2007, and in my collection as EDT since 2013. (+ had a shower gel in 2009/2010 (that was in a terrible bottle design btw - could'nt get the shampoo out ))

@Breau - As one who discovered GPH II only in the last 2-3 years, I think recency and stylistic trends might have something to do with people's varied reactions. I can't help thinking that GPH II was simply ahead of its time, considering the state of perfumery back in 2007. But yeah, it's pretty unique, well balanced and elegant stuff -- exceedingly good for a designer product. Proof positive that words like "masterpiece" are very subjective, and that not every "masterpiece" has to be niche.

BTW, I am the proud owner of THREE bottles of this stupendous stuff (have owned 5 total), and they're not going anywhere! :)

I own a bottle of this. I bought it while it was still in production and I use it sparingly because I like it so much (see my prior review). I know how Gucci will pull the plug on their quality stuff.

I think this thread is one of MANY examples of what happens when a fragrance gets discontinued, whether that fragrance is good or otherwise. Notice how the reviews changed from “average/good” to “masterpiece” after it ceased production a few years ago. Is that because there’s a human tendency to elevate what is more difficult to obtain, or can’t be obtained at all? Or in some cases, are folks (outside of Fragrantica) simply trying to cash in and hyping it up to justify the crazy prices?

Interesting phenomenon.

Truly one of the most comforting scents of all time. Spray on your sweater if you want it to last (and you should really be wearing a sweater with this one).

Probably the best, most versatile tea-based scent! IMO, the best Gucci fragrance they ever produced: the blend, the quality, performance - all is from niche side of the market. I get standard projection and longevity for EDT formulation. I believe you can wear this any season (spring being the best of them) and any age group.This is a very unique scent (there is Him by Mori and there is Tea for Two by L'Artisan but the Gucci is the Swiss Army knife out of all of them!). In terms of recommend-ability, I say it's a try: tea based scents are not for everybody. But this is the best there is in the category. Shame it was discontinued :(

Un coup de maître, tout simplement. Le dernier, d’ailleurs, de la part de GUCCI qui depuis, décevra toutes les espérances que cette grande maison a fait naître pendant des décennies d’excellence chez les passionnés que nous sommes (voir la désastreuse série des GUCCI GUILTY qu’un GUCCI ABSOLUTE, bon mais brouillon, sauvera à peine du naufrage). GUCCI POUR HOMME 2 est un chef d’oeuvre d’élégance subtile, non démonstrative et qui pourtant ne cesse de vous faire voyager. Il évoque les rencontres insolites alors que vous êtes loin de chez vous, une cigarette à la main (note qui est élégamment présente dans ce parfum). Il faut espérer que GUCCI, marque d’avant-garde, saura pour une fois regarder en arrière et s’inspirer des géniales intuitions qui étaient les siennes il n’y a guère que 20 ans (époque du génialissime ENVY également).

Bought one last year after reading the reviews, instantly fell in love with the scent. It's really good. Unique, masculine, elegant, and relaxing. But the performance is terrible. I can't even enjoy it myself, for which I bought it in the first place. I knew from the reviews that it doesn't perform well, but in my case, it's worse than that. I'm not sure what the problem is. The scent still makes the purchase worthwhile for me. I'm glad I have it in my collection.

I believe that I have a 2017 batch. Scent is beautiful but fleeting. Light and sweet, with just a touch of warm spice. Performance is abysmal. Despite the almost non-existent performance, I don't regret buying this one. It really is a unique (at least nowadays) scent: fresh tea, tobacco and bubblegum. Good for a younger crowd. There is something in here that reminds me of Gillette deodorants from the 2000's.

Nice stuff. Worth trying. Probably won't buy again, because of the lack of performance (seriously it's bad). I would love to see a company like Parfums de Marly or Creed clone this one.

I get respectable performance from GPHII
Longevity 7+ hours

This fragrance is an amazing tea fragrance which I am too late to discover!

Longevity is pretty decent, although for most of its life it is almost a skin scent. Sillage and projection are on the weaker side, but the unbelievable quality of the scent cannot be mistaken. The best part of about this scent is that it is versatile as heck, and because of the fresh airiness of the tea note, it is suitable for warmer weather too.

It's like a opening up a bag of high quality black tea leaves, while enjoying the scent of an unlit cigar, all the while nursing a cup of chai.

GPHII was a blind-buy for me and I'm super happy with the purchase. It's truly one of a kind with the pimento fumes inviting you in as soon as you open the bottle. On my skin, every note does a bit of the heavy-lifting for a 2 hour scent-bubble and a 6-8 hour skin scent. I have the 2012 batch (2333).

I usually wear it to office and find it a bit too elegant for outdoors. Maybe during fall with a jacket and your loved one next to you, but apart from such one-off scenarios, GPHII truly shines in indoor setups. For work, I spray my shoulders on the shirt in addition to the key points on the skin. After the initial violet burst fades away, you're left with a beautiful, clean, relaxing scent that people might feel is not coming off you but something around you. I had a colleague come over at my desk and while talking to me, have a look at my cup to see if I was sipping tea.

One thing I've realized is that if you're buying these bottles online YEARS after their manufacturing dates, use them a couple of times and allow them a month and a half to completely come to character. It's almost like burning your earphone drivers for 50-75 hours before they start to open up. My bottle has changed character over the past two weeks.

I don't get longevity issues on my skin but the sillage is definitely on the lower side.

Beautiful scent for close encounters!

Picked this up primarily because the thick glass bottle and juice color really appeals. The bottle is beautiful and heavy, it makes a good impression.

The color of the juice is a perfect representation of the smell - Mellow

Soft, pleasant and lacking any harshness is how i would describe this, in my collection it is a unique scent, I've smelt nothing quite like this before

Its a fresh Green smell with hints of fruity citrus in the open, getting progressively warmer with the introduction of a very discernible Tea and spice mid

I enjoy spraying this when i feel carefree and want a calming fragrance that is not overly loud
I also spray pillows and clean bed sheets with this for a delightful clean and warm smelling bed

Glad to have it in the stash
Actually i dont like it.too much tobacco cologne.But As if it smells like two different perfume.one of them oriental,other modern.if u will decide so many perfume ,u shouldnt choose gucci pour homme2

I've bought this back in 2014. Nice bottle, great looking juice amazing smell but poor performance.
I can get the smell of tea and some cinnamon (I can't get much tobacco). Longevity up to 2-3 hours at max. Skin scent. I decided to wear this on windy days, only that way I can get whiffs of it. And trust me that whiffs are good!
Then I gave it to my brother in law when it was half empty due to its Eau de cologne performance.
Is the father of spicu bomb and granddad of bvlgary Extreme Think!

Just got to put my nose on GPHII, I could immediately understand why people compare Hanae Mori HiM to this juice.

Gucci Pour Homme II opens with an almost unidentical scent of the dry down of HiM. After that, it becomes fresher, some green kicks in, before the whole juice settles down into a refreshing and warm scent, very lovely and very calming. Just like a cup of tea. But this would not be listed as a gourmand, it doesn't smell like a cup of tea that you would drink, but rather an aroma that keeps reminding you the feeling of holding a hot cup of tea.

It's not so sweet as HiM which I like the most, the opening of HiM was so sharp and sweet that it was almost unbearable for me for the first half an hour. GPHII lacks the spiciness of HiM which makes it more suitable for the warm weather, but that by no means it cannot kick asses in the winter. This is an all-arounder in my opinion, warm or cold, office-friendly, casual, and can be worn on a date too. It would simply put a smile on everyone get to smell it, inoffensive and calming.

Full bottle worthy: yes.
8/10
