After some wears, this fragrance is headache-inducing for me, bye. It's boring too.

6/10

Beware of fakes. I just got my 3rd bottle of GPH2, and unlike the previous two, everything about the scent was different - more like a cheap designer aquatic and not the spiced black tea dominated joy of the real McCoy.

As for the genuine article - there is nothing out there quite like it. I can't stop going back to this one, in spite of having a collection of 100+ bottles, about half of which are more expensive and/or acclaimed. It's just that wearable and enjoyable IMO.

I like this a lot on paper, I catch the violet and tea. Smells quite soft and delicate. On my skin however, it turns acrid and I get a smell that I associate with Ketchup. Very weird and kind of gross.

3/10

Did a blind buy for $40 and its not for me. I think it may be a nice summer fragrance or high school fragrance for a guy/girl who doesn't want to be part of the smells like BO crowd without smelling like the mall mixed with AXE. It smells OK, its not a hate the smell thing, its just a bit meh. Longevity and projection are garbage though.

It smells a lot of green tea and a little sweet cinnamon.


7/10

This is one of my all time favorite designer fragrances. I’ve had it in my collection for around 10 years now. It appears this has been reformulated in recent years and has a new distributor as well.
The bottle I purchased nearly a decade ago has a more prominent green/ozonic opening note when first sprayed.
It’s a special scent to me which I wear any time of year. In the warmer climate the tea and slightly woody/tobacco aspect reveals itself more as opposed to the softer violet/floral tones I experience in cooler weather
It lasts hours on my clothes, while not nearly as long on my skin. The older version definitely has more lasting power, sillage, and projection.
Overall, this is a scent anyone can wear and is wildly pleasant.
I will apply once and reapply maybe 30-60 mins later to lay it on a bit thicker.
My suggestion for having any fragrance last longer is to apply fragrance free moisturizer which will absorb into the skin and help create more lasting power for a scent
This was a suggestion from an associate at a boutique.
Gucci nailed it. Have to smell the predecessor still. It’s a rarity now.

It has a really nice fresh black tea smell that's perfect for warmer weather. The performance is unfortunately as awful as it gets. Longevity is mostly around 30 minutes with almost non-existing projection. Don't buy it if you actually want a fragrance that other people can experience.

If you havent got this in your collection GET IT. It is just superb. Extremely non offensive and just such a nice relaxing smell to be around. Best suited for formal events, going out for coffee etc. It doesn't project that great unless you spray alot, but youll all you need is 3 sprays and your good to go.

Last quite long aswell. First time smelling this I really thought it was crap, but then it just slowly grew on me and its just such a great smell, love it. Please get this if you havent already.
Sadly, a short lived fragrance . Giving this. Bottle away

YES. This is so good. My now-husband used to wear this all throughout college and afterwards (8 years and still wearing) so I have had a long time to slowly fall in love with this fragrance. Honestly, part of the reason I fell for him is because he always smelled so damn good! The thing I love the most about Gucci Pour Homme II is that it is a fresh scent for men that doesn't have that sharp "masculine cologne" smell. I've realized that I don't appreciate that sharp scent on me OR on men. This one, however, is just perfect. It opens up super fresh with violet leaf but morphs very quickly. It's so smooth, and the tea/tobacco combination is done so well here. The spiciness isn't harsh, just sweetly spicy and perfect for warmer weather, with the violet leaf still present but muted. I can smell this on me and my husband all day when either of us wear it (I steal from his bottle :D) so it's a good performer for a fresh scent without ever becoming overbearing. This is one of those scents where I have trouble focusing on any one note - it all just blends together into something you just want to nuzzle into. There is nothing I would change about this: 10/10.

Gucci pour homme II is the lighter and more summery version its now discontinued predecessor, the Gucci pour homme.
Even though it distinctively retains the originals classy and masculine DNA, a very strong and beautiful tea leaf note givs it a very fresh and slightly herbal touch. Opening few minutes do give you a slight lemony feel but then it quickly disappears and a hint of woody and tobacco leaf notes join in at the base. Although cinnamon is also mentioned in its notes breakdown, I didn't get any sweetness during it's evolution.
In the nutshell, it is a very unique black tea leaf fragrance all along with other mellow notes that show up in between from stat to the end to keep you interested.
An all occasions, spring and summer fragrance for sure that gives you 6 to 7 hrs of staying power and very decent silage for up to 2 hours.

This is a great spicy, warm, sweet, light clean scent. Gucci Pour Homme is my favorite scent and this doesn't replace it but I enjoy it quite a lot.

Scent: 8.5/10
Longevity 7/10
Projection 6.5/10
Smells very synthetic to me, noting special. Not terrible but just your basic sweet type fragrance

It is so beautiful, dry, herbal tea, woody. Very chic. Elegant. The bottle is remarkable. It looks so exclusive on the shelf (however, it's not practical, very edgy and heavy in hand) One of those scents which you cant decide it suits better hot or cold weather? I was disappointed it was discontinued but I'm not surprised: interesting fragrances are not popular on the market mostly dominated by typical, safe, boring masculine standard synthetics.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
25.June 2025

We have parted our ways today, so I thought i would write a few lines about this little thing. I will start by saying that i really like the Flora original eau de parfum and eau de toilette with black lids and golden letters on either black or white sticker. The other ones not so much. I already reviewed the "anniversary edition" in a beautiful bottle, but the fragrance itself was not as good. This "eau fraiche" sadly will not get my praises as well, since to my taste it is too sharp, for the lack of better words. It is like the "Flora" but with extra citruses and green notes added, and that is what ruins it for me. The creaminess and beautiful flower bouquet is gone here. All i smell is a watery peony with overdose of bergamote, very basic scent in my opinion and has nothing to do with original. If out of all "reminds me of" i could choose, then i would say its the closest to Versace´s "Yellow diamond" - they share same vibe and feeling. Sadly with "Flora eau fraiche" lasting power is not good, as many mentioned before, yet sillage is quite ok.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: This is my go-to spring/summer fragrance! It's so fresh and bright, perfect for daytime wear. The citrus notes are really prominent at first, then it settles into a lovely floral scent with a hint of sweetness. It lasts a decent amount of time too, which is always a plus.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
a fairy emerging from a flower, in the early morning spring dew.

missing this scent. it was one of the first real fragrances i was gifted when i was 15 years old.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: Quite lovely florals, but not distinctive.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: I'm not usually a floral fan but this one caught my attention! However, while the scent is amazing, it is also very weak and does not last long (maybe an hour or two). Carrying this in your purse for a refresher is a must. The dry down is nice and leaves an almost flirty floral scent. I love using it during the summer especially! Very hard to find as I believe it has been discontinued but I found mine at Stoneberry.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: This is my signature scent. I have been wearing this perfume literally since it came out! That's over 12 years living with it and it has never failed me to mesmerize me with every spritz. If you do not like green, chypre scents, then this is not for you. This is my signature scent year round, but it SHINES in the summer on a VERY hot day. On my skin, this pulls very green aquatic with slight floral notes, sandalwood and very light pink pepper pop out at the end. I can definitely pinpoint the peony, lemon, bergamot and aquatic notes upon first spray. Once it settles and dries on your skin, GREEN comes out, I think due to the osmanthus being a bit creamy and aromatic, however it remains calm and comes out as more of a sage green as opposed to kelly green. The sandalwood hides until the very end but is what keeps your nose coming back for more. The pink pepper keeps it only very slightly spicy and is very well blended, the patchouli in this is very well blended as well as you can barely pick it up. Sandalwood keeps the scent from being too cloying and the patchouli keeps it earthy. If I were to describe this smell, it would be like relaxing in the horizon on a hot summer's day, lying in a healthy bed of grass with your eyes closed, and the wind blowing against your skin. As you inhale, you catch whiffs of the salty ocean breeze, the vapors from the water hitting the shore tickling your nose. There is a bit of petrichor as it may rain in a couple of days, so the grass, leaves and trees are dewy and moist. You sniff the air and it smells wet and dry at the same time. You smell warmth and coolness all at the same time. The cool aroma of the ocean and the earthy scents of the forest intertwine as you sip an ice cold limoncello(garnished with a fresh lemon peel) under the sun and the shade all at the same time. You would like every summer day to be like this. Both uplifting and grounding all at the same time. I imagine this to smell like an ideal Italian summer day. This is what I enjoy smelling like every single day. I will continue to buy and wear this scent forever!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: This perfume smells squeaky clean. Great for right out of the shower but not what I want to smell like all day.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: Opened up with a less than famiiliar citrus, and in a few seconds transformed into obvious osmanthus 'tea' scents with water notes. Pepper slowly emerges. It's pretty unique! Took a while for it to grow on me...

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: This smells exactly like Chanel Chance the green one. The dry down is like the Chanel chance eau tendre. Is fresh, green, and light it last longer than Chanel chance imo.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: it's not all that. Pass. Though not for me, I felt no need to scrub it off and it turns into a skin scent within a couple hours, anyway. which is fine with me. I don't need to invite all my perfumes to spend the night. You just have to try and see if it suits you. . It did remind me of Kristalle < sp>? Chanel. a little bit. not my cup of tea. Like most of them. I will stop looking soon and be thankful for the handful that are in my rotation.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: This is amazing and so unique! This to me is an expensive tropical weather daytime scent that can do well on any occasion. It can work in colder weather too as a clean crisp answer to the chilly winds but, the warm weather is where it really performs. For me the sillage is just about okay but, the longevity is on point. A definite love for me, this.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
It is like for me not love. Actually even if it is not heavy , it gives me a little headache. It can be suitable general taste and any women over the age of 20 can use. Not fresh but it can be used in office areas.
Edit: this perfume is very very bad on my skin, for a reason I don't know my headache has increased gradually. However my comment above is still valid because on my friend's skin this perfume is good.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
This is the most beautiful scent in the world. It's just happiness in a bottle, it's perfection.
Flora Eau de Parfum is not available in the stores anymore, which is why I purchased this version instead. They also removed Gucci Eau de Toilette and renamed Flora Eau Fraiche so it's now Gucci Flora Eau de Toilette. It's a bit confusing. EDP is still available online but not in the boutiques. The Eau de Toilette is completely gone. Eau Fraiche is now Eau de Toilette and is still available everywhere. Thank God. I'm just thankful since this version is still strong for an EDT. It's incredible!

Short story. I wore it for the whole day and was cuddling with a guy in the evening. When he left he wrote me later that evening that he could smell my perfume on himself. So the fragrance lasted for 10+ hours and even transferred to his skin and clothing! That's actually insane for any perfume and mostly for an EDT!

I love both EDP and EDT, they are almost identical. EDP has always been my signature and my true love fragrance for a long time. I just couldn't find it anywhere for a period of time, so I had to go with this one, which is totally fine! You can't really tell them apart. EDT is just slightly more fresh but still has good performance!

Edit: This version lasts longest on my skin. I've been wearing both EDP and this for some days now, and this one wins in performance, which is weird but amazing since it's cheaper and fresher, which I love.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: I love this one. Green and slightly sweet, better than Flora, much fresher. So so sad can't find her anymore. So I spritz her sparengly. Soft, feminine for special moments.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: Very sharp. On myself, the pink pepper and mint are the strongest notes. Unlike the other reviews, this perfume is not at all fruity on me but more of a zingy-soapy.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: This was a blind buy for me and a very successful one at that! I am hooked! I opened the box and couldn't stop saying wow with every sniff. Crisp, fresh, fruity. As it hung out on my skin for the rest of the day I smelled some soapiness which was really nice and clean, it mingled with the fruity freshness super well. Next came the dry down which smelled a teeny bit less fresh, more powdery and woody floral with the fruity freshness. Longevity is phenomenal, silliage is moderate and projection is moderate also. With every move of my body, this scent comes to life again and a beautiful sparkly feeling enters my soul. Outstanding scent. Definitely top 3 of all time for me.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: Love the scent for every single second of the 3-4 hours it lasts on my skin. It is all things floral and springy. It’s not the most exclusive smelling floral fragrance on the shelf but its worth a sampling.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: Frech and fruity. perfect for a hot summer day. nothing special.. but nice.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: I wore this today and was very pleased with the performance. Much better than the original which I could not get to last on me at all. It’s been 7 hours and it’s still radiating. This smells like the original but fresher and greener.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
I am a perfume addict and am constantly blind buying bottles based on reviews of others (bc I live in a remote town with literally no shopping). I have collected over 300 beautiful perfumes. I had to write a review on this because I am pretty unlucky with it. I bought the biggest bottle, just knowing I would love it, and then my mother gave me the biggest bottle for my birthday. Now I have two huge bottles and I will never wear this.

I usually love many styles of perfume; fruity floral to rose oud and niche perfume. This one, however, I do not at all understand the good reviews. I try and try and keep hoping that one of these times smelling it, i will have a change of heart (which has happened before with other frags). No luck.

In my opinion, this smells like the most basic generic boring perfume I can even imagine. To my nose, there is nothing at all appealing about the scent, and I have smelled this a thousand times before... at Target or Walmart. Gucci used to be so great, but now I do not love any of their newer releases. They are all weak, boring, and nondescript. This one takes the cake of boring. I won't even wear this around the house because I would rather break out my celebrity frags for the day that smell so much better.

After discovering how boring I think this one happens to be, I ordered a few more by Gucci, just to see if it was a fluke. Gucci Envy, which was also highly rated, was better than this, but still boring and nondescript. I ended up returning my bottle of Bamboo. Someone gave me (once again) TWO of the biggest bottles of Gucci II EDP. To my nose, this one was the best Gucci I have smelled...ever. Not weak, has moderate sillage and also acceptable longevity. Don't even mind having to reapply thru the day, as it was pretty inexpensive for what the juice smells like. Even though I like Gucci II the best, I still don't ever reach for it. I don't love it.

Just for some reference, my all-time favorite is Chloe. Not the old Chloe, which is REAL gross, and I gave away the day I received it, but the newer version in the square/rectangle bottle. Both EDP and EDT are so awesome that I could cry.

I hope I didn't offend anyone as that is not my intention. I just want to be as honest as I can be to hopefully stop a blind buyer with MY type of taste from wasting money. Another house that seems pretty basic and boring, but I bought them all anyway, is Versace. Maybe I am different than everyone else, but I am curious if there is anyone that feels the same way that I feel about the two houses?

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
This is so pretty. I know that fruity florals seem to be especially common right now, but that doesn't mean they can't be good. I actually really like fruity florals, because I find them refreshing and versatile.This one stands out in my mind from other fruity florals (and I've tried quite a few), because it doesn't have an artificial or metallic, cheap after-smell at all (a problem I've had with lesser quality fruity floral scents).

The water note makes it more distinctive, in my opinion. It elevates it to a more airy, happy, ephemeral, cheery scent. One problem I have with some (not all) fruity florals is that they feel more like perfumed water to me...not in terms of longevity or sillage (although that too) but the scent itself. I don't consider myself a fan of stronger, more intense fragrances, but whenever I try the newest Daisy flanker (don't know which one, I swear, they churn out a new one every hour) or another fruity floral, the presence just seems to not be there at all. I always end up forgetting what it smells like immediately after I spray it, because it seems to disappear immediately. In two hours, I'd be lucky if I could get even a slight sniff of a simpering whisper of sugar water from my wrist.

And by nature, fruity florals are supposed to be light and airy, so a lot of those scents end up not having any mileage or presence at all. Gucci Flora Eau Fraiche avoids those pitfalls, though. I could spray it in the morning, and in the afternoon, when I'm walking in the breeze, I'd still smell it on myself, which is highly impressive, given it's an EDT. It's a huge compliment getter too, and very likable. I just spray it twice (I don't want to be the one person who oversprays) and it's lovely.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: After many years, I once again get the 75ml of this Gucci beauty. The water-fruit acord is airy, yet stays for eternity. This reminds me of the many great and wonderful times I had in life, and smelling this makes me relive those moments. Apart from Rush, this Flora flanker will forever be my love from the house of Gucci.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: Bought this perfume several years ago. I fell in love with it as soon as I sniffed it. It’s a watery fresh floral fragrance that is great for summer. I recently gave it away to my mom though. Lasting power was zilch on me. I felt like I sprayed and thirty min later it was completely gone. I have so many other perfumes I wanna use up and this one was just collecting dust. It was pretty much full. My mom is very happy with it. I figured it would be perfect for her since she works in an office and the frag is definitely office safe.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: My no 1 for hot summer. I love all the refreshment this fragrance provides. Like walking into a cold creek during an extremely hot day. You feel relaxed immediately. And that feeling stays long.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: This is how I imagine edie sedgwick would smell, rich, glamorous, and beautiful, and also young and cool

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: This perfume keeps a long time. I got mine 5 yrs ago too and it's still in perfect condition and since it doesn't take much it's practually full still. Only the bow has stretched out and fallen off

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
This is the only perfume I own from Gucci since my aunt gave me this. I love a great packaging so I really love the hexagon bottle which makes it so elegant and sophisticated. The only con is, the bottle is too heavy for a 50ml. But of course, I'm not carrying it on my bag so it's no big deal.

I'm not a fruity floral kind of girl. I'm into woody, musky perfumes. This one is definitely a fruity floral perfume. It smells very good but not amazing. It's absolutely an expensive fruity floral perfume when I smell it. More on the fruity side than the floral. I don't think I've smelled anything the same or close to it from the fragrance mists I've tried and smelled before. I was expecting it's more floral since it is labeled Flora. It smells strong for my liking but eventually I get used to it. It screams YOUTH to me. This is perfect for late teenagers or early twenties women with glowing carefree character. It smells like summer and spring with a touch of class and happiness to me, like an expensive potent fruity floral drink. I've used it once to school and I must say I'm very impressed with its sillage and longevity. I went to school at one in the afternoon until I got home at nine, it was still pretty strong.

Overall, it smells very good but it's just not for me.

Smell: 7/10
Sillage: 8/10
Longevity: 9/10

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: Talking about perfume in my country is not something to be happy looking the the price tag, so I bought EDT Eau Fraiche edition because i don't have enough money for EDP, so sad. Now is 2017 (was bought it in 2012), I still got my juice about 30% left. Just want to say about this perfume, so I'm very happy to wearing it specially for night and work, so fresh bright sweet flowery, bit harsh in the opening because of the citrus note, then flowers note taking part to make it so flowery with little touch of woodiness in the end. Sillage is moderate but longevity is amazing on me, 6 spritz is lasting to the evening, so unexpected.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: Rubbery, lemony, refreshing, soapy. Somewhere there is artificial sweet fruits, floral notes. First 10 minutes there was something sharp that made my nose and throat scratch. Lasted about 2 hours. Even next day I could catch some moments with this fragrance. Very synthetic.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: sooo uplifting and feminine. love it.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
Immediately smells like a bowl of citrus when sprayed and has a very fresh smell. As it sits it continues to retain citrus top notes, but quickly seems to change into a more floral, green scent. Not as noticeable, and starts to fade. Very bright smell and the overlaying smell is stable as a citrus-based scent.

Update: I ended up not using this much because it did not last long on me. I passed it on to my aunt though, and on her it does have better longevity.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: Sweet greens and the scent of a beach on a cool day. Very appealing. Interesting blend of fruits give it a tangy background. Distinctive.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
Have tried this at Shins Beauty Shop last week.So here is my review.I think I do not need that expensive or elite fragrances such as Chance and also Coco Mademoiselle by Chanel or any frags that is related.

I prefer this one better that its other two identical sisters of EDP (the gold coloured) and EDT (the clear coloured liquid).Eau fraiche version smells fresher,way better and lighter to my nose.I only smelled it on a tester strip.Later on the drydown and to be specific,on the next day.I am able to smell a nice rose flower scent along with its woody n leafy patchouli composition.but the citrusy scent remains.

Top notes : Citrus fruits of kumquat,bergamot,lemon and mandarin orange.
All are freshly present and appeared to be quite strong and quite sharp on its initial spray.

Middle notes : Peony,rose and osmanthus.
Peony and osmanthus makes flora eau fraiche smells oriental-like.
Rose flower at its later stage.I mean on the drydown.Lovely.

Base of notes : Patchouli,sandalwood and pink pepper.
Pink pepper enhances the citrus part in Gucci Flora so that the wearer would be happy and stay active.
Patchouli makes Gucci Flora mature and humble or down-to-earth in character yet recognizable.
Sandalwood contributes its femininity,soft n gentle traits to the wearer.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: This is a great scent for parties or being a guest at a wedding. It is very green, light and friendly. It is not dramatically different from the others in the Gucci Flora line, except for being the brightest. Cheerful and pleasant. I like it!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: At the time I was looking at buying this I was trying to choose between a Bvlgari fragrance and this one and I chose this one and I'm so glad I did. This is really, really pretty! It is fresh in a way that is different than a lot of other fresh fragrances. The lemon note is not the most prominent and it is not very woody. It is floral for sure and just a little sweet, but all mixed together with a clean vibe. The only bad thing is that sometimes when I wear this it will give me a headache. I still like how it smells even through a headache but I would rather not have one. So I usually wear this on days I know I won't be going out and can wash this off if I need to. I highly recommend trying this out though! :)

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
The name "Eau Fraîche" really does this perfume justice, it is a fresh aquatic scent but not in this weird cucumber-watermelon-citrus sense that you can smell so often on people in the summertime.

Flora EF opens aquatic and sweetly green; the kumquat and peony join quickly.

At times this smells "icy", like an icy mountain river surrounded by flowers, melting in the springtime.
"Crisp" smelling, as someone wrote here.


This is long-lasting and the heavy sillage for a perfume like this was nice and surprising.

I usually don't go for fresh light fragrances like this, I was gifted a small bottle by someone. I was hesitant to try this, but so so many people commented on my scent while wearing this.

Flora EF is nice when you want to smell polished.

If you usually don't like aquatics (like me), try this.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: Tried this one at Sephora for the first time months ago. At first I wasn't impressed, but my husband loved it. Now craving for a light aquatic scent I ended up buying this (and because my husband love it and its he only perfume I have that doesn't flare up his allergies). For an eau fraiche I think it lasts a good time (6 hrs on my skin) and the sillage its pretty good with just a couple squirts. If you like sweet light and aquatic florals this is for you. I think its a very young and happy kind of scent, perfect for the warmer months.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: I love this fragrance! Lovely, classy floral to be worn in any circumstances, with enough freshness to feel youthful, optimistic and relaxed. Made me think of a stroll in a summer garden, caressed by a fresh breeze and when I had it I preferred to keep it for casual time off. As the ad shows, it is a scent of freedom.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: It's summer here, hot and humid and I've been searching for the perfect "green" scent. Spritzed this on in store today and was pleasantly surprised. Very fresh, light, airy and aquatic but still has a feminine sweetness to it with the lovely peony and rose. Really uplifting and refreshing on hot days but when you still want to smell nice. I previously used Acqua Di Gioa but unfortunately that one smells too harsh on me; like lemon detergent. This one worked really nicely with my skin chemistry and is definitely going on my summer fragrance wish list!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
The Gucci bottles have no labeling on them that distinguishes the regular Flora from the Fraiche, but the one I tried smelled lighter and sweeter, so I am guessing it was Fraiche.

I had high hopes for this one after smelling it on paper and even when I first applied it. It was so pretty, and I got a sharp peppery grassy smell right away, which was funky and different (I am looking for "different" for my signature scent). Sillage was just right, not overpowering, but not so close to the skin that I didn't smell it every now and then. I was thinking I was in love.

Then came the drydown. Have you ever smelled someone with a perfume on, and it almost smells like PEZ and metal? Maybe mixed with static? Well, this is what I smell like with most complex perfumes, and this one was no different. In fact, it reminded me exactly of the way Chance Fraiche smelled on me, which was a no go as well. Luckily, the longevity on this was practically non-existent, so I didn't have to be tortured for long. What is left on my skin at this point is just a slight fruity floral, but it still doesn't give me any sense of warmth or excitement...I completely agree with another reviewer who said this is a "cold" fragrance. I really need to start looking for common ingredients in fragrances so I know what it is I do not like in so many of them. I'm sick of smelling like pennies!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: I just love it. It is more autumn/winter scent, bit heavy for the summer. Makes you feel beautiful and sophisticated :)

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
Smells wonderfully fresh, clean and elegant! I feel the warm sun against my skin, the beach in the distance and the distant smell of orange blossoms in the breeze.

Its important to test on the skin as I find sniffing it from the bottle tends to make me dizzy some how...

Nice scent. Worth every penny

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: I enjoy this perfume, and wear it more than my others. It smells clean and fresh on me, sweet too. I often get compliments when I wear it.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: No idea what has happened to my bottle of this, it smells nothing like the tester from the shop and I've wasted £58 on it as once opening, you can't send it back to get a refund! The shop bottle was lovely, fresh and smelt like you'd just stepped out of the shower and similar to the normal Gucci Flora perfume, but my bottle has this odd after smell, like stinky sweaty socks/it's gone off? What a shame and waste of money.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: Oh no, this is not nearly eau fraiche. Sweet, very sweet. It's sweeter than the EDP version of Flora. Well, it's kind of aquatic, but not in a fresh and bright way. More like a sugar water aquatic. There's a hint of fruity notes, but mostly it's still sugar water.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: I really like it for hot sunny summer & spring

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: When i received my sample first i check the notes: aquatic, green notes, peony and pepper are not my favorite ones so i was ready to pass on it.Gucci creations are also not on my top list. But curiosity took over and i sprayed tiny amount on my arm. And you know what? This is amazing. It's sweet, cheerful and not that green at all. Very well balance between so many ingredients. Eau Fraiche had another surprise for me - longevity. It lasted good couple of hours radiating nice, delicate sweet aura around me (at the end i used whole sample).

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: I like the opening - very azonic, fresh, fruity, not overly sweet... but then disappointing, some sort of "detergenty" dry down on the skin, just like all the other cheep fragrances on the market today. Can you do a little better, Gucci?

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: Is citrus the main accord? Really? I only remember the strong floral one... sorry, it's quite nauseating

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: This is really refreshing your day, even cold day. It has a blast of mandarin & aquatic vibe. Trully fresh. When i wore it, anybody's around me can smell it even they're about 3 ft away. And they can feel the fresh just by sniffing it from me. I think the commercial should be for this version because when you wear it, you can feels like you are in the Flora commercial. The scent's stick on your body all day, very impressive for EdT. I had to have 1 or 2 more bottles for my own stock. 2 thumbs up for Flora Eau Fraiche. Well done Gucci

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
Fraiche is the right name for this. This is breezy,and perfect for spring. Perfect for a woman on the go. It's long-lasting and fresh. Great for daily wear. At work,shopping,or an independent day out by yourself.
I was surprised to find that there is no spearmint in this,because,that is the first thing I smell. Not to mention,the mint green juice I see.
This is a great scent,in a great bottle.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: I bought this recently and I'm very fond of it. Lovely fresh-floral adequate for office but I prefer it for relaxing,casual time off.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
This Gucci Flora flanker does not remind me very much of the original eau de parfum. Eau Fraîche is closer to the eau de toilette: a standard-issue abstract fruity-floral. Fresh, clinically clean, uplifting and bright. An SSRI frag of the twenty-first century! Or is it a shampoo-conditioner frag? Maybe this is a combination of the two.

These sorts of fragrances are designed specifically for public settings: office-ready inoffensive fruity-floral frags (ORIFFF). They match the scent of Pantene conditioner, not uncoincidentally (also from Procter & Gamble!).

I find the scent and simplicity of this Flora Eau Fraîche eau de toilette to be very similar to some of the Bond no 9 abstract florals. Most of these launches are interchangeable to me and it would be difficult to distinguish them except in a direct side-by-side sniff-off. They all tap into the same memory: freshly shampooed hair.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: This perfume is a lighter and brighter version of flora by Gucci EDP witch i honestly don't like cuz its too much and sickly heavy but this is so fresh , aquatic , suitable for hot weather or spring time . this is a shampoo perfume or a shampoo scent cuz its like clean , good smell , expensive shampoo . I love it and enjoy it so much , plus its long lasting on my skin.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: Just got this today. Fresh take on the original Flora scent- very nice!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: I bought the eau fraiche because at that time I found Flora too sweet and heavy (but later on I have become more fond of the original as well). The eau fraiche has been in my collection for a while (second bottle now) and it's one of my favorites for summer. My boyfriend enjoys it as well, which is a bonus. The only downside is that it doesn't last longer than a couple of hours on skin so I have to re-apply after 3 hours, but overall it's a very nice, delicate and fresh floral scent.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: Lately I have been on a fresh and clean perfume kick so I ordered this fragrance from sephora.com in the 2.5 oz size to put away for the spring.I had previously smelled this perfume and really liked it.I find it rather different from most aquatic fragrances.While light blue is more on the natural earthy side and really depicts salty ocean air,Gucci flora eau fraiche is more of a seaside atmosphere and more on the classy floral side if that makes any sense.Its more elegant and I would wear this if I was going out to dinner or was more dressed up on a spring or summer eveing.This opens with strong juicy mandarin oranges and a touch of peony.The floral notes are well blended with a seabreeze accord thats clean and fresh linen like.The pepper notes are there from start to finish so if you don't like pepper you will not like this fragrance but I think it gives eau fraiche a kick.The drydown is sophisticated and the sandalwood is blended with the patchouli very nicely.It is not a dirty patchouli but it gives it a classy earthy touch.This perfume is fruity, floral ,earthy and sparkling all at once.It does depict spring and summer breezes at some beautiful resort.If you like aquatics but are looking for something a little more classy and chic give this fragrance a try.If you like chanel eau fraiche,light blue and acqua di gioia you will like this as well. This is just a tad different and more of an elegant aquatic with more flowers to give it that garden by the seaside vibe.The longevity is about 4 to 6 hours depending on your skin type and the silliage is medium.I am going to pair this with the body shops satsuma body butter to keep the juicy mandarin smell going!Happy spring summer breezes to come!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: I just bought this from an ebay seller. When I first received it and sprayed it on, it had a funny smell. I thought I had gotten a loser. Then, I started cooking. As I cooked, I kept smelling some heavenly scent as I worked. I sniffed my wrist where I had sprayed the Gucci Flora Eau Fraiche -- that was it! To me, this perfume smells absolutely lovely (after dry down). Very soft and feminine. Wow! I got a very good buy on ebay -- I will have to watch for more of this. It reminds me slightly of Versace Brigth Crystal and Bvlgari Mon Jasmin Noir L'eau Exquise (all florals, but each slightly different). Bright Crystal is the strongest and sweetest of the three. This one, Flora Eau Fraiche, is the lightest. I love it's soft elegance!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
It reminds me good quality body balm with strong green notes. Very fresh, charming, a bit soapy, but still it is perfect for hot season. Why is it worthy? It gives a lot of pleasure when you wear it.

Update: In warmer weather, it reveals its true beauty. This scent is amazing, fresh green, and yes - I rarely use that word - noble. Perfect for office and any formal/business occasions. Miraculously fresh and totally unobtrusive!

Update2: I've tested it once more, just to be sure. And yes, I am sure I love it, even if it includes green notes! Here green notes are totally pleasant, not grassy at all!

Update3: I've bought a small bottle for summer 2014 and I am so happy!

Update4: I highly recommend to wear it in heat. It gives a lot of refreshment, like a cool shower. I feel so fresh!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: I love this one. It's never offensive and always appropriate, good job Gucci. aI hope it will become a classic perfume ! If it isn't available anymore in stores I'm gonna cry, that's for sure, I love it !

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: first aquatic I love! on me, it smells like a summer flower bouquet with a hint of jasmine. I used to dislike citrus noted scents - my skin disapproves them, but Flora's is adorable! it's very different with Calvin Klein summer fragrances which also citrusy. On first spritz, the notes gradually reveal themselves, one by one, like facets of a gem. Then they mingle and melt, and wear very close to the skin, with a hint of playful freshness. Flora definitely spells Class. I will go for the full size.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: Just tried this for the third or fourth time I'm not sure how many times I tried this but it's really clean & perfect after a cool refreshing bath. Smells like a clean clothes washed with clothes softner. I adore clean smelling fragrances & this one is absolutely a winner. It doesn't smell exactly like zara matin as I thought before. This one is way better & doesn't smell rotten or cheap like I heared from some reviewers.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
Surprisingly this is my first Gucci fragrance. It's lovely, it's love at first whiff.
I thought it's aquatic, like Acqua de Gioia, but this one is a more beautiful, more sophisticated, less raw, more natural. It has been my summer scent, and I'm enjoying this. Everyday I look forward to having to smell this scent, it's invigorating in some way.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
My wife has this unusual preference when it comes to buying fragrance. She would go by color than smell. (I mean, the color of the juice instead of how exceptional or mediocre the smell of the scent is)

She bought this last year, simply because she wanted a pale blue-green fragrance. Out of many other fragrances (of similar color) the sp presented her, she picked this one. She said she liked it, and she wanted it, so, she had it.

That moment, I thought this would be just another ridiculous purchase she made, of so-called 'fraiche' fragrances, that smell of calone, along with pale floral notes.

I was wrong. This fragrance is quite an exception. Instead of being 'airy-watery', the 'fraiche' comes from the lush, sweet smelling of citrus notes, plus the florals. It's not caramel-sweet, but rather more to the smell of ripe, sweet-juicy mandarin and other citruses. This is a strong but not overpowering fragrance, feminine, and simply gorgeous.

Both lasting power and silage are great. I wonder what color she'd look next.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: Very fresh, fruity fragrance which cheers me up. I'm absolutely in love with this one. It is a perfectly balanced coctail of delicious fruits, spring fields and flowery vivid spirit. On me it doesn't change much while wearing it and the scent stays pretty strong for long time. It makes me feel free, confident and beautiful.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: I'm in love with this scent, it was recommended to me by an empolyee and I have been wanting to buy it. The only thing stopping me is the price, so steep.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: Loved the top notes, smelled so fresh and fruity. But the dry down after about 5 minutes, meh. It smells like something I can't put my finger on. Not fresh at all. Someone said bubblegum and yeah it smells a bit like an old bubblegum. If I buy a perfume that is called Fraiche I want it to be fresh the whole time.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
With full respect to the person who compared this with bvlgari l'eau exquise, there's no comparison really. Gucci is so fresh & way cleaner than l'eau exquise & it doesn't even smell like green tea or anything like that. This one is so fesh & clean & just way too good to not have a bottle of it ♥
I forgot to add this one is the soapiest scent & the freshest ever. I thought vera wang is the queen of all soapy scents until I sniffed this one.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: I almost have all of the Floras and this is my favorite. I LOVE it!!!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: all gucci flora perfumes smell so fresh. really refreshing

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
Today it's cold, wet and windy. It's still winter here where I live. So I bought a hyacinth in the pot ( it's in button right now but after 3 days it will show me a wonderful and divine smelling flower), I am looking at the summer pictures, the sea, green grass, flowers. My hand cream from Yves Rocher smells like fresh cut grass and I sprayed one spray of Flora eau fraiche on my wrist. This scent brings back the summer feeling- fruits, flowers with a hint of elegance and sensuality.
Memories of summer. No winter allowed.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
Aquatics aren't usually my style, however I must admit that Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche is by far my favourite from the Flora range.

I wasn't a huge fan of the original Flora. Something in it just didn't sit right with me. I also found it unoriginal and plain. This Summer inspired flanker is much nicer. It's crisp, delicate and fresh. It also feels very feminine and clean on the skin.

Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche opens with green, citrusy bergamot and a refreshing ocean breeze accord. There are a fair few fruit notes in this composition, and while they are definitely present, they smell subdued on the skin. Osmanthus and peony predominantly feature in the heart of this fragrance, adding a fresh floral touch.

Due to the watery aspect, Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche seems like the perfect fragrance to wear to the beach or to the public pool. It is a very Summer appropriate scent. I doubt that I would crave such a fragrance during Winter.

Since its release in 2011, Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche has had quite a few good reviews and many fans. I can now see why it is so widely liked. I too wouldn't mind a bottle of this in my collection for the warmer months.

The projection may be fairly light on, however the longevity was impressive. Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche lasts even longer on fabric. I highly recommend this flanker.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
Eau Fraiche?
You would think aquatic, green scent right away, however this fragrance is more than just aquatic green floral scent. This fragrance is crisp, zesty sweet and citrusy with subtle notes of the florals. (peony, rose and osmanthus). To my nose, the kumquat is the dominant citrus scent, smells so sweet like a ripe mango. All and all, the fragrance is subtly fresh, with soft florals. Lasting power and silage are good.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: There is something about this scent that I like but I do agree with everyone who said that this scent has a weird drydown plus this barely lasts on my skin! WTF?? That's not acceptable for a designer fragrance.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: i have a sample vial of this. a sniff off the vial is cooling sweet but as soon as it touches my skin the smell suddenly evaporates, leaving some kind of laundry detergent behind...and it's very faint too. looks like this one does not agree with me :/

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: Very clean feminine and delicate scent that is slightly green and soapy floral. It's not all that sweet nor fruity enough by my standard. It stays soapy musky clean for the whole time I have this on. I wish it'd be a bit less clean and more fruity or more girly floral. Anyway, this is not a bad choice out of all Flora. I just prefer the original and the Gorgeous Gardenia.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: This is one of my favorite scents ever. So smooth and lightly sweet I could drink it. I only wish it stayed awhile longer. I don't think it will last me long at this rate.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
I am very fond of this one . I like it even better than Gucci Flora edt.

Maybe because we have summer now and this scent is very clean , fresh and simple but in a very positive way. Simple but not ordinary.

Zesty lemons with flowers and oranges plus watery and other green notes are a perfect combination for my skin .

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: this smells like green tea with watery notes. but too sweet I think, very ordinary

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
I think my humble collection greeted the arrival of this lovely Gucci’s EDT, a very appreciated birthday gift, with kind of a relief sigh: “Finally a fragrance that can be easily worn during this hottest Italian summer!”. I’ve never tried to hide my passion for creamy and sweet fragrances in general, but really this is one of the most enjoyable scents that stay quite far from that category and still make me intrigued.

Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche, since the watery shade of the juice, owns a brightness that is both lively and exquisitely refined, sending me reminiscences of some other brisk and successful summery fragrances from the past especially for its sparkling mood: Tommy Girl and Clinique Happy mostly, plus some others I can’t put my fingers on right now. Ideally put beside those, Eau Fraiche feels in a way much more aquatic, even salty and aromatic, eventually behaving like an intense floral dominated by osmanthus and peony (at least on warm skin).
A polished yet very flirtatious interpretation of freshness, that's what Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche is to me.

I can sense kind of an iced green tea note between the almost scratchy mandarin orange-bergamot combo in top notes and the more relaxed and delicate floral heart.. evoking pleasant afternoons and evenings spent on a terrace in some holiday place..
(Light-hearted chats, a turquoise and white strapless mini-dress, drinking a cool lemonade with little sugar in and enjoying the air fulfilled with fragrant nuances from trees, fruits and flowers around).
The blend of sour citrus notes and sweet osmanthus, in this EDT, feels even more pronounced than in the previous Flora releases.. like an overexposed, purer, juicier and somehow simpler version of both that never loses its graceful nature.
In the drydown the fragrance acquires some depth thanks to sandalwood and patchouli - one beloved note by perfumers at Gucci, it seems - though subtle aromatic (citrus) and aquatic whiffs keep coming from my skin after several hours.
For an Eau de Toilette, Eau Fraiche has a noticeable tenacity on skin (about 6 hours in the heat of summer), with a come-closer-and-sniff-me attitude more than a terrific sillage.

This is definitely a soothing, bright fragrance with some slight suavity and complexity to it... an excellent and most wearable choice for daytime wear in hot and humid climate thanks to its citrus-floral composition (and, most probably, it would feel like a joyous ray of sun in a cold, melancholic winter day). Not tender but lovable, not fluffy but smooth… it smells "young", yet quite formal too.
The hexagonal bottle - the same of the other Flora’s - deserves a mention for it is pretty solid and elegant at the same time, with a heavy white cap and a little black ribbon running around the sprayer… tout très chic and accurately made, packaging included.

An ode to cuteness!
:)

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: I never regret buying this. Very refreshing and elegant. My co-worker complimented that I smelled so good and even asked the perfume I'm wearing.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
One more thing...
The sun filled my room this morning, and I observed how beautifully the rays of light go through the bottle of Flora and make a rainbow on the ceiling.
Shakespeare has even noticed that perfume is "a liquid prisoner pent in walls of glass". This reminds me the perfume bottles of Gucci, they are all heavy and solid... like prisons for the liquid beauties.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: This is a very fresh scent but something about it really bothers my nose. It reminds me of a candle made by Pier 1 Imports called Oceans. I think it's a artificial ocean/beach smell and it's one of the only scents I couldn't wait to wash off. Luckily the longevity is not great. I've been really disappointed in the whole Flora series so far :(.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
It's like sleeping in the meadow, in a warm, sunny summer day and counting the white clouds floating over me. Sometimes a fresh breeze passes bringing me back in my childhood - no worries, no problems to solve, no deadlines for my work...
It's the summer in a bottle, woman, freedom, sensuality, careless whispers in my ear, clean clothes, rays of sun touching my naked skin.
I adore it, especially those green notes and white flowers I get.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: Yes, it is fresh, yes, it has fruity/floral notes, which I generally like in perfumes. It seems like it would be perfect for summer but there's something piercingly cold about this fragrance that is unpleasant. This coldness is not refreshing at all, it's irritating and clingy! Perhaps the aquatic and green notes mixed together create an overload? Not sure. It's a no for me.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: Its very floral & lovely. I really love the scent & the design of the bottle itself is simple but edgy. Would highly recommend it to all woman :)

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: best parfume:)

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: At first this smelled so nice on me – seemed like I had found the unique floral I was looking for. It didn’t last. The fragrance gradually turned into something reminiscent of pool water with too much chlorine. I almost suffocated on my drive home (from one spray!) and had a really hard time washing this off of my arm. Please wear for at least 1.5 hours before you decide to buy!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: such a nice fragrance, floral airy, a little sweet, and smells a little juicy at the same time,lasts all day on me, seems to be the best of the 3 floras (perfume and toilette)by far. It also stays floral to the end nice top note,it's a little juicy, floral middle, I think that's where the green is if any would be but it's a beautiful floral and the base is still flirting with the middle, nice soft drydown, maybe a little green but far from a forest,just a hint, and it does not at all smell like the eau de parfum, no way, this is much softer and prettier through the whole olfactory experience. I think it's the peony in it that is making me really like it.It has that note of peony that is like Lancome's Miracle which is a really nice fragrance but something smells a little cheap at the end, this one is beautiful all the way through.In california I can wear it all year round b/c of the warmer climate, so it's not just a summer fragrance, so i kinda don't care about certain fragrances for certain seasons unless it's cold and rainy and then something with a nice vanilla drydown like The One D and G would be appropriate

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: I think this might be my next purchase. It is perfect for spring summer and now that I am on the hunt for a fragrance for that season...I might just have to purchase this one. It has a very fresh scent to it. I am going to sample it for a while though before I make a decision.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: I don't really like it on my skin. Is tooo sweety for me. Cannot breathe.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: This one smells delicious. One of my friends told me about this one. I was skeptical at first....after I tried it, I REALLY liked the floral smell, simply because it doesn't turn into an old musky smell and it doesn't leave people smelling like old nanna. :o) Definitely one of my favourites. It's not TOO common either...

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: Love it. Fresh, sweet, wonderful.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: Fresh and floral. I can't say there is anything bad about this fragrance, BUT i think the negative feedback from people is becuase the citricy appeal is simply too much for some consumers. I have to say it depends on the nose. Thanks for reading<3<3 autumn

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: My bf loveeeeeeeeeeeeeeee love love it on me

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: Tried this at a department store on a tester. The top notes hit me with a fresh and floral hit but not in an overpowering way. The dry down is less floral and more sandalwoody...but oh so nice. I would like to try it on my skin to see its lasting power.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
Thanks Gucci for this wonderful perfum!
I am ur big fan!!!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
I ordered Gucci Flora via a new yet unrated merchant listed on Amazon. It was being offered at a very low price and I risked ordering it. I was sent the Eau Fraiche instead. I have never worn a Floral Aquatic and hence was apprehensive.

However, to my surprise I loved the fragrance. Its young, its sophisticated and its light. Its just perfect.

Its very Gucci. It jives perfectly with the Gucci brand image. If you are a Gucci girl, or aspire to be one, this is your perfume!!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
Fresh, light, very feminine and absolutely regenarating: that's what you need in the hot
summer days!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
I have no idea why, but Gucci perfumes smell very weird on my skin. The opening of Flora was lovely, but after some time "something" in it (I can smell the same "thing" in Envy Me too) started to bother me a bit.
On my skin it smells like a meadow in late dry summer, when all of the grass and flowers are burnt from sun. Very pretty.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
Just ordered this to my collection! I actually discovered this at work because a costumer was wearing this wonderful perfume and I just couldn't help myself asking what perfume she was wearing and she told me it was a Gucci one but she didn't know the name of it but it had a bottle with six sides and it was a new one. So i figured it must be the newest Flora, the Eau fraiche one and I went and got a tester of this and i just can't get enough of it!
So when i found a great deal on it I just had to buy it.

It's very sweet and fresh, i found it to be kind of a "varm" scent still tho. It's very pretty both the scent and the bottle, a must have.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: love it perfect for summer! lighter than Gucci Florale i won both so i will just use the other in the fall... love love love

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: This smells better than the original flora. Not long lasting though.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: Absolutely love it! But what I shame, than last on my skin, not longer than 2 houres!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: it's one of the best, light, fresh and sparkling..

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
Light hearted and easy to wear! Floral + Lightness(a little bit aquatic kind of lightness)

If there wasn't the Chanel Chance Eau Fraiche, I might consider getting this. They both work at freshness and floral scents, but achieving these in somewhat different ways. Chanel Chance turns woody after a while, whereas Gucci Flora stays floral all the way. Also, the former is elegant while the latter is easy going, conforming to the imagnes of their brands and of the countries the brands are based on.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: I really don't like the original flora but i thought I'd give this a try. At first it was pure love, absolutely beautiful, fresh, yummy and I thought I found the one. But after a few minutes it became strange not in a good way, my friend thought it smelled like sweat. I am kind of disappointed ... I really loved the initial notes

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
The beginning is amazing! Fresh - as if you're at the hairdresser's - and fruity, tart in a good way. Then it developes into the "normal" Flora. Very sweet and peach/pear smelling.

If anyone finds a fragrance that stays as wonderful as the top notes in this one - please pleas please contact me!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content: Really nice and fresh at the top. The dry down is not much different from the other Floras and unfortunately it plays up really badly on my skin.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Eau Fraiche Gucci
review_content:
Tried it some time ago - though didn't find it here last time.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Diamond Gucci
review_content:
Gucci Guilty Diamond Edition is masculine citrus aromatic. It exists as an artisan version of the original Gucci Guilty, that's been blended up to be fuller-bodied and more complexified.

In the cologne facet of this fragrance, you get Gucci's signature Italian lemon. Deathly potent. Stingy, but icy. Then a sweet, seemingly unique mandarin backing it up—with what seems to be like a little bigarade (or Seville orange); and the faint presence of some seemingly indistinguishable fruits that form a ghost cocktail in the distant background. Probably white peach, fig, pomelo, and lime—if I had to guess it.

In the aromatic facet of this fragrance, you get an extremely well-blended array of textures and accents that give the fragrance its depth and appeal. The most prominent is an accord of sweet leaves, lavender, orange flower, pink pepper, and coriander.

The sweet leaves aren't distinguishable, but the body that they add to the fragrance is noticeable and very nice. The lavender is unique and has a beautiful smell to it. I'm not normally a fan of lavender, but this one has been fixed up perfectly, or is seemingly perfect itself. The orange flower seems natural, yet is sweet and perfumey; while the pink pepper and coriander seem to provide the finishing touch with a subtle abrasive texture.

I would consider this a flawless version of the original Guilty as far as a well-rounded composition is concerned.

Another thing to note is that this fragrance is super potent. I almost killed myself the first time I put it on. I had to dilute the last of my sample with a little water. It doesn't seem to carry well in the cold—but in the heat is absolutely stunning and beautiful.

Sweet, stylish—and flawlessly cut. I personally love it, and it will be a staple in my collection for as long as it's around.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Diamond Gucci
review_content: Love this review. Read it to my BF who loves the original. Thanks for taking the time to write this candid tale!
