product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Diamond Gucci
review_content:
I can understand why those who owned Gucci Envy are disappointed in this series because I am one of them. Even if you just walked by a fragrance counter once, long ago, and smelled Envy wafting through the air, you will remember the difference between its lush and intoxicating bouquet and the much weaker Gucci Guilty series. Even the name is less provocative. Guilty? Guilty of what? Aren’t there enough things and people in life that make us feel guilty? Must Gucci make us feel guilty, too? I would rather people be envious of me than I feel guilty about anything, including wearing this.

Nevertheless, I did take a sniff of Gucci Guilty Diamond and decided if I could set aside my memories of wearing Gucci Envy and the feeling I was “settling” for something less glamorous than I expected, I might be able to enjoy this fragrance mostly because it does have the most distinctive leafy, green patchouli aura of any of the Guilty series. GGD certainly has flaws.It does not project especially well and its longevity is questionable; however, if you really like lemony patchouli with a splash of neroli, as I do, then you might wear GGD when lazing about on a summer day poolside or when in bed with somebody who will be close enough to you (skin on skin close enough) to really enjoy your aroma. These I can recommend.

Maybe next time they'll start over from scratch and pick another Deadly Sin like “Lust” or better yet, “Avarice“. Yeah, how about it Gucci? Just drop all pretenses, get down with your own bad, avaricious self and call the next release “GUCCI GREEDY INTENSE”. That may fit just right!

This was the sh*t here in Europe back in the day. Absolutely loved it. The perfect autumn/winter scent, dark and spicy but yet soapy clean — and awesome staying power. Whether clubbing, hitting the shops, dating, going out for dinner — it was just so good and sexy. There was so niche market back then, a new release by a top luxury brand was a big, big thing for fragrance fans, as was the case with Egoïste some years before and with Poison and Antaeus before that. And yes, it was a huge hit. So then Gucci… pulled it? Why?! Their best scent, gone. If you can find a vintage bottle, grab it.

An easy 9 / 10.

Don't come for me,

But I wore Gucci Envy f1 to the office today - a love of mine i don't wear often.

Then half way through the day - all of a sudden a garbage fly attacked me today, I was dodging under my desk, swatting it. It landed on everything cleaning his hands like he was preparing for a feast - till I finally swatted him away somewhere else. Garbage flies don't bother me - ever.

I was skyping my coworker - her response to the fly was WAY BACK THERE??? I'm far far away from the main hall where the garbage's are. Hours later I had an epiphany and I whiff my arm - completely disassociated from my biases and likes - coming to realize that Gucci Envy in its mid to base is reminiscent of that quintessential sweet earthy spicy vanillic garbage heap smell you get when you get close to a mass garbage bin to throw your bag away (Minus the rotten smell that makes you hurl).

I am not being a troll - I love Gucci Envy - but the comparison is striking. I can't believe Gucci Envy is reminiscent of a garbage heap - yet I like it - I even searched the comments with Ctrl + F to see if anyone else noticed the comparison - no one does! Am I going crazy? Cause I swear i'm not - the fly has spoken. Even the FLY is green like Gucci Envy.

Tf is going on right now. Halp.

Heerlijk is deze, los van de nostalgie het was de kenmerkende geur van mijn vriend. Ik heb er nog een beetje van welke ik 2 keer per jaar gebruik.
Destijds gebruikten we parfums, er waren nog geen databases over.
Nu denk ik bij alle heerlijke geurtjes die in no-time uit de roulatie zijn dat ze wel ingrediënten in zich zullen hebben die schadelijk voor de gezondheid blijken te zijn.
Misschien dat ze er eenmalig mee weg komen, maar niet bij blijvende productie.
Waar ik me het meest over verwonder dat er een assortiment is binnen de designerluchtjes die wel jaren en jaren in productie blijven, welke vaak echt niet de lekkerste zijn.
-
This one is wonderful. Nostalgia aside, it was my boyfriend's signature scent. I still have a little of it, which I wear twice a year.
Back then, we used perfumes; there weren't any databases about them yet.
Now, I think of all the wonderful fragrances that are discontinued in no time that they probably contain ingredients that turn out to be harmful to health.
Maybe they can get away with it once, but not if they're kept in production.
What surprises me most is that there's a range of designer fragrances that stay in production for years and years, and they're often not the best.
Jubilee scents does an EXACT copy of the spicy batch (greener juice) of this

Absolutely love everything about this fragrance. I bought my first bottle in 2002 and it lasted me years. Exceptional performance but as others have mentioned this is more for a date night or a formal event, rather than a daily casual. I’m on the lookout for what would be my 3rd bottle and to be honest I’m not too mad at the reseller price. I’ve paid more for a Creed recently which in my opinion is inferior to Envy in many ways.
One day the world will run out of this and it’ll be like it never existed.. but I’m pretty sure if Gucci ever re-released it, they would reformulate it beyond recognition and it would probably last 30 minutes on the skin. I’m not sure which outcome is worse! Probably better to let it die on its sword rather than come back with no soul like some rancid dog from Pet Semetary.

This is a very good fragrance. Ginger, cardamom, sandalwood, anise. It's a spicy, creamy, sweet fragrance. The anise in the dry down is faint but it balances everything out so well.

The ingredients are high quality. I wouldn't have expected the quality to be this high for a designer fragrance.

This is more of a dating fragrance than something to wear to work or an everyday fragrance. The ginger makes it unique. There's nothing quite like it.

A rich EDP concentration of spicy ginger, alluring florals, spiritual incense, and a sweet ambery warmth (no gourmand sweetness). No distinguishable fruits, no animalics, no masculine notes like tobacco nor leather persay, but also no feminine notes neither.

A hybrid blend & unique palette of green notes (not resembling traditional 60s, 70s, and 80s greens) simmering on low in a boiling pot making everything incredibly warm with a light steam.

People that hate on this truly astonish me. There is NOTHING like this in perfumery - its such a sweet spot of many influences modestly delivering what childish generations don't have time for nowadays; expensive modest regal elegance with conservative allure.

This doesn't ask you to smash the YouTube like button - instead you beg this to post a video.

Masterpiece.

Ah! The High-school sweet years... had countless bottles of this magnificent juice. Signature and memories maker!
People knew I was there and people befriend me easily based on this.

Alongside PH 1, 2 ... this is easily a 10/10 in perfumery and honestly... I MISS THIS with a passion!

Gucci, listen to us and give us Envy again, make it dense and we will buy it!
Used to wear this in my Early Twenties in the Early 2000's, before heading to the various Bars and Nightclubs in my Home City. Remember it being Fantastic. Gucci, please bring this back!

All the great Gucci fragrances during Tom Ford's reign have been discontinued. I wonder if there is something to that. Gucci haven't come close to those great scents ever since. This one should never have been discontinued.
Wearing this today and it’s reminding me why this was my signature scent for years. So well blended, woody, spicy, and masculine. From when there was no such thing as a unisex fragrance

Nostalgia more than anything for me.This was my first back in the early 00's along with the black plastic aftershave. Thinking back on it , it wasn't age appropriate for a 12 year old... pretty woodsy. Asked a girl out for the first time with this on.

Envy For Men is smooth and seductive, both spicy and creamy. It's more suitable in a romantic setting than a formal business setting. Despite the long list of notes, it doesn't smell particularly complex - it's basically intense spices and wood smoothed out by warm amber and tobacco.

I've always loved this scent, and I still have my bottle that I bought over 20 years ago. However, it is far from being one of the greatest scents ever made or a perfect masterpiece. I think people are gushing over it now simply because it's been discontinued for about 15 years and is very hard to find. I remember back when it was issued in the late 90s, and although people liked it, I don't remember people gushing over it like they do now.

This intoxicating scent evokes the sharp allure of wealth and ambition, capturing the essence of money and greed. Imagine Gordon Gekko striding through the bustling streets of Wall Street in the film, exuding an aura of confidence and power. It transports you to the dynamic world of Manhattan's high finance in the vibrant 1980s, where every moment is charged with the excitement of opportunity and risk. The fragrance envelops you like a tailored suit, embodying the spirit of ambition and the relentless pursuit of success in a time when fortune favored the bold.

Contains "FD&C Yellow Nº 10," "FD&C Green Nº 3," "FD&C Red Nº 33," -- this stuff is terrible for your lungs, skin, nervous system, and endocrine system.

Choosing to smell sexy shouldn't be a hazardous decision.
the top and middle phase make this perfume interesting. the end just smells like air freshener in a shoe store. the store is called ccc
Too good, never understood why it wasn't released again

I always found this was a weird one - weird incense note in the first blast and then goes kind of pickled.
I find Gucci rush pour homme and envy very similar like could have been an eau de fraiche version of it and probably still would have done well. A very a very pickled sandalwood overall. I honestly believe this was discontinued due to its time and place - I think they did well for a certain period and realised you either die the hero or live long enough to see your self become the villain. If this was still about and worth £50 no one would be buying it today, it went with the late 90s and early 2000s life, fashion and style which is just so far in the past I don’t think it can be relived.
@rmanukya i find that Nasomatto Pardon gives the same feeling and same flavor. It's my replacement thing at least 😉

The fragrance is, unfortunately, no longer offered or produced (because what is good cannot last forever, and especially according to the current Gucci philosophy), which is a pity, because it is an example of one of the best-cut men's fragrances in the history of perfumery... I admit that I approached it many times to finally understand it, appreciate it and, as a result, love it....

My first contact with Envy was at the urging of “fellow misery” from a friendly forum (greetings Gentlemen and Ladies) 😉.
Since the fragrance is hard to come by and to buy basically only in online stores and on the few auctions on alledrogo, by happy coincidence I spotted it one day on the shelf at the local drugstore Superfarm (typo intended and intentional 8) )....

I will immediately interject that I do not recommend sniffing perfumes, let alone making a decision to consciously purchase anything other than the fragrances you know very well in this type of establishment, because the conditions for sniffing in this type of establishment are far from favorable....
Firstly, the ubiquitous and subtle in action like the Red Army security guards... poking a suspicious look at my back because, in their view, I take too long to take an interest in the contents of the rack, instead of promptly throwing some Lacoste into the basket and crawling towards the checkout....

Secondly, in this type of place there is air conditioning and artificially forced air movement in a rather strong way, so most of the sniffed smell is caught by the ventilation system before it manages to reach my nostril by gravity....

Thirdly, there are various people walking around all the time, shrouded more or less intensively in their own fragrances, and every now and then they spray something profusely in the blotters or on themselves... in addition, there is a cacophony of fragrances coming out of, as it were, “not quite airtight” atomizers of dozens of testers on the shelves....

It is impossible to sniff in such conditions, it absolutely will not be authoritative, so for anyone who wants to get to know this fragrance as well as any other, I recommend getting a sample and testing the scent quietly at home... I assure you that the reception will be surprisingly different than in combat conditions....
My surprise during the re-test (lovely thanks to Lichu for the sizable decant) in home conditions was overwhelming... the fragrance smelled completely different, fuller, more willing to share its shape and every now and then revealed new previously unknown fragments of the composition.... and there is much to contemplate....

Envy is complex, multifaceted and treacherous as hell... it can surprise as much as an overprotective mom popping into a teenager's room every now and then under any pretense, and with a view to preserving her son's virginity and purity in dealing with women 8)

The composition of Envy is a masterpiece in terms of composition and release of the various elements of the composition... it can rapidly change its face in extremes depending on the conditions, time of day, humidity and ambient temperature... what on the surface seems chimerical and capricious... after getting to know it more closely begins to appreciate over time... Envy has as many faces as users and on each it will play in concert, but somewhat differently.... this endearing play of aniseed, which like a green absinthe fairy circles and moves the senses, combines with a kind of vegetable scent of spices and plants to create a multifaceted somewhat culinary note....

It is a phenomenal sensation that surprises both the wearer and his surroundings... the fragrance is not the least bit forward or unbearable... the projection is relatively lazy and some time passes before it begins to envelop our surroundings with its tentacles, but it is able to move the senses despite the apparent sleepiness of the composition....

I love the subtle aniseed note, which in Envy is extremely balanced and rid of the aggressive sharpness known even from Opium YSL....
It is calm, somewhat idyllic, my nerves are gently soothed by the lazily dragging streaks of once aniseed, once vegetable notes, up to the sweet, subdued, yet remarkably masculine base of the fragrance....
The whole is enclosed in a classic rectangular, one-sided flattened flacon made of thick glass, which is topped by a slightly oversized black plastic stopper reminiscent of the one in the Gucci PH/PH II series, but obscuring almost the entire contents of the flacon... The color of the liquid in the form of an intense vivid green is somewhat at odds, although it partly alludes to the composition and arrangement of the composition....
Head: anise, coriander, cardamom, iris, nutmeg
Heart: musk, opoponax, incense
Base: cedarwood, sandalwood, vanilla, ambergris, vetiver
Prada amber pour homme 2006 + Prada amber intense 2011 + green.
@rmanukya Try Envy of Fomo by FOMO
I purchased a vintage bottle but the top notes which made the original so lively and complex were ruined. Can anyone recommend something similar that's widely available?
masterpiece

Eclat 642 (because it doesn't have its own page): Creamy, spiced sandalwood ginger tea. Delicious and solid quality for a clone.

Decent presentation for a clone brand, minimalist but heavy glass bottle, magnetic cap. I dislike the 55ml size, would have preferred more JUICE. I like the monster performance, this definitely has longer longevity than my memory of Envy's longevity. Much like the OG, this for me is strictly a winter only frag, I can't see myself using this anytime outside of that season. Definitely not one to overspray, can get cloying extremely easily, this EDP concentration would suffocate people in Spring/Summer. I'm an expat in Southeast Asia (extreme humidity most of the year), and I honestly don't even know when I'm actually going to be able to use this properly...

I haven't smelled Gucci Envy in 12 years or so, but this definitely shares the same overall DNA as Envy. Obviously, nothing is as good as the real deal, but to echo the other positive comments below, Eclat 642 gets my tick of approval as a solid quality and nearly identical alternative.

As for Gucci Envy itself, I mean, what more can be said? The fact that utter crud like Gucci Gucci Pour Homme (2008) is still in production and greats like Gucci Envy, Gucci Pour Homme (2003), and Gucci Pour Homme II (2007) were discontinued says it all...

Envy, alongside Prada Amber Pour Homme Intense, is Daniela Andrier's finest moment.

Edit: @Antoshka2 is most likely correct about the clone brands copying older Envy bottles with diluted scent notes after all these years. Eclat 642 - After testing this more, it definitely has less incense than Envy, is much more mandarin/orange forward, and has slightly less ginger compared to Envy. It is still an extremely great buy if you're not looking to spend $$$ on a grey market Envy bottle. Carven Homme is a very solid fragrance by it's own right but the cinnamon in that really sets it apart from Envy (no cinnamon) so in my opinion it's not a worthy replacement for Envy. Eclat 642 is much closer.

Gucci Envy: 10/10

Eclat 642: 8.5/10

It's utter insanity that both Gucci Envy and YSL Rive Gauche Pour Homme have been allowed to be discontinued for so long...

Amazing, absolutely amazing. I didnt like it one bit after blind buying it and thought it had a bitter play dough-y smell to it but i tested again and i fell inloveee the cardamom, lavender, cedarwood and vetiver are the most noticeable and its so sexy.
No fragrance is bad, it just deserves a second chance

This is a heavy ginger scent and it smells like some type of tea. It is not what I was expecting based off the reviews...

It is a nice scent, but I'm not sure why it's so highly sought after... and it reminds me of something I've encountered before.



Side notes:

I fell for the hype of this particular fragrance and bought a 50ML for an outrageous price. Don't do what I did, find yourself a sample before purchasing this fragrance.

I just put three sprays under my chin, on my chest and my shoulders and I'm sitting here in a cloud and this is just simply,..... the best a man can get ! ,what's that old saying? Lol
If you could only pick one fragrance for the rest of your life this is the one you pick it doesn't get any better than this.
This is quite simply the best barber shop fougeue ever created.

Spicy ginger and sweet incense and sandalwood. Very strong projection, so it's the best for winter. Too bad I don't have the aura for wearing this (as a mid-20s woman), and my parents were using this as their room spray! So I had to pass it to someone else.
Its the most perfect cardamom mandarin incense i ever experienced. The bottle speak for itself, "FOR MEN". For 40> mens.

I came across this today while visiting a friend. I don't have much to add to the other reviews except to say that it occurred to me that an updated version of this vibe can be found in the likes of Givenchy Gentleman Boiseé or the L'Homme Ideal series. Just a thought!

This is the first scent I can remember being absolutely amazed by but feeling somehow under-qualified to wear. Like, perhaps I'd need to dye my hair darker to be able to pull this one off. Gucci Envy for me was aspirational. I wanted to become the person who could wear it. I was only twenty-two-or-three years of age, and when I sprayed this on I felt impressive as fuck but also maybe like a bit of an imposter. Looking back I think that's because the first time I wore it in public was at my job at a call center. This definitely is not a cubicle-friendly scent. Not unless you're trying to get your co-workers all unnecessarily twitterpated. Which I was not. There's nothing 'cool' about this. No icebergs or fighter jets or whatever. This is super-warm ginger-sandal-cream. Nowhere to run. Makes the air in the immediate vicinity thicker. Changes the latitude. Makes everyone's blood pump up a notch whether they like it or not.
Not worth it for the price ,too expensive .. just the hype

I do miss this. It reminds me of my 20s. I bought both a 20 year old bottle for an extortionate price and a dupe. Neither smells like it did back in the day. I think the dupe people must actually be copying the old bottles with long faded top notes. Sadly this doesn’t exist anymore. Even if you buy a genuine unopened bottle it’s over 20 years old. The fragrance is lost to time now. The dupes can’t even get a reference point to copy. A real shame really.

A true masterpiece from the past 🏆 Envy for men was released when Tom Ford was the Boss at Gucci ❤️ carven pour homme is the twin brother of Envy for men ❤️ sadly both are discontinued 👎👎 go and ask why? Nonsense marketing policy perhaps!

The Prelude: Creamy Ginger

Picture this: a sun-kissed ginger root, freshly unearthed from the moist earth. Its skin, golden and warm, yields to the blade, releasing a creamy nectar—an elixir of fire and silk. Gucci Envy opens with this very essence, a spicy crescendo that flirts with your senses. It’s as if the ginger itself leans in, whispers, “Come closer, my dear. Let me weave my spell.”

The Heartbeat: Sandalwood’s Sigh

And then, like a clandestine lover, sandalwood emerges. Its woody notes wrap around you, a velvet cloak of ancient wisdom. Close your eyes, and you’ll feel the sun-drenched forests of Mysore, where sandalwood trees stand sentinel. Their fragrant breath mingles with your skin, leaving an indelible mark—a promise of eternity. Gucci Envy’s heart beats to this rhythm, a slow, hypnotic pulse that draws you deeper.

The Finale: Whispers of Longing

As the hours wane, Envy unfurls its final act. Incense curls like smoke from forgotten altars, vanilla caresses like a lover’s kiss, and amber glows like embers in the night. Tobacco and leather linger, a secret shared between kindred souls. It’s a symphony of longing, a whispered confession in the language of scent.

The Verdict: A Stolen Kiss

Gucci Envy for Men is not for the faint of heart. It’s for the midnight wanderers, the poets who pen verses on skin, and the rebels who dare to chase desire. Wear it when the moon hangs low, when the world sleeps, and let it weave its magic. For in its creamy ginger and sandalwood embrace, you’ll find a stolen kiss—a memory that lingers long after the night has surrendered to dawn.

Note: Gucci Envy for Men is a discontinued gem, elusive as a shooting star. Seek it in the hidden corners of vintage boutiques or the whispers of perfumistas. But when you find it, hold it close. For in its allure lies the promise of forbidden dreams.

I have just recently moved to Brisbane Australia from NZ. I was lucky enough to pick a 50ml bottle of this on eBay for $220 when I first got here. Yesterday I was in the chemist just below the apartments where I live, and I couldn't believe my eyes, They were selling a 50ml tester bottle of Envy for $60. That's crazy considering how long ago it was discontinued ha ha I love this scent. It smells simple and elegant. Simple as in how well it's been created and how perfectly the notes blend together.

I have an unopened bottle left of this magnificent unique fragrance. Masculine, suave, smooth. It’s very unfortunate that it has been discontinued. I bought my first bottle in the early 2000s. It brings back many good memories of my young adulthood. I can’t think of another men’s fragrance that resembles this one.
Great for dates or going out. If you want to experience this without the steep price point, get the Oil Perfumery inspiration, its pretty spot on.

#590 in my "Tour de Fragrance"

Found an old half-used bottle, scent's getting faded, but still familiar enough to bring back memories. 26 years ago was an exhausting but wild time in my life and from '98 to '06 this green juice traveled the world with me the equivalent of over 120 circumnavigations just in air travel alone. Many times I would arrive in a foreign country and go straight into a meeting with no time to go to a hotel room and prep, and go straight back to the airport to depart for another overseas destination. The life of a Yankee trader. This fragrance did yeoman's duty keeping me from smelling like whatever they served for breakfast on the plane that morning, or worse. Still enough scent left in this old bottle to recognize and wax nostalgic, but too faded to wear except for my own daydreaming.

There are many scents from that era where the perfumer threw in the kitchen sink as we say, putting in a little of all the good stuff in an attempt to satisfy every taste. You can read the notes for yourself, so I won't repeat them here. My fragrance collection was small and very consumer mainstream in those days. But Envy was my travel buddy in a spray bottle. Every note on the scale playing, but softly, like an orchestra playing pianissimo, though honestly I always wanted Gucci to pump up the volume on the scent, that I enjoyed but always seemed weak stuff to me, though better than many others (I grew up in the age of Brut and Jade East, so what else would you expect?). Envy got compliments from the ladies pretty regularly, or at least that's how the conversations started.

Curse Gucci for discontinuing the scent instead of keeping it alive in an EDP version. Gucci by Gucci is by a pale shadow, a wraith drifting by an open window. But I'm a guy who still appreciates Bowling Green, Giorgio, Original and Red, Cacharel, Bogart Pour Homme, Paco Rabanne Pour Homme, Oscar Pour Lui, scents whose day is admittedly done, but still project masculinity to me, as does Envy. Would I pay an eBay scalper a few hundred for Envy? Oh hell no! You can get the same nostalgic feel from any of the aforementioned scents, all still in production for under $30, and Bogart by Jacques Bogart is closer than any of those to Envy. But if Gucci brought Envy back as an EDP or Parfum, I'd go as high as $120 for it, no hesitation, and I feel the same about Gucci Nobile

@AndyWarholsFavoriteWig It's "lauded". This fragrance is lauded. I bought this for the nostalgia.

It used to be my party fragrance years and years ago, would wear it in sweaty Berlin techno clubs, Gabba raves in Hackney and crisp Japanese techno events.

The scent is still as beautiful and serene as it was back then, although my memories from back then are somewhat blurred (go figure..). Timeless and a true masterpiece. I also remember wearing Gucci Rush for men - and the first edition of Envy when it was first released.

Gucci Envy has that clean feel of the mid to late 90s minimalism...think Jil Sander, Helmuth Lang and polished concrete flooring amongst bare white walls.

This is a masterpiece. To me it smells like a Gothic but crisp mixture of spicy ginger and creamy sandalwood, but with something green in the background, and this green does not necessarily remind me of nature, but of church; hinting at incense but not 100 per cent there.

I found this too serious and for adults when it was released, but mesmerising as well. As I was in my late teens, I did not feel comfortable wearing it, but from the very first moment I knew this was going to make a big impact for a very long time, as it has.

Envy for Men is something unique, distinguished, really creative, a bit challenging to wear at times maybe (it wears you unless you dress formally and look a certain way) but oustanding. Like a work of art. The problem with such pieces is that sometimes they leave you in awe, and you can only look or smell in admiration, from a distance, or envy them but not be part of them, somehow. It took me time to feel comfortable wearing it, but now with age (despite the cliché) I do like to wear it finally...

I will never understand why it was discontinued, and I also find it hard to understand why other companies (Zara, I am looking at you) do not release some kind of dupe, even if it is updated or a bit fresher or a bit less strong. It would certainly sell out.

From the clones that keep on being mentioned to replace this, none do fully replace it. Floris Santal lacks punch and ginger; Vintage Carven Homme is too strong on the vanilla; and Tabac Man Fire Power smells like a pale reminder of Envy's last phase. The three of them do have some nice similarities, but that's about it.

Re-releasing Envy for Men these days would make such a statement...

Anything to secure the Gucci Envy name because someone actually not liking this fragrance is one of the most incomprehensible things I've ever heard. Right up there with someone saying they don't like tacos or saying they'd rather work in the office than from home.

My sense of smell is not fully back after covid. This has moderate projection, so I'm not getting all the fullness of what it is.
It is wonderfully blended. I have mostly niche fragrances. This smells like a niche quality frag. Like a vintage Guerlain, Derby or Lupin.
It is more youthful than those, more playfully like a Creed Aventus.
It's very smooth with the amber base. I get a great sandalwood and mahogany.
The greeness is coming from cardomom and carnation. But the cardomom and ginger do not stand out prominently, but everything is well blended.
From the open to mid, it's somewhat fresh, green spicy. From the mid to dry down it's creamy smooth, warm spicy.
I can understand why people say it's one of the best designer fragrances ever.
There is nothing cheep smelling like many designer frags today. M-7 Fresh was a great YSL fragrance that had ginger and mandarin orange and Oud. When Tom Ford moved from Gucci to YSL.
Vintage bottles of M-7 Fresh can be had for 1/2 the price of this Envy. I would rate it as good a designer classic.
But Envy is a complex great all arounder, any season any occasion.

Rating: 10/10

Now would I pay over $200 for this? No. Would I pay over $100 for this? No. I paid $25 for my 3 ml sample and I’m fine with that, it will last me many years unless I fall in love and want to wear it more. It is nice, but I’ve smelled nicer fragrances. This is an overall warm woody scent. The scent opens up surprisingly fresh; not "fruity and sparkly" freshness, but more "warm and menthol-like" freshness from aromatics such as ginger, lavender, cardamon, orange, and sandalwood. The scent becomes more warm and aromatic sweet with the addition of amber and tobacco. The projection and longevity are moderate. It is a nice, warm, and complex scent that is characteristic of 80s-90s designer fragrances (vs more simple/linear designer scents of the 2010s). I imagine classy smokers from 80s-90s (a young businessman in a dark brown suit, or a chic artist in a black turtleneck) sporting scents like this. It is not a safe scent in that it cannot be worn at any occasion, but definitely easy to wear scent in spite of its complexity.

I can understand why some enjoy it, and why some have strong, nostalgic memories of it. If you remove the nostalgia/history from it, it is just that: a nice designer scent. This is quite a synthetic scent that gives me a headache, which also is quite characteristic of 90s designer fragrances, and behaves just any other fragrance in the $60-100/100mL range. For frag-heads searching for thought-provoking and unique fragrances, there are plenty of similarly complex niche scents with higher quality ingredients for similar (or less) than what the market is currently asking for.

Gucci Envy is good. Damn good, in fact. But I don’t think it’s good enough to justify a niche price tag.

I have no nostalgic connection to this fragrance whatsoever. I’ve never had the pleasure of getting my nose on this fragrance until recently, and as such, I feel like an outsider looking in here. Everywhere I look, Envy receives praise that would make even modern giants such as Sauvage or Aventus turn green with, well, envy. And make no mistake; this fragrance is certainly deserving of a lot of it.

It’s a woodsy, spicy, dare I say oriental fragrance that has the most invigorating pop of ginger at the top. The incense still comes out and is one of the high points of the entire experience. In the base and the heart, the woods come together very sharply. The closest contemporary comparison I can think of is Givenchy Gentleman Boise. Despite its age, it still smells fantastic, though I don’t doubt age has gotten to this fragrance, even if only slightly.

If we’re talking demographics, I’d consider this to be a younger man’s fragrance. If you’re in your early to mid-20s, right up into your 30s, I think this would be right at home on your skin. And let me tell you, wearing Envy in 2022 is a statement. Not just because you need to fork out the scratch to afford the damn stuff, but because nothing else in the game smells quite like this. Clones exist, and some of Envy’s contemporary competitors (Floris Santal specifically) are still around; and while they take a similar scent profile and perform admirably, they still don’t quite reach the lofty heights that Envy perches itself upon.

Projection and longevity are nothing special. I’d say it tends to follow typical EDT standards, and projects moderately (bordering on intimately) for about 3-4 hours, before settling into a skin scent for another 2-3 hours. My particular bottle is from 2006, so I’m not going to judge a 14 year old fragrance too harshly for not projecting and performing like a beast.

Would I recommend a purchase of Envy to someone who doesn’t have a nostalgic connection to it? It depends. If you like a sharp ginger note, this will be a fantastic fragrance for you - period. It’s beautifully blended and is as unique as they come. However, I’d recommend marking this one down as a sample before you buy, unless you’re a committed collector.

Finally, I figure we should address the elephant in the room - the inflated pricing for this scent. Is it worth the astronomical prices being demanded on eBay? No. But also… yes? Let me explain. I believe Envy still, more than a decade after its discontinuation, competes with the very best Tom Ford has to offer. TF’s private blend will run you between $150-250 for 50ml, depending on the fragrance. If you can find a 50ml bottle of Envy for around that price, I’d consider it worthwhile. If you find a 100ml bottle of Envy in that range, I’d consider it an absolute steal. However, for this price to be AT ALL justified, it must be worn and enjoyed down to the last spray; not savoured and babied for another 20 years. Like the decade Envy came from, this fragrance won’t last forever. To remember it as an olfactory zeitgeist is only going to make the discontinuation of this fragrance harder to stomach as the years roll on.

Envy is a lamentable loss, but it had a good run. I like seeing that it still has a dedicated fanbase. It is truly, truly excellent and holds up well to this day. I’d consider it a must try for almost any fragrance collector, but not necessarily a must own.

I’d recommend giving JordanFromNZ’s (below) YouTube review a watch, he approaches it from a similarly non sentimental angle.

EDIT: For those of you interested, Covet by Dua is a decent enough approximation, but not a perfect clone. It's much sharper and harsher than Envy is, and far louder. For those of you who have used Envy in the past and are looking to relive the experience for a price that's actually affordable, it may scratch that itch. But for those looking to experience Envy for the first time, I wouldn't recommend Covet.
You can try Cavalli Paradise Found, of course it's not the same, but it has some similarities.

Ok, although i rarely visit this site, i just created an account to help others like myself to find a suitable alternative to this masterpiece. Like many others, this was my all-time-favorite back in the 90's - '00's so a lot of good memories are associated with this fragrance. Ever since it was discontinued (still baffles me as well) i started buying bottles on ebay and searching for alternatives. I tried a lot of these (Carven Homme, Floris Santal, Tabac Firepowrer, Vetyver l'occitante but none of them ever came close to the warmth, depth, classiness & mystery of the real deal until......
i found this VERY good & affordable alternative: Eclat N642, initially there's a notcieable difference between the two (yet not unpleasant) but on the dry down it's actually very, very similar & the longevity is better than the original. I still have 1,5 bottles of the original so i have done side-by-side tests. I only wear the original on special occasions and my wife asking me why i all-of-a-sudden started wearing Envy again on a daily basis was the ultimate compliment for this alternative in my POV Prize-wise it's also a great deal as well and they ship international (i live in Holland, eclat is german). I am by no means associated with Eclat in any shape or form. Just want to help out others who like me, simply can't live without this fragrance nor can't afford to wear it on a daily basis. Try it out! Am sure you won't be dissapointed.

The leather note is clearly discernable, so the accord stack on this page should have a Leather accord listed. Really cool bottle design too. This is in my favorites collection. Too bad its discontinued. I have about 7ml left in a 15ml bottle, but I wear Dua's very good clone called Covet. Disagree with @Karim_Ezzat above on Dua Covet. Covet does indeed smell like a stronger Envy, but you do have to tolerate Dua's amped up performance and the enhancers they use as I can see that might effect quality. I also have the Envy clone by Scentual Obsessions called "Role Model". It is very good and doesn't suffer the distortion of the strong performance enhancer in the Dua. I also have Floris Eau de Santal, which is very similar - it opens very similar but veers more a bit more green in the drydown, essentially just the opposite of @Karim_Ezzat's opinion above. And its performance is worse. And, laughably, I have to say Gucci Envy for Men smells NOTHING like Chanel Egoiste. Lol. Nor is it anything, and I mean anything, like Creed Tabarome. I have all of these fragrances. I mentioned that because someone actually invoked these as a comparison.
UPDATE: I just found a cheapie clone of Envy for Men called Enthral by EAD. It was brought to my attention by a YouTube reviewer who said it was a dead ringer for Envy for Men. Haven't yet worn it but it smells just like Envy for Men on test blotter. Lol, on the back of the box it says "EAD - European American Designs and Enthral is not associated in any way with Envy which is a registered trademark of Gucci". What is that, a legal way to say its an Envy clone by not saying it?

The Legendary Gucci Envy for men
A very solid fragrance with excellent performance!
Unfortunately discontinued like many other gems.

I remember buying this scent as a kid at a Ross in early 2000's. I returned it because it smelled like old man. lol I'm surprised they took it back so I got my money back. I wish I can smell it now to see if I made a mistake.... Seems to have many positive reviews.

Like a gift from somebody's god(s), this elixir fills me to the brim with happiness and emotional well being. Divine, gorgeous, ambrosia...dare I say, heavenly. Almost too celestial for comment. I'll leave it at sublime.

Really lovely ginger incense scent. But one that I’ve bought and sold twice. I love the smell. I just don’t know if I want to smell like it myself. I’ve realised I gravitate away from scents that smell of one or two notes predominantly (I know there are tons more in this but I get more of the two), in favour of scents that are blended so well it’s harder to pick out one or two notes. Also this isn’t one I grew up with so there’s no tie to the fragrance. It is a beauty though. Ginger, spicy almost barbershop incense. If you can find it for a decent price and you’re older and had it years ago I’d say go for it. For me, my decant is enough to last years

For me, the absolute perfect fragrance. I have nothing bad to say about this. Wore this throughout the 2000s and still have a few ml left in a bottle from 2008. Tried it again the other day and it's not nostalgia, it's still King. I purchased Carven Homme and Floris Santal as replacements after it's discontinuation and whilst I found them to be similar and great in their own right, neither really hit the mark as a permanent replacement. My all time favorite.

I had this scent since 2001. A few days back I decided to empty this bottle because I never use this scent since 5 to 6 years. I had nearly 60ml juice left.. So I sprayed here n there and empty this bottle n throw it in trash.. After few days I checked ebay and hit my head on wall.. How costly it is in these days.. And I sprayed it here n there so carelessly... 😩😩😩😩

Nursed my bottle til the fumes ran out. Could be the GOAT, this fragrance is truly alive, I think its the ginger. The clones I've tried come off creamier, Floris Santal is fleeting. Just not the same. Bring it back, pleeeease!
5/5

Gucci Envy
A modern classic. Very wearable spicy, fresh, musky.
Very crisp, professional, zesty. Great memories, during my university days in city of Melbourne, for some reason reminds of me rainy, grey days in an urban modern metropolis. Very sophisticated.
Tom Ford at his most stylish creative best.
Sadly discontinued.

I have an Envy bottle first formulation from 2000 (first reformulation was in 2004, second in 2008 then discontinued in 2011). If you like this dna you can get same kind of vibe with TF Fougère D'Argent and PDM Habdan drydowns but...last night I tried Memo Paris Oriental Leather and i found some obvious similarities to Envy!!!😳🤔😱

This is one is super unique....the way they blended the leather and the tobacco is genuinely amazing ! I have got 3 bottles since it’s first released and I am sorry to disappoint anyone but the silage on this one doesn’t perform amazing....it is sad being so expensive that it’s mostly like a victoria secret splash with - of course - more longevity. Overall a good scent but not for the prices that are in the market.

So I’ve been introduced through decant. After the second wear, I moved it from like to love. Woody but old school. It is a weird mix usually those old school scents come across as sharp barbershop. But this is smooth and woody. Probably a very different take at the time. It’s still very unique and nice. I just wish I could have tried this in its prime. Do I recommend? Well with the price hikes for discontinued I’d say not. While a nice subtle cedar, there does almost seem a small amount of cypress but not listed. It comes across as almost a smooth cypress cedar scent. But most of the other notes I have a hard time identifying. It would be nice for this scent to be brought back, but for $200 plus a bottle... envy rip.
23 years of journey with you finally end today. I'll miss you so much.. RIP. 😩😭

I actually threw out a 3/4 full large bottle of this 5 years ago that I had got a bit bored of many years earlier. It was just gathering dust. This was before I got into collecting fragrances. I remember wearing it every day to work etc and I always thought it was a bit over the top and sickly. On reflection I think it was just too heavy a scent for the hot tropical climate I lived in at the time. I think I replaced it with something fresher and less spicy.

Absolutely makes me feel sick when I see what it’s going for on ebay now!! It certainly was like nothing else I had smelt at the time, and the only modern scent I have come across that somewhat reminds me of it is Cactus Azul by niche house Fueguia 1833 (which I love, ironically). So was Gucci Envy unique? I think so yes, but does it deserve this cult like status? No, I don’t recall it being that particularly special. Maybe I would have appreciated it more living in a much colder climate like Melbourne where I live these days.

This is quite a nice spicy winter or night time fragrance thats still has a cult like following a ex got me a bottle in 98 which is still half full
discontinued now.
Perfume Parlour do a good clone i hear at £14
@MichelMontaigne For real?! Is that some deep insider information? Where did you hear that?

One of my all time favorite fragrances that is sadly long discontinued and very, very overpriced as a result. It's warmth is just something that I wish I could be smelling all of the time, but because of its price I can't afford to wear this one anywhere near as frequently as I'd like.

We have this fresh sort of opening, but the top notes are nearly instantly overpowered by the rich, spicy, ambery, sexy base notes and depending on which batch you got this may also contain a massive dose of incense which I absolutely adore. The first formulation also has this smokey woody note that reminds me of a few other designer fragrances I own a little bit: Bentley for Men Intense and Absolute, and YSL M7 Oud Absolu. Another key note here is the very intense and creamy sandalwood note, which I don't think this fragrance gets enough love for having such a great sandalwood. For a designer release, I believe this was pretty ambitious which makes sense since Tom Ford was the head of creative at the time.

Overall, this is probably my all time favorite fragrance, I wish I could use it more. Dua's Covet is absolutely outstanding and really nails the sandalwood aspect but misses some of the finer details. Overall, I would say it's about 90% similar to the less dark batches of Envy where the incense was toned down. I'll continue to use that and only bust out the real thing for special occasions until Gucci realizes their mistake and brings back this beautiful fragrance, hopefully along with Gucci Rush, Gucci Nobile, and Gucci Pour Homme I and II.

Why is this simply the BEST! why can no one recreate it!
There is nothing like the original, unless you've smelled it, experienced it,.....there is nothing I can say to properly convey the greatness of Tom's creation.

beware of ebay sellers . one guy was selling a whole bunch of the 1.7oz bottles all fake . smelled like nothing basically fake sticker on bottom of bottle and letters gucci envy for men fall right off when the bottle gets wet. of course ebay being ebay deleted the negative feedback .

I love this scent in the fall. Spicy ginger is king for the cooler weather.

I bought over a few dozen opened bottles of this, they're very common to find on the 2nd hand market here in Japan. I see a few come up for sale everyday. It pains me to see so many in here wishing they could ever find it at all. I've been collecting them over the past year, and I'll be selling them off over the next few years.

It was criminal for Gucci to discontinue this scent. And part of me doesn't want them to bring it back either - because we all know it would never match up to the original formulation.

The warm rich sweet spiciness of this scent conjures up memories of a decadent relationship that I had a with a 35+ man in the early 2000s. The way it would develop on his skin, and how his body heat would make it melt onto mine. This juice found its way all over us, our bed linen, furniture and clothes. Longevity was out of this world.

Sexy. An utter classic.

Finally got my nose on it. This is a pretty classic masculine scent. I like it a lot, though I do find this one to be for the older gents - I don't really like capping fragrances to certain age groups because anyone should wear whatever they want, though when I smell this I picture gents 35+ rocking this one.

I do agree with some of the folks here saying this one is dated. It most certainly is, but it's a good'un!

Greatest fragrance in history. Nuff said.

Bring it back please Gucci.

P.S. And Gucci Rush. for men of course.

Titans. Legends. Gods of mens perfumery.

How can you describe Gucci envy? Bogart would use it if he lived. This is one of the 5 best fragrances ever. Sexy opening. You get all the notes. Ginger, lavender, rose, pepper, vanilla, incense for harmony too. Gentleman of my envy collection 5/5

Excellent fragrance! I was weary of ginger frags before, but this is great. It's blended very well, hard to pick out specific notes. A great signature scent type of perfume; easy to wear. Slightly sweet, masculine but not macho or old-school.

Ginger, tobacco, incense and mahogany is what makes this a stunning masterpiece. Refined and absolutely top notch quality compared to today's designer market. Simply puts most niche offerings to shame, so don't be afraid to pull the trigger if you can find a bottle for a reasonable price. Fans of the ginger and incense concatenation used here should check out Nobile 1942 Infinito. An absolutely amazing scent that shares the same philosophy Envy follows, but with a much more traditional approach as far as fougere's go.

One of the best incense I have ever felt. It has a seductive, dark and spicy sweetness that instantly captivated me.

Opens with notes of lavender and a peppery orange, enriched with cardamom. In a few minutes the heart begins to emerge... the sweetness becomes more evident with the carnation, jasmine and the rose, creating a spicy floral accord. But the best is yet to come.

The dry down is incredible. Smooth and warm, slightly spicy and sharp at the same time. Ginger, incense, amber, tobacco and vanilla with a woody background (rich in sandalwood, mahogany and patchouli) create an acrid/sweet/smoky accord.

It's heady but at the same time soft, comforting and exciting... it's really hypnotic. Longevity and sillage are medium and require mild temperatures. It's elegant, but not formal.

A wonderful (and discontinued) creation by Daniela Andrier, once again blessed by the hands of Tom Ford, during his time at Gucci.

My favorite male fragrance.
Confidence booster and women magnet. So unique and unforgettable. It remainds me of late 90s.

Timeless classic fragrance!
I love Gucci pour homme and never tried or smelled envy until now, so have to say it is equally great and unique as GPH.
I found it at local parfumerie, perfectly preserved and full.
PM me if interested.
Cheers

Very dense and complex aroma: rare perfumes of so many notes announced REALLY make it possible to feel almost all of them distinctly (until today I have only experienced about 4 frags like this, including this one). The initial explosion of Gucci Envy already announces this possibility: extremely rich (and naturally confused), where all those notes from the grid (I said them all in a sincere way, they're virtually all there) can be felt going back and forth within smell, with a very high green tone on top of the general madness.

At dry-down, the game ends and it all gets more defined, opening with the following chords:
1) in greater volume it becomes a bitter and incensed green, strongly seasoned (black pepper and ginger are easily felt);
2) in a smaller volume and assisting the first chord above, there is a chord of the base notes - amber tobacco / cardamom, leathered, woody, mossy.

The high quality of ingredients conveys reliability for the notes, but the undeniable excess plus the use of one too many "love / hate" notes (like too much pepper) delivers a result that is too aggressively ahead of the curve and leaves versatility way restricted, and restricted versatility from a designer point of view makes the the discontinuation very understandable.

Performance merely between satisfactory to low.

Complex green male fragrance icon.
It's grassy, flowery, spicy, incensy, nutty, sweety, amazing...
This masterpiece has many faces!
I'm a big fan of the envious green juice. Not only does it illustrate the scent, it goes perfectly with the name too.

★★★★★

When something is a link between you and the version of you in the past, it surely is a precious thing. When that link is taken away from you, it almost becomes an urban legend. A myth.

I’ll try to be grounded, and talk about Envy without thinking it’s rarity and high price on the net. It’s a beautiful mass appealing designer. It’s unique, easy on the nose, sensual and refreshing at the same time. The gingery sweetness is contrasted cleverly with its oriental woody character. It’s that ginger that makes me think of a total black Japanese minimalistic outfit, an aesthetic I love.

It’s not a mind blowing smell, then again it was not intended to be. A massively successful designer that conquered the 00s. That’s it!

I am not encouraging anyone to pay a high price for envy. I found a bottle at a moderate price by accident. Then again I understand how precious this memory link to the past can be for some people. That’s the beauty of fragrance.

I’ll wrap this up by saying that it’s not a beast mode fragrance. Lasts long, but projects discreetly. One of the best designers for men, yes, but there are some other designers that have been really mind blowing (looking at you By Man, wherever you’re hiding)

Smokey ginger and spices floating on a dry sandlewood backbone. Phenomenal.

Sheesh, I've just used up the very last of my bottle.

All gone.

F@#k!

The heartache of not having this beautiful scent on my shelf will now be very real.

I bought my bottle of Envy in 2003 while stationed in Italy. I thought it smelled amazing then and purchased the bottle for probably around $45. I wore this a ton and barely have anything left in my bottle now. Had I known it would appreciate so much in value, I would have been more conservative with use. It is a great scent and I can see why some think it might feel a little dated now. The performance is outstanding and I think it's best suited for outdoors in cooler weather. I only ever needed 2 sprays of this which is far less than I usually use with other frags. Its great but definitely not worth the prices it goes for now.

Now I have to admit I've been very curious to put my nose on this scent for a while now. I've tried to get samples but no cigar .. so I turned to my old friend "Perfume Parlour"in the hope that it's a hit . Well I have to say that if Envy smells like this then I'm blown away ! What a fantastic masculine woody spicy scent, lovely stuff !
I bought it because was discontinued and hard to find but is not that good as people talk. I am not a hater but is not my cup of tea .

Nice to see this getting some love, lol, how does someone forget about this in an attic for 17 years , or put a half bottle in the cellar?....wow are you guys lucky. Enjoy!
BTW,this stuff now goes for $5 a ml
50ml are $250us and up
100ml are $400-600us
I too am baffled why they can't recreate this, even by a niche house......people would pay!

Ssg.
I stopped trading with Perfume Parlour. Their copy of Acqua Di Parma Oud is fantastic, but they’re so unreliable,and have sent wrongly labelled perfumes on a few occasions, including the ADG Oud. The last mistake they made, I had to pay for the postage.
To be honest. I’d now rather save up and buy the real deal, as the money I’ve wasted on companies like this, and the Lattafa and Ard al Zaafarans of this world easily equates to the cost of a couple of bottles of Roja Dove and/or Tom Fords.
At least one can sell the authentic bottles. I’m stuck with a cupboard full of Lattafa, Armaf, Anfar, Rasasi and Ard al Zaafaran blind buys courtesy of the YouTube hypers and narcissists.

Sweet the way sweet was in the case of perfumes from the late 1990s / early 2000s. Oxygen by Lanvin and Cacharel Nemo come to mind.

I don't know what happened with these, Oxygene is still available, Rush ad Nemo are discontinued.

Unfortunately, Oxygene is not up to the way Rush was blended: it was more balmy, more powdery, subtler and more gentle than Oxygene.

there are three different formulations;
-original pale yellow
-2nd light pale green
-3rd optic bright green

the pale yellow one is the one with the spicy ginger in the top notes,and the rich real sandalwood in the drydown, it's the best one.
the bright green one is more incense heavy I think, it's less gingery and more smokey, or dusty, ?...it's definitely a little different, it's missing that spicy ginger as someone said in their review,...."a fresh ginger that says Let's Party!!"

For those who are trying to find this fragrance still there is a company called parfumes vintage which makes clones of hard to get or discontinued fragrances.
They just released a fragrance called Pour homme and pour homme intense which is said to be a clone of Gucci envy.

I totally fail to understand why a company, that makes a buch of stuff like handbags and shoes and bottles and bottles of generic smelling scents, would just stop making its most beautiful, elegant, popular and really unique fragrance...

Wish they still made fragrances like this one. Most of these day's fragrances (niche and/or designer) are more like "pages", while Gucci Envy is a whole "book".
Amazing scent, with amazing longevity, projection and depth. They will make so much money if they release this fragrance again, don't get why they don't.

10/10

Unfortunately I never had the pleasure of owning Envy, though I really wish I did. I read somewhere that Curve is similar to it. I used to wear Curve in the 90s and it was far and away my most complimented cologne. Curve was a god in the 90s and early 00s. Can anyone attest that Curve is somewhat of a substitute for Envy?

Dear Gucci Envy,

Why did you leave me without a trace?
Everything was going perfectly and then...POOF!
Gone.
Never to be seen or heard from again.
You just disappeared into the ether like a ghost.

I adored you.
I treated you like royalty.
We were together every moment of every day.
Nothing came between us and nothing came before you.

Oh sure, now I spend time with Carven Homme and Floris Santal every once in a while.
But they can never be you, just as a swimming pool can never be the ocean.
They’re just vague reminders of the love we shared.

Of course I’m heartbroken and angry with you.
But I’d forgive you and ask no questions if you came back to me.
I’m waiting for you with open arms.

I Love You Forever,
Me

I to am experiencing the same issues as you , but not always.
I woke up in the middle of the night and could smell the rich smell of the incense and sandalwood coming from my arm, so it could be olfactory fatigue , the intense smell was intoxicating and reinforced why i bought it and now treasure it, i just picked up my second bottle, and I still look every day .....I will never have enough bottles of Gucci Envy.

not a big fan of gucci either Envy . I bought it long time ago but nothing in special I sold it . There more frags better and cheaper dont waste your time trying get this frag.

Yeah, it’s literally basically gone on me after a few hours... this is a fairly gigantic bummer to me... may may be sitting on the skin for a little longer... then it’s just gone. I tried it with some Vaseline, and it kept the opening around a bit longer for sure.... then it just fades away to nothingness... as amazing as this smells (and it has a cool bottle) I can’t really understand how this could possibly project more than arms reach for anyone... and the fact that it is simply disappearing is insane to me. I know it’s and EDT, but I have some EDT’s that certainly last nearly all day... and some EdP’s that literally may last on clothing for a week!

If I spray this on fabric... it is GONE in about 45 minutes or so... so WTF? I believe I have a bottle of the pale green, it’s sort of yellow, mostly green for sure... it has little floating particles in it, which I’ve read other Gucci Envy owners have in their bottles, so it’s probably Ford’s propensity for natural ingredients doing something inside....

But the price:performance ratio here so far is actually depressing....

I’m really happy I got this for a good price... and it smells so amazing and looks great in the collection... lol but if even sprays on a Vaselined neck don’t work... then why in the fuck would I not sell this for a 300-400$ profit?

I’m not sure how many of the comments on here are people who remember anything about the performance of this and are mainly attaching beast level to their memories of this smell...

This isn’t cool how this is going... no other frag in my entire collection works like this... if have body mists that perform better.... so what’s up?

EDIT: just now I sprayed 5 sprays into the same spot on a piece of fabric and put it on my desk... so I’ll see how long it can be detected....

EDIT 2: alright... so I can still smell the 5 big sprays I put onto a pair of socks and went out all afternoon and left them on my desk... I don’t really understand what’s up here... because one spray on each side of a tshirt and a jacket I did yesterday, then went out and walked around for a few hours (it’s really cold right now in Toronto) and seemingly not a single trace could be detected. Still don’t know what’s going on here... I’ll give it a few more tests before it’s set in stone.... but again, at the price per spray (as I have a 98% full 3.4 bottle) is insanity, and 6 sprays anytime I try to wear this isn’t going to work... I’d rather sell it and then buy every clone of envy ever made to find the best one.
zorba_colin69 On me it has great longevity and strong sillage, I can smell it whole day.

Yeah... wow. Finally got my hands on a bottle of this today!!!! Found a 3.4 of the lighter green version! Oh man, didn’t really know what I was expecting... just hoped it lived up to all of you on here proclaiming it as a masterpiece...

I think it probably is... this smells super super awesome. It’s hard to describe the smell, it’s different than anything else in my collection... it’s definitly woody, peppery, with some floral action behind all that. This is really really really good stuff.

It must be a little subliminal with the green juice, but my first spray when I got home today, so my first time smelling this ever, it reminded me somehow of pickles hah. Good ones though and not a vinegar/alcohol smell, but that mysterious, sweet, pickled strange vegetable from a far off land...

Pretty captivating and I haven’t warn this out in public yet hah.

EDIT: Hmmmmmm, so this seems to be performing, really badly? 3 or 4 sprays on my neck, one each on my wrists, a shot on my shirt and jacket... on the clothes it’s almost immediately gone. After three hours or so I can smell it right where I blasted my wrist... seemingly my neck smells like nothing, and I’m not sure if it was really projecting at all since I left the house... if I can barely smell myself, surely no one else can smell me...


This is disappointing on a fairly different level lol. This smells incredible, definitly the only thing I’ve ever smelt like this... but if after 6 sprays or more in total and it’s gone in 3 hours.... wtf? Not usable at the price per ml basically..... hmmm I’m going to give it another day or too and see if it gets any better but I mean... today was the big test to see if it was as awesome as everyone says.... but if this won’t last beyond an hour or so with any strength, I definitly don’t see the point.

I was getting wiffs of it when I walked around, but it seems to be gone, I sniffed the collar of my shirt right now... barely detectable... so anyone who actually has this and isn’t just remembering... what’s up?

well,....it's all about the Ginger, incense, and sandalwood
simple as that.....wow.
I can't get over how good this is, it actually lived up to the hype.

This is what dreams are made of. My whole journey in perfumery hangs of Gucci Envy.
I held back for years with giving what is my first review on fragrantica.com.
We cannot add to what has been added already but i can share with you a little dream of how ive chased the composition for years. Beta Caryophelleyne is the name, an aldehyde resembling nutmeg, pimento, ginger, rosewood, carnation & lavender - blend this with patchouli & a firm coumarin oriental base & your close to the real thing.
Theres a special incese with Envy that cannot be discovered, some say mrrh or cobalt, either way this is what makes it.

I have so many great memories with this one. My father used to wear it when I was child. It's been many years that I haven't smell it but I can clearly remember what it smelled like. So damn beautiful. Wish it wasn't discontinued.

I love this scent and am disappointed that it is no longer in production.

I was excited to hear that there is a company called Perfume Parlour, here in the UK, that supposedly makes good copies of many fragrances, including Envy.

The reviews of other scents they produced seemed to be largely very positive, including 7 reviews of PP's version of Envy, which I guess could easily have been fabricated...!

On receipt of their version of Envy, I was VERY disappointed it did not even closely resemble it!! They supposedly use gas liquid chromatography to put the fragrances together, I don't believe this judging by the result.

I was equally disappointed by their response when I said as much. They said "It is very unlikely that we would have got the scent wrong as we have sold many of the same and not had a single complaint thus far." What arrogant b*****ds!! They have got it VERY wrong, so don't waste your money on them, as you will be sorely disappointed as I was.

Any recommendations of places that do GOOD copies are most welcome! :-)
unique and elegant. luxury.title the king absolutely suitable for it.masterpiece.

I love Gucci Envy, if it was widely available, that would be mine signature scent. It makes me feel sexy, confident and manly, reminds me so much about 90's, it has this 90's Gucci feel from fashion shows. I had a chance to test Floris Santal and WOW! It's true that this is brighter, niche version of Envy, that makes perfect sense, they are very similar. Trust me I have some Envy on the bottom of my bottle, so I can make hand by hand comparison. Envy is little bit sharper and head notes are stronger, but Santal has Envy heart, wich I personally love ! Gucci Envy Fresh anyone ?

i have 3 mini bottles, so i decanted one in a travel spray. carven homme is very similar, especially in the deep drydown. i know someone can call me mad but i find some similarities with the one gentleman by dg, which is more peppery and oriental, envy and the carven one have a more european vibe. in my opinion envy smells quite 90's(i love this thing) and a bit mature now. it's a great scent, a classic woody-spicy with lavender and soft tobacco. i think it's not the most unique scent, u can find traces of gucci envy in many fragrances released before and after it. the fact is it's a fantastic scent, no doubt about it. i hope to find a bigger bottle in order to have a deeper impression. grazie.

my vote: 9

Envy for Men features a very unique but immediately recognizable and logical structure of lavender, ginger, sandalwood, vanilla, and vetiver.

The yellowish vintage juice is greatly superior to the bright green reformulation, which lacks real sandalwood and possibly other ingredients as well.
Why not give credit to the brilliant creator of this perfume, Daniela (Roche) Andrier?

Right after spraying it smells like pickles, freshly out of gingery vinegar. A while after, an incense kicks in, but it's far from being intoxicating, like for example in Gucci PH I

Maybe there is something wrong with my bottle, but since it's discontinued, checking a different source may be too pricey.

I have a small decant of this and I love it to death. It reminds me of the 90's and would buy it nowadays (for retail price) in a heartbeat, would they release this again. Absolutely fantastic scent. This one really lives up to the hype, not like other hyped up frags.

Thanks god eBay to give me a chance owning this one in 50 ml with a friendly price.

Envy Opened by loudly Ginger and dried down with Sandalwood which caught me at the first sniff. Tobacco Vanilla abd Cardamom blended well by the Incense and Cedar which makes my surprise.
Let yourself trying it while you can. The gem won’t makes disappoint.

I could give 9/10 for all of this projection. -1 for its lid and packaging.
20th anniversary of this modern classic. I can't say anymore about this that hasn't been said already .
king of the discontinued fragrances.

I don’t understand the love for this one.
To me the smell is the epitome of “old man.”

It's beyond words. Masterpiece. Scent of the strong, sophisticated, demanding man. I'm envious of those who has it nowdays. It does not work on boys, they can easily become ridiculous with it, but over 30.....booom. irresistible ;)

Other masterpiece forgotten! as Dior, Armani, and Ralph Lauren all of them only make flankers ... Envy is a powerfull and magnetic fragance... for me is in the vein of EGOISTE, is very similar, a complex and intoxican fragance.

This one is completely spectacular in the dry down , and smells like a spice isle in a health food store in the opening. But the drybdown is great enough artistically and also girlfriend pleasing - wise

It's really a ballenced high quality juice.defenately a niche quality.green spicy warm delicious masculine scent.
Ginger coriander lavender on the bed of sandalwood vanilla and incense.
I love it as much as I found and bought another full 100 mil bottle to my collection.
Yesss I own 2 100 mil bottle and happy about having such a rare amazing typical fragrance.true masterpiece.
Another great and discontinued scent from Gucci. It's sad that such great perfumes were replaced with generic Guilty line. SHAME ON YOU GUCCI ! Envy is sooo sexy and masculine ! I love it !

I still have an almost full bottle that my gf (who is now my wife) got for me in 1999. I went years without sniffing it. For years I only had Platinum Egoiste and Envy as I really didn't care much about fragrances. Two pretty good ones to have, though. My interest in frags only emerged four years ago, albeit with a vengeance. Sadly, I fear that time and neglect has not been kind to the contents. It smells a little off in the opening but still dries down beautifully. Oddly, and I don't know if this is possible, but since I started storing it in a cool place over a year ago, it seems that it has been remedied a little. Could just be wishful thinking. Stuff does smell great. I do have Gucci Pour Homme that kinda fits the bill, and I'm hoping that my soon-to-arrive Beloved Man will also fill a similar space.

I haven't used this in over a decade but the smell is still in my memory. Compelling, clean, masculine, refined. Fresh ginger, punchy spices and intense woods. The bottle was truly elegant and the juice's color suggested a magical elixir. The ebay prices are criminal but justified. A shame this is no longer produced.
A beautiful mean fragrance. This is the best smell of an affair. How can this be discontinued? Can Tom Ford please buy it and produce it? Too good to be gone.
I'm missing enough cruel words from cultural people dictionary to describe decision about discontinuation this Amber -incense - ginger masterpiece ( specially early type before reformulation)

Gucci Envy for Men is one of the more hyped recently-discontinued men's fragrances, a highlight of Tom Ford's stewardship of Gucci.

A mix of citrus, ginger, amber, rose, and incense, I detect mostly the spicy side of the ginger and incense mix, not being distracted by too much else. Ginger is usually difficult for me to bear in excess, but in Envy, it is used tastefully, not spoiling as it often does. It has lighter parts but overall feels like a heavy-handed masculine takeover, a firm punch to remind of what we imagine that men's scents of yore must have smelled like, regardless of whether that's accurate. It doesn't indulge an appeal to barbershop freshness as a fougere would, but leans far more toward something worn in the winter, or at least at night.

Performance for an EDT is impressive, moderate/strong on projection and strong on longevity--back in the day this would have been quite a steal as far as a mature, classic-smelling men's fragrance.

Unfortunately, Envy's status seems to have become overblown, with bottles going for $200+ on eBay. While I don't appraise it so highly, I can recognize this as one I'd like to own and reach for, just not so much what the market is purportedly bearing at this time.

8 out of 10

Man, I smelled this today and it totally reminded me of something I've smelled before. It was bugging all day and BOOM it hit me! Mont Blanc Presence. Presence is actually much better because of its creamy dry down. Please try, so I know I'm not crazy.

tonight I went to my brother homme after greeting and eating dinner he said I search for one of my parfume that I can`t find it gucci I whispered to myself with mockery envy .he brought thier perfumes suprisingly it was gucci envy amongst them i sprang and seized it and borrowed it. I didn`t believe one day I could grab Gucci Envy specially in this way.It was a dreamy night cuz D&G Pour Homme vintage was in my bringings to home.
It has gingery incensy woody type of smell.
the age is almost mature suitable fo 30 and above.
fall winter.
for work party night .
Goergous mature up lifting scent.
9/10
They also discontinued Gucci Rush for man in the same way like Envy. What is going on?

Why why why they discontinued it? It was one of the best fragrances ever (if not the best...-specially first version before reformulation ) I guess it's marketing trick.. Prices are now flying high to the sky for last bottles of Gucci Envy for man on eBay you can pay even 400 £, or $ - for 100ml and its not the end - they will be even more expensive. And then.. Lady's and gentleman's - one day... Legendary Envy will be back and starts do big money again. It's secret weapon of company for hard days (I think

- Timeless masculinity - ★★★★☆

Envy, one of the centerpieces from the holy era of modern male perfumery. Many of the older powerhouses such as Poison, Kouros and Eau Sauvage are masterpieces on their own but unfortunately very dated and difficult too wear for a guy in his early 20s. Nearly all the great releases since the beginning of 90's are however still oddly very relevant today and mix very well with the current trends - A*men, Rush and Opium Pour Homme come to mind.

Envy for Men is very different from the aforementioned fragrances but had a strong influence on the direction where the modern male perfumery headed after its release. A genre I like to call soft orientals emerged - heavy use of spice and incense in a fresh Western style. Other great examples of this genre would be Gucci PH I, Lanvin Arpege PH, L'eau d'Issey Intense, V&R Antidote. Especially the use on nutmeg (very evident in Envy) was particulary prominent and a trend that I personally miss these days.

Envy is an excellent fragrance and needs to be respected for the impact it had back in the day but I don't find it to be the masterpiece that many claim it to be. I think it's a jack of all trades but a master of none - there's woods, spiciness, some sweetness and eventually turns a little powdery. Ginger, nutmeg and coriander meld beautifully with the incense and peppery sandalwood but I'm left wanting something more. Something spicier or sweeter perhaps. My own signature Arpege Pour Homme is very similar to Envy in structure but it has that extremely powdery iris and intoxicating nutmeg-vanilla that give it a precisely defined character surpassing it's forefather.

To summarize: If Envy was still in production, I would buy it immediately but IMO is not worth the +200$ prices in eBay. Happy hunting!

Soundtrack: Barry Adamson - Something Wicked This Way Comes

I went to my parents for Christmas and didnt take cologne because i flew... When I asked my dad was like yes son I have a bottle of cologne that you bought me years ago.. I just threw the after shave bottle out a couple months ago because it was empty... I go in his bathroom and BAM!!! three quarter full bottle of this beautiful juice,.. Vintage, original formula that I bought 10+ years ago.... I have a half of each at home after shave and cologne so I was happy he had it.. I old him it was worth like $200 dollars and he flipped when we saw it online for that price.. good stuff..
haha i really wanna see Boss number one being sold at 250$ one day that'd make my day.

I had this scent in 2009.
I was a manager at the time for a pharmacy, so this item was placed clearance shelf.
So picked it up and used my discount, only bought it because it was a name brand...Gucci Envy.
Tried it and it smelled like old men...That scent of old people in old folks home.
Gave it away to my best friend, who saw it on my dresser.
"Can I try it, bro, you can have it"
Made his day....
Now I wish I bought more of them and keep them.
People are buying them at $200 bucks a pop.
Smfh.
Anyway, he still has it.
And I tried it, to me it still smells the same.
Sillage four feet.
Last 4-6 hours.
Is it worth today's price...HELL NO!
Is it worth $20-$40 max sure...no more!
So if you're a collector go for it, but if not don't do it!
There are better scents at way cheaper price out there.
I wouldn't buy this ever again.

Take 4 parts of YSL Opium Homme (EdT, 1995), add 1 part of Dolce & Gabbana The One for Men (EdT, 2008), then you get this one.

If you are not completely satisfied, okay, go ahead, mix 0.5 part of Caron pour un Homme (1934) into the compound... Now you can call it [YourName ] Envy for Men Bespoke Edition.

Not bad, but just not very impressive. If it could be found in the original price before being discountinued, it should be a quite decent choice.

Rating: 7.0/10

Batch Code of Mine: 6318

Overrated because of it being discontinued. It's an okay fragrance but nothing exceptional. Not worth the crazy prices $250+ it's going for on eBay from people looking to cash in on its rarity. Honestly, for that money I'd rather plunk down for a more modern powerhouse like Amouage Interlude Man or some other modern beast. Gucci Envy is well worth its original price of about $40. But for $250 to $400... get lost!
Masculine. Powerful. Fit. Exotic. Alluring.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I love this I just wish it lasted sometimes I feel like it disappears after only 1 hour which is a shame

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: It's a really refreshing aromatic with a lovely violet flower note. Has similarities to Maison Crivelli's Absinthe Boréale, but side by side they're clearly different fragrances. Yeah, it's a shame this got discontinued because it's genuinely a great example of a modern fougere. Grab a bottle from the discounters before it's relegated to ebay if you like this style of fragrance.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Ahh yes, Gucci wipes.
Great aroma to wipe your boujee ass’es with! 🧻

I personally find it unisex leaning feminine due to the way the violet/ heliotrope combination smells here. The violet is soft & calm but w/ a subtle body care product sweetness twang.

The cypress is unfortunately completely absent throughout 😫. As well as bergamot & patchouli which I do not care for.

Not herbal, not soapy, not medicinal, not powdery!

It’s all heliotrope, violet & rosemary.
