Pleasantly boring. Couldn’t imagine any woman wanting their man to smell like pampered baby ass 👶

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
A soap and detergent mix that smells very clean and unique. To be honest, it was one of the first fragrances I bought, and it was a meh, boring scent. After collecting and having so many different types of scents, this one feels very refreshing and clean. I haven't smelled anything like it, so it is relatively unique, and the performance is in the medium-low range.
5/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I liked it when it released, and i like it now.

Now people are finally appreciating it. When something isnt following the current trend and touches new ground, people dont like it bc of npc/normie mindset. But this is genius by a genius. Really cool and masculine fresh, going against the grain.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Green, unique, and herbal masterpiece. Good performance with great silage. Women live it, and have commented a couple of times. Great when it’s windy out. Catch wiffs all day. Has a therapeutic aspect that hard to describe, and puts me in a chill mood. Spring, Summer, Fall appriopate. Get it while you can.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I don’t see anything ominous in this perfume; it doesn’t suffocate, it’s sterile, evoking the atmosphere of entering a freshly opened hospital where you know doctors are there to help, a place where you feel safe. But that is just a faint background. The stronger impression comes from the blend of cypress, rosemary, and juniper berries, enhanced by bergamot that emerges with the deepest breath.

This is a perfume designed for successful people, suitable for all seasons, something that will define you in the eyes of others as bold and confident. I see nothing wrong with this fragrance; for an affordable price, you get a brand with quality comparable to Zara but exceptional in every way. It’s a true burst of spiced freshness, the essence of business trips, and the realization of dreams bottled up.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
The reviews for this are perplexing. It's nowhere near as divisive as people make it out to be. In fact, it might be one of the best men's fragrances released in recent years (so of course it's discontinued 🙄).

I mainly get cool, soapy evergreens supported by clean, powdery purple florals and herbal rosemary. There's a slight minty aspect from the rosemary in the opening and a clean, sparkly patchouli in the base.

This was a breath of fresh air in today's sea of uninspiring, $120 "cologne guy" releases.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
When sprayed on skin, it can smell a little intense and like cleaning products. However, give it an hour or so, it completely transforms into a fragrance that I have been stopped in the street and asked what I am wearing. I will buy this until it goes end of life.

EDIT - its gone end of life and Im devo

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: The time of icons is long gone. I don't understand how the house that gave birth to Envy Men, Nobile, III, has made franchises and generics for approximately a decade... In this case, what could have been a wonderful cologne is nothing more than something plastic and synthetic, similar to a self adhesive...

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I quite enjoy this fragrance. It's definitely not for everyone, so I'd recommend sampling first. One of the things I enjoy about this fragrance is that it's it's a freshie that isn't your typical citrus or aquatic scent. The juniper berries, cypress, and rosemary stand out the most. It comes off a bit medicinal, but not in a way I dislike at all. It's a more mature scent, so guys in their early 20s and younger probably won't care for this fragrance.

It's not a strong performer, but it's a high cologne flanker, so it's what you'd expect. Gucci has its share of fragrances that are very different than other designers. This fragrance is discontinued to my knowledge, but still shows up here and there online.

Overall: 8/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I'm going to keep the review very short - they should've called it Gucci Guilty Absolute Cologne...
Cuz somehow that's what it smells like - a Cologne version of Absolute.
That should tell you this is not safe and definitely not a blind buy. But for those who complain that Gucci does safe fragrances these days - between the EDP, Absolute, even Elixir a bit and this, there's definitely room for doubt and reconsideration.

9/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: this fragrance made my day, Alberto morillas is a genius 🌅

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I would not recommend buying this at all.
If you are I would suggest smelling it beforehand or sampling it.
I got this gifted to me but the smell is just weird.
I bought Gucci Guilty Black before which was more appealing to all noses but quite boring. This on the other hand is just very odd.
It is not the worst but most certainly not the best.
For me, the notes are what doesn't do it any justice.
The only reason this fragrance is okay is because the bergamot is the only note making it smell just alright.
If it didn't have that note this fragrance would be very bad in my opinion.

Price = 1/10
Scent = 4/10
Bottle = 6/10
Longevity = 4-6 hrs
Sillage = Moderate

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Got a 2ml decant of this because it seemed interesting. I regretted it. Smells like soap and sweaty diaper.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: If I smelled this before Cypres Pantelleria I would probably like this so more but it’s certainly not bad, they’re like 90% the same imo Guilty Cologne is more fresher and powdery than it’s Armani rehash but still very much feels like an EDT cologne, not the strongest or longest lasting but is definitely different from your typical shower gel freshie worth a shot if you’re tired of those and want something greener.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I really dont like this.. the mint is killing me and smells weird. 3/10 from me. If anyone wants to buy mine its halfway and its a 1.7 or 2 oz i cant remember.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I had a hard time with this one, as from the first sniff my thought was 'do people actually pay for smelling like this, weirdos?', I tried it out in stores few more times and noticed it's getting less stocked, and then on one of the groups I found a good deal for first batch, so I took it. Back then I wasn't too sure if I'd ever actually use it, although when I forced myself into occasional usage during summer made me fall in love with it, exactly the same way I fell in love with Guerlain's Ideal Cool.
It's fresh. It's herbal with some citruses. It's green. I don't smell this heliotrope powderiness here.
Longetivity-wise it's not a best performer on my skin, although I get a decent sillage in first hour.
Whenever I see some other perfumes with color like this, I hope they'll smell similar.
If you find this somewhere in the shops, do not hesitate.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
To me it's not dental or bug spray at all !!
It's definitely more on the green side of fresh perfumes.
It's unique.
The biggest downside is as a "cologne", I wanted it to be way more bright and sparkly.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
That was... weird. The first sniff caused me this sensation of "I smelled something that's too minty/fresh and it got into my lungs", which caused quite an uncomfortable sensation.

After it's a soapy powdery and floral smell, really fresh and different. Good one if you are looking for a rare blue smell. I understand the dentist comparison, but it is not as close. Kinda regretted not buying it, it's a cool perfume to have as a collector.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: It's more of a flanker to the Absolute then to the original. And that being, in the upper echelon of the line. It's green, herbal, and stark, with a nice sting. Will get lots a burn this summer.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Fantastic summer fragrance. Different than most other blue / aquatic fragrances on the market. Very fresh uplifting scent profile. Performance is decent.
9/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme is a soapy powdery, smooth woody, green and flowery unique freshy.
Personally, I liked it a lot, at the opening it smells weird for a minute than it becomes beautiful I think a lot of people judged the fragrance for that 1-minute smell without smelling it more without giving it more time.
it has moderate performance on my skin approximately about 6-7 hours it projects very good at the first 2 hours than it becomes close to skin, when it comes to likeability of the fragrance, I think it's pretty likeable.
So, guys I recommend it, at least give it a chance don't pass it because of the judgments of others.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
man I wish i bought dozen of this before discontinued. last time i felt like this when i heard the news about the v&r antidote.
gucci cologne has a real coolness effect just after applying which is very enjoyable and the magic appears in the dry down which gives a mature and manly feel with dark greeny notes.
dont get me wrong sillage is not perfect but as long as it stays on you cant stop smelling your clothes

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
The whole Guilty line seems to be disrespected in the fragrance community & sometimes I don't understand the negative reviews. Reviewers will have you believing that you will smell like shit.

Guilty Cologne is one of the freshest scents I have ever tried. Immediately that juniper and rosemary brings a fresh herbal vibe, mixed with the floral mid just creates a lovely atmosphere of cleanliness. It's okay if that isn't your vibe but surely if you came across someone wearing this you wouldn't think they smell bad, right?

Where the original is fresh and soapy, this one is fresh, soapy, & floral. you might see it as feminine and that is okay. For the price on discounters it's pretty good. I don't think it lasts long though, when do fresh scents ever...

8/10 lovely floral freshness

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
There is something really strange in the first minutes of this composition, like juniper gone bad or the rosemary way too much, or the moment you taste that nettle shampoo with your mouth: a chemical-bitter taste, spoiling the rest to come.
And the rest is a cool herbal cocktail with a frosting of heliotrope and violet, crispy and cold. I eventually stopped paying attention to the opening and I like a lot the ice-cold floral sweetness that comes after - violets are yummy, and the herbal part is like a Comme des Garcons urban abstraction. But it needs some time for adjusting, meaning you can't sell it at airports.
Anyway, I reach for it more often than I initially expected: it's refreshing, without implying a particular mood; a cologne without a tangible citrus note, for the times when you don't really feel like being "immediately transported" to Amalfi or Tuscany, more like going to the local pharmacy, but this should be fun, too.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: to me this is very floral i have a 10ml of this honestly has a gatorade/bath bomb type of vibe def think of bug spray at times but i like it. i wouldn’t recommend this at all unless i know you personally would like it. i would stick with the OG.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: some of these flankers are light years better than the more expensive garden line. this is a stand out release and greatly overlooked.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Crisp, clean, bug spray. Very chemical smell, not a typical male scent, but still "fresh" enough that it skews toward basic blue male fragrances. I personally like it-- I have some nostalgia for Tresemme hairspray smell-- but definitely won't be everyone's favorite.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Dental Office - For Men.

Henry from Life Like wears this.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Guys, here me out - no matter what kind of awesome deal you've found, no matter how much you trust Alberto Morillas as a perfumer or Gucci as a brand - do not blind buy this! Juice color and name "cologne" suggest something remotely fresh but it's not there - terms like hair (bug) spray are spot on.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: This cologne doesn't smell like diapers or wet wipes. It's spicy, slightly bitter and not a bit sweet. Still, it's a fresh scent. A good alternative to the citrusy or blue scents in summer.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: kinda gave me ptsd of being intoxicated of going to cheap hair salons from all the hair dye and bleach smells together, thats sadly what this reminds me of

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Skin test, winter.
This has a chalky powdery musk dry quality to it, it's dry but rounded, does not feel thin and whispy like some colognes do..
Very slightly pissy in the background, though I haven't found that before.. sobits probably something else I have on with woods and citrus intermingling...

Not an easy buy for me, I would try this again with nothing else on..
It has gone more pleasant, lost the animalic feel it had, which wasn't hugely noticeable anyway..
I have the regular men's guilty I the silver bottle no issues with it.

It is a rounded, fresh but not light feeling scent, runs cool, and generally good. I would buy but need to retest to be sure. Female here

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Woody, herbal, peppery, and medicinal on my skin. I enjoy it because it is mature, classy, and masculine. The projection, performance, and sillage are slightly above average. Office or casual, day or night, spring or fall, GG cologne simply works for me.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: This smells like that barber at the barbershop that pulls out some secret weapon deliciousness smelling spray bottle after he just gave you that dope fade and you hesitate to ask the barber what scent it was! Then you leave get to your car and your mad A/F at yourself for not asking what scent spray he hit you with!!! Yeah 😎 this is simple and yet so glorious from the one and only Mr. Alberto Morillas DA GOAT!!!!!! ✌️❤️🔥🔥🔥🙏🏽🙏🏽

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Kinda feel autistic almost smelling i love it but also nearly dislike it. Powdery yet green, natural yet synthetic, almost slightly off putting yet cant stop smelling. Very unique experience with some challenge, takes a little while to understand but god is it good. Challenging facets should calm down in the summer when that cooling effect is really needed.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Bright, herbal, purple floral with an addictively salty, musky base. This smells fantastic!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Reminds me of a pool for some reason. Salty, watery, it’s alright but nothing groundbreaking. The OG is better than this one. This would be a good gym fragrance, or for a pool party. That’s about the only situations I can see grabbing for this one, at least from my personal collection.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Sharp fruity spicy scent the violet really shines

I personally love it, excellent longevity and sillage

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: A chilly, fresh and citrusy fragrance for men. Gucci fragrances are very different. As for male, its attractive and simple as well.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I got a phenomenal deal on this one
£24.50 for 150ml on fragrance shop (UK discounter)
And....
I read a lot of negative reviews about it but also some positives praising its uniqueness.

Personally I think it is very interesting.
Original
Smells very herbally and bit medicinal
I do like the berries note.
It has a surprisingly great projection
So far I am digging this

Beautiful bottle
I need to give it some time, luckily spring is on its way

Overall very much pleased with it so far

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: @Afc_Croatian: two reasons: 1. nostalgia. people are mad at gucci because envy, pour homme/ph II, nobile and rush (i'm a big fan of each of them) we're killed/not re-released (unlike the great retro line with ph, m7 or jazz by ysl). such a heritage. they don't get it. me neither. 2. guilty doesn't resemble anything popular these days. it's not Yish, not bleue, not invictusy. i don't say the guilty line is a work of genius because it's not, but the hate is pathetic.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: To be honest, I haven't tried this one, but I tired the OG DNA along with the EDP and parfum, in all seriousness, is there ANY Fragrance from the Guilty line that people don't hate on??? Why do they all have such bad ratings, every one i've come across seems very pleasant.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
with more and more useless sweet crap produced and praised day by day finally some people slowly get how unique and good this stuff actually was and still is. yep, it says cologne and it is a true cologne (with edt longevity and projection). very herbal, fresh, unique if slightly medicinal, clean. a rare breed.
and all the dislikes? a big lol, you simply know nothing.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Further to my earlier review of this 2 years ago, I’ve just bought a 150 ml back up bottle of this before it becomes unavailable.

This stuff is criminally underrated and fairly unique. I love my summer citrus’ and freshies but this offers an alternative freshness, menthol and mint….incredibly refreshing and cooling, can’t wait for the warmer weather to come so I can drown myself in it again.

This has garnered me more compliments than any other fragrances i own & if I leave it in the bathroom it gets stolen by my daughter and my wife.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: A cologne that is true to its look. The green tinge is perfect for it. Woody, citrusy, fresh, manly. Quite herbal and spicy too. Covers many bases and is overall a great pick, can be used casually or even on special occasions.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: It is the least known but most successful perfume of the series in my opinion. A very clean, very fresh and very green spice scent. It is a perfume that can be used easily by men of all ages and fully meets your expectations from a designer perfume. I'm glad I discovered it so late.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: It has an overwhelming baby wipe and citrus disinfectant smell. Definitely not one I wear often.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Class in a bottle.

This resembles a very good quality rustic herbal and musk soap, the type you find in 5 star Hotels.

I can understand why this wasn't popular when it was released, especially amongst today's noses, it takes some maturity and a few wears to understand it, but once you do you will have that epiphany moment of how good it is.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I love this. It opens with a very herbal take on Italian cologne, with the bergamot alongside medicinal rosemary and the coldness of juniper. The mid leans heavily into heliotrope, giving a slightly "Nivea Creme" feel. For me the scent then changes significantly, as the dry down somehow becomes a very rich, warm, almost Middle Eastern woody smell, with flecks of Italian herbal cologne around it. This phase is gorgeous and happens to last for hours on me, at least until I'm long home from work.
Overall a very unique release that oozes class. Goes to show that overall score is not always relevant on Fragrantica.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I've been sniffing all the perfumes in the store from Azzaro to Xerjoff like a truffle hog but literally all of them had strong notes I had smelled before. Then I tried this one. It was definitely not a love at first sigh but it was something that I've never smelled. What convinced me that we'll fit together is the rollercoaster like journey that comes with this cologne. The top notes are like a new product of Jagermeister, like a Jagermaister summer edition without too much sweetness. After drydown come the powdery, even dust-sniffing like notes that I somehow love.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Maybe I don’t know what baby wipes smell like, and maybe I should. This juice smells great to me, a classic herbal green fougere/cologne scent. It’s very similar to Tom Ford Fougere Platine, but with the volume turned down a few notches.
Having bought it, I’m a bit surprised at how divisive it seems to be, not that far out at all to my nose. I rate it highly, especially for what you’d can buy it for now.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
This one strays far enough away from the og Gucci guilty to be unique, but still has the DNA.

It is powdery, herbal and doesn't really smell like anything else in my collection. Like someone else mentioned, I do get a baby wipe note at the start, but it goes away in the dry down.

After a couple of hours, I get some classic Gucci Envy vibes.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I wore it in the heat wave a week ago. Terrific. Sweeter and more fruity and especially flowery than it is in other seasons or reasonable temperatures. Not cloying or wet sweet. Smells great on me and on clothes. Kept my mood and energy up. Very long lasting dry down on clothes, like the good old days.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Coming from a girl's perspective, I would be really upset if my man spent $80-120 to smell like this. It is not good. At all. Reminds me kind of Light Blue. It just smells like an unclean bathroom or something.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I applied this on a hot day in Texas and I IMMEDIATELY wanted to go take a shower 🥴
This scent profile smells EXACTLY like baby wipes!
It felt like I wiped my whole body down...
The woman I was with kissed me on my neck because she loved it... NEVER AGAIN FOR ME!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Folks in India; this fragrance is a dead ringer for Cinthol Original Soap. The green one with the red wrapper. If you like that smell you may enjoy this. Clean, soapy scent with a powdery dry down. Definitely unisex, leans slightly male. You will smell unique. But it’s a polarising smell, and it’s not cheap, so try before buying. Decent longevity with modest spraying.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I am a person that doesn't care what time of the year a fragrance is made for, I'd usually wear them all year....THIS particular fragrance belongs nowhere BUT summer. High heat, bursting sun, nothing else. It's off putting at first, but let the magic work it's way. I promise you, that when you smell this fragrance again, you'll remember everything you did when you wore it in summer. It's so special to me because it brings me fantastic memories from 2019 when it got released and I got myself a bottle in London's Liverpool street station (boots). Try before buying and have fun with it!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Tested this fragrance twice on skin and in a hot weather, all I can say, this smells luxurious! Smells elegant and I think this will stand out among other scent profiles especially in hot weather. The best in the Guilty line! Casual to formal events IMO this will work perfectly fine. I'll now save money to buy this one since most of the people here says it's discontinued. Here in my country, it's still available. I won't let it slip away 🧐.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: My boyfriend wears this and I think it's one of the best men's perfumes I know of! It's naughty! And sweeter than the notes would suggest.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: This one is just okay. Very green, a coniferous forest in a bottle. I prefer a bit of sweet and a softer green. Others that like that sharpness would probably enjoy it. It wouldn't appeal to me much if my husband was wearing it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I couldn't ski or even go up to mountains between Christmas and New Year so it occurred to me to spray this cologne generously and go for a walk in the forest. How silly that I considered it a summer only cologne. The eucalyptol rosemary and camphoraceous juniper berry! Bracing.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: It's crazy how our taste and sense of smell can change! Right after launch of this perfume I have ordered a sample... well I didn't like it. I mean I can always appreciate a good perfume even it's no my cup of tea. For my nose it was weird concoction - powdery, sweet, bitter. After few years I can appreciate it more, now I like it. Gucci Guilty Cologne is very unique fragrance and together with Absolutes the best releases from Gucci for many years.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Tried this at the local store. This is a fresh and bright musky powdery scent. Not really what I was looking for, Guilty Absolute, which is leather based, but I tried it anyway as it was 30%off. alas, not my type.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Bergamont, Balsamic Notes, Clean Musk & Cedar. There is a tart, clean smell with woods. This tart Bergamont note sticks around longer than most citrus notes do. This is not a crazy projector, its subtle and light unless you overspray. I really like balsamic notes, it's subtle here from the combination of cypress & juniper. If you don't like green balsamic notes, this may not be for you. It's clean smelling and should be worn in warm weather. This doesn't have enough strength to be worn in the cold weather. For me this will be a summer, errand running, gym scent. It's a pretty average scent overall, but I do like it.

Discontinued as far I know. Got a great deal on a tester. Not remotely worth retail price or inflated discontinued prices. Don't think I'd pay more than one $40-45 for this. This is a safe scent, if you want something more avant garde and unique, go with Gucci Guilty Absolute.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
VERY TART!!!!
But I will say-----this is amazing from the house of gucci. Wear this to the gym and don't over spray... It will get the job done... Overall, versatile for everyday use, very fruity and soapy----yes I know, it's weird but one to try in my opinion... PS BB Cobalt is WAY better...

7.9/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Fresh and strange opening. Then once it settles down it becomes a juniper tart bomb. Is very comfortable, also there's some sweet undertones here. But definitely this is a juniper berry bomb, lol.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Smells Herbal Minty powdery. Is anyone else reminded of The minty Amouage Enclave?

After reading the reviews on here I thought I'd check this one out while I was stocking up on Gucci Guilty Absolute. To my surprise I really enjoyed it although my wife doesn't. Tempted to get some bottles because it does seem like it would be really good in summer.

Unique!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: This has a very soapy smell when sprayed. The outer bottle emmits a nice, fruity fresh fragarance, but once it hits your inner wrist it smells ghastly. Like too much soap. Whats more interesting is how it dries. After an hour it starts to sweeten up and after half a day it smells great. You can wake up the next morning smelling the better part of it on you in this strange magic trick of smelling the soapy odor dissapear.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Very dfficult ages for Gucci s fans! Gucci nowadays is only worried about making flankers as Fendi, Armani, Dior and Ralph Lauren. The glorious years of all those brands are lost. Love colognes but in this case we have synthetics elements for this fragance that became into plastic and medicinal.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I wanted to like this fragrance and have it grow on me, but after wearing it multiple times, I had to sell it. I always found myself thinking, "did someone open a diaper bag behind me". It's not a turd smell by any means, but it reminds me of baby wipes. I would highly advise against blind buying this one.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I like this cologne. It's challenging, but the more I smell it, the more I'm reaching for it as a daily wear. I am satisfied with my purchase of a whole bottle. And truthfully, I enjoy it a lot. Among the shower-gel freshies, the ambrox bombs, and the nauseating milky-sweet-sandalwood mens fragrances at Sephora as of 07/21, this one definitely stood out.

The fragrance is dominated by a strong, long lasting "gunpowder" accord that I can only describe as extremely powdery, dry, green, sharp, fresh, slightly sulfurous, smooth, and balanced. This might be the "heliotrope, violet and cypress". I'm guessing the heliotrope + violet is a ton of ionones (alpha ionone anyone?) and some irones and heliotropin, somehow dried to a crisp with other aromachems. The cypress note might be a microdose of some sulfurous aromachem? The Alaskan Cypress Oil I own definitely has sulfurous top notes, so this is appropriate. Anyway, it's a really nice and unique aroma that is linear and lasts.

It starts out with a nondescript, acidic, distant, sharp but pleasant citrus note. It finishes off with a nose-tingling breeze of woody-amber molecules (ambrocenide, norlimbanol perhaps). Through the duration of the fragrance, there is a very mild and lovely aquatic presence, perhaps calone or cascalone. Normally calone disgusts me, but here it works so well!! I cannot detect the white musk... I could perhaps be anosmic to it, or it's just carefully hidden, or very transparent.

Good longevity, and strong but not overpowering.

Is it a safe blind buy? No. But it's different than anything I own, and I really enjoy it. It's minimal, light and transparent, but lovely. Definitely polarizing. Try before you buy! Wear it and see how you feel.

EDIT: I really like this juice, the more I wear it the more I appreciate it. I also removed some snark in my review regarding note pyramids.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I just tried this. Its rare that i have to wash off a fragrance that i sprayed on myself but this one is one of them. It just doesnt smell good...... headache inducing mess. Sorry.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Blind buy because, c'mon, this scent sounds so interesting and controversial from the get go, and it is discontinued to boot. This is a throwback to the 80's early 90s powerhouses, any shame aside. I can even see this having it's placemaker earlier on, referencing some mediteranean colognes of fore. The whole Gucci Guilty line, in my opinion, is coherent and manly, which means women won't necessarily appreciate them -have in mind-. The cologne version I am reviewing is clearly based on the OG but veers towards warmer weather and daily wear, by means of bergamot. I find the whole Guilty line as polarizing, high quality masterpieces. You need to sample this -I stress this- before you make up your mind, but if you like the OG chances are you want this badly for your spring-summer daily wear. I paid 30 euro for the 90ml and I just can't get enough of it. I find it perhaps a less melancholic Hommage a L'Homme, and as excellent as that.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: SearchingScents: thank you so much for a good read. couldn't agree more. (just bought my second 150ml bottle lol).

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I must reveal my strange relationship with this fragrance. I cannot be silent anymore because I've been obsessed with Gucci Guilty Cologne ever since I got it. It confuses me, it intrigues me, it humors me, it supports me, it loves me, it gets me... I didn't bother test this one. I just plunged straight into a blind purchase. I disregarded the consistent hate, disgust and rejection this scent received. People call it names insult it but it just made me more curious.

It came. I sprayed it on.

I thought, "Damnit I actually don't like this... What is that saltiness? What is that fizziness? What is that weird creaminess? What is making it smell dry, powdery and soapy like baby wipes like others have mentioned? The notes looked so promising but the result is so f...ing strange". I was so upset that I continued spraying it on hoping it would change or dry-down to something different. I kept spraying trying to find out what I enjoyed about the scent. Why am I still spraying this thing? I already decided I don't like it, but why do I keep spraying. Am I forcing myself to enjoy my blind buy? Are my feelings about this not reliable anymore because I am a hostage in denial of the idea that maybe I wasted my money? Stockholm syndrome at its spookiest... But wait a minute...

At the time it had been two consecutive days and I had worn nothing but Gucci Guilty Cologne trying to understand it, but also enjoying it. Performance is quite strong for a cologne even an edt but stable. It is clean and soft, like fabric softener and baby-powder in the air but contrasted by the facets of creaminess, fizziness and the sparkle of shaving cream like an ultra-modern fougère. The scent profile humors me. It is humbling expressing humility by displaying an infant-like cleanliness but then it is rounded and matured by a cleanliness that is also of a grown man clean shaven. I have stopped wearing it to understand it because not understanding it is why I love it. Gucci Guilty Cologne is Olfactory art. It is a statement.

It has told me, "shut-up, stop overthinking and just wear me" reminding me of the basic function of a perfume, and I have submitted to its commands. It has restarted everything for me and told me it is as much functional as it is art. I needed Gucci Guilty Cologne to remind me that perfume is equally an art as it is functional. I find it calming and addicting and it has become one of my favorite signatures to reach for this spring and summer. I look forward to also wearing it this fall and winter. Unique, avant-garde, but ultra-modern and clean. A misunderstood masterpiece in my opinion.

🧼 🌿🪒
10/10

Edit:
I don't know how or why but I've been complemented and approached numerously on my wearings of this. I don't usually write on complement factor but this performs very well on me. I'm always afraid to recommend it because of how polarizing I know it is. And yes @dabatch I too see a second bottle of this in my future if I can still find one!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Confessions of a Gucci Fanboy:
It's happening. . . I have gone full circle from the frustrating prospecting of niche to the well-calculated, marketed, targeted, tested raw power of designer. Oh hell, I just gave in, the designers are so darn good. Still, I love my niche Sticky Fingers by Francesca Bianchi. Just one score like this one makes niche worth the struggle.
Side Rant: Francesca Bianchi is so amazing--not hard on the eyes either. Probably can't say that nowadays. We guys oughta just shoot ourselves or maybe go to one of those charming 're-education' facilities like the Communists use. I can see it now: Bad Doggie re-program Room A. Right. You are now cured. 'Oh. . you look nice today (snore). You can't even joke anymore so let me sort this out so as not to offend. Guys who are gentlemen can meet todays standards. A gentleman always keeps the standard. OK relax, good talk.
Regarding 'designer' versus niche; designer is not as robust a fragrance and re-formulation has erred toward weaker compared to niche. Still, alot of niche quickly becomes a skin scent. Confused enough?
Wondering if the public does not want something too strong that will hang in the air. Maybe the public just wants a fragrance quickie.

NOTE: This is a cologne with surprisingly great durability. Being a cologne it is not as concentrated as a Toilette. Still, keep the faith. This stuff delivers with a hearty spray!!!!
The juice is the prettiest, softest green-- that ever made the scene. The glass bottle is so heavy and tapered for the hand. Yep. It just feels good. Nice ritual.
To the notes, to the point:
Top: Juniper Berries, Rosemary, Calabrian Bergamot
Middle: Cypress, Heliotrope, Violet
Base: White Musk, Patchouli LEAF, Cedar

Done by Roberto Morillas and launched 2019.

Open is just wonderful with my favorite note of Juniper Berries. I go crazy over black pepper and juniper as found in many of the British scents like Dunhill or Hugh Parsons. (By the way. . . . Hugh Parsons kind of is getting the 'high hat'. This stuff is fun, bright and traditional for a real gent!)
Moving past the Juniper--there is no black pepper. A quick entrance of Cypress, and Violet in just a matter of ten seconds. Super nice Violet.
The Heliotrope adds a lush nectar/sweetness with maybe even some heft! The only base I can really detect is Cedar which I have come to love. After some hours, the final drydown does seem to have the White Musk factor and it is barely detectable--but 'gamey' and classy.
It's in there:
I'm going to have to try the Patchouli Leaves by : is it Montale? Mancera?
This scent is remarkably successful in attaining two goals: First off, it has a certain bulk to the fragrance cloud as well as a bright aspect. Also the Violet is so nice and the Heliotrope is like a really satisfying confection or pastry. I think the Heliotrope adds the "bulk".
Secondly, this scent in final dry down offers a real delicate interpretation of musk and a much brighter Patchouli that fools my nose. I saw it in the notes, I did not detect it. So light. . . must be the leaves.
Apparently, this was not run for very long. I get real curious when a fragrance is met with 'we don't get it' . Dump it, 'it aint sellin'. I just have to move in for the sniff. I like prospecting. I'm getting real good at it, but had to waste some money at first.
I paid $71USD. Upon initial purchase, it seemed a bit rich. The product really is unique and worth every penny. Shop it, if you want. I love a great deal.
I learned alot. Patchouli leaves--wow. Heliotrope--luxe.... doll. Violet--not all the same. Juniper Berries--where the big boys screw it up but not this one.
Also learned: Cologne is not always too weak. Re-calculating.
Also learned: Practical and hot all in one bottle. I like that.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Herbal, sweet, slightly coniferous, a hint of something powdery and just masculine enough...

A unique and original composition.... So I can see this one being a little controversial.

The sillage this puts off is very nice - Different then what you get burying your nose in the arm you sprayed. It's not as powdery/medicinal. (Almost the fresh/clean counterpart to Absolute... In a way.)

I've never understood the blind hate for this line.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Oh my god, it is just horrible. I am not exaggerating, this is the worst fragrance I have ever put my nose on. For the first time in my life I see myself can't standing a fragrance. I grabbed it from my brothers closet and sprayed it on my elbow and I rushed to bathroom to wash it off.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I'm sorry, but whoever is telling you this is rebottled Gucci by Gucci Sport is dead wrong. Stop misleading people! Gucci by Gucci Sport was a masterpiece while this is a misunderstanding.
Do you know that faint and sweet smell you detect when entering a pharmacy? The weird mixture of Nivea creams, baby powder, medicine cabinets and all the pharma brand cosmetics? There you go.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Sunny Italian style cologne, rocky pine forest above the Mediterranean Sea. It's original and in today's mix of market and products, Guilty Cologne is good value. In my warped mind I could see this being a drug store classic from decades ago. It's an earthier and more organic take on Calvin Klein freshies, too. Alberto Morillas really has the magic touch for combining designer fragrance formulas with perfume art.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
well, the more people with the "gucci guilty is garbage" attitude, the longer some bottles of this gorgeous masculine, herbal, uplifting yet deep stuff will be available and for fair money. 9/10.
soundtrack: giorgio poi - estate.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I am a woman and our local cosmetic store put the sample of this fragrance with purchase of my perfume (guess Gucci guilty I think)

As a woman I usually prefer woody perfumes of any womens fragrances so reasonably I thought I may like but sorry 😞 I do know its for men but I think its super crisp,edgy not for everyone’s taste

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I love Gucci Guilty Absolute but I hate this one. It is truly green and medicinal! I just can't stand it. I'm selling my 150ml bottle.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I bet GGC will be discontinued soon. Simply because it doesn’t fit into context. It is and is not cologne. Pale green is exactly what it is (I have never seen such a color of perfume). The stars that shine are: at the beginning bergamot, in the center is a very special cypress (due to a pinch of powdery heliotrope) and at the end (which just lasts) an interesting musc with woods. As some note, seemingly nothing special but unique. However, this is not immediately obvious. Quality. Definitely no association to anything Gucci. Sophisticated, if not intelligent water / cologne fragrance for "niche" lovers. It lasts, it doesn't project too much (Great). So, not for fashionable Gucci folk, for sure. Even Guilty Absolute, which isn’t bad in its genre either, but despite the boldness really nothing special, isn’t as anti Gucci as this one. The last good Gucci before Cologne, as far as I'm concerned, was Envy. Save Cologne, return Envy.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: After hearing a few pleasing reviews I was quite curious to check this out because based on the notes it looks like something I would enjoy, and it is. This is a very well done classic Italian style cologne, which is no surprise considering the perfumer. I feel like the majority of people who won’t like this are just used to and don’t tend to steer from Gucci Guilty edt and Black or The One, Sauvage, Bleu de Chanel, La Nuit De L’homme, etc. more basic mass appealing frags. This is definitely unique compared to those, but not as unique in the more niche market such as Creed Viking, Nishane B-612, Roja’s Scandal or Reckless, and many, many colognes, after shaves and tonics of yesteryear. It’s sad to see this discontinued from Gucci along with Gucci Guilty Absolute and Gucci Guilty Oud considering how unique to the line they are, but from a marketing standpoint I totally understand. They are classics, but not classics of the brand. Stock up or get your hands on these gems now if you’re looking because they’ll eventually become very hard to find and fetch a pretty penny, especially Absolute.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Totally unisex perfume. It gives a weird powdery scent.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: i sold my bottle after a few years . it leaked from the factory bottle right into the box before i even opened the box up about 30% was gone which is alot since its only 3oz .. very poor quality control at gucci .. very chemical type of cologne . if this was made in the 90's before the reformulations i bet it would of been really good with natural ingredients . i just could never get into wearing it its just like a sicking candy annoying smell . i then preceded to sell the bottle before it all evaporated cause it wasn't sealed properly by the good folks at gucci factory working hard making there cheap leaking bottles .. this was sucky becouse i paid like 50 bucks for it and it evaporating before i could even use it

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I just happen to be at Sephora and saw that the bottle that they have actually has blue juice in it. I’ve had two or three bottles of this because I love it as a summer fragrance but my juices always been green. I didn’t ask the attendant if I could sample the blue juice that they had on the shelf and when I tried it I felt like there was a softer more powdery opening than the strong green/citrusy (the juniper and rosemary is less prominent) opening I get from the green colored juice. Does anyone know if this has been reformulated ????I’m assuming so I even took a picture of the blue juice on the shelf to make sure it’s BLUE the attendant had no idea what I was talking about 😳! LOL

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Million Dollar fragrance

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Superbly well made cologne (but with EDT concentration so lasts longer). Not citrus here so the vibes are even more herbal-masculine with a good amount of cypress that makes it so unique. As every distinct fragrance is not a crowd pleaser but very unique and pleasant.

As a big fan of cologne I can make some comparison with Acqua di Parma: this goes in the opposite direction: no citrus, herbal but very pleasant. Longevity is good and better than most AdP since these are Eau de Cologne and this is Eau de Toilette. It doesn't have a big projection but is a new classic, masculine barber scent.

Reasonably priced so I did buy the 150ml bottle. Price/quality for an Alberto Morillas fragrance is unbeatable. 10/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Not usually a fan of Gucci fragrances but this is a winner IMO. Slight medicinal green juice with a nice dry down of musk and cedar. I really like it just wish it lasted way longer on my skin (4 hours max). For the price and quality I would say it's a strong buy. I am sure it is available to sample in most mall stores. Enjoy!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
A great alternative to common citrusy ‘Cologne’ summer versions of other frags. The bottle and it’s color are spot on in describing the contents.

This can be a love or hate deal. For me it was the latter at first, as I sniffed it way too up close. The attention beggar molecules in the base were too harsh and obvious.

Later, when wearing this on my chest, the magic started happening. I’d get whiffs of something fresh, like a weird blue slushie drink you’d get from an American retro diner. Perhaps some fresh sour berries combined with something slightly aquatic, but not at all too much. Luckily not a calone bomb.

All in all, this turned out to be a lovable curiosity. Wearing it just might turn you into one too.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I’ll just say that being a brave or original,doesn’t necessarily means good smelling.A pass for me.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Wow, so what to say about this one? Well, I do love it, not just a like for me. The issue is, I like it because of what it intended on doing. Which is old world Italian clean charm. What does that mean.. Well, my grandfather used to wear certain fragrances that had a very medicinal minty fresh vibe, like a "gin & tonic", which makes sense with the Juniper berries, bergamot, mandarin and cypress found here. So, as I'm wearing it, I get that mental image of my grandfather dressed up conducting business and just being a commanding presence.
The longevity and projection are both good, as I get 6 to 8 hours, and just maintain a bubble around me that isn't too far reaching, but enough to reach those you walk by. Again, more than acceptable, as no one wants to be the person that you meet the fragrance before you meet the person.
I bought the 150ml bottle at a decent price of $65. My opinion, it was worth it. This is such a departure from Sauvage, Dylan Blue, and the rest of the blue fragrances that have taken over. Just as Gucci Guilty Absolute was polarizing, this is no different. You want to hate it for being different, yet love it for the exact same reason. Which is why I consider this a niche way to go for high heat fragrances. You'll get noticed and know that you're clean, but they may not be sure why they like it. Lol.
Definitely a try before you buy, but if you do, you may find it just as appealing the more you wear it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: This smells just like Gucci Sport, a blast of fruit loops on your skin, I don’t like this ,it’s more masculine than sport , but it’s virtually the same juice just remixed in 2019

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
This is a really good fragrance. This is probably my favorite of the Gucci guilty‘s for summer weather. It is a great every day summer scent. I use things like dolce and Gabbana light blue, Dylan blue and maybe even a little happy for men during the summer but this is for sure my daily go to in warm weather. It reminds me of the beautiful beaches of Malibu and the windy mountain trails and fresh breezes of Topanga! You get the perfect combination of clean and earthy without a lot 🍋 and 🧼 and the dry down is completely comforting. When I put this on I get comps out of the gate! It is unique especially the dry down. I get pretty decent longevity but do carry a small bottle of it for refresher around 2-3pm After a 8:30 application. Is it worth the money? I would say yes this is one of the few fragrances that I constantly re-purchase. I do look for opportunities to pay less for it but that’s just in my nature I do that with everything but I have never had an issue paying full price for it. I’ve been very satisfied. If you never experienced one of the Gucci guilty fragrances for men I think this would be a very good first time buy for that line. Honestly I think this has the best longevity and silage (outside of absolute and the GG Parfums) I’m such an ADD individual when it comes to fragrances I cannot consistently wear the same one every single day because I need my scents to go along with my mood and what I’m feeling for that day. But I wear this more consistently as a signature fragrance than I do anything else during the summer.
The key to its longevity, since it is a cologne, is to go heavy on the application and let it completely dry if you want it to last more than a hour or so...

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I get why this fragrance is polarizing, it's certainly not a crowd pleaser and in fact I felt a little disappointed after the first wear. I did enjoy the opening when I tested it at the store, I didn't love but I liked it and it was on sale so I went for it. First actual wear started fine, very nice opening but the dry down not so much but the damage was done and I wouldn't just leave in the back of the closet, at least I'd wear it when I stay home but after 2nd wear I paid closer attention and by the 3rd it became almost a love.

Yes, Guilty Cologne is challenging to some extend, it does have a gorgeous opening and then it turns into a baby wipe kinda smell that can be off putting at first but it's different from your average freshies and blues. The baby wipe vibe is not an actual bad thing, it does smell clean and fresh and longevity is actually real good (7hrs plus).

Overall it's a nice fragrance that falls a little bit short to become a 'love' but it is a strong 'like'

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I'm not sure why so many people dislike this frag. Its quickly become one of my favorites, one of my longest lasting frags and really unique in its style. I recommend anyone who likes more floral-sweet smelling summer fragrances. Not as cloying as some may suggest, perfect for a hot day!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Unpleasant to the point of being a 'scrubber'... I am surprised it is created by Alberto Morillas who is known for his crowd-pleasing fragrances. This is definitely not one of them.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I don’t know what it is. But I get like baby powder and florals. Something really weird on my skin. We’ll see how it unfolds

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I am surprised of the completely different feelings on this perfume; from big disappointments to praise for the beautiful scent.

I agree with the latter group of praisers, this is among the best scents I've smelled yet on my fragrance-journey.

This will surely be on high rotations this summer.

So uplifting and calm, yet one spray lasts and lasts.

Perfect spring and summer scent. It brings sunshine to cloudy, icy cold and wintery spring days like here in Norway at the moment.

Two thumbs up!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Really disapointed! Love colongnes but not this one! Weird but saddly and totaly synthetic!!! Smells plastic!!! It coud be a great launch! Gucci had forgotten its icons and only makes flankers and generics nowadays... Envy men, Nobile, Nro.3, Eau ... are saddly forgotten!!!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I first smelled this at Sephora and thought it smelled 'nice'...no big deal. I'm not a big fan of any Gucci Guilty (except Absolute), but every time I passed this at a counter, I would take a whiff. I did that so many times that I would look forward to smelling this cologne during every shopping trip.

So I finally bought a bottle. I love this stuff. It is now my favorite Guilty. I like that this is bright and fresh without being marine or citrus-heavy. The opening is slightly sweet and herbal. As it dries down on my skin, it's a powdery patchouli, but the cypress and rosemary keep it crisp the whole way through. I cannot think of a situation or season that would not work with this scent. I love Gucci Guilty Cologne...one of my new favorites.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I had high hopes for this one but nope, I hate this smell. Something so awkward and off putting in it. Till now none of the Gucci fragrances appeal to me to be honest. A big pass from my side.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
The score is creeping up on this as people who’ve actually spent time with it are leaving their reviews!

Could be a cult classic in the making like Absolute. It is as interesting as Absolute but far more versatile and wearable.

Currently my number 1 go to. It is a perfect spring and cooler Summer day scent, leaving the citrus’ for hotter summer days.

Best ‘designer’ I currently own!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: This is so unique and different it gets a lower rating than deserved. Green, cold, fresh, gentlemanly and smart.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Stealth Fragrance.

Massively Underated.

I sampled this in Boots (uk) 6 months ago and was completely disinterested. Sprayed on to a sample strip and asked a female colleague what she thought and she said it smelled like deodorant.


Months later, I sampled in Hanover Airport and on the back of that ordered a couple of tester vials.

Wow.....,,This is presently my go to ‘dumb reach’. Fresh, Clean, unique, Minty (controlled and softened....not a toothpaste mint).

I love this yet I don’t know why? It’s not incredibly nuanced or different, yet I find it so fresh and clean without resorting to the ‘blue and generic’ approach of so many others.

Like I said at the beginning, this is a stealth fragrance, a true grower and currently my Number 1!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
7/10- Minty Summer.

This is yet another unique freshie release from the guilty line, this one is a very minty camphor-like smelling freshie with no citruses or massive soap in its composition. The heliotrope at the top smoothes the mintiness till it tames down, a beautiful dumb reach clean fragrance for summer.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Okay, this is a pretty strange one... Kudos for ingenuity and originality

The hair dresser saloon from the advertisements actually seems like a good choose that captures the scent visually. Not masculine at all! Neither is the scent.

The scent is so strange. But it actually smells like hair products - it's especially the chemical smell of hair coloring that comes to my mind. Not pleasant at all, but strange...

The actual scent is a dislike, but it makes me curious, at least.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
A very nice and unique fragrance. Old school and very modern at the same time. Well dressed italian gentleman spraying this on early in the morning before heading into the city. Great job Gucci...I can see this becoming a cult classic.

8.5/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
This is such a weird, cool fragrance. I like to preface all of my comments on originality by saying "If you are in your 30's, and didn't grow up in the...," but this smells original even next to old powerhouses and old school colognes. It's strange in an 80's sort of way, but it doesn't smell like an 80's cologne.

Shout out to Gucci. My wife loves the Bloom line--and I love smelling her in it--and since Absolute, this house makes interesting fragrances that really do smell great.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: This is a one of a kind in my collection. Didnt like it when tested in store. But couldn't get it out of my mind because it's very unique. Still bought it, and it grew on me, then it took over. It's cold and the dense fresh unique smell made it stand out from all my other winter scent. My wife and daughter also love it. Great longevity and good projection. Big thumbs up.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Gucci guilty cologne smells like a strong laundry detergent when first applied. It’s just alright, nothing different, but the dry down is a bit softer and the green notes become more prominent.

Your average Joe will probably enjoy this fragrance, but it’s not for people who want something a bit more unique.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Gucci Guilty Cologne’s reception seems to be lukewarm overall, and while I can understand the bar being set fairly high by the three prior releases of 2017 and 2018—Guilty Absolute Pour Homme / Pour Femme and Guilty Oud—and I agree with some that find there to be a sort of calone-like prominence that makes for a very sharp marine vibe..

However, I don’t find Gucci Guilty Cologne to be synthetic or general to the point of being unenjoyable—quite the opposite, as I really enjoy it, though I do have a little bit of difficulty describing it. It smells mainly of bergamot, cypress, violet, and, as mentioned before, a bit of a calone vibe, though no such note is listed.

Overall, it’s fresh, but quite sharp, and I imagine that’s what turns some people off to it, but that it’s a bit biting is part of what makes it interesting to me, perhaps not quite as inoffensive as its cologne name suggests. It performs pretty well but not anything outstanding—it’s loud during its opening couple of hours and then fades fairly quickly into a skin scent. It’s a nice option for casual or daytime summer wearing, in my opinion.

As with the retail pricing of the other beloved Gucci Guilty offerings, Cologne’s pricing of $95 for 90ml / $75 for 50ml is a reasonably tough sell, even tougher than the bolder, stronger Absolutes and Oud, so this would need to be a discount, grey market, or p2p type of sale. Still, I’m happy I blind bought it.

7 out of 10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: It's a first fresh fragrance in a long time that doesn't smell to me like a cleaning product. Actually, I find it quite pleasant and a bit intriguing. Is Gucci trying to turn Guilty into a line of polarising, unapologetic frags? I certainly hope so. I'm definitely buying this next spring.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I was dying to smell what the buZZ was about :

" Sigh " is this considered exciting these days ? Thank God I have at least 3 signatures now.

Musky , Fruity , Synthetic (ANY PRODUCT) fragrance . Borderline cleaning product air freshener smell.

Great performance for a cologne. I forgot I tried it this afternoon and now at 8;45pm I still smell it. Been getting whiffs all day long.

Really though such an infantile immature smell I couldn't possibly recommend this to anyone.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Just picked up a 1.6 at Sephora and after returning to the office and trying on my wrist, I wish I had gotten the large bottle. Underrated with a score of 3.13. Super clean with no prominent citrus notes (a great thing). Will be great as summer winds down and we head into fall.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Opening is pretty harsh and synthetic. I do not like it. Drydown isn't that bad. A fresh powdery, almost laundry linen smell.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Is this the best Gucci could come up with? Smells like a salty calone smell. Spare your money and look somewhere else.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
This should have 100% be a stand alone new fragrance release from Gucci and not a flanker. It is so unique, so pleasent, so different, i like it a lot.

The violet, the cypress and the rosemary with heliotrope and juniper berries create a vibe hard to explain. Some said it smells somewhat medicinal and I can see that. I find the vibe it gives being a gentle metallic, with a little sweetness (probably from patchouli) and some greenness, but both the sweetness and greenness are one with the gentle metallic smell, not on their own (this is very well blended).

It does give a fresh vibe when you wear it, but don't think about citrus or floral or herbal freshness, it is a... well, metallic freshness for me. Just try this and you will smell it too.

If this DNA gets popular and people accept it, I am sure many other houses will go this way in the future.

Edit: I tried this for the 3rd time on skin and I was blown away... Why? First 2 times it lasted for about 7 hours on the skin cause I had to go to sleep one time and the other time I had to take a shower. The 3rd time I sprayed it 2 times on the forearm at 14:30. I went to bed at 2 and I could still smell it... WTF??!!??. And don't think about some leftover generic "I sprayed something here" scent. I could 100% feel Gucci Cologne on my forearm. Maybe it's my skin, I don't now how it manages to last so long on my skin, but I am buying this tomorrow. It already made it to discounters, I will get the 90ml for 56$.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Not a bad fragrance. Must like juniper and rosemary. For a general idea of what this smells like, imagine Pure Shot by Mugler mixed with L'eau Bleue d'Issey Miyake.

The above is an approximation as I get more patchouli than others. I think performance and sillage are average.

While I don't love it, I didn't dislike it. I'm glad overall for the direction the Gucci Guilty is going. Absolute was a home run for me...this one is just a single.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
It just struck me, this is closer to the drydown I was expecting Silver Mountain Water to deliver - it is fantastic.

This has me almost ready to throw SMW in the "to sell" pile. The drydown is herbal, mildly green, semi-sweet, woody and astringent, it does everything that I like in SMW just much, much better.

I'm guessing the violet is driving most of what I like about that drydown - it's to me the best floral note for men's fragrances (sorry Lavender, I still like you though). It's brings its own earthy woodiness with its subtle floral contributions.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Oooooo sooo nice.. and quite unique.. its not generic like most said.. last long on my skin.. project moderate for 2 hours and become almost a skin scent for 8 hours.. when i type this review holding my phone i can still smell the fragrance that i sprayed 8 hours ago at the back of my hand.. still a safe fresh scent but not that typical.. open with citrusy freshness with some herbal minty quality even no mint in the notes pyramid.. it then turns slightly sweet and musky.. it stays dat way until the life of the fragrance.. i recommend anyone to test it on skin.. its very2 good..

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Guilty Cologne is a fresh aromatic woods. The fragrance opens with an aqueous cocktail accord based on juniper berry. The aroma is mildly sour, with a subtle sting and abrasive texture. It has a mellow feel to it—and is a bit enjoyable to my tastes.

Naturally, anyone over-familiar with fragrance crafting would think that this is a take on a gin essence—and with that—that this was intended to be marketed to the British. Smashing. Can't say it entirely has that feel though.

The opening sets somewhat of a stylish, mature tone, from which the woods (cypress and juniper) begin to step out onto the front-line. This presence increases the mature tone a lot, but the aroma retains this cool and composed oversoul to it.

I find this fragrance to be very neutral toned overall. Light and breezy; non-offensive. Fresh—and subtly stimulating. With its qualities, it strongly feels like a fragrance that would be perfect for the office. However, something else about it feels like this was intended for gays. I'm trying as hard as I can to be optimistic about it.

I would have said they're trolling in the first place by calling it a "cologne"—yet it has no citrus in it whatsoever. You simply can't do by Italian heritage. I don't find that this has an entirely a bad style though. It feels very new age—like a Neo-style take on the Cologne style. Very artistic. Nice technique.

Not a bad fragrance by any means at all. Very short, sweet, and to the point. It obviously sets out to capture a certain essence-in-style and does so simply, and very well. It's elegant—in much respect. Easy to wear, easy to enjoy. For those who can behold it, an easy daily driver; with plenty of room for fun (to blend up to your higher expectations or tastes).

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Like the cyan shade of its liquid – neither blue nor green but something in between – Gucci’s new Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme treads the line between aromatic and woody genres without ever stepping into either.

Bergamot, a very astringent juniper, and rosemary open the composition in a bracingly fresh accord that comes across almost medicinal – a quirk not dissimilar to the opening of Gucci Guilty Absolute. It’s in the heart though that Gucci Guilty Cologne really shines as the green freshness of cypress marries the sweet (but not candied) powderiness of violets and smooth creaminess of heliotrope, carrying through and eventually coming to contrast the rather raspy base of cedar and ice-cold patchouli.

Befitting the Guilty line, this is a rather daring release from Gucci but one I expect will prove quite popular as a sort of avant-garde masculine.

Longevity is good at 6-8 hours, though sillage is rather soft.

6.5/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Honestly, I don't understand the extreme reactions people are having to this. This is in a similar dimension to Zegna's Florentine Iris. They don't really smell alike, but where the Zegna plays out like iris and violet battling for dominance over jasmine, this is heliotrope and violet becoming best friends over gin. The musk is actually surprisingly warm and human in this which is a really nice surprise. It is sweet, but in a very aromatic, fresh kind of way. I love it!

I just tried layering this with Absolute and they really compliment each other well. Cologne adds sweetness and freshness to Absolute's black heart. I wonder if this was intentional

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I thought this would be a slam dunk for me as I love rosemary and juniper berries. Not the case here sad to say. Instead of being bitter/fresh as I expected, this is strangely ocenanic and sweet. To top if off I detect a weird gingerbread spice way in the background which is rather unpleasant. Smells like those cheap generic men's colognes you see at TJ Maxx. Sorry Gucci, but you blew this one. Thumbs way down for me.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I was introduced in the department store due to being new and was to be compared with a new Hugo Boss fragrance. The Hugo Boss sample smell was generic, but I liked this one - in the first few minutes I could detect a sharp minty, spearmint freshness. This could be from the juniper berries and spanish cypress. I don't know what heliotrope smells like so cannot comment on that. I don't get the violet - which to me is a good thing. It's also not sweet - which is good too.

UPDATE: Wore it today, and noticed a masculine smokiness and then I could almost smell the fruity smell of the juniper berries - that's with the minty-freshness. Then you may start to pick up a well-blended white musk. This is a new take on a clean long-lasting top-note without the typical reliance on the citrus theme. Innovative, clean, refreshing and uplifting!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: In the drydown smells like nivea cream. Not worth it guys;-)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Allow me to start with the positives here this is not just a cookie cutter, eau de cologne freshie. Nor is it the ultimately bland aroma chemical mess of a eros or Invictus, some small merciful praise can be bestowed upon Gucci Guilty Cologne for this fact.
Gucci had really turned a corner injecting life into this Guilty line with the divisive release Guilty Absolute (Men's one) which people either found to be a blissfully animalic leather or an inept, antiseptic, nightmare. Stranger still that it had come from the nose of Alberto Morillas, and this one does too, with the use of a note/accord seldom found in men's designer perfumes and that's Heliotrope. All this sets us up for an interesting fragrance and cologne is not without that merit let's just let it have this credit, before I rip it to shreds!
So the opening is actually very fresh, truly aquatic, fresh a bit salty but with a steady decent into more floral territory. This is that violet leaf, dry ionones sort of tinge but if this was a violet fragrance I expect I would like it. I sampled this without prior knowledge of the notes and I KNEW there was heliotrope in here....I couldn't place the name and kept saying Angelica no...mimosa, no....artemisia no....what is it?? I knew what I meant and seeing it here just validates how prominent it is in this fragrance.
Three stages are... unusual fresh, seaside floral opening, into a heart that is almost a scrubber, it's that bad. Let me just say that this could be a taste thing on my part but I found it really sour and unpleasant combination. Then when nearly dead and settled right the way down comes a woody, synthetic aroma chemical heaven of timbersilk, clearwood, synth ambers? and like that.....all is well.
Too little, too late and overall I have to say I plain dislike this fragrance and would never wear it, categorising it as a stinker.
Just let me highlight once again that this was not a failure for any of the reasons I thought it might be, and I respect that Gucci and Morillas have tried somewhat to follow suit from the barnstorming Absolute, with something different. It fails because perfume like this should be at the least pleasant for all it's challenges and this wasn't to me. Sorry it just wasn't.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: TERRIBLE! The pleasing hue lured me; the smell eww'ed me. Another person smelled it too and agreed it was gross...glad I didn't buy! Coty true colors...smelled like cheap floor cleaner at best.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Cypress and juniper fresh opening, with a foggy/musky heliotrope drydown, giving an impression of "baby diapers". Actually, it's a hard scent to describe, because heliotrope is the main player here, which smell may be unfamiliar to most of us, so try before you buy! Average performance.

Creativity at its best, surprising both from Morillas (a perfumer that used to be more focused on commercial success than creativity in the last 15-20 years), as well as from Gucci (who recently got out of a 10-year creative desert with Gucci Guilty Absolute.... inspired, if not copied from Terenzi's Ursa, but that's a different discussion...)

Unlike GGA, it's not a love at first sniff. I like, but not sure I could pull it off, as I'm not sure it would fit my personality... will have to waer it again before thinking at a full bottle. But for sure, I have to admit that it's really a new kind of masculine floral, very unique, that Gucci has issued here. Great job!

Spring days, 25+

Edit: 2 years later, I bought a bottle. On my skin, it's way more juniper/cypress forward than florals. In the base, it's a musky wood acccord, the violet and heliotrope, while noticeable, are more toned-down compared to the paper strip test.
This is 'digital cypress v2.0'. Again, very original, unique, but it definitely feels synthetic. I now love it, but this is absolutely not a safe blind buy.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Rosemary and white musk with a dash of lime, slight heliotrope smoothed out by cypress and nootka in denatured alcohol. Very light, very forgettable, rubbery in a way, meh...

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Not a massive fan of this but all of the Guilty frags are pretty polarizing so its down to your tastes.

Decent performance, popped into Boots today sprayed two sprays to the wrist, been getting wafts for hours later and then went to gym, work out, shower, spa, sauna another shower its still at the very least a strong skin scent.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Gucci knows better.. I respect the uniqueness of this & boldness that Gucci chose to release something new & unexpected & agreed its very different if you're tired of the same ol same ol .. but this smells just so odd like soapy dirt on me.. love everything down to the color of the bottle.. but the juice.. sorry Gucci hard pass!.. not for me, but I'm sure someone else might really enjoy this. Hate to say but I can see this being discontinued sooner then later.. the women's is pure heaven though!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Flowery Windex....but I like it!!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Sampling today good!! But I think Zegna uomo does it better!! Gucci guilty cologne is very short projection but with longetive!! Zegna Uomo is more Italian cologne!!its cheaper projects better and even smells better!!! I'm just bummed cause I love absolutley pour homme & femme even the oud!!!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Finally, a groundbreaking cologne. This is polarising when looking at the votes. This is what all new creations get in the beginning. I love that Morillas did this and it is so refreshing. It smells almost bug spray. Very strong and old world perfume like. If you are sick of acquas, cinnamom gourmands and the blue ambergrises, get your nose on this odd composition. It might be the only real new experience in the designer fragrance since Le Male came out.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
[Guilty Cologne Pour Homme]
⚫️⚫️⚪️⚪️⚪️

TONIC - HERBAL - VINEGAR

I’ve bought a bottle and have been trying my absolute hardest to like this one. It’s taking every fibre of my being however I just cannot appreciate it. The opening as fruity, a bit minty and absolutely to die for, however for the next 2 hours I get a dry and almost malt vinegar tone. I had really high hopes for this one as the bottle/design is gorgeous and the reviews were promising however I cannot get past the vinegar note I’m picking up on. Such a shame as I appreciate Gucci’s guts in creating interesting fragrances.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Agree with others who say they get a distinct "diaper" smell from this. Not a dirty diaper of course, but a smell akin to baby wipes.

The scent is not horrible, but not something I was wowed by, or would ever wear again. To me, the slightly sweet accord clashed with the rest of the fragrance, and not in a desirable way.

I'm quite disappointed, as I thought I would have really loved this fragrance, judging by the note breakdown.

4/10.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: @yahnicash- Lol! I swear I thought the same exact thing about this fragrance! Crazy. I was traveling and stopped by a Macy’s and sprayed on my hand then hit the road.
