The first 5 - 10 minutes was different, minty fresh. Then the diaper isle at the store from then on. Great fragrance, for a baby.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
A 12 year old girl just told she smelled diaper/baby wipes upon entering a room that I just liberally sprayed about 2 ml sample of this on me. I’m not sure what to make of that. I later confirmed that it was definitely the cologne she was smelling. I asked her mom a couple hours later that if she thought this cologne smelled nice? And do you think it smells like diapers or whatever? She answered yes, it does smell like huggies or wipes.

Ever feel like you just can’t win at this cologne game?

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: IMO...This has got to be hands down the worst smelling men’s fragrance I have ever smelled. It’s a shame because back in the day Gucci Nobile & Envy were a couple of my all time favorites.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Heliotrope city!
The cypress rounds it out to make it masculine. A new spin on a “old timey” style fragrance.
Very nice!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I just received my bottle today, I absolutely love this fragrance! Very fresh, with a hint of sweetness.

I love the use of cypress and juniper berries. They blend very nicely with the woods and white musks.

Overall, another beautiful release by Gucci!

9/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
GGC is a lovely flanker and is all about the dry-down which has a high-end designer scent character. The top and mid notes also smell lovely. But may smell unappealing to those that have limited experience wearing niche/indie/premium fragrances. Patience is key with GGC...you will start to appreciate and enjoy GGC once you start entering the 2 hour mark which is when all the notes start to smooth out and play in harmony with each other.


GGC has an earthy, vetiver, iris, aquatic and fresh sort of concocted smell. I was surprised to realize that GGC smells similar to Bleu de Chanel without the citrus notes, and shares a slight resemblance to Alien Man with toned down incense/resinous notes. Consequently, GGC is excellent for both professional, casual, and night-out wear and is ideal for the spring and summer seasons.

Overall: 8/10 (Scent)
Performance/Projection: 6/10 (Gucci should've used an oil rich EDP formulation)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: This is marvellous! Suncream! It isn't pour homme, it's pour moi!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I must say this smells fantastic ! Fresh and with some depth..I would defintely see one of my sons wearing this..it is modern, I see more a young guy wearing this, it is rounded, no harshness or spiciness, it has the typical Morillas light touch, so nicely done...Not like a deep rich scent, This is a fresh casual yer unique cologne, it isn't like your typical masculine fragrance..but a very nordic refreshing one.would be ideal to wear in warm weather, on the one to take on a trip...i think I will bring it to my son when I go to Paris this summer !

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Classic worthy. Smells strange on initial spray and skin contact. After 10 mins take a sniff again and you get a Fresh Green Mediterranean scent. Fresh out the barbershop with a clean hair cut. Very sporty casual vibe. One person I spoke with said it smells medicinal. The next 3 said it smells good and fresh after the settle in. It’s a good blend because I only get a breezy cypress and a faintviolet. This definitely smells completely different from the usual generic guilty. They best description basically it’s a fresh wind breeze of cypress that you get when your near the beach coast in Italy. Reminds me of ADP Cipresso and Bottega Veneta Parco Cypress. I would buy this before the other guilty stuff anytime.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Too the people who says this is not MASS APPEALING. you are crazy! this smells so good. like a fresh a little sweet edible soap.. by no means an gourmand fragrances.. i just sprayed it on my hand. not the best projection and longevity. but dont care. too good!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
It has the twist you can expect from Morillas.

Instant hit. Ignore the comments and try it at a boutique.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Great composition, abismal performance, sadly. Two hours and it is a skin scent, even overspraying does absolutely nothing.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Odd. The rating is low but the comments are glowing. Going to have to smell this!

Edit: Smells herbal but far too near to a bathroom air freshener.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Beautiful composition. It’s fresh, soapy and floral, but still manages to smell modern. Definitely part of the “new” Guilty line, sitting along Absolute and Absolute pour femme. Glad to see a mainstream house releasing interesting scents that don’t follow the pedestrian trends every other major designer house is. Bravo to Alessandro Michele.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Green herbal powdery white musk. Daring in a good sense. What Mugler Alien man could have been. Only the harsh opening 8.5/10. Might unfortunately be a trendsetter. But first everybody is going to do something with Sun/Sand.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
first impression:

i tried yesterday in a store and im pretty impressed and im considering to buy. it's one of the bravest fresh cologne ever. it's something completely different from the other fragrances on the current market. the opening is a blast floral, then the patchuli and soapy notes are definitely stronger. u can also detect musk and cypress.i think many will hate this release but for me is very interesting, it has a strange manliness inside. maybe im saying something completely wrong, but i consider this the wild, aggressive version of prada infusion d'homme, especially in the opening. they are not identical but have something in common like the floral notes. the one from prada is more gentle and natural for sure.
i prefer gucci cologne to the absolute version, which smells like old shoes. absolutely try before buy.
strano, accattivante, da provare.

for now is an 8/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Wow! This fragrance is actually really good! Definitely not what I was expecting but I'm happy about that. Very modern and not your average designer spring/summer fragrance. Where most are all citrus and aquatic, This cologne is floral and woodsy. This one really reminds me of Dior Homme, but not in smell rather in genre. The more floral, soapy and woodsy with be a nice change and make you standout from all the other heavy citrus and aquatics this summer. Like Dior Homme this one opens with a pungent almost medical citrus smell, I'm assuming from the bergamot but that dissipates in seconds and the florals takeover. The Heliotrope is centerstage in the fragrance and again like Dior Homme gives a really nice soapy/powdery scent with a little little spice from the rosemary I'm guessing. From there the scent remains this soft clean floral with a warm base and the scent stays this way for most of the duration until maybe around the 4 hour mark and then the woods and patchouli completely takes over and finish off the night. And honestly the woods is really what made me a fan of this fragrance. The warm cypress with the patchouli gives this a animalic, balsamic aroma that almost comes off as a cleaner more musky Oud. This fragrance is label a cologne but the opening is pretty wide and comes off more like a edt but once it dries down it becomes very soft which I'm sure others will confuse the performance with being weak but I think this is a A+ fragrance from the house of Gucci and another one of those fragrances pushing the boundaries and starting conversation of what men fragrance can be just like Gucci Guilty Absolute, this one belongs in my collection.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
The opening is a bit medicinal, very herbaceous, nauseatic - a bit peppery and kinda' like menthol? After half an hour changes into herbal soap. Nothing pungent nor off-putting. Rather clean and safe. Boring as well - I would say.

After 2 hours sticks very close to the skin and stays there.

At least doesn't smell chemical.

So far I'm dissapointed but I'll give it a chance in hot humid days - it might be cooling on the skin.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: A balsamic-very pungent edt.no Cologne.great performance. Many floral and Woody. Good for all year. But not for my taste. Not sport,but casual and elegant.7/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
beware this is a risky fragrance !! No safe at all .. do not blind buy..
Very very dry,soapy acrid , astringent, detergent insect repellent Vibe !!! I do not say that it is bad but a is a very particular fragrance ,if you are looking for a safe fragrance for summer this is not... you might not like it.....do not expect the typical fresh summer fragrance!!! reminds me a little Infusion d'Homme Prada for men

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: A very novel structure with powdery violet and heliotrope placed over acerbic, astringent juniper and cypress. The base seems to be a particularly cold patchouli base and overall there's a vague insect repellent sensation but in a good way like with Fierce by Abercrombie and Fitch. Not particularly complicated but strong for a "cologne".

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Can't wait!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
a different colony that is based not only on citrus, but above all on aromatic notes.
different and innovative.
I'll have to test it again on the skin and not on the paper to evaluate its performance. being a colony I do not expect great performance. perhaps excellent for everyday use for gentlemen.
I will update you.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Wow the colour of that bottle is stunning! A welcomed change for the usual blue/white/green theme of other masculine freshies. I hope this will be an icy patchouli similar to Moschino Forever Sailing!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: That bottle is (or juice rather) absolutely stunning! Alberto is hitting hard this year with releases. Looking forward to trying this one out. After a successful blind buy last year with Absolute, this cologne release, is definitely high on my radar. Sounds perfect for spring! Will be hunting this one down!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Can't wait to try this!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I think everyone has to realize that when fragrance houses release flankers there should be a expectation that they’re not going to necessary smell like it’s from the same vain as the original DNA would suggest. It’s just the way it’s been going lately.
I suggest smelling it on it’s own merits and then make a judgment.
In regards to this fragrance, I’m looking forward to getting my nose on it (-as with pretty much any new release!)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Cologne Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I have long since written off Gucci as a perfume house, but I've gotta say I find the color of the juice really cool...I was expecting something predominantly mint, but I guess I was wrong.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content: A very synthetic play on purple florals. I should love this and honestly, I hate when people bitch about synthetics, but, here, I get it. I should love this, it has some of my favorite notes with no other filler and my purple florals should be sparkling and coming to life, however, because of the quality of the notes here, it doesn't smell like a pure purple floral. It doesn't really smell like violets and iris, I do get violet leaf and maybe some orris. Mostly I get a musky perfume, like a white musk with synthetic violet, orris, violet leaf and red berries. If you don't like purple florals, I think you could still wear this. These gucci perfumes may smell nice but I don't know WTH I'm smelling in any of them. It's a very non-descript, generic floral. After about 5-10 minutes I also get a soapiness. Clean, fresh, artificial iris and violet.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content: This is a really lovely violet scent! It's soft and powdery, with just the right amount of sweetness. I get a lot of compliments when I wear it.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content: It has taken me a long time to warm up to this scent but I can finally say I like it. I received it in a swap some time ago and wasn't impressed. I wouldn't go out searching for this perfume or spend money to buy it but I can appreciate it for what it is. It's a very delicate, sweet violet scent that sits relatively close to the skin and doesn't change much. I don't get any suede whatsoever, this is a sweet floral violet through and through. It runs in the same vein as Ellis Brooklyn Myth and Mon Guerlain, both of which I also classify as "kind of boring but kind of interesting and very pretty" scents. It's almost like these perfumes are giving you just enough to want to keep coming back. I don't know how to explain it very well, but I'm sure someone out there understands what I'm trying to articulate. This scent perfectly embodies the color violet imo, or even a periwinkle blue. It's fragile, light, and pretty. A perfume for Cinderella. Lasting power is surprisingly good with this. I've only worn this a few times out of the house but I don't need to respray throughout the day, as I still get whiffs of it while I'm moving. If you want to smell like a delicate pastel purple princess that speaks the language of flowers and animals try this.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content: This one smells sooo similar to pure seduction! After the first spray, I can get the iris and floral notes but after that, I swear this one smells just like VS pure seduction.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content: Finally! A pretty, candied violet scent that doesn’t smell earthy and dry. Violet scents are a real hit or miss and this one is a hit for me. Yes, the Violet note isn’t as potent as it is in others but at least you get the sentiment and it smells feminine and pretty. I could always layer this with a stronger violet scent like The Virgin Violet for more violet oomph but all in all I’m very happy with this one. The bottle is also gorgeous.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content: Very powdery, subtly sweet and comforting fragrance. It smells soft and intimate.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content: For me, there's something curious, and often frustrating, about this fragrance. I've worn it at times for nearly a year now, and it never smells the same twice. It has smelled like berries, powdery, white floral, iris, tea rose, even woody, but not often all at once or in combination. I can catch a strong violet for a moment, and sometimes not at all. I don't dislike it but it's not consistently good for me.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content: Most beautiful iris and rose combination, smooth leather, and invigorating aldehydes. On me, one day it works as a leather perfume, bold and strong, another day it is the most sweet, sexy, fluffy powdery iris, next day it's a dewy rose, innocent and intoxicating, and so on. Such a versatile, refined, powdery, leathery, chic scent. High silage and long-lasting longevity. Classic fragrance! Edgy! Sexy!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content: Gorgeous!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content:
بنفشه جان در اوج لطافت
-----------
Scent & Quality: 9/10
Longevity: 8/10
Sillage: 6/10
Creativity & Uniqueness: 6/10
Affordability: 6/10
-----------
Overall: 7/10

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content: I love it! I was looking for a nice soft violet and this is it! Longevity a bit weak but that is ok.a safe blind buy

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content: I was looking for a fragrance that would remind me of Borsari’s Violetta di Parma. I read the notes of this and did a blind buy. I immediately regretted the purchase. To my nose it smelled like cheap bathroom freshener, and I could not wait to wash it off of my skin. This is not a pleasant nostalgic violet, not powdery, nor green. It smells like a bad Glade bathroom spray.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content: Absolutely, 100 percent in love with this delightful handful of powdery soft spring time violets and thanks to my wonderful friend Xrayer, am now the proud owner of this beauty. I don't even know exactly what it is about the scent of violets that makes my heart sing but this bottle is the embodiment of the little dark purple flowers and to me, of springtime. I agree with other reviewers that it's reminiscent of Insolence but this is far more wearable for me just personally - this is delicately tender, uplifting, wistful, yet a little daring and I love, love, love it!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content: My latest obsession from the line of non offensive powdery and lively perfumes. The ones who love MFK a la Rose or l’eau a la Rose, Gucci Generous Violet is the same mood and vibe but with a Violet flower. In fact, wondering why MFK hasn’t come up with a Violet scent so far. Such a happy smiling Violet with a tingling champagne lightness. I really placed the bottle next to MFK aLa Rose and Dior Rose n’Roses because those 3 are the in the same light and easy mood territory. My absolute love for this Violet.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content: Not a fan of Gucci flora flankers at all, but I like this one. Sweet, fruity and fresh; not too sweet, fruity nor fresh; and not just sweet, fruity or fresh. It's a favored warmth in the heart of a lovely flower on the ground, echoing the flourishing springtime.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content:
Tiny little buds of the fragile fragrant violet.
Upon buying this perfume I did not expect it to be so sweet. I would have perhaps preferred a more realistic, green bloom. Instead Generous Violet smells a lot like lipstick, somewhat like Lipstick Rose by Frederic Malle. This perfume is cute, if a fragrance can be called that, innocent and inspiring. It smells like hope in the morning. It does indeed smell like the color purple. Quite a safe buy, will definitely be liked by the majority of people and will definitely uplift your spirits. Generously so.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content:
One of the fragrances that I rediscover, over and over again. Each time I wear it, I get another new side of it. I believe that translates to complexity, a little bit unusual for a fragrance with rather few notes. It's violet, it's purple, it's mauve, it's baby blue and white, and soon after is crispy green.

Amazing mix of violet leaf, iris, lilly of the valey, violets and orris. At first it can be missleading by sharp, smashed green leaves opening, but it settles soon into a beautiful powdery orris note. A Holy Grail for me, as I declare myself a big iris lover. It has rewarded me lots of compliments and devotion, because it's very long lasting. Especially in cold temperature.
If you don't like iris or violet, it could be a mistake. If you love these two notes, this is a must try!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content:
pretty
like smelling the little pruple flowers
a touch of gentle pepper
rounded
dewey powder

this goes a bit creamier but maintains the lovely powdery floral feel,
gorgeous sillage

i found this a little dry in the warmer weather but its now winter and this is performing great.

i see as im typing this that parisienne and guerlain insolence are perhaps similar - i can understand that - guerlain is drier on me absolutely, parisienne... im going on memory only, perhaps a general relative...

EDIT this also reminds me of another from this line; tuberose with the blue juice. right now the Violet Flora is a dusky creamy sweet airy dry down.
(could this be similar to vera wang princess i ask myself?)

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content: :)Instantly smells like guerlain insolence and guerlain rosa pop! That was the main reason why I purchased this gucci violets. I was in love with the powdery violet scent I got from the two guerlain fragrances. Also a bit of paco rabanne ultraviolet without the pepper. And this was spot on. If you love violets or anything powdery this will make your day. Perfect for summer weather. I get about 4 hours on on my clothes and hair.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content:
I don’t normally seek out Gucci fragrances, they’re not my style. However, I was on a violet trip and I thought I would give this fragrance a go. I have to say I am reasonably satisfied with my purchase. I don’t think it’s got a lot of backbone, but it’s very pretty, in a spring time soft violet kind of way.

I think labelling this as ‘generous’ violet shows a distinctly ambitious view of the product, unless of course the marketing department decided to inject a sense of irony into the label. However, longevity...about 10 hours!

Nice office scent though, and compared to the absolutely vile blind buy I made along with this one, it’s saved the day. I can’t even begin to describe the other one...I won’t be naming it because I have to sell it first...after that, it will be all guns blazing.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content: Usually I don't like Gucci fragrances, but the color and packaging made me curious (that's marketing for you). At first it was sharp and alcoholic, then developed into something similar to Tresor Midnight Rose, but with far less sweetness. Or perhaps like a more expensive Lanvin Couture, sour, but with a more powdery finish. In any case, I quite like it and think that I need something like this in my wardrobe. Still haven't decided if this will be the one, though.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content:
As a violet lover this is an easy grab and go perfume for me. It is not my favourite violet scent by any means, but it is a cute and very wearable little number.

I have owned or tried all of the Gucci Flora flankers and this one is my second best. I like Gorgeous Gardenia the most but they are all nice easy florals for every day use.

Violet is by far the strongest note, but I do smell both the iris and the suede quite well. I do like the suede, it gives the fragrance a bit of an interesting twist I think. The drydown is a bit more powdery and sweet, but pleasant. I would describe it as a innocent and cute spring scent.

Longevity is medium on me at least.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content: The other day I purchased a five pack mini bottle gift set of the Gucci Flora scents. So I was really hoeful about this one. It sounded so lover aaaaaaaand wow was I disappointed. This one is hands down just gross. It reminds me of some weird smelling cleaning product. So sad!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content: Simple violet scent....if you like this flower is ok, but I get a very alcholic note which I don't like, that makes me think of spirits (distilled)...maybe it's the suede?!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content:
Interesting).big yellow roses , black tea at glass mug .summer quet garden.candied roses and sugar powder.some white suede . maybe gloves.

And where is the violet at this perfume?:)


Nice safe elegant fragrance.close to skin.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content: A sensual and sweet violet perfume, a little deeper and more mature than april violets by yardley. Can defenatly smell the suede base, blended with candied violet. Stunning!

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content:
This is a nice entry-level violet + iris scent that feels very modern.

While violets can feel "old lady", cosmetic-like, or dense and candyish, Generous Violet uses the powdery flower in the softest way possible. I smell a tang of watery green apple in the opening, which dissipates and is replaced by powdery floral sweetness. A cooling aspect from the iris and orris root is present throughout the duration of the composition, but like the violet, it is used in an "easy" way - not too steely, melancholy or cold, but cool and soothing instead, like resting under the shade of a big, beautiful tree. The suede note seems to function as a "blur tool" so no one note dominates.

I wore this while walking around my college campus recently - the building is all concrete with jutting, modern architecture. This scent fit the cool grays of the campus and the studious, deliberate way I was feeling. A nice little scent, especially for the cool, sunny days of Spring and Fall.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content:
For me Generous Violet opens with an initial note of crisp white musk, before moving into a nice, light, dry tea rose. In the dry down, iris and a touch of soap. Very soft, no sillage.

Where are the violets?

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content:
First off, I don't understand why the violet is generous. That said, I liked this fragrance very much.

Initially I get a bit of iris, and within a minute the violet comes through and starts to dominate the fragrance. The powdery aspect gathers steam with time as well, and I suspect that if you don't like powdery fragrances you may recoil in horror. There is nothing "wet" about this violet - it's all powdery and very Victorian to my nose. There is a hint of sweetness. Lasting power is acceptable, and it stays quite close to the skin. In the battle of the violets, I greatly prefer Penhaligon's Violetta and will stick to that for the moment. But who am I kidding! I will probably acquire this violet as well (in a moment of weakness, of course).

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content:
Great. I constantly got compliments. Soft and clean. The other comment that described it as "soapy" is pretty accurate. Soapy in a soft perfume way.

I'm very afraid that Gucci is going to discontinue this.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content: Nicely sweet and somewhat juicy fruity at first; almost like blackcurrent, but it quickly becomes "very" powdery. It's so clean, soft but strong at the same time for being so powdery. The suede gives a very subtle masculine touch and I like that. One spritz on my neck and it lasts about 8-9 hours on me and it rarely happens that a scent lasts this long. All Floras by Gucci are pretty awesome. I may attempt to acquire them all.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content:
Beautiful, fresh violet & iris scent, mysterious, ladylike and quite gentle. I like it very much! It is ozonic and aquatic, perfect for warm season.
Usually violet scents are too powdery to my nose, so I am so happy that it wasn't this time!

Update: I've tested it again and yes, it is very nice, but I think that there is too much iris in this scent.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content:
It has indeed a watery vibe, it is a nice violet scent, not the best, at least a fresh floral, feminine, nothing extraordinary ,but light and definitely airy!!
It isn't my favorite in the Flora scents, it is mild, and a bit ordinary..

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content: This is available right now (29.04.14) at allbeauty.com for £53.95 for 100ml.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content:
Ozonic and floral are good words to describe it. I can't smell anything woody though.
At first when I sprayed it I felt a very strong alcohol scent. After some minutes it started to get soapy.
The more time passed the soapier it got. Smells like soap water or some cleaning product, not an expensive perfume.
Not good in my opinion but not the worst in this collection either.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content:
This is an ozonic scent that my nose will only accept to wear in one season...Summer. I tried to wear it one day in the Spring, it was very wet, snowy, I didn't really like it at all. But now in the heat, I find it much more tolerable. In any other season, the cooler air it is just a sharp ozonic slightly aquatic mess. In much warmer temps the violet isn't overpowered by this,it is very lovely and vibrant, and I am able to catch the iris and orris, giving it a nice powdery touch. It is a very refreshing violet.

I would have liked to have more suede with this, but overall, this will be a nice non offensive summer scent. This one would be nice to wear to a bridal shower or wedding. Very understated and refined.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content:
This perfume is true to it's name, it's a whole lot of violets :)!

The start is full of strong violets, which can be a bit too much for some. Then it gradually fades into a softer, gentle and lovely violet. There is also a hint of iris, giving its a slightly powdery feel.

I find it really comforting, gentle and stunning. I also feel like it's quite dreamy, and love wearing it before I sleep. I absolutely love this perfume. It lasts quite a long time on my skin - around 8 hours, I can often smell the lingering violet when I wake up.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content: I just got it as a gift 100 ml,it s good,but i like better georgeus gardenia :)

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content: I found while wearing this perfume it starts out on me as a heavy violet with a powdery note, after a few hours it dissipates to a a sweet mild violet with a hint of a powdery note. I find it a bit strong to start with but it dries down to something milder and lovely.

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content: Where can I find this perfume? None of the counters seem to carry it. It's missing...haha. All I wanted was a sample.

review_content: بسیار لذت بخش برای شنونده های که برای استشمام روان پی سرچشمه میگردنند

product_name: Flora by Gucci Generous Violet Gucci
review_content: not so powdery, a little rose, no character, disappointing

I’m a huge fan of Gucci Envy by Tom Ford and have been since the early 2000’s. Because of that I paid a premium to buy this back in 2017. When I say premium, I mean it was like £100, which is nothing like what it costs now. I really didn’t enjoy it. It doesn’t have the depth or glamour of Gucci Envy.. it smelt more like a cleaning product to me. Anyway I sold it soon after but I’m amazed at the price these are going for now. It is literally ridiculous. I get it somewhat for Gucci Envy, because that fragrance would win the Pepsi Challenge against any of your niche fragrance coming out at the moment.. but yeah Gucci Pour Homme does not belong in that lane!

This is reminiscent of the 1970s, where Tom Ford drew inspiration, as is also the case with the M7. Some young people used to sauvage will say that it smells old, but if you grew up in an environment with men smelling of Polo, Aramis, Fahrenheit, Kouros, antaeus, habit Rouge, Zino,Creed BDP you will realize that it is a modernized classic.
Change the photo back.

@korngoldo ih sure it does not make "a moden impress" at all. A masterpiece like this, one of a kind, cannot stay in line with none of the modern "all the same" chemical bulshits, all nauseating, suffocating and ALL with the same sticky syntetic vibe.
No. And more than this, Gucci Pour Homme, which represent the peak of the GUCCI era under genius Tom Ford, is was not made for everyone. You need to have a certain level. Of everything.

True masterpiece...

10/10 🤎

Not necessarily, very delicate, watery woodiness, maybe pleasant, but quite obvious, doesn’t make a modern impression. It has something masculine that people recognize, but that’s rather past its time.

Nevertheless, it’s a certain form of classic that deserves respect. On skin, not very good — outdated, discontinued, why bother?

Check out a song by Florence & the Machine - Bedroom Hymns; it should describe this fragrance pretty accurately.

Simply glorious!

Got a full 100ml back around 2008/2009. Went and bought another 2 bottles for backup (price was still around €70/80 those days). The first bottle lasted less than a year. The second bottle lasted me about 2 years (collection was growing and was reaching out for some other fragrances). Third bottle sat in my wardrobe for years, until last month when instead of selling it off and making a pretty penny, decided to open and revisit this creation. Hats off to sir Almairac, you are a genius!

Catholic church incense without the skank in the top, beautiful hypnotic middle, soft cosy base.

I have full bottle up for sale. Approx.47/50ml (no box).
Feel free to pm me.
EU only!
Thanks

Managed to get a 1/3 full bottle of this from my cousin. ULTRA masculine scent. Not for the weak and definitely for men at least 30+. Opening reminds me a lot of an orthodox church because of the incense/patchouli combo. After 30 minutes becomes more of an ambery-woodsy scent with a bit of spice. Great interesting niche-smelling scent, I like it. I haven’t smelled Bentley Intense to compare the two, but might get a bottle of it to use instead of the Gucci one, as everyone says they smell almost fully alike.

Gucci pour homme is very dry, woody and extremely hot, it's very hot on the skin once I wore it in the heat and started sweating profusely.
As if you were entering a very hot sauna.
Gucci reminds me of a man in his 40 s+ with hair on his arms and chest, wearing a button-down shirt with two buttons open, showing off his hairy chest. I think this is a fragrance that also recalls the image of Tom Ford and also Tony Soprano from the series The Sopranos.
To genvy, "Get a clue", you suggest. Is there a reason why all of your posts are laced with rudeness and anger? This is the past time of smelly water. It's not that serious.

I like it ! Citrus & spices resemble cola & tobacco like in Rojas Enigma but without the florals. Gets woodier & ends with soft vanilla. Average, more mild performance & projection, less harshly-synthetic than others, smoothly blended, very pleasing & masculine, sad this is gone now.

Reminder that this is absolutely a different fragrance than Bentley Absolute despite what Michel’s son (who had a fragrance he needed to sell) said, that Tom Ford made changes to the formula Michel provided before releasing it as Gucci Pour Homme, that perfumers make multiple variations of their fragrance concept to pitch to the company that hired them and those other unused formulas can get purchased by other companies down the line, and that anyone who has a bottle of GPH and Bentley Absolute along with a functioning sense of smell can tell you they are clearly different fragrances. Everyone can tell. Even people who have no connection to the fragrance community and have not been pre-biased to expect either sameness or difference can tell they are very different.

Even the ingredients on the labels are different. Get a clue.

Bentley Absolute is a really nice fragrance, or at least it was before it got allegedly weakened in reformulation (I have the original, have not smelled recent bottles). It is so clearly not the exact same thing as GPH. It’s like saying Cool Water is the exact same as Green Irish Tweed.

Owned is since the release and almost at the end now.
It's a warm cosy classic frag.
Not in the face type. Very subtle, sophisticated.

Not too massive on lasting. 4 hours on my skin
Same with silage. Not very strong.

#1064 in my "Tour de Fragrance:

Another collector was kind enough to part with a decant of this, and it is as good as I recall. Damn shame this was discontinued.

This was a masterpiece, Bentley is good but nowhere near the sillage, projection and longlasting. And you can feel that the ingredients are not the same.
This was one of the biggest crimes in the fragrance world. Even Michel Almairac's own take on this Papyrus Oud(from Parle moi de parfums) is not as good as Gucci Homme was. Gucci Homme was out of this world, strong, dark, when someone came into a room and wore this, all eyes turned on him. Bentley lasts 1 hour and is mostly a skin scent.
I'm very sad that this one was discontinued.

“Gucci Pour Homme is absolutely the same [as] Bentley Absolute, or more like Bentley Absolute is absolutely the same as Gucci Pour Homme. It’s absolutely the same. I asked Michel [Almairac, the perfumer of both] like 4 days ago, ‘what are the differences between Gucci Pour Homme and Bentley Absolute?’, he informed me “nothing, there is no difference”. And I’m quite surprised when I see [on social media] things that are very, how you say, you feel like it’s a big truth, [people saying that] ‘Bentley Absolute is not the same as Gucci Pour Homme’… absolutely it’s the same.”

“You mean that people are saying that they are all of these differences in them whereas actually there are no differences at all?”

“Absolutely! There are no differences at all and people are saying that there are differences but I mean I’m not blaming them, it’s just to say that the power of a brand, Gucci, and the power of a trend, is so huge that it affects [your perception]… even if you think no no I’m not that kind of person, this doesn’t affect me, it affects everybody. All the people saying that Gucci Pour Homme was better than Bentley Absolute it means that the power of Gucci and the power of the success of Gucci Pour Homme is so huge that they still think it’s better than Bentley Absolute. Because it’s absolutely the same.

- Benjamin Almairac in a 2020 Interview with Persolaise

You are a suit-clad business professional enduring a long meeting in your corporate office. It has been a long day and the freshness of your white shirt with a classic cologne you enjoyed in the morning now gives way to a musky body odor under your wool jacket. It is not unpleasant yet but noticeable enough to make you start feeling uneasy and surprisingly kind of... sexy? But, you are still in that meeting!

In another episode of buy that not this.. get Bentley Intense, 95% or more the same.. same perfumer, same or better performance. I particularly do not detect any additional nuance that makes GPH worthy while BI exists. Otherwise Get Bois Pacifique by Tom Ford which is a little different but should be of similar if not better quality, and an improvement in my opinion.

Definitely one of Gucci's best. Along with Gucci by Gucci Pour Homme. ( that one is spicy)
This one is quite good. Though 100ml bottles are quite high.

Rumor has it that Parle Moi de Parfum Papyrus Oud 71 is very similar to this. It is the same perfumer after all. I have sample on the way.

I bought a 50 ml for 50 dollars in Tuscan Arizona. That is something that doesn’t really happen often super lucky. I’m 28 yrs old I do respect the masterpiece behind it but I am having a hard time in enjoying this perfume since it is from a different era!!
The opening and mid are amazing. The drydown is divine. Easily a 10/10.

I am a firm believer that the people saying this is worth current prices are the people selling it.

It's a great fragrance, but it's not worth $200 for a 50ml. That's insanity.
One of the greatest of ALL time. Woody masterpiece. Intoxicating! No imitations can do what it does.

Who would belive me if I said that it's one of the fragrances i paid the least for?
Reason i bought it blind was its classy packaging. I remember spraying it and immediately thinking I'm too young to wear it. I was about 25 back then. Another thought I had was that it's calming, composed, autumn/winter scent. I remember exactly thinking the pencil shavings and smell of whiskey.
I'm 41 now and still have half of 50ml bottle.
It's melancholic and reserved. Ite a picture of a father figure we all would love to have- wise, secure, calm but strong. Its so perfect that it's hard to put this scent on as you just feel out of place. One day you hope to be that person to your own child.
It's what you would like to be rememberd as a man - in absolute control.

I will write right away that my adventure with perfumes began with this first notification a few years ago... it was signaled to me by a friendly distributor, with a trademark for years... it was not the main user of this perfume, because of the keyword it smells...
that it's some Gucci, but I don't remember the name, and it was given to me by my wife... additionally, that the perfume is contained in a square bottle made of thick glass....
on the same day that PH itself comes 😉

There is one of them and the most charming fragrances available, which will be available to touch and which will always be in my collection…
there is also one of the last Gucci fragrances that is safely marked (the last one is Gucci PH II), which has its logo and at the same time appears as "the last of the Mohicans" - the quintessence of a characteristic, sophisticated style and substance...
something that Gucci lost, consciously - in pursuit of Boss, Lacoste and other brands with fragrances that are nice, light and bring nothing, but provide considerable profits...

So what is Pour Homme?
It is heavy, spicy, woody and slightly oriental…
It starts on the skin with a characteristic masculine pepper note, which, however, politely withdraws after a while, allowing the composition to breathe with its full spicy, powerful heart...
Although the composition doesn't show it, I also feel cinnamon, cloves and much more precious wood than the manufacturer declares...
It's hard to be surprised, after all, who would reveal the full composition of such a masterpiece...
And the composition is undoubtedly a masterpiece that no manufacturer would be ashamed of - even a niche one... There are several fragrances similar to PH on the market, including: Azzaro Visit or Piver Epices, but none of them comes close to the "cinnamon prince" in terms of nobility, complexity and perfect combination of ingredients...
It's hard for me to believe that a fragrance so complex and full of heavy, difficult to tame and strong scent notes was combined into such a uniform, smooth and coherent composition, in which each individual ingredient is a perfectly fitted element of the intricate puzzle from which this perfume was woven...
Gucci PH is a fragrance that dominates its surroundings, is suggestive and does not allow the person wearing it to pass by indifferently...
some people say that it smells like a pharmacy or a doctor's office... I only smell a composition filled with oriental spices and noble wood for a decisive and domineering man...
if we combine it with wonderful projection, the dignity of the composition itself and the unprecedented lightness with which it bounces off the skin to leave a pleasant spicy tail and is characterized by the legendary durability of almost 12 hours... - we get a perfect fragrance!...
yes, my dears, this is an example of good old Gucci... they don't make such fragrances anymore and they won't make them at Gucci...
In addition, a beautiful warm cinnamon color, perfectly reflecting the character of the composition and using a massive black cork suggesting the use of the fragrance for the evening time of the day...
The whole thing was enclosed in a relatively simple bottle made of thick glass, with an even thicker bottom resembling the shape and weight of whiskey glasses... what a simple but refined form... charming simplicity and a thoroughly masculine form, without unnecessary frills...
The bottle perfectly harmonizes and blends with the color of the liquid and the fragrance itself, creating a perfectly tasteful and harmonious whole...

Fragrance notes:
Top note: white pepper, ginger, pink laurel
Heart note: papyrus wood, iris
Heart notes: amber, leather, vetiver, white incense.

A little spice, a little smoke, a HECK OF A LOT OF CEDAR! My wife brought this home for me from a closeout at a grocery store or something saying she smelled it in the store an liked it (maybe $30 USD at the time). I sprayed it on a was instantly in love and we went back to see if they had anymore. Unfortunately they did not. Well I used the bottle up until it was bone dry thinking I would find another somewhere and by the time I did it was already going for over $100. Now it is astronomical if you can find it. Was it a great cedar? Yes, one of the best I have smelt. Is it worth hundreds of dollars? Nope, not to me. Enjoyed, loved, remembered, but there are to many great scents to try and replace it with another bottle.
Iso Pour homme and pour homme II

Absolute masterpiece.None of the modern fragrances can compete with pour homme 1 and 2.
BTW i have both and are available for swap and sale.

Difference can be detected easily:
Top and mid notes ,if you spray them one next to another GPH1 and Bentley Absolute doesn`t even smell like similar parfume.
Gucci pour homme is much better blended and smoother, has some kind of background flowers.(more naturals)
Bentley has a lot of sharpness.(more synthetic)
Drydown on the other hand- even if you`re familiar with the scent, it will be really hard to say which is which.(if not comparing)

A true masterpiece 🏆 now discontinued by Gucci 👎 fortunately Michel Almanac created the twin of Gucci pour homme & which is Bentley for men absolute & trust me it's almost the same as Gucci pour homme ❤ the best alternative in the market 👍 now I'm wearing both & I can't detect the difference on my skin! Thanks to Michel Almanac 🙏😀
The only issue is Bentley is a bit weaker!

One of my favorite fragrances of all time ! A divine smoky incense with a background of a fresh green feel. A gem from Almairac & Tom Ford.
I got a backup 50ml bottle for under 50$ in 2023, so I can't complain. But the current prices are just insane.
Shame it was discontinued, but just move on .. Don't overpay unless it holds a very very specific sentimental value for you.

This is a very nice fragrance and I wish they still made it to the same standard of its past glory. That said it was a sub $50 cologne and no amount of hype or over the top pricing is going to make it better than it was. I see it up for $200-400 for 50ml. Don't waste your money. It wasn't worth it then and it's not now.

Used to be one of my favorite perfumes. its sad Gucci stopped making this masterpiece.

The closest alternatives I could find to it (based on my humble efforts) is Lalique's encre noir which I also stopped using years ago because it started to smell bitter & sour in some batches.

Another amazing alternative which filled the gap for me is loewe 7. However, this gucci has middle eastern vibes in it. And with the emergence of many middle eastern fragrance brands in recent years. I believe there is a possibility to find something similar in their leathery/woody collections.

This 100% is not a 1:1 with Bentley Absolute and anyone saying that is either nose blind or hasn’t smelled both. Bentley Absolute clearly has an added ingredient I believe it’s synthetic ‘western Oud’ and pepper removed from the heart. I’d say they go in the same direction and Bentley Absolute is a great substitute but they are NOT the same.

I like Gucci Pour Homme I more because it is cleaner smelling to me. Smells more versatile and classy.

What can I say about the scent profile?

The market has determined a 100ml is worth about $300 at the time of writing this and I think that’s a fair valuation. It’s as good as fragrances that resell for that price on discounters I think of Creed Royal Oud, Louis Vuitton Ombré Nomade, and YSL Babycat as examples and this scent is just as good as all of them with added historic value. The bottle is shockingly thick glass and heavy feels very well made. I imagine it will 100% appreciate in value imagine what it’ll be worth 15 years from now? Probably a lot.

A 50ml goes for about $150 to 200 and is enough to wear it once a month for about 10 years…

Amazing smooth classy scent.

Theres a lot of auctions at $5-800 but they are not selling at those prices it’s just sellers that are daydreaming.

This is a classic Cedar scent with pepper. If you like Bentley Absolute you will like this but may not find it worth the price difference. I do. Since I’ll only wear this on special occasions a $300 100ml bottle is a lifetime supply and it feels special. As it ages in my collection it’ll feel even more special. Can’t get that with Bentley.

And to everyone saying the original perfumer claims Bentley has the same formula - maybe he lied? Since a lot of people buy Bentley thinking it’s the same formula as GPHI the lie worked.
Smells like mulch , and wood chips. reminds me of playing on the playground as a kid. I personally do not like it

Hello
Did someone order a 50 ml bottle from FregranceX and not receive it?

I was crazy about this perfume in my early twenties (I'm probably the only queer 00s kid that was never that much into Le Male, so this was what I always wore when I went out). It made me feel oozingly sexy and confident. If my memory doesn't fail me, this was a glowing frankincense, warm cedar, spicy and slighty boozy/sleezy scent. I loved to wear this with my dad's old suede jacket and white sneakers and my chunky 1960s glasses. It made me feel as hot as Tom Ford.

I just picked up a 50ml, almost full bottle of this off Vinted for £6 😱 even has the lid.

Sometimes you're in the right place at the right time. Didn't help that they had it listed as Gucci Guilty.

Now I can stash away my 100ml bottle and use the 50ml like it's a cheapie.

I long for the day a proper 1:1 clone of this surfaces because Papyrus and Bentley Absolute both miss the Tom Ford additions/subtractions of GPH1 - ignore those that say they're exactly the same, they're not, if they had the original to hand to compare they'd know the difference a mile away. If they were the same, people wouldn't pay £300+ for a bottle of the original would they.

This was seduction & sophistication in a bottle. I was given a bottle of this by my stylist when I was going to the Gucci boutique back when this came out and got so many compliments whenever I wore it. It was absolutely beautiful. Slightly boozy, smoky, woody. Reminds me of Christmas in a bottle. I still have half a bottle left. It was my signature scent for a long time, and I miss it dearly. Will only wear it on special occasions now. Bentley Absolute IS a very close replica of it, especially the dry down. The major difference is, Bentley is very black pepper forward initially but when it dries down, it does smell very, very close to Gucci Pour Homme. Both were formulated by Michel Almairac

A smell of aged whiskey. Dry resinous and smoky but with a soupy layer. Zero sweetness. It's like fahrenheit with what it's trying to do but for someone who grew out from diors masterpiece, has some grey hair and bigger bank account
The only true clone of this is papyrus oud. Bentley Absolute is foul by comparison, don't waste your money on it, even though it's cheap.

I used to live in Paris with an abundance of perfume shops around. That's when I would buy fragrances based on how they compared with others. After a serious session and choosing some to take home, a powerful aroma suddenly hit me. It covered the rest, which is saying something considering where I was. It was deep, superior, masculine and irresistible. I looked across at the sales assistant and she held up the bottle for me. I just had to buy it too even though I'd told myself no more. To be fair, it later seemed that I was more attracted to Gucci Pour Homme than those around me. There's a mystical incense vibe that doesn't suggest youth, sexiness or sportiness but it doesn't reach fart-in-suit territory like many other scents. What I liked and never forgot about though was the way it crushed the others in a side-by-side comparison regardless of notes or genre.

I was rummaging around my wardrobe doing a massive clear out…. when I found this hidden amongst the piles of crap. A pristine 50mL bottle which I must’ve bought when it first came out. My heart was racing as I opened the cap, thinking to myself, I hope this hasn’t spoiled and gone bad! I proceeded to dispense one spray onto the back of my hand and I was worried…. But the scent immediately transported me back to my twenties when I must’ve bought this. I must’ve had “baby nose” as I probably didn’t appreciate what a masterpiece this fragrance truly is. It gives me this really warm cozy feeling. I just love the woody notes here but I also seem to get a boozey note too, which I love. Definitely a unique scent suited to cooler elegant nights out, it’s beautifully crafted. I’m lucky to have this now discontinued scent!

Great scent, a classic. There is an interview on this site that clearly states Bentley Absolute is made with the same recipe as Gucci Pour Homme, minus the Tom Ford additions. So many have trouble understanding this I feel real bad. This is not the same as Bentley Absolute. The person who designed it says so, his children say so. Ask Tom Ford if you don't believe it.

Had this fragrance for years and years, one of my all-time favorites and I especially liked wearing it during warm summer nights. I checked from time to time after it was discontinued but people are asking way to much money, disappointing!

I had a good search and found out that Michel Almairac has his own Perfume brand and also this specific scent since 2018; Papyrus Oud 71 of Parle Moi de Parfum. I have bought it and tested and it is for 98% identical, in the beginning it really smells 100% identical.

What I really remember of the Gucci is that the it was not very long lasting, which of course is normal for eau de toilette. Papyrus Oud 71 is an eau de parfum so it also lasts longer....glad I can buy it again.
Just get Bentley Absolute.. it's the same formula made by the same purfumer..

Has anyone tried to layer Bentley Absolute with Loewe 7 Anónimo? Guess it would result in something with CdG 2 Man vibe with better performance. I would try it myself but I don't have Bentley Absolute right now, I just remember how it smells (Bentley Absolute and CdG 2 Man are considered good substitutes for Gucci pour Homme).

Here’s the deal. I spent months trying to track this fragrance down. Months of sifting through absolutely ridiculous prices, months of finding nothing but the new ‘Gucci by Gucci Pour Homme’ or ‘Gucci Pour Homme II.’ When I finally found a bottle of this fragrance for a realistic price, I jumped on it. And… well.

It’s good. It’s really, really good. But when we’re talking between $400-600 for a 50ml bottle, forget it. It isn’t that good, no matter how you spin it. Normally I try not to discuss price too early in my review, but it’s impossible not to here. Unlike it’s brothers Pour Homme II and Envy, Pour Homme I has been cloned rather successfully. Bentley for Men Absolute is the first one everyone points to, but Michel made a very similar fragrance for his own perfume house, too.

To be completely fair to PH1, it’s certainly deeper and richer than its clones. It really is magnificent. It’s a cedar bomb, with some pepper and incense through it. Very refined and very masculine, yet very subtle. Not as subtle as the likes of Gucci Rush, but it’s not going to choke people out. It’s a tantalising scent, just begging to be discovered. The closest thing I had in my collection until getting this one was Creed’s Royal Oud, and this smacks Royal Oud around so hard it isn’t even funny.

It’s a tragedy that this was discontinued. If it could still be found for $50 a bottle, it’d be the biggest steal in all of fragrance, bar none. Hell, even $100 for a bottle would be perfectly justified, maybe even $150 if you were REALLY pushing it. But for the prices it commands today, I just can’t recommend it.

It's a gem of a fragrance but don't waste your money on ebay and the second hand market with this discontinued fragrance unless you are a Collector of fragrance bottles, the prices are too high and because you can buy Bentley For Men Absolute which is the exact same fragrance.

For those that say Bentley For Men Absolute and Gucci pour Homme (2003) Gucci are similar but different are likely comparing a vintage bottle Gucci and a modern bottle of Bentley for Men Absolute side by side and not taking into consideration the passage of time. I had Gucci pour Homme (2003) when it was released and I have Bentley for Men Absolute, they are identical fragrances.

Further to this, the original perfumer of Gucci pour Homme (2003) is the perfumer of Bentley For Men Absolute and his representatives have said on record that the exact original formula was used to create the Bentley for Men absolute.

I like it a lot but the projection is completely non-existent. I sprayed this behind the neck twice, on each shoulder, and on my wrist and I cannot smell this whatsoever unless I put my nose right to my wrist or shoulder.

I wish they'd make a stronger version of this. Not a re-buy for me due to awful silage, but great atomizer in the sample, and great packaging. It feels more like a day time scent than a night scent, but you could do either.

I have this Gucci pour homme(98% full) and Gucci pour homme II(65% full)
If anyone is wanting to buy them I can do a deal on both. Email crunkwun@gmail.com or find me on our Facebook page Common scents. It's new so not many members but all are welcome. I'm admin.
I can find several bottles of this perfume from 2003. but i live in turkey and transport by courier will cost more than perfume.
I used to love it. Perfect Gucci fragrance - wish they brought it back just like ENVY and RUSH for men.

For me the best incense fragrance even though it's no longer in production. Perfectly blended incense with woody notes, leather and other minor components. A carefully dressed Italian gentleman on a Sunday visit to the Basilica, for me the epitome of grown man elegance. And maybe for no reason, but I associate it with the smell of a good and expensive cigar.

This was a great fragrance, it has a very interesting smell. Woods, pencil shavings, inccense...great smell. On the performance level, it had good longevity, yet i didn't felt it pushed far on the projection. I got wiffs of it, others too, but given the notes and the way the fragrance starts, one could think that it would be a projection monster, wich is not even close. Kind of subtle on the projection.

Price: Great deal back then, now...ahahahah, let's be serious, it is not worth more than 80-100$ tops.

GPH was the legend, the king of all scents. Absolute perfection.

Bentley Absolute is not the same. It has similarities and you might like it, but saying it's the same as GPH is borderline disrespectful. It's just ok, it's not great and it's definitely no legend.

The search for a worthy replacement for GPH continues...

I immediately bought two backups when am fallen to this back in 2004. So yes, I am a proud owner of this lost gem. Woody, spicy, burning, and totally something else. It projects like hell, lasts 8+ hours with monster silage on me. Crazy performance juice in heavy bottle. The closest thing-on the air only-to GPH is Bentley For Men Absolute. They're not the same, but close, like 70% close.

I love this fragrance but its hard to find being as how its production has been discontinued.
The next best and maybe even better is Thierry Mugler's Woodissime. They sell out of this frequently on the Mugler site but they re stock it occasionally so if you like Gucci Pour Homme. You'll love Woodissime even better. Its just as beast mode and last 10+12hrs easily.

One of the best masculine fragrances I ever owned.

Amazing woody spicy opening then its ambery mildly sweet.. just perfect👌 ..Gucci Pour Homme RIP .. will check Bentley for sure.
What a shame it is discontinued...

My greatest love of all, but definitely not for everyone. I went through two bottles and some samples before it vanished. I'm sampling Parle moi de Parfum's Papyrus Ood at the moment, as I heard that they are very similar, and I can wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone who's pining after Gucci pour homme!

Woody cedar with a bit of olibanum (similar to the jubilation olibanum).
Alongside considerable putrid synthetic smoke.
The smoke and cedar form a repulsive and headache inducing burning smell, possible worse than 'smoke' as it is almost like a synthetic rubber/plastic type of smell. This also smells a bit like nuts.

I would only recommend if you are a fan of all of the following:
- Strong weird synthetic burning / smoky type scents. e.g. Amouage interlude man // Tom Ford F*cking Fabulous.
- Strong cedar scents e.g. Creed royal oud
- Strong nut scents e.g Nuit d'issei Issey Miyake 2014.

Josenajas, I would LOVE to live in the universe where Bentley absolute lasts longer than Gucci pour homme.. I promise you, anyone who wishes this was the case is NOT defending the original, just disappointed that Bentley came pretty near, but still came out a bit shallow and with not enough of the peppery heart as the original. :(
Props to it for what it is though, to be certain.

It is a great sample of complexity.

Bentley Absolute is 99% identical. I dropped and smashed my bottle if Gucci with 10ml remaining, mopped it up with a t shirt, sealed it in a plastic bag, and bought this. They are almost identical.

For those of you who want a definitive answer, here it goes. I do own both, GPH and Bentley Absolute for men. They are 98% the same fragrance. The only difference (the remaining 2%), is that Bentley lasts longer and costs what GPH used to cost years ago and a fraction of what it costs now. If you are a completist, and need to have GPH's heavy, beautiful glass bottle, go ahead and throw away 250 plus dollars for it, but the juice is exactly the same.

Presented as a work of art: its stylish, distinctive flacon is simple yet elegant, the golden amber fluid inside is captivating in its beauty.
Warm and woody with a hint of pencil shavings, subtly sweet with facets of tonka bean and ambery vanilla and resinous depth conveyed by frankincense and labdanum.
The woody and incensey aspects really emphasise the meditative impression of GPH.
To my mind it summons the image of a Buddhist temple.
GPH always struck me as an elegant man’s fragrance that could easily be unisex - stylish and innovative, yet fairly linear.

Mr Almairac created a variation on a theme in Bentley for Men Absolute, whose similarities to GPH are striking.
Although there are some differences (like the Western-style oud in Bentley Absolute) there are way more similarities between the two - both GPH and BA feel like they share the same DNA.
Not identical twins but siblings.
In addition to the overall formulaic similarity there’s one note in particular that both GPH and Bentley Absolute have in common - maybe it’s Papyrus?
In any case, it’s like a paternity test.

Although a supremely beautiful fragrance, GPH’s performance and longevity are disappointing.
The discreet simplicity and elegance of the solid, cubic crystal flacon with its golden nectar is a perfect visual representation of GPH.
Classy and elegant.
GPH is a legend and rightly so.

GPH feels warm and friendly, comforting yet dignified, self-assured and serene.
GPH’s distinctive woodsy backbone reminds of my father, his library, desk, and armchair, and the subdued resins and incense add a meditative dimension, perhaps from memories of old temples in Kyoto, which have a very particular smell, probably due to centuries of burning expensive fragrant woods and temple incense.

For me GPH is warm, relaxing and meditative.

There’s a beautiful rich woodiness that reminds me of the finest aspects of sandalwood, cedar and patchouli united, then enriched and enhanced with other notes, that persists through to the dry down and create an overall impression of luxury.
Don’t detect any leather in GPH but I think leather is more of an idea or an accord based on a fantasy rather than an actual organic component. Like the dried skin of a dead animal soaked in a putrefying enzyme solution.

Performance is best in Winter, when GPH becomes an understated aura of meditative serenity that elicits compliments (from those close enough to smell it)

Bentley Absolute is one of my favourites and unquestionably the closest thing to GPH on the market at present.
Given the cult status of GPH it seems as though Mr Almairac created an heir to its legacy, a successor.

I really enjoy GPH and as is the case with so many fragrances (like Egoïste) just wish I’d been a bit less profligate with it in the days before it became such a precious commodity.

It is a very beautiful fragrance and one of Michel Almairac’s finest, but I wish it weren’t so rare and so expensive.

I used to work in the fragrance and beauty section of a pharmacy in my early twenties, and I used to own two or three bottles of this fragrance at a time. This was back in 2007-2008. One of my colleagues and good friends, who was from Slovakia, could not understand why I liked it so much and always used to say, “ it smells like church". My Greek Cypriot friend agreed. But I absolutely loved it.

Gucci pour Homme was my first dry woody scent, and I have kept a soft spot for this sort of scent ever since, always on the hunt for something that scratches that itch. I just wish I had shown all my bottles more respect knowing now that this masterpiece would be discontinued and turn into a rare gem. A brother-in-law from Trinidad shared my appreciation for this dark and smoky incense perfume, so I gave him a couple of bottles to take home with him when he had come to visit in 2009.

In many ways, this was such a pure scent, which seems at odds with the array of notes that had been used to create it. I can only go by memory - and trust me, when I close my eyes I can still smell it - and this scent always made me imagine what it would have been like to live in the 70s. Dark, elegant, and a classic of its time.
Unbeatable. After so, so many years, this a masterpiece. End of the story.

Smooth and smoky, incense and cedar. Finally got myself a sample of this to compare to my much loved Bentley Absolute.

Most of my review will be from the viewpoint of comparison with Bentley Absolute, because I bought that first, and have experience with it. If you have tried Bentley Absolute, you've smelled this before, it is that close. The 604 "reminds me of" votes here (as of May 2021) are spot on. The downvoters are most likely purists and diehard GPH owners who say that the Bentley could never compete, and in some regards it doesn't - but it is very close - and in all fairness, it doesn't need to compete.

From the perspective of a Bentley Absolute wearer who may be curious about what this fragrance offers, I can attest that Bentley Absolute does not deviate far from what Gucci Pour Homme 2003 did first. The sour smoke note is incredibly similar. When I opened my sealed sample pouch, I knew instantly what I was getting - it gave the very familiar smell of Bentley Absolute.

The best analogy I can come up with is that it's like two twins singing perfectly the same note, but their minor personality differences and differing life experiences allow you to distinguish which is preferred, "nicer" and more rounded.

I find GPH rewards you for smelling up close, whereas Bentley is more akin to a large artwork that you're best admiring from a distance. Bentley sniffed too close can break the illusion as your nose picks out certain elements that contribute to the overall image. GPH up close does not suffer the same problem, but rather invites you to keep sniffing closer and closer. Bentley will constantly remind you of its presence all day, whereas GPH is content to wait for you.

GPH is smoother - by which I mean there is a tighter focus on the woody notes with smoke and this makes it more photorealistic overall, whereas I think Bentley focuses more on pumping up the volume and giving the smoke some space, perhaps at the expense of some fireside realism. Bentley Absolute opens a touch greener/bright/woody/smoky, whereas Gucci tends more resinous/woody/smoky and stays that way. Again, the sour smoke effect is done in exactly the same style.

I don't think it is over hyped. GPH 2003 is beautiful and there's certainly good reason for the love it gets. If you're just curious about the similarity to Bentley Absolute and don't want to shell out $500 for a bottle of this (if you could even find it) then rest assured, the scent is 90% similar in character. The 10% difference for me is in the overall aims of each; Gucci being a bit darker, closed off, rounded and realistic, high-definition, more reserved while Bentley's is slightly more loud, more open, a bit obvious, and less concerned with subtleties while still getting the same job done.

If I had to boil it down to one point I'd suggest that Bentley Absolute was perhaps tweaked for loudness and cost vs GPH's more fleshed-out smoothness around the same theme.

A Greek or Catholic cathedral/church/monastery in late December, Christmas eve midnight mass service.... Lightly, calmly snowing out.... This is all that in a bottle, for me personally. At first smell, I'm instantly transported back to childhood with mom and dad at Greek Orthodox church services within a cathedral in late December. Bishops/priests conducting the services in ancient, Koine/Biblical Greek... That olibanum/resinous/ambery/cedar/smokey incense vibe is to die for. I'll forever miss indulging in this stuff.

One of the best fragrances for men.

An Egyptian Pharoh. Opulent, cultured and abundant. It’s masculine but not in a typical fougere scent profile, it alludes to a guy who achieves excellence on his own terms and isn’t bound by societal validation. I absolutely love the leather, papyrus and cedar combination which constitutes most of this scent.

It is a wonderful woody and deep but also playful one and I don't know if it can be replicated. Could be worth those high asking prices if you can get a good deal because this is the Pinnacle of a designer fragrance and Jesus if this sold now, Gucci would grow as a business exponentially. Its said countlessly I know but those old Gucci ones are incredible. This is Cosy, Professional, Enticing, Woody as anything, warming, its just awesome. Get it on a good deal.

This is pure sex in a bottle. The first time I encountered it was with a hot one nighter from VMU. It was in the middle of a winter blizzard of 2003/4. I met him online and he made it to my apartment from his dorm by foot, down the hill, enshrouded in a swirling mass of snow and this amazing scent!

The next morning over coffee, I asked him his name, and the name of the scent he was wearing. It was Gucci Pour Homme. I was at the Burlington, Mall the following afternoon to buy it at Macy's.

That was almost twenty years ago and I haven't had another bottle since. But I have often remembered it, and that Greek God who introduced it to me in the best way one could. And now, I am in disbelief to find that it has long since been discontinued. I feel as if the world has lost something akin to the recipe for Channel No. 5. Such a terrible loss.
I really don't understand why Gucci discontinued this masterpiece? Are they bunch of Morons?? Damn since I never bought another Gucci after! They must bring it back💪

This is a bold release from the house of Gucci.....in many different ways! This was brave for them to release this as the main mens fragrance of the line (homme). This is a incense beast! A 2 second blast of citrus and papyrus up front then its straight into the deep, dark, smokey resinous woods and burning incense! The minute I sprayed this fragrance it was WOW! Oh man! What a statement! Then I thought, when could I ever wear such a smokey beast? An hour later and you will realize how fantastic this scent actually is! Burning wood and incense in a orange grove is the top. This beautiful monk in a church vibe is the mid. And the base is a smooth, sweet wafty musk, amber, smoked wood and incense. What a trip...what a fragrance...was perfect to experience while working in the yard on a crisp/clear winter afternoon! Amazing creation but I will say...these 3 2ml samples that I have will probably last me the year...a very situational scent. Pour homme II is better and more versatile btw.
Bentley absolute thank you for still being there for us!

My boyfriend wore this, it was absolutely divine.. I would literally drink in the scent. I started wearing his..I had trouble finding it to replace his nearly empty bottle, and luckily found two at my local Melbourne suburban pharmacy for $90 a bottle. Little did I know that these were such old stock, that they were literally the last two bottles in Australia. I have scoured every local market, garage sale, country pharmacy and deceased estate to no avail. My boyfriend died of a sudden heart attack, and in one way I'm glad that the scent has become obsolete- as to me, Gucci Homme pour Homme (2003) was his signature scent. It died with him.

This was not killed by “dumb management” but simply collateral damage in the ongoing saga of the company. Frida Giannini, and to a lesser extent John Ray and Alessandra Facchinetti, had little choice but to move away from Tom Ford’s huge influence on the company. Not just the overtly sexualized clothing but also fragrances. In the end, Ford’s “Porno Chic” era had to give way to Millennial post-genderism and that left nowhere for the likes of GPH to hide. I still have about a third of a bottle of this but never wear it. Indeed, it is almost certain that any replacement “signature” scent I find WILL go the same way....into the furthest reaches of memory. The trick is to find the next thing, enjoy it while you can and move on when it goes the same way as all the others.

Bentley is a different smell than GPH. The similarity is general, but the reception is completely different. Bentley is such a raw, flat GPH. More dusty. GPH is deep, fuller and mature. This is an extraclass. I smell my forearm and move to another world ... It's a real masterpiece ...

A very interesting and refined blend of incense, cedar and pepper. I was gifted an 100ml bottle (only 40ml remaining) and I had to do the usual comparison with Bentley Absolue.

I must confess, back in the day when Gucci pour Homme was around, I didn’t get the chance to test it. I was only focused on Envy, which is my favorite Gucci fragrance.

Years later, after all the praise I blind bought a bottle of Bentley Absolue so I can sniff what the fuss was all about. I loved the smell, even if the performance was not that great on me.

At this very moment, I finally have the original Gucci on my right hand (batch 0273) and the Bentley on my left. They smell almost identical, the only difference is that the Bentley comes across a bit brighter with a slight leathery oud nuance, whereas the Gucci in the dry down has a more prominent incense note.

Having said that, I will say that both are average performers. (the Bentley has a bit more projection while Gucci better longevity)

Please, do not spend the insane amounts on eBay! As a fellow fragrance aficionado who still misses his favorite scent D&G By Man (which I still haven’t found and I’ve been searching for so many years), I guarantee you the differences are very very minor. It’s the same formula! The same aromatics were used! Bentley doesn’t smell cheaper, you will get the whole effect with it. The statement that the same perfumer used the same formula in both scents is absolutely true!

I feel like I need to get this out there (like many other reviewers have done) and prevent people from spending the crazy amounts of money instead of giving Bentley Absolue a try. Sometimes, when we can’t reacquaint with our favorite scent, we only keep the memory of it, therefore our perception is altered. I feel that’s the reason why many people here say that the Bentley is not even close to Gucci, which is f a u l s e.

Bentley is really keeping this beautiful fragrance among us! I wish there was a substitute for D&G By, but I’m not as fortunate as all of the Gucci Pour Homme cult followers!
It is a beast. An intelligent, refined one, dressed in brown and navy blue, wine-brown brogues. Wallet filled with black credit cards.

Now available in samples!
Honestly, 99% same to Bentley Absolute IMO

To me this was the best scent I ever smelled - the first time I smelled it on a friend mid 2000's I immediately asked what it was and bought it the next day. It is just beautiful, sacrosanctum incense, conifer and spices all blended into one single overpowering and omnipresent juice that makes you feel like heaven. It broke my heart when I found out it was discontinued. Since then I was on the lookout for a substitute and I tried both - CdG Man2 and Bentley Absolute (which seems to be an outright copy formulated by the same designer) and while those are both extremely close and very well projecting quality fragrances, I felt like I'm still missing that "something" I had when I sprayed Gucci. I guess I should move on and continue my search for Holy Grail. After all, searching for this parfume introduced me to Fragrantica and opened up the amazing world of scents to me that I keep enjoying ever since.

andy the frenchman is missing the nuance in the english language, he does NOT say that all three are identical, here is the quote.

"BENJAMIN: We started 2 years ago with our boutique and eight eaux de parfum. We launched two new scents at the beginning of 2018 – Chypre Mojo and Orris Tattoo. In June 2018, we launched a new exclusive perfume for Selfridges London and our boutique, it's called Papyrus Oud. This perfume may remind you a lot of Gucci Pour Homme, which was made by my father. So it’s OK, it’s still our formula. A lot of people enjoyed Gucci Pour Homme, it's like a religion.



SERGEY: Yes, people are still looking for it on ebay…

BENJAMIN: Actually, my father made three Gucci Pour Homme – the first was created for Gucci, the second was made for Bentley (Bentley Absolute For Men), and the third is Papyrus Oud. It's nuanced and I don't blame Andy, so don't attack me Andy, I'm just pointing out that you making fun of people spending money on GPH aren't buying an "identical" scent,....sorry they just aren't, i own 2 bottles of each.
