The early to mid two thousands were a Golden Age for masculine perfumery, and those of us who were coming of age and interested in fragrances at the time probably didn't realise it. I had--and loved--Rive Gauche, Rive Gauche Intense, Rive Gauche Light, the glorious original formulation of Armani Code, Richard James Savile Row, Davidoff Good Life, CGD Kyoto, and of course, this gem. This was the one I wore to nice restaurants or on winter nights out, and while it was not my favourite of the lot, it scented many great coming of age memories.

It was only after it was discontinued that I really started craving it. Something about the dry, vaguely pencil shaving tinged incense and amber in it became addictive. By that point, it was beginning to command huge prices on the grey market. I'm not sure anything will ever replace it, though others have tried and mostly failed.

Hot, ambery frankincense and dry cedar--natural smelling, no piercing, screechy, ambroxan in sight.

Great, masculine scent.
Gucci has discontinued it and I can't stand them for it. Now they are producing pointless scents with no charisma and no continuation to house's tradition.

Gucci Rush Man, Gucci Envy and this one we have lost and I can't get over it!!! What a shame, I hope they will come back in some memoir collection similar to what YSL did.

@ Andy the Frenchy, how you got me all laughed up...in agreement, of course! Mind you, I have to concede that after realizing you actually sent us die hard fans a guiding light by revealing how the actual nose made identical copies and the one with some slight tweaks, I got the same idea- why not just pour that into the original fabulously thick, heavy bottle? Surely that would have solved our mere mortals souls...I then kinda remember, one can't remove the spray cap, it's not one of those, like Prada Infusion bottles, where you could just remove it, sadly.

I for sure would have loved to do that, since I've got two 50ml and one 100 ml bottles with some of that magical juice still very much captured and unaffected inside- refilling would have been amazing! But like they say, some dreams are better left un-resurrected and the memory of what was will console us for the years we'll still be blessed with.....Quite a poignant way of looking at it, I guess....

@wenna41: agreed, your comment deserves my balloon.

You summed it up and ackowledged what I said: the power of branding, and that brands want people to buy the brand, not the content.

In the wine field it's the same: what counts is who is the winemaker (and the terroir obsviously), not who the owner of the estate is. Most people are looking for the estate name, history, legend (aka "label drinkers"), while others look for the winemaker (wine experts)... What the first one want to drink is the image, while the latter focus on the juice. I am part of latter (not as an expert though).
The mass has a hard time admitting, as you said, that who created GPH1 is Michel Almairac, not Gucci... The only brand honest enough to disclaim it is Frederic Malle.

@ Andy the Frenchy, the thing is, this very same formula was introduced as a Gucci Scent, and the prestige, heritage and clout the Gucci brand became synonymous with, meaning, those of us who could relate to Gucci and what it stood for, bought more than just a scent- we bought an experience as a result of what we associated with by the the shape of the bottle, the color of the juice, the image portrayed in the ad, the spark it created when we, those die hard fans of this masterpiece, experienced back the. Like you've said with the Coke experiment, that demonstrates the power and force of association. As crazy as it might sound, few people would be willing to even free of charge, proudly accept a LV Speedy or Never Full bag, however identical it might appear, without the LV logo on the inside of that bag, simply because they know they will not have equal "bragging right", in case someone requests to see the inside of the bag- heritage is what separates the icons from the more younger and easily available "houses". What this scent represented and introduced us to to, is imprinted in that time capsule and our memories and this still has that gravitas to eclipse most of the more "palatable" aromas in this segment, so to say. Remember, it's only been over the past few years that noses became public knowledge, the designer was seen and regarded by the public what we could relate and aspire to be. pity as it might sound, I'm not willing to buy this formula unless it's presented as what I've become accustomed it to be, cause that's its identity,for many of us who went weak at the knees...People will have a hard time believing this to be "that " Gucci smell- hence it will take much effort for the nose to lure them, especially if without mentioning its relation to the original scent from 2001, people will naturally be skeptical. Gucci as a fashion house has been intriguing us mere mortals for many for years, Bently is known as an automobile
manufacturer- quite frankly for me, there is no comparison, since less than even a very small percentage of the global population can really afford a Bently...

I'm sorry for who has spent hundreds of dollars on GPH1, but Benjamin Almairac (the son of Michel Almairac, the nose behind GPH1) admitted in an interview to Fragrantica a few months ago, that his father made 3 twin versions of GPH1 (lowest price found online as of Dec 2018 on the side):

- Gucci Pour Homme 1 (2003) - $350/400 on ebay
- Bentley for men Absolute (2014) - $32 on FragranceNet
- Parle Moi de Parfum Papyrus Oud 71 (2018) - ~$180 directly on their website in France (excludes export taxes)

In the interview, Almairac said that the 3 versions were identical, with Papyrus Oud 71 having a minor variation and the version he would have liked GPH1 to be without Tom Ford reviewing it.
I think that is the demonstration of the power of marketing, branding and packaging. Take 3 bottles of Coca-Cola with 3 different labels, and people will feel 3 different tastes.

Minor variations or not, I'm asking you and all the super collectors and fragnerds: which of the the 3 bottles is the best buy, given that Almairac himself admitted that those are 99.9% identical??

Note: I have never smelt GPH1 or PO71. But assuming they are identical I am happy to have spent only $32 on BA. Because, while I think that $32 is a good deal for such a scent, I would have felt scammed to spend more than $50 on that (independently of the bottle label) since there are much interesting frags around over that price range.

Gucci Pour Homme I is a vintage oriental incense. There are two versions of the formula. One is very dark brown with an extremely potent incense note. And the other is a golden light brown, with the incense note strongly blended down into a sweet-spicy complex.

I personally favor the dark brown stuff for the vintage flare that it brings. The potency of the incense note is just otherworldly, and projects with the most amazing clarity and realism to it. It provides this vintage experience that's so life-like, it's amazing!

The incense takes you straight back to the 1920's...where you can literally smell the aged wood and atmosphere of the manor; you can see the people walking along the cobblestone streets; and everything around you optically appears in a monochrome vintage filter.

I personally enjoy every minute of it. I wore it on a trip downtown while walking around in Tower City, and it really emulates the scene of the old world architecture, and brings those vintage roots to life.

The golden brown stuff is a little more modern styled, but I'd say the vintage essence is still there; and it's a little special tastes, so possibly still not for everyone. It's just in the intended style. Gucci Pour Homme I is moreso a fragrance for those that are old at heart—and those with ties to the past.

The fragrance starts off with a heavy dose of spice and wood and settles down to a beautiful and rich blend of the two as it dries down. Makes you feel empowered in no small measure. On first sniff, my better half thought it smelled too strong, but later got used to it and liked it. I for one love this, and given that it has been discontinued, I will treasure it even more. It's definitely a fragrance more suited to more mature men and is perfect for formal occasions.

The mighty Pour Homme I. The legend. If Rive Gauche started the legend of Tom Ford, then this one solidified it.

Upon it's release, nothing at all smelt like it. It was totally out there. A total throwback.

However, despite most throwback scents, GPH I is still valid in 2016. It smells mature, but not outdated. Grown up, but not old.

The opening is a woody affair. For all it's listed notes, I mainly get a dusty papyrus accord with ginger and hints of pepper.

As we reach the middle, the pepper is amped up. It becomes very spicy. An accord of earthy patchouli is here as well. This is the stage where GPH becomes very grown up and mature. It's very in your face at this staged, almost unrefined.

A woodsy combo of sandalwood and cedar ends the accord. It's a peculiar type of woodiness. You have the creaminess of sandalwood, with a slight briskness of cedar. It's impeccably crafted, and is a real headturner. Combined with the pepper and patchouli, it's possibly devastating.

After the quite raw middle stage, the base rounds it all out. Smoky incense, earthy vetiver and smooth vanilla are all here. In combination, they give this scent a distinct smoothness that sets it apart from the many vintage scents it borrows from. Where they are raw and unpolished, Gucci is a refined best of, a greatest hits collection of the best 70s and 80s scents in one bottle.

This a very smoky fragrance. However where CdG's 2 Man is artistic and unrefined, GPH I remains tamed and contemporary. It isn't as artsy nor raw as 2 Man, and this is what makes it timeless.

2 Man, it's closest contemporary, comes across as nice but weird. The incense is amped up and gives it a very distinct edge. Here the incense is used to fill out the composition. If 2 Man is a catholic church, GPH I is the refined gentleman attending mass.

GPH I isn't perfect at all, but GPH I and GPH II are by far the best things Gucci ever gave us.

Longevity is excellent 12+ hours. Unlike most scents with great longevity, GPH I remains restrained, always there but never in your face.

Does price have a significant influence on perceived value? It can... sometimes unwarranted.

It's hard to believe now, but when Gucci Pour Homme was discontinued, you could find bottles of it for discount prices... as cheaply as $60 USD for a 100ml bottle! Today, it's not uncommon for a NIB 100ml bottle to be snapped up for $235 USD. What happened?

Rarity. GPH is not "super" rare, as you can see from the available inventory in that great resale channel known as eBay. But the quantity is low enough and resale price history high enough that most sellers drop them into an auction and watch in amazement as the price skyrockets.

Colin Maillard said this is not a masterpiece. I would have to disagree. GPH is easy to "miss"... meaning, the impression of the top notes is rather ordinary. Nice, but no Mozart of fragrances. What I've found is that you have to be patient. And into the dry down, you can eventually realize just how wonderful this fragrance truly is. To say "pencil shavings" is to be guilty of quick presumption. It is not a distillation of pencil shavings. It is so much more than that.

Personally, I'd say GPH is well worth about $150 USD for 100ml, and not much more. Clearly people are paying more than that, as they fervently want to own something scarce. To catch a fleeting whiff in the air as though James Dean was flying by in his vintage Porsche speedster into history.

Now that I've sampled and read about so many fragrances, I've realized most "commercial" fragrances are more or less the same cheap chemical soup, so I started to dismiss them (with exceptions of course) and quickly move onto niche or "private collections."
With that said, this is the diamond in the rough, more so than some other overhyped vintages; although it's not mentioned anywhere, this actually reminds me more of Serge Lutens Chene than Bentley & CdG.

12 year old me begged my mother to buy this for me when we were in Duty Free going into the US. I remember my mother smelling it and saying "phuff...are you sure?"... I have no regrets. I still love this scent!

@Bugsbunny
Where did you get that lucky bargain? :)
فروش اين عطر از كلكسيون شخصي بنده با حجم ٩٥ درصدي ٠٩٣٦٢٢١٥٤٥٣
Just got it yesterday and I love it.

I think the notes on this are right on target!. As with so many reviews, I think this is a perfectly blended scent and no individual note overwhelms. I am not sure smoke or incense belongs in the #1 spot because this will not remind you of church or the smoke of lets say Sahara Noir or L' Air du Desert Marocain, but there is certainly incense in there. Manly. Dark. Cedar, leather and a slight bit of pepper. Sandalwood to give it a spicy smoke.
I blind bought this at $100.00 for 1.7oz because I simply had to experience it myself and while I like it a great deal I would not say it was worth what I paid. Close to the skin and so many have noted. Still detectable 6 hours later but its on its way out. If you stumble upon it for a great deal then I say "go for it" but otherwise I would test out other comparable scents that you can know for sure you will love.

Gucci Pour Homme. This fragrance is so adult and sexy, I can totally understand why it was discontinued. No one else seems to have commented on that here. I bought this as a mini just out of curiosity--and a love of woody, smoky fragrances--but I ran to Ebay immediately afterwards to pay a premium price for a 3oz flacon. Sexiest manufactured thing I've put my nose to since Bulgari Black.

It's Gucci signature, it's a masterpiece that never repeated. Woody Oudh with beautiful spices. Very masculine. It's for night on lovely spring or winter seasons. The bad news it's no more available ..

Nice, but nobody will know you are wearing this because projection is very poor. No amount of sprays will resolve the projection issue. Strangely, longevity is excellent.

Btw, the Bentley is the best imitator by far. It is the same perfumer after all, and I get the impression he set out to recreate the Gucci, perhaps note for note.
Gucci, please get this gem back into production, or your karma will keep going down!
Smells of a newly sharpened Mongol Pencil No. 2.

This will never get "replaced"
It's like Michael Jordan, it's over..it was one of the greatest of all times
It's better this way, makes me appreciate my full bottle every time I see it
Just wish the price gouging wasn't so ridiculous or I would not be so frugal on the trigger, especially this time of the year when I want it to be my signature....

Beautiful dry wood and incense. To me this wood is very creamy, and the dry down sublime. Of course it's discontinued. That's my luck.

So far I have tried these "replacements" (to be updated):

Wonderwood - Not the same. Sweeter, and more piney. Not classy.ISOE, Vetiver
CDG 2 Man - Similar opening. Dry down is not the same at all. Vetiver.
Tommy Bahama -
Bentley -
Still a fuxing beast!! PERIOD!
Each time I wear it, I get stunned. Beautiful . End.

this art blended with my essence for many years of my adolescence, high quality mixture. You only really know what you have once you lost it or until it becomes discontinued.




What is the best perfume sample co website that ships to the USA and Canada?

I have this perfumm.every thing is mixed well and it doesnt tire your nose and soul.great mix of spicy,smoky and woody notes and i think its spicy smell is unique between perfumes i have ever seen.but unfortunately this top perfume production was discontinued.i miss it ,great perfume.

The second Gucci Pour Homme I from the Millenium doesn´t need a lot of words. It´s a classic, masculine incense + cedar fragrance.
It came out at a time when there was a cedar trend. Now it´s gone and so did PH I too.
Today there is a trend to oud. And even oud seems to be the setting trend. The whole circle rotates again.
Gucci Pour Homme I isn´t an individual fragrance, but it was pretty popular, so is the hype after the discontinuation.
There are a few similar male fragrances out there, don´t pay those kapitalists the hundreds of Euros for the stocked up bottles.
Best alternative so far is Comme des Garcons 2 Man. Amouage Fate Man and Carbone de Balmain are distant cousins.

The quintessential cedar fragrance, tragically discontinued. If Gucci had any sense they would bring this timeless masterpiece back to market. Dry and woody with a soft warmth and smokiness. I spent a year in Casablanca some ten years ago and this beauty was the only scent I wore. My girlfriend at the time said it was the sexiest and manliest smell she had ever encountered, and requested that I only ever wear this. Vivid memories: hot sweaty nights infused with sex, passion and wine, candles burning and the scent of Gucci Pour Homme lingering in the room. Beautiful, classic, sensual... A masterpiece!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content:
This is one of the best lilac inspired perfumes. It's very sophisticated and lasts for days on my skin, hair and clothes. I've been looking high and low and Gucci surprised me with this springy creation. It is not powdery, nor sweet and definitely not airy or too green like other perfumes I've tried. It's amazing and the ambery drydown is very original, not a powdery soup of notes. It's not similar to the Guilty original. I think they should rebrand it and call it Purple Love. An ode to lilac.
Liliac is a symbol of love, resilience, hope and rebirth, it's also close to my heart as it reminds me of my wedding. What can I say? I love Love!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: absolutely love. gorgeous warm sweetish amber and intense lilac. also very musky. i don't smell patch but I'm a bit anosmic to it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content:
Oooh this is nice! A tiny bit heavy on the amber for me (amber brings a dull quality to scents for me, which brings down the experience) but really this is so pleasant! If someone gifted this to me, I would definitely wear it.

It has a sort of grunge vibe. Sort of damp, but still wonderfully floral. :)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: In a trip to Montana I smelled real lilac for the first time. I was in LOVE. I’ve been searching for that smell for so long- I usually hate it in perfumes because it’s so fake and powdery. Then I found this, and it captures it so beautifully. It’s floral, soft, feminine, dewy, and ever so slightly fruity. “Lovely” has been used a lot in its reviews, and it truly is.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: This just smells exactly like the original edp Gucci Guilty to me.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content:
Elegant
Beautiful
Classy
For dates
For day out in restaurant
For pool party
For every imaginable occasion during the day
For brunch
It's a no brainer
Slightly sweet candy floral, so feminine...and the bottle is also nice
Compliment getter from handsome men on street as well

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content:
The opening is a realistic, slightly sweet and fresh, lilac.
It is a little green, very light, the lilac note stays throughout the life of the fragrance on your skin. This makes it an ideal perfume for spring.
The musk gives it depth and the patchouli appears after 3 to 4 hours.
It is a very pleasant fragrance overall, but it is linear and for me, a bit too light to invest in, I like my perfume to be more intense, as my skin eats it up.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: Soft, delicate, powdery lilac. This is what I imagine (book) Yennefer from the Witcher would smell like.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: It's amazing, just like gucci guilty in black bottle. Feel like under the lilac tree. I hope it doesn;t get discontinued.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: Call me crazy but this has a bizarre apple note that reminds me of Badee Al Oud Sublime. Very shampooey. Hand to god I can't smell lilac at all

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content:
I just left my grandmother's viewing. Her funeral is tomorrow and I came to macys because I wanted to buy a lip product for me to use.

I walked past the fragrance counter for a spritz drive by. I usually don't pay attention to the gucci counter but for some coincidence i spotted this matte lightish purple bottle. Automatically, I reach for it ...I sprayed and didn't even think anything of it until this wave of light flooded my brain..I couldn't even believe what I was smelling. Its a beautiful lilac with a lovely musk that's not the grungy musk . Its a calming, comforting scent that's almost as if you're getting embraced by an angel that's come to let you know everything will be alright even though things aren't looking right.

My grandmother's casket is a lilac light purple color with a slight mauve sheen tint to it. . So I leaned into the fragrance even more. It smells the way the color looks. Its not linear on my skin. It evolves and gets better as the time goes.

This review is getting too emotional. I appreciate the time to sink into this smell. I love it so much. First spray and maybe ill just grab a 2nd bottle just because. My grama and I used to bond over fragrance. The last time she complimented my perfume she asked for it and I swiftly gave her the bottle. Grama, I miss you so much. I love you.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: I get a very clean powdery scent in a softly sweet floral background. This is a clean girl fragrance. It’s pleasant but almost a bit too powdery to me. Anyways, if you want something calm and feminine, it’s worth trying.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content:
My latest purchase from Gucci, and this is so lovely. A Romantic floral beauty. Love at first sniff for me. It has lilac, amber, patchouli, and musk. When I sprayed it at the store, I asked them if it has a fruity note too, and they said it does not. Even the pyramid doesn’t show any fruity notes, but I definitely pick something sweet and fruity here. Either way, I love it.

- Bhavna Darira Chesan

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: Definitely get the lilac, patchouli, and musk and it's well blended, but definitely feels like there's some kind of fruit that isn't listed! Like it feels life a softer fruity floral version of the OG

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content:
The opening is lovely. I am quite enamored with it. I feel skin-like lilac and musk. It is carnal and sensual. On my sample card it states only patchouli essence, vanillin and oak moss. I think in addition to the ingredients of the classic. Vanilla indeed sweetens it but in a great and restrained way. Patchouli or oak moss are not prominent on me. It feels present but light and solar. In how it wears it reminds me of J'Adore, sillage-wise. Close to the classic, lilac is the main focus. If one has the classic this is not needed, I think.
It is a feel good, smell good scent that does not make a statement and won't offend anyone. It is however sensual, luxurious and effortless. 6 hours in and I feel it gently around me, which means good performance.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: Gucci Guilty has been my signature fragrance since 2011. Started with the OG EDT and the intense, and I remember being devastated when it got discontinued and replaced with the newer EDP, which smelled completely different. Things got a little better with the more recent EDT, which has become my new go-to and was a lot closer to the original notes I love, and then a little worse with the new intense, which I can’t stand. But having recently purchased this, it’s brought back everything I remember loving about the original EDT and more. An easy, classic, soft-powdery-sweet floral. Just unfortunate that it’s a limited edition. Went for the 50ml, but will definitely be stocking up on the 90ml at a later point.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: Lovely scent. I am getting slight violet candy scent - not as dense or sweet, more comforting and soft with hints of it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: Wauw..I had little expectations for this fragrance as I am not the biggest fan of Gucci fragrances in general...but this is a gorgeous scent, that is quite unique imo. I think she is full bottle worthy and I will ad her to my collection very soon.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: i did not expect to like this frag as much as i do. the lilac on top is very sophisticated, and there is somehow an aquatic component to the scent. the base musk remains pretty powdery throughout the wear. all together there is something clean yet naughty about this scent, like cleaning yourself up with an expensive hygienic wipe after.. ahem... my only complaint is that i wish this lasted longer on the skin as i can only get a couple hours max out of it, but attaches itself to clothes a bit better

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content:
The opening is a beautiful fresh Lilac blossom with a hint of green and aquatic touch. Very shortly it goes into a slightly lotion-like powdery modern musk with ambery touches. If you don't like ambroxan you will certainly notice it in this composition, it's very present. I can tolerate it because it's dialed back here and the scent overall is very intimate and close to the skin.
Unfortunately after a short 10-15 minutes it dries down to a very uninspiring ambery musk base with a hint of sweetness to it. I don't think it worth the price.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: Went to go pick up the men’s version of this but tested this one out. Wound up buying it for my fiancé. Smells exactly what I want my woman to smell like

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content:
100 ml worthy
Its soo modern..... ..feminine..calming..beautiful...
Sexy..lady like..happy scent
Just buy the big bottle immediately

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: Pretty, lilac-y smelling frag. Smells very feminine and like the color purple, but musky & powdery

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: the most delicious wonderful thing my nose has ever had the pleasure of sniffing. it has all of my favorite scent components, beautiful lilac and powdery musk. i can still smell it days later on all my jewelry and i start smiling and kicking my feet when i get a whiff of it. i wish i did not fall in love with a fragrance i cant easily get on a discount site... if anyone knows if this smells the same as the pink one from 2020 plz let me know....

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: Gorgeous, a very realistic lilac. Smells like springtime. What can I say? I want it!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: Tried this at a store and I just couldn't take my mind off it. A week later went back for a bottle. It's a calm and lovely scent. New fav!!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: To my nose and on my skin the opening reminds me of J’Adore but with lots of woodsy notes and without melon. The florals have the same classic sort of fresh feel to them. The drydown makes me think of My Burberry Black. It’s nice and inoffensive but not outstanding enough for me to want a full bottle.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: This is quite lovely. I tried it at the store and I left smelling kind of "put together". I agree with the other reviews saying that this smells quite unisex and mature. At the beginning all I could smell was lilac and the freshness of musk but as it dries down the musk and amber become more dominant making the scent less floral and more masculine. Sadly way too overpriced for what it is to be full bottle worthy but definitely a like.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: I tried it in the store. I think it's a brilliant unisex scent. I like floral scents. It has a bit of masculinity to it, I love it! I'm going to buy it!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content:
Gucci Guilty Love Edition 2024 is hands down my favorite version since the original gold square bottle that I loved! I've tried every version since then, trying to recapture that feeling lol. It's very lilac-forward at first, and to me it lasts much longer than the 2021 version. I sometimes have a love/hate relationship with patchouli, but thankfully the patchouli in this is the sweet earthy, green, fresh kind. It really adds richness and longevity to the perfume. It might start off feeling cool and realistic like you're burying your head in a lilac bush, but it gets richer as it dries down, and becomes more warm, deep, and ambery. I think that is where the genius of this version lies. This is so pretty! The ingredients include hydroxycitronellal and alpha-isomethyl ionone, but this is not a powdery violet, it comes off as a freshly floral, sweet (not sugary) lilac mixed with lily of the valley. It's not really fruity either, like the raspberry 2020 version. Modern, not "matronly."

I use 4 sprays (both elbows, both sides of neck) and on 4 out of the 5 days I wore it last week I got complimented and asked what I was wearing, so apparently people can smell it a few feet away about 4 or so hours after I applied it. Would be appropriate during Spring, Summer, and even Autumn. Days, not nights. It really smells PURPLE and I love the dusky purple bottle. I bought a 50mL, but will be going back for the bigger bottle before this limited edition disappears! It's not as rich or sweet as the Elixir, but I think it would be lovely to wear this one during the day and then spritz the Elixir over it in the evening for a little more oomph!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: On the paper it's very similar to the old Gucci guilty that I loved! And I see I'm not the only one who thinks that :)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: Powdery, mature and lasts forever. I washed my hands 3 times and still couldn’t scrub it off. I’m more of a sweets and gourmand girl so this was definitely not for me.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: I have this in my collection now and I will say a positive thing about the performance. This scent profile typically lends itself to being an evening scent and I originally thought that this was going to be that for me but I've found it appropriate for all day wear and easily worn in temps of 70-80F. I live in Palm Springs; CA and it never gets cold here during the day, so I don't really need that many cold weather fragrances in my collection. For me, I get a good 5-6 hours of wear with this with moderate projection and scents have a way of just slipping off my skin. Also, with designer scents, I'm much more likely to overspray and not feel bad about it. I wore this to my parents and they mentioned how strong my perfume was. Yes, they both have sensitive noses, but I ALWAYS wear perfume and they don't ALWAYS say this to me, so I say the performance of this fragrance is actually good for me. I've just opted to purchase bottom filled fragrance decant travel sprays and make a travel spray for most of my perfumes at this point. Like, the only ones in my collection that don't need to be refreshed during the day are Hibiscus Mahajad, Delina, BTSO (they have PHENOMENAL performance), Angel, Perris Monte Carlo, Althair, BDK. Performance of perfumes just suck in general for me so it's nothing new for a perfume to last 5-6 hours. Actually that's good for me. Buy a Gucci Guilty body lotion, put it on under the perfume and you're good. The only lilac scent I own and have liked so far.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: This is quite nice soft and powdery lilac scent. Certainly reminiscent of her predecessors. well done and stays long. Very feminine, motherly, gentle scent. I like it!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: I like it! I received the perfume as a sample gift. It's a smooth, sweet and dark lilac scent. The package says “mousse de chêne”, which means it has oakmoss. Although it is not as dominant as in the chypres, it adds a nice depth to the scent with patchouli. Lilac always gives me an innocent impression, but not here. This is a sexy and mature lilac.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content:
Sampled this on skin. The lilac is quite nice. It's ambery, but with that typical somewhat soapy, soft Gucci Guilty DNA. It's quite likeable, but at the same time not very memorable. Dries down nondescript ambery. It's nice, but I'm not wowed. I guess that typical Gucci Guilty DNA just isn't for me. I can't handle white musk whatsoever.

It's been 8 hours or more and I can still smell it on skin from two sprays. I guess with sufficient sprays performance should be quite decent.

The bottle is the wrong colour though. Should have been lilac, like that Gucci Flora Magnolia bottle. Why is that one lilac anyway?

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content:
There's a soft green note at the top that I couldn't discern, then I found out that it was lilacs! I don't think I've ever smelled fresh lilacs so it's very unique. Definitely fits the bottle color. Doesn't last too long though.

If you've seen Nosferatu (2024) I feel like this fits in with that vibe (iykyk). The dry down is light and powdery, almost like baby powder. I like it, it's different. It has a mature, yet ethereal edge to it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: OMG! The moment it hit me, it took me straight back to my fave memories. This is so subtle, so simple, and far from generic. It’s versatile enough for all four seasons, especially during the day, for night time probably I would combine it with different scents like more woody ones.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: I really love this fragrance with the subtle powdery lilac and the sweet ambery dry-down. I'm just disappointed with the performance compared to my other fragrances in terms of longevity. I'll update if that improves. Still a beautiful fragrance.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: After the first spray, I thought that this was my ultimate lilac perfume. That thought disappeared within 10 minutes. My grandma used to soak lilac flowers in this cheap chipre cologne to create some sort of rubbing alcohol. This is what it smells like after 10 minutes: green amber, or cheap lilackish cologne. Super disappointing.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content:
I was really looking forward to testing this but sadly I'm very disappointed. I own the elixir version and that is a violet, rose, fruitachouli with vanilla bomb with excellent lasting power. Very sweet, yes but it's fun and easy to wear. This new love edition is quite frankly very much like the original Gucci Guilty pour femme but weaker. It is more fresh I will give you that but it didn't bring anything really new to the table. I was expecting more of a real lilac presence and this isn't that. A fresher version of the original. And it is sweeter than what the above accords would have you think. Nothing new, weaker and quite boring.

Edit: 1/4/25 the review above mine nailed it. Right, totally right. This is very weak. The lilac accord starts off nice but disappears quickly. What the hell Gucci?! The rest of this line is a nuclear bomb. Also, after 5 minutes it turned into a weaker version of the original. I am sooo disappointed. I wanted to like this one and have it in my collection. If you are looking for lilac search elsewhere this is more of a fruity/floral/patchouli just like the original. Nice but not really all that floral. But then again the younger crowd will probably think this is very floral. It is somewhat more floral than many so called floral newer fragrances on the market today.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: Smelled this today at Sephora, really surprised to not see violets on the note list. I definitely smelled a violet note in here and to me lilacs and violets do not smell alike. I'm a huge violet fan and lilacs are definitely not a note I seek out. The patchouli was very well done and not overwhelming whatsoever. I found this to be clean, fresh, and it had that violet cooling quality that they possess. This wasn't powdery. It was listed as being woody and perhaps I didn't smell long enough for the woody notes to come out but to me it was much more of a fresh floral fragrance.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content:
As with the male version in this love edition 2024, the notes are not 100% as declared by the brand, according to Gucci are essence of Patchouli, vanillin and oakmoss accord, but here there is much more and you can especially notice flowers, I feel the pristine cleanliness of the lilies of the valley and the most modern lilac like A drop by Issey and above all, the one it most resembles is another fragrance from the house of Gucci, which is from its private line. "Tears of the moon" I suspect that these love editions, like the previous ones, are the work of Alberto Morillas, as is Tears of the Moon, this love edition is not so similar to the one compared to 2020, that one had a very present raspberry along with it to the violet and in this one the floral of the lilac is felt more like in the 2021 edition but even so it is not as similar, this one has its own path, it is a clean floral fragrance with an almost solar lilac accompanied by the whiter and soapier lily of the valley, bathed by the slight sweetness of Patchouli and a shy bitter touch of that oak moss accord with a base (like inj the masculine one) of that very modern "ambroxanic" vanillin, but without sweet excesses, no extremities and just like the men's version, the color of the bottle honors the fragrance inside, bravo for these two new Gucci releases, I completely loved them.
PS: if you like tears of the moon but find it excessively expensive, this would be a good option, although they have a similar vibe, it is not that they are the same.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content:
Lady at the perfume counter gave me a sample of this today (was surprised samples even exist yet).

I am a big fan of the gucci guilty line.

It's a beautiful clean ambery-powdery lilac. Smells very similar to the eau de toilette. So it can be redundant if you own the EDT.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Love Edition Pour Femme 2024 Gucci
review_content: I sell perfumes. The tester arrived today. I really liked this scent. The lilac scent is the note I feel the most. I also like patchouli. The lilac is in the foreground, patchouli comes as you wait. The matte lilac bottle is wonderfull. If you like lilac scents, you should definitely try it.
Alien Goddess by Mugler but without cashmeran. Marie Salamagne's vanilla DNA. Sweet bourbon vanilla, without flowery aspect.
It’s floral with fresh and clean breeze. The projection is not that loud; it’s the kind of smell you would wear during office hours but it is more fitting for daytime trips.

This smells like a daytime version of Dolce & Gabbana the one desire. If you get it on your clothes it will smell identical the next day, and you get more of a vanilla/caramel scent.

I think the reason why some people smell banana in this is because of the sweetness from the vanilla and freshness from the ozonic notes, which combined give off a hint of ripe fruit + yellow bottle = banana

Love it! Sweet fruity vanilla, cosy yet fresh. I could still smell it on my skin next day. I don't smell banana, more like a melon like scent. I used to have the Atheeri by Lattafa, that perfume caused me mayor headaches and nausea, despite me liking the scent, there was something off. Later I found out about the gucci one, and was expecting banana, but after smelling it, it immediately reminded me of the Lattafa one, so I was expecting the headache and nause to come, and it never did. This perfume is just perfect, some say it is not unique, however I find it very unique in it's own right amongst my 30ish perfumes. Maybe I am not a total connoisseur but to my nose Gucci Flora Gorgeous Orchid is delicious, clean, sweet and long lasting.

Gorgeous Orchid leads with a melon-mango-aquatic note (or ozonic, if you prefer...), but there is also some generalized floral sweetness, and powdery, non-gourmand vanilla in the background. For me, this is a pleasant stand-out among the Gorgeous Flora line, though overall it does seem generally similar to many, many other fruity-floral aquatic scents.
Regardless of its degree of distinctiveness, it certainly is a freshly wet-sweet fragrance for casual wear.
Mango icecream in a bottle

i love love this one so much, i sadly lost it somehow since i only had a 10ml travel bottle and it was always in my purse.
one day it wasnt there anymore and i cried lol. this is such a spring scent, i have always loved orchid in anything and with the sweetness from the vanilla this is AMAZING. such a fresh and light scent, it sadly just doesnt last as long.

Maybe my nose is going crazy, but this smelled exactly like Miss Dior to me. I'm sick of Miss Dior (I used up my travel spray and thought I liked it, but the moment I bought a full bottle I couldn't stand wearing it anymore, I really need to sell that thing). I don't know what it is, because looking at the pyramids they don't even have any notes in common, but there's something musty and powdery about both perfumes that makes me want to gag now. Such a shame, vanilla and vanilla orchid sound so beautiful. Luckily I only bought a small decant of Gorgeous Orchid.
I was Shocked cause i smell fruits like a mango scent
i had a deo spray from adidas that smelt somewhat like this. is it good, is it bad? what do i know? it’s not unpleasant.
You know a perfume is well loved when literally no one is reselling it on Mercari.

Yes, I smell banana flower that have similar vibes with JPG La Belle Paradise Garden, but this one is lean more on vanilla heavy. It's not offensive yet charming and feminine. Creamy and elegant. Not a fan of vanilla but this one is safe choice.
I would say this is a very original scent DNA for a quite typical easy wear vanilla. There is nothing bad or wrong with this at all but it pretty tame. Still special tho!

Don't know where everyone gets the banana from? To me it's a creamy, floral, vanilla. It's a heavy scent and I definitely wouldn't overspray it. Longevity is quite the letdown though, I'd say not longer than 2 hours, but maybe it's better if you spray more. But that would be too much spillage wise I feel.

I don't even know what's going on here, so much fruit, and a note of... Fig? Maybe it's my nose but even if it's not listed in here I swear, this has to include it somehow. It reminds me of a cottage lost in a flower field in the middle of spring. I mentioned the fig cause I sense something reminiscent of jam, powdered with a mix of honey. There's also the need to mention that this perfume is STRONG, not so sure about the sillage but damn, the projection might've fill up an entire room with a tiny spray. Also there might be some mangoes going on here... And almost banana too, as I mentioned, super fruity. And there's also this signature clean vibe to it as well, similar to Gorgeous Gardenia, but more diffused. It has more depth than Gardenia, with all the fruitiness and sweetness going on, so if you like fun, bubbly fragances this might be a good find for you.

I love it!!! 🥰🥰🥰 It's so tropical, wet, solar, feminine...forever on vacation! I can also smell mango in the notes and maybe some other tropical fruits.Omg and it's not even my type of scents. I'll get a full bottle!💛💛💛💛💛💛

I love, love, love this! The vanilla is soft and inviting, and dries down into a beautiful floral orchid. Lasts a pretty long time but I wouldn’t call it a beast mode fragrance. Definitely worth picking up if you like floral vanillas.

This is a creamy
Vanilla scent slightly salty it reminds me of beach walk maison margiela and CK reveal has that suncream undertone it’s alot smoother and longer lasting nice one for daywear

I tried it at the store, but it smelled like banana cream. But I got a good deal, and my boyfriend said he liked it, so I bought it. When it came, I loved it right away. It smells so warm and unique. I love it, and I'll totally buy it again. It's more mango-y now instead of banana. I don't know; it's such a unique vanilla scent, and I love it.
Atheeri is a great dupe. Gorgeous Orchid smells so good, beautful banana-ylang floral, but I already own Atheeri, so I don't need this, since they are so similar.

The best perfume I’ve discovered in recent years!! It’s divine — I don’t get any banana note, and I also don’t find it gourmand (I usually don’t like gourmand). To me, it’s a sweet floral with vanilla, absolutely divine! Longevity is moderate, but it feels like a garden of orchids with vanilla. Perfect! A blind buy success.

Lovely, easily wearable, smooth, flowery vanilla. Smells like eating a vanilla dessert in the seaside of Italy in the early summer. Ozonic notes are loosen up vanilla's density. Not a scent that elevates my pulse, but it’s pleasant and feminine. If you're looking for an airy vanilla scent with youthful floral hint, get this.
Unfortunately longevity and sillage are both weaknesses, it’s a bit overpriced to be reapplied 5-6 times a day…
Lemon flavoured Mascarpone whipped cream
Banana laffy taffy

I usually have a problem with vanilla scents, but this is a love! The yellow bottle has possibly confused my brain, but to me banana is very much there, together with a hint of sitrus and airy, lovely vanilla. So good!

I tested this many, many times and was obsessed with the idea of it. I love vanilla and I loved the cheerful and feminine yellow floral bottle. I really got it in my head that this injection of yellow was what I needed in my life.

So even though I always felt unsure after testing, I went ahead and bought an 8ml decant. Oh boy... this stuff gives me nausea. Really badly. As in, I get so sick that I feel on the verge of vomiting.

Not to say that this perfume smells putrid or anything. It doesn't. But whatever they use to create "ozonic notes" does not agree with my body. In general, salty vanilla scents make me uncomfortable. The whole concept is odd to me. Either be vanilla or be marine, but don't try to be both.

This to me smells very chemical, like watered down banana cough syrup. If you like banana then that might actually be great for you. It also has intense longevity.

The entire Gucci gorgeous line is just... not for me. What will be very interesting is if and when they make an "intense" version of this scent. I'm afraid, but also curious at the same time 😅

Disappointed. No sweet vanilla note and all I smell is bathroom airfreshner/ potpourri. I've tried it on my skin.. I've sprayed it on clothing and pillow cases and I don't know which is worse. Definitely has a citrus note as well in the opening.

The tester in store was sweeter so I'm hoping the sweetness develops over time.

To experience this girl at her best, try wearing her during a late summer, early fall balmy day. She favors this warmer weather at the end of summer. Any other time she’s off putting and kind of sickening.
Vanillac sunshine freshie with an aldehydic pop, a "sunny" designer perfumey vanilla. Not a fave but possibly has potential
When first sprayed this was a very beautiful gourmand vanilla, not too sweet. When it dried down my arm smelled like it was decomposing lmao

Yes, this is a pretty simple fragrance, but the lightly floral ozonic notes make this a very clean and fresh vanilla which is pretty unique. This is sweet but has no cloyingness, and it's a safe vanilla for those who like fresh scents and a safe fresh scent for vanilla loyalists. If you’re looking for a typical warm, gourmand vanilla, this is not for you. If you love clean fragrances but want something a bit sweet and vanilla-centric, this is perfect, especially for warmer weather when sweet fragrances can become suffocating.
This does NOT smell like vanilla. Fucci Flora Flop!
Absolutely love this one. It's sweet, but also fresh/aquatic and a bit floral. Makes me think of having a delicious dessert outside on vacation. Such a bright, happy, uplifting scent.
Been wearing this one for about a year or so - and I have found over time (could just be my nose lol) the smell has changed. Fresh, clean, has a nice powdery scent to it. I don't get banana at all :)
For me, it was love at first sniff. Very uplifting and warm!
combines floral & vanilla so well. very unique
OMG!!! The airyness in this vanilla is MAGICAL😍

Beautiful, vanilla, floral with an interesting ozonic fresh fantasy accord.

Atheeri does not smell like this! Sorry, it doesn't. Not at all. And, if I need to wait a year for it to mature, Lattafa do better. Either macerate the perfume properly before putting it out on the market or use better ingredients, like other affordable Middle Eastern brands, so upon purchase your customers do not have to wait so long to use their purchase.

Perfume is NOT wine, when one buys a perfume, ideally we want to wear it out of the box.

An additional thought, Lattafa, usually after 30 days an item is not returnable. SOOO, if a perfume takes 6-months to a year to develop, then it just does not make sense for many buyers to discover if the fragrance is right for them. Especially with some retailers not having testers available on site and/or telling you a perfume is a "final sale". This is no bueno for sales and/or buyers.

Thank you for considering my thoughts.
Very pretty ozonic vanilla, bf lovesss it. Think it would be hard to find someone that really didn't like this, girly and inoffensive. Doesn't last very long though so have held off purchasing.

Ozonic notes make this one stand out compared to other florals
I tried lattafa atheeri before but it is so far from this
I guess the ozonic notes might be hard to dupe
it smells really original

I absolutely adore this scent, despite it being rather simple and linear it reminds me a lot of fresh mornings in spring. I personally get a bit of lemonade when I smell it on my skin but others have told me it smells very floral with an underlying tone of vanilla which becomes more prominent once it dries down throughout the day.

I normally prefer gourmand scents, but this hits just the spot between gourmand and fresh for me and I've fallen in love. It's a great everyday scent for spring and summer (and warm fall days) that I think anyone regardless of age (or gender if you're a man who prefers florals) can wear. Longevity is surprisingly decent and the silage is good enough to not be overwhelming unless you drown yourself in it.

If you like soft, feminine, floral, happy, sweet, fresh yet cozy scents then I recommend gorgeous Orchid!

I think this is such a lovely scent, perfect for a sunny day. I find it opens up with a laconic vanilla which almost mimics a creamy banana (in a good way). Once it start to settle on my skin the vanilla flora really start to shine and feel almost fresh and airy. It's perfect for vanilla lovers who want something light and flora for the spring to summer months!
To the comment below mine, YES, YES, YES!

Very Beautiful, sweet, powdery, ozonic, bright, airy, fresh, sunny, feminine, sensual, flirty, elegant, chic, delicate, uplifting, charming, whimsical, divine, dreamy, happy, cheerful, enchanting, delightful, alluring, inviting, cozy, comforting, unique, vanilla centered

So, this is actually rather difficult to describe. It feels bright, happy, cheerful, and charming. It’s a fresh and airy vanilla, but it’s also sweet, and somehow even cozy. It’s delicate and powdery, but also has a kind of creaminess to it. It’s basic, linear, and rather simple, yet somehow unique. It’s like its uniqueness comes from its simplicity. It’s sweet, but not too sweet, and never cloying. If sunshine and happiness could be bottled, this is what it would smell like!

I bought this as soon as it was available to pre-order from Gucci, and I was apparently one of the first people to try it. Oh my goodness it was so very beautiful to me! It’s been just over a year now, and I still love it just as much as I did from the very first sniff! This is easily the best of the whole Flora collection! This has actually ended up becoming one of my top favorite vanillas! I absolutely adore it! It’s one of the few fragrances that I keep a backup bottle of. It’s also one of my most complimented fragrances. Everyone just really seems to love this one!

This is perfect as a fragrance to wear everyday, and would make a lovely signature scent. It wears beautifully throughout the entire year, and feels suitable for women of all ages. It’s a super easy reach that works for all occasions. The bottle is really beautiful, it gives the perfect vibe for the fragrance it holds. Also, the spray nozzle works wonderfully, it always sprays evenly and the perfect amount.

I get excellent performance with Gorgeous Orchid. The longevity is incredible, it lasts throughout the entire day on me, and I can smell it the next morning. The projection is great, it radiates out at least a few feet from me.

For reference, some of my other favorite vanillas include Kayali Yum Boujee Marshmallow, Kayali The Wedding Silk Santal, Kayali Vanilla 28, Kayali Vanilla Candy Rock Sugar, Kayali Yum Pistachio Gelato, PDM Oriana, Kilian LDBS, Burberry Goddess, The 7 Virtues Vanilla Woods, Ellis Brooklyn Marshmallows, VS Vanilla Lace, BBW Beach Nights, BBW Boardwalk Marshmallow Clouds

*as a side note, I don’t get any banana with this. Also, everyone I’ve personally asked about it has also said that they don’t get banana. I also agree with the comment that’s below mine a few, about “sunshine flavored ice cream”.

Sprayed it in the air, and didn’t like it. I thought maybe if I sprayed it on my skin I might think different. I get a creamy banana shake with vanilla extract. I do not like it and can’t get my mind away from the banana dry down

HEAVEN. HEAVEN ON EARTH OMG????? ITS one of the best things I've ever smelt. It smells just like sol de janeiro's 59 but if it fell under a clean scent category, it's a very soapy sweet soft fluffy orchid vanilla I want to drown in this forever
Are there any 1:1 impressions of this yet in 2025?
inoffensive and yet i’m offended

To my nose, this is clean, warm, creamy vanilla. Nothing uber-special or new on the market, but it's pretty enough for me to want to wear it. I don't know what it is similar to, but I definitely smelled that DNA before. I'm sure it will be people-pleaser, but I don't find it so attractive to call it sexy. I guess we'll see by men's reaction..

This is just a linear, very sweet vanilla fragrance that screams basic. It could have been big in the 90s, along with peroxide blonde hair, Von Dutch and smacking chewing gum.

She’s that girl…

This is my favorite heavy-floral-vanilla perfume. It smells like a ripe mango at the first sniff, and it suddenly turns into an orchid, peony kind of flower on a vanilla base. The vanilla fragrance in this perfume is not exaggerated, but properly light and sweet, so you can use it in summer.
Opening is sooo pretty and pleasant but I honestly tell you it disappears as soon as it hits you. For the money, I'd prefer something that lasts much longer than that.

I received a free sample of this through a recent Sephora purchase and while I was open to giving it a try, I don't see myself putting it on after trying it on to test it. Heavy, sweet, linear vanilla and that's it. I don't get much else from this, even in the dry down. Kinda wish I liked this more after reading all of the positive reviews.

I prefer the smell of this on clothing vs skin. On skin it is Heavy on the florals. On clothing it has a warmer almost spicer element which I wish was more prominent. It’s a pretty scent but nothing super unique. I thought I really loved it at first sniff but every time I go back for another it kind of just gives air freshener? Not in a terrible way but just not in a way I necessarily want on my skin! One of my favorite YouTubers rants and raves about this one,, and I just have to disagree it’s mediocre. But the dry down is heavenly, a lot smoother and warm vanilla. Just wish the top notes weren’t as screechy of a floral.

I want to love this, but I cannot. When I read others who describe it as "fluffy and refreshing", "light and brisk", "banana", etc.. I cannot agree. But I want to interpret it this way, because the dry down can almost get me there. The beginning is almost unbearably too much for me: strong, intense, heavy, sweat... and something else that I don't really know what it is (maybe the vanilla?). Someone said that the 'dry down' reminded them of Marc Jacobs and I really want to know WHICH Marc Jacobs. Because the far dry down is, to me, the best part - yet still not quite there.

Beautiful bottle. Interesting scent that fall a bit short for me. Envious of you who are getting this one as a bullseye!

I mean, I have smelt a banana, this is not that. It's like a refreshing vanilla. It's like a vanilla sky, a fluffy refreshing scent cloud that swirls around you all day. It is long lasting. It is strong. But it isn't cloying or heavy. It's light and brisk and charming. Somehow the scent seems cool in my nose. Idk. I freaking love it. It's wonderful

Nose Note #450

A great new release from Gucci that's getting really popular in 2025 and for a reason. Really sweet, very yellow (bottle ycolor is matching perfectly). The three notes given don't tell the story. It's a little peachy and very flowery. But maybe it does consist of only handful of notes, because this bears minimal complexity and doesn't develop almost at all and thus can become a little annoying.
But my wife loves it - that's most important.

9/10, also smells like banana!!
Smells like sunshine flavored ice cream. A creamy summer day. I know that doesn’t make sense but that’s exactly the vibe it has.

It's a simple, sunny and nice scent for summer and spring, but very light on my skin.

One hour later, i can barely smell it on my arm, so... i like the smell but it's not enough to buy a full bottle.

I do not get any banana! However, I do not get bread either and my mom said I smelled like bread and it made me chuckle. We are used to the asian-style milk breads - but I don't think she enjoyed me smelling like bread in the car. I've had a travel size for a while and would definitely say it's worth a purchase for those who like simpler scents.

Cooler in temperature, fuzzy, solar, and I can see why they named it orchid - orchids taste very mild. It adds a slight (faintly green) hydration to the fragrance.

A love-at-first-sniff! Reminds me of PDM Althair’s drydown…so lovely and yummy! I spray it on my blanket and robe for sweet dreams lol

EDIT: wore it again to sleep and to correct, this is sweeter than Althair…more feminine should I say because I still smell the florals after long hours…and I AM LOVIN IT SO MUCH!
Love the opening but the drydown reminds me of Marc Jacobs
It feels like mango flavor!

It absolutely reads as banana, not full on banana pudding but a more green banana, sweetened by vanilla - banana has a slight floral smell (to me anyway) rather than all out fruity.
It’s bright, fresh & summery, the opening is quite green. It lasts reasonably well on clothing, on skin maybe 4 hours? A little longer perhaps. It’s one of my favourites right now, perfect for spring and summer.

Smelled way better on the test strip than it did on my skin. On my skin it was a plastic, air freshener like vanilla. I can see why people enjoy it, it’s just not my style. A lot of reviews mentioned banana but I don’t really get any. Very little to no projection. Meh.

I have to be honest. I think many people are imagining a banana note because the bottle is banana yellow. This is very vanilla and creamy, with a bit of a zing (I think that may be the ozone?). I don’t smell flowers at all, this is very gourmand. I tried it out today and kept smelling my own wrist, I just found it very delicious.

This layers so beautifully with Sol de Janeiro Cheirosa 59. I love 59, but since its a mist I was looking for an EDP to enhance its longevity. I love Georgeous Orchids' soft, sweet and fresh aura. 59 adds a depth and sweetness that makes it really stand out.

I actually enjoy this. It reminds me of when I chew on haribo banana sweets 😋. Fresh banana vanilla flowery summer scent.
I enjoy this quite a bit. Its a simple scent nothing complex.
very lovely and cute.. my favourite from the gucci flora series
It's not listed as a note, but I'm definitely getting lychee. Reminds me a lot of Tresor la Nuit.

beautiful summer scent :) nice simple straight forward scent but done very well :) to me it has a sunny sweet disposition............nice smooth vanilla topped with the aroma of orchids............i dont get ozonic notes but maybe thats where i get sunny lol this is easy to wear for any occasion too :)

good one gucci :)
Very very sweet and delicate vanilla carrying a soft lingering hint of banana. The opening is super pleasant, green, fresh.. i just hoped it lasted a bit longer

Really interesting! From the sample strip alone I would not have tried it on skin, it was to my nose vegetal, green and dry, no vanilla. But I did spray it on my hand because I'm in search for soft vanillas and I knew the composition. Glad I did! After a minute it transformed to a sweet and light vanilla with ozonic qualities. It sometimes reminded me of vanilla scented soap (in a good way), a really luxe and expensive soap. Maybe not full bottle worthy, but overall really nice fragrance!

I was expecting a slightly soft sweet vanilla , but instead i got strong garden flowers mixed with mango . So its very floral green . But its a quite pleasant and unique scent, it catches attention for sure .
Very poor performance. Why couldn’t it last longer and have a bit more kick to it?

I tried Bosca Vanilla Forte from Guerlain a few months ago thinking I would love it, but it ended up being way too salty for me. this is exactly what I imagined it would smell like - a slightly aquatic, powdery, and salty vanilla. this is lovely! it has all of the correct facets that turn an ordinary vanilla into a perfect summer signature scent. I only have a little sample but I love it and if you’re looking for a perfect summer vanilla that you can equally wear on your beach day as well as evening dinner, this is the one. it is fleeting on skin but lasts nicely on clothes!

A very floral vanilla fragrance with an ozonic background. Simple but dramatically good—not groundbreaking! I can't imagine how anyone could dislike this perfume.
It performs well with excellent projection. I would definitely recommend this to vanilla fragrance lovers as it's an easy-to-wear, everyday perfume.

Received a full size bottle as a gift. I wear it anytime I go out literally every day and the bottle is still going strong after a year and a half. I have a complicated relationship with this perfume because it does smell good, indisputably, but it doesn’t really fit my vibe at all. I prefer a woodsy, spicy, more unisex scent. I also use Lush’s “Super Milk” product daily (orange, lemon, oat milk, subtle florals) in my hair, so this fragrance REALLY mingles well with that. I just don’t want to wear it forever, because its silage is powerful and the creamy floral blend is quite memorable — not really the kind of smell I want associated with my memory or lingering in every space it touches. If you don’t believe me, ask the kids I teach — they are telling me every single day how good my classroom and office smell, even when I’m not there.
To me this a perfect summer dress perfume, vanilla but airy and fun. I am very picky but this one is a 9,5 / 10.

When I spray Gucci Orchid, I kinda imagine fruits, such as bananas (maybe banana pie?) and passion fruit. I smell vanilla, as well. It is very sweet, may not be hot-weather-friendly, it is a bit heavy :)
I just loved this perfume as soon as I smelled it! People smell it from me quite actively, it has a good projection. This scent gets me compliments even from people who do not like any fragrances :) Longevity is nice: my skin makes perfume evaporate fast, usually, but this one lingers to me for 5+ hours.
Not a safe blind buy, seems a lot of people find this one too generic (I strongly disagree), but definitely worth to test it out! People around me and I all love this beautiful orchid.

So many strange perspectives of this below.

This is not like Burberry goddess because it has no lavender, the similarity is vanilla. Many perfumes have vanilla that doesn’t mean they all smell the same.

This is also no green. Maybe slightly because of the florals but it is sweet.

There’s no banana note but the way vanilla is done here and in my opinion it’s the vanilla orchid note i believe is what creates this illusion of a banana ish scent. To me it reminds me of the little yellow banana runts candies.

With that said i don’t feel this is juvenile like most candy style perfumes can be.

I do find this to be a sort of casual elegant easy type of perfume.

It’s definitely not like “ a generic every department store perfume”. That’s a very generalizing statement.

The closest I’ve smelled of this is Lataffa Atheeri BUT it is not exact as that one has a bit more of a heaviness in the base/ dry down that this one doesn’t have and i believe it’s the amber wood note.

Personally i really love this one and to me it does stand out in my collection of over 150 fragrances both designer and middle eastern and even some niche ones as well.

The reviews are all over the place with this one, seems like it reminds every single person of a different fragrance than the last. I don’t get anything ozonic or salty in this so not sure how people are getting some of these in the “reminds me of” section. I do however get a very generic perfumey department store smell, no one note really stands out. It’s sweet…and that’s about it. It almost gives me Nishane HSW vibes just minus some notes. This is one of those fragrances you’ve smelled before, a dozen times probably. I also don’t get banana which is why I bought it.

It's very linear. I get sugary-banana candy floss and I honestly find it too sweet for the amount of time it lingers.

I'll wear it because I own a bottle, but there's many other scents I gravitate towards before this one.

Faeriecoma is correct, it's a vanilla Little Trees air freshener scent.
This smells great layered with Sol de Janeiro 59 body mist! The orchid notes meld together and SDJ adds depth to it.

it’s lovely and nuanced but almost not enough. gorgeous orchid can easily be mistaken for a vanilla car air fresher. the tree shaped one. similar to queening by mind games not quite but the vibe of a quiet vanilla.

this smells like walking into a victoria's secret by the food court.

very sweet, almost cloyingly so, but also a bit creamy and oddly powdery (especially on first spray). it does smell pretty generic white floral initially, it reminded me of a sweeter jimmy choo, but after several minutes the vanilla seems to be the only note that really survives. i don't get the ozone at all.

i can definitely see the "white chocolate" comparison, but to me it ends up smelling like warm cinnamon bun glaze. really wasn't expecting a gourmand out of this one !

It smelled delicious on the tester, but dried down to play-dough on my skin. I have this problem with a lot of vanilla perfumes - I was really sad it happened with this one since I was hoping to buy the full size.

I have had this on my wishlist since last year and finally got it. I've been testing it for months through samples. It's worth it! Everybody thinks they smell bananas. Y'all this is the ozonic notes that give a (water)melon, 🍈 like a salty type of vanilla vibes. It's a salty, summery, beachy vanilla 🏖️ and I can for sure imagine that vanilla orchid note 🌺, but let's be honest: it's vanilla and sea breeze 🌬️. That's what we get! Perrrrrrrfect for the summer 🏝️ 🌞 ⛱️

I don’t know how to tell yall this but I sprayed this on my wrist for the first time today without reading reviews and I swear to everything when I wave it past my face I get Burberry Goddess. Replace the lavender in BG with a green note and you get this. Sorry but I do, and I am obsessed with BG and I know the opening isn’t similar or the notes but the dry down….I immediately loved it and was like wait, no wonder I love it. You can be mad at me but its what I smell. I would describe it as a sunny green vanilla fragrance personally, perfect for the spring and summer. I don’t really get the banana note mainly just a beautiful fresh vanilla but not soap fresh like green smell fresh if that makes sense. Lovely.
White chocolate, floral, bananas. Relatively straightforward for a Gucci fragrance.
I love this fragrance for my regular days. Fresh but beautiful, i feel bananas, its no in the notes but i can feel it!!!!! Is amazing!!!!

I really liked this scent, but there is a few things that held me back from feeling bold about liking it or recommending it. Imo this powder ozonic combination effect it has makes me think of roll on cream deodorants for some reason. Given the insane price point it has, my mind thinking about some deodarant makes me a little reluctant to like it...but it was my top pick in a collection of samples I had.

It's a great fun but "daily nothing too much" because of that ozonic effect, but again..I can't help feeling people will just think this must be a deodorant??
is this not alien goddess?

This really reminds me of Killian Princess, I haven't seen many comparisons but I'd for sure sort it within that same DNA. It's nice, very pretty. The dry down is more of a powdery, sweet vanilla.

I don't really understand the Burberry goddess comparisons. I have both, but Goddess is definitely 'sharper' because of the lavender.

The longevity is pretty decent. I sprayed last night on my wrist before bed, and my wrist and shirt still smell of it this morning
Aquatic melon with contemporary vanilla base. I can see young girls wearing it to the beach, will perform best in humid and hot climate.
I love it! ...And it's a very rare thing, because I'm quite picky. This perfume is very happy and uplifting. The color yellow represents it very well. On me, the sillage and longevity are moderate.

Great fresh and bright vanilla. The orchid accord gives it a sensual and intimate feeling. I smell a banana that isn't fully ripe yet, but don't worry if you don't like banana scents, I usually don't and this is my favorite vanilla perfume. It's so creamy and uplifting. Picking up on the subtleties of the accords, I don't think this is boring at all. It suits a cool winter or spring day. I don't think it smells cloying on a hotter day, but the lactonic scent of this really shines when it's a bit chilly out. I always overspray my perfumes and this one lasts all day long.

This is my gourmand perfume for summer from now on! At first sniff, I thought this was mango-y and exotic, reminds me of a Cantonese dessert mango pomelo sago (I am Cantonese so this reminds me of home). I was kind of right cuz this is actually best worn in summer since it’s got a heavy ozonic note but the other listed note being vanilla surprised me. It’s a bit like Rabanne’s Fame, I get mango from both of these fragrances but to me this is even sweeter and this has a thick creaminess to it. I use 3 sprays on my wrist after applying lotion, it lasts a good 4ish hours and dry down turns more floral and less sweet or creamy as time passes. I think this is a bit overpriced but so is everything so I won’t even complain anymore, still a good fragrance, would recommend if u like mango scents!

Tested this in Sephora. In the top notes, there's a fruitiness that's not listed, as others have mentioned, sort of a banana-mango. But the main body reminded me a lot of Flora Gorgeous Magnolia. The body is nicely filled out, with a powdery, creamy, floral vanilla that leans a bit to tonka. Could be worn year-round. I quite liked this. It's a love for me. Enjoy!

Contrast to Alien Goddess Mugler:
These are different, but there are similarities with a powdery, creamy vanilla. Flora Gorgeous Orchid has a more forward fruity note in the top, while Alien Goddess leans a bit more beachy with coconut & a recognizable jasmine running along side. Both have excellent performance, although a bit stronger for Alien Goddess.

Contrast to Flora Gorgeous Magnolia:
These are different, but there are similarities with the Gucci Flora DNA, a fruity top note, and powdery, creamy & floral tones in the main body. Flora Gorgeous Orchid is sweeter and more vanillic in the main body, while Flora Gorgeous Magnolia has a more obvious berry top note, more waxy magnolia in the heart, and just a hint of patchouli in the base. Roughly equivalent performance.

The vanilla accords are almost identical to Mugler Alien Goddess. Strong, sweet, creamy and cloying. I find this and Alien Goddess quite suffocating. It's not a particularly interesting nor charming fragrance to my nose.

I consider Paradox and Guidance to fall under this same cloying umbrella.

Gucci did something special here.

This is the best floral, vanilla scent I've ever tried. It is intoxicating. To the point where I am repeatedly sniffing my sleeve, because it's just that good.

My boyfriend smelled every single fragrance in Sephora and landed on this one as a gift. I wasn't ecstatic about the other Flora flankers. To my surprise, this is now one of my favorites out of my whole collection.
exactly same with VS bare vanilla sol

Holy fuckinf shit this is the most beautiful creamy vanilla I have ever smelled on myself. I’m a vanilla fiend but literally every and I mean EVERY vanilla perfume I’ve ever tried turns into this disgusting cloying artificial rubbery playdough scent on me in the drydown (ie Middle Eastern brands’ eclaire, vanilla voyage, cream velvet etc) and it breaks my heart every time. This is the only one I have ever tried that stays smelling like clean clearly fluffy vanilla ice cream with whipped cream throughout. Totally worth the price and I’m mad at myself to not just committing to it sooner. Idk if maybe the iconic note in this stops that from happening or higher quality ingredients or what but it’s really the best vanilla I have ever smelled. If the same problem happens to u with vanilla fragrances I 1000% recommend pulling the trigger and buying this, as the name suggests it truly is gorgeous. I feel gorgeous wearing it

I got a sample of this with my Sephora order. I like the scent and got compliments for it from people I work with. I won't be getting a full bottle tho. Because it is nice but not necessairly my vibe. Maybe I'll gift a bottle of this to a friend.

This is so beautiful! It has a zingy green mango skin note which is so unique. Like when you eat a mango scored off the cheek and you are finished down to the mango skin. And then the floral note is so fresh and green, so well balanced. The vanilla just grounds it doesn’t overpower. Oh my gosh, I can’t stop sniffing my wrist. I bought a decant of this because I am searching for a perfect banana scent. There is a very faint banana note to me but not very prominent. I don’t care I’m in love and will wear it this summer in Costa Rica so I can use it to associate it with one of my favorite vacation spots forever. The projection and longevity is great and worth buying a full bottle.

I forgot I ever owned Snoopy's Let's Mango. Until I sprayed Gucci's Flora Gorgeous Orchid.

We start this fragrance off with a very clear, ripe mango. Why it's not listed is beyond me. This is so present that it managed to trigger a memory of a long forgotten fragrance from over a decade ago.

Over time the mango fades into the background a little while a floral vanilla takes center stage. The sillage is good. The longivity is surprisingly poor. I struggle to pick up much of it 90 minutes in.

I wasn't expecting to compare Gucci to Snoopy. But the association is so strong, I can't stop thinking about it. If you're not burdened by this association, I can imagine this to be a pleasant fragrance.

Another reviewer mentioned putting it back on the shelf to explore again in 6 months. I will do that. But for now, it's a no for me.

I think this is the best vanilla fragrance I’ve ever smelled it’s not too gourmand and it’s not too floral it’s a good balance. Some people say it smells like mango I kind of understand why they might but it smells amazing I would bathe in this. If you want people to complement you and stop you and ask for that fragrance it is I suggest you buy this. If I could only use one perfume in my life it would be this , I kind of wish there was a dupe for it because it’s a bit pricey and I’m tired of fragrance houses not being inspired by other fragrances besides delina, tom ford and the infamous BR540.

I have had this one a while. Initially I didn't particularly like it as it was too Ozonic. Sometimes I find that with Ozonic notes, it leaves almost a blank space in the middle of the perfume and that's what I got with this (and with Gaultier Divine). It smelled floral on one end and sharp on the other with this blank space in the middle which wasn't particularly pleasant.

However, I've left the bottle sitting on a shelf for a good six months or so and tried it again today. Now I get much less of the Ozonic note and more of a banana note. It starts with underripe sharp banana and as it dries I get banana peel. I wouldn't say it's as vanilla strong as other perfumes which is surprising given the reported notes. It comes across quite tropical to me rather than floral. It's unusual and I can't really decide if I like it or not.

VERY similar to Dolce Gabbana Light Blue Sun. This is a bit stronger while LBS is softer, but you can get it for a third of the price on Joma. Both are great summer scents but my nose prefers Light Blue Sun.

Beautiful beautiful fragrance.

to me it does not smell like gourmand or vanilla at all. the florals come through more which i'm assuming is the vanilla orchid.
