(bear with me, i'm not very familiar with notes so i can't give it the proper terminology) it is SOOO SO yummy beachy fun refreshing and BRIGHT!! all without being too heavy. it's very sweet and feminine, but still very refined!! she's light and feminine without being juvenile. this is definitely one of my favorites i've tried and absolutely a crowd pleaser.

i got so many compliments wearing this one. longevity is okay, it took a lot of sprays for it to last me a good 4-6 hours? not beast mode by any means but with how gorgeous and well-rounded this scent is i really have no qualms.

this also reminds me a lot of alien goddess by mugler, which has a bit of a "sunscreeny-but-delicious" feel. the two have totally different nuance though, and i prefer gucci flora gorgeous orchid by leagues to my mugler (however the mugler definitely outperforms gucci orchid!)

TLDR: yummy bright summery refreshing feminine perfume while still being refined and not cloying. highly recommend!

This is a delicious fragrance, it is light, gourmand, delicately flowery and airy at the same time. It is just so perfect, with a warm but delicate/acquatic vanilla. I, fortunately, can't smell any banana ( I don't like artificial banana smell), just a "milky" kind of base. It is a soft and sweet gourmand, with light flowers, which is ideal for spring, early summer. This is stunning, and I am obsessed with it. Longevity is ok, it creates a nice scent bubble for a couple of hours 💛

I was both wary and curious to try the last one from the Flora range. The bottles still don’t do it for me, they look plasticky and cheap, which doesn’t exactly help set the mood. But Gorgeous Orchid turned out to be a pleasant surprise (but again, what kind of drug store name is that?). It’s delicate, airy, and creamy, fresh enough to feel light, but with a sweetness that keeps it from sliding into the vegetal territory.

Out of the range, Jasmine is my favorite. I never quite clicked with Gardenia and Magnolia, but Orchid joins Jasmine as the second winner for me. Two out of four isn’t bad, and I’m glad this little Gucci escapade wasn’t a waste of time as I thought it would be based on the bottle design.
I LOVE this one. It smells like a sunny spring day.

This smells very leafy/green. A very realistic leaf/stem, not a sweetened or softened version of it. As a result, I didn’t like it! I was expecting some airy sweet vanilla and got a green smell, as though you’ve been out in the garden.

I received this perfume as a sample. I am not a lover of gourmand, so even if it was "flowery", I could smell vanilla almost all the time. No one around me noticed the sillage, even though I could feel the sweetness on my skin, if I brought my wrist closer. I could not test the longevity much because it was a sample and it is not to my taste.
I saw a lady talking about how she loves this fragrance on YouTube... I went into ulta yesterday and smelled it. I was NOT impressed.

This is incredibly unique. All anyone can say to describe to those who haven’t smelled it is that it’s a fresh floral vanilla but you just have to smell it. Something about it is incredibly addictive! I snagged a 1oz preloved bottle on Mercari and i wish i could afford a pint of this stuff!

Oh wow, what a beautiful surprise this scent is! I just now made the purchase after ordering a sample and loving it. It's a creamy vanilla lovers dream for sure with a touch of soft floral. I agree with an almost banana scent or something similar too. I own many perfumes and this one just seems unique, different in a wonderful comforting way. With 3 notes listed I was not expecting to fall so in love but it happened

Gucci Flora Gorgeous Orchid is a beautifully unexpected take on a floral gourmand. While the official notes highlight vanilla, vanilla orchid, and an ozonic accord, what truly stands out—at least to my nose—is a soft, creamy banana note that weaves through the florals. It’s subtle, natural, and completely non-synthetic, adding a tropical twist that feels playful yet elegant.

This is the banana-tinged perfume I’ve been searching for—not overly sweet, not artificial, just a gentle, creamy nuance that blends seamlessly with the luminous florals and airy vanilla. The ozonic freshness keeps the scent light and breathable, preventing the gourmand elements from feeling too heavy.

The result is a soft, radiant floral with a tropical soul, creamy without being cloying, and surprisingly beautiful. If you’re looking for something that combines familiar sweetness with an unexpected twis, this fragrance is absolutely worth exploring.

Flora Gorgeous Orchid is a delicate, airy beauty that captures the essence of soft elegance. The vanilla in the air is sweet and light, but not overpowering, giving it a dreamy, almost ethereal quality. It feels like the fragrance is floating around me rather than settling on my skin. The scent is subtle, and while it may not last long, it leaves behind a delicate trace that feels almost like a soft whisper in the atmosphere. It’s the kind of scent that doesn’t demand attention but gently enchants anyone in its vicinity. A beautiful, fleeting floral experience, but not one for those seeking longevity.

- Bhavna Darira Chesan

Definition of creamy. I don't know how to explain but it really smells creamy. It's very sweet but not cloying at all. Would pair perfect with half a spray of a stronger jasmine perfume or a more fresh lily of the valley. Oh or maybe with an oceanic one, that would be amazing.
Smells like bubble gum, airy clean bubbles and banana laffy taffy. So simple yet beautiful!!! I’m more into niche fragrances but this is special and I loved it.
Expensive version of Jean Nate. Glad I bought the travel size.

I tried this perfume once it was launched and it did not touch my heart. Later (because I love the bottle, it's so pretty) I gave it second try- sprayed it in Sephora and wear during the evening. Honestly, I hope that longevity is not great, cause it bothers me for 2 hours already😂 No, first impression was correct. Next :)
No banana (it was not even a note :) ), no good vanilla, no ice cream. It's just something unclear, boring and irritating.
No ofence, it's just my 5 cents. If you enjoy this perfume- please enjoy!

At first I was getting just coconut and sweet flowers, then came a faint banana scent. It smells nice, summery, fruity. I got a small sample and I'll use it for summer, but I wouldn't buy. Way overpriced for its performance.

I was looking for a banana perfume; something floral and green, not on the artificial side. My husband gifted this to me and I am pleasantly surprised! It smells like a floral banana type of smell and it is quite addictive. Very pretty and happy 😊 🍌

I love this one a lot. I was initially biased when it came to the Gucci flora line but I have since eaten my words and made an about turn where these fragrances are concerned. This is my favorite and I smell a delicious banana note in this one

I sprayed this on myself in a perfume shop earlier today and as soon as it started to dry down i started getting perfume deja vu. It hit me about an hour after smelling my wrist constantly - this smells just like Diesel Loverdose to me. Maybe the combo of floral and floral notes - it’s hard to put my finger on. Definitely don’t get the people saying it smells like Burberry goddess but maybe that’s just my skin chemistry!

The pyramid is obviously incomplete (as usual...), and honestly, I wouldn't be surprised if ylang-ylang were in there.

To me, Flora Gorgeous Orchid is a sunny fragrance, smelling mainly of vanilla and ylang-ylang - which might explain the banana note some people perceive.

It's very pretty, bright, and fresh, perfect for summer. It leans a bit conventional because of the vanilla, but it’s still a pleasant scent to wear.

This is a total BEACH scent. Absolute summer fragrance. I believe it has a unisex surfer energy. The most unique of the Gucci Flora fragrances, I don't get flowery vibes at all. Sand and ocean. The vanilla gives it that creamy banana/coconut vibe that some users have picked up on. This scent only works with a very HOT summer day. Its downside is that it is also a very POWERFUL fragrance with a strong silage, which usually is not the type of fragrances people like to wear when it's hot out. Those who are sensitive to strong fragrance, beware, this can definitely be headache inducing for you. I recommend this scent for a fancy summertime outdoor lunch or dinner near the beach. It smells like a high end sunscreen, which is enjoyable but only appropriate for a slim number of events. It does dry down to a sweeter, vanilla scent close to the skin - but most of the wear has the BOOM in your face sandy beach feel.
Banana, coconutty marshmallow floral on vanilla base. It's my favourite Gucci flora and I like it for being a bit less mature smelling. It's a guilty pleasure perfume. I personally enjoy it.
wait why the hate? this is the gucci flora scent i like the most, but i might be biased because i love any scent with vanilla in it. but i like this! it lowkey reminds me of a banana milkshake!

I went to Sephora to try it because people on YT said that it smelled a lot like Burberry Goddess. Well, to my nose it's totally not the case. Nothing like the Burberry, at all! To me it smells like a basic designer vanilla flower perfume. Really plain, nothing special.
Honeydew melon?? I know it’s a far cry from the notes but there’s something fruity. It is vanillic but like it’s added into a fruity smoothie/milkshake
I sampled this and it smells like a soft creamy marshmallow, pretty basic. Also, the sillage is kind of disappointing
Why is it kind of giving toasted marshmallow?? I was not expecting that! I like it and the bottle is pretty but it's pretty boring, won't be purchasing

Simple, inoffensive, but BORING to my nose unfortunately. I was hoping for more sweetness or more vanilla, but I don't detect that note at all. Just the generic designer fragrance floral and the freshness of outside air, with a very slight suncreen vibe to it.
OK so this reminds me of So Miami Vibes body spray. It’s quite a headache inducing vanilla. I love the other fragrances from this line but this is not for me.
This sells like a banana. Full on banana smoothie

very pretty & creamy. i know theres no fruitiness in the notes, but somehow this smelled like mango sticky rice on my skin. sweeter than i usually go for, but it was just so nice i had to get the travel size. i’m addicted! i keep smelling myself and it’s delicious every time.

Such a nice fragrance! It's very simple, but so delightful and happy. There's something slightly fruity about it despite there being nothing like that in the notes. I would've sworn there was a mango note. It doesn't smell like pure mango fruit (no sourness) but mango in an almost creamy way like a mango smoothie.

This reminds me of Burberry Goddess. Nothing ground breaking. It smells nice when freshly applied though. But it doesn't last. After a few minutes, it ends up being a rather bland, boring scent. It also quickly becomes overwhelming to my nose, it's headache inducing if oversprayed.
The opening was gorgeous - floral, creamy, sweet but that drydown is disgusting. It smells like chemical nail polish & vanilla.

Tested today in the local perfume shop. Reminds me if Estee Lauder Beyond Paradise.
A very nice girly fragrance but not 'outstanding' or 'groundbreaking' it is pleasant but that's it.

Smells like a cold, creamy vanilla milkshake on a hot day with a hint of freshness and orchid! I also get a slight banana note, it's stronger when smelling from the bottle.
I havent tested longevity but even with just a spray and a half the sillage is like 2 metres!!
This was just a random sample I got and so far I didnt expect to like it as much as I do, super delicious.

legit one of my favourite fragrances. i smelled this in the airport and i could not stop thinking about it I had to buy the full size, but here's the thing, the longevity and sillage is BAD. Not good at all. Spray it on your clothes and it lasts for a really long time but on my skin it just dissapears :(
its very sweet u can smell the vanilla and also the ozonic notes are very noticeable its good but if u wanna wear it in summer u should probably pair it with something fresher
Glittery lip balm from a coin operated dispenser. Kinda dirty. Smells identical to something from my childhood, like makeup you'd get in the party favors for a little girls birthday

Pretty straightforward. Nothing complex here. A light and lovely springtime spin on the classic vanilla. Comes through heavy on the vanilla for me, but this is not a complaint! Dry down into that ozone scent is very pleasant and makes this a nice one for spring/warmer weather.
Sillage is pitiful and longevity isn't as impressive as the other Flora flankers.

I love it! A fresh twist on vanilla. Not for those who prefer heavy spicy vanilla fragrances - this is airy and light and smells like a sunny day out. Weak sillage, but stays on my skin for the whole day.

This smells like bubblegum and a fresh, juicy pear. Delectable!

I spritzed it on a tester card. Two days later it was still discernable. Highly recommend spraying on clothes.

I distinctly smell lemon in the opening of this fragrance. I'm surprised it's not listed or talked about, and I THOUGHT when we were trained on this fragrance for my work, that we were told it contained a lemon note. Very confusing. Anyway, I'm not a vanilla girl, nor a gourmand girl. I don't like basic and this is very much that... And yet, there's something really enjoyable about this that I can't pin down. I had to have it.

Gucci Flora Gorgeous Orchid offers a fresh interpretation of vanilla, making it perfect for summer. The vanilla here is soft and luminous, paired with the floral richness of orchid. It strikes a beautiful balance, sweet yet airy, with a breezy elegance that feels effortless in warm weather. Perfect for us vanilla girlies who don’t want to miss out on our beloved vanillas, even in the high heat, this scent is light and radiant, ideal for sunny days and balmy evenings.
💛💛💛

An airy and uplifting vanilla! Crowd pleasing in a good way. Vanilla has been a hot trend for a while now, but this is distinctive enough to give a try. The ozone notes give it a nice touch that it could work spring, summer, and fall. Maybe not dense enough for winter. Overall, Flora Gorgeous Vanilla is an inoffensive, high-quality, easy reach.

A lot of people are saying this is basic. I however, love it!! It’s warm and creamy, not too strong but just enough projection to form a bubble around you. I really enjoy this one and I think it’s fresh (green) enough but also sweet and buttery. I picked up a small bottle because I do have other vanilla fragrances but I think it’s worth a 1oz. Lovely, and that banana opening is everything.

I wanted to love this, but it's sooooo green. It's a basic green floral. Very little vanilla from start to finish, and one friend told me it smelled 'sharp' even 3 hours after putting it on. Glad I've only gotten the travel size as this was just very underwhelming.

I sprayed both the orchid and gardenia versions on two cards about 36 hours ago. The gardenia has definitely faded, but the orchid one is still going surprisingly strong.

Initially, I wasn’t sure about the orchid scent—my friend and I fell in love with the gardenia in-store, while this one felt a bit confusing for some reason. But after letting the sprayed card sit on my bed, I’ve grown to adore it. I can’t believe I didn’t immediately love it or immediately notice how similar it is to Burberry Goddess and Angham by Lattafa. It’s a warm, floral vanilla, and I can imagine it layering beautifully with Burberry Goddess or even the intense version. Gucci Flora Gorgeous Orchid is that gurlll she is gorgeous she’s kind she smells like a girls girl

That said, I’m hesitant to buy it right now since my last eight perfume purchases have all been vanillary 🥴😭. I was initially drawn to the gardenia, but after reading reviews about its poor performance—and seeing firsthand how much weaker it is compared to the orchid—I’m put off for now.

Anywayyy, the orchid version clearly has much better longevity, and I’ll definitely be purchasing it in the future!! For now, though, I’m still on the hunt for a strong-performing summery scent—ideally something floral or citrusy/ fresh, sweet (ANY BEASTMODE VERSION OF GARDENIA ??😩)
boring! lol like this is inoffensive but very underwhelming. pleasant and floral opening and simple vanilla dry down

it smells like sunshine & cheers me up :) people are saying this one is too simple but i think it's simplicity is its charm, it's sweet and so so easy to love. i got my sisters bottle and i really enjoy it! i only wish the sillage were stronger & its initial banana note was as strong in the drydown.

An effortlessly pretty scent. It's a light floral with a vanilla/banana twist. I know there's not a banana note listed, but I do not care. Inoffensive, yet still can fill a room.. The projection is there and it lasts atleast 5 hours or so. Spray it on clothes if you need it to stay longer than that. I layered it with banana flower passionfruit lotion. From experience, men will wanna eat you up wearing this. Do with that information as you will!!💋

I stupidly bought this based on the opening scent which is AMAZING. So fresh, sweet, floral and slightly citrus. Unfortunately it dries down to a smell I can only describe as 'old lady'. The longevity is terrible and Gucci has something to answer for given the price point of £135+

The most inoffensive, plain, generic floral perfume you could ever imagine. A scent you'd conjure in your head when you think of a flower perfume. Weak silage. With Gucci's prices it's kind of a miss... Maybe on a clearance or with a very big discount?

This actually lasts well on me. The dry down is a strong, pure vanilla. Sadly, I don’t get the banana others do, but I still love it anyway. The bottle is very cute, I love the happy yellow with the floral label. Great addition to round out my fragrance collection.

Am I the only one smelling salty in this? Yikes, it ruins it :/ I want to love it, I'm in the mood for a Gucci Flora Vanilla, but this just complicates it way too much. Can't we have just a basic vanilla? lol
The notes are very straightforward (vanilla, ozonic notes, orchid), but here and there I can catch a glimpse of banana as well. Poor longevity (1-2 hours max).

The only Gucci Flora I like and one of the few perfumes I liked out of the 15 I sniffed today at Ulta. This is better than Alien Goddess (to my nose, they are only slightly similar). I wish I smelled this before I bought AG. It’s slight banana, slight orchid with vanilla amber. Really nice. I’m sure someday I will buy it.

i got a decant tester of this and after the first wear i knew i needed a bottle of this. i couldnt stop smelling myself throughout the day, it's soooo addicting to me. all i smelled was pure delicious vanilla. it wasn't until i read the comments here that i could smell the banana. there's definitely banana laffy taffy in there somehow but despite hating actual bananas i love banana laffy taffy so it doesn't bother me at all lmao. overall it's a very yummy scent!
Yes, it is vanilla, but it is also very banana which is strange yet intriguing. It's not a banana foster, but it is a dessert that is sweet without being overwhelming.

I was very excited to try this as a vanilla, floral, and ozone lover. On my skin, this is screechy playdough banana. The banana is noxious. I had to scrub it off 😣 So glad I didn’t blind buy this, which I was tempted to do.
Smells just like Luxuria by Memoize London, which is a niche version of CH good girl.

As soon as I sprayed it (department store fragrance counter, on skin, eventually worn for 6 hours), I was immediately reminded of Kenzo World Power (which is reminiscent of JPG Divine), with slight differences (Orchid being perhaps slightly more floral and vanillic). I think it’s the ozonic saltiness that links them?

Confirmed with side-by-side test; obviously not a clone, but would be redundant in my collection, as I already own and appreciate World Power.

Initially thought the comparison with Wild Vanilla Orchid was way off, but there is indeed half a ghost (maybe a quarter?) of that perfume (which I also own) in Gorgeous Orchid.

very pretty, and very likeable. it's a sweet, airy, vanilla floral. i'd recommend this to any girl wanting a nice fragrance because that's what it is - nice and inoffensive, and it isn't just the generic designer white floral that has been done to death.

there's too many fragrances i personally like more to buy a bottle, but i wouldn't turn my nose up at it; i don't think you can really go wrong with it.
7/10

Love at first sniff. Bought it immediatly.
I don't get the banana note, but a king of candied mango note. The ozonic note is very light to me.
Love this yellow bottle.
A great perfume for spring and summer nights.
To me, this perfume is in the same vibe than Alien Goddess from Mugler, Yara Tous from Lattafa and Valentino Born in Roma Intense.
This same fruit/amber/vanilla trend.
Gorgeous.
I got sprayed with this by a saleswoman and it is awful. A headache inducing yellow .

this is my favorite in the gucci flora line, it`s a light vanilla, it is well balanced between warmth and freshness. so you smell effortlessly innocent and sweet.
i think as in debut 2025, my current taste gravitates toward uncomplicated scents with clear imagery.

It really reminds me of Floral Street Wild Vanilla Orchid with the bamboo and interesting green nuances stripped out. I enjoy it, but I prefer Wild Vanilla Orchid (which is apparently close to Poets of Berlin). If you didn't like the green aspect of those scents maybe this would work for you. The ozonic note makes it a cut above some of the more cloying, juvenile vanillas out there, and more suitable for warmer weather.
For me, it has a strong artificial scent, reminiscent of artificial banana or mango. The synthetic for me its quite dominant, making it difficult to pick up on any other scent.

I love the ozonic note in this, especially mixed with the vanilla. I definitely get a banana candy from this, but I also pick up a lemon cake or lemon muffin scent from it as well. I tend to stay away from vanilla fragrances in the spring and summer as they can be a bit too heavy, but this one has just the right amount of vanilla, and it is not at all cloying. This is a favorite in my collection 💛

Recibí una muestra de este aroma Un aroma floral y dulce y ligero para de verano. Se puede oler especialmente la vainilla y la orquídea en este perfume. Permanece presente de una manera agradable, pero no demasiado abrumadora. ¡Especialmente un maravilloso aroma de verano! Podria funcionar como aroma en trabajo, ya que no es tan intrusivo como otras vainillas en el mercado y es bastante lineal.

Olor dulce
Acordes de vainilla
Perdura sutilmente, no demasiado abrumador.

I liked the vanilla aspect but somehow ozonic notes don't go well with me. I am the type of fragrancehead who doesn't define my choices of perfume by weather however-- ozonic / solar fragrances dont jive with me even though I'm from the tropics! I gravitate towards balsamic/resinous/ smoky/suede/leather types of scents

I have learned in 2025 blind buying is not an option for me because everyone loved this when it came out and it is nice when I spray it in the air. But on me it is an ok scent . Its not great and its not horrible. Its just not for me...if you happen to love the scent you will find that it lasts so long so thats a plus. . Another thing is that it is very linear on my skin. I'm trying to sell it locally but nobody wants it.

*sigh

way too sweet for me. though i will say, the ozonic notes made it a lot more tolerable compared to other really sweet scents. i got some underlying vanilla, but the banana is definitely the strongest note here.

I really, really love this.
A sunny, bright and creamy vanilla. There is a crisp quality to this I can’t quite place. I sense a little musk? Regardless, it’s beautiful. I do not get any banana, instead, I get vanilla with some kind of yellow floral and a green note in the background I cannot identify.

It’s my favorite from the Gucci Flora collection- though I think it’s better suited for spring/autumn, not summer. It can be a little too sweet, at least for hot and humid weather.

I’ve never owned a full bottle from the Gucci Flora series, but this one might be my first. Absolutely lovely.

Extremely long lasting (8+ hours on my skin)
Silage is moderate to heavy- do be mindful when you spray.

Edit: I understand why people might smell banana. There is a fruity, creamy quality to it- but I think it’s mostly a very sweet, musky vanillic floral.
Love it!

I wish I got bananas or vanilla from this. On me it smells like straight up sunscreen. Like if Replica Beach Walk had an intense version. I feel like that beachy sunscreen scent profile is over done. Definitely not blind buy safe.
I really wanted to like this because I love vanilla, but to me it just smells like bananas. I would not wear this.
ıts smells really fruity too me . I smell banana - mango smells like fruity car scent to me .
I didnot expect this to smell like a soft, creamy but airy (which is unusual) banana-ish summer friendly sweet fragrance. from the bottle I would expect yellow flowers. will definitely buy it!

It's fresh and sweet. I could say almost citrusy within the first few seconds of spraying, but once it settles it's definitely sweet while still being airy. I get absolutely no banana at all, only vanilla.
Longevity is pretty decent, I could still smell it on myself after 6 hours.
My friend wears this and you can smell her from AFAR! It's really nice though. It's like a fresh, airy vanilla with a little musk. It has a shimmery quality.
I went back and forth on how I felt about this. But IMO this is a great vanilla for summer.

So interesting what people smell.

I don’t get bananas. And not gourmand. I get a warm floral, not spicy. It smells like a bouquet of flowers with lots of white and yellow florals that opens with a fresh green background and settles into a floral with creaminess. I don’t get overwhelming vanilla even in the dry down.

It’s very pretty. Is it my fav? No. But I reach for it occasionally when I want something floral and different.

If this perfume were any lighter, it would probably float out of the bottle and hover around your head like a fragrant halo. It’s so ethereal!

Some people say they smell banana. I don’t, but I can kind of see where they’re coming from. It’s not “banana” in the “here’s your morning smoothie” sense. It’s more like, “What if a banana briefly dated a coconut, broke up amicably, and now they exchange polite emails once a year?” There’s a tropical vibe, but it’s subtle, like a whisper of piña colada memories from a distant beach.

The orchid is the star here; soft, creamy, and sophisticated. And then there’s an ozonic, breezy undertone that makes you feel like you’re standing on a cliffside with the wind in your hair, except the wind smells amazing.
Powdery vanilla. Compliment getter. Very beautiful feminine airy scent.

I smelled it in the store and I loved it, I would say it's more of a fruity banana/mango scent but the vanilla is there, it's amazing nonetheless. It's a very powdery, rich, airy smell and it gives off "sitting on a yacht and each lunch somewhere in Italy as a slight breeze is blowing in my face" vibes. Very pretty fragrance, 8.5/10

Not normally a vanilla lover per se but this one was very nice. I received a sample and decided to give it a try. It’s a bit powdery and very vanilla. I don’t get the orchid as much but it’s there. Overall if you like vanilla you will probably like this but it’s not for me. Too sweet and powdery for me. One thing i can say is that it only took one spray and it was very strong with decent longevity. Pretty vanilla scent :)

I read a review that said that this perfume smells like yummy cream and bananas. As a gourmand lover, I had to buy it…well, it turns out that our smelling abilities are very different. To me it smells like my grandma’s aloe vera body lotion. My husband said that it smells like a face cream, however he likes it on me, meanwhile I do not. It is a light, body lotion-like, slight flowery-orchidy scent to me. Disappointment. I am never buying a perfume based on influencer reviews😅…

This is a unique fresh/sweet scent.
It feels like a fresh baked banana cake to me.
I love it

WOW!! This is a beautiful creamy and bright vanilla. It is evocative of drinking a vanilla milkshake with some banana blended in while sitting on the fresh green grass of a sunny meadow. There is an orchid bush nearby and it is wafting a subtle aroma your way. Everything is ok and life is good :) I think yellow was an excellent choice for the packaging because it is such an optimistic scent. I fell in love with it upon first whiff. The other Gucci Flora flankers were not my style, but this one is different. The vanilla in this reminds me so much of a vanilla I’ve smelled in different Dior fragrances. It’s honestly good for all year round. It smells both fresh and warm all at once.

Okay… not what I expected. I thought this would be like Dolly Partons “Tennessee sunset.” A strong rich vanilla scent.that would be Super gourmad. But she’s a different type of vanilla.. She’s light, she’s airy, she’s a little creamy, and she’s a fresh out of the shower vanilla. If that makes sense. It’s not a super gourmad vanilla. It’s a clean vanilla.
I loved this but so did the bees
It's okay, very harsh florals, a bit of a tea smell at the end that I couldn't quite discern

Originally posted 23Jun2025 but accidentally deleted when updating my ranking of the Flora Gorgeous line:

Thank you @Camilovely for detailing, because Gucci Flora Gorgeous Gardenia Intense can be summarized as smelling like classic B&BW Dark Kiss especially in the opening. I'm surprised there are no dark fruits like a berry or other dark notes like amber and patchouli listed. I do see why the magnolia flanker was originally voted as similar since it has those dark notes made in a fun shampoo way.

As the intense dries, the hedione musk and sandalwood shine more creating a lightness in here that will work for some parts of spring and fall weather. Lush gardenia was not something I really picked up in the original, but I do pick it up a little more in the Intense and it has a nice sweetness. For the brown sugar, it's not quite the same as the original; imagine berries being cooked and sweetened by brown sugar. As I wear it more, I also get a juicy orange in the opening. Very interesting to see what other people get.

Like the original, projection on my skin seems to dissipate into a closer bubble or maybe that's the airy hedione quality, but longevity is better at 6-7 hrs. But that could just be me, since others think differently about performance. For the bottle, I love that you can still see the liquid inside, but the glass color is still dark. This is also the first Gucci fragrance I've felt inclined to add to my collection, that clicks for me. From the line so far, Flora Gorgeous Gardenia Intense is the best, then Gorgeous Magnolia, original Gardenia, the Orchid which was a bit underwhelming to me (I now love this as for me it is a smoother, less fruity dark, light airy version of this intense), and lastly Jasmine which I just didn't like the smell of.

It does what it says on the tin! Flora Gorgeous Gardenia indeed, such a delicious Gucci scent! This is NOT a fruitchouli fragrance at all. The original GGG might be, but not the Intense. It’s an intriguing fragrance.

I tend to gravitate towards hedione notes because it smells addictive to me.

This flanker would be my best out of the line up. It’s Jammy, sensual, and garners compliments (guess it’s just how I layer my fragrances or how it comes off on my skin.)

There is definitely no patchouli although the sandalwood is what some might perceive as the whole Fruitchouli vibe when I can definitely say this is not that.

Fruitchouli would be alongside the lines of YSL Mon Paris, Chanel Coco Mademoiselle, Lancôme La vie bell, even the new MiuMiu with the strawberry and patchouli note is a heavy fruitchouli (the name escapes me)

So yeah, this is not a fruitchouli to me although I do see how some might perceive it as such.

It’s more of a fruit jam with a little bit of spice and warmth- the sandalwood is a gorgeous woody cozy scent with juuuuuuust a teeny hint of a smokiness to it. It’s also pretty sweet - basically it’s a rather complex scent

At first I didn’t really give this a chance. I too thought it smelled like a basic designer scent (which I could see how most might get that impression)

Through the wear it develops in stages so yeah that’s it- fruity, jammy, creamy, woody, spicy, hint of smokiness like incense wise but not like a church incense.

I gave it a chance and love it now !

Very basic fruitchouli vibe from these notes. I have smelled so many of those since their 2000s explosion, it's exhausting. Same same. I don't dislike this, but hard pressed to find something to actually like. I can say that I do prefer the dry down to the initial blast. It is smoother and more coherent. The opening is scratchy to me.

Ultimately, it makes me slightly irritated that I even decided to test it on skin because it took a day out of wearing something I actually like, but that's on me. I just did not expect to be transported to a mall in 2005 based on these notes.

It is strong and it is long lasting. Definitely has that going for it.

The opening is more woody than the edp, but the drydown is the same as the edp. I didn't like this one because I didn't like the original.

I'll be waiting for the intense version of jasmine and vanilla.

I bloody love this, the dry-down is so nice and woody leaning unisex, and lovely white floral tones softening the edges. It smells clean and fresh instead of too sweet or high floral. This is my favourite of the line by a wide margin.

i have all five flora flankers and love them all. I can recognise the gorgeous gardenia dna in this one, but this one is more complex and deep, it is a bit more fit for the colder months in my opinion. For some reason this is my husbands least favorite out of all the floras. I love it tho.

I tried this at kicks. On paper it smelled really nice. So I put it on my wrist.. it smelled nice at first like the paper. Then it smelled like a mans cologne.., really manly.. I took a shower and it still smells. I have tried soap, oil, shower, other perfumes and I cant get the scent of my skin,, so the lasting is really long. I am on day 2 and still smell the perfume., I now hate the smell.. dont buy unless you really like the scent.
This is way more sweet than i was expecting. There is something here that reminds me of Angel. I wanted a strong and pure white floral, but that was not it. The florals are soft. I will have to pass.

sweet and soft to begin with. yes, it has „intense“ in its name but it’s not too overpowering. perfect for a warm spring or fall night. it smells like a fruity cocktail. i find myself smelling it from time to time cause it’s just so lovely. people will definitely give you compliments and the scent lingers for hours! if you love sweet, dreamy scents, this will be for you.

LOL, apparently the sillage is enormous!! My husband came downstairs and said he could smell it to the second floor!!
He likes it!! He prefers it to La vie est belle Vanille Nude that I had yesterday (that he also liked!)
But he thinks this smells more charismatic and mysterious ;D.
My own opinions are below;

It starts sweet but then turns spicy. After drydown it smells equally spicy, floral and sandalwood. Compared to some other perfumes out that smells too young for someone in my age (42), this seems age appropriate for any woman, not a girl. For my taste it is too spicy though.

Why??? It is seriously underwhelming. Too much of everything and also boring that every perfume now is full of artificial ambroxan and after dry down it is just a chemical mess. After an hour it is like an Arabic male dupe cologne. All the same Armani Si Intense, Coco Mademoiselle Intense. Chemical warfare 💥
@tojisbicep you clearly haven’t got the slightest clue about fragrances then have you 😂

This was so intense for me. At first it was just a strong and overstimulating scent , then it turned into a men's cologne on my skin. it was not feminine at all and i had to walk around Dresden smelling like a man who just bathed in cheap perfume.

Gorgeous gardenia intense opens with a sweet, slightly fruity/jammy opening. It contains mandarin, but this comes across more fruity than citrus/sharp (I was left wondering if it had lychee or red berries, but apparently not). This is very soon succeeded by a very heady gardenia scent that is very pretty. This is not a perfume to overspray - it is quite heady, and those easily overwhelmed might not like it. But the gardenia scent is lovely. The base notes of this are quite woody (from the sandalwood) so the dry down is quite stemmy/woody and a little citrusy.

I think this is a lovely scent for autumn into winter, but would avoid on hot days.

I do not dislike this at all however this reminds me of grandma soap. I love white florals but I would not wear this, don't ask me why. And I know this one is being compared to VLJ but there's some kind of fruity note or maybe the actual gardenia, that smells a bit off to me.

Sweet florals turned bold, juicy mandarin, creamy gardenia & warm sandalwood. Feminine, luxe & impossible to ignore
⚠️ Note: Sweet florals lovers will adore it, but in hot humid weather it can feel a bit intense.
Jammy and sweet

Just sampled it and I think it's really lovely. I'm not a fan of the Flora perfumes but this one is pretty different to me. It's flowery but in a grown up way. It's sweet but not too sweet. The woodiness works very well in this but the dry down on me is mainly gardenia and a hint of rose.

Mmmmmmm it's okay!!! Normaly intense perfume versions are nice.
Its a one dimensional perfume with only one single note in it.
Is that really what sandalwood smells like? Cause to me it feels like patchouli.
They should have called this gorgeous sandalwood because that’s all I’m getting: sandalwood with a whisper of mandarin and an even smaller whisper of gardenia.

I have a sample, and I kinda want the full bottle now. It is the intense so I’m not surprised, but it is STRONG like only one spray and I can’t breathe. Smells like the color red in a bottle to me, but sexy.

I just bought this perfume and I'm in love. It smells so strong, my brother immediately asked me what perfume I had. It's expensive, but I think it's worth it and I think it will last me a long time because I only need to spray it once or twice. It's perfect for the autumn days ahead. Of all the Gucci perfumes, this one is definitely the best for me.

I love the way this smells but would get nauseous trying to wear it due to how syrupy and patchouli heavy it is. It’s a dark sweet berry and patchouli scent. Enjoy smelling it on a tester but not on myself.

Still sweet and candy fruit like but not as the original GG obviously
Soo bubblegummy not tuberose bubblegum at all more like jasmine bubblegum

I'm not very aware of the scent profile on the original Gorgeous Gardenia by Gucci, but I can def say I really like the profile on this one.

Very heavy with patchouli, but also incredibly sweet and rootsy from the mandarin and sandalwood pairing. Of course, this is INTENSE and has an incredibly strong silage and wear time.

I’m not familiar with the original Gorgeous Gardenia, so I can’t say how the Intense compares, but this is a piss-poor perfume I must say. Zero personality or originality, just a boring musky floral which you’ll have smelled a hundred times before.

Initially it smelled like wet makeup wipes to me, with a typical perfumey smell, but this started to become more dry and more powdery as this vague barrage of scratchy white musks and amber molecules abused any delicate presence of white flowers. It’s just bad.

It’s overloaded with hedione, so no doubt the general public will enjoy it, but it’s just so painfully boring and generic. It doesn’t exactly smell bad, but it’s existence annoys me.
Update: The patchouli in the drydown totally ruins this. After a few hours it’s all you can smell, smells like a spicy sweaty sceant and I can’t stand it.

This one is an exact copy of the original Gorgeous Gardenia. I wore that one for 7 years and it was my signature scent that I have missed dearly. When Gucci repackaged their scent from the clear bottle to the new one the scent changed. I am so happy they launched this. It does not smell like the notes at all, it is very sweet just like the original. I like the colour of this bottle as well. Only downside is the crazy price, can’t believe that normal designer perfumes now cost the same as niche! I would get this so fast if it weren’t for the price! Will wait to see if I can find a discount as it is very overpriced in my opinion.

I like it a lot, but then, like many have noted, it reminds you of several fragrances. The one I get is Nest's Black Tulip. It's not as intense as Black Tulip. But, it's a safe fragrance and gets the job done.

Same as the original but a lot woodier. Sugary white florals with fake woody aroma chemicals. Nasty. Opens with an extremely tart bergamot. This line just doesn't live up to Gucci's other much better lines.

I really like this a lot (it’s very designeresque - you’ve smelled it everywhere before and since I love perfumes in general I felt like it really smelled nice but that’s it just that nothing really grabs at you - it tries to but you’ve met it before 1000x

The hedione interests me plus sandalwood- I love a good sandalwood.

I would so buy this but I already got vanilla nude lveb and the new Q Parfum by D&G yesterday which I absolutely love them both

I miiiiiiiight buy this one but only thing stopping me is that I get this waxy smell I would pick up in Gucci magnolia flanker - purple bottle. I decluttered that one because it was turned up on the waxiness/thickness

This one does have that but it’s wiped away or smeared into the fragrance . The bubblegumminess takes a drop as the drydown comes as well.

. I’ll finish my sample but it does remind me so much of the “not so pleasant” phases of Magnolia


edit to add: this smells like it has blackcurrant in it. It has that fruitiness you can find in many other designer releases. Very loud . Similar to euphoria the red bottle and Ralph Lauren romance intense. Would be considered fruity woody scent profile

It's very sweet sugary with white flower and woods in the background, it's like the original but way more sweeter and stronger which I really like, it's a 10/10 for me, but I don't know I'm gonna get it or not cause lately the price of perfumes are going insane.
longevity is more improved but still bad. For the price point and as a brand, I need more than 5-6hrs not like a few mins.
/crying lonely

This is one of the better in this line, definitely more sophisticated than the original. It has an addictive sweet white floral trail with a hint of citrus. It is pretty linear throughout. I don't get a lot of woods but I'm sure it's there to ground and give some depth. I love gardenia and although I enjoy this there are of course better representations out there. Sure, it is designer style and not the most original but it's not bad. It is a fairly versatile grown up fragrance suitable for many occasions....an easy reach if you will. I'm still debating a full bottle. I don't need it but I find myself reaching for the travel size enough that it's almost halfway gone now.

I am obsessed with this!! One of my few “must haves” upon first smell. It is designery and reminds me of some other fruitichouli frags (Dark Kiss, Secret Wonderland, Angel, Euphoria (Intense), Fenty) However this one does everything I want and not too much. On my skin the gardenia isn’t actually the star of the show. I get more musky woody notes. It’s sparkly, floral, and rich, but not heavy. It is sultry but in a bubbly way- think someone like Sofia Vergara. I love it for an easy reach. It brings me to a nostalgic place of becoming a young woman in 2011, getting dolled up for a party to impress a crush. Fun, fabulous, sexy and feminine. Chefs kiss!

Update: after testing more, I have second thoughts. The chemically smell is real in the dry down. Smells like rubbing alcohol/fake woods :(

This is the grown up mature version of Juicy Couture Viva la Juicy line. Better than the original Gorgeous gardenia and more deep and surely better than Gold Couture. This lady is flirty and carefree with sex appeal . I admit that the opening is more intersting than the dry down as the dry down is a bit gold couture vibes But I love it. Its signature scent worthy except in the heat of summer.
christmas gift ahh perfume
It gives Viva la Juicy vibes 100 %. I probably would've liked it 10 years ago but not anymore.

someone sent me a sample of this with a purchase I made and I avoided spraying it as I just figured it wasn't my thing.
however, I am trying a new way of using my fragrances so I am doing an alphabet challenge. When I got to G I decided to give this one a go and boy was I wrong.
This fragrance was an absolute delight from first spray. Slightly darker in tone and something that could be worn not just on a hot summer evening but a fragrance that would suit the autumn and winter months as well. I could smell this on myself most of the day and only topped up once.
This may just have to go onto my list of full bottle worthy fragrances
Much better than the original!!!
Does anyone not think this smells like the dior trafalgar espirit? Smells almost identical to me, but then again I havent smelled that in a while, need to revisit and give it a test side by side

smells like a grown up version of taylor swift's wonders truck. as soon as I smelled it I felt incredibly nostalgic.

it leans very fall/winter, which I love because I find that it's super rare to find a floral that feels like fall/winter. its got this woodiness and spiciness that I just really love. I can't wait to wear this more in the fall.
Voní to jako CK Euphoria a je to velmi drahé.

Gucci Flora Gorgeous Gardenia Intense opens sweet, fruity, and flowery. As it dries down, the sweetness intensifies and a soft but pungent spiciness appears.
I tried the original a couple of months ago, and this version smells like a more intense version of what I remember the original smelling like. As I tried it in Boots on my way back home, I had to buy a 30ml bottle. I like the original; I particularly loved the brown sugar note, but the performance is so poor that I could not bring myself to buy it.
This intense version seems longer lasting, still very sweet and flowery but spicy: it seems ideal for late summer weather, turning into autumn 🤎❤️🍂

Update: after 3 to 4 hours, this fragrance is gone. Just as well I got the cute little bottle, I can bring it with me and re-apply... Longevity is still better than the orginal, but not that much, so that you know...
Generic, the performance is ridiculous for a intense perfume.

I tried this at Ulta and it's definitely stronger than Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia, but I also found it to be way too sweet for me. It lasted a good 4 hours and the drydown was definitely better than what I smelled in the top notes, but still not a fan.

got this as a sample. i smell the juicy mandarin straight away. there are white florals that somehow feel more cold weather adjacent as apposed to the more common summer fresh i'm used to from them.

unfortunately i get a strange cheap plastic undertone from the fragrance which puts me off heavily.

After smelling so many intense versions of perfumes that smell nothing like the original, this is truly what I had hoped the intense version of Gorgeous Gardenia would be like-- 100% met my expectations. Gorgeous Gardenia has a fresh and clean undertone alongside the bright fruity florals, and that freshness is totally missing here. BUT as a freshie girlie, I was actually surprised that I didn't miss those facets! This version is less clean and a bit more deep and rich without losing the initial DNA. It is still a sweet, fruity white floral, but the sandalwood gives it a creamy, spicy depth that is really pleasant. I enjoy it so much, and I really would like a full bottle!

The sillage is not beast mode but certainly you get a decent scent bubble, and this lasted 4-6 hours on me in a dry climate-- definitely has more throw in humidity!

I love this perfume because it is truly just a slightly more intense version of the perfume we all know and love.

This one gives me the same vibes as the orchid (not the same smell but the thiknessy if you know what i mean) and I'm in love.

The lovely opening is unisex to me.

I will have to sample this again, but somehow on my skin it smells strikingly similar to Jimmy Choo EDP (the original). One of the few perfumes I've tried that lasts all day and has crazy sillage though! Impressive.

to me, it reminds me of christmas (in the best way)
it's got a really interesting spicy note (kind of pine-y to me?) that evolves the more you smell it, and the sweet notes gently get stronger and leave a pleasant impression

This is interesting. I can detect a pepper rose note in this. I also get a very syrupy drydown with notes of berries. This is more of a bold floral fatale night scent. They took the intense very seriously with this one. Intense gardenia is not your typical fluffy white floral. Not a blind buy. I really enjoy it though. A unique scent.

On my skin, it's light floral, and there's spiciness. To me it doesn't smell same as the original. Woody dry down. I think men can wear this. It's for women with strong personality. Not for me. I like floral feminine perfumes. Not a safe blind buy.

Rating: 1/10

Dry down smells similar to Zoologists' Rabbit but with added florals and not as much of a biscuit as Rabbit is. 6/10 floral gourmand unique but not big on this scent profile. Defo better than Zoologist because it is more wearable.

This Intense version smells exactly the same as the regular one (to my nose, mostly sweet red fruits), but it lasts longer. If you like the original, you’ll probably like this one too.

For the record, I tested it at the same time as the original version (one on my left arm, the other on the right).

In my opinion this one is the best of the lot because it's richer. It is more in the category of, say, Elle - YSL, Midnight Poison - Dior. It couldn't be mistaken for either, don't get me wrong. It is a rich, sweet, modern fruitchouli. I don't go in for many scents of this ilk but I really like THIS one and I like the way this range is presented too. Think rich berries, rich florals like "orchid" style, purple (really, that's just the vibe I get), soft patchouli and cedar, with sweeeeet wedding cake icing.
Smells like bubblegum! Too sweet
Does what it says on the tin, it's a more intense version of the original, if you love the original then you will love this.

This smells exactly like warm banana bread with a orange glaze on my skin.

I do like it, but I'm also very confused by it.

If it wasn't for niche perfumes I'd be obsessed with this (and I'm even on the other side of the fence about buying this eventually) but one minor thing putting me off is (now don't if you're not a mum let this put you off) it smells like a mumsy designer perfume. It's definitely a good blind buy though if you're not sure on what mature-ish smell to buy.

I'd say this fragrance suits someone best around their 20s

Male here, can’t say no to free samples, so when this came through the post and found it in a gucci bag on the entrance floor after a long day at work, I thought f**k it and gave it a go. Maybe I was in a different mindset, who knows, but this hit different and really enjoyed it and I’m not even afraid to admit it. It’s like my third eye opened.

This is for your elegant vampire princess. Everything about this is so Autumn coded, even that gorgeous cranberry, blood-red bottle. It's fruity with a spicy woodiness from the sandalwood, which is the dominant note for me in the drydown. A bit reminiscent of wine, and somewhat similar in vibe to JPG La Belle Parfum. This is definitely its own entity from the original Gorgeous Gardenia, they're nothing alike. Out of the whole range, I'd say this one is the most elegant and perfect for a date night.

I smelled this in a Gucci store on a tester card and really liked it. The original, Gucci Flora Gorgeous Gardenia, was one of my first designer perfumes. This intense version smells like a stronger and richer version of the original. I think this would be perfect for the colder months. I have yet to try the intense version on my skin though. This could potentially be added to my collection depending on how it performs and smells on my skin. Really wanting a proper sample of this to test on me before buying a bottle.
How is this not a pure fruitchouli? That's all I smell. RL Romance Elixir and BBW Dark Kiss are spot on!

I loved the original gorgeous gardenia and plan to use this as a base to layer over since that one doesn’t last long. Same dna to me in the intense but this is stronger brown sugar through out. When I sprayed the back of my hand, there was a sheen from the oils. The juicy fruits at the opening are mouth watering. I never really smelled the gardenia in the og, But here in the intense, the florals are creamy and enveloping like a hug. I’m asking for this for Christmas.

I like this 🙂 I'm not so sure if I will ever buy it, but its good. Creamy flowers and strong sandalwood, i have the image of berries in my mind also, although not listed as notes, may be just the red bottle. It does not inspire me as much as I hoped.

I received a free sample of this and it was love at first sniff!

I have a body mist from Impulse called Purple Petals and Smokey Sky that smells quite similar in my opinion and will layer so beautifully. This is super woody but in a sweet way if that makes sense and dries down to such a nice vanilla smell.
I can also smell really fruity berries (blackcurrant like) but can’t see it listed in the notes so not sure what I’m smelling.

I would definitely wear this during the evening and probably the winter time as I think it suits colder weather a little more.

Definitely on the woodier side, almost none of the sugar from the original. I prefer this one, it's distinctly different, more grown-up as well. There's patchouli in there somewhere - hence the Flowerbomb vote in the 'reminds me of' section. Also reminds me of something I smelled years ago (could be early 00s?) but can't quite put my finger on it.

Love the original, so thought I'd try this while it was in store, and got a big surprise. Whilst I wasn't expecting a stronger dupe, I was expecting some resemblance but this is a heavy, fall and winter perfume - more night time. On me it strongly smelt of Euphoria. Performs well, but not what I was looking for.

Very much like Baciami and Crystal Noire Parfum to me. More woods and less vanilla in comparison to Baciami. Warmer and more ambery than CNP. The white florals are creamy with a slight peppery bitterness, which I like. The woodiness is more like guaiac instead of sandalwood to my nose. I like it but it would be redundant as I have similar scents. Beautifully done nonetheless.

Oh there’s no way there’s no patchouli notes listed. While it’s not as intense as the Gucci guilty intense edp in the gold bottle, the patchouli profile is definitely here. It’s a little softer, musky and slightly sweet from the creamy white florals. I’m a fan!

I do smell the original here but this is warmer and darker, kinda fruity

Editing to add - I think this will be great in the fall

I get a strong bubblegum note in the opening. Like a lighter less dense version of Kayali's Vanilla Candy Rock Sugar. The dry down is a pretty, lightly sweet floral. It goes a bit creamy but very subtle. Strong on opening and on clothes, but settles to moderate projection on skin. Very long lasting.

Love it. All the Floras smell amazing on paper but do something strange on my skin. This is the first one to not do so. It stays smooth yet slightly uplifted. It’s a bubble bathe scent. Scented and fragrant but not heavy. Just pretty and clean. Will def need a bottle!

Nice, very different from original Gorgeous Gardenia. But you can definitely snell gardenia and hedione note which I find a more sophisticated and balance then jasmine. Woody, warm, goos for fall and winter or as evening perfume all year round .

Overly synthetic and far too sweet.
Unfortunately, it just smells cheap.
The overall structure (the “fabric” of the fragrance) feels like something you’ve smelled everywhere before.
I usually adore gardenia for its clean, angelic vibe, but this doesn’t give me that at all.
A hard pass from me.

The opening reminds me so much of dark kiss from bath and body works, something I wore 15 years ago! To me this is a dark and sweet, mysterious and seductive scent. This would be a head turner to wear on a summer night out. But it also has a cozy feel to it so this would be good for the fall and winter too. It smells like a dark sweet fruit, almost like a dark berry or plum or something. The florals are present, but not too strong so they don’t make you smell like an old lady. The sandalwood is a great note in here to round it all out. I can imagine this scent lasting allll day. The reddish burgundy bottle is very pretty too, I feel like the color matches the fragrance very well.

This is not a more intense version of the previous flanker. You really smell the gardenia and jasmine and it smells so luxurious. There is a fruitiness that lasts throughout the wear of the fragrance but I get a more berry feel than mandarin but it is fresh and not juvenile. The sandalwood is perfect, it's anchored deep and really keeps the florals from being to heavy and dense. This fragrance is perfectly balanced being warm, creamy, but fresh at the same time. This fragrance is a head turner for sure and I'm really impressed. Definitely sexy and screams luxury, but you must like your white florals. Great performance at least 8hrs with beautiful scent trail. I love this fresh take on gardenia it's beautiful!
Nice, sweet, slightly powdery with hint of citrus.
Gucci please, please do a Gucci Flora Gorgeous Orchid Intense EDP!
They better make Gorgeous Jasmine Intense with JASMIN SAMBAC

Love the original
Brown sugar is the best
Rates as 1?

The best part about the original was the brown sugar note IMO. I'm curious to smell this flanker although I'm skeptical it will smell better. It looks like it will smell very different compared to the first one. A flanker should retain the DNA of the original while adding its own flair. Either way, I'm eager to get my nose on it.

The bottle is gorgeous! I am also curious if the others in the line will get an "Intense" addition?! I imagine so but it could widely depend on the success of this one.

Anyone else excited for this one? Or do you feel it's redundant?
This was a blind buy that I truly regret. On me, there is no floral. There is a weird chemical fragrance. It's starting to trigger a migraine.

I loved the fragrance in the bottle but it reacted quite poorly to my body chemistry - it loses all of the floral smells and just turns into a sickly sweet smell, which is disappointing. It's not bad but it's not great. I learned a lesson here to never pay for a full size perfume unless it's very reasonably priced or I've had a chance to test a sample or travel size. I'm not sure if other people have had similar reactions, but for a Gucci perfume, at that price point it's definitely worth testing before buying. I think I just fell victim to the packaging, which is really beautiful.

Update - this turned quite badly. I've had other perfumes turn after 5 years, which is not unreasonable. But I've had other perfumes that lasted much longer, because I store them in a cool dark place - like I've had Dolce&Gabbana perfumes stay great for like 9 years. But usually when other perfumes turn I find they either just lose potency or smell alcoholic. ...but not Gucci Bamboo. It literally smelled like a portapotty. It's truly bizarre. I thought I was out of my mind, and I had my friend smell it before I threw it out and she said "it smells like a toilet," and that was the end of it.

At the end of the day, this is the only perfume I've ever had that I would NOT recommend. It's the worst perfume I've ever had in my collection.

Scent Description: Sweet
Sillage: Medium, Arms Length
Longevity: Medium, ~3 Hours
Presentation: Beautiful Dark Pink Crystal Bottle

A creamy soapy feminine scent，reminds me of the enchanting Feminine by Dolce and Gabbana，probably a more refreshing and less complex version though。 The drydown smells quite similiar to the ever so comforting White Moss by Acca Pacca， sexy in a discret way~this is a lovely everyday fragrance:lily+ambergris+sandalwood。。。I like it a lot actually。
absolutely beautiful. on my skin it's a sweet floral without being overwhelming, cloying or vintage. lasts long too. can't stop sniffing my wrist.

Limited Edition with adding up with sweetness, nothing much different, Gucci has change the bottle colour and I notice vanilla note is dominant compare to the original, JUST I REALLY NOTICE IS, GUCCI ONCE AGAIN RAISE UP THEIR PRICE RANGE FOR ALL GUCCI LINE STARTING NEXT YEAR 2018

The fragrance is unchanged, it's not an "updated version".
You can check on sephora.com which says:
"Gucci Bamboo Limited-Edition eau de parfum is the original woody floral fragrance, tinted a jewel tone to celebrate the scent’s new chapter."

Tempted to blind buy this just for the bottle and the box.

Despite the single topnote and lukewarm reviews.

Almost wish design houses would just produce pretty bottles and let us fill them with our preferred fragrances!

I'm sorry to say, it was quite disappointing in my opinion. Not an awful smell, but completely unimpressive and quite boring.
Those notes sound good, but this scent isn't the greatest composition. It's without a character.
Maybe they just try to please everyone with it and that's the result.
That bottle is simply beautiful!
I hope there is another new Flora collection instead of Bamboo... Hrmmm
Gorgeous marketing campaign!
Aren't those the same notes that are in the original? Just a different color bottle?

I decided to open and test my vintage sample of Gucci No. 1 in honour of the new House of Gucci film (not that anyone at my local cinema would notice - purely for my own satisfaction!) What a treat - G1 is a beautiful, high quality, well-rounded scent. Of its time, but not dated, this floral-aldehydic scent smells elegant and expensive. It is quiet yet rich - this could be due in part to the nature of the parfum concentration. In general, I find that sillage can be stronger in EDP or even EDT form compared to the extrait/parfum version, and as a result I sometimes consider the latter to be more elegant. Here, the subtle, quiet depth of the parfum suits the ladylike elegance of G1.

G1 opens with soft, slightly soapy aldehydes. There is a prominent hyacinth note that is reminiscent of the flower, and is rendered in soft focus by the aldehydes. Rich, vintage-smelling yet soft, the hyacinth is a masterful addition here. When hyacinth is done right, it is a beautiful addition to perfumes (see Goutal Grand Amour for an excellent example). There is a lovely green background to the opening, giving G1 a damp freshness, reminiscent of a garden after rain. The spicy-floral green notes of carnation and geranium enhance this. Lily-of-the-valley is also prominent to my nose here, enhancing the white floral-green accord.

As it develops, more floral notes unfold. There is a subtle sweetess provided by the rose, ylang ylang and some clean jasmine. It is a natural and restrained sweetness - ladylike and elegant, a far cry from modern candied vanilla scents. The greenness remains, and the florals become powdery thanks to the iris and heliotrope. The drydown is musky, mossy and woody, tempered by a subtle hint of vanilla in the base. A sweet amber accord emerges as it fades.

G1 is a beautiful, dense, complex floral bouquet. Feminine elegance in a bottle, it has vintage charm but does not smell dusty or old-fashioned. There is something delicate about it despite its richness. It is extremely well-blended and is long lasting. Sillage is intimate-to-moderate. Technically a chypre given its base, the aldehydic florals dominate. I must track down a full bottle of this masterpiece. They don't make them like this anymore. 5/5.
I received a sample. Such an avant-garde scent for its age. It would fit today's market with its sweetness, yet it is not candylike. Elegant scent.
Seems it is the only carnation I can stand and like

@psychocandy regarding counterfeit alchemist bottles. Yes, they are everywhere. I recommend visiting a Gucci boutique if you can.

I own a handfull, I've sold a couple over the years, and I've tried nearly all of them. I consider myself pretty well versed and in tune with this particular line. I have inadvertantely purchased counterfeit (decided to repurchase midnight stroll and seller I bought from was genuinely unaware, and I got my money back) and, I literally live down the street from an Gucci boutique. I go there at least once per month, for many years.

To be clear, the smaller, thinner box batch code is above the larger bulkier box code on genuine alchemist garden bottles. I can post photos of both the genuine Gucci boxes, and the fake. I took lots of pictures before returning the fake.

The best way to tell if they are counterfeit is to know the smell, because they're never accurate. This is true for 99% of counterfeit bottles from any house. Another way, specifically for alchemist, is the material of the bag is totally wrong on the counterfeit. Additionally, the print is never quite as robust and seems to fade, and the straps on the bag should not be frayed. Otherwise the counterfeits are very good. I even weighed the bottles and the caps separately, and they were pretty close. But the thing is, the weight of the caps when comparing genuine caps have slight weight variation.
Italian brands like Gucci are not exactly known for laser like focus manufacturing consistency. Yes they are well made, but they are artisan.

P.S. The juice should be blue. Counterfeit juice is clear

Never smelled anything like this. Deep, herbal, industrial, dark and outta this world! This scent will set you apart from everyone else nearby. IMO better than Voice of the Snake and by far a fav from the whole Alchecmist Garden line. As its been discontinued fro a few years now it is a collectors item, dont miss out!

Be careful with this one…every listing I’ve seen lately for this have the marks of the fakes, (batch code printed in the wrong spot, even the smaller bar code above the larger one printing is wrong)I compared them to my legit box and they are off…it’s a shame people think they have a real bottle and in their listing say “guaranteed authentic”, I got duped the first time I tried buying this on a listing like that, I only found a bottle after a seller was kind enough to authenticate with a Gucci receipt 😳

This basically doesn't exist anymore. It's not to be found online.



Cool...because I'd really like to get my nose on this one

Gucci Hortus Sanitatis (2019) - cedar vetiver - #albertomorillas wonderfully creates a scent that you would assume to be linear, but has so much depth. The accord I’m getting would be Ginger, Vetiver and Cedarwood. But these 3 have so much character that it morphs differently on skin. The ginger is fresh and medicinal. The vetiver is earthy, wet soil-like, and rooty. The cedar is pine-like, smooth, yet camphoric. Completely androgynous and well-made

Very green and bitter opening. Quite medicinal. If you give it time it will become sweeter later. Rather quite the taste of life, after a bitter period there comes the sweetness. Quite like the kitty on the label and the cap btw.

Some key differences in the real vs the fake:

-real has visibly thicker box
-real has significantly more rigid box
-real has visibly more rounded box edges when compared to other authentic Alchemist Garden boxes
-the real tote bag silk screened cat logo will be ON TOP of swirl pattern, the cat will be very crisply printed without the swirl pattern visible in the printing. The fake had lines and stripes visible in the cat print and was much less crisply printed.
-the real tote bag will feel more like nylon, noisier crisper in texture like a nylon windbreaker, NOT ‘satin’ like a pair of satin sheets, the fake was visibly more “silky” in texture.
-the real tote bag has a considerably smaller tag, sewn in precisely. The fake had a tag at least twice as big and was sewn somewhat crudely when compared to authentic.
-the real bottle cap will have NO casting flaws or texture in the groove, the fake had some flaking/texture in the groove that looked poorly cast
-the FAKE used a known batch code “0023”, my REAL bottle also has this code so be cautious as Gucci may have only made one batch…
-Real box batch code printed to left side just above center of the white area for the barcode with the last digit actually touching the white area, the fakes seem to have the batch code printed well above and to the left of the white bar code area.

Anyway if you’d like any help authenticating a bottle let me know I have all the comparison photos as well as an authentic bottle/box/bag in hand (as well as 6 other fragrances from the Alchemist Garden)

Is anyone interested in a swap with Les Liquides Immaginaires Melancolia EDP? I am enthusiastic of medicinal smelling perfumes, which Hortus Sanitatis seems to be (I don't know, is it?) and I would gladly swap my extra bottle of Melancolia (100 ml, 98% full) with a similar bottle of Hortus Sanitatis. PM me if you reside in Europe and are interested.

My friends, I too could weep for joy.
I managed to score a bottle at an excellent price on eBay and it all worked out for the best- very satisfied.
The beautifully made nesting coffin style textured box with the inner nylon bag (made in Italy) makes for a stunning presentation, better than many bottles costing many times more.
The batch code dates it to January 2020- so the 1st (and only?) batch.
The scent reviews are close to accurate, a ginger spicy opening blast with smoky vegetal undertones, almost beet-like. Sebastian had compared the scent to barbecued roses which is strangely accurate.
The dry-down becomes earthy/musty and woody, very hard to describe overall but intriguing.
Opening sillage is very strong and dries down to moderate sillage and longevity.
I’m thrilled to add it to my collection when I realized too late that Gucci had cancelled it in March.

My friends, I could weep for joy. After scouring the internet for some time, I came across a bottle that, based on detailed photos, appeared to be genuine... and at an unbelievable price. I got so lucky to snag it, especially now that it's disappeared from the Gucci website.

This perfume is challenging and intriguing, with a shocking medicinal and metallic opening blast that quickly paves the way to the promised bone-dry papyrus. Then deep, dark roses start to smolder on resinous wood, alongside more papyrus, menthol, and spicy, rich roots. There is a feeling of stepping into an apothecary, a hint of dusty books, metal implements sanitizing in a basin, bundles of plants hung to dry, 100s of materia medica on the shelves, all of which sit behind the fragrance of the fire heating the room. After years of medicine being prepared here, the scent has permeated the walls, no longer the discernible notes of the ingredients of a remedy, but the scent of the space itself.

The frag head in me appreciates this as a work of art. But as a practitioner of herbal medicine who appreciates the history of my field, this scent transports me. I couldn't be more pleased by this homage.

This has a simple note tree like all from the line, but it's also a deep and meditative. The first thing I thought of was historical artifacts in a museum. It's earthy, smokey, woody, and I can sense (in my minds eye) old metal equipment like swords and shields used in Roman Gladiator battles in the colosseum.

If this was named bronze and wood it would make sense. There's also an old worn leather vibe. This highlights the best parts of papyrus and wood. Some may also catch a medicinal smell of a doctor's office. Might be challenging for every day wear as it's serious and not light-hearted at all. I think it would be perfect on a well dressed man heading out for a night on the town. I keep smelling the spray spots which is usually a bad sign for my wallet 😵.

Deep, meditative, ancient, transportive, I love it, and ended up buying it. This will appeal only to niche fragrance lovers imo.

Scent 10/10
Performance 9.5/10

P. S. This is way better than Le Labo Patchouli 24. Although they share a little similarity in the opening, P24 smells like you're wearing patchouli smothered in BBQ sauce.

This fragrance was synthesised by Alberto Morelas by Astlham Gucci for Hortus Sanitatis’ book “Garden of Health” is one of the first and perhaps the most influential books printed on herbs and is one of the most important works of the Middle Ages that contributed to our knowledge of natural history, especially in the field of medicinal plants. The book consists of sections of plant knowledge and drug extraction.

Alberto Morelas has formulated this beautiful fragrance made up of papyrus, vetiver, cedar and ginger with a wood combination of your earthy that resembles the smell of medicinal medicines and the amazing combination of foreground and finish.

When smelling the first spray of perfume, you start smelling a nail-like smell and ramming plants 🪵with a dumbbell of smoke and the combination of burning vetiver and ginger with a background of the smell of wound healers “Ditol” 💊, all this with one spray, when the perfume proves after about 15 minutes it begins to smell

I didn't find the perfume similar or the same composition.

A very wonderful and amazing perfume, a winter perfume par excellence.

I recommend it to lovers of exclusivity, you will evaluate 10/10.

When I smell this smell, I remember the cold winter nights in the middle of the land and the warmth with fire, the smell of burning ramids and golden sand 🪵🏜

How did I not know about this earlier? Stumbled upon this on a casual visit to my local Gucci Boutique and felt beyond delighted! Hand down the best in the Alchemist Garden Collection so far! It’s way more complex than what described here. I picked up notes of spices, some iris, cade, birch tar, vanilla, patchouli. It’s really close to Le Labo’s Patchouli 24 with a green spicy opening and a more powdery musky base (Gucci Alchemist Garden DNA - very similar to Voice of the Snake or Midnight stroll). It’s more smokey woody than aromatic to my nose. This also seems to last the longest for me compared to other similar scents in the collection.

If it smells like GGPH to you or has weak performance, it’s very likely you might have gotten a counterfeit one. Real bottles are sold only at certain boutiques and DSM

The sent trail of this fragrance is mouth watering. Relative to what's out there, this is very mentholated with hints of sweetness and some woods. Its dry..its unique..and very underrated. I'm a girl and purchased it blindly afer I got Voice of the Snake which I also love (also a blind purchase). Its perfectly unisex. Don't sleep on this fragrance.

In light of all the fakes apparently circulating out there (see psychocandy's review below), I guess I should start by pointing out that my bottles of Hortus Sanitatis were both purchased directly from one of the Gucci botiques. So I am reviewing the genuine stuff. That's a good thing, because this is going to be a glowing review for one of my favorite fragrances of 2020.

HS is not just part of the Gucci Alchemists' Garden series of haute partum releases, its name is also the Latin nomenclature for a "health garden", or a garden comprised of plants having medicinal properties. This scent opens, appropriately enough, with a medicinal, mentholated note that is unique in my experience. Fans of Gucci Guilty Absolute will be reminded of the band-aid note in that fragrance, but here there is more depth and complexity to this note--it smells like a medication with several aromatic ingredients, not just a bandage. I think this note is a manifestation of some real camphorous oud at work in HS.

The notes here are hard to pick out because the blending is exceptionally intricate. Papyrus, in a very natural and lifelike grassy, dry form, is about all I can pick out distinctly in the initial phase of this scent. Later, as things progress, there is a smokey incense note which is joined by rose. One of the well-known YouTubers has said that this phase of HS smells like barbecued roses. I don't quite know if I would have used that description, but it is as good as any, I suppose. Barbecued or not, there is nothing jammy about the rose in HS. This rose is herbal and astringent in nature and somewhat spicy, perhaps with a hint of ginger.

I have seen suggestions that this scent is similar to Gucci Pour Homme I, or Parle Moi de Parfum's Papyrus/Oud 71. I own all of these scents and I do not see any such similarly beyond the presence of papyrus in all 3 fragrances.

This fragrance is most certainly unisex. Projection is considerable and longevity stretches out over 10 or more hours. The presentation is reminiscent of an old laboratory bottle and also the containers of the Louis Vuitton fragrances. Perhaps LVMH, which owns both Gucci and Vuitton, is utilizing designs submitted for consideration in response to a single request for ideas to get the most for their money or to avoid wasting a second good design when they need only one per product line. In any event, the bottle looks very good and the atomizer is among the best.

This is one of those fragrances that is so unlike anything else, and so far removed from trends and fashion, that it is amazing that Gucci has created and marketed it. I love HS. It is expensive, but the quality is extraordinary.

HS is hard to find because the distribution is so very limited, but if you should find yourself in a Gucci boutique where HS is sold, don't miss the chance to smell this wonderful fragrance. Most highly recommended. Beautiful!

This is essentially a sequel to Le Labo’s Patchouli 24. The scents are very similar. This Gucci is a tad more sharp and candied than the Le Labo. Crazy that Gucci is selling something so utterly daring and complex. Major props to them!!!

I want to put this up as a public service announcement to be very careful when buying this line including this one: I just purchased on a reputable auction site and the product I received was in fact a fake. It looked quite convincing but upon comparison to an authentic packaging presentation it was clearly a fake. This fragrance has been faked for certain😳 the box will have a smoother texture than an authentic, it will be noticeably thinner and have flex which the originals do NOT.
