I compared side by side the boxes and my fake Hortus was immediately noticeably thinner! Next the little pouch of the fake will be more silky and satin like, the real deal is a raspy nylon type bag. My fake Hortus sticker on the bottom of the bottle had a nearly unreadable batch code, the real things will be bold black and look almost embossed. If you image search this fragrance you will see it pop up being sold from all the sketchy sites from around the world for a huge discount, anyway buyer beware, I was shocked this got faked, I will document this product for any who want to see what a fake Hortus looks like!

This is a slightly off topic rant, so excuse me for it. I am patiently waiting for a brand new high end fragrance creation to take the spiritual place of Creed Aventus. Aventus has been out for a decade now and we need a new niche star to inspire us for the next decade. With a name like that I don’t think this fragrance will be it. But I hope everyone understands what I am trying to say. Aventus is old. We need a revolutionary high end fragrance that will pave the way for other niche and designer fragrances. When Aventus was released no one in the world predicted it would get as big as it did. I want something brand new to capture all of our attention like Aventus did.

Suitable for Coronavirus. Name and colours (white with red £cross") make me think to sanitizer. Please. The old story of alchemy, and church and priests is nice but the watchable result make me bleah!

ثبات وفحوان سيء جدا ، رائحة جميلة

ثبات اقل من ساعة
فوحان اقل من ١٠ دقايق
رائحة ٧ من ١٠

Price point for sillage and longevity is a gimmick !

But still i paid full retail price for a bottle , this is hands down Gucci's top creation , extremely luxurious scent very comforting , sandalwood got the main role here , patchouli adding a kick while cedar adding depth ..

Unisex leaning towards feminine

Oh Gucci , Why would u reserve this gem for stupid "scented water" ?! We need it in EDP intense !

I have now sampled 12 of the Alchemist Garden line and Fading Autumn is by far my favorite scent of the line. I really wish they had released this as an edp rather than a scented water. It’s such a gorgeous woody spicy scent. I truly love it. The problem is that I’m constantly applying it and with the price tag of a full bottle I can simply not justify a purchase. I wish it lasted longer and had slightly more sillage. Overall, I’m glad I sampled this and if I could find a decant for a great price or a dupe, I would definitely buy it.

Sweet, warm, and comforting sandalwood, a touch ephemeral in the sense that you get an impression of the notes.
My sample on my wrist isn't projecting much, just content to linger in that little space. It's been an hour and it's already in skin scent territory. Longevity doesn't justify price, if you get a sample, that ought to be enough.
Perfect for spring and autumn.

It seems like I need to stop trying Gucci… This one is again a strongly feminine frag. It’s sweet and even a little bit heavy. I’ve detected my fave nagarmotha note in the opening, but at the drydown all Gucci frags are the same to me - candy-like and powdery, heavy sweet and for cis women after at least 25.

I so wanted to fall in love with a fragrance from this line because the packaging is gorgeous to me! I had high hopes for Fading Autumn - woodsy notes and a romantic name... This isn't the one though. Upon spraying it's initially woodsy, airy, and a little spicy. Pleasant enough if not too unique, very gentle.

However it almost immediately becomes a faint lemon cleaner smell to me, with only a whiiiiisper of woods. And nothing at all left of it after about an hour. The quiet initial topnotes carrying the little intrigue to be had only last a few seconds, and it's nearly impossible to parse them in that time

As a few have said before- I mainly love this for the bottle, and kudos to Bormioli Luigi for this one. Don't get me wrong, the fragrance is very lovely if a bit fleeting (or /fading/- hey, sorry, had to). A very pleasant and well-blended woody scent. Perfectly unisex.

Lovely, beautiful ceramic bottle. Very classy. Act as a piece of art to interior decor of any house. Romantic, comfortable scent of sandalwood. Kinda sweet and triggers memories. Love it so much. Despite its weak performance the big bottle would last for ages. Find it suitable for layering with other floral perfumes.

Really great woodsy scent, not green in the least, the "fading" part of "fading autumn" really rings true as you smell this.

The longevity makes me want to cry though. It's quite sad.

Refined and seductive. September night at the Adriatic coast and islands of Croatia smells like this. I love it. Also, this is a skin scent, which works for me often, good for beaches, day, night, home, bedroom, every occasion when you don't feel the need of stronger scents. Notes develops so good at my skin, it is so alluring and sexy.

Beautiful, aromatic smelling woods when first sprayed and when you smell it from the bottle. But after a few minutes, I can smell a gasoline/petrol note. I looked online and found it mentioned in a forum that sometimes the constitution of the sandalwood note results in this gasoline note. That note destroys this perfume. And with the price tag associated with this perfume, Gucci should have done better, at least tested it better. Such a shame, because, had it not been for this note, the perfume was woody perfection, for me. And I don't like smelling like a gas station
Smells like a diluted version of Halfeti.

They say scent evokes memories. For me, Gucci’s ‘Fading Autumn’ smells exactly like a Mediterranean forest after rainfall. To be precise, it took me back to Galicia in the North West of Spain, when I was hiking in the countryside in early morning, admist the usual Galician rainfall. It’s the smell the forest floor gives off when damp, that earthy but woody mix of fallen pine needles and undiscovered pathways. It’s the abundance of pine trees along with tall eucalyptus. ‘Fading Autumn’ takes me back to the scent of hiking the Camino De Santiago and finding myself.

I actually like the smell, it's neutral woodsy, very light and airy, like a veil weaved from woods. It's relaxing and classy, simple but not boring. However, it really is scented WATER as the product name suggests, it drips like water upon application, has low sillage and is gone in one to two hours, kind of like after-shower/shave splash. I'm not going to comment on the value, but don't blind buy I suggest. P.S. It could have been much more appealing if released as EdP

product_name: A Nocturnal Whisper Perfume Oil Gucci
review_content:
In the collection 'The garden of the alchemist' Oil version, ode to melancholy is no longer available.
I was intrigued by this name, whose subjects correspond to my favorites.
So I chose this night murmur, filled with sweetness and poetry.
This time it is the leather with the saffran accompanied by incense scrolls against the background of Oud whose oil makes its name wonderfully.
The idea of including the glass applicator like Arab perfumery is daring for this very commercial house.
Admittedly, this range is of a higher level whose choice of Alberto Morillas is no coincidence.
The Atkinsons house, with its Mystic Essence collection, had released in its time some perfumes in this format of oils, which I have Oud Save the Queen.
With this method, we perfume ourselves with details, the perfume is just deposited by applying the glass rod behind the ears and on the neck by small touches, instead of receiving an often clumsy wavy with sprays except for people who flavor the clothes, yes I say the clothes, by them.
But now, the Prays broadcasts the alcohol in which the oil is there but only it is not feasible.
A shame that other brands do not offer this means, just to revive the pleasure and the art of perfuming.
It is therefore a real pleasure for me with this perfume.
The oud here must be that of Laos, already used by Morillas for its original Oud to mizensify accompanied by a sumptuous geranium, and which I find here this lightness surrounded by saffron, giving this impression of leather.
The outfit is very good and the wake is light, as its name suggests, since this perfume is not intended to attract attention but to seduce the one who carries it and not strike a very little receptive entourage in the OUD in general.
And moreover, a very beautiful collector's room, with its glass bottle dressed in its silk pocket, in a pretty box and all with green and gold green colors.

product_name: A Nocturnal Whisper Perfume Oil Gucci
review_content:
Im totally in love with this one!

Can I hear some advices about where to put it and how much?
The main target is to smell this masterpiece nearly all day long

product_name: A Nocturnal Whisper Perfume Oil Gucci
review_content: Can someone help me? I own voice of the snake, is this redundant? The notes seem so similar. But I love voice of the snake it makes me want to branch out and acquire this as well

product_name: A Nocturnal Whisper Perfume Oil Gucci
review_content: Far from a whisper, this is a quite intense take on an oud/leather-combi. I'm not a fan of oud in general, but this is very well blended with a hint of sweetnes from the saffron and benzoin. Imagine one of them andalusian equestrian clubs with polished leather saddles, elegant horsemen and the finest breed of horses. It sure smells lavish and the bottles in the collection are very beautiful, yet I don't find it distinctive enough to warrant such an exorbitant price.

product_name: A Nocturnal Whisper Perfume Oil Gucci
review_content: So I dabbed Nocturnal Whisper at Dubai airport while waiting for my flight. The heady incensy dark notes just hit me straight in the heart and I was in lust. I nearly fainted when I heard the price so it was a pass. But unfortunately I couldn't forget it on returning back to London and as the days passed I couldn't forget that intense love that literally mesmerised me as did the beautiful enchanted bottle and name. So I bought it and we have been in love ever since. I've layered it with A Reason To Love since the perfume oils can layered... And well that burning love has just become eternal.

product_name: A Nocturnal Whisper Perfume Oil Gucci
review_content: Oh shit- this is straight gasoline smelling (in a good way, of course). I received this as a gift from a friend, but I do not think I'd ever purchase it myself, and certainly not for that retail price. However- for what it is, you get amazing quality ingredients and an absolutely gorgeously decorated bottle and glass dropper applicator attached to the cap.

product_name: A Nocturnal Whisper Perfume Oil Gucci
review_content: Beautiful skin scent, nice balance of leather, real oud, spicy saffron and slightly sweet benzoin. I’d never buy it at retail price, discounted yes, I blind bought it heavily discounted and I must say that yes it has real oud, not the best quality oud but nonetheless real oud. This perfumed oil is way better than all the other trash Gucci has offered before so I’m very impressed and happy with the way they’ve gone with Alberto Morilla. It leans more masculine than unisex because of the heavy oud presence but if you like pungent, daring, leathery scents this will provide a nice backbone for layering. BTW this ain’t no whisper.

product_name: A Nocturnal Whisper Perfume Oil Gucci
review_content: At the opening this is a blast of leather, which softens up very nicely. I found the dry-down to be largely woods, with a slight leather in the background. It's blended very nicely. However, to me this DNA isn't anything new, and certainly doesn't warrant the price tag. Although, the bottles are stunning.

product_name: A Nocturnal Whisper Perfume Oil Gucci
review_content:
Gucci is sinking.... who do you caaaalll??? Ghost-bust....No..... AL-BERTOOOO!

Yep. After 10 years of creative desert (with the excpetion of the great Gucci Intense Oud) in the fragrance department, Gucci woke up 2 years ago by calling Alberto Morillas to save the ship. This started with the non-mainstream beautiful Gucci Guilty Absolute. (even if probably highly inspired by Terenzi Ursa, released a couple of years before..)
Now, Gucci wants to capture value by launching is high-end line to compete with Armani Prive, Dior La Collection, Tom Ford Private Blend & co...
Well... I would suggest: keep cool Gucci. One can not go "dalle stalle alle stelle" from one day to another... (an italian expression litterally meaning "from the stables to the stars")

That said, I have to say I tested a couple of their Alchemist's Garden line, and these where very nice blends.

This oud oil is a beautiful oud-centered fragrance, made with real oud oil (from Thailand I would guess).

Will I buy it? At $415 (for just 0.5oz) retail, that's simply a no.
If I was rich, would I buy it? No, because while it is well blended, it is not unique and thus not worth it.
If I had to spend $400 on a fragrance, I would choose a couple of beautiful and really unique niche fragrances for that price, or just double the $ amount to get Frederic Malle The Night (at $900/1.7oz, it ends being less $/ml, and it's much more potent - need just one spray, will last much longer- and unique). I have the felling here that what the price counts is the unicity ( of the beautiful old style bottle - personally I care about the juice, not the bottle or label).

In one sentence: great fragrance, horrible price.

Fall/Winter evenings, 30+

product_name: A Nocturnal Whisper Perfume Oil Gucci
review_content:
The new Gucci Alchemist's Garden collection just ticks all the right boxes.

The naming, the flacon, the color, the mood... Very traditional and Italian/English.

Perfetto, Alessandro Michele!

Bye Vuitton!

-AB-

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: literally... same, valery_perfumejunkie.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I haven't seen anyone commenting on this, but I've been using this EDT for a few days now, and I sense something that reminds me (in a very watered-down and simplistic way) of Guerlain's Champs Élyseés. Perhaps it's the common notes: lilac, peach, and blackcurrant. They seem to have been crafted in a very similar way to the masterpiece that is Champs, but much weaker than Guerlain's. Anyway, just because it reminded me of my beloved Champs, I like this Gucci Guilty EDT and will have it in my collection. It's a beautiful floral scent, fresh and pleasant. I don't see any situation that would make it unpleasant—quite the opposite.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
Okay wow. I sold my original 2010 edt several years ago, but heard someone talking about it recently so I went to try this newer, available version. This is incredible. Truly amazing. It is admittedly less intense than the original formulation of the edt, but for me, that translates as a very good thing. This has the same mysterious sexy clean scent, but is a bit sweeter and smoother.

I will say, I’ve only had it for a week and already ran through a third of the bottle :/. It lasts pretty well for an edt, but obviously I’m over spraying, which I need to do, because otherwise it wouldn’t be worth spraying at all. Aside from that (which is a huge con) I am truly in love with this and will be wearing it forever.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I'd never had a particular interest in the Guilty line by the time I was accidentally introduced to Love Edition 2025. Saying that I was swept away by it is underestimation. Unfortunately, that limited edition is far pricier, so I was looking for some alternatives. Having sniffed all the possible Guilty perfumes, I realised the EDT is the closest to Love Edition. It is so gentle and sultry at the same time. The lilac note is the most delicate and mesmerising. I wish I had discovered it sooner

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Upon first spray, it smelled identical to something else I have smelled before, although I can’t place it! Quickly, it starts to develop into such a pretty scent. This is one I can smell in the air more than on skin. It’s such a pretty scent bubble! Slightly sweet, floral with such a classy base! The lilac isn’t super apparent to my nose. For me this is spring and summer, and it’s gorgeous!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
subtle, elegant, effortless, flexible, light, alluring, classy .... perfect for all occasions <3

now i am wearing my sample and this potion just entered my top 5 fav. i will get one soon.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
This used to be one of my favorite grab 'n go scents. Was caught off guard when I noticed she no longer came in her cute little rounded square flacon.
I blind bought this new formulation after discovering the notes are almost identical to the original. They've added raspberry and removed bergamot. Considering bergamot has a deeper spicier accord than other citruses, in its absence, we arrive at something less sultry, slightly softer and fruitier.

Initially, I didn't appreciate it, as I was pining for the OG but over time, I've grown to love this :)

EDIT: Just purchased a 30ml of the original on eBay. In a side-by-side comparison, the original is spicier, and soapier than this new EDT. During the dry down the original also projects stronger and for longer.

Conclusion: While the original fragrance is a little edgier, in it's absence I've grown to love my new EDT version

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: smells straight up like green olives yuck

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
It is a very sophisticated veil of an angelic scent. The most vivid part is lilac and skin-like musk. A dash of pink pepper, a drop od jasmine, a note of peach and amber.
Surrounds me in a fragrant cloud that feels universal occasion-wise. Lovely concentration for the spring and summer as it is more airy than the edp as I know it from the Love edition. When you want a light pleasure and not to make a statement. It still has enough presence to satisfy me, I feel it for 11 hours already. It only was absent when I was hiking, but whenever I stood still I could clearly detect its lovely aura, so its parameters are spectacular. Faint remains of it I feel the next morning.
And it can be oversprayed to my heart delight.
It feels luxurious and well done.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
Very subtle, elegant. It won't offend anyone.
Like a warm breeze carrying the scent of lilac and other florals and a fruity nuances of mandarin and peach. With time pink pepper makes an appearance. I feel also musk.
I love the soft veil of opening. I bought it wanting a subtle floral breeze and it delivers.
Gucci Guilty the Love edition has stronger presence as an eau de parfum. Also the opening of the original, old formula is more lilac and stronger.
It might be a good companion for summer.
It feels carnal and skin-like. Your skin but better scent.
When I was going to sleep and my skin heated in bed, I could suddenly feel the pretty projection of the scent, a musky-floral goodness 10 hours after application.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: The Eau de Parfum version of Gucci Guilty bears a striking resemblance to the original 2010, featuring a notably powdery scent. As one commenter pointed out, it has a delightful hint of baby wipes /baby powder. The scent is a light citrus, floral powder fragrance with a hint of spice. Perfect signature scent its soft and balanced.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
A scent so smooth, yet bold and bright,
Gucci Guilty feels just right.
Citrus sparks with lemon zest,
Lilac follows clean and fresh.

Hints of spice and floral play,
Soft and subtle, never stray.
A touch of musk, so warm and light,
Keeps it mellow, never trite.

It’s easy, breezy, hard to hate,
A classic choice a simple fate.
Not too loud, but lingers still,
A scent that’s chic yet fits the bill.

And though the name may hint at sin,
There’s nothing guilty locked within!
🙃😉

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: It's so fresh and clean, and reminds me of summer. My husband says it smells straight up like baby wipes, so keep that in mind I guess, but to me it smells like a beautiful summer day, pure childhood nostalgia, and like feeling carefree. Lilacs and geraniums and playing outside with my siblings. I don't find the name "Guilty" to be very fitting, lol

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
A little bit sweet, but I still like it. There’s patchouli, a note I normally do not like, but here it’s dialed down. Very feminine pretty scent.

Update: 5/11/2025 Maybe because it is an EDT, I could not smell much after applying a few dabblers from a mini bottle. I ended up splashing half the bottle. Now I smell it, and it’s pretty. But I won’t be buying a bigger bottle.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I recently found a sample of this at the bottom of my makeup drawer. It has probably been there for years. I tried it and feel so lucky I did. On the surface it doesn't seem that original but there is something about it that stands apart from other florals and I'm having a hard time saying why. Maybe because none of the other perfumes I've tried were lilac? Maybe it is the lilac? But I feel like I've found he perfect floral for me. It is comforting, elegant, classy, not overbearing and but subtly unique. It is light but has good longevity. I like that I can wear it out to dinner and it doesn't clash with food. It's safe for wearing to work and also special enough for an event. I went out and tried all the other versions of Gucci Guilty and I definitely prefer this over the EDP. I love the bottle too.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I am very devoted to floral perfumes. Gucci Guilty gives me that but also adds a smokiness I find really alluring. It has become my most worn perfume in the past year or so.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Love

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette is AMAZING! It's the perfect balance of floral and fruity, with a touch of sweetness that's not overpowering. I get so many compliments when I wear it. Definitely my new signature scent!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I have a good memory of Gucci Guilty 2010.
The pyramid of this and 2010 are almost identical on fragrantica, but I can tell 2021 is definitely different thing.

2021 jasmine is much much prominent than 2010. Initial spray of 2021 definitely reminds me of 2010 but just 2mins later it’s turn to the cheap mass-appealing scent… longevity and sillage are good as cloying for some even as EDT.

I personally felt this disrespected the original Guilty 2010.
Honestly I am disappointed and I miss the juicy peach and soft lilac’s perfect balance of 2010…

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
This smells like what I thought Chanel No. 5 would smell like after learning it was Marilyn Monroe's bedtime scent. Then I smelled Chanel No. 5 and it was something else entirely, but never mind that.
Guilty eau de toilette smells like a glamorous 50s starlet on her days off, when she doesn't want to be bothered. She puts on beige striped pajamas and her glasses and curls up with a book. The scent is unobtrusive, feminine and soothing.
It's a very perfume-y perfume, in that it smells like more like a smooth, musky floral blend than one identifiable scent. That being said, the peach and lilac are prominent enough to ease this into a vintage-like territory.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Amber, raspberry, and musk stand out the most. Doesn’t evolve much. It is okay. I’ve always had an infinity to Gucci Guilty, so I like it. Inoffensive. Office safe. Moderate longevity and sillage.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I like this a lot. Idk why but I detect a little bit of a sweet pea note? It’s slightly powdery but overall it smells like a clean baby. I’ll have to wear it more. Veryyyyy different from the edp to me. Less sweet and lighter.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Much prefer this one over the EDP. This EDT is fresh and light; it smells powdery and peachy.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I am usually into lighter florals (Chloe EDP, l'Eau, Rose Naturelle) - Gucci Guilty EDT is my evening perfume. Whenever I wear it, I feel like an adult woman - the kind who makes her own money, knows the etiquette, can flirt with refinement and leaves the event before the after-party to go home to her husband. It is a classy and sexy confidence booster without being attention-seeking.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This is going to sound weird, but this reminds me insanely of what all of the perfumes in the fashion magazines of the early 2000's smelled like, but in a good way. I really like the men's version of Guilty so I had a feeling this would be just as nice. This reminds me of a department store. Sharp mandarin and raspberry, and then there starts to be a mish mash of a lot of different things going on as it dries down. The sharp fruit sticks around, then I smell the lilac and grassy patchouli. I seem to smell everything but the vanilla. This is very weird because I scrolled down just now through the comments and someone said EXACTLY what I envision when I smell this. I'm glad I'm not the only one that pictures the perfume counter at JC Penney and the perfume samples in Cosmo. I really want to try the original version. It gets softer and sweeter the more it dries down.10 minutes later and it isn't hardly there anymore. Well blended, but not worth the price tag to me for a skin scent. If you prefer something soft and inoffensive, this would be that girl. Office friendly.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: The lilac is more forward in this newer version. Feels a bit more focused on the floral and fresh aspects. I suppose it is a watered down version of the original, but the original never worked well on my skin. I LOVE the way it smells, but on me it turns a little BO-ish. This version doesn't, so I'll take it. I love this DNA so much. Feels like me!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: A generic, musky fruity floral. This smells like the department store perfume aisle. It is pretty and elegant, and reminds me of the samplers that they used to have in magazines. The peach is lovely and pairs well with the patchouly, but I don’t find it very memorable. But it really is pretty!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Softly spicy and a more classy kind of fruity than is usually in mainstream frags. Feminine but could also be pretty male-friendly IMO. All of the notes are really well blended and harmonious. I am finding I like a lot of frags with geranium and blackcurrant and I personally get the blackcurrant and raspberry a little more than the peach, on my skin. No harsh alcohol scent on this even at first spray. Not much projection. I don't think this is baby powder-y at all but more of a soft amber.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Men love this!!! Unique powdery peach violet floral <3

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: The pachouli in this is VERY well done. Much better than Mon Paris or Flowerbomb in my opinion. Like others have said: smells expensive. The fruits and amber are alllmost on the edge of being too “mall perfume-y” but it clears it on the dry down. It’s excellent and I think it’s perfect for the office, especially for meetings when you have to be a bad boss babe.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
Such an amazing blend of notes!
I am stunned by this high quality, uplifting and optimistic parfume.

Took me by surprise, since it is a designer not expensive parfume.

It became my number one scent, and it has the "it" factor when compared to the EDP.

Significantly better than many niche expensive offerings out there.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I owned the original edp but I only got the travel spray to test it out before I committed to a bottle. I loved it but never purchased a full size, for some reason.

Anyway, fast-forward to today and I got a 30 mL from Marshall's. It smells so good and similar to the edp just lighter and it doesn't last as long. But it is so good, they don't make fragrances like this anymore.
I get a lot of baby powder fresh lilac, with a bright opening and a hint of the pink peppers, but not all that spicy, and a sexy amber-y musk at the base.

It essentially smells like a grown up, sexy and sophisticated baby powder, perfect for any time of the day and season. I honestly wish it lasted longer but it's really good if you're into fresh scents and powdery scents.

Lastly, I wish they still made them all in the older, all gold bottle. But this one is ok but the top is a little too tight.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: A very beautiful but very subtle fragrance. I had a tiny 30 or 50 ml bottle of this given to me as a gift many years ago and have wanted to buy it again ever since but it’s so over priced. I can’t justify paying the cost. As lovely as it is it’s extremely subtle and suitable for work or when you’re sharing a car or enclosed space, being intimately close to someone, etc but it’s not going to get you noticed in a crowd. I’d buy a cheap copy before I paid more than £40/£50 for this.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This is the epitome of what I consider a grandma perfume. It’s the patchouli and lilac mix I think. Heavy musk note. A very light fruit note hidden in there. If you use baby powder you’ll get the exact same scent for less. Idk why anyone would buy this outside of wanting the label. When I think elegant I think unique or something you would want to be, and this is the opposite of that.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Smelled this at ULTA today. Another really powdery, perfume-y smell… but i REALLY like it. Much better than the original guilty, honestly. Soft lilac with a touch of peppery, musky peach… I’m starting to realize peach might be a favorite note of mine, as I always enjoy fragrances where it makes an appearance… really nice. Very feminine, and soft.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
The EDT smells so much better than the original. I love this one, I feel like it can be worn in cooler and warmer temps. I worn this to work and this can definitely be a safe workplace fragrance, I received a compliment. It is light so you can overspray yet i can still smell myself. I am now reaching the 6 hour mark and I detect the scent.

I will buy this over the EDP any day.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
The first thing I want to say about this is that it smells expensive. This is the fragrance to wear if you want to smell and feel like you're wealthy.

Expertly blended. There's no particular scent note that dominates this.

I notice the pink pepper but it doesn't burn my nose, it's subtle. The mandarin orange brings a clean and slightly aquatic vibe to the top notes. I sense the lilac and geranium, some blackcurrant too. This scent doesn't change much between the different phases.

You don't have to spray a lot for good results.

Good for basically any occasion and signature scent worthy

Classy and suits a grown woman.

I have the matching lotion too. I put one spray of this on my other arm with nothing on it and a spray on my other arm with the lotion first and the lotion does make the scent stronger and last twice as long but even without any lotion it still lasts about 5 hours before it starts to fade away and the projection's good without it too.

the sleek gold bottle fits this fragrance well.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Jezebel said it perfectly. This is elegant, somehow ethereal and expensive smelling. It’s a very perfumey perfume which I love, brings to mind scents of a bygone era but it’s in no way old fashioned. Suitable for any time or occasion for sure. I received a sample of the edp and loved it but only had enough loyalty points to buy the edt so after reading all the reviews for both, I took a chance and blind bought the edt. Zero regrets, love at first sniff. I prefer this to the edp as the addition of the raspberry and the vanilla notes are really noticeable giving it even more appeal for me as they’re favourites of mine. For an edt I’m impressed with the longevity. Sillage isn’t huge but I can smell it easily so I’m happy! I can’t say if it resembles the original as that passed me by sadly.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This is absolutely pretty, delicate and elegant, and smells expensive . If this perfume would be an object it would be a light beige finest silk scarf. The bottle is not what I usually go for, but is gorgeous. It's suitable for all occasions and seasons. It is both low key sexy and completely elegant and proper. It's slightly powdery but the fruit notes keep it from smelling dry powdery. The main note I detect is the lilac, but it doesn't overpower the perfume.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Official carded sample lists only Mandarin, Lilac, Patchouli as the notes. Testing out today as I was in the mood for a lilac fragrance - but this is mainly a fruit-chouli and the lilac takes a backseat to the orange. It’s pleasant! Reminds me of being a teenager; also of Flowerbomb even though the notes are different, they share the same vibe.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I've been an a journey with this one. I cannot smell this on paper, which in some ways intrigued me because I was looking for a super light, everyday scent. I really went back and forth but decided I had to have it. In cooler weather, the musk turned dirty on me and after the opening, I didn't like it at all. I almost got rid of it. I'm wearing it today in warmer, more humid weather and it's so much better. Almost 8 hours in and I can still smell the light, lilacy musk with the smallest touch of vanilla. Not dirty at all.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I’ve been missing the OG Guilty lately and got my hands on samples of the new EDT and EDP.
Long story short, if you loved the OG Guilty definitely get this one instead of the EDP, that one is entirely different and not as fresh and sparkling. The new bottle is gorgeous as well.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
Fruitchouli.
Moldy fruit.
This was not made for me.

Review of official carded spray sample that came free with purchase.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: smells lovely, quite feminine but with a bit of edge. sophisticated but fun and youthful at the same time, which I love! not too strong but the sillage and longevity on skin are still quite good. I usually dislike jasmine in perfumes but here it's very subtle and fits to the mix. this kind of reminds me of Hugo Boss The Scent For Her but this is has more edge - must be the pink pepper!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
It’s a very Powdery !!! mandarin scent…. I think of a pretty women’s boutique, whenever I smell this. I’m seriously thinking of getting this for an everyday scent, or a cute intimate date night scent
I could even see this being great for work

* update: May-14- 23
I ended up getting this for Mother’s Day ❤️ 🎉

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: As someone said, this is VERY close to the original Gucci Guilty and my beloved OG Gucci Guilty Intense. It is about 97% and I am soooooo thrilled as the OG was a masterpiece and discontinued and impossible to find similar sexy lilac frag, lilac gets a bad rap these days it seems and can be very old fashioned if not blended well but this is STUNNING and so close to the original and intense which i've gone through 4 bottles of! Thank god they made this cuz all the other reissues smell nothing like the classic I almost gave up! I'd say it's slightly lighter and a bit fruitier, lending it a touch more sweetness but several side by side comparisons with Gucci Guilty Intense had me buy a bottle immediately as they are NEARLY IDENTICAL THANK YOU GOD!!! The new bottle is not as cool as the original and I feel its a bit top heavy and scares me it may tip but the juice is incredible and will have you GUILTY OF SMELLING DELICIOUS. This is a lilac with secrets. An extremely warm and a little spicy purple flower. It used to smell like the color lavender to me (not the flower) but now i get more of a black and it's hot and sexy in the most subtle unexpected way. Not your normal sexy sweet gourmand it's a sexy floral IMO. I've never smelled anything like this and its been my signature scent since the day I met the Intense flanker in 2017. I do not like powder or playdoh but I can sometimes pick those up but for some reason it just works and i find this to be utterly intoxicating and my most complimented fragrance. It does smell expensive and I'd say not for the teens. I wear it day or night hot or cold and will be buried in this scent.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I adore this fragrance! I didn't know what to expect and the only frame of reference I had was that I love Gucci Bamboo and Gucci Flora Gorgeous Gardenia EDT (the pink hex bottle that is discontinued). So I hoped I would enjoy this...and I was right! On my skin the opening is all lilac and peach. It's subtle and very pretty. The musk and amber come out within the first thirty minutes. This scent is truly so lovely. I went a little heavy on the spraying. I have a large sample and I sprayed 3 times on each arm and once on my hair, but I work alone in an office so don't worry about anyone around me being offended. I think that's a good amount to spray because the scent is not overwhelming, it's the perfect amount to really get a sense of how Gucci Guilty EDT smells. I kind of wish the lilac projected more. I think I would consider buying this on a discount, although I want to see how long this lasts on my skin.

This scent would be gorgeous during the winter-to-spring transition. It's safe for the office or running errands/casual events.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This is the most delicious perfume I’ve ever purchased. Best blind buy ever

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Not at all what I normally gravitate towards. I usually go for musky, spicy scent. But this is gorgeous! I get that pink pepper and some peachiness right away. Then the lilacs come in, and they radiate such beauty! Definitely a soft musky drydown, a bit powdery, but not simple or overly vanillic. This is sort of sweet, which surprises me that I like it; it's not a gentle floral, but very feminine. I wore it all summer, and wondered what it might be like in the cold weather. I put it on today (it's 12 deg F here), and Gucci Guilty edt is still lovely! I have a rollerball, but will certainly purchase a FB!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This is very pretty. Smells like a powdery makeup smell. This actually smells exactly like a body mist i have from ted baker I purchased years ago. A very light slightly sweet powdery smell. Gorgeous and sophisticated would be the best way to describe it, but unfortunately because of the poor longevity and poor sillage I don’t think I would buy a full bottle of this. I think I’ll stick to my ted baker body mist (in case anyone was wondering it’s the light mint color bottle and has iris in it)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: A like or a love! This is a surprise to me because I initially didn't like the Gucci Guilty range (way back when it was in the gold bottle) and thought it smelled weird. But I took some time to let it dry down and started to get addicted. Slightly sweet and surprisingly great for summer days in the A/C. The star of the show is the dry, slightly powdery amber. It's not as sweet and full bodied as my Ambra del Nepal, but that final drydown is reminiscent of it. I find GG EDT 2021 so elegant as it dries down to the base. I used to like the 90s Calgon (?) Lilac body spray a lot, but GG EDT 2021 is not that. The fruits here seem nonexistent to me, as this is blended well and not a "fruity" fragrance. I don't consider this to have a strong patchouli either. The most prominent notes are easily amber, lilac, and geranium for me, but again it is smooth and something easily worn for the warmer months. I spray liberally, and maybe went through a tenth of my 30 mL this month. GG EDT is a soft, pretty fragrance appropriate for anytime during the day: office, picnic, etc. I tried the EDP in store (2019) and liked something about it, but the base notes were quite masculine. The EDT is lighter, more ethereal, and sophisticated.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This is an easy reach, office-safe everyday fragrance. Just wish it lasted longer on skin.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
Ooh, lovely. I'm not 100% sure if this is the version my sample is of, but I'm just going to guess it is. I remember when Gucci Guilty first came out my friend and I were so confused because nothing about it smelled guilty to our noses. I'm not sure if the scent has changed or I have changed, but I can sense the fruity soft sexiness of this perfume now. It's very sexy in a gentle way. I get a lot of peach and amber, but it's not sticky sweet like some peach ambers, more tart - lilac and musk bring a beautiful floral powderiness to this scent. Sultry but demure. I just picked up the intense version, and although they don't share the same notes, I do smell the link - the fruity, musky, stone-fruit link.

P.S. There is a baby lotion waft to this one, so beware if that's not your thing. Also, in the drydown it starts resembling Michael Kor's Sexy Ruby - they have that same fruity "sexy woman" smell.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Love at first sniff. Delicious & expensive smelling for a great price. Very fresh yet I smell some creaminess too. I love it!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
SIGNATURE!!!

-an angel smell with an edge-

👍wearable in every situation
👍but still unique
👍with recognition factor
👍all seasons appropiate
👍compliment getter - without even trying
👍floral with a kick
👍elegant yet sassy
👍practical bottle design
👍very good longevity (especially for EdT!)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: This gives me baby lotion vibes. It's not unpleasant, but I am not into this scent. I'm getting peach, powder, vanilla. It's soft and sweet. Given the association I'm having with baby products, it just doesn't smell like the sophisticated woman scent I'm going for.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: my grandmother’s best friend owned a flower shop when i was young. i used to go there every easter and this perfume is the closest i have gotten to replicating that scent. so gorgeous and natural 💕

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I absolutely love this! I do own Gucci Guilty, the original first one that was released in 2010 & they smell pretty much the same to me? I don’t see the difference. Just different packaging? I would consider this an evening, special occasion, fancy scent. I can’t smell any of the notes listed, it’s not even floral to me. I would say it’s soft spicy, musky & powdery. Definitely for the confident individual & sexy.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: i really love this fragrance, its complex but not headache inducing. kind of smells like baby powder and flowers but with a hint of something spicy ? (which might not sound Good but trust me it is.) the only complaint i have is that it doesnt last very long on my skin. :/ i love spraying it on my clothes though, its a good 'idk what to wear' perfume, i feel like it can suit any season and occasion. very safe. i like it alot, 4/5 just bc of longetivity.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I bought this one for my daughter and I loved it on her. Smells classy, feminine, expensive. Its not an offensive fragrance, so it could work for business or something professional.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I was shocked that I liked this one. I really do not care for Gucci Guilty but this one the Guilty Eau de Toilette smells lovely. It is a very feminine and sophisticated scent. It smells expensive, sexy, and classy.
I love that is softly sweet and a little powdery.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Interesting scent. The lilac makes it stand out a bit from the usual mainstream soft florals. The powderiness gives it a slight vintage feel.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I have a lot of perfumes, and I know the original came out around 10 years ago, and I have to say the new EDT is one of the best perfumes of the last 10 years, and I am kicking myself waiting this long to get it, the only other Gucci Guilty I have had in Gucci Guilty EAU that I bought in 2016, but I don't have that anymore, but to me this is similar to that, but this new EDT is even better. I think if you aren't a perfume collector, and only like to have so many perfumes, this should be one of them hands down. This perfume is very romantic to me, and very Spring like, but that doesn't matter to me, I will wear this all year round. This perfume is a must have for me. I love how all the notes in this mix so well together, it's so nice and smooth, I get the lilac the most, I smell a slight powdery peach, white musk, and just a slight touch of amber and patchouli. Wow this is just mesmerizing. I have to suggest this to all the men reading this, and their Girlfriend, or Wife doesn't have this perfume get this for them for Christmas this year, Macy's among other department stores, have Gucci Guilty gift sets, in EDT, and EDP. Don't sleep on this perfume.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Compared to the OG edt, this one is smoother but slightly lighter. A bit less patchouli and pepper, a bit more rounded. The opening is juicier but the drydown is a tiny bit less intense than the OG. But still extremely similar.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I LOVE this scent. It makes me feel rich and sexy. I've only had it a few days and I'm contemplating buying a back up bottle because I know I will go through this bottle fairly quickly. The reason for that is the longevity is pretty much trash. I can get a solid 2 hours out of this then I have to reapply. If you are looking for a long lasting 12+ hour fragrance that projects this isn't the one for you. But if you want a soft, powdery, floral scent that smells rich, this is for you. This is like the only perfume I will still support with no lasting power. I just love the scent.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
I really like this fragrance, which is a total surprise. I never expected to like lilac in a fragrance. I always loved fresh lilacs as a child, but my experience with it as a fragrance note, was in soaps and strong scented candles, at my grandmother's house. Not really something I want to smell like.

However, this is really beautiful.. fresh orange, pretty lilac, sweet peach, black currant... all of these notes together are heavenly.

But, this fragrance is too light for me. I like a STRONG perfume. I want the neighbors to smell me when I am at home, and I like to have a personal scent aura when I am at work. Otherwise my day is dull, bleak, and unbearable.

It does have some projection, but it's mostly the lilac, and it's light. I only smell the other notes nose to skin. For someone who likes a pretty skin scent, I recommend you try this one.

For me, I am intrigued enough to try the EDP.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: Nothing in particular. Really boring. :/

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: The warmer sister of Gucci Bloom's intense bouquet. It's dialed back on the bouquet, dialed up on the vanilla, amber, and musk. I would say 75/25 floral/warm. I'll wear it in the fall a lot!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I didn’t think I would enjoy this based on the notes listed and I had no intention of trying it, but I got a sample so I gave it a go. It’s lovely. Warm, floral, fruity, and romantic with some freshness to it. I hate patchouli and pink pepper and this is the first fragrance with those notes that I enjoy. I don’t detect them (or they are so well blended they don’t screech at me like they normally do). If you normally steer clear of those notes don’t let that stop you from trying this one. I have never tried the EDP so I can’t say how it compares.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content: I haven't ever smelled the original EDT, and it's been a while since I smelled the original EDP so I'm coming to all of this with a fresh nose. This fragrance to me really took me by surprise. I don't usually love powdery scents, but this is so soft and inviting. Very fresh at first, but it become this lovely, comforting, soft cloud. I'm not a fan of sweet scents unless there's something tart to balance it, but this is just soft and every so slightly sweetened by the peach and blackcurrant. I'm not a huge fan of patchouli these days, and thankfully I don't get much of it here. I have not been able to wear any other fragrances since I purchased this a week ago. Just gorgeous!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette Gucci
review_content:
If anyone has been wondering about potential differences between this one and the discontinued Gucci Guilty EdT, I can say that the two are basically identical. They have just put the old EdT into a new bottle. Perhaps some details have been altered, but they are not detectable without direct comparison. Overall it smells like the good ol’ Guilty EdT! :)
What I love about Guilty is its versatility - it just fits any occasion, so it makes a great signature scent. It’s not a bold fragrance, but rather simply pretty. Yet, Guilty is still unique and recognizable due to the lilac as its main note, which is rarely found in other designer perfumes. I would sum the scent up as a musky lilac with hints of fruit.
This is not for me. BUT, it is beautifully atmospheric and dark. This scent is evocative of a walk on a cool October evening just as the sun is about to completely wink out. This is art.
Absolutely gorgeous scent! It kinda has a leather tinge to it but overall it does just what the name suggests and teleports you on a midnight stroll through mossy rich woods next to a mansion.

Perfection, but I'm never going to pay that price for it. I love Mr. Morillas and this perfume is a dream. I purchased a sample because I was tired of imagining how much I'd enjoy it. A true unisex fragrance in that it is so solidly the smell of those natural materials, and is an atmosphere more than a persona. Beautiful.

This is a smoke show. Undeniably cade is the central element here. A wonderful scent if you're into the dark stuff. It's hard to find good times to wear it other than being dressed up. It's also strong so you have to be mentally prepared for it.
ADDICTING! Never heard of cade oil--now i'm gonna look for it. Not a simple frag takes a bit of time to unravel. A true masterpeice.

Was expecting it to be way more dark and camp firey, not at all. That *Alchemyst's Garden generous atomizer. Sprayed two long puffs and none of the three notes, Incense, Cade oil and Cypress are overpowering, this is just perfectly done. Fairytale like too. Top three, up there with Elysium and Teronni for me, probably the best 2023 perfume purchase r there.

Salami? BMX tires??? LOL I love this place.

So far the hands down best thing about "The Alchemist's Garden" is the names. They are all just a little bit sinister or foreboding, though the black bottles really nailed the concept, not just the name. This one is no exception. If you have any business strolling around this particular place at midnight, you better be ready to defend yourself in a witch trial. Good luck!

Zoologist T-Rex? Anyone? I must be the only one. This opens up with a TON of barbeque, like you got all your wood chips smoking and failed to make any flames. That subsides pretty quickly, though, and you're left with very sweet woodiness, not too aggressive, very nice, I attribute that to the cypress. Cypress never really ends in woody monstrosity like other woods. I don't feel like all the votes for oud-centric things are correct... TF Black Lacquer is dead last in votes but I'd put that way closer to the top. I would also call this unisex, even though it seems only guys are in here testing and reviewing.

Store Test Short Review:
A very lovely simple smoky scent, has a subtle woody green tree-like base. Unfortunately dries down into a more boring typical synthetic western incense.

Performs well compared to the others.
Smells like my old BMX tires.
The name is perfect and captures the mood and vibe of the fragrance, we are definitely strolling through the woods though. A dark incense perfect for solitary night time contemplation and relaxation.

Originally intended by Gucci to be layered with other fragrances, this one can also stand alone.

However... I've layered this with several other perfumes and have found the results to be incredible!

Fragrances that I've layered with this are:

Quir De Russie, L.T. Piver

Ameer Al Oud

Obsession For Men

Chopard

Amouage Jubilation XXV

And believe it or not, Avon's Black Suede.

It's worked BEAUTIFULLY with each... And each has either brought out hidden qualities in the scent, or it's magnified certain aspects of the fragrances that I've mentioned.

I can't wait to get my hands on Voice Of The Snake now!

Smells like my garden, but with a nice pleasant smoke scent, reminds me of the smell from burning garden waste brush wood on the bonfire. Tested on skin and cloth and got different notes. Skin: rosemary / sage opening, which then gave way to the lovely evergreen tree and smoke notes. Cloth: evergreen tree and smoke opening, oddly sweet middle note, dry-down was complex with evergreen, smoke, sweet, and rosemary/sage/palo santo smoke. If I didn't pick up the rosemary at all on the cloth I'd think it was just my skin but it's definitely there-- not rosemary EO, that's a completely different scent, this is rosemary fresh from cutting, with the sap all over my hands. Definitely smells like my garden, even kind of smells like the extracts of my garden fragrance I've made in my kitchen.

It's funny how so many people say it reminds them of witches, because, well... Yes, I do like it. And I do think it would be excellent to wear while setting up my Halloween bonfire next week. I'll probably wear it other times too. It's always witchy around here because well...

Very strange smell that is supposed to be simple. I smell an old leather bag, smocked salami, a muscle rub, a burning pine tree. It is not entirely unpleasant, but definitely not something I want to smell like.

Look, i can understand anyone not liking this. It is not a safe blind buy. That is what is fabulous about this, its so dark and different.
Goth as hell. Reminds me of a late night forest party with a bonfire and cloaked witches casting spells.
Not sure if i have the guts to wear this out in public.

A Midnight Stroll isn't as morbid as you may have been lead to believe. Yes it's leathery, smoky, and all of those things you'd expect given the black, lacquered bottle, but there's a spectral sweetness keeping the evil at bay. It is possible for a scent to be simultaneously Halloween appropriate, and wearable. A Midnight Stroll pulls this off well, and it's quite addictive.

While projection and longevity seem light on the surface, I got a much better interpretation after smelling this on a friend. It projects without blasting the room. And that's great, because you really don't want something this Gothic to be loud and brash. Those in the camp of "fragrances should be discovered not announced" will be pleased. It drifts off the skin here and there, making it's presence known without throwing haymakers.

Given the notes, I'm not really sure where the aforementioned sweetness is coming from, though I assume it's the incense. While very different, it's perhaps in the realm of Comme des Garcons Zagorsk or Kyoto. Think heavy incense with remnants of vanilla or berries. That being said, I'm gonna file A Midnight Stroll in the Autumn and Winter only cabinet. It may have seasonal limitations, but that's also why it will last you for years. 9/10.

Originally got this and it was very, very smokey, to the point of not being able to perceive any other notes. After mellowing for a while, the smoke definitely settles a little and moves out of the way for other notes to be "heard".

This one is fairly linear, the opening brings equal parts smoke, incense, and camphor, right from the get-go, while the same chord is played all throughout, the base (bass, heh) fir-needle note, becomes more and more prominent, as the smoke gently fades into a soft, mellow tone. The fragrance is very, very dry (not sweet) and extremely smooth and elegant.

As for how beautiful this scent is? Maximum points. It's addictive, rich and almost intoxicating. When I wore this I felt like I was wearing something sexy, and mysterious. It *screams* autumn. It also just *smells* expensive and like very fine perfumery to me.

Unfortunately, this scent also falls into the category of things that I think smell fantastic, but have very restricted wearability. The total lack of sweetness, and strong smokiness make it very much a limited-context sort of frag. It is also too linear and one-dimensional for my liking. I wish there was more to it; more going on. For the price, I don't think it's too much to ask. But I get it, for what it is - it's unquestionably great. For my personal tastes though, I like something dynamic and complex; again, especially with this price tag.

Conclusion: Fine perfumery, intoxicating, addictive scent, definitely will wear it at times throughout this time of the year, but wish there was more going on in this bottle o' juice. Scent is 9.5/10. Over all 8.5/10.
Pretty similar to Noir Anthracite by Tom Ford
Have a sample of this just get Maison Alhambra The Trail, for incense lover i love it

Holy shit, you fragrance-huffing lunatics, strap in for a wild fucking ride through the demented nostrils of whoever cooked up this "A Midnight Stroll" madness. Gucci, in their infinite wisdom or batshit insanity, has somehow managed to bottle the essence of a midnight bender in Transylvania.

Let's cut through the bullshit, shall we? This isn't your typical eau de whatever-the-fuck. No, no. This is what happens when a coven of witches decides to open an upscale head shop in the seventh circle of Hell.

The incense hits you first, like a face full of smoke from a burning church. It's downright ecclesiastical, I tell you, as if some defrocked priest decided to hotbox the confessional. But wait, there's more, you degenerates!

Just when you think you've got a handle on this olfactory circus, the cade oil saunters in like a leather-daddy at a Mormon picnic. It's smoky, it's raw, it's the kind of scent that makes you want to howl at the moon and sacrifice a small rodent to the gods of hedonism.

And then, like some cosmic joke, the cypress shows up fashionably late to the party. It's as fresh as a midnight skinny dip in a forest lake, assuming that lake is swarming with the ghosts of lumberjacks past.

The real kicker? They put this unholy concoction in a bottle that looks like it was designed by Edgar Allan Poe on a morphine binge. Black as a raven's heart, with a jaguar slapped on it because apparently, we're all secretly furries now.

In conclusion, "A Midnight Stroll" is the olfactory equivalent of dancing naked around a bonfire while the bastard children of William S. Burroughs and Aleister Crowley take turns reading the Necronomicon backwards. It's not a fragrance, it's a fucking spiritual crisis in a bottle.
This one is magical. This is what I want to smell like for the rest of my life.

A straight up cough medicine opening. Drying down it smells like patchouli with extra smokiness, a juniper note, and a woody base. Smells niche! An interesting fall fragrance that isn't for everyone. I like it, but I know my girlfriend wouldn't. Thankful the duty free in BKK had a tester of this.

smells like leather cowboy boots with a hint of dark musky aura, i don’t know who would want to wear this unless they own a motorcycle, are into BDSM, or are a dominatrix!! more mature/masculine leaning
Beautiful, not as scary as some describe it here. Yes, it is close to D&G Velvet Desert Oud. Love it.
It’s very different and somehow I loving it. I think it would be great for layering. Definitely cold weather perfume. Would be great for outdoors. Very mysterious scent.
Death breath after vampire sex.

This fragrance is exceptionally graceful and harmoniously blended, presenting itself as a gentler rendition of "Attaquer le Soleil Marquis de Sade" by Etat Libre d'Orange. To my nose, both fragrances share a similar essence, yet the latter carries a more intense scent signature.

However, there is something else about A Midnight Stroll that makes it even more appealing to me—perhaps it's the smoothness or the way it evokes the magic of a blooming night flower, even though no such flower smells like this. I often find myself reaching for it as a substitute for burning incense bakhoor, which further highlights its unique and dark quality.

I bought the dupe of this - Maison Alhambra The Trail, but it's not in this database for some reason, even though it's available everywhere for a long time alteady...please fragrantica, update your database, this is getting really lame !!!
If By the Fireplace is kindergarden, this is the PhD. Outstanding in every way, shape and form. Baba Yaga at the Met Gala.

Dark, gothic and mysterious.
Perfect for halloween.
This is smoky and spicy, really bold and loud.
Smells like a dusty shelf of books in an old library.
10/10

I appreciate this one, especially for the autumn months. It will transport you to the darkness of fall time and remind you of autumn bonfires.


Side note:

This is in the same vein as "A City On Fire" from Imaginary Authors in the opening and "Fille en Aiguilles" by Serge Lutens in the dry down. Both are excellent fragrances and I can't get enough of this scent, but I could never justify spending $300 for it.

<<< This is a review of Maison Alhambra The Trail, a clone of Gucci A Midnight Stroll. Posting it here since it doesn't have its own page. The previous one was somehow hidden by the administration (?) without any downvotes. What is your point in doing that? You don't even update the database frequently enough so I could put that review in a proper place. >>>

Maison Alhambra The Trail is a sensorial journey that veers into the realm of the esoteric, bearing an air of elegance that could easily be mislabeled as otherworldly. When sprayed, imagine standing at the edge of an enchanted forest at midnight — a forest laced with smoke, saffron, a touch of gourmand peppery allure, and underpinned by a harmony of medicinal dry oud and leather. There's no barnyard oud here; it's all sophistication, as if the woods were dressed in a tuxedo.

This fragrance embraces you with its addictive opening that might remind you of a forgotten antique shop selling vintage tobacco products — curious, but utterly captivating. Its character is deep, mysterious, and irresistibly sexy.

However, it doesn't take you on multiple twists and turns; its charm lies in its consistency. From its luscious start to its more muted end, it holds its olfactory notes close, slowly fading into a scent reminiscent of ancient sacral rituals. It's consistent, though. It may have a short-lived presence, leaving you in just a few hours, its longevity resides around 2 hours, which then turns to a skin scent, but it leaves an indelible impression. For something so one-dimensional, it makes that dimension incredibly seductive.

In summary, The Trail by Maison Alhambra is a beguiling experience that casts a spell you'll be reluctant to break. Though it doesn't evolve dramatically over its short lifespan, it doesn't need to — the opening alone is a masterclass in perfumery.

With this bottle being so cheap, it's an intimate secret you might be tempted to keep all to yourself.

Opening note: 9+
Sillage/Projection: 3-
Dry down: 5
Longevity: 2
Blend/Composition: 8-
Versatility: 4
Uniqueness: 9
Value for money: 6
Bottle design/Aesthetics: 8+
Overall experience: 6+
Blind-buy rating: 1+

smells like a death-themed tattoo shop i've been to recently! a scary scent indeed...perfect for halloween. i feel like i'm in the woods where bad things are happening. i like the smokiness of this but i find it very hard to pull off

I can't understand why I'm smelling a tropical, banana or champaca note in this. At first sniff it reminded me to 1805 Tonnerre plus this banana / champaca. Now wearing them side by side all I get from this is the banana, the contrast between the two scents is much sharper. Pity, it won't be a replacement for the sea battle scent. Where did the smoke go?
Like somebody built a campfire using resinous pine logs instead of regular wood. Smokey, intense and no other notes recognizable.
Smells like you moved into a house where a shoe polisher had his workstation for 45 years, in a good but eerie way.

Cypress woods wrapped in tarred and rubbery leather and set aflame. The smoke lingers with some of the other scents in the air (there's a noticeable rose note that doesn't seem to be listed), and permeates everywhere.
Cold weather only, there's just no other season to wear this.
Would work as a great base to experiment with other scents.

very smoky, woody and long lasting and @whitfieldkimberlyd, absolutley i also get bacon/sausage vibes :)
but no vicks vapor!!
I belive it is more off a "layerying" scent.
Smoky Vicks Vapor Rub that turns into bacon/sausage????

This is amazing! To me it sounds like a smoky rose (tho it's not listed on the pyramid)
But important remark is that... smoky rose will delight your nose not at once..
Not at once at all :D
Because... at fist sniff it smells like... no, those who write about some churches, no,
actually this smells exactly like something being burnt out in some village, at some fireside
Therefore the very first notes may be really overwhelming and way resine, even repulsive
But those who wait would be blessed so much! With that delightful gorgeous rose starting
to open from the heart of the composition and it still lasts for a few hours on my skin!
I love it!

One of my favorite incense scents, I find this much more full-bodied and hearty than most of the others, which can lean a little churchy, dry and whispy. Tar like, astringent, smokey and intensely green too. Amazingly I sense something creamy and "rounded" in here too, which works well among all the harsh and intense smoke and acidic green. No idea what it could be. Imagine a bit of cold cream in the midst of deep forest air and woodsmoke. Extremely linear, you get what you get in the first five minutes. The name is appropriate too, it really evokes a late-night little walk, perhaps back from a party, or after a big dinner, when you have a couple drinks in you and take big lungfulls of the cool night air, admiring the lights and shadows of the night with your companions, while looking forward to the warmth of home.

I think what peeps forget is this line is for layering and creating your perfect scent which will be perfect for add ons
Make it yours ;)

This is being outside a church on a cold night, probably a Catholic one after Christmas Eve mass. The burnt rubber tire in a castle is a fair comparison. It could go either way. It's also a bit astringent.

Dark. Deep and dark leathery wood. The opening was overwhelmingly burnt rubber, acrid dusky incense laden burnt rubber. The Cypress and Cade oil were really overpowering, like being smeared in liquid wood. Then the leathery incense floats to the top. One friend said 'like an old school pub with leather seats, that people used to smoke in' I'm not sure what type of man would wear this but I'd like to meet him!

I had to remove my original review because I realized what I had wasn't authentic. So now for the authentic one...
It smells weirdly interesting. Someone described it as emerging at the dawn from the woods after a night of rituals and it's very nicely said. It's extremely woody aromatic with incense and balsamic notes. It's quite enjoyable. It gets a lot better on dry-down. Not sure in what occasion you can pull this off and it's one of those perfumes that whoever likes it would answer "I don't care".
It's definitely a niche quality perfume with no boundaries. Also very masculine. Don't think it would be easy for any ladies to pull this off; but, again if you like it, probably you won't care.
Although I really like this, but I can't justify its price tag. For The Voice of The Snake I can but not this as it's not an easy perfume to wear.

For its "simplicity", as only having three notes, it is paradoxically quite complex. A Midnight Stroll definitely fits the pyramid note.
The incense is dry and smoky, while the cade oil sometimes gives a low but pleasant "leathery" vibe, resting on a background of green, dry and earthy notes of cypress.. Very elegant, intense and dark, as if you were walking through a forest at night.
Good longevity, moderate sillage. Very original and exquisitely executed. Great bottle too.

Good fragrance that lasts long. Strong notes of incense and cedar, super masculine in my opinion. Not my personal preference for a fragrance since i like super feminine fragrance but i can appreciate this

Really nice fragrance for lovers of incense and/or marine notes. That's right, marine notes.

Opening is very smokey, not like BBQ grill (what i get from AdP Leather), but a pleasant airy smoke/peat, akin to an islay scotch. As it dries down the smoke disperses/diffuses and becomes lighter, more of the green cypress comes out to play, and perhaps the cade? I honestly don't know what cade smells like. The image above looks the same as juniper, which to me seems to blend with the cypress to greate a green/herbaceous accord.

Drydown stays peaty and airy, which recalls sel marin to my nose, maybe more brine/peat putting it closer to oud minerale from TF. The same feeling gets evoked, but in this it's smoother and better blended, and slightly more dense than sel marin too.

I think it's a great colder-weather alternative to sel marin or oud minerale, and for people who like those 2 I think they'll love this too.

This is a very unique and beautiful incensey perfume. The smokiness in the open doesn’t last long and then it becomes very bright and “clean”. It’s very powerful and after an hour or so, I feel suffocated by it. I love the smell, but I can’t describe the note in it that becomes problematic for me. Maybe it’s ambroxan or another synthetic ambergris note. But there’s something that lingers beneath the overall composition that bothers me when I’m wearing it. It’s very thick. I wouldn’t let that deter you from giving this a try as most ppl aren’t bothered by ambroxan. Extremely unique and I understand the “mysterious” descriptions that ppl have said about it. Glad to have it in my collection.
burnt rubber tire in a castle hallway

Immediate church incense that is soon overtaken by the green of the cypress. Then the tar-like smell of the Cade Oil appears. These three main accords actually work very well together, harmoniously, each one appearing and reappearing throughout the journey. So it is not a pure incense fragrance, as the green forest vibe of the cypress and the cade are also prominent. The incense is calming, the cypress is more refreshing and lightens everything up, and the cade oil is stronger and tougher, waking you up. This is more formal and semi-formal for the cooler months. Although the green gives it freshness, so could be okay for warmer months and daytime and the outdoors. (I don't know about the height of summer, though.) Fairly strong projection and longevity. This is good quality and really quite impressive. The name suits it- it conjures up a night out in the city, a light rain falling, out on a special occasion.
At first it smells very musky spicy then settles to smell like band aids. I’m not sure if it’s suppose to smell like bandaids. Is it?

First impression/wearing = Smells like a haunted house and storm clouds.
Tarry, gooey, smokey incense, cade and vintage woods. Reminds me of a better version of Kilian Pure Oud without the chemical bonfire.
Very interesting and perfect for October 🌃🎃

Full review: Great fragrance that gives me the impression of something mysterious and perhaps supernatural happening at night.
It's an ethereal almost meditative experience wearing this.

This fragrance is for the first half and almost puts me into a trance. The smokey tar of cade and incense are very well blended with the cypress, although I feel I also pick up nuances of cypriol and dark leather or suede. Additionally, I don't think it contains only cypress as I'm certain I pick up cedar, ebony woods, vetiver and earthy petrichor. Don't be beguiled by the simplistic note tree.

Longevity is fantastic around 10 hours. This is feels very well made and I don't get even the slightest hint of synthetics, although like all fragrances, they are there. Bottle is a work of art and atomizer is pressure sensitive like Penhaligon's portraits series.

It's a deep, bewitching fragrance, that will take you on a journey first deep into the darkness, and return you to the moonlight. 🌙

I get the notes and whatnot but to describe this scent you have to paint a picture. This smells like an evening in the Verona gardens. You're surrounded by iconic statues and and well manicured fragrant green foliage in all sorts of shapes reminiscent of Edward Scissorhand shrubbery. As you sit down and watch the sunset beyond the greenery and divine garden symmetry ou sip a slightly sweet wine as a satyr darts by at the far end of bushery ahead. You know you're in a magical place.

A Midnight Stroll is one of many excellent fragrances in Gucci's upmarket Alchemist's Garden collection. This fragrance is, as has been noted below, a fairly straightforward leather incense composition, but it is brilliant in its simplicity. Cade and birch tar combine with a spice and incense blend to produce a classic leather accord that smells very high quality (as well it should at this price point) and has good longevity and projection. As the scent reaches its deep drydown, it is grounded by a cedar-esq aromachemical that lingers for a very considerable time on my skin keeping the leathery aroma alive.
This fragrance is simply one of the very best incense-forward scents available today. Whether you, like me, decide that A Midnight Stroll is worth the high asking price is, or course, entirely up to you, but if you do decide to buy this fragrance, you will encounter one of the best presentations out there. The vintage apothecary style bottle with its painted logo is pure class and everything else about the way this product is delivered to the customer, from the box to the atomizer and even the bag (if you get it from Gucci) is clearly intended to make you feel good about parting with the asking price.
I love this fragrance and look forward to the cool weather for which it is best suited so that I can wear it again regularly. The scent is masculine leaning, but could easily be worn by anyone regardless of how they identify. This fragrance is OK for work, but really impressed me as a great choice for an autumn night out.
Try to sample A Midnight Stroll if you can. If you are a fan of leather/incense scents, I bet you'll love it as much as I do.

I continue to be seriously impressed by this collection from Gucci, it has no right to be so good. I think I need to give Gucci a break and forgive them for that horrible period they spent in the fragrance wilderness in the late noughties until recently, because before that and since they’ve produced some excellent iconic fragrances. I need to stop typecasting Morillas too as this, ubiquitous, designer freshie, journeyman, because there’s so much more to his repertoire and Midnight stroll is yet another example of that.
This is a Smokey cade/birch tar affair but used affectionately to create a leather accord in the traditional sense. I found it incredibly smooth and deep when smelling for the first time from one of those little bell/closh things on the Gucci counter.
Genuinely a leather type fragrance with a unique look and one I’ve never smelled before. Upon wearing it on skin and experiencing the top notes it actually has even more intrigue in that it has fresh aspects, totally different to the drydown.
I need to wear it properly and I will update this review, but I was even tempted to purchase, even at the outrageous prices Gucci want for this line. I accept that the packaging is beautiful and they are competing with other designer ‘exclusive’ lines of a similar price bracket, but these are still more expensive than Dior & Chanel and I find that hard to get by in the same way I do with Creed or similar brands.

This is the first one I have been blending with others from the collection, 'A Voice of The Snake' and 'Last Days of Summer'. True, it doesn't last all that long, but it is a very good coniferous smoking incense, the Alchemist Garden atomizers spray out a fine prolonged mist so I find myself spraying this one on like a body mist, up and down the arms, my hair, clothing...it is addictive! My wife says she can smell it on me, so I'm guessing the aroma chemicals used are the kind you can easily go anosmic to. If you can get it under $200(got mine $160, tester) Id say its worth it, but I would rather buy something like Mississippi Medicine for a similar experience for much less. I must admit...I am a sucker for these black bottles!My 'A Voice of The Snake' needed a friend on the shelf...and it has a jaguar on it, they really know their market! If your a hopeless lover of incense fragrances like me you will enjoy dousing yourself in it and walk around reeking of smoldering resins

I got a smoky, leathery green scent first on. It got more sharply resinous as the cypress or cade took over, relegating the smoke to a background feel. And then it didn't do anything else.
