I ended up smelling mostly tar, and a strong note of turpentine. Not loving this one. Disappointingly boring and just not evocative enough for the gorgeous bottle, the amazing title and the rather stiff price point.

I bought this in Harvey Nichols and when I first smelled it from the bottle I was absolutely bowled over and in love with it, it is absolutely beautiful.

But... and this is an absolute fact it doesn’t last more than half an hour. I can’t smell it on myself I can’t smell it at all and I’m pretty sensitive to perfume it’s just got zero longevity and I was so annoyed by by this that I had paid £250 for it that I told Gucci I wanted my money back and I got it.

Bottom line is whilst it smells absolutely divine it doesn’t last five seconds that’s my opinion.

Okay, this, to my nose is extremely similar to Bois d'Encens by Giorgio Armani, 90% similar to my nose. AMNS has a bit more sweetness, I’m not sure where the sweetness is coming from, I’m guessing the Cade oil/cypress mixture and I smell a lot of frankincense. It seems as though perfumers are taking known masterpieces, cloning them but putting their own little twist on them and trying to present them as something new. It’s a very nice fragrance but having Bois d'Encens Makes this totally redundant for me. It is a very, very nice fragrance though.

A Midnight Stroll is my first try of Gucci’s collection The Alchemist’s Garden and is a lovely dark blend of incense, cypress, and cedar, so it fittingly is incense-dominant but leans wood as well. It’s dark and smooth, reminiscent in execution of By Kilian Incense Oud but fittingly with more incense and less oud. It’s not quite as ashy as Profumum Roma Olibanum—which I usually regard as one of the best incense-dominant fragrances in the market—so it’s an even smoother, slightly more mainstream/designer-esque incense-heavy mix that is nonetheless very wearable and fairly enjoyable, without much bite in the opening.

It performs pretty well overall, and in the US, is sold via the Gucci website and the department stores Saks Fifth Avenue and Nordstrom, and its retailing pricing is $330 for 100ml. Also, I usually don’t gawk over bottle design the look of The Alchemist’ Garden’s bottles, most even more colorful than the black of A Midnight Stroll, are lovely.

Overall, A Midnight Stroll is great, and would certainly be made better by a lower price point, so I’d be curious to see if it’s available anywhere on the secondary market, and I’ll have to seek out some others in The Alchemist’s Garden.

8 out of 10

Take Zoologist Squid and add incense. That is A Midnight Stroll. I imagine this one being completely irresistible in a dive bar setting

Update: Only the beginning is like Squid. The rest of the fragrance is similar to Malt by Akro.

Smokey, frank-incensy, very mystical and Oriental. Not for everyone, I feel like people either LOVE or HATE this smell, there's no in-between. Something about it draws you in though. Mr.Alberto Morillas knows what he's doing!

Ash! Ash! Sweet Ash! The opening has a real WOW factor. I'm not great at picking up notes but this is more for autumn and is quite smokey. Good quality, dries down to an variation of Encre Noir, with a bit more smoke.
When you see the name Alberto Morillas your expectations can’t be high

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Platinum Gucci
review_content:
A nice cologne, gives off a man smell and dries down into a playful woody/floral smell, nice for date nights or clubs.
Not overpowering but not much projection.
Smell 8/10
Bottle 7/10
Performance 6.5/10
Longevity 7/10
Overall 7/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Platinum Gucci
review_content: I don't understand the hate against this perfume, its a good one though. Fantastic 8/10 for me.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Platinum Gucci
review_content: opening is painful but the dry down is worth it

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Platinum Gucci
review_content: The hate for this fragrance is not as deserved as I think. It has around 5-6 hours of performance which is decent, and definitely pulls compliments! The lemon and lavender pairing is a great smell, and the cedar touch is nice! This is more of an office scent for me because it does not project much, however, overall it is one of my favorites!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Platinum Gucci
review_content: I tried this. Generic opening and mid, and dries down to pez candy on my skin

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Platinum Gucci
review_content:
I do not understand the HATE for this one.
I’m a huge lemon and lavender fan, this smells like Prada Luna rossa eau sport, and like a very toned down version of sauvage edt. I really like this, it’s fresh, super versatile, MASS PLEASING and clean.
Absolutely easy blind buy. Sillage is VERY good, projection is average and longevity is 5 hours.
I don’t understand all the haters for this one they must like gourmand crap like one million

Scent 8.5/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Platinum Gucci
review_content: من اصلا اهل کالبدشکافی روایح و نتهای عطرها نیستم ولی جالبه که ورژن پلاتینیوم این برند محترم را در هر فصلی که میزنم لذت میبرم و جوابی که بخواهم را میگیرم فکر کنم بخاطر وجود نعنای هندی درون این کاره و همه از این عطر ازم سوال میکنن.بنظرم یک عطری است که باید همیشه درون کیف چرمی ما باشه و هر جا که لازم بود فقط دو پاف از آن را استفاده کرده و لذت ببریم.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Platinum Gucci
review_content: So synthetic and just plain annoying. It smells JUST like Only the Brave from Diesel. I'm so glad I didn't blind buy this and only got a sample.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Platinum Gucci
review_content: My prediction came true bigger and bolder than I imagined! Meryl Streep appeared adorned with large metallic shards and many other Hollywood elites reflected the light fantastic at the Golden Globes. The liquefaction of society itself continues daily across media outlets. “W” magazine’s “In/Out” declared it bluntly on Jan 9th: “In: Metallics and Romance on the Red Carpet”. Icy, vainglorious, shimmering metallics, with or without content, reflect the false light of the Imperial Me most brilliantly, but will blind you if you forget to wear your Ray-Bans. Gucci Guilty Platinum continues to be the perfect fragrantic totem for the halo of iridescent fallout that will surely accompany the meltdown of everything you thought was unshakable. Eat, drink and be merry, my friends. When you ask for the sun and the stars, sometimes you get a nuclear furnace.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Platinum Gucci
review_content: Metallics glint and gleam for 2017 in homage to the Imperial Me. Gold is the new (and maybe the ultimate) black, but this platinum prelude will do in a pinch. Facts are now liquid, so delete your fact checker and your sense of justice, too. Welcome to the genuine 21st century: shiny, new and brimming with glittering flankers and fusible fakes. My facts are different from yours and that’s okay, because I have developed a predilection for this lemony scented patchouli in its flashy flask, or maybe just all things Gucci.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Platinum Gucci
review_content: I just had a SA at Sephora try to tell me this is a new fragrance. It's no different other than the packaging. I've work GG since it was released, if you already have the original don't waste your time

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Platinum Gucci
review_content: Reminiscing the golden days of Gucci Nobile and Gucci Pour Homme. All we get these days is flankers upon flankers coupled with shocking performances. As Bob Dylan puts it "The Times They Are A Changin'". We deserve more respect than being laughed on!!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Platinum Gucci
review_content: This fragrance is not an actual flanker of Gucci Guilty.. Just like Gucci Guilty Diamond, this Gucci Guilty Platinum is the same old original Gucci Guilty juice in a different bottle.. Gucci should really be more specific & let everyone know that this fragrance is just the same old Gucci Guilty juice in a new limited edition bottle, as I am sure many will actually think it is a new flanker when in reality it is not..

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Platinum Gucci
review_content:
For five years Gucci has released 6 Gucci Guilty flankers for men and women. Five years! Enough is enough! How many flankers to the same generic college guy scent can you make?! And even if this isn't technically a flanker, it's a rebottle, it's still a waste.

I mean Yves Saint Laurent, excuse me "Saint Laurent", made 13 flankers to L'Homme over ten years and 29 flankers to Opium, 8 of which were released over the last two years.

Enough flankers.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Pour Homme Platinum Gucci
review_content: Let the hate begin.

an elegant fragrance that isnt overbearing. perfect for after a bath or at the gym or work. reminds me of what 90's minimalism looks like it would smell like. very unisex. also pairs nicely as a layering scent with other perfumes.
Out of the 759264292 perfumes, samples and body sprays I have, this is the only time I can recall my husband saying “wow, you smell lush!” so it’s a win

Is it similar to 212 nyc for women ? Not the opening but the really the last notes appear it the base… do they share the same lily scent ? Yeah exactly the same scent of lily but not the whole fragrance and ylang smells chocolaty and i can smell the musk and the bergamot isn’t screechy and sharp like what the other reviews is saying its the opposite the bergamot is lightly in the opening refreshing the scent if u are a floral lover and u like lily and ylang scent u gonna enjoy this fragrance and if ur signature scent is bamboo or at least u like it … ? What are u waiting for go and grab a bottle of 212 nyc for women u gonna thank me 100 times for it and if bamboo is clean floral 212 is angelic more musky and clean than bamboo 212 nyc is definitely waaaaaaaayyyyyyyyy better and softer and more long lasting and better in every point but they share similarities to be honest 8/10
I used to love this perfume, but over time (after like a year) it started to smell really bad. Keep in mind it should last 3 years.

It did not charm after release I thought it something lightweight without much character but I received it as a gift and decided to try it in summer. And it seems a perfect setting for it.
It is gentle but with clear character and very present without being strong or overwhelming.
Perfect for applying it in the early morning before going to the office. It opens refreshingly with zesty bergamot tones that together with lily give a watery bamboo impression.
It is floral at heart, the lilies are gentle and only their best part, ylang mellows the flowers a bit.
It is still a bit heady thanks to lilies but in a sensual, clean way.
It is elegant. Professional. For a lady that does not like nonsense yet won't stand loud scent for her days and still has her feminity intact and wants to enhance it.
It feels a bit aquatic.
Now that I wear it - it feels better on than Gucci's Bloom and Gorgeous Flowers series. Better than many offerings. Better than Acqua di Gioia. It might have competed with it.
Brings to mind elegance of Fan di Fendi and delicacy of Premiere by Gucci which is also a perfect everyday scent for the office. The romantic floral part reminds me a bit of Yohji by Yohji Yamamoto. His flowers also work so subtly but delectably in summer.
But it is also a perfect signature for a romantic, gentle and feminine soul.
It feels fresh on, leaving a gorgeous floral trail.
Romantic evening? Perfect for it.
Now that I have a bottle I am impressed.
There is a need for such scents. Waking us up, dressing in flowers, caressing with base. Calling it a masterpiece is not an overstatement. It is quite dreamy.
If I was to wear it daily, I would be happy. It is this close to a perfect floral.
Oh, it reminds me also of Boss Femme, too. But better.
It becomes skin scent after 6 hours but I catch wafts of it after 9 hours. And I feel it in the morning still, floral with buttery sandalwood.

This thing is terrible at first whiff it smells like the mud outside a latrine with a Feild offlowers growing close by. And then you take a poop and there’s a flowery breeze.. I bought this as a blind buy.. based on On The Notes …bad decision.

It's such a beautiful fragrance. Bamboo EDP is one of the newer additions to my fragrance wardrobe and I am already halfway through the full-size bottle. Having in mind that I own quite a few fragrances, it's actually impressive. i just love it oh so much. It's perfect for the office or for hot summer days when one absolutely doesn't want anything even remotely sweet, but doesn't want to smell like one just took a shower or washed clothes. It's for those times when one wants to smell effortlessly sophisticated. It's a citrusy fragrance with a slightly leathery undertone, which makes it smell so incredibly refined-sexy.

I did accidentally made some kind of magic.
I put one spray DG Devotion in the morning, then sprayed this fairly in noon..
Now.. its perfect fresh and soft scent for hot summer day. Im suprised really.
Bamboo is my great new-”vintage” find, that makes me happy.

I mistakenly purchased the EDT first and loved it! I expected to be over the moon with the EDP. However, it falls a little flat for me. Don’t get me wrong, I like it. But I actually prefer the EDT! This has that dry hairspray smell that seems to be becoming so incredibly popular in many viral fragrances of late. It seems aldehydic however, I don’t see them listed in the fragrances that I find smell this way to me! I find it to have good projection and decent longevity. If it didn’t feel so dry, I’d like it a lot more.

If your skin chemistry’s right for this perfume, then it’s nothing short of stunning. She comes off as basic but don’t be fooled. There’s more to her and you will catch delicate wafts and glimpses of her fragrant layers throughout the day. Everything comes together beautifully in a non-offensive, clean floral & ever so slightly powdery scent. A versatile fragrance with deceptively impressive longevity. Have had this for what feels like forever in my collection and it’s still one of my faves in spring/summer. A dumb reach for when I want something clean, feminine, put together, with an air of ethereal mystery. There’s an irresistibly clean, sea salt come laundry powder note which adds something unique to the white florals & ylang ylang. The sandalwood, vanilla and amber in the drydown does well not to overpower or compromise the freshness of the composition. I think Gucci Bamboo is a bit like Marmite for some, it’s either loved or hated. But I’ll always have space for her in my collection. A timeless beauty 🌼

I was expecting more green fragrance, with bamboo inclooded, however I am not dissapointed.

The perfume invites with fresh opening, a bit dry and bitter, but not tart. Orange blossoms are fully developed and rich, sandalwood base suits the floral heart.

It is acctually very nice scet, energic and bright, but not overcharging. Elegance and complexity of it is quite special, one of the Gucci very best...

lovely everyday fragrance. smells remarkably similar to chanel chance eau fraiche… but with a delayed warmth that chance eau fraiche lacks. gorgeous in summer. like a silk headscarf in an open topped car on a sunny day. nostalgic, gorgeous. more to this fragrance than the first impression reveals.

I wore this to someone's wedding once. At our bengali weddings, we hug it out a lot because we meet people in the community that we haven't seen for ages etc. So I kept smelling this beautiful clean woody smell, wafting about here and there, to the point I kept asking everyone what they were wearing and trying to sniff them again (much to the discomfort of others 😂). Anyhoo, I knew i just HAD to have that smell. That perfume. Whatever it was. Throughout the 5 hour wedding I kept getting wafts. It was only until after I came home and was getting changed, I got the wafting of this gorgeous woody spicy, clean sandalwood smell again. The same smell i couldn't detect where it was coming from throughout the whole wedding. It was ME all along. I just fell in love with it after that and was soOo happy that it was me and I had a bottle of it sitting safely at home. It was a gift in case you're wondering why I hadn't discovered what it actually smelt like. I hadn't tried it properly, all I knew was that it was a safe inoffensive scent at first whiff. And i hadnt really worn it anywhere. So.... LOVE THIS. Pesca by Reef smells a lot like this but without the strong ylang ylang note (which a lot of people dislike, but i dont mind it because the dry down is soOo worth waiting for!) And I have a 200 ml bottle of the Pesca Reef, so I am a happy bunny.🐰

How good would this be if it actually had bamboo in it?! Bamboo is such a good and under-utilised frag note.

Honestly, this is really good anyway. It's different than all my other scents - it's a mild citrus/green woody vibe even though there's no actual light wood notes in it... Which is kind of crazy and fun to consider.
I don't get any of the warm sandalwood, vanilla or amber in this. The whole fragrance is pretty cold, but in a nice way.
The only notes present that I can correctly identify are white flowers, with unspecified but lovely and well-blended citrus.
I like the white flowers they chose for this, Lily and orange blossom are less popular in fragrances than say jasmine or tuberose - that adds to the uniqueness.

Wearing this makes me feel elegant, sophisticated and unique without being controversial.
I don't reach for it everyday but it's lovely to wear when you're in the right mood.

It's a great job interview perfume! lol. Professional yet memorable.

I disagree with the reviews that call this masculine. It's really feminine, just not little girly feminine. If you love D&G Light Blue and want some variety for another occasion, you may really like this. It's less powerfully tart (and a totally different scent), but you'll probably appreciate the sharp yet well-blended, citrus note.

I also find it surprising that this one is a Gucci scent. No offence intended to people who like Gucci clothes etc, but I don't associate the apparel label with elegant, classy lady 'crisp linens, loafers and no visible logo wearing' vibes like this scent evokes.
Very clean and nice floral. No headache here. Classy lady at a meeting or getting lunch after shopping. Really well priced at the moment for what it is.
Repulsive combination of notes

Don’t let the pink fool you, this is not feminine. Technically it's unisex, but heavily leans masculine, almost cologne-like. The bergamot opening quickly transitions into a clean base. Very Y2K energy. Very white-shirt-and-blazer, ready for a boardroom.

The dry down is sharp and structured, and has more sleek power than delicate. I’d say it wears better on someone who enjoys traditionally masculine-clean profiles. I layered it with Armani The Yulong to pull out a bit more freshness and edge, and it worked well. It added clarity, direction and had a more grounded feel. Not something I’d grab for myself, but for a tailored look, it's fine.
sharp and smells a little masculine. it also just smelled bad on my skin. it's a no for me 😔

Bought this at the airport just because it was there, thinking I needed something fresh clean and light. And I’m so happy I did, because it’s all of these things. First spray when I opened the bottle was VERY citrusy and unpleasant. But after one day it changed and is round and softer. It’s a little nostalgic and yes, someone said it’s 2000 kind of scent and I agree. I enjoy it now that’s spring is coming. Not too strong, but I can smell myself for few hours after spraying. I like it a lot.
It’s just ylang ylang thats giving me nausea. Hated this fragrance

I have tested it in a perfume store, this perfume is citrusy fragrance in the top notes, but this scent fades a way fast, in the middle notes the perfume moves to white flory fragrance, hence, Ylang-Ylang and Orange Blossom were very clear to my nose, in the dry down, this perfume settle on cozy balanced white flory with Sandlewoods and amber fragrance, also a hint of vanilla exist in the background. For my own taste, or from this kind of perfumes, I prefer "Love Story Chloé" perfume, I found it more mature with more ingrediants, also more Classy and fiminine perfume, but most of people they are influenced by the "name of brand" to buy a perfume.

If you didn't smell this perfume before, I advise that you can blind buy if you interest cozy balanced perfumes without gourmand or a lot of sweety notes, also search on a perfume contains clear amount of white flory with woods and amber. I think this fragrance suitable for sensitive nose people.

This fragrance very suitable to wear it at summer or Spring seasons, It lasts 6-8 hours on leather and one day on clothes.


لقد جربته في متجر للعطور، يتميز هذا العطر برائحة حمضية في النفحات العليا، لكن هذه الرائحة سرعان ما تتلاشى بسرعة، في النوتات الوسطى، يتحول العطر إلى رائحة الزهور البيضاء حيث أن رائحة الإيلنغ إيلنغ وزهر البرتقال كانتا واضحتان جدًا في أنفي. أما في نوتات القاعدة، يستقر العطر على رائحة متوازنة ومريحة من الزهور البيضاء مع نوتة كل من خشب الصندل والعنبر، مع لمسة من الفانيليا في الخلفية. بالنسبة لذوقي الخاص، أو من بين هذا النوع من العطور، أفضل عطر "لف ستوري من كلوي"، فقد وجدته أكثر نضجًا بمكونات أكثر، كما أنه عطر أكثر أناقة وأنوثة، لكن معظم الناس يتأثرون باسم العلامة التجارية عند شراء العطر.

إذا لم تشمِ هذا العطر من قبل، أنصحك بإمكانك شرائه شراء أعمى إذا كنتِ تستمتعين بالعطور المتوازنة المريحة الخالية من الروائح الشهية أو الكثير من النوتات الحلوة، أو تبحثين أيضًا عن عطر يحتوي على كمية واضحة من الزهور البيضاء مع الأخشاب والعنبر. أعتقد أن هذا العطر مناسب جداً للأشخاص الذين لديهم حساسية في الأنف.

هذا العطر مناسب جدًا لارتدائه في فصلي الصيف أو الربيع، ويدوم لمدة 6-8 ساعات على الجلد ويوم واحد على الملابس.

This could very well be the fragrance that solidifies my distaste of ylang-ylang. At the opening it smelled perfectly fine, but then it turned on me. I'm not sure if it is my body chemistry, or my nose, or perhaps both, but the ylang-ylang was all I could smell after about 30 minutes. I always tend to gravitate towards fragrances that feature all the other notes (both on their own and in combination with one another), so this leaves me with no other conclusion than that ylang-ylang just smells horrible on me.

That being said, if you like ylang-ylang, then this could be the fragrance for you, but it's definitely not for me.

A nice addition to your collection if you’re a beginner and looking to expand your taste, animalic note caught me off guard ngl it’s so weird lmao but I enjoy the dry down a bit more it’s something id wear again

Just pulled this beauty from storage in time for the spring/ summer wardrobe switch. (Clothes, shoes, frags.) I’m purging a bit too, I’m an admitted over-consumer … ANYWAY! This baby is spring in a bottle. It’s a florally, floral, white flower. I usually like my white flowers creamy or fruity, but this straight up lily for me, but it’s powdery in the dry down, which I love! This has to be one of the least talked about Gucci fragrances, I just happen to come across on clearance on one of the fragrance sites years ago, but it’s my absolute favorite of the house. Until the recent Gucci floral vanilla orchid, it was my only Gucci fragrance ever.
MNA: missing nose alert. Who is the perfumer?

What a lovely perfume for spring! The lily is the star of the composition from start to finish. In my opinion, what elevates Bamboo is a slightly animalic and indolic undertone that adds to the impression of being surrounded by flowers. The sandalwood adds to the creaminess in the drydown, while ambery notes provide gravitas and staying power. Despite the rather intimate sillage after a few hours, I can still smell a powdery residue of the fragrance on my clothes the next day. Surprisingly, even though only created 10 years ago, Bamboo is so different from most of today’s new fragrances and worth trying if you crave a change.

I tried this on a paper sample and I fell in love right away, but then there was this odd note I couldn't put my finger on, it must have been a whiff of the "animalic" note, but then it luckily and quickly went away. After that it was just beautiful and the dry down is like nothing else I have smelled, just so pure, classic, and somehow nostalgic. I usually don't like vanilla scents, but its not strong here, and very well blended into the dry down, so if it was not shown on the notes I would have never guessed it was there, but it warms the dry down so much, that I would use this as an autumn, winter and evening scent.

I kept smelling the paper all day and fell more and more in love, so I got a bottle. The weird animalic note on paper I don't seem to find on my body chemistry, but somehow it seems more mature when I wear it, compared to on paper, and there's this super weird note in the dry down I cant put my finger on, but its slightly off putting. I can see how it could be a divisive scent.

This is so similar to Chanel Chance!!!! "the pink one"
This one is slightly more green than Chance that is a bit more floral perhaps, but it is insane how similar they are.
Love them both!
i would say that this is a great spring time fragrance.

I really liked this one, to be honest. Just after spraying you can really feel the citrusy notes and it dries down into a more of a calm and gentle, flowery-amber scent. Even though I really liked it, I'm quite disappointed by the longevity and sillage. After approximately 30 minutes to an hour of applying it, you can only smell it when you bury your nose into the place you sprayed it on. 💔

This is so masculine that I was surprised it was actually advertised for women. I'd wear it, but that's because I like masculine scents (they bring me comfort)! It is fairly unisex, and I think it's more masculine at first and then settles more unisex later. I could smell on either man or woman and wouldn't bat an eye. You shouldn't be discouraged if you like this perfume just because of the 'intended gender'. I wouldn't have even known had I not read the description.

About the scent:
I do really like it and find it comforting. I like how the 'bamboo' settles in. I find it smooth. A spring scent for me.

Very classy and elegant but not old lady smelling. Something maybe a Russian supermodel would wear. Or maybe even Sophie from two broke girls. Big tatas, blonde hair, sexy. This is what a bombshell would smell like, not whatever Victoria secret is doing lol
Sweet yellow floral with a bit of a citrusy kick to it. I really enjoy it. It’s very wearable. Definitely a great pick for an everyday fragrance.
although i’m not on the floral scented perfumes side, this one is really fresh, feminine and lightweight so is good for an everyday wear.
The bergamot in this is so screechy and it dries down to be sharp and fairly masculine. Not my vibe at all.

Strange powdery, bitter, dusty, chemical scent. I smell bergamot at the opening and then a synthetic woodiness that sticks to the back of my throat like hairspray. I don’t get the white florals, but maybe the lily note is what smells so strange here? It doesn’t smell like any sandalwood I’ve ever smelled. Smelled expired and dated from the first spray…Not good

Just wore it and stepped out, straight out the bat, a compliment: ‘ Mmm you smell really good’

Got it as a gift from a colleague and happy I have it as I never glanced twice at it on the shelves.

Creamy white florals with a soft sandalwood and a touch of sweetness from the vanilla.

Very feminine and pretty!

This is everything I've been looking for in a perfume. In this heat (South of the Equator), it is uplifting, refreshing, feminine, soft. I'd wish for a tiny bit more projection and silage, but that would perhaps go against the whole point of this fragrance. It's a little demure, elegant without trying too hard. A gentle gem. It's definitely something I don't see myself getting tired of so easily in Summer, which is the case for most of the scents I think I love.

It's a clean, citrusy laundry scent. It's like if dolce and gabbana light blue wanted to be a laundry soap. I don't hate it, I'm personally more of a gourmand lover so this type of fragrnce just isn't my style. But if you like smelling like clean laundry this is a good scent for that!
Can’t smell any bamboo there. It’s just there.
I bought this 10 years ago for my wife and she's just come around to it as her bedtime fragrance. It smells really 'pretty', very floral and a little sultry. I love it on her.

It's not my style but I liked it. It is something a middle aged trophy wife with fake tatas and a big blonde bun would wear. Reminds me of Jennifer Coolidge in Two Broke Girls lol. Winter scent, preferably worn during the night. Sillage is mild, does not last very long. I will not repurchase.

I smell absolutely NO pee note. I really tried to find it but i dont. I just smell lovely refreshing flowers and bergamot. Warm, soothing and increadibly beautiful.
Im in love with this.
Smells like make up to me.

A delicate, herbal, yet warm fragrance. More herbal and fresh at first. Then it deepens into a warmth. Similar to a very good soap. It's not complicated, it's pleasant. Smells like something fresh after washing.
It was nice to try, there is something so calm about this scent. If it's soap, it's a soap in a very nice, bright, cozy house

i dont know why peoplw dont like this..
The only word i can describe this is beautifull.
Its not too sweet, it smells good, clean, confident.
Its beautifull and inoffensive. i love spraying it on my clothes it smells really good and lasts so long

I had this perfume about 3 years ago, it’s a simple yet beautiful refreshing floral perfume, a well balanced ylang-ylang, lily and bergamot perfume, with a slightly sweet and woody dry down that’s reminiscent of bamboo.

It served its purpose at the time as I was in between university interviews and I needed to look professional. This perfume perfectly completed the impression.

Good for spring, summer and work environment, not a complexe composition (for me) so it’s pretty likeable for almost everyone.

Damn I don't like it. Too challenging for me.

It smells like urine and fermented young bamboo shoot (we call it 'rebung' in my local language) to my nose.

It also has this screechy note, which I hate, but I don't know what is the source. It makes it extra sour, like the juice went bad? I'm glad I get the tester vial, not the full sized.

had like 3 tiny sample bottles. REALLY tried to give it a chance because i love almost everything about it but oh my god. i'm so sorry. it smells like a zoo. it's like you sprayed on a REAL good perfume and then walked by the elephant exhibit. i can't decribe it any other way. it's small, but it's THERE, and it's pretty much unavoidable until it dries down to a better smell. which i don't feel like waiting for. i'm sorry gucci :(
I think there is something about the older gucci musks that I really like, that smell very "femme". This to my nose is quite similar to the old Guilty

I got this from a lady online with a bunch of other perfume as I collect hundreds of perfumes.
Immediately it took me back to early 2000s.
Then I remembered exactly Michael Kors Very Hollywood.
I still have the bottle I bought before I went to Disneyland in 2011.
It reminds me of summertime California warm skin, it has a rich vibe to it; an older classy woman would wear it. I am now that older woman LOL
I always felt it was a little old for me before, it's a gorgeous scent.
These almost smell identical, they have that fun summery vibe. I could see how it could smell like pee although I don't think it does. My nose is extremely sensitive to anything peewee lol I pick up the slightest scent that others never smell around me of anything.
I'm glad I bought it it's a very rich wonderful classy expensive smelling smell and now I know I have a dupe for my Very Hollywood.🌴💋🕶️

Is the name Bamboo misleading? Yes. Is it ground-breaking? No. Is it generic? Yeah, a little bit. But I can't stop smelling my wrist.... It's clean and fresh, I just wished it wasn't a skin scent. With the price tag it's not easy to overspray this one. The one thing I love the most is that the drydown is the same as the opening. (I hate perfumes that change to completely different scents after an hour or so). I would say this is a safe blind buy, and can be worn at any occation :)
Not fun, soothing, or interesting in any way.

All the other scents come and go but love for Gucci is permanent! Who wouldn't want this? It's beautiful inside out and I am crazy for it. Bergamot with Casablanca creating the signature scent for a women of this era with added elegance and class!

Not sure why the edt is better/as in I can smell it and is much stronger & wonderful than the edp but it is so...
Am returning the edp to Nordstrom today.
The Bamboo edt has an "animalic" after it's been on my skin into the 3 hour that I love.
The edp would be good if the notes would unfold...

I self consciously love this. I was so surprised to read from other's that this has a pee note. I don't pick this up on me at all, but I'm not sure if others do 😔 My bottle is older, from 2016. I thought it was so unique at that time when everything was either fruitchouli or floral and fruity.

To me, this smells quiet and melancholy. Kind of sad and dark, but clean and soft. Maybe it is the lily making me feel this way. This lasts all day on me with softer sillage.
Same DNA as Karl Lagerfeld For her, but at doubled price

I will agree that it is mature and that it smells a bit like (pee) but for me it is a nice fragrance, I would wear it on a date out.

bottle:8/10
smell:5/10

Update (4.17.2024): My original review was a first impression of a blind-buy, so now that I got to know this fragrance a little better I wanted to give an update. First, I changed my vote from "ok" to "like". I wasn't impressed at first but since wearing it more I have more respect for the quality of the product. This juice needs the warmth of skin to really perform at it's best. Also, it beautifully develops from a floral opening to a deep and creamy sandalwood dry-down with powdery, warm and sweet nuances. In other words, this fragrance is a lot more complex than it may seem at first. More recent releases aren't really doing that these days so I appreciate that. And the longevity on the skin is out of the this world (over 24 hours!). But it's still a little out of date without being completely old fashioned so my only challenge is wearing it often because it's not suitable for my lifestyle. But if you have more sophistication to your day-to-day lifestyle and want a scent that many people aren't wearing (I'm looking at you Coco Mademoiselle) then this might be for you.

I purchased this fragrance today for a discount at a rack store and here are my first impressions:

Firstly, this is a blind-buy purchase, however I have tested the edt version and I liked that one so I decided to get the edp thinking it wouldn't be that much of a difference.

Well, I was wrong and the two are very different and Gucci Bamboo edp was not what I was expecting.

I was expecting a fresh and modern floral scent with some aquatic nuances and maybe some greenness and woodiness (hence the name bamboo).

Instead, I got a very classic floral scent with some woody undertones and a little bit of brightness up top with a bit of fresh spicy in the base.

And it smells retro but with a modern twist but still classic. I like those types of scents because I find them elegant but I was thrown off by the packaging and appearance of the bottle it just gave a modern vibe.

So, if you do not like straight up floral scents or old school fragrances or spicy scents this may not be for you.

It's also a bit mature leaning and a little more business and elegant than young and playful. So, this one may not be for everyone but I'm happy to have it, although I think I could've lived without. I prefer the edt but this one is ok.

this has a particular nostalgic early 2000s smell to me, i remember the department stores and avon page samples smelt like this. playing with a friends mum’s makeup counter smelt like this. and it’s so gorgeous. it’s clean, barbie, celebrity like. doesn’t quite fit the name bamboo, but i love it.

I bought it like weeks ago. At first,I regretted for buying this instead of gucci bloom. It took me a bit of works to get used to this smell. Surprisingly,I got compliments from my brother who never ever complimented about my other perfumes. I applied it in my room before i went out and left my room with air conditioner on. When i got back, my room smelled like the whole wood forest with floral scents. That’s when I fell in love with this perfume. Personally, I would recommend this to ladies who like fresh and airy scents.

Обхожу белоцветочные ароматы стороной ,иногда это неприятно но сносто, но этоо!! Коллега душилась в одно время ,когда она проходила мимо я убиться хотела,мой парфкошмар) в ту же степь армани май вей и флер наркотик это пытка для меня.

“Ewwwwww!” was my initial reaction to trying this for the first time. I’ve had a sample that I never opened. All I can say is thank goodness it was in a dabber and not a spray. But I am mad it is all over my arms and hands!

Gucci Bamboo EDP smells EXACTLY like my grandmother’s cosmetic powders (I am 32 for reference, but that scent is forever tied to my childhood in the ‘90s).

When products used to always look lux and come in hefty ornate frosted glass containers and golden caps. Scented powders with big puffball applicators and a slim ribbon you could slip your fingers through to make applying a breeze. What a time to truly feel like a woman.

As I wear Bamboo EDP longer, I get a bit past the overpowering lily note. I’ve avoided most fragrances with anything lily-involved, as that always seems to bring the smell of a bygone era, that I don’t particularly love to wear at my age, especially surrounded by the sweet-gourmand trends since Baccarat Rouge started reigning King.

The sweeter notes (orange blossom, vanilla) come up to modernize just a smidge.

Now, when I sit with Bamboo EDP for half an hour to an hour minimum, I will be honest, I still smell a vintage fragrance. I would not be surprised if I smelled it blind and was told it was a perfume from the ‘90s.

Maybe if sprayed one time on an older woman, she could pull it off. It’s definitely not one to overspray unless you want to give off that “old lady smell”. I never use that phrase, I find it rude, but for here, it just seems accurate. 😔 I apologize.

Bamboo is a beautiful floral perfume with depth and character. It's not your generic floral. It's versatility makes it appropriate for work and for play. I believe you should wear what you love, no matter the season or time of day. Bamboo is a proven compliment getter, if that's important to you. It's certainly inoffensive, making it perfect for work as well as for play. I prefer niche fragrances, however, Bamboo has a niche quality. It's a safe blind buy in my opinion, as well as an excellent value for what you're getting.

Longevity = 6-8h
Sillage = moderate
Definitely leans feminine

Classic female scent and very balanced. Elegant , lasting, and great for any age. I call it perfect and think it is the best perfume I have purchased in years.

It is great to find a scent that is feminine, not loud or candied and juvenile. Gucci Bamboo is a work of art and highly underrated.

Everytime without fail a man tells me I smell absolutely divine or incredible or just super good. Men love this scent! It really attracts the men like crazy and I know it's because of the musk. I won't wear this for a long time and then all the sudden I pull this out and remember how crazy it makes the men lol Narciso Rodriguez pure musc has a similar effect as well. Im telling you those kind of scents are the best even though they aren't my favorite which would be vanilla based scents that are sweet. This is super underrated and the reactions I recieve are unlike anything else with any of my other perfumes. I always overspray especially on clothing but it does last and project well. I do around 15 sprays and I'm super solid from morning until night. I love musk based scents 💜 so happy I pulled this out today and was reminded how good it is. If you dont want to smell like everyone else then wear this baby and drive the men crazy and wait for their crazy reactions lol

Edit: I owed the edt and now I am half way through the edp. They are super similar while the edt has more citrus in it but the edp definitely lasts longer so I prefer that one. The edt lasts well if you overspray but you have to spray A LOT(like 25 sprays) on clothing for it to last all day but you will leave a sillage. The edp is way more noticeable so just go with that if you care about performance.

First impressions (sorta):
This was the best one on paper in perfumania. I finally got a full bottle for Christmas. I have to say if you think that this is going to smell like bamboo you’ll be surely mistaken. I also think people who do not appreciate white florals would be apawled by this for being too indolic for them. I will have to agree it’s a tad bit on the generic side of white florals, no matter. This to me reminds me of Versace Versense -way less crituses, and no fig. +kick up the Lilly and you’ll have this concoction.
Edit 1:
This also gives me Armani my way in a way with the dry down, but more dusty. Or maybe like 212 Carolina Herrera just less hair spray.
Edit 2:
This is definitely very mature with the ylang ylang

This is sooo bad! Luckly I learned my lesson and purchesed a decant first.


Smells like detergent mixed with bad smelling flowers.

I've tried many others but keep coming back to Gucci Bamboo, my good old standby. I didn't really take care of my last bottle and with time it has gone off and now smells a bit like urine, so it's time for a new bottle. This is clean, classic, and beautiful. This smells really nice and you can't go wrong if you need a signature scent.
So basically it's a really pretty unique scent and It's perfect for everyday wear!

I had it in 2015 maybe, at the time I tried it and I liked it sooo much. Funny how tastes change. I have tried other Gucci perfumes and they are just not for me. At the end I thought it seemed too green for my taste and I also, as others, felt the “pee note”. Overall office suitable daytime scent, nothing bold or interesting.

Extremely basic, it has that floral Gucci DNA for sure. Too mature for me though. It smells like a fresher, cleaner Gucci Guilty, but I still prefer Guilty over this. Like others have said, the bottle and name doesn't really match the scent... like why bamboo, lol?
It does smell a bit like pee

Like others have said, completely underwhelming and basic. But with that said, it’s does smell nice, just nothing special. Has a 90s vibe kinda reminds me of Pleasures. Highschool me would love it but I don’t see an adult wearing this and being taken seriously. I don’t smell the creamy notes much at all, it’s just a slightly sweet floral with no real identity of its own. I can see this being a good layering perfume to soften some sweeter scents.

My friend wears this as a signature and it smells great on her, so I was intrigued and got a sample.

On me the lily does initially smell a little indolic (that “pee-like” vibe others have mentioned). However thankfully this wears off quick and it’s mainly a thick ylang-ylang freshened up by bergamot. I really like it, possibly don’t love it as it doesn’t last long on me.

However despite being a bit paranoid about the pee note, I have been complimented on this perfume and my family said they can’t smell that note on me at all (believe me they’d tell me if they did!!!).

This is a lovely one for spring and summer, especially at work, or running errands.

On skin it’s a good first spritz. Fresh notes are there. But then after 3-5 mins, oh my god. Cat pee or a fart. IDK WHY but it smells like fart. Then after 10 mins from the fart smell, it becomes citrusy vanilla musk, which my brain can’t tell if good or bad because I still get the hint of cat pee. Dry down (minus the cat pee) is a bit similar to Armaf CdN Woman.

Wow the cool fall weather has brought this one to life, this is gorgeous now 😍. It's no longer a whisper of a scent, you can smell the spice, the florals and the powder. It's nice, still a nice soft scent just quietly beautiful.

It took months for me to warm up to Gucci Bamboo. At first I felt sort of nothing about it and it spent quite a bit of time on the margins of my collection. I gave it another full honest wearing before moving it into the out box, and that's when I realized how lovely it is. The scent is beautiful. Bamboo is not the knockout who turns heads when she walks into a room; it's the the girl next door who is pretty but becomes gorgeous after you've talked to her a few times and seen her sincerity and goodness up close.

If you like subtlety and discretion, femininity and grace, and are impeccably polite, you may love this perfume. Or if you simply have occasions where you hope to embody those traits, this is the scent for those occasions.

As a former design and marketing professional, I actually think the branding and bottle design don't represent this fragrance super well and that's one reason I think I didn't gel with it at first - I think I was expecting something a little green, a little herbal, maybe spa- or zen-like. The idea of bamboo evokes those things for me - bamboo is a specific object, it's an actual thing you can picture. But what I feel when I wear it is a gentle, very classy, feminine, warm white floral. The bottle shape and design are cool-looking, but it comes across as a little bit aloof with that cold, chrome-colored cap and smoky grey. If I were leading a design update, I would change the cap to a warm, polished nickel, and change the lettering to a creamy white on top of the soft grey glass. This fragrance is not aloof and individual, and not the smell of a spa lobby - it is warm and inviting and soft.

Once I adjusted my expectations, I've grown to really like/love this fragrance!

This one is seriously underrated. Almost no one seems to know about this gem. The bottle is beautiful, the scent is the best "clean girl" perfume. Many won't even notice it's an actual perfume, it's discreet in a good way. Suitable for work or situations where you can't wear a really strong perfume. It's completely inoffensive and is never inappropriate. It doesn't matter if you bathe in this, it will never be overpowering. Ever. I feel so clean and super calm and put together when I'm using this. A lot of times I spray this on me and my pillows before I go to bed, it's just relaxing and peaceful. I just purchased my fourth bottle, used up three 75 ml during this year. I don't even like freashies usually, but this one hit home. This is not too citrusy and soapy, it's just beautifully floral. I absolutely love the lily and ylang ylang in this. The absolutely only con to this is that it's very expensive. I mean, I'd get it if it was a powerful scent, but this is a light fresh scent. This price point is close to many different niche brands, which doesn't make any sense to me. I never buy this full price, I get it from like Ebay or something like that for significantly cheaper. I do make sure it's legit of course. But I do think this is such a gem and will keep repurchase this over and over. Highly recommend this hidden gem!

Smells floral yes, but to me somehow spicy? Maybe more like fresh (because of the bergamot), and light. Don't get any sandalwood though. I don't tend to get any vanilla or amber, as it most stays at the middle notes for me. Lasts me almost 6 hours on my hijab, and it has a moderate projection. I'd say this reminds me of a mature, slightly more masculine vibe. I wear it usually when I want to feel "grown up."

This is soo basic and unmemorable all I really get is that lily note which I’m not enjoying in this fragrance. Why did they make such a bland fragrance, with absolutely no kick or nothing to it, it’s such a waste. The funniest thing is that I have a small bottle and it seems suitable for summer but I just couldn’t bring myself to wearing it. It was the last thing I would like to put on. I sprayed it here and there, but I’m not able to make a significant dent so I’ll be parting ways with it.

For me, this perfume is unique because it is Elegantly Fresh as ChayChama perfectly described. I went swimming on a late summer's night and then showered and got into PJs. I didn't want a sweet or energising zesty fragrance, I wanted something serene and fresh - this is exactly that. This holds a unique place in my collection for being both elegant and zen.

I'm usually never in the minority who finds something strange off with scents. But this literally does smell like urine to me. Not even just a little bit. Right from the opening, it's like someone who peed themselves tried to cover with fresh floral perfume. I really thought something was off with the sample bottle at first, because no mass-appealing perfume could smell like this. But reading other reviews here, I'm apparently not the only one. The urine smell does dissipate in 2-3 hours, after which this becomes a pleasant sorta mature floral.

I wonder how this happens with designer perfumes. Are mass-market fragrances not tested by a lot of people before they're released? Will the release still go forward if 10% of people think it smells like the person wearing the perfume wet themselves?

I could see this working so well on a tropical vacation to a luxury resort. I wish I got more of the woody notes. It is pretty when my mom wears it but it smells like fresh-cut grass & lily on my skin.

This is ELEGANTLY FRESH. I am not into summery fragrances in general, as they tend to be generic with common zesty citrusy notes. The bergamot here disappears after few minutes, the Bamboand the Moroccan lily elevates this scent and makes it special yet simple and inoffensive. I receive compliments at my work about it every time I wear it. However, I needed to go heavy on the trigger to get a better sillage.
Generic, boring, dissappears after 10 min on my skin, not worth the money nor talking about it.

Really nice feminine woody fragrance. Thats the perfect description I feel, because usually woody scents are associated with mens perfume but this is definitely feminine. Its quite a clean scent, perfect to compliment that just showered feeling. The silage isn’t very good and it stays close to the skin. I would say its nice and works for a lot of occasions, but not interesting or anything special.

i’m very surprised this is described as a basic white floral. At least on my skin, the smell very closely resembles the bamboo i had around my house when i was a child. There is definitely the soft sweet of a white floral, but there is also fresh green citrus that reminds you that you are smelling the stalk, not the bloom. On me, this smell is very literal, as literal as the earl grey in Jo Malone’s earl grey & cucumber.

Though I understand why at first, its just another citrus floral, the dry down is such a nostalgic green smell, and layers perfectly with more aromatic, herbal tea smells. Lovely perfume <3

This is a fresh, airy, citrus yellow-floral. It's lovely, light and a great choice for the summer months, but there's not much to say about it. It doesn't leave a lasting impression, but there's nothing wrong with it to my nose. Perhaps it does nothing for my skin chemistry.
It's so basic that it hurts my soul just to sniff it

Không có gì để chê về em này,mùi hương tỏa mạnh,bám cực dai,trên da mình tầm 10 tiếng
Mùi hương thanh thoát,tinh khiết,vibe sang trọng,kiểu rất có khí chất và bản lĩnh ấy
mình cảm thấy hơi có chút hương na ná kim loại xen lẫn trong mùi hoa,lại có chút mát lạnh (cảm giác của tre trúc mang lại,như khi nằm trên chiếu trúc vậy).thực sự là một mùi hương must have

EXOTIC & SPICY Pacific Garden. Opens with multi-faceted bergamot that has citrus, fruity, fresh, aquatic & sweet nuances. The opening transitions to a floral heart of lily and ylang that has plush, succulent, violet, peppery and sour aspects, resting on a vanillic amber-woody base. On the skin, I get faint pencil shaving touches, and the woody notes lean to incense-y wooden church pews. Moderate performance with a small scent bubble for a light, summer wearing experience.

Contrast to Un Air de Samsara Guerlain:
These have very different note structures, but the ylang-sandalwood combo has reminders of the Samsara range, in it's lighter, fresh approach. Un Air de Samsara has green touches and outperforms Gucci Bamboo, although GB will be easier to wear for some, and is more universally appealing.

Contrast to Sira des Indes Jean Patou:
These are different, but there are some similarities with spicy-sour white & yellow florals. Sira des Indes has more animalic touches and ouperforms GB, although GB will be easier to wear for most noses.

Overall: Beautiful summer spicy scent profile, with moderate performance, this is the perfect scent to wear for adding some spice to your summer. I'm a longtime fan of the Samsara range, so t's a love for me. Enjoy!

I didn’t know what to expect from this I am surprised at how rich church mom it seems to be. It smells very powdery and like a classic smell that a well off Chanel wearing lady would wear to take care of the toddlers and babies in the church nursery. I’m reaching that age, hmm… I’ll wear this to rock the babies 👶 😇 . It’s a comforting scent, it makes you feel safe and well cared for. Perfect really, if any scent should have been named “Perfect,” it should’ve been this one. Not because the scent is perfect but because the feelings it evokes are just perfect in every way. Life is grand wearing Bamboo. Sorry I can’t pick apart the notes they’re too unfamiliar for me to distinguish between them.

I would describe this scent as elegant and crowd-pleasing. The bergamot lends a sparkling opening that acts as a bright counterpoint to the white flowers. For me, the lily takes a backseat to the ylang-ylang, but I know many people find the lily overpowering and unpleasant. It lasts up to 8 hours on my skin and dries down sweet and woody, owing to the vanilla and sandalwood in the base. Though the citrus-white floral scent has been done to death, I still really enjoy Bamboo for its simplicity and freshness. Is it a little bit boring? Maybe. Does it smell like a classy, rich woman on her way to amaze her company's shareholders? Yes.

This opens really nice with the citrus and then quickly changes to a woody fresh scent. If you like that scent profile, it would be a mass crowd pleaser. Isn't nothing unique. That's nothing remarkable about it. We have seen this done a zillion times. Nothing about it wows you and makes you say, "Ive GOT to have a bottle of this." It lasts forever and ever. If this isnt your type of scent, even after you wash your hands it holds you hostage and wont leave your skin. I hate when this happens.
Smells like pee on my skin. First sniff- wow smells so citrusy and nice, but within few seconds, I can smell strong urine-like stink. It’s a no from me

This is bland. Nothing interesting about it at all and instantly forgettable. It is as though a focus group was held choose the least offensive perfume and Bamboo won. If you love Casablanca lilies, try to get your hands on Donna Karan Gold or Cynthia Rowley Flower. Both are beautiful, creamy and powerful.
Smells like spit to me. I can’t bring myself to wear it.

This is easy to love ! I actually find it perfect for me. It is not a sugary or sweet scent , and it is a light floral that is not intense. To my nose the lily is beautiful . I find it lasts a long time - I always spray on my clothes to avoid chemicals in my blood stream.

Gucci Bamboo is feminine , understated, elegant and very classy . It has just the right amount of presence and it lingers many hours . It suits a woman who aspires to be polished in any setting , but who does not want her perfume to scream loudly .

I am grateful to have found something that is feminine, not drowning in fruit or sugar and that is so very pretty . I find it to be an excellent value for the quality . Another plus with this fragrance is that it is unique and not worn by everyone around me .
The lily in this is incredibly strong and it smells a bit pissy. If they dialed that right down it would be a really nice, slightly sweet, fresh and spicy scent. Shame

If someone needs to find a cheaper clone of this Floyesa "Ginazzi" is quite chlose. On me it smells a little animalic and I am wondering if there is some note that is not listed that gives this frag a bit of muskyness? Top bergamot is refreshing and sparkly in this and first spray is very bittery fresh, green and joyful. In the drydown the bergamot vanishes a bit and you get this woodier, white and yellow floral base. It settles into white floral/woodsy smell that someone said reminds them of funerals and I agree. The lily in this is more the "dirtier" kind which gives this frag some maturity and some might not like that. It is an office scent for a confident and calm person to me. The amber and animalicness in it makes me think of 90s fragrances and I was surprisen it came out 2015. It has a 90s vibe. It is not overly sweet. If you don't like greener and more animalic frags with heavier base maybe this won't work for you. On my skin it works really well. I have dry combination skin. I get a multifaceted, fresh, a little sexy and mature scent that sits chlose to skin and is inviting but energizing. Sample before buying!

7.5/10 I think it is a bit more unique fresh, clean office scent. I like it and all the different aspects on it. I wish it lasted longer. On me I get 4h.
The overall DNA plays in the same sandbox as Tom Ford Soleil Neige and Guerlain Shalimar Souffles. Incredibly underrated IMHO.

I was gifted this one by my OH. I would have moved past after testing it in a store for sure. I usually wear this on the days when i want something refreshing, not too heavy and inoffensive. Overall it is not my most favourite scent by Gucci, but it's good for casual daily wear.

I wanted so bad to love this perfume. Everyone around me seems to love it, but to me it smells like a grandma. I would have still worn it because everyone else loved it on me, but it gave me a major migraine every time I wore it.

Kinda shocked by the inclusion of vanilla, the citrus and florals are so powerful in this I had no idea that was a note in here lol. This perfume receives a lot of hate on here it seems but I really like it! It’s fresh and bright without being overly sweet, it makes a great office fragrance. There is nothing unpleasant about this to me, if it smells mature to your nose maybe you’re just missing the sweetness that usually accompanies frags like this. I like this one because it tends to last on me longer than others in this category. When spring hits I may use my bottle up

Screechy and green but in the best possible way. I think the name is perfect for the scent. I tend to use it on the days I feel overwhelmed by my usual heady white floral or rose scents. Gucci Bamboo is that sharp, it snaps me out of my stupor after the first spray!

Projection is not bad and the longevity is alright for the price. Not my favourite but it serves a purpose in my collection.

Surprises me that so many people describe this as mature, because to me this is the perfect perfume for a young 20-something, but can also be worn by someone older. It's very fresh in the opening with notes of white floral and citrus. The opening smells like watered-down Gucci Guilty - must be the bergamot. The base is very musky and clean. Overall it's a very good daytime scent, and personally I'd say it's a pretty safe one. Dunno if I'd buy the full size, but it's slowly growing on me. Good for blending in with everyone else, not for those who like to stand out. Lasts all day on me. 9/10
I only have one word for this - ISH

Oh it's incredibly mature, and kind of "dark" and deep if that makes sense. It lasts really long tho which is nice. I could probably only get away with it in a professional setting.

UPDATE: This might sound super weird, but - both my sister and I think this is a "funeral" fragrance. Similar vibe to Death & Decay by Lush. Sooo incredibly heavy in white florals, with a dash of wood at the base, that it quite honestly smells like attending a funeral service in a room full of flower bouquets and a wooden casket.
Too mature for me and soo unbelievably boring. For this reason i think it'd be the perfect work/ professional setting type perfume.

(This might be a follow up review YEARS after I initially tried Bamboo) This is a very clean, mature, professional scent. I don't like lily but I do love ylang ylang so it's a bit of a wash here but I do find it to be pleasant. There's something in the opening that smells like an antique shop which isn't great, but it does go away on the drydown. I wouldn't purchase this but don't hate it.

This is so lovely, it reminds me of back in the day when i used to wear very irresistible by Givenchy or chance by Chanel. Utterly beautiful. I can smell the citrus but it's not sharp, it blends with the florals beautifully.

Overall, I liked this perfume but I don't think it suited me at all. It was too mature on my skin. The top and middle notes of citrus, lily and ylang-ylang really clung to me, and I'm not a huge fan of lily anyway. I didn't get any of the base notes at all in the dry down.
Gucci Bamboo is truly gross. If Lilies smelled like this I would hate them. Sickly, fake, obnoxious and cheap. It smells like a cheap body lotion that has spoiled.

I gave this a second chance and it’s really good! To me it’s a green lily, not an intense lily. The dry down is creamy vanilla/sandalwood. I think this fragrance is pretty and versatile. I will wear this quite a bit. It is floral but a bit modern.
green & lemon. i actually like this more than I thought I would. bright summer beach day.

Imagine a world where the sun is hot, sand between your toes and exotic spices fill the air. This fragrance will take you there with its robust accents of amber-infused woods accompanied by sweet vanilla from Tahitian flowers that linger long after each inhale has been taken in deep.

This fragrance understands what it means to be captivated by beauty more than just skin deep; instead bringing out your most intimate desires for closeness with its sophisticated yet robust mixology that will have everyone around smelling like they're living in an expensively decorated tropical paradise!

I accidentally bought a 75 ml bottle of the EDT first, and I finished it at a record speed (a couple of weeks!!) because it was so weak. I did really enjoy the scent though, so I purchased the EDP version this time around. They are very similar, but the EDP is deeper, has a creamy softness to it and has better projection and longevity than the EDT. The EDT is greener, fresher and more sparkling, but the longevity is crap unfortunately. I do like the EDP a lot, it's really good for daytime wear at work or in the heat when you don't want a lot of perfume. It's really nice and fresh, makes you feel uplifted for sure. It's really floral, and has a warmth to it as well. The bottle is beautiful, really minimalistic and classy looking with the heavy glass and the metal bamboo cap. Looks good on the vanity table. The only thing is that this perfume really is pretty expensive for what it is. I don't imagine me buying this full price, I bought this second hand at a very good price. I don't think it's worth that much money, so if you can get it with a discount or on ebay or something, that is definitely preferred.
Musky clean and green. Comes off very feminine for me. Smells good, but also more mature.

This gorgeous lily scent has this refinement to it that I have not been able to find anywhere else! The citrus balances out the white florals to keep it light while still keeping it grounded in the sandalwood. This scent was made for expensive brunches, cocktail parties, and late night emails.

This is a sultry one! I hate citrus perfumes, the citrus isn't so pungent, but everything is such a smooth blend I forget there's bergamot in here. It makes me think of what a perfume with sugar and salt should smell like, instead of that screechy old lady invasive salt note that makes you squint your eyes in Olympea (my sister said it smells like vinegar lol). I could have this in my collection all my life its that good!I love gourmand heavy night time/ winter scents but this was also love at first sniff for me, give it a try!
To me, this is a beautiful summer fragrance. It's not complicated. It's safe, summer simplicity. Great choice for your beach, lake or any other summer holiday.

Citrus opening, then becomes floral (lily and a tad Ylang - & maybe a bit of lotus), with hints of bare warmth from the base - more vanilla than sandalwood to me. To my nose, I don't find any of the offensive elements others have mentioned on my skin. Decent, light, nothing unique, office friendly. The most interesting thing about this is how polarizing it is.
I love it, it’s refreshing and agrees with my skin chemistry. It’s citrusy and I definitely get the vanilla.

Skin is an actual ingredient of how weak or potent any scent can be. Having said that….don’t leave yourself with what everyone say …just go and try it on your own skin ….perhaps for others this might be amazing unlike for you or viceversa. This was gorgeous on me (I’m a male with very soft skin) and abhorrent on a friend of mine (he had a thicker and hairier skin complexion)

I got this as a gift..
Unfortunately, I absolutely hate this perfume !
Too much bergamot!!!
Burns your nose on the first spray😤
Too overpowering.. I read somewhere that it’s similar to (dolce and gabbana light blue) .. Not even one note is similar .. Not fresh at all ..

It doesn’t smell like an old lady .. and definitely not a young scent.. I just can’t understand it
Too green , grassy , trying to be aquatic but not getting there ..

Base notes of Vanilla and amber?!
I cannot smell any of these .

I gave it to my friend she sprayed it and it completely disappeared after 2 hours 😒
For that price and this low performance?
Just a NO 👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻

This is a very pretty perfume. Its not sexy, its pretty.
It isn't complex or groundbreaking. However, its very feminine and clean. Not soapy, but rather perfumy. Office appropriate.
I wouldn't say CEO, rather accounting supervisor.
I was horrified in reading the reviews that it smelled like cat urine, as not to say the vulgar word used.
Good grief, that's a little extreme. That must have been some bad bottles that somehow turned idk.
However, my experience is that its a fantastic little fragrance.
I'm incredibly picky. I don't like too floral, or powdery, and this is a fresh bouquet of fresh white flowers with Lily being the star, but not in a bad way. Believe me I easily get nauseous, and this didn't induce a headache.
The opening is my favorite, its a crispy bamboo illusion like, but beautiful Bergamot with department store perfume. I like it.
Its a safe buy, I think. Buy a sample if you're iffy.
All I can say is that the reviews scared me, but I'm glad I bought it because its a very pretty one if you want a quick clean, perfumy scent to run errands.
It lasts a good 8+ hours. I sprayed it this morning, I've showered, am ready for bed and I still smell it a bit.
Hope this helps ツ

Oh, I read someone say it smelled like toilet. Maybe a clean restroom at Bergdorf Goodman or Barneys NY.
But hey, to each their own. ¯_(ツ)_/¯

Oh, this is so bad it's actually putrid. To me, it smells like I am wearing a pretty fragrance, then a baby puked on me. i think the sandalwood (a note that I often hate) and the lily may be responsible for wrecking this fragrance for me. Both notes can turn foul for me. I have since learned to not blind buy fragrances with these notes. There are some beautiful components in Bamboo. The bergamot opening is bright, fresh and sweet, but fades very quickly (a couple minutes). Once that fades away the lily really dominates the fragrance and it has that smell of death and decay that lilies sometimes get. It's too bad because the other florals in the background are quite pretty and I like how the amber and vanilla round out the base. They stay light enough to make what could have been an easy to wear, everyday fragrance.

This fragrance is better in the air and on clothes where the lily stays lighter and fresher. This tells me that a lot of my distaste for this fragrance is my body chemistry's fault. I can see how it could be lovely if it behaves better on your skin. Also the nauseating element is more pronounced with a heavier spray and in heat. I could probably tolerate wearing this very lightly and only on my clothes. But I have so many other fragrance I love, I think it's better to find this one another home.

The performance is reasonable for a lighter fragrance. It lasts 4-6 hours with very strong projection for 1-2 hours then stays much closer to the body. I find the sillage much more attractive than how the fragrance smells up close. I find it a feminine, but not girly fragrance. It could almost be unisex.

Although there is no bamboo in this fragrance, it is present in the bottle design. I find the bottle simple and attractibe with the faceted, heavy glass bottle and a cap shaped like a bamboo stalk. Unfortunately the cap fits very loosly on my bottle, I don't know if I just got unlucky or if that is the case with this line.

Honestly, I don’t get why so many people dislike it so much.

It smells great, really fresh, mature without being a “grandma smell”, and it’s almost like a "your skin but better" type of fragrance.

When you spray it initially, it can be a little strong, but then it settles on your skin, and it’s not suffocating after that. It does last a lot of time in my clothes and skin, but it’s not really a strong smell, you’d have to actually sniff me to get a whiff of the perfume (that is, unless I wear a lot)
I mostly get the lilies and sandalwood notes from the perfume, and I really like that. It’s really refreshing, and just what I was looking for.

A lot of people mention that it’s “too basic”, but in my case, it actually stands out from what my friends tend to wear (they usually gravitate towards more “sweet” fragrances, and they use a lot of rose scented stuff too). It might be because of my age group, but it really does stand out.
I’ve actually gotten a bunch of compliments on it, including today.
I was in class, and I had just sprayed some of this on after lunch break, and my friend (who was standing next to me) asked if someone had just sprayed perfume because it smelled nice.
When I mentioned it was me, she said it was a really good smelling perfume lol
Don't love this one. It's not terrible. It's just not one I would buy again. It is a soft fragrance, but there is a note in it that I don't care for.
meehhh...smells like the cheapest air freshener. I don't understand the positive reviews or is anything wrong with my nose ?

First of all is it strange that im commenting and reviewing ladies perfume? i guess not when you are enthusiastic about scents : ) while everything and anything is subjective this is my take on this one and right of the bat i Dislike it....
Ok the name is Bamboo its written right there so i expect there be a bamboo note like D&G light blue femme or MB Starwalker but nope its just a name ,... and now a bit of detail , upon first spray there is bergamot , O/blossom with underlying hint of Ylang^2 , the bergamot is just gone in seconds, i ask myself was it really there? this part is cool floral and sweet after a white i can detect hints of lily but its overpowered by the O/blossom note this part remind me of lady million , then after couple of hours there is a soft sandal woody mildly ambery sweetness at the base probably with white musk galaxolide , still reminds me of LM and thats that , i wonder why ladies perfume should be this bland and simple but tbh there might be a problem with my nose or either with my skin i assume !! anyways what i stated is what i get with this one , i think for what it offers it's over priced , longevity is meh ok-ish (im testing a 75ml edp 2016 version,... and no its my sister's;) projection....!!! its non existence what are U talking about , nice bottle though in conclusion dont even bother with Gucci Bamboo its a waste

A grown-up elegant perfume, perfect for spring and summer! A very "easy grab" kind of scent. The lily and ylang together creates a beautiful "tropical" smell. I imagine this would layer very nicely with a coconut scent or body butter! It can seem a bit heavy in the initial spray, but after 10-15 minutes it's beautiful. It's actually quite light. The only downside with this, is that it disappears rather quickly... I will buy a small atomizer to bring this in my purse to reapply.
It's a clean and professional floral fragrance. For me, the lily note was too overpowering and I didn't like the smell at any point.
I’m shocked no one has mentioned that this smells palmist identical to Tommy girl

Un perfume que en México cuesta casi $3,000 no dura casi nada en la piel y su aroma es como atalcado de viejita.
No vale la pena.
This is lily dominated and well balanced , perfect for a woman who likes understated elegance and is not attention starved . This is feminine and classy and quite lovely .

My mother owns this, and initially I thought it was a pretty clean floral.

Then the fucking middle notes hit, and GOD they were mid. The lily is overpowering and I hate it. I can't take this anymore.

Got a 30ml on a plane years ago, and just finished it.
It’s nice, a powdery white floral with a soft woody amber base. Maybe a touch of citrus but mainly a powdery white floral. Has a kind of clean feeling, like freshly washed towels.
But I don’t think I’ll rebuy it. Too many fragrances too little time!

Very white floral with a hint of citrus. Overall an inoffensive, every day, office appropriate scent. It’s clean, shampoo-like but gives off a professional vibe (a bit more mature than I expected). Would I upgrade my sample to a full size? Not really. There are nicer and more interesting every day scents, but go for it if you’re looking for a simple scent that will make you smell pleasant.

I was complimented that this scent makes me attractive, professional, feminine but also playful. It is exactly what I love. A hidden gem. Not too distinct, but overall very pleasant. It is my go to and hope it never gets discontinued.

This smell is serious. Very business and to the point kind of woman. Good for going to work, maybe an interview. It keeps a respectful distance between you and the person. Not really sexy or playful. Very clean. She's not misbehaving. But it changes as well as time goes by. At first you get the "bamboo" then you're left with jasmine citrus.
This fragrance on my skin smells like a toilet, I absolutely despise it 🙈🙈

Weak as hell.... I can hardly smell any of the notes. Utterly boring non-perfume.
I've body mists with more OOOMMPHH than this. Terrible for the price.

I'm just beginning my perfume journey but I'm quickly coming to the conclusion that designer fragrances although beautiful are incomplete concepts. Layering fragrances isn't a choice, it's a necessity. This one is a perfect example. At first spray, a full-bodied, juicy note entices me and makes me want to keep smelling the journey of this scent. Its a quick turn around thereafter because the lingering pungent "pee" note I heard of and thought I was going to be able to surpass lingers long. I've made up my mind to keep all my fragrances for at least one calendar year so I get creative at night and experiment with fragrance combinations I don't like on their own (with many fails in between).

I am so enamored with the opening of Gucci Bamboo. I am glad layering it with Valentino Donna's cosmetic/powdery scent seems to do the trick of keeping that urine note at bay. Not a perfect match but they really help bring out notes in each other that makes me appreciate them more together than on thier own.

Gucci Bamboo EDP is a nice clean white floral scent. I feel that it has a good long lasting strength. From the time that I applied it to my skin until it disappears the scent is sweet and not overwhelming. I would repurchase.

I thought I liked this from a sample so I bought a bottle, but the more I smell it the more I can't stand it. There's something in it that is thick, suffocating and cloying. I can't figure out what it is as I like all the notes listed. I take it out once every couple of months to see if my tastes have changed (happens to me all the time) but it just seems to get worse every time.

I can’t remember if I’ve ever reviewed this. I’ve owned it for 5 or 6 years. Started with the EdT and now I just bought a larger bottle of the EdP for Christmas. Gucci Bamboo is an underrated beauty for sure. Out of all my perfumes, this one would be the “everyday classic” for me. It can be worn in any situation. It’s a beautiful, clean, fresh, citrusy but also floral fragrance. I feel like any age could get away with wearing this also as the citrus isn’t “too” tart and the florals arnt powdery. Definitely give it a try!

This is a bit too subtle and too plain for me. It’s nice, but too floral and too soft for me. This is an airy, light, floral. Nicely done. (Would also call this a bit soapy.) Also, I bet this opens up very nicely in warm weather.
I love this EDP. If the longevity was better, it'd be a definite candidate to be a signature scent for me. I can't decide on a signature scent anymore. There are so many to love.
Not my every day perfume but I can see it being someone else's! It smells classy and professional. I wear it when I want to feel disguised as a normal lady.
Does someone else get “the tanned skin” note from this? Or is it only my nose?

I had high hopes for this, based on the notes. Went to the store to test, and what I got on my skin was some flowers plus some king of “tanned skin” note. You know, when you tan, your skin gets a special smell, under direct sunlight. This fragrance has that note for me. I thought this was intended, and went back to check the notes, to figure out what gives me this impression. Didn’t find the note who is to blame for this. I don’t dislike it, just not what I expected from this.

Versatile and unique (yes really) beauty!

My second review for this, that’s how much I love it! Still love it years later. So underrated. She gets called generic but at the same time there is noting actually similar in the ‘reminds me of’ section apart from the other iterations. This is like an updated Pure Poison with added Ylang and vanilla. The scents aren’t similar apart from the white floral-citrus-musk aspects but the effect is similar. It will envelop you in a soft scent-bubble of attractive feminine goodness. People (especially men!) will think you smell so good, and wonder if it’s your shampoo or laundry detergent. Lasts the entire day with perceptible sillage.

This would make a great gift, layers well with any vanilla, great pick for both dates and work, and is suitable for most weather conditions. Very versatile. Get the EDP, the EDT is just a weak impression lacking depth and creaminess.
