There are rumors of this getting discontinued but the big retailers still carry it. I got backups but I hope they won’t actually discontinue it.
Smells very fresh and clean, if not a bit generic. Would have liked to see how it settled but had to scrub quick bc I felt a headache coming on right away with this one.

I get floral and fresh spicy. It's nice, if generic. Does not last long on my skin. Inoffensive skin scent. The bottle is pretty, and that's about all this fragrance has going on. That said, it could make a nice gift, if you end up with a bottle and aren't sure you're going to use it (regifting box I'm looking at you!)

I have a love hate relationship with this fragrance. Probably due to the Lily note which tends to remind me of funerals. I can only wear it when I’m in the mood for it and when it’s really hot. And when I do, I wear it with coconut lime lotion which makes its smell really good. It smells of freshly printed dollar bills. I just wish the lily was toned down. I actually have the limited edition bottle but left the review here because they are the same fragrance and who is checking the reviews on the limited edition bottle anyways?

Got pressured into buying this in harrods, but I’m so glad I did! It’s beautiful. It’s definitely one I save for special occasions. Received so many compliments on it whenever I’ve worn it, it’s fresh, floral, flattering and just smells “clean”. Definitely a good buy!

A beautiful clean, fresh floral fragrance with impressive lasting power / sillage (on my skin!). I really enjoy this for low effort days. It should be noted that I’m not a huge floral fan in general, but the sandalwood and ylang ylang make this a creamy floral which goes well with the freshness of the citrus. A favourite!

I tried this at Ulta and it didn’t stand out. Fast forward a few months and I saw a great price online and bought it just because of the price.
It quickly became one of my favorite scents ever.
I’m not sure what it is about this fragrance but it is so clean and creamy at the same time, I am in love. On me it lasts about 7-8 hrs.
My fav shampoo frag. Easygoing, Fresh, flowery and I love the Bamboo bottle design.

I tested this fragrance at Ulta today and it smells so nice and fresh and inoffensive. Not sure how it performs on skin but on the paper strip it smelled like it had potential to be a signature freshy!
lovely smell. but agreed with most of the reviews here, nothing really special and not loud. very clean and fresh, def smell the yellow floral. overpriced though for this performance :(

I liked this fragrance but I didn’t love it. Good scent and lasted a while on my skin, it just didn’t wow me and isn’t the fragrance category I tend to go for. I found it to be very fresh, clean and citrusy and the sandalwood/vanilla in the base notes really help darken it up a bit. I actually enjoyed using this perfume as an “after shower” scent.
Too strong and floral for me. Instant headache. It smells okay though, I just can't stand wearing it
It's nice, a clean white floral/citrus combo but I don't think it's nice enough to justify the price for me.

I just purchased this, and I will say this is your normal "flowery" scent, but with a little more depth and notes that make this stand out - at least to me. It gives you a "clean out of the shower" feeling, and I feel very elegant every time I wear it. To me, it smells expensive and a little more complex than just another flower perfume. Not loud, nor offensive - just elegant and lingering.

I also have to add that I'm typically not a fan of flowery perfumes, but this just checks off everything that I look for in a clean, fresh, elegant-smelling perfume.
This is very lovely definitely need this in my collection..
if this perfume had a zodiac sign she would be a virgo. simple clean nice and feminine it’s not very strong /doesn’t last long on the skin but it’s so nicee and fresh

(29 F. Combination skin, leaning toward oily).

I have been sampling some fragrances for the summer, including Gucci Bamboo EDP.
I was pleasantly surprised by how this turned out. Opening notes are definitely citrus, but dries down to a white-flower (as many have pointed out). Not a fan of citrus scents in general, but love bergamot, so it hasn't bothered me that much. I can pick up on the sandalwood, and a little of the ylang ylang, lily and orange blossom.

I agree with FiligreeAngel that it is on the weak side (longevity, and silage-wise), but that makes it perfect for the summer. And, for someone whose skin is prone to projecting perfumes quite strongly, this is a bonus. Plus, it is one of those linear scents that can be layered, and I have been doing just that!

Gucci Bamboo is one of my favorite low-maintenance perfumes. By that I mean I don't really give it much thought day-to-day, but when I wear it I always enjoy how I smell. It's incredibly underrated as a well-blended white floral that can be worn year round and for any occasion. I can see why it's overlooked - there is nothing loud about it nor is it full of trendy notes, but I think it's such a beautiful fragrance. It smells so lovely in general, but especially on my skin. My only gripe is I hate how Bamboo doesn't come in a 3.4 oz size....2.5 oz is some BS. Currently I own a rollerball, when I use it up I hope to buy a large bottle. I have a feeling this fragrance will be discontinued/phased out within the next few years which is upsetting to think about, but I think Bamboo is a really unique composition of these notes. I could see this being a fragrance for all ages! 9/10 for sure

I have had this perfume for a year but I don’t wear it very much. I wore it again last night and I started to think a bit. It smells very similar to Burberry Body EDP and Marc Jacobs Daisy EDP. To test this theory I spayed each wrist and one knee….ran out of wrists!!! To me it smells like three different people were given the same ingredients but they combined them in different amounts. I like them all but don’t see myself reaching for any of them this summer. A bit too much for me right now!!
Anyone else find these similarities?

I don't know what it is about Gucci Bamboo, it's nice, but doesn't wow me. I like it, but it's like it doesn't have enough character, nothing about it really stands out. I like the vanilla in this, I just wish something in it was more striking, you know? I mean, judging by the notes listed it could be just very simple, but I've smelled other perfumes with the same amount of notes or less listed that smell more complex and nice than this. It needs something more to elevate it. The bottle is nice and I appreciate having this. This won't bother anybody, won't really make a statement, but is that really a good thing?

Bamboo is a white floral of purity, simplicity and elegance. But, it takes a bit of working out. There's more to Bamboo than first impressions.

I have an olive skin, and on it lily, ylang-ylang, orange blossom and amber find their full expression. The sandalwood and vanilla convene to balance out the florals to effect a 'green' airiness, a powdery softness and crisp freshness of hotel bed sheets. Bamboo projects unobtrusively but does at least last many hours on me even in the warmest of weather.

If you've ever been to Milan's Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II on the north side of the Piazza del Duomo, this is the scent of the forty-something exquisitely attired lady who helps you choose your €300 cashmere jumper inside the noiseless, deeply carpeted, more exclusive boutique. Everything about her is a projection of understated Milanese sophistication and eunoia. Patrons seeking her poise can't quite replicate it. Part of her intangible allure is her scent, which is entirely in step with her patrician beauty – just in an understated Miss Moneypenny kind of way. Bamboo is her scent.

I have always loved Gucci scents. Something about them marks them out. Others notice when I wear them too. Bamboo is versatile: a perfectly good choice for daytime and evening. For all its simplicity it doesn't stray from the Gucci ethos, and it is actually my favourite from the house since their outstanding and much missed 2002 Eau de Parfum.

A brief mention of the bottle: a sturdy and pleasingly faceted flacon with good heft and a stylish stopper. A distinguished combination that would grace any dresser. 💚🤍❤️

To my nose this smells almost exactly like honeysuckle in the late afternoon of a hot day.
General description:
I get white flowers blended really well with something citrusy and spicy (the spice is barely noticeable to me but enough to make things interesting, like fresh cut flower stems) and something slightly sweet in the background which I'm guessing is the amber because it doesnt smell vanillic at all.It doesnt smell artificial at all which I really like.
A little timeline of the scent progression:
Upon spraying, I sometimes get a sharp jasmine note which thankfully goes away after a minute, and then I get lovely orange blossom and white lilly. After about half an hour it gets a bit sweeter and spicier and it really does smell like honeysuckle. Thankfully, it stays that way until it disappears from the skin.
Longevity:
It stays for about five hours on me. So far it seems to be on par with most white floral dominant fragrances that ive worn. These notes don't stay a very long time on my skin and I'm used to it so I reapply.
Projection:
It sits kinda close to the skin, but it doesn't go unnoticed if someone is sitting right next to me. I am satisfied with it, because I like discreet scents that dont make others notice you because of them.

In conclusion:
I have to say that this is a little bit generic and I dont think it would jump out to anyone but it is so lovely. A very inoffensive spring and summer scent that I could easily wear every single day and still find interesting.
Smells like Gucci Bloom to me but lighter maybe because of the bergamot. I like Gucci Bloom. But I think that's better worn at night. Bamboo is for the day.

The vanilla / lily / orange together evoke a honeysuckle-for-grownups feel, almost jasmine. The drydown moves the scent from early citrus through lasting white floral. I don't like powdery scents and it does have a little in it. I'm keeping it because it feels like a more refined option for a spring scent - something I'd wear to a wine tasting, but not every day.

I read so many reviews that this was youthful, fresh and light that I expected an aquatic citrusy fresh floral. It doesn’t smell like that to be at all. I was put off initially by how warm, powdery, and soapy it was to me. I kept giving it a chance and now that I’ve let go of my expectations I find it quite nice. I would describe it as a warm white floral. The initial spray is very different from the dry down but it’s because of that bergamot and it fades within minutes. Then I really get the flowers, sandalwood, vanilla and amber. It’s hard to pick up one note because it is very well blended, but I do think they are all there in the dry down, minus the bergamot. It is a comforting, feminine, sophisticated. I don’t find it youthful, I think girls will find this too “mature,” however, it isn’t old fashioned. It’s warm without spice.
I wanted to like this, but unfortunately on my skin smells like urine.
I hate this perfume! on initial spray it honestly smells like cat pee, once it dries down you can smell the flowers but i honestly had to wash this off

I'm surprised I didn't care much for this because I'm usually a fan of white floral fragrances and the white floral in Bamboo is very apparent. I thought it was pleasant at first. It starts off like a typical white floral, I could easily pick up on the orange blossom and a bit of the lily. It has a fresh, green opening that I think could be partly due to the bergamot but it doesn't smell very obviously citrus-y or fruity to me. The vanilla and amber are there in the beginning but they come out more as it dries down as does the sandalwood which remains pretty quiet until the fragrance has some time to settle. Bamboo gets less sweet and starts to smell a bit soapy the longer it sits. All that is fine, but the primary reason I find this fragrance to be just OK is that as it dries down, there comes a sharp, way-too-much-pepper note that coupled with the sweetness fading makes this too piercing and not soft and fresh like I wanted this fragrance to be.

I also found the strength to be rather low and doesn't project very well. It also faded pretty quickly too. OrientalVanillaGourmand mentioned it might be discontinued. It's definitely no longer on the Gucci website, but if it was discontinued I'm not all that surprised. I wanted a lot more from this scent and I didn't get it.
Gucci Bamboo edp and the edt is no longer on the Gucci website. This leads me to believe that it has been discontinued.
Opening is unremarkable and perfumey. Dries to a sweet vanillic white floral.

I love this so much! It is elegant and classy. It smells expensive. It doesn't crowd the room or choke anyone being overpowering, but it IS there, and I like that perfect balance. It is sexy and mature. Capable and focused. It conjures images of people perfecting their talents and snatching success that awaits them. Like, you know how Marylin Monroe was asked what she wears to sleep, and instead of saying 'nothing', she said Chanel No5? At first I thought maybe she said that to tactfully NOT say she slept naked, but with this perfume and my attachment to it, I can understand how her mind identified it as something she actually wears. I feel like it IS an accessory in a way that I really could just wear this to bed and still feel like I'm accessorized. I'm wearing something that makes me feel beautiful and confident, so if I want to dress up or wear jeans and a sweatshirt, I put this on either way and still feel like I am the expensive investment and not the clothes. Maybe that's when you know you've got your signature scent; when you find the scent that makes you feel like YOU and comfortable in your own skin. The ylang-ylang is intimate and enticing, and I think that and the vanilla is what gives it the sex appeal. The sandalwood grounds it nicely as the citrus pulls it all up from sinking too dark and brightens it just enough. I think the lily must be what is solidifying it as a definite feminine scent. This is my signature scent, and though I can still easily get it, Gucci isn't selling it on their site, and when I contacted them they said they don't know if they have plans to make more but didn't want to flat out say that they discontinued it, so that makes me nervous. It will be very hard to find a replacement, so I'm hoping they are just coasting until they sell what's in stock before making more.

I have not written many reviews, but here is my experience wearing Gucci Bamboo eau de parfum to work for the first time (which was today). I am a female auto parts sale rep, so I work with about 30 men and I also visit (service/sales) over 100 more men throughout my work week - therefore, I do not wear flowery floral perfume to work. I typically wear Liquid Cashmere Black (Donna Karan), sometimes Mon Guerlain, and Black Opium once in a while. But today was the first time I spritzed on Bamboo for work. The temperature reached mid to high 50s, with a breeze, and a tad bit of moisture in the air from melting snow and a faint mist like it might rain later. One of the shops had just opened the large overhead bay door when I walked in. One of the 2 main head technicians said to me, "Wow! Doesn't the air smell so much nicer for change. Spring must be almost here." Then a few minutes later, as walked past him, he commented that the fresh spring air was actually the scent trailing from me. I had perceived it as a skin scent on myself. But others could pick up on the light, refreshing, spring-like fragrance. It is not a strong, nor overpowering, perfume. It's a light, fresh, clean, smooth citrus (not sharp) with a soft floral hidden in the background. Maybe a faint touch of green vibe. I get no powdery vibe from it. And definitely no animalistic scent. I also do not detect any woodiness.

A Blind buy that hits it out of the ball park for me. I love Gucci and Gucci Bamboo smells so good on me. It is a unique scent that starts with a pleasing bergamot that turns to a lovely white floral scent that trails through the air pleasing your senses . It caught my husband attention when he hugged me and i was told just how yummy I smelled to him.
Winds down to a nice vanilla amber scent that is long lasting with a good sillage. When I woke up the next morning I could still smell it on me. I don't feel that it will appealing to younger ladies, more of a mature scent , which is working great in this colder weather.

I don’t know what to expected when I first received this sample, every thing just seems like another elegant perfume vibe but I was surprised
White silky woody powder floral freshen up by tangy bergamot on top, it’s have this cosmetic vibe to it maybe that’s the shampoo things people talk about but I like it
Not sure how to put it, this perfume for me feels professionally pretty like imagine what a strong, refined, white shirt, grey pencil skirt and suit person probably wear but if wear this dress down formal casual style wouldn’t be too far fetched.
This seems to work really nicely on a cool spring days, those day where the sunlight is warm fuzzy but the air is cool enough for you to not sweat type days however I can see the potential for this to turn sour so testing it first would be great.
If this work for you, it’s totally a signature scent worthy💖

Gucci Bamboo EDP is beautiful on my skin. I actually blind bought it as a gift for a friend who loves this type of perfume to wear to work, but I fell in love with it. I find this perfume uplifting, light, clean, sophisticated, classy and fresh. Bergamot is the strongest note, with its naturally sweet refreshintg scent . I'm not a big fan of orange blossom, but it's not so noticeable here. The florals are well blended, softly melding together into a more green than sweet blend. The sandalwood is gentle and calming. A bitter animalic amber emerges after the first 2 hours, but thankfully, it's not too intense, and serves only to give this delicate fresh scent its longevity. Gucci Bamboo EDP projects about a foot for an hour, then clings close to skin for another 4 hours. Non offensive, fresh clean scent perfect for office. Leans feminine, but could easily be unisex. I love it !

This is my new favourite spring fragrance!!!
It smells incredibly clean with hints of citrus. Very classy.
It's generic, non-descript really, clean, inoffensive, popular girl kind of fragrance but that is it's appeal!

it’s a blind buy based on notes and reviews and I hate it on me. The ylang ylang and animalic notes are dominant. The reviews are pretty positive. Maybe it will blossom in the summer heat as recommended.

I love what Lucritia Darke had to say. The reviews are all over the place. Some people say it’s nursing home urine and others love the powdery lily scent.

If L’Eau par Kenzo & Abercrombie & Fitch’s 8 had a love child it would be Gucci Bamboo.

Sometimes when reading reviews on hear I wonder if some of the people have actually smelled the perfumes, the opinions are so diverse. Take this for example, Bamboo is sweet, with warmth and sophistication. White florals with gentle vanilla and sandalwood dry down, a silk shirt worn over a strong toned tanned body. A perfume for every occasion. Simple classic and ultimately female, not the least bit bathroom cleaner, or harsh or granny. We are all entitled to an opinion but let's make sure were not just venting here, people read these reviews before committing to spending money, we owe them our honesty folks.

Pretty nice Gucci-style perfume. Very uniform, not bright, rather grayish and complex, there is a little cotton sweetness, for me it really smells a little of some kind of bamboo and bitter medicinal herbs.
Sagebrush, liquorice root, pond, moss and tree bark.
After woody-bitter aroma goes sweetness, as if you are drinking a concentrated decoction of wormwood and licorice. Strict and formal, but not luscious or simple. The perfume is more for winter-autumn, very persistent like all gucci perfumes. In my opinion good and very rare scent.

This fragrance is rather bland (though I'll say I don't see Lily featured every day in fragrance...) BUT I love it. Love it. I mean it is very versatile and pleasant. Excellent sillage (the only fragrance I have where someone stopped me in the hall and asked what I am wearing). It works with me, and when I first smelled it in 2015 in Heathrow, it just made me smile. It is satisfying and was vaguely familiar... evocative of some dreamy yesterdays that I can't quite pinpoint. Bamboo takes all of the easy beauty of a "shampoo scent" and elevates it to a perfume that would be a charming, clean, professional, likable signature scent.
Starts off citrus shampoo scent similar to Daisy- very quickly turns into pretty white floral sandalwood. Calming and good for work.

I think this is one of those that is highly reactive to skin chemistry. I see all these negative reviews but this perfume smells amazing on me & lasts. I'm giving waves of beautiful lily all day. It has something making it more subdued and rounded, not a sharp scent. Beautiful Sheer did this same thing on my skin. People always said in reviews it was just nice but it bloomed on my skin. I think this is one you probably need to get a sample of to see how it reacts on you. If it works on you this is beautiful and luxurious smelling.

This flowers on the hottest of hot days and I very much enjoy it. How's that for a simplistic review 😂

I overspray it as yes, it is true that it's on the weak side. To be honest though, on a hot day who wants a lingering strong fragrance?

This frag is one to consider if you struggle wearing the traditionally expected and more linear citrus spritzers of summer. Those ones tend to sour on me.

I loveee this. I don’t get why there’s lots of bad reviews?? It’s a beautiful scent. My every day one, I’m so happy I finally found a perfect day perfume that I can wear every day. I had too many night wear sprays (black opium, lady million, Olympia) which are all amazing just felt too strong for day time use. If you’re from the uk, you’ll know what I mean by when you walk into Debenhams and it just smells soo nice! This bamboo scent reminds me of this. It smells gorgeous, and classy. Definitely a signature scent of mine

Had a small sample of it at some point and remembered it to be quite nice, so I bought a 50ml bottle when I saw it on sale. Boy do I regret it. It smells like a basic hairspray. Boring, generic, nothing else to say. Gets a little better in an about 2 hours, but not much..

The sales assistant sprayed some of the Bamboo EDT on a paper, and although I did not appreciate the opening, I did enjoy the way Bamboo EDT develops. The sales assistant asked if I would like EDP or EDT. The little devil in my head reminded me how I've tried EDP before, and how it smelled similar to Voulez Vous Coucher Avec Moi by Kilian, and how beautiful the ylang was. I've decided to go for the EDP although it was the EDT I tested on that day.
It is not that I actually regret having EDP instead of EDT - but I think I would have enjoyed the EDT more. It has a bright and sheer citrus kick in it that makes those florals bloom. The EDP is more tamed, perhaps longer lasting, but more tame, more of a skin scent. If you enjoy non complicated classic florals with a modern take you will enjoy Bamboo EDP. If you would like a more sparkling scent, go for EDT.

I absolutely love this fragrance
It smells like luxury.
This isn’t a sexy fragrance.
This is a citrus, fresh, white floral fragrance.
The person commenting below me possibly smelled an old bottle.
I would definitely repurchase this fragrance, but it has been discontinued, and I still have around half a bottle.
Considering I’ve had it for nearly two years, I’m too scared to buy another bottle, as it might go rancid before I use it all
This is TF’s Oud Wood..

이 향수는 단독으로 쓰기에는 발향과 지속력이 너무 약하고 ... 좀 느끼한 향수들과 레이어드 했을 때 괜찮을 것 같아요.
시린 겨울바람같은 날카로움 + 비누향을 더해줘서 느끼한 향수랑 같이 뿌렸을때 밸런스를 잡아주는 듯???
같은 알케미스트가든 시리즈 중에서 분홍색 친구랑 같이 뿌리니까 좋았어용 ㅇㅇ
분홍색 친구가 은근 향이 무겁고 달콤하게 꽃냄새 범벅이라서 ...
This fragrance has been discontinued. Get your bottle while you can.

This is a very spicy woody dry scent.. not heavy but more airy. I blind bought this because I love pepper and cedar and I really like this. It’s very simple not complex. It gives you that pencil shaving scent with a hint of spice. So nice for fall. I am a female and I love it but I would imagine this being more for men but it isn’t masculine at all just very woodsy. Very nice. I am very happy with my purchase.

The name and description suggest darkness, but it's a dry, astringently peppery, light wearing fragrance. Sheer, almost transparent black pepper opening, linear dry down and base of elemi and cedar.

Not a chemical, "cologne" or "perfume" smell, but one of true and natural cedarwood. Simple and straight forward, but very high quality.

An awesome minimalist woody fragrance or one that would be great for layering.

This does not project, but it does last. It is an intimate skin scent for several hours.

Store Test Short Review:
Initially an intense sweet dark wood, kinda reminiscent of patchouli, but it quickly reveals itself to be a pleasant peppery cedar, and later dries down to a subtle smoky incense wood.

A bit simple and weak for its status, but lovely nonetheless. Also a very lovely name.
Perfect woody scent

This smells really beautiful. It’s a whisper of a perfume. It’s so intimate and fleeting and expensive though that I cannot imagine purchasing more than the sample size I have. It’s unfortunate, if there was more than an hour longevity, I would consider it, because even though it’s intimate sillage, if it were too strong I don’t think I would appreciate it as much as I do. Anyway, it’s warm and spicy and resinous. It’s a very straightforward perfume, but smells expensive. As this is from the Alchemist’s Garden line, and I have several samples, I’m going to play around with layering this one and hope that I can create something beautiful, as also happens when you layer The Voice of the Snake and The Eyes of the Tiger.

ETA: so I layered this with Tears for the Moon and damn, they are great together. I’m starting to really like the intimacy of these perfumes. They are special, for you only, or anyone special enough to get up close to you. These 2 together just made my skin smell so clean and beautiful. It still didn’t last long, but I really enjoyed it while it lasted.

I can see the similarities to oud wood. This it’s a beautiful cedar wood, sparkling black pepper and incense fragrance. It’s very airy at the same time. The incense does have a deep oud-patchouli background. However the longevity on this scent is very very upsetting.

This is an ok scent to me and I don’t think it smells nothing like Tom Ford Oud wood like few think. Tittle spicy and great for cold weather. My favorite from the entire collection still remains the pink bottle

I tried this today at the boutique and I can explain this one pretty easily. Take Tom Ford Oud Wood and dilute it with 50% water and you have Love at your darkest. Alberto Morillas mailed this one in, and the executives at Gucci who gave the okay for this, did the same.

I got about 30 minutes of performance before it completely disappeared from my skin. This is only my first impression so take it for what it's worth. It was a hot day so I only put on two sprays. Maybe I should have put on 7 or 8 sprays instead but regardless, this should be stronger and more present at this price point.

Love At Your Darkest is a beautiful presentation of black pepper.

Fresh, spicy pepper shine from the the first second, woodied up with a soft and musky cedar note, possibly the best cedar note I've smelled. The cedar's warmth counters the pepper's freshness beautifully. The olibanum is not overt and it exists to shape the woody spicy facets of the 2 former notes.

Fresh spicy, pepper, musky, lightly-woody, clean, and slightly-soapy

There is definitely more at play than these 3 notes. There is obvious soft, fuzzy, and soapy-clean white musk here. There is, also, a lightly green and slightly sweet green earthy note, very reminiscent of a minuscule amount of patchouli. Yet, it could be just the combination of cedar wood and olibanum.

LAYD (lol) is a beautiful clean, fresh spicy scent with some warmth. Lovers of pepper and cedar wood would surely enjoy this. However, at its exorbitant price, LAYD is just another severely overpriced Gucci product, especially with its very poor sillage.

The fragrance LAYD reminds of the most is Versace Pour Homme Oud Noir, but lighter. Also, there is faint resemblance to Issey Miyake Nuit d'Issey, Tom Ford Oud Wood (the cedar wood), and Davidoff Hot Water Night & Amouage Journey Man (the pepper).

Unisex leans masculine, mild-to-cool weather wear.

Very "Likeable" but the price is a repellent, and the performance doesn't help.

I love this scent but the longevity leaves much to be desired. It does linger on the skin for a while but it's very close to the skin even when first sprayed. Bought it still anyway as i very much enjoy it!

A nice light and fresh incense fragrance. Very much a designer fragrance as opposed to a niche fragrance. This isn’t a heavy-hitter, but more of a Jo Malone-style fragrance. It’s good but definitely not worth the price if you are on any budget whatsoever. I was surprised at first that Gucci would release an incense fragrance in a white bottle, but I get it now.

Edit: The performance is some of the worst I have ever come across in my life, and that includes neroli fragrances. I am genuinely curious if Gucci messed up their batches and if they will have to pull this from the shelves. For the 15 minutes that I can barely smell it, it smells like the incense note from Bleu de Chanel isolated. I was thinking this would smell similar to Tom Ford Ebene Fume, but it really couldn’t be any further from it.
When did three note fragrances become the trend? Sure, it can smell nice, but seems really lazy to me and lacks creativity.

Very nice 😊 better than the original! I was just saying how I needed a scent with lilac in it. It’s so fresh and pretty yet a tad powdery, I love it 🥰 I don’t smell lilac though. It’s like Gucci took the Elizabeth Arden Untold line and slightly switched things but made copies. This is like Untold Absolue

This is my signature scent, at first I really don't know what is the differences between the OG & platinum, but I was recommended to buy the platinum. I love the smell so much, this perfume not scattered everywhere. But the problem for me is the longevity not amazing, and the sillage moderate for me.
I'm curious about the og gucci guilty
Overall I love it and still be my signature scent 9/10

This is going to be the weirdest review I have written so far. Smells like a bit of calc powder, you know, the one you found at ur grandma's place, the one she purchased in 65, and the paper cover with the camomile printed on it is half rubbed off. Smells like finding a little porcelain earring holder with carefully crafted roses on it in a pile of clutter. I LOVE IT. It takes me to another universe. Smells grey and lace-y.

Initially I wanted the original, because I accidentally fell in love with it, but wasn't really prepared to pay the full price as it was way expensive back then. Couple of years ago I saw this discounted (I'm a bargain hoarder) and snatched it even though there was no tester.
To be perfectly honest I haven't worn it much, but I do crave it in certain occasions. I find it quite different from the original, it's more strict, almost metallic in a way. It's performance is also quite different, it's very present, very much in your face and loud, almost in ways that powerhouses of the eighties or early nineties were, yet it does lack complexity, but still manages not to smell cheap. I really love the lilac in this, I guess it must be the note that I associate with cold and metallic bells ringing in my head. The lilac is the only cold aspect juxtaposed with amber and patchouli on saccharin steroids.

I got this one solely b/c my work flubbed up on the price when we got it in & my boss & I said it was too good of a price not to buy them.. bought them as a customer and ended up only paying 39$ each for 2.5oz.. I gave it to my mom cause I thought it smelled like something she’d wear.. she did for a bit ended up giving it back to me.. I’m a gender bender so I said w/e I’ll wear it I like the smell of guilty.. Platinum I think smells the OG but dialed down a bit.. I’ve been wearing it a bit and find I can barely detect it on me even being generous with sprays.. idk if it just works well with my body chem or it has poor projection..but I’ll catch subtle wafts here and there and I still like it..think it’s a nice cozy scent.
Not doing a THING for me. I usually smile when I sniff a fragrance I like. This one? Nothing but...curiosity. It's not bad, as it was a gift, but I will not be repurchasing.

This was actually an erroneous buy for me. I card-tested it and it smelled more woody and spicy than floral, and I was trying to find something different. However when I got home and actually started using the bottle it was a lot more floral than expected. I guess it's with how they stored it in the shop (on a heat-emitting spotlight with no cap). I'm not particularly fond of it but I do use it when I wanna a spicy feminine edge, something between my Chloe Love Story and Samsara.

I have original Guilty and wouldn't mind having this one as well. Compared to original, this is less juicy (sexy) and more "clinical" smell what makes him perfect for humid and hot days, as well as formal occasions. It is clean and tidy with some "guilty" dancing on the edge of getting too sexy for every day use.

I've been stuck on Gucci Guilty Black ... i'm very tempted to get this and the Gucci Flora Anniversary edition.
EDIT (9/17/16): 2 US sellers finally have it on Ebay....I'll be getting mine within 1 week! :)
Oh this looks like a bit better version of Gucci Guilty :)
love the bottle and the Name, Im sure Im gonna love the smell as well! finally another gem after the LÉAU desaster
Gucci should bring this formulation back. This exact formula. No changes. And hopefully Gucci wasn't bought by Estee Lauder. They made TF Tuscan leather more floral. Bad Estee Lauder. Bad on you.

I had a bottle of this back in the day, but I cannot recall the fragrance in my mind. I remember liking it. Why Gucci discontinued this and Nobile is a mystery and a crime. I agree with some that Gucci has gone downhill. Envy was pretty nice too.

This is a classic for a reason! Gucci Pour Homme has this amazing depth to it – spicy, woody, with a touch of citrus that keeps it fresh. It lasts forever and gets compliments all day long. Definitely a timeless scent.
Got some used bottles, about half full. Not sure about it being off or not as this is the only time I’ve smelled it. It smells remarkably similar to Creed Viking.

This is a beautifully crafted lovely and chic masculine scent that cannot be found anywhere anymore (sadly). It carries the usual DNA for the era it is coming from but it is not loud! Most of the fragrances from this era are loud which makes them unwearable in today's standard; but this, you can wear it easier since it does not make a big loud cloud.
It's fresh spicy, warm, earthy, woody goodness. Iris and soft leather is making it just so much more interesting. It has a gazillion notes in it and if you try to guess them by smelling it, you will be lost in an ocean of beautiful notes. I may not be able to wear this everywhere but whenever I can cherish it, I do. It goes well with formal dressing.

Nice vintage DNA. Spicy, woody, earthy. My vintage juice has turned a bit but it settles down after the opening to reveal the true scent profile. It's fairly different than Hermès Equipage and not too similar to Floris Elite. Envy and Nobile are my favorites from the house but this first masculine of the house runs a close third.

This is Gucci’s Equipage. Guy Robert seems to have developed the same formula for both houses. Two birds, one stone. The resemblance is astonishing. Citrus leather Chypre as it seemed to be the fashion back then.

[edit] If you can’t create a good line and have to quote things you read online, at least give credit where credit is due, youtuber. Don’t be a parasite.

Have an Eau de Cologne splash bottle, and EDT also splash. The third one is with atomizer. Splash bottles smell way more sparkling and fresh, the rectangular bottle has a more pronounced Amber accord. Don't ask me why, but the difference is very notable. Go for the splash juice, drier, no doubts. Iconic fragrance.
How Gucci discontinued this gem 💎? And replaced it by worthless scents since👎 this gem was irreplaceable! Shame on Gucci decision makers🤔👎👎👎

Smells very natural and high quality.
A classic gentleman's fragrance, but considering when it was released projection and longevity are pretty crap.
Have two bottles, one is a travel spray in brown plastic (that looks surprisingly tacky for Gucci) and the other, a glass bottle, has condensed, oily accretions around the spray and rim, which happens with a lot of old fragrances, and the congealed gloop is almost like an extrait, a concentrated version of this fragrance that more closely resembles what I would have expected.
Although pleasant, the fragrance itself is very linear and doesn't smell very Italian.
Totally different to fragrances like Lancetti, Romeo Gigli, Fendi Uomo, which (to my mind) embody the heritage and traditions of Italian perfumery.
Considering the legendary, cult status of its 2003 successor and namesake, along with the other Tom Ford era Gucci fragrances, especially Envy for Men and Rush for Men, this seems singularly uninspired and conservative. Boring even.

I have been wearing this fragrance since 1979. These days I nurse my last bottle since it is virtually irreplaceable. I will not pay the ridiculous prices asked for sealed box bottles of this or any of the other "Guccicorns".

This is a great aromatic fougere and one of the best of its era. In its day, there was nothing remarkable about the ingredients in this scent, although these days, many of them are virtually unavailable. The net effect of the way the ingredients work together is to create a very French version of an Italian scent. As such, the fragrance opening is somewhat spicy with citrus notes as you'd expect in a fougere. The lavender is there, but it is faint. Later, before the oakmoss, slightly animalic leather and musk (unabashedly real musk) in the base notes arrive, there is an unusual camphorous note that is medicinal but soapy at the same time. I have always thought that this note might be a hint of natural oud. Perhaps it is just caused by the way that the various spices, geranium and patchouli work together. In any event, this note, transient as it is, has always been what made this fragrance better than the scores of other aromatic fougeres that came out in the mid-1970s through the early 1980s.

All-in-all, this fragrance is masterfully structured and compounded. The fragrance is both a bit dirty and beautifully risque (the French part) and also a soapy, clean gentleman's scent with clean florals and sparkling citrus (the Italian part). I love it.

I bought this fragrance in the late '80s from Canada's best, yet sadly long-defunct department store, Eatons. I still have that bottle, 2/3 full, and it's quite a testament to the quality of the old days, as I smell my wrist... it is still perfectly fine. I've not worn it in decades before this morning. An aromatic blend of citrus, spices, and lavender.

Very pleasing to revisit this fragrance, I'm going to give myself another squirt.

What I find absurd with the fragrance industry is the way they use the same fragrance in different items. I know more scents like this Gucci which are used in different items like wc fragrance or in face/body creams and lotions. What a pity!

I first noticed this fragrance somewhere around 89-90 by a "Sebamed" soap free cleansing bar (light green color) which I bought because it was soap and alkaline free and etc. They still produce the same soap, but I don't know it smells the same. If I see it somewhere, I would like to give it a snif. I was crazy about the scent and I was thinking why they use such a nice fragrance on a soap, but don't make a fragrance of it. One or two year later by a chance I met with this "Gucci Pour Homme" in a drugstore. I couldn't believe my nose that this was the same fragrance. It was the only bottle and I bought it immediately. After that I have searched everywhere for a second bottle, but I was never able to find one. I still have the same bottle. Almost the 2/3 of it is used. I keep it in a cool dark place and it smells almost the same. Time to time I use it. I notice that the top notes are bit changed, but the middle and the base notes are still the same. After the top notes are gone it smells still fresh as before. I wonder if there is another fragrance which smells like this one. Iceberg which is mentioned above here is not the copy cat of it. The Iceberg here smells more like Borsalino and Enrico Coveri. Unfortunately I don't know the other two fragrances.

Spicy, balsamic, smoky, and timeless. Gucci Pour Homme has a vintage feel to it without smelling dated. Something I can't quite put my finger on. I see the similarities to Equipage but this goes in an entirely different direction. These Vintage Gucci's sure have some of the best dry-downs, makes you wonder what the hell happened to this house.

Versatile, confident, warm, kind, gentle and natural. Like that old uncle who take you under his wings, and put a good word for you in his fellows company. Money is not anything to talk about, neither brag about. This is the smooth operator, blending well with cigarette smoke and drinks, fitting well into the closeness of a business-class small-talk. Still feeling clean after a forty year-long transatlantic flight, it will not stand out, even if you try to rinse your mouth with it. It just work in the background, with its soapy, mossy leathery drydown. 9/10 -for every occasion when you need a big hand to hold. Not hip at all.

I'm so excited I can barely contain myself. SO, I've been knocking myself out trying to find the HOLY GRAIL because seriously . . . with 199 specimens I'm out of shelf space. I just blind bought a vintage Chanel Egoiste and also it's flanker, Cologne Concentree for a steep but respectable price. I thought I may have hit the jackpot with these but, although they're very nice, they aren't the end all in men's perfumes.

Well, I was surfing for cologne bargains just now and stumbled upon a little vintage-mementos site; quirkyfinds - there, in the clearance section, I see a tall, clear, 8 oz. bottle of Gucci Pour Homme 90° (Ninety Degree) EAU DE PARFUM by Gucci filled half-full with a dark amber liquid. So I get to searching and come right away to this page and see the picture which is only similar.

The perfume I was looking for is in a tall, clear, square, rectangle bottle with a brass metal cap. On the front, near
the top is the Gucci crest and below are the words:

GUCCI

In the center:
eau de parfum

Beneath that:
The green, yellow and green horizontal stripes. (no center buckle)

At the bottom:
8 FL OZ _____ 90° _____ ml 240

I have found no other information about this vintage but I think I struck the mother-lode with this and for only . . . $42.63 w/tax & shipping for 4 OZ!
Gucci Pour Homme - 90 degree EDP (1976) My 200th bottle!

I'll keep y'all updated.

1st update - 40 y.o. G.P.H. received and it hasn't soured one bit. At first splash it's a bit reminiscent of Aramis 900 and also
Chanel #5. But quite puts them both to shame, it's that good. It's manly, masculine, classy and bold.
For men only - Soy boys need not apply!

2nd update - it's a powerhouse of projection & longevity. It takes several hours to dry down to its sublime birthday suit. This is beautiful stuff. It may very well be the pinnacle, the zenith, the apex, the holy grail . . . you get the picture.

3rd update - This ambrosia is 4 oz. in an 8 oz. splash bottle so when you dab it on it's pretty much in your face when you've applied enough to start smelling it waft into your nostrils.

I was pretty sure that I wanted more precise performance than a splash bottle gives so I thought about diluting it with 190 proof grain alcohol and maybe a dollop or two of Jojoba oil for good measure.

So I started reading up on ways to do that and found several opinions, both here and at basenotes, which I thought were pretty lame for the most part. So I bought an 8 oz. perfume atomizer-bottle from Amazon (best price there) and I went with my initial thought. I said a prayer and then poured about a third of an oz (I eyeballed it) of the oil in. Then, with a funnel, I poured in approx. 2 oz. of the Everclear. Then I topped it all off with the 4 oz. of Gucci Pour Homme - 90 Degree EDP (1976)

Voila, this is perfection! I can now spray fine mists, just as you'd expect, and this stuff is actually going into the dry-down much sooner. Oh, my wife just looked into the room and made eye contact with me, and with her forefinger, and a big smile, she made that Follow Me gesture. See ya'll later :)

I sincerely appreciate you posting the correct image of this timeless masterpiece...

Thank you.
Ummm admins...wrong picture to display! :-/

This is really awesome. THE '70s in the full sense. On the way of Eau Sauvage and Capucci pour homme, but with and incredible spicy/herbal background that gives a solid base and of course, the leather. The elegance and class it gives you is notable. For gentlemen.
Everytime I use it I feel like Don Johnson in Miami Vice. Real stuff from '70 for true machoman. Masterpiece

I would wear this in 1986. It is a spicy leathery note, and with a top note of citrus. Quite remarkable as it does encapsulate the era of 80s. Many fragrances tried Gucci approach, Quorum, Sybaris, Halston, YSLPour Homme, Eau Sauvage. This was in the days of Porsche 911's loads of money, the first mobile phone, and when people going for a curry was good for taking the mick out of the poor waiter, and builders vans would go past any brown skin person saying "oi Abdul go back home" then they would pile into the Rise of the Raj drink Skol Lager and order egg and chips. For me this was sitting in the back of the biology class, whilst listening to Grand Master flash while Mrs Jordan with her pale skin and dyed brown hair with white roots, wearing a lime green dress would say there is a locust missing and the guy called Randolph later to be committed to a mental institution for a string of offences and molesting children and rape,would be toasting the locust on the end of a compass on the bunsen burner. Yet I think every time she smelt it she would accuse me of day dreaming and call me to the front to sit next to her. Years later I met her and I said why did you do that, I was well behaved, and she said yet but you smelt so nice. In a group of teenage spotty kids, you smelt like a man would smell. It was really nice as I would always wear YSL, pour Homme, Aramis, but when I wore this, she would just say come and sit near my desk your not paying attention. She would often say right 30 mins detention for you. I was perplexed as I had not killed any locusts! No locusts were hurt during the write up of this review, only the fact as my school reports say, must pay more attention! It was sad when Gucci discontinued this fragrance. Even applying it to your skin it felt luxurious.

Gucci Original is an absolute classic and the fact it is no longer available is just WRONG! Imagine if Aramis, Polo, Tabu, Joy or Chanel No. 5 were to cease to exist --- or if a classic piece of music were to disappear from the earth --- or if one of Shakespeare's plays could no longer be seen. Each represents a loss of a vital piece of human culture and imagination.

H & R's Fragrance Guide lists the notes as:

TOP: Bergamot, Lavender, Basil, Artemisia, Petitgrain, Lemon
MIDDLE: Geranium, Carnation, Patchouli, Jasmin, Orris, Pepper, Pimento Berry, Sandalwood, Cedarwood
BASE: Moss, Tonka, Musk, Vanilla, Labdanum, Amber, Leather

This fragrance is a near-perfect balance of fresh, wood, leather, and mellow notes … strong enough to be assertive, but not overpowering, and sophisticated with an undertone of rawness. It lasts many hours, but stays close to the skin, so it's not an "in-your-face" all day scent bomb like some more recent creations. It's not only a perfect representative of 70's class, it's a timeless statement, and I still get compliments when I wear it nowadays.

The first Gucci Pour Homme begins with a whole dose of clinical bandage. Very distant memories of Hermes Equipage are there, Guy Roberts seems to be a WWII partisan.
But then Gucci develops to the best black tea so far. Wow.
Gucci Pour Homme II is the follower of this creation.

Possibly the greatest chypre for men ever created. Guy Robert has created a fragrance that represents sophistication and gracefulness while still maintaining a sense of hubris. The ingredients are numerous and complex, yet the result is a smooth and astounding blending of notes rarely seen in the world of fragrances. A special treasure in my collection that will be forever cherished.

Oh I had been so curious about this fragrance as it was the original Gucci fragrance for men.. I had been wanting to smell it for so long & finally I got my hands on some of this! My first impression just from sniffing the sprayer was not so good! It smelled to sharp and sour at first sniff, but I gave it a chance & wore it.. Oh how gorgeous it smells to me now! It was a little shocking at first because I am not use to these type of vintage scents but it just keeps getting better and better.. I will update my review of this masterpiece with a full review after I wear it again and understand it more..

OMG......this fragrance is ABSOLUTELY PHENOMENAL!!!
I agree that there's never too much elegance which is an excellent way to describe this frag. Gucci pour homme and Noble are the pillars of Gucci's early success creating two amazing men's fragrance's.
The open notes of this luxurious frag is a hint of bergamot, lavender, sandalwood and a refined mixture of spices.
The heart of this frag is the aromatic and masculine scent coming from leather, cedar wood as well a warm/sweet scent of amber and musk.
After this frag settles you can pickup all the subtle floral notes of jasmine, iris and french labdanum making this juice very desirable hands down.
Having worn this frag both during the day and evening I'm always have someone come up and say that you smell sooooooo good.
Both longevity and Silage are EXTREMELY high-quality. On my skin this fragrance lasts beyond 10hrs.
Finally thoughts,
How can anyone not find this fragrance amazing? Regardless of your skin type or your body chemistry, this fragrance is priceless. Rating this frag less then perfection is an insult on those who worked behind-the-scenes in the birth of this fragrance. Kudos to Gucci...10/10 love this frag ♥♥♥♥♥ :)))

This is the first perfume I wore, given by my father. He was presented as a gift but never wear so it was passed on to me in the beginning of 80's.
It is a classic class, it is simple fragrance perhaps at that time guys would buy too. Probably one of the flagship perfume before many more were released years after. I love it and I can still imagine the scent in my mind.

What does one do when the bottle of this is running empty. You have tried to find a new one but no luck.

These are sad times indeed.

I have not had the opportunity to sample a large amount of Gucci fragrances in my lifetime and experience with scents.

I do have Gucci Pour Homme II, and recently purcahsed this vintage version of Gucci Pour Homme.

This is a very sneaky scent to me. I sprayed some on a card, and the beauty of it eluded me at first. Then i sprayed some on my wrist, and I have fallen in love with it. This is a dynamite fragrance.

I do not so much get the woody notes, as some spiciness with citrus and a hint of what appears to me as vetiver,and definitely musk.

In conclusion, i love this shit! I adore the sheer masculinity and power of this fragrance. It is the scent for an ideally strong and driven man.

Take the time to sample this on your skin a couple times, as you will not be disappointed.

Some time soon I will be sampling the newer version of Gucci Pour Homme from the Tom Ford era.

Being honest, I have never been a Gucci admirer or 'fan' and probably never will be, but one has to appreciate 70's luxury in a bottle.

It's a 'reserved powerhouse', lemons, masculine yet high-quality woods and leather then appear over a background of oakmoss. The mid also feature the famous florals (geranium, carnation) and herbal-lavender of course! See- Gucci Pour Home 1.

Old-skool for sure, but with a touch of assured quality and luxury the brand simply could not translate properly into the 21st century. Gucci Pour Homme 2 remains their best for me, a 3/5 for the surprisingly elegant herbal tea-fume.

High 2/5 for this one. Knock off a point (or 2) if you're an 'old-skool' hater.

First impression after spraying it on cloth: a perfect blend, with clear lemon, vanilla/amber, leather, patchouli, and a floral accord. I don't really get the wood but there's a hint of geranium and some spice element that helps to create a somewhat creamy quality overall. In some ways, it strikes me as Pub Cologne made elegant, though the notes aren't exactly the same (PC has clear anise whereas here there is a suggestion of anise). Though there's a touch of the crude here, the overall suggestion is that of a man with power who uses it judiciously, cognizant of what the masses desire. There is considerable richness and weight here, but it doesn't have the dryness required to produce great depth, not that it's necessary (Joint for Men is the deepest fragrance I've experienced). This is an excellent example of a high quality, blended designer fragrance, and to be honest, I prefer it to Patou Pour Homme. To me it is what I'd call a citric oriental, though with a chypre accord that becomes clear eventually (but it's never very strong). It's sort of like the citric oriental is covering up the chypre, and as it weakens you get a sense that a chypre is present. I get no fougere accord, however.

UPDATE: I wore it normally today and my assessment is roughly the same, though I find it a bit more refined than on cloth. Clearly, it's not for the young, fresh, sport, aquatic or party crowd.

UPDATE: Wore it today and got more lavender this time around, in a fougere accord, but it's light and nicely blended into the whole. The wood notes are no more than a bare background hum. It's a slightly powdery fougere/chypre/oriental hybrid with quite a bit of complexity, but it's subtle complexity. If you felt that Z-14 was way too crude this would be one to try, for example. There's a bit of an animalic quality, presumably from the jasmine.
I received this as a gift in a small 25ml size many years ago. It was OK..nothing to write home about. A very forgetful unmemorable fragrence. Bottle was nice though!

Finally I have it again, lovely stuff. Is this a masterpiece or is it a masterpiece.

Edit: Found another 60ml bottle, it´s a treasure.

10/10

Perfection.

This is a true masterpiece created by Guy Robert and one the most iconic masculine chypres ever created. Gypsy Parfumista's articulate (and wonderfully enthusiastic) review captures what this scent is...for those of us lucky enough to have it, or to have even ever smelled this divine juice. One of my favorite classic male scents of all time. It is simply stunning & timeless.

I am left, almost speechless...but remember that Gucci has always been a very high-end house of everything their logo is upon. This is exquisite, chic and very suave with its classic lines and composition. Desmondorama, I second your wish that this iconic and sensual fragrance somehow be reissued. But, sometimes it is better to let the days of yesteryear be forgotten by the new generation and only sought out by those really want to relive them or experience what existed in a bygone era.

Alfarom, who I admire greatly on this forum, has it fully correct. You cannot compare this to anything created under Tom Ford. This is truly a 70's chypre with an awesome warm leather, musk, woody, amber and oakmoss base covered in lavender, sparkling citrus, and beautiful florals - green jasmine, earthy geranium, lush lavender and powdery iris in the heart. Spices are dashed upon everything...offering 'flavoring' and depth. It can be worn year-round although Spring, Fall and Summer evenings offer more strength and richness due to the warmth, I find it creates it own sunshine on cool, cloudy winter days. A scent that commands respect and will always be one I reach for on the day of a special occasion. No note or accord is dominant...it is the epitome of a balanced fragrance, so impeccably blended.

Gucci Pour Homme Original holds a very dear place in my collection! If "liquid heaven" has a price tag - then it is on a bottle of Original Vintage Gucci Pour Homme. "There can never be too much elegance in your life"...what a marketing tagline and this came out when I was a very young child. I have finally discovered what the beauty and hype is all about - it only took me three plus decades to do so in my existence. 5/5 stars!! 10/10 and, anyone who does not know what an incredible chypre is, should try it and understand the art of perfumery that is captured in this glorious composition. One cannot 'quantify' beauty like this...it is olfactory bliss!

A moment to share: I put a couple of dabs from a perfect 4oz/120ml squared flacon on the back of my hand just 5 minutes ago. I will put this poetically to evoke my sentiment: "To me, this is like coming home to my beautiful wife...and she kisses me the way she did like the first time we kissed, years ago." It is simply...stunning! For me, Gucci Pour Homme Original (1976) is a timeless, masterpiece of scent that will forever be relevant and captivating...

still have some of this fragrance, was able to find a small amount of splash on ebay, smells fantastic still.put into a spray atomizer..i save it , if just to spray it once in awhile to smell this masculine masterpiece...this fragrance says simply..." yep, i got a set." i wish they would produce this again..cannot think of anything new that kicks it's ass..unless you want to smell like a cinnamon bun, still one of my all time favorite colognes,crisp snappy and all man..no confusion on who just walked into the room.
sort of reminds me of armani pour home, this is from the same person who created hermes equipage.. no wonder I enjoy that one as well..

Yep this is rarer than hair on a balding man. I have 15ml left. I'll admit I came by it completely by accident thinking I was buying the modern version.
Want to know what this was like?
Get in touch: now. Before every last drop of Gucci Pour Homme in the world is gone.

Like the ad says: "There can NEVER be too much elegance in your life". THIS is just what the name implies GUCCI ("old school" Gucci, at that) FOR MAN! This smells like a man, and captures, so well, that European sense of quality and luxury that the brand has always signified. This scent, also, is the perfect example (at least for me) of a stunning male chypre.

*Many thanks and reverent bows to Action for the gift of a full sample vial of this wonderful manscent!* You are still the High Priestess of Perfumes...and always will be!

This opens beautifully with clean citruses combined artfully into warm greens and clean floral aromas, manly from whoa to go!! First it is clean and manly then, as it develops, it becomes wonderous with dry flowers like carnation and geranium and irises with the warmth of pepper and earthy woody notes...HEAVEN! Like most TRUE chypres, this takes a while to unfold all of its beauty. And, as it does, I am amazed that Gucci even thought they needed another fragrance besides this one. If this is "dated", you may call me an 'old fogey'! GPH is another disastrous loss at the hands of either the IFRA or those who sought to dilute everything within an inch of its life, while supposedly making things "more modern" and I simply cannot imagine why!?! God, words cannot do this justice, it just HAS to be smelled. There is nothing even remotely feminine (even the jasmine is "butch") or "unisex" about this scent. It is all man, all the time! Strong, but not brutal, and amazingly luxurious without smelling too "rich". The eventual drydown is perfumed paradise for this guy! Warm, like a favorite wool fisherman's sweater, it eventually gets covered with a beautiful soft leather note and sweet tonka, resins and musk. Oh, and the oakmoss here really shines! OAK moss, now, not tree moss or black moss or whatever else they are using these days...REAL honest to goodness Evernia prunastri, that grows on oaks and other deciduous and coniferous trees and has a woody and sharp slightly sweet smell you cannot mistake. Gucci Pour Homme makes me feel like I am dressed in a vintage Italian leather coat and loafers, hand woven sweater and bespoke twill pants; even when I am wearing bleached out ripped jeans and a tee shirt (like today). What I wouldn't give to own an original vintage bottle of this golden elixir...

Sillage: very good
Longevity: amazing
Overall: 5/5 Chyprefect!

It came to my attention when using the search feature on here to bring this page up that the 2005 version is "pour Homme" and this magnificent melange is "Pour Homme"...that P should be capitalised! Everything about this scent is upper case, upper echelon and upper crust! I bow humbly in the face of Greatness...

The original Gucci Pour Homme and the later Tom Ford's version perfectly represents the two peaks of Gucci's success. The first one back in the 70's when the Gucci family was at the top of their popularity and always protagonist in the main fashion magazines. A family surrounded by mistery, intrigues and extreme luxury and elegance. In this context Gucci Pour Homme (original) was perfectly fitting the bill with a superbe combination of woods (mainly cedar), deep leather, pipe tobacco and some floral notes (lavander and bergamot). A complex composition, that's rich and elegant but not too mannered and one of those perfumes that we can't forget. Great!

In the late 80's the big success of the house started to decline due to several conflicts and scandals in the Gucci's family, but fortunately Tom Ford came in and saved the brand from oblivion. 1999-2003 (perhaps 2004) was the best period for Gucci and the new Gucci Pour Homme, was the expression of those creative years and one of the last good releases form this (once) gorgeous maison.

Rating: 8/10

I agree this was a great fragrance. I used to always be complimented on this fragrance. Masculine, woodsy, a hint of cinnamon note, soft musk and an air of elegance. Genuine wrist sniffer in the office. Come on Gucci, please re-issue.
I had this years ago and I really loved it! It was quite lasting, sexy, warm and quite masculine. I wish Gucci would reissue this iconic and sensual fragrance again!

This is a pungent and loud one. The rose is green and the earthy patchouli is stronger than the oud. I don't get any of the fruits. Maybe adding a sweet vanilla scent could make it tolerable. To me smells like Pink Roses by Mancera (not a fan) with tons of patchouli and some oud.

i cant do this scent. instant headache and gag-worthy. its so strong and jarring in a way that makes me feel like i’m suffocating on it.

if this is your go-to, stay AWAY from me.

Gucci Oud is a fragrance I bought when it was first released. I liked it back then — it had something smooth and pleasant.

But here’s the thing: I never felt excited to wear it. It smells good, sure, but it doesn’t move me. It’s linear, doesn’t evolve on my skin. There’s no story, no surprise, no emotion. Just a flat line of pleasant scent. This is my personal experience.

I still have my original bottle, and after all these years, it’s only half empty — which says a lot.

Our hunt for Rose Ouds started with this wonderful scent in 2016, soon after we heard it was discontinued, we wore it exclusively as if it were niche.
If you are into refined rose-ouds but without the skank and fluff this is an excellent alternative.
Opens fruity and settles into a soft yet alluring rose.
It is elegant, warm and comforting and wears closer to the skin.
If you can score yourself a bottle, do buy it, this is a collectors’ classic.

Pear raspberry opening is very noticeable. The sweetness hits you first followed by the rose. The oud is just about there in the base as the fragrance evolves. It's a smell I've smelled before, but I don't know where.

I've been chasing this perfume for a while in an effort to not spend £250 on a bottle. I finally won it on an eBay auction for much less and it's the first time I've hesitated to take a plastic wrap off. It's lovely. I'm glad I own it. The thrill of the chase made the perfume a big deal to me, it's not that big a deal. It's nice. I will wear it. If I'd paid the resale price for it I'd be disappointed.

A fruity, floral, woody, musky, soft, warm fragrance that was nicely blended. This aroma is 100% unisex. Doesn't smell masculine or feminine. This also doesn't smell like a designer fragrance. It's more leaning in the aromatherapy category in my humble opinion. Nothing really groundbreaking about this. This is not a crowd pleaser, an attention grabber, or a panty dropper. Overall this is a boring scent that doesn't smell offensive & probably won't get you really noticed either.

The longevity is pretty solid. But I still normally layer my cologne with essential oils that are inspired by the fragrance itself to get the performance that I truly desire without having to keep overspraying myself to get that scent trail I like leaving behind as I pass by.

I would only wear this for.

1)Fall/Winter.
2)Job/Office.
3)Dressing casual or festive.
4)Running errands, shopping or movies.
5)Hanging with women that are 40 & over.
6)Going to a Franchise restaurant or an All you can eat buffet.
7) Happy Hour.
8)Relaxing at home.
9)Family gatherings.
10)Indoor activities.

I wouldn't necessarily reach for this.

1)Spring/Summer.
2)Going to the gym.
3)Trying to be noticed.
4)Special occasions or romantic evenings.
5)Hanging out with the fellas.
6)Hanging with women younger than 40.
7)Sports bars/Sporting events, concerts, strip clubs or Clubbing.
8)Going to the Casino.
9)Dressing rugged, sophisticated, dapper, youthful/Juvenile, sporty.
10)Outdoor activities.
11)Going to 5 star restaurant.

Many rose-first perfumes give me a headache but this is a wonderful exception. I don't find it oud-y, as others have said, but it is perfectly blended, classy without being formal, and for me has just the right sillage for work or other situations where you want to project just a bit. To me it smells like a rendezvous with a clandestine lover at a quiet museum in the afternoon.
It's beautiful
Intense unique fragrance, reminded me BlV from Bulgari, I loved it from the second I smelled. It is almost like a spell casted :)

i love this . it is a very strong oud fragrance with a lot of fruit to it. my grandmother used to wear this and everytime she did i could smell it from all the way from the kitchen . a little goes a very long way! i like to combine this with mfk oud silk mood to stabilize its intensity. the fragrance spurrs out of control like a rose blooming violently , the fruity deception when you first spray will gurantee suprise you but do not worry , this is a very real and very good oud fragrance.

I'm selling a 50ml sealed bottle
Email me at jordantzouvelis13@gmail.com
Gucci by Gucci OG but with extra oomph. Got it because my GbyG was running out and I couldn’t find it. Got this, not disappointed.

Oriental Rose

I own a lot of rose and oud-fragrances and this is definitely a rose fragrance. From the beginning all i could sense was the rose combined with pear and rasperry. Around 10-15 minutes later saffron and patchouli take over and make the rose creamy and seductive.
Until the end the rose is and remanins at the center of this fragrance.
I do not sense any oud at all... but maybe that's only me.

You can either consider this a Rose/Oud version of Gucci Pour Homme I with a fleeting Tom Ford Black Orchid undertone, or a better done version of Calvin Klein Encounter.

Either way i love it.
This is a lovely perfume--not too oudy... got a small pocket size yesterday

Sweeter than anticipated.
Has the Gucci by Gucci dna, but with a touch of oud and rose. Neither dominate. The rose and raspberry make it sweeter.
Happy to add this to my Gucci by Gucci family.
Still prefer the Gucci by Gucci edt. It’s less sweet.

Very beaufiful elegant and classy I love it when I spray on the clothes but if i spray on my skin it's going to be too shap oud and saffron note to my nose. Well I decided to sell it to my friend because I think I won't use it much then.

I really wanted to have this thinking that it must be different enough to have both based on the notes... but.... it smell the same as the original edp with a lot of delicate rose added & a bit more fruity & a bit spicy... i don't find it so heavy on oud at all. It's there but not much happened, but you still can smell it lingering like everywhere... it's more like a smooth soft woody notes in it... Funny thing is... this Oud version marketed as a unisex but it smell more feminine than the og EDP (while EDP smells more unisex)... very long lasting & very strong... be careful with how much you spray

Gucci Oud has a strong resemblance to Coach Rose d'Or. It contains a similar rich, juicy, almost-edible rose and orange blossom duet, as well as a brush of softly fruity-sour raspberry. However, Gucci Oud passes on the skanky, musky castoreum and replaces it with a very dry, nearly salted amber-patchouli accord that almost hints at a sandalwood note. Gucci Oud definitely has a middle-eastern vibe, so it's not surprise that it was launched there. That said, it is not particularly oud-y.

I smelled this on a male friend and was blown away. Loved the sillage. Got a bottle and it’s way more feminine than I remember. Very rose heavy. Probably have to be dressed in a tux with a carnation for a man to pull this off, but I’m gonna try it anyway and see how it goes.

Update: Gave it to a friend as he enjoys wearing more feminine fragrances.

Always found Oud to be overpowering and obnoxious. This was recommended by a friend as an intro to Oud and I was pleasantly surprised. The saffron is very much present and the fruits add a nice balance.

Elegant and classy scent, a little bit on the feminine side. At first the rose note is overwhelming but the dry down is amazing.
I would not call it an "oud" fragrance.
Herbal opening but the dry down is pleasant and easy perceive

This most definitely smells very close to Gucci by Gucci EDP with a more prominent spicy rose & Oud combo. Soft wearable Oud easy to enjoy by even non Oud lovers.. leans slightly more feminine imo but at the same time could still be very unisex & no one would tell otherwise. I'm sure if this had a name like Gucci by Gucci Noir or something this would have been a bigger hit people get so off put by "Oud" even though this is in no way off putting. I've smelled better but still well done, could even say easily blind buy worthy if you like Gucci by Gucci but hoped it was even a tad bit deeper.
Not the oud update I was looking for. To me, this smells exactly like Gucci by Gucci, but with a strong and prominent note of rubber Wellington boots.
Even if you are not a big fan of oud you probably will like Gucci. It is very soft and round. Oud here is not screaming. Well done fragrance. Feminine, I would not call it unisex.

I am a serious perfume collector. I just began a few years ago (after I quit smoking cigarettes) as my reward for quitting. I started out loving all things citrus and neroli. Then it evolved to fresh/clean scents. Then my taste became richer and darker. I have been looking for the perfect oud for a year. I have bought many high-dollar ouds that were highly recommended. Most smell great but I just got this one today and it is THE ONE I have been searching for all along! It is a WONDERFUL combination of fruit and oud. sweet and oud with rose. NOTHING beats this so far. I have paid up to 400 for designer niche oud perfumes and they don't even come close to this in my opinion! Best blind buy ever! By the way, most all of my selections have been blind buys. I live in the mountains of WV where there is little to no good shopping alternatives. Also, I am always looking online for the best deal.

Wow... What an under the radar fragrance. This wears great on guys. Wore it today received several unsolicited compliments. Ordering another bottle now. This shit is getting pricey. Love it as I do the intense version.
i am in love with this one , it is so sexy , for women that don't need to prove anything in this life:)

I will admit this was my first Oud perfume , I might have tried and that is a strong might have at a perfume counter , they knew me by name in Nordstroms and Macy's , or spritzed a friends . I had no other to compare { in owning } until recently . I was looking for a unique Oud Blend and found reviews on Oud Asgharali , on a different site . I decided to look around and found Habat Al Oud , after reading the notes , it was a blind buy that I was excited to purchase . I purchased a backup bottle without waiting to receive my first purchase , just because of the notes , a lustful scentual indeed . Seriously , I do not understand why HAO is not listed . It is superior , now my signature scent . The reason I even bring this one up is it sadly puts Gucci Oud to shame , literally . I don't think I'll wear my Gucci Oud , it is so weak , it stinks { on me } what you can detect , I truly don't get any notes singly or in a group . I bought the Gucci Oud on eBay and unless I got a dud it literally has little too no smell of Oudh . I paid about $60 for it 3 / 4 years ago . I'll wear Habat Al Oud or Trish McEvoy Black Rose Oud , Club de Nuit by Armaf . The notes of GO are so much weaker and really have no oomph to make it special or stand out on its own . I'll apologize now for going on about the Habat Al Oud , but truly you can smell it from just taking the lid off , and it is the same as when spritzed , that is how much I love . I dislike Gucci Oud , I'll have it a very , very long time if I don't end up throwing it away ~ On Ending , if you get a chance to smell or sample the Habat Al Oud , do so , yes it is sweet , longevity is 8 hours at least before she gets lighter , but honestly I can smell most , if not all the notes . I'll be on the look out for more Asgharali scentual fragrances as they're that special ~ I kept smelling my wrist after spritzing , I showered that night and used it just so I could go to sleep with this on my sheets . I slept well and with a smile on my face ~ /=^} ~

This one is okay for the first few minutes but then it turns to the normal Gucci guilty which I HATE!!!


I don't hate the scent, but I hate the transformation.

Fresh oud perfume, you can barely smell the oud - huge disappointment.

The orange blossom stole the shine unfortunately, should've been called Orange Blossom Gucci Guilty. If you don't like oud, you'll like this.

ريحته ريحة برتقال، حادة . ماله خص في العود قاصين علينا حسبي الله

Gucci Oud is a curious beast. It smells like pears, raspberries, and sweet oud in the bottle but on my skin it transforms into patchouli, tobacco, and leather and smells basically like old man. Is that what they meant by unisex? Yikes.

Oh, and of course the longevity is amazing since I hate it. I scrubbed and scrubbed and scrubbed and even after two days there was a faint whiff on my wrist.

An oriental masterpiece from Gucci. After reading some guys saying this could be a unisex scent, I tried it.
Westernized oud, spicy rose, slightly sour, rasberry, a noticeable powdery feel with the ethereal note of aromatic incense, I guess from the smooth combo of amber/saffron/patchouli . Very sensual and very pleasant. I'd love to smell it on a woman. I don't know if I could wear it.. I guess not.
If it had more depth and a touch of darkness, maybe more oud, resins, smoke etc, it could be easily unisex scent equal for example to Amouage or something very special.
Well, the price for the big bottle here is almost 11.000 rubles. In my opinion the smell does not justify the price tag.
Conclusion. It's an overpriced but beautiful feminine scent. Gucci could have done it better, I'm sure.
I like this simply because I love the smell of oud. However, this is admittedly a boring interpretation of oud.
Liked it, but became to feminine for me, so gave to the misses

I'm writing this review after having the blotter, under my nose, for the last two days... It reminds me so much of Gucci premiere, with just a tiny bit of oud thrown into it...

It's likeable but I expected much more!

Here I am, I’ve come back. It took me quite a while to form a "more rational" idea of Gucci Oud, perhaps because whenever I wear it I feel it kinda intimidates me.

I love the opening, a triumph of bitterness and rose that I find absolutely remarkable — every time I wear it, for the first forty/fifty minutes I can't help but sniff and think: "WOW!". In the initial concoction saffron is rather noticeable because I get a leather-spicy twist; as for the rest, I cannot say I distinguish every single note…anyway it’s very well blended and the result is harmonious. As it begins to dry down, Gucci Oud becomes sweeter and sweeter, but it never becomes too sweet because of the initial bitterness...it's an "oriental bitter-sweetness", very hard to find the right words to describe it! This second stage definitely pulls the scent closer to the feminine side, not too overtly feminine though, at least on my skin.

The presence of oud and patchouli is massive and in the final stage these are the dominant notes. In fact, oud is there since the beginning and it’s a “continuum”, patchouli instead shows up little by little and *sometimes*ends up being a bit over the top. No way you will go unnoticed while wearing Gucci Oud — this is a heck of a perfume with great longevity and strong projection. It does leave a powerful oriental trail, people will turn their heads and look at you as you walk by.

My only objection is that with a softer patchouli and perhaps more rose/different varieties of roses (Taif ❤ for example) this perfume, maybe, would be even better…who knows? I guess that Gucci, after this and Intense Oud, won't re-invest in oud so soon; it seems that the oud-frenzy of the past six/seven/eight years is now calming down. Oud has kinda “lost the wow-factor it used to have” and each mainstream designer has to ponder very well what he/she is doing with agarwood.

Anyway, in spite of the tricky patchouli and the boldness that characterizes this fragrance, I will always keep a lovely memory of Gucci Oud and pull it off proudly on more or less special occasions — like yesterday, for example.
