I don’t care if in the Middle-East they have plenty of cheaper/purer/truer oud-based perfumes that smell similar to this one. Gucci Oud means a lot to me and I got the feeling it will always be by my side to make the difference, to impress a memory, crystallize a moment.

Side note: The bottle is marvelous, I could spend hours staring at it on my dresser.

I finally found my new signature scent in this perfume. I used to wear the Gucci EDP (the brown one in the clear glass bottle), but it was discontinued and it's very hard to find now.

After a 2 year hunt, I happened upon what I had been missing - a strong, oriental female fragrance.

It is marketed as unisex, but I'd find it difficult to imagine a man wearing it. It's a bit on the heavy side, but definitely still within the female range.

The fragrance makes me feel sexy and confidence, and the Oud smell is so unique that to most people it's quite intoxicating. I've used two bottles of it now, and find it suits me as a strong signature scent and you can smell it for days afterwards..maybe even weeks. It definitely lingers - my now-ex-boyfriend used to say he could smell me for days afterwards in his car.

This perfume reminds me of a man, a man who lives by double standards and is both the most attentive and the most insufferably arrogant person on earth. He never listens to the others' opinions and never says sorry even when he is. The life of this man is pervaded by mistrust and he is unable to realize that people do grow fond of other people - that's inevitable. It happens, not because people wanna take advantage of him, but just because there is a real human connection. And Love. I love Gucci Oud.
To be frank, I expected more from this one. It's okay, but not lovable.

This was enjoyably surprising. When I first smelled it, I instantly thought of the original Gucci by Gucci for women because of its similar fruity notes. On first spray, you immediately get the oud note with pear and raspberry notes. It subsides in a few minutes to reveal a woody rose in perfect pitch with the oud. At this point it reminds me of Arabic oud mixtures, less geranium which can make it very high pitched and overly stringent. No problem here however. I'm a fan of rose notes which puts me in the minority of contemporary perfume lovers who seem to equate rose scents to dear old grandma.

With a lot of oud scents, Arabic and Western versions, the oud tends to overpower and take over everything. It becomes insistent and to me, rather irritating. I start to feel worn out by the oud. Gucci's oud stays around, but doesn't start to smell sharp or too dry. It keeps its gentle pace and lingers subtly.

Overall though, I still think it smells like GbG, though lifted because of the oud's woody and resinous nature, where GbG becomes a sweet juicy ambery "new chypre" concoction.

Marketed as unisex, it teeters towards feminine IMO, so men might step back a little in wearing this because of its floralcy and sweetness. The scent doesn't seem to go big and permeate a room, but stays close. A great go to when I care for something floral.

Victorious oud. I don't like oud usually but exception this.

For winter autmn;

Scent: 9/10
Long: 8,5/10
Sillage: 9,5/10

The first 30 minutes to one hour are a beautiful sweaty rose trapped in a moist plastic container with the dew drops slightly turning sour in a pretty manner. However after this passing phase, it is as if you have just sprayed the original Gucci by Gucci (brown bottle with the same shape)
I did not enjoy the original because it had a sharp quality that would cause mild headaches but is bearable and interesting on others.

An interesting long lasting scent with a lot of depth.
However, this should not be marketed as unisex in my opinion, it's just too feminine, I can't ever picture me wearing it again.
On women I would find very attractive as there is a certain classiness to it.

I love it, I'm enticed by these oudy, oriental fragrance. When I smell this I smell opulence & ceremony although I do feel it's more of a women's fragrance & Gucci Intense Oud is more of a man's fragrance

Oud at the top, heady, spicy, woody, slightly sour. The heart is where the rose comes in, but it is like rose petals, innocent and pretty, floating in a sea of wood and spice. I think this belongs in the same category as my beloved Prada l' eau ambree and Sensuous noir.
So in all honesty can MEN pull this off?? I wanna blind buy it but if it smells too much like womens perfume Im gunna be bumped

This is feminine. Very feminine.

This is more "floral oriental" or "floral spicy" than "oriental woody".

It is a nice smell but more feminine than masculine.

PS: this a fantastic floral smell for women! it's a killer romantic fragrance for women

Not at all creative nor innovative for a perfume, but let me tell you something.

Next to Gucci PH II, it's the only Gucci that smells natural, without, more or less pronounced, synthetic accord. The rose here is really beautiful. Until I've sniffed this fragrance, I thought the best rose in the mainstream genre is Cartier Declaration d'Un Soir. But the thing with d'Un Soir is that rose presented there is kinda' to jammy for my taste. This smells like plenty, thousands, millions of rose petals cascading from the air. And I mean it. Ok, we have a jammy moment here - right after it's sprayed on the skin, you can feel the jammy raspberry. But after 15 minutes it's gone.Luckilly, it's not too oudy when it dries down, the oud here is like a woody backbone to the whole fragrance.

Longevity is solid, over 10 hours on my skin, projection is rather moderate.

It should be cheaper though, it doesn't deserve the niche pricing.

Here's my problem. Any Oud fragrance that is marketed as "unisex" has either rose, saffron, vanille, raspberry, and all that jazz. This is one reason I feel such Oud fragrances are synthetized and emasculated. By this, the perfumer is flirting with the idea of having both sexes have fun (original oud from the Middle East is worn by men). Being an Oud-conscious cologne collector, I won't get this (Gucci Oud). But I could get Oud Wood, Tobacco Oud (Tom Ford), Oud Oriental (S. T. Dupont), Black Aoud (Montale), Bois D'Oud (Perris Monte Carlo) and of course Interlude (Amouage)! The aforementioned colognes are remarkably masculine scents that would suit my olfactive personality! And to make matters seemingly worst, Gucci is offering me a 50-75ml flacon of amorphous synthetized oud! Well, guys mail me if there's "Gucci Guilty Black Oud Pour Homme" in at least 90ml, EDP! Ok. Nevermind. Thanks!

Decided to stop off at Bloomingdales to hunt down & sniff Gucci's latest creation "Gucci Oud". It's well put together with many subtle notes of raspberry, saffron, rose, orange notes, white floral lilly-like with a synthethic musk-amber-oud hiding in the background. Yep, you guessed it; synthesized artificial "oud-amber-musk". After applying a single-squeeze on my inner wrist (no rubbing it in) it last for about 5hours which isn't bad for the price. It's not a horrible fragrance, although if you're a guy with thoughts of getting Gucci Oud blindly without smelling; the notes are slightly sweet, fruity, and floral while presenting a synthethic oud/musk/Amber as mentioned. Not worth retail price which was $135 for 2.5oz/75mL EDT. However it is made in a 1.7oz/50mL EDP for $110, but I doubt the overall notes would change. It's not bad, not horrible, but in my opinion this would fit best on a lady for a movie/dinner/office/fall/spring/winter.

My favourite perfume is Gucci by Gucci Edp and I am surprised that some of you find Gucci Oud very similar to that. These two are VERY different to my nose. Gucci by Gucci is honey-flowery-smokey with a little bit of masculin bitterness. This one is an oud bomb with a little bit of fruity sweetness and rose.
I would not recommend it for men, I think it seems to be unisex in the first couple of minutes but grows to be very feminin in the drydown with the sweetness and the rose. It smells like a rich Arabic lady from the Gulf Bay (no offense, half of my family is from there). My husband (who is Arabic) loved it but I'm not really into oud scents so I did not really like it.
i would love to find this in winners ...

I will precede this review by stating that I love Gucci by Gucci EDP. I found it unique, modern in a way and very classic in another.
Since Gucci by Gucci is now harder to come by, I am nose-shopping around for other perfumes I like that fill the same spot,preparing myself for yet another of my perfumes to become elusive.
I tried Oud yesterday. I like Oud perfumes, though a lot of them tend to be too dry.
I found the oud scent to come through loud and clear as a top note, though its dryness was cut down with a sweetness that reminded me a lot of the way Gucci by Gucci cuts its very masculine flavours with honey.
As time went, it reminded me more and more of Gucci by Gucci.
When I got home, I looked it up and recognized the saffron from its description on the Gucci site.
All in all, I liked it very much, though I wouldn't own both this one AND Gucci by Gucci due to their similarity.
I think I will go back to test it with one arm wearing Gucci by Gucci so I can compare them side by side and see which one I prefer.

Nov 7/14
Just tried Gucci Oud this evening at Hudson's Bay in Canada. Very, very beautiful and molto Gucci! Opens strong and woody and approx. 30 mins later... rose and saffron unfolds with a Smokey veiling that is Oh so alluring. The underpinning is certainly Gucci by Gucci EDP with a new twist, a hint of OUD. Has a post lingering of marsala wine (laugh) leaving a feeling of coziness and deliciousness. More of an evening perfume because of its depth, although very wearable in the daytime too. Easily a signature scent. Very long-wearing. This is Gucci alright and brings back memories of Gucci in the 80's..."the prominent female" (perhaps the days of Tom Ford with Gucci). I really like Gucci Oud and will certainly purchase it for myself. Grazie GUCCI, con amore❤ .
لاجديد في التوليفة كبقية عطور العود التي حوت هذه المكونات

Loved it from the first sniff. Especially the beautiful jammy rose. Along with saffron they are the most prominent notes to me untill the drydown comes. After the drydown there are three "main players" and these are rose and saffron (as before) plus oud and amber. Oud here is interesting, it's not dark nor smoky, rather woody.

Longevity is excellent on me, 10+ hours, sillage is good within 4 hours.

I'm waiting for prices to come down. Then I will be surely buying a bottle.

After having lived in the middle east and exploring many fragrances around the world in my military travels and have been exposed to Oud plenty of times. I agree with many that Gucci jumped on the bandwagon of the newest gimmick of including Oud in fragrances. I've smelled many different varieties of Oud mixed in many combinations. Westerners don't know this so of course its new and new can always be priced at a premium. I was very intrigued by this perfume and bottle and the fact that this one is labeled unisex because I really loved this bottle also so I went and got it. So far very hard to find as i'm typing this up. It was delivered to me and very excited to spray it and at first I was moved, WOW this is an amazing smell , very beautiful, but wait a minute. Why does this smell familiar? I realize looking over at the many different middle eastern oils I have of musks and oud , this perfume by Gucci isn't something new, its just repackaged. One can say all combinations of fragrances have been found and honestly todays "new" fragrances are just repackaged fragrances. The oils I bought in the middle east are cheap. They are pure perfume grade and if packaged to look expensive they would be, but they don't bullshit you. What you have here is just repackaged scent. I love it but the arabs have had these oud fragrances for the longest times and the idea of the european companies to try to get in the arab market is silly, because arabs are laughing at us for spending so much on these "oud wannabes" as I like to call them.

overall I love the smell, but I had to call it out on the bullshit.
Also I am a male, and I'll say not every guy will be able to pull this scent off.

This is a very pleasant surprise from Gucci (Premiere and flankers did not appeal); it's reminiscent of the original, which is a stunner, and is a wonderful combination of oud and rose. Welcome back Gucci.

I got a sample of this and I think it's more feminine than masculine.
It's quite a rich composition very warm with oud and amber.It's very well blended and yet it's nothing special.
It's very feminine with the addition of rose.
However since oud should play the main role here I can think of other much bettere scents with oud in it

عطر جوتشي عود أراه نسخة مقلده ومكرره من عطر ديفيد يورمان الإصدار المحدود
David Yurman Limited Edition 2011
والذي صدر عام ٢٠١١ بعبوة زجاجية لونها الداخلي بني محْمر .

جوتشي عود .. مصنف كعطر عديم الجنس لكن تغلب عليه الجينات الأنثوية !

مستوى الثبات والفوحان متوسط ..

Expect more from Gucci , my bf got a sample and I dislike it ... Smell lemony and it reminded me of insect killer spray .. First time I actually insult a fragrance this much ! Didn't pick up oud at all and I am a big fan of oud , This one is not for me :(
Got my hands on a sample of this and to put it simple ...Not for men at all and its not that great ...IMHO

Very sweet and more toward feminine side for first hour. It change to something masculine if the humidity be low or you not sweat. If humidity increase or you sweat, then the sweat scent screams again and you get stinky like a gum! Like a strawberry gum in the mouth of smoking man!

It's very pricey for its quality ..... If I was to purchase a rose oud, I prefer to spend on Dior Oud Ispanan instead. Oud Ispahan is more expensive, but the scent and quality you get from it is much more that what you get from Gucci Oud. Acqua de parma Colonia Intensa Oud is also amazing with similar price. Consider it if you want a Oud perfume ......

Longevity and sillage is better than most of the fragrances in the shop. The scent can be excellent, or it may turn to gum.

Recommend? hmmmm ...... You can smell it yourself and buy it for yourself, but do not give it to a men as a gift. For women it would be more safe .....
And again without the info who's the nose behind this. Does P&G have something to do with it or rather they hired a perfumer (perhaps Lorenzo Villoresi) again?

I highly doubt this is really being marketed toward men and women.. The notes look a lot more feminine than masculine and the bottle is the same as the Gucci by Gucci for women.. It does look interesting and I will try it if I ever come across it.. Gucci Oud, knew they would jump on the bandwagon, although I think they are kind of late..
I own this. Currently available exclusively at Dubai Duty Free. It is BEAUTIFUL!! Pricey but SO worth it!!
Will it be an "exclusive" release available in Gucci boutiques only? Looking at the price I'm assuming it will be just like I'm saying....
Finally something more interesting after so many boring mehh scents releases !

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Pure lilac, I loved it, sadly it was discontinued. Similar to gucci love 2024 in violet bottle.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I liked this well enough but didn't repurchase. It's sweet but almost in a candy apple way less in a fruity way. Peaches? With some pepper mixed in for balance, so I could see this being a unisex fragrance. Depends on your body chemistry. I could see myself repurchasing but as someone else said it's not really a standout, a bit generic.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Very boring generic fragrance you would smell at the check out counter of any department store, not memorable either.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: That first spritz really reminds me of Bvlgari Omnia Coral... & then it darkens & warms up the same way Gucci Rush does on my skin, I feel like I get the Caramel note very early on with the Lilac, Peach & Violet sitting reaaal nice & then the Patchouli, Amber & Caramel seep through 😍 one of my fav blind buys! It smells very different to the Original on my skin!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I have both of the original formulations of Gucci Guilty, and Gucci Guilty Intense, which are basically indistinguishable to me. They are my husband’s favorite, and one of the only ones in my giant collection he ever compliments or comments on one way or another, so for that reason I’d had my eye on Gucci Guilty Black for a long time. Found a bottle from a reseller at a reasonable price, so I blind bought it. The difference between it and Gucci Guilty OG and Intense is so minimal that I wish I hadn’t bothered. It smells almost exactly the same, and if I were try to blindly determine which was which, I guarantee that I could not. At least I have plenty of this discontinued scent though, so my husband will be happy lol.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Gucci Guilty Black is a truly captivating fragrance! The initial burst of red berries and pink pepper is so vibrant and alluring. It settles into a beautiful floral heart with hints of raspberry and peach, which adds a touch of sweetness without being overpowering. The base notes of patchouli, amber, and caramel create a warm and sensual dry down that lasts for hours. This perfume is perfect for evening wear and makes me feel confident and glamorous.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
I love this one, by far the best from the Guilty line. At last I found the most airy and soft violet which gives subtlety and is not as heavy, outdated and mature as the one in EDP.
The fragrance is beautiful, elegant, airy, enriched with sparkling red fruits and berries. It's also the most sensual of the line thanks to subtle peach and caramel. Such a beautiful everyday scent.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
dark and very strong compared to other female fragrances, hated it at first but then it grew on me. you dont need more than 3 sprays for it to be too much, as i said it is very strong.

perfomance 10/10 :)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
I overspray this like a mad woman but the scent still doesn't seem to project. I get whiffs of it here and there but there's no scent bubble, it becomes a skin scent almost immediately.

The smell itself is pleasant, smells like berries, violet and patchouli. It smells a bit bubbly, fizzy due to the red pepper and patchouli.

Overall it smells like a nice shampoo and I mostly use it casually on the days that I feel like wearing something light and non intrusive.

I would't buy this again due to bad projection. Not to be hars but I've had deodorants that are stronger then this. My bottle is from 2022.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: @Forbiddenjade's review does justice to this perfume. I like it more than the recent Gucci Guilty versions. Applause to Aurelien Guichard for creating what for me is a mood booster and sophisticated but youthful feeling perfume. I find that the fruit (not too sugary), is balanced well with floral and warm elements with hints of spice and powder.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
I agree with the some of the comments below, there's nothing dark and mysterious about this one. But, it's sweetness is alluring, sexy even. Now, pour femme or not, this is absolutely unisex, as long as it's worn in cooler weather. Projection is not huge, but its there and it's enough with 3+ sprays. I lament that the scent doesn't develop further than its top, merely fading over time (about 6 hours).

If you happen to stumble on a pre-2016 collecting dust on a shelf somewhere, grab it. The later releases just before discontinuation are so diluted it's absolutely not worth your money.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I don’t understand the hate but this is genuinely a very pleasant performer. It’s not offensive to start with and it’s also not weak to be a skin scent but this will definitely make heads turn. The composition is great but I am not getting hints of red pepper.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
Quick update- paired the Nebras with Gucci Guilty Absolue- wow. Softened it up but still packs a punch without the headache for me.

Layered the new Gucci Guilty parfum in gold and pink which was just sitting there living with me being mad at it for being so dang boring— Nebras brought it to life. I can wear both of these again now.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
Black? Seductive? Mysterious? Vampy? Guilty?
Where?!
Bad? Absolutely not.
It’s just that the whole marketing from name to bottle to add campaign is way off from the scent IMO.
GGB starts with juicy sweet red berries on soft powdery florals, ending with a well behaved patchouli and warm sweet amber. Lovely and pleasant, maybe flirty at most, but not deep or dark by any means.
I find the Guilty and Flora lines from Gucci pleasing but not ground breaking. However I love their Bloom line. It has so much more character.
Also the performance of GGB is like a weak edt not an EDP.
To be considered if you have a small collection and you are looking for a fruitchouli where patchouli doesn’t overpower, but if you are a collector with a wide selection, it’ll probably be redundant.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
Call it basic but I always loved how soft and pretty this scent was. Of course- Gucci watered it down and then discontinued it, making my remaining bottle a serious disappointment.
However— I got Lattafa’s Nebras today and since it has some similar notes but is just a touch linear, I thought it might layer well with it. Well guess what Guilty Black girls n’ boys— I have something even better than both Guilty Black or Nebras now. The Nebras makes the Gucci pop again and then turns into a vanilla velvet with the faintest florals. Let the mint die down for a minute, but once it does it’s very smooth.
I also layered with Lalique Amethyst, which I like but does get a hair too sharp for me at times. The Nebras accentuated the red berries that I love and smoothed over that sharpness that I don’t always want with a light vanilla frost.

Tried to layer with Very Good Girl (Carolina Herrera) and it was just meh, took the sparkles out of it.

Hope this helps someone rejuvenate an old bottle of Guilty Black! Happy Spraying!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
I am from Brazil.
The text was translated by Google.

The dark bottle has nothing to do with the fragrance.
The output is comfortable and a little creamy, reminiscent of a moisturizer.
The sweetness of the fragrance is very light and refined.
The exit brings me memories of perfumes used to aromatize designer stores, remembering the smell of a mall.
The red berries and raspberry are more sour than sweet.
In the evolution, the violet note leaves the fragrance slightly powdery, and the fruit smell (which was already very light), practically disappears, leaving the evolution, zero sugar.
In the final phase, a sweet smell appears (would it be the caramel note?) But it is a very light sweet, nothing gourmand.
Gucci Guilty Black is NOT the style of club perfumes. The fragrance is simple and smooth, but very tasty and well balanced, like those perfumes that you can't stop smelling.
At least on my skin, it's a joker perfume, which can be used in the workplace and in the classroom.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: smells like a cherry blossom scent from bath and body works or l’occitane.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Heavy, sweet lilac belongs in cool weather. (Sickening in the heat.) Syrupy, waxy floral.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
This is way, way better than the original and all other flankers. It is standing on its own, though vaguely retaining their DNA.

The red fruits here are so well balanced with flowers and Patchouli and Amber. On my skin, reacting with my pH, this exudes in a much refined, smooth scent. Very classy, and I wouldn't have guessed without testing it.

It does not project beastly, but it's perceivable and persistent with a great consistency. It doesn't fade or morph into a disfigured rendition of its top notes. All seems to work in harmony creating a demure sophistication, a comforting aura around me. I only sprayed it once on the back of my hand and yet people stopped me to ask what it was that I wore.

I love it and recommend it to those with rather dry and colder type of skin like mine. I'm pretty sure that the slightly alkaline pH would make this fragrance sing like a nightingale. As it does on me. Who'd have said?

Buy testers as I think that this needs a particular chemistry to release its magic. A keeper for me, and a decent 7/10. I'll enjoy wearing this daily, everywhere.

PS: this nose knows magic, I'll check his other works!

UPDATE: 2 hours in, the Amber and red fruits are singing from my skin!!!!

"Casta Diva, che inargenti
Queste sacre antiche piante,
A noi volgi il bel sembiante
Senza nube e senza vel...
Tempra, o Diva,
Tempra tu de' cori ardenti
Tempra ancora lo zelo audace,
Spargi in terra quella pace
Che regnar tu fai nel ciel..."

This. Is. Suave. Plaisir. My 7/10 went up to a fat, round 10!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: great if you're looking for a fruity patchouli that manages to be work-appropriate and doesn't smell like it needs to be worn to a club.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Super pretty. I ended up falling in strong like/love with the slightly sweet, lilac-patchouli amber of Gucci Guilty EDT (2021). Gucci Guilty Black (2013) is a slightly sweeter, fruitier, bolder version. I adore the raspberry blast at the start but the drydown is very similar (but not completely the same). This is the more outgoing older sister of GG 2021 EDT. Gucci was foolish to discontinue this! I don't think it smells dirty, but it has an interesting accord from the purple floral amber patchouli that may not be for everyone. I find it soft enough to wear in multiple settings.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Have just ordered a bottle after finishing a decent sized sample. It just works for me, and is ok in lots of settings. It's on the cusp of darkness, but is a creamy sensual fragrance that is really enjoyable to wear. Love it, one of my top 3!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Very light but I get very sexy whiffs of Violet and Amber.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I remember testing it when it first came out and it took me this long to get a bottle. I have been looking for a lilac perfume, which I love to wear between mid April and mid May when the lilacs bloom. To my nose this is a very clean, gentle lilac and peach, with surprising longevity. I actually smelled some lilacs in bloom and can't say it is a realistic lilac scent, but somehow it is recognisable as lilac and the peach makes it less floral and more sweet. I can see how it can be dismissed as a clean floral, but to me it is very special and it feels posh. Definitely prefer it to Idyll Love Blossom, which I used to have. Bottle doesn't match the scent at all. It is more "strength in gentleness" than femme fatale. Husband asked why I got a "Batman" Perfume and now I can't unsee it...

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: It reminded me of a fruitier version of pour femme but it didn't last past an hour on my skin.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
Ended up giving it away to my stepsister who loved it at first sniff. It smells incredible on her but not on me. The patchouli, pink pepper & violet where more prominent and gave me headaches. It's my chemistry for sure because on the bottle and on her it smells fruity sweet with the warmth of the amber/pink pepper and cozy powdery violet.

Any fragrance with patchouli on it turns bitter and sharp on me 😑

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I don’t know how to feel about this one. It is fruity, but it is absolutely nothing like the original gucci guilty. It doesn’t have very good lasting power at all, I guess those who are particularly keen on fruity scents may well be into it. I think I’ll be donating this one.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Guilty black pour femme is a fruity sweet perfume but it’s not your basic fruity sweet perfume... it's bold and sexy!! It’s sweet and juicy from the berries and peach with powdery violet and lilac and some spice from the pink pepper. The base is warm, ambery, caramel and the patchouli is just right. It’s a compliment monster and makes me feel like a baddie!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I wish this perfume had better longevity as it last about 3 hours on my skin :( Beside that it is very pretty perfume,fresh and juicy with some touch of warmth.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: A very pretty, soft, juicy and fresh scent. Agree with the reviewer below that this isn't a "sexy, dark scent." But I find it pleasant, wearable, and quite feminine. A "like," but perhaps not a "love". Good for a young adult maybe.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Most misleading name and bottle design ever? Gucci Guilty Black is not a dark, sexy fragrance for illicit encounters or date nights - or it wouldn't be my first choice for that anyway. It's actually a pretty, friendly, easygoing floral I wear to work and to hang with family! Very berry, lilac, and violet forward (but not just another candied violet; the berries are the star with lilac as a strong supporting act). Good for any time other than high heat, particularly cooler weather. Moderate longevity. Familiar smelling, but nice enough to use up before moving on to something else not blind bought :P

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
I love Gucci so I had to try for I found it at Saks 5th off for half price . The opening reminds me of Alien Fusion with it pink pepper opening with a touch of its Mandarin sweetness. It not a bold or over a powering opening, but a light pretty scent but I did have to spray twice for it's either really light on my skin or a very close to a skin scent.

But wait, time passes and now I can smell it very nicely. I can smell the Lilac and Geranium with the peach blending them together for a lovely floral scent with a touch of the pink pepper lagging behind them. I really like it for the projection is growing still but its not annoying, but fun, a very feminine scent that feels like spring/summer is here.

It was very impressed how long it lasted. It goes into it's dry down of a creamy amber combine with Geranium and Lilac which the I love for they both have a lovely floral sweetness . I don't think this scent will appeal to some people for you have to like pink pepper along with the floral notes I listed but to me they blended very nicely into a different, lovely, fun, pretty, scent.

Can't wait to try it this summer for its working great in cold winter months. Good for day or night use!!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
With a name like that, I expected something dark, sexy, warm and spicy. Instead I get an overwhelming fruity sweetness that dries into a powder with a hint of spice. This isn't at all what I expected and I was let down.

On me, this initially went on very sweet with an almost waxy kind of quality (I was getting slight Lipstick On from MMM vibes right at first). The fruitiness was right there at the front as well. Through the middle I picked up on some of the spice and then it dried down to be less sweet, more powdery and creamy. Still, this doesn't smell like a mature, elegant, or classy fragrance. Someone mentioned it's more suited for parties and dates and I have to agree. Definitely a fall/winter night fragrance. I couldn't imagine this being worn any other time, it's way too cloying for me.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
This is absolutely my new favorite perfume - I love it so much! Beware of dupes, those smell vaguely like Gucci Guilty Black should, but they are just a puff of air compared to the real thing.
The real GGB is sweet, subtle and fresh, and the longevity is quite good. I can smell berries with pink pepper and possibly raspberry, with sweet and tender amber caramel base.
On top of that it's somehow different from anything I smelled/owned before, win-win for me definitely.
Surprised to see people comparing it to regular Gucci Guilty, they are very different on me, the latter missing the tang of berries and caramel sweetness. On the contrary, it's rather similar to Dior Addict Eau Delice (unfortunately discontinued).

So here's to my new found love for berry scents!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
This will be an unpopular view, but for me it's just 'meh'. I got bought this as a birthday present a few years back and I have continually tried so hard to like it.

It's safe, granted, but to me smells generic. It's trying to be dark, but there is no depth behind it. It's what good girls wear if they are trying to be daring. It's not sweet, but there is no oomph here. There are no stand-out notes for me, and sillage and longevity is weak.

I think what I'm trying to get at is that this is a perfume that just... smells like perfume. Does that make sense?

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
This is what regular Gucci Guilty is supposed to be.
I was never bothered when it appeared: I simply ignore all perfumes advertised and pushed hard into my throat. While decluttering my home I found a small sample, this peel off one and it smelt just gorgeous. Very similar to City Rush by Avon which I own but wasnt aware GG was an inspiration. I tried to found a good deal, bought a mini bottle off Ebay, found a small sample at home and in a meanwhile I blindly bought GG black. I tried my sample of GG and huge disapointment.... I cannot stand initial note of it. I was worried about my blind buy of GG black, started to consider resale or return... but, we only live once! Opened it yesterday and this is the beauty from my peel off sample! It has nice fruity opening and carmel! It also smells beautiful on clothes. Great buy, Ilike it a lot and find it much better than GG EDT.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
I love fruity scents that have a little substance beside the fruit notes, and Guilty Black is just that. It opens with peach and raspberry, which are sweet and remind me of gummy candy here. But the intense, dry pink pepper, musk, powdery violet and hints of lilac balance the scent, so it smells like a good perfume and not like some gummy bear bodyspray. In the base I get patchouli and amber too, so the fragrance turns warm and slightly sensual. It becomes better the longer I wear it, contrary to Guilty Intense, which has a nice opening, but is lacking in the drydown, at least on me.
The only thing I would criticise about this is that I wish the lilac note was a little stronger.

Guilty Black is more flirty than deeply sexy and "guilty", and not a black or dark scent. I would say the gold packaging from the other scents of the Guilty line would be more fitting with this, maybe with some red or dark pink accents.
I don't think I'll buy it, because my collection is so large, but this is a pretty and versatile scent. I'd happily use it if I got it as a gift or if I found it for an extremely good price.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
oh how i love the old gucci guilty line........its one of my favorites for a lilac scent :) for this particular version the lilac & violet smell amazing !!! its blended so nicely....comes off smooth & elegant :)

i was wearing this the other day & it made me wonder why in the heck did gucci mess with a great thing lol..........the old guilty line is so wonderful BUT the new gucci line well for me just doesnt cut it (well i havent tried the love edition one so maybe that one might be ok lol )..........but the others just dont compare............if u havent tried the old line - try it - all the versions are simply beautiful :) especially if u love lilac :)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I really want to like this, but I can get past the fact that the opening smells like a Huggies pamper.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: This v lightly spiced, it's incredibly smooth, it's not a nose hitter. In terms of being sexy you'll need to be feeling fairly sexy already n have got close up to smell this on someone, it doesn't project that much. I don't get obvious berries either, it's very well blended, nothing stands alone, which I personally prefer. It's soft, smooth, sweet n creamy, skin scenty, maybe a tiny bit of smoke in the vanilla at the end. It's a fresh vanilla, not heavy. I may have to get another bottle before it disappears. Don't know how I failed to notice this until just now, I think it's perfect.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
Beautiful, very well blended. Smells like juicy berries (but it's not immaturely fruity, not in a way I'd consider 'girly' and juvenile), smooth milk chocolate, and yes, as someone said below, paper money.

The red berries are definitely there, but very well blended with the sweeter, smoother notes, so they aren't sour or stringent in any way. I don't particularly distinguish the pink pepper, it's well incorporated and gives spice and body to the fragrance. The amber-caramel medley makes it particularly warm and cozy, and gives that 'freshly opened chocolate' feel.

The reviewer who said this smells like the purple Johnsons Baby was spot on - it really does! However, the gourmand notes add extra sophistication to the blend, and the berries make it a bit more fun.

Something I don't quite like is the smoky note in the dry-down - where does this come from? I think the fragrance could have done without, which would have made it my ultimate any occasion, extra cozy, ultra huggable but still sexy and mysterious fragrance. That smoky note, probably added for additional pretentiousness, is a bit too mature and contrasts with the general vibe of the perfume.

Speaking of which, the general vibe is not really 'guilty'. It's more like 'warm, embracing, but I have a couple of secrets of my own'. I love it, but the longevity and projection make me sad, really weak.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
Oh. Well, that's disappointing. I love Guilty Intense and I was giddy with excitement trying this because I thought it would be an improvement on Intense, but... it's a little boring? Opens very sweet with the red fruit and I can also immediately pick up on the caramel toffee scent, but it's not a real, molten caramel. I think Boss Private Accord does that a lot better. There's a mix with some soapiness that stays clear from being sharp, but only just. The patch is dry and heavy, but the development of the notes is a bit disjointed, like they don't mix well together and they're fighting for dominance. The pepper is hardly noticeable in the beginning, but after half an hour I do get spicy. Still, I'm left with a very distinct feeling of 'meh'. Overall, it even smells a little cheap.

It's as if someone requested Guilty Intense to be sweetened for sexiness. Instead, Guilty Black is only sweet in the opening, and then it dries to a drab dry soapy scent with a vague caramel background and something else that reminds me of deodorant spray. It's not an improvement. It's not sexy. And it gives me a slight headache. Pass.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
This opens VERY sweet raspberry. At first I thought OH NO but as it dried down more nuances came out to play. I once heard that every Gucci fragrance has a note in the base that in reminiscent of paper money. So now I hallucinate that note in every Gucci scent.

Anyway the opening on this is very different than the drydown, which is less peppery berries and more powdery ambered peach.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
First whiff is very juicy and sweet, the red berries hit you on that first spritz immediately. Then I get a very heady, powdery patchouli that's very sexy and powerful. I enjoy the dry down most, I get the caramel and it's not so assaulting on the nose which it can tend to be. I get a lot of compliments on this one, people seem to enjoy this a lot. I guess it's less painful on the nose when it's smelled from afar. My boyfriend likes this a lot, I own a lot of perfumes and constantly am rotating which one I wear each day but he never fails to compliment me when I wear this one. He keeps asking me what perfume I am wearing when I have this one on. I guess he can never remember LOL
Projection for me is close to beastly, I can walk into a room and people can smell me from afar. Longevity is a good 8-10 hours on my skin, I can still smell this even after scrubbing myself vigorously with a loofa and copious amounts of body wash.
This is generally a likeable perfume for all. If you're meeting someone or a group of people for the first time and not sure what to wear in order to not offend yet still leave an impression on them (albeit that impression might be one of sexiness) then wear this. It's very rich and sexy and strong enough but does not offend at all.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Oh my do I love this! I have great love and appreciation for the original Guilty, and this one is a flanker well done. This is the berries version of Guilty. More berries, less musk. Black is thus, sweeter, more powdery, more fruity. This is on the fruitchouli side, together with my beloved Jimmy Choo Signature EDP, Miss Dior Cherie, Flowerbomb... if you own any of the mentioned, you may not need this one. Although, I would say it is worth having on its own because of the pretty violet and lilac accord.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: It's odd - My mom purchased this for me when I was quite young, 7th or 8th grade, as I smelled it during a mother-daughter trip to the mall in Nordstrom and loved it. Now, as a 19 year old in college, I remembered this perfume and went to repurchase. The first thing it reminded me of is....baby powder!? I don't get that sharp freshness from the berries at all, but rather, a sickening powdery smell. The pepper definitely comes through, though. I just remember this perfume smelling gorgeously elegant and mature, like a strong, sensual young woman. Perhaps my body chemistry changed. I literally sprayed it on myself in the car, after I purchased it, and went right back in to return it minutes later, lol.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
This is fruity done right! It’s jammy, soft and sexy. It reminded me of Guilty Absolute, but Black is darker, softer and simpler. It’s very pleasant, but doesn’t project well and it’s not really long lasting.
Anyways, really pleasant fragrance. Good for dates.
Final note: 7,5/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Gucci Guilty...To me this is a light, youthful and innocent fragrance. It is nice and last at least 7 hours on me. But doesn't bring to mind sexy or guilty. It takes me back in time when my children were babies. Because to me this smells so much like Johnson and Johnson baby lotion, the original in the pink bottle. The most predominant notes imo are the berries and lilac.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: My signature scent! My man allso like this one very much😍 love IT! I mostly smell the divine lilac in IT AS the original one❤️

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Oh how I love this perfume....it’s just yummy! I just feel damn good when I wear it...hell yeah!!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: The more mellow Gucci Guilty version, without biting spice. Amazing. I finished my 15 spray bottle, will going to buy another full sized one.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
This is in my top two favorites. It's sweet, but clean and sensual. It is Light, but smoldering at the same time. I purchased it, and YSL Black Opium together.
My everyday fragrance. I was shopping on vacation and tried it. Outside the plaza, my husband asked if it was me that smelled so good. It doesn't last as long as a few others, but it definitely lingers on the skin the next day. Men love this scent, and I do too. I am on my third bottle. The only thing I do not care for, is the dye in the perfume. It stained my white blouse pink! I was under the impression that it was only the glass on the bottle that was pink!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: As a guy I would love to smell this on a girl! Sprayed some in ULTA and wow this is defientlty a sweet berry & peach with a slight make up vibe to it. 100% date night scent. Or night out with your friends. I feel this could defiantly be a all year round scent maybe just hold a few sprays back in the summer.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
This is a warm sweet fragrance. The fruity sweetness hangs just on the edge of too sweet but never crosses the line. The patchouli, amber, and floral notes keep this fragrance in control and give it the warmth that tempers the sweetness.

It feels a little young but not so young that I am uncomfortable wearing it. It also seems to lack something to really give it a unique scent. Its not exactly generic but it doesn't have the wow factor.

Longevity is moderate and it leaves an impressive scent trail. All in all its nice but probably not something I need a FB of .

Edit: I had a mini bottle of this so I continued to wear it. The more I wear it the more I love it. It last about 7 or 8 hours and almost everyone finds it to be pleasant. It isn't particularly complex but its a nice basic fragrance. I think I have changed my mind about the need for a FB after wearing this scent for about a week.

EDIT 2: Gucci Guilty Black has become one of my standard cool weather fragrances. I wear it frequently from October through February or March. Love it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
Looove love love it!!
So similar to the gucci guilty (gold), but thats fine for me since that is my nr1 fav frag in the world!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Miguel: I say go for it, LOL!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I love so much this scent that I want to smell it all the time... My wife smells really nice, I can't get out of her neck!!!... hahaha . Can I wear it too?

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: A fairly standard fruity floral. Surprisingly soft and mellow for the brand and notes list. Not that interesting, you have smelled this before.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Another great addition to the Guilty range, I heard great things about this so tentatively blind bought it! Luckily it’s gorgeous. It’s a smoky, patchouli, berry flanker, like Guilty’s naughtier cousin. I love the Guilty range and always get compliments. Highly recommended!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: this bottle is sooo unpractical :( when it comes to an end, you can't spray whatever left at the bottom :(( scent itself it's not to bad

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
Fruity scent with noticeable berries mixed with pink pepper. To me it smells a bit smokier that Guilty Intense, the parchouli is more prominent here. I get a little bit of violet after the drydown.

Playful, sweet, heavier evening fragrance. I would prefer more prominent floral notes to it so it would make it really different to Guilty Intense.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I prefer the original to it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
Open with fresh fruity berry before slowly fade away till flora, patchouli along with hint of pink pepper appear and finally drydown with amber and powdery scents.

I think this perfume is beautiful fruity flora, feminine, sweet but has a hint of "dark aura" ( I understood why they call "guilty" and "black" ) that made me feel elegant, power and mystery.

And it's more interesting because the longevity for my (very quickly absorbed) skin is long lasting and the sillage is good even if the average is moderate. I sprayed at 7 a.m. and now 6 p.m. I can smell it. seem like it's suitable for my chemical.

I can wear it both of day and night. ( happy! )

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: i just got it from a swap and i really like it. it seems to be similar to original, but i am no expert, i just barely tested it some time ago. Gucci Guilty Black is not a perfume i would wear for profesional situations, quite the opposite. it has a vibe of dates, parties and ocasions like these. i will update later how much i like it after some time, but now it seems to be perfect for winter and for coming holidays festive season. i got it on a day that was good for me, and the fragrance captures well the feeling of optimism and confidence. very feminine as well, sensual and flirty in a grown up way. pretty much all the good things i expect from a fragrance in black bottle. like it a lot!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Gucci Guilty Black for women is a lovely floral with fruity berry notes with a hint of spice and patchouli. It’s longevity and sillage is moderate, may be few hours on my skin. However the scent is not a typical floral but different in a sexy way. It is a bit similar to the original Gucci Guilty but has more depth and lasting power. .

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
I first gave a negative review of this eau de toilette but after two weeks of owning it I have had a change of heart. I get so many compliments on this one! And the more compliments I received, the more it helped to realize that this EDT was actually worth my impulse buy.
This smells like red berries done right, that it doesn't smell synthetic or like syrup. Just right. It also makes me think of chocolates. Lastly I love the blown up patchouli on this one. It's heavy so it smells like dollar bills that have been sitting in the wallet for a long time. It smells like men in dark business suits and vegas. Money money money and POWER. It smells sophisticated, and rich, and sensual. Definitely one for night time but I wear this even to work and I get so many compliments from men and women alike. I absolutely have fallen in love with this power flacon. If you want to smell sexy yet sophisticated and powerful, wear this.
Sillage - heavy
Longevity - about 4-5 hours on me

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
A true lady scent. This is a classy, mature, and powdery floral-fruity perfume. Such a good take on the powder smell and presenting it in an intimate way. I'm not a fan of the opening, but the dry-down is too feminine, sensual, and remarkable. It could be light in sillage, but it's longlasting and noticeable from a close range.

Again Aurelien Guichard is behind such a subtle perfume. Now I can call him the powdery-notes-man, for his (Narciso Poudre) + (Valentino Poudre) + (Trussardi My Name, which resembles the most innocent baby powder ever).

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Mmmm this perfumes is sweet, fruity then floral...i like it better than the original.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Hmm... it's a fruity-sweet fragrance that becomes powdery in the dry down. I wouldn't say it's original or sexy or dark for that matter. I get the pepper only in the first few minutes, then the fragrance softens and becomes creamy. Still, probably better to use for the night as it might be too cloying during the day. The original is definitely more 'guilty'.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I smell sweet, fruity then floral. I love it!!!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I really disliked the original gucci guilty because it smelled like baby powder and nothing else on me. This is really nice because of the berry note. It is more complex and sexy than the original. Longevity and sillage is moderate.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I was recommended this by someone who said it gives somewhat of the same impression as my signature scent, Hugo Boss Intense. Smelling them next to each other I see what she means. Intense has a slight sporty/shaving cream/unisexy edge to it though, and this one doesn't. This one is sweeter as well. It's nice, but not a love.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I have this and I can't seem to reach for it, not my favorite at all. Open to swaps

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
This fragrance is almost as confusing as its predecessor, boring, mildly fruity, and peppery but I can't really tell a difference between this and Guilty. This one is slightly more fruity.
This fragrance is in a word, nice, not bold, daring, mysterious, dark, just nice. I really don't think this is an addition to the Guilty line, it's almost exactly the same to me.
Just like Guilty this perfume is only guilty of having a misleading name and the only mystery I'm left with is why its called Guilty Black as though it was a sexy or sexier version, but it's not. Although the long winded description says it, this perfume is not breaking any rules

I won't be purchasing the full size; the pepper in this one gives me a headache

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I think I was expecting something a little darker and more mysterious than this, based on the name and the sleek bottle. It's not a particularly inviting scent. It's predominantly fruity - but the raspberry feels a little more sour than sweet. I can faintly detect the pink pepper, but the remaining notes are lost on me. It's not bad, but it doesn't make the 'raw and compelling' statement it claims to.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: It smells like a cherry hand cream. Even my husband asked me if I changed the one I've been using and bought a cherry one. No sillage at all, all skinscent-y. It's nice, but I prefer Intense version better.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I received this perfume as a present before my trip and I really like it. Its sweet fruity smell has a long durability and power. However, it's not annoying. It's quite feminine and maybe too sweet for me and definitelly doesn't have any "dark" notes as it could indicate the serie Black. But still a good perfume which I will always associate with my travel :)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: The packaging and advertising don't match the juice. There's nothing dark, deep or sexy about this fragrance. I actually find the original Guilty more interesting. This is a nice, inoffensive powdery, baby wipe scent with a touch of barely there sweet fruits and an almost unnoticeable and very clean patchouli. I was expecting a vavavoom, sexy time scent, but this is simple, quiet, boring, good girl fragrance. There isn't a sexy bone in her body.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
Quick burst of red berries then a hit of pink pepper and purple flowered smoke on a bed of green amber :)

Lovely little rainbow :)

L: Moderate/Low
S: Soft

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: sweet and chic This one is my favorite of the Gucci Guilty.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Sweet and Smokey but hardly fruity imo.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Dark Sweet And Smokey! This one is my favorite of the Gucci Guilty. Looking for something dark and sweet, then this is it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I love the way this one smells on clothes rather than skin. It is very mild and has this mature smell to it. It's a cool day time perfume and can be a signature scent too. I'll definitely purchase another bottle.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I like this one, but I probably wouldn't purchase. It isn't very unique. On initial spray, the berry note is prominent. On me, the drydown is creamy, but doesn't turn powdery at all. I don't get the lilac or violet at all, mostly fruit.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
Right off the bat, this one smells a little like sweet baby powder because of the pepper, violet and lilac, but after a few minutes, the peach is definitely noticeable. It's nice and ripe, yet not in that way that makes your mouth water. After that fruit wears down, it feels more well rounded. It is so delicate and dry and warm, though the fragrance was inspired by "danger." Patchouli isn't really present on my skin until the end, but it isn't super prominent and just gives a good edge to the violet. After eight hours of wear, I can finally notice raspberry and amber, and it pulled something vanilla on me!
I do prefer this Black version over the originals, since they lack a "something." I think the red berries in this juice did the trick.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
Like it, I think this scent would please enyone. Could be a blind buy for sure.
First notes are creamy, sweet, like heliotrope, I gues it's violet, lilacs and red berries. And at dry down there's sweet light amber. Very luxurious smell. I feel rich wearing this.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: nice fruity sweet frangrance. Not too young or mature, not too sweet or weak. A bit sexy everyday wear. Not special enough to be memorable or classic. The advertisement poster doesn't reflect the style of the scent at all

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
I like a fragrance with patchouli in it. I, a person who can't stand the thought of patchouli let alone the actual smell, like a fragrance with patchouli in it. There is hope for every patch-o-phobe out there, LOL!

On a slightly more serious note, I have to say that I was very pleasantly surprised by GG Black. I have the original GG and I don't know what I was thinking when I bought it because all I can smell is patchouli when I first spray it and it makes me gag. This, however, comes across in a much different way to me. The patchouli is present, but it seems more well-behaved and tolerable. Perhaps it is the opening sweetness of berries and gentle nuances of lilac that calm the patchouli down; whatever it is, this is a thing of delightful beauty on my skin and I'm seriously considering buying a full size version once my little sample is gone.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
Gucci guilty Black, found This version discounted and had to have it:) bought it Without smelling it, based on The reviews here. I have Never tried any of The GG Line before, it just did not have my interest, untill now. This is very surprising, youthful and fruity,mainly cherries.
Sillage and longevity is moderate, This is probably due to it being an EDT.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: It's noting special but not bad at all... Smells like cherries in my eyes..

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I was neither not a fan nor a fan of Gucci Guilty. I'm sure I've sprayed it a few times in passing but found it vague/immemorable. Struck by the more constrasting bottle, I decided to try this one and the dry down is 90% like Dior Addict Eau Delice. It has maybe a dollop less of Vanilla, but the Cranberry/Vanilla combo is definitely there. The beginning notes are quite pleasant, and almost interesting but it's sort of vaguely fruity, slightly sweet and a tiny bit creamy. It's less challenging than the bottle might indicate and though I like Eau Delice, I find it somewhat cloying and the same drydown here affects me similarly.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Smells like a heftier version of Dior Addict Eau Delice :)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
Slightly spicy and red berry at first, then dreamy and sweet floral. It's very pretty, definitely dominated by lilac for me, which I love! I don't get the name but I actually think the bottle is pretty nice, though it makes me think of batman. :D
Lasts a ridiculously long time on me, I smell nice all day long. :) Love!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
Gucci Guilty Black is an amplified version of its predecessor, Gucci Guilty. This is not an intense fragrance, per say, rather Black is sweeter and juicier. The bottle is, ironically, quite colourful with the red glass design; which I really like.

The opening of Gucci Guilty Black is all fruits. Raspberries and red berries and pink pepper. The lilac of the original is replaced with violet to give Black more warmth. The patchouli note is so quiet as to be almost non-existent and the amber is sweet and musky.

I love this fragrance; it's in the same sweet/musky/floral family as 212 Sexy by Carolina Herrera and Wink! by Avon, both of which I wear. It's not terribly ground-breaking or original, but it's still a great fragrance. Don't be put off by the dark packaging and marketing; this scent is entirely appropriate for daywear because of all those berries. Longevity is around 6 hours, although it becomes difficult to detect at around 4. Silage is moderate.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Well, at first I thought it was a men's fragrance. I liked the fruity-spicy start but there was something masculin and disturbing in the dry-down which made me get rid of this perfume.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I love this one, but it makes me angry. Comes on strong, seduces with red berries and molten purple liquid sex, then puts all of its demure lilac clothing on and leaves me abruptly. Pretty little bitch. Expensive, too. I'll never commit to the full bottle. For that kind of cash, I'd expect it to put out. ;)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
Nice, wearable, light and pleasant. I think it's very easy-going scent, you can't go wrong with it.
A little more fruity than the original Guilty. Not overwhelmingly sweet or annoying in any way.
There's a little bit of everything, I think it's quite fine.
I loved the original more, as it reminded me of beautiful lilacs at the countryside, but this is also very-very nice.
I don't understand the name though. This doesn't smell like black guilt to me.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Funny, but this actually reminds me of Jovan Black Musk which I miss dearly!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: This one was a blind buy. Bought it a month ago. Big mistake! There is just something sickening about it, I believe it is the combination of powder and amber that make this scent unwearable and somehow heavy. The packaging is great, and that is pretty much the only thing I like about this.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
FIRST IMPRESSIONS

I am a big fan of the originial Gucci Guilty and Guilty Intense so I was expecting to like this. I sprayed it onto my hand and I instantly loved it. It was definitely Gucci Guilty, but much sweeter, much more fruiter. The pink pepper and red berries are definitely detectable. The patchouli is just a hint, so all you patchouli-loathers need not worry. Nicely blended fragrance, not too much of anything.

SILLAGE & LONGEVITY

Not great. Around 4 hours max. Stays close to the skin. Considering perfume never lasts long on my skin, no matter how strong it is, I'd also check other reviews.

FEELINGS PROVOAKED

Sexy, edgy, modern

CONCLUSION

A nice edition to the Gucci Guilty family, It's definitely worth a try. And I think it's worth mentioning I've seen Guilty Black selling online much cheaper than the originial Guilty so shop around for a good deal (I've seen the 75ml selling on allbeauty.com for £31).

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
When I first tried this I immediately disliked it. I thought it was loud and obnoxious. The second time, I realized I might have been influenced by the name and the bottle. To me, what's inside is more playful than seductive as its image would suggest. I still wasn't won over, but I went from hate to dislike. The third time, I went from dislike to interest. And now, I think I can safely say I like this. Though who knows what the fifth attempt will bring.

It opens with a blast of berries, then pink pepper, then raspberry, then patchouli and nectarine. Slowly the florals start to peep out as it sits. It's spicy, but definitely not dark and edgy. It's warm and pretty sweet, actually. It's well-suited for a fall evening out or a winter evening in.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
GGI opens rather fruity with berries you can feel original Guilty in this but Intense is more fruity with raspberry and peach.
It then dries down with amber and patchouly being quite intense.
It's rather nice but personally I prefer Guilty EDP also longevity is not very good here sillage is moderate.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
While cleaning out my room yesterday I found a sample spray of this hiding away somewhere. It's not the kind of thing I usually wear, and I'm not even sure where I got it because it's not the kind of thing I would be drawn to, but because of that it was the first thing I reached for this morning. Surprisingly enough, I'm very impressed!

This starts off with a juicy fruit note (current, I guess, but I actually thought it smelled more like raspberry) and then mellows out into a creamy peach/lilac combination. There's just a hint of spice in the background but it's not overpowering--even my dad, who usually hates patchouli, decided he likes this one. It's less "dark" than I was expecting but it's very pretty.

Since I haven't tried the original I might do that before I decide if I want to get a bottle of this, but I really like it and I'll have fun using up my tester.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I got this one at discounted price(at my own risk considering some of the reviews...), and I like it a lot - it's different from the majority of scents on the market, definitely grown-up and sexy, stays close to the skin, which makes it wearable day time and evening, and the longevity on me is good 4-6 hours:)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
I was really craving a new perfume, something sexy and mysterious. After sniffing around Ulta for what seemed like ages, my nose kept coming back to this one.

It smells completely different on me, than it did on the card. My skin tends to turn things super powdery, while on the card it smelled more berry.

This is sexy, sweet, but not cloying. Powdery, but not in a baby powder way. It's a sexy type of powder. It's sultry and dark. I feel that it could be worn day or night, depending on the person. It's heavy on the patchouli, and pink pepper, with a touch of raspberry, and amber. I don't reach for this one often, but I'm glad to have it in my line up. A great night or date scent!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
Hate to admit this but I'm usually a play it safe girl and I'm 37!!!???
I usually love the very fresh, innocent, fruity floral with just a little amber musk woodsey base. So, when I first smelled the guilty's, I thought, No Way!!but I'm finally tired of playing safe so I made myself try the One and was pleased. It was okay, actually. Then I tried guilty Black and at first it kind of scared me. Then as I started roaming around Macy's, I could smell it on me and was like WOW!!! It smelled warm yet fresh. I really like it. It's a flirty but still classy. Definitely, snuggable!!! I've gotten many compliments wearing black. The only downside is the longevity. No more than 3 to 4 hours. I wish they made an EDP, for sure.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
I picked up a roller ball of this a few weeks back and I have wanted to write a review on this but I'm having trouble figuring this out. Not because I don't know if I like it or not, because I defiantly do, but because I can't really pick up what I'm smelling. It's like when you wake up from a good dream that immediately starts to fade away from memory but you can remember small bits and pieces and you try to put the pieces together but you can't, all you remember is it made you feel happy but you don't really know why.
To me, this perfume is just as soft as those hard to reach memories. With the black and red bottle and named "Guilty", I guess I keep expecting this to be loud and in your face- but it is soft, slightly sweet and demure. This should have been named "Innocent".
The opening is all pink pepper, then somewhere in the middle it's a soft....I don't know! It's just "soft". Maybe amber with a touch of the lilac? I really can't tell what any of these notes are other then just "pretty". I sprayed this on about 20 minutes ago to revisit it and I have to press my nose to my skin to get any scent. I really wish this was longer lasting and had more projection because it is very pretty and I'd probably get a full size if that were the case. Unfortunately it's a bearly there skin scent that could use more punch with a name like "Guilty".

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
I'm a BIG fan of Gucci Guilty so I was eager to test this today when I saw it in a perfume section of a department store.

At first I liked it and thought it was very similar to the original Gucci Guilty, maybe a little bit fruitier though and the lilac is far less noticeable sadly, and I thought it was very pleasant. Luckily, I didn't even notice the patchouli in it, which was a VERY good thing because I really hate that note! Sadly though, after about 3 hours Guilty Black virtually evaporated and I can only smell it very slightly if I stick my nose right against my wrist! I tested two other perfumes as well on different parts of my arms .. Chopard Wish and Moschino Cheap & Chic Chic Petals .. and both of those have outlasted the Guilty Black.

So, for me, this would be a perfume to skip because I don't see the point in buying a fairly costly perfume that has almost no staying power. Luckily I have a bottle of the original Guilty which I got in a swap and I'd definitely get another bottle of that when I run out but I wouldn't waste my money on Guilty Black, despite it smelling nice while it lasted!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: this is more fruitier than GOLD. Gucci Gold scent is really gender neutral, anyone can wear. I find Gold more muskier and bolder than this one.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I AM A MAN AND I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS BLACK AND RED FRAGRANCE BY GUCCI SO MUCH, THAT I BOUGHT ONE JUST MYSELF A SMALL 60 DOLLAR BOTTLE TODAY!!!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Absolutely love this scent! I cannot get enough of it! It's definitely in my top list of favorites and possibly my signature. My fiancé also enjoys it. A few years back I tried the original Gucci Guilty and liked it but not enough to buy it. The original actually smells more masculine on me than the Black. As we all know, each person's skin chemistry is different, therefore, you should always try before you buy. It's extremely frustrating reading strong, bashing negative perfume reviews when a person's skin chemistry rejects a certain scent. We all wear what smells good on ourselves, there's no need to totally bash a perfume. Constructive criticism is much better than bashing. Just saying....

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Hmmmm....testing it out for the second time in the dark. First time I thought it was sexy. But i I didn't like it on my skin. I think it's the terrible patchouli note that Gucci overdoes a lot of the time. It's in several of their fragrances and it kinda smells like wet pencil shavings or sweaty money...the dry downs usually make me feel sick. Gucci if you are reading this a lot of your fans don't want this note in your scents. So get rid if it please. ..I really got a good blast of this when I first squirted.....however, it was mercifully gone within a few minutes and in really liking the masterfully present lilac uniquely associated with guilty. The Same really elegant clear scent that the regular guilty has and it is a quality scent. It does smell expensive. Maybe that's why they have that paper smell in there because they want to be associated with money perhaps. A few reviewers cited that it reminded them of Vegas and turning heads and lights and it does.....but also expensive suits and cutting deals. Fancy floral arrangements in front of waterfalls in five star hotel suites. Something about this scent makes me feel alive and like I am really good...like a make it happen girl. If I can get it to last a few hours I think I'm going to buy this.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
I rather like the regular Guilty, and was a bit sad to see this rather than that in my sampler. I found it a bit cloying from the bottle.
On my skin, though, I think I like this rasperry version a touch more. Unlike the overwhelming mess I get on the card, on me it's red rasperry, amber and a sheer floral that comes and goes. (I suspect violet is the ephemeral one, but the lilac seems touch and go, too)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: not that this is particularly bad mix but i do not associate this mix with sexiness but rather innocence. i can not shake the memory of play-doh from this scent so to me this is mis-named

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
MMM This fragrance has something in particular that I can't describe.
I don't have this fragrance but yesterday I went shopping with my two sisters and they have made me immediately try the scent..when I sprayed it on my hand at the biginning I did not like it very much,it was too heavy and the fact that this fragrance has a lot of alchol smelled too much of fruity-wine.
But after a while the smell was biginning to unfold and I could smell the sweetest notes like raspberry and pink pepper.
I give this fragrance 4/5 for the lovely notes and because I can't resist it even though it gives me a headache!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: Very sexy fragrance. I find it strikes a personal note with me and as such it has become one of my current favourites. Behind the purchase of this scent comes a story of love, betrayal and sensuality Ha! Went through an emotional roller coaster ride with this bad boy appropriately titled 'guilty'.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: It's got all the notes I love in fragrances... I'm not sure why it comes off like stale powder to me, very disappointing results on my skin.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: My boyfriend purchased me Gucci Guilty Black as a Christmas gift(the biggest package). It is a very elegant, glamourous and luxurious scent. Very stylish, sexy and full of passion as well. I always get compliments wearing it!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
Sweet, dark, and mysterious. The first spritz is boozy fruity, a little medicinal then it's sweet and sweet. The drydown is warm sweet amber, a bit powdery.

Notes from official site:
top notes of pink pepper and red fruits
heart notes of violet
base notes of patchouli and amber

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
The intial spray blast was not that great- smelled plasticky to me.
However, let me tell you- things quickly changed for the better! This is the perfect scent for young sexy moms who rock! It's fresh, sexy, addictive, and comforting all in one... not at all black or dark, like the bottle suggests. I also get a beautiful powdery smell that reminds me of my daughter's baby powder (Johnson&Johnson soothing chamomile/ lavender).

Highly recommend to anyone- it's also very safe.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content:
I smell peaches, makeup and amber. Not a lot of patchouli or pepper.
Here and there I get a whiff of berries, but I have to think about it.
Final drydown is basically amber. I don't find it dark or sexy or even very interesting.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: I spent a long time in the store deciding which fragrance I was going to purchase, and I ended up choosing this one over the original Gucci Guilty and Gucci Guilty Intense. What kept drawing me back to smell this again and again was something I couldn't put my finger on for a while.. Then I realized, it smelled exactly like chocolate covered cherries! Juicy, dark and sweet at initial spray and then developing into something sexy, cuddly and warm still with a little kick of sweetness. Although it's an EDT it really lasts a good amount of time, close to 5 hours on my skin. Perfect for fall and winter, this is an absolute go-to smell for me when I want something sexy for colder days.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
review_content: The openings of the Gucci's have not impressed me. The are rather soft and I would suppose I have acquired a taste for a stronger, more robust perfume that can take me away, one that will grab me by the shoulders and shake me. Granted, there is no horrible alcohol whizz at first hint, just a soft hint of something to come. Maybe peach. Maybe vanilla. So we have generic fruity-gourmand blended into a soft cream sitting low, so low that I must put my nose into it and therein lies the problem. The patchouli is so weak I don't know it's there. Another common scent packaged oh-so-prettily, rather vampy to catch the eye of unsuspecting wallets, a designer name for those that care enough about labels, pretty packaging and the money shall be spent on commonality.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Black Pour Femme Gucci
