I sprayed it a few times initially, and didn't feel the love (thought it was just ok - because I was at that point just coming out of a major niche phase), but things completely changed as the months went on. For some reason I placed this one next to my bed (I have a bedtime ritual of testing perfumes) and it stayed there. I tried it again several times in the following months and slowly fell in love. Each time I spray this I think it's more and more beautiful - not just beautiful, but perfect. It's an EDT, but wears like an EDP. This is a fragrance that requires multiple wearings and maybe several chances.. I wasn't that excited originally, but now am looking for backup bottles because this is one I would be obsessively seeking if it were ever discontinued.

Sweet, pretty, peony with some sparkling fruitiness. My now-husband bought this for me circa 2006 and it brings back happy memories. Longevity is great and I feel like I smell pretty when I'm wearing this. Say it's for girls age 20-25 all you want, but I'm dang near 40 and I love it!

This was my first perfume that I bought and I loved it, I remember that always I kept it in its box and each time I wanted to wear I took it out.
My girlish perfume which reminds me of those time I was so happy about the life.

My first Gucci fragrance, a small vial was included in a recent purchase. At first I was quite excited to try this famous house frag, but that excitement evaporated quickly - unlike the perfume! It does have staying power, I'll give it that much.
Envy me is sweet and fruity, there's a strong note of peach or nectarine. Sadly, I don't get any litchi, which I happen to love to eat.
There's nothing really wrong with Envy me, but there's nothing really special about it either. It seems like I've smelled frags like this before, but didn't bother to purchase the bottle.
This is the problem with many modern frags, especially the sweet/sugary/fruity ones - they're a bit thin, a little predictable and almost interchangeable. There's a cheapness to frags that depend on fruits and sugars. How many fruit notes can be incorporated before the frag becomes a fruit salad?
I'm probably too fond of classic fragrances to fully appreciate the modern scents, but I doubt that many of the modern fruit scents will stand the test of time to become classics.
Envy me will be a nice addition to a sample box, someone else will surely appreciate this frag.
Nice peony scent but not so special. I don't get any fresh fruity like summery scent in here

I was a teen around 2005 and practically begged my mom to buy me this one from the local perfume shop. It smell véry fruity, but with a bit of kick from the pepper, so it doesn't come across as overly sugary, and it dries down to a rose/musk on my skin. It evokes low-rise bootcut jeans, small purses, shimmery eyeshadows and an overload of mid-OO's pink in my mind :-) I think most people boght it for the logo on the bottle, which was a big thing back then.

Just got it and since it was discontinued I thought I'd grab it, first spray was pretty impressive, some sort of musky, flowery with a tobacco note. Then later it started not working for me. Smelled pretty awful, synthetic, heavy unpleasant something like unwashed clothes or such. I don't know why it would smell so bad and cheap like from oriflame or whatever maybe was the expired discontinued batch who knows. Really disappointed.

for me this is very lichi - and I love it as a drastic change from my normal oriental taste (YSL opium / Elie Saab Intense EDP). When I cannot take them in summer, this sort of flowery citric grapefruity and lichee thing works really well.

In summer I stay away from the oriental and goes back to the basics :)

Enjoy

What can I say. Gucci Envy Me is another guilty pleasure of mine,. It is totally basic, for the 20-25 demographic, and maybe that is why. I love peonies, pepper and pomegranates, which is why I'm drawn to this. If this scent was a human, it would have been the popular girl circa 2004. Think Mean Girls, but not as mean. Definitely unabashedly flirty, without being too sugary or over the top.
Finally a tobacco fragrance that doesn't make me nauseous! In fact, I really like this. It's light, fresh, and a good representation of the early 2000s.

Very much agree with "alumez(?)" below.
Smells very very predictable. But, some-
times I just want mainstream/pedestrian..

Review below is mine, fragrantica has played up on me lately..

I bought this from Europe while I was on holiday back in July/August.
I didn't use it, up until I came back home. To be honest, this didn't do anything in summer/spring for me absolutely nothinggg.
The notes looked lovely, but I couldn't pick out anything. I started thinking it was generic/cheap smelling. So I put it amongst my other perfumes. Not touched for quiet a while.
Tonight I was trying on a few perfumes because I have an engagement coming up.
I thought (give it ago) and to my surprise guess whatttt? It finally worked!!! Like I was freaking out lol. This smells a little medicinal but it's fruity GOODNESS!
Very chic type & girly❤️
In all that being said, I sprayed it on at 8PM it's now 12AM & I can still smell it.
I guess perfumes that don't work on me during the day, work on me at nights.
It's lovely.
My new night time fruity favourite. I'll be spraying away because I have a full bottle & not many fruity fragrances work on me at nights except for Sofia Vergara!
My absolute all time favorite scent.. just wish it had a bit my re staying power.. always get compliments on it and feel so beautiful when wearing it..

On first spritz I immediately thought fresh, juicy, fruity floral fragrance- nothing spectacular, but nothing bad, just pleasant. However, there is something very artificial and synthetic about the drydown in this fragrance. It smells of a child's expensive doll, you know the ones that are made out of a rubbery plastic type material so that the skin looks and feels somewhat like real skin. This is what the drydown is like, with hints of mango and rose in the background. I honestly detect no other notes except from mango and rose in this scent and do not understand why all the other notes were thrown in as they are undetectable to the nose. I wouldn't buy this, smelling of a synthetic plastic rubber doll is not what I am looking for in a fragrance. This was a miss for me personally. there is a reason why it is cheaper than the other Gucci's, this is just not in the same league.

Sillage is very poor, your skin will simply smell like a rubbery plastic doll.

Girly, SPRING-ly feminine type of scent. Fits perfectly for those who love Peony and Rose. Its not cloying but I'd rather use this sparingly, as the humid hot weather can render this watery thin and will have very poor longevity. I was expecting more since this seems to be the baby sister of the original Envy. You could do better than this Gucci!

More suited to cool weather, a 3.5 out of a 5

Pretty but boring. Looks and smells like something you can buy at Avon for 1/10 of the price. And doesn't last long at all, so if you're looking for some vibe and personality from this one, I think you might be disappointed a bit. Nice bottle, great for luggage though.

Envy Me is very pretty, flirty, fun and easy to wear. The litchi, peony and rose are most prominent yet blend seamlessly so that none of them overpowers. Although this is a nice perfume, there's nothing that distinguishes it from the abundance of other rose/peony-based fruity florals...if you already own one of them, you don't need this one too.
confident yet young and girly, smells so wonderful. I don't have this perfume any longer but I am considering re-buying it as I wore it 10 years ago at least and still remember it!
Beautiful feminine floral classic that is never disappointing. longevity and silage 9/10. Can suit every weather because you'll always sniff yourself for more lol

Fruity floral that is balanced and non linear, I can absolutely see why it got so popular.

One of the few representatves of this genre that I really like. Sweet fruits are grounded with some darker notes of seringa, sandalwood, ad musk while the whole composition is being freshened up with a shampoo-like floral notes.

Freshness and tackiness united to produce a sense of a feminine étalon, as madly as it sounds,it simply works.

It also reminds me of how a good beauty parlour smells.

I've been wanting to try on this perfume since I've been looking for a summer/spring fragrance and saw several people on the net suggesting this. They also say it draws compliments and I've been also on the lookout for such - so I was so excited when this bottle arrived.

I saw so many people here commenting that this fragrance is forgettable and not unique but I beg to disagree. I believe that yeah, it's somewhat reminiscent to a lotion I have sniffed before (still a good thing) - but that's it. The combination of the notes for me is great. They are nothing I have smelled before.

I love this. I've always been blind-buying perfumes (I know, not a good thing to do). And so far - this Gucci Envy Me is that top perfume that I did not regret getting.

All in all - I love that the scent is light: floral/fruity with a hint of masculinity and green notes. Ahhhh, I love sniffing it on my wrist. When the wind blows on me, I could smell other notes I cannot decipher. Haha. Soooo lovely. Contemplating on making this my signature perfume. Guess I have to look on other Gucci perfumes too.

Also, this is one perfume that has good sillage. I seldom have a bottle of perfume that I smell around me immediately. Most perfumes I got, has to be sprayed a lot before I could smell it on me but this one's soooo great - considering it's just an EDT!!!!

Bottomline: if you love fruity/floral scents that are NOT overly sweet, you should try this!

P.S.
I love the bottle! So chic and girly. Looks plasticky at first but it's sturdy.

What can I say? I do not hate anything about this perfume. 10/10 for me.

EDIT:
I am loving this perfume, really. Really. The pink pepper adds some oomph to it!! Plus, the drydown is superb! Creamy sort-of vanillic floral (if that's possible). Lovely!! Ugh, cannot get enough of sniffing on my wrists.

This is such an all-rounder crowd pleaser for spring, summer and the beach! On me it lasts all day and I get so many compliments from both men and women. This is not a complicated or sexy fragrance, but in terms of floral summer fragrances go, at least it's clean, classy and sassy!
Peony.... Envy me...

I like the opening composition of happy fruits. When the peony and litchi come in the scent softens and becomes creamy tropical. Base is musky with a hint of rose. It's a likable fragrance, but is there anything to envy a woman wearing it?

Smells like grease at the initial spray, it must be the tobacco. Very harsh & rough but it settled in about a minute. After that the litchi dominated with some peony, and something a bit musky... The more it developed on my skin the more note that i really love in perfumes come out, it is ROSE. Yes, it becomes more rossy after that. But not a straight away roses. It's smells more like fresh-sweet/fruity-woody/spicy-ROSES with really good warm feeling at the dry down. I don't get the juicy pineapple, pomegranate & the pink pepper that much, well maybe just a hint. It does smells a bit spicy from the pink pepper & tobacco. Jasmine, ermmm she is lost & left somewhere behind this time but i hope i can smell her a bit actually. Envy Me smells a bit masculine but settled to a very romantic & pretty sweet roses. In my opinion this is not a casual scent, it's more for a formal, work or any event & all year around kind of scent. Anytime, day or night, hot day or cold. It's versatile. But 1 thing i've noticed about Envy Me, been 2 weeks wearing it when i wore it outdoor under hi-temperature, the sweet-spicy smells of tobacco seems lauder than the fruits but at least i'm sweat a bit then the sweet-fruity-woody-roses will show themself. Litchi, she's really star of the show in cold day. But you can't get away from the roses & peony. Dare i say Envy Me smell quite similar to Versace Bright Crystal because both have the same fresh vibes. But obviously Bright Crystal is more to aquatic-fruity/citrusy-floral, while Envy Me is more to fresh-fruity-rossy with some spicy/woody twist in it. Let's just say, Envy Me is a darker/formal-elegant version of Bright Cristal. About the perfomance, it has very impressive longevity for an EdT. Lasts all day on me even after shower, still got some of it left on my skin. Projects moderately. 'Like' for Envy Me, not yet 'Love' it i think eventho i love rose perfumes. But this stuff is a must have. Wearable & likeable.
very girly sweet and romantic scent, happy one

Wonderful smell, warm and soft. Opens fresh at the beginning due to the pineapple and becomes more and more rosy and smooth. It's romantic and tender and easy to wear all day. If you are looking for a fresh but warm rose scent, this is perfect and unique.
It is a nice scent for hot summer days.

bouquet of nice flowers. That's what I smell. Delicate, pleasant, but I don't picture a mature woman wearing this. More for teens and youngsters. Moderate longetivity, and the sillage isn't that good.
the first spray is very heavy on apricot which I found it's quite similar to Incanto Heaven. The drydown is like every other floral-fruity category.

I like it I smelled it one day when I was buying my favorite Gucci rush I asked to smell this perfume I liked it soft and pine-apply, someone complimented me the first I wore it, I love the exotic smell makes me feel like im on an island or going to get there somehow, I will just continue sniffing this n the meantime

This is a very sexy scent, even the name is provocative. I smell the tobacco but its mostly fruity and fresh. It smells very young and modern. I have been wanting it for a while and although it was a blind buy i dont regret it. im actually happy to have this apart of my collection.

Don't know if I like it or not.
I used to wear it in highschool and I found it so cool.
Now I'm almost 30 and I don't know.
Thing is, I still find it cool and I'm not sure if I'm supposed to!

It's a somewhat annoying floral, with harsh green notes (they scratch in your throat) and tropical fruity notes. I cannot really smell any of the notes listed, it's like a multifruit juice: Taste somehow like fruit but one cannot say which actual fruits. And this smells somehow like flowers, but one cannot really detect any actual flower's smell.
But still, it smells cool and I think I'm going to buy it again.
Fruity, floral, fresh. Somehow both young and dated at the same time, which is confusing. Like all fresh scents I have tried so far, I can only picture myself wearing this when going to the gym.

I usually really don't like fruity fragrances but this is quite fresh and pleasant. Quite subtle, I don't think I tested enough to get a good impression but I don't see this offending anyone. It is the tea, musk and pepper which really balances it out, this is almost aquatic, it's fresh like I said, it hasn't got any sickly fruit notes which usually turn me off. Very pleasant. Sillage and longevity is only moderate, I can imagine someone who has projection issues might need to apply this pretty frequently.
to sweet and juicy for me
This smells like heaven fulfilled with delicious flowers.

this is life after death...
love it
why dont you better just describe the scent Georgia?? lol..

This is more fruity (sour and fresh kind of fruity not sticky sweet kind of fruity) than floral on me in the heat of tropical weather. No pepper at all. Have a strong tea scent if i sprays this on clothes.

Definitely make a cool light summer scent.

I hate the TV commerial. It doesn't make sense at all. The whole heavily mark up woman and a (half?) naked guy in an dark place with lots of leaf and a snake???? The TV commercial is so disconnected with the actual scent in this glass/pink patterned bottle, it is almost embarrassing to watch.

I bought it from a shop which allowed testing and I had no idea why I bought this. This was the perfume I hated most among everything I ever owned. Cheap, fruity, way too sweet - there is no sophistication whatsoever to it. Could not bring myself to finish it.

Love this very much! Just perfect spring/summer scent!
Nothing 'cheap' in this fragrance!
I tried quite some sweet fruity smell but I guess this is going to be my favourite! Even my boy says I'm smelling good! And peach has always been my favourite note for perfume selection.

The peony in this made me think of bright crystal. But they re not too similar to me. Bright crystal is much brighter (just as the name suggested :p) and more aquatic. While envy me is fruitier and somewhat less birght. It's as if envy me is bright crystal under a veil, with extra smoky fruits.

Gucci Envy Me is one of those girl next door perfumes that's pretty, fun and flirty. Unfortunately, I also found it to be flat and forgettable.

On my skin, this is very synthetic. This scent is familiar to me, so I've definitely smelt it on others before. It's a little sweet, a little green, and also complex, clean and soapy. It reminds me of shampoo. The dry-down is a nondescript fruity-floral smell. In Envy Me's favour, it isn't too sweet, and I think it's unlikely to offend anyone.

All in all, it doesn't sing on my skin, so I don't really care for it. To each their own :) Sillage is soft; lasts for about 4-5 hours.
My favorite scent as of now. It last 2 hours on my skin. But scent still smells on my blouse. Makes me feel nice.

I got this once as present I couldnt believe my friend would associate this with me. At the time it didnt smell similar to anything and while it was a perfect teen scent I didnt know what to do with it. It was too girly fruity sweet it just wasnt me. I wore it all year round and finally emptied the 100ml bottle. Now I agree burberry smells similar which makes burberry generic, not gucci.
Even though I didnt appreciate this happy scent at the time as it didnt match my grumpy state of mind I am thankful I had it, it changes the way I look at that period of my life it somehow seems like happy times.
P.s. I've got this memory in my mind I had this before 2004 ....I am pretty sure it was before that as I had moved out in 2004..hm...

I agree with people who say this perfume 'smells cheap'. It does. I usually like flowery scents, but this one isn't that good for me. Maybe because that 'sharp' feel when I sniff it. The dry down isn't very nice either.
Fresh delicate floral that lasts all day. Grapefruit, pineapple, green apples and lilies is what I smell. I love this. I can't find it anywhere....:(
Its a lovely fragrance for spring.Its very fresh and floral. Sadly it doesnt last that long on me.Had compliments wearing this.
Bottle is just so cute and love this smell! Smell of berries, citrus fruits, its sweet and fresh at the same time. Although a generic smell, I do like it.
I don't know why so many people like this scent. To me it just smells like I'm around a pharmacy or some type of medicine. It is a very clean fragrance though.

At first application the notes are kinda complex, like a synthetic smelling soap. But having high hopes for Gucci, I gave it another try, rub it off and after 15 minutes.. Hhmmmm.. the drydown develops nicely into a clean, floral scent with a hint of tea - WONDERFUL!
After a few more minutes, i've detected its resemblance with Burberry Brit Sheer which I also own. Very girly and cheerful! Good sillage but lacks longevity and uniqueness.
I really love this perfume, it's so fresh and make me feel happy and energetic.

I used to wear Gucci Envy in high school, but then it discontinued. 3 of my friends wore Gucci Envy that time and they smelled amazing! I decided to buy Envy Me since I couldn't find Envy anymore, I bought it without a try. On me it's very fruity and sweet and nauseated. I don't like it! I think it's not for me..

This smells like drunk (on pina colada) sex in the Carribbean :) -smells like rich kids having an exotic carefree vacation -its yummy,exotic, melts on your skin and it goes to your head.
Its rare that a perfume smells so delish, like bubble gum and shampoo, but still has a bitter sort of base,that gives sofistication, and has such a sillage and longevity.(incredible for a EDT), it melts in my pores and becomes my own skin's smell.
I dont see this being the most appropriate "business" perfume as stated below, but I do see it projecting a happy bubbly mood and getting you through a hard day at work.. Its not suitable for a bride but it is for a sexy maid of honour, because its sooo playful and flirtatious...

Sweet and fruity. No need to go in detail about the top, heart and base notes. Lasts long after a two or three sprays on the skin. Gives a sense of sophistication, class and sexiness. Gucci needs to bring this piece of heaven back.
this is what i love....

I would really love this if it wasn't for the tobacco note in it. It's light, fresh, exactly the kind of fragrance I normally go for, but it is ruined by the smell of cigarette smoke. Disappointed in this one!
So adorable scent! Can't get enough of it! Long lasting floral tropical fragrance with a tempting depth in a dry down. I am so happy, becouse i got almost full tester bottle of 100ml for 20 pounds ;)

This perfume is just a mish-mash of notes clashing with each other. I'm not sure which is worse...the thick smell of peach and pineapple or the cloying smell of jasmine and mango.
This really smells more like one of those Dollar Store perfumes than a Gucci.
Very few perfumes have ever given me a headache but this one does!

A flora, very optimistic and charismatic fragrance! It was my choice for today and everything went perfect! It might be coincidence or not, but I have a great self esteem when I dress up and wear a fragrance with strong personality!I am a great fan both of peony and jasmin and I think this is a perfect combination!
fresh floral kind of '' happy ''scent. it lift up the mood, and turn the noses of people to ask me what am wearing. I smeel a lot of litchy in it . Big like !

Acizane düşüncem tam bir genç ve orta yaş hanım kokusu olduğudur. Genellikle parfümlerde kadın erkek ayrımı pek yapmam ama bu koku gerçekten bir erkek için fazla kadınsı. Kesinlikle gayet çiçeksi ve şekerli bir koku. Ancak itiraf etmeliyim ki bence sert veya biraz modası geçmiş diyebileceğimiz türdeki keskin baharatlı erkek parfümleriyle birlikte doğru oranlarda kullanınca garip bir şekilde eşsiz ve cinsiyetsiz bir parfüm yaratmanıza imkan veriyor. Tabi yine de biraz eli yüzü düzgün çekici bir erkek olmanız durumunda bu karışımı öneririm. Yoksa hiç bu önerimi dikkate almayın ve erkekseniz doğrudan uzak durun. Benim gibi parfüm ayırmayı sevmeyen biri bile "aga nesin, necisin, bu nasıl koku? bilelim de ona göre davranalım.." diye bir tepki verebilir. :D

Geleyim kokunun karakterinin nasıl olduğuna. Özetle başımdan geçen bir olayı anlatayım. Artık siz karar verin. Bu parfümü yanlışlıkla başka bir ürün alıyorum diye güzel kafayla kör alışla sipariş vermiştim. Elime geçince ise "anaaa bu ne lan? ben bunu mu aldım?" tepkisini verdim. Zaten şişesinin ebatları ve tipi itibariyle resmen acısını içimde hissettim. :) Çünkü şişesi gayet büyük ebatlarda, dar, uzun ve köşeli bir yapıda. ;)

"Parfümün kadını erkeği olmaz" ilkemden hareketle üzerime sıktım. Off o ne güzel bir koku. Ağır kokuları seven biri olarak hafif bile sayabileceğim, şekerli, çiçekli bir yapıdaydı. Yalnız işin kötü tarafı bu parfümü sıktığımı unutarak yarım saat sonra arkadaşların çağrısıyla buluşmaya gittik. Ben dahil toplam 4 erkek arkadaş buluştuk ve otururken herkes durmadan burnunu çekerek bir şeylerin kokusunu almaya çalışıyordu. Parfüm tutkumu bile diğer tüm arkadaşlarım gibi buluştuğum arkadaşlardan biri sonunda dayanamayarak "aga yaa bu koku senden mi geliyor, yan masadaki kızdan mı? Eğer senin parfümünse gözünü seveyim bu parfümü bir daha sıkma, bir hoş oldum. Allah muhafaza günaha sokarsın adamı" dedi. Tabi ben de önce afalladım sonra da gülmeye başladık. Kısaca tecrübeyle sabittir ki bu koku kesinlikle erkekler üzerinde gayet çekici hatta tahrik edici etkiler yaratabiliyor. :)

40 yaş üzeri hanımlara çok genç işi kalabilir. Ama bakımlı ve minyon tipte bakımlı bir hanımsanız 45 yaşa bile uyabilir. Genç kızlar için de bence son derece uygun ama gözünüzü seveyim dozu kaçırmayın. Hem siz başınıza iş açarsınız hem de içeriğinin biraz şekerli olması yüzünden sıcak havalarda milleti bayıltma riskiniz yüksek.

Dozu ayarlanamazsa sıcak günlerde bayıltıcı ve itici olabilir. Çok soğuk havalarda da fazla çekingen bir hal alacak bir yapıya sahip.

Kalıcılık ise EDT olmasının hakkını vererek ılık havalarda yarım günü buluyor. Belki sıcak havalarda daha uzun süre etki gösterebilir. Yine de küçük dozlarda kullanılmasını ve şişe ebatları yüzünden yanınızda bir atomizer ile gün içinde tazelenmesinin daha güzel olacağını düşünüyorum.


Not : Yorumlarımı ve özel mesajlarıma cevaplarımı sadece Türkçe olarak yapacağım. Böylece yabancı dil konusunda sıkıntı yaşayan arkadaşlara gerçekten denediğim parfümlerdeki kendi görüşlerimi paylaşmayı amaçlıyorum.

its one of my favorite fragrances and i can smell it the whole day long. it has just a perfect balance between the different notes. its not too strong, not too soft, very ladylike and for any occasion!
My go-to scent! Fresh and floral, not too overpowering. Perfect for if you are just hanging around the house or running errands.

Fresh floral perfume. There a lot of peony in it. I can also sense some pineapple. It smells so ordinary, it leaves me no impression. Nothing to envy here.
The bottle is cute and girly though.
I couldnt recognize any note of this fragrance. It smells just ordinary fresh to me. It is easy to wear, nice fragrance, but boring.
This is a very beautiful fragrance. Love it anytime, any season.
Don't get the name of this perfume. To me this smells very boring and too "happy fresh". Sorry guys, you can keep this to yourselves :)
A lovely girly scent which doesn't offend other pple , I love it bt have to apply again and again

If you're seeking a fragrance which is fresh, clean and light withouth reminding air freshener to the slightest, nor having any raw edges - Envy Me is for you!

It's pretty, lasts for a long time and has a lovely "floaty" sillage. I get whafts of it throughout the day, which is rather surprising given how delicate the scent seems at first.
I liked this one many years ago, even wondered if buy or not. Unfortunately, now it does not have stillage on my skin. And also, after an hour, starts to be sour.

Without going into individual notes, I'd say this is too simple, like many other drugstore colognes, with the florals stepping into old lady territory. The only saving grace for me was the drydown which is a more complex musk. I like it, but not enough to want-list it.

GUCCI ENVY ME is a Wonderful light clean fresh scent not overpowering or powdery. Super clean smelling and feminine. I lived in the Southern CA Desert when I first bought this and wore it daily 104 degrees F, at work etc... casual and elegant - jeans to dressy. Not an annoying fragrance at all. Powder perfumes and cloying edgy synthetics are not for me this smells real and spring like! Has a vibrant vibe to it, love it! BTW over 40 not a teen and choke smelling the popular body sprays vanilla, fruit, and heavy powder junk lots of younger people wear.

رااائع هالعطر
شركة جوتشي ما تجيب شيئ مخيس كلش حلو

اشتر الطر وماجاك عندي
Way too one dimensional. To me this is a dupe for Kenzo Flower, strong on the violet and not much else. Good for a very young girl.

I absolutely love this for casual wear spring/summer! I had the Versace Bright Crystal which I disliked and I can see why some find this similar -- I would say only for the first half hour but the notes for this one holds through to it's base whereas Bright Crystal turns into something like the generic VS body mists.
So girly, fresh and happy. For a teenager with style. Not sophisticated at all, but a pretty nice scent.
fruity floral fragrance in general .... very sweet for the taste of a mature woman and i think it’s a good choice for woman who likes to play it safe; fresh, ordinary and sickly sweet.

My sister used to wear this. Though the bottle has a cute gucci logo, when she initially wore it she asked me if I liked it and I honestly said no because I thought it smelled like nail polish remover upon spraying INCLUDING base notes. She would ask me time and time again because she wouldn't understand why I didn't like it. I would like to try Envy. I hope it doesn't smell ANYTHING like this! (Crossing fingers)

EDIT 04/05/22: To my surprise, I think it smells ok now. 😄 It's definitely fresh smelling-a category I LOVE. I obtained my sister's old bottle. It had quite a bit left, so I'm testing it out every now and then to see if it's actually a "like 🙂" or an "ok 😐." It's crazy, I've never been confused on fragrance decisions like these before🤔...🤷 I'm assuming I'm not a fragrance snob anymore. After all these years of only bathing in all my favorite scents, my nose has become more forgiving throughout the years. So weird! 🤯

a sweet fruity floral fragrance yet another by gucci,
this is my first ever buy of a lady perfume,and i liked it,but unluckily it stays on my skin not for more than 2 hours or so,
so thinking of swapping it for another lady perfume.

I had this perfume for at least 4 years now.
At first I used it almost always and then I stopped because I wanted to preserve whatever was left for a while.
After all this time it didn't turn bad, so the % of alcohol isn't high!
It smells of : roses, roses, roses, pink pepper. Oh and I forgot roses!
Honestly I can't smell anything else.
It's a really light fragrance on me. After a while I can smell only the spiciness of pink pepper, which I learned is my most favorite and recurrent note.
I think it has a weak-moderate ( on skin up to 2h -3h) longevity, suits well with warm weather and should be used in daylight.
When sprayed on hair, lasts 12h +, even after working at gym. I swear!
Not a remarkable fragrance, probably a transitory one.
Today I finished it and maybe If I have a chance, I'll buy it again in the future. Who knows!
I won't keep the empty bottle, because honestly the packaging is really really under average.
Oops, forgot to add something........I hate the name of this, who wants to be envied!? Whomever named this needs a slap! : )
This was a gift for me. All I can detect are two things, peony and fresh mown GRASS!
just fresch roses..plenty of it!very classy, yet fresch. love it

Girly but mature, suitable to anyone, though. This is my love at first sniff and has been my most favorite scent so far. However, it doesn't last long on my skin (personally, it would last only a couple of hours) but because I love the scent so much so I still keep buying it.

There's something very repulsive about this. Tried analyzing the notes and I think I found it:

Cassis.

The description of the scent as found on this very website :
Odor profile: leaves and buds of blackcurrants, also known as bourgeons de cassis, characteristic green & ammoniac scent reminiscent of "cat piss"

Cat piss. CAT PISS?! This perhaps explains it all.
I bought this perfume a few years ago and was very dissapointed,it was a blind buy,I immidiately dislike the smell it was very synthetic,boring and pretty heavy on me.

Two words: rich, and clean. It reminds me of something a beverly hills housewife would wear. It is pleasant and powdery, and distinctive. It smells expensive. Like really high-end deodorant or something. But I like it.

Got a sample of this today... first impression was a pungent, synthetic floral, peony and rose with pepper... It starts smelling a little soapy, like a rose scented cleaner, and that's how it smells on my skin from then on... A comment I seen said it smells like hair products, I totally agree with that - it smells like a shampoo. Not my cup of tea though. Lucky I got the sample first.

I was quite disappointed with this perfume. It gave me just handaches...

Not worth it at all, PLEASE don't buy it for yourself or as gift!!!

I hate this perfume with all my heart. it cause me nauseating . I bought this several years ago and well, pretend to like this perfume just because I own it. so sad that this perfume smell cheap like $1 cologne in a market. too sweet, too candy and the bottle is too simply. maybe because i'm a big fan of heavy oriental woody spicy balmy fragrance.
If you are teens maybe it's good for you. I really angry when my lil' sister spray this when she went to school. get out over here or throw the bottle away from me.
I'm so disappointed in myself for being disappointed at and hating this scent! To me it smells really cheap... I guess it is because of the People I've smelt this on.
I am really dissapointed not to buy this perfume. my sister use this perfume, and the smells make me really envy =/ I must to get it later

I love this scent, but i can never have it for myself, because this is the signature scent of my best friend, so i couldn't do that to her :) Full, fruity, sensual, safe,warm and dangerous at the same time. I miss it.
This smells like Escada Jardin de Soliel

This is again one of my transition perfumes... if we were to chart it... i went from blues to light pinks to dark pinks to purples and now black toned bottles... more or less! =)

That being said...this was in my light pink era where i was moving away from my beloved Light Blue by D&G and craving some pink...but not bubble gum or cotton candy pink...more like pink lemonade. And this fit the bill to a T.

It really is a citrusy fresh perfume that has a sweet woody warm quality to it. It's very similar to Versace's Bright Crystal but with a bit more oomph!

U can follow me on YouTube @ BeautyOnSale

very fresh and green, not for me but a younger person may enjoy the green and white tea notes. Mine was an unsolicited sample, strange because it came with femme rochas and mauboussin, opposite end of the 'fume spectrum.

I have been wanting it for a long time I wasn't dissapointed when I got it it's amazing how can the Gucci group produce such special scents it's mainly fruity but very outstanding and unique unlike any other widely used fruity perfume I smell mainly the litchi and pomergrante with musk as a base the litchi gives the a feeling af a chocolate hint though it doesn't exist I really like it it's happy and sexy at the same time good job Gucci :)
This smells like a green tea undertone to me. It smells like this desert... But otherwise, it's best on a hot night.
Headache in a bottle for me!!! There was nothing to Envy about this perfume...it smelled like a sink of Joy dishsoap on me. Thank goodness it was a gift. Very disasppointed.
Gucci Envy me = U by Ungaro Avon
Rose, rose and more rose, lifted by litchi but yes still predominantly a rose scent on my skin, from first spray (two hours ago) til now. Light, pretty, fruity, rosy.
This is a very sexy perfume that takes away to a tropical paradice sipping on a litchi martini!! Itz so sweet and elegant. The perfect delicious fragrance for spring and summer <3
first time i like it then when i bought it it was so bad and all i notice is Rose from the beginning to end! nothing else!!

Rose from the beginning to end... the usual rose... the one we find in every fragrance for woman...mixed with spices (pepper?) at the beginning, and transformed into something less sharp by fruit after a bit. It doesn't change, and it doesn't even release those woodsy notes I have been expecting until it faded.. Yawn.

I love this perfume, simply love it! This is one of my favorite spring/summer fragrances. This is girly, fresh, pretty, pink and fruity with an amazing, sexy peony note! So gorgeous! Yes, it resembles to Versace BC and Burberry Brit Sheer but this one is a lot more complex and sophisticated! I find it very young and flirty, a perfect pink perfume IMHO!
Ps: I love the pink pepper note too! :)
they did a beautiful job designing the bottle.
So pretty. Reminds me of Bright Crystal except Bright Crystal is a little more sweet-glamorous, whereas I find this one a little bit more peppery at times.
This is a dupe for Burberry Brit sheer and Bright Crystal. Very fresh and girly. Lasts all day.
This is such a forgettable fragrance. Get the burberry brit sheer scent instead. They are similar but at least the burberry scent has a scent that I can remember LOL.

This s a pretty rose scent, it smells nice but on me it gets a bit sharp, but for spring it would do fine, it has a 70ties edge, not sure why it smells that way to me, probably because it is very floral. But it is feminine, and elegant in a way. Not much wrong with it.

I love this fragrance. It's perfect for spring. Sexy but not super floral. However this fragrance tends to wear off in two hours. If it wasn't for that, this would be my signature Spring/Summer scent.

I tried this recently and grudgingly as I am still annoyed they have discontinued Gucci Envy.

Well I was secretly hoping it might be an Envy flanker with some similarities, but there are no similarities between this and Gucci Envy.

However, it's really lovely in its own way. I got a light floral that turned into a delightful clean laundry/luxury soap sort of scent that lingered for around 3 hours.

I don't think it will ever be a favourite of mine, but I certainly wouldn't turn it down if I got a bottle as a gift.
i actually really like this scent, it's clean and pretty and fresh. but it gives me a headache. (i'm very sensitive) 1 oz bottle for swap. north america only please.

This is definitely my signature scent. My sister bought a bottle for herself and the first time she wore it, I just couldn't stop smelling and wonder what that heavenly smell came from.

The dry down is the very best, is a very light, creamy, sweet woodsy scent.

When you first spary it might come too strong for some people but after you let it air for a acouple of minutes, the smell is just wonderful.

I received tons of compliments from my co-workers the fisrt time I wore it, just a heavenly smell.

It's a very feminine floral perfume for all ages. More floral than fruity, the peony and pink pepper dominate, but stays pleasant and fresh. On my opinion it's long lasting daytime scent,so I love it:)

Lily of the valley all the way. Why is this targeted at teens? It feels very "mature"and green to my nose.

Cute bottle, but it doesn`t match the scent AT ALL.

Envy me is a nice floral-fruity! I get mostly the peony,the rose,the lichee and the pineapple! The dry down is soft and feminine with the musk and the sandal wood! The peony and the rose stays on throughout the all fragrance! Perfect for day time! Love it!

This is a fruity white musk scent. Lasts around 2 hours then pretty much disappears.

Definately a tamer pinapple and green than found in regular Envy (which is good as they were way too loud for me) but this scent is otherwise pretty generic.

It has no qualities to set it apart. Smells nice, that's about it.

It's pretty cheap so it's got that going for it...
I like this scent but it is not one of my most used. It's a fresh and sweet fragrance and is really soft.

I have two bottles of this perfume but I haven't used them yet. But I got a sample at the store & I can say that it has a sweet floral scent with hints of musk. The bottle is quite lovely. I love the pink bows (?) on the bottles. Very cute. 9/10

Light fruity floral.

I would say that the leading notes in this fragrance are the peony note and the pineapple note.

I don't like this fragrance. Just one of the light pink girlish fragrances, besides the peony note smells not too natural. Not my cup of tea for sure(

I bought this one after asking a shop assisant to pick something that's similar to Burberry Brit Sheer. It's very sweet and real refreshing, the scent of Lychees and Jasmines amazingly got me :)

Though, I like it more than Burberry Brit Sheer, I won't buy it again, because the scent's gone too quick, I never smell its base note scent ie. musk left on my skin.

Somehows,I don't think the name 'Envy Me' suits the scent. I choose to wear it in the mornings for simply days or lazy weekends.

Envy me? oh, please, don't be silly. It's just a plain floral scent and very flat one too. it doesn't have anything special, and at some point the scent is not pleasant at all. it's just like a soap or shampoo, you may like it's floral fragrance, but it's just not something you would buy in a bottle. On my skin, it's boring, flat and dissapears after ten minutes, leaving a very soapy scent.
I love the bottle, though. Wish the scent made same impression!
cool and fresh.like it!
my signature fragrance... love it :)

I've tested this one twice. I think its a sub-standard floral. I detect too much green in there. I realize they might be going for the.natural rather smell or something but it gives me a raging headache. Original envy is better. This one was despicable.
All I am getting is yucky floral, this in no way smells like Brit Sheer no where close.

I get a lot of grapefruit and some other crispy citrus, maybe mandarin. Then a bush of white flowers, mostly peony. Very likable and beautiful, great for office on casual fridays and weekends when chillin`out with your friends and family.

Bought this because of the reviews, and all I got was a very strong floral fume.. all peony i think! instant headache.. Yuk!! Back to the store it went!

Wish it worked on me as well as it does on others! :-(
It's very nice and floral, sweet and fresh in the same time,I love it! It's not like Versace Bright Crystal in my opinion.

"Aquatica" said this one is "floral fruity gourmand", and that pretty much sums it up! There is something suggestive of cake, to me, and of course, the presence of fruit, and to a lesser degree: flowers. I like it, mostly perhaps because it reminds me of something from my past I can't quite put my finger on...

This is one of my all time fav perfumes,. Those who doesn't like it I must say that not all perfumes that you think is good will work well on you as that depends on your body chemistry, you'll smell the real scent of a perfume if it jives on your body chem so it is really important that you have to test is first before you buy so there will be no regrets. This perfume works well on my body chemistry, this is something really feminine and free spirited perfume, delicate, not strong. I used to wear this at daytime. This is for those who wants to emphasize their femininity. I so love it... They definitely should ENVY me as it works perfectly well on my body.
I would rather consider this as floral fruity gourmand. It starts with floral scents, continues with sweet, fruity and in the drydown smells like caramel to me.
renux2000 , you got the point ! It really smells ( after i use it a lot , and start to get bored of it ) like plastic and alcohol- something too overpowering , it gives me a nausea.
it smells rosy... refreshing indeed..
It's a light, beautiful floral fragrance but it doesn't last very long on me. A spring scent during the day.
Although i really enjoy this perfume, it can get a bit boring at times. It definitely does not stick out, it's just your typical floral, sweet, girly smelling perfume, nothing to envy over ;P

I really like this. This to my nose is essentially a rose scent. It's not sweet at all though as the pink packaging etc would suggest. It's got slight resemblance to Chloe for me (the new one with the bow on it hehe) the rose in both these perfumes is that clean crisp rose. Very nice!

The fruits in here are also quite crisp, even though there is peach which normally smells dry, fuzzy and heavy. The other notes in here keep this perfume light and airy.

I feel quite refreshed wearing it which I really like in a perfume. I'd give it a thumbs up!!
Very feminine, yet not too sweet. Love how the pink pepper gives it a kick.

Such a refreshing fruity perfume. i love this and have gone through 2 bottles and i never tire of it. Reminds me a bit like dior addict 2. Suitable for day wear i think. Difficult to find now though :)

One of the best fruity florals I've tried. Refreshing but still a little warm. Gucci Envy Me is not sexy as it is marketed to be, but overall a pleasing scent, not to mention quite long lasting considering it is an edt.

nice bottle very pleasant scent. Florant, gentle, lasting power is horrible. on my skin just 2-3 hours. never mind. Its still worth the price. I LOVE IT:) it´s not strong, vulgar scent. I smell white flowers and white body milk. I smell something green as well. But NO citruses- good:) I am wondering how the green version smells:) anyone help me?
love,love,love...but im growing a bit older..and can't seem to pull off the teenage girl in me...that this fragrance demands:(

Yeap, here’s definitely one from the “pink line” (as I call some of my perfumes) - girly, safe, sometimes even boring. Still – there’s something in it that keeps me coming back. Probably it’s the peonies, because of childhood memories… This perfume is the definition of peony on my skin. But I have to admit – with time our bond grows weaker. Maybe it’s because I evolve, and this is just a plain and uncomplicated scent.

I had a sample. I didn't feel comfortable using it because the fragrance doesn't match my personality. This really may be about envy! Because the fragrance is so mean and acid-like in my perception. I haven't met a similar fragrance on my way, Brit Sheer was different, more cold and pink velvety. All in all the notes are a bit of mess that creates the sweet acid and malicious appear. Envy Me is quite strong, with good sillage. I quickly got tired of it. No, Gucci isn't my favourite brand...
I had it and since the first day I absolutely hated it. It moved on to my mother's.
I like this perfume , it's very nice and fresh but does anyone think that it smells like alcohol ? or my just my nose , lol The Envy Me 2 it's too much better

Smells good. Light, warm, nice and girly. Noticeable but boring. It is as though you have smelled it before. I would buy this one, but not a big bottle. Anddd the bottle is like an unstable tower. You have to be extremely careful not to accidentally push it and broke it.

It's a type of perfume that will lasts me for long and won't repurchase it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: One of my top 5 scent DNAs. The lavender and coriander, together with the orange blossom (recently up-and-coming, see the YSL MYSLF line)--just divine.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
This was my first fragrance I ever owned. I believe I was 19 or 20. I was visiting my mom and her boyfriend had a few fragrances at the time and I had a date that evening. He told me to go spray some and see if I liked any.

When I sprayed this one I loved it. I put it on and I told him this one is amazing. He said keep it. I was shocked and happy.

The date went well. I had another experience with this fragrance as well. I was at my job at the time. Myself and 3 other guys and one female were standing in a circle talking. The female (who was good looking) just stopped mid conversation and said one of you guys smell so good.

She went around the circle and got to me. She said yep it's you. I knew then that fragrances make a difference.

Sad this is discontinued. Good memories.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
This is Gucci Guilty EDT with an ambery and chocolatey patchouli base.
I wouldn't call it totally generic, but it's been done before, it's sort of in the style of Paco Rabanne Black XS 2005 - it's a pretty good twist on the original DNA overall.
All year-round and every occasion (maybe not the dressiest, because it can come across as playful), has great longevity (I could clearly smell it after 7-8 hours) and the projection is moderate to heavy for about 2 hours.
Just like most discontinued fragrances, it's not worth the inflated price, but if you can find it for the original retail price or under, it might be worth a shot.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Absolutely love this fragrance. I have a bias since this was one of the first fragrances on my journey as a fragrance hobbyist. It has sentimental value to me. But, Gucci Guilty Intense is fantastic regardless of my history with it.

It's indeed a step up from the original and more intense in scent and performance. I do find the original as being just ordinary, but this Intense ticks all the boxes for me. Love that lavender/citrus opening.

I equate this with Chanel Allure Homme Sport Eau Extreme. I feel it serves a similar purpose: a great smelling, fresh, modern attention-grabbing scent that's hard to dislike for the wearer and everyone around. Unfortunately the mockingbirds will repeat the dogma that Gucci Guilty sucks because it's not Pour Homme 2003 or Pour Homme 2. I agree that those are masterpieces, but let's not hate a good fragrance over poor marketing decisions. If Guilty Intense were in an Armani Code bottle, or YSL Y flanker, people wouldn't shut up about it.

Seems like this has been discontinued. Must secure a backup before prices hit the $200+ mark. I'll always have some on hand to remember the earlier days. Love this stuff.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
It is a very nice fougere fragrance.
It reminds me a lot of Houbigant Fougere Royale.
The best of the line.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: This Gucci Guilty Intense is my go-to for a night out. It's strong and sexy without being overpowering. I get tons of compliments on it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I like the overall scent profile. Fresh, a little bit of sweetness in the opening—amber, mature dry down. The main problem for me with this version of the Guilty line is longevity. Even with some serious overspray, this stuff is gone from my skin in under an hour. The projection and longevity are so bad, it almost feels like a prank.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Very pleasant fragrance - quite fruity, but makes people wonder what you are wearing.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
A decent fragrance !! Definitely a "LIKE" but not impressive enough to be a "LOVE" !!

Opens with a citrusy-lavendery smell.. After a while this citrusy-lavendery smell weakens but stays in the background and is taken over by a note that is spicy, very ambery and slightly floral.. I find the smell quite smart and manly.. Can be used for both formal and casual occasions..

Depending on the weather, the smell lasts between 5 and 6 hours on my skin.. Projection is confined to about a six-inch radius around my skin.. Can be worn all year round but my personal recommendation would be fall or winter nights...

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Majority of the time when someone asks me what I'm wearing and or compliments my fragrance, they refer to what I'm wearing as "cologne"... which drives me nuts. However, this generic scent is exactly what I would consider a "cologne" type smelling scent.



Side notes:

It reminds me of walking into Macy's during Christmas time. For that reason, I'll keep a 10ML around for the nostalgic factor of reminding me of the holidays.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: It's hard not to love this considering how versatile and mass appealing this is. It's not a monster performer, but it's smooth and sleek and gets the job done. You can wear this to the office or to the bar. If you wear it to the bar, you will need a few extra sprays and you are sure to get compliments from the bar maid.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
This is one of those fragrances in my collection that always seems to pull me back in every time I start to think about moving on from it. It has a knack of just doing everything you need in a fragrance good enough across the board.

To me, It has a pleasing scent profile, and no less than 8 hrs of longevity on my skin, I like it better than the original due to the fact that it is a much better performer. It's a good 3 season scent, and provides a nice 1-2 ft scent bubble for 1-2 hours. (2011 bottle)

It has a fresh but dense vibe that may not rock your world or garner many compliments, but it just smells nice. I have come to appreciate it more now 13 years later since it smells different compared to what's being released now.

It's not a must-have for every collection. But it is unique enough in my collection to keep its spot and get worn once or twice a month. As for occasions to wear, I primarily wear it in cooler weather months, and mostly for the office.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Underrated but still not enough for a ''AAA perfume''. Feels not like Gucci.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I particularly like the amber and slightly spicy drydowns in each perfume. It offers great longevity and projection. I will never understand negative comments, personal preference is important. Explain why you don't like it, don't attack. Don't do that with any perfume. Every perfume can have its likes and dislikes.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Probably the most underrated flanker of the guilty line. This is nice to wear on a crisp day. Good longevity from this I get about 8 hours. This is by no means unique but if you want to just smell good then this is any easy grab

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
This line from Gucci makes me very sad and angry at same time . Years away from Absolute, Homme I, Rush, Nobile and of course Envy .

Just replicating the Invictus childish formula .

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: To be completely honest, it’s nothing too crazy. I love a fresh cologne though, and this fits the profile. It’s one of my run of the mill colognes personally - as i can just throw it on and live with my day. I’d reccomend but, imo if you wanted something super fresh and good for your value just go with a classic nautica voyage.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: So. Boring.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Average

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Someone had this smelling like polo red extreme? Lol! I downvoted that right away, you must have lost your sense of smell.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Sweet fragrances are my favorite... The One Polo Red 212 Vip Bvlgari Black Le Male Intense... this is one of the worst of the Gucci collection... cannot stand the bad spirit of sweetened coriander... puff smells like a hot "brown" meal of beans... many people here seems to like it but i am sure this one is the worst scent even with the diamonds version... neither a trail of charm... the drydown is plain woody rotten... as am ambery fragrance fails to appear it's touch... The One is a bomb of uniqueness that's all you need to know from here to then...

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
There is a line where Guilty and its flankers went from Unremarkable to Unbelievable. By no coincidence it's also when they handed things over to Alberto Morillas.

This one is completely unremarkable to me, which it shares with original Pour Homme (2011), Black (2013), Diamond (2014), Eau (2015) and Platinum (2016). All but the first have no listed nose (or at least none that will be publically associated with them?) which seems to say they were created by a marketing committee that wanted an amalgam of certain notes and just kind of tossed them together and got these rather unremarkable scents.

Morillas delivered Absolute (2017), Oud (2018), Cologne (2019) and Love (2020). The first three are some of my favorite designers (full stop) and the fourth while not spectacular still makes much more of an impression than those Guilty variants that preceded Morillas' intervention.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Highly underrated. Could easily be someone’s signature.


Rating: 8.5
Compliments: 9/10 (for the first 2 hours)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Gucci Guilty Intense Men opens with a moderate projection of citrus, spicy, floral, woody and resinous notes. The opening is fresh, the notes are intense, sharp, and very pleasant. Almost all notes are noticeable as soon as the fragrance is applied, particularly the lemon, neroli, orange blossom, amber, and cedar. As the fragrance dries down, some of that initial citrusy sharpness subsides under the amber that develops adding a slightly sweet/powdery/projecting touch. Also, the fragrance loses intensity very quickly taking one step down from moderate to moderate-low. Once Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme EDT has reached its full dry-down, it can be summarized as a moderate to low, slightly sweet, resinous, lemony, white floral, spicy, and woody fragrance with green and soft lavender accords. The fragrance feels casual, delicate, dry, elegant, fresh, green, masculine, resinous, short-lived, sour, sweet, woody, zesty, and pleasant.

BATCH REVIEWED: 2020
WOW RATING: 7/10. A very good fragrance but does not feel special.
DISLIKE RATING: 0/10. The fragrance contains no offensive or harsh notes.
UNIQUENESS: 7/10. The notes and resulting scent are relatively common.
MASS APPEAL: 9/10. This is a fragrance that most people will enjoy.
PROJECTION: 3/10. Moderate to low, about 3 feet around the wearer.
SILLAGE: 3/10. Moderate to low, about 3 feet behind the wearer.
APPLICATION: 6 atomizations.
LONGEVITY: 4/10. Moderate, about 4 hours, it projects for about 2 hours, it becomes powdery.
SEASONS: Winter, spring, fall, colder days, and climate-controlled environments.
OCCASIONS: Formal events, outdoor gatherings, gym, office, business, casual, holidays, vacations, romantic, dating, clubbing. This is an office-friendly fragrance.
VERSATILITY: 9/10. Very versatile, this could be an all-year fragrance, for any occasion.
GENDER: Masculine, the fragrance contains a light coriander spicy touch.
AGES: Any.
RECOMMENDATION: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme EDT can be purchased for about $60, it is not a ground-breaking fragrance but it is pleasant and highly versatile. This is a good buy.
BLIND-BUY: Yes, but only if you are familiar with its main notes.
SIMILAR: These are examples of fragrances in the same genre. Calvin Klein Eternity EDT features citrus, woody, and green touches, good but low performance; Carolina Herrera 212 Men EDT is nice citrus, green, warm spicy and woody fragrance; Dunhill Icon Men EDP is intense and pleasant citrus, spicy, and woody fragrance; John Varvatos Men EDT a very soft, sweet, vanilla, caramel, fruity tamarind, dates, and ambery fragrance; Mandarina Duck Black is a mandarin and tonka bean delicious fragrance; Pasha de Cartier Men Parfum is a very sweet ambery, liquorish, slightly animalic, woody, and spicy fragrance; Zadig & Voltaire This Is Him, is a sweet, vanilla, sandalwood, and incense fragrance, but lacks performance; Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme EDT is a good fragrance, featuring, resinous, lemony, white floral, spicy, and woody notes.
SUMMARY: A moderate to low, slightly sweet, resinous, lemony, white floral, spicy, and woody fragrance with green and soft lavender accords. The fragrance feels casual, delicate, dry, elegant, fresh, green, masculine, resinous, short-lived, sour, sweet, woody, zesty, and pleasant.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I actually like this one. If you're a fan of sweeter fragrances, this may be up your alley. Silage and performance is NOT so intense, instead the scent profile is more amped up and sweeter compared to its older brother. I feel like to get most of this one, it must be used RIGHT when you enter a function or going somewhere. Synthetic and can be a little scratchy at times. Easily all year round in indoor environments, may be good for the spring, summer NIGHTS and autumn days outdoors.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Smells a lot like the first with horrendous performance on me. Not worth it even from a discounter imo.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I'mma be straight up, this was one of the first ones I bought as I got into fragrances because I always thought it was cool as a kid walking into Sephora and seeing the prices for just some "perfume".

I have both this intense version and the original Gucci Guilty Pour Homme. I admit I am a fan of the scent. Its refreshing, light, and boosts my confidence. I don't know why. The citruses and lavender are blended well, this scent was created for mass-appeal, and that is where I do get where dislike/hate is directed towards this line. But I personally believe that no one is going to complain if you are wearing this. The bottle is really nice as well. I'd recommend this if you can buy it at a discounters for a good price.

Performance for the intense version is pretty good, I would say average. 4+ hours consistently on my skin while projection for at least an hour. Superior to the original GG, so I do prefer the intense version (But they do smell 90% similar). Won't change your life, but you'll smell good :)

Longevity: 7/10
Projection: 6.5/10
Scent: 8/10 (Love it, but it is not special)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Very pleasant fragrance. Soft,a bit sweet and elegant. Projects very well.
To me, it is almost unisex. Certainly not generic. It's really unique. One of the best male scents out there.
This is for a modern,a bit artsy young man.
Dominant notes are orange flower, amber (liquid and sweet, not powdery ) and lavender that adds a nice herbal touch. It's very well blended. I am positively impressed.
Final Note : 9,5/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
My respected friends with respectable olfactory sense laugh at me. They tell me, "Guilty Intense is *intensely* Generic." "One step above massive mass appeal", they chime. "All it needs is to be layered with Ambroxin!" they say.

Confession time. I consider myself a little bit of a nerd when it comes to fragrances. I like some weird ones, got a taste for leather and the boozey, and hate anything that screams teenager or early 20s. I am 30, but started in the fragrance game when I was 17, and my taste hasn't really changed.

Rewind back to 2011 - I was teaching at the time, and I wore Gucci Guilty Intense for the first day back after Summer. This female colleague entered the building behind me,

"Wow. You smell like a MAN!"

I'm not sure if it was that comment (as well as a few others), but I have this crazy belief that this scent used to be smokier. When I went through that bottle, I bought a second a few years later and thought I was sold a fake. A few weeks ago, I was missing that old smell after not having it for months, and naively thought it might give me that old smokey feeling like my first smaller bottle did (for the record, my last two were 100ml, the first was smaller, perhaps a 50) - it smelt similar to the previous, but a little better, no doubt due to it's age.

Still, when I spray this on my wrist paired with any other fragrance - Diors, Parfums De Marleys, etc, I still prefer it. Crazy, I suppose? In fact, at immediate first sniff I feel like it's not there, then it slowly enfulgs my nostrils in a way no other scent does, like it creeps into my brain slower. That sounds ridiculous, but it's true. It also faintly burns my nose, like a strong mint.

I love Neroli Portofino, but wouldn't wear it. Maybe it's the neroli that puts most people off about GG, but then neroli isn't a mass appeasing note. Maybe I have a tumor and it's making me smell something different. Maybe people are just hung up on Envy and the former greats. Good times they were, but Intense is still far from generic to me.

I was hesitant to say Guilty Intense was my favorite for years - can't help it though. I'm guilty of loving this damn scent.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
This is a strong fragrance, to me it has a good longevity, maybe my skin or PG goes well with it.

This will make heads to turn to look at you, when you pour this on you and get to a public place, this will make that people look at you as the attention center, if you're shy or don't like to catch the attention my advice is that you do not wear this.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Amazing scent, simply love it...

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I find this to be a fairly bold scent, but not too strong. I wore it all summer and really enjoyed it. The blending is excellent. However, I found that, despite its initial strength, the projecting power of the scent fades quicker than expected. Fortunately, the remaining scent lasts many more hours. Be careful not to use too much; one spray is enough for me.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
This has been my favorite scent for my entire time dabbling in fragrances. Granted I only wear it during the fall or winter because it is a beast mode fragrance, but it's a fantastic scent.

I recently wore it for the first time in a couple of months because Fall has just begun and I was still blown away by the performance. I applied it at 11:30 am and I was still getting whiffs at 8:00 pm and the projection is fantastic as well.

I really enjoy the Gucci Guilty scent DNA because nothing else smells like it. Sure, it's a take on a modern day fresh scent for a younger man, but that's perfect because I am 20. What I love most about this scent is the "dark" / "mysterious" vibe that it has. It's a fresh scent, but I can only guess that the combination of lavender and amber give this a "dark" / "mysterious" vibe, and the ladies eat this stuff up.

Scent: 5/5 (great scent, unique)
Longevity: 4.5/5 (great longevity)
Sillage: 4/5 (very good projection)
Versatility: 3/5 (great for the fall or winter because it's strong)
Compliments: 4/5 (fresh with a dark vibe. the ladies love it)
Age Range: 18-35(ish)

Overall: 4.10/5.0

You cannot go wrong with this stuff. Be careful to not over apply this though because it is quite strong and lasts a long time. I recommend 2-3 sprays, with 4 sprays being the max. I apply 1 spray behind each ear and 1 spray either on the front of my neck or the back.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
My husband favourite fragrance. I like it too but it does not last long. I know the smell fading away after 1 hour and he gotta spray again after that.
Nice fragrance but the longevity is very bad. And here in Malaysia, it's expensive too!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
3 sprays, 1 hour = amazing

3 spays after 1 hour = Did I forget to wear cologne today?

The longevity is bad, but the scent is amazing.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
A lovely sweet smelling fragrance for about 30 minutes. My girlfriend says it's sexy as hell and loves me wearing it. The only problem is after the 30 minutes it's hardly even noticeable. I use around 6 or 7 sprays and it fades to nothing that quickly. Nice and fresh while it lasts but very disappointing longevity.

5 out of 10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I get a fresh patchouli not very dark I’d even say this is more of a spring summer scent than gets credit for I still find the original maybe a touch better and both are extremely underrated the opening of every Gucci Guilty throws ppl off the rails so much they don’t wanna take the full ride ..... wait the 30 min and smell how beautiful they can develope

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
It's a nice fragrance that has an minty, earthy, citrus scent profile. That can turn heads...during the warmer times.
I'll have to keep this in mind and try it again during the late spring.
Overall it's a very nice scent...
But the cold weather will take most of its power away.
So yea...
Nothing else to say, hope it helps.

I used six sprays...both wrist, back & front of my neck, chest and front of my shirt.

Will I buy this again?...No.

Does this fragrance enter BEAST MODE, good, just okay or weak sauce at best? Good.

What's the strength of this? EDT.

Am i willing to trade this fragrance? Yes.

Should You Skipped It, Sample It First or Blind Buy It? Sample it!

Can you use it as a unisex scent? No.

Is it the old, new formulation? Old.

What's its availability; in production, limited edition or discontinued? In production.

SKU Number: 737052525242 (Tester)
Batch Number: 3088 (Production Date: March 29, 2013)

Age: 25+
From: Hookup
Size: 90 ML
Scent: 3.75/5 (Nice).
Value: 5/5 (Cost free).
Sillage: 3/5 (Three feet Easy).
Longevity: 4.5/5 (Eight plus hours).
Creativity: 5/5 (Sexy fresh lemon & mint with coriander).
Projection: 3/5 (Two hours).
Versatility: 5/5 (Anytime & anywhere).
Compliments: 3.5/5 (You smell nice).

Until next time, I'll catch you on the flipside.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I've only recently started to enjoy the Guilty line. I hated them all when I first tried them 5 or 6 years ago, but for some reason lately, there's something about these fragrances that I really find appealing. There's an awful lot of shade thrown at Gucci for this series, but I think it's largely undeserved.

The one thing I think they've done particularly well is in creating a discernable contrast between the flankers, while retaining the core Guilty DNA. I have both Intense and Eau. The former is fruity and light at the top, but gets deeper and darker very quickly. The drydown has a rich incense/sandalwood vibe to it. In contrast, Eau starts out with the same fruity fresh top notes, but stays light and atmospheric. Longevity for both is around 4-5 hours. Both are unmistakably Guilty, but are as different as day/night or summer/winter in terms of their depth and intensity. Does Guilty hold up in comparison to its predecessors Envy or Nobile? Maybe not, but it's delightful for what it is :)

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I'm guilty in enjoying this fragrance.

Is it the best fragrance I've ever smelled? No. Is it in my top 5? No. But it doesn't need to be. It smells pleasant, it's versatile and it gets me awesome compliments. A more refined version of the original and a people pleaser.

It has also dropped in price, and while it's still not super cheap, it still comes at an acceptable price. I guess this is my guilty pleasure as far as "political correctness" in fragrances goes. But hey, fragrances are subjective. So sample it and make up your own mind.

7.5/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: aman allahım! nasıl bir koku böyle. ilk sıktığınızda bileğinizi burnunuzdan alamıyorsunuz. gece gündüz her zaman kullanılabilir. dönüp baktıran bir koku. karşı cinse karşı bir silah! severek kullandım. kalıcılık orta-alt ama teninize uyarsa değişkenlik gösterebilir

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Strong and catching whiffs continuously. A little too strong for my taste and not a smell that grabs me. Ready for it to wear off.

the Gucci Guilty was definitely my favorite over the Guilty Black and the Guilty Intense.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Very nice smell reminds me of diesel only the brave edt...
Smell 9
Longevity 9
Sillage 8
Warm spicy night frag
9/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Pretty long-lasting winter fragrance. I like it.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: This stuff is disgustingly nauseating. Seriously terrible.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I sold my Guilty Black but as far I remember they share the same caracteristic smell. This is more woody perhaps, and lasts more, but the overall feeling is that they all belong to the same breed that generated CK Free, Tommy Prep Man and maybe others. Not a bad thing though.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: This is the fragrance for those with no true nose for fragrance. (yes synthetics) and cheap even with that so for $35 I'd buy this but anything higher is a no way. If I want a weak scent I'll spray less of a quality fragrance but refuse to be cheated on the ingredients by any brand so until gucci makes something with silage and longevity there dead to me. I'm only gonna try the gucci oud because it's hard to weaken and oud base unless the maker is just that cheap and willing to screw the consumer by any means. Better yet just use dupes of cheap crap like this because who needs the name and bottle of a company that has lost all of its charm and stature but found new ways to cheat people out of cash by stamping a once respected name on undeserving products like all of this poor performing guilty line

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
I've absolutely fallen in love with this stuff. I can't get enough. I was sniffing paper at Ulta and initially thought this one's brother just stood out a bit from the others, so I thought, yep, if I was to choose I'd probably choose this one, but I wasn't buying, and really wasn't that impressed, I just thought Gucci Guilty was better than the other waft's I whiffed.

Then though, it stayed in the back of my mind. I started thinking I wanted another juice to add to my collection. I went to another store that has way more options and whiffed a bunch of stuff I saw get rave reviews. Then, I saw the Gucci Guilty and wondered how it would compare. Darned if it wasn't still better to me than even all these greatly reviewed scents. Then, I saw the Intense version. Had to compare the two.

Lo and behold, Intense was just a more potent stronger example of what I liked about the lesser strength brother. Still though, I had to repeatedly go back and forth between the strips to decide. Heavenly, I pulled the trigger on the Guilty Intense. It won the shoot out.

Now, I'm wearing it and loving every moment. This stuff is much better to me, than any reviewer has indicated. I have no idea why that is. Most stuff I tend to agree with the majority of reviewers, but I really think this stuff should be lauded over La Nuit, or any of the Chanel's, or Dior's. It's just a pleasure to smell on yourself. I don't have any fragrances I want to smell my arm this much with. I love this stuff.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
scent : 8/10
sillage : 8/10
longevity :8/10
70% day/ 30% night fragrance
reminds me of diesel OTB
nice fresh amber scent

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I blind bought this perfume and although quite good it cannot compete with either Dior Intense, Spice bomb, Gaultier 2, Valentino, or Marc Jacobs Homme which are still my top male perfumes of all times. Having said that Gucci Intense Homme is a sweet, fruity, and spicy perfume which you can wear day or night. I am not at all dissappointed!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: مقدمة العطر منعشة تبعث شعور بالراحة والسكينة ولكن ما يلبث العطر ان يجف حتى يتحول الى رائحة تشعرك بتعقيدات الحياة واجواء العمل .

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I quite liked Gucci Guilty Intense. There's a spicy, almost green note that I really enjoyed.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: aromatic citrus with the touch of warmy feeling,impressive!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I see a lot of folks referring to notes of chocolate, but I don't get any of that. Spicy for a moment in the opening but otherwise this is orange creamsicle to me. Sweet, warm, sensual, amazing in cold weather. It lasts, it projects, one of my favorites.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Gucci Guilty is a good fragrance, it´s so aromatic in the style of Bleu of Chanel. Its lavender, orange blossom, lemon and patchouli does of this fragrance a good choice for hot weather, coriander and mainly amber give a warm touch.

Certainly is a little synthetic, but it´s a good choice for office work and outings with friends.

The longevity and sillage is medium.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
first couple seconds you may think a nice parfume it is. then it begins let you know not good to smell it for a day long.
4/10

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Not one of my favorites but something just won't let me sell it... Definitely agree with the 'Synthetic' comments, however, on my skin that only last for about a half hour. Once the alcohol burns off and the notes interact, it smells pleasant. I consider it a fun scent. Don't wear it enough to comment on performance.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: People hate for a number of reasons. To me, this cologne is unenjoyable because of its synthetic nature, not because it is Gucci. I have several colognes from this house. However, this and its predecessor, remind me of the dryer sheets that permeate the evening air of my neighborhood. If I wanted to smell like Febreeze, I would have gone to Kroger to buy my cologne.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Can someone tell me is this parfum smells same like regular Guilty pour home only stronger or?Because I want to by this but "blind" bye this and i love Guilty pour home but it's weak on my skin

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: اين عطر رايحه بسيار دلنشيني داره اما به لحاظ ماندگاري و پخش بو متأسفانه عليرغم قيمت نسبتاً بالايي كه داره از ماندگاري و پخش بوي پاييني برخورداره كه حدود 2 ساعت است.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
For me Gucci Guilty Intense is much better than the original. Yes, it's more intense than Gucci Guilty, lavender, patchouli, and orange blossom are more prominent, and the addition of amber and coriander adds value to this composition.

As the original, good for office wear.

Longevity: About 7 hours on my skin
Sillage: Moderate

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: i absolutely ADORE this cologne! i was searching for something for my boyfriend for Christmas and i stumbled upon this. I know that it will smell very different on him but on my skin, it is a very subtle, very sexy and very intimate scent. It is absolutely incredible and I'm tempted to buy a bottle for myself!

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I dont get all the hate this fragrance is getting,theres nothing special about it but i dont think its that bad,i think its suitable for anytime any weather

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content:
Definitely one of the worst designer fragrance. It definitely smell.

Longevity - 3/10
scent 5/10
