review_content: Does anyone have any info on Guilty intense for women. I also know there should be a version for women but it will come out in the UK first.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: I don't think this is real - that bottle looks like it was done in photo shop.

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Instead of launching an Intense NOTHING, they could use the money they spent on that, in charities. At least..

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: Why to do "intense" version of any ordinary and cheap drug-store-like fragrance? Gucci have discontinued the classic Pour Homme and started to produce these cheap waters :(

product_name: Gucci Guilty Intense Pour Homme Gucci
review_content: It kinda does doesn't it? Here's hoping it is real cuz the original isn't anything to go crazy about. I'm hoping Intense means better. Haha. : )

Cult creation.
The initial phase reminds me of red currant mixed with plastic. The effect however is very sexy, modern and appealing.
Perfect clubbing scent.
Universal weather-wise strikes me as an evening scent but can be worn during a day.
A thorough blend creating a new quality out of the parts.
Taking ot apart it smells of freesia with coriander a bit of gardenia creaminess. Peach, rose and vanilla are also tangible. Artfully blended.
It should never get out of production it is too good.

i heard about this perfume a couple of years ago, but a few months ago my mother mentioned it and so i searched it up and while reading the reviews i fell in love with them not the perfume as i didn’t have it.
A couple of weeks ago i finally got my hands on a small tester bottle of it. I really did not like it at first but it definitely grew on me. Even though it is a 2000s perfume i can smell the 70s-80s inspiration. I do get the hedonistic confident smell that you might have smelled on a lady of the night on the street after a long night of clubbing. Hairspray, cigarettes, latex and sketchy parties. Creamy patchouli peach. I wear it everyday no matter the occasion, i think only my mom likes it because all of my friends and classmates say it smells like propolis but i don’t care i love it and i think that is a big part of this perfume.

I've already reviewed the amazing Rush, but I just tried Eden by Cacharel. They have a very similar vibe. Sweet, peachy, otherworldy florals, plastic doll head, sweet patchouli, and sileage for days. I'm not saying Eden is a dupe, not at all. But if you like Rush, I think you'll like Eden. Their iconic bottles would look great next to each other, too.

Think of Rush as Jeannie from I Dream of jeannie - sweet, feminine, sexy, and over the top, and Eden is her green-hued sister that is similar but a lil skanky.

That fruity patchouli sweet tart musk. Dead sexy. Very flirty. Head turner and head scratcher. What is that making it so intriguing? I thought they unlocked some pheromone science. I smelled this so much at beach and pool parties. Not to mention the clubs, especially for gentlemen. Nearly all the pretty girls who made good tips had it. This is that live potion driving boys crazy. If Curly showed up in a bikini wearing this; chaos would erupt as every man would foolishly try to outdo the others for her affections. Take my money already

Something about this one really tickles my nose. It’s funny, but it almost smells like one of those things you shouldn’t be smelling ??? At the same time, it’s kind of — bear with me — bratty, like it’s teasing you to keep smelling it even if it’s kind of uncomfortable. Hits me deep in the sinuses and consumes me in peachy plastic. I prefer Petal Jus to this, just because it doesn’t distract from the stars of the show with needless spices: instead, Petal Jus uses lactonic notes to buoy the synthetic into a wonderball of chocolate (complete with its little plastic choking hazard hiding inside, of course). Rush has a similar strange character, the kind that leads people to ask “What are you wearing?” when you lean in to speak with them. It certainly isn’t perfect, but it also doesn’t seem to want to be, pulling your senses (and your moods) in every wild direction. charli xcx signature fragrance?

Sampled Gucci Rush because I was curious about this classic and it isn't bad like I thought it would be. Maybe a bit cloying but not in a foodie way. It's a ripe peach scent first and foremost with a pinch of baby doll plastic I get from the gardenia, which adds creamy facets and gets stronger as it dries. Also a fruitchouli, or rather a peachouli. The patchouli in here is obvious but not offensive imo. I see where TF got some inspiration from because Rush smells like a calmer, lol surprisingly, Bitter Peach. So similar even in its great longevity.

first time I smelled this was at a friends' house on mushrooms in high school over 7 years ago. Hasn't left my mind since. I bought two bottles of this stuff. It's awful in a really delightful way. Yes, drugs, illegal fantasy, neon scent. all that resonated with me. The peach note is literally sickening to my stomach but I can't stop wearing it. I'm addicted. This is a scent for the girls that love juicy couture and mcbling aesthetics.

In a world full of mainstream bubbly, pink ribbon barbie style; she is a weirdo. She doesn’t match with the bubbly cutie pie pink aesthetic. If you are bored with seeing cotton candy colored juices with fancy bottles, non-risky characterless sweet-florals, you may try this one. I cannot guarantee that everyone will love; since it is not a crowd pleaser, or a silage beast. But it is definitely unique and bold. It is for a woman who doesn’t neither need to explain her taste nor care what everyone else thinks. It is sharp, artificial, but addictive.

Happily, I received a partial bottle in a trade from a lovely person who hated it. I was repulsed, then indifferent, then curious, and now I really appreciate Gucci Rush and enjoy wearing it. The odd thing this fragrance strongly reminds me of is, yes, plastic; but also art supplies! There is the scent of that oily modeling clay that never hardens, the softly sweaty smell of pencil shavings, the wax of cheap crayons, a peach-scented eraser. This is a passing but powerful impression in the top notes — peach, the green (almost minty) funk of coriander, and fuzzy patchouli dancing around an unmistakably oily putty note. The peach, coriander, and wispy patchouli remain as a shampoo-ish freesia appears, evoking a mango in pastel shades. From then on it’s shimmering, sweet, chalky jasmine and super-soft basenotes: musky vanilla, and soft-focus patchouli & vetiver. There is, yes, an overall impression of hairspray as well, something aerosolized or possibly carbonated. Yet, somehow the whole perfume gives an impression of softness; in its native club-context, perhaps it’s different, or perhaps the reformulating has de-fanged this weird wonder.

I returned to my bottle, slated for donation, after a positive experience with By Kilian Flower of Immortality which sent me reeling back to Gucci Rush, a superior powdery peach. And as disparate as these references may seem, I do also understand the comparisons to Narciso edp and Patchouli Tenation, though moreso the latter. But if you’ve had a fondness for any of these, give this raging red cassette a try, and you may also find it somewhat mismatched to its delightfully gauche packaging.

I just adore unique scents and this is one of them. It stands out without a question. Funny enough I didn’t like it at first for some reason. But when it was gone, I was surprised to miss it. Gave it another try a year later and fell in love. I believe this is one of those fragrances that need to mix well with your skin chemistry in order to work. My boyfriend loves it too and he has a very picky nose. It’s very erotic and playful, not an everyday fragrance in my opinion. It’s like a sugar rush without the sugar, hard to explain. Just like the uniqueness of the 90s is hard to explain.

You only smell it close to skin after a while, so this is perfect for date night .😏 I realized peach scents can be very seductive and sassy.

The only thing I don’t like, just like many others, is the packaging. Although it’s perfect for on the go, I wish it was a red glass bottle!

Her bare thighs stick to the warm leatherette.
All is plastic except the peaches piled high in the tuppaware bowl. They fill the air with their over ripe scent. Their bruised and discoloured undersides drip a note of decay in their nectar accord.
But wait, there IS something else that breathes. A drooping gardenia, covered in blackened, dying blooms manages to whimper its indolic prescence from a single, untainted white bud.
There are faint white lines on the scarlet, rectangular table before her. She rubs her gums reminiscently. Naughty. But that's not all. She raises her head like a dog to sniff the air. The faintest touch of patchouli, a hint of vetiver, a sweet memory of vanilla. No clue there whether it was boy or girl who left her clothes in such disarray.
The film credits running on the small, bulbous TV screen finish. There are clicks, then whirring as the video reaches the end and begins to rewind.
The sound has broken her reverie. She jumps to her feet, unsure whether she feels sated or cheap. It is time to shower and return to the elegance, substance and genius of her 20th century Guerlains.
At the door she pauses and smiles. She wouldn't have missed this for the world.

Gucci Rush has such a unique peach note; it is creamy and lactonic, ripe and sweet, loud and proud. It is not the compote peach in heavy syrup with a metallic accord found in many vintage perfumes, nor is it the under ripe fresh peach in the more modern releases. It’s so unique.

The florals here are more abstract. I can’t pinpoint a specific one, maybe just the rose. The patchouly in the base is surprisingly not overpowering and has a weird but likable plastic undertone. It adds to the uniqueness of Rush.
The performance is very good.
Gucci Rush is definitely different (back then and even now), but it is still very wearable and likable. It stands out and can definitely pass as niche.
Sadly, it doesn’t work for me. There’s a sickly sweet gardenia with patchouli, vanilla, and coriander. They just don’t mix well for me.

Gucci, please do not discontinue! In a world where so many things look the same, sound the same, and even smell the same, where movies and songs feel generic, this one stands the test of time. It fits every moment and every era. And now, when most perfume houses are leaning toward oriental blends, this feels more perfect than ever. Even the design is iconic I don’t understand the hate for it. It’s called RUSH for a reason! It was meant to be light, bold, and easy to carry, and I think the cassette-style bottle matches the name.

About the scent, mschnabel666 put it perfectly: this IS a WEIRDO. I never liked it at first. Back in the early 2000s, whenever my friend wore it, I’d always ask what she possibly saw in it; it smelled masculine to my nose then. Now, in 2025, I saw it again in a store, sprayed it out of curiosity, and again I couldn’t decide if I really liked it. But the thing about this scent is that it sneaks up on you. You don’t even have to love it, yet somehow it grows on you until you realize you have to have it. I kept sniffing the back of my hand until I made up my mind - I had to make her mine! It reminds me of that scene in Perfume, the story of a murderer, where the perfumer unveils his masterpiece. He sprays the fragrance into the air above the crowd, and the entire audience is spellbound, overwhelmed, enchanted, collapsing under the spell of the scent. That’s exactly the kind of power this perfume has, it makes you surrender completely. I LOVE IT!
When you splurge on Uber Black and get a pretty white lady who is nice and flirty with you.
Put simply, the greatest female designer perfume ever made. My original Scannon bottle is one of my most prized possessions and I'll take it with me to the grave. Bury me with it.

Gucci Rush is a bold, unforgettable 90s classic; a fruity chypre that bursts with juicy peach, lush gardenia, and freesia before unfolding into a spicy floral heart of coriander, rose, and jasmine. The creamy, earthy base of patchouli, vanilla, and vetiver gives it a sensual, slightly mysterious edge. With impressive lasting power and strong sillage, it clings to the skin for hours, leaving a trail that demands attention. Wearing it feels like stepping into a room with complete confidence… seductive, fearless, and just a little dangerous.

I never smelled your until 2020 when I bought it at someone's selection. I really didn't start wearing it till a couple days ago and now I am in love. This is sophisticated in the way Eau du Soir is. I think it's very modern still and has an interesting edge. I can see how it might be different on different people..

Gucci Rush is pure 90s hedonism in a bottle. It evokes the scent of a packed nightclub: tanned skin, red hot lacquered lips, and a slinky black backless viscose dress clinging to the beat of "Living La Vida Loca." Bold, synthetic, and unapologetically sensual, it's a fever dream of pleasure and excess, bottled in high-gloss red. A cult classic that still turns heads.

at one point i was so obssessed with this perfume, i could not stop thinking about it, it reminded me so much of a visual kei PV, such a heavy 90s makeup glam vibe and it truly is a scent that sticks to you. unfortunately it isn't a daily scent and i found out many associate this perfume with old pompous ladies which doesn't really make sense but i understand that rush is a perfume you either love or can't stand. as time passed by i got bored of it and found myself using it randomly but all in all not bad at all.

(27)

★★★★★

plastic red heartbeat
synthetic supernova
neon dreams in bloom

I absolutely LOVE this, definitely still lives up to the hype... as a former y2k clubkid this was *everything* neon.
Addictive spicy peach patchouli with a sharp edge from the coriander and freesia, not a vetiver fan normally but this utilizes the earthiness to my delight.
I bought this one after almost 20 years and I have to say that I'm a lil bit disappointed. It's not that loud and potent Rush it used to be years ago. They reformulated it. Whyyy Gucci??
smells like a new car. love it

Changing my ranking for a "like" to an "ok". Wearing this today, it was super sweet, fruity and fun for a super hot day (100 degrees!), but it's faded already and I haven't even made it to lunch. What I do smell of it isn't sweet fruity or fun anymore. It's a boring vanilla and very faint. There's also an earthiness which reads a little as body odor. I won't repurchase but was fun while it lasted.

lovely scent but it seems to fade rather quickly on me and has a very low sillage.... interesting to see it's the opposite for most people. anyways i bought this scent at 13 after googling "what perfume do prostitutes wear?" so do with that information what you will ♡

Gucci Rush is an oriental-floral fragrance that hits you like a fierce kiss from a forbidden place, intoxicating and mysterious... Gucci Rush is the power and speed of water, the heat of fire, it is euphoria, passion, a lover... A fragrance beyond the boundaries of modernity, timeless and original, provocative, daring... A fragrance for those who know what they want and can express their feelings and excitement.....
Gucci Rush is passion in a bottle!❤️🔥❤️🔥❤️🔥
Pure Passion!❤️🔥.....Unique, timeless, different, daring, sooooo sexy! I love every molecule of this fragrance...i love the bottle, the color ❤️....made for me?

Perfection!!! But the first production from Scannon. I don't know how other production houses executed this perfume, but I smelled the newest production in the store a couple of weeks ago, and it is a disaster. It seems too floral, too loud,too cheap. In other ways a masterpiece, completely ruined.Such a shame.

My alllllll time FAVORITE. I swear there's nothing like it.
This paired with Sanctuary's Lily & Rose Body Lotion... there's not a day I don't get complimented, this may be tmi but at my old job they never had AC on so it was sweat town central... & summer was crazy, when I tell you I would be oozing heat off my body & paranoid I wasn't fresh, I would have half the damn staff sniffing my neck & arms complimenting me whole time I'm about to overheat & pass out... idk how it does it but it blends perfectly with my skin chemistry & smells ever better when my skin gets hot or I sweat... & for that alone I have to worship Gucci Rush, I've never known anything to work & project the way it does 😂

I will forever repurchase this, it smells lile irreponsebility and lust for life. I do however think this reacts very different to bodychemistry. Ive gotten so many compliments, followed by friends purchasing it - only to pass it on to me because it is too myøuch for them

i'm confused as to why this is polarizing? i just get a creamy white floral peach with vanilic nuances, i honestly don't even smell much patchouli. i am a patchouli lover though so maybe that is why? but overall this is so pleasant and definitely reminiscent of the 2000s, it totally smells like a young gen x girl at the club.

layer it with angel! really awesome combo.

It’s a classic clubbing scent for older millennials and younger gen x. It has mostly notes I hate (allegedly rose, gardenia, coriander & peach) but somehow I have always loved it since I first accidentally sprayed it in my drink because I didn’t understand the bottle. It’s an edt but it is very long lasting and great projection. It’s divisive but there’s really nothing else like it and I am not literate enough to describe it. I think it can go in every season at night. It’s sexy and daring & if you are even remotely into patchouli or Vetiver give it a try.

A very familiar scent, the perfume is calm and light. I bought it because it reminds me of my childhood and nostalgic memories. It’s the fragrance of our mothers. Nowadays, many perfumes have tried to imitate it, so it’s not something you’ve never smelled before. However, the longevity didn’t impress me.

once you spray it you will never fcking get rid of it i swear to god. i hate this thing i keep it in a drawer where it's hidden away. and what the hell is the design??? why am i pressing down on an ugly box just to smell like toilet cleaner

Time stops when I smell this again. My college scent. Reminds me of bold, carefree days. Although this scent somehow captivates the 90s vibe for me, it’s the 2000s when i actually experienced it. It’s sexy, exotic, and luscious. Notes of peach, gardenia, freesia, rose, coriander, jasmine, vanilla, patchouli, vetiver …each one mixes to create a fragrance that feels like the ultimate it-girl energy. For me, this and Gucci Envy Me were the whole vibe during my college years. The memories this scent brings back? Pure magic. It’s not just a fragrance; it’s a nostalgic journey into youth, confidence, and unforgettable moments. Its intoxicating and addictive.

– Bhavna Darira Chesan
This smells like going for a walk with your mom when you’re 7 years old and it’s snowing outside and u have no worries about your future.

For those of you who have no nostalgia for this perfume, then all you’re going to get is a super generic teeny bopper perfume. Which I totally get, because I still own Tommy Girl and Coolwater for the sole purpose of transporting back to the mid-90s. But if it doesn’t take you back in time, PASS.

one day, around seven years after she had moved away, i finally gathered the courage to snoop around my oldest sister’s room and found this abandoned in one of the bottom drawers. i assumed it was an empty bottle that she was too lazy to throw away and forgot there… i was wrong.

the atomizer on mine is broken and it squirts in a single line which is a nightmare to use, but this thing smells like if an angel descended from heaven but was really pissed and b*tch-slapped you. it instantly changed my life. very strong and confident floral scent that doesn’t smell like a drugstore deodorant or squished grass. an offensive white floral in the best way - i love white florals and it is an honor to be offended by them lol.

no dry down or whatever, the white flower remains aggressive for the whole day. maybe gets slightly warmer and milder after the 5 hour mark, but just maybe.

i love this thing so much. im glad my sister hated it!

Rick Deckard’s peachy Moloko Plus served by replicant Rachael at the Korova Milk Bar - Bladerunner meets Clockwork Orange: a cyberpunk fever-dream.

Also, as a child of the 90s, I simply love this.

I just rebought this masterpiece of a perfume and I'm instantly transported to the nightclub I used to work at in the early 2000s! I was the manager, very young and veeeery naughty..we would party till the sun came up and then do it again the next night, rinse and repeat. This reminds me of those carefree days so much! I remember the entire club smelling like Rush, it was worn by so many drunken party girls! Now I'm a bit too old for all night clubbing, but this perfume will always remind me of all the fun we had!
I love this scent! Can't they make an intense version?🙈

gucci rush used to be my moms signature for a good 2 years when i was a kid, before she switched to something else. out of all her signatures throughout the years, i remember liking this one the most, so i gifted her a bottle recently that she insisted on sharing with me.

if angel is the king of trashy y2k club fragrances, rush is the queen. (dont be put off by my word choices: i adore angel, as well as this fragrance). at its core its a pretty linear, fruity-floral scent, but the patchouli in the base is on full blast, which makes it unique in my opinion. the peach is what gives it that slightly plastic-y quality, but its not off putting at all. well-rounded and fun. wearing rush is, above all, a genuine mood lifter due to its playful nature.

if you are a certified patchouli hater, i would still advise you to steer clear. but for anyone who wants the perfume equivalent of recession era club pop a la black eyed peas and pitbull, this is a great pick.

Looking back at my super late teens, early twenties, this is one of the best scents I 've ever tried. Truly addictive sweet vanilla scent, that trigers some of the best memories of my life. My best friend wore it, so it will always remind me of her. Just to have a different scent, I got myself Rush 2 - and although another nice and innocent scent, its never gona be the same first love.
I think, I just need a mini bottle to spray it once ir twice a year, just to swing in the memories.
I get a lot of spicy notes from this perfume!

right of the bat, this is such a unique and different fragrance, it has some sort of element to it which makes it smell so avant garde in a way.. haha what i mean by that its a super special scent. its a really sweet, fruity and tangy perfume that has a touch of vanilla which neutralizes the power a SMIDGE. saying that, i didnt expect the longevity and projection of this. it smells so nice on skin and projects like crazy. while it doessss sort of remind me of hairspray a little bit its still beautiful and really girly.
All I get is a strong patchouli scent with vanilla and coriander notes in the background. I don't get the plastic association, it smells very green on my skin.

I can't help but love this perfume down to the red bottle. It's weird, a little plasticky, sweet, and kind of smells like a barbie doll's head (but in a good way). It's a synthetic dream of peaches, vanilla, and spice. I've never really smelled another perfume that even comes close to Rush. It's not for everyone but...I don't care. It's fun, a little trashy, and sweet.

What a blast from the past. This came out when I was a teenager in the 90s. I used to love this and would leather myself in it for nights out as something different than my usual Samsara or Dolce & Gabbana red. I don't know why I stopped repurchasing it, I thought it had been discontinued to be honest until I stumbled upon it today. I had to buy it, if only for nostalgia purposes. As soon as I sprayed it, that familiar scent of yesteryear filled my nostrils, bringing back a time long forgotten. I can definitely say my tastes have since changed. Even though it smells exactly as it did back then, there’s something cloying about this that makes me feel a bit nauseous. It reminds me of the screechy rosey peach scented potpourri that my nan would have lying around in small wicker baskets to scent the house when I was a kid. It’s not that it isn’t lovely, it is in its own unique way. I just cant get past the association and it lingers like i’m getting wafts of potpourri with every movement 😂

If pink had a smell..this is it. I had a doll when i was a kid..the hair smelled like this. I love it so much..sweet but not sickeningly sweet. Synthetic in the best way. Doesn't smell like anything you cd eat or anything in the natural world. If u want to smell like a doll..look no further. Not a sexy smell at all...its the type of smell a child wd want to wear.
Btw my review is for the original rush. The reformulations probably suck but i dont know i haven't smelled them.

+3 Yesss I agree. Hair conditioner/mask some girls use, cocaine and pussy. 😈

Some women will hate this fragrance but all men will love it on a woman

In my pursuit of a replacement for my discontinued Bottega Veneta I tried this - and there are similarities - but just not enough to make me wear this. However, I previously tried Rihanna Rogue because some people said it was like BV and I realise that Rush is very much Rogue. Actually, identical to my nose. I’ve heard Black Dart by Zara is a dupe of Rush but to me smelled of BV - sadly it was discontinued almost immediately it was launched. So, if I wanted Rush I’d buy it’s wannabe - Rogue - but there’s something in Rush that’s just not smooth enough and quiet enough for me
I miss her....I ran out and need her back....

I wasn't sure about this initially. It can give hairspray vibes at first and for the love of God please DO NOT overspray this. But ... I've come to love it. Underneath it all it's a beautiful rosey vanilla peach that I just can't get enough of. One spray on back of neck, one on each wrist and it is heaven. Truly intoxicating.

I gave in today and bought it after my first and only bottle finished around 2003. I cannot believe I am writing this. 2003!!!
21 years later and a curated collection of a range of perfumes, varying in scent and bottle designs, scents increasingly leaning towards the mor and more expensive and niche, bottles looking more and more exquisite and elite, I long for Rush. Why? I guess that is the exact reason for Rush's existence: to feel young, free, daring, different and unbothered.
I remember each time I went to the red plastic square bottle it was me approaching both a friend in crime and partner for life. It is looking at you with its read plasticky eye and you go " hey you, shall we do it then? You and me". It goes "switch me on".
You do not care what others will think. You smile and press the "button" of the "cassette". It is Friday, let the fun times begin!
Well...enter!! Click!Punch of clovey citrus hits your nose- punchy, effervescent. You feel baptised and pre-sequeled to enter another dimension. Shy jasmine and gardenia lead you to an outerwordly colourful bountiful wood from Alice in wonderland...along the trail you have a intense feeling of presence of some strange creatures and as you walk you can smell things you have never smelled before, however find some comfort in some dried. maybe even rotten fruit that fallen off the trees. You start to understand that to enjoy the experience you need to let go and embrace its novelty and you keep going further through the forest. Looking up you see some neon lights on the branches and in the distance something that finally feels close to something you feel makes you feel happy and familiar that in your mind looks like white chocolate milk and marshmallows. Ah yes- there is a party with Madhatter hosting it. You are so so happy you came. You start dancing and hugging all the wild creatures who you found there, and then you fall asleep already knowing you want to go to that place over and over again.
I hate this fragrance so much. Strong burned plastic smell. Must say the scent is really unique, you'll not find a perfume similar to this one.

I adore this stuff, I'm shocked and disappointed in myself that I decluttered it once (but am happy it is back in my collection). Gucci Rush is delightfully weird, smells a little like plastic and synthetic peach rings, with patchouli. A fruitchouli descendant of Mother Angel. Brash and unapologetic. I love it.

Gucci Rush, by Gucci, smells like peaches, peach candy and white florals.

I'm coming to the conclusion that I really like peach scents. Maybe because I had an obsession with peach Activia yogurt when I was a child, and I still like it.
Gucci Rush smells like peach candy. Peach with sugar. Smells exactly like Haribo Peaches.
When it dries down, you also get a hint of white florals.
It's a very nostalgic fragrance for me, also reminds me of peach hard sucking candies and the 2002-2005 period. That makes sense, in a way, since Gucci Rush was launched in 1999.
It's fun, synthetic, plasticky.
The downside regarding this fragrance is that it is very short-lasting and it lacks intensity too.

Gucci Rush original formula (Scannon) - released in 1999, created under Tom Ford during his time at Gucci. It has been subject to several reformulations since but I do not own any reformulated version to compare with. This one is not for the faint-hearted. It's bold, it's fun, plasticky smelling, manufactured, it's an out and out synthetic fragrance. It doesn't even try to be anything else. Love it or hate it, the fragrance container and the juice are well matched, both being synthetic and plastic. The original fragrance contains decalactone and jasmelactone (synthetics used for peach and jasmine), along with aldehydes, to help re-create the fruits and florals and these give it that plastic smell. To me, Rush is a shining example of this being done the right way. It modernised Chypre and made this one of the best fragrances created within its decade. Rush is joyously trashy and fearlessly unapologetic. Its signature and distinctive character make it unique and unforgettable. Projection and sillage are nothing less than incredible. A fragrance this highly addictive should come with a warning sign.

"Pantene pro-V, cocaine, and pussy" - mooregrace wins, everyone go home!!

this is literally that, and I adore her.

it's what the sweat tour would smell like bottled up; spilled bottles of rush and Amsterdam gold in an enclosed space, cans of got2b and aquanet, an orgy in the bathrooms of whatever stadium Charli and Troye are at, a sloshed-around gin tonic, and a hankering for trouble.

no notes. I adore her. full review will come in an edit but whatever the case:

verdict: WHEN I GO TO THE CLUB I WANNA SMELL THOSE CLUB CLASSICS 💚

i first discovered bruno banani and then this one. This one is much more intense, it has character, I guess because of patchouli, and it's a bit seductive also. Interesting choice, and can be signature scent
Worst packaging of all time. And the perfume inside smells like old stinky plastic. Overpriced for what you are getting, and a major design failure in whoever designed the packaging

My favourite of all times. What can i say for this masterpiece? It was the first perfume that i bought and my first love since i was 20. Really charming and seductive. The colour of the bottle is the most appropriate i believe. Red like passion! I believe there is no woman that can resist this beauty. Seduction in a bottle. Love love love
Pantene Pro-V, cocaine and pussy.

An oldy but goody! This perfume is my absolute favorite night time and cold weather scent. I’ve been wearing it since I was a teenager and it evokes so many good memories. It’s probably the sexiest perfume I have ever smelled. The best way to describe it would be a sultry fruitchouli! It has decent silage without taking over an entire room and lasts 8-10 hours. I see myself continuing to buy this for many more years to come.

I have tested it in a perfume store, This fragrance is white flory with peach in top notes, then moves to be more flory with a hint of spices not annoying in the background and stills in the dry down with fragrance very similar to dry down of "L'Interdit Eau de Parfum Givenchy",but this fragrance is lighter than "L'Interdit Eau de Parfum Givenchy" seems like the little sister of "L'Interdit Eau de Parfum Givenchy" without tuberose ,also the hint of spices in the background still exists with more clear woody fragrance.

If you didn't smell this perfume before, I advise that you can blind buy if you interest "L'Interdit Eau de Parfum Givenchy" but searching on perfume similar to it, but lighter. This perfume very suitable to sensitive nose people.

This fragrance suitable to wear it at night or during the day in all seasons, It lasts 4 hours on the leather and more hours time on clothes.


لقد جربته في متجر للعطور، هذا العطر عبارة عن زهور بيضاء مع الخوخ في النوتات العليا، ثم يتحول إلى زهور بيضاء أكثف مع لمسة من التوابل غير مزعجة في الخلفية ويستقر في القاعدة مع رائحة تشبه إلى حد كبير رائحة "جيفينشي ليندرتي إيدي بارفوم"، لكن هذا العطر أخف من "جيفينشي ليندرتي إيدي بارفوم" يبدو وكأنه الأخت الصغرى لـ "جيفينشي ليندرتي إيدي بارفوم" بدون مسك الروم، كما أن لمحة من التوابل في الخلفية لا تزال موجودة مع رائحة خشبية أكثر وضوحًا.

إذا لم تشم هذا العطر من قبل، أنصحك بشراؤه إذا كنتِ تستمتعين بروائح مشابهة لـ"جيفينشي ليندرتي إيدي بارفوم" ولكن تبحثين عن عطر مشابه له ولكن أخف. هذا العطر مناسب جدًا للأشخاص الذين لديهم حساسية في الأنف.

هذا العطر مناسب لارتدائه في الليل أو أثناء النهار في جميع الفصول، يدوم لمدة 4 ساعات على الجلد وساعات أطول على الملابس.

I acquired Gucci Rush in 2023 f/the Dufry at the Vienna (Austria ) Airport. No clue what formulation.

I hold massive scent associations.
My gentle, old, best friend Mr. Fred The Cat, was very sick when I had to leave the USA, so I’ve now a heart wrenching, wretch-ed, yet thankful reaction whenever I smell this.
I will never wear it again.

But that summer, I needed a soul boosting-pull up your big girl panties & boot straps fragrance to push me through a job that had to be done before I could go home. I was in absolute despair, & with sobs, I chose this.

I’ve heard polarizing reviews on it, my favorite being:
“The lady who boiled the rabbit in Fatal Attraction probably wore this”.
Well, I needed a bitchy scent to match my attitude & project me forward, so ya…perfect.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~>
This is intoxicating. Good or bad, it’s modern & it’s timeless.
It’s Andy Warhol. It’s Santana.

1st spray: Electrifying. Florals & spices. Then you’re sucker punched w/funky peach, (I hate peach) & indolic gardenia & like it or not, it captivates to the point of distraction. This helped me not concentrate on my overwhelming heart sick homesick emotions.

As it settles, a super weird plasticky Barbie doll head trail emerges that also smells of the strong jasmine “California Scents” brand car air freshener (it comes in a pop tab can), nachos & cilantro. Maize? Herbs? Idk, but think drunken 2 am taco runs in college that have loads of sensorial associations.
(Malibu Musk or Coty’s Exclamation were probably wearing you.)

It’s bold. The vanilla & smoky patchouli warm up the base & linger leaving a comfort you grasp if you appreciate incense or the smell of cigarettes at the beach. You can’t wear this if you’re afraid to stand out. All my fux were given so I wore it for the entire 2 months.

No fear.
I was with a team of people.
People complained.
People complimented.
Neither mattered.

It’s edgy, badass, disco-tech. It’s the Y2K suburban mom slumber party hostess who snuck Seagram’s wine coolers to power her through her duties of the night. We other moms understood because it would be our rotation next month. We knew she needed a little Rush in her world.

I made it home & so did my beloved cat.
Mr Fred is now at peace.
As am I.

Bless you, Gucci.
🌷🫶🏻 xo
smells like a party girl with an aquanet hair helmet on, in a disco in 1998 italy. love.

This was on sale at the airport and blind bought it knowing it has been a signature fragrance of our yesteryear. It was a big mistake. A masculine smelling not very nice perfume. I don't quite get the love, sorry. Avoid.

I love this but its not strong enough for me.

I am a lover of truly big bombastic fragrances. Its the entire reason i collect vintage 80s to mid 90s scents. They are heavy hitters, they last AND project bigly ALL DAY, and are excellent value for those very reasons.

Rush is totally addicting and gorgeous… i dont find it nearly as crazy or unusual as others describe it. But it’s just a really gorgeous piece of perfumery.

However, finding a vintage bottle is like paying big bucks for a lottery ticket.

You need to look for “Scannon” on the box/bottle.
BUT…
The problem is that Scannon bottles span from 1999 to the mid 2000s and i really suspect the first reformulation happened within that time.

All i know is that the juice in my Scannon bottle isnt all that long lasting or projecting after the first 30 minutes.

Thats not good enough for me.

I wore it this weekend and my boyfriend said it was faint even after i massively over-sprayed (this was only two hours later).

My rollerball of Rasha by Al Rehab lasted all day, and had great projection. It was years ago when i owned it, but i finally ordered more (hope its still beastly!)

My suggestions to replace GUCCI RUSH:

Rasha was and hopefully still is the best dupe of Rush one could hope for. Its fantastic. I used to get tons of compliments on it.

Angel Nova is different but it does really remind me of Rush, its similarly unique, fruity, and has that same ELECTRIC ALIVENESS! that Rush does. Another compliment getter. Beastly.

Red Jeans by Versace also has that same “Aliveness” and if you overspray that sucker will last and project strongly all day.I actually find both the newer bottles and the vintages to project and last really well (when sprayed generously).
I like them both equally. The newer bottles are also fresher smelling.

All of the above are compliment getters, and they all remind me of each other.

For me, all the above satisfy the Rush shaped hole in my heart. And all of them also layer remarkably well with each other AND with Rush. I have been layering my vintage Scannon Rush with both Nova and Red Jeans, at different times, and they blend seamlessly.

But reformulated Rush does NOT fill the void for me, and Ive given up trying to find a bottle of the vintage.

Not worth the money or the effort.

I got this in 1999 at a duty free. Loved it then, love it now. Since, I’ve accumulated a collection of about 125 perfumes. Recently purchased this again, for nostalgia’s sake. Albeit, slightly less of a beast, smells like I recalled. It smells like disco manic fuchsia sparkle candy. It reminds me of TF Black Orchid’s sweet little cousin who’s on gap year and is on a coke-fueled clubbing binge, in lucite platforms that smell of plastic, and drinking fruity cocktails.

When I properly wore it for the first time, I thought I was anosmic to it because it took me a few minutes to get accustomed to my new scent. I appreciate that it is very "adjustable" depending on the amount of sprays you use.

Two sprays give me a creamy, white floral, peachy, beautiful scent that is still decidedly feminine. It does smell like expensive hairspray at first but it is more accurate to say that the hairspray smells like this. Some fragrances have a certain unpleasant smell at first but when you let them sit on your skin and keep sniffing, you realise they are not as one-dimensional as you have imagined. "Rush" is a prime example for such perfume.

Three sprays give me a dusty, earthy, slightly dirty scent that is also a little spicy and creamy. I have no idea what most of the notes smell like on their own therefore I judge based on the description of the notes and my own sense of smell. I believe the "dirty" scent is the patchouli. The white flowers make it more palatable and less coarse while the coriander gives it a masculine edge. The peach and the rose are also there, adding juicy sweetness to the scent. The pyramid seems so bizarre at first but the notes compliment one another and work really well.

It is an extremely interesting perfume. It is very original and unique yet very comfortable to wear. It is well-balanced yet most of the notes stand out. None of them overpower the rest but they are clearly distinguishable. It can be a feminine scent but it can also be pretty unisex. Since my skin has its own "scent", it gives this fragrances a dark twist. I own some men's colognes that are less masculine than this. It is quite versatile.

I love everything about "Rush". The name, the package, the juice, the ad campaign. The entire team that worked on this product was really creative. They did a fabulous job. The bottle is surprisingly easy to use. It is compact and lightweight but does not feel cheap despite being made of plastic. I love the idea.

Tip: if you hold the bottle in front of a source of strong light (e.g. flashlight), you can see the amount of liquid you have left. The inside of the bottle looks identical to the "Rush 2" flanker which comes in a clear bottle.

One of my best blind buys! Long-lasting, stunning, different, high-quality. You only need 2-3 sprays on each arm and 3 sprays on your neck and it will easily last until you wash it off in the evening. You do NOT overspray this. It will become repulsive. It is potent.

It does NOT smell like plastic to me. I really do not get that.

Song: La Oreja de Van Gogh - La Niña Que Llora en Tus Fiestas

One of the most unique perfumes I have ever smelled.Not the most beautiful.But just because its unique and not comperable to almost anything else, (Bitter Peach maybe) it gives it super extra points.
Its fruity sweet patchouli heavy,woody spicy and aromatic.
The drydown I find a bit masculine,so I think this could be unisex.

One of the best numbers released yet in the 90s!
The new formulation may not be like the original, but this ... boys, this was a head turner and all for the good reasons back in the days.
All time favourite for a woman. 1000/10

i had to take out a lil sample from a while ago. the plastic comparison has been made so many times. it has the exact type of hazy fresh out the factory plastic smell from a new barbie doll. especially in the opening.

the fact that this was very popular back in the days genuinely baffles me a bit lol... it smells clean and dirty feral at the same time. patchouli base + idolic white florals. bit camphor like. quite heavy on the patchouli. combined with a creamy sweet vanilla with a slap of coriander and a hint of cheap make upy rose? its a really odd one for my nose. experimental, avant-garde... reminds me a lot of a bjork music clip. tbh cant think of anything like it.

i genuinely like it but purely artistically. it is just so weird and interesting but it borders being extremely unpalatable for me. however im starting to nod some appreciation towards Michel Almairac. from what i've tried of him so far he seems to be a very creative parfumer that can create a unique abstract fragrance. most notably my favorite of his was dior farhenheit and that stuff straight up smells like gasoline and car leather, and i love it. so i can understand why people like this too.

however just like dior farhenheit it's one of those scents you cannot force people around you to like... and it'd be justified if they ask you to leave the premise lol. don't spray too much.
I can't describe this perfume >>>>>it is like a burned plastic

Can anyone in here tell me what I need to look for if I want to try and find a vintage "cassette" of this one?? I was so beyond let down at the re-form version. One of the worst re-forms in perfumery honestly. They stripped this of it's character. If you never smelled the old one, you might think this one smells good. But if you could compare the two, I think you'd totally agree with me that they nearly smell like two different frags. I'm going to try and hunt down a vintage bottle. What do I need to look for? I know it's going to be pricey. Help! I can find no info online answering this question and I know someone in here knows Lol!

Having never tried this fragrance before, upon spraying it on today I recognized the scent straight away as I remember smelling this on women many years ago. I was dying to try it, especially as I saw on here that it's listed as a night time scent. I really expected this to be quite sexy but to my nose, it is quite watery. Not in a watered down way, but light and somewhat watery smelling. This watery-ness could be coming from the peach and gardenia together (as opposed to being syrupy or juicy). The patchouli isn't heavy at all and doesn't throw out "dirty hippy" vibes. The vanilla is done well in this fragrance because it just sweetens up the composition a bit without making it cloying. To be completely honest, I was looking for Freak Me by Silk in this perfume but instead I got Thank You by Dido 🤭

This is a light (not deep, dark, or mysterious), feminine perfume which is pretty in its own right. I do have to give it credit for its longevity as I've been wearing it almost 12hrs and am still getting wafts of it just like when I first sprayed it on.

boring, pissy, sour musty white floral. reminds me of la vie est belle but more coarse and slightly dirty. perfumey and dusty. subtle dirty patchouli combined with dated white florals, zero modern/animalic notes.

the bottle though.. so cheap, the red plastic is horrid and weightless.

lasts 4hrs

regardless i’m a huge fan ❤️

Shiny vinyl pants in a bottle. Sings with high pitched voice. Lately I find my knees aching and my body being all stiff on the mornings feeling like I am 100 years old even though Im just 43, I bought it for nostalgia I suppose. My roommate wore this back in 1999 or 2000. I disliked it then. What made me think Id tolerate it now? Same thing when I bought black xs. Cant stand it either but it smells like when I was young, fit and I had ass that was not saggy.

Woody peach and breezy, sugar-water-esque white florals. There's also a smooth, slightly dirty-mineral undertone to the whole thing, like dusty stone. The notes sound natural, but the vibe is plasticy, synthetic, and cool; a Y2K scent if ever there was one.

It's Strict Machine by Goldfrapp, and Can't Get You Out Of My Head by Kylie Minogue. It's color-tinted sunglasses with no frames, and a slick ponytail with glitter-gel side pieces.

For a 2001 bottle of this juice:

I remember applying this at Sephora in high school (literally two sprays), walking into a coffee shop, and seeing a girl from my school working the register. She immediately says “ I CAN SMELL YOU FROM HERE” in the weirdest way possible.

I didn't realize how nuclear this is because one spray is enough to give me anosmia. The “new” formulation is like a stripped down Mitsouko with some Saran Wrap, but the old is a detonation of peach, plastic, earthy green, and insane sweetness. This rocks my socks off I have to say. It is, despite its sweetness, quite masculine due to the prominent Vetiver and patchouli. It’s a circus act with the balance of fruity plastic sweetness almost overtaking the earthy spicy counter-notes. Such a cool fragrance and VERY distinctive. You have to have a personality to pull this off.
OMG. This doesn't smell good on me at all...no way!
Very herbal. Don’t like this at all.

I was somewhat surprised to see this still on the shelves, it seems to have been around forever. The packaging hasn't changed it seems, the fragrance however has, but let's be honest, what hasn't. It may not be quite as potent as it once was, but it still packs a punch, this latest version is a fruity patchouli embrace, it's sweet and creamy, but it works. Sillage was moderate, longevity however was good.

It's still a winner, still unmistakable.
Sadly the only impression I get from this is gas station bathroom cleaner. Way too sharp and synthetic smelling for me.

I haven't smelled the reformulation (I highly doubt it's as stellar or potent as the original, which i ripped off the shelves at The Bay the second it was first released) but the original is a piece of futurist, rave scene art. It was dense, mind bending, synthetic, edgy and sexy. If you wore Fornarina platform shoes, silver bellbottoms and a lime green fun fur coat, this would be the fragrance to match.

Mmmm, patchouli? Really? More like a warm sweet peaches and cream with a nutty aroma thrown in. I like spicy/ oreintal perfumes so this is too light for me. It slightly reminds me of agent pro when first spayed, the white floral, with a tad of rose and the above mentioned notes
I got this as y2k is all around me and a blast of the noughties, taking me back to my thirties would be fun, it’s not that fun but wait after 4 hours this is quite sensual.
I like a feral, animalistic scents, but this is super sweet and sickly, but has a few moments of being close to classy, understated and sheer.

There is something magic about this fragrence🥰

A really great channel for learning to see the difference between real and fake👌
Is patchouli in the room with us?

This shouldn't be my thing. I hate peaches and patchouli- but this freak I can't live without. Maybe it's being born in 1980, in college in 1998-2002 that makes me LOVE this weirdo. I don't even like the smell THAT much, but I love wearing it. IT'S PLASTIC and it's FANTASTIC! I have a backup somewhere, and I almost need it. Since 2019-ish, the prices have gone up slightly and stock seems to be lower (it was EVERYWHERE at discounters) I fear this has been discontinued? Well, I found a lone dusty 2.5oz at TJ Maxx in a locked cabinet for $50. Done. Backup to the backup secured.
This is the perfume version of Mambo #5. EVERYONE HATED THAT SONG, but man, it's catchy and I find myself laughing while I enjoy it today. Same with Gucci Rush.

This is a blind but I am happy about!
This is vintage in 2024! This smells like Edie Britt or Gabby from desperate housewives!
It’s sexy but sweet!
I sprayed it once on my hand and went, yep I know this smell! This is what they were spraying in cool girl shops before Abercrombie and fitch!
I don’t get any milk with this, maybe a touch of sherbet milk bottles.
The patchouli and peach is amazing. I dislike Angel but my husband loves it, I’m hoping he will like this more!

Disarmingly weird. I'm almost surprised that this was such a go-to for thousands and thousands of women because there's something almost offensive about it. The peachy opening is very brief; it's a sticky, slightly yucky peach, like you left one in the bottom of your bag and forgot about it for a week. Things get worse or better (depending on your taste) with the dry down, which I can only describe as plastic and candy wrappers that have been left to marinate in milk. It's unfortunately weak on me, but the bottle is a masterpiece. A real achievement.

I remember this being a bright vibrant fruity y2k perfume that high school and college me always coveted when friends had it. But memories of scents are often unreliable…

Finally got my hands on a bottle today in 2024 and idk if this wasn’t well stored/cared for but it’s so light and weak and has such poor performance :( I’m so bummed. Especially seeing that other people consider this a winter/fall fragrance I’m really disappointed in my bottle. (Though this is one of the very few bottles where I am pleased to have it just for the bottle.) But alas the search continues.

This is in my top 3 of favorite fragrances. Its sexy beyond belief but I also find it romantic and nostalgic. Its very polarizing, some people love it and some people hate it. I'm in the first camp. It is a bit synthetic but still smells like a brand name perfume. I think a few people.are offended by the extreme female sexual nature of Rush. Soft white florals, peaches and cream + coriander held together and supported on a bed of patchouli. It reminds me of a sexy American Italian lady for some reason.

While on the hunt to collect vintage perfumes I wore years ago, thank god from digging around TJ Maxx found this for $60 versus $125 on the Gucci site. Don’t know who I thought I was wearing this bougie beast while probably only having $10 in my savings then. Nevertheless, I get it- once the alcohol plastic initial smell fades, you’re left with the gardenia, and peach. Sweet too with hints of jasmine and not heavy on the patchouli, it may be the reformulated version. Thinking this is what introduce me to like white florals. For a mere toilette, I’m not mad at it. 💗
Jenny Glow Vision is another example along this line. Intense fragrance, good sillage, lasts 4-5 hours, longer on clothes.

Because I don't care for the haters, I'm skipping reading any reviews and writing my own free will, ha. Gucci Rush is eternal, and not just because it's so strong. Since it debuted I've probably gone through four bottles and today I bought my fifth after a longer than 15 year hiatus while exploring true vintages, indies and niches. The thing I also dig about Rush is it's still unique after 25 years, and that's especially true now. Rush is not for the faint-hearted. It's a powerhouse, it's sweet, and definitely a gourmand fruitchouli, although it's not completely wrongly described as a Chypre Fruity. To my nose, it's quite sexy. While wearing it, I am transported back to simpler times and places, a smaller physique, heh, and getting into new genres of music. It's watching Charmed. It's being young and carefree. I love it. <3

I’ve wanted to try this scent out for a very long time, but I couldn’t find any testers or samples. I finally lucked out and won a partial bottle in a giveaway. The first time I tried it, I got a burst of coriander similar to that in Tom Ford’s Cafe Rose before the white florals kicked in. Things didn’t work out so well the next few times I wore it, though. The patchouli and vetiver notes combined with the coriander to create a weird sour and musty accord that drowned out the peach and the white floral notes. I also kept getting a plastic note on and off throughout the day. Ultimately, I ended up with a headache. I tried wearing less the next time and I still got a headache. Choosing a different lotion didn’t make much of a difference either. As interesting as this scent is, it’s just not for me. Don’t let my bad experiences discourage you though; if you can somehow get a sample or tester and you’re in the mood for something bold, give it a try. It’s fairly long lasting and strong- perfect for those days you feel like standing out from the crowd.

Gucci Rush smells like gardenia, vinyl records, patchouli, peach schnapps, men's aftershave and milk. The peach schnapps are spilled and slightly dried on the sticky floor like in the aftermath of a wild party. It reminds me of the manic energy around the turn of the millennium when people were wondering if the world was going to end or what the future was about to reveal. To me Gucci Rush is contradictory in that it is reminiscent of both trying too hard to have fun and melancholy. A deceptively joyful fragrance declaring brashly that the party is over.

Reminds me of the way video/dvd rental stores used to smell like.

If u have them layer this with december vanille paris corner. They just work together so beautifully ❤️

Found a reseller of this perfume online because I was so curious about it based on its reputation. Took a while to grow on me, and to be honest I still don’t understand why this was such a hit, but I do really like it. It makes me feel like a hot bitchy slut. I don’t go clubbing but this perfume makes me want to go clubbing. I feel like I should be wearing a tube top while smelling like this. If you can’t understand what’s cool about being trashy, it won’t be for you. But I love being a bimbo personally soooo…. Vibes.

I have a big question, why in the past most perfumes had such an intense patchouli?
a big no from me, it's disgusting, especially when patchouli is combined with peach, it's worse.

I was sure I was not going to like this. Reading the very divisive reviews, along with comments mentioning “hairspray” “neon” “milk” “plastic” “fruitchouli”. My thoughts without smelling were like “what the f***?” But now that I have smelled it, yes. I get all of those comments. And for some this could be a nightmare to smell. But this is going to very quickly become a love, I can tell.

I was born 1992 so although I didn’t wear fragrances in the 90s, I was surrounded by them. I definitely recognize this scent profile, just like I did when I smelled a vintage bottle (haven’t smelled a current formulation) of Eden by Cacharel. And although these actually do have some similarities, I couldn’t bear Eden for more than an experiment. I wore it maybe 3 times before it found a new home. But this, I sprayed a few hours ago, and I want to spray it again! Addictive! I haven’t looked at the batch code for mine yet. And I did just receive it in the mail from the grey market a few hours ago, so I’m not judging its performance just yet. It doesn’t seem as strong as I was imagining from the comments, but I still am getting lovely whiffs so perhaps to people around me this would be stronger.

This is my first Gucci love, yeah I’m just gonna say I love it. I’ve only tried modern Gucci fragrances, besides the men’s version of Envy (reminds me too much of old school masculines - which I don’t like), and they all fell flat and generic to me. *One day I’ll find a way to try others released during Tom Ford’s reign.* This does not feel generic. It feels truly unique. And as a gay man, I now see why other gay men have loved wearing this. Aside from the substance reference lol. And fragrance knows no gender to me, you like what you like. Life is too short to try and live by others expectations. I also love the bottle. I’ve read through comments and many find it ugly. I find it charming. It reminds me of the red plastic boombox I had. Along with all the plastic I remember from being a kid. And I think it has a nice almost “retro mod/futuristic” look, if that makes sense. Btw, this gives me some kinda vibe that is similar to I think Chance by Chanel. Perhaps Chance (albeit spicier IMO) is the well behaved side of one’s personality, and maybe Rush is everything after dark. 😉

Neon peach rings. Late nights at a club. Dancing. Hairspray. Blue cocktails. MDMA. Being in another man’s bedroom only lit up by the neon light on the wall across from his bed.

Song: I See You Baby (Fatboy Slim Remix) [feat Gram’Ma Funk] by Groove Armada

🥀


Update 10/15 - The more I wear this the more I realize it is not really me. I think it’s the gardenia. I do like having this in my collection and I would like to take a break from it and see if I like it on a winter’s night or something. I don’t hate it by any means, I just feel like an imposter or something. Could be that this feels young and sexy and sexy is just something I’ve never been so maybe it’s just not a match. Will give it some more time to see.

Vintage version starts off more blatantly fruity, along with more pungent coriander and some seriously overripe aldehydes (I'm testing a 24-year-old formula, mind - newer batches are brighter on the open). But in less than five minutes, Gucci Rush is down to business as usual. Hairspray, peach candy, plastic doll head, Grandma's dusting powder, Scotch tape, Impossible Gardenia™, brown sugar musk (think Narciso's white cube), vetiver, patchouli, [insert oakmoss synthetic here], a whiff of your older brother's cologne from down the hall, and milk. These flabbergasting accords somehow transmogrify into a humming, neon-like aura that's warm, sensual, sophisticated, nostalgic...and maddeningly, bafflingly addictive. Don't worry about reformulation - the current Rush is just as weird and wonderful (and strong!) as it's ever been, and after years of fearing its discontinuation, I think I can confidently say it's here to stay for a while. Get comfortable and enjoy it. Or don't; you won't be alone. Either way, it's like no other perfume you'll ever smell.

Smells like Coco Mademoiselle's trashy, but loveable sister. My Rush is from the early 2000's. I love it, but don't wear it out of the house because it is very permeating and a little raunchy. On me I get that sweet plastic doll scent, peaches, strawberry yogurt, and something else unidentifiable, maybe that's the sex/raunchy part. Definitely not patchouli, as I really don't like that scent. This lasts for days on clothing a solid 12 on skin.

Парфюм- шедьовър! Уникален, класен.
Противоречив- топъл и студен.
Страхотна трайност.

This is a “strong” perfume, with an exceptional sillage ; timid refrain!

A beautiful scent of white flowers, woody, with a hint of peach and enhanced by coriander which gives a spicy and punchy side to the whole. I really liked it and wore it in the past because, I make no secret of it, I love when the sillage is good !

Note that the coriander is well dosed because in certain perfumes, it bothers me terribly. Here, not at all.

For self-confident women who don't care about how others look at them.

I applied it at 10 a.m. and was immediately overwhelmed by a blast of white floral--but not 80s white floral, because there was a hint of something synthetic and plasticy that dampened the assault and paradoxically added to the appeal. It was instantly recognizable as a late 90s, Millennial-Gen Z cusper. If I could situate Gucci Rush in a piece of media, it would be The Sweetest Thing, one of the most rotten films of the aughts ("You're too big to fit in here!") and yet second only to Charlie's Angels in epitomizing the aesthetics of Y2K. Specially, the early clubs scenes, replete with asymmetrical crop tops, corsets, and bootcut pants riding low on impossibly flat stomachs accentuated with a belly chain. But I digress...the rose followed quickly on the heels of the gardenia and freesia and, by 1:00, the vanilla was enthusiastically announcing itself as well. Then, around 2:00, the fabled patchouli sprouted at last, completing the four-hour journey from floral to lactonic to chypre and announcing the final movement of a wonderfully discordant symphony. Who knew that a slow burn really could feel like such a rush?

Smells like fancy 00s nightclub restrooms - the attendant in the ladies' would always have this in her arsenal of pay-per-spray fragrances and I guess some ladies did avail (or the scent-profile was being replicated by other chemicals used on-site...) because the smell is sooo evocative. It's also just a great perfume, & although I'm still not a fan of the cinnamon note I actually find Rush's freesia-peach-patchouli-plastic very wearable now.
the combination of patchouli and vanilla gives a suede scent. This is the beautiful smell of a well-groomed woman.
As time went by, this fragrance turns out to be far more conceptual than at times of its greatest glory. I find the current formulation airy, subtly industrial and almost aquatic. Cherish this! 7/10

I'm not sure how I feel about this one. I do love the fruity floral notes but I'm not sure if it's the coriander or the patchouli or the combination of both that I don't like. I've never actually smelled coriander in perfume and I've definitely had perfumes with patchouli but I'm not able to discern which of the two I don't like in Rush. It has this peppery scent that makes it hard to love. When first sprayed it on I thought "ok this is nice it's unique" but then then that pepper like scent becomes stronger and stronger to me. It's a bit confusing. It does last and it does project, it's unfortunate it's not really for me but maybe it will grow on me eventually.

Absolutely not for an innocent person or a crowdpleaser but someone that is confident, sexy and familiar with nightlife because I am getting faux-leather dresses/pants/corsets, nightclubs, strong liquor cocktails, lipsticks and trails of chemicals. A little bit of an illegal fantasy. Everything late 90s and early 2000s hid in itself I can smell from this. Definitely not unpleasant but a very distinctive fragrance that is unlike anything I have smelled before.

Gucci Rush is a beautiful combination of Peach,White florals, Patchouli and Vanilla with a waxy and plastic vibe. It's a bold, unique and sexy perfume which will leave a trail wherever you go and people are bound to turn their heads. Some may find it a bit synthetic & maybe even vintage, but that's what makes this perfume so exceptional than other perfumes. It's a fragrance you should wear when you want to go out for fun & get noticed. This reminds me of a carnival full of cotton candies, fruits, flowers and adventurous rides. The perfume was named after a stimulative dr*ug which was really widespread in America during 1980's. And maybe that's why the perfume smells so intoxicating, rebellious and enigmatic. It's not for the shy girl but perfect for the lady who wants to get noticed. Not a safe blind buy but if you don't mind something bold and a bit timeless then you can give this perfume a try.

🌸Gucci Rush is extremely long lasting on my skin. And it projects very nicely. In fact if you spray more than 7/8 sprays then it may fill the whole room announcing your arrival.

🌸 Perfect for parties and hangouts. You can wear this all year round but better avoiding it during hot sunny days. But it's ok for breezy summer evenings.

🌸The bottle is a nice addition to the vanity. Video Cassette shaped unique design and the bold red color makes it look really eye catching and interesting. It brings back memories of the 90's ❤️

A synthetic floral fragrance. Very distinctive and plasticky, could only have been spawned by the 90's. The bottle is an absolutely genius piece of design as it perfectly reflects the scent: a synthetic, red note, all treble, completely devoid of bass. This is a "high" fragrance. Comparisons to Cacharel's Eden are completely on point. Although interesting pieces of art, both fragrances exist to me as a suggestion of a headache waiting to appear. Yes it smells like poppers.

Some say it is synthetic or plasticky, well that was the goal.
An Iconic masterpiece. Avant-garde and merciless.
Only for the confident.
Gucci was still Gucci when this was launched.
10/10
The scent of guilty pleasure...

absolutely adore this one, my mother used to wear it in the early 2000s and it's still such an iconic scent. On the first spray it might be a bit intense but it mellows out into a lovely warm spiciness. I'd go as far as to describe it as a lighter more floral Elixir des Mervailles by Hermes if that makes sense.

This perfume smells amazing. It's an easy reach, great everyday fragrance that's not offensive. These fragrances from the 90's and early 2000's really do it for me.
I found this in a local Ross store for $49.99. Great buy!

My addiction. How have I skipped writing you a review?! It's a scent you don't forget and you can't compare it to anything else. Even after radically simplifying my shelf, I am so horrified at the thought of this being discontinued, I have a stacked supply. Even after all this time and reformulations, this is a perfume you can smell from the box even before you spray it for the first time. And boy, does it last.

Notes: think the top note as a smashed peach by vinyl high heel boots. The heart is a strong, in-your-face jasmine, touch of rose, all blended in milky vanilla. Then all of this carried by dark, daddy patchouli.

It's my ultimate "I'm going out and I'm looking for trouble" perfume. I wear it not when I want attention, but when I know I'm getting it. I sniff it when I need a mood lift. It's addictive. Powerful. Sexy. It's obvious and in your face and it doesn't fucking care. It's such a mood. I am so happy this is slept on by the younger generation (for now), as I know I won't smell myself on others among the Good Girls and Black Opiums. I've had men follow my scent trail at parties just to tell me it's the sexiest thing they've smelled. I feel like with the right marketing it could make a bomb comeback, because this is both nostalgic and futuristic in the same time. It cannot go out of fashion. It makes people go crazy, and I am proudly one of them. It will always have place on a rave in Berlin, on a sunrise walk at 6am in Rome, on a dress on the floor in a room you've never been in. God, how I fucking love you Rush. Please stay, always.

Rush is a very unique scent. The opening is very fresh peach, but there's also heavy batch of patchouli and white flowers. For me, it smells plasticky and synthetic, but not in a bad way if that makes any sense. I love waxy lipstick type of scents, so this is not quite my cup of tea, but I find it intriguing.

I don't know how to describe this scent, I can't pick up any definitive note from it. Smells like aromatic candy, if that makes any sense. An aromatic cologne sprinkled with fruity candy dust. It smells good, don't get the amount of hate it gets.

My mum had this and it was my favourite to steal hahaha it is a really feminine scent it brings out your energy and confidence I love this one I do believe it is a good buy for 20+ y.o. and prefer to wear when going out

neon, ostentatious and plasticky. it opens up like a barbie you sprayed with your moms perfume when you were young and you can still smell her hair. then, it transforms into a deep red smell (idk) that kinda smells like a woman who grew out of her party days but is still wild at heart. intoxicating patchouli mixed with fruits, you can definitely identify why young women and gay men wore this in the late nineties/early 2000s, since it's sweet and almost crowd pleasing, but it's too strange and gnarly to smell like any of the tedious cotton candy scents of nowadays. i have a sort of respect for this, yet idk if i would wear it. also, it has that vibe of doing a whore's bath after a hookup and you can still smell last night's perfume and the glitter and the sticky bar. beautiful, but my personality isnt big enough to encompass all of this.

Candy, plastic & steam machines at the disco.
I´ve come across this scent many times without knowing what it was.
I like it.
But it is a bit much to handle too often

Very quirky bottle 🙂.

This is absolutely beautiful. I don't understand why people are so dismissive of 90s fragrances. CK One is still one of my favourites and I'll be enjoying this for a long time as well.

It's very powerful; perfect for the cold weather. Some people have described it as otherworldly and electric and whilst that doesn't describe the scent, it certainly describes the vibe.

The patchouli and vanilla are prominent. Huge compliment getter. You'll love it and so will others.

9/10

I really wanted to like it, but sorry to say, this didn't agree with me at all. I tried to give it time but hours later, I still couldn't get on with it. Best way to describe how it smells to me is artificial fruit-scented disinfectant, if there ever was one, resting on a backdrop of a sweet sandalwood. Smells that seem discordant with each other rather than harmonious. Also didn't smell any patchouli in it, yet its description says it is there. Usually patchouli fragrances are hit and miss with me, but in this case, I didn't get any of that. Interesting that this was inspired by the use of poppers in clubs. When I was much younger, I have tried poppers in a club eh... I was quite out of it that night but I remember that I felt nauseous and sick suddenly and threw up on the club floor in front of people, so not a great memory 😅 Maybe that's why I didn't like it. This is a very Marmite fragrance so try it before you buy.

I love Gucci Rush! It's one of my favourites at the moment -- so unique and intriguing, yet very easy to like. I never smelt it when it first came out, but it doesn't smell like it came out in the late '90s; it was definitely ahead of its time.

For a fragrance featuring peach and white florals, it is very ballsy -- the patchouli and coriander give it a bite. I do get the "electronics" smell that some have described -- like wires that have been fried from a power surge or a remote control car that's been used constantly for a couple of hours, but in the most appealing way possible.

It's not delicate or pretty; it's bold and edgy. It reminds me of a woman who is feminine and classy but has masculine energy -- maybe skateboards on the weekends and has hidden tough tattoos.

I don't understand why it has such low ratings for spring and summer wear -- it's a warm fragrance, but it's not too sweet or suffocating. I've been wearing it in pretty warm weather and to the gym and have loved it. This could be a signature scent.

Performance is fantastic (I am a bit of an over sprayer -- 8 sprays mainly on clothes); after 8 hours, it wafts up to my nose if I start walking around. It lasts all day on clothes and 5ish hours on skin.

I like Gucci Rush. Always have and always will. To me it does not smell scandalous, vulgar or dated. Yes it was perceived like that in the beginning when it just came out, but I always liked it and will continue to ware it. To me, Rush and Clive Christian X smell very similar, so why pay more?

[975] I have wanted to try Gucci Rush for a long time. An avant-garde composition that is the epitome of the futuristic Y2K aesthetic, its opaque red rectangular bottle was cutting edge - much like the scent housed within. It is also the polar opposite of the minimal L'Eau d'Isseys/CK Ones that summed up the 1990s - again, perhaps looking to the future. A bold fruitchouli with a heady white floral heart, it is an extroverted, polarising scent, made for nightclubbing. I found a tester (modern bottle obviously) in a pharmacy and I was surprised by how familiar it is - it resembles Cacharel Eden and perhaps others (but this is much better than Eden).

Rush opens with sweet, juicy peach followed closely by the creamy white floral accord that defines this scent. There is a camphorous green undertone to the opening that amps up the volume while remaining cohesive. Some peppery spice follows.

As it develops, jammy rose rears its head, joining the lush, sweet white florals. The modern chypre quality is unmistakable as the cloud of patchouli emerges, earthy and slightly muddy, making for a nice counterpoint to the bold floral sweetness. The vetiver complements it nicely, woody and dry. The peach persists, keeping things fruity throughout.

A liberal dose of vanilla adds sweetness to the base, alongside a slightly salty amber accord. It is smooth and creamy, complementing and prolonging the florals. The earthiness remains, underscoring the second act of Rush. It fades to a sweet vanilla skin scent punctuated by earthy patchouli until final fade. Sillage is strong and longevity is long-lasting. It is a feminine autumn/winter evening scent.

Intoxicating, lush and bold, Rush is also very well-composed and avoids being "kitchen-sink-y", which was what I expected. An edgy, brilliant time capsule that is still wearable today, Rush is to be worn with confidence. 4.5/5.

This fragrance makes me feel like i should be at a night club taking eccies. Super synthetically sweet but somehow in the best way possible. Always find myself holding my wrist up to my nose whenever I wear it because the smell is so addicting!
Wish it lasted longer.

Man’s review. This and Bvlgari
Blv Notte my favorites for women all time for me. Genius, Michael Almairac new this was a classic real woman smell, that’s why he made so many versions in different brands. This is still a mature dated classic. My mother and Grand mother still loves it In 2023. Only a grown mature or classic woman can wear this. Prob 28 age and up. Teenagers will not understand. If you want the best of Gucci Rush in the purest less synthetic 90 percent form, You should Try Clive X Woman you will love it and buy it. If you cannot afford Clive X, get Azalee Lalique, it’s lovely ladies….

I wore this when it first came out. Would not wear it now. It’s too synthetic and strong for me and I love strong perfumes. I loved it at one time. I love the red square bottle. It’s funny how your tastes can change.

Best scent ever. Sexy, a little sweet, absolutely intoxicating and addictive. One of the best fragrances ever created. I used it then and I’m using it now. But I found myself with so many perfumes now that I have an extra large brand new bottle I can let go if you are in the US.

1999 Ethereal tragically cool peach chypre with white-florals by Michel Almairac...

Overall it's a gorgeous, ethereal, airy, cool peach chypre, that sucks you in with the intoxicating drydown. Being sucked in is perhaps the only thing this scent bears in common with the film of the same name, Rush (1991). The mood here is more in keeping with the tragic coolness of Baz Luhrmann's cinematic retelling of Romeo + Juliet (1996). I could imagine Juliet (played by Claire Danes) wearing this scent the night she first meets Romeo (Leonardo DiCaprio), seeing him for the first time as a stranger through an aquarium. In this way, Gucci Rush is like a re-interpretation of the classic chypre genre, with a tragically cool flair popular to the late 90s.

The opening before the spray dries has some fresh, near-green & fruity tones. Once the spray dries and the sillage starts to open up, I get ethereal, cool, airy white-florals and soft peach, with an earthy patchouli underneath. In the drydown I get an earthy patchouli with dark, leathery, near-licorice-y tones. The longevity is there, but the sillage takes some time to wake-up. Batch code: 7129 (2017-05-09), but dark storage after first sprays helps with this. Overall, this scent does evoke the feeling of an ethereal, cool, lightheaded rush, and it's become a love for me. Enjoy!

Update 02/06/25: Sprayed this on this morning. First thing I notice is how leathery/suede-y the patchouli is. I'm surprised that leather or suede isn't a listed note. I find this more leathery with hints of licorice than the suede in Rihanna's Rogue, but there is a passing similarity. At first I don't notice any top notes, peach or gardenia (in keeping with my original test). But then they start to wake up and it turns the underlying leathery patchouli much more creamy with a hint of sweetness on a direct sniff. Just gorgeous.

I absolutely love gucci rush and I just bought a new bottle directly from gucci site. I remember long time ago my sister would spray it on herself in high school and the scent would start off exactly how the scent now dries down. I can even smell the current dry down after I shower and it's the best part of the fragrance for me. I'm not sure if gucci added more top notes over the years but I'd love to find a fragrance that starts off (as it did years ago) exactly like the current formulation ends. I looked up the base notes of rush and they are listed as rich vanilla, java patchouli, bourbon vetiver. If anyone knows of a fragrance that predominantly has these notes, please let me know.

LadyIva- Rush was released in 1999

Rush bottle in my opinion is avantgarde, innovative and unique. Just like the scent. I love it.

I’ve heard stories and fairy tales about this perfume; but now that I’ve finally tried it, I can’t believe how horrible it is!
