It’s a typical product of the 1980s, with that obnoxious overripe sweet peach, loads of powder and a synthetic patchouli base. It’s potent and unbearable. Oh, and that red plastic ‘bottle’ is beyond ugly.

This has to be one of my favourite perfumes ever gucci rush is what started my obsession with fragrances.

For me I get a lot of peach,vanilla and some floral notes to me it’s so interesting and unique.
I remember back in the early 2000s my mum always wore this and I always use to spray some on. It has been reformulated longevity isn’t how I remember but it does last about 6 hrs.

I will always have this perfume in my collection I wear this mostly in colder weather I also get alot of compliments when I wear this. This perfume isn’t for everyone but if you love it like me you’ll understand why it’s just so captivating

I absolutely adored this fragrance, and I wore it for a short time. But it was just too heavy. It would have been a keeper (and frankly, had more longevity on the market) if it had simply been less heavy. I would have loved to have the same exact fragrance, but dialed down.

Writing this review with a broken heart... this was the perfume I used to wear 10 years ago when my husband fell in love with me and he went crazy for this perfume. He associated this perfume with me. And today I wore it, as he picked up the last boxes from what used to be our home. He walked right past me and stopped, looked me in the eye and said "you are wearing your Gucci Rush"... I have a collection of 100+ perfumes, yet this is the one he never failed to recognize. I am going through the hardest time of my life right now, and I know I will recover someday from this separation... but this perfume will forever hold such a strong and powerful space in my life... will I wear it again? I just don't know...This is that perfume, that represents not only me... but us.

I love this perfume it’s addictive and unique and weird. It opens like intense peachy shampoo and banana peels, and dries down to smell like peaches and cookies. If it were a color it would be that translucent neon pink that looks orange from certain angles. Current formulation lasts well but doesn’t project much, unfortunately, I wish people could smell me through a wall when wearing this. It’s prettiest in cooler weather but I try to get away with wearing it all year. Not for everyone but the girls who get it, get it💅🏼
The patchouli is scratchy with the sweet peach, it's not for everyone it's either you like it or not.I like it, it has been in my collection since 2003.

I wrote my review of this beauty two years ago.
I tried the scent a couple of weeks ago again in an airport duty free shop after 15 years or so.
I was surprised and excited to find it, because I have been looking for it for a long time and couldn't find it in shops. I have also read that it was allegedly discontinued. But what a disappointment, after applying it: it is a shadow of what it used to be: it is watered down, diluted, pale version of the original that I wore for years when it was released and loved.
What a shame. 😐

P. S. "fake"? "plastic"? I have *never* perceived this beauty like that.
What about: Sexy, exciting, energising, head turner, uplifting, attention getter, WOW what is THAT?! (my reaction when I first smelled it on my coworker),
luscious, magnetic, irresistible, glam, fascinating and unique.

When you look at promotional videos and ads for the scent, there's lots of sexual implications. I perceive the scent as very sexy and the name as relating to sexuality.
@ludicmlady nailed it. I don't have anything to add.

Soft peachy jasmine heart with a lot of strange textural nuances to give this perfume some serious heft. The patchouli note is scratchy, the sour peach is milky, the white flowers are creamy, the vanilla is powdery, the vetiver is ashy. These notes come together and form a strange sensation of static electricity, as if you're about to be shocked. A "Rush" indeed.

Deliberately cheap smelling and quite bizarre, but absolutely not one-dimensional. The bottle perfectly matches the scent; bright red, garish, plastic. Tom Ford claims to take artistic inspiration from Jeff Koons, and in this release I see it.

This is pure early 2000s nostalgia in a bottle. It actually makes me excited when I smell it (and I cannot.stop.sniffing.it), which I guess is the point.

Delicious, powerful, bright and exciting. Plus, it outperforms a lot of the perfumes I bought for twice the price. Can’t argue with the power of this one. A winner for sure.
Love Gucci rush, it’s so unusual but I can’t stop smelling my wrist. It’s lasts a good 10-12 hours but I am an over sprayer.

I just received this perfume about 2 days ago. I can say right off the bat, I am loving this one!!!

This was a complete blind buy success , after watching some YouTube videos on how unique it was w its plastic fruit scent . I just had to try it out. I sprayed it on my arm before my workout .

I was hit with a strong plastic-peach scent a long with the gardenia and then i fought a whiff of something Spicy. On my skin, this spice kinda smelled like spicy chilli peppers which I thought was pretty cool since I love hot peppers lol but it was the coriander along with the patchouli which I think went well w the vanilla after the dry down . After a few hours even after set my workout, I still smelled the plastic peach with vanilla, vetiver and patchouli .

I love this scent , and will probably use it as a night time, going out fragrance . It’s definitely an attention getter , and the projection is prettty strong and makes its presence known. I don’t think I can wear this during the hot weather here in FL ( which is year round!) and will have to mainly use it when it’s gets below 60 or nighttime. Either way i will definitely have to repurchase this unique scent . Love it
I recently bought a 50ml bottle for $200 because i used to love it years ago. Now it smells different on me if anyone would like to buy it off me for half price pls message me. I only used it twice.

Synthetic smell, here it's purposeful.
Gucci Rush has a plastic smell, a perfumed plastic, the name comes from a category of drug called Poppers, also called Rush, that once inhaled, causes immediate reactions in those who use it, very common in the US in the 80s. It's a unique perfume, it has something psychedelic about it, an unearthly smell (this one should be called Alien). When I smell it I think of the movie Enter the Void and also Requiem for a Dream; neon lights, drugs, sex, ballads in the 2000s, LSD, things like that, as the name suggests.

My mother has been using this fragrance for years, and unfortunately it’s one that bugs me. Overall it’s a nice fragrance, but unfortunately there’s one note that is extremely penetrant. It’s the kind of note that gets in your nose and you can’t shake it, no matter what you do. My mum doesn’t overspray perfumes, so that’s not the issue, the note just enters your nose and latches into your mucus membranes and stays there for the rest of the day.

I’m not entirely sure which note bothers me so much, as I’ve always never truly ‘investigated’ the scent, or sprayed it on myself, due to disliking it. I don’t think it’s the patchouli, unless It’s a patch that smells fairly different to the patchouli in my own fragrances. It might be the vetiver, although I don’t get this type of sharpness from my own fragrances with vetiver either. Perhaps it’s a combination of vetiver, patchouli and coriander that doesn’t work for my nose, or perhaps I dislike synthetic patchouli, but do appreciate natural patchouli..

Long story short; this fragrance isn’t for everyone, so don’t buy it blind. It’s also absolutely not office safe as it has a very prominent note that some people strongly dislike and has a very strong silage. This is a note that people will smell the moment they enter the room.

NB: I wrote this review as I believe many or most negative reviews on this fragrance have been deleted. Please do NOT downvote reviews because you don’t agree with them. They will be deleted forever, and everyone puts in time and effort into trying to help people form their own opinion and decide on a purchase. Both positive and negative reviews help with that. If you don’t agree with a review, or don’t find it helpful, just scroll past it, or leave your own review.

I adore this perfume so much. First, it was one of my mom`s signatures in 2000s, so it has sentimental value. Second, I looove the concept. It is a bowl of juicy plastic peaches. It smells so fake through and through, powdery and a bit bitter from gardenia and florals. Amazing blend, so beautiful, otherworldly but grounded. Whimsical urban fairy dust.

I have new bottle from 2022, but I don’t feel much difference from the smell from my childhood. Performance is beastly, I literally use one-two sprays and all-day smell like a fussy plastic peach. I think might be best in warmer weather.

Late 90's early 2000s. This perfume was a present from my sister to my mum. I remember the whole room smelling once she sprayed them. I am a massive fan of patchuli therefore this might be why i like them. As a little girl, I've imagined the Gucci Rush being a signature smell of a successful New yorker in her late 20s, 30s. Sophisticated, always on her best behaviour and head turning. I've read that this scent has lost its lust and strength since. Also, someone compared it to Rihannas Rogue, I sort of agree. Although it is quite similar, I find the Rogue had a strong leather smell to it and Rush doesn't.

I love the way the patchouli radiates beneath the almost plastic-y fruity note. Like a person with a magnetic, yet quiet charm this fragrance has a strength that sneaks up on you and a dusky warmth that makes me think of late summer, early autumn.

A true original. Unique. There aren't that many perfumes that are this recognizable and leave such a strong impression. And transport you back to the end of the 20th century, whoever was old enough to feel the armosphere at that time must appreciate this, if not because they like the smell (i find the audience pretty polarizing when it comes to this one, and I do understand it), then because of the vibe that it captured so perfectly. I recommend to anyone younger who wishes to get a feel of that late 90s/early 00s era to try and sniff this. It's a LOVE from me!

This...is...legendary.
There are certain perfumes that get you. They are intense, and real, and just special. This is one of those scents. It is truly unique and special. I don't know if they've messed with the formula or not, but for an EDT this is a BEAST.

I have a huge collection, and this is the only one I have a backup of. I love it that much. This and og The One are two of the most magnificent peach scents ever.
I agree with Petrichor134. I would only add that I detect hot sauna benches and butter mint humbugs as well. I like it.

Medicinal gardenias, candied peach flavouring, spicy coriander and a ton of plastic patchouli; sooooo delicious, sexy, with a masculine edge to it, heavy but crisp *chef's kiss* This is a perfumery masterpiece 🥹👌🍑🌿

Despite the marketing and this red, plastic bottle this perfume never gave me the 90' feel, electronic era, VHS generation. It always smelled quite mysterious and peculiar. It might sound insane but if this came in a different bottle, if it was marketed differently...this is what i imagine Gucci Alchemist garden collection would smell like. Well, not the garden, but the interior of an alchemist cupboard or apothecary table. Very camphor like smell, medicinal gardenia and mint syrup, coriander seeds mixed with various other fragrant seeds that fell out of pouches. Thick and sweet cough syrup, aromatic wooden drawers made out of exotic wood. The interior mixes with wind from the outside from an open window, sweet and heavy just before the rain. I guess there is a garden outside, with flowers you can't identify. But still, the smell of garden is just from the open window and the earthy smell rises as the weather is turning. It's like a medicine from those vintage vials, left soaking in the grain of the wood and as the liquid evaporates thick syrup is formed. I was a child when this one was popular. I've never smelt it on others in a club or at a party, never met someone wearing it , never seen the commercial until I discovered fragrantica, so my impression is completely different. I understand the vibe this goes along with, but as those illusions of a dancer spinning I can simply switch it in my mind and create another story.

I have been using this perfume since 2008 or so. I have repurchased it multiple times and was always happy, even as of last year 2022. The scent has always been consistent, the sillage has always been strong and it has always been long lasting.

I recently (June 2023) repurchased it again from the official Gucci website, as my last bottle ran out, and unfortunately the scent has changed. The scent is no longer as powerful and the sillage is noticeable weaker.
I cannot help to be disappointed since this has been one of my “standard” perfumes for so many years and I used to receive many compliments even hours after application.

I will look for a new signature scent and most likely will not repurchase this again. Worth noting that the price was $105 on the Gucci website, the bottle I bought last year (2022) was $80 for reference.

Very sad and disappointed to say the least. I am hoping that with some time sitting around that the perfume might develop a bit, if so I will update this review.

Powdery, synthetic, peach bubblegum ❤️ the patchouli and vanilla is more noticeable after awhile, it reminds me of Rogue by Rihanna but it smells less cheap. I like it because it reminds me of the 80s, girls with big hair and red lipstick. Very unique and polarizing perfume

I had this years ago when it came out and I loved it. I can’t believe it gets such low marks. There is no way Patchouli is that deep in this scent. I wore this all the time and I hate Patchouli. I don’t know why companies try to reissue originals that are not exactly the same. If a company wants to make a new fragrance they should… and call it something else. So frustrating. The same can be said for Miss Dior Cherie and J’adore.

I am one of those oldies who remember when it was first released. I was in love with it. I don’t have it anymore, but some say it has been reissued, but it does not smell just like the original.

Gucci Rush is what is in its name – Rush. It is fast and furious, it is sharp, straight to the point, strong statement, like who is the boss. Powdery? Yes but strong. Might come across a bit synthetic as a result. But once it wears off, its aftertaste is milder and smells actually quite proper and expensive. Could surely be confused with some contemporary niche brand. Definitely a memorable scent, not your average Joe.

Great longevity and projection.

The is is what Rachel’s red lipstick smells like in Blade Runner.
Starts off smelling like polly pocket shoes and scented erasers, dries down to smelling like when you try to cover up cigarette smell with body spray.
202X retrofuturism, a world where real fruits haven’t existed in a generation. Sweet in an incense way without leaning gourmandaise.
It’s fake and synthetic in the best way, and for me it smells the same way as blue raspberry, as in a replication of something that no longer exists or maybe never did.
Definitely polarizing and not for the faint of heart, but that’s what I love about it.
This was also my aunt’s signature scent when I was growing up and I blind bought it without realizing. So I love that the scent memory is passed down.

I have never smelled the OG Rush but this recent formulation is definitely weak.
It is a fresh pretty scent great for summer.
The mix of peach with freesia and gardenia very inviting.
I am not familiar with play-doh so I don't understand that smell reference and cannot comment on it.
It's rather linear on me though.
The scent gets a little bit deeper maybe coriander and vetiver show up but I don't get any other notes.
Disappears after 3 hrs, so longevity is not there. Projection moderate
Would I repurchase? No. It's not complex enough, but I'll finish this bottle.
I prefer Britney Spears Fantasy than this for my current summer rotation.

The first time I smelled Gucci rush was in ‘99. Folding back the stuck together edge of a scratch and sniff fragrance add in Cosmo, my soul was wrapped in a cozy cashmere blanket with comfort. Reminiscent of Banana medicine, a creamy coconut, vanilla dessert and clouds of whipped cream. Intoxicating in the best way. I begged my mom for gucci rush for years. I finally got it for Christmas and savoured it till it was gone. I recently bought a bottle, the formula seems weaker and more plasticy, just not the same. It is strange to me that I never noticed peach until I read other reviews. Rush will always be a staple in my collection for anytime I need a whiff of nostalgia. A versatile scent, great in summer but to me smells best on a cold winter day.
Sweet peach with a slight hint of earthy patchouli in the base. NOT as bad as people say and definitely not as loud.

I have a decant of the current formulation. To my nose this is Gucci’s own Accenti, stripped of everything that made it interesting and with the sugar dial turned all the way up. Sweet synthetic peach, some sort of flower (freesia?) if you squint, and not much else. The drydown is better, a touch of rose and patchouli… but still falling short for me. I fail to understand why this is classified as a chypre.
I struggle to find anything shocking, subversive, or sexy in Rush, but I’m happy others do. I’ve really enjoyed reading through the differing opinions on this fragrance. Diversity adds beauty to the tapestry of human life!
Bizarre synthetic plasticky floral fruity patchouli fragrance. Definitely not for someone who hates artificial scents and expects at least a natural vibe if not real naturals in a fragrance.

First impression on paper. I think i like the smell, it reminds me of something, but i dont know what. Maybe apple? It smells mysterious in a good way, like sour fruit. its very unique. I almost cant describe what i smell. Smell like reciving a hug, at the beach in the summer. Comforting and fresh. Instead of red, the bottle should have had a nude peach or orange color.
Update, still on paper. Smells like a sour fruit drink. I have not tried it on the skin yet.. I dont dare 😂 so far, this might be the worst parfume ever for me.

I think Gucci Rush has been re-released? Sephora had it a few mos back, it’s on Gucci site, fragnet etc.

I vaguely remember it from the 90s but somehow I never owned it. So I had to try it (fragnet, 1oz) I guess I didn’t realize it’s an edt? It lasts prob +- an hr on my skin, but on my clothes… I sprayed it on my sleeve yesterday and can still faintly smell it 24 hrs later.

And it smells okay? I do like it, like it doesn’t smell bad, just not as earth shattering as I thought it would be, so a tad disappointed. Fruity, patchouli, plasticky, peach. Glad I tried it tho & at least can get an idea of what it was like… but do wish I could’ve smelled it back in the day as I’m sure the reform has not done it any favors.
This smells like a red vintage leather jacket from the year 2400.

Sexy, sexy, sexy! Bold! The IT girl. The price is crazy low for this quality. My clothes smells like it DAYS after I’ve worn them. My boyfriend rarely says something because I always smell nice. But to this he always says: WOW! You smell AMAZING. And Its true. What a queen this perfume is. Such a strong character. A leader, an icon. The type of girl that you turn behind to look at. Quite an ugly gesture, really… but you have to. Outstanding. I don’t think this is “old” or “heavy”. Alot of bad reviews I was scared to try this. Never fully trust reviews. WOW!
chaos in a bottle, in a really cute way. It's an Aries scent! it has a certain off putting edge to it, like a very attractive girl who starts bargaining at the counter or forgets her table manners.

I used to have it and love it during my teenage years.
Out of nostalgia, I recently purchased it and it was not the very same: it is much weaker than it used to be.
I get the burnt plastic smell but in the best way! It is peachy, sweet and still has a place in my collection.

RB2002, I think another oldie that might have smelled similar (but nowhere near as gorgeous) was Samba from Perfumer's Workshop. Do you feel that at all? I don't have Samba anymore to compare, but as I recall, the fruity opening and the dry oakmoss was similar to the coriander in Rush...

Sweet newborn baby’s breath, warm milk, hairspray, Barbie doll, clubbing to death, ….
It evokes all this feelings and put me in a happy mood. This perfume stands the test of time, it’s not dated despite being on a market for quite a long time.
The bottle is also a masterpiece, simple, effective and practical.
Soundtracks: Prince - Baby I’m a Star
Vanity 6 - Nasty Girl

The mix of florals and patchouli smells very familiar and like something I had in the 80s. This smells like a big haired rocker chick with lots of makeup in an 80s hair band video. Since this didn’t come out until 1999, I’m trying to figure out what 80s perfume smelled like this. I think it might have been Revlon Trouble (An Invitation To Trouble), that was around 1988/89, and isn’t in the data base. But I had it, and think it may have smelled similar to this.

To my nose, the most prominent notes are patchouli, gardenia and vetiver. I do not notice so much the peach, instead I find the gardenia exquisite, modern and not at all dull. There is nothing dull or barbie like, except from the plastickness, which I adore! To each their own, but this is a perfume for bold, dynamic women, not girly bubble gum pinky little skirt. Dynamic women who wanna have fun. Yes, it is a fun perfume, but when fun is being taken seriously. Its sillage is extraordinary, everybody can smell me, when other supposedly loud perfumes are so light to my skin. Maybe skin chemistry? I love the opening, I adore the drydown. Yes, the opening may seem a little "silly", but the drydown is serious business of seduction, uniqueness and retromodern vibe. Maybe, the lovers of so-long-old hypnotic poison would love this, because of the plasticky effect. To my nose, it has nothing to do with Eden, it has similarities with Loulou, with less floral notes. Memorable, at least!
I had difficulties liking it. It’s an okay perfume. Powdery, peachy, vetivery…opens with a very harsh chemically smell which dries down to a sweet powdery finish. Not something I would go for.
Contrary to my expectations, this smells pretty good! Playfull and sexy, but not really special enough for my taste.. If anyone has any ideas to layer this? I'd love to hear from you!

A small dose is maybe ok for the office. This one is simply different in a way hard to describe. Very modern from 1999. Not office, not romance. Something I would enjoy on the odd occasion; a full bottle would be a lifetime supply. I am glad it exists.

I have a bottle from about 5 years ago and don't find anything strange about it at all - no plastic, powder, or patchouli, just very sweet fruity candy. It's definitely stronger than a normal EDT but not the sillage bomb reflected in the ratings for me. Very tenacious and lasts all day.
I get a spicy peach with a fresh effect. It is almost a little soapy. It’s not my favorite but I enjoy it.

My third review. I am obsessed. Researched and tried vintage (by Scannon) and current (by Coty) formulas and saw a big difference in intensity and sillage. Vintage formula feels juicer and more powerful. However! The current formula lasts longer on my skin. Go figure! I am happy to own both, will likely layer.

Punchy, peachy plastic for sexy cyborg women. This a dancefloor perfume if I ever smelled one. Not a ballroom, but a warehouse party with loud, experimental music. Though the perfume is vintage at this point, there's definitely something futuristic that is inherent in this perfume; it reminds me of the dance scene from Ex Machina. Performance-wise, it lasts at least 7-8 hours on me. The peach and patchouli are the most prominent notes, so you definitely have to like both to enjoy this perfume!

The absolute best scent on a woman - any age group. This is one of the most distinct scents on the market and I could pick it from a mile away.

Performance is still remarkably good although not as good as it used to be.

To me this smells fizzy (unsure what note makes it smell fizzy), peachy and patchouli. It’s sweet but not in a gourmand way

It’s just WOW - if you love perfumes please try this one. It is so sexy.

Posting this so people know GR is not as scary as some reviews make it out to be. The opening has an icy freshness, the peach, gardenia, and freesia all snowy white. There is definitely a synthetic aspect, like hairspray, but it is enjoyable in a nostalgic way. The base is a powdered vanilla milk and some deeper, funkier patchouli and vetiver. It's unusual even today, but it isn't as sickening as other perfumes from the same era. I also love the feel of the cassette-shaped bottle.

I purchased it as a blind buy for myself this Christmas. Don't ask me how it's possible, but I didn't know what it smelt like. I have amassed a large perfume collection over the years, and yet I didn't have Gucci Rush in it nor did I have any idea what to expect. Because it's from 1999 I knew I would recognize the aroma from somewhere. So I was very excited about testing it. Upon spraying it I immediately saw friendly Loretta, the receptionist at my medical centre. I suddenly actually remembered asking her one day what she was wearing. I asked her because she was sitting there all blonde and cute looking surrounded by a cloud of something sweet, but not quite edible. Something that reminded me of vitamin chew tablets from my childhood- they were made to taste appetizing, yet somehow you knew it was medication, and not lollies. I also know I have also smelt it elsewhere, but I cannot pinpoint.
I am happy to have this perfume and I will wear it. It's fun and nostalgic for sure. The bottle I have is obviously a recent batch. It smells strong and lasts a long time.
The bottle is very cute and reminds me of a cassette. I like how it simply slides out of the box.
A similar perfume in feel and structure that I already have is Chinatown by Bond no.9. They are both fruity chypre perfumes. They are absolutely not the same but I do get a similar vibe. Luca Turing describes Chinatown as " To my nose it smells like a corner of a small French grocery in summer, in the exact spot where the smell of floor wax meets that of ripe peaches." Add a generous sprinkling of icing sugar, and you have Gucci Rush.
Beautiful Fragrance. Intoxicating and addictive.

bought a new bottle and it's laughably weak, which really sucks because I remember this edt being so strong that I'd wake up nauseated every time I fell asleep with it still on my skin... guess those days are over now

Ohhh it smells like a techno rave! I love this!!! I've been experimenting with this perfume for a few years now. I rarely wear it because for me it requires a certain mood, a certain ambience. It's for sure a perfume to go out and attract attention! It definitely is a little bit in your-face type of scent, which leads me to the question OMG HOW IS THIS EDT??? This is Extrait d'extrait :D This is nuclear, I think they haven't reformulated this scent at all, because most of the stuff these days especially if it is edt stays for about 1h and that's it. This one... THIS IS JUST NOT WASHABLE.
My mother used to wear this perfume when it just came out, but she is an elegant lady, so I didn't have this illusion of Gucci Rush as a rave perfume, a perfume for a dancefloor or something like that. But when I bought it myself a few year ago It just straight up came out to me as this superior sexy perfume, a perfume that just goes so well with nightlife, with your fantasies, with everything that is a bit secretive but also not.
Rush is an amazing attention magnet, a very unique smell, I do get this plastic note also, but I love it! This is the note that incarnates the name of the perfume - this note gives me that rush. The rush of excitement, this buzzing feeling inside. I will not be shy and say this is just sexy sexy sexy perfume, a confidence-boosting elixir. It has something dirty in it something vulgar but in a very high-end way and I love it. I love how unapologetic this perfume is!
Please Gucci never discontinues this perfume!!! Never reformulate it! We all need this excitement in our lives! This super ecstatic sexy rush!
It definitely goes with the Gucci vibe when Tom Ford was a creative director and those sexy collections started to amaze people and those provocative ad campaigns were in Vogue magazines... That's the vibe!

The batch code suggests that I have a product released in 2020. As many have mentioned, the fragrance opens with a plasticky peach smell and it reminded me of Cacherel's Eden but without the smell of wet fur and rotting fruit. The plastic smell matches the cassette-like structure in which the liquid is encased. Bright, cheerful, and quite spunky, the scent is really not for the fainthearted. Dries down to a hypnotic patchouli-vetiver-vanilla scent and disappears at about the 7h mark. Perhaps because this is a later formulation, the perfume projected and lasted a lot shorter than I'd anticipated.
This is the best fragrance of all time. It’s sexy, confident, strong and sweet. I do get the plastic smell, it’s intriguing, and oh every time I smell it my eyes roll! It’s orgasmic!!!

Gucci brought this back in 2022.
I got it on the grey market.
Had that plastic note @ the beginning for the first 2 hours from 6 sprays.
I have to say, the dry down is where the magic is.
I suggest you wear this in cold weather. I live in tropical weather, can be headache inducing until the dry down.

My mom's brother gave this to her a long time ago when he still worked at Gucci. Not gonna lie, I REALLY am not a fan. It smells fine on others, but on me it's an eternal headache. I could still smell it three days later on the sleeve of my hoodie when I first tested it. Maybe I'll wear it if I ever go to a music festival or a rave, but I can't see myself doing anything else with this (other than letting it collect dust on my shelf.)
I have a full 2.5 oz bottle. Message me if interested.
Smells like one night stand girl

When it starts getting balmy in Texas and I'm wearing this to the club please hide your partners I will be too sexy. Sexy metal smell mix with sweat mmmmmm. Also smells like my cool fun aunt meeting us for tex-mex and I'm going to be allowed to order margaritas.
department store girl smell

Feminine floral with some amber and woody undertones . When I wore it I had a man who was three tables across in Starbucks ask me what I was wearing and he wanted to buy it for his girlfriend . This version of the Gucci guilty I believe has been discontinued .

A peachy, peppery and soft scent.


I have inherited an older bottle which is starting to die off a bit, but I would consider buying the new version.

I have the intense edition of the new version but it feels a lot harsher than this.

I don't know how to feel about this perfume. Someone said hard to pinpoint anything and think of scenarios where I'd like to wear this and I couldn't agree more. It smells like 2012, if that makes any sense.
hard to pinpoint anything in this perfume. maybe also because i can't imagine the scenarios i would want to use this perfume. the dry down is pleasant though

This was always my go to party girl perfume. Not sure why, but I have worn this to many bars and parties. I would literally never ever wear this in the daytime because it just reminds me of drinking, cigarettes, and lipgloss. To me it was the perfect fragrance to wear with a smoky eye and a leather jacket. When you smell it, you cannot tell what any of the notes are IMO. It just smells like what it smells like which sounds silly but it just does. But I have never smelled another scent like it! I still have about half my bottle left and will cherish it for what it is. Smells vintage and synthetic but so so nostalgic and holds so many memories. The bottle is also so bougie looking but over the years my hands have worn away a lot of the gold.
i recently bought a bottle from 2012, will be reviewing it when it comes in. ❤️

I sold this years ago for 30 dollars. WHY DID I DO THAT. DID I NOT KNOW I HAD GOLD

i smelled the new edt yesterday and knew i needed this again. now, i haven't smelled this version in 5 years, but i am SO excited to have it again and i will be holding onto it for dear life.

Update: I have it now and I'm elated <3 I bought 3 pre-loved partial bottles and scored one full tester. Projection and longevity are good! Not beastly, but good. I've been wearing this almost daily for over a month now and for all occasions. It's perfect.

Serena van der Woodsen vibes.
Golden aura, chic, popular, rich, kind of shallow.
Rather than guilty, girl next door energy👀
will forever remind me of my beloved A
Smells bold, modern, and a little rebellious. Feels confident and daring — perfect for making a statement.
For me it’s too synthetic. Perhaps the most “perfume” fragrance I’ve smelled so far. Doesn’t really smell like anything.
hoş,ferah klasik bir koku ama beni çekemedi kendine.
Powdery mature scent. Perfect for grandmothers or great-grandmothers.

I recently bought this original formulation on eBay (I missed this cute little unique bottle) and today tested it side by side with the newer EDT version. Both fragrances are almost identical with the original being slightly spicier, crisper, the notes more distinct. This original also projects considerably more and lasts longer on my skin.
Although the original has the edge over the new EDT, I'm pleased at the very least we still get to enjoy this beautiful fragrance.
Edit: trying them side by side (again) and must add that the original also smells very soapy, like a literal bar of soap.

Opens with that familiar pink pepper sparkle, which I usually enjoy — but here, something feels very basic and flat to me. There’s a generic undertone that I can’t quite get past. It’s not unpleasant, just not memorable or special on my skin.

Today I am enjoying this scent from my sample. It has a winning musky-ambery projection that carry lilac and jasmin. It is quite substantial and enveloping but gentle. My new version edt bottle does not have this much power, neither does my old version bottle. Maybe because my skin is heated today after a shower. But the scent bubble is intense, clean, subtle and luxurious. I fell in love with this scent from this very sample and so far my bottles disappoint a bit in comparison.
This is quintessential Gucci style. Rich, sensual, effortless.
Perfect signature for the whole year and any occasion.
5 hours of radiating from my skin already, it only does not project during a walk. Strange that from my bottles it seems weaker in sillage. At 7 hour mark it was already just an afterscent, barely there, so it was not easing me into sleep.

Like a wind carrying the scent of lilac flowers. Very subtle, feminine, fascinating but light. Barely there, with 3 hours longevity on me. Something carnal and skin-like, probably how lilac reacts with musk. It makes it sensual.
It is undeniably pleasant, elegant and safe.
I feel lilac the most, undefined florals and musk.
I like it. It has intimate sillage and lingers close to the skin. The opening is floral and gorgeous, the drydown soft and warm. Fits spring and summer, also the evening.
Very clean girl freshie. Pair this with the body lotion for longevity. Perfect inoffensive day scent, good for the office, gym.

I think 'gorgeous' is the word for this fragrence. not grandma-ish and definitely not juvenile. very smooth and alluring. I'm not an amber person, and also not a fan of strong patchouli and musk. but the formulation of these notes are so good, they don't get overwhelming at all. finished one bottle, definitely going to purchase the second one.
I really didn't like it. I gave it to someone who I don't like

This was in my rotation for a few years, went through a few bottles before I stopped using it. It is a confidence booster, and highly complimented too. Used to be my 'important meetings' go to. Very chic, less floral than most Gucci fragrances.

The initial spray is a not so pleasant vintage cologne. I thought I accidentally purchased the male version sample, but no. It has a unisex DNA, and aims to be elegant and poised, but it doesn't quite get there for me. The dry down is a bit better than the "spicy musky Italian uncle with moustache smell" opening. It is for classy and more mature wear, suitable for work environment. It doesn't give feminine, and it sort of gives me the same vibes as Pure Poison - a woman with masculine traits, bossy, and not to be played with.

But what I like about it is the freshness. I love to swim, and this gives me a similar sensation as when I just enter the pool section, both indoor and outdoor. There is something watery fresh in this with that resemblance, which is quite nice. Also evokes an expensive car smell, but not in a sophisticated way.

I would tolerate this on someone wearing it in my proximity, but not necessarily on me.
Powdery and musky, in the grossest way possible. Think baby's diaper changing station kind of powdery. Actually, just think of an unused diaper smell.
cheap and grandma-ish
this perfume was beautiful and classically sexy before the reformulation :( rip og gucci guilty, i will always miss you
I wonder why this has such a positive reception. This smells like a man's cologne from the 70's called Royal Copenhagen. Absolutely awful. Cheap, powdery, musty and dusty.

Gucci Guilty where do I start. It has notes of pink pepper, mandarin, bergamot, lilac, peach, jasmine, amber, musk and vanilla. It has a very impressive list of notes. However, all these notes in one bottle of juice don’t mesh well together for me. I don’t really care for how the fruity notes smell in this perfume. They don’t smell bad but there is definitely something off putting about the fruity notes of this fragrance. That being said, I can say that Gucci Guilty does have a very unique and original smell. I can’t name one scent it reminds me of. It does perform well on the skin and is better suited for summer and autumn.

Lilac & Peach Odyssey...

I only have a tester of this from before the reformulation. Opens with a fruity burst of mandarin & pink pepper supported by mult-faceted bergamot, that deepens into the lilac & peach heart. This all rests on an amber-floral support base rounded out by patchouli, white-musk and vanilla. This is really well blended and it's difficult to pick out the additional notes in the heart, but the Gucci DNA is definitely present. It's just so well done that I can understand why it has so many fans.

Contrast to Sotoor Seen Rasasi:
This is a dupe of Gucci by Gucci but there are similarities with dewy, sweet florals and the Gucci DNA. Sotoor Seen gets a lot sweeter in the drydown with honey, although it has a similarly slow unfolding. Both have excellent performance, but Sotoor Seen has beast mode once it gets going and can work up to a cloying sweetness if oversprayed.

Overall: Beautifully blended classic lilac-peach scent with excellent performance. You can't go wrong if looking for a classic amber-fruity-floral. It's a love for me. If you manage to find a bottle, enjoy!
Johnsons baby bedtime products in a perfume.

Bf loves this on me but I don’t like it.

The powdery notes aren’t listed but this is pretty much a mature & sophisticated baby (woman? Lol) powder scent.

A powder bomb to me and not in a good way, I like powdery scents but there’s something headache inducing about this one.
Smells really similar to baby wipes, but it's soft and comforting. i don't get any of the patchouli
Vibrant, feminine, subtle and sofisticated.

It smells very similar to Calvin Klein Contradiction except a little less strong and a little more powdery. I like it. It does smell classy, but as I already have a big bottle of CK, I’ll stick to that. It’s just not unique enough to justify the price tag.
It’s alright. Doesn’t last very long and smells vaguely like baby powder.

I have tested it in perfume store, This perfume fruity spicy with a large amount of Patchouli plus little amount of flowers, this is what I had smelled only. I didn't find it interesting scent, I didn't feel any baby powdery notes, This perfume isn't my type of perfumes, but surley it lasts along.

If you didn't smell this perfume before, I advise you to not blind buy. This Fragrance didn't suitable for majority of people, needs someone interest this fragrance or someone don't prefer gourmand or sweety perfumes.


لقد جربته في متجر العطور، هذا العطر فاكهي حار مع كمية كبيرة من الباتشولي بالإضافة إلى كمية قليلة من الزهور، هذا ما شممته فقط. لم أجد رائحته مثيرة للاهتمام، لم أشعر بأي نفحات بودرية تشبه بودرة الأطفال، هذا العطر ليس نوع العطور المفضل لدي، لكنه بالتأكيد يدوم طويلاً.

إذا لم تشم هذا العطر من قبل، أنصحك بعدم شرائه شراءً أعمى. هذا العطر غير مناسب لغالبية الناس، يحتاج إلى شخص مهتم بهذا العطر أو شخص لا يفضل العطور الشهية الغنية أو الحلوة.

ive had a tiny little tester bottle of this since forever (like since i was 7!). i guess ive always savoured this thinking it was the epitome of old money and boujee, i cant believe i still have it and the tester has definitelyy expired but i still feel sentimental about it and love how classy and fresh this fragrance is.
this smells very expensive, hard to describe and name any specific note. i imagine a boujee, classy girl boss in her 40s wearing this.

Hmmm, it’s interesting that people mention that it smells like baby powder. Yet, there’s no powder notes listed in the frag. I completely agree. It smells like funeral flowers and baby powder. I don’t dislike this or hate this perfume. However, I feel like it’s pretty meh. It was good in the 2010s. I’m sure you can find other amazing fragrances. It’s not a bad scent, it just doesn’t stick out from the crowd.
I have been wearing this every year since 2012 till now.. I keep buying new bottles every time.. I just reach for it when I don't wanna over think.. simply adorable 😍 💖 ❤️
This is what i would imagine old money scent. it’s vibrant floral scent. would image a rich fashion women walking in paris on the street. even though it’s an edt it still last a long time.

I was so dissapointed when I tried out this one. The opening was okay but the more it stayed on my skin the worse it became. It's not my taste.
It smells like old baby powder and I always pictured an old lady wearing it. It causes me headaches as well.

this was my first ever fragrance gifted to me a couple years ago, funny how i found out later when i really got into the fragrance community, i found out it was for women.

Honestly could not care less its a great fragrance i still do love it.

Im a man if you still couldnt figure:)

Very nice and nostalgic,,, reminds me so much of covid era i used to apply a drop of it on my mask and go out. I didn’t repurchase it after it ran out and even forgot about it. But then I stumbled upon it at the store last night and the nostalgia hit me like a wave. Such a powerful feeling.

A warm, spicy floral. I'm surprised reading the notes, I thought this would be a fruity, girly-girl perfume. There are a lot of fruits in this scent but I don't pick them up at all. I like how it actually lasts on my skin. Usually scents fade in under an hour on my skin, but 4 hours later I still smell this beauty. I also remember smelling this years ago in the bar scene. It's definitely familiar. Pleasant and strong.

I used to use this fragrance when i was 19 . My mom bought me this and i immediately fall in love.
This is was my Chanel
Smells expensive and clean . I remember my friends keep saying to me that I smell like a baby powder but in a good way . So sad that I can’t find it anywhere

i do think this smells really nice. it was actually the first ever perfume i bought for myself, when i was 24, i had just been dumped, and i was looking for some small way to change myself that didnt involve dyeing my hair. i decided i needed a Scent. a Signature Scent that i would wear all the time and it would be my new cool feminine thing. so i picked up this one, which is funny in retrospect because of how obvious it is. i dont hate her, i just outgrew her. she was my special date night perfume for years. she's floral, powdery, and a tiny bit masculine if you squint. i really loved how long she lasted and she'll always have a place in my heart and in my collection for when i'm feeling really fancy

This is a fragrance that slaps you in the face in the best possible way.

Extremely musky and powdery, yet sweet and floral.

The type of person to wear this is, powerful, sexy, mature and intelligent. It can be worn by any and all genders.

It was one of my first "mature" fragrances and I'm sad to see its been discontinued.

This is literally the best ever fragrance I ever had. While spraying it feels like you are falling to the endless alley full of beautiful threes.
It lasts forever both on skin and clothes. This is such a shame it has been discontinued as it used to be my signature fragrance.

This smells like Zara Bright Rose which is supposed to dupe Narciso For Her EDP (the pink bottle) which is similar to Lovely by SJP. Overall just a musky powdery lightly floral patchouli that feels like a grown woman. This perfume however has a tiny bit more sweetness because of the peach, but it's not a sweet perfume by any means. Too mature and plain for me.

I've been seeing a lot of reviews saying that this perfume doesn't last for more than a few hours, but that's not the case for me. This perfume lasts 6+ hours for me, and I receive endless compliments. It might just be like this because of skin chemistry, but this perfume has been nothing but amazing for me. I agree, it is a simple scent, and the peach and lilac notes aren't as strong as I would like them to be, but I find it best worn in the winter or spring, the summer not so much. I think the reason why I love this scent is because it introduced me to the value of smelling good and how receiving compliments about how good I smell truly means a lot to me. After reading some comments, I discovered it was discontinued, so I will try to ration it out through the rest of spring😅.

Weird after 2 yrs of owning this & thinking it was too masculine smelling. I just sprayed original gucci on one hand & guilty gucci on the other. Then Mariah carey m on my upper arm (which smells alot like euphoria but I liked Mariah better.)
So comparing all of these.. The regular gucci is more tissue smelling, maybe like a nice feminine teacher would wear this. But she has a slight hint of coffee breath. The sour smelling breath when someone gets too close & you have to turn your head. She's kinda pretty but you'd probably think she was prettier without a Sourish coffee breath
Guitly gucci- this one...smells better to me. But.
I just had my bf smell each one & he liked the regular gucci better cause he said it was softer.
Which is weird it seems like guys would like a stronger smell & girls like softer but I get where hes coming from, its like laying on Your mom & feeling comforted. But i still like the guilty smell better.. its stronger & more bold & doesn't have a tissue kleenex drydown smell to it. we got on the topic that its weird how men like softer scents & women like more masculine. If the opposite was true then why aren't men wearing feminine scents to draw in women. & women wear masculine to draw in men. I suppose that is why.. Personally I love gourmand scents so if my fella wore sweet stuff I'd be pretty turned on.
But still this one smells better & bolder, than gucci. Maybe thats why its gold. Shaped like a gold bar. Cause it smells like gold. its weird cause for 2 yrs i never smelled the la nuit type of smell until i just put it on again. Its actually pretty good. I was overwhelmed that I couldn't figure out how to describe this but yes it does have that generic typical gold amberish cashmere smell to it. I think of going into a department store during xmas & spraying it on & thats the scent you keep smelling for an hr afterwards. this one is on the verge of a mariah carey m/ calvin klien euphoria (which these 2 smell very similar to me) but sweeter... mariah has a marshmallow scent to it but also a black licorice hint to it which I love cause one of my favorite smells is Halloween night from solstice scents so comparing all 3 of these im starting to like Mariah careys best especially after 1/2hr & its also cheaper.
Guilty on the other hand is discontinued..so it verges on the more expensive side of designer if you want to smell bolder then this gucci guilty is better.
It smells more like if you mixed regular gucci w "the only one" purfume. Or lancome la nuit smell? Im not smelling the peach smell everyone is saying it has in it. So its sweeter than the lighter powdery somewhat sour tissue paper smell of regular gucci. My bf prefers the regular. & im starting to smell the Mariah carey m (purple bottle) that I sprayed on my upper arm & guilty is kinda smelling like that & euphoria by Calvin klien a few yrs ago I compared mariah M to euphoria & I thought they smelled identical so I gave euphoria to my friend. So..out of all the 400 purfumes I have guilty smells mainly like euphoria possibly lancome lan uit but less creamy

I feel like Fragrantica reviewers tend to look down to a perfume that easy to understand and mass pleasing. They reduce the fragrance into ‘generic’ category. And they will write long essays and praises for scents that are complicated to understand. I will keep it real. Gucci Guilty is a beautiful fragrance. If you’re looking for a flexible scent, one that inoffensive enough to wear at work and fun enough to wear after hour; this is for you. It gives a clean, unbothered but smells good vibes for working environment but still cool enough for a night out.

If you’re not looking for a challenge in perfume especially for work, just trying to be proper, this will be a great choice. And oh, people around you will like it, ignore these 0.001% of the population, the fragrance snobs.
This is just too masculine for my personal taste, but it is a lovely fragrance for what it is. Just fairly generic and for the price, I would expect a bit more oomph.

For me, all I get in Guilty is spicy ambery peach and patchouli. My mom was sent this perfume, she didn’t like it. I don’t really love it either. It’s quite bland. And it’s way too mature. I don’t think a lady in her 20s can wear it. It reminds me of Avon little black dress. Their notes are entirely different but they have same style, warm, oriental, sensually fruity, spicy, woody at dry-down, can be wore at workplace and night time, give a proper elegant lady vibes.

i really wanted to like this because of the peach, lilac, and vanilla, but for some reason this just smells like play dough on me. i thought it was just me getting the smell but i wore it the other day and my sister said the same thing. there’s just a lot going on with this perfume. it’s really strong, too. perfect if you like it but i end up washing this off every time i give it a chance.
It reminds me of Bvlgari Blv that was discontinued . it is a good substitution for Blv lovers .
This fragrance sounds beautiful & I would like to know if it's in the same family of fragrances of Lancome Tresor A La Folie?

I would say I have mixed feelings about Gucci Guilty. Like others have said, it's surprisingly complex and sophisticated. The dry down is very fresh and soapy, yet multidimensional in the way that it still maintains a hint of vanilla warmth that cuts though the floral. I'm a little confused by the combination of notes, they almost work together and yet something is still a little bit off. Maybe the patchouli?

It might just be a bit too mature for me. My mom loves it though, and I certainly don't hate it, but I can't really see myself wearing such a strong, sharp perfume.

I expected something dark sticky and sexy out of this based off the advertising and reading the notes. I was disappointed to find another basic designer fresh floral that only lasts 3 hours. It smells good, I would describe it as an extremely safe blind buy or gift, but personally I was disappointed with the intensity and longevity. For my collection it also lacks uniqueness.

I got this sample a few years ago and wasn't really sure what to think. But it's grown on me. I find this scent very sophisticated, and I mostly get notes of spices and light florals (I also get anise and rose, which aren't listed so not sure where that's coming from). I don't get any fruits or vanilla. I think this is a great scent that can be worn both in the office and on a date, so it's very versatile. I prefer the EDT to the EDP, the parfum tends to smell really strong and spicy, almost like black licorice, which I'm not a huge fan of. EDT still has that licorice quality, but only on initial spray. I usually only spray this once when I use it, but I can smell it all day, so I would say it's pretty long-lasting. I tend to prefer my scents close to the skin, hence why I only do one spritz, but I don't think this fragrance is too strong for 2+ if you wanted more projection.

This is my least favorite perfume that I have, and it's very weak on me. It hardly lasts at all. And although it's supposed to be a feminine scent, I feel like it's so soapy smelling and plain that it would be better used on a guy who doesn't really use perfume and just needs to smell clean. I'm going to give it to my boyfriend who doesn't wear perfume.

Perfume that first of all lacks longevity. And no idea what is "guilty" about it - one of the most neutral and office friendly fragrances. It's nice and smells somehow classic - in good not outdated way. A lovely white floral, not too strong and well blended. Makes you feel clean and well made. great white t-shirt smell. So said - the name and whole campaign are a huge mismatch in my opinion.
Would srsly love it if it lasted at least an hour.
The package is tacky, but I got used to it.
They should bring this back! So sad it’s been discontinued
One of My favorite creations of Gucci!

The best creation Gucci have ever made! This scent is so chic and deep and develops in a slow manner.
It has an Italian, French and oriental DNA, all at once! And you can sense it straight from the opening.
If you know anything in the market similar to this masterpiece please let me know. 💕

I go to Sephora pretty much everyday on my lunch break. I smelled this with a couple others.

it smells awful omg. idk if someone below said it was reformulated but whatever it is now?!?! omg I literally scrunched my face up everytime I sniffed the tester. it's just... bad. definitely geriatric vibes. and just unpleasant to my nose. immediately no.

I bought this perfume because I girl I was crushing on had worn it and I loooved it on her.. don't love it on me ( learned that the hard way ) I wanted a night "clubbing" type fragrance and with this being so popular I thought it might just fit the role. I don't know why but on me it smells geriatric- and not in a sophisticated rich grandma type of way like channel no.5 but like baby powder and metal coins. I still think with the right type of woman this fragrance is a killer but I guess I just don't suit that role.

I wanna get this again too😭😭 I miss this so much
Please msg me if there’s a seller still out there
If anyone is selling this original perfume please contact me. This is my signature scent and I miss it so much as it’s been discontinued and reformulated with different packaging.

Very average, clean, feminine floral.
it's a classic mainstream frangrance; a violet, rose and lilac flower bouquet, with a tad of peachy fruityness and a classic amber-patchouli base.
Not as bad as other designer frags (LVEB, Prada Paradoxe, Coach, Michael Kors, Daisy etc) indeed it's very wearable, not offensive, but as well not memorable.
OK for office wear (if you are able to locate a bottle, that is).
Very similiar to CK Beauty, RL Romance.
....you can upgrade to a higher level now.
This my signature fragrance ❤️ I miss it

I recieved a tester of this perfume today and I must say even though this is not my usual scent profile and I strongly dislike patchouli, I really like it.
It’s such a nice powdery, floral fruity fragrance and the patchouli blends perfectly between the notes.
I think this perfume is very unisex and I would love to smell it on a man or a woman.
Very nice, inoffensive and crowd pleasing smell, I’m not surprised it’s so popular.
I have the original formulation and don't like it at all. Why am I keeping it?? I dont even know.

This is a tough one. I don't dislike it, but I'm thrown off.

It opens super aromatically, which actually made me balk a little. Not in a bad way, but it actually has a masculine tone with the brisk nature of lilac, pepper and whatever citruses are here. Yet...as it fades a bit and settles into the heart, it becomes more obviously floral in nature. Still, the lilac is more femme, but it contends with the pepper...I think this is easily unisex (who cares, wear what you want anyway).

It becomes soapy in the dry down. I can't even discern what's going on at all, but it's a malange of stuff and smells like a 70s soapy, aromatic, kitchen sink blend of things. I really don't dislike it though, but I'm mystified by this packaging and marketing. Not in a million years would I have guessed it would smell like this!

So anyway, it's not bad, but it isn't at all sensual, golden or anything close. It smells like light powdery greens and purple. This might be the most incongruous scent&bottle combo I've ever experienced.

It is pretty in its own way though, and the performance is decent.

Beautiful, soft, comforting, 'nudy' velvety.
The only thing I will never understand is why they called it Guilty.
Sounds so off and lacking fantasy.
Too puritan of a name.
Mature scent in good way, cozy, sweet, smooth, bit boring for me. I gave it to my mother in law, she enjoys it way more. Nice scent I love on someone els.

Imagine yourself at the Duty Free shop in a nice airport. They have all the higher end usual suspects at hand, clean tester bottles, the works. You're tired, vulnerable, stuck in this in between transient moment of your life. And that's how they get you.

Gucci Guilty smells ok. Nothing jarring, nothing challenging or sharp. It smells nice, kinda expensive. There is no change between top notes and dry down, what you see is what you get: An utterly boring, unoriginal scent that smells like an airport shop.

This smells like the boss. She's not joking, and she's up there because she worked hard for it. She deserves it and she's telling everyone about it. She's independent, hard to please, and don't do relationships. Occasionally she does hook-ups but that's it. She's an only child, parents abroad, and lives at the Penthouse. She spends her holidays in Europe and doesn't come back to work until a week later. But she's the boss so nobody minds. She books the best hotels and dines at the best restaurants. She knows everybody from everybody and doesn't get no for an answer. But although she's all of this, I sense a tinge of sadness. Underneath it all, the glamorous and luxurious lifestyle, she just seeks love from everyone around her.

PS. Grandest bottle ever.
it smells like a brighter gucci guilty for men better then the mens maybe

I find this just boring, a mashup of notes, it's a perfume that I can't see offending people. But it's so liner.

It has a moderate sillage when being generous with spraying and lasts for about 2-3 hours on my skin possibly less to be honest.

The juice does not match the bottle, I expect something more vibrant or loud.

Smell 3.5/10
Duration 4/10
Sillage 6/10
Quality/price - can't remember
Packaging 8.5/10
Would I buy again? Nope


I have about 10 to 15mls left and I can't wait to just finish it. I've had it for years. It's such a nothing fragrance quite boring. I have come to realise that I'm just not a fan of Gucci fragrances. Definitely test it out before purchasing.

I expected a more bright citrusy scent, but instead while I do get the bright opening, it dries down very peppery and powdery, almost baby powder smell. Personally, too mature for my taste, and the scent doesn't really last either.
This reminds me of the 80's clubbing scene. It's a bit retro to me. I like it but don't love it enough to purchase a bottle.

I’m usually not a fan of Gucci scents, but I really liked this one. I sprayed some of my mom’s and had to get it for myself. I’m not sure why, but it sort of reminds me of Prada Candy. More of a toned down version though.

I’m not getting any fruit from this perfume. I mainly smell musk, powder, amber, and pink pepper.
It is a beautiful easy wearing scent It will neither leave a lasting impression nor offend. Go to the gym or the office...all good. Good sillage and lasts about 2 to 3 hours.

This was my signature scent for about 6 years, it's classy and bright and zesty. I had a rough couple of things happen during those years so I might get another bottle and try to reclaim the scent. Definitely a favorite, I wore it everywhere perfect for nights out and work etc.

3.8 / 5 stars. Def a fall perfume. In my tester bottle I smell pink pepper and then the bergamont. When applied to the skin, I smell immediently the lilac, jasmine and mandarin. Lasts about 4 hours on me.
I smelled this on someone, found out the name and bought a mini. Very glad I didn't spring for a full bottle. To me this is not sexy, it's not clean, it's not anything. Mature, yep
I got this as a gift and I must honestly say I am not a fan at all. This is a very mature scent. The florals don’t come through at all for me.

I initially added this during the summer months and it was just a "like" for me. In fall, I'm re-evaluating and rotating in some fragrances specifically for fall vibes. Because I lean so hard into Bergamot and citrus notes, it's harder for me to find heavier, fall-like scents I like on my body. I also HATE vanilla and dislike most powdery and ozonic notes on my skin as they dry down.

This is one of only a couple of scents with vanilla that will remain in my likes. The patchouli, musk, and amber balance it so it just gives the scent body and not "hi! We're in a bakery!" vanilla flavor. And the powdery note others mention is not prominent on my skin, particularly in this cooler weather. I get that pink pepper blast to start which I LOVE, btw, but it settles down in under 30 minutes. The floral trail is perfectly balanced by the black currant, and the dry-down doesn't veer too fruity or too floral. I'm in love.

I'm still testing longevity with the bottle I purchased from someone who pre-sprayed about half their bottle on EBay, so I'll be interested to see. This just might become a fall staple for me. If it has staying powder, it might go into the "love" category!
If this wasn’t so expensive i would have already had at least three bottles, and also they change the bottle shapes. Non offensive and amazing. Waiting for some sale atleast.
This will always be in my collection! I love this perfume so much. Sexy, powdery, and alluring. Very feminine and pretty, men like this one as well. Always get compliments.
I have Cuba Paris Prestige Legacy and it's really same smell. I can't really tell any differences. I think it's more like hot weather perfume unlike what these indicates tell by people. it's citrucy
I don't feel anything special about this perfume. It's not smelling bad, but it's ordinary.
Smells like grown up baby powder😝 if that makes any sense.

This was my first ever designer perfume. Got it as a gift for my Birthday from my then Boyfriend and this was Sometime in 2018 when I knew absolutely nothing about Perfume Notes or what Niche in perfumery even was lmao. But I Absolutely adore this fragrance. I wore it to every special occasions then. Date nights, club, parties, the park, to church and weddings lol but even at that, I used it sparingly too. Two to four spritz and I was Good to go. I can say that the projection of this is moderate but the performance is amazing. Even when I go nose blind to this, people around me could still smell my fragrance so the sillage is amazing. I absolutely love the dry down of this. It’s giving what it’s supposed to give on my skin so yeah. Hoping to repurchase this sometime soon.❤️

initially reminds me of fizzy, candy peach rings, then it settles into baby powder with a hint of citrus. i wish the peach was prominent throughout but it becomes a flat, powdery scent. no florals or vanilla for me :(
it does smell very clean but ends up quite generic, quickly developing into a skin scent with not much else going for it. it’s a shame because i love peach scents so i was excited about this one. the opening is really fun but that’s about it.

To my nose this smells like a spicy sexy soap. There's definitely a clean element to it. It brings me back to highschool where one of my girlfriends would keep this in her locker and spray herself in between classes. Good times.

So I had her a long time ago ..... she made me feel expensive with her gold bottle. I carried her to school everyday and loved her to the moon and back .
I always remember feeling so classy when I wore this fragrance. It is uplifting and fresh without being too clean.

Am eyeing a new bottle

Viniendo de Gucci, mis expectativas eran altas, pero me decepcionó. La fragancia tiene un comienzo muy fuerte, intenso, amaderado, para luego a la media hora bajar a algo mas dulce y simil al talco. En mi piel sólo duró 4 hs. Por alguna razón me recordó al "Givenchy-Ange ou demon edp" (el original que salió en 2006). Nada más que ese me duraba todo el día en la piel y este no.

I have to laugh at the reviews where people said this smells like diapers. Because honestly, they aren’t entirely wrong! Lol! But I truly do love this frag. It does kind of remind me of baby wipes. And I don’t mind that at all. Those smells like baby wipes, baby powder, Johnson’s & Johnson’s baby magic, they’re all great scents to me! But I think Guilty is more complex than just a baby wipe smell. You have the florals and the ambery vibes. The musky vanilla. I think this scent really shines in cold weather. But maybe that’s because it’s the only time I wore it- my boyfriend (now husband) bought this for me as a birthday gift I think in 2011 or 2012. And I blew through it and ran out of it all by around march or April. So I didn’t get to experience it much in spring or summer. I truly do love this scent. I’d say it’s one of the first scents that I’ve ever used, to me, that felt “sexy”. I haven’t smelled a ton of perfumes in my life but I don’t think I’ve ever smelled anything quite like this! It feels really unique in my opinion.

But I will say this: this scent has been reformulated and I have not smelled the new formulation. The OG formulation that I had, it really did have great longevity. Only a couple sprays and it was very strong. In fact, when I wore this in college, I was freshly showered, hair washed, and sprayed 2 spritzes of guilty. I walked into a room on campus where you can hang out and study, and was dismayed that two college boys across the room kept saying things like “oh my God what’s that horrible old lady smell“ “Jesus it’s so strong”. So yeah, despite their comments I still adore this scent, but yeah definitely not for everyone lol. But I can at least confirm that it has great sillage and longevity!

A young woman started using a weight machine next to me at the gym today and she smelled divine. I couldn't help myself - I had to ask her what she was wearing and she said "Gucci Guilty." My encounter of it was fleeting as she finished her set and left, but it smelled so good - the overall impression was fresh, very feminine, a bit powdery and elegant. It was not my style -- not something I would purchase myself, but I thought it was lovely on her and I thanked her for making the gym smell better.
A stronger version of My Burberry Blush with a bit more depth.

When I saw that it had mandarin orange and patchouli, I was prepared not to like this fragrance but boy was I wrong. The opening is a gorgeous pink pepper and juicy fruits (mandarine orange, peach and currant) combo that instantly grabs you. The drydown is sweet vanilla, amber and patchouli with hints of white musk. This is a sensual, elegant offering that I have smelt too many times on too many people in the past and so will not be jumping on the bandwagon to purchase a full bottle.

I ordered a sample of this to see if I wanted to purchase the full bottle. I'm glad that I did. This reminds me of an old lady's perfume. I do not like this at all. The floral/soft spicy combination does not work for me.
For some reason all i can smell in this is A1 steak sauce and heavy heavy musk.

Very old fashioned parfume, but in a bad way. It has a unique smell, that is at the same time really basic, that im sure you have smelled before. It gave me immidiently throw back to my childhood, where many people wore this. I don’t like it at all.

This to me was another one of those fragrances that came across pretty basic for the most part. I did like some things that were used here but I'd never go out of my way to buy this for myself. If I smelt this on someone else, I'd like it for sure but again, nothing that really stands out here.

I got this as a sample. At first, all I could smell was heavy floral and patchouli, and I am not a fan of patchouli. As it dries down, I find I agree with others that say that it smells like fresh diapers. I mean, it smells soft and sweet like a freshly cleaned and diapered baby, if that is what you are going for, but that seems a bit weird to me. I will not be purchasing this.

There are only a few perfumes I've given away. Calvin Klein Euphoria and this...I'm not great with notes but know there may be something in notes such as pink pepper, lilac, geranium possibly that I don't like. I did get a swift feeling of never going to like this fragrance. If anyone knows the strong prominent note in Euphoria please DM me. I do like strength in fragrance, berries, musks, vetiver, anamalaic warm ambers, so really don't know what upsets me about whats listed here for Guilty.

lol, gucci guilty is another one that reminds me of my teens when i had no idea what frags really "fit" me or worked with my body chemistry in any way whatsoever. all in all, it's a deep and citrusy musk. it's pretty spicy and intense honestly, so i can't imagine what people must've thought of my 16-year-old self dousing it all over, haha. the black currant notes really come through, and the florals are very much there but a lil less forward than you'd imagine. no complaints to this day, it's just not really my cup of tea anymore!
agh, so basic unfortunately. This is what i thought cool teens smelled like when i was 10

I wore this in my early twenties, and got through a whole bottle of it, so I must have liked it enough. In honesty, I can't really remember what this smells like but I do clearly remember other scents I wore in this time period, and earlier - so unmemorable?

This perfume is probably the worst perfume I have used till date.
Terrible lasting power, forty five minutes max. Pleasant smell, but it does not last long at all.
If you must go for Gucci, I strongly suggest you try Gucci flora eau de perfume instead.
i smelled more than sexy scents in the world until now.

Wasn’t sure the first time I sniffed this. It’s spicy, powdery and patchouli. But the more I wears it the more it grows on me. When I need a confidence booster I will definitely go with Gucci Guilty. It gives me a powerful feeling but still friendly and sexy at the same time.

But I believe this version isn’t available anymore and when it’s available it became way too overpriced. So when you have a chance to grab it, go grab it as many as you can!
I can’t find this version any more but GUCCI GULTY POUR FEMME is the same

Powdery with a tiny touch of sweetness and discreetly sexy/sensual. The silage is medium, people feel the cleanliness but they have to come quite close to actually smell the scent. It didn't have a Pampers effect on me and it lasts a very long time BUT...it is not an intense scent and i wouldn't wear it for a night out (except if i wanted to go unnoticed or noticed by someone who likes scents that are not overwhelming). It gives off a clean, feminine, luxurious vibe which is great for a day at work or in places where you just want to smell good without making a statement of your presence. I wear it all year round, usually on days when i can't decide which perfume i want to wear. Never had a bad comment on it but i never had really enthusiastic comments on it either.

@swedishmilk15
I think this only comes in edt. Sounds like you have the Intense version which is an edp. That would explains why it smells different (I think the bottles look the same)

It's funny that this has been considered the ultimate clubbing scent for many reviewers here because I find this so innocent! I received it in a swap and I am only getting a full wear for the first time today. Of the ones in my collection this reminds me a lot of My Name with it's sweetness and prominent lilac note.

I have been changing diapers daily for nearly 7 years but thankfully I am not reminded of diapers! Also, peach is a note I sometimes struggle with, it's not cloying and screetchy in Guilty though. I think it's easy to wear and quite lovely, something I will probably reach for when I want something non-offensive and likeable.

I was reading a magazine and caught a whiff of something incredible. It was a test strip for Gucci Guilty. I got tons of patchouli, incense, and jasmine from the test strip. I was loving it, excited to find something that smelled like my bath routine-- Neutrogena rain bath, a layer of nag champa lotion, followed with jasmine body oil and a dab of Matchabelli Skin Musk (oil). Most perfumes I own are more vintage in their profiles so I was pumped to find a perfume that wouldn't be redundant AND hit some great notes for me.

Unfortunately my bottle doesn't seem to replicate the same accords. It's nice, I get the incense and jasmine in the opening. Then it turns into basically a VERY light musk/skin scent within 2 hours. Usually a scent will linger on my clothes around the neckline--NADA. I might finish my bottle but it will probably take a long time--there are better scents out there and my Mugler Alien EDP definitely outranks and outperforms this when I want Jasmine and warm woods. The best part of this is the bottle, which reminds me of a shiny gold Boccioni sculpture. Very Italian. Doesn't match the juice inside.

I see this going for big prices so I'm glad I spent more like $40 usd for my 1.7oz rather than the 92 DOLLARS??!! I'm seeing this go for now??!! PLEASE DO NOT BUY THIS FOR $92.

Edit: another user mentioned there's not an EDP. Mine is the EDT. Facade fell off the bottle so now I can't even enjoy that until I glue it back on 😅
This smells like a straight up clean diaper. Like Pampers fresh out of the package.
It's not my favourite fragrance, a bit too sweet and average for me

This is my signature. I’m obsessed with Gucci Guilty! I always get compliments, no matter when or where I’m wearing it. I’ve layered it with a few different perfumes but honestly my favorite mixed with this one is Ariana Grande’s Cloud. *chefs kiss*

It's a good scent but I don't get anything special from it. Its opens sweet a bit floral and the dry down is powdery. Powdery scent last forever in my skin so I still get some of the smell even after 10 hours. It's a good smell to wear for shopping alone, going on an all-girls day or a simple date (for more of a serious date, would prefer something that smells more special)

I wanted to love this fragrance sooo bad! But each time i tried to wear it it just never worked for me :( Its soooo very interesting though, every girl whose smelled this on me adored it. They say it smells expensive, it smells like a boss, it smells luxurious. But yet LITERALLY every man whose smelled this on me said it smells like a baby/baby wipes. And i personally had the same impression when i first smelled it too. I think its the abundance of lilac in this perfume that really reads as a baby lotion/baby wipe/ baby product and i just cant shake that. Its such a shame because it opens with a pleasant floral fruity opening with the peach and black current, and it drys down to a really lovely spicy vanilla on me which i really do love. But the haunting of that Lilac literally lingers for the entirety of this perfumes life on my skin and i just cant feel confident knowing i smell like a baby. Overall i will say its a pleasant perfume and i understand why people love it, but i will always remember this one as the “baby smelling” perfume for me :(
xoxo - <3 Stevie

Everybody seems to love this scent I just don’t understand the big hype. My boyfriend bought me this one saying he thought it smelled really good but for me it’s just…meh. The vibe I’m getting here is sweetened baby powder. However when I do wear this I get SO many compliments saying “you smell like money”. I wish I could smell what others do because this is sadly one of my most complimented fragrances! Lol ugh! I am going to finish the bottle but won’t be re-purchasing, I wear perfume that I like to smell not for others. Still since it is highly complemented and lasts a decent amount of time I’ll give it a higher rating than it may deserve. 6/10 🤷♀️

Guilty indeed... This fragrance is hot. I get girl out on the town in New York vibes, dripping in Gucci Guilty, laughing, feeling confident and bold. The brand's descriptor is perfect: "It is designed for the glamorous, daring, brave, and very sexy girls who like to party and enjoy themselves." This is it! The fragrance opens with mandarin and bergamont and slowly dries down to delicious jasmine and amber notes that I love. It's not really sweet, not too floral, just sexy and rich. It's a little synthetic but in a way I like. Slightly oriental, Gucci Guilty is an amber floral fragrance that just works. The bottle really gives the whole feel of this fragrance.
I brought a travel size bottle at Macy’s a few years ago, I love it and I’m still in love with this scent. Gucci Guilty is so sexy. I have to get a bigger size of this.

This is another scent I heard people raving about but I just cannot stand it.
It is very strong and instantly gives me a headache.
I tried to like it but I cannot tolerate being in the same room where this is worn.
I don't know what it is exactly about this perfume or if it is just too heavy of a scent for me. But I do like the Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette which is softer and more appealing to me.

I actually liked this perfume and found it good for layering. However, once I eventually realised that it smells identical to baby wipes, I could never “un-smell” that scent and it ruined the perfume for me especially because other people I wore it around also smelled me and said “baby wipes”-_-

It’s fine if you don’t mind that, but it just wasn’t something I wanted to smell like to be honest.
