Overall, this smells like a nondescript, perfumy, floral fragrance. But after a few minutes, it honestly becomes a fresh baby diaper scent. Not much longevity, which is great if you hate the smell of pampers. Depending on your nose and skin chemistry, it might ring closer to a pleasant musky, ambery floral.

It’s nice. It doesn’t have the “annoying” warm note that the intense has, though it is still a “warm” perfume. Lilac is my favorite note and I don’t really get that here. It’s a bit creamy from the vanilla. Nice.
AS THIS PERFUME DISCONTINUED, TRY ( Entebaa Rasasi for women) GREAT DUPE!!

First blast of musky sweet fruits and white floral floating on top of a warm woody amber. There's a real sense of weight here, a maturity. This is definitely not a juvenile fruity white floral but remains nevertheless.... yet another fruity white floral. The only guilty thing about this scent is that it's guilty of being boring. Feminine and best for cool weather.

Tested the one in the new bottle and it is not exactly as I remember, but that's probably just me. I feel the new one has less lilac and more pink pepper but other than that it is still pretty much the same scent.

Years ago I smelled this and said "it's missing a lot" and quickly moved on.. but now revisiting I think that's it's charm!! It's understated. Like the quiet confident woman. I picture a smart and sexy real estate agent saying to herself "Honey, please- I'm here to sell you guys a house. Not to steal your husband. but keep it up with the backhanded compliments and you may just tempt me."
Sexy & understated. You fill the missing piece With this one :)

This is arguably my favourite scent - Favourite scent for a particular mood or occasion.
Realistically, I don't believe this scent is for everyone however.
What is this scent made for in my opinion? Summer. A bottle chilling out in your apartment on your bed, as you gaze into the sunset sipping a Moscato wine, thinking about what outfit you're going to pull together for a night out on the town by the waterfront. It's a certain lifestyle that this scent goes with and perhaps is made for - And it doesn't make sense outside of that lifestyle.
Clubbing scent, yes, but luxe lifestyle more so.
I would spray this all over me, and my clothes - And it is just a signature scent for those who love Gucci and the beach. :)
I prefer the women's EDT however - I am very fussy, and have contemplated all of them - This is my favourite concoction and I don't believe you can purchase it anymore within Gucci boutiques?
I just find mine at Chemist Warehouse :) Now that's style :D
Honestly one of THE worst perfumes I have ever tried.

no longevity at all not one hour even soo watered down
version . sad i blind bought it because i loved the pour homme diamond edition

This has got to be one of the best and most well-blended designer fragrances i’ve ever tried. I can’t pick out a single note, it simply just smells good. I do not get baby powder, pepper, or hand soap at all as other reviews have been saying, like, not even a little bit (thank god). sexy, classy, pretty much everything a woman could want out of a fragrance.

I really like this perfume. The pink pepper is present but not too intense and the dry down is a subtle lilac peach. It doesn't last very long but it's been my favourite blind buy so far. I wouldn't say it's sexy but it's getting there.

Yes you get baby wipe vibes BUT if you spray heavier you get a more balanced scent and the longer you have the bottle the better it will smell :) it is oddly sexy but fresh as well. Seems like a clubbing scent but is also comforting. Probably why guys love it.

This was a very strong, sexy, heady fragrance that I could not quite pull off. I did like it at first but quickly found it too overpowering to wear regularly. I got turned off by this scent after I smelled it on a coworker.
I regret getting this. I just dislike the opening smell. It has this strong peppery scent then just plain sweet scent which gave me a headache. Just not my type of scent.
I got it as a gift and I like the scent. To me it smells very clean and I get a lot of amber. One thing I like about this perfume is that every man who smells it falls in love with it.

Softly spicy, powdery floral.
Synthetic. Luxurious. Sensual.

This definitely feels like a perfume scent. But this scent has sentimental value to me since it's the first perfume I ever wore consistently for a long time. I blind bought this in year 2015 when I was first year in college, and the first impression I got was 'luxurious' and 'mature'. I remember I was relieved that I liked it. I smelled this recently in a subway station from a woman who walked pass me, and brought back so many memories since it was special time of my life. It's a scent I won't wear anymore, but it's quite a unique scent.
This smells great - like soft sweet peach and lilac, but it reminds me of a hand soap I've smelled before...

I got this as a gift. I must admit I was reluctant to put this on reading the name. I expected something super punchy in your face, full of patchouli and dirt, sweat etc. So I went online to read the notes. The notes made me feel a bit more assured that this won’t be the case but I was still nervous to try this on because of the pink pepper. I was sure I’d get a headache or that I’ll want to immediately scrub this off when I tried it on my skin…but…wait a minute…

This actually smells nice and … light? airy??.. I remember my first thought was “ Guilty? How exactly?!” I needed a bit of time to make sense of it, to put it in a category but I just couldn’t…
See that’s the case with it.
You can’t define it. It’s not sweet or floral centered, it’s not sexy in an obvious way, not super musky and clean, not sophisticated in a serious way. It’s not “old” or “young”… it’s just…balanced. And most of all…It’s free.
It doesn’t care about your perception of it. It doesn’t want to be put under a certain label.

Most perfumes bring a memory or a loved in mind when I smell them but this one smelled like a fictional character… This smelled like what I imagine Carrie Bradshaw would smell like in the first few seasons of SATC. She’s walking down the streets of Manhattan with the wind blowing through her hair. She’s chic and clean and sexy but doesn’t care to fit your perfect image. She’s smoking and on her way for some cocktails. She’s single or in between an affair. She doesn’t care. She’s empowered and working for herself. She’s not sure of what the future holds but she’s certain of one thing…it won’t be boring.

If I could, I’d bath myself in this scent because the EDT is light enough for all seasons and my skin just sucks this up SO so quickly. I’ll reapply generously though just to feel this way again. This won’t be a signature, I know, it’s just a love affair… I know it won’t last, but I’ll remember this for a long time after we part ways. That’s what makes this “guilty”.

On my skin it smells ambery and too peppery, I don't hate it but I never wear it out, used more as a room spray. Though I dont reach for it on myself, I have smelled it on other people and really liked it so I think it's just they way it sits on my skin.
this fragrance smells like baby powder on me. it's light and innocent but has a bit of sexyness to it. if you're looking for a safe fragrance, this is the one.

All I smell is a light, spicy floral, powdery and ambery scent. It's OK for me, but no wow and poor longevity. I wear this for casual wear and work during cold climates. When I use up this fragrance, I will not be repurchasing it as this has to go. I suggest that there are better fragrances everywhere.

In conclusion, Gucci Guilty EDT and EDP are not for you if you can't stand the heavy amber and patchouli smell.

Alternatively, Untouched by The Veronicas(if it's available in your country) will be good if you enjoy a sultry, unisex, sweet floral scent.

Got this as a gift, and sadly did not like. I think the pepper notes were too strong in this one, apart from that it contains all the notes I love. But pepper is so overpowering and it just doesn't match my style. The pepper makes it feel somehow workaholic boss lady career woman, that is strutting around in skirt-suit, high heels and gucci bag on her shoulder. One with too much hairspray that you can also smell a mile away. No offense to anyone who loves this scent by the way. Perfumes do manifest differently on everyone's skin, but this is the vibe that I got from it. And that stiletto did not fit sadly. I gave it to someone who does not have much money to buy her own scents and she absolutely adored it, including her teenage son who saw the name 'gucci' and that pretty much sold it to him. The more brands the merrier was probably his motto back then XD

a sweaty sinful long night,
(maybe thats why its called guilty)
it gives me that vibe,
very provocative
Shouldn’t be a signature scent it’s definitely not (office, brunch, day, family, shopping) appropriate.

I get nothing smelling this, i just get gucci guilty

I love this fragrance and it smells really nice on me, but I have purchased the EDT in a new 2021 bottle that looks like the 2019 EDP bottle and it is sad how little it lasts, even on clothes. It just disappears completely after an hour if at that. I've tried the EDP version and while it does have great projection and longevity it's borderline headache inducing for me and the scent itself is more potent. I prefer the softness of the EDT, if only it lasted longer.
Don’t like the opening - smells like cheap perfume but the dry down is nice and has peppery notes which I find unique. But the staying power just wasn’t there.
On me, it's a slightly spicy lilac baby powder. It's inoffensive and nice but not really a statement. Would be nice for the office.

I HATE the soapy opening ! I simply hate it!

Sometimes I put it on and when I get past the opening , I'm like ... Ooh nice! Other times like today, it's just irritating ! I don't get patchouli at all. That would be the salvation for this perfume. I get soap. Musk. Yuck.

I can see where people are getting the soap vibes from. It does have a soapy quality once it's dried down. I'll start by saying it's not my favorite but it's not terrible. Initially I get a sweet, peppery peach. But I also get a sort of juicy, waxiness that lingers throughout that reminds me a bit of MMM Lipstick On but far less sweet and cloying than Lipstick On. I said this about Gucci Guilty Black, and although my sentiments about the two fragrances are different (because they definitely are) - I'm wondering if this sort of sweet waxiness is characteristic of the Guilty line. No mistake, it's certainly not a bad quality, but it's there. The spicy sharp pepper note stays throughout as well, making itself more known as the fragrance dries down and helps cut through some of the initial sweet fruitiness. All of the base notes really come out after the sweet peach fades down but the amber and musk take up much of the attention. I get hints of the lilac, jasmine, and geranium but they blend into an indistinct generic "floral" note. Overall I find this to be an inoffensive but unremarkable fragrance.

It took me a long time to like this scent. Now i find her very pretty, but a lot of people around me don't like her. It's not a safe blind buy. Ideal for winter and fall. When I wear it I feel "boss", but I never guet compliments on this one. Dominant notes are powdery lilac, peach, and pepper. Its smell way better on the skin, its sweeter.
10/10 for the bottle.
6.5/10 for the scent
6/10 for performance

Other reviewers have said that Gucci Guilty is wrongly named and that 'Innocent' would be far more apt but I disagree. This would be the perfect scent to wear if one were having an affair or otherwise up to no good: it's pleasant but not at all distinctive; undetectable as it doesn't hang around for too long. It's safe, pleasant, pretty and anonymous. The ideal perfume for anyone undertaking clandestine activities.

Floral patchouli primarily, but the pepper and peach do add a very nice depth. Mostly warm, but the geranium always feel like such a cool stone flower to me so there is a nice contrast. I think the geranium and something else, possibly the musk are giving it a little soapy feel, not a bad thing on it's own.

The black currant must be from the berry and not the leaf/bud because the "green" parts of black currant always turn to cat pee on me and this did not, though I'll admit I never quite found the berry either, I just know there was no cat pee.

This feels like a nighttime party scent, the sort of thing wafting around in the background of a James Bond casino scene, maybe.
I too smell soap in this. A matter of fact has a distinct Dove bar soap smell. Not only that it made me feel nauseated all day long. Other then that I did like it, and my hubby LOVED it.

I got a sample and it's my first time smelling this. Or is it?? My first impression was, oh yeah...I recognize this right away. I've smelled it in the department store air while out shopping. The first note I'm getting is the lilac, and it's a lovely lovely lilac. The patchouli and jasmine join in a few moments later and now it's giving me Coco Mademoselle vibes. But the patchouli isn't making my nose itch as much as the patchouli in Coco Mademoiselle. This strikes me as a "fancy" perfume to wear when you're feeling sexy and confident, when you want to get noticed, for a date or a night out, or an important work meeting or conference when you want your confidence to shine. Very feminine.

NOT discontinued to the best of my knowledge!

I've come back to this very late in the day.. I think it's discontinued now? I tried it when it first came out, but at the time just thought meh. It didn't interest me but I'm revisiting the past generally at the moment as I really don't want to live in the present. It could be found in pretty much every perfume shop everywhere n I decided I would get it for the bottle mostly, before it disappears into the perfume shop in the sky. It's bright lilac, peach n berries over patch, the powder is almost off radar. It feels different to most of the rest of my collection to me but I'm not sure what's setting it apart.. it seems amiable so far..

I smelled this on paper in the store and I loved it. It smelled like an evil lady. However after spraying it on myself at home, it smells so different. The best way to describe it is like a deodorant that has been worn for a whole day that a slight armpit smell is present.

I love this perfume. I get a nice juicy peach opening which dries down to such a lovely scent on me. I find this is an easy fragrance for me to reach for when I want something a little sexier and warmer for the cooler months. I think it’s worth getting a sample of!

For Gucci, I don’t think it’s that strong or long lasting atall. Not really worth the money. Kinda gives me Michael Kors sexy amber vibes. It is a nice smelling perfume don’t get me wrong, it’s just not strong enough smelling for me. (Gives me a headache too!!) classy tones, good and suitable for job interview style

This was my first perfume ever that I absolutely loved for many reasons. I’d say my first real signature scent. I do get compliments wearing this. Has great sillage and lasts a long time on my skin. Another that I would also wear for nights out and I’d still be able to smell on myself the morning after lol.. definitely a fun, sexy vibe to it. I think this was my first perfume that didn’t give me headaches as well. It’s warm, mature and spicy. Lots of good memories from my 20s with this one.

It's fine. I got this from Scentbox and it just smells like a generic department store perfume on me. It has a musky green smell that I like, but probably not enough to buy at full price. My initial test spritz on my wrist radiated through my whole arm. I don't know for longevity right now since I haven't had the chance to wear it out but I can imagine it would be pretty good because of how initially intense it is.

I got this for Christmas. This is on my to try before buying list since it’s recommended by Kathleen lights. Patchouli has never been easy on me, it always gives me a strong headache. I tried to like this but just on the first use alone it gave me a terrible headache.

It’s nice sans the patchouli 😔
Anyone wants to buy it on a lower price?

This is for the EDT. It starts off sharp like Lady Million of Paco Rabbane, must be the common patchouli amber combo and also Rihanna's Reb'l Fleur has that same sharp opening that im not a fan of and it has patchouli amber as well. Thank God it calms down quickly and then I get a light powdery and peppery floral sweetness that's very elegant and not too mature not too juvenile. Idk why but its powderiness reminds me of makeup and lipsticks. Id go for this perfume if i were to be out in the open and not in a room, only cuz out in the air it smells so much better to me. Its drydown is very peachy and lilac to my nose, this is why it kiiiinda reminded me of Reb'l Fleur's drydown (has peach too), but theyre totally different compositions, they have the same base notes tho and I think theyre in the same family of youthful mysterious fruity florals with a touch of purple in them (lilac and black currant in Gucci, plum and violet in Reb'l Fleur). I ended up liking Gucci Guilty and like I said I can appreciate its beauty out in the clean air, winter or summer. I wore it in 25 degree weather while snowing and i loved it.

For some reason, I always seem to get compliments when I'm wearing Guilty. It's a very feminine and powdery scent, perfect for all occasions whether you're out on the hunt looking for a new boo or if you're just going to work. It's quite inoffensive and I'm a big fan of the dry down. On me, the patchouli stands out as does the lilac. The only downside is that it's not the most long-lasting fragrance (3-4 hours) but a beautiful scent nonetheless.

I bought this one when it was fairly new. I loved it and I do remember recognizing it on others, so I can say it is definitely a unique and recognizable scent. Maybe for those that like loud perfumes and they were expecting something totally different from the Guilty name, this one was a bit disappointing.
For me it smells like a very feminine modern floral scent. I smell lilac mixed with jasmine with slight spiciness. The dry down surprises with a little sweetness - vanilla.
I like it in winter, or colder weather. I like lighter scents, so it works for me.
Oh, I should add I like the bottle. My kids (boys) think it is the coolest one that I have :).
The sprayer is not the best.
When I finish this one, I may try a flanker of GG.

I got this from my boyfriend as a gift and I love it!!! It's a soft spicy that smells little bit soapy in my nose (probably because of patchouli) with a hint of warm orange in dry down. It smells elegant, laidback, feminine, and perfect for night out. Too bad it doesn't last long in my skin.

This perfume smells like a hot model who is smoking a cigarette after having bathroom sex in a Miami club after downing expensive booze. It literally smells like a party and made me feel like a bad party girl in my 20s. I’m not a party girl, nor am I in my 20s, so I gave it to my cousin who is.

I like how this has the faint powdery start before the fruity and floral notes come in. I also like that it's not just overwhelmingly sweet like some of the newer perfumes are. It's a good scent for pretty much any occasion; as long as you don't bathe in it, you can wear it pretty much whenever you want. I wish it lasted a bit longer, though.

this scent has always been my "secret weapon." more of a fall, winter, night time scent especially when going out for the night with friends or a date. I've always gotten comments on it and even one from a friend who hated the smell of it from the bottle but then loved it on my skin later on. it's feminine but not too much (which fits me very well) and it makes me feel confident and sexy... so much so that I love to spray some on myself as I'm getting ready. it can be VERY intense though so don't overdue it with the spritzes, keep it light and mysterious and I assure you it will draw people in.

This is a special scent, for me it has the DNA of Gucci Bamboo and Gucci Rush mixture added some sweetness to it. It is great for daytime busy day running around and enjoying the colours of autumn 🍂 Playful and energetic, long lasting as well, great value for price. I would also add to the review if anybody is looking to gift a perfume this one would impress anybody as it’s very easy going.

A truly incomparable scent. I love that it’s called guilty, sounds sexy, yet still classy and mischievous. It contains pink pepper, which gives it that little bit (but not too much) spice. A really pretty, classy looking bottle too.

On me this perfume is so faint. And the light scent that I can actually smell has faded away in a couple of hours. But what I have noticed is that the opening for at least 10 minutes is a light licorice scent, like anise. After searching through the hundreds of reviews on here, I finally saw one other person who mentioned the licorice! So I’m not the only one! :) Then I noticed some people saying it reminded them of diapers, and as I smelled it again, I got it! Yes a baby powder scent. Probably the lilac. It’s quite a pretty, ordinary scent and as I mentioned VERY light and faint. (Today was my third time testing it and I even sprayed more than usual.) I agree with other reviewers that the name does not fit this perfume. It’s not guilty, it’s the most innocent thing I’ve ever smelled :) I mean, it is lovely even though I can barely smell it, so I’ll finish out my sample but I won’t purchase a larger size.
I'm wearing this perfume now after finishing Chanel Chance. Nice flower scent. Very feminine and confident at the same time. Good longevity and moderate silage. Perfect for office work fragrance!

Fruity in the beginning, then softened down to the spicy lilac. This is lovely, but fades way too much...no sillage whatsoever. This would be the perfect office fragrance, inoffensive and fresh, but not big or noticeable for a date night (as I was hoping). This is a clean, polite floral.

~ I am the minority here , I spritzed a few minutes ago { about 5 } and it is already gone " poof " on me . My skin just ate this up literally with no afterthought . Ha ~ she is there , only when I place my wrist up my nose and inhale deeply , truly .The Lilac is the only hint of a note I get the most of , which I do like a lot as a main floral note . She would have been better on me as EDP instead of EDT. I only have a few EDT's because I did not look before purchase , I don't wear them well , I may have one or two that wear more like an EDP though which is always a gem to find . Most times vanilla is super strong on me , sometimes sickeningly so and is all I can smell . I got a hint of something , it could be the vanilla but I'm not sure , but if any other note is present besides the Lilac I can't really tell on me . Layering would be a waste of juice regardless of how she would wear , it just kills me that at the cost of GG ,I'd have to resort to layering , and no way of knowing if I'd get any benefit of layering unless I use a cheap scent . So after today's ordeal I'll place in my " does not work for me bin " which I'm proud to say only has about 4 in total . Hmm , I just realized two of those are Gucci , this one and Gucci Oud ~ and two Swiss Arabian ~ Unless I got a fake or a watered down bottle , GG has ghosted me ~///= ^ } ~ Boo

I have always loved this fragrance. It smells expensive and lasts a long time on me unlike most perfumes. I find it perfect to wear to a nice restaurant or bar on an evening out. I think this perfume is very good value for money and I have received lots of compliments from both men and women.
There is a unique, warm depth in this fragrance. Smells like home, a hug, soft cashmere sweater, falling leaves during October. Its very unique. One of a kind.

A powdery floral with some spice. This is classy, but also sexy without being too in your face. This would be a great nighttime going out scent for someone who prefers more lightweight perfumes and is not into the super heavy, loud, sweet orientals (like CH Good Girl, for example). The bottle is stunning, too!

I'm not getting the baby note people are talking about. What I do smell is a very well-blended fragrance. I don't know how big the ad campaign for this scent was, because it smells to me like a pile of fashion magazines (in the best possible way). The drydown is such a creamy vanilla, and the top notes are floral and peachy, in an unobnoxious way. I find it sexy. Maybe not "Guilty" sexy, but sexy in a grown woman way.
It would absolutely be named Gucci Innocent..Irrelevant of being Guilty.So flat,quite powdery vibe that I got from it.It is not bad,doesn’t impress me either..

Saw this few months ago at the Macy's and decided to try on. Ended up purchasing the bottle, even though there's nothing "guilty" about this fragrance. As many already have mentioned, it's clean, fresh, very nice scent. I don't detect anything even slightly spicy... Nothing special to write home about, just a beautiful fragrance in a beautiful bottle. Downside of the bottle - it gets tarnished where you keep touching it. Pain in the neck if you have OCD to keep polishing it after every use :)

Amazing!!!!
This perfume is elegant and sophisticated, definitely for a more mature women I feel (20-35). I'm not gonna lie though as others have stated they smell a clean fresh diaper... I get that 100%! Went and smelt a fresh Pampers newborn diaper and its spot on it has that fresh powdery smell. Although I still love it, its calming and warm and welcoming. Definitely one of my favs!

Wow, I sprayed this last night before bed and over twelve hours later, I can still smell it. Crazy! I really love this soft, comforting scent, and the peach really stands out on me. I wish Gucci Guilty Absolute had this longevity but that one fades quickly on me.

This is a floral, slightly peppery scent. I like that it is sophisticated but still sweet. I generally wear it on club nights. Its pretty long-lasting and I've received compliments on it. To me, its a pretty basic scent and I probably would not repurchase. But, it is very nostalgic and it reminds me of a few good, long nights out. Overall, it is very pleasant, but I'm after more interesting scents these days.
This is simply clean fresh and light perfume, i like using it with other parfums or on its own if im doing stuff around the house, i get only flower notes on me snd reminds me of dior J‘adore.

Smells clean, expensive and soapy.

The bottle and packaging are very nice and classy, but I wouldn't expect anything less from Gucci.

I just got through a bottle, and it was never something I raved about or reached for very often. It would be a very safe blind buy and gift. I agree with previous reviewers that said it smelled like expensive skin care. On my own mother, it smelled like some fancy hotel soap. Pleasant and feminine, but nothing that made us go "wow."

Personally, I wouldn't re-purchase. (I was gifted a bottle.) I think it's nice and easy-going, but it's nothing ground-breaking or sexy.

A stronger character perfume of Lanvin Eclat d'Arpege. Do you know soft spring flowers? Do you know the heavy purple branches of lilies emitting that lovely scent of honey and wild wind? Gucci Guilty is an alluring, youthful fruity floral oriental elixir. If it was a fabric, it definitely would be grey silk, a grey silky dress - likely to become a new classic. Guilty? Not so much. No crimes commited, unless the crime is too many bees on a single lily tree. Or a forgotten peach.

Wow, this is soft, clean, creamy, sweet, it smells like luxurious expensive moisturizer. It’s a peaches and cream delicate, clean, soft lilac. It’s quite musky and bordering on safe. Oh, heck it is safe. But it’s also tender and gentle like a sweet little baby. This is a great shower clean scent when you just want to smell nice. This has the cleanest patchouli I’ve ever smelled. It’s almost nonexistent. This is one of the least perfumy scents ever. It smells like a perfume lotion to me in a creamy laconic way. It has a nice warm amber and some vanilla. About an hour in the florals come out of this some more the lilac ramps up a little bit and it’s a little bit powdery. It’s got a little bit fruit but it’s very mild and quiet with a tiny bit of pink pepper.
